es_translation: Maybe because I was the one who had answered him, or maybe not, he placed both hands on the locker, with me in the middle, and came close enough for me to consider what brand of toothpaste he used. —What do you know about Margo and Jase?

en: “Uh,” I said. I thought of everything I knew about them: Jase was Margo Roth Spiegelman’s first and only serious boyfriend. They began dating at the tail end of last year. They were both going to University of Florida next year. Jase got a baseball scholarship there. He was never over at her house, except to pick her up. She never acted as if she liked him all that much, but then she never acted as if she liked anyone all that much. “Nothing,” I said finally.
vi: “Ờ,” tôi đáp, trong đầu nghĩ đến mọi thứ tôi biết về hai người đó: Jase là bạn trai nghiêm túc đầu tiên và duy nhất của Margo Roth Spiegelman. Cả hai bắt đầu hẹn hò hồi cuối năm ngoái. Sang năm cả hai sẽ cùng đến Đại học Florida. Jase được học bổng vì sẽ chơi trong đội bóng chày của trường. Hắn chưa bao giờ ở lâu trong nhà cô ấy, trừ phi đến đón Margo. Cô ấy chưa bao giờ tỏ ra là thích hắn đến mức ấy, nhưng cô ấy cũng chưa bao giờ tỏ ra thích bất cứ ai đến mức ấy. “Chả biết gì cả,” rút cục tôi nói.
tr: “Şey,” dedim. Onlar hakkında bildiğim her şeyi düşündüm: Jase, Margo Roth Spiegelman’m ilk ve tek ciddi erkek arkadaşıydı. Geçen senenin tam sonunda çıkmaya başlamışlardı. Gelecek yıl ikisi de Florida Üniversitesi’ne gidecekti. Jase orada bir beyzbol bursu almıştı. Jase hiçbir zaman Margo’nun evine gitmezdi... onu kapıdan almaya gittiği zamanlar hariç. Margo asla Jase’ten o kadar da hoşlanmış gibi davranmazdı ama zaten kimseden o kadar hoşlanmış gibi davranmazdı. “Hiçbir şey,” dedim sonunda.
es: —Uf —le contesté. Pensé en todo lo que sabía de ellos: Jase era el primer y único novio serio de Margo Roth Spiegelman. Habían empezado a salir a finales del año anterior. Los dos iban a ir a la Universidad de Florida al año siguiente. A Jase le habían dado una beca para jugar en el equipo de béisbol. Nunca había entrado en casa de Margo, solo pasaba a buscarla. A Margo no parecía gustarle tanto, pero la verdad es que nunca parecía que le gustase nadie tanto. —Nada —le contesté por fin.
vi_translation: “Uh,” I replied, thinking about everything I knew about those two: Jase was Margo Roth Spiegelman's first and only serious boyfriend. They started dating late last year. Next year, they will both be going to the University of Florida. Jase got a scholarship because he will be playing on the school's baseball team. He never stayed long in her house, except when picking up Margo. She never seemed to like him that much, but she never seemed to like anyone that much. “Don’t know anything,” I finally said.
tr_translation: “Well,” I said. I thought about everything I knew about them: Jase was Margo Roth Spiegelman's first and only serious boyfriend. They had started dating at the very end of last year. Next year, both of them would be going to the University of Florida. Jase had gotten a baseball scholarship there. Jase never went to Margo’s house... except when he went to pick her up at the door. Margo never acted like she liked Jase that much, but then again, she never acted like she liked anyone that much. “Nothing,” I said finally.
es_translation: —Ugh —I replied. I thought about everything I knew about them: Jase was Margo Roth Spiegelman's first and only serious boyfriend. They had started dating at the end of the previous year. Both were going to attend the University of Florida the following year. Jase had received a scholarship to play on the baseball team. He had never been inside Margo's house, he only picked her up. Margo didn't seem to like him that much, but the truth was she never seemed to like anyone that much. —Nothing —I finally replied to him.

en: “Don’t shit me around,” he growled.
vi: “Đừng hòng lừa tao,” Chuck gầm lên.
tr: “Beni kafaya alma,” diye gürledi.
es: —No me jodas —gruñó.
vi_translation: “Don't even think about deceiving me,” Chuck roared.
tr_translation: “Don't mess with me,” he roared.
es_translation: —Don't mess with me —he growled.

en: “I barely even know her,” I said, which had become true.
vi: “Tôi hầu như chẳng hiểu gì về Margo cả,” tôi nói, và đúng là như vậy.
tr: “Margo’yu doğru düzgün tanımıyorum bile,” dedim ki bu gerçekti.
es: —Apenas la conozco —le dije, y puede decirse que en los últimos tiempos era cierto.
vi_translation: “I hardly understand anything about Margo,” I said, and it was true.
tr_translation: “I don't even know Margo properly,” I said, which was true.
es_translation: —I barely know her —I told him, and it could be said that in recent times it was true.

en: He considered my answer for a minute, and I tried hard to stare at his close-set eyes. He nodded very slightly, pushed off the lockers, and walked away to attend his first-period class: The Care and Feeding of Pectoral Muscles. The second bell rang. One minute to class. Radar and I had calc; Ben had finite mathematics. The classrooms were adjacent; we walked toward them together, the three of us in a row, trusting that the tide of classmates would part enough to let us by, and it did.
vi: Nó cân nhắc câu trả lời của tôi trong chốc lát, còn tôi cố hết sức nhìn thẳng vào hai tròng mắt sát nhau của nó. Chuck gật đầu rất khẽ, rời dãy tủ đựng đồ và vào lớp học môn tiết một của nó: Chăm sóc và dinh dưỡng cho cơ ngực. Hồi chuông thứ hai reo. Còn một phút trước giờ vào lớp. Radar và tôi có giờ giải tích, còn Ben có giờ toán tổ hợp. Các phòng học san sát cạnh nhau, bọn tôi vào lớp, ba thằng giăng hàng ngang, tin rằng lũ bạn sẽ dạt ra đủ rộng cho chúng tôi qua, và đúng như vậy.
tr: Bir an cevabımı gözden geçirdi, birbirine yakın gözlerine bakmak için çok uğraştım. Belli belirsiz başını salladı, elini dolaptan çekti ve ilk dersine girmek için çekip gitti: Göğüs Kaslarının Bakımı ve Geliştirilmesi, ikinci zil çaldı. Derse bir dakika kalmıştı. Radar ve benim matematik, Ben’in ise sonlu matematik dersi vardı. Sınıflarımız bitişikti; art arda, sınıf arkadaşlarımızdan oluşan akıntının geçmemize izin verecek kadar ayrılacağına güvenerek sınıflara doğru yürüdük ve öyle oldu.
es: Consideró un minuto mi respuesta, y yo intenté con todas mis fuerzas no desviar la mirada de sus ojos bizcos. Movió muy suavemente la cabeza, se apartó de la taquilla y se marchó a su primera clase de la mañana: Mantenimiento de los Músculos Pectorales. Sonó el segundo timbre. Faltaba un minuto para que empezaran las clases. Radar y yo teníamos cálculo, y Ben tenía matemáticas finitas. Nuestras clases estaban una al lado de la otra. Nos dirigimos juntos a ellas, los tres en fila, confiando en que la marea humana se abriera lo suficiente para dejarnos pasar, y así fue.
vi_translation: It considered my answer for a moment, while I tried my best to look straight into its closely set eyes. Chuck nodded very slightly, left the row of lockers, and went to his first-period class: Chest Care and Nutrition. The second bell rang. One minute left before class starts. Radar and I had calculus, while Ben had combinatorial mathematics. The classrooms were right next to each other, we walked in, the three of us in a row, believing our friends would make enough space for us to pass, and they did.
tr_translation: He reviewed my answer for a moment, and I struggled to look into his closely set eyes. He nodded faintly, pulled his hand from the cupboard, and left to attend his first class: Care and Development of Chest Muscles, as the second bell rang. There was one minute left until the class started. Radar and I had mathematics, while Ben had finite mathematics. Our classrooms were adjacent; we walked towards them, trusting that the stream of our classmates would part enough to let us pass, and it did.
es_translation: He considered my answer for a minute, and I tried with all my might not to avert my gaze from his crossed eyes. He very gently nodded his head, stepped away from the locker, and went to his first class of the morning: Pectoral Muscle Maintenance. The second bell rang. There was one minute left before classes started. Radar and I had calculus, and Ben had finite mathematics. Our classes were next to each other. We headed to them together, the three of us in a row, trusting that the human tide would part enough to let us through, and it did.

en: I said, “Getting you a date to prom is so hard that a thousand monkeys typing at a thousand typewriters for a thousand years would never once type ‘I will go to prom with Ben.’”
vi: Tôi nói: “Cua được một em chịu đi dạ hội với ông là chuyện khó xảy ra đến mức một ngàn con khỉ gõ một ngàn cái máy chữ trong một ngàn năm cũng không một lần gõ dòng Tôi sẽ đi dạ hội với Ben.”
tr: “Sana balo partneri ayarlamak o kadar zor ki, bin tane maymun bin tane daktiloyla bin yıl boyunca yazı yazsa, bir kere bile ‘Ben’le baloya gideceğim’ yazmazdı,” dedim.
es: —Conseguirte una pareja para el baile es tan duro que mil monos tecleando en mil máquinas de escribir durante mil años no escribirían «Iré al baile de graduación con Ben» ni una sola vez —dije.
vi_translation: I said: “Getting a girl to agree to go to the prom with you is so unlikely that a thousand monkeys typing on a thousand typewriters for a thousand years would not once type the sentence 'I will go to the prom with Ben.'”
tr_translation: "It is so difficult to find you a dance partner that if a thousand monkeys typed on a thousand typewriters for a thousand years, they would never once write 'I will go to the dance with you'," I said.
es_translation: —Getting you a date for the dance is so hard that a thousand monkeys typing on a thousand typewriters for a thousand years wouldn't write "I'll go to the prom with Ben" even once —I said.

en: Ben could not resist tearing himself apart. “My prom prospects are so poor that Q’s grandma turned me down. She said she was waiting for Radar to ask her.”
vi: “Cua được một em chịu đi dạ hội với ông là chuyện khó xảy ra đến mức một ngàn con khỉ gõ một ngàn cái máy chữ trong một ngàn năm cũng không một lần gõ dòng Tôi sẽ đi dạ hội với Ben.” Ben không thể kìm nén khỏi suy sụp. “Viễn cảnh đi dạ hội của tôi thảm đến mức bà của Q cũng chẳng thèm đi với tôi. Bà bảo bà đang đợi Radar mời bà đi kìa.
tr: Ben kendisini rezil etme cazibesine daha fazla dayanamadı. “Baloya dair umutlarım o kadar zayıf ki Q’nun büyükannesi beni reddetti. Radar’ın davet etmesini beklediğini söyledi.
es: Ben no pudo resistirse a machacarse a sí mismo: —Tengo tan pocas posibilidades que hasta la abuela de Q me ha rechazado. Me ha dicho que estaba esperando a que se lo pidiera Radar.
vi_translation: Ben couldn't help but break down. “The prospect of me going to the prom is so pathetic that even Q's grandmother wouldn't go with me. She said she's waiting for Radar to ask her out.”
tr_translation: Ben kendisini rezil etme cazibesine daha fazla dayanamadı. “Baloya dair umutlarım o kadar zayıf ki Q’nun büyükannesi beni reddetti. Radar’ın davet etmesini beklediğini söyledi.”
es_translation: Ben couldn't resist beating himself up: —I have so few chances that even Q's grandmother has rejected me. She told me she was waiting for Radar to ask her.

en: Radar nodded his head slowly. “It’s true, Q. Your grandma loves the brothers.”
vi: Radar từ tốn gật đầu. “Đúng đấy, Q. Bà của ông khoái các chiến hữu mà.”
tr: Radar yavaşça başını salladı. “Bu doğru, Q. Büyükannen erkek kardeşleri seviyor.
es: Radar asintió despacio. —Es verdad, Q. A tu abuela le encantan tus colegas.
vi_translation: Radar slowly nodded. "That's right, Q. Your grandma likes her comrades."
tr_translation: Radar slowly nodded his head. "That's true, Q. Your grandmother likes brothers."
es_translation: Radar nodded slowly. —It's true, Q. Your grandmother loves your friends.

en: It was so pathetically easy to forget about Chuck, to talk about prom even though I didn’t give a shit about prom. Such was life that morning: nothing really mattered that much, not the good things and not the bad ones. We were in the business of mutual amusement, and we were reasonably prosperous.
vi: Dễ như bỡn thế là đã quên được Chuck, để say sưa bàn tán về buổi dạ hội dù tôi chẳng mảy may quan tâm đến nó. Cái sự đời sáng ngày hôm ấy: chẳng có gì thực sự quá hệ trọng, cả chuyện tốt lẫn chuyện xấu. Chúng tôi bận mỗi việc mua vui tiêu khiển cho nhau, và chúng tôi đã ung dung hào phóng một cách rất chính đáng.
tr: Chuck’ı boş verip hiç umurumda olmamasına rağmen baloyla ilgili konuşmak acınacak derecede kolaydı. O sabah hayat böyleydi: Hiçbir şey o kadar önemli değildi, iyi şeyler de, kötü şeyler de. Müşterek eğlence içindeydik ve epey başarılıydık.
es: Era patéticamente fácil olvidarse de Chuck y hablar del baile de graduación, aunque me importaba una mierda. Así era la vida aquella mañana: nada importaba demasiado, ni las cosas buenas ni las malas. Nos dedicábamos a divertirnos, y nos iba razonablemente bien.
vi_translation: It was so easy to forget Chuck, to eagerly discuss the ball even though I didn't care about it at all. The events of that morning: nothing was really too important, neither the good nor the bad. We were only busy entertaining each other, and we were leisurely generous in a very rightful way.
tr_translation: Ignoring Chuck and talking about the prom, even though I didn't care at all, was pathetically easy. That morning, life was like this: Nothing was that important, neither the good things nor the bad things. We were in shared amusement and we were quite successful.
es_translation: It was pathetically easy to forget about Chuck and talk about the prom, even though I didn't give a damn. That's how life was that morning: nothing mattered too much, neither the good things nor the bad. We were dedicated to having fun, and we were doing reasonably well.

en: I spent the next three hours in classrooms, trying not to look at the clocks above various blackboards, and then looking at the clocks, and then being amazed that only a few minutes had passed since I last looked at the clock. I’d had nearly four years of experience looking at these clocks, but their sluggishness never ceased to surprise. If I am ever told that I have one day to live, I will head straight for the hallowed halls of Winter Park High School, where a day has been known to last a thousand years.
vi: Ba giờ đồng hồ tiếp theo tôi ở trong lớp, cố không nhìn lên đám đồng hồ treo trên những tấm bảng đen, rồi nhìn đồng hồ, rồi tá hỏa nhận ra mới có mấy phút trôi qua kể từ lần cuối tôi xem giờ. Tôi đã có gần bốn năm kinh nghiệm xem đồng hồ, nhưng tốc độ rùa bò ì ạch đó chưa bao giờ khiến tôi hết ngạc nhiên. Giả sử chỉ được sống thêm một ngày, tôi sẽ lao ngay đến những hành lang hun hút của trường Winter Park, nơi ai cũng biết một ngày kéo dài như cả ngàn năm.
tr: Muhtelif tahtaların üzerindeki saatlere bakmamaya çalışarak, fakat sonra saatlere bakarak ve ardından son baktığımdan beri sadece birkaç dakika geçmiş olmasına şaşırarak sonraki üç saati farklı sınıflarda geçirdim. Bu saatlere bakma konusunda neredeyse dört yıllık bir deneyimim vardı ama uyuşuklukları beni her defasında şaşırtıyordu. Eğer sadece bir günüm kaldığı söylenirse, doğruca, bir günün bin yıl sürdüğü Winter Park Lisesi’nin kutsal koridorlarına giderim.
es: Pasé las tres horas siguientes en clase, intentando no mirar los relojes de encima de las diversas pizarras, y luego mirándolos y sorprendiéndome de que solo hubieran pasado unos minutos desde la última vez que había mirado. Aunque contaba con casi cuatro años de experiencia mirando aquellos relojes, su lentitud nunca dejaba de sorprenderme. Si alguna vez me dicen que me queda un día de vida, me iré directo a las sagradas aulas de la Winter Park High School, donde se sabe que un día dura mil años.
vi_translation: The next three hours I spent in class, trying not to look up at the clocks hanging on the blackboards, then looking at the clock, then panicking when I realized only a few minutes had passed since the last time I checked the time. I had nearly four years of experience watching the clock, but that snail's pace had never ceased to amaze me. If I were to live just one more day, I would rush to the endless corridors of Winter Park school, where everyone knows a day feels like a thousand years.
tr_translation: Trying not to look at the clocks on various boards, but then looking at the clocks and then being surprised that only a few minutes had passed since I last looked, I spent the next three hours in different classes. I had almost four years of experience with looking at these clocks, but their sluggishness surprised me every time. If I were told I had only one day left, I would go straight to the sacred corridors of Winter Park High School, where one day felt like a thousand years.
es_translation: I spent the next three hours in class, trying not to look at the clocks above the various blackboards, and then looking at them and being surprised that only a few minutes had passed since the last time I had looked. Even though I had almost four years of experience looking at those clocks, their slowness never ceased to amaze me. If I am ever told that I have one day left to live, I will go straight to the sacred halls of Winter Park High School, where it is known that a day lasts a thousand years.

en: But as much as it felt like third-period physics would never end, it did, and then I was in the cafeteria with Ben. Radar had fifth-period lunch with most of our other friends, so Ben and I generally sat together alone, a couple seats between us and a group of drama kids we knew. Today, we were both eating mini pepperoni pizzas.
vi: Hoặc dài như môn vật lí ở tiết thứ ba tưởng chừng không bao giờ đi đến hồi kết, nhưng cuối cùng nó cũng đã kết thúc, và rồi tôi vào căng-tin với Ben. Radar ăn bữa trưa vào tiết năm với hầu hết những đứa khác, thế nên nhìn chung Ben và tôi một mình ngồi cạnh nhau, có một đôi ngồi giữa chúng tôi và một nhóm trong đội kịch mà bọn tôi quen. Hôm nay, hai thằng bọn tôi đều ăn pizza xúc xích cay.
tr: Ancak üçüncü ders olan fizik hiçbir zaman bitmeyecekmiş gibi gelse de bitti ve sonra Ben’le kafeteryadaydım. Radar öğle yemeğini, diğer arkadaşlarımızın çoğuyla birlikte beşinci teneffüste yiyordu, bu yüzden ikimiz genelde baş başa otururduk, aramızda iki sandalye ve tiyatrodan tanıdığımız bir grup çocuk oturdu. Bugün ikimiz de biberli pizza yiyorduk.
es: Pero, por más que pareciera que la física de la tercera hora no iba a acabar nunca, acabó y de repente estaba en la cafetería con Ben. Radar comía más tarde con los demás amigos, así que Ben y yo solíamos sentarnos solos, con un par de asientos entre nosotros y un grupo de tipos de teatro. Aquel día los dos comíamos minipizzas de pepperoni.
vi_translation: Or as long as the physics class in the third period that seemed like it would never end, but eventually it did, and then I went to the canteen with Ben. Radar had lunch during the fifth period with most of the others, so generally, Ben and I sat alone next to each other, with a couple sitting between us and a group from the drama team that we knew. Today, both of us had spicy sausage pizza.
tr_translation: Although the third lesson, physics, seemed like it would never end, it finally did, and then I was in the cafeteria with Ben. Radar ate lunch during the fifth break with most of our other friends, so the two of us usually sat alone, with two chairs between us and a group of kids we knew from theater. Today, we were both eating pepperoni pizza.
es_translation: But, no matter how much it seemed that third-hour physics would never end, it did end, and suddenly I was in the cafeteria with Ben. Radar ate later with the other friends, so Ben and I usually sat alone, with a couple of seats between us and a group of theater guys. That day we were both eating pepperoni mini pizzas.

en: “Pizza’s good,” I said. He nodded distractedly. “What’s wrong?” I asked.
vi: “Pizza ngon tuyệt,” tôi nói. Ben lơ đãng gật đầu. “Có chuyện gì vậy?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Pizza iyi,” dedim. Ben dalgınca başını salladı. “Sorun ne?” diye sordum.
es: —La pizza está buena —dije. Ben asintió distraído. —¿Qué pasa? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: “The pizza is delicious,” I said. Ben nodded absentmindedly. “What's wrong?” I asked.
tr_translation: “Pizza is good,” I said. Ben nodded absentmindedly. “What’s the matter?” I asked.
es_translation: —The pizza is good —I said. Ben nodded distractedly. —What's happening? —I asked him.

en: “Nuffing,” he said through a mouthful of pizza. He swallowed. “I know you think it’s dumb, but I want to go to prom.”
vi: “Khùng cú giừ,” Ben trả lời bằng một miệng đầy bánh. Nó nuốt đánh ực. “Tôi biết ông nghĩ trò này rất lố, nhưng tôi muốn đi dạ hội.
tr: Ağız dolusu pizzayla, “Hüşbişe,” dedi. Yutkundu. “Aptalca olduğunu düşünüyorsun biliyorum ama baloya gitmek istiyorum.
es: —Nazza —dijo con la boca llena de pizza. Tragó—. Ya sé que crees que es una gilipollez, pero quiero ir al baile.
vi_translation: "Crazy old man," Ben replied with a mouth full of cake. He swallowed hard. "I know you think this is ridiculous, but I want to go to the prom."
tr_translation: With a mouthful of pizza, "Hushbish," he said. He swallowed. "I know you think it's stupid, but I want to go to the ball."
es_translation: —Nazza —he said with his mouth full of pizza. He swallowed—. I know you think it's nonsense, but I want to go to the dance.

en: “1. I do think it’s dumb; 2. If you want to go, just go; 3. If I’m not mistaken, you haven’t even asked anyone.”
vi: “1. Đúng là tôi thấy trò này lố; 2. Nếu ông thích thì cứ việc đi; 3. Nếu tôi không nhầm, ông đã ngỏ lời mời ai đâu.”
tr: “1. Öyle düşünüyorum; 2. Eğer gitmek istiyorsan git; 3. Eğer yanlış bilmiyorsam, daha kimseyi davet bile etmedin.
es: —Uno: sí, creo que es una gilipollez; dos: si te apetece ir, ve, y tres: si no me equivoco, ni siquiera se lo has pedido a nadie.
vi_translation: “1. Indeed, I find this game ridiculous; 2. If you like it, go ahead; 3. If I'm not mistaken, you haven't invited anyone yet.”
tr_translation: “1. I think so; 2. If you want to go, go; 3. If I'm not mistaken, you haven't even invited anyone yet.”
es_translation: —One: yes, I think it's nonsense; two: if you feel like going, go, and three: if I'm not mistaken, you haven't even asked anyone.

en: “I asked Cassie Hiney during math. I wrote her a note.” I raised my eyebrows questioningly. Ben reached into his shorts and slid a heavily folded piece of paper to me. I flattened it out:
vi: “Trong giờ toán tôi đã hỏi Cassie Hiney. Tôi viết giấy hẳn hoi.” Tôi trợn mắt lên đầy nghi hoặc. Ben thò tay vào túi quần lôi ra tờ giấy gấp dày cui đưa cho tôi. Tôi mở giấy ra: Ben,
tr: “Matematik dersinde, Cassie Hiney’yi davet ettim. Ona bir not yazdım.” Sorgular biçimde kaşlarımı kaldırdım. Ben şortuna uzandı ve çok kez katlanmış bir kâğıdı bana yolladı. Kâğıdı açtım:
es: —Se lo he pedido a Cassie Hiney en la clase de mates. Le he escrito una nota. Alcé las cejas en un gesto interrogante. Ben metió una mano en un bolsillo del pantalón corto y me deslizó un trozo de papel muy doblado. Lo aplané: Ben:
vi_translation: “During math class, I asked Cassie Hiney. I wrote a proper note.” I rolled my eyes skeptically. Ben reached into his pocket and pulled out a thickly folded piece of paper and handed it to me. I unfolded the paper:
tr_translation: “In math class, I invited Cassie Hiney. I wrote her a note.” I raised my eyebrows inquisitively. He reached into his shorts and handed me a piece of paper that was folded many times. I unfolded the paper:
es_translation: —I asked Cassie Hiney in math class. I wrote her a note. I raised my eyebrows in a questioning gesture. Ben put a hand into a pocket of his shorts and slipped me a very folded piece of paper. I flattened it:

en: Ben,
vi: Ben,
tr: Ben,
es: Ben:
vi_translation: Ben,
tr_translation: Ben,
es_translation: Ben: Hello, how are you?

en: I’d love to go to prom with you, but I’m already going
vi: Tớ cũng muốn đi dạ hội cùng cậu, nhưng tớ đã đồng ý sẽ đi với Frank rồi.
tr: Seninle baloya gitmeyi çok isterdim ama zaten
es: Me encantaría ir al baile contigo, pero ya he quedado con Frank.
vi_translation: I also want to go to the prom with you, but I already agreed to go with Frank.
tr_translation: I would love to go to the ball with you, but I already
es_translation: I would love to go to the dance with you, but I have already made plans with Frank.

en: I refolded it and slid it back across the table. I could remember playing paper football on these tables. “That sucks,” I said.
vi: Tôi gập giấy lại và trượt trả nó qua mặt bàn. Tôi vẫn nhớ đã từng chơi bóng đá bằng giấy trên những mặt bàn kiểu này. “Chán thế,” tôi nói.
tr: Kâğıdı tekrar katladım ve masanın karşısına doğru itekledim. Bu masalarda kâğıtla futbol oynadığımızı hatırlayabiliyordum. “Berbat,” dedim.
es: Lo doblé de nuevo y volví a deslizarlo por la mesa. Recordé haber jugado al fútbol de papel en aquellas mesas. —Vaya mierda —le dije.
vi_translation: I folded the paper and slid it back across the table. I still remember playing paper football on tables like these. "So boring," I said.
tr_translation: I folded the paper again and pushed it across the table. I could remember playing football with paper on these tables. "Terrible," I said.
es_translation: I folded it again and slid it back across the table. I remembered playing paper football on those tables. —What a piece of crap —I told him.

en: “Yeah, whatever.” The walls of sound felt like they were closing in on us, and we were silent for a while, and then Ben looked at me very seriously and said, “I’m going to get so much play in college. I’m going to be in the Guinness Book of World Records under the category ‘Most Honeybunnies Ever Pleased.’”
vi: “Ừa, chán gì đâu.” Những bức tường âm thanh dường như khép lại quanh chúng tôi, hai thằng ngồi lặng ngắt một lúc, rồi Ben nhìn tôi vẻ nghiêm trọng và nói, “Vào đại học tôi sẽ quậy tưng trường cho coi. Tôi sẽ được ghi vào Sách Kỉ Lục Guinness ở mục ‘Người chiều được nhiều thỏ non nhất.
tr: “Evet, neyse.” Etrafımızı ses duvarları çeviriyormuş gibi geldi ve bir süre sessiz kaldık, sonra Ben çok ciddi bir şekilde bana baktı ve “Üniversitede çok eğleneceğim ve ‘Tatmin Edilen En Çok Tavşancık’ kategorisi altında Guinness Rekorlar Kitabı’na gireceğim,” dedi.
es: —Sí, ya ves. El sonido ambiental parecía echársenos encima. Nos quedamos callados un momento, y luego Ben me miró muy serio y me dijo: —Voy a dar mucho juego en la facultad. Saldré en el Libro Guinness de los Récords, en la categoría «Ha dejado a más pavas satisfechas».
vi_translation: “Yeah, it's not boring at all.” The walls of sound seemed to close in around us, the two of us sat in silence for a moment, then Ben looked at me seriously and said, “When I get to college, I'm going to turn the place upside down. I'll be recorded in the Guinness Book of World Records under the category 'Person who can charm the most bunnies.'”
tr_translation: “Yes, anyway.” It felt like we were surrounded by walls of sound and we stayed silent for a while. Then Ben looked at me very seriously and said, “I’m going to have a lot of fun in college and get into the Guinness Book of World Records under the category of ‘Most Satisfied Bunny.’”
es_translation: —Yes, you see. The ambient sound seemed to close in on us. We remained silent for a moment, and then Ben looked at me very seriously and said: —I'm going to be a big hit at the faculty. I'll make it into the Guinness Book of World Records, in the category "Has left the most chicks satisfied."

en: I laughed. I was thinking about how Radar’s parents actually were in the Guinness Book when I noticed a pretty African-American girl with spiky little dreads standing above us. It took me a moment to realize that the girl was Angela, Radar’s I-guess-girlfriend.
vi: Tôi cười phá lên. Còn đang mải nghĩ chuyện bố mẹ Radar đã thực sự được đưa vào Sách Guinness như thế nào, tôi chợt nhận thấy có một cô bạn người gốc Phi trông rất xinh với những lọn tóc tinh nghịch đang đứng trước mặt mình. Mất một lúc tôi mới nhận ra đó là Angela, theo-phỏng-đoán-của-tôi là bạn gái Radar.
tr: Güldüm. Küçük, sivri uçlu rastaları olan, sevimli, siyahi bir kızın tepemizde durduğunu fark ettiğimde, Radar’ın ebeveynlerinin nasıl gerçekten Guinness'te olduğunu düşünüyordum. Bu kızın Angela olduğunu anlamam çok kısa bir zamanımı aldı, Radar’m “tahminimcekız arkadaşı”.
es: Me reí. Estaba pensando que los padres de Radar aparecían realmente en el Libro Guinness cuando vi por encima de nosotros a una guapa afroamericana con pequeñas rastas de punta. Tardé unos segundos en darme cuenta de que era Angela, la novia de Radar, supongo.
vi_translation: I burst out laughing. While still lost in thoughts about how Radar's parents actually got into the Guinness Book, I suddenly noticed a very pretty African-American girl with playful curls standing in front of me. It took me a moment to realize that it was Angela, who I guessed was Radar's girlfriend.
tr_translation: I laughed. When I noticed a cute, black girl with small, pointy dreadlocks standing above us, I was thinking about how Radar's parents were really in the Guinness Book. It took me very little time to realize that this girl was Angela, Radar's "presumably girlfriend."
es_translation: I laughed. I was thinking that Radar's parents actually appeared in the Guinness Book when I saw above us a beautiful African American woman with small pointed dreadlocks. It took me a few seconds to realize that it was Angela, Radar's girlfriend, I suppose.

en: “Hi,” she said to me.
vi: “Chào,” cô ấy lên tiếng với tôi.
tr: “Selam,” dedi bana.
es: —Hola —me dijo.
vi_translation: "Hello," she said to me.
tr_translation: “Hello,” he said to me.
es_translation: —Hello —he said to me.

en: “Hey,” I said. I’d had classes with Angela and knew her a little, but we didn’t say hello in the hallway or anything. I motioned for her to sit. She scooted a chair to the head of the table.
vi: “Chào cậu,” tôi đáp. Tôi đã học chung lớp với Angela nên cũng biết sơ sơ, nhưng tôi và cô ấy chưa từng chào nhau ở hành lang hay đại loại như vậy. Tôi nhích sang một bên nhường chỗ cho Angela ngồi. Cô ấy lách qua ghế ngồi xuống phía đầu bàn.
tr: “Selam,” dedim. Angela’yla aynı derse girmişliğim vardı ve onu biraz tanıyordum ama koridorda birbirimize selam vermemiş ya da herhangi bir şey dememiştik. Oturması için elimle işaret ettim. Masanın başına doğru bir sandalye çekti.
es: —Hola —le contesté. Conocía de vista a Angela porque había ido a alguna clase con ella, pero no nos saludábamos en los pasillos ni cuando nos encontrábamos por ahí. Le indiqué con un gesto que se sentara y acercó una silla a la mesa.
vi_translation: "Hello," I replied. I had been in the same class as Angela, so I knew her a little, but we had never greeted each other in the hallway or anything like that. I moved aside to make room for Angela to sit. She squeezed past the chair and sat down at the head of the table.
tr_translation: "Hello," I said. I had been in the same class with Angela and knew her a little, but we hadn't greeted each other or said anything in the corridor. I motioned for her to sit down. She pulled a chair towards the head of the table.
es_translation: —Hello —I replied. I knew Angela by sight because I had attended some class with her, but we didn't greet each other in the hallways or when we ran into each other around. I gestured for her to sit down and she pulled a chair up to the table.

en: “I figure that you guys probably know Marcus better than anyone,” she said, using Radar’s real name. She leaned toward us, her elbows on the table.
vi: “Hình như các cậu là những người hiểu Marcus nhất,” Angela vào đề, dùng tên thật của Radar. Cô ấy nghiêng người về phía bọn tôi, khuỷu tay tì lên mặt bàn.
tr: Radar’ın gerçek ismini kullanarak, “Siz çocukların Marcus’u herkesten daha iyi tanıdığınızı düşünüyorum,” dedi. Dirsekleri masada, bize doğru eğildi.
es: —Chicos, supongo que conocéis a Marcus mejor que nadie —dijo empleando el nombre real de Radar, con los codos en la mesa.
vi_translation: “It seems like you guys understand Marcus the best,” Angela began, using Radar's real name. She leaned towards us, her elbows resting on the table.
tr_translation: Using Radar's real name, he said, "I think you kids know Marcus better than anyone else." With his elbows on the table, he leaned towards us.
es_translation: —Guys, I suppose you know Marcus better than anyone —he said, using Radar's real name, with his elbows on the table.

en: “It’s a shitty job, but someone’s got to do it,” Ben answered, smiling.
vi: “Một sứ mệnh chán òm, nhưng cũng phải có ai đó chịu trận chứ,” Ben đáp, nhe răng cười.
tr: “Boktan bir iş ama birinin yapması gerekiyor,” diye cevap verdi Ben gülümseyerek.
es: —Es un trabajo de mierda, pero alguien tiene que hacerlo —le contestó Ben sonriendo.
vi_translation: “A boring mission, but someone has to take the hit,” Ben replied, grinning.
tr_translation: “It's a crappy job, but someone has to do it,” Ben replied with a smile.
es_translation: —It's a shitty job, but someone has to do it —Ben replied, smiling.

en: “Do you think he’s, like, embarrassed of me?”
vi: “Các cậu có nghĩ cậu ấy, ừm, xấu hổ vì tớ không?” Ben cười phá lên.
tr: “Sizce benden utanıyor mu?
es: —¿Creéis que se avergüenza de mí o algo así?
vi_translation: “Do you guys think he, um, is embarrassed because of me?”
tr_translation: “Do you think he is ashamed of me?”
es_translation: —Do you think he's ashamed of me or something like that?

en: Ben laughed. “What? No,” he said.
vi: “Các cậu có nghĩ cậu ấy, ừm, xấu hổ vì tớ không?” Ben cười phá lên. “Cái gì cơ? Không đâu,” nó nói.
tr: Ben güldü. “Ne? Hayır,” dedi.
es: Ben se rió. —¿Qué? No —le contestó.
vi_translation: Ben burst out laughing. “What? No way,” he said.
tr_translation: I laughed. "What? No," he said.
es_translation: Ben laughed. —What? No —he/she replied.

en: “Technically,” I added, “you should be embarrassed of him.”
vi: “Thật ra thì,” tôi thêm thắt, “chính cậu thấy xấu hổ vì cậu ta mới phải.”
tr: ‘Teknik olarak,” diye ekledim, “sen ondan utanıyor olmaksın.
es: —Técnicamente —añadí—, deberías ser tú la que se avergonzara de él.
vi_translation: "Actually," I added, "it's you who should be ashamed of him."
tr_translation: “Technically,” I added, “you are not ashamed of him.””
es_translation: —Technically —I added—, you should be the one ashamed of him.

en: She rolled her eyes, smiling. A girl accustomed to compliments. “But he’s never, like, invited me to hang out with you, though.”
vi: Cô ấy tròn mắt chớp chớp và mỉm cười. Một cô nàng quen được khen ngợi đây. “Nhưng dù gì cậu ấy chưa bao giờ, thế nào nhỉ, rủ tớ tụ tập cùng các cậu.”
tr: Gülümseyerek gözlerini devirdi. İltifatlara alışkın bir kız. “Ama beni hiç sizinle takılmaya falan davet etmedi jöne de.
es: Miró hacia arriba y sonrió. Una chica acostumbrada a los piropos. —Pues nunca me ha invitado a salir con vosotros.
vi_translation: She widened her eyes and blinked, then smiled. A girl who is used to being praised. "But anyway, he has never, how should I put it, invited me to hang out with you guys."
tr_translation: She rolled her eyes with a smile. A girl accustomed to compliments. “But he never invited me to hang out with you guys or anything.”
es_translation: He looked up and smiled. A girl accustomed to compliments. —Well, he has never invited me to go out with you all.

en: “Ohhhh,” I said, getting it finally. “That’s because he’s embarrassed of us.”
vi: “Ồồồ...,” rút cục tôi đã hiểu ra vấn đề. “Tại cậu ta xấu hổ vì bọn tớ chứ sao.”
tr: Sonunda durumu anlayıp, “Haaa,” dedim. “Bunun nedeni bizden utanması.
es: —Ahhh —dije; por fin lo pillaba—. Eso es porque se avergüenza de nosotros.
vi_translation: “Ohhh...,” I finally understood the issue. “He’s embarrassed because of us, isn’t he?”
tr_translation: Finally understanding the situation, I said, "Ahhh." "The reason is that he is ashamed of us."
es_translation: —Ahhh —I said; I finally got it—. That's because he's ashamed of us.

en: She laughed. “You seem pretty normal.”
vi: Angela bật cười. “Các cậu có gì quái đản đâu.”
tr: Güldü. “Oldukça normal görünüyorsunuz.
es: Se rió. —Parecéis bastante normales.
vi_translation: Angela burst out laughing. "You guys aren't weird at all."
tr_translation: She laughed. "You look quite normal."
es_translation: He laughed. —You seem quite normal.

en: “You’ve never seen Ben snort Sprite up his nose and then spit it out of his mouth,” I said.
vi: “Cậu chưa chứng kiến cảnh Ben hít Sprite bằng mũi rồi phì ra đằng mồm đấy thôi,” tôi nói.
tr: “Ben’i burnuna Sprite çekip sonra ağzından çıkarırken hiç görmedin,” dedim.
es: —Nunca has visto a Ben esnifando Sprite por la nariz y sacándolo por la boca —le dije.
vi_translation: “You haven't witnessed Ben snorting Sprite through his nose and then spitting it out through his mouth,” I said.
tr_translation: "You've never seen me snort Sprite up my nose and then blow it out of my mouth," I said.
es_translation: —You've never seen Ben snorting Sprite through his nose and blowing it out through his mouth —I told him.

en: “I look like a demented carbonated fountain,” he deadpanned.
vi: “Lúc đó trông tớ như một đài phun nước có ga đang trong cơn cuồng nộ ấy,” Ben nói tỉnh rụi.
tr: Ben, “Çıldırmış, gazlı bir çeşme gibi görünüyorum,” dedi ruhsuz bir ifadeyle.
es: —Soy como una enloquecida fuente carbonatada —añadió Ben, impávido.
vi_translation: “At that moment, I looked like a carbonated fountain in a fit of rage,” Ben said nonchalantly.
tr_translation: "I look like a crazy, fizzy fountain," Ben said with a lifeless expression.
es_translation: —I am like a crazed carbonated fountain —added Ben, impassive.

en: “But really, you wouldn’t worry? I mean, we’ve been dating for five weeks, and he’s never even taken me to his house.” Ben and I exchanged a knowing glance, and I scrunched up my face to suppress laughter. “What?” she asked.
vi: “Nhưng nếu là các cậu thì các cậu có lo không? Bọn tớ hẹn hò được năm tuần rồi mà cậu ấy chưa bao giờ đưa tớ đến nhà cả.” Ben và tôi liếc nhau một cái kiểu biết-ngay-mà, mặt tôi như muốn rúm lại vì nhịn cười. “Sao thế?” Angela hỏi.
tr: “Ama gerçekten, siz endişelenmez miydiniz? Yani, beş haftadır çıkıyoruz ve beni evine bile götürmedi.” Ben’le manah bir şekilde bakıştık ve ben kahkahamı bastırmak için yüzümü buruşturdum. “Ne?” diye sordu Angela.
es: —De verdad, chicos, ¿vosotros no os preocuparíais? No sé, llevamos cinco semanas saliendo y ni siquiera me ha llevado a su casa. —Ben y yo intercambiamos una mirada cómplice, y yo me estrujé la cara para no soltar una carcajada—. ¿Qué pasa? —preguntó Angela.
vi_translation: “But if it were you guys, would you be worried? We’ve been dating for five weeks and he’s never taken me to his house.” Ben and I exchanged a knowing glance, my face contorting as I tried to suppress my laughter. “What’s wrong?” Angela asked.
tr_translation: “But really, wouldn't you be worried? I mean, we've been dating for five weeks and he hasn't even taken me to his house.” Ben and I exchanged a meaningful look, and I scrunched up my face to suppress my laughter. “What?” asked Angela.
es_translation: —Honestly, guys, wouldn't you be worried? I don't know, we've been dating for five weeks and he hasn't even taken me to his house. —Ben and I exchanged a knowing look, and I scrunched up my face to keep from bursting into laughter—. What's going on? —asked Angela.

en: “Nothing,” I said. “Honestly, Angela. If he was forcing you to hang out with us and taking you to his house all the time—”
vi: “Không sao,” tôi đáp. “Tớ nói thật, Angela ạ, nếu cậu ta bắt cậu tụ bạ với bọn tớ và suốt ngày đưa cậu đến nhà cậu ta...”
tr: “Hiç,” dedim. “Doğrusu, Angela, seni bizimle takılmaya zorluyor ve sürekli evine götürüyor olsaydı...
es: —Nada —le contesté—. Sinceramente, Angela, si te obligara a salir con nosotros y te llevara a su casa cada dos por tres…
vi_translation: “No problem,” I replied. “I'm serious, Angela, if he makes you hang out with us and takes you to his house all the time...”
tr_translation: "Nothing," I said. "Honestly, Angela, if she were forcing you to hang out with us and constantly taking you home..."
es_translation: —Nothing —I replied—. Honestly, Angela, if he forced you to go out with us and took you to his house every other day...

en: “Then it would definitely mean he didn’t like you,” Ben finished.
vi: “Thì như vậy đứt đuôi con nòng nọc là cậu ta không thích cậu chút nào đâu,” Ben kết thúc vấn đề.
tr: “Kesinlikle senden hoşlanmıyor demek olurdu,” diye bitirdi Ben.
es: —Sin la menor duda significaría que no le gustas —terminó Ben.
vi_translation: “So, in short, he doesn't like you at all,” Ben concluded.
tr_translation: “It would definitely mean that she doesn't like you,” Ben concluded.
es_translation: —Without the slightest doubt, it would mean that she doesn't like you —finished Ben.

en: “Are his parents weird?”
vi: “Bố mẹ cậu ấy dị lắm à
tr: “Ebeveynleri mi tuhaf?
es: —¿Sus padres son raros?
vi_translation: “Are his parents weird?”
tr_translation: “Are their parents weird?”
es_translation: —Are your parents weird?

en: I struggled with how to answer that question honestly. “Uh, no. They’re cool. They’re just kinda overprotective, I guess.”
vi: Tôi chật vật tìm cách trả lời câu hỏi ấy một cách thành thực. “Ừm, không đâu. Hai bác ấy hay phết. Cơ mà tớ nghĩ hai bác cưng cậu ta hơi kĩ thôi.”
tr: Bu soruya nasıl dürüstçe cevap vereceğimi düşünerek çırpındım. “Ah, hayır, iyiler. Sadece biraz aşırı koruyucular, sanırım.
es: Pensé en cómo responder sinceramente a su pregunta. —No, no. Son guays. Solo algo sobreprotectores, supongo.
vi_translation: I struggled to find a way to answer that question honestly. "Um, not really. They're pretty cool. But I think they spoil him a bit too much."
tr_translation: I struggled to think of how to answer this question honestly. "Oh, no, they're good. Just a bit overprotective, I guess."
es_translation: I thought about how to respond sincerely to their question. —No, no. They are cool. Just a bit overprotective, I guess.

en: “Yeah, overprotective,” Ben agreed a little too quickly.
vi: “Ờ, cưng hơi kĩ,” Ben đồng ý phắt luôn, một cách hơi bị quá nhanh.
tr: “Evet, aşırı koruyucu,” diye katıldı Ben, biraz fazla hızlı bir şekilde.
es: —Sí, sobreprotectores —convino Ben un poco demasiado deprisa.
vi_translation: “Well, you're a bit meticulous,” Ben agreed immediately, a bit too quickly.
tr_translation: “Yes, overly protective,” Ben agreed, a bit too quickly.
es_translation: —Yes, overprotective —agreed Ben a little too quickly.

en: She smiled and then got up, saying she had to go say hi to someone before lunch was over. Ben waited until she was gone to say anything. “That girl is awesome,” Ben said.
vi: Angela mỉm cười đứng dậy, nói là phải đi kiếm ai đó trước khi hết giờ ăn trưa. Ben đợi cô ấy đi khuất rồi mới thốt lên, “Một cô nàng hơi bị được!”
tr: Angela gülümsedi ve öğle yemeği bitmeden önce gidip birine selam vermesi gerektiğini söyleyerek kalktı. Ben, bir şey söylemek için o gidene kadar bekledi. Sonra, “Bu kız müthiş,” dedi.
es: Angela sonrió y se levantó diciendo que tenía que ir a saludar a alguien antes de que acabara la hora de comer. Ben esperó a que se hubiera marchado para abrir la boca. —Esta chica es impresionante —me dijo.
vi_translation: Angela smiled and stood up, saying she had to go find someone before lunchtime was over. Ben waited until she was out of sight before exclaiming, "What a girl!"
tr_translation: Angela smiled and got up, saying she needed to go greet someone before lunch was over. Ben waited until she left to say something. Then, he said, "This girl is amazing."
es_translation: Angela smiled and stood up, saying that she had to go greet someone before lunchtime was over. Ben waited for her to leave before opening his mouth. —This girl is impressive —he told me.

en: “I know,” I answered. “I wonder if we can replace Radar with her.”
vi: “Chứ còn gì nữa,” tôi nói. “Hay là ông với tôi đá béng thằng Radar đi để chơi với cô nàng này nhỉ.”
tr: “Biliyorum,” diye cevap verdim. “Acaba Radar’la onu değiştirebilir miyiz?
es: —Lo sé —le contesté—. Me pregunto si podríamos sustituir a Radar por ella.
vi_translation: "What else could it be," I said. "Or how about you and I ditch Radar to hang out with this girl instead."
tr_translation: “I know,” I replied. “I wonder if we can swap it with Radar?”
es_translation: —I know —I replied—. I wonder if we could replace Radar with her.

en: “She’s probably not that good with computers, though. We need someone who’s good at computers. Plus I bet she sucks at Resurrection,” which was our favorite video game. “By the way,” Ben added, “nice call saying that Radar’s folks are overprotective.”
vi: “Cơ mà chắc cô nàng không kì tài máy tính bằng thằng Radar đâu. Bọn mình cần người giỏi máy tính mà ông. Mới cả tôi cá là cô nàng chơi Hồi Sinh rất ấm ớ,” đó là trò chơi điện tử mấy đứa bọn tôi đều ghiền. “Mà này,” Ben nói thêm, “nói ông bà già của Radar cưng nó hơi kĩ nghe hay đấy.”
tr: “Gerçi muhtemelen bilgisayar konusunda Radar kadar iyi değildir. Bilgisayardan iyi anlayan birine ihtiyacımız var. Üstelik Diriliş’te berbat olduğuna bahse girerim.” Diriliş en sevdiğimiz bilgisayar oyunuydu. “Bu arada,” diye ekledi Ben, ‘Radar’ın ailesinin aşırı koruyucu olduğunu söylemek iyi fikirdi.
es: —Aunque seguramente no es muy buena con los ordenadores. Necesitamos a alguien bueno. Además, apuesto a que no tiene ni idea del Resurrection, nuestro videojuego favorito. Por cierto, una buena salida decir que los viejos de Radar son sobreprotectores.
vi_translation: “But she probably isn't as much of a computer whiz as Radar. We need someone good with computers, man. Plus, I bet she's pretty clueless at Resurrection,” which is the video game we're all addicted to. “By the way,” Ben added, “it sounds funny when you say Radar's parents spoil him a bit too much.”
tr_translation: “Although he is probably not as good with computers as Radar. We need someone who understands computers well. Besides, I bet he's terrible at Resurrection.” Resurrection is our favorite It was a computer game. “By the way,” Ben added, “it was a good idea to mention that Radar’s family is overly protective.”
es_translation: —Although she surely isn't very good with computers. We need someone good. Besides, I bet she has no idea about Resurrection, our favorite video game. By the way, a good excuse is to say that Radar's parents are overprotective.

en: “Well, it’s not my place to tell her,” I said.
vi: “Ờ thì tôi sao có thể bép xép gì được,” tôi nói.
tr: “Şey, Angela’ya anlatmak bana düşmezdi,” dedim.
es: —Bueno, no es cosa mía decírselo —le respondí.
vi_translation: “Well, how could I possibly blab anything,” I said.
tr_translation: "Well, it wasn't my place to tell Angela," I said.
es_translation: —Well, it's not my place to tell you —I replied.

en: “I wonder how long till she gets to see the Team Radar Residence and Museum.” Ben smiled.
vi: “Không biết khi nào Angela sẽ được tham quan Dinh Thự Bảo Tàng Nhà Radar nhỉ,” Ben cười nhăn nhở.
tr: “Radar Takımı Konutu ve Müzesi’ni görmesi ne kadar sürecek merak ediyorum.” Ben gülümsedi.
es: —A ver cuánto tarda en ver la Residencia Museo del Equipo de Radar —dijo Ben sonriendo.
vi_translation: “I wonder when Angela will get to visit the Radar House Museum Mansion,” Ben grinned mischievously.
tr_translation: “I wonder how long it will take to see the Radar Team Residence and Museum.” Ben smiled.
es_translation: —Let's see how long it takes to see the Radar Team Museum Residence —said Ben, smiling.

en: The period was almost over, so Ben and I got up and put our trays onto the conveyer belt. The very same one that Chuck Parson had thrown me onto freshman year, sending me into the terrifying netherworld of Winter Park’s dishwashing corps. We walked over to Radar’s locker and were standing there when he raced up just after the first bell.
vi: Sắp hết giờ nghỉ, Ben và tôi đứng dậy đặt khay đồ ăn trưa lên băng chuyền. Chính cái băng chuyền Chuck Parson đã từng lẳng tôi lên hồi tôi mới lơ ngơ vào trường, ném tôi xuống lãnh địa ngầm đầy kinh hãi của tập đoàn tẩy rửa bát đĩa Winter Park. Bọn tôi đi đến chỗ ngăn tủ cá nhân của Radar và vẫn đứng đó khi nó xoẹt đến sau hồi chuông thứ nhất.
tr: Teneffüs neredeyse bitmek üzereydi, bu yüzden Ben’le kalktık ve tepsilerimizi taşıma bandına koyduk. İlk senemde Chuck’m beni üstüne fırlatarak Winter Park’ın bulaşıkçılar birliğinin korkunç cehennemine gönderen bandın ta kendisine. Radar’m dolabına doğru yürüdük ve ilk zilden hemen sonra Radar oraya koştuğunda hâlâ aynı yerde duruyorduk.
es: La pausa casi había terminado, así que Ben y yo nos levantamos y dejamos las bandejas en la cinta transportadora, la misma a la que Chuck Parson me había lanzado el primer año de instituto, lo que me envió al inframundo de la plantilla de lavaplatos de Winter Park. Nos dirigimos a la taquilla de Radar, y allí estábamos cuando llegó corriendo, justo después del primer timbre.
vi_translation: Lunch break was almost over, Ben and I stood up and placed our lunch trays on the conveyor belt. The very same conveyor belt that Chuck Parson had once thrown me onto when I was new and clueless at school, tossing me down into the terrifying underworld of the Winter Park dishwashing crew. We went to Radar's locker and were still standing there when he zipped over after the first bell.
tr_translation: Recess was almost over, so Ben and I got up and put our trays on the conveyor belt. The very same belt that, in my first year, Chuck had thrown me onto, sending me into the terrifying hell of Winter Park's dishwashers' union. We walked towards Radar's locker, and when Radar ran there right after the first bell, we were still standing in the same place.
es_translation: The break was almost over, so Ben and I got up and left the trays on the conveyor belt, the same one that Chuck Parson had thrown me onto in my freshman year, which sent me to the underworld of the Winter Park dishwasher crew. We headed to Radar's locker, and we were there when he came running, just after the first bell.

en: “I decided during government that I would actually, literally suck donkey balls if it meant I could skip that class for the rest of the semester,” he said.
vi: “Trong giờ học môn nhà nước và chính quyền, tôi đã quyết định rằng nếu phải liếm bi của lừa mà có thể được bỏ qua môn ấy cho đến hết học kì, thì tôi sẵn sàng cam tâm tự nguyện làm như vậy,” Radar làu bàu.
tr: “Siyaset dersi sırasında bir karar verdim: Eğer yarıyılın geri kalanında bu dersi atlatabilmem anlamına gelecekse gerçekten, kelimesi kelimesine eşek hayalarım bile yalarım,” dedi Radar.
es: —En la clase de política he decidido que sería capaz de chuparle los huevos a un burro, literalmente, si con eso pudiera librarme de esa clase hasta el final del trimestre —dijo.
vi_translation: “During the state and government class, I decided that if I had to lick a donkey's balls to be exempted from that subject for the rest of the semester, I would willingly and voluntarily do so,” Radar muttered.
tr_translation: “During the politics class, I made a decision: If it means I can get through the rest of the semester, I would literally, word for word, lick donkey balls,” said Radar.
es_translation: —In politics class, I decided that I would be willing to suck a donkey's balls, literally, if that could get me out of that class until the end of the term —he said.

en: “You can learn a lot about government from donkey balls,” I said. “Hey, speaking of reasons you wish you had fourth-period lunch, we just dined with Angela.”
vi: “Ờ, bi của lừa có thể dạy ông khối thứ về nhà nước và chính quyền đấy,” tôi nói. “Mà này, nói về những lí do có thể khiến ông ước gì mình đã ăn trưa từ tiết bốn, tụi tôi vừa ngồi ăn cùng Angela đấy.”
tr: “Eşek hayalarından siyasetle ilgili çok şey öğrenebilirsin,” dedim. “Hey, hazır dördüncü teneffüste öğle yemeğine çıkmak isteme nedenlerinden bahsetmişken, az önce Angela’yla yemek yedik.
es: —Puedes aprender mucho sobre política de los huevos de un burro —le contesté—. Oye, hablando de las razones por las que deberías hacer la pausa del mediodía una hora antes, acabamos de comer con Angela.
vi_translation: “Well, a donkey's balls can teach you a lot about the state and government,” I said. “By the way, speaking of reasons you might wish you had lunch during the fourth period, we just had lunch with Angela.”
tr_translation: “You can learn a lot about politics from donkey balls,” I said. “Hey, speaking of reasons for wanting to go out for lunch during the fourth recess, we just had lunch with Angela.”
es_translation: —You can learn a lot about politics from a donkey's eggs —I replied—. Hey, speaking of the reasons why you should take the midday break an hour earlier, we just had lunch with Angela.

en: Ben smirked at Radar and said, “Yeah, she wants to know why she’s never been over to your house.”
vi: Ben nhếch mép với Radar và nói: “Ừa, cô nàng thắc mắc là sao chả bao giờ được đến nhà ông.”
tr: Ben, Radar’a pişmiş kelle gibi sırıttı. “Evet, neden senin evine hiç gitmediğini merak ediyor.
es: —Sí —dijo Ben sonriéndole con suficiencia—, quiere saber por qué nunca la has llevado a tu casa.
vi_translation: Ben smirked at Radar and said, "Yeah, she wonders why she never gets to come to your house."
tr_translation: Ben grinned at Radar like a Cheshire cat. "Yes, he wonders why he has never been to your house."
es_translation: —Yes —said Ben, smiling smugly—, she wants to know why you have never taken her to your house.

en: Radar exhaled a long breath as he spun the combination to open his locker. He breathed for so long I thought he might pass out. “Crap,” he said finally.
vi: Radar thở hắt ra một hơi dài thườn thượt trong khi quẳng một đống hầm bà lằng vào tủ đựng đồ. Nó thở dài lâu đến mức tôi tưởng nó sẽ đứt hơi ngất xỉu luôn mất. “Mạt quá đi mất,” rút cục nó nói.
tr: Radar, dolabım açmak için şifresini girerken derin bir nefes aldı. O kadar uzun süre nefes aldı ki bayılacağım düşündüm. “Lanet olsun,” dedi sonunda.
es: Radar lanzó un largo soplido mientras giraba la cerradura de combinación para abrir la taquilla. Soltó tanto aire que pensé que iba a desmayarse. —Mierda —dijo por fin.
vi_translation: Radar let out a long, drawn-out sigh while tossing a bunch of random stuff into the locker. He sighed so long that I thought he would pass out from lack of breath. “It's too bad,” it finally said.
tr_translation: Radar took a deep breath as he entered the code to open his locker. He held his breath for so long that I thought I would faint. “Damn it,” he finally said.
es_translation: Radar let out a long sigh as he turned the combination lock to open the locker. He exhaled so much air that I thought he was going to faint. —Shit —he finally said.

en: “Are you embarrassed about something?” I asked, smiling.
vi: “Ông xí hổ chuyện gì sao?” Tôi cười cười hỏi.
tr: Gülerek, “Bir şeyden mi utanıyorsun?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Te avergüenzas de algo? —le pregunté sonriendo.
vi_translation: “Are you embarrassed about something?” I asked with a smile.
tr_translation: Smiling, I asked, "Are you ashamed of something?"
es_translation: —Are you ashamed of something? —I asked him, smiling.

en: “Shut up,” he answered, poking his elbow into my gut.
vi: “Tắt ngay,” Radar cau có thúc cùi chỏ vào bụng tôi. “Nhà ông đẹp thế còn gì,” tôi chưa tha.
tr: Dirseğiyle midemi dürterek, “Kapa çeneni,” diye cevap verdi.
es: —Cállate —me contestó pegándome un codazo en la barriga.
vi_translation: “Turn it off now,” Radar grumbled, elbowing me in the stomach.
tr_translation: He nudged my stomach with his elbow and replied, "Shut up."
es_translation: —Shut up —he replied, giving me an elbow in the stomach.

en: “You live in a lovely home,” I said.
vi: “Tắt ngay,” Radar cau có thúc cùi chỏ vào bụng tôi. “Nhà ông đẹp thế còn gì,” tôi chưa tha.
tr: “Sevimli bir yuvada yaşıyorsun,” dedim.
es: —Vives en una casa preciosa —le dije.
vi_translation: “Your house is so beautiful,” I persisted.
tr_translation: "You live in a lovely home," I said.
es_translation: —You live in a beautiful house —I said to her.

en: “Seriously, bro,” added Ben. “She’s a really nice girl. I don’t see why you can’t introduce her to your parents and show her Casa Radar.”
vi: “Tôi nói nghiêm túc với ông nhé,” Ben bồi thêm. “Angela thật sự dễ mến. Tôi không hiểu sao ông không cho bạn ấy gặp bố mẹ ông và xem một vòng Casa[4] Radar nhỉ.”
tr: “Dostum, cidden,” diye ekledi Ben. “Angela gerçekten hoş bir kız. Neden onu ailene tanıtmadığım ve Casa3 Radar’ı göstermediğini anlamıyorum. 3 (İsp.) Ev. (ç. n.
es: —En serio, colega —añadió Ben—. Es una chica muy maja. No entiendo por qué no se la presentas a tus padres y le enseñas la Finca Radar.
vi_translation: “I'm serious with you,” Ben added. “Angela is really nice. I don't understand why you don't let her meet your parents and take a tour of Casa Radar.”
tr_translation: “Dude, seriously,” added Ben. “Angela is really a nice girl. I don't understand why you haven't introduced her to your family and shown her Casa3 Radar.” 3 (Sp.) House. (pl. n.)
es_translation: —Seriously, man —added Ben—. She is a really nice girl. I don't understand why you don't introduce her to your parents and show her the Radar Estate.

en: Radar threw his books into his locker and shut it. The din of conversation around us quieted just a bit as he turned his eyes toward the heavens and shouted, “IT IS NOT MY FAULT THAT MY PARENTS OWN THE WORLD’S LARGEST COLLECTION OF BLACK SANTAS.”
vi: Tôi không hiểu sao ông không cho bạn ấy gặp bố mẹ ông và xem một vòng Casa[4] Radar nhỉ.” Radar ném nốt sách vào ngăn tủ rồi đóng lại. Không khí trò chuyện chộn rộn quanh chúng tôi tắt lịm khi Radar nhìn thẳng lên trời và hét, “ÔNG BÀ GIÀ TÔI CÓ BỘ SƯU TẬP ÔNG GIÀ NOEL DA ĐEN ĐỒ SỘ NHẤT THẾ GIỚI THÌ CÓ PHẢI LỖI TẠI TÔI QUÁI ĐÂU!”
tr: n. Radar kitaplarını dolaba fırlatıp kapağını kapattı. Etrafımızdaki konuşmalar, o gözlerini'gökyüzüne çevirip bağırırken biraz sessizleşti: “EBEVEYNLERİMİN, DÜNYANIN EN GENİŞ ZENCİ NOEL BABA KOLEKSİYONUNA SAHİP OLMASI BENİM SUÇUM DEĞİL.
es: Radar lanzó sus libros a la taquilla y la cerró. El ruido de conversaciones que nos rodeaba se silenció un poco mientras levantaba los ojos al cielo y gritaba: —NO ES CULPA MÍA QUE MIS PADRES TENGAN LA COLECCIÓN MÁS GRANDE DEL MUNDO DE SANTA CLAUS NEGROS.
vi_translation: Radar threw the book into the drawer and closed it. The lively conversation around us died down when Radar looked straight up at the sky and shouted, “IT'S NOT MY FAULT THAT MY PARENTS HAVE THE WORLD'S LARGEST COLLECTION OF BLACK SANTA CLAUSES!”
tr_translation: He threw the radar books into the cupboard and closed the door. The conversations around us quieted a bit as he turned his eyes to the sky and shouted: “IT'S NOT MY FAULT THAT MY PARENTS HAVE THE WORLD'S LARGEST BLACK SANTA CLAUS COLLECTION.”
es_translation: Radar threw his books into the locker and closed it. The noise of conversations around us quieted a bit as he looked up at the sky and shouted: —IT'S NOT MY FAULT THAT MY PARENTS HAVE THE WORLD'S LARGEST COLLECTION OF BLACK SANTA CLAUSES.

en: I’d heard Radar say “the world’s largest collection of black Santas” perhaps a thousand times in my life, and it never became any less funny to me. But he wasn’t kidding. I remembered the first time I visited. I was maybe thirteen. It was spring, many months past Christmas, and yet black Santas lined the windowsills. Paper cutouts of black Santas hung from the stairway banister. Black Santa candles adorned the dining room table. A black Santa oil painting hung above the mantel, which was itself lined with black Santa figurines. They had a black Santa Pez dispenser purchased from Namibia. The light-up plastic black Santa that stood in their postage-stamp front yard from Thanksgiving to New Year’s spent the rest of the year proudly keeping watch in the corner of the guest bathroom, a bathroom with homemade black Santa wallpaper created with paint and a Santa-shaped sponge.
vi: Tôi đã nghe Radar rên rẩm “bộ sưu tập ông già Noel da đen đồ sộ nhất thế giới” cả ngàn lần trong đời, và chưa bao giờ tôi nén nổi phì cười vì điều đó. Nhưng Radar không nói giỡn. Tôi vẫn nhớ lần đầu đến nhà nó. Hình như lúc ấy tôi mười ba. Hồi đó là mùa xuân, đã mấy tháng sau Giáng Sinh, thế mà vẫn có vô số những ông già Noel da đen giăng trên các bậu cửa sổ. Các ông già Noel da đen bằng giấy treo dọc tay vịn cầu thang. Những cây nến hình ông già Noel da đen đặt trang trí trên bàn ăn. Một bức sơn dầu vẽ ông già Noel da đen treo phía trên lò sưởi, còn trên bệ lò sưởi là một loạt hình nộm các ông già Noel da đen. Trong nhà có một lọ đựng kẹo hình ông già Noel da đen mua từ Namibia. Cây đèn hình ông già Noel da đen thường được đặt cạnh thùng thư ở sân trước từ lễ Tạ ơn đến Năm mới, những lúc khác trong năm đứng hiên ngang trong góc phòng tắm dự phòng, một phòng tắm có giấy dán tường tự chế với họa tiết ông già Noel da đen và miếng bông tắm hình ông già Noel.
tr: Radar’m “dünyanın en geniş zenci Noel baba koleksiyonu” deyişini hayatım boyunca herhalde binlerce kez duymuştum ve komikliğinden hiçbir şey kaybetmiyordu. Ama Radar şaka yapmıyordu. İlk kez oraya gidişimi hatırladım. Galiba on üç yaşındaydım. İlkbahardı, Noel’in üstünden aylar geçmişti, yine de pencere pervazlarında zenci Noel babalar diziliydi. Kâğıttan yapılmış zenci Noel babalar tırabzanlara asılmıştı. Yemek masası zenci Noel baba mumlarıyla donatılmıştı. Kendisi de zenci Noel baba heykelcikleriyle bezeli olan şömine rafının üstüne zenci bir Noel babanın yağh boya tablosu asılıydı. Namibya’dan alınmış, zenci Noel baba şeklinde bir Pez şekerlikleri vardı. Şükran Günü’nden yeni yıla kadar küçücük ön bahçelerinde duran, ışıklı plastik zenci Noel baba, yılın geri kalanını boya ve Noel baba şeklindeki süngerlerden yapılmış, ev yapımı zenci Noel baba duvar kâğıdıyla kaplı bir banyo olan misafir banyosunun köşesinde gururla bekçilik ederek geçirirdi.
es: Aunque había oído decir a Radar «la colección más grande del mundo de Santa Claus negros» unas mil veces en la vida, nunca dejaba de parecerme divertido. Pero no lo decía en broma. Recordé la primera vez que había ido a su casa. Tenía yo unos trece años. Era primavera, varios meses después de las Navidades, pero los Santa Claus seguían en las repisas de las ventanas. Santa Claus negros de papel colgaban de la barandilla de la escalera. Velas con Santa Claus negros adornaban la mesa del comedor. Un cuadro de Santa Claus negro estaba colgado encima de la chimenea, en cuya repisa se alineaban también figuritas de Santa Claus negros. Tenían un dispensador de caramelos PEZ con cabeza de Santa Claus negro comprado en Namibia. El Santa Claus negro de plástico y con luz que colocaban en el diminuto patio desde el día de Acción de Gracias hasta Año Nuevo pasaba el resto del año vigilando con orgullo en una esquina del cuarto de baño de invitados, un cuarto de baño empapelado con un papel casero con Santa Claus negros pintados y una esponja en forma de Santa Claus.
vi_translation: I have heard Radar groan about “the world's largest collection of Black Santas” thousands of times in my life, and I have never been able to stifle a laugh because of it. But Radar wasn’t joking. I still remember the first time I went to his house. I think I was thirteen then. It was spring, several months after Christmas, yet there were still countless Black Santas hanging on the window sills. Paper Black Santas were hanging along the stair railings. Black Santa-shaped candles were decorating the dining table. An oil painting of a Black Santa hung above the fireplace, and on the mantelpiece was a series of Black Santa figurines. In the house, there was a candy jar shaped like a Black Santa bought from Namibia. A Black Santa lamp, usually placed next to the mailbox in the front yard from Thanksgiving to New Year, stood proudly in the corner of the spare bathroom at other times of the year, a bathroom with homemade wallpaper featuring Black Santa motifs and a Black Santa-shaped loofah.
tr_translation: I must have heard Radar's phrase "the world's largest collection of black Santa Clauses" thousands of times throughout my life, and it never lost its humor. But Radar wasn't joking. I remembered my first visit there. I think I was thirteen years old. It was spring, months had passed since Christmas, yet black Santa Clauses were lined up on the window sills. Paper black Santa Clauses were hung on the railings. The dining table was adorned with black Santa Claus candles. A painting of a black Santa Claus in oil paint was hung above the fireplace mantle, which was also decorated with black Santa Claus figurines. There were Pez dispensers in the shape of black Santa Clauses from Namibia. The lighted plastic black Santa Claus that stood in their tiny front yard from Thanksgiving to New Year's spent the rest of the year proudly guarding the corner of the guest bathroom, which was covered with homemade black Santa Claus wallpaper made from paint and Santa Claus-shaped sponges.
es_translation: Although I had heard Radar say "the world's largest collection of Black Santa Clauses" about a thousand times in my life, it never ceased to amuse me. But he wasn't joking. I remembered the first time I had gone to his house. I was about thirteen years old. It was spring, several months after Christmas, but the Santa Clauses were still on the window sills. Paper Black Santa Clauses hung from the stair railing. Candles with Black Santa Clauses adorned the dining table. A painting of a Black Santa Claus was hung above the fireplace, on whose mantel also stood figurines of Black Santa Clauses. They had a PEZ dispenser with a Black Santa Claus head bought in Namibia. The plastic, light-up Black Santa Claus that they placed in the tiny yard from Thanksgiving to New Year's spent the rest of the year proudly watching over a corner of the guest bathroom, a bathroom wallpapered with homemade paper featuring painted Black Santa Clauses and a sponge in the shape of Santa Claus.

en: In every room, save Radar’s, their home was awash in black Santadom—plaster and plastic and marble and clay and wood and resin and cloth. In total, Radar’s parents owned more than twelve hundred black Santas of various sorts. As a plaque beside their front door proclaimed, Radar’s house was an officially registered Santa Landmark according to the Society for Christmas.
vi: Trong mỗi phòng, trừ phòng Radar, vương quốc của ông già Noel da đen bành trướng khắp nơi nơi–trên thạch cao, chất dẻo, đá hoa, đất sét, gỗ và vải vóc. Tổng cộng, bố mẹ Radar sở hữu hơn một ngàn hai trăm ông già Noel da đen dưới mọi hình thức. Như được trịnh trọng viết trên tấm bảng nhỏ cạnh cửa chính, nhà Radar là một di tích về ông già Noel được Hiệp hội Giáng Sinh chính thức công nhận.
tr: Radar’mki hariç bütün odalar zenci Noel babalarla doluydu... alçı, plastik, mermer, kil, ahşap, balmumu, kumaş. Radar’m ebeveynlerinin toplamda, çeşitli türlerde bin iki yüzden fazla zenci Noel babası vardı. On kapılarının yarımdaki bir tabelada beyan edildiği üzere Radar’m evi, Noel Cemiyeti’ne göre resmen tescilli bir Noel baba kent simgesiydi.
es: Todas las habitaciones de la casa, menos la de Radar, estaban llenas de Santa Claus negros de yeso, plástico, mármol, barro, madera, resina y tela. En total, los padres de Radar tenían más de mil doscientos Santa Claus negros de todo tipo. Como constaba en una placa por encima de la puerta de la calle, la casa de Radar era un Monumento a Santa Claus oficial, según la Sociedad Navideña.
vi_translation: In every room, except Radar's room, the kingdom of Black Santas expanded everywhere—on plaster, plastic, marble, clay, wood, and fabric. In total, Radar’s parents owned over twelve hundred Black Santas in every form imaginable. As solemnly written on a small plaque next to the front door, Radar's house was a Santa Claus monument officially recognized by the Christmas Association.
tr_translation: All the rooms except Radar's were filled with black Santa Clauses... plaster, plastic, marble, clay, wood, wax, fabric. Radar's parents had more than twelve hundred black Santa Clauses in total, of various kinds. As declared on a sign next to their front door, Radar's house was officially registered as a Santa Claus city landmark by the Christmas Society.
es_translation: All the rooms in the house, except Radar's, were filled with Black Santa Clauses made of plaster, plastic, marble, clay, wood, resin, and fabric. In total, Radar's parents had more than twelve hundred Black Santa Clauses of all kinds. As stated on a plaque above the front door, Radar's house was an official Santa Claus Monument, according to the Christmas Society.

en: “You just gotta tell her, man,” I said. “You just gotta say, ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: when we go to my house and hook up, we’ll be watched by the twenty-four hundred eyes of twelve hundred black Santas.”
vi: “Ông chỉ việc nói với Angela thôi,” tôi nói. “Đại loại như, ‘Angela này, tớ thực sự thích cậu, nhưng có điều này cậu cần phải biết: khi ở trong nhà tớ và dính lấy nhau, tụi mình sẽ được quan sát bằng hai ngàn bốn trăm con mắt của một ngàn hai trăm ông già Noel da đen.
tr: “Dostum, Angela’ya söylemelisin,” dedim. “Demen gereken şu: ‘Angela, senden gerçekten hoşlanıyorum ama bilmen gereken bir şey var: Evime gidip oynaştığımızda, bin iki yüz zenci Noel babamn iki bin dört yüz gözü tarafından izleniyor olacağız.
es: —Solo tienes que contárselo, tío —le dije—. Solo tienes que decirle: «Angela, me gustas, de verdad, pero hay algo que tienes que saber: cuando vayamos a mi casa y nos enrollemos, dos mil cuatrocientos ojos de mil doscientos Santa Claus negros nos observarán».
vi_translation: “You just need to talk to Angela,” I said. “Something like, ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: when we’re at my house and close together, we’ll be watched by two thousand four hundred eyes of one thousand two hundred black Santas.’”
tr_translation: “Buddy, you need to tell Angela,” I said. “What you need to say is this: ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: When we go to my place and fool around, we will be watched by twelve hundred black Santa Clauses' two thousand four hundred eyes.”
es_translation: —You just have to tell her, man —I said to him—. You just have to say: "Angela, I really like you, but there's something you need to know: when we go to my house and we make out, two thousand four hundred eyes of twelve hundred black Santa Clauses will be watching us."

en: Radar ran a hand through his buzz cut and shook his head. “Yeah, I don’t think I’ll put it exactly like that, but I’ll deal with it.”
vi: Radar đưa tay cào cào mái đầu húi cua, lắc lắc. “Ừa, không nghĩ là tôi sẽ nói y chang như vậy, nhưng tôi sẽ giải quyết việc đó.”
tr: Radar elini kazınmış saçlarında gezdirdi ve başım salladı. “Evet, tam olarak böyle açıklayacağımı sanmıyorum ama halledeceğim.
es: —Sí —convino Radar pasándose una mano por el pelo rapado y moviendo la cabeza—. No creo que se lo diga exactamente así, pero ya se me ocurrirá algo.
vi_translation: Radar scratched his crew-cut head, shaking it. "Yeah, I didn't think I would say exactly that, but I'll handle it."
tr_translation: Radar ran his hand through his cropped hair and nodded. "Yes, I don't think I would explain it exactly like that, but I'll handle it."
es_translation: —Yes —agreed Radar, running a hand over his shaved head and nodding—. I don't think I'll tell him exactly like that, but I'll come up with something.

en: I headed off to government, Ben to an elective about video game design. I watched clocks through two more classes, and then finally the relief radiated out of my chest when I was finished— the end of each day like a dry run for our graduation less than a month away.
vi: Tôi vào lớp học môn nhà nước và chính quyền, Ben học môn tự chọn về thiết kế trò chơi điện tử. Tôi nhăm nhăm xem đồng hồ suốt hai tiết học nữa, rồi cuối cùng cơn thở phào cũng bật khỏi lồng ngực khi hết giờ–khúc cuối một ngày luôn giống như chạy việt dã đến lễ tốt nghiệp còn chưa đầy một tháng nữa.
tr: Siyaset dersine doğru yola koyuldum, Ben de bilgisayar oyunu tasarımıyla ilgili bir seçmeli derse. İki ders daha saatleri izledim ve işim bittiğinde, nihayet göğsümden vücuduma bir rahatlama yayıldı... her günün sonu, bir aydan daha yakın olan mezuniyetimizin bir provası gibiydi.
es: Me dirigí a la clase de política, y Ben a una optativa sobre diseño de videojuegos. Contemplé relojes durante dos clases más y, al final, cuando terminé, mi pecho irradiaba alivio. El final de cada día era como un anticipo de nuestra graduación, para la que faltaba poco más de un mes.
vi_translation: I attended the class on state and government, while Ben took an elective course on video game design. I kept glancing at the clock throughout the next two periods, and finally, a sigh of relief escaped my chest when the class ended—the last part of the day always felt like a marathon with less than a month left until graduation.
tr_translation: I set out for the political science class, while I had an elective course on computer game design. After attending two more classes and finishing my work, a sense of relief finally spread from my chest throughout my body... the end of each day felt like a rehearsal for our graduation, which was less than a month away.
es_translation: I went to the politics class, and Ben to an elective on video game design. I watched clocks during two more classes and, in the end, when I finished, my chest radiated relief. The end of each day was like a preview of our graduation, which was just over a month away.

en: I went home. I ate two peanut butter and jelly sandwiches as an early dinner. I watched poker on TV. My parents came home at six, hugged each other, and hugged me. We ate a macaroni casserole as a proper dinner. They asked me about school. They asked me about prom. They marveled at what a wonderful job they’d done raising me. They told me about their days dealing with people who had been raised less brilliantly. They went to watch TV. I went to my room to check my email. I wrote a little bit about The Great Gatsby for English. I read some of The Federalist Papers as early prep for my government final. I IM’ed with Ben, and then Radar came online. In our conversation, he used the phrase “the world’s largest collection of black Santas” four times, and I laughed each time. I told him I was happy for him, having a girlfriend. He said it would be a great summer. I agreed. It was May fifth, but it didn’t have to be. My days had a pleasant identicalness about them. I had always liked that: I liked routine. I liked being bored. I didn’t want to, but I did. And so May fifth could have been any day—until just before midnight, when Margo Roth Spiegelman slid open my screenless bedroom window for the first time since telling me to close it nine years before.
vi: Tôi về nhà. Ăn lót dạ hai miếng bánh mì với bơ lạc và mứt. Xem pô-cơ trên ti-vi. Bố mẹ về nhà lúc sáu giờ, ôm nhau và ôm tôi. Bữa tối nghiêm chỉnh có mì ống bỏ lò. Bố mẹ hỏi tôi về trường lớp. Về dạ hội tốt nghiệp. Bố mẹ tấm tắc rằng nuôi dạy tôi khôn lớn là một kì tích của bố mẹ. Rằng trong công việc hàng ngày bố mẹ phải xoay xở với những người lớn lên trong cảnh ít được chăm sóc chu đáo. Bố mẹ đi xem ti-vi. Tôi về phòng kiểm tra e-mail. Tôi viết một ít về cuốn Gatsby Vĩ đại cho giờ Quốc ngữ. Tôi đọc một ít Những văn bản Liên bang, chuẩn bị trước cho kì thi môn nhà nước và chính quyền. Tôi chát chíu trên mạng với Ben, một lúc sau Radar cũng vào mạng. Trong lúc tán chuyện, nó đã bốn lần nhắc đến “bộ sưu tập ông già Noel da đen đồ sộ nhất thế giới”, lần nào tôi cũng bật cười khùng khục. Tôi bảo nó rằng tôi rất mừng vì nó đã có bạn gái. Nó bảo mùa hè năm nay sẽ hay ho đây. Tôi đồng ý. Hôm nay ngày mùng năm tháng Năm, nhưng cũng chẳng quan trọng. Chuỗi ngày của tôi giống nhau một cách dễ chịu. Tôi luôn thích như vậy: nhịp sinh hoạt đều đặn. Tôi thích cảm giác chán chán. Tôi không muốn như vậy, nhưng đúng là tôi thích thế. Và như vậy mùng năm tháng Năm có thể là bất cứ ngày nào–cho đến ngay trước nửa đêm hôm ấy, khi Margo Roth Spiegelman trượt mở ô cửa sổ không có lưới chắn của phòng tôi, lần đầu tiên kể từ khi cô ấy bảo tôi hãy đóng nó lại cách đây chín năm.
tr: Eve gittim. Akşam yemeğinden önce, iki tane fıstık ezmeli ve reçelli sandviç yedim. Televizyonda poker izledim. Altıda ebeveynlerim eve döndü, önce birbirlerine, sonra bana sarıldılar. Düzgün akşam yemeği olarak fırında makarna yedik. Okulla ilgili sorular sordular. Baloyla ilgili sorular sordular. Beni yetiştirerek ne harika bir iş yaptıklarına hayret ettiler. Bu kadar ustalıkla yetiştirilmemiş insanlarla ilgilenerek geçen günlerini anlattılar. Televizyon izlemeye gittiler. Ben de odama epostalarımı kontrol etmeye gittim. İngilizce dersi için Muhteşem Gatsby’yle ilgili bir şeyler yazdım. Siyaset bilimi sınavına önceden hazırlık olsun diye, Federalist Yazılar’ın birazını okudum. İnternette Ben’le mesajlaştım, sonra Radar çevrimiçi oldu. Radar “dünyanın en geniş zenci Noel baba koleksiyonu” cümlesini konuşmamız boyunca dört kez kullandı, her defasında güldüm. Bir kız arkadaşı olduğu için onun adına sevindiğimi söyledim. Harika bir yaz olacağını söyledi. Katıldım. Mayısın beşiydi ama öyle olmak zorunda değildi. Günlerim mutlu bir tekdüzelik içinde geçiyordu. Bunu her zaman sevmiştim: rutini seviyordum. Sıkılmayı seviyordum. İstemiyordum ama seviyordum. Yani mayısın beşi herhangi bir gün olabilirdi... gece yarısından hemen önceye kadar; Margo Roth Spiegelman, dokuz yıl önce kapatmamı söylediğinden beri ilk defa, artık teli olmayan yatak odası penceremi iterek açana kadar.
es: Volví a casa. Me comí dos sándwiches de mantequilla de cacahuete y mermelada para merendar. Vi póquer en la tele. Mis padres llegaron a las seis, se abrazaron y me abrazaron a mí. Cenamos macarrones. Me preguntaron por el instituto. Luego me preguntaron por el baile de graduación. Se maravillaron de lo bien que me habían educado. Me contaron que en su época habían tenido que tratar con gente a la que no habían educado tan bien. Fueron a ver la tele. Yo fui a mi habitación a revisar el correo. Escribí un rato sobre El gran Gatsby para la clase de literatura. Leí otro rato el Federalista para preparar con tiempo el examen final de política. Chateé con Ben y luego Radar se conectó también. En nuestra conversación utilizó cuatro veces la frase «la colección más grande del mundo de Santa Claus negros» y yo me reí cada vez. Le dije que me alegraba de que tuviera novia. Me comentó que el verano sería genial. Estuve de acuerdo. Era 5 de mayo, pero podría haber sido cualquier otro día. Mis días eran apaciblemente idénticos entre sí. Siempre me había gustado. Me gustaba la rutina. Me gustaba aburrirme. No quería, pero me gustaba. Y por eso aquel 5 de mayo habría podido ser cualquier otro día… hasta justo antes de las doce de la noche, cuando Margo Roth Spiegelman abrió la ventana de mi habitación, sin mosquitera, por primera vez desde aquella noche en que me había pedido que la cerrara, hacía nueve años.
vi_translation: I went home. Ate two pieces of bread with peanut butter and jam as a snack. Watched poker on TV. My parents came home at six o'clock, hugged each other and hugged me. A proper dinner with baked pasta. My parents asked me about school. About the graduation prom. My parents marveled that raising me was an achievement of theirs. That in their daily work they have to deal with people who grew up with less attentive care. My parents went to watch TV. I went to my room to check emails. I wrote a bit about The Great Gatsby for English class. I read a bit of The Federalist Papers, preparing for the government and politics exam.
