en: “Interesting capitalization,” I said.
vi: “Kiểu viết hoa này hay đấy,” tôi nhận xét.
tr: “İlginç bir büyük harf kullanımı,” dedim.
es: —Muy interesantes tus mayúsculas —le dije.
vi_translation: “This style of capitalization is interesting,” I remarked.
tr_translation: “Interesting use of capitalization,” I said.
es_translation: —Your capital letters are very interesting —I told him.

en: “Yeah. I’m a big believer in random capitalization. The rules of capitalization are so unfair to words in the middle.”
vi: “Kiểu viết hoa này hay đấy,” tôi nhận xét. “Ừ, tớ hết sức cổ xúy lối viết hoa ngẫu hứng mà. Quy tắc viết hoa thông thường rất bất công với các từ không đứng đầu câu.”
tr: “Evet. Rastgele büyük harf kullanma taraftarıyım. Büyük harf kullanma kuralları ortadaki kelimelere hiç adil davranmıyor.
es: —Sí, creo firmemente en las mayúsculas aleatorias. Las reglas de las mayúsculas son muy injustas con las palabras que están en medio.
vi_translation: “This style of capitalization is interesting,” I remarked. “Yeah, I totally advocate for the whimsical capitalization style.” “The conventional capitalization rules are very unfair to words that don't start a sentence.”
tr_translation: “Yes. I'm in favor of using random capital letters. The rules for using capital letters are not fair to the words in the middle.”
es_translation: —Yes, I firmly believe in random capitalization. The rules of capitalization are very unfair to the words in the middle.

en: Now, I’m not sure what you’re supposed to say to the checkout woman at twelve-thirty in the morning when you put thirteen pounds of catfish, Veet, the fat-daddy-size tub of Vaseline, a six-pack of Mountain Dew, a can of blue spray paint, and a dozen tulips on the conveyor belt. But here’s what I said: “This isn’t as weird as it looks.”
vi: Chà, không biết bạn sẽ nói gì với nhân viên thu ngân siêu thị vào lúc mười hai rưỡi đêm khi bạn xếp lên quầy thanh toán khoảng sáu kí cá da trơn, kem tẩy lông Veet, tuýp Vaseline loại bố-bé-béo-ú, một bịch sáu chai nước có ga Mountain Dew, một bình xịt phun sơn màu xanh da trời và mười hai bông hoa tulip. Còn đây là những gì tôi đã nói: “Trông có vẻ kì quặc nhưng thực ra không đến nỗi ấy đâu ạ.”
tr: Şimdi, gece saat yarımda taşıma bandına yaklaşık altı kilo kedi balığı, Veet, kocaman “şişko baba boy'” Vazelin, altı kutu Mountain Dew, bir kutu mavi sprey boya ve bir düzine lale koyunca kasadaki kadına ne denilmesi gerektiğinden emin değilim. Ama benim söylediğim şuydu: “Göründüğü kadar tuhaf değil.
es: No tengo muy claro qué se supone que tienes que decirle a la cajera del supermercado a las doce y media de la noche cuando colocas en la cinta seis kilos de pez gato, Veet, el bote gigante de vaselina, un pack de seis refrescos de naranja, un espray de pintura azul y una docena de tulipanes. Pero lo que le dije fue: —No es tan raro como parece.
vi_translation: Well, I wonder what you would say to the supermarket cashier at twelve-thirty at night when you place on the checkout counter about six kilograms of catfish, Veet hair removal cream, a tube of Vaseline in the extra-large size, a pack of six bottles of Mountain Dew, a can of sky blue spray paint, and twelve tulips. And here is what I said: "It looks a bit odd, but it's not that bad actually."
tr_translation: Now, I'm not sure what to say to the woman at the checkout when you put about six kilos of catfish, Veet, a huge "big daddy size" Vaseline, six cans of Mountain Dew, a can of blue spray paint, and a dozen tulips on the conveyor belt at half past midnight. But what I said was: "It's not as weird as it looks."
es_translation: I'm not quite sure what you're supposed to say to the supermarket cashier at half past midnight when you place six kilos of catfish, Veet, a giant jar of Vaseline, a six-pack of orange soda, a can of blue spray paint, and a dozen tulips on the conveyor belt. But what I said was: —It's not as strange as it seems.

en: The woman cleared her throat but didn’t look up. “Still weird,” she muttered.
vi: Cô thu ngân hắng giọng nhưng không nhìn lên. “Tức là vẫn kì quặc mà,” tôi nghe thấy cô ấy lẩm bẩm.
tr: Kadın boğazım temizledi ama başını kaldırmadı. “Yine de tuhaf,” diye homurdandı.
es: La mujer carraspeó, pero no levantó la mirada. —Pues lo parece —murmuró.
vi_translation: The cashier cleared her throat but didn't look up. "So it's still weird," I heard her mutter.
tr_translation: The woman cleared her throat but did not lift her head. "Still strange," she grumbled.
es_translation: The woman cleared her throat, but did not raise her gaze. —Well, it seems so —he murmured.

en: “I really don’t want to get in any trouble,” I told Margo back in the minivan as she used the bottled water to wipe the black paint off her face with the tissues. She’d only needed the makeup, apparently, to get out of the house. “In my admission letter from Duke it actually explicitly says that they won’t take me if I get arrested.”
vi: “Tớ thực sự không muốn dính vào bất cứ rắc rối nào đâu,” quay lại chiếc minivan, tôi nói với Margo như vậy, trong khi cô ấy dốc nước trong chai ra lau sạch thứ màu đen trên mặt bằng khăn giấy. Rõ ràng là cô ấy chỉ cần lớp ngụy trang ấy để ra khỏi nhà. “Trong thư mời học mà trường Duke gửi cho tớ, họ nói rõ ràng rành mạch rằng sẽ không nhận tớ vào học nếu tớ bị cảnh sát bắt.”
tr: Arabaya geri dönünce, Margo yüzündeki siyah boyayı peçeteyle temizlemek için şişedeki suyu kullanırken, “Gerçekten belaya bulaşmak istemiyorum,” dedim. Görünüşe göre makyaja sadece evden çıkmak için ihtiyacı olmuştu. “Duke Üniversitesi’nden gelen kabul mektubumda açık bir şekilde, tutuklanırsam beni almayacakları yazıyor.
es: —No quiero meterme en problemas, de verdad —le dije a Margo al volver al coche mientras se limpiaba la pintura negra de la cara con la botella de agua y los pañuelos. Al parecer solo se había pintado para salir de su casa—. En la carta de admisión de la Universidad de Duke se explicita que no me aceptarán si me detiene la policía.
vi_translation: "I really don't want to get involved in any trouble," I said to Margo as I turned back to the minivan, while she poured water from the bottle to clean the black stuff off her face with a tissue. Apparently, she only needed that camouflage to get out of the house. "In the acceptance letter that Duke University sent me, they clearly stated that they would not admit me if I got arrested by the police."
tr_translation: When we got back to the car, as Margo used the water from the bottle to clean the black paint off her face with a napkin, I said, "I really don't want to get into trouble." Apparently, she only needed the makeup to leave the house. "In my acceptance letter from Duke University, it clearly states that if I get arrested, they won't take me."
es_translation: —I really don't want to get into trouble —I told Margo as I got back to the car while she wiped the black paint off her face with the water bottle and tissues. Apparently, she had only painted herself to leave her house—. The admission letter from Duke University explicitly states that they will not accept me if I get arrested by the police.

en: “You’re a very anxious person, Q.”
vi: “Cậu rất biết lo xa đấy Q.”
tr: “Çok kuruntulusun, Q.
es: —Eres demasiado nervioso, Q.
vi_translation: “You are very foresighted, Q.”
tr_translation: “You worry too much, Q.”
es_translation: —You are too nervous, Q.

en: “Let’s just please not get in trouble,” I said. “I mean, I want to have fun and everything, but not at the expense of, like, my future.”
vi: “Vậy làm ơn đừng có dây vào chuyện gì rắc rối,” tôi nói. “Đúng là tớ cũng khoái vui vẻ và đủ thứ, nhưng không thể trả giá bằng, xem nào, tương lai của tớ chẳng hạn.
tr: “Bak, lütfen, sadece belaya bulaşmayalım,” dedim. ‘Yani eğlenmek filan istiyorum ama geleceğim pahasına değil.
es: —No nos metamos en problemas, por favor —le dije—. Vaya, que me parece bien que nos divirtamos y todo eso, pero no a expensas de mi futuro.
vi_translation: “So please don't get involved in any troublesome matters,” I said. “It's true that I also enjoy having fun and all sorts of things, but not at the cost of, let's see, my future for example.”
tr_translation: “Look, please, let's just not get into trouble,” I said. ‘I mean, I want to have fun and all, but not at the expense of my future.”
es_translation: —Let's not get into trouble, please —I said to him—. Well, I think it's fine that we have fun and all that, but not at the expense of my future.

en: She looked up at me, her face mostly revealed now, and she smiled just the littlest bit. “It amazes me that you can find all that shit even remotely interesting.”
vi: Margo ngước nhìn tôi, khuôn mặt cô ấy đã gần như hoàn toàn sạch sẽ, và phảng phất nụ cười mơ hồ. “Tớ ngạc nhiên đấy, cái đống chết tiệt ấy còn xa tít mù khơi mới đến mà cậu đã bấn lên thế sao.”
tr: Başım kaldırıp bana baktı, artık yüzünün çoğu ortaya çıkmıştı ve birazcık gülümsedi. “Bütün bu saçmalığı azıcık bile ilgi çekici bulmana hayret ediyorum.
es: Levantó la mirada hacia mí, ya con casi toda la cara limpia, y me lanzó una mínima expresión de sonrisa. —Me sorprende que toda esa mierda pueda parecerte remotamente interesante.
vi_translation: Margo looked up at me, her face almost completely clean, with a faint, vague smile. “I'm surprised, that damn mess is still far away and you're already freaking out.”
tr_translation: He lifted his head and looked at me, most of his face now revealed, and he smiled a little. “I am amazed that you find even a bit of this nonsense interesting.”
es_translation: He looked up at me, with almost his entire face clean, and gave me a slight smile. —I'm surprised that all that crap can seem remotely interesting to you.

en: “Huh?”
vi: “Hả?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Cómo?
vi_translation: “Huh?”
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —How?

en: “College: getting in or not getting in. Trouble: getting in or not getting in. School: getting A’s or getting D’s. Career: having or not having. House: big or small, owning or renting. Money: having or not having. It’s all so boring.”
vi: “Đại học: vào học hay không vào học. Rắc rối: dính dáng hay không dính dáng. Trường phổ thông: đạt điểm A hay điểm D. Sự nghiệp: gây dựng hay không gây dựng. Nhà cửa: to hay nhỏ, mua đứt hay đi thuê. Tiền bạc: có hay không có. Toàn một mớ chán òm.”
tr: “Üniversite: girmek ya da girmemek. Bela: bulaşmak ya da bulaşmamak. Okul: A almak ya da D almak. Kariyer: sahip olmak ya da olmamak. Ev: büyük ya da küçük, satın almak ya da kiralamak. Para: sahip olmak ya da olmamak. Hepsi çok sıkıcı.
es: —Ir o no ir a la universidad. Meterse o no meterse en problemas. Sacar un sobresaliente o sacar un muy deficiente en el instituto. Tener o no tener futuro profesional. Tener una casa grande o una pequeña, en propiedad o en alquiler. Tener o no tener dinero. Es muy aburrido.
vi_translation: "University: attend or not attend. Problems: get involved or not get involved. High school: get an A or a D. Career: build it or not build it. House: big or small, buy it outright or rent. Money: have it or not have it. It's all a boring mess."
tr_translation: “University: to enter or not to enter. Trouble: to get involved or not to get involved. School: to get an A or to get a D. Career: to have or not to have. Home: big or small, to buy or to rent. Money: to have or not to have. All of it is very boring.”
es_translation: —To go or not to go to university. To get into trouble or not to get into trouble. To get an excellent grade or a very poor grade in school. To have or not to have a professional future. To have a big house or a small one, owned or rented. To have or not to have money. It's very boring.

en: I started to say something, to say that she obviously cared a little, because she had good grades and was going to the University of Florida’s honors program next year, but she just said, “Wal-Mart.”
vi: Tôi chực muốn nói, rằng rõ ràng là Margo chẳng chịu chú tâm nghiêm túc gì cả, vì cô ấy học hành giỏi giang và năm tới sẽ theo học chương trình cử nhân tài năng tại Đại học Florida, nhưng Margo đã hô lên, “Wal-Mart.”
tr: Bir şeyler söylemeye başladım, bunları biraz umursadığının açık olduğunu çünkü iyi notlan olduğunu ve gelecek sene Florida Üniversitesi’nin onur programına gideceğini söylüyordum ki yalnızca, “Walmart,” dedi.
es: Empecé a decirle que obviamente a ella también le importaba un poco, porque sacaba buenas notas y por eso al año siguiente entraría en un programa de alto rendimiento de la Universidad de Florida, pero Margo se limitó a contestarme:
vi_translation: I was about to say that it was clear Margo wasn't paying serious attention at all, because she was a good student and next year she would be attending the honors bachelor's program at the University of Florida, but Margo shouted, "Wal-Mart."
tr_translation: I started to say something, noting that it was clear she cared a bit because she had good grades and was going to the honors program at the University of Florida next year, when she simply said, "Walmart."
es_translation: I started to tell her that obviously she cared a little too, because she got good grades and that's why the following year she would enter a high-performance program at the University of Florida, but Margo simply replied:

en: We entered Wal-Mart together and picked up that thing from infomercials called The Club, which locks a car’s steering wheel into place. As we walked through the Juniors department, I asked Margo, “Why do we need The Club?”
vi: Chúng tôi cùng vào Wal-Mart và chọn một món dụng cụ mà quảng cáo trên ti-vi vẫn gọi là The Club, có tác dụng khóa cứng tay lái ô-tô lại. Trong khi đi qua khu đồ cho trẻ em, tôi hỏi Margo, “Mua cái The Club này để làm gì?”
tr: Walmart’a birlikte girdik ve arabanın direksiyonunu yerine kilitleyen, The Club adlı, reklamlardaki o şeyden aldık. Çocuk reyonuna doğru yürürken Margo’ya, “Neden The Club’a ihtiyacımız var?” diye sordum.
es: —Walmart. Entramos en el Walmart y cogimos una barra de seguridad para fijar el volante. —¿Para qué necesitamos la barra? —le pregunté a Margo mientras avanzábamos por la sección de jóvenes.
vi_translation: We went into Wal-Mart together and chose a tool that the TV commercials call The Club, which locks the car's steering wheel. While passing through the children's section, I asked Margo, "What are we buying The Club for?"
tr_translation: We entered Walmart together and bought that thing from the commercials, called The Club, which locks the steering wheel in place. As we walked towards the children's section, I asked Margo, "Why do we need The Club?"
es_translation: —Walmart. We entered Walmart and grabbed a security bar to secure the steering wheel. —Why do we need the bar? —I asked Margo as we moved through the youth section.

en: Margo managed to speak in her usual manic soliloquy without answering my question. “Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement. There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for planning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future, and so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future—you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.”
vi: Margo đáp bằng kiểu độc thoại xen lẫn chút hưng phấn quen thuộc mà không trả lời trực tiếp câu hỏi của tôi. “Cậu biết không, từ xưa lắc xưa lơ và kéo dài rất lâu trong lịch sử nhân loại, tuổi thọ trung bình của con người chưa đến ba mươi. Tức là người ta có khoảng mười năm của tuổi trưởng thành, phải không? Như thế tức là chẳng cần lập kế hoạch nghỉ hưu. Chẳng có kế hoạch xây dựng sự nghiệp nữa. Chẳng có khái niệm lên kế hoạch. Làm gì có thời gian để lên kế hoạch. Không có thời gian cho tương lai. Nhưng rồi vòng đời bắt đầu dài dần ra, con người bắt đầu có nhiều cái gọi là tương lai hơn, thế là họ dành nhiều thời gian nghĩ đến nó hơn. Nghĩ về tương lai. Và bây giờ sự sống đã trở thành tương lai rồi. Mỗi khoảnh khắc trong đời cậu đều sống vì tương lai–cậu học phổ thông để có thể vào đại học để có được công việc tốt để mua được nhà đẹp để kiếm được tiền lo cho con cái cậu vào đại học để chúng có được công việc tốt để chúng mua được nhà đẹp để chúng kiếm được tiền lo cho con cái chúng vào đại học.”
tr: Margo her zamanki delice monologunda soruma cevap vermeden konuşmayı başardı. “Neredeyse tüm insanlık tarihinde, ortalama yaşam süresinin otuz yıldan az olduğunu biliyor muydun? On yıl falan gerçek yetişkinlik yaşayacağına güvenebiliyormuşsun, değil mi? Emekliliği planlamak yokmuş. Kariyer planlamak yokmuş. Planlamak yokmuş. Plan yapmak için zaman yokmuş. Gelecek için zaman yokmuş. Ama sonra yaşam süreleri uzamaya başlamış ve insanlar gittikçe daha fazla geleceğe sahip olmaya başlamış ve böylece konu hakkında düşünmek için daha fazla zaman harcamışlar. Gelecek hakkında. Ve şimdi hayat gelecek haline geldi. Hayatının her anı gelecek için yaşanıyor... liseye gidiyorsun ki üniversiteye gidebilesin, böylece iyi bir iş bulabilesin ki güzel bir ev alabilesin, böylece çocuklarını üniversiteye göndermeyi karşılayabilesin ki çocukların iyi bir iş bulabilsin, böylece güzel bir ev alabilsinler ki çocuklarını üniversiteye göndermeyi karşılayabilsinler.
es: Margo se las arregló para soltarme uno de sus habituales monólogos frenéticos sin contestar a mi pregunta. —¿Sabías que, durante casi toda la historia de la especie humana, el promedio de vida ha sido inferior a treinta años? Disponían de unos diez años de vida adulta, ¿no? No planificaban su jubilación. No planificaban su carrera profesional. No planificaban nada. No tenían tiempo para hacer planes. No tenían tiempo para pensar en el futuro. Pero luego las expectativas de vida empezaron a aumentar y la gente empezó a tener cada vez más futuro, así que pasaba más tiempo pensando en él. En el futuro. Y ahora la vida se ha convertido en el futuro. Vives cada instante de tu vida por el futuro… Vas al instituto para poder ir a la universidad, y así podrás encontrar un buen trabajo, y así podrás comprarte una bonita casa, y así podrás permitirte mandar a tus hijos a la universidad para que puedan encontrar un buen trabajo y así puedan comprarse una bonita casa y así puedan permitirse mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.
vi_translation: Margo responded in a monologue style mixed with a familiar excitement without directly answering my question. "You know, from ancient times and for a very long period in human history, the average lifespan of humans was less than thirty. That means people had about ten years of adulthood, right? So there was no need to plan for retirement. No career planning either. No concept of planning at all. There was no time to plan. No time for the future. But then lifespans started to lengthen, and people began to have more of what we call the future, so they spent more time thinking about it. Thinking about the future. And now life has become the future. Every moment in your life is lived for the future—you go to high school to get into college to get a good job to buy a nice house to earn money to send your kids to college so they can get good jobs to buy nice houses to earn money to send their kids to college."
tr_translation: Margo, as usual, managed to speak in her crazy monologue without answering my question. “Did you know that for almost all of human history, the average lifespan was less than thirty years? You could only count on living a real adulthood for about ten years, right? There was no planning for retirement. There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. There was no time to make plans. There was no time for the future. But then lifespans started to increase, and people began to have more and more of a future, so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future... you go to high school so you can go to college, so you can get a good job, so you can buy a nice house, so you can afford to send your kids to college, so your kids can get a good job, so they can buy a nice house, so they can afford to send their kids to college.”
es_translation: Margo managed to unleash one of her usual frenetic monologues without answering my question. —Did you know that, for almost the entire history of the human species, the average lifespan has been less than thirty years? They had about ten years of adult life, right? They didn't plan for retirement. They didn't plan their professional career. They didn't plan anything. They didn't have time to make plans. They didn't have time to think about the future. But then life expectancy started to increase and people began to have more and more future, so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. You live every moment of your life for the future… You go to high school so you can go to college, and that way you can find a good job, and that way you can buy a nice house, and that way you can afford to send your kids to college so they can find a good job and that way they can buy a nice house and that way they can afford to send their kids to college.

en: It felt like Margo was just rambling to avoid the question at hand. So I repeated it. “Why do we need The Club?”
vi: Hình như Margo cứ lảm nhảm như vậy để tránh trả lời câu hỏi đã rõ ràng. Thế nên tôi nhắc lại. “Sao chúng ta lại cần cái The Club này?”
tr: Margo sadece yönelttiğim sorudan kaçınmak için abuk sabuk konuşuyormuş gibi gelmişti. Bu yüzden tekrar ettim. “Neden The Club’a ihtiyacımız var?
es: Me dio la impresión de que Margo divagaba para evitar mi pregunta, de modo que la repetí. —¿Para qué necesitamos la barra?
vi_translation: It seems like Margo keeps mumbling like that to avoid answering the obvious question. So I repeated. “Why do we need this The Club?”
tr_translation: It seemed like Margo was talking nonsense just to avoid the question I had asked. So I repeated it. "Why do we need The Club?"
es_translation: I got the impression that Margo was rambling to avoid my question, so I repeated it. —Why do we need the bar?

en: Margo patted me in the middle of the back softly. “I mean, obviously this is all going to be revealed to you before the night is over.” And then, in boating supplies, Margo located an air horn. She took it out of the box and held it up in the air, and I said, “No,” and she said, “No what?” And I said, “No, don’t blow the air horn,” except when I got to about the b in blow, she squeezed on it and it let out an excruciatingly loud honk that felt in my head like the auditory equivalent of an aneurysm, and then she said, “I’m sorry, I couldn’t hear you. What was that?” And I said, “Stop b—” and then she did it again.
vi: Margo vỗ nhè nhẹ lên lưng tôi. “Chẳng phải tớ đã bảo cậu rằng mọi chuyện sẽ dần sáng tỏ trước khi trời sáng đấy ư.” Và rồi, ở khu bày dụng cụ chèo thuyền, Margo chọn lấy một cái còi hơi. Cô ấy lấy nó ra khỏi hộp đựng và giơ cao lên, tôi lập tức bảo, “Không được đâu”, và Margo hỏi lại, “Cái gì không được cơ?” Tôi nói tiếp, “Không được dùng còi hơi ở đây,” hiềm nỗi tôi mới nói đến chữ d trong từ dùng thì cô ấy đã bóp còi và một tiếng rít đinh tai nhức óc xé qua không khí, ong ong trong đầu tôi, như thể các mạch máu đang phình ra và lùng bùng đập. Margo tỉnh rụi hỏi, “Xin lỗi, lúc nãy tớ không nghe rõ, cậu vừa bảo gì cơ?” Và tôi đang dở dang “Đừng b...” thì cô ấy đã lại bóp còi một lần nữa.
tr: Margo usulca şutum sıvazladı. “Yani belli M bütün bunlar gece bitmeden açığa çıkacak.” Sonra kayıkçılık malzemelerinin orada bir koma buldu. Kornayı kutusundan çıkardı ve havaya kaldırdı, “Hayır,” dedim, “Ne hayır?” dedi. Ben de “Hayır, komayı çalma,” dedim, ancak ben çalma kelimesinin ç harfi civarına geldiğimde Margo kornayı sıktı ve korna kafamda bir anevrizmanın işitsel dengi gibi hissettiren, dayanılmaz derecede yüksek bir ses çıkardı. Sonra, “Üzgünüm, seni duyamadım. Ne demiştin?” dedi. “Bırak ç...” dedim ve sonra tekrar yaptı.
es: Margo me dio un manotazo suave en la espalda. —Bueno, está claro que lo descubrirás esta misma noche. Y entonces, en la sección de náutica, Margo encontró una bocina de aire. La sacó de la caja y levantó el brazo. —No —le dije. —No ¿qué? —me preguntó. —No toques la bocina —le contesté. Aunque cuando iba por la t de «toques», presionó y la bocina soltó un espantoso zumbido que resonó en mi cabeza como el equivalente auditivo de un derrame cerebral. —Perdona. No te he oído. ¿Qué decías? —me preguntó. —Deja de t… Y volvió a tocar la bocina.
vi_translation: Margo gently patted my back. "Didn't I tell you that everything would become clear before dawn?" And then, in the boating equipment section, Margo picked up an air horn. She took it out of the box and raised it high, and I immediately said, "No, don't," and Margo asked back, "What do you mean, don't?" I continued, "You can't use an air horn here," but I had barely said the "u" in "use" when she pressed the horn and a piercing shriek tore through the air, buzzing in my head, as if my blood vessels were swelling and pounding. Margo calmly asked, "Sorry, I didn't hear you, what did you just say?" And I was in the middle of saying "Don't b..." when she pressed the horn again.
tr_translation: Margo gently patted my shoulder. “I mean, it's obvious M, all of this will come out before the night is over.” Then she found a horn among the boating supplies. She took the horn out of its box and raised it in the air, “No,” I said, “What no?” she said. I said, “No, don't blow the horn,” but as I got to the 'b' of 'blow,' Margo squeezed the horn and it emitted an unbearably loud sound that felt like the auditory equivalent of an aneurysm in my head. Then, “Sorry, I couldn't hear you. What did you say?” she said. “Don't bl...” I said and then she did it again.
es_translation: Margo gave me a gentle slap on the back. —Well, it's clear that you will find out tonight. And then, in the nautical section, Margo found an air horn. She took it out of the box and raised her arm. —No —I told him. —No what? —he asked me. —Don't honk the horn —I replied to him. Although when I was on the "t" of "toques", he pressed and the horn let out a dreadful buzz that resonated in my head like the auditory equivalent of a stroke. —Sorry. I didn't hear you. What were you saying? —he asked me. —Stop t… And he honked the horn again.

en: A Wal-Mart employee just a little older than us walked up to us then and said, “Hey, you can’t use that in here,” and Margo said, with seeming sincerity, “Sorry, I didn’t know that,” and the guy said, “Oh, it’s cool. I don’t mind, actually.” And then the conversation seemed over, except the guy could not stop looking at Margo, and honestly I don’t blame him, because she is hard to stop looking at, and then finally he said, “What are you guys up to tonight?”
vi: Một nhân viên của Wal-Mart, chắc chỉ lớn hơn chúng tôi vài tuổi, đi đến và nói, “Này, không được dùng còi hơi ở đây.” Margo liền đáp với một vẻ tưởng như hết sức chân thành, “Xin lỗi anh, em không biết ạ,” còn anh chàng kia nói ngay, “Ồ, cũng vui, không sao đâu, thật đấy.” Màn đối thoại có lẽ chỉ có thế, ngoại trừ việc anh chàng không thể rời mắt khỏi Margo. Thật lòng tôi không trách anh ta, vì đã nhìn Margo thì khó có thể rời mắt đi được. Rút cục anh ta nói, “Hai em có kế hoạch gì bây giờ không?”
tr: Bizden sadece biraz daha büyük bir Walmart çalışanı yanımıza gelip, “Hey, onu burada kullanamazsınız,” dedi, Margo da sözde samimi bir tavırla, “Üzgünüm, bilmiyordum,” dedi, sonra çocuk, “Ah, önemli değil. Benim için mahzuru yok, aslında,” dedi. Ondan sonra konuşma bitmiş gibi göründü ancak çocuk, Margo’ya bakmaktan kendini alamıyordu ve işin aslı onu suçlayamıyorum çünkü insanın Margo’ya bakmaktan kendini alıkoyması zordur, sonra nihayet, “Bu gece ne yapıyorsunuz?” diye sordu.
es: Un empleado del Walmart algo mayor que nosotros se acercó. —Eh, no podéis usarla aquí —nos dijo. —Perdona, no lo sabía —le contestó Margo con aparente sinceridad. —Tranqui. La verdad es que no me importa. Y la conversación pareció zanjada, pero el chico no dejaba de mirar a Margo, y sinceramente no le culpo, porque es difícil dejar de mirarla. —¿Qué vais a hacer esta noche, chicos? —preguntó por fin el empleado.
vi_translation: A Wal-Mart employee, probably just a few years older than us, came over and said, "Hey, you can't use an air horn here." Margo immediately responded with an apparently very sincere look, "Sorry, I didn't know," and the guy quickly said, "Oh, it's okay, really." The conversation probably would have ended there, except the guy couldn't take his eyes off Margo. Honestly, I don't blame him, because once you look at Margo, it's hard to look away. Finally, he said, "Do you two have any plans now?"
tr_translation: A Walmart employee, just a bit older than us, came up to us and said, "Hey, you can't use that here," and Margo, with a supposedly sincere attitude, said, "Sorry, I didn't know," then the kid said, "Oh, it's no big deal. It doesn't bother me, actually," he said. After that, the conversation seemed to be over, but the kid couldn't stop looking at Margo, and honestly, I can't blame him because it's hard to take your eyes off Margo. Finally, he asked, "What are you doing tonight?"
es_translation: An employee from Walmart, somewhat older than us, approached. —Uh, you can't use it here —he told us. —Sorry, I didn't know —Margo replied with apparent sincerity. —Relax. The truth is, I don't care. And the conversation seemed settled, but the boy couldn't stop looking at Margo, and honestly, I don't blame him, because it's hard to stop looking at her. —What are you going to do tonight, guys? —the employee finally asked.

en: And Margo said, “Not much. You?”
vi: Margo đáp, “Không có gì nhiều. Còn anh?”
tr: Margo, “Pek bir şey yapmıyoruz. Sen?” dedi.
es: —No gran cosa —le contestó Margo—. ¿Y tú?
vi_translation: Margo replied, "Not much." "And you?"
tr_translation: Margo said, "We're not doing much. You?"
es_translation: —Not much —Margo replied—. And you?

en: And he said, “I get off at one and then I’m going out to this bar down on Orange, if you want to come. But you’d have to drop off your brother; they’re really strict about ID’s.”
vi: Anh ta nói, “Anh hết giờ làm lúc một giờ, sau đó sẽ tới quán bar ở Orange, nếu em cũng muốn đến đó. Nhưng phải để em trai em lại đâu đó, quán ấy kiểm tra giấy tờ tùy thân nghiêm lắm.”
tr: Ye çocuk, “Birde çıkıyorum, sonra Orange’daki bara gideceğim... gelmek istersen. Ama kardeşini eve bırakmalısın; kimlik konusunda gerçekten katilar,” dedi.
es: —Salgo a la una y luego iré a un bar de Orange. Si quieres venir… Pero tienes que dejar en casa a tu hermano. Son muy estrictos con el carnet de identidad.
vi_translation: He said, "I finish work at one o'clock, then I'll go to the bar in Orange, if you also want to go there. But you have to leave your younger brother somewhere, that bar checks IDs very strictly."
tr_translation: Hey kid, "I'm going out for a bit, then I'll go to the bar in Orange... if you want to come. But you have to drop your brother off at home; they're really strict about IDs," he said.
es_translation: —I leave at one and then I'll go to a bar in Orange. If you want to come... But you have to leave your brother at home. They are very strict with the ID card.

en: Her what?! “I’m not her brother,” I said, looking at the guy’s sneakers.
vi: Cái gì của cô ấy cơ?! “Tôi không phải là em trai,” tôi nói trong khi nhìn đôi giày thể thao của anh chàng đó.
tr: Margo’nun nesi?! “Kardeşi değilim,” dedim çocuğun spor ayakkabılarına bakarak.
es: ¿Su qué? —No soy su hermano —le dije con la mirada clavada en sus zapatillas de deporte.
vi_translation: What belongs to her?! "I am not your little brother," I said while looking at that guy's sneakers.
tr_translation: What's wrong with Margo?! "I'm not her sister," I said, looking at the child's sneakers.
es_translation: His what? —I am not your brother —I told him, with my gaze fixed on his sneakers.

en: And then Margo proceeded to lie. “He’s actually my cousin,” she said. Then she sidled up to me, put her hand around my waist so that I could feel each of her fingers taut against my hip bone, and she added, “And my lover.”
vi: Thế là Margo bắt đầu bày trò. “Thực ra đây là anh họ em,” cô ấy nói, nhích sát lại, vòng tay qua hông tôi và tôi có thể cảm thấy từng ngón tay Margo ấn lên mỏm hông của tôi. Rồi cô ấy nói thêm, “Và là bồ của em.”
tr: Sonra Margo yalan söylemeye devam etti. “Aslında kuzenim,” dedi. Sonra bana sokuldu, her bir parmağının kalça kemiğimde gezindiğini hissedebileyim diye elini belime doladı ve ekledi: “Ve sevgilim.
es: Y entonces Margo siguió mintiendo. —La verdad es que es mi primo —le dijo. Se colocó a mi lado, me pasó la mano por la cintura, de modo que sentí cada uno de sus dedos tensos sobre mi cadera, y añadió—: Y mi amante.
vi_translation: So Margo started to play a game. “Actually, this is my cousin,” she said, moving closer, wrapping her arm around my waist, and I could feel each of Margo's fingers pressing into my hip bone. Then she added, “And he's my boyfriend.”
tr_translation: Then Margo continued to lie. "Actually, my cousin," she said. Then she snuggled up to me, wrapped her hand around my waist so I could feel each of her fingers wandering on my hip bone, and added: "And my lover."
es_translation: And then Margo kept lying. —The truth is that he is my cousin —she told him. She positioned herself next to me, put her hand around my waist, so that I felt each of her tense fingers on my hip, and added—: And my lover.

en: The guy just rolled his eyes and walked away, and Margo’s hand lingered for a minute and I took the opportunity to put my arm around her. “You really are my favorite cousin,” I told her. She smiled and bumped me softly with her hip, spinning out of my embrace.
vi: Anh chàng kia tròn mắt bước đi, tay Margo vẫn nguyên như vậy thêm một phút nữa, tôi liền chớp cơ hội quàng tay qua vai cô ấy. “Cậu đúng là cô em họ mà tớ rất thích đấy,” tôi nói với Margo. Cô ấy mỉm cười, hông khẽ huých tôi ra và rời khỏi vòng tay tôi.
tr: Çocuk sadece gözlerini devirip yanımızdan uzaklaştı, Margo’nun eli bir dakikalığına belimde kaldı, böylece kolumu ona dolama fırsatı yakaladım. “Sen gerçekten en sevdiğim kuzenimsin,” dedim. Gülümsedi ve dönerek kollarımdan kurtulurken, kalçasıyla bana hafifçe vurdu.
es: El chico miró al techo y se marchó. Margo dejó la mano en mi cintura un instante y aproveché la ocasión para rodearla con el brazo yo también. —Eres mi prima favorita —le dije. Sonrió, me dio un golpecito con la cadera y se apartó.
vi_translation: The guy walked away with wide eyes, Margo's hand still in the same position for another minute, so I seized the opportunity to put my arm around her shoulder. "You really are the cousin I like a lot," I said to Margo. She smiled, gently nudged me away with her hip, and left my embrace.
tr_translation: The child just rolled their eyes and walked away from us, Margo's hand stayed on my waist for a minute, giving me the chance to wrap my arm around her. "You are really my favorite cousin," I said. She smiled and, as she turned to free herself from my arms, she lightly bumped me with her hip.
es_translation: The boy looked at the ceiling and left. Margo left her hand on my waist for a moment, and I took the opportunity to wrap my arm around her as well. —You are my favorite cousin —I told her. She smiled, gave me a little bump with her hip, and stepped aside.

en: “Don’t I know it,” she said.
vi: “Chẳng lẽ tớ lại không biết điều đó ư,” cô ấy nói.
tr: “Bilmez miyim,” dedi.
es: —Como si no lo supiera —me contestó.
vi_translation: "Could it be that I don't know that?" she said.
tr_translation: “Wouldn't I know,” he said.
es_translation: —As if I didn't know —he replied to me.

en: We were driving down a blessedly empty I-4, and I was following Margo’s directions. The clock on the dashboard said it was 1:07.
vi: Chúng tôi lái xe dọc cao tốc I-4, may phước là không có ai, và tôi đi theo chỉ dẫn của Margo. Đồng hồ trên bảng điều khiển chỉ 1:07.
tr: Arabayla bomboş I4’te yol alıyordu ve ben Margo’nun tariflerini takip ediyordum. Kontrol panelindeki saat 01:07’yi gösteriyordu.
es: Circulábamos por una autopista providencialmente vacía, y yo seguía las indicaciones de Margo. El reloj del salpicadero marcaba la 1:07.
vi_translation: We drove along the I-4 highway, fortunately there was no one, and I followed Margo's directions. The clock on the dashboard showed 1:07.
tr_translation: He was driving on the completely empty I4 with the car, and I was following Margo's directions. The clock on the control panel showed 01:07.
es_translation: We were driving on a providentially empty highway, and I was following Margo's directions. The dashboard clock read 1:07.

en: “It’s pretty, huh?” she said. She was turned away from me, staring out the window, so I could hardly see her. “I love driving fast under streetlights.”
vi: “Đẹp đấy chứ, hả?” cô ấy nói khi quay khỏi tôi và chăm chú nhìn ra cửa sổ xe, thế nên tôi gần như không thấy nét mặt cô ấy. “Tớ rất thích lái xe thật nhanh trong ánh đèn trên phố.”
tr: “Güzel, değil mi?” dedi Margo. Diğer tarafa dönmüştü, pencereden dışarı baktığı için onu zar zor görebiliyordum. “Işıklandırılmış sokaklarda hızla gitmeyi seviyorum.
es: —Es precioso, ¿verdad? —me preguntó. Como se había girado para mirar por la ventanilla, apenas la veía—. Me encanta ir en coche deprisa a la luz de las farolas.
vi_translation: “It's beautiful, isn't it?” she said as she turned away from me and stared out the car window, so I could barely see her face. “I really love driving fast under the streetlights.”
tr_translation: "Beautiful, isn't it?" said Margo. She had turned to the other side, and I could barely see her because she was looking out the window. "I love speeding through the lit-up streets."
es_translation: —It's beautiful, isn't it? —she asked me. Since she had turned to look out the window, I could barely see her—. I love driving fast by the light of the street lamps.

en: “Light,” I said, “the visible reminder of Invisible Light.”
vi: “Ánh sáng,” tôi nói, “thứ hữu hình gợi nhắc Ánh Sáng Vô Hình.”
tr: “Işık,” dedim, “Görünmez Işığın görünür hatırlatıcısı.
es: —Luz —dije—, el recordatorio visible de la Luz Invisible.
vi_translation: “Light,” I said, “the visible thing that reminds us of the Invisible Light.”
tr_translation: “Light,” I said, “The visible reminder of Invisible Light.”
es_translation: —Light —I said—, the visible reminder of the Invisible Light.

en: “That’s beautiful,” she said.
vi: “Đẹp quá,” Margo thốt lên.
tr: “Çok güzel,” dedi.
es: —Qué bonito.
vi_translation: “So beautiful,” Margo exclaimed.
tr_translation: "Very beautiful," he said.
es_translation: —How beautiful.

en: “T. S. Eliot,” I said. “You read it, too. In English last year.” I hadn’t actually ever read the whole poem that line was from, but a couple of the parts I did read got stuck in my head.
vi: “T. S. Eliot,” tôi nói. “Cậu cũng đọc rồi mà. Trong môn Quốc ngữ năm ngoái.” Thực ra tôi chưa từng đọc toàn bộ bài thơ có câu vừa rồi, nhưng vài câu trong những đoạn tôi đã đọc vẫn còn vướng lại trong đầu.
tr: “T. S. Eliot,” dedim. “Bunu sen de okudun. Geçen seneki edebiyat dersinde.” Aslında bu dizenin bulunduğu şiirin tamamını hiç okumamıştım ama okuduğum birkaç bölümü aklıma kazınmıştı.
es: —T. S. Eliot —añadí—. Tú también lo leíste. En la clase de literatura del año pasado. En realidad no había leído todo el poema al que pertenecía aquel verso, pero algunos fragmentos se me habían quedado grabados en la mente.
vi_translation: “T. S. Eliot,” I said. “You've read it too. In last year's National Language class.” In fact, I had never read the entire poem with that line, but a few lines from the parts I had read still lingered in my mind.
tr_translation: “T. S. Eliot,” I said. “You read this too. In last year's literature class.” In fact, I had never read the entire poem from which this line was taken, but a few sections I had read were etched in my mind.
es_translation: —T. S. Eliot —I added—. You read it too. In last year's literature class. In reality, I had not read the entire poem to which that verse belonged, but some fragments had stuck in my mind.

en: “Oh, it’s a quote,” she said, a little disappointed. I saw her hand on the center console. I could have put my own hand on the center console and then our hands would have been in the same place at the same time. But I didn’t. “Say it again,” she said.
vi: “Ồ, hóa ra cậu trích thơ à,” cô ấy nói, có vẻ hơi thất vọng. Tôi thấy tay Margo đặt trên bảng điều khiển chính. Tôi có thể đặt tay mình lên bảng điều khiển ấy, thế là tay chúng tôi sẽ ở cùng một chỗ, vào cùng một thời điểm. Nhưng tôi đã không làm vậy. “Cậu đọc lại đi,” Margo nói.
tr: “Ah, alıntı yani,” dedi biraz hayal kırıklığına uğramış bir şekilde. Orta konsolun üstünde elini gördüm. Kendi elimi de orta konsola koyabilirdim ve böylece ellerimiz aynı anda aynı yerde olurdu. Ama yapmadım. “Tekrar söyle,” dedi.
es: —Ah, es una cita —me dijo un poco decepcionada. Vi su mano en la guantera central. Podría haber metido también la mía, y nuestras manos habrían estado en el mismo sitio al mismo tiempo. Pero no lo hice. —Repítelo —me pidió.
vi_translation: “Oh, so you were quoting poetry,” she said, sounding a bit disappointed. I saw Margo's hand placed on the main control panel. I could place my hand on that panel, and then our hands would be in the same place, at the same time. But I didn't do it. “Read it again,” Margo said.
tr_translation: “Ah, a quote, I see,” he said, somewhat disappointed. I saw his hand on the center console. I could have placed my hand on the center console too, and our hands would have been in the same place at the same time. But I didn't. “Say it again,” he said.
es_translation: —Ah, it's a date —she told me, a little disappointed. I saw his hand in the central glove compartment. I could have put mine in as well, and our hands would have been in the same place at the same time. But I didn't. —Repeat it —he asked me.

en: “Light, the visible reminder of Invisible Light.”
vi: “Ánh sáng, thứ hữu hình gợi nhắc Ánh Sáng Vô Hình.”
tr: “Işık, Görünmez Işığın görünür hatırlatıcısı.
es: —Luz, el recordatorio visible de la Luz Invisible.
vi_translation: “Light, the visible reminder of Invisible Light.”
tr_translation: “Light is the visible reminder of the Invisible Light.”
es_translation: —Light, the visible reminder of the Invisible Light.

en: “Yeah. Damn, that’s good. That must help with your lady friend.”
vi: “Ôi chao, thật sự rất hay. Hẳn là đã khiến cô nàng của cậu cảm động.
tr: “Kahretsin, çok iyi. Kız arkadaşın konusunda işe yarıyor olmalı.”
es: —Sí, joder, es bueno. Debe de funcionarte con tu ligue.
vi_translation: “Oh wow, it's truly wonderful. It must have moved your girl.”
tr_translation: "Damn, it's really good." "It must be working with your girlfriend."
es_translation: —Yeah, damn, it's good. It must work with your fling.

en: “Ex-lady friend,” I corrected her.
vi: “Cô nàng cũ,” tôi chữa lại.
tr: “Eski kız arkadaş,” diye onu düzelttim.
es: —Exligue —la corregí.
vi_translation: “The ex-girlfriend,” I corrected.
tr_translation: "Ex-girlfriend," I corrected him.
es_translation: —Exligue —I corrected her.

en: “Suzie dumped you?” Margo asked.
vi: “Suzie đá cậu rồi à?” Margo hỏi.
tr: “Suzie seni terk mi etti?” diye sordu Margo.
es: —¿Suzie te ha plantado? —me preguntó Margo.
vi_translation: "Did Suzie dump you?" Margo asked.
tr_translation: “Did Suzie leave you?” asked Margo.
es_translation: —Did Suzie stand you up? —Margo asked me.

en: “How do you know she dumped me?”
vi: “Sao cậu biết bạn ấy đá tớ?”
tr: "Onun beni terk ettiğini nereden biliyorsun?
es: —¿Cómo sabes que ha sido ella la que me ha plantado a mí?
vi_translation: “How do you know they kicked me?”
tr_translation: "How do you know that she left me?"
es_translation: —How do you know it was her who stood me up?

en: “Oh, sorry.”
vi: “Ôi, xin lỗi nhé.
tr: ‘Alı, üzgünüm.
es: —Ay, perdona.
vi_translation: “Oh, sorry about that.”
tr_translation: ‘‘Ali, I am sorry.”
es_translation: —Oh, sorry.

en: “Although she did,” I admitted, and Margo laughed. The breakup had happened months ago, but I didn’t blame Margo for failing to pay attention to the world of lower-caste romance. What happens in the band room stays in the band room.
vi: “Dù sao cũng đúng là như thế,” tôi thừa nhận, và Margo bật cười. Chuyện chia tay từ mấy tháng trước rồi, nhưng tôi không trách Margo đã không để ý đến kiểu chuyện tình nhạt nhẽo ấy. Những gì xảy ra trong phòng tập nhạc sẽ ở lại trong phòng tập nhạc.
tr: “Gerçi, etti,” diye itiraf ettim, Margo da güldü. Aylar önce ayrılmıştık ama alt sınıfın aşk dünyasıyla ilgilenemediği için Margo’yu suçlamadım. Bando odasmda olan, bando odasmda kalır.
es: —Aunque sí me plantó ella —admití. Margo se rió. Habíamos cortado hacía meses, pero no culpé a Margo por no prestar atención al mundo de los rollos de segunda división. Lo que sucede en la sala de ensayo se queda en la sala de ensayo.
vi_translation: “Well, it is true after all,” I admitted, and Margo laughed. The breakup happened months ago, but I didn't blame Margo for not paying attention to such a bland love story. What happens in the music room stays in the music room.
tr_translation: “Well, he did,” I admitted, and Margo laughed. We had broken up months ago, but I didn't blame Margo for not being interested in the love life of the lower class. What happens in the band room, stays in the band room.
es_translation: —Although she did stand me up —I admitted. Margo laughed. We had broken up months ago, but I didn't blame Margo for not paying attention to the world of second-rate flings. What happens in the rehearsal room stays in the rehearsal room.

en: Margo put her feet up on the dashboard and wiggled her toes to the cadence of her speaking. She always talked like that, with this discernible rhythm, like she was reciting poetry. “Right, well, I’m sorry to hear that. But I can relate. My lovely boyfriend of lo these many months is fucking my best friend.”
vi: Margo gác bàn chân lên bảng điều khiển và ngúc ngoắc ngón chân theo tiết tấu giọng nói. Cô ấy luôn có kiểu nói chuyện như vậy, với nhịp điệu lên xuống rõ rệt, nghe như đang ngâm thơ. “Phải rồi, ừ nhỉ, tớ xin lỗi nhé. Nhưng tớ cũng có chuyện tương tự đấy. Anh chàng bạn trai đẹp mã từ ối chao là mấy tháng nay đang mần cô bạn thân nhất của tớ.”
tr: Margo, ayaklarım ön panelinin üstüne koydu ve konuşmasmm ahengine uygun olarak başparmaklarım kımıldattı. Hep bu şekilde, fark edilebilen bu ritimle konuşurdu, sanki bir şiiri ezberden okurmuş gibi. “Şey, peki, bunu duyduğuma üzüldüm. Ama gayet anlaşılır bir durum. Benim bunca aydır beraber olduğum sevimli erkek arkadaşım da işe bak ki en yakın arkadaşımı beceriyor.”
es: Margo había puesto los pies en el salpicadero y movía los dedos al ritmo de sus palabras. Siempre hablaba así, con ese perceptible ritmo, como si recitara poesía. —Vale, bueno, lo siento. Pero lo entiendo. El guapo de mi novio lleva meses follándose a mi mejor amiga.
vi_translation: Margo put her feet up on the control panel and wiggled her toes to the rhythm of her voice. She always had a way of talking like that, with a distinct up-and-down cadence, sounding like she was reciting poetry. “Oh right, yeah, I'm sorry. But I've got a similar story. My handsome boyfriend has been fooling around with my best friend for the past few months.”
tr_translation: Margo placed her feet on the front panel and wiggled her toes in rhythm with her speech. She always spoke in this way, with a noticeable rhythm, as if reciting a poem from memory. "Well, okay, I'm sorry to hear that. But it's quite understandable. It just so happens that my lovely boyfriend of many months is screwing my best friend."
es_translation: Margo had put her feet on the dashboard and was moving her toes to the rhythm of her words. She always spoke like that, with that perceptible rhythm, as if she were reciting poetry. —Okay, well, I'm sorry. But I understand it. The handsome guy who is my boyfriend has been screwing my best friend for months.

en: I looked over but her hair was all in her face, so I couldn’t make out if she was kidding. “Seriously?” She didn’t say anything. “But you were just laughing with him this morning. I saw you.”
vi: Tôi quay sang nhưng tóc che gần hết mặt Margo, nên tôi không hiểu có phải cô ấy đang đùa không. “Cậu đang nghiêm túc đấy à?” Cô ấy không đáp. “Nhưng sáng nay cậu còn cười với cậu ta cơ mà. Tớ thấy hai cậu mà.”
tr: Ona baktım ama saçı yüzünün her yerini kapamıştı, bu yüzden dalga geçip geçmediğini çözemedim. “Cidden mi?” Hiçbir şey söylemedi. “Ama daha bu sabah onunla gülüyordun. Seni gördüm.”
es: La miré, pero, como tenía todo el pelo en la cara, no pude distinguir si lo decía de broma. —¿En serio? —No dijo nada—. Pero esta misma mañana estabas riéndote con él. Te he visto.
vi_translation: I turned around but Margo's hair covered most of her face, so I couldn't tell if she was joking. "Are you serious?" She didn't respond. "But you were laughing with him this morning. I saw you two."
tr_translation: I looked at her, but her hair covered her entire face, so I couldn't tell if she was joking. "Really?" She said nothing. "But you were laughing with him just this morning. I saw you."
es_translation: I looked at her, but since she had all her hair in her face, I couldn't tell if she was joking. —Really? —He didn't say anything—. But this very morning you were laughing with him. I saw you.

en: “I don’t know what you’re talking about. I heard about it before first period, and then I found them both talking together and I started screaming bloody murder, and Becca ran into the arms of Clint Bauer, and Jase was just standing there like a dumbass with the chaw drool running out of his stank mouth.”
vi: “Tớ không biết cậu đang nói đến lúc nào. Tớ biết chuyện trước khi vào tiết một, rồi tớ thấy người ta nói chuyện với nhau và tớ bắt đầu hét lên đồ giết người khát máu, Becca lao vào vòng tay Clint Bauer còn Jase đứng ngây như phỗng, cái miệng hôi hám nhểu đầy nước dãi.”
tr: “Neden bahsettiğini bilmiyorum. İlk dersten önce olanları duydum, sonra ikisini beraber konuşurken buldum ve bağırıp çağırmaya başladım. Becca, Clint Bauer’m kollarına koştu, Jase de kokuşmuş ağzından ağız dolusu salya akıtan bir embesil gibi orada dikildi.”
es: —No sé de qué me hablas. Me he enterado antes de la primera clase, luego me los he encontrado charlando y me he puesto a gritar como una loca, Becca se ha abrazado a Clint Bauer, y Jase se ha quedado ahí plantado como un gilipollas, cayéndole la baba pegajosa de su apestosa boca.
vi_translation: "I don't know what time you're talking about." "I knew about it before the first period, then I saw people talking to each other and I started yelling 'bloodthirsty murderer,' Becca rushed into Clint Bauer's arms while Jase stood there dumbfounded, his stinky mouth drooling."
tr_translation: "I don't know what you're talking about. I heard what happened before the first class, then I found them talking together and started yelling and screaming. Becca ran into Clint Bauer's arms, and Jase stood there like an imbecile with a mouthful of drool dripping from his stinking mouth."
es_translation: —I don't know what you're talking about. I found out before the first class, then I ran into them chatting and I started screaming like a madwoman, Becca hugged Clint Bauer, and Jase just stood there like an idiot, with sticky drool dripping from his stinking mouth.

en: I had clearly misinterpreted the scene in the hallway. “That’s weird, because Chuck Parson asked me this morning what I knew about you and Jase.”
vi: Hóa ra tôi đã hoàn toàn hiểu nhầm cảnh ở hành lang sáng nay. “Lạ thật, sáng nay Chuck Parson không dưng hỏi tớ biết gì về cậu và Jase.”
tr: Belli ki koridordaki sahneyi yanlış yorumlamıştım. “Tuhaf, çünkü Chuck Parson bu sabah bana sen ve Jase hakkında ne bildiğimi sordu.
es: Estaba claro que había malinterpretado la escena del vestíbulo. —Qué raro, porque Chuck Parson me ha preguntado esta mañana qué sabía de ti y de Jase.
vi_translation: It turns out I completely misunderstood the scene in the hallway this morning. "Strange, this morning Chuck Parson suddenly asked me what I knew about you and Jase."
tr_translation: Clearly, I had misinterpreted the scene in the hallway. "Weird, because Chuck Parson asked me this morning what I knew about you and Jase."
es_translation: It was clear that he had misunderstood the scene in the lobby. —How strange, because Chuck Parson asked me this morning what I knew about you and Jase.

en: “Yeah, well, Chuck does as he’s told, I guess. Probably trying to find out for Jase who knew.”
vi: “Ừa, tớ đoán là Jase bảo Chuck đi hỏi đấy. Chắc là cố moi tin cho Jase xem ai đã làm vỡ lở sự việc.”
tr: “Evet, şey, Chuck kendisine söyleneni yapmış olsa gerek.
es: —Sí, bueno, Chuck hace lo que le piden, supongo. Seguramente Jase le había ordenado que descubriera quién lo sabía.
vi_translation: “Yeah, I guess Jase told Chuck to go ask. Probably trying to get information for Jase to see who leaked the matter.”
tr_translation: “Yes, well, Chuck must have done what he was told. He was probably trying to find out who knew about the incident on behalf of Jase.”
es_translation: —Yes, well, Chuck does what he's told, I suppose. Surely Jase had ordered him to find out who knew.

en: “Jesus, why would he hook up with Becca?”
vi: “Trời ạ, tại sao cậu ta lại đi lằng nhằng với Becca chứ?”
tr: Büyük ihtimalle Jase adına, kimlerin olayı bildiğini öğrenmeye çalışıyordu.” “Tanrım, niye Becca’yla takılsın ki?
es: —Joder, ¿por qué iba a enrollarse con Becca?
vi_translation: "Oh my God, why is he messing around with Becca?"
tr_translation: “God, why would he hang out with Becca?’
es_translation: —Damn, why would he hook up with Becca?

en: “Well, she’s not known for her personality or generosity of spirit, so it’s probably because she’s hot.”
vi: “Chậc, cô nàng không lẫy lừng vì bầu trời nhân cách hay lòng hào hiệp ngời ngời, vậy thì chắc là vì cô nàng nóng bỏng thôi.
tr: “Şey, Becca kişiliğiyle ya da cömert ruhuyla tanınmaz, yani muhtemelen seksi olduğu için.
es: —Bueno, no es famosa por su personalidad ni por su generosidad, así que será porque está buena.
vi_translation: “Tsk, she's not famous for her stellar personality or her shining chivalry, so it must be because she's hot.”
tr_translation: “Well, Becca isn't known for her personality or generous spirit, so it's probably because she's sexy.”
es_translation: —Well, she's not famous for her personality or her generosity, so it must be because she's hot.

en: “She’s not as hot as you,” I said, before I could think better of it.
vi: “Becca làm sao nóng bỏng bằng cậu được,” tôi nói mà không kịp nghĩ gì hay ho hơn.
tr: “Senin kadar seksi değil,” dedim düşünemeden önce.
es: —No está tan buena como tú —le dije sin pensármelo dos veces.
vi_translation: “How could Becca be hotter than you?” I said without thinking of anything better.
tr_translation: "Not as sexy as you," I said before I could think.
es_translation: —She's not as good as you —I told her without thinking twice.

en: “That’s always seemed so ridiculous to me, that people would want to be around someone because they’re pretty. It’s like picking your breakfast cereals based on color instead of taste. It’s the next exit, by the way. But I’m not pretty, not close up anyway. Generally, the closer people get to me the less hot they find me.”
vi: “Tớ luôn thấy như vậy thật nực cười, rằng người ta cứ xoắn lấy ai đó chỉ vì bề ngoài đẹp đẽ thôi. Y như là chọn ngũ cốc ăn sáng dựa vào màu sắc chứ không phải mùi vị. Mà này, rẽ ở chỗ tiếp theo. Nhưng tớ không đẹp, vả lại cũng không thân mật. Nói chung càng ở gần tớ thì sẽ càng thấy độ nóng của tớ giảm đi.”
tr: “Bu bana hep çok saçma geldi, insanlarm güzel olduğu için birinin etrafında olmak istemeleri yani. Kahvaltılık gevreğini tadı yerine rengine dayanarak seçmen gibi. Sonraki çıkıştan, bu arada. Ama ben güzel değilim, en azından yakından değilim.
es: —Siempre me ha parecido ridículo que la gente quiera estar con alguien solo porque es guapo. Es como elegir los cereales del desayuno por el color, no por el sabor. Es la próxima salida, por cierto. Pero yo no soy guapa, al menos no de cerca. En general, cuanto más se me acercan, menos guapa les parezco.
vi_translation: “I always find it ridiculous that people get so hung up on someone just because of their looks. It's like choosing breakfast cereal based on color rather than taste. By the way, turn at the next corner. But I'm not beautiful, and I'm not intimate either. In general, the closer you get to me, the less warmth you'll feel from me.”

Like choosing your breakfast cereal based on its color rather than its taste. Next exit, by the way. But I'm not beautiful, at least not up close. Generally, the closer people get to me, the less sexy they find me.”

It's the next exit, by the way. But I'm not pretty, at least not up close. In general, the closer people get to me, the less pretty I seem to them.

en: It struck me as somewhat unfair that an asshole like Jason Worthington would get to have sex with both Margo and Becca, when perfectly likable individuals such as myself don’t get to have sex with either of them—or anyone else, for that matter. That said, I like to think that I am the type of person who wouldn’t hook up with Becca Arrington. She may be hot, but she is also 1. aggressively vapid, and 2. an absolute, unadulterated, raging bitch. Those of us who frequent the band room have long suspected that Becca maintains her lovely figure by eating nothing but the souls of kittens and the dreams of impoverished children. “Becca does sort of suck,” I said, trying to draw Margo back into conversation.
vi: Trong lòng tôi rộn lên cảm giác bất công, tại sao thằng tồi như Jason Worthington lại ngon lành nẫng được cả Margo và Becca, trong khi những người đàng hoàng tử tế một cách hoàn hảo như tôi lại không thể chạm được một phân vào một trong hai, hoặc bất cứ cô gái nào. Thực ra, tôi muốn nghĩ rằng mình là kiểu con trai không thèm dính đến Becca Arrington. Cứ cho là cô nàng nóng bỏng đi, nhưng cũng 1. ngốc một cách thảm hại, và 2. là một ả cún dại kinh điển. Mấy thằng hay tụ bạ quanh phòng tập nhạc bọn tôi lâu nay vẫn ngờ rằng Becca giữ được dáng thon chuẩn như vậy là nhờ chế độ ăn chỉ gồm linh hồn mèo sữa và những giấc mơ của trẻ con nhà nghèo. “Becca toàn bày những trò chẳng ra gì,” tôi nói, cố gắng kéo Margo trở lại câu chuyện.
tr: Jason Worthington gibi bir göt suratlı hem Margo hem de Becca’yla sevişebilirken, benim gibi kesinlikle hoş insanların ikisiyleya da herhangi başka biriylesevişememesi oldukça adaletsiz görünüyordu. Gerçi Becca Arrington’la takılmayacak türde bir insan olduğumu da düşünmeyi tercih ediyorum. Becca seksi olabilir ama aynı zamanda 1. dehşet derecede bön ve 2. tam anlamıyla, katıksız bir fahişe. Sık sık bando odasında takılanlar olarak uzun süredir Becca’mn sevimli görüntüsünü, kedi yavrularının ruhlarından ve yoksul çocukların hayallerinden başka bir şey yemeyerek koruduğundan şüpheleniyorduk. “Becca biraz fena gerçekten,” dedim, Margo’yu konuşmanın içine geri çekmeye çalışarak.
es: Me pareció injusto que un gilipollas como Jason Worthington pudiera tener sexo con Margo y con Becca, cuando individuos perfectamente agradables como yo no tienen el privilegio de tener sexo con ninguna de las dos… ni con cualquier otra, la verdad. Dicho esto, me gusta pensar que soy el tipo de persona que no se enrollaría con Becca Arrington. Puede estar buena, pero también es: 1) tremendamente sosa, y 2) una total y absoluta zorra. Los que andamos por la sala de ensayo sospechamos desde hace tiempo que Becca mantiene su preciosa figura porque no come nada aparte de las almas de los gatitos y los sueños de los niños pobres. —Becca da asco —dije para que Margo volviera a la conversación.

en: “Yeah,” she answered, looking out the passenger window, her hair reflecting oncoming streetlights. en: “Just drive,” she said, and so I just did. We found Jase’s Lexus two blocks down from Becca’s street, parked in a cul-de-sac. Before I’d even come to a complete stop, Margo jumped out of the minivan with The Club in hand. She pulled open the Lexus’s driver-side door, sat down in the seat, and proceeded to attach The Club to Jase’s steering wheel. Then she softly closed the door to the Lexus.

Tôi chưa kịp dừng xe hẳn lại thì Margo đã nhảy ra ngoài, tay cầm cái The Club. Cô ấy mở cửa chiếc Lexus, phía ghế lái xe, ngồi vào ghế và bắt đầu lắp The Club vào tay lái của Jase. Ben arabayı tamamen durduramadan, Margo elinde The Club’la dışarı atladı. Lexus’un sürücü tarafındaki kapıyı açtı, koltuğa oturdu ve direksiyona The Club’ı taktı. Sonra Lexus’un kapısını yavaşça kapattı.

Abrió la puerta del conductor del Lexus, se sentó y colocó la barra de seguridad en el volante de Jase. Luego cerró con cuidado la puerta del coche.

en: “That’s quite brilliant,” I said, even though inside I was bursting with a shimmering nervousness.

en: I turned onto Becca’s street and parked two houses down from her McMansion. Margo crawled into the wayback of the minivan and returned with a pair of binoculars and a digital camera. She looked through the binoculars first, and then handed them to me. I could see a light on in the house’s basement, but no movement. I was mostly surprised that the house even had a basement—you can’t dig very deep before hitting water in most of Orlando.
vi: Tôi rẽ vào phố nhà Becca và đỗ cách biệt thự của Becca hai căn. Margo bò qua phía sau cái minivan và quay lại với đôi ống nhòm và một máy ảnh kĩ thuật số. Cô ấy nhìn qua ống nhòm trước rồi đưa cho tôi. Tôi thấy ánh sáng từ tầng hầm căn biệt thự, nhưng không có động tĩnh gì. Tôi hơi ngạc nhiên vì tòa nhà có tầng hầm–gần như khắp nơi ở Orlando, không cần đào sâu cũng có thể gặp mạch nước ngầm.
tr: Becca’mn sokağına saptım ve çirkin malikânelerine iki ev kala arabayı park ettim. Margo, arabanın arkasına emekleyip bir dürbün ve bir dijital fotoğraf makinesiyle geri döndü. Önce dürbünden baktı, sonra onu bana verdi. Evin bodrumunda bir ışığın açık olduğunu görebiliyordum ama hiç hareket yoktu. Daha çok evin bir bodrumu olmasına şaşırmıştım... Orlando’da suya denk gelmeden fazla derin kazamazsmız.
es: Giré en la calle de Becca y aparqué a dos casas de su McMansión. Margo se arrastró hasta la parte de atrás del coche y volvió con unos prismáticos y una cámara digital. Miró por los prismáticos y luego me los pasó a mí. Vi luz en el sótano, pero no se veía movimiento. Me sorprendió sobre todo que la casa tuviera sótano, porque en buena parte de Orlando no se puede excavar muy profundo sin que aparezca agua.

vi: Margo ra khỏi xe, một tay cầm bình xịt sơn, tay kia một gói cá. Tôi rên rẩm, “Chuyện này không hay ho chút nào,” nhưng tôi theo sau Margo, rạp người xuống như cô ấy, cho đến khi cả hai đứng trước cửa sổ tầng hầm còn để ngỏ.
tr: Bir elinde sprey boya, diğerinde kedi balıklarından biriyle arabadan çıktı. “Bu kötü bir fikir,” diye fısıldadım ama hâlâ açık olan bodrum penceresinin önünde durana kadar onun gibi çömelerek peşinden gittim.
es: Salió del coche con el espray de pintura en una mano y un pez gato en la otra. —No es buena idea —susurré. Pero me agaché, como ella, y la seguí hasta la ventana del sótano, que todavía estaba abierta.
vi_translation: Margo got out of the car, one hand holding a spray paint can, the other a package of fish. I groaned, "This is not a good idea," but I followed Margo, crouching down like she did, until we both stood in front of the open basement window.
tr_translation: He got out of the car with spray paint in one hand and one of the catfish in the other. “This is a bad idea,” I whispered, but I followed him, crouching like him, until he stopped in front of the still-open basement window.
es_translation: He got out of the car with the spray paint in one hand and a catfish in the other. —It's not a good idea —I whispered. But I crouched down, like her, and followed her to the basement window, which was still open.

en: “I’ll go first,” she said. She went in feetfirst and was standing on Becca’s computer desk, half in the house and half out of it, when I asked her, “Can’t I just be lookout?”
vi: “Tớ vào trước,” Margo nói. Cô ấy thò chân qua và đứng trên bàn máy tính của Becca, nửa người ở trong nhà, nửa ở ngoài. Khi ấy tôi hỏi, “Tớ ở ngoài này canh gác thôi nhé?”
tr: “Önce ben gireceğim,” dedi. Ayaklan önde içeri girdi, yansı evin içinde, yansı dışarıda Becca’mn bilgisayar masasının üstünde dururken, “Sadece gözcü olamaz mıyım?” diye sordum.
es: —Entro yo primero —me dijo. Metió los pies por la ventana y los apoyó en la mesa del ordenador de Becca. Tenía medio cuerpo dentro de la casa, y el otro medio fuera, cuando le pregunté: —¿No puedo quedarme vigilando?
vi_translation: "I'll go in first," Margo said. She stuck her leg through and stood on Becca's computer desk, half of her body inside the house, half outside. At that moment, I asked, "Should I stay out here and keep watch?"
tr_translation: “I will go in first,” he said. He went in with his feet first, half inside the house and half outside, standing on Becca's computer desk, and I asked, “Can't I just be a lookout?”
es_translation: —I'll go in first —he told me. He put his feet through the window and rested them on Becca's computer desk. He had half of his body inside the house, and the other half outside, when I asked him: —Can't I stay and keep watch?

en: “Get your skinny ass in here,” she answered, and so I did. Quickly, I grabbed all the boy-type clothes I saw on Becca’s lavender-carpeted floor. A pair of jeans with a leather belt, a pair of flip-flops, a Winter Park High School Wildcats baseball cap, and a baby blue polo shirt. I turned back to Margo, who handed me the paper-wrapped catfish and one of Becca’s sparkly purple pens. She told me what to write:
vi: “Lê cái mông nhọn của cậu vào đây,” Margo đáp, và thế là tôi làm theo. Nhanh gọn, tôi vơ hết mấy thứ quần áo kiểu con trai mà tôi thấy trên sàn trải thảm màu tím hoa oải hương. Cái quần jeans với thắt lưng da, đôi dép lê, mũ lưỡi trai của đội bóng chày Mèo Hoang Winter Park, và cái áo phông xanh nhạt. Tôi quay lại phía Margo, cô ấy đưa tôi gói cá và một trong mấy cái bút nhũ màu tím của Becca, bảo tôi hãy viết lên giấy gói:
tr: “Sıska kıçını kıpırdat,” diye cevap verdi, ben de öyle yaptım. Çabucak Becca’mn eflatun hahyla kaplı zemininde gördüğüm bütün erkek kıyafetlerini kaptım. Deri kemerli bir kot pantolon, bir çift sandalet, bir Winter Park Lisesi Wildcats beyzbol şapkası ve bebek mavisi bir polo gömlek. Bana kâğıda sarılı kedi balığını ve Becca’mn simli mor kalemlerinden birini uzatan Margo’ya döndüm. Bana ne yazmam gerektiğini söyledi:
es: —Mueve el culo de una vez —me contestó. Y lo hice. Recogí rápidamente toda la ropa de Jason que vi en la alfombra lila de Becca: unos vaqueros con un cinturón de piel, unas chanclas, una gorra de béisbol con el logo de los Wildcats del Winter Park y una camiseta azul celeste. Me giré hacia Margo, que me tendió el pescado envuelto y un lápiz de color violeta brillante de Becca. Me dijo lo que tenía que escribir: «Mensaje de Margo Roth Spiegelman: Tu amistad con ella duerme con los peces».
vi_translation: “Get your skinny butt in here,” Margo replied, and so I did. Quickly, I grabbed all the boyish clothes I saw on the lavender carpet. The jeans with a leather belt, the slippers, the Winter Park Wildcats baseball cap, and the light blue t-shirt. I turned back to Margo, she handed me the fish package and one of Becca's purple glitter pens, telling me to write on the wrapping paper:
tr_translation: “Move your skinny ass,” he replied, and I did so. I quickly grabbed all the men's clothes I saw on Becca's lilac carpeted floor. A pair of jeans with a leather belt, a pair of sandals, a Winter Park High School Wildcats baseball cap, and a baby blue polo shirt. I turned to Margo, who handed me the catfish wrapped in paper and one of Becca's glittery purple pens. She told me what to write:
es_translation: —Move your ass already —he replied to me. And I did it. I quickly picked up all of Jason's clothes that I saw on Becca's lilac carpet: some jeans with a leather belt, some flip-flops, a baseball cap with the Winter Park Wildcats logo, and a sky-blue t-shirt. I turned to Margo, who handed me the wrapped fish and one of Becca's bright violet colored pencils. She told me what to write: "Message from Margo Roth Spiegelman: Your friendship with her sleeps with the fishes."

en: A message from Margo Roth Spiegelman: Your friendship with her—it sleeps with the fishes
vi: Thông điệp từ Margo Roth Spiegelman: Tình bạn của mi với cô ấy–ngủ với cá rồi.
tr: Margo Roth Spiegelman’dan bir mesaj: Onunla olan arkadaşlığın... balıklarla uyuyor6
es: Me dijo lo que tenía que escribir: «Mensaje de Margo Roth Spiegelman: Tu amistad con ella duerme con los peces».
vi_translation: Message from Margo Roth Spiegelman: Your friendship with her–sleeps with the fishes.
tr_translation: A message from Margo Roth Spiegelman: Your friendship with her... sleeps with the fishes6
es_translation: She told me what to write: "Message from Margo Roth Spiegelman: Your friendship with her sleeps with the fishes."

en: Margo hid the fish between folded pairs of shorts in Becca’s closet. I could hear footsteps upstairs, and tapped Margo on the shoulder and looked at her, my eyes bulging. She just smiled and leisurely pulled out the spray paint. I scrambled out the window, and then turned back to watch as Margo leaned over the desk and calmly shook the spray paint. In an elegant motion—the kind you associate with calligraphy or Zorro—she spray-painted the letter M onto the wall above the desk.
vi: Margo giấu gói cá giữa mấy đôi quần soóc đã gấp trong tủ quần áo của Becca. Nghe thấy tiếng bước chân trên cầu thang, tôi liền gõ gõ vào vai Margo và nhìn cô ấy, hai mắt tôi như muốn bắn ra khỏi tròng. Margo chỉ mỉm cười và thong thả rút bình xịt sơn ra. Tôi lồm cồm chui qua cửa sổ, quay lại thì thấy Margo đang nhoài mình trên bàn, từ tốn lắc bình sơn. Bằng động tác duyên dáng–những chuyển động khiến chúng ta nghĩ ngay đến nghệ thuật viết chữ đẹp hoặc những đường kiếm của Zorro–Margo dùng bình xịt phun một chữ M lên mảng tường phía trên bàn máy tính.
tr: Margo balığı Becca’nın dolabmdaki katlanmış şortların araşma sakladı. Yukarı kattan gelen ayak seslerini duyabiliyordum, Margo’nun omzuna hafifçe vurup ona baktım, gözlerim yerinden 6 Genellikle mafyayla ilgili durumlarda kullanılan, “öldürülüp denize atıldı” anlamına gelen bir tabir, (ç. n. fırlamıştı. Sadece gülümsedi ve acele etmeden sprey boyayı çıkardı. Zorbela pencereden dışarı tırmandım ve Margo masanın üzerine eğilerek sakince sprey boyayı çalkalarken, onu izlemek için geri döndüm. Kaligrafi veya Zorro’yla ilişkilendirebileceğiniz türden zarif bir hareketle masanın gerisindeki duvara sprey boyayla M harfi yazdı.
es: Margo escondió el pescado en el armario de Becca, entre pantalones cortos doblados. Oí pasos en el piso de arriba, di unos golpecitos a Margo en el hombro y la miré con los ojos como platos. Se limitó a sonreír y abrió el espray de pintura la mar de tranquila. Salté por la ventana, me giré y vi a Margo inclinada sobre la mesa, agitando la pintura con calma. Con un movimiento elegante —de los que hacen pensar en un cuaderno de caligrafía o en el Zorro—, pintó la letra M en la pared, por encima de la mesa.
vi_translation: Margo hid the packet of fish among the folded pairs of shorts in Becca's wardrobe. Hearing footsteps on the stairs, I tapped Margo on the shoulder and looked at her, my eyes almost popping out of their sockets. Margo just smiled and leisurely pulled out a spray paint can. I clambered through the window, turned back to see Margo leaning over the desk, slowly shaking the spray can. With a graceful motion—movements that immediately make one think of calligraphy or Zorro's sword strokes—Margo used the spray can to paint an "M" on the wall above the computer desk.
tr_translation: Margo hid the fish among Becca's folded shorts in the closet. I could hear footsteps coming from upstairs, I lightly tapped Margo on the shoulder and looked at her, my eyes wide open. A phrase generally used in situations involving the mafia, meaning "killed and thrown into the sea," (abbr. n.) It had burst out. She just smiled and took out the spray paint without hurrying. I barely climbed out the window, and as Margo leaned over the table and calmly shook the spray paint, I turned back to watch her. With an elegant movement that you might associate with calligraphy or Zorro, she wrote the letter M on the wall behind the table with the spray paint.
es_translation: Margo hid the fish in Becca's closet, among folded shorts. I heard footsteps upstairs, tapped Margo on the shoulder, and looked at her with wide eyes. She just smiled and calmly opened the spray paint. I jumped out the window, turned around, and saw Margo leaning over the table, calmly shaking the paint. With an elegant movement —the kind that makes you think of a calligraphy notebook or Zorro— she painted the letter M on the wall, above the table.

en: She reached her hands up to me, and I pulled her through the window. She was just starting to stand when we heard a high-pitched voice shout, “DWIGHT!” I grabbed the clothes and took off running, Margo behind me.
vi: Cô ấy giơ tay lên và tôi kéo Margo qua cửa sổ. Cô ấy vừa đặt chân xuống đất thì chúng tôi nghe thấy một tiếng rít vút lên nhọn hoắt, “ANH DWIGHT ƠI!” Tôi ôm mớ quần áo và chạy, Margo chạy theo bén gót.
tr: Ellerini bana doğru uzattı, onu pencereden dışarıya çektim. Tam ayağa kalkmaya başlamıştı ki, “DWIGHT!” diye bağıran çok tiz bir ses duyduk. Kıyafetleri kaptım ve kaçmaya başladım, Margo arkamdaydı.
es: Extendió las manos hacia mí y tiré de ella. Estaba ya casi de pie cuando oímos una voz aguda gritando: «¡DWIGHT!». Cogí la ropa y salí corriendo. Margo me siguió.
vi_translation: She raised her hand and I pulled Margo through the window. As soon as she set foot on the ground, we heard a sharp, piercing scream, "MR. DWIGHT!" I grabbed the pile of clothes and ran, Margo following closely behind.
tr_translation: He reached his hands out to me, and I pulled him out of the window. Just as he was starting to stand up, we heard a very shrill voice shouting, "DWIGHT!" I grabbed the clothes and started running, Margo was behind me.
es_translation: She extended her hands towards me and I pulled her up. She was almost standing when we heard a high-pitched voice screaming: "DWIGHT!". I grabbed the clothes and ran out. Margo followed me.

en: I heard, but did not see, the front door of Becca’s house swing open, but I didn’t stop or turn around, not when a booming voice shouted “HALT!” and not even when I heard the unmistakable sound of a shotgun being pumped.
vi: Tôi nghe thấy, nhưng không nhìn được, cửa nhà Becca bật mở. Tôi không dừng cũng chẳng ngoái lại, kể cả khi một giọng trầm đục như sấm rền vang lên “ĐỨNG LẠI!”, thậm chí cả khi tôi nghe thấy âm thanh không thể nhầm lẫn được tiếng nạp đạn súng hoa cải.
tr: Becca’mn evinin ön kapısının açıldığım duydum ama görmedim, buna rağmen durmadım ya da dönüp bakmadım, ne gürleyen bir ses, “DUR!” diye bağırdığı zaman ne de ateşlenen bir av tüfeğinin sesini duyduğum zaman.
es: Oí la puerta de la calle de la casa de Becca abriéndose, aunque no la vi, pero ni me paré ni me giré cuando una atronadora voz gritó «¡ALTO!», ni siquiera cuando oí el inconfundible sonido de una escopeta cargándose.
vi_translation: I heard, but could not see, Becca's door swing open. I did not stop nor look back, even when a deep, thunderous voice roared "STOP!", and even when I unmistakably heard the sound of a shotgun being loaded.
tr_translation: I heard the front door of Becca's house open, but I didn't see it. Nevertheless, I didn't stop or turn around, neither when a thunderous voice shouted, "STOP!" nor when I heard the sound of a shotgun being fired.
es_translation: I heard the front door of Becca's house opening, although I didn't see it, but I neither stopped nor turned around when a thunderous voice shouted "STOP!", not even when I heard the unmistakable sound of a shotgun being loaded.

en: I heard Margo mumble “gun” behind me—she didn’t sound upset about it exactly; she was just making an observation—and then rather than walk around Becca’s hedge, I dove over it headfirst. I’m not sure how I intended to land—maybe an artful somersault or something—but at any rate, I spilled onto the asphalt of the road, landing on my left shoulder. Fortunately, Jase’s bundle of clothes hit the ground first, softening the blow.
vi: Tôi nghe thấy Margo lầm bầm “súng” ở phía sau–nghe không có vẻ như cô ấy đang lo lắng hay hoảng loạn, mà chỉ đang ghi nhận tình hình–và tôi không chạy vòng qua hàng dậu bao quanh nhà Becca mà cắm đầu lao qua. Tôi không chắc mình muốn hạ cánh thế nào–có thể là một màn lộn cù mèo thiện nghệ hoặc đại khái thế–nhưng rút cục hóa ra tôi buông mình sóng soài xuống mặt đường nhựa, tiếp đất bằng vai trái. May có đống quần áo của Jase bị ném xuống đất trước nên màn đo đường của tôi có phần êm ái hơn.
tr: Margo’nun arkamda, “Silah,” diye mırıldandığım duydumsesi konu hakkında pek keyfi kaçmış gibi gelmiyordu; sadece gözlem yapıyordusonra, Becca’ların çalı çitinin etrafından yürümektense, üstünden başımı öne eğerek atladım. Yere nasıl inmeyi planlıyordum emin değilimbelki ustalıklı bir parende ya da onun gibi bir şey düşünmüştümama her halükârda, sol omzumun üstünde asfalta düştüm. Neyse ki yere önce, düşüşümü yumuşatan Jase’in kıyafetleri çarptı.
es: Oí a Margo mascullar «escopeta» detrás de mí —no parecía alterada, se había limitado a hacer una observación—, y entonces, en lugar de avanzar pegado al seto de Becca, me tiré por encima de él de cabeza. No sé cómo pensaba aterrizar —quizá un hábil salto mortal o algo así—, pero el caso es que acabé cayendo sobre el hombro izquierdo en medio de la carretera. Por suerte, la ropa de Jase tocó el suelo antes que yo y amortiguó un poco el golpe.
vi_translation: I heard Margo mutter "gun" behind me–it didn't sound like she was worried or panicking, but just acknowledging the situation–and I didn't run around the hedge surrounding Becca's house but instead plunged straight through. I wasn't sure how I wanted to land–maybe a skillful somersault or something like that–but it turned out that I ended up sprawling on the asphalt, landing on my left shoulder. Luckily, Jase's pile of clothes had been thrown to the ground first, so my fall was somewhat cushioned.
tr_translation: Margo’s voice behind me, when I murmured “Gun,” didn’t seem particularly upset about the subject; she was just observing. Then, instead of walking around Becca’s hedge, I jumped over it, ducking my head. I wasn’t sure how I planned to land—maybe I had thought of a skillful somersault or something like that—but in any case, I fell onto the asphalt on my left shoulder. Luckily, Jase’s clothes, which cushioned my fall, hit the ground first.
es_translation: I heard Margo mutter "shotgun" behind me —she didn't seem upset, she had merely made an observation—, and then, instead of moving forward along Becca's hedge, I dove headfirst over it.
