I don't know how I thought I would land —maybe a skillful somersault or something like that—, but the fact is I ended up falling on my left shoulder in the middle of the road. Luckily, Jase's clothes hit the ground before I did and cushioned the fall a bit.

en: I swore, and before I could even start to stand, I felt Margo’s hands pulling me up, and then we were in the car and I was driving in reverse with the lights off, which is how I nearly came to run over the mostly naked starting shortstop of the Winter Park High School Wildcats baseball team. Jase was running very fast, but he didn’t seem to be running anyplace in particular. I felt another stab of regret as we backed up past him, so I rolled the window halfway down and threw his polo in his general direction. Fortunately, I don’t think he saw either Margo or me, and he had no reason to recognize the minivan since—and I don’t want to sound bitter or anything by dwelling on this—I can’t drive it to school.
vi: Tôi lầm bầm chửi rủa, còn chưa kịp chuẩn bị đứng dậy thì Margo đã xốc tôi lên. Chúng tôi vào xe và tôi lái giật lùi mà không bật đèn, thế nên suýt nữa đã tông phải chàng tuyển thủ chặn bóng của đội bóng chày Mèo Hoang Winter Park lúc này gần như hoàn toàn khỏa thân. Jase đang chạy rất nhanh, nhưng hình như hắn cứ chạy loạn xà ngầu thế thôi chứ không biết đi đâu. Tôi lại cảm thấy lưỡi dao hối hận cứa vào mình khi chúng tôi vượt qua hắn, thế nên tôi trượt cửa sổ xuống phân nửa, ném cái áo phông của hắn ra. May phước chắc hắn không thấy cả Margo lẫn tôi, và hắn không có cơ sở gì để nhận ra cái minivan vì–tôi không muốn tỏ ra chua chát hay đại loại thế khi cứ phải nhay lại điều này–tôi không được lái xe đến trường.
tr: Küfrettim, daha ben kalkmaya başlamadan önce, Margo’nun beni yukarı çeken ellerini hissettim, nihayet arabadaydık ve ben arabayı farlar kapalı geri geri sürüyordum, işte bu şekilde Winter Park Lisesi’nin Wildcats beyzbol takımının çıplak oyuncusunu neredeyse ezecektim. Jase çok hızlı koşuyordu ama belirli bir yere koşuyormuş gibi görünmüyordu. Geri geri giderek onu geçtiğimizde, başka bir pişmanlık sızısı daha hissettim, bu yüzden pencereyi yarıya kadar indirdim ve gömleğini ona doğru fırlattım. Neyse ki Jase’in ne beni ne de Margo’yu gördüğünü sanmıyorum ve ben okula arabayla gidemediğim içinbu konu üzerinde durarak bu
es: Solté un taco, y antes de que hubiera empezado a levantarme sentí las manos de Margo tirando de mí. En un segundo estábamos en el coche y di marcha atrás sin haber encendido las luces, que es más o menos como pasé por el casi desierto puesto de torpedero del equipo de béisbol de los Wildcats del Winter Park. Jase corría a toda velocidad, pero no parecía dirigirse a ningún sitio en concreto. Volví a sentir una punzada de remordimientos al pasar por su lado, de modo que bajé la ventanilla hasta la mitad y le lancé la camiseta. No creo que nos viera ni a Margo ni a mí, por suerte. Tampoco había razones para que reconociera el monovolumen, dado que —y no quiero que insistir en el tema pueda sonar a que estoy amargado— no puedo utilizarlo para ir al instituto.
vi_translation: I mumbled curses, and before I could prepare to stand up, Margo had already lifted me up. We got into the car and I drove in reverse without turning on the lights, so we almost hit the Wildcat Winter Park baseball team's catcher, who was nearly completely naked. Jase was running very fast, but it seemed like he was just running around aimlessly without knowing where to go. I felt the blade of regret cutting into me again as we passed him, so I rolled the window down halfway and threw his T-shirt out. Thankfully, he probably didn't see either Margo or me, and he had no reason to recognize the minivan because—I don't want to sound bitter or anything—I wasn't allowed to drive to school.
tr_translation: I cursed, and even before I started to get up, I felt Margo's hands pulling me up, finally we were in the car and I was driving backward with the headlights off, and this is how I almost ran over a naked player from the Winter Park High School Wildcats baseball team. Jase was running very fast but didn't seem to be running towards any particular place. As we passed him while driving backward, I felt another pang of regret, so I rolled the window halfway down and threw his shirt towards him. Luckily, I don't think Jase saw either me or Margo, and since I couldn't drive to school, I dwelled on this
es_translation: I let out a curse, and before I had even started to get up, I felt Margo's hands pulling me. In a second we were in the car, and I backed up without turning on the lights, which is more or less how I passed through the almost deserted torpedo station of the Wildcats baseball team from Winter Park. Jase was running at full speed, but he didn't seem to be heading anywhere in particular. I felt another pang of remorse as I passed by him, so I rolled down the window halfway and threw him the shirt. I don't think he saw either Margo or me, luckily. There was no reason for him to recognize the minivan either, given that —and I don't want to sound bitter by insisting on this— I can't use it to go to school.

en: “Why the hell would you do that?” Margo asked as I turned on the lights and, driving forward now, began to navigate the suburban labyrinth back toward the interstate.
vi: “Ma quỉ phương nào xui khiến cậu làm vậy hả?” Margo hỏi khi tôi bật đèn và lái xe đi, bây giờ tìm cách ra khỏi khu mê hồn trận ngoại thành này để vào cao tốc liên bang.
tr: ruk gibi görünmek istemiyorumminivam tanımak için de hiçbir nedeni yoktu. Ben farları açıp artık ileri doğru sürerek banliyö labirentinden tekrar eyaletler arası yola doğru giderken Margo, “Ne diye böyle bir şey yaptın?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Por qué demonios has hecho eso? —me preguntó Margo. Encendí las luces y, circulando ya hacia delante, me metí por el laberinto de calles en dirección a la autopista.
vi_translation: “What kind of devil prompted you to do that?” Margo asked as I turned on the lights and drove off, now trying to find a way out of this suburban maze to get onto the interstate highway.
tr_translation: I don't want to look like a jerk, and there was no reason to get to know the minivan. As Ben turned on the headlights and drove forward, navigating out of the suburban labyrinth back towards the interstate, Margo asked, "Why did you do such a thing?"
es_translation: —Why the hell did you do that? —Margo asked me. I turned on the lights and, already moving forward, I entered the labyrinth of streets heading towards the highway.

en: “I felt bad for him.”
vi: “Tớ thấy tội nghiệp hắn.”
tr: “Onun için üzüldüm.
es: —Me ha dado pena.
vi_translation: "I feel sorry for him."
tr_translation: “I felt sorry for him.”
es_translation: —I felt sorry.

en: “For him? Why? Because he’s been cheating on me for six weeks? Because he’s probably given me god-only-knows-what disease? Because he’s a disgusting idiot who will probably be rich and happy his whole life, thus proving the absolute unfairness of the cosmos?”
vi: “Hắn ư? Tại sao chứ? Vì hắn đã lừa dối tớ suốt sáu tuần ư? Vì có thể hắn đã lây sang tớ một thứ bệnh nào đó có-trời-mới-biết-là-gì ư? Vì hắn là thằng ôn ngu độn tởm lợm có thể cả đời sẽ được ăn sung mặc sướng, minh chứng hoàn hảo cho sự bất công của vũ trụ này ư?”
tr: “Onun için mi? Neden? Altı haftadır beni aldattığı için mi? Muhtemelen bana Tanrı bilir ne hastalığı bulaştırdığı için mi? Hayatı boyunca muhtemelen zengin ve mutlu olacak iğrenç bir ahmak olduğu ve böylelikle kainatın mutlak adaletsizliğini kanıtlayacağı için mi?
es: —¿Te ha dado pena? ¿Por qué? ¿Porque lleva un mes y medio engañándome? ¿Porque seguramente me habrá pegado vete a saber qué enfermedad? ¿Porque es un imbécil y un asqueroso que seguramente será rico y feliz toda su vida, lo que demuestra que el universo es absolutamente injusto?
vi_translation: “Him? Why? Because he deceived me for six weeks? Because maybe he has infected me with some disease that only God knows what it is? Because he is a disgusting, stupid jerk who might live a life of luxury, a perfect example of the injustice of this universe?”
tr_translation: “For him? Why? Because he has been cheating on me for six weeks? Because he has probably given me some disease, God knows what? Because he is likely to be a rich and happy disgusting fool all his life, thus proving the absolute injustice of the universe?”
es_translation: —Has it made you sad? Why? Because he has been deceiving me for a month and a half? Because he has probably given me who knows what disease? Because he is an idiot and a disgusting person who will probably be rich and happy all his life, which proves that the universe is absolutely unjust?

en: “He just looked sort of desperate,” I said.
vi: “Trông hắn cứ kiểu thảm thảm thế nào ấy,” tôi nói.
tr: “Sadece çaresiz gibi görünüyordu,” dedim.
es: —Parecía desesperado —le contesté.
vi_translation: “He looks kind of pitiful,” I said.
tr_translation: “She just looked desperate,” I said.
es_translation: —He seemed desperate —I replied to him.

en: “Whatever. We’re going to Karin’s house. It’s on Pennsylvania, by the ABC Liquors.”
vi: “Kệ xác hắn. Chúng ta sẽ đến nhà Karin. Ở Pennsylvania, cạnh tiệm rượu ABC Liquors.”
tr: “Her neyse. Karin’in evine gidiyoruz. Pennsylvania’da, ABC Liquors’ın yakınında.
es: —Da igual. Vamos a casa de Karin. Está en la avenida Pennsylvania, cerca de la licorería ABC.
vi_translation: "Forget about him. We will go to Karin's house. In Pennsylvania, next to the ABC Liquors store."
tr_translation: “Anyway. We are going to Karin's house. In Pennsylvania, near ABC Liquors.”
es_translation: —It doesn't matter. Let's go to Karin's house. It's on Pennsylvania Avenue, near the ABC liquor store.

en: “Don’t be pissed at me,” I said. “I just had a guy point a freaking shotgun at me for helping you, so don’t be pissed at me.”
vi: “Đừng chơi tớ thế,” tôi nói. “Một người đàn ông vừa chĩa súng hoa cải vào tớ vì tớ ra tay giúp cậu, cho nên đừng có chơi đểu nhau nữa chứ.”
tr: “Bana kızma,” dedim. “Az önce sana yardım ettiğim için bir adam lanet olası tüfeğini bana doğrulttu, yani sakin bana kızma.
es: —No te cabrees conmigo —le dije—. Un tipo acaba de apuntarme con una puta escopeta por ayudarte, así que no te cabrees conmigo.
vi_translation: “Don't mess with me,” I said. “A man just pointed a shotgun at me because I helped you, so stop playing dirty with each other.”
tr_translation: "Don't be mad at me," I said. "Just a moment ago, a man pointed his damn rifle at me because I helped you, so don't be mad at me."
es_translation: —Don't get mad at me —I told him—. A guy just pointed a fucking shotgun at me for helping you, so don't get mad at me.

en: “I’M NOT PISSED AT YOU!” Margo shouted, and then punched the dashboard.
vi: “TỚ CHƠI ĐỂU GÌ CẬU!” Margo gào lên và đấm mạnh xuống bảng điều khiển.
tr: “SANA KIZMADIM!” diye bağırdı, sonra kontrol panelini yumrukladı.
es: —¡NO ESTOY CABREADA CONTIGO! —gritó Margo dando un puñetazo al salpicadero.
vi_translation: “WHAT DID I DO TO YOU!” Margo screamed and slammed her fist down on the control panel.
tr_translation: “I'M NOT MAD AT YOU!” he shouted, then punched the control panel.
es_translation: —I'M NOT MAD AT YOU! —shouted Margo, punching the dashboard.

en: “Well, you’re screaming.”
vi: “Ái chà, cậu đang gào thét đấy.”
tr: “Şey, çığlık atıyorsun.
es: —Bueno, estás gritando.
vi_translation: "Wow, you're screaming."
tr_translation: “Well, you are screaming.”
es_translation: —Well, you're shouting.

en: “I thought maybe—whatever. I thought maybe he wasn’t cheating.”
vi: “Tớ cứ ngỡ có lẽ... chẳng biết nữa. Tớ đã nghĩ biết đâu hắn không lừa dối tớ.
tr: “Sandım ki belki de... her neyse. Belki de beni aldatmıyordur diye düşündüm.
es: —Pensé que quizá… Da igual. Pensé que quizá no me engañaba.
vi_translation: “I thought maybe... I don't know. I thought perhaps he wasn't deceiving me.”
tr_translation: “I thought maybe... whatever. I thought maybe she wasn't cheating on me.”
es_translation: —I thought that maybe… Never mind. I thought that maybe I wasn't being deceived.

en: “Karin told me at school. And I guess a lot of people have known for a long time. And no one told me until Karin. I thought maybe she was just trying to stir up drama or something.”
vi: “Karin đã nói với tớ khi ở trường. Và tớ đoán là nhiều người đã biết tỏng từ lâu rồi. Thế mà chả có ai cho tớ biết, trừ Karin. Tớ cứ tưởng con bé muốn dựng chuyện đặt điều gì chứ.”
tr: “Karin okulda bana söyledi. Sanırım birçok insan uzun zamandır biliyor ve hiç kimse Karin söyleyene kadar bir şey söylemedi. Ben de Karin ortalığı karıştırmaya falan çalışıyor olabilir diye düşündüm.
es: —Karin me lo dijo en el instituto. Y supongo que mucha gente lo sabía desde hacía tiempo. Pero nadie me lo había dicho. Creí que Karin solo pretendía liarla o algo así.
vi_translation: “Karin told me when we were at school. And I guess many people have known for a long time. Yet no one told me, except Karin. I thought she was just trying to make something up.”
tr_translation: “Karin told me at school. I think many people have known for a long time and no one said anything until Karin did. I also thought that maybe Karin was trying to stir things up.”
es_translation: —Karin told me at the institute. And I suppose a lot of people had known for a long time. But no one had told me. I thought Karin just wanted to stir things up or something like that.

en: “I’m sorry,” I said.
vi: “Tớ rất tiếc,” tôi nói.
tr: “Üzgünüm.
es: —Lo siento —le dije.
vi_translation: “I'm very sorry,” I said.
tr_translation: “I'm sorry.”
es_translation: —I'm sorry —I said to him.

en: “Yeah. Yeah. I can’t believe I even care.”
vi: “Tớ rất tiếc,” tôi nói. “Ờ, ờ, không thể tin được là tớ lại động lòng đấy.”
tr: “Evet. Evet. Umursadığıma bile inanamıyorum.
es: —Sí, sí. Me cuesta creer que me importe.
vi_translation: “I'm very sorry,” I said. "Uh, uh, I can't believe I was moved."
tr_translation: “Yes. Yes. I can't even believe that I care.”
es_translation: —Yes, yes. It's hard for me to believe that I care.

en: “My heart is really pounding,” I said.
vi: “Tim tớ đang nện mạnh lắm,” tôi nói.
tr: “Kalbim küt küt atıyor,” dedim.
es: —El corazón me va a toda pastilla —añadí.
vi_translation: “My heart is pounding hard,” I said.
tr_translation: “My heart is pounding,” I said.
es_translation: —My heart is racing —I added.

en: “That’s how you know you’re having fun,” Margo said.
vi: “Đó là cách cậu biết mình đang có trò vui mà,” Margo nói.
tr: “Eğlendiğini bu şekilde anlarsın,” dedi Margo.
es: —Así sabes que estás divirtiéndote —me contestó Margo.
vi_translation: “That's how you know you're having fun,” Margo said.
tr_translation: “This is how you know you're having fun,” said Margo.
es_translation: —That's how you know you're having fun —Margo replied to me.

en: But it didn’t feel like fun; it felt like a heart attack. I pulled over into a 7-Eleven parking lot and held my finger to my jugular vein while watching the : in the digital clock blink every second. When I turned to Margo, she was rolling her eyes at me. “My pulse is dangerously high,” I explained.
vi: Nhưng thực ra không giống cảm giác vui vẻ, mà giống một cơn đau tim hơn. Tôi tấp xe vào bãi đỗ của một cửa hàng 7-Eleven, đặt ngón tay lên chỗ động mạch cổ trong khi đếm thời gian bằng số lần dấu : nhá lên và tắt mỗi giây trên mặt đồng hồ điện tử. Khi quay sang, tôi thấy Margo đang tròn mắt nhìn mình. “Mạch của tớ nhanh một cách đáng ngại,” tôi giải thích.
tr: Ama eğlence gibi gelmiyordu, daha çok kalp krizi gibiydi. 7Eleveriın park alanına çektim ve dijital saatin saniyede bir yanıp sönen iki noktasını izleyerek parmağımı şah damarıma koydum. Margo’ya döndüğümde, bana gözlerini deviriyordu. “Nabzım tehlikeli derecede hızlı,” diye açıkladım.
es: Pero no me parecía divertido. Lo que me parecía era que iba a darme un infarto. Entré en el aparcamiento de un 7-Eleven, me llevé un dedo a la yugular y controlé mis pulsaciones en el reloj digital que parpadeaba cada segundo. Cuando me giré hacia Margo, la vi alzando los ojos al cielo. —Mi pulso está peligrosamente acelerado —le expliqué.
vi_translation: But it actually didn't feel like joy; it felt more like a heart attack. I pulled into the parking lot of a 7-Eleven, placed my finger on my carotid artery while counting the times the colon blinked on and off each second on the digital watch. When I turned around, I saw Margo staring at me wide-eyed. "My pulse is alarmingly fast," I explained.
tr_translation: But it didn't feel like fun, it was more like a heart attack. I pulled into the 7Eleven parking lot and placed my finger on my carotid artery, watching the two dots on the digital clock blink every second. When I turned to Margo, she was rolling her eyes at me. “My pulse is dangerously fast,” I explained.
es_translation: But it didn't seem fun to me. What it seemed like was that I was going to have a heart attack. I entered the parking lot of a 7-Eleven, put a finger to my jugular, and checked my pulse on the digital watch that blinked every second. When I turned towards Margo, I saw her rolling her eyes to the sky. —My pulse is dangerously accelerated —I explained to him.

en: “I don’t even remember the last time I got excited about something like that. The adrenaline in the throat and the lungs expanding.”
vi: “Tớ chẳng nhớ nổi lần cuối tớ thấy phấn kích vì điều gì đó như vậy. Adrenaline trong cổ họng và buồng phổi cứ thế trào lên.”
tr: “Böyle bir şey için en son ne zaman heyecanlandığımı bile hatırlamıyorum. Boğazındaki ve ciğerlerindeki adrenalin yayılıyor.
es: —Ni siquiera recuerdo la última vez que me puse a cien por algo así. Adrenalina en la garganta y los pulmones hinchados.
vi_translation: “I can't remember the last time I felt so excited about something like this. Adrenaline surged up my throat and lungs.”
tr_translation: “I can't even remember the last time I was excited about something like this. Adrenaline is spreading through your throat and lungs.”
es_translation: —I don't even remember the last time I got so worked up over something like this. Adrenaline in my throat and my lungs swollen.

en: “In through the nose out through the mouth,” I answered her.
vi: “Hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng,” tôi nối lời cô ấy. “Tất cả những chộn rộn nho nhỏ ấy.
tr: “Burnundan al, ağzından ver,” diye karşılık verdim.
es: —Inspirar por la nariz y espirar por la boca —le contesté.
vi_translation: “Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth,” I continued her words.
tr_translation: "Inhale through your nose, exhale through your mouth," I replied.
es_translation: —Inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth —I replied.

en: “All your little anxieties. It’s just so . . .”
vi: “Hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng,” tôi nối lời cô ấy. “Tất cả những chộn rộn nho nhỏ ấy. Chẳng phải thật...”
tr: “Bütün o küçük endişelerin. Sadece çok...
es: —Todas tus pequeñas preocupaciones. Es tan…
vi_translation: “All those little disturbances. Aren't they real...”
tr_translation: “All those little worries. Just very...”
es_translation: —All your little worries. It's so…

en: “Cute?”
vi: “Đáng yêu sao?”
tr: “Sevimli mi?
es: —¿Bonito?
vi_translation: “Cute, huh?”
tr_translation: “Cute?”
es_translation: —Beautiful?

en: “Is that what they’re calling childish these days?” She smiled.
vi: “Ngày nay người ta coi như thế là trẻ con nông nổi đúng không?” Margo mỉm cười.
tr: “Bugünlerde çocukça yerine böyle mi diyorlar?” Gülümsedi.
es: —¿Así es como llaman últimamente a la inmadurez? —me preguntó sonriendo.
vi_translation: “Nowadays people consider that as childish impulsiveness, right?” Margo smiled.
tr_translation: “Is this what they say instead of childish these days?” She smiled.
es_translation: —Is that what they call immaturity these days? —he asked me, smiling.

en: Margo crawled into the backseat and came back with a purse. How much shit did she put back there? I thought. She opened up the purse and pulled out a full bottle of nail polish so darkly red it was almost black. “While you calm down, I’m going to paint my nails,” she said, smiling up at me through her bangs. “You just take your time.”
vi: Cô ấy bò xuống băng ghế sau rồi quay lại với cái túi con. Những thứ hầm bà lằng gì chất ở phía sau thế không biết? Tôi trộm nghĩ. Cô ấy mở túi, lấy ra một lọ đầy sơn móng tay màu đỏ sậm, gần như đen. “Trong khi chờ cậu bình tĩnh lại, tớ sẽ sơn móng tay,” cô ấy nói và mỉm cười với tôi qua mấy lọn tóc mái. “Cậu cứ thong thả đi.”
tr: Margo arka koltuğa doğru emekledi ve bir el çantasıyla geri döndü. O arka tarafa ne kadar çok ıvır zıvır koymuş ki? diye düşündüm. Çantayı açtı ve içinden dolu bir oje çıkardı, o kadar koyu kırmızıydı ki neredeyse siyah görünüyordu. Perçemlerinin arasından bana gülümseyerek, “Sen sakinleşirken tırnaklarımı boyayacağım,” dedi. “Sen keyfine bak.
es: Margo se coló hasta el asiento trasero y volvió con un bolso. «¿Cuánta mierda ha metido ahí detrás?», pensé. Abrió el bolso y sacó un frasco de esmalte de uñas de color rojo tan oscuro que parecía negro. —Mientras te calmas, me pintaré las uñas —me dijo mirándome a través del flequillo y sonriéndome—. Tómate el tiempo que necesites.
vi_translation: She crawled down to the back seat and returned with a small bag. What kind of random stuff is piled up back there? I thought to myself. She opened the bag and took out a bottle of dark red, almost black, nail polish. “While waiting for you to calm down, I'll paint my nails,” she said and smiled at me through her bangs. “Take your time.”
tr_translation: Margo crawled towards the back seat and returned with a handbag. How much junk has she put in the back? I wondered. She opened the bag and took out a full nail polish, so dark red that it almost looked black. Smiling at me through her bangs, she said, "I'll paint my nails while you calm down." "Take your time."
es_translation: Margo slipped into the back seat and returned with a bag. “How much crap has she stuffed back there?” I thought. She opened the bag and took out a bottle of nail polish so dark red it looked black. —While you calm down, I'll paint my nails —she said to me, looking at me through her bangs and smiling—. Take all the time you need.

en: And so we sat there, she with her nail polish balanced on the dash, and me with a shaky finger on the pulse of myself. It was a good color of nail polish, and Margo had nice fingers, thinner and bonier than the rest of her, which was all curves and soft edges. She had the kind of fingers you want to interlace with your own. I remembered them against my hip bone in Wal-Mart, which felt like days ago. My heartbeat slowed. And I tried to tell myself: Margo’s right. There’s nothing out here to be afraid of, not in this little city on this quiet night.
vi: Và chúng tôi ngồi đó, Margo với lọ sơn móng tay đặt thăng bằng trên bảng điều khiển, tôi với ngón tay xương xẩu chặn trên mạch đập của mình. Màu sơn móng tay rất bắt mắt, và ngón tay Margo rất đẹp, mảnh mai và xương xương hơn phần còn lại của cô ấy, những đường cong và góc lượn mềm mại. Margo có kiểu ngón tay khiến người khác chỉ muốn đan tay mình vào đó. Tôi nhớ những ngón tay ấy ở trên hông tôi trong gian hàng Wal-Mart, cứ như đã từ nhiều ngày trước. Tôi nghe tim mình chậm lại. Và tôi cố tự nhủ: Margo nói đúng. Ngoài kia chẳng có gì đáng sợ cả, không phải trong cái thành phố bé nhỏ này, vào cái đêm yên tĩnh này.
tr: Ve orada öylece oturduk, o panele oturttuğu ojesiyle, ben kendi nabzımda titreyen bir parmakla. Hoş bir oje rengiydi ve Margo’nun da güzel parmakları vardı, kavislerden ve yumuşak kenarlardan oluşan bedeninin geri kalanından daha ince ve daha kemikliydi. Kendi parmaklarınızla iç içe geçirmek isteyeceğiniz türdendi. Walmart’ta kalça kemiğimin üzerinde oldukları zamanı hatırladım, sanki günler önceymiş gibi geliyordu. Kalp atışlarım yavaşladı. Kendime Margo’nun haklı olduğunu söylemeye çalıştım. Burada, bu sessiz gecede. Bu küçük şehirde korkacak hiçbir şey yoktu.
es: Y nos quedamos allí sentados, ella con su pintaúñas en el salpicadero, y yo tomándome el pulso con un dedo tembloroso. El color del pintaúñas no estaba mal, y Margo tenía los dedos bonitos, más delgados y huesudos que el resto de su cuerpo, todo él curvas y suaves protuberancias. Tenía unos dedos que daban ganas de entrelazarlos. Los recordé contra mi cadera en el Walmart y me dio la impresión de que habían pasado varios días. Mi corazón recuperó su ritmo normal e intenté decirme a mí mismo: Margo tiene razón. No hay nada que temer en esta noche tranquila, en esta pequeña ciudad.
vi_translation: And we sat there, Margo with a bottle of nail polish balanced on the dashboard, me with my bony finger pressed against my pulse. The nail polish color was very eye-catching, and Margo's fingers were very beautiful, slender and bonier than the rest of her, with soft curves and gentle angles. Margo had the kind of fingers that made others just want to intertwine their hands with hers. I remembered those fingers on my hip in the Wal-Mart aisle, as if it had been many days ago. I heard my heart slow down. And I tried to tell myself: Margo was right. There was nothing to be afraid of out there, not in this little town, on this quiet night.
tr_translation: And we just sat there, with her nail polish that she had put on for that panel, and me with a finger trembling on my own pulse. It was a nice nail polish color, and Margo also had beautiful fingers; they were thinner and more bony than the rest of her body, which was made up of curves and soft edges. They were the kind you would want to intertwine with your own fingers. I remembered the time they were on my hip bone at Walmart, it felt like it was days ago. My heartbeat slowed down. I tried to tell myself that Margo was right. Here, in this quiet night. There was nothing to fear in this small town.
es_translation: And we sat there, she with her nail polish on the dashboard, and I taking my pulse with a trembling finger. The color of the nail polish wasn't bad, and Margo had pretty fingers, thinner and bonier than the rest of her body, all curves and soft bumps. She had fingers that made you want to intertwine them. I remembered them against my hip at Walmart and it felt like several days had passed. My heart returned to its normal rhythm and I tried to tell myself: Margo is right. There is nothing to fear on this quiet night, in this small town.

en: “Part Six,” Margo said once we were driving again. She was waving her fingernails through the air, almost like she was playing piano. “Leave flowers on Karin’s doorstep with apologetic note.”
vi: “Phần Sáu,” Margo nói khi chúng tôi tiếp tục hành trình. Cô ấy vung vẩy những ngón tay trong không khí, trông như đang chơi dương cầm. “Đặt hoa trên thềm nhà Karin với lời nhắn xin lỗi.”
tr: “Altıncı Bölüm,” dedi Margo tekrar yola çıkar çıkmaz. Tırnaklarını âdeta piyano çalıyormuş gibi havada sallıyordu. “Özür mektubu ile çiçekleri Karin’in kapı eşiğine bırakmak.
es: —Sexta parte —dijo Margo en cuanto volvimos a arrancar. Movía las uñas en el aire como si estuviera tocando el piano—. Dejar flores en el escalón de la puerta de Karin con una nota de disculpa.
vi_translation: “Part Six,” Margo said as we continued our journey. She waved her fingers in the air, looking like she was playing the piano. “Place flowers on Karin's doorstep with an apology note.”
tr_translation: “Chapter Six,” said Margo as soon as they set off again. She was waving her fingers in the air as if she were playing the piano. “Leaving the apology letter and flowers on Karin’s doorstep.”
es_translation: —Part six —said Margo as soon as we started moving again. She moved her nails in the air as if she were playing the piano—. Leave flowers on Karin's doorstep with an apology note.

en: “What’d you do to her?”
vi: “Cậu đã làm gì cậu ấy vậy?”
tr: “Ona ne yaptın ki?
es: —¿Qué le hiciste?
vi_translation: “What did you do to him?”
tr_translation: “What did you do to her?”
es_translation: —What did you do to him?

en: “Well, when she told me about Jase, I sort of shot the messenger.”
vi: “Ờ, lúc cậu ấy kể về Jase cho tớ biết, tớ đã xử bắn sứ giả luôn.”
tr: “Şey, o Jase’ten bahsedince, elçiye zeval olmaz diye düşünmedim pek.
es: —Bueno, cuando me contó lo de Jase, de alguna manera maté al mensajero.
vi_translation: “Well, when he told me about Jase, I shot the messenger right away.”
tr_translation: "Well, when he mentioned Jase, I didn't really think 'don't shoot the messenger.'"
es_translation: —Well, when she told me about Jase, I somehow killed the messenger.

en: “How so?” I asked. We were pulled up to a stoplight, and some kids in a sports car next to us were revving their engine—as if I was going to race the Chrysler. When you floored it, it whimpered.
vi: “Thế nào cơ?” tôi hỏi. Tôi tăng tốc qua một đèn giao thông, có mấy nhóc trong một xe thể thao đi cạnh cũng rồ ga lao theo–như thể tôi muốn đua trên cái Chrysler này lắm không bằng. Ép nó chạy nhanh là nó rên rỉ ngay.
tr: “Nasıl yani?” diye sordum. Kırmızı ışığa yakalanmıştık, yanımızdaki spor arabadaki birkaç çocuk motora gaz verip duruyorlardı... sanki ben Chrysler’ı yarıştıracakmışım gibi. Chrysler’a tam gaz verildiğinde ancak inildiyordu.
es: —¿Cómo? —le pregunté. Nos acercábamos a un semáforo y a nuestro lado unos chavales en un coche deportivo aceleraron… como si se me fuera a pasar por la cabeza hacer una carrera con el Chrysler. Cuando pisabas el acelerador, gemía.
vi_translation: “What do you mean?” I asked. I sped through a traffic light, with some kids in a sports car next to me revving their engine as if I wanted to race in this Chrysler. Pushing it to go faster made it groan immediately.
tr_translation: “What do you mean?” I asked. We were caught at a red light, and a few kids in the sports car next to us were revving their engine... as if I was going to race the Chrysler. When you floored the Chrysler, it would only groan.
es_translation: —How? —I asked him. We were approaching a traffic light and next to us some kids in a sports car revved their engine... as if it would ever cross my mind to race with the Chrysler. When you stepped on the gas, it groaned.

en: “Well, I don’t remember exactly what I called her, but it was something along the lines of ‘sniveling, repulsive, idiotic, backne-ridden, snaggletoothed, fat-assed bitch with the worst hair in Central Florida—and that’s saying something.’”
vi: “Chậc, cũng chẳng nhớ chính xác tớ đã gọi Karin là gì nữa, nhưng đại loại một tràng kiểu ‘đồ cún cái mông bự răng hô mụn cóc ngu ngốc thối tha èo uột có quả đầu xấu nhất Trung Florida’–và như thế là động chạm đến người ta rồi.”
tr: “Şey, tam olarak ona ne dediğimi hatırlamıyorum ama ‘sümüklü, iğrenç, aptal, sırtı sivilceli, kırık dişli, Florida’daki en kötü saça sahip, koca götlü fahişe’ gibi bir şeydi, artık geri kalanını sen düşün.
es: —Bueno, no recuerdo exactamente lo que la llamé, pero fue algo parecido a «llorona, repugnante, idiota, espalda llena de granos, dientes torcidos, zorra culona con el pelo más horroroso de Florida… que ya es decir».
vi_translation: “Well, I don't exactly remember what I called Karin, but it was something like a string of 'big-butted, buck-toothed, stupid, warty, smelly, weakling with the ugliest head in Central Florida'—and that was enough to offend her.”
tr_translation: “Well, I don't remember exactly what I said to her, but it was something like ‘snotty, disgusting, stupid, acne-backed, broken-toothed, worst hair in Florida, big-assed whore,’ you can figure out the rest.”
es_translation: —Well, I don't remember exactly what I called her, but it was something like "crybaby, disgusting, idiot, pimple-backed, crooked teeth, fat-assed bitch with the most horrible hair in Florida... which is saying something."

en: “Her hair is ridiculous,” I said.
vi: “Tóc tai Karin đúng là dị dị thật mà,” tôi nói.
tr: “Saçı gerçekten gülünç,” dedim.
es: —Su pelo es ridículo —observé.
vi_translation: “Karin's hair is really weird,” I said.
tr_translation: “His hair is really ridiculous,” I said.
es_translation: —His hair is ridiculous —I observed.

en: I know. That was the only thing I said about her that was “true. When you say nasty things about people, you should never say the true ones, because you can’t really fully and honestly take those back, you know? I mean, there are highlights. And there are streaks. And then there are skunk stripes.”
vi: “Tớ biết chứ. Đó là điều duy nhất xác thực trong những gì tớ đã nói về con bé. Khi nói những lời không hay về người khác, không bao giờ nên nói sự thật, vì thực ra không thể hoàn toàn thực sự và thật lòng rút lại những lời ấy, cậu hiểu chứ? Tớ muốn nói là, có những điểm sáng, có những dị biệt, và có những thứ đê tiện thật bốc mùi.”
tr: “Biliyorum. Onun hakkında söylediğim tek doğru şey buydu, insanlar hakkında kötü şeyler söylediğinde, gerçek olanları asla dile getirmemelisin çünkü onları tamamen geri alman mümkün olmaz. Yani, röfle diye bir şey var. Gölge diye bir şey var. Bir de kokarcaya benzemek var.
es: —Lo sé. Fue la única verdad que le dije. Cuando le dices a alguien barbaridades, no debes decirle ninguna verdad, porque luego no puedes retirarla del todo y ser sincera, ¿sabes? Es decir, están los reflejos. Están también las mechas. Y luego están las rayas de mofeta.
vi_translation: “I know. That is the only thing that is true in what I said about her. When saying bad things about others, you should never tell the truth, because in reality, you can never fully and sincerely take back those words, you understand? I mean, there are bright spots, there are differences, and there are really stinking vile things.”
tr_translation: “I know. The only true thing I said about him was this: when you say bad things about people, you should never mention the true ones because it’s impossible to take them back completely. So, there is such a thing as highlights. There is such a thing as shadow. And there is such a thing as looking like a skunk.”
es_translation: —I know. It was the only truth I told him. When you say awful things to someone, you shouldn't tell them any truth, because then you can't completely take it back and be sincere, you know? That is to say, there are highlights. There are also streaks. And then there are skunk stripes.

en: As I drove up to Karin’s house, Margo disappeared into the way-back and returned with the bouquet of tulips. Taped to one of the flowers’ stems was a note Margo’d folded to look like an envelope. She handed me the bouquet once I stopped, and I sprinted down a sidewalk, placed the flowers on Karin’s doorstep, and sprinted back.
vi: Xe dừng trước nhà Karin, Margo biến mất ở phía sau xe rồi quay lại với bó hoa tulip. Ở cuống một bông hoa trong bó có đính mẩu giấy Margo đã gấp lại, trông như phong thư. Cô ấy đưa cho tôi bó hoa, và tôi xẹt qua lối đi bộ, đặt bó hoa xuống thềm nhà Karin, rồi lại xẹt về xe.
tr: Ben Karin’in evine doğru arabayı sürerken, Margo arka tarafta gözden kayboldu ve lale buketiyle geri döndü. Çiçeklerden birinin sapma zarf gibi görünecek şekilde katladığı bir not yapıştırmıştı. Durduğumuz anda Margo buketi bana verdi, kaldırımda hızla koşup çiçekleri Karin’in kapı eşiğine yerleştirdim ve koşarak geri döndüm.
es: Mientras nos dirigíamos a la casa de Karin, Margo pasó a la parte de atrás y volvió al asiento delantero con el ramo de tulipanes. Pegada al tallo de uno de ellos había una nota que Margo había doblado para que pareciera un sobre. Detuve el coche, me tendió el ramo, corrí por la acera, dejé las flores en el escalón de la entrada de Karin y regresé corriendo.
vi_translation: The car stopped in front of Karin's house, Margo disappeared behind the car and then came back with a bouquet of tulips. On the stem of one flower in the bouquet, there was a piece of paper that Margo had folded, looking like an envelope. She handed me the bouquet, and I dashed across the walkway, placed the bouquet on Karin's doorstep, and then dashed back to the car.
tr_translation: As Ben was driving towards Karin's house, Margo disappeared in the back and returned with a bouquet of tulips. One of the flowers had a note attached to it, folded to look like an envelope. As soon as we stopped, Margo handed me the bouquet, I quickly ran up the sidewalk, placed the flowers on Karin's doorstep, and ran back.
es_translation: As we were heading to Karin's house, Margo moved to the back and returned to the front seat with the bouquet of tulips. Attached to the stem of one of them was a note that Margo had folded to look like an envelope. I stopped the car, she handed me the bouquet, I ran across the sidewalk, left the flowers on Karin's front step, and ran back.

en: “Part Seven,” she said as soon as I was back in the minivan. “Leave a fish for the lovely Mr. Worthington.”
vi: “Phần Bảy,” Margo nói ngay khi tôi vào xe. “Tặng cá cho ngài Worthington đáng yêu.”
tr: “Yedinci Bölüm,” dedi ben döner dönmez. “Sevimli Bay Worthington için bir balık bırakmak.
es: —Séptima parte —me dijo en cuanto entré en el coche—: Dejar un pescado al agradable señor Worthington.
vi_translation: “Part Seven,” Margo said as soon as I got into the car. “Giving fish to the lovely Mr. Worthington.”
tr_translation: “Chapter Seven,” he said as soon as I turned around. “Leaving a fish for the charming Mr. Worthington.”
es_translation: "Seventh part," he told me as soon as I got into the car, "Leave a fish for the pleasant Mr. Worthington."

en: “I suspect he won’t be home yet,” I said, just the slightest hint of pity in my voice.
vi: “Tớ nghĩ giờ này hắn chưa về nhà đâu,” tôi nói với một chút xíu tiếc rẻ.
tr: “Henüz eve dönmemiş olabilir,” dedim sesimde belli belirsiz bir acımayla.
es: —Me temo que todavía no habrá llegado a su casa —le dije con solo un ligerísimo toque de pena en la voz.
vi_translation: “I think he hasn't come home yet at this time,” I said with a slight hint of regret.
tr_translation: “He might not have returned home yet,” I said with a faint trace of pity in my voice.
es_translation: —I'm afraid he still hasn't arrived home —I told him with just the slightest hint of sorrow in my voice.

en: “I hope the cops find him barefoot, frenzied, and naked in some roadside ditch a week from now,” Margo answered dispassionately.
vi: “Ước gì một tuần nữa cảnh sát bắt được hắn trong cảnh chân đất, tâm thần điên loạn, mình trần như nhộng vạ vật ở rãnh nước bên vệ đường,” Margo rất hào hứng.
tr: “Umanın bundan bir hafta sonra polisler onu yalınayak, çıplak ve çıldırmış bir halde yol kenarındaki bir hendekte bulurlar,” diye karşılık verdi Margo soğukkanlılıkla.
es: —Espero que la poli lo encuentre descalzo, desesperado y desnudo en alguna cuneta dentro de una semana —me contestó Margo sin inmutarse.
vi_translation: “I wish that in a week the police would catch him barefoot, mentally deranged, naked as a jaybird, lying in a ditch by the roadside,” Margo said excitedly.
tr_translation: “Let's hope that a week from now, the police find him barefoot, naked, and insane in a ditch by the roadside,” Margo responded calmly.
es_translation: —I hope the cops find him barefoot, desperate, and naked in a ditch somewhere in a week —Margo replied to me without flinching.

en: “Remind me never to cross Margo Roth Spiegelman,” I mumbled, and Margo laughed.
vi: “Hãy nhắc tớ đừng bao giờ chọc giận Margo Roth Spiegelman,” tôi làu bàu và Margo cười phá lên.
tr: “Bana Margo Roth Spiegelman’a asla karşı gelmemem gerektiğini hatırlat,” diye mırıldandım ve Margo güldü.
es: —Recuérdame que nunca haga enfadar a Margo Roth Spiegelman —murmuré. Y Margo se rió.
vi_translation: "Remind me to never make Margo Roth Spiegelman angry," I muttered, and Margo burst out laughing.
tr_translation: “Remind me to never go against Margo Roth Spiegelman,” I muttered, and Margo laughed.
es_translation: —Remind me to never make Margo Roth Spiegelman angry —I murmured. And Margo laughed.

en: “Seriously,” she said. “We bring the fucking rain down on our enemies.”
vi: “Nói nghiêm túc nhé,” cô ấy nói. “Chúng ta thả giông bão xuống đầu kẻ thù của chúng ta.”
tr: “Cidden,” dedi. “Düşmanlarımızın üstüne lanet yağmuru getiriyoruz.
es: —Ahora en serio —me dijo—. Estamos desatando la tormenta sobre nuestros enemigos.
vi_translation: “Seriously,” she said. “We will unleash storms upon our enemies.”
tr_translation: “Seriously,” he said. “We are bringing a curse storm upon our enemies.”
es_translation: —Now seriously —he told me—. We are unleashing the storm upon our enemies.

en: “Your enemies,” I corrected.
vi: “Kẻ thù của cậu,” tôi chỉnh lại.
tr: “Senin düşmanlarının,” diye düzelttim.
es: —Tus enemigos —la corregí.
vi_translation: “Your enemy,” I corrected.
tr_translation: "Your enemies," I corrected.
es_translation: —Your enemies —I corrected her.

en: “We’ll see,” she answered quickly, and then perked up and said, “Oh, hey, I’ll handle this one. The thing about Jason’s house is they have this crazy good security system. And we can’t have another panic attack.”
vi: “Để rồi xem,” cô ấy đáp nhanh, rồi mặt chợt sáng bừng lên. “Ái chà, tớ sẽ xử lí vụ này. Vấn đề là nhà Jason có hệ thống an ninh siêu đẳng cấp. Mà chúng ta không thể để bản thân bị tấn công thêm một cú kinh hoàng nào nữa.”
tr: “Göreceğiz,” diye karşılık verdi çabucak, sonra neşelendi. “Ah, hey, bunu ben halledeceğim. Jason’m eviyle ilgili olay şu ki çılgınca iyi bir güvenlik sistemleri var. Ve başka bir panikatak daha geçiremeyiz.
es: —Ya veremos —me contestó al instante, y entonces reaccionó y me dijo—: Oye, yo me ocupo de esta parte. El problema en casa de Jason es que tienen un sistema de seguridad buenísimo. Y no podemos sufrir otro ataque de pánico.
vi_translation: “We'll see,” she replied quickly, then her face suddenly lit up. “Oh wow, I'll handle this. The problem is that Jason's house has a top-notch security system. And we can't afford to be hit by another terrifying blow.”
tr_translation: “We will see,” he replied quickly, then he cheered up. “Oh, hey, I will handle this. The thing about Jason's house is that it has an insanely good security system. And we can't go through another panic attack.”
es_translation: —We'll see —he answered me instantly, and then he reacted and said to me—: Hey, I'll take care of this part. The problem at Jason's house is that they have an excellent security system. And we can't afford another panic attack.

en: “Um,” I said.
vi: “Ừa,” tôi nói.
tr: “Hımm,” dedim.
es: —Hum —dije.
vi_translation: “Yeah,” I said.
tr_translation: “Hmm,” I said.
es_translation: —Hmm —I said.

en: Jason lived just down the road from Karin, in this uber-rich subdivision called Casavilla. All the houses in Casavilla are Spanish-style with the red-tile roofs and everything, only they weren’t built by the Spanish. They were built by Jason’s dad, who is one of the richest land developers in Florida. “Big, ugly homes for big, ugly people,” I told Margo as we pulled into Casavilla.
vi: Đi xuôi phố nhà Karin sẽ đến chỗ Jason, cái khu sang chảnh tên là Casavilla. Tất cả các căn nhà ở Casavilla đều theo kiến trúc Tây Ban Nha, mái ngói đỏ đặc trưng và tất cả các thứ khác nữa, ngoại trừ không phải do người Tây Ban Nha xây dựng. Người kiến tạo những căn nhà ấy là bố Jason, một trong những tay buôn bán bất động sản giàu có nhất Florida. “Nhà vừa to vừa xấu cho những người vừa xấu vừa to,” tôi nói với Margo trong khi tấp xe vào khu Casavilla.
tr: Jason, Karin’in biraz ilerisinde, Casavilla adlı süperzengin semtte yaşıyordu. Casavilla’daki tüm evler kırmızı kiremitli çatılarıyla filan Ispanyol tarzındaydı, ancak Ispanyollar tarafından yapılmamışlardı. Florida’daki en zengin arazi ıslahçılarmdan biri olan Jason’m babası tarafından inşa edilmişlerdi. Casavilla’ya girerken, “Büyük, çirkin insanlar için büyük, çirkin evler,” dedim Margo’ya.
es: Jason vivía justo al final de la calle de Karin, en una urbanización hiperrica llamada Casavilla. Todas las casas de Casavilla son de estilo español, con tejas rojas y todo eso, solo que no las construyeron los españoles. Las construyó el padre de Jason, uno de los promotores inmobiliarios más ricos de Florida. —Casas grandes y feas para gente grande y fea —le dije a Margo mientras aparcaba en Casavilla.
vi_translation: Going down the street from Karin's house, you will reach Jason's place, the fancy area called Casavilla. All the houses in Casavilla follow Spanish architecture, with characteristic red tile roofs and everything else, except they were not built by Spaniards. The person who created those houses is Jason's father, one of the wealthiest real estate moguls in Florida. “Big and ugly houses for big and ugly people,” I said to Margo as I pulled the car into Casavilla.
tr_translation: Jason lived a little further from Karin, in a super-rich neighborhood called Casavilla. All the houses in Casavilla were in the Spanish style with red-tiled roofs and such, but they were not built by Spaniards. They were built by Jason's father, one of the richest land developers in Florida. As we entered Casavilla, I said to Margo, "Big, ugly houses for big, ugly people."
es_translation: Jason lived just at the end of Karin's street, in a super-rich development called Casavilla. All the houses in Casavilla are Spanish-style, with red tiles and all that, except they weren't built by the Spanish. They were built by Jason's father, one of the richest real estate developers in Florida. —Big and ugly houses for big and ugly people —I said to Margo as I parked in Casavilla.

en: “No shit. If I ever end up being the kind of person who has one kid and seven bedrooms, do me a favor and shoot me.”
vi: “Bó tay luôn. Nếu tớ chẳng may đi đến kết cục trở thành người có mỗi một quí tử và nhà có bảy phòng ngủ, làm ơn hãy cho tớ một ân huệ là bắn quách tớ đi.”
tr: “Yapma ya. Eğer bir gün, bir çocuğu ve yedi yatak odası olan türde bir insan olursam, bana bir iyilik yap ve beni vur.
es: —Tú lo has dicho. Si alguna vez acabo siendo una de esas personas que tienen un hijo y siete dormitorios, hazme el favor de pegarme un tiro.
vi_translation: "I give up." "If I unfortunately end up being someone with only one son and a house with seven bedrooms, please do me a favor and just shoot me."
tr_translation: “No way. If I ever become the kind of person with a child and seven bedrooms, do me a favor and shoot me.”
es_translation: —You said it. If I ever end up being one of those people who have a child and seven bedrooms, do me a favor and shoot me.

en: We pulled up in front of Jase’s house, an architectural monstrosity that looked generally like an oversize Spanish hacienda except for three thick Doric columns going up to the roof. Margo grabbed the second catfish from the backseat, uncapped a pen with her teeth, and scrawled in handwriting that didn’t look much like hers:
vi: Chúng tôi đỗ lại trước nhà Jase, một ca quái đản về kiến trúc, nhìn tổng thể từa tựa một nông trại Tây Ban Nha ngoại cỡ, trừ ba cây cột to uỵch kiểu Hi Lạp đâm thẳng đến mái nhà. Margo với gói cá thứ hai ở ghế sau, cắn mở nắp bút bằng răng, và loằng ngoằng ngoáy một dòng trông không giống chữ viết hàng ngày của cô ấy lắm:
tr: Jase’in evinin önünde durduk, çatıya doğru giden üç kalın Dor tarzı sütun haricinde, genel olarak aşırı büyük bir İspanyol çiftliği gibi görünen mimari bir canavardı. Margo arka koltuktan ikinci kedi balığını kapıp bir kalemin kapağını dişleriyle açtı ve kendininkine benzemeyen bir el yazısıyla bir şeyler karaladı.
es: Aparcamos delante de la casa de Jase, una monstruosidad arquitectónica que parecía una inmensa hacienda española, excepto por tres columnas dóricas que se alzaban hasta el tejado. Margo cogió el segundo pez gato del asiento trasero, quitó la tapa a un boli con los dientes y garabateó en una letra diferente de la suya: «El amor que MS sentía Por ti Duerme Con los Peces».
vi_translation: We stopped in front of Jase's house, a bizarre case of architecture, overall resembling an oversized Spanish farmhouse, except for three huge Greek-style columns jutting straight up to the roof. Margo, with the second bag of fish in the back seat, bit open the pen cap with her teeth, and scribbled a line that didn't quite look like her usual handwriting:
tr_translation: We stopped in front of Jase's house, an architectural monstrosity that generally looked like an overly large Spanish ranch, except for the three thick Doric columns leading up to the roof. Margo grabbed the second catfish from the back seat, opened the cap of a pen with her teeth, and scribbled something in a handwriting that didn't resemble her own.
es_translation: We parked in front of Jase's house, an architectural monstrosity that looked like an immense Spanish hacienda, except for three Doric columns that rose up to the roof. Margo grabbed the second catfish from the back seat, took the cap off a pen with her teeth, and scribbled in a handwriting different from her own: "The love MS felt for you Sleeps With the Fishes."

en: MS’s love For you: it Sleeps With the Fishes “Listen, keep the car on,” she said. She put Jase’s WPHS baseball hat on backward.
vi: tình yêu của MS dành Cho mi: đã yên Ngủ Với Cá rồi “Tớ bảo này, đừng tắt động cơ xe,” Margo nói. Cô ấy đội ngược cái mũ lưỡi trai đội bóng chày Mèo Hoang Winter Park của Jase lên đầu mình.
tr: MS’nin sana Olan aşkı: Balıklarla Uyuyor “Arabayı çalışır halde tut,” dedi. Jase’in beyzbol şapkasını ters bir şekilde başına geçirdi.
es: Margo cogió el segundo pez gato del asiento trasero, quitó la tapa a un boli con los dientes y garabateó en una letra diferente de la suya: «El amor que MS sentía Por ti Duerme Con los Peces». —Oye, deja el coche encendido —me dijo poniéndose la gorra de béisbol de Jase al revés.
vi_translation: MS's love for you: has rested peacefully with the fish “I’m telling you, don’t turn off the car engine,” Margo said. She wore Jase's Winter Park Wildcats baseball cap backward on her head.
tr_translation: MS's love for you: Sleeping with the fishes "Keep the car running," he said. Jase put his baseball cap on backwards.
es_translation: Margo grabbed the second catfish from the back seat, took the cap off a pen with her teeth, and scribbled in a handwriting different from her own: "The love MS felt for you Sleeps With the Fishes." —Hey, leave the car running —he said to me, putting on Jase's baseball cap backwards.

en: “Okay,” I said.
vi: “Ừ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Tamam,” dedim.
es: —De acuerdo —le contesté.
vi_translation: “Yes,” I said.
tr_translation: "Okay," I said.
es_translation: —Agreed —I replied to him.

en: “Keep it in drive,” she said.
vi: “Để sẵn sàng phóng đi nhé.”
tr: “Arabayı caddede tut,” dedi.
es: —De acuerdo —le contesté. —Preparado para largarnos —añadió. —De acuerdo.
vi_translation: "Get ready to launch."
tr_translation: “Keep the car on the street,” he said.
es_translation: —Ready to leave —he added. —Agreed.

en: “Okay,” I said, and felt my pulse rising. In through the nose, out through the mouth. In through the nose, out through the mouth. Catfish and spray paint in hand, Margo threw the door open, jogged across the Worthingtons’ expansive front lawn, and then hid behind an oak tree. She waved at me through the darkness, and I waved back, and then she took a dramatically deep breath, puffed her cheeks out, turned, and ran.
vi: “Được rồi mà,” tôi đáp, cảm thấy mạch lại rộn lên. Hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng. Hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng. Tay cầm gói cá và bình xịt sơn, Margo mở cửa xe, từ từ đi bộ qua thảm cỏ mênh mông trước nhà Worthington, rồi nấp sau một cây sồi. Cô ấy vẫy vẫy tôi trong bóng tối, tôi vẫy lại, và Margo hít vào một hơi thật sâu, hai má phồng lên, quay đi và chạy.
tr: “Tamam,” dedim ve nabzımın hızlandığını hissettim. Burundan al, ağızdan ver. Burundan al, ağızdan ver. Margo, elinde kedi balığı ve sprey boyayla kapıyı ardına kadar açıp Worthington’ların devasa çimenliğini koşarak geçti, sonra bir meşe ağacımn arkasına saklandı. Karanlığın içinden bana el salladı, ben de ona el salladım, sonra dramatik bir biçimde derin bir nefes alıp yanaklarım şişirdi, döndü ve koştu.
es: Y sentí que se me aceleraba el pulso. «Inspirar por la nariz, espirar por la boca. Inspirar por la nariz, espirar por la boca». Con el pescado y el espray en las manos, Margo abrió la puerta, corrió por el amplio césped de los Worthington y se escondió detrás de un roble. Me hizo un gesto con la mano en la oscuridad, se lo devolví y entonces respiró dramática y profundamente, sus mejillas se inflaron, se giró y echó a correr.
vi_translation: "It's okay," I replied, feeling my pulse quicken. Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth. Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth. Holding a bag of fish and a spray paint can, Margo opened the car door, slowly walked across the vast lawn in front of the Worthington house, and then hid behind an oak tree. She waved at me in the darkness, I waved back, and Margo took a deep breath, her cheeks puffing out, turned away and ran.
tr_translation: “Okay,” I said and felt my pulse quicken. In through the nose, out through the mouth. In through the nose, out through the mouth. Margo, holding a catfish and spray paint, flung the door wide open and ran across the Worthingtons' vast lawn, then hid behind an oak tree. She waved at me from the darkness, I waved back, then she dramatically took a deep breath, puffed out her cheeks, turned, and ran.
es_translation: And I felt my pulse quicken. «Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth. Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth». With the fish and the spray in her hands, Margo opened the door, ran across the wide Worthington lawn, and hid behind an oak tree. She gestured to me in the darkness, I returned the gesture, and then she breathed dramatically and deeply, her cheeks puffed out, she turned, and took off running.

en: She’d only taken one stride when the house lit up like a municipal Christmas tree, and a siren started blaring. I briefly contemplated abandoning Margo to her fate, but just kept breathing in through the nose and out through the mouth as she ran toward the house. She heaved the fish through a window, but the sirens were so loud I could barely even hear the glass breaking. And then, just because she’s Margo Roth Spiegelman, she took a moment to carefully spray-paint a lovely M on the part of the window that wasn’t shattered. Then she was running all out toward the car, and I had a foot on the accelerator and a foot on the brake, and the Chrysler felt at that moment like a Thoroughbred racehorse. Margo ran so fast her hat blew off behind her, and then she jumped into the car, and we were gone before she even got the door closed.
vi: Margo mới chỉ bằng được một sải chân thì toàn bộ căn nhà đã sáng trưng lên như cây thông Giáng Sinh ở trung tâm thành phố, và còi hụ inh ỏi. Tôi thoáng nghĩ hay là phó mặc Margo cho định mệnh, nhưng tôi tiếp tục hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng khi cô ấy chạy về phía tòa nhà ấy. Margo quẳng gói cá vào nhà qua một cửa sổ, còi báo động chói tai đến mức tôi hầu như không nghe thấy tiếng kính vỡ. Và rồi, vì cô ấy là Margo Roth Spiegelman, cô ấy tranh thủ thời gian lượn một chữ M mĩ miều lên phần cửa sổ không bị hư hại. Rồi Margo chạy hết tốc lực về xe, tôi đã đặt sẵn một chân lên chân ga, chân kia lên phanh. Chiếc Chrysler lúc đó như đang trong một cuộc đua ngựa thuần chủng dòng Thoroughbred. Margo chạy nhanh đến mức cái mũ trên đầu bay lên rơi lại phía sau, cô ấy nhảy phộc vào xe và chúng tôi lao đi trước khi cô ấy kịp đóng cửa xe.
tr: Ev bir Noel ağacı gibi aydınlandığında ve bir siren bangır bangır çalmaya başladığında sadece bir adım atabilmişti. Çok kısa bir an Margo’yu kaderiyle baş başa bırakmayı düşündüm ama o eve doğru koşarken burnumdan nefes alıp ağzımdan vermeye devam ettim. Balığı bir pencereye doğru attı ama sirenler o kadar yüksekti ki camın kırıldığım bile zar zor duyabildim. Sonra, yalnızca Margo Roth Spiegelman olduğu için pencerenin kırılmayan kısmına sprey boyayla dikkatlice güzel bir M yazmak için bir dakikasını ayırdı. Ardından arabaya var gücüyle koşmaya başladı, bir ayağımı gaz pedalında bir ayağım frendeydi ve o an Chrysler sanki safkan bir yarış atıymış gibi hissettiriyordu. Margo o kadar hızlı koşuyordu ki şapkası geriye uçtu, sonra arabaya atladı ve daha o kapıyı kapatamadan kaçmıştık.
es: Había dado una sola zancada cuando la casa se iluminó como un árbol de Navidad municipal y empezó a sonar una sirena. Por un momento me planteé abandonar a Margo a su suerte, pero seguí inspirando por la nariz y espirando por la boca mientras ella corría hacia la casa. Lanzó el pescado por la ventana, pero las sirenas hacían tanto ruido que apenas pude oír el cristal rompiéndose. Y entonces, como hablamos de Margo Roth Spiegelman, se tomó un momento para pintar con cuidado una bonita M en la parte de la ventana que no se había roto. Luego corrió hacia el coche, yo tenía un pie en el acelerador y otro en el freno, y en aquellos momentos el Chrysler parecía un purasangre de carreras. Margo corrió tan deprisa que la gorra salió volando, saltó al coche y salimos zumbando antes de que hubiera cerrado la puerta.
vi_translation: Margo had barely taken a step when the whole house lit up like a Christmas tree in the city center, and the sirens blared loudly. I briefly thought about leaving Margo to her fate, but I continued to inhale through my nose and exhale through my mouth as she ran towards the building. Margo tossed the fish package into the house through a window, the alarm was so loud that I could hardly hear the glass shattering. And then, because she was Margo Roth Spiegelman, she took the time to elegantly draw an M on the undamaged part of the window. Then Margo ran full speed back to the car, I had one foot on the gas pedal and the other on the brake. The Chrysler at that moment felt like it was in a Thoroughbred horse race. Margo ran so fast that the hat on her head flew off and fell behind, she jumped into the car and we sped off before she could even close the door.
tr_translation: He had only taken one step when the house lit up like a Christmas tree and a siren started blaring. For a very brief moment, I thought about leaving Margo to her fate, but as she ran towards the house, I continued to breathe in through my nose and out through my mouth. She threw the fish towards a window, but the sirens were so loud that I could barely hear the glass shatter. Then, because she was Margo Roth Spiegelman, she took a minute to carefully spray-paint a beautiful M on the unbroken part of the window. Then she started running towards the car with all her might, one foot on the gas pedal and the other on the brake, and at that moment, the Chrysler felt like a purebred racehorse. Margo was running so fast that her hat flew off, then she jumped into the car and we sped away before she could even close the door.
es_translation: He had taken only one stride when the house lit up like a municipal Christmas tree and a siren started blaring. For a moment I considered abandoning Margo to her fate, but I kept inhaling through my nose and exhaling through my mouth as she ran towards the house. She threw the fish through the window, but the sirens were so loud that I could barely hear the glass breaking. And then, since we are talking about Margo Roth Spiegelman, she took a moment to carefully paint a nice M on the part of the window that hadn't broken. Then she ran towards the car, I had one foot on the accelerator and the other on the brake, and at that moment the Chrysler felt like a racing thoroughbred. Margo ran so fast that her cap flew off, she jumped into the car and we zoomed off before she had even closed the door.

en: I stopped at the stop sign at the end of the street, and Margo said, “What the hell? Go go go go go,” and I said, “Oh, right,” because I had forgotten that I was throwing caution to the wind and everything. I rolled through the three other stop signs in Casavilla, and we were a mile down Pennsylvania Avenue before we saw a cop car roar past us with its lights on.
vi: Tôi dừng xe ở đèn giao thông cuối phố, Margo kêu lên, “Gì thế này? Đi thôi, mau mau mau!” và tôi đáp, “Ồ, được thôi,” vì tôi quên mất rằng tôi đã ném hết mọi cẩn trọng vào gió và đủ thứ khác nữa, mặc kệ và bất chấp. Tôi vượt qua ba đèn đỏ nữa trong khu Casavilla, và chúng tôi đã chạy được một dặm trên đại lộ Pennsylvania khi một xe cảnh sát rú còi và bật đèn hiệu chạy qua.
tr: Sokağın sonundaki dur işaretinde durdum, Margo, “Ne halt ediyorsun? Devam et devam et,” dedi, ben de, “Ah, doğru,” dedim, çünkü ihtiyatı elden bıraktığımı filan unutmuştum. Casavilla’daki diğer üç dur levhasını da geçtim ve ışıkları yanarak yanımızdan geçen bir polis arabası görmeden önce, Pennsylvania Caddesi’nde bir kilometre kadar ilerlemiştik.
es: Me detuve en el stop del final de la calle. —¿Qué mierda haces? Sigue sigue sigue sigue sigue —me dijo Margo. —Bueno, vale —le contesté, porque había olvidado que estaba lanzando al viento la prudencia. Pasé de largo los otros tres stops de Casavilla y estábamos a un par de kilómetros de la avenida Pennsylvania cuando vimos que nos adelantaba un coche de policía con las luces encendidas.
vi_translation: I stopped the car at the traffic light at the end of the street, Margo exclaimed, "What's this? Let's go, go go go!" and I replied, "Oh, alright," because I had forgotten that I had thrown all caution to the wind and everything else, regardless and defiant. I ran through three more red lights in the Casavilla neighborhood, and we had driven a mile on Pennsylvania Avenue when a police car blared its siren and flashed its lights as it passed by.
tr_translation: At the stop sign at the end of the street, I stopped, and Margo said, "What the hell are you doing? Keep going, keep going," and I said, "Oh, right," because I had forgotten that I had thrown caution to the wind. I passed the other three stop signs on Casavilla and we had gone about a kilometer on Pennsylvania Avenue before we saw a police car with its lights on passing by us.
es_translation: I stopped at the stop sign at the end of the street. —What the hell are you doing? Keep going, keep going, keep going, keep going —Margo told me. —Alright, fine —I replied, because I had forgotten that I was throwing caution to the wind. I passed by the other three stops in Casavilla and we were a couple of kilometers from Pennsylvania Avenue when we saw a police car with its lights on passing us.

en: “That was pretty hardcore,” Margo said. “I mean, even for me. To put it Q-style, my pulse is a little elevated.”
vi: “Màn vừa rồi gớm thiệt,” Margo nói. “Như tớ mà tớ cũng thấy gớm. Còn nói theo kiểu của Q, mạch máu tớ cũng đập nhanh hơn chút chút.”
tr: “Of, çok pisti haha,” dedi Margo. “Yani, benim için bile. Eğer Qtarzı açıklayacak olursak, nabzım biraz hızlandı.
es: —Ha sido muy heavy —dijo Margo—. Vaya, hasta para mí. Por decirlo a tu manera, se me ha acelerado un poco el pulso.
vi_translation: “That last scene was really scary,” Margo said. “Even I found it scary. And to put it in Q's terms, my blood vessels were pumping a bit faster.”
tr_translation: “Oh, it was so dirty haha,” said Margo. “I mean, even for me. If we were to explain it Q-style, my pulse quickened a bit.”
es_translation: —It has been very heavy —said Margo—. Wow, even for me. To put it in your way, my pulse has quickened a bit.

en: “Jesus,” I said. “I mean, you couldn’t have just left it in his car? Or at least at the doorstep?”
vi: “Chúa ơi,” tôi nói. “Kì thực cậu không thể nhét nó vào xe hắn ta sao? Hay chí ít để lại trên thềm nhà thôi?”
tr: “Tanrım,” dedim. ‘Yani, balığı arabasına filan bırakamaz miydin? Ya da en azından kapı eşiğine?
es: —¡Joder! —exclamé yo—. ¿No podrías habérselo dejado en el coche? ¿O al menos en el escalón?
vi_translation: "Oh my God," I said. "Couldn't you actually fit it into his car? Or at least leave it on the doorstep?"
tr_translation: “My God,” I said. ‘I mean, couldn't you have left the fish in your car or something? Or at least on the doorstep?”
es_translation: —Damn! —I exclaimed—. Couldn't you have left it in the car? Or at least on the step?

en: “We bring the fucking rain, Q. Not the scattered showers.”
vi: “Chúng ta thả giông bão mà Q. Không phải mưa rào rải rác đâu nhé.”
tr: “Lanet yağmuru getiriyoruz, Q. Serpinti değil.
es: —Desatamos la puta tormenta, Q, no chubascos dispersos.
vi_translation: “We are unleashing a storm, Q. It's not just scattered showers.”
tr_translation: “We are bringing the cursed rain, Q. Not the fallout.”
es_translation: —We unleashed the fucking storm, Q, not scattered showers.

en: “Tell me Part Eight is less terrifying.”
vi: “Hãy nói với tớ là Phần Tám sẽ ít hãi hùng hơn đi.”
tr: “Lütfen bana Sekizinci Bölüm’ün daha az korkutucu olduğunu söyle.
es: —Dime que la octava parte no es tan espantosa.
vi_translation: "Tell me that Part Eight will be less terrifying."
tr_translation: “Please tell me that Chapter Eight is less scary.”
es_translation: —Tell me that the eighth part is not so dreadful.

en: “Don’t worry. Part Eight is child’s play. We’re going back to Jefferson Park. Lacey’s house. You know where she lives, right?” I did, although God knows Lacey Pemberton would never deign to have me over. She lived on the opposite side of Jefferson Park, a mile away from me, in a nice condo on top of a stationery store— the same block the dead guy had lived on, actually. I’d been to the building before, because friends of my parents lived on the third floor. There were two locked doors before you even got to the condos. I figured even Margo Roth Spiegelman couldn’t break into that place.
vi: “Đừng lo. Phần Tám là trò trẻ nít thôi. Chúng ta trở lại khu Jefferson Park. Nhà Lacey. Cậu biết nhà con bé đúng không?” Tôi biết, nhưng chỉ có Chúa mới biết tại sao Lacey Pemberton chả bao giờ thèm mời tôi đến nhà. Nhà Lacey ở phía bên kia Công viên Jefferson, cách nhà tôi một dặm, một căn hộ xinh xắn ở tầng trên hiệu văn phòng phẩm–chính là khu chung cư ngày xưa người đàn ông bị chết đã từng ở. Tôi đã từng vào trong vì bạn bố mẹ tôi ở tầng ba. Trước khi vào được tòa chung cư, còn phải qua hai lần cửa khóa. Tôi trộm nghĩ kể cả Margo Roth Spiegelman cũng khó lòng đột nhập vào nổi.
tr: “Endişelenme. Sekizinci Bölüm çocuk oyuncağı. Jefferson Park’a geri dönüyoruz. Lacey’nin evine. Nerede oturduğunu biliyorsun, değil mi?” Biliyordum, gerçi Tanrı biliyor, Lacey Pemberton beni evinde ağırlamaya asla tenezzül etmezdi. Jefferson Park’m öteki tarafında oturuyordu, benden bir kilometre uzakta, bir kırtasiye dükkânının üstündeki güzel bir apartman dairesinde... ölü adamın oturduğuyla aynı bloktaydı aslında. O binaya daha önce de gitmiştim çünkü annemle babamın arkadaşı üçüncü katta oturuyordu. Daha dairelere ulaşamadan önce iki tane kilitli kapı vardı. Margo Roth Spiegelman’ın bile oraya giremeyeceğini tahmin ediyordum.
es: —No te preocupes. La octava parte es un juego de niños. Volvemos a Jefferson Park. A casa de Lacey. Sabes dónde vive, ¿verdad? Lo sabía, aunque Dios sabe que Lacey Pemberton nunca se rebajaría a invitarme a entrar. Vivía al otro lado de Jefferson Park, a un par de kilómetros de mi casa, en un bonito bloque de pisos, encima de una papelería, en la misma manzana en la que había vivido el tipo muerto, por cierto. Había estado en aquel edificio porque unos amigos de mis padres vivían en la tercera planta. Pero antes de llegar al bloque en sí había dos puertas cerradas con llave. Suponía que ni siquiera Margo Roth Spiegelman podría abrirse camino.
vi_translation: “Don't worry. Part Eight is just child's play. We return to the Jefferson Park area. Lacey's house. You know her house, right?” I knew, but only God knows why Lacey Pemberton never bothered to invite me over. Lacey's house is on the other side of Jefferson Park, a mile from my house, a cute apartment above a stationery store–the very apartment building where the man who died used to live. I've been inside because my parents' friends live on the third floor. Before you can enter the apartment building, you have to go through two locked doors. I secretly thought that even Margo Roth Spiegelman would have a hard time breaking in.
tr_translation: “Don't worry. The Eighth Chapter is a piece of cake. We're going back to Jefferson Park. To Lacey's house. You know where she lives, right?” I did know, though God knows, Lacey Pemberton would never deign to host me at her house. She lived on the other side of Jefferson Park, a kilometer away from me, in a nice apartment above a stationery store... actually on the same block where the dead man lived. I had been to that building before because a friend of my parents lived on the third floor. There were two locked doors before you could even reach the apartments. I guessed that even Margo Roth Spiegelman wouldn't be able to get in there.
es_translation: —Don't worry. The eighth part is child's play. We're going back to Jefferson Park. To Lacey's house. You know where she lives, right? I knew it, although God knows that Lacey Pemberton would never stoop to invite me in. She lived on the other side of Jefferson Park, a couple of kilometers from my house, in a nice apartment block, above a stationery store, on the same block where the dead guy had lived, by the way. I had been in that building because some friends of my parents lived on the third floor. But before reaching the block itself, there were two locked doors. I supposed that not even Margo Roth Spiegelman could make her way through.

en: “So has Lacey been naughty or nice?” I asked.
vi: “Thế là Lacey đã ngoan hay hư vậy?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Peki, Lacey yaramazlık mı yaptı yoksa uslu muydu?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Lacey ha sido mala o buena? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: "So, has Lacey been good or bad?" I asked.
tr_translation: “So, was Lacey naughty or well-behaved?” I asked.
es_translation: —Has Lacey been bad or good? —I asked her.

en: “Lacey has been distinctly naughty,” Margo answered. She was looking out the passenger window again, talking away from me, so I could barely hear her. “I mean, we have been friends since kindergarten.”
vi: “Lacey cực kì là hư,” Margo đáp. Cô ấy đang mải tìm xem có ô cửa sổ nào không, quay đi không nhìn tôi, nên tôi nghe câu được câu chăng. “Mà chúng tớ là cạ cứng với nhau từ hồi mẫu giáo đấy.”
tr: “Lacey fena halde yaramazlık yaptı,” diye cevapladı Margo. Yine pencereden dışarı bakıyordu, benden ters tarafa doğru konuşuyordu, bu yüzden onu zar zor duyabiliyordum. ‘Yani, anaokulundan beri arkadaşız.
es: —Lacey ha sido mala, sin la menor duda —me contestó Margo. Volvía a mirar por la ventana, sin dirigirse a mí, de modo que apenas la oía—. Bueno, hemos sido amigas desde la guardería.
vi_translation: "Lacey is extremely naughty," Margo replied. She was busy looking for any windows, turning away and not looking at me, so I only caught bits and pieces of what she said. "And we've been best friends since kindergarten."
tr_translation: “Lacey was really naughty,” answered Margo. She was looking out the window again, talking away from me, so I could barely hear her. “I mean, we've been friends since kindergarten.”
es_translation: —Lacey has been bad, without a doubt —Margo answered me. She was looking out the window again, not addressing me, so I could barely hear her—. Well, we've been friends since kindergarten.

en: “And she didn’t tell me about Jase. But not just that. When I look back on it, she’s just a terrible friend. I mean, for instance, do you think I’m fat?”
vi: “Thế mà nàng ấy chẳng nói gì về Jase cho tớ biết. Nhưng không chỉ có thế thôi đâu. Khi tổng kết lại, tớ thấy nàng ta là đồ bạn tồi. Chẳng hạn, cậu có cho là tớ béo không?”
tr: “Ve bana Jase’le ilgili hiçbir şey söylemedi. Ama sadece bu değil. Geri dönüp bakıyorum da tam anlamıyla berbat bir arkadaş. Yani, mesela, sence ben şişman mıyım?
es: —Y no me contó lo de Jase. Pero no es solo eso. Pensándolo bien, es una pésima amiga. Por ejemplo, ¿crees que estoy gorda?
vi_translation: “Yet she didn't say anything about Jase to me. But that's not all. In summary, I think she's a bad friend. For example, do you think I'm fat?”
tr_translation: “And he didn't tell me anything about Jase. But that's not all. Looking back, he's a downright terrible friend. I mean, for example, do you think I'm fat?”
es_translation: —And she didn't tell me about Jase. But that's not all. Come to think of it, she's a terrible friend. For example, do you think I'm fat?

en: “Jesus, no,” I said. “You’re—” And I stopped myself from saying not skinny, but that’s the whole point of you; the point of you is that you don’t look like a boy. “You should not lose any weight.”
vi: “Trời ơi, không hề,” tôi đáp. “Cậu...” Tôi ngăn mình thốt lên cậu không lẳng khẳng, nhưng đó là toàn bộ vấn đề về cậu; vấn đề ở cậu là trông cậu không giống một tên con trai. “Cậu đừng có mà giảm cân đấy nhé.”
tr: “Tanrım, hayır,” dedim. “Sen...” Sonra şunları söyleyecekken kendimi durdurdum: Cılız değilsin ama en önemli yönün de bu; en önemli yönün bir oğlan gibi görünmüyor olman. “Kilo vermemelisin.”
es: —Madre mía, no —le contesté—. No estás… —Y me detuve antes de decir «delgada, pero eso es lo mejor de ti. Lo mejor de ti es que no pareces un chico»—. No te sobra ni un kilo.
vi_translation: "Oh my God, not at all," I replied. "You..." I stopped myself from saying you are not scrawny, but that was the whole issue with you; the problem with you is that you don't look like a boy. "Don't you dare lose weight."
tr_translation: “My God, no,” I said. “You...” Then I stopped myself from saying: You’re not skinny, but that’s your most important feature; your most important feature is that you don’t look like a boy. “You shouldn’t lose weight.”
es_translation: —My dear, no —I replied to her—. You are not... —And I stopped before saying "thin, but that's the best thing about you. The best thing about you is that you don't look like a boy"—. You don't have an extra kilo.

en: She laughed, waved her hand at me, and said, “You just love my big ass.” I turned from the road for a second and glanced over, and I shouldn’t have, because she could read my face and my face said: Well, first off I wouldn’t say it’s big exactly and second off, it is kind of spectacular. But it was more than that. You can’t divorce Margo the person from Margo the body. You can’t see one without seeing the other. You looked at Margo’s eyes and you saw both their blueness and their Margo-ness. In the end, you could not say that Margo Roth Spiegelman was fat, or that she was skinny, any more than you can say that the Eiffel Tower is or is not lonely. Margo’s beauty was a kind of sealed vessel of perfection—uncracked and uncrackable.
vi: Margo bật cười, vẫy tay về phía tôi và nói. “Cậu chỉ khoái cái mông bự của tớ thôi chứ gì.” Tôi không nhìn đường mà ngoái lại một giây và liếc cô ấy. Thực ra tôi không nên làm vậy, vì Margo có thể đọc được nét mặt tôi, và cái mặt này đang nói: Ồ, một là tớ sẽ không nói chính xác rằng nó bự, mà hai là nó thực sự ngoạn mục. Nhưng mà còn hơn thế. Không thể chia tách con người Margo và thể xác Margo. Không thể chỉ nhìn cái này mà không nhìn cái kia. Khi nhìn vào mắt Margo, ở đó có màu xanh dương và cả màu Margo nữa. Rút cục, không thể nói rằng Margo Roth Spiegelman béo hay gầy, giống như không thể nói rằng Tháp Eiffel cô đơn hay không cô đơn. Vẻ đẹp của Margo là sự hoàn hảo nằm trong một dạng vỏ chứa kín–không chút rạn nứt và không thể rạn nứt được.
tr: Güldü, elini bana doğru salladı ve “Sen sadece koca kıçımı seviyorsun,” dedi. Bir saniyeliğine gözümü yoldan çekip ona baktım, yapmamalıydım çünkü ifademi okuyabiliyordu ve ifadem diyordu ki: Şey, birincisi ben tam olarak koca demezdim, İkincisi gerçekten dikkat çekici. Ama bundan daha fazlası vardı. İnsan olan Margo’yu vücut olan Margo’dan ayıramazsınız. Birini görmeden diğerini göremezsiniz. Margo’nun gözlerine bakarsınız ve hem maviliklerini hem de Margo’luklarını görürsünüz. Sonuç olarak Margo Roth Spiegelmanin şişman ya da cılız olduğunu söyleyemezdiniz, Eiffel Kulesi’nin yalnız olduğunu ya da olmadığını söyleyemeyeceğiniz gibi. Margo’nun güzelliği bir nevi kusursuzluğun mühürlendiği bir araç gibiydi... mührü kırılmamış ve kınlamaz.
es: Se rió, me hizo un gesto con la mano y me dijo: —Lo que pasa es que te encanta mi culo gordo. Desvié un segundo los ojos de la carretera, y no debería haberlo hecho, porque me vio la cara, y mi cara decía: «Bueno, en primer lugar, yo no diría que es gordo exactamente, y en segundo lugar, es espectacular». Pero era más que eso. No puedes separar a la Margo persona de la Margo cuerpo. No puedes ver lo uno sin lo otro. Mirabas a Margo a los ojos y veías tanto su color azul como su marguidad. Al final no sabías si Margo Roth Spiegelman estaba gorda o estaba delgada, como no sabes si la torre Eiffel se siente o no se siente sola. La belleza de Margo era una especie de recipiente de perfección cerrado, intacto e irrompible.
vi_translation: Margo burst out laughing, waved at me, and said. “You just like my big butt, don't you.” I didn't look at the road but turned back for a second and glanced at her. Actually, I shouldn't have done that, because Margo could read my expression, and this face was saying: Oh, first, I wouldn't exactly say it's big, and second, it is truly spectacular. But it's more than that. You can't separate Margo the person from Margo the body. You can't look at one without seeing the other. When looking into Margo's eyes, there is blue and also a color that is uniquely Margo. In the end, you can't say that Margo Roth Spiegelman is fat or thin, just like you can't say that the Eiffel Tower is lonely or not lonely. Margo's beauty is a perfection enclosed in a seamless shell–without a crack and uncrackable.
tr_translation: She laughed, waved her hand at me, and said, “You just love my big butt.” For a second, I took my eyes off the road and looked at her, I shouldn’t have because she could read my expression and my expression said: Well, first of all, I wouldn’t exactly say big, secondly, it’s really remarkable. But there was more to it than that. You can’t separate the human Margo from the body Margo. You can’t see one without seeing the other. You look into Margo’s eyes and see both their blueness and their Margo-ness. As a result, you couldn’t say Margo Roth Spiegelman was fat or skinny, just like you couldn’t say the Eiffel Tower was lonely or not. Margo’s beauty was like a kind of vehicle sealed with perfection... unbroken and unbreakable.
es_translation: He laughed, made a gesture with his hand, and said to me: —What happens is that you love my big butt. I took my eyes off the road for a second, and I shouldn't have done that, because she saw my face, and my face said: "Well, first of all, I wouldn't say she's exactly fat, and secondly, she's spectacular." But it was more than that. You can't separate the Margo person from the Margo body. You can't see one without the other. You looked into Margo's eyes and saw both their blue color and her Margoness. In the end, you didn't know if Margo Roth Spiegelman was fat or thin, just like you don't know if the Eiffel Tower feels lonely or not. Margo's beauty was a kind of closed, intact, and unbreakable vessel of perfection.

en: “But she would always make these little comments,” Margo continued. “‘I’d loan you these shorts but I don’t think they’d fit right on you.’ Or, ‘You’re so spunky. I love how you just make guys fall in love with your personality.’ Constantly undermining me. I don’t think she ever said anything that wasn’t an attempt at undermination.”
vi: “Thế mà cô nàng ấy lúc nào cũng lóe xóe những chuyện như vậy,” Margo nói tiếp. “‘Tớ sẽ cho bồ mượn quần nhưng chắc bồ chẳng mặc vừa đâu.’ Rồi là ‘Bồ mạnh mẽ quá ta. Tớ khoái cách bồ làm tụi con trai điêu đứng vì cá tính của bồ đấy.’ Lúc nào cũng nhạo tớ. Hình như cô nàng không bao giờ nói gì mà lại không cố ý chìm tớ xuống.
