In the end, I thought of calling Ben. He wasn't Radar, but he knew all his passwords. I called him. It went to voicemail after ringing several times. I called again. Voicemail. I called again. Voicemail. —It's clear that he's not answering —observed Margo. —Well, he'll answer —I said, dialing again. And after a couple more calls, he answered.

en: “You’d better be calling me to say that there are eleven naked honeybunnies in your house, and that they’re asking for the Special Feeling that only Big Daddy Ben can provide.”
vi: “Hẳn là ông gọi cho tôi để thông báo rằng có mười một em thỏ non ngon ngon đang thoát y trong nhà ông, và rằng các em ấy đang mong mỏi Xúc Cảm Đặc Biệt mà chỉ có Bố Già Ben mới đáp ứng được.
tr: “Evinde on bir çıplak tavşancık olduğunu ve yalnızca Babacık Ben’in sağlayabileceği Özel His’i istediklerini söylemek için arıyor olsan iyi olur.
es: —Más te vale haberme llamado para decirme que tienes a once pavas desnudas en tu casa pidiendo la sensibilidad especial que solo el gran papá Ben puede ofrecerles.
vi_translation: “Surely you called me to inform that there are eleven delicious young bunnies stripping in your house, and that they are longing for the Special Sensation that only Godfather Ben can provide.”
tr_translation: “You better be calling to say that you have eleven naked bunnies at home and that they only want the Special Feeling that only Daddy Ben can provide.”
es_translation: —You better have called me to tell me that you have eleven naked chicks at your house asking for the special sensitivity that only the great Papa Ben can offer them.

en: “I need you to use Radar’s login to the student directory and look up an address. Chuck Parson.”
vi: “Tôi cần ông dùng tài khoản của Radar đăng nhập vào danh bạ của trường và tra một địa chỉ. Chuck Parson.
tr: “Radar’m öğrenci sistemine giriş şifresini kullamp bir adrese bakman lazım. Chuck Parson.
es: —Necesito que entres en la página del instituto con la contraseña de Radar y me busques una dirección. Chuck Parson.
vi_translation: “I need you to use Radar's account to log into the school's directory and look up an address. Chuck Parson.”
tr_translation: "You need to use Radar's student system login password to check an address." Chuck Parson."
es_translation: —I need you to log into the institute's website with Radar's password and find me an address. Chuck Parson.

en: “No.”
vi: “Không.”
tr: “Hayır.
es: —No.
vi_translation: “No.”
tr_translation: “No.”
es_translation: —No.

en: “Please,” I said.
vi: “Đi mà,” tôi nói.
tr: “Lütfen,” dedim.
es: —Por favor —le dije.
vi_translation: "Go," I said.
tr_translation: “Please,” I said.
es_translation: —Please —I said to him.

en: “No.”
vi: “Không.”
tr: “Hayır.
es: —No.
vi_translation: “No.”
tr_translation: “No.”
es_translation: —No.

en: “You’ll be glad you did this, Ben. I promise.”
vi: “Ông sẽ mừng vì đã ra tay vụ này, Ben ạ. Tôi hứa đấy.”
tr: “Bunu yaptığına memnun olacaksın, Ben. Söz veriyorum.
es: —Te alegrarás de haberlo hecho, Ben. Te lo prometo.
vi_translation: “You will be glad you took action in this case, Ben. I promise.”
tr_translation: “You will be glad you did this, Ben. I promise.”
es_translation: —You will be glad you did it, Ben. I promise you.

en: “Yeah, yeah, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no—can’t help but help. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why do you want Chuck Parson’s address at four-twelve in the morning?”
vi: “Rồi rồi, làm xong rồi đó. Tôi đã làm trong khi nói không rồi đó–không thể làm gì ngoài giúp đỡ há. Bốn-hai-hai Amherst. Này, thế quái nào mà ông lại cần địa chỉ của Chuck Parson vào lúc bốn giờ mười hai phút sáng vậy?”
tr: “Evet evet, az önce yaptım. Hayır derken yapıyordum, yardım etmekten başka çarem yok. 422 Amherst. Hey, sabahın dört buçuğunda neden Chuck Parson’m adresini istiyorsun?
es: —Sí, sí. Ya está. Estaba entrando mientras te decía que no… No puedo evitar ayudarte. Amherst, 422. Oye, ¿para qué necesitas la dirección de Chuck Parson a las cuatro y doce de la mañana?
vi_translation: “Alright, alright, it's done. I did it while saying no–can't do anything but help, huh. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why the heck do you need the address of Chuck Parson at twelve minutes past four in the morning?
tr_translation: “Yes, yes, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no, I have no choice but to help. 422 Amherst. Hey, why are you asking for Chuck Parson’s address at four-thirty in the morning?”
es_translation: —Yes, yes. It's done. I was coming in while I was telling you no... I can't help but assist you. Amherst, 422. Hey, why do you need Chuck Parson's address at four twelve in the morning?

en: “Get some sleep, Benners.”
vi: “Ông ngủ đi cho lành.”
tr: “Biraz uyu, Benners.
es: —Vuelve a dormir, Benners.
vi_translation: “You should sleep for your own good.”
tr_translation: “Get some sleep, Benners.”
es_translation: —Go back to sleep, Benners.

en: “I’m going to assume this is a dream,” Ben answered, and hung up.
vi: “Tôi sẽ ngỡ rằng tất cả chỉ là một giấc mơ,” Ben đáp rồi tắt máy.
tr: “Bunun bir rüya olduğunu farz edeceğim,” diye cevapladı Ben ve telefonu kapattı.
es: —Mejor pienso que ha sido un sueño —me contestó Ben. Y colgó.
vi_translation: "I will think that it was all just a dream," Ben replied and then hung up.
tr_translation: “I will assume this is a dream,” answered Ben and hung up the phone.
es_translation: —I think it was just a dream —Ben replied to me. And hung up.

en: Amherst was only a couple blocks down. We parked on the street in front of 418 Amherst, got our supplies together, and jogged across Chuck’s lawn, the morning dew shaking off the grass and onto my calves.
vi: Amherst chỉ cách đó mấy dãy nhà. Chúng tôi đỗ xe trên phố, trước nhà số 418, nhặt nhạnh đồ nghề và băng qua bãi cỏ nhà Chuck, sương sớm rung rung rời nhành cỏ, bám lên bắp chân tôi.
tr: Amherst sadece birkaç blok ötedeydi. 418 numaranın önüne park ettik, malzemelerimizi toparladık ve Chuck’m evinin çimenliğim koşarak geçtik, çimlerdeki sabah çiyleri paçalarıma düşüyordu.
es: Amherst estaba a solo un par de manzanas. Aparcamos frente al 418, cogimos las herramientas y corrimos por el césped de Chuck. El rocío que cubría la hierba me mojaba las pantorrillas.
vi_translation: Amherst was just a few blocks away. We parked on the street, in front of house number 418, gathered our gear, and crossed Chuck's lawn, the early morning dew trembling off the blades of grass, clinging to my calves.
tr_translation: Amherst was just a few blocks away. We parked in front of number 418, gathered our supplies, and ran across the lawn of Chuck's house, the morning dew on the grass soaking my pants.
es_translation: Amherst was just a couple of blocks away. We parked in front of 418, grabbed the tools, and ran across Chuck's lawn. The dew covering the grass soaked my calves.

en: At his window, which was fortunately lower than that of Random Old Guy, I climbed in quietly and then pulled Margo up and in. Chuck Parson was asleep on his back. Margo walked over to him, tiptoeing, and I stood behind her, my heart pounding. He’d kill us both if he woke up. She pulled out the Veet, sprayed a dob of what looked like shaving cream onto her palm, and then softly and carefully spread it across Chuck’s right eyebrow. He didn’t so much as twitch.
vi: May phước là cửa sổ phòng Chuck thấp hơn cửa phòng ông bác Đi Nhầm vừa nãy. Tôi nhẹ nhàng trèo được vào trong và giúp Margo vào theo. Chuck Parson nằm ngửa, ngủ tít. Margo nhón chân đi về phía nó, tôi đứng sau cô ấy, tim nện thình thình. Chuck mà tỉnh dậy thì dám nó nghiền nát hai đứa bọn tôi lắm. Margo lấy thuốc Veet ra, phun một nhúm trông như kem cạo râu vào lòng bàn tay, rồi từ từ thận trọng bôi lên lông mày bên phải của Chuck. Nó chẳng hề cựa quậy động đậy chút nào.
tr: Rastgele Yaşlı Adam’ınkinden neyse ki daha alçak olan Chuck’m penceresinden sessizce içeri tırmandım ve Margo’yu önce yukan, sonra içeri çektim. Chuck Parson sırtüstü uyuyordu. Margo parmak uçlarında durarak ona yaklaştı ve ben de arkasında durdum, kalbim küt küt atıyordu. Eğer uyanırsa ikimizi de öldürürdü. Margo Veet’i çıkardı, avucunun içine tıraş kremi gibi görünen şeyden bir miktar sıktı, sonra usulca ve dikkatle Chuck’m sağ kaşına sürdü. Chuck kıpırdamadı bile.
es: Subí sin hacer ruido a su ventana, que por suerte era más baja que la del viejo con el que nos habíamos topado por casualidad, y tiré de Margo para que entrara. Chuck Parson estaba dormido boca arriba. Margo se acercó a él de puntillas, y yo me quedé detrás, con el corazón latiéndome a toda velocidad. Si se despertaba, nos mataría a los dos. Margo sacó el bote de Veet, presionó, se puso en la palma de la mano una bola que parecía crema de afeitar y muy suavemente y con cuidado la extendió por la ceja derecha de Chuck, que ni siquiera parpadeó. Luego Margo abrió la vaselina.
vi_translation: Fortunately, Chuck's window was lower than the window of Mr. Di Nham's room that we mistakenly entered earlier. I gently climbed inside and helped Margo follow. Chuck Parson was lying on his back, sound asleep. Margo tiptoed towards him, and I stood behind her, my heart pounding. If Chuck woke up, he could very well crush the two of us. Margo took out the Veet cream, sprayed a dollop that looked like shaving cream into her palm, and then carefully applied it to Chuck's right eyebrow. He didn't move a muscle.
tr_translation: I quietly climbed through Chuck's window, which was thankfully lower than that of the Random Old Man, and pulled Margo up first, then inside. Chuck Parson was sleeping on his back. Margo tiptoed towards him, and I stood behind her, my heart pounding. If he woke up, he would kill us both. Margo took out the Veet, squeezed some of the stuff that looked like shaving cream into her palm, and then gently and carefully applied it to Chuck's right eyebrow. Chuck didn't even move.
es_translation: I climbed silently to his window, which luckily was lower than that of the old man we had run into by chance, and pulled Margo in. Chuck Parson was sleeping on his back. Margo tiptoed towards him, and I stayed behind, my heart pounding. If he woke up, he would kill us both. Margo took out the Veet bottle, pressed it, put a ball that looked like shaving cream in her palm, and very gently and carefully spread it over Chuck's right eyebrow, who didn't even blink. Then Margo opened the Vaseline.

en: Then she opened the Vaseline—the lid made what seemed like a deafeningly loud clorp, but again Chuck showed no sign of waking. She scooped a huge gob of it into my hand, and then we headed off to opposite sides of the house. I went to the entryway first and slathered Vaseline on the front door’s doorknob, and then to the open door of a bedroom, where I Vaselined the inner knob and then quietly, with only the slightest creak, shut the door to the room.
vi: Rồi Margo mở hộp Vaseline–cái nắp bật ra một tiếng oách rõ to, nhưng Chuck vẫn không có vẻ gì là tỉnh cả. Margo vục một vốc tướng sang bàn tay tôi, và chúng tôi đi ngược chiều nhau trong nhà. Tôi đi từ cửa chính trước, trát Vaseline lên tay nắm cửa, rồi đến một cửa phòng ngủ để ngỏ. Tôi chà Vaseline lên tay nắm phía trong phòng, và khe khẽ, chỉ hơi tách một tiếng nhỏ, đóng cửa phòng lại.
tr: Sonra vazelini açtı... Kapak kulakları sağır edecek yükseklikte bir plop sesi çıkardı ama Chuck yine uyanma belirtisi göstermedi. Margo elime vazelini boca etti, sonra evin farkh taraflarına doğru gittik. Önce girişe gittim ve vazelini ön kapı koluna bolca sürdüm, sonra bir yatak odasının açık kapısına gittim ve iç taraftaki kolu vazelinleyip odanın kapısını sessizce, sadece belli belirsiz bir gıcırtıyla kapattım.
es: La tapa hizo un blop que pareció ensordecedor, pero Chuck tampoco dio indicios de despertarse. Me puso una bola enorme en la mano y fuimos cada uno hacia un lado de la casa. Yo me dirigí primero al recibidor y unté vaselina en el pomo de la puerta de la calle, y luego a la puerta abierta de un dormitorio, donde apliqué vaselina en el pomo interior y después, muy despacio, cerré la puerta, que apenas chirrió.
vi_translation: Then Margo opened the Vaseline jar—the lid popped off with a loud snap, but Chuck still didn't seem to wake up. Margo scooped a big handful into my hand, and we went in opposite directions in the house. I went from the front door, smearing Vaseline on the doorknob, then to a bedroom door that was ajar. I rubbed Vaseline on the inside doorknob, and gently, with just a slight click, closed the door.
tr_translation: Then she opened the petroleum jelly... The lid made a plop sound loud enough to deafen ears, but Chuck still showed no sign of waking up. Margo poured the petroleum jelly into my hand, then we went towards different parts of the house. First, I went to the entrance and generously applied the petroleum jelly to the front door handle, then I went to an open bedroom door and applied the jelly to the inside handle, closing the door quietly with only a faint creak.
es_translation: The lid made a pop that seemed deafening, but Chuck didn't show any signs of waking up either. She put a huge glob in my hand and we each went to one side of the house. I first went to the foyer and smeared Vaseline on the front door knob, then to the open door of a bedroom, where I applied Vaseline on the inner knob and then, very slowly, closed the door, which barely creaked.

en: Finally I returned to Chuck’s room—Margo was already there—and together we closed his door and then Vaselined the hell out of Chuck’s doorknob. We slathered every surface of his bedroom window with the rest of the Vaseline, hoping it would make it hard to open the window after we closed it shut on our way out.
vi: Cuối cùng tôi quay lại phòng Chuck–Margo đã ở đó– chúng tôi cùng đóng cửa phòng lại, quết vô khối Vaseline lên tay nắm cửa. Chúng tôi phết nốt chỗ Vaseline còn lại lên khắp khung cửa sổ buồng nó, hi vọng như vậy sẽ làm cửa khó mở hơn sau khi chúng tôi đóng cửa lại trên đường rút.
tr: Sonunda Chuck’m odasma geri döndümMargo çoktan gelmiştive birlikte Chuck’m kapısını kapatıp kapı koluna vazelin sürdük. Yatak odasındaki penceresinin her yerine kalan vazelinden bolca sürdük, dışarı çıkarken kapattıktan sonra pencerenin açılmasını zorlaştıracağım umuyorduk.
es: Por último volví a la habitación de Chuck —Margo ya estaba allí—, y juntos cerramos la puerta y untamos con vaselina el pomo. Embadurnamos toda la ventana de la habitación con el resto de la vaselina con la esperanza de que, después de salir y cerrarla, resultara difícil abrirla.
vi_translation: Finally, I returned to Chuck's room–Margo was already there–we closed the door together and smeared a large amount of Vaseline on the doorknob. We spread the remaining Vaseline all over the window frame of his room, hoping that it would make the window harder to open after we closed it on our way out.
tr_translation: Finally, I returned to Chuck's room. Margo had already arrived, and together we closed Chuck's door and smeared vaseline on the doorknob. We generously applied petroleum jelly all over the window in the bedroom, hoping that it would make it harder to open the window after closing it when going outside.
es_translation: Finally, I returned to Chuck's room —Margo was already there—, and together we closed the door and smeared the doorknob with Vaseline. We smeared the entire window of the room with the remaining Vaseline in the hope that, after closing it, it would be difficult to open.

en: Margo glanced at her watch and held up two fingers. We waited. And for those two minutes we just stared at each other, and I watched the blue in her eyes. It was nice—in the dark and the quiet, with no possibility of me saying anything to screw it up, and her eyes looking back, like there was something in me worth seeing.
vi: Margo liếc đồng hồ và giơ hai ngón tay lên. Chúng tôi đợi. Trong hai phút ấy hai đứa chỉ nhìn nhau, và tôi nhìn màu xanh trong mắt cô ấy. Thật tuyệt–trong bóng tối và không gian yên tĩnh, không có nguy cơ tôi sẽ vạ miệng nói lung tung làm hỏng khung cảnh, và đôi mắt cô ấy nhìn lại tôi, như thể có gì đó ở tôi đáng được nhìn vậy.
tr: Margo saatine bir göz attı ve iki parmağını yukarı kaldırdı. Bekledik. O iki dakika boyunca sadece birbirimize gözlerimizi dikip baktık ve ben onun gözlerindeki maviliği izledim. Çok hoştu... karanlık ve sessizlik, her şeyi mahvedecek bir şey söyleme ihtimalim olmadan. Ve onun gözleri de bana bakıyordu, sanki bende görmeye değer bir şey varmış gibi.
es: Margo echó un vistazo a su reloj y levantó dos dedos. Esperamos. Y durante dos minutos nos quedamos mirándonos. Yo observé el azul de sus ojos. Fue bonito. A oscuras y en silencio, sin la posibilidad de que yo dijera algo y metiera la pata, y ella me devolvía la mirada, como si hubiera algo en mí que merecía la pena ver.
vi_translation: Margo glanced at the clock and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just looked at each other, and I gazed into the blue of her eyes. It was wonderful—in the darkness and quiet space, there was no risk of me saying something foolish to ruin the moment, and her eyes looked back at me, as if there was something in me worth looking at.
tr_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just stared into each other's eyes, and I watched the blueness in her eyes. It was very nice... darkness and silence, without the possibility of me saying something that would ruin everything. And her eyes were looking at me too, as if there was something worth seeing in me.
es_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. And for two minutes we just stared at each other. I observed the blue of her eyes. It was beautiful. In the dark and in silence, without the possibility of me saying something and messing it up, and she returned my gaze, as if there was something in me worth seeing.

en: Margo nodded then, and I walked over to Chuck. I wrapped my hand in my T-shirt, as she’d told me to do, leaned forward, and—as softly as I could—pressed my finger against his forehead and then quickly wiped away the Veet. With it came every last hair that had been Chuck Parson’s right eyebrow. I was standing above Chuck with his right eyebrow on my T-shirt when his eyes shot open. Lightning fast, Margo grabbed his comforter and threw it over him, and when I looked up, the little ninja was already out the window. I followed as quickly as I could, as Chuck screamed, “MAMA! DAD! ROBBERY ROBBERY!”
vi: Rồi Margo gật đầu, và tôi lại gần Chuck. Tôi bọc bàn tay mình trong lần áo phông, Margo đã dặn thế từ trước, cúi xuống và–nhẹ nhàng hết mức có thể–miết ngón tay mình lên trán nó, nhanh gọn lau hết thuốc Veet đi. Song hành với tất tật lông từng là chân mày bên phải của Chuck. Tôi đang đứng trước mặt Chuck với hàng lông mày bên phải của nó trên áo phông tôi, thì bỗng dưng mắt nó mở trừng. Nhanh như chớp, Margo vớ lấy cái chăn và ném bừa lên Chuck, tôi ngước lên thì nàng ninja đã ở ngoài cửa sổ rồi. Tôi vội vàng ra theo, trong khi Chuck kêu la rầm trời, “MÁ ƠI! ỐI BA MÁ ƠI! TRỘM! TRỘM!”
tr: Margo o sırada başım salladı, ben de Chuck’a yaklaştım. Elimi tişörtüme sardım, Margo’nun bana söylediği gibi öne eğildim veyapabildiğim kadar usulcaparmağımı Chuck’m abıma bastırıp çabucak Veet’i çektim. Chuck Parson’m sağ kaşındaki bütün tüyleri tek tek onunla birlikte geldi. Chuck’ın gözleri açıldığında, tişörtümde sağ kaşıyla onun üstünde duruyordum. Margo yıldırım hızıyla yorganım akp Chuck’a fırlattı ve başımı kaldırıp baktığımda küçük ninja çoktan pencerenin dışına çıkmıştı. Chuck, “ANNE! BABA! HIRSIZ HIRSIZ!” diye çığlık atarken, yapabildiğim kadar hızlı bir şekilde onu takip ettim.
es: Margo asintió y me acerqué a Chuck. Me envolví la mano con la camiseta, como me había dicho, me incliné hacia delante y —lo más suavemente que pude— apoyé un dedo en la ceja derecha de Chuck Parson y retiré rápidamente la crema depilatoria, que arrastró consigo hasta el último pelo. Estaba todavía al lado de Chuck, con su ceja derecha en mi camiseta, cuando abrió los ojos. Margo cogió el edredón como una flecha, se lo tiró a la cara, y cuando levanté la mirada, la pequeña ninja ya había saltado por la ventana. La seguí lo más deprisa que pude mientras Chuck gritaba: ¡MAMÁ! ¡PAPÁ! ¡LADRONES! ¡LADRONES!
vi_translation: Then Margo nodded, and I approached Chuck. I wrapped my hand in the t-shirt, as Margo had instructed earlier, bent down and–as gently as possible–ran my finger over his forehead, quickly wiping off all the Veet cream. Along with every bit of hair that once was Chuck's right eyebrow. I was standing in front of Chuck with his right eyebrow on my t-shirt, when suddenly his eyes snapped open. In a flash, Margo grabbed the blanket and threw it over Chuck, and when I looked up, the ninja girl was already out the window. I hurriedly followed, while Chuck screamed at the top of his lungs, “MOM! OH MY GOD, MOM! THIEVES! THIEVES!”
tr_translation: Margo nodded at that moment, and I approached Chuck. I wrapped my hand in my t-shirt, leaned forward as Margo had told me, and as quietly as I could, pressed my finger against Chuck’s eyebrow and quickly pulled the Veet. All the hairs on Chuck Parson’s right eyebrow came off one by one with it. When Chuck’s eyes opened, I was standing over him with his right eyebrow on my t-shirt. Margo threw the blanket at Chuck with lightning speed, and when I looked up, the little ninja was already out the window. As Chuck screamed, “MOM! DAD! THIEF! THIEF!”, I followed him as fast as I could.
es_translation: Margo nodded and I approached Chuck. I wrapped my hand with the t-shirt, as she had told me, leaned forward and —as gently as I could— placed a finger on Chuck Parson's right eyebrow and quickly removed the depilatory cream, which took with it every last hair. I was still next to Chuck, with his right eyebrow on my t-shirt, when he opened his eyes. Margo grabbed the duvet like an arrow, threw it in his face, and when I looked up, the little ninja had already jumped out the window. I followed her as quickly as I could while Chuck screamed: MOM! DAD! THIEVES! THIEVES!

en: I wanted to say, The only thing we stole was your eyebrow, but I kept mum as I swung myself feetfirst out the window. I damn near landed on Margo, who was spray-painting an M onto the vinyl siding of Chuck’s house, and then we both grabbed our shoes and hauled ass to the minivan. When I looked back at the house, lights were on but no one was outside yet, a testament to the brilliant simplicity of the well-Vaselined doorknob. By the time Mr. (or possibly Mrs., I couldn’t really see) Parson pulled open the living room curtains and looked outside, we were driving in reverse back toward Princeton Street and the interstate.
vi: Tôi rất muốn nói rằng, Tụi này chỉ lấy hàng lông mày của bồ thôi mà, nhưng đành mím chi trong khi đu người qua cửa sổ. Tôi xém rơi trúng Margo trong khi cô ấy phun một chữ M lên lớp tường nhựa bao ngoài nhà Chuck, rồi hai đứa xách giày chạy tóe khói ra xe. Tôi quay lại nhìn ngôi nhà, đèn đóm đã bật sáng nhưng chưa có ai ra khỏi nhà, minh chứng hùng hồn cho hiệu quả bá cháy của những tay nắm cửa được xử lí kĩ lưỡng bằng Vaseline. Đến khi chú (hoặc cũng có thể là cô, tôi nhìn không rõ lắm) Parson kéo được rèm phòng khách lên và nhìn ra ngoài, chúng tôi đã ung dung lái xe ngược lại Phố Princeton, vào cao tốc liên bang.
tr: Çaldığımız tek şey kaşındı, demek istedim ama ayaklarım önde, kendimi pencereden dışarı sallandırırken ağzımı bile açmadım. Chuck’m evinin cephesine sprey boyayla M yazan Margo’nun tam yanma indim, sonra ikimiz de ayakkabılarımızı kaptığımız gibi oradan toz olup arabaya gittik. Dönüp eve baktığımda ışıklar açıktı ama henüz kimse dışarı çıkmamıştı, iyi vazelinlenmiş kapı kolunun zekâ dolu basitliğinin bir kanıtı. Bay (ya da belki bayan, tam olarak görememiştim) Parson oturma odasının perdelerini açıp dışarı bakıncaya kadar, biz arabayı geri geri sürerek Princeton Caddesi’ne ve eyaletler arası yola geri dönüyorduk.
es: Quise decirle: «Lo único que te hemos robado es la ceja», pero cerré el pico y salté por la ventana. Casi aterricé encima de Margo, que estaba pintando una M en el revestimiento de plástico de la casa de Chuck. Luego cogimos los zapatos y volvimos al coche cagando leches. Me giré a mirar la casa y vi que las luces estaban encendidas, pero todavía no había salido nadie, lo que demostraba con brillante simplicidad lo bien que había untado el pomo con vaselina. Cuando el señor Parson (o quizá la señora, la verdad es que no lo vi) corrió las cortinas del comedor y echó un vistazo, nos alejábamos ya marcha atrás hacia la calle Princeton y la autopista.
vi_translation: I really wanted to say, "We only took your eyebrow stuff," but I had to keep my mouth shut while swinging out the window. I almost fell on Margo while she was spraying an "M" on the plastic siding of Chuck's house, then we both grabbed our shoes and sprinted to the car. I turned back to look at the house; the lights were on but no one had come out yet, a testament to the effectiveness of the doorknobs meticulously treated with Vaseline. By the time Mr. (or maybe Mrs., I couldn't see clearly) Parson managed to pull up the living room curtains and look outside, we were already leisurely driving back to Princeton Street, onto the interstate highway.
tr_translation: The only thing we stole was itchy, I wanted to say, but with my feet first, while I was dangling myself out of the window, I didn't even open my mouth. I landed right next to Margo, who had spray-painted an M on the facade of Chuck's house, then we both grabbed our shoes and bolted to the car. When I turned back to look at the house, the lights were on but no one had come out yet, a testament to the clever simplicity of the well-vaselined doorknob. By the time Mr. (or maybe Mrs., I hadn't seen clearly) Parson opened the living room curtains and looked out, we were already backing the car onto Princeton Avenue and heading back to the interstate.
es_translation: I wanted to say: "The only thing we've stolen from you is your eyebrow," but I shut my mouth and jumped out the window. I almost landed on top of Margo, who was painting an M on the plastic siding of Chuck's house. Then we grabbed the shoes and hurried back to the car. I turned to look at the house and saw that the lights were on, but no one had come out yet, which brilliantly demonstrated how well I had greased the doorknob with Vaseline. When Mr. Parson (or maybe Mrs. Parson, to be honest I didn't see) drew the dining room curtains and took a look, we were already backing away towards Princeton Street and the highway.

en: “Yes!” I shouted. “God, that was brilliant.”
vi: “Được!” tôi hét lên. “Trời ơi, đúng là bá cháy con bọ chét!”
tr: “Evet!” diye bağırdım. “Tanrım, bu harikaydı.
es: —¡Sí! —grité—. Joder, ha sido genial.
vi_translation: "Alright!" I shouted. "Oh my god, that's absolutely amazing!"
tr_translation: “Yes!” I shouted. “My God, that was amazing.”
es_translation: —Yes! —I shouted—. Damn, it was awesome.

en: “Did you see it? His face without the eyebrow? He looks permanently doubtful, you know? Like, ‘oh, really? You’re saying I only have one eyebrow? Likely story.’ And I love making that asshole choose: better to shave off Lefty, or paint on Righty? Oh, I just love it. And how he yelled for his mama, that sniveling little shit.”
vi: “Cậu có thấy không? Mặt Chuck thiếu một bên lông mày ấy. Bản mặt nó mang một vẻ ngờ vực vĩnh cửu, kiểu như ‘ồ, thật sao? Chúng mày bảo tao chỉ có một chân mày thôi à? Bá láp bá xàm.’ Tớ khoái bắt thằng cùi bắp ấy phải lựa chọn: cạo nốt cánh tả hay tô vẽ cánh hữu? Ôi, vui thật! Nó còn ngoạc mồm gọi mẹ nữa chứ, đúng là đồ mít ướt nhão nhoét.”
tr: “Gördün mü? Kaşsız yüzünü yani. Sürekli olarak kararsız bir şekilde bakıyor olacak. ‘Ah, gerçekten mi? Sadece bir kaşım oldu ğunu mu söylüyorsun? Haklı olabilirsin,’ gibi. Ve o göt suratlıya seçim yaptırma fikri harika: Solu da mı tıraş etmesi daha iyi olur, yoksa sağı boyaması mı? Ah gerçekten harika. Nasıl da annesini çağırdı küçük pislik.
es: —¿Lo has visto? ¿Le has visto la cara sin ceja? Se le ha puesto cara de interrogante. En plan: «¿En serio? ¿Estás diciéndome que solo tengo una ceja? Gilipolleces». Y me ha encantado tener que decidirme entre depilarle la ceja izquierda o la derecha. Sí, me ha encantado. Y cómo gritaba llamando a su mamá, el llorica de mierda.
vi_translation: "Did you see that? Chuck's missing one of his eyebrows. His face always has this perpetual look of skepticism, like 'oh, really? You guys are telling me I only have one eyebrow? What a load of nonsense.' I love making that loser choose: shave off the left one or draw in the right one? Oh, it's so much fun! He even yelled for his mom, such a crybaby."
tr_translation: "Did you see?" "I mean, his eyebrowless face." "He will constantly be looking indecisively." "Oh, really? I only had one eyebrow." Are you saying that? You might be right,’ something like that. And the idea of making that jerk choose is great: Should he shave the left side too, or paint the right side? Oh, really great. How he called for his mom, the little brat.”
es_translation: —Have you seen him? Have you seen his face without an eyebrow? He looks like a question mark. Like: "Seriously? Are you telling me I only have one eyebrow? Nonsense." And I loved having to decide whether to pluck his left eyebrow or his right one. Yes, I loved it. And how he screamed calling for his mom, the little crybaby.

en: “Wait, why do you hate him?”
vi: “Này, sao cậu lại ghét nó chứ?”
tr: “Bir saniye, sen neden ondan nefret ediyorsun?
es: —Espera, ¿tú por qué lo odias?
vi_translation: “Hey, why do you hate it?”
tr_translation: “One second, why do you hate him?”
es_translation: —Wait, why do you hate him?

en: “I didn’t say I hated him. I said he was a sniveling little shit.”
vi: “Tớ có bảo tớ ghét nó đâu. Tớ chỉ nói nó là đồ mít ướt nhão nhoét thôi mà.”
tr: “Ondan nefret ettiğimi söylemedim. Küçük bir pislik olduğunu söyledim.
es: —No he dicho que lo odie. He dicho que es un llorica de mierda.
vi_translation: "I never said I hated him." "I just said he's a crybaby."
tr_translation: “I didn't say that I hated him. I said he was a little jerk.”
es_translation: —I didn't say I hate him. I said he's a pathetic crybaby.

en: “But you were always kind of friends with him,” I said, or at least I thought she had been.
vi: “Nhưng hình như cậu luôn bạn bè với nó cơ mà,” tôi nói, ít nhất tôi nghĩ cô ấy cũng từng bạn bè với Chuck.
tr: “Ama onunla her zaman bir bakıma arkadaştınız,” dedim, ya da en azından ben öyle olduğunu düşünmüştüm.
es: —Pero siempre has sido su amiga —le dije. O al menos yo pensaba que era su amiga.
vi_translation: “But it seems like you were always friends with him,” I said, at least I thought she used to be friends with Chuck.
tr_translation: "But you were always kind of friends with him," I said, or at least that's what I thought.
es_translation: —But you have always been her friend —I told her. Or at least I thought I was her friend.

en: “Yeah, well, I was always kind of friends with a lot of people,” she said. Margo leaned across the minivan and put her head on my bony shoulder, her hair falling against my neck. “I’m tired,” she said.
vi: “Ờ, lúc nào tớ chả bạn bè với khối người,” Margo đáp. Cô ấy nghiêng người ngả đầu lên bờ vai xương xẩu của tôi, sóng tóc buông xuống chạm vào cổ tôi. “Mệt quá,” Margo nói.
tr: “Evet, şey, ben her zaman birçok insanla bir bakıma arkadaştım,” dedi. Eğildi ve başım sıska omzuma koydu, saçları boynuma dökülüyordu. “Yorgunum,” dedi.
es: —Sí, bueno, era amiga de mucha gente —me contestó. Margo se estiró en el coche, apoyó la cabeza en mi hombro huesudo y su pelo me resbaló por el cuello. —Estoy cansada —añadió.
vi_translation: “Oh, I'm always friends with a lot of people,” Margo replied. She leaned over and rested her head on my bony shoulder, her flowing hair brushing against my neck. “So tired,” Margo said.
tr_translation: “Well, um, I was always kind of friends with a lot of people,” he said. He leaned in and put his head on my skinny shoulder, his hair falling onto my neck. “I’m tired,” he said.
es_translation: —Yes, well, she was friends with a lot of people —he replied to me. Margo stretched out in the car, rested her head on my bony shoulder, and her hair slipped down my neck. —I am tired —she added.

en: “Caffeine,” I said. She reached into the back and grabbed us each a Mountain Dew, and I drank it in two long chugs.
vi: “Ca-phê-in,” tôi nói. Cô ấy nhoài ra sau, lấy cho mỗi đứa một chai Mountain Dew, tôi uống hết sau hai ngụm dài.
tr: “Kafein,” dedim. Arkaya uzandı ve ikimiz için birer Mountain Dew aldı, iki büyük yudumda içtim.
es: —Cafeína —le dije yo. Alargó la mano hasta la parte de atrás y cogió dos latas de Mountain Dew. Me bebí la mía en dos largos tragos.
vi_translation: “Caffeine,” I said. She leaned back, grabbed a Mountain Dew for each of us, and I finished mine in two long gulps.
tr_translation: “Caffeine,” I said. He reached back and grabbed a Mountain Dew for each of us, I drank mine in two big gulps.
es_translation: —Caffeine —I told him. He reached back and grabbed two cans of Mountain Dew. I drank mine in two long gulps.

en: “So we’re going to SeaWorld,” she told me. “Part Eleven.”
vi: “Bây giờ đi đến thế giới đại dương SeaWorld thôi,” Margo bảo tôi. “Phần Mười Một.”
tr: “Şimdi SeaWorld’e gidiyoruz,” dedi. “On Birinci Bölüm.
es: —Bueno, vamos al SeaWorld —me dijo—. Onceava parte.
vi_translation: "Now let's go to the SeaWorld ocean world," Margo told me. "Part Eleven."
tr_translation: “Now we are going to SeaWorld,” he said. “Chapter Eleven.”
es_translation: —Well, let's go to SeaWorld —he told me—. Eleventh part.

en: “What, are we going to Free Willy or something?”
vi: “Sao cơ, chúng ta có đi Giải Cứu Willy hay đại loại thế không đấy?”
tr: “Ne, Willy’yi özgür falan mı bırakacağız?
es: —¿Cómo? ¿Vamos a liberar a Willy o algo así?
vi_translation: "What, are we going to Rescue Willy or something like that?"
tr_translation: “So, are we going to set Willy free or something?”
es_translation: —How? Are we going to free Willy or something like that?

en: “No,” she said. “We’re just going to go to SeaWorld, that’s all. It’s the only theme park I haven’t broken into yet.”
vi: “Không,” cô ấy đáp. “Chúng ta sẽ chỉ đến SeaWorld, vậy thôi. Đó là công viên duy nhất tớ chưa từng đột nhập vào.”
tr: “Hayır,” dedi. “Sadece SeaWorld’e gideceğiz, hepsi bu. Orası şimdiye kadar izinsiz girmediğim tek eğlence parkı.
es: —No —me contestó—. Simplemente vamos al SeaWorld, eso es todo. Es el único parque temático que todavía no he allanado.
vi_translation: “No,” she replied. “We will only go to SeaWorld, that's it. That's the only park I haven't snuck into yet.”
tr_translation: “No,” he said. “We’re just going to SeaWorld, that’s all. That’s the only amusement park I haven’t snuck into yet.”
es_translation: —No —he replied to me—. We're simply going to SeaWorld, that's all. It's the only theme park I haven't broken into yet.

en: “We can’t break into SeaWorld,” I said, and then I pulled over into an empty furniture store parking lot and turned off the car.
vi: “Tụi mình không thể đột nhập SeaWorld được,” tôi nói, tấp xe vào bãi đỗ của một cửa hàng bán đồ nội thất và tắt máy.
tr: “SeaWorld’e izinsiz giremeyiz,” dedim ve mobilya mağazasının boş park yerine çekip arabayı durdurdum.
es: —No podemos allanar el SeaWorld —le dije. Me metí en el aparcamiento vacío de una tienda de muebles y apagué el coche.
vi_translation: "We can't break into SeaWorld," I said, pulling the car into the parking lot of a furniture store and turning off the engine.
tr_translation: "We can't enter SeaWorld without permission," I said and pulled into the empty parking lot of the furniture store, stopping the car.
es_translation: —We can't raid SeaWorld —I told him. I pulled into the empty parking lot of a furniture store and turned off the car.

en: “We’re in a bit of a time crunch,” she told me, and then reached over to start the car again.
vi: “Không còn nhiều thời gian nữa đâu,” Margo nói và vươn tay để bật lại động cơ.
tr: “Zaman açısından biraz sıkıntılıyız,” dedi bana, sonra arabayı çalıştırmak için uzandı.
es: —Ha llegado la hora de la verdad —me dijo inclinándose para volver a encender el coche.
vi_translation: "There isn't much time left," Margo said and reached out to restart the engine.
tr_translation: "We are a bit pressed for time," he said to me, then reached out to start the car.
es_translation: —The moment of truth has arrived —he told me, leaning over to restart the car.

en: I pushed her hand away. “We can’t break into SeaWorld,” I repeated.
vi: Tôi đẩy tay cô ấy ra, nhắc lại. “Tụi mình không thể đột nhập SeaWorld được.”
tr: Elini bir kenara ittim. “SeaWorld’e izinsiz giremeyiz,” diye tekrarladım.
es: Le aparté las manos. —No podemos allanar el SeaWorld —repetí.
vi_translation: I pushed her hand away, repeating. "We can't break into SeaWorld."
tr_translation: I pushed his hand aside. “We can't enter SeaWorld without permission,” I repeated.
es_translation: I pushed his hands away. —We cannot raid SeaWorld —I repeated.

en: “There you go with the breaking again.” Margo paused and opened another Mountain Dew. Light reflected off the can onto her face, and for a second I could see her smiling at the thing she was about to say. “We’re not going to break anything. Don’t think of it as breaking in to SeaWorld. Think of it as visiting SeaWorld in the middle of the night for free.”
vi: “Cậu lại lảm nhảm về đột nhập rồi,” Margo dừng lại và mở thêm một chai Mountain Dew. Ánh sáng phản chiếu qua chai, trùm lên mặt cô ấy, và trong một giây, tôi thấy Margo mỉm cười trước điều cô ấy sắp nói. “Tụi mình sẽ không đột nhập chỗ nào hết. Đừng nghĩ rằng như vậy là đột nhập vào SeaWorld. Hãy nghĩ rằng tụi mình đến SeaWorld chơi lúc nửa đêm và được miễn phí đi.”
tr: “Al işte, yine haneye tecavüz meselesi.” Margo bir ara verip başka bir Mountain Dew açtı. Işık kutudan yüzüne yansıdı ve bir saniyeliğine, söylemek üzere olduğu şeye gülümsediğini görebildim. “Tecavüz filan yok. Bunu SeaWorld’e izinsiz girmek olarak düşünme. Geceyansı SeaWorld’ü bedavaya gezmek olarak düşün.
es: —Ya estamos otra vez con el allanamiento. Se calló un momento y abrió otra lata de Mountain Dew. La lata proyectó la luz sobre su cara y por un segundo la vi sonriendo por lo que estaba a punto de decir. —No vamos a allanar nada. No lo consideres un allanamiento. Considéralo una visita gratis al SeaWorld en plena noche.
vi_translation: “You're rambling about breaking in again,” Margo paused and opened another bottle of Mountain Dew. The light reflected through the bottle, casting over her face, and for a second, I saw Margo smile at what she was about to say. “We are not breaking in anywhere. Don't think of it as breaking into SeaWorld. Think of it as going to SeaWorld at midnight and getting in for free.”
tr_translation: “Well, here we go again with the breaking and entering issue.” Margo paused and opened another Mountain Dew. The light reflected off the can onto her face, and for a second, I could see that she was smiling about what she was about to say. “There’s no breaking and entering. Don’t think of it as sneaking into SeaWorld. Think of it as getting a free tour of SeaWorld at midnight.”
es_translation: —Here we go again with the raid. He fell silent for a moment and opened another can of Mountain Dew. The can cast light on his face and for a second I saw him smiling at what he was about to say. —We are not going to break in. Don't consider it a break-in. Consider it a free visit to SeaWorld in the middle of the night.

en: “Well, first off, we will get caught,” I said. I hadn’t started the minivan and was laying out the reasons I wouldn’t start it and wondering if she could see me in the dark.
vi: “Được rồi, trước hết, bọn mình sẽ bị bắt,” tôi nói. Tôi không khởi động động cơ và bắt đầu giải thích với Margo tại sao tôi chưa làm việc đó, tự hỏi không biết cô ấy có nhìn thấy tôi trong bóng tối này không.
tr: “Peki, öncelikle, yakalanacağız,” dedim. Arabayı çalıştırmamıştım, çalıştırmamamın nedenlerini sıralıyordum ve beni görüp göremediğini merak ediyordum.
es: —Mira, para empezar, nos pillarán —le dije. No había encendido el coche. Estaba haciendo recuento de las razones por las que no iba a ponerlo en marcha y preguntándome si Margo me veía en la oscuridad.
vi_translation: “Alright, first of all, we are going to get caught,” I said. I didn't start the engine and began explaining to Margo why I hadn't done it yet, wondering if she could see me in this darkness.
tr_translation: “Well, first of all, we are going to get caught,” I said. I hadn't started the car, I was listing the reasons why I hadn't started it, and I was wondering if he could see me or not.
es_translation: —Look, to begin with, they will catch us —I told him. I had not started the car. I was counting the reasons why I was not going to start it and wondering if Margo could see me in the dark.

en: “Of course we’ll get caught. So what?”
vi: “Tất nhiên chúng ta sẽ bị bắt. Vậy thì sao?”
tr: “Tabii ki yakalanacağız. Ne olmuş?
es: —Pues claro que nos pillarán. ¿Y qué?
vi_translation: “Of course we will be caught. So what?”
tr_translation: “Of course, we will be caught. So what?”
es_translation: —Of course they'll catch us. So what?

en: “It’s illegal.”
vi: “Như vậy là phạm pháp.
tr: “Bu yasadışı.
es: —Es ilegal.
vi_translation: “That is illegal.”
tr_translation: “This is illegal.”
es_translation: —It's illegal.

en: “Q, in the scheme of things, what kind of trouble can Sea-World get you into? I mean, Jesus, after everything I’ve done for you tonight, you can’t do one thing for me? You can’t just shut up and calm down and stop being so goddamned terrified of every little adventure?” And then under her breath she said, “I mean, God. Grow some nuts.”
vi: “Q này, theo nhìn nhận của cậu, SeaWorld có thể đẩy cậu vào rắc rối gì nào? Tớ muốn nói, Chúa ơi, sau tất cả những gì tớ đã làm cho cậu đêm nay, cậu không thể làm một việc vì tớ được sao? Cậu không thể yên lặng bình tĩnh và thôi tá hỏa vì mỗi cuộc phiêu lưu bé như con kiến thế này ư?” Và rồi qua hơi thở, Margo nói, “Ý tớ là, trời ạ, cậu hãy nuôi chút điên rồ đi.”
tr: “Q, SeaVVorld seni ne tür bir belaya bulaştırabilir? Yani, Tanrım, bu gece senin için yaptığım bunca şeyden sonra, benim için tek bir şey yapamıyor musun? Çeneni kapatıp sakinleşsen ve her lanet olası küçük macerada dehşete düşmesen olmaz mı?” Sonra alçak sesle, “Yani, Tanrım. Biraz cesur ol,” dedi.
es: —Q, ¿qué problema puede causarte SeaWorld en términos comparativos? Quiero decir que, joder, después de todo lo que he hecho por ti esta noche, ¿no puedes hacer una sola cosa por mí? ¿No puedes callarte, calmarte y dejar de acojonarte tanto por cada aventurilla? —Y en voz baja añadió—: Joder, échale un par de huevos.
vi_translation: “Q, in your opinion, what kind of trouble could SeaWorld get you into?” I mean, God, after everything I've done for you tonight, can't you do one thing for me? Can't you stay calm and stop freaking out over every tiny adventure like this?” And then under her breath, Margo said, “I mean, come on, live a little.”
tr_translation: “Q, what kind of trouble can SeaVVorld get you into? I mean, God, after all the things I've done for you tonight, can't you do just one thing for me? Can't you just shut up, calm down, and not freak out at every damn little adventure?” Then in a low voice, “I mean, God. Be a little brave,” he said.
es_translation: —Q, what problem can SeaWorld cause you in comparative terms? I mean, damn, after everything I've done for you tonight, can't you do just one thing for me? Can't you shut up, calm down, and stop freaking out so much over every little adventure? —And in a low voice he added—: Damn, grow a pair.

en: And now I was mad. I ducked underneath my shoulder belt so I could lean across the console toward her. “After everything YOU did for ME?” I almost shouted. She wanted confident? I was getting confident. “Did you call MY friend’s father who was screwing MY boyfriend so no one would know that I was calling? Did you chauffeur MY ass all around the world not because you are oh-so-important to me but because I needed a ride and you were close by? Is that the kind of shit you’ve done for me tonight?”
vi: Giờ thì tôi cáu điên lên thật. Tôi chui đầu qua đai an toàn đeo chéo vai để có thể nghiêng người qua bộ phận điều khiển mà nhìn cô ấy. “Sau tất cả những gì CẬU đã làm cho TỚ sao?” tôi gần như gào lên. Cô ấy muốn tự tin ư? Tôi đang tự tin lên đây. “Cậu có gọi điện cho bố của bạn TỚ, đứa bạn đang quặp lấy bạn trai CỦA TỚ để không ai phát hiện ra là tớ đã gọi điện không? Cậu có lái xe chở cái bàn tọa CỦA TỚ đi loạn lên khắp nơi, không phải vì cậu ôi-quá-quan-trọng với tớ, mà vì tớ cần đi nhờ và cậu ở ngay cạnh không? Đó có phải là những thứ thổ tả cậu đã làm cho tớ trong đêm nay không?”
tr: İşte bunun üstüne kızdım. Konsolun öbür tarafına, Margo’ya doğru eğilebileyim diye başımı emniyet kemerinin altından geçirdim. “SENİN, BENİM için yaptığın bunca şeyden sonra öyle mi?’ dedim neredeyse bağırarak. Kendine güven mi istiyordu? İşte kendime güveniyordum. “Kimse benim aradığımı anlamasın diye, BENİM sevgilimi beceren BENİM arkadaşımın babasım sen mi aradın? ‘Ah benim için çok değerli’ olduğun için değil de, arabaya ihtiyacım vardı ve sen de yakındaydın diye dünyanın çevresinde BENİM kıçıma şoförlüğü sen mi yaptın? Bu gece benim için yediğin haltlar bu tür şeyler mi?
es: Entonces me volví loco. Pasé por debajo del cinturón de seguridad para poder acercarme a ella. —¿Después de todo lo que has hecho por mí? —casi grité. ¿No quería que confiara en mí mismo? Pues ahí lo tenía—. ¿Llamaste tú al padre de mi amiga, que estaba follándose a mi novio, para que nadie se enterara de que quién llamaba era yo? ¿Me has hecho de chófer no porque seas importante para mí, sino porque necesitaba un coche y te tenía a mano? ¿Es esa la mierda que has hecho por mí esta noche?
vi_translation: Now I'm really pissed off. I slipped my head through the cross-shoulder seatbelt so I could lean over the controls and look at her. “After everything YOU'VE done for ME?” I almost screamed. She wants confidence? I'm getting confident here. “Did you call my friend's dad, the friend who's clinging to MY boyfriend, so no one would find out that I made the call? Did you drive MY butt all over the place, not because you're oh-so-important to me, but because I needed a ride and you were right there? Is that the crap you did for me tonight?”
tr_translation: So I got angry because of this. I ducked my head under the seatbelt so I could lean towards the other side of the console, towards Margo. “After all the things YOU did for ME, is that so?” I said, almost shouting. Did she want confidence? Well, I was confident. “So that no one would understand what I was looking for, did YOU call MY friend’s father who was screwing MY girlfriend? Did YOU drive ME around the world not because I was ‘so precious’ to you, but because I needed a car and you were nearby? Are these the kinds of things you did for me tonight?’
es_translation: Then I went crazy. I went under the seatbelt so I could get closer to her. —After everything you've done for me? —I almost shouted. Didn't you want me to trust myself? Well, there you had it—. Did you call my friend's father, who was screwing my boyfriend, so no one would find out that it was me who called? Have you acted as my chauffeur not because you're important to me, but because I needed a car and you were available? Is that the crap you've done for me tonight?

en: She wouldn’t look at me. She just stared straight ahead at the vinyl siding of the furniture store. “You think I needed you? You don’t think I could have given Myrna Mountweazel a Benadryl so she’d sleep through my stealing the safe from under my parents’ bed? Or snuck into your bedroom while you were sleeping and taken your car key? I didn’t need you, you idiot. I picked you. And then you picked me back.” Now she looked at me. “And that’s like a promise. At least for tonight. In sickness and in health. In good times and in bad. For richer, for poorer. Till dawn do us part.”
vi: Margo không nhìn tôi. Cô ấy chỉ nhìn thẳng trước mặt, về phía lớp cửa bao bằng nhựa của cửa hàng nội thất. “Cậu tưởng tớ cần cậu sao? Cậu không nghĩ rằng tớ có thể cho Myrna Mountweazel một liều Benadryl để nó ngủ chết giấc trong khi tớ khua cái két dưới gầm giường bố mẹ đi sao? Hoặc mò vào phòng cậu trong khi cậu đang ngủ và nẫng chìa khóa xe cậu đi ư? Tớ không cần cậu, ngốc ạ. Tớ đã chọn cậu. Rồi chính cậu đã chọn lại tớ.” Giờ Margo nhìn tôi. “Và điều đó như một lời hứa. Ít nhất cho đêm nay. Khi ốm đau cũng như khi khỏe mạnh. Lúc thuận lợi cũng như lúc khó khăn. Khi giàu hơn cũng như khi nghèo đi. Cho đến khi nào bình minh chia lìa chúng ta.”
tr: Bana bakmıyordu. Sadece gözünü ileriye dikmiş, mobilya mağazasının cephesine bakıyordu. “Sana ihtiyacım olduğunu mu sanıyorsun? Ben annemle babamın yatağının altından kasayı ça larken Myrna Mountweazel’a uyusun diye Benadryl verebileceğimi düşünmüyor musun? Ya da sen uyurken odana gizlice girip arabanın anahtarını alabileceğimi? Sana ihtiyacım olmadı, seni aptal. Seni seçtim. Sonra sen de beni seçtin.” O anda bana baktı. “Ve bu bir tür söz gibi bir şey. En azından bu geceliğine. Hastalıkta ve sağlıkta. İyi günde, kötü günde. Zenginlikte ve yoksullukta. Şafak bizi ayırana kadar.
es: No me miraba. Miraba al frente, hacia el revestimiento de plástico de la tienda de muebles. —¿Crees que te necesitaba? ¿No crees que podría haber dado a Myrna Mountweazel un sedante para que se durmiera y robar la caja de debajo de la cama de mis padres? ¿O colarme en tu habitación mientras dormías y cogerte las llaves del coche? No te necesitaba, idiota. Te he elegido. Y luego tú me has elegido a mí. —Me miró—. Y esto es como una promesa. Al menos por esta noche. En la salud y en la enfermedad. En lo bueno y en lo malo. En la riqueza y en la pobreza. Hasta que el amanecer nos separe.
vi_translation: Margo did not look at me. She just stared straight ahead, towards the plastic-covered doors of the furniture store. “You think I need you? Don't you think I could give Myrna Mountweazel a dose of Benadryl to make her sleep like a log while I snuck the safe out from under my parents' bed? Or sneak into your room while you're sleeping and swipe your car keys? I don't need you, you fool. I chose you. And then you chose me back.” Now Margo looked at me. “And that feels like a promise. At least for tonight. In sickness and in health. For better or for worse. For richer or for poorer. Until dawn do us part.”
tr_translation: He wasn't looking at me. He was just staring straight ahead, looking at the front of the furniture store. "Do you think I need you? I can get the safe from under my parents' bed Don't you think I can give Myrna Mountweazel Benadryl to make her sleep? Or sneak into your room while you're asleep and take your car keys? I didn't need you, you fool. I chose you. Then you chose me too. At that moment, she looked at me. “And that's like some kind of promise. At least for tonight. In sickness and in health. In good times and in bad. In wealth and in poverty. Until dawn separates us.”
es_translation: He didn't look at me. He looked straight ahead, towards the plastic covering of the furniture store. —Do you think I needed you? Don’t you think I could have given Myrna Mountweazel a sedative to make her sleep and stolen the box from under my parents' bed? Or sneaked into your room while you were sleeping and taken your car keys? I didn’t need you, idiot. I chose you. And then you chose me. —He looked at me—. And this is like a promise. At least for tonight. In sickness and in health. For better or for worse. For richer or for poorer. Until dawn do us part.

en: I started the car and pulled out of the parking lot, but all her teamwork stuff aside, I still felt like I was getting badgered into something, and I wanted the last word. “Fine, but when Sea-World, Incorporated or whatever sends a letter to Duke University saying that miscreant Quentin Jacobsen broke into their facility at four thirty in the morning with a wild-eyed lass at his side, Duke University will be mad. Also, my parents will be mad.”
vi: Tôi khởi động máy và lái xe ra khỏi bãi đỗ, nhưng gạt tất cả những gì liên quan đến tinh thần đồng đội của Margo sang bên, tôi vẫn cảm thấy như mình bị buộc làm một điều gì đó, và tôi muốn nói cho ra ngô ra khoai. “Được thôi, nhưng khi SeaWorld, công ty hoặc bất cứ cá nhân nào viết thư đến Đại học Duke, nói rằng cái cậu Quentin Jacobsen đầy tội lỗi đã đột nhập cơ sở vật chất của họ vào lúc bốn giờ ba mươi phút sáng cùng với cô nàng đồng hành có cặp mắt hoang dại, thì Đại học Duke sẽ điên lên đấy. Mà bố mẹ tớ cũng phát điên luôn.”
tr: Arabayı çalıştırıp park yerinden çıktım fakat bütün o takım çalışması ıvır zıvırı bir yana, hâlâ başımın eti yenerek bir şeye zorlanıyormuşum gibi hissediyordum ve son sözü ben söylemek istiyordum. “İyi. Ama SeaWorld ya da her neyse, Duke Üniversitesi’ne zalim Quentin Jacobsen’m, yanında vahşi bakışlı bir genç kızla, sabahın dört buçuğunda, tesislerine zorla girdiğini söyleyen bir mektup gönderdiğinde Duke Üniversitesi fena kızacak. Annemle babam da fena kızacak.
es: Encendí el coche y salí del aparcamiento, pero, dejando de lado su rollo sobre el trabajo en equipo, sentía que estaba presionándome y quería decir la última palabra. —Muy bien, pero cuando el SeaWorld o quien sea escriba a la Universidad de Duke diciendo que el desaprensivo Quentin Jacobsen allanó su edificio a las cuatro y media de la madrugada con una muchachita de mirada salvaje, la Universidad de Duke se pondrá furiosa. Y mis padres también.
vi_translation: I started the engine and drove out of the parking lot, but putting aside all of Margo's team spirit, I still felt like I was being forced to do something, and I wanted to get to the bottom of it. "Alright, but when SeaWorld, the company, or any individual writes to Duke University, saying that the guilty Quentin Jacobsen broke into their facility at four-thirty in the morning with a wild-eyed companion, Duke University will go crazy. And my parents will go crazy too."
tr_translation: I started the car and pulled out of the parking spot, but despite all that teamwork nonsense, I still felt like I was being forced into something with my head being chewed off, and I wanted to have the final say. “Fine. But SeaWorld or whatever, Duke University is going to be really mad when they get a letter saying that cruel Quentin Jacobsen, along with a wild-eyed girl, broke into their facilities at four in the morning. My parents are going to be really mad too.”
es_translation: I started the car and left the parking lot, but, putting aside his spiel about teamwork, I felt that he was pressuring me and wanted to have the last word. —Very well, but when SeaWorld or whoever writes to Duke University saying that the unscrupulous Quentin Jacobsen broke into their building at four-thirty in the morning with a wild-eyed girl, Duke University will be furious. And my parents too.

en: “Q, you’re going to go to Duke. You’re going to be a very successful lawyer-or-something and get married and have babies and live your whole little life, and then you’re going to die, and in your last moments, when you’re choking on your own bile in the nursing home, you’ll say to yourself: ‘Well, I wasted my whole goddamned life, but at least I broke into SeaWorld with Margo Roth Spiegelman my senior year of high school. At least I carpe’d that one diem.’”
vi: “Q ơi, cậu sẽ theo học ở Duke. Cậu sẽ trở thành luật-sư-hay-gì-đó công thành danh toại, lập gia đình, sinh con và sống hết cuộc đời con con này. Đến phút lâm chung, những khoảnh khắc cuối cùng của cuộc đời, khi cay đắng nghẹn ngào trong nhà thương, cậu sẽ tự nhủ: ‘Ồ, mình đã lãng phí cả cuộc đời chết giẫm này, nhưng chí ít vào năm cuối cùng ở trường phổ thông, mình đã lén vào SeaWorld cùng với Margo Roth Spiegelman. Ít nhất mình đã có một ngày huy hoàng, carpe diem.
tr: “Q, Duke’a gideceksin. Çok başarılı bir avukat falaıi olacaksın, evleneceksin, çocukların olacak, bütün o küçük hayatı yaşayacaksın, sonra öleceksin ve son dakikalarında, huzurevinde kendi safranda boğulurken kendine diyeceksin ki: Teki, lanet olası hayatımm tümünü boşa harcamış olabilirim ama en azmdan lise son sınıfta Margo Roth Spiegelman’la SeaWorld’e izinsiz girdim. En azmdan bir diem’ı carpe yaptım.
es: —Q, irás a Duke. Serás un abogado con mucho éxito, o lo que sea, te casarás, tendrás hijos, vivirás tu vida mediocre y te morirás, y en tus últimos momentos, cuando estés ahogándote en tu propia bilis en la residencia de ancianos, te dirás: «Bueno, he desperdiciado toda mi puta vida, pero al menos el último año de instituto entré en el SeaWorld con Margo Roth Spiegelman. Al menos, carpeé un diem».
vi_translation: “Q, you will attend Duke. You will become a successful lawyer-or-something, start a family, have children, and live out this ordinary life. In your final moments, on your deathbed, when you are bitter and choking back tears in the hospital, you will tell yourself: ‘Oh, I wasted this damn life, but at least in my final year of high school, I snuck into SeaWorld with Margo Roth Spiegelman. At least I had one glorious day, carpe diem.’”
tr_translation: “Q, you will go to Duke. You will become a very successful lawyer, you will get married, you will have children, you will live that whole little life, then you will die and in your last moments, while choking on your own bile in a nursing home, you will say to yourself: Maybe, I might have wasted my entire damn life, but at least in my senior year of high school, I broke into SeaWorld with Margo Roth Spiegelman. At least I carpe'd one diem.”’
es_translation: —Q, you will go to Duke. You will be a very successful lawyer, or whatever, you will get married, have children, live your mediocre life and die, and in your last moments, when you are drowning in your own bile in the nursing home, you will say to yourself: "Well, I wasted my whole fucking life, but at least in the last year of high school I got into SeaWorld with Margo Roth Spiegelman." At least, I carpe'd a diem."

en: “Noctem,” I corrected.
vi: “Một đêm huy hoàng, carpe noctem[5],” tôi sửa.
tr: “Noctem,” diye düzelttim.
es: —Noctem —la corregí.
vi_translation: “A glorious night, carpe noctem[5],” I corrected.
tr_translation: “Noctem,” I corrected.
es_translation: —Night —I corrected her.

en: “Okay, you are the Grammar King again. You’ve regained your throne. Now take me to SeaWorld.”
vi: “Được rồi, cậu lại là Vua Ngữ Pháp. Cậu vừa giành lại ngai vàng rồi đó. Giờ đưa tớ tới SeaWorld thôi.”
tr: ‘Tamam, Dilbilgisi Kralı tekrar sensin. Tahtım geri kazandın. Şimdi beni SeaWorld’e götür.
es: —De acuerdo, vuelves a ser el rey de la gramática. Acabas de recuperar el trono. Ahora llévame al SeaWorld.
vi_translation: “Alright, you're the Grammar King again. You've just reclaimed the throne. Now take me to SeaWorld.”
tr_translation: ‘Alright, you are the Grammar King again. You have regained my throne. Now take me to SeaWorld.”
es_translation: —Alright, you're the king of grammar again. You've just reclaimed the throne. Now take me to SeaWorld.

en: As we drove silently down I-4, I found myself thinking about the day that the guy in the gray suit showed up dead. Maybe that’s the reason she chose me, I thought. And that’s when, finally, I remembered what she said about the dead guy and the strings— and about herself and the strings.
vi: Lặng lẽ lái xe dọc cao tốc I-4, tôi nhận ra mình đang nghĩ đến người đàn ông mặc bộ đồ xám bị phát hiện đã chết năm đó. Có thể đó là lí do cô ấy đã chọn mình, tôi nghĩ. Và khi đó, cuối cùng, tôi nhớ ra những gì Margo đã nói về người chết và những dây nối–về chính cô ấy và những dây nối.
tr: I4’te sessizce ilerlerken, kendimi gri takım elbiseli adamın öldüğü günü düşünürken buldum. Belki Margo’nun beni seçmesinin nedeni bu, diye düşündüm. Tam o anda, nihayet, Margo’nun ölü adam ve iplerle ilgili söylediklerini hatırladım... ayrıca kendisi ve iplerle ilgili söylediklerini de.
es: Mientras avanzábamos en silencio por la I-4, me descubrí a mí mismo pensando en el día en que el tipo del traje gris apareció muerto. «Quizá por eso me ha elegido», pensé. Y en ese momento recordé por fin lo que me había dicho sobre el muerto y los hilos. Y sobre ella y los hilos.
vi_translation: Quietly driving along the I-4 highway, I realized I was thinking about the man in the gray suit who was found dead that year. Maybe that's why she chose me, I thought. And then, finally, I remembered what Margo had said about the dead and the connections—about herself and the connections.
tr_translation: As I quietly advanced on I-4, I found myself thinking about the day the man in the gray suit died. Maybe this is why Margo chose me, I thought. At that very moment, I finally remembered what Margo had said about the dead man and the ropes... and also what she had said about herself and the ropes.
es_translation: As we moved silently along the I-4, I found myself thinking about the day the guy in the gray suit turned up dead. “Maybe that's why he chose me,” I thought. And at that moment, I finally remembered what he had told me about the dead man and the threads. And about her and the threads.

en: “Margo,” I said, breaking our silence.
vi: “Margo này,” tôi lên tiếng phá vỡ bầu im lặng.
tr: “Margo,” dedim suskunluğumuzu bozarak.
es: —Margo —le dije rompiendo el silencio.
vi_translation: "Margo," I broke the silence.
tr_translation: “Margo,” I said, breaking our silence.
es_translation: —Margo —I said, breaking the silence.

en: “Q,” she said.
vi: “Q,” cô ấy đáp.
tr: “Q,” dedi.
es: —Q —me contestó.
vi_translation: “Q,” she replied.
tr_translation: “Q,” he said.
es_translation: —Q —he answered me.

en: “You said . . . When the guy died, you said maybe all the strings inside him broke, and then you just said that about yourself, that the last string broke.”
vi: “Cậu từng nói... Người đàn ông bị chết năm ấy, cậu từng nói rằng có lẽ tất cả những dây nối bên trong ông ta đã đứt hết, rồi lúc nãy cậu vừa nói về chính cậu, và dây nối cuối cùng bị đứt.
tr: “Dedin ki... Adam öldüğünde, belki de içindeki tüm ipler kopmuştur dedin ve sonra demin bunu kendin için de söyledin, son ipin koptuğunu.
es: —Dijiste… Cuando aquel tipo murió, dijiste que quizá se le habían roto los hilos por dentro, y hace un rato has dicho lo mismo de ti, que el último hilo se había roto.
vi_translation: “You once said... The man who died that year, you once said that perhaps all the internal connections within him had snapped, and just now you were talking about yourself, and the last connection snapped.”
tr_translation: "You said... When a person dies, perhaps all the strings inside them have snapped, you said, and then you just said this for yourself as well, that the last string has snapped."
es_translation: —You said... When that guy died, you said that maybe his strings had broken inside, and a while ago you said the same about yourself, that the last string had broken.

en: She half laughed. “You worry too much. I don’t want some kids to find me swarmed with flies on a Saturday morning in Jefferson Park.” She waited a beat before delivering the punch line. “I’m too vain for that fate.”
vi: Margo nửa bật cười. “Cậu lo lắng quá nhiều rồi đấy. Tớ không muốn đứa trẻ con nào tìm thấy tớ trong cảnh ruồi bâu kiến đậu vào một sáng thứ Bảy ở Công viên Jefferson đâu.” Cô ấy nghỉ một nhịp rồi nói điều cốt lõi. “Tớ quá tự kiêu cho một kết cục như vậy.”
tr: Güler gibiydi. “Fazla endişeleniyorsun. Birkaç çocuğun beni bir cumartesi sabahı, üstüme sinekler üşüşmüş halde Jefferson Park’ta bulmasını istemem.” Can alıcı noktayı dile getirmeden önce biraz bekledi. “Bu kader için fazla gösterişçiyim.
es: Se medio rió. —Te preocupas demasiado. No quiero que unos críos me encuentren cubierta de moscas un sábado por la mañana en Jefferson Park. —Esperó un momento antes de rematar la frase—: Soy demasiado presumida para acabar así.
vi_translation: Margo half laughed. “You worry too much. I don't want some kid to find me covered in flies and ants on a Saturday morning in Jefferson Park.” She paused for a moment and then said the crux of it. “I’m too proud for an ending like that.”
tr_translation: She was smiling. “You worry too much. I don’t want a few kids to find me in Jefferson Park on a Saturday morning with flies swarming over me.” She waited a moment before stating the crucial point. “I’m too flamboyant for that fate.”
es_translation: He half-laughed. —You worry too much. I don't want some kids to find me covered in flies on a Saturday morning in Jefferson Park. —She paused for a moment before finishing the sentence—: I'm too vain to end up like that.

en: I laughed, relieved, and exited the interstate. We turned onto International Drive, the tourism capital of the world. There were a thousand shops on International Drive, and they all sold the exact same thing: crap. Crap molded into seashells, key rings, glass turtles, Florida-shaped refrigerator magnets, plastic pink flamingos, whatever. In fact, there were several stores on I-Drive that sold actual, literal armadillo crap—$4.95 a bag.
vi: Tôi cười khì, thở phào và lái xe ra khỏi cao tốc liên bang. Chúng tôi rẽ vào đường International Drive, thủ phủ mua sắm của xứ này. Có đến cả ngàn cửa hàng ở International Drive, tất cả đều bán một thứ giống nhau: thứ bỏ đi. Những thứ bỏ đi dưới đủ mọi hình dạng: vỏ sò, móc đeo chìa khóa, đồi mồi bằng thủy tinh, nam châm gắn tủ lạnh hình bang Florida, hồng hạc bằng nhựa, gi gỉ gì gi đủ thứ. Thực ra có vài cửa hàng trên đường I-Drive bán thứ bỏ đi thật, nghĩa đen, phân con ta-tu, bốn đô-la chín mươi lăm xu một túi.
tr: Güldüm, rahatladım ve eyaletler arası yoldan çıktım. International Bulvarı’na döndük, dünyanın turizm başkenti. International Bulvarı’nda binlerce dükkân vardı ve hepsi tam anlamıyla aynı şeyi satıyordu: çer çöp. Denizkabuğu şeklinde biçimlendirilmiş çer çöp, anahtarlıklar, cam kaplumbağalar, Florida şeklinde buzdolabı mıknatısları, pembe plastik flamingolar, ne olursa. Aslında IBulvan’nda gerçek armadillo pisliği satan dükkânlar bile vardı... poşeti 4. 95 dolara.
es: Me reí aliviado y salí de la autopista. Giramos en International Drive, la capital mundial del turismo. En International Drive había mil tiendas que vendían exactamente lo mismo: mierda. Mierda con forma de conchas, llaveros, tortugas de cristal, imanes para el frigorífico con la forma de Florida, flamencos rosas de plástico y cosas por el estilo. De hecho, en International Drive había varias tiendas que vendían mierda real y literal de armadillo, a 4. 95 dólares la bolsa.
vi_translation: I chuckled, sighed in relief, and drove off the interstate. We turned onto International Drive, the shopping capital of this place. There are up to a thousand stores on International Drive, all selling the same thing: junk. Junk in all shapes and forms: seashells, keychains, glass turtles, Florida-shaped refrigerator magnets, plastic flamingos, you name it. In fact, there are a few stores on I-Drive that sell literal junk, like armadillo poop, four dollars and ninety-five cents a bag.
tr_translation: I laughed, relaxed, and exited the interstate. We turned onto International Boulevard, the world's tourism capital. There were thousands of shops on International Boulevard, and they all sold exactly the same thing: junk. Junk shaped like seashells, keychains, glass turtles, refrigerator magnets in the shape of Florida, pink plastic flamingos, you name it. In fact, there were even shops on International Boulevard that sold real armadillo poop... for $4.95 a bag.
es_translation: I laughed with relief and exited the highway. We turned onto International Drive, the tourism capital of the world. On International Drive, there were a thousand stores selling exactly the same thing: crap. Crap in the form of shells, keychains, glass turtles, refrigerator magnets shaped like Florida, plastic pink flamingos, and things like that. In fact, on International Drive, there were several stores selling real, literal armadillo crap, for $4.95 a bag.

en: But at 4:50 in the morning, the tourists were sleeping. The Drive was completely dead, like everything else, as we drove past store after parking lot after store after parking lot.
vi: Nhưng vào 4:50 sáng, khách du lịch vẫn còn đang ngủ. Con đường hoàn toàn vắng ngắt, giống như những đường phố khác, khi chúng tôi lái xe qua hết bãi đỗ này đến bãi đỗ khác.
tr: Ama sabah (MACMe turistler uyuyordu. Biz ardı ardına dükkânları ve park yerlerini geçip giderken bulvar tamamen ölüydü, diğer her şey gibi.
es: Pero a las 4:50 de la madrugada los turistas estaban durmiendo. Drive, como todo lo demás, estaba completamente muerto mientras dejábamos atrás tiendas, aparcamientos, más tiendas y más aparcamientos.
vi_translation: But at 4:50 AM, the tourists were still sleeping. The road was completely deserted, just like the other streets, as we drove from one parking lot to another.
tr_translation: But in the morning (MACMe the tourists were sleeping. As we passed one shop and parking lot after another, the boulevard was completely dead, like everything else.
es_translation: But at 4:50 in the morning, the tourists were sleeping. Drive, like everything else, was completely dead as we left behind shops, parking lots, more shops, and more parking lots.

en: “SeaWorld is just past the parkway,” Margo said. She was in the wayback of the minivan again, rifling through a backpack or something. “I got all these satellite maps and drew our plan of attack, but I can’t freaking find them anywhere. But anyway, just go right past the parkway, and on your left there will be this souvenir shop.”
vi: “Đi qua hàng cây kia là đến SeaWorld,” Margo nói. Cô ấy ra sau xe, lục tìm trong ba-lô hay cái gì đó. “Tớ có đủ bản đồ vệ tinh và đã vạch kế hoạch tác chiến của chúng ta, nhưng quái lạ sao chả thấy đâu nhỉ. Dù sao cứ đi qua đoạn đường có hàng cây, bên tay trái sẽ là một cửa hàng bán đồ lưu niệm.”
tr: “SeaWorld ağaçlı bulvarı geçtikten hemen sonra,” dedi Margo. Yine minivanın arka tarafmdaydı, bir sırt çantasını ya da onun gibi bir şeyi karıştırıyordu. “Bütün uydu haritalarını alıp saldırı planımızı çizmiştim ama lanet şeyleri bir türlü bulamıyorum. Ama her neyse, bulvardan sağa sap, solunda hediyelik eşya dükkâm olacak.
es: —El SeaWorld está justo detrás de la autopista —dijo Margo. Estaba de nuevo en la parte de atrás del coche, rebuscando en una mochila o algo así—. Tengo un montón de mapas satélite y dibujé nuestro plan de ataque, pero no los encuentro por ninguna parte. En fin, gira a la derecha después de la autopista, y a la izquierda verás una tienda de souvenirs.
vi_translation: “Go past those trees and you'll reach SeaWorld,” Margo said. She went to the back of the car, rummaging through her backpack or something. “I have enough satellite maps and have planned our operation, but weirdly I can't find them anywhere. Anyway, just go past the road with the trees, and on the left, there will be a souvenir shop.”
tr_translation: “SeaWorld is right after you pass the tree-lined boulevard,” said Margo. She was in the back of the minivan again, rummaging through a backpack or something like that. “I had taken all the satellite maps and drawn up our attack plan, but I just can't seem to find the damn things. Anyway, turn right at the boulevard, there will be a souvenir shop on your left.”
es_translation: —SeaWorld is right behind the highway —said Margo. She was in the back of the car again, rummaging through a backpack or something like that—. I have a bunch of satellite maps and I drew our plan of attack, but I can't find them anywhere. Anyway, turn right after the highway, and on the left, you'll see a souvenir shop.

en: “On my left, there are about seventeen thousand souvenir shops.”
vi: “Bên tay trái tớ có khoảng mười bảy ngàn cửa hàng bán đồ lưu niệm.”
tr: “Solumda yaklaşık on yedi bin tane hediyelik eşya dükkâm var.
es: —A la izquierda hay unas diecisiete mil tiendas de souvenirs.
vi_translation: "To my left, there are about seventeen thousand souvenir shops."
tr_translation: “There are approximately seventeen thousand souvenir shops in my town.”
es_translation: —To the left, there are about seventeen thousand souvenir shops.

en: “Right, but there will only be one right after the parkway.”
vi: “Đúng, nhưng chỉ có một ngay sau khi đi hết qua hàng cây thôi.
tr: “Doğru ama bulvardan sonra sadece bir tane olacak.
es: —Sí, pero justo después de la autopista habrá solo una.
vi_translation: “Yes, but there is only one right after you pass through the row of trees.” Indeed, there was only one such store.
tr_translation: “That's true, but after the boulevard, there will be only one.”
es_translation: —Yes, but right after the highway there will be only one.

en: And sure enough, there was only one, and so I pulled into the empty parking lot and parked the car directly beneath a streetlight, because cars are always getting stolen on I-Drive. And while only a truly masochistic car thief would ever think of jacking the Chrysler, I still didn’t relish the thought of explaining to my mom how and why her car went missing in the small hours of a school night.
vi: Quả là chính xác, chỉ có một cửa hàng như vậy, tôi đưa xe vào chỗ đỗ trống, dừng ngay dưới một cột đèn đường, vì ở I-Drive này rất dễ bị mất xe. Chắc chỉ có gã đạo chích siêu quái đản mới tìm cách thổi bay chiếc Chrysler này, nhưng tôi cũng không khoái nghĩ đến việc phải giải thích với mẹ làm thế nào và tại sao xe của mẹ đã biến mất trong mấy tiếng đồng hồ khuya khoắt này.
tr: Sahiden de yalnızca bir tane vardı, böylece boş park yerine çekip arabayı doğruca bir sokak lambasının altına park ettim, çünkü IBulvarı’nda arabalar sürekli çalmıyordu. Ancak gerçek ten mazoşist bir araba hırsızı Chrysler’ı çalmayı düşünecek olsa bile, anneme ertesi gün okul olan bir gecenin ilerlemiş saatlerinde arabanın neden ve nasıl kaybolduğunu açıklama düşüncesinden yine de hazzetmemiştim.
es: Y por supuesto había solo una, así que me metí en el aparcamiento vacío y aparqué el coche debajo de una farola, porque en International Drive siempre roban coches. Y aunque solo a un ladrón de coches masoquista se le ocurriría trincar el Chrysler, no me apetecía tener que explicarle a mi madre cómo y por qué su coche había desaparecido en plena madrugada de un día de clase.
vi_translation: I parked the car in an empty spot, right under a streetlight, because it's very easy to lose your car on I-Drive. Only a super bizarre thief would try to steal this Chrysler, but I didn't relish the thought of explaining to my mom how and why her car disappeared in the middle of the night.
tr_translation: Indeed, there was only one, so I pulled into the empty parking space and parked the car directly under a street lamp, because cars were not constantly being stolen on the Boulevard. But the truth Even if a masochistic car thief were to consider stealing the Chrysler, I still didn't relish the thought of explaining to my mother why and how the car disappeared in the late hours of a night before a school day.
es_translation: And of course, there was only one, so I pulled into the empty parking lot and parked the car under a streetlight, because on International Drive, cars are always getting stolen. And although only a masochistic car thief would think of snatching the Chrysler, I didn't feel like explaining to my mother how and why her car had disappeared in the middle of the night on a school day.

en: We stood outside, leaning against the back of the minivan, the air so warm and thick I felt my clothes clinging to my skin. I felt scared again, as if people I couldn’t see were looking at me. It had been too dark for too long, and my gut ached from the hours of worrying. Margo had found her maps, and by the light of the street lamp, her spray-paint-blue fingertip traced our route. “I think there’s a fence right there,” she said, pointing to a wooden patch we’d hit just after crossing the parkway. “I read about it online. They installed it a few years ago after some drunk guy walked into the park in the middle of the night and decided to go swimming with Shamu, who promptly killed him.”
vi: Chúng tôi đứng bên ngoài, dựa vào đuôi chiếc minivan, không khí nóng và nặng đến mức tôi thấy quần áo như dính chặt lên da mình. Tôi lại có cảm giác rờn rợn, như thể ai đó đang nhìn tôi mà tôi lại không thấy họ. Đêm tối quá lâu, bụng dạ tôi đau nhói sau nhiều tiếng đồng hồ lo lắng căng thẳng. Margo đã tìm thấy bản đồ, dưới ánh đèn đường, đầu ngón tay dính sơn xanh của cô ấy dò theo tuyến đường. “Tớ nghĩ ngay đây có một đoạn hàng rào,” cô ấy nói, giơ tay chỉ một vạt um tùm phía bên kia con đường có hàng cây. “Tớ đã đọc trên mạng. Mấy năm trước người ta dựng hàng rào vì một gã say nào đó nửa đêm mò vào công viên và nảy ra ý tưởng bơi cùng Shamu, cho nên đã bị Shamu xực luôn.”
tr: Dışarıda minivanın arkasına yaslanarak durduk, hava o kadar ılık ve yoğundu ki kıyafetlerimin üstüme yapıştığını hissettim. Sanki göremediğim insanlar bana bakıyormuş gibi tekrar korkmaya başladım. Çok uzun zamandır çok karanlıktı ve endişe dolu saatler nedeniyle karnım ağrıyordu. Margo haritaları buldu ve sokak lambasının ışığı altında, sprey boyah mavi parmağı güzergahımızı takip etti. “Sanırım tam şurada bir çit var,” dedi, bulvarı geçtikten hemen sonra karşılaştığımız tahtadan bir yeri işaret ederek. “İnternette burayla ilgili bir şeyler okudum. Sarhoş bir adam gecenin bir yarısı parka girip Shamu’yla yüzmeye karar vermiş ki hayvan da onu öldürmüş.
es: Nos quedamos fuera, apoyados en la parte de atrás del monovolumen. El aire era tan cálido y denso que se me pegaba la ropa a la piel. Volvía a estar asustado, como si gente a la que no veía estuviera mirándome. La noche había sido muy larga y llevaba tantas horas preocupado que me dolía la barriga. Margo había encontrado los mapas y trazaba nuestra ruta con el dedo azul a la luz de la farola. —Creo que aquí hay una valla —me dijo señalando una zona de bosque con la que nos habíamos topado nada más pasar la autopista—. Lo leí en internet. La pusieron hace unos años porque un borracho entró en el parque en plena noche y decidió darse un baño con la orca Shamu, que no tardó en matarlo.
vi_translation: We stood outside, leaning against the tail of the minivan, the air hot and heavy to the point that I felt my clothes sticking to my skin. I had that eerie feeling again, as if someone was watching me but I couldn't see them. The night dragged on too long, my stomach ached after hours of anxious tension. Margo had found the map, under the streetlight, her green paint-stained fingertip tracing the route. “I think there's a section of fence right here,” she said, pointing to a dense patch on the other side of the tree-lined road. “I read about it online. A few years ago, they put up the fence because some drunk guy wandered into the park at midnight and got the idea to swim with Shamu, so Shamu ate him.”
tr_translation: We stood outside leaning against the back of the minivan, the air was so warm and dense that I felt my clothes sticking to me. I started to feel scared again, as if unseen people were watching me. It had been very dark for a long time and my stomach ached from the anxious hours. Margo found the maps and under the streetlamp's light, her spray-painted blue finger traced our route. "I think there's a fence right here," she said, pointing to a wooden spot we encountered just after crossing the boulevard. "I read something about this place on the internet. A drunk man decided to enter the park in the middle of the night and swim with Shamu, and the animal killed him."
