es_translation: We stayed outside, leaning against the back of the minivan. The air was so warm and dense that my clothes stuck to my skin. I was scared again, as if people I couldn't see were watching me. The night had been very long and I had been worried for so many hours that my stomach hurt. Margo had found the maps and was tracing our route with her blue finger under the streetlight. —I think there's a fence here —he told me, pointing to a wooded area we had encountered just after crossing the highway—. I read it on the internet. They put it up a few years ago because a drunk person entered the park in the middle of the night and decided to take a swim with the orca Shamu, who didn't take long to kill him.

en: “Seriously?”
vi: “Có chuyện ấy thật sao?”
tr: “Cidden mi?
es: —¿En serio?
vi_translation: "Is that really true?"
tr_translation: “Really?”
es_translation: —Seriously?

en: “Yeah, so if that guy can make it in drunk, surely we can make it in sober. I mean, we’re ninjas.”
vi: “Ừ, nhưng nếu gã đó hành động trong cơn say, thì chúng ta sẽ ra tay khi hoàn toàn tỉnh táo. Tụi mình là ninja mà.”
tr: “Evet, yani o adam sarhoşken bunu yapabiliyorsa, biz ayıkken kesinlikle yapabiliriz. Sonuçta biz ninjayız.
es: —Sí, así que si aquel tipo pudo entrar borracho, seguro que nosotros, que no hemos bebido, también podremos. Vaya, somos ninjas.
vi_translation: "Yes, but if that guy acts in a drunken state, we will strike when fully sober. We are ninjas after all."
tr_translation: "Yes, I mean if that guy can do it while he's drunk, we can definitely do it while we're sober. After all, we are ninjas."
es_translation: —Yes, so if that guy could get in drunk, surely we, who haven't drunk, can also get in. Come on, we're ninjas.

en: “Well, maybe you’re a ninja,” I said.
vi: “À, chắc cậu là ninja thôi,” tôi nói.
tr: “Şey, belki sen bir ninjasm,” dedim.
es: —Bueno, quizá tú eres una ninja —le dije.
vi_translation: “Ah, you must be a ninja,” I said.
tr_translation: “Well, maybe you're a ninja,” I said.
es_translation: —Well, maybe you are a ninja —I told her.

en: “You’re just a really loud, awkward ninja,” Margo said, “but we are both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ears, pulled up her hood, and scrunched it shut with a drawstring; the streetlight lit up the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she had the outfit.
vi: “Cậu là chàng ninja ồn ào và lắm chuyện,” Margo nói, “nhưng hai đứa mình đều là ninja.” Cô ấy vén tóc ra sau vành tai, đội mũ lên, thít chặt dây rút; ánh sáng từ ngọn đèn đường rọi lên những nét sắc sảo trên khuôn mặt nhợt nhạt của cô ấy. Có thể cả hai đứa tôi đều là ninja, nhưng chỉ Margo mặc trang phục thích hợp.
tr: “Sen sadece gerçekten gürültücü, sakar bir ninjasın,” dedi Margo, “ama ikimiz de ninjayız.” Saçını kulaklarının arkasına attı; kapüşonunu başma çekip ipiyle hışırdatarak büzdü; sokak lambası solgun yüzünün keskin hatlarını aydınlatıyordu. Belki ikimiz de ninjaydık fakat ekipmanı olan yalnızca oydu.
es: —Los dos somos ninjas, solo que tú eres un ninja torpe y ruidoso —dijo Margo. Se colocó el pelo detrás de las orejas, se puso la capucha y se la ató con el cordón. La farola iluminó los agudos rasgos de su cara pálida. Quizá los dos éramos ninjas, pero solo ella lo parecía.
vi_translation: “You are the noisy and talkative ninja,” Margo said, “but we are both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ear, put on her hat, and tightened the drawstring; the light from the streetlamp illuminated the sharp features on her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only Margo was dressed appropriately.
tr_translation: “You’re just a really noisy, clumsy ninja,” said Margo, “but we’re both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ears; pulled her hood over her head and tightened it with a rustle; the street lamp illuminated the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but she was the only one with equipment.
es_translation: —We are both ninjas, only you are a clumsy and noisy ninja —said Margo. She tucked her hair behind her ears, put on the hood, and tied it with the cord. The streetlamp illuminated the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she looked like one.

en: “Okay,” she said. “Memorize the map.” By far the most terrifying part of the half-mile-long journey Margo had plotted for us was the moat. SeaWorld was shaped like a triangle. One side was protected by a road, which Margo figured was regularly patrolled by night watchmen. The second side was guarded by a lake that was at least a mile around, and the third side had a drainage ditch; from the map, it looked to be about as wide as a two-lane road. And where there are water-filled drainage ditches near lakes in Florida, there are often alligators.
vi: “Được rồi,” cô ấy nói. “Ghi nhớ bản đồ nhé.” Đến thời điểm này, phần gian nguy nhất trong hành trình nửa dặm mà Margo đã vạch ra chính là hào nước. Địa hình SeaWorld như một tam giác. Một cạnh là mặt đường, Margo suy luận rằng sẽ thường xuyên có nhân viên an ninh đi tuần tra ban đêm. Cạnh thứ hai sát với một hồ nước chu vi ít nhất một dặm, và cạnh thứ ba tiếp giáp hào thoát nước. Nhìn từ bản đồ, hào nước này rộng cỡ một con đường hai làn. Và ở Florida, ở đâu có hào thoát nước cạnh hồ, ở đó thường có cá sấu.
tr: ‘Tamam,” dedi. “Haritayı ezberle.” Margo’nun bizim için kurguladığı yaklaşık bir kilometrelik yolculuğun açık ara farkla en korkutucu bölümü hendekti. SeaWorld üçgen şeklindeydi. Bir tarafı, Margo’nun yürüttüğü tahmine göre, gece bekçilerinin devriye gezdiği bir cadde tarafından korunuyordu, ikinci taraf, çevresi en az bir kilometre olan bir göl tarafından gözetiliyordu ve üçüncü tarafta bir drenaj kanalı vardı; haritada yaklaşık iki şeritli bir yol kadar geniş görünüyordu. Ve Florida’da, göllerin yakınında suyla dolu drenaj kanalları varsa, orada genellikle timsahlar olur.
es: —Bien —me dijo—, memoriza el mapa. La parte más terrorífica del recorrido de casi un kilómetro que Margo había trazado era, con diferencia, el foso. El SeaWorld tenía forma triangular. Un lado estaba protegido por una carretera por la que Margo suponía que patrullaban permanentemente vigilantes nocturnos. El segundo lado estaba protegido por un lago de casi dos kilómetros de perímetro, y en el tercero había una zanja de drenaje. Según el mapa, parecía tener la anchura de una carretera de dos carriles. Y en Florida, en las zanjas de drenaje junto a los lagos suele haber caimanes.
vi_translation: “Alright,” she said. “Remember the map.” At this point, the most perilous part of the half-mile journey Margo had outlined was the moat. The terrain of SeaWorld was like a triangle. One side was the road, which Margo reasoned would frequently have security personnel patrolling at night. The second side bordered a lake with a circumference of at least a mile, and the third side adjoined a drainage ditch. From the map, this moat appeared to be as wide as a two-lane road. And in Florida, where there is a drainage ditch next to a lake, there are often alligators.
tr_translation: ‘Okay,’ he said. ‘Memorize the map.’ The most terrifying part by far of the roughly one-kilometer journey Margo had planned for us was the ditch. SeaWorld was triangular in shape. One side, according to Margo's estimation, was guarded by a street patrolled by night watchmen, the second side was watched over by a lake with a circumference of at least one kilometer, and the third side had a drainage channel; on the map, it appeared to be about two lanes wide. It looked as wide as a road. And in Florida, if there are drainage canals filled with water near the lakes, there are usually alligators there.
es_translation: —Alright —he told me—, memorize the map. The most terrifying part of the nearly one-kilometer route that Margo had mapped out was, by far, the moat. SeaWorld was triangular in shape. One side was protected by a road on which Margo assumed night watchmen patrolled permanently. The second side was protected by a lake with a perimeter of almost two kilometers, and on the third side, there was a drainage ditch. According to the map, it seemed to be as wide as a two-lane road. And in Florida, drainage ditches next to lakes usually have alligators.

en: Margo grabbed me by both shoulders and turned me toward her. “We’re going to get caught, probably, and when we do, just let me talk. You just look cute and be that weird mix of innocent and confident, and we’ll be fine.”
vi: Margo đặt cả tay lên hai vai tôi và xoay tôi lại phía cô ấy. “Bọn mình sẽ bị tóm, có thể thôi, trong trường hợp đó, cứ để tớ nói mọi chuyện. Cậu chỉ cần tỏ ra hiền hiền kiểu nửa ngây thơ nửa thẳng thắn, rồi ta sẽ ổn cả thôi.”
tr: Margo beni iki omzumdan tutup kendine çevirdi. “Muhtemelen yakalanacağız ve yakalandığımızda bırak ben konuşayım. Sen sadece şirin görünüp şu tuhaf masumkendinden emin tavrını sergilersen, her şey yolunda gider.
es: Margo me agarró por los hombros y me giró hacia ella. —Seguramente nos pillarán, así que, cuando nos pillen, déjame hablar a mí. Tú limítate a poner cara de bueno, medio inocente, medio seguro de ti mismo, y todo irá bien.
vi_translation: Margo put both hands on my shoulders and turned me to face her. "We might get caught, maybe, in that case, just let me do all the talking. You just need to act kind of innocent and straightforward, and we'll be fine."
tr_translation: Margo grabbed me by both shoulders and turned me towards her. “We will probably get caught, and when we do, let me do the talking. You just need to look cute and display that weirdly innocent yet confident demeanor of yours, and everything will be fine.”
es_translation: Margo grabbed me by the shoulders and turned me towards her. —Surely they will catch us, so when they do, let me do the talking. You just focus on looking good, half innocent, half confident, and everything will be fine.

en: I locked the car, tried to pat down my puffy hair, and whispered, “I’m a ninja.” I didn’t mean for Margo to hear, but she piped up. “Damned right you are! Now let’s go.”
vi: Tôi khóa xe, cố gắng vuốt gọn mái đầu bù xù, lẩm nhẩm, “Mình là ninja.” Tôi không định để Margo nghe thấy, nhưng cô ấy đã thốt lên, “Khỉ ạ, cậu đúng là ninja đấy. Đi mau thôi.”
tr: Arabayı kilitledim, kabarmış saçımı yatırmaya çalıştım ve “Ben bir ninjayım,” diye fısıldadım. Margo’nun duymasını amaçlamamıştım ama birden karşılık verdi. “Kesinlikle öylesin! Şimdi gidelim.”
es: Cerré el coche, intenté aplanarme con la mano el pelo alborotado y murmuré: —Soy un ninja. No pretendía que Margo lo oyera, pero de repente soltó: —¡Claro que sí, joder! Ahora, vamos.
vi_translation: I locked the bike, tried to smooth down my messy hair, and muttered, "I am a ninja." I didn't mean for Margo to hear it, but she exclaimed, "Damn, you really are a ninja." "Let's go quickly."
tr_translation: I locked the car, tried to smooth down my frizzy hair, and whispered, "I am a ninja." I hadn't intended for Margo to hear, but she suddenly responded. "You definitely are! Now let's go."
es_translation: I locked the car, tried to smooth down my disheveled hair with my hand, and murmured: —I am a ninja. He didn't intend for Margo to hear him, but suddenly he blurted out: —Of course, damn it! Now, let's go.

en: We jogged across I-Drive and then started bushwhacking through a thicket of tall shrubs and oak trees. I started to worry about poison ivy, but ninjas don’t worry about poison ivy, so I led the trail, my arms in front of me, pushing aside briars and brush as we walked toward the moat. Finally the trees stopped and the field opened up, and I could see the parkway on our right and the moat straight ahead of us. People could have seen us from the road if there had been any cars, but there weren’t. Together we took off running through the brush, and then made a sharp turn toward the parkway. Margo said, “Now, now!” and I dashed across the six lanes of highway. Even though it was empty, something felt exhilarating and wrong about running across a road that big.
vi: Chúng tôi đi bộ qua I-Drive, bắt đầu mò đường qua đám sồi rậm rạp và cây bụi lùm xùm. Tôi hơi lo về độc tố của cây thường xuân, nhưng ninja không sợ độc tố thường xuân, thế là tôi xông lên, cánh tay giơ trước mặt, gạt cành gai lá lẻo sang hai bên để tiến về phía hào nước. Cuối cùng cũng qua được vạt cây và tầm nhìn thoáng ra, tôi thấy con đường với hàng cây ở bên tay phải và hào nước thẳng phía trước mặt. Ai ngồi trong xe trên đường hẳn sẽ nhìn thấy chúng tôi, nhưng chẳng có chiếc xe nào cả. Chúng tôi cùng chạy qua bụi rậm, rẽ ngoặt về phía hàng cây. Margo nói, “Nào, nào!” và tôi xẹt qua đường cao tốc sáu làn xe. Dù trên đường hoàn toàn không có ma nào, trong tôi vẫn dội lên cơn phấn khích và cảm giác sai trái to đùng khi chạy cắt qua một con đường lớn đến vậy.
tr: 1Bulvan’nın öteki tarafına koştuk, sonra uzun çalılar ile meşelerden oluşan yeşilliğin içinde pusuya yattık. Zehirli sarmaşık hakkında endişelenmeye başlamıştım ama ninjalar zehirli sarmaşık hakkında endişelenmeyecekleri için hendeğe doğru yürürken, kollarım önde, dikenli çalılan ve fundalığı kenara iterek öncülük ettim. Nihayet ağaçlar bitti ve meydan ortaya çıktı, böylece sağımdaki bulvarı ve tam karşımızda olan hendeği görebildim. Eğer birkaç araba olsaydı, insanlar yoldan bizi görebilirlerdi ama hiç araba yoktu. Birlikte yeşilliklerin arasından koşmak için harekete geçtik ve sonra bulvara doğru keskin bir dönüş yaptık. Margo, “Şimdi, şimdi!” dedi ve ben fırlayıp anayolun altı şeridini geçtim. Yol boş olduğu halde, bu kadar büyük bir caddeyi koşarak geçmekle ilgili bir şey hem heyecan verici hem de yanlışmış gibi geliyordu.
es: Corrimos por International Drive y luego nos abrimos camino entre arbustos altos y robles. Empecé a preocuparme por la hiedra venenosa, pero los ninjas no se preocupan por esas cosas, así que me coloqué a la cabeza, con los brazos extendidos, y aparté las zarzas y la maleza mientras avanzábamos hacia el foso. Al final se acabó la zona de árboles y llegamos a campo abierto. Veía la autopista a nuestra derecha y el foso justo enfrente. Podrían habernos visto desde la carretera si hubiera pasado algún coche, pero no pasó ninguno. Corrimos por la maleza y trazamos una curva cerrada hacia la autopista. —¡Ahora! ¡Ahora! —exclamó Margo. Y crucé corriendo los seis carriles de la autopista. Aunque estaba vacía, cruzar una carretera tan grande me pareció estimulante e inapropiado.
vi_translation: We walked through I-Drive, starting to find our way through the dense oaks and tangled bushes. I was a bit worried about the ivy's toxins, but ninjas aren't afraid of ivy toxins, so I charged ahead, arms raised in front of me, pushing the thorny branches aside to move towards the moat. Finally getting through the patch of trees and with a clearer view, I saw the road with rows of trees on the right and the moat straight ahead. Anyone sitting in a car on the road would surely see us, but there were no cars at all. We ran through the bushes together, turning towards the row of trees. Margo said, "Come on, come on!" and I darted across the six-lane highway. Even though there wasn't a soul on the road, I still felt a surge of excitement and a huge sense of wrongdoing as I dashed across such a big road.
tr_translation: We ran to the other side of the boulevard, then lay in ambush in the greenery made up of long bushes and oaks. I had started to worry about poison ivy, but since ninjas wouldn't worry about poison ivy, I led the way towards the ditch, arms forward, pushing aside thorny bushes and shrubs. Finally, the trees ended and the clearing emerged, allowing me to see the boulevard to my right and the ditch directly in front of us. If there had been a few cars, people could have seen us from the road, but there were no cars at all. We moved to run through the greenery together and then made a sharp turn towards the boulevard. Margo said, "Now, now!" and I dashed across the six lanes of the main road. Even though the road was empty, there was something both thrilling and wrong about running across such a big street.
es_translation: We ran along International Drive and then made our way through tall bushes and oaks. I started to worry about poison ivy, but ninjas don't worry about those things, so I took the lead, with my arms outstretched, and pushed aside the brambles and weeds as we advanced toward the moat. Eventually, the wooded area ended and we reached an open field. I could see the highway to our right and the moat directly ahead. We could have been seen from the road if any cars had passed by, but none did. We ran through the underbrush and made a sharp turn toward the highway. —Now! Now! —exclaimed Margo. And I ran across the six lanes of the highway. Although it was empty, crossing such a large road seemed thrilling and inappropriate to me.

en: We made it across and then knelt down in the knee-high grass beside the parkway. Margo pointed to the strip of trees between SeaWorld’s endlessly gigantic parking lot and the black standing water of the moat. We ran for a minute along that line of trees, and then Margo pulled on the back of my shirt, and said quietly, “Now the moat.”
vi: Băng qua đường rồi, chúng tôi lom khom đi trong đám cỏ lác cao đến đầu gối bên vệ đường. Margo chỉ lằn cây giữa bãi đỗ xe mênh mông bát ngát của SeaWorld và mặt hào nước tĩnh lặng sẫm màu. Chúng tôi chạy dọc hàng cây khoảng một phút, rồi Margo kéo lưng áo tôi, khẽ nói, “Lội nước thôi.”
tr: Karşıya geçmeyi başardık ve bulvarın yanındaki dize kadar uzanan otların içine çöktük. Margo, SeaWorld’ün uçsuz bucaksız, devasa park alanı ile hendekteki karanlık durgun su arasındaki ağaç sırasını işaret etti. Bir dakika bu ağaç sırası boyunca koştuk, sonra Margo tişörtümün arkasından çekti ve sessizce, “Şimdi hendeğe,” dedi.
es: Después de cruzar nos arrodillamos en la hierba, al lado de la autopista. Margo señaló la hilera de árboles situada entre el interminable aparcamiento del SeaWorld y el agua negra del foso. Corrimos un minuto a lo largo de aquella hilera de árboles y luego Margo me tiró de la camiseta desde atrás y me dijo en voz baja:
vi_translation: After crossing the road, we crouched and walked through the knee-high rush grass by the roadside. Margo pointed to the tree line between the vast, expansive parking lot of SeaWorld and the dark, still moat. We ran along the tree line for about a minute, then Margo tugged at the back of my shirt and whispered, "Just wade through the water."
tr_translation: We managed to cross over and collapsed into the grass that stretched knee-high next to the boulevard. Margo pointed to the row of trees between SeaWorld's vast, enormous parking area and the dark, still water in the ditch. We ran along this row of trees for a minute, then Margo pulled me by the back of my shirt and quietly said, "Now into the ditch."
es_translation: After crossing, we knelt on the grass beside the highway. Margo pointed to the row of trees situated between the endless SeaWorld parking lot and the black water of the moat. We ran for a minute along that row of trees, and then Margo pulled my shirt from behind and whispered to me:

en: “Ladies first,” I said.
vi: “Mời quí cô,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bayanlar önden,” dedim.
es: —Ahora el foso. —Las señoritas primero —le dije.
vi_translation: "Please, ladies," I said.
tr_translation: "Ladies first," I said.
es_translation: —Now the pit. —Ladies first —I said to him.

en: “No, really. Be my guest,” she answered.
vi: “Không đâu, thật đấy. Cậu cứ tự nhiên đi,” cô ấy đáp.
tr: “Hayır, gerçekten. Seni tutmayayım,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —No, de verdad, como si estuvieras en tu casa —me contestó.
vi_translation: "No, really." "Go ahead," she replied.
tr_translation: "No, really." "I won't keep you," he replied.
es_translation: —No, really, make yourself at home —he replied to me.

en: And I didn’t think about the alligators or the disgusting layer of brackish algae. I just got a running start and jumped as far as I could. I landed in waist-deep water and then high-stepped across. The water smelled rank and felt slimy on my skin, but at least I wasn’t wet above my waist. Or at least I wasn’t until Margo jumped in, splashing water all over me. I turned around and splashed her. She faux-retched.
vi: Và tôi chẳng còn nghĩ đến cá sấu hay lớp bùn lầy rong rêu tù đọng bốc mùi nữa. Tôi chỉ chạy lấy đà và nhảy xa hết mức có thể. Tôi rơi xuống một chỗ nước cao đến thắt lưng, liền sải từng bước đi tiếp. Nước xộc lên một mùi nồng nặc và ướt lớp nhớp trên da tôi, nhưng ít nhất từ thắt lưng trở lên tôi không bị ướt. Hoặc ít nhất là tôi chưa bị ướt cho đến khi Margo nhảy xuống, bắn nước tung tóe lên khắp người tôi. Tôi quay lại và té nước lên người cô ấy. Margo giả bộ sặc nước, làu bàu nói:
tr: Ve ben timsahları ya da iğrenç yosun tabakasını düşünmedim. Sadece koşmaya başladım ve yapabildiğim kadar uzağa atladım. Belime kadar gelen suyun içine indim, sonra uzun adımlarla karşıya geçtim. Su iğrenç kokuyor ve tenimde sümüksü bir his yaratıyordu ama en azından belimden yukarısı ıslak değildi. Ya da en azından Margo her tarafıma su sıçratarak atlayana kadar değildi. Arkamı dönüp ben de ona su sıçrattım. Yalancıktan öğürdü.
es: Y no pensé en los caimanes ni en la asquerosa capa de algas salobres. Cogí carrerilla y salté lo más lejos que pude. Aterricé con agua hasta la cintura y avancé a grandes zancadas. El agua olía a podrido y estaba llena de barro, pero al menos no me había mojado de cintura para arriba. O al menos hasta que Margo saltó y me salpicó. Me giré y la salpiqué a ella. Fingió que iba a vomitar.
vi_translation: And I no longer thought about crocodiles or the stagnant, foul-smelling muddy swamp. I just took a running start and jumped as far as I could. I landed in waist-deep water and continued to wade forward. The water reeked and felt slimy on my skin, but at least from the waist up I was dry. Or at least I was until Margo jumped in, splashing water all over me. I turned around and splashed her back. Margo pretended to choke on water and grumbled:
tr_translation: And I didn't think about the crocodiles or the disgusting layer of algae. I just started running and jumped as far as I could. I landed in water up to my waist, then crossed with long strides. The water smelled disgusting and created a slimy feeling on my skin, but at least I wasn't wet above my waist. Or at least not until Margo jumped in, splashing water all over me. I turned around and splashed her back. She pretended to gag.
es_translation: And I didn't think about the alligators or the disgusting layer of brackish algae. I took a running start and jumped as far as I could. I landed in water up to my waist and strode forward with large steps. The water smelled rotten and was full of mud, but at least I hadn't gotten wet from the waist up. Or at least until Margo jumped and splashed me. I turned and splashed her back. She pretended she was going to vomit.

en: “Ninjas don’t splash other ninjas,” Margo complained.
vi: “Ninja không té nước lên người đồng đội.
tr: “Ninjalar, diğer ninjalara su sıçratmazlar,” diye yakındı.
es: —Los ninjas no se salpican entre ellos —se quejó Margo.
vi_translation: "Ninjas do not splash water on their teammates.""
tr_translation: “Ninjas do not splash water on other ninjas,” he complained.
es_translation: —Ninjas don't splash each other —complained Margo.

en: “The true ninja doesn’t make a splash at all,” I said.
vi: “Ninja thứ thiệt không rơi oạch xuống làm nước tóe lên như vậy,” tôi nói.
tr: “Gerçek ninja hiçbir şekilde su sıçratmaz,” dedim.
es: —El auténtico ninja no salpica al saltar —le contesté.
vi_translation: “A real ninja doesn't fall down with a splash like that,” I said.
tr_translation: “A true ninja does not splash water in any way,” I said.
es_translation: —The true ninja doesn't splash when jumping —I replied.

en: “Ooh, touché.”
vi: “Ồ, tớ bị trúng tim đen rồi.”
tr: “Tuşe.
es: —Vale, touché.
vi_translation: “Oh, you hit the nail on the head.”
tr_translation: "Touché.""
es_translation: —Okay, touché.

en: I was watching Margo pull herself up out of the moat. And I was feeling thoroughly pleased about the lack of alligators. And my pulse was acceptable, if brisk. And beneath her unzipped hoodie, her black T-shirt had become clingy in the water. In short, a lot of things were going pretty well when I saw in my peripheral vision a slithering in the water beside Margo. Margo started to step out of the water, and I could see her Achilles tendon tensing, and before I could even say anything, the snake lashed out and bit her left ankle, right below the line of her jeans.
vi: Tôi nhìn Margo đi lên từ hào nước. Tôi thầm mừng rỡ vì không phải đụng độ cá sấu. Mạch máu của tôi nếu có đập nhanh thì cũng ở mức chấp nhận được. Bên dưới vạt áo khoác không cài của Margo, chiếc áo phông đen thấm nước ướt đẫm. Tóm lại, rất nhiều thứ đang diễn ra suôn sẻ, nhưng bất chợt tôi nhác thấy có gì đó loang loáng trên mặt nước ngay cạnh Margo. Cô ấy nhảy lên bờ, tôi thấy gân gót của Margo căng lên, và trước khi tôi kịp kêu lên, con rắn đã bắn đến cắn vào cổ chân trái, ngay dưới gấu quần jeans của cô ấy.
tr: Margo’nun kendini hendekten yukarı çekmesini izliyordum. Ve timsahların yokluğundan gerçekten memnundum. Ve nabzım biraz hızlı atmasına rağmen kabul edilir bir hızdaydı. Ve Margo’nun fermuarı açık kapüşonlu ceketinin altındaki siyah tişörtü ıslanıp üstüne yapışmıştı. Kısacası birçok şey oldukça iyi gidiyordu ki göz ucuyla Margo’nun yanında, suda sürünerek ilerleyen bir şey olduğunu fark ettim. Margo sudan çıkmaya başladı, aşil tendonunun gerginleştiğini görebiliyordum ve daha ben bir şey söyleyemeden yılan saldırıp paçasının tam aşağısından sol bileğini ısırdı.
es: Observé a Margo saliendo del foso, encantado de la vida de que no hubiera caimanes. Mi pulso era aceptable, aunque acelerado. El agua ceñía al cuerpo de Margo la camiseta negra que llevaba debajo de la sudadera desabrochada. En resumen, casi todo iba perfecto cuando vi de reojo algo que serpenteaba en el agua cerca de Margo. Margo empezó a salir del agua y vi que tensaba el tendón de Aquiles. Antes de que yo pudiera abrir la boca, la serpiente se abalanzó sobre ella y le mordió el tobillo izquierdo, justo donde acababan los vaqueros.
vi_translation: I watched Margo climb up from the moat. I was secretly relieved that we didn't have to deal with any crocodiles. My pulse, if it was racing, was still at an acceptable level. Underneath Margo's unbuttoned coat, her black T-shirt was soaking wet. In short, many things were going smoothly, but suddenly I caught a glimpse of something shimmering on the water's surface right next to Margo. She jumped onto the shore, I saw Margo's Achilles tendon tighten, and before I could shout, the snake had already struck, biting her left ankle just below the hem of her jeans.
tr_translation: I was watching Margo pull herself up from the ditch. And I was genuinely glad for the absence of crocodiles. And although my pulse was a bit fast, it was at an acceptable rate. And the black t-shirt under Margo's unzipped hooded jacket was wet and clinging to her. In short, many things were going quite well until I noticed out of the corner of my eye that there was something crawling in the water next to Margo. Margo started to get out of the water, I could see her Achilles tendon tensing, and before I could say anything, the snake attacked and bit her left ankle just below her cuff.
es_translation: I watched Margo coming out of the pit, delighted that there were no alligators. My pulse was acceptable, though accelerated. The water clung to Margo's body, making the black t-shirt she wore under her unbuttoned sweatshirt stick to her. In short, almost everything was perfect when I saw out of the corner of my eye something slithering in the water near Margo. Margo started to get out of the water, and I saw her Achilles tendon tighten. Before I could open my mouth, the snake lunged at her and bit her left ankle, right where her jeans ended.

en: “Shit!” Margo said, and she looked down and then said “Shit!” again. The snake was still attached. I dove down and grabbed the snake by the tail and ripped it from Margo’s leg and threw it into the moat. “Ow, God,” she said. “What was it? Was it a moccasin?”
vi: “Bỏ xừ!” Margo thốt lên, cô ấy nhìn xuống và lại nói “Bỏ xừ rồi!” Con rắn vẫn chưa rời chân Margo. Tôi lao đến tóm lấy đuôi rắn, giật nó ra khỏi chân cô ấy và ném thẳng xuống hào nước. “Ôi trời ơi,” Margo kêu lên. “Con gì vậy? Có phải rắn hổ mang không?”
tr: “Kahretsin!” dedi Margo, aşağı baktı ve sonra tekrar, “Kahretsin!” dedi. Yılan hâlâ ayağındaydı. Aşağı uzanıp yılanı kuyruğundan yakaladım ve Margo’nun bacağından söküp hendeğin içine fırlattım. “Ah, Tanrım,” dedi. “Neydi o? Zehirli su yılanı mıydı?
es: —¡Mierda! —exclamó Margo. Miró hacia abajo y repitió—: ¡Mierda! La serpiente seguía aferrada a su tobillo. Me sumergí, agarré la serpiente por la cola, la arranqué de la pierna de Margo y la lancé al foso. —Ay, joder —dijo—. ¿Qué era? ¿Era una boca de algodón?
vi_translation: "Oh no!" Margo exclaimed, she looked down and said again, "Oh no!" The snake still hadn't left Margo's leg. I rushed over, grabbed the snake's tail, yanked it off her leg, and threw it straight into the moat. "Oh my God," Margo cried out. "What was that? Was it a cobra?"
tr_translation: “Damn it!” said Margo, looked down and then again, “Damn it!” she said. The snake was still on her foot. I reached down, grabbed the snake by its tail, and yanked it off Margo’s leg, throwing it into the ditch. “Oh, God,” she said. “What was that? Was it a venomous water snake?”
es_translation: —Shit! —exclaimed Margo. She looked down and repeated—: Shit! The snake was still clinging to her ankle. I dived in, grabbed the snake by the tail, tore it off Margo's leg, and threw it into the pit. —Oh, damn —he said—. What was it? Was it a cotton mouth?

en: “I don’t know. Lie down, lie down,” I said, and then I took her leg in my hands, and I pulled up her jeans. There were two drops of blood coming out where the fangs had been, and I leaned down and put my mouth on the wound and sucked as hard as I could, trying to draw out the venom. I spit, and was going to go back to her leg when she said, “Wait, I see it.” I jumped up, terrified, and she said, “No, no, God, it’s just a garter snake.” She was pointing into the moat, and I followed her finger and could see the little garter snake skirting along the surface, swimming beneath a floodlight’s skirt. From the well-lit distance, the thing didn’t look much scarier than a baby lizard.
vi: “Tớ không biết. Nằm xuống, nằm xuống đi,” tôi nói rồi nâng chân Margo trong tay và kéo gấu quần jeans của cô ấy lên. Có hai giọt máu rỉ ra từ vết cắn, tôi cúi xuống, áp miệng lên vết thương và hút mạnh hết sức, cố gắng rút nọc độc ra. Tôi nhổ máu đi, định hút tiếp thì cô ấy nói, “Từ từ đã, tớ thấy nó rồi.” Tôi hoảng hồn đứng bật dậy, Margo nói, “Trời ơi, không sao, loài này không độc.” Cô ấy chỉ về phía hào nước, tôi theo hướng ngón tay Margo và thấy một con rắn sọc nhỏ đang lướt dọc mép nước, bơi ngay chỗ có ánh đèn rọi xuống. Nhìn ở chỗ đủ sáng, con rắn chỉ như con thằn lằn con, chẳng đáng sợ mấy.
tr: “Bilmiyorum. Uzan, uzan,” dedim ve bacağım tutup kot pantolonunu yukarı çektim. Yılanın dişlediği yerden iki kan damlası çıkmıştı, eğilip ağzımı yaranın üstüne koydum ve yapabildiğim kadar güçlü bir şekilde emerek zehri çıkarmaya çalıştım. Tükürdüm, bacağına geri dönecektim ki “Bekle, onu görüyorum,” dedi. Dehşete düşmüş bir halde zıpladım ve Margo, “Hayır hayır, Tanrım, sadece küçük bir yılan,” dedi. Hendeğin içini gösteriyordu, parmağım takip ettim ve yüzeyin yakınında, bir projektör ışığının kenarında yüzen küçük yılanı görebildim. İyi aydınlatılmış mesafeden yaratık bir yavru kertenkeleden daha korkutucu görünmüyordu.
es: —No lo sé. Túmbate, túmbate —le ordené. Le cogí la pierna y le subí los vaqueros. Los colmillos habían dejado dos agujeritos de los que salía una gota de sangre. Me agaché, puse la boca en la herida y succioné con todas mis fuerzas para intentar sacar el veneno. Escupí, y me disponía a volver a succionar cuando Margo dijo: —Espera, la veo. Me levanté de un salto, aterrorizado. —No, no —siguió diciendo—. Joder, es solo una culebra. Señaló el foso. Seguí su dedo y vi la pequeña culebra serpenteando por la superficie, justo debajo del haz de un foco. Desde la distancia no parecía mucho más temible que una lagartija.
vi_translation: "I don't know." "Lie down, lie down," I said, then lifted Margo's leg in my hands and rolled up the cuff of her jeans. Two drops of blood oozed from the bite, I bent down, pressed my mouth to the wound, and sucked hard, trying to draw out the venom. I spat out the blood, intending to suck again, but she said, "Wait, I see it. "I jumped up in a panic, Margo said, "Oh my God, it's okay, this species isn't venomous. " She pointed towards the moat, I followed Margo's finger and saw a small striped snake gliding along the edge of the water, swimming right where the light shone down. In the light, the snake looked just like a small lizard, not very scary.
tr_translation: “I don't know. Lie down, lie down,” I said and grabbed his leg, pulling up his jeans. Two drops of blood had come out from where the snake had bitten, I bent down and placed my mouth over the wound, trying to suck out the venom as strongly as I could. I spat, was about to go back to his leg when he said, “Wait, I see it.” I jumped up in horror and Margo said, “No no, God, it's just a small snake.” She was pointing inside the ditch, my finger followed I did, and near the surface, I could see a small snake swimming at the edge of a projector light. From the well-lit distance, the creature didn't look more frightening than a baby lizard.
es_translation: —I don't know. Lie down, lie down —I ordered him. I grabbed his leg and rolled up his jeans. The fangs had left two small holes from which a drop of blood was oozing. I bent down, put my mouth on the wound, and sucked with all my strength to try to extract the venom. I spat, and was about to suck again when Margo said: —Wait, I see her. I jumped up, terrified. —No, no —he kept saying—. Damn, it's just a snake. He pointed to the pit. I followed his finger and saw the small snake slithering across the surface, just below the beam of a spotlight. From a distance, it didn't look much more fearsome than a lizard.

en: “Thank God,” I said, sitting down next to her and catching my breath.
vi: “Ơn giời,” tôi nói, ngồi xuống cạnh Margo và lấy lại nhịp thở của mình.
tr: ‘Tanrıya şükür,” dedim Margo’nun yanma oturup soluklanırken.
es: —Gracias a Dios —dije sentándome a su lado y recuperando el aliento.
vi_translation: “Thank goodness,” I said, sitting down next to Margo and catching my breath.
tr_translation: “Thank God,” I said as I sat down next to Margo to catch my breath.
es_translation: —Thank God —I said, sitting down next to him and catching my breath.

en: After looking at the bite and seeing that the bleeding had already stopped, she asked, “How was making out with my leg?”
vi: Sau khi xem vết cắn và nhận ra máu đã cầm, cô ấy hỏi tôi, “Gặm chân tớ thấy thế nào?”
tr: Isırığa bakıp kanamanın çoktan durduğunu gördükten sonra, “Bacağımla yiyişmek nasıldı?” diye sordu.
es: Tras echar un vistazo a la mordedura y ver que ya no sangraba, me preguntó: —¿Qué tal el filete que te has pegado con mi pierna?
vi_translation: After looking at the bite and realizing the bleeding had stopped, she asked me, "How does biting my leg feel?"
tr_translation: After looking at the bite and seeing that the bleeding had already stopped, she asked, “How was it to mess with my leg?”
es_translation: After taking a look at the bite and seeing that it was no longer bleeding, he asked me: —How was the steak you had with my leg?

en: “Pretty good,” I said, which was true. She leaned her body into mine a little and I could feel her upper arm against my ribs.
vi: “Ngon đấy,” tôi đáp, vì đúng là như vậy. Margo hơi nghiêng người về phía tôi, tôi cảm thấy cánh tay cô ấy áp vào sườn mình.
tr: “Oldukça iyi,” dedim ki bu doğruydu. Vücudunu benimkine biraz yasladı ve üst kolunu kaburgalarımda hissettim.
es: —Muy bien —le contesté, y era cierto. Se inclinó un poco hacia mí y sentí su brazo en mis costillas.
vi_translation: "Delicious," I replied, because it truly was. Margo leaned slightly towards me, and I felt her arm press against my side.
tr_translation: "Quite well," I said, which was true. She leaned her body slightly against mine, and I felt her upper arm on my ribs.
es_translation: —Very well —I replied, and it was true. He leaned in a little towards me and I felt his arm against my ribs.

en: “I shaved this morning for precisely that reason. I was like, ‘Well, you never know when someone is going to clamp down on your calf and try to suck out the snake poison.’”
vi: “Tớ cạo lông chưn sáng nay chính vì lí do này, kiểu như: Ái chà, biết đâu có người trong lúc cấp bách sẽ tóm lấy bắp chân mình mà hút nọc rắn ra.”
tr: “Tam olarak bu nedenle, bu sabah tıraş olmuştum. Düşündüm ki ‘Birinin ne zaman baldırına yapışıp yılan zehri emmeye çalışacağını bilemezsin.
es: —Me he depilado esta mañana precisamente por eso. He pensado: «Bueno, nunca se sabe cuándo alguien te agarrará de la pierna para succionarte el veneno de una serpiente».
vi_translation: "I shaved my legs this morning precisely for this reason, like: Oh, you never know, someone might urgently grab my calf to suck out the snake venom."
tr_translation: “That's exactly why I shaved this morning. I thought, 'You never know when you'll have to latch onto someone's calf and try to suck out snake venom.'”
es_translation: —I shaved this morning precisely because of that. I thought: "Well, you never know when someone will grab your leg to suck out snake venom."

en: There was a chain-link fence before us, but it was only about six feet tall. As Margo put it, “Honestly, first garter snakes and now this fence? This security is sort of insulting to a ninja.” She scampered up, swung her body around, and climbed down like it was a ladder. I managed not to fall.
vi: Có một hàng rào mắt cáo trước mặt chúng tôi, nhưng chỉ cao cỡ hai mét. Như Margo nhận xét, “Thật không vậy, thoạt đầu là con rắn ranh, rồi đến hàng rào này sao? An ninh kiểu này sỉ nhục ninja quá.” Cô ấy leo lên, lẳng người qua và trèo xuống, uyển chuyển như bước trên thang vậy. Tôi cũng cố không để bị ngã.
tr: Önümüzde tel örgüler vardı ama sadece yaklaşık iki metre yükseklikteydi. Margo’nun ifade ettiği gibi, “İnanılır gibi değil, önce yılanlar, şimdi de tel örgü mü yani? Bu güvenlik bir ninja için hakaret sayılır.” Çabucak tırmandı ve sanki tel örgü bir merdivenmiş gibi tutunarak aşağı indi. Ben de düşmemeyi başardım.
es: Ante nosotros había una valla de tela metálica de apenas dos metros de altura. —¿En serio? ¿Primero culebras y ahora esta valla? —dijo Margo—. Esta seguridad es insultante para un ninja. Trepó, pasó al otro lado y bajó como si fuera una escalera. Yo intenté no caerme.
vi_translation: There was a chain-link fence in front of us, but it was only about two meters high. As Margo remarked, "Really, first a sneaky snake, and now this fence?" "This kind of security is an insult to ninjas." She climbed up, swung herself over, and climbed down as gracefully as if she were walking on a ladder. I also tried not to fall.
tr_translation: There were barbed wires in front of us, but they were only about two meters high. As Margo put it, "Unbelievable, first snakes, now barbed wire? This security is an insult to a ninja." She quickly climbed up and descended as if the barbed wire were a ladder. I also managed not to fall.
es_translation: In front of us, there was a wire mesh fence barely two meters high. —Seriously? First snakes and now this fence? —said Margo—. This security is insulting for a ninja. He climbed over, went to the other side, and descended as if it were a staircase. I tried not to fall.

en: We ran through a small thicket of trees, hugging tight against these huge opaque tanks that might have stored animals, and then we came out to an asphalt path and I could see the big amphitheater where Shamu splashed me when I was a kid. The little speakers lining the walkway were playing soft Muzak. Maybe to keep the animals calm. “Margo,” I said, “we’re in SeaWorld.”
vi: Chúng tôi chạy qua một bụi cây nhỏ san sát, bám chặt trên những bể chứa lớn màu xanh ngọc, chắc hẳn có động vật ở trong. Chúng tôi chạy đến một dải đường nhựa, từ đây tôi thấy được khán phòng lớn nơi Shamu từng làm bắn nước lên tôi hồi tôi còn bé. Giàn loa nhỏ mắc dọc lối đi đang phát nhạc không lời êm dịu. Chắc để các con vật cũng cảm thấy êm dịu. “Margo ơi,” tôi nói, “tụi mình ở trong SeaWorld rồi.”
tr: içinde hayvanların olabileceği kocaman opak havuzlara sıkıca yapışarak, küçük bir ağaç sırasının arasından koştuk, sonra asfalt bir patikaya çıktık ve çocukken Shamu’nun üstüme su sıçrattığı büyük amfiyi gördüm. Yürüme platformu boyunca sıralanmış küçük hoparlörlerden yumuşak bir müzik çalıyordu. Belki de hayvanları sakinleştirmek içindi. “Margo,” dedim, “SeaWorld’deyiz.
es: Atravesamos un pequeño soto pegados a unos enormes depósitos opacos en los que seguramente guardaban animales, fuimos a parar a un camino asfaltado y vi el gran anfiteatro en el que Shamu me salpicó de niño. Los pequeños altavoces a lo largo del camino reproducían música ambiental, quizá para tranquilizar a los animales. —Margo —le dije—, estamos en el SeaWorld. —Efectivamente —me contestó.
vi_translation: We ran through a small, dense thicket, clinging tightly to the large turquoise tanks, surely containing animals inside. We ran to a strip of asphalt road, from here I could see the large auditorium where Shamu once splashed water on me when I was little. Small speakers along the path were playing soothing instrumental music. Probably to make the animals feel calm too. "Margo," I said, "we're in SeaWorld now."
tr_translation: We ran tightly clinging to the large opaque pools that might contain animals, through a small row of trees, and then we emerged onto an asphalt path where I saw the big amphitheater where Shamu splashed water on me when I was a child. Soft music was playing from small speakers lined up along the walking platform. Maybe it was to calm the animals. “Margo,” I said, “we're in SeaWorld.”
es_translation: We passed through a small grove next to some huge opaque tanks where they surely kept animals, we ended up on a paved road and I saw the great amphitheater where Shamu splashed me as a child. The small speakers along the path played ambient music, perhaps to calm the animals. —Margo —I said—, we are at SeaWorld. —Indeed —he replied to me.

en: And she said, “Seriously,” and then she jogged away and I followed her. We ended up by the seal tank, but it seemed like there were no seals inside it.
vi: Margo đáp, “Hẳn rồi,” và cô ấy bắt đầu đi quanh còn tôi đi theo. Chúng tôi dừng lại trước khu nuôi hải cẩu, nhưng hình như không có con hải cẩu nào ở trong.
tr: O da “Cidden,” dedi, sonra koştu, ben de onu takip ettim. Fok balığı havuzunun yanında durduk ama içinde hiç fok yokmuş gibi görünüyordu.
es: Echó a correr y la seguí. Acabamos en el acuario de las focas, que parecía vacío.
vi_translation: Margo replied, "Sure," and she started walking around while I followed. We stopped in front of the seal enclosure, but it seemed like there were no seals inside.
tr_translation: He said, "Really," then ran, and I followed him. We stopped by the seal pool, but it looked like there were no seals in it.
es_translation: She started running and I followed her. We ended up at the seal aquarium, which seemed empty.

en: “Margo,” I said again. “We’re in SeaWorld.”
vi: “Margo ơi,” tôi nói lại lần nữa. “Chúng ta ở trong SeaWorld rồi.”
tr: “Margo,” dedim tekrar. “SeaWorld’deyiz.
es: —Margo, estamos en el SeaWorld —repetí.
vi_translation: “Margo,” I said again. “We are in SeaWorld now.”
tr_translation: “Margo,” I said again. “We are at SeaWorld.”
es_translation: —Margo, we are at SeaWorld —I repeated.

en: “Enjoy it,” she said without moving her mouth much. “’Cause here comes security.”
vi: “Hãy vui đi,” cô ấy nói mà như không cử động môi. “Vì an ninh đến rồi kìa.” Tôi phóng vội qua mấy bụi cây cao đến thắt lưng, nhưng Margo không chạy nên tôi dừng lại.
tr: ‘Tadım çıkar,” dedi ağzını fazla oynatmadan. “Çünkü güvenlik geliyor.” Bele kadar gelen çalıların arasına atladım ama Margo koşmayınca durdum.
es: —Disfrútalo —me contestó sin mover apenas la boca—. Porque por ahí viene un vigilante.
vi_translation: “Be happy,” she said without moving her lips. “Because security is coming.” I quickly dashed through the waist-high bushes, but Margo didn't run, so I stopped.
tr_translation: “I’m having fun,” he said without moving his mouth too much. “Because security is coming.” I jumped into the waist-high bushes but stopped when Margo didn’t run.
es_translation: —Enjoy it —he replied to me without barely moving his mouth—. Because a guard is coming this way.

en: I dashed through a stand of waist-high bushes, but when Margo didn’t run, I stopped.
vi: Tôi phóng vội qua mấy bụi cây cao đến thắt lưng, nhưng Margo không chạy nên tôi dừng lại.
tr: Bele kadar gelen çalıların arasına atladım ama Margo koşmayınca durdum.
es: Corrí hacia una zona de matorrales que me llegaban a la cintura, pero al ver que Margo no corría, me detuve.
vi_translation: “Because security is coming.” I quickly dashed through the waist-high bushes, but Margo didn't run, so I stopped.

es_translation: I ran towards a bushy area that reached my waist, but seeing that Margo wasn't running, I stopped.

en: A guy strolled up wearing a SEAWORLD SECURITY vest and very casually asked, “How y’all?” He held a can of something in his hand—pepper spray, I guessed.

tr: SEAWORLD GÜVENLİK yeleği giyen bir adam bize yaklaştı ve oldukça rahat bir tavırla, “Nasılsınız genç ler?” diye sordu. Elinde bir kutu tutuyordu... biber gazı olduğuna dair fikir yürüttüm.
es: Un tipo vestido de sport y con un chaleco en el que ponía SEGURIDAD SEAWORLD se acercó. —¿Qué hacéis aquí? Llevaba en la mano una lata, supuse que de gas pimienta.

es_translation: A guy dressed in casual clothes and wearing a vest that said SEAWORLD SECURITY approached. —What are you doing here? He was carrying a can in his hand, which I assumed was pepper spray.

en: To stay calm, I wondered to myself, Does he have regular handcuffs, or does he have special SeaWorld handcuffs? Like, are they shaped like two curved dolphins coming together?

tr: Sakin kalmak için, kendi kendime düşünmeye başladım. Sıradan kelepçelerden mi taşıyor yoksa özel SeaWorld kelepçelen mi var? Birbirine geçen iki kavisli yunus şeklinde falan mı acaba?
es: Para tranquilizarme, me preguntaba: «¿Las esposas son estándares, o son esposas especiales para el SeaWorld? Por ejemplo, en forma de dos delfines curvados».
vi_translation: To calm myself down, I wondered, Does he have regular handcuffs or does he use special SeaWorld handcuffs? Like handcuffs shaped like two dolphins arching their backs?
tr_translation: To stay calm, I started thinking to myself. Are they using ordinary handcuffs or special SeaWorld handcuffs? Are they perhaps two interlocking dolphin-shaped ones?
es_translation: To calm myself, I wondered: "Are the handcuffs standard, or are they special handcuffs for SeaWorld? For example, in the shape of two curved dolphins."

en: “You know a man got kilt here a couple years ago jumping in the big tank, and they told us we cain’t never let anybody go if they break in, no matter if they’re pretty.” Margo pulled her shirt out so it wouldn’t look so clingy. And only then did I realize he was talking to her breasts.

It was only then that I realized he was talking about her chest.

Margo tugged at her shirt so it wouldn't look too tight. Only then did I realize that the man was talking to Margo's breasts.

Margo pulled at her shirt to lift it a bit off her body. And only at that moment did I realize that the guy was talking to her breasts.

en: “Well, then I guess you have to arrest us.”

Cô ấy ngúc ngoắc bàn tay trong túi áo ướt và rút ra tờ một trăm đô-la ướt nhẹp thứ nước ở trong hào.
tr: “Ama olay şu. Yola çıkmak, eve gidip bi bira içmek ve biraz uyumak üzereydim ve eğer polisi ararsam, gelmek için hiç mi hiç acele etmeyecekler. Sadece sesli düşünüyorum,” dedi, sonra Margo onaylayarak gözlerini kaldırdı. Bir elini ıslak cebine götürüp hendekteki suyla sırılsıklam olmuş yüz dolarlık banknot çıkardı.
es: —Bueno, entonces supongo que tiene que detenernos. —Lo que pasa es que estoy a punto de salir, largarme a mi casa, tomarme una cerveza y dormir un rato, pero si llamo a la policía, tardarán lo suyo en venir. Solo estoy pensando en voz alta —dijo. Margo lo entendió y miró al cielo. Se metió una mano en el bolsillo y sacó un billete de cien dólares que se le había mojado en el foso.
vi_translation: “But the main issue here. You're about to finish work, want to go home, have a beer, and take a nap. If you call the police, they will take their precious time to come here. You're speaking your thoughts out loud, you know,” he said, and Margo raised her eyebrows in understanding. She fumbled her hand in the wet pocket and pulled out a hundred-dollar bill soaked with the water from the moat.
tr_translation: “But the thing is this. I was about to hit the road, go home, have a beer, and get some sleep, and if I call the police, they won't be in any hurry to come. I'm just thinking out loud,” he said, then Margo looked up in agreement. He put his hand into his wet pocket and pulled out a hundred-dollar bill soaked from the water in the ditch.
es_translation: —Well, then I guess you have to arrest us. —What happens is that I'm about to leave, go home, have a beer, and sleep for a while, but if I call the police, they'll take their time to come. I'm just thinking out loud —he said. Margo understood it and looked at the sky. She put a hand in her pocket and took out a hundred-dollar bill that had gotten wet in the pit.

en: The guard said, “Well, y’all best be getting on now. If I were you, I wouldn’t walk out past the whale tank. It’s got all-night security cameras all ’round it, and we wouldn’t want anyone to know y’all was here.”
vi: Người bảo vệ nói, “Chà, cô em nên đi ngay đi. Nếu là anh thì anh sẽ không loạng quạng đi ngang bể cá voi đâu. Quanh đó có camera an ninh bật suốt đêm, và tụi anh không muốn ai biết rằng cô em đã ở đây.”
tr: Bekçi, “Peki, en iyisi siz şimdi çıkın. Yerinizde olsaydım balina havuzunun yamndan geçerek dışarı çıkmazdım. Havuzun her yanında bütün gece çalışan güvenlik kameraları var ve birinin sizin burda olduğunuzu fark etmesini istemeyiz.
es: —Bueno —dijo el vigilante—, y ahora será mejor que os marchéis. Yo de vosotros no pasaría por el acuario de las ballenas. Está rodeado de cámaras de seguridad que funcionan toda la noche, y no creo que queráis que se sepa que habéis estado aquí.
vi_translation: The guard said, "Well, miss, you should leave right away. If it were me, I wouldn't be wandering around the whale tank. There are security cameras on all night around there, and we don't want anyone to know that you were here."
tr_translation: The guard said, "Well, it's best if you leave now. If I were you, I wouldn't exit by passing next to the whale pool. There are security cameras working all night around the pool, and we don't want anyone to notice that you were here."
es_translation: —Alright —said the guard—, and now it would be best if you leave. If I were you, I wouldn't go by the whale aquarium. It's surrounded by security cameras that operate all night, and I don't think you want it known that you've been here.

en: “Yessir,” Margo said demurely, and with that the man walked off into the darkness. “Man,” Margo mumbled as the guy walked away, “I really didn’t want to pay that perv. But, oh well. Money’s for spendin’.” I could barely even hear her; the only thing happening was the relief shivering out of my skin. This raw pleasure was worth all the worry that preceded it.
vi: “Rõ ạ,” Margo e dè đáp, và người bảo vệ đi tiếp về phía khu vực tối. “Trời ạ,” Margo lẩm bẩm khi anh ta đã đi khuất, “tớ thực sự không muốn xì tiền cho gã dê xồm đó. Nhưng thôi, tiền là để tiêu.” Tôi gần như không nghe rõ những lời ấy, điều duy nhất tôi cảm thấy là cơn thở phào lan ra trên da. Cái cảm giác khoan khoái một cách rất thô thiển này cũng xứng đáng với những lo lắng lúc trước lắm chứ.

Ama boş ver. Para harcanmak içindir.” Onu doğru düzgün duyamıyordum bile; olan tek şey, tenimden dalga dalga yayılan rahatlama hissiydi. Bu saf keyif, öncesinde yaşanan bütün endişelere değerdi.
es: —Sí, señor —añadió Margo recatadamente. Y el tipo desapareció en la oscuridad. —Joder —murmuró Margo en cuanto el tipo se hubo alejado—, la verdad es que no quería dar dinero a ese degenerado, pero, bueno, el dinero está para gastarlo. Apenas la escuchaba. Lo único que sentía era el alivio recorriéndome la piel. Aquel placer en estado puro compensaba todas las preocupaciones anteriores.
vi_translation: “Understood,” Margo replied cautiously, and the guard continued towards the dark area. “Oh my God,” Margo muttered once he was out of sight, “I really don't want to shell out money to that pervert.” “But well, money is meant to be spent.” I could barely hear those words; the only thing I felt was a sigh of relief spreading across my skin. This crude sense of relief was well worth the previous worries.
tr_translation: “At your service,” said Margo with a dignified manner, and with that, the man disappeared into the darkness. “Oh,” murmured Margo once the man was gone, “I really didn't want to give money to that creep. But never mind. Money is meant to be spent.” I could barely hear her; the only thing was, wave after wave from my skin the spreading feeling of relaxation. This pure pleasure was worth all the worries experienced before.

And the guy disappeared into the darkness. —Damn —murmured Margo as soon as the guy had walked away—, the truth is I didn't want to give money to that degenerate, but, well, money is there to be spent. I barely listened to her. The only thing I felt was relief coursing through my skin. That pure state of pleasure made up for all the previous worries.

en: Margo didn’t respond. She was staring past me, her eyes squinting almost closed. “I felt this exact same way when I got into Universal Studios,” she said after a moment. “It’s kind of cool and everything, but there’s nothing much to see. The rides aren’t working. Everything cool is locked up. Most of the animals are put into different tanks at night.” She turned her head and appraised the SeaWorld we could see. “I guess the pleasure isn’t being inside.”

Cô ấy nhìn xa xôi, hai mắt nhíu lại gần như nhắm. “Tớ cảm thấy lần này giống hệt hồi vào trong phim trường của hãng Universal,” lát sau Margo nói. “Chỗ này cũng hay hay, đại loại thế, nhưng chẳng có gì xem được nữa. Các loại xe trượt cảm giác mạnh không hoạt động. Những thứ hay ho đều bị khóa lại cả rồi. Buổi đêm đa phần các con vật đều bị nhốt trong các lồng bể khác nhau.” Margo quay đầu lại và nhận xét về SeaWorld mà chúng tôi đang chứng kiến. “Tớ nghĩ phần lí thú không phải là được đứng ở đây.”

Benim arkamda bir yerlere bakıyordu, gözleri kısık, neredeyse kapalıydı. “Universal Stüdyoları’na girdiğimde de tam olarak böyle hissetmiştim,” dedi kısa bir süre sonra. “Çok güzel falan ama görülecek pek bir şey yok. Turlar çalışmıyor. Güzel olan her şey kilitli. Hayvanların çoğu geceleri farkh havuzlara konuyor.” Başım çevirdi ve SeaWorld’e değer biçercesine baktı. “Sanırım işin keyfi içeride olmak değil.
es: Margo no me contestó. Miraba al frente con los ojos entrecerrados. —Me sentí exactamente igual cuando me metí en los Estudios Universal —dijo un momento después—. Son geniales, aunque no hay mucho que ver. Las atracciones no funcionan. Todo lo guapo está cerrado. Por la noche meten a casi todos los animales en otros acuarios. —Giró la cabeza y observó el SeaWorld, que teníamos ante nosotros—. Me temo que el placer no es estar dentro.

The thrill rides aren't operating. The interesting things are all locked up. At night, most of the animals are locked in different tanks." Margo turned her head and commented about the SeaWorld we were witnessing. "I think the fun part isn't about standing here."

en: “Planning, I guess. I don’t know. Doing stuff never feels as good as you hope it will feel.”

en: “This feels pretty good to me,” I confessed. “Even if there isn’t anything to see.” I sat down on a park bench, and she joined me. We were both looking out at the seal tank, but it contained no seals, just an unoccupied island with rocky outcroppings made of plastic. I could smell her next to me, the sweat and the algae from the moat, her shampoo like lilacs, and the smell of her skin like crushed almonds.

Chúng tôi cùng nhìn về phía khu hải cẩu, nhưng không có con hải cẩu nào ở trong, chỉ là hòn đảo nhỏ chẳng có gì ngoài mấy đụn giả sơn xù xì bằng chất dẻo. Tôi ngửi thấy mùi của Margo ngay bên mình, mùi mồ hôi và rong rêu từ hào nước, mùi dầu gội đầu thơm như tử đinh hương, và mùi làn da cô ấy, thoang thoảng như hạnh nhân mới nghiền vậy.
tr: “Bu bana oldukça iyi hissettiriyor,” diye itiraf ettim. “Görecek hiçbir şey olmasa bile.” Bir banka oturdum, Margo da bana katıldı. İkimiz de fok havuzuna bakıyorduk ama içinde hiç fok yoktu, yalnızca plastikten yapılmış kaya gibi çıkıntıları olan boş bir ada gibiydi. Yanımdaki Margo’nun kokusunu duyabiliyordum; ter ve hendekteki yosun, leylak kokulu şampuanı ve badem ezmesi gibi kokan teni.
es: —Para mí no está tan mal —admití—. Aunque no haya nada que ver. Me senté en un banco y Margo vino a sentarse conmigo. Observamos el acuario de las focas, en el que no había focas. No era más que un islote deshabitado con salientes de plástico. Me llegaba el olor de Margo, el sudor y las algas del foso, su champú de lilas y el aroma a almendras machacadas de su piel.
vi_translation: "I find this game quite fun," I admitted. "Even though there's nothing to see." I sat down on a bench, Margo sat down next to me.
