I could smell Margo right beside me, the scent of sweat and algae from the moat, the lilac-scented shampoo, and her skin, faintly reminiscent of freshly ground almonds.
tr_translation: “This makes me feel pretty good,” I confessed. “Even if there’s nothing to see.” I sat on a bench, and Margo joined me. We were both looking at the seal pool, but there were no seals in it, just an empty island with plastic rock-like protrusions. I could smell Margo next to me; sweat and ditch algae, her lilac-scented shampoo, and her skin that smelled like marzipan.
es_translation: —It's not that bad for me —I admitted—. Even though there's nothing to see. I sat on a bench and Margo came to sit with me. We watched the seal aquarium, in which there were no seals. It was nothing more than an uninhabited islet with plastic protrusions. I could smell Margo, the sweat and the algae from the moat, her lilac shampoo, and the scent of crushed almonds from her skin.

en: I felt tired for the first time, and I thought of us lying down on some grassy patch of SeaWorld together, me on my back and she on her side with her arm draped against me, her head on my shoulder, facing me. Not doing anything—just lying there together beneath the sky, the night here so well lit that it drowns out the stars. And maybe I could feel her breathe against my neck, and maybe we could just stay there until morning and then the people would walk past as they came into the park, and they would see us and think that we were tourists, too, and we could just disappear into them.
vi: Lần đầu tiên tôi thấy mệt. Và tôi mường tượng ra cảnh chúng tôi nằm bên nhau trên vạt cỏ trong SeaWorld, tôi nằm ngửa còn Margo nằm nghiêng, cánh tay buông trên người tôi, đầu ngả vào vai tôi và đang nhìn tôi. Không làm gì cả–chỉ nằm cạnh nhau dưới bầu trời, màn đêm ở đây vẫn sáng quá, lút cả những vì sao. Và hình như tôi cảm nhận được hơi thở của Margo mơn man trên cổ mình, và có lẽ chúng tôi có thể cứ nằm như vậy đến sáng, mọi người bắt đầu đi ngang qua chúng tôi khi họ vào đây, họ sẽ thấy chúng tôi và sẽ nghĩ rằng chúng tôi cũng là khách tham quan, và thế là chúng tôi chỉ việc nhập vào và biến mất trong đám du khách.
tr: İlk defa yorgun hissettim ve ikimizi SeaWorld’deki bir çimenlikte beraber uzanırken düşündüm; ben sırtüstü, o yan yatmış ve kolunu bana dolamış halde, başı omzumda, yüzü bana dönük. Hiçbir şey yapmıyoruz... sadece gökyüzünün altında uzanıyoruz ve gece o kadar iyi aydınlatılmış ki yıldızların ışıltısını bastırıyor. Belki nefesini boynumda hissediyorum ve belki sabaha kadar orada öylece kahyoruz, sonra insanlar parka gelince yammızdan yürüyüp geçiyorlar, bizi görüp bizim de turist olduğumuzu düşünüyorlar ve onların arasında gözden kayboluyoruz.
es: Por primera vez me sentí cansado y nos imaginé tumbados juntos en el césped del SeaWorld, yo boca arriba y ella de lado, pasándome un brazo por encima y con la cabeza apoyada en mi hombro, mirándome. No hacíamos nada. Simplemente estábamos tumbados juntos bajo el cielo. La noche estaba tan iluminada que no se veían las estrellas. Y quizá sentía su respiración en el cuello, y quizá nos quedaríamos allí hasta la mañana, y entonces la gente pasaría por delante de nosotros al entrar al parque, nos vería y pensaría que también éramos turistas, y podríamos desaparecer entre ellos.
vi_translation: The first time I felt tired. And I imagined the scene of us lying next to each other on the grass at SeaWorld, me lying on my back and Margo lying on her side, her arm draped over me, her head resting on my shoulder and looking at me. Doing nothing at all—just lying next to each other under the sky, the night here still so bright, obscuring all the stars. And it seemed like I could feel Margo's breath gently caressing my neck, and maybe we could just lie there until morning, people starting to walk past us as they enter, they would see us and think that we were visitors too, and then we would just blend in and disappear among the tourists.
tr_translation: For the first time, I felt tired and thought of us lying together on a grassy area at SeaWorld; me on my back, her lying on her side with her arm wrapped around me, her head on my shoulder, her face turned towards me. We are not doing anything... just lying under the sky, and the night is so well-lit that it outshines the stars. Maybe I feel her breath on my neck and maybe we stay there until morning, then as people come to the park, they walk past us, see us and think we are tourists too, and we disappear among them.
es_translation: For the first time, I felt tired and imagined us lying together on the grass at SeaWorld, me on my back and her on her side, with an arm over me and her head resting on my shoulder, looking at me. We weren't doing anything. We were simply lying together under the sky. The night was so bright that the stars couldn't be seen. And maybe I felt her breath on my neck, and maybe we would stay there until morning, and then people would pass by us as they entered the park, see us, and think we were tourists too, and we could disappear among them.

en: But no. There was one-eyebrowed Chuck to see, and Ben to tell the story to, and classes and the band room and Duke and the future.
vi: Nhưng không. Còn phải chứng kiến cảnh Chuck Parson lông mày một mất một còn. Còn phải to nhỏ kể lại chuyện này với Ben. Còn lớp học, phòng tập nhạc, trường Duke và tương lai.
tr: Ama hayır. Daha görülecek tek kaşlı Chuck vardı, hikâye anlatılacak Ben ve dersler ve bando odası ve Duke ve gelecek...
es: Pero no. Tenía que ver a Chuck con una sola ceja, y contarle la historia a Ben, y estaban las clases, la sala de ensayo, la Universidad de Duke y el futuro.
vi_translation: But no. Still have to witness Chuck Parson with one eyebrow missing. Still have to whisper this story to Ben. Still have classes, the music room, Duke University, and the future.
tr_translation: But no. There was still the one-eyed Chuck to see, Ben to tell stories to, and lessons and the band room and Duke and the future...
es_translation: But no. I had to see Chuck with one eyebrow, and tell the story to Ben, and there were classes, the rehearsal room, Duke University, and the future.

en: “Q,” Margo said.
vi: “Q ơi,” Margo nói.
tr: “Q,” dedi Margo.
es: —Q —dijo Margo.
vi_translation: "Q," Margo said.
tr_translation: "Q," said Margo.
es_translation: —Q —said Margo.

en: I looked up at her, and for a moment I didn’t know why she’d said my name, but then I snapped out of my half-sleep. And I heard it. The Muzak from the speakers had been turned up, only it wasn’t Muzak anymore—it was real music. This old, jazzy song my dad likes called “Stars Fell on Alabama.” Even through the tinny speakers you could hear that whoever was singing it could sing a thousand goddamned notes at once.
vi: Tôi nhìn lên cô ấy, thoáng chốc tôi không hiểu sao cô ấy lại gọi tên mình, nhưng rồi tôi hết hẳn cơn nửa tỉnh nửa mơ. Và tôi nghe thấy. Giàn loa đang phát nhạc, nhưng không phải nhạc không lời dìu dịu nữa, mà là nhạc thực sự. Một bài hát jazz cũ kĩ mà bố tôi thích, tên là “Sao sa ở Alabama.” Qua những cái loa bé xíu, có thể nghe thấy ca sĩ như đang cất lên cả ngàn nốt nhạc cùng một lúc.
tr: Yukarı, ona doğru baktım ve bir anlığına neden adımı söylediğini anlamadım ama sonra birdenbire yan uykulu halimden silkinip kendime geldim. Ve duydum. Hoparlörlerden gelen hafif müziğin sesi açılmıştı, ancak artık hafif müzik değil... gerçek müzikti. Stars Fell on Alabama adlı, babamın sevdiği şu eski caz şarkıydı. Beş para etmez hoparlörlerden bile şarkıyı söyleyenin bin tane lanet notayı tek seferde söyleyebileceğini anlamak mümkündü.
es: La miré y por un momento no entendí por qué había dicho mi nombre, pero de repente desperté de mi ensoñación. Y lo oí. Habían subido la música ambiental, solo que ya no era música ambiental. Era música de verdad. Un viejo tema de jazz que le gusta a mi padre llamado «Stars Fell on Alabama». Incluso con aquellos diminutos altavoces se percibía que el cantante podía hacer mil condenadas notas a la vez.
vi_translation: I looked up at her, for a moment I didn't understand why she called my name, but then I completely snapped out of my half-awake, half-dreaming state. And I heard it. The speakers were playing music, but it was no longer gentle instrumental music, it was real music. An old jazz song that my father liked, called "Stars Fell on Alabama." Through the tiny speakers, you could hear the singer seemingly hitting a thousand notes at once.
tr_translation: I looked up at him and for a moment I didn't understand why he said my name, but then suddenly I shook off my drowsy state and came to my senses. And I heard it. The volume of the soft music coming from the speakers had increased, but it was no longer soft music... it was real music. It was that old jazz song called Stars Fell on Alabama, which my father loved. Even from the worthless speakers, it was possible to understand that the singer could hit a thousand damn notes at once.
es_translation: I looked at her and for a moment I didn't understand why she had said my name, but suddenly I woke up from my reverie. And I heard it. They had turned up the background music, only it was no longer background music. It was real music. An old jazz tune that my father likes called "Stars Fell on Alabama." Even with those tiny speakers, you could tell that the singer could hit a thousand damn notes at once.

en: And I felt the unbroken line of me and of her stretching back from our cribs to the dead guy to acquaintanceship to now. And I wanted to tell her that the pleasure for me wasn’t planning or doing or leaving; the pleasure was in seeing our strings cross and separate and then come back together—but that seemed too cheesy to say, and anyway, she was standing up.
vi: Và tôi cảm thấy sợi dây liền mạch nối tôi với cô ấy, kéo suốt từ hồi hai đứa nhóc tì ở trong cũi, đến người đàn ông đã chết năm nào, cho tới sự gần gũi ngày hôm nay. Và tôi muốn nói với Margo rằng phần vui nhất đối với tôi không ở chỗ lập kế hoạch, hành động hay đào tẩu; mà phần vui nhất là thấy được những dây nối của chúng tôi gặp nhau rồi chia tách, và lại trở về với nhau–nhưng nói ra như vậy có vẻ sến sẩm quá, vả lại cô ấy cũng đã đứng lên rồi.
tr: Beşiklerimizden ölü adama, ölü adamdan tanışıklığımıza, oradan bugüne kadar uzanan, onunla benim aramdaki kopmamış bağı hissetim. Ve ona benim için işin keyfinin planlamak ya da yapmak ya da orayı terk etmek olmadığını, keyifli olanın iplerimizin kesişip ayrıldığını, sonra tekrar birleştiğini görmekte olduğunu söylemek istedim... ama bunlar söylemek için fazla dandik gibi göründü ki zaten o da ayağa kalkıyordu.
es: Y sentí que las líneas de su vida y de la mía se extendían desde nuestra cuna hasta el tipo muerto, desde que nos conocimos hasta ese momento. Y quise decirle que para mí el placer no era planificar, hacer o no hacer. El placer era observar nuestros hilos cruzándose, separándose y volviéndose a juntar. Pero me pareció demasiado cursi, y además ya se había levantado.
vi_translation: And I feel the seamless thread connecting me to her, stretching all the way from when we were toddlers in the crib, to the man who died years ago, to the closeness of today. And I want to tell Margo that the most enjoyable part for me isn't in the planning, the action, or the escape; the most enjoyable part is seeing our threads meet, then separate, and come back together again–but saying it like that seems too cheesy, and besides, she was already standing up.
tr_translation: I felt the unbroken bond between him and me, stretching from our cradles to the dead man, from the dead man to our acquaintance, and from there to the present day. And I wanted to tell him that for me, the pleasure wasn't in planning or doing or leaving that place, but in seeing our strings intersect and diverge, then come together again... but these seemed too trivial to say, and besides, he was already getting up.
es_translation: And I felt that the lines of his life and mine extended from our cradle to the dead guy, from when we met until that moment. And I wanted to tell him that for me the pleasure was not in planning, doing, or not doing. The pleasure was in observing our threads crossing, separating, and coming together again. But it seemed too cheesy to me, and besides, he had already gotten up.

en: Margo’s blue blue eyes blinked and she looked impossibly beautiful right then, her jeans wet against her legs, her face shining in the gray light.
vi: Đôi mắt xanh thứ màu xanh kì diệu của Margo chớp chớp, khi đó cô ấy đẹp đến không tưởng, ống quần jeans ướt bó trên chân, gương mặt sáng lên trong ánh ngày nhàn nhạt.
tr: Margo’nun masmavi gözleri parıldadı ve hemen ardından bana inanılmaz derecede güzel göründü; kot pantolonu ıslak, bacaklarına yapışık haldeydi, yüzü gri ışıkta parlıyordu.
es: Los azulísimos ojos de Margo parpadearon. En aquel momento estaba increíblemente guapa, con los vaqueros mojados pegados a las piernas y la cara resplandeciente a la luz grisácea.
vi_translation: Margo's eyes, a miraculous shade of blue, blinked. At that moment, she was unbelievably beautiful, her wet jeans clinging to her legs, her face glowing in the soft daylight.
tr_translation: Margo's bright blue eyes sparkled, and immediately after, she looked incredibly beautiful to me; her jeans were wet, clinging to her legs, and her face was glowing in the gray light.
es_translation: Margo's very blue eyes blinked. At that moment, she looked incredibly beautiful, with her wet jeans clinging to her legs and her face glowing in the grayish light.

en: I stood up and reached out my hand and said, “May I have this dance?” Margo curtsied, gave me her hand, and said, “You may,” and then my hand was on the curve between her waist and her hip, and her hand was on my shoulder. And then step-step-sidestep, step-step-sidestep. We fox-trotted all the way around the seal tank, and still the song kept going on about the stars falling. “Sixth-grade slow dance,” Margo announced, and we switched positions, her hands on my shoulders and mine on her hips, elbows locked, two feet between us. And then we fox-trotted some more, until the song ended. I stepped forward and dipped Margo, just as they’d taught us to do at Crown School of Dance. She raised one leg and gave me all her weight as I dipped her. She either trusted me or wanted to fall.
vi: Tôi đứng lên, chìa tay ra và nói, “Cho phép tớ mời cậu nhảy điệu này được không?” Margo nhún chân, đưa tay cho tôi và nói, “Được chứ.” Tôi đặt tay lên đường cong giữa eo và hông cô ấy, và tay cô ấy đặt trên vai tôi. Bước-bước-bước ngang. Bước-bước-bước ngang. Chúng tôi nhảy fox-trot một vòng quanh khu hải cẩu, bài hát vẫn ngân nga về những vì sao sa trên bầu trời. “Điệu chậm lớp sáu nào,” Margo nói, và chúng tôi đổi tư thế, tay cô ấy trên vai tôi và tay tôi trên hông cô ấy, khuỷu tay đan vào nhau, hai đứa chỉ cách nhau có nửa mét. Rồi chúng tôi lại nhảy theo điệu fox-trot cho đến hết bài hát. Tôi tiến một bước và đỡ Margo ngả ra, như chúng tôi được dạy hồi ở trường vũ đạo Crown. Margo giơ một chân lên, dồn toàn bộ trọng lượng vào tôi khi tôi đỡ lưng cô ấy. Cô ấy đã tin tưởng tôi, hoặc là muốn bị ngã.
tr: Ayağa kalkıp elimi uzattım ve “Bu dansı bana lütfeder misiniz?” dedim. Margo reverans yaptı, elini uzattı ve “Elbette,” dedi, sonra elim kalçası ile beli arasındaki kıvrımda, onun eli de benim omzumdaydı. Ve ardından adımadımyana adım, adımadımyana adım... Fok havuzunun başından sonuna kadar fokstrot yaptık ve yıldızların kaymasıyla ilgili şarkı hâlâ devam ediyordu. Margo, “Altıncı sınıf tarzı yavaş dans,” dedi, yerlerimizi değiştirdik, onun elleri omuzlarımda ve benim elim onun kalçasındaydı, dirseklerimiz kilitlenmiş, aramızda yarım metre. Sonra biraz daha fokstrot yaptık... şarkı bitene kadar. Bir ayağımı öne attım ve Margo’nun geriye doğru eğilmesini sağladım, tam da Crovvn Dans Okulu’nda bize öğrettikleri gibi. Ben onu eğdiğimde bir bacağım kaldırıp bütün ağırlığını bana bıraktı. Ya bana güveniyordu ya da düşmek istiyordu.
es: Me levanté, extendí la mano y le dije: —¿Me concedes este baile? Margo me hizo una reverencia y me cogió de la mano. —Te lo concedo —me contestó. Y entonces coloqué la mano en la curva entre su cintura y su cadera, y ella apoyó la suya en mi hombro. Y uno dos a un lado, uno dos a un lado. Rodeamos el acuario de las focas bailando foxtrot, mientras la canción sobre las estrellas que caen seguía sonando. —Baile lento de sexto —comentó Margo. Cambiamos de postura. Colocó las manos en mis hombros y yo la sujeté por las caderas, con los codos cerrados, a medio metro de distancia. Y luego seguimos con el foxtrot hasta que acabó la canción. Di un paso adelante e incliné a Margo, como nos habían enseñado en la Escuela de Baile Crown. Ella levantó una pierna y dejó caer todo su peso sobre mí. O confiaba en mí o quería caerse.
vi_translation: I stood up, extended my hand, and said, "May I invite you to dance this dance?" Margo curtsied, gave me her hand, and said, "Sure." I placed my hand on the curve between her waist and hip, and her hand rested on my shoulder. Step-step-step sideways. Step-step-step sideways. We danced the fox-trot around the seal area, the song still humming about the falling stars in the sky. "The slow sixth-grade dance," Margo said, and we changed positions, her hand on my shoulder and my hand on her hip, elbows interlocked, the two of us only half a meter apart. Then we danced the fox-trot again until the song ended. I took a step forward and dipped Margo, as we were taught back at Crown Dance School. Margo lifted one leg, putting all her weight on me as I supported her back. She trusted me, or she wanted to fall.
tr_translation: I stood up, extended my hand, and said, "Would you honor me with this dance?" Margo curtsied, extended her hand, and said, "Of course," then my hand was on the curve between her hip and waist, and her hand was on my shoulder. And then step-side-step, step-side-step... We did the foxtrot from one end of the seal pool to the other, and the song about shooting stars was still playing. Margo said, "Sixth-grade style slow dance," we switched places, her hands were on my shoulders and my hand was on her hip, our elbows locked, half a meter between us. Then we did a bit more foxtrot... until the song ended. I stepped forward and made Margo lean back, just as they taught us at Crown Dance School. When I dipped her, she lifted one leg and put all her weight on me. Either she trusted me or she wanted to fall.
es_translation: I got up, extended my hand, and said to him: —Will you grant me this dance? Margo curtsied to me and took my hand. —I grant you that —he replied to me. And then I placed my hand on the curve between her waist and her hip, and she rested hers on my shoulder. And one two to the side, one two to the side. We circled the seal aquarium dancing foxtrot, while the song about falling stars kept playing. —Slow dance from sixth grade —commented Margo. We changed positions. She placed her hands on my shoulders and I held her by the hips, with elbows closed, half a meter apart. And then we continued with the foxtrot until the song ended. I took a step forward and dipped Margo, as we had been taught at the Crown Dance School. She lifted one leg and let all her weight fall on me. Either she trusted me or she wanted to fall.

en: We bought dish towels at a 7-Eleven on I-Drive and tried our best to wash the slime and stink from the moat off our clothes and skin, and I filled the gas tank to where it had been before we drove the circumference of Orlando. The Chrysler’s seats were going to be a little bit wet when Mom drove to work, but I held out hope that she wouldn’t notice, since she was pretty oblivious. My parents generally believed that I was the most well-adjusted and not-likely-to-break-into-SeaWorld person on the planet, since my psychological well-being was proof of their professional talents.
vi: Chúng tôi mua khăn bông ở một cửa hàng 7-Eleven trên đường I-Drive, cố lau sạch những thứ nhớp nhớp mùi mùi khỏi quần áo và da mình. Tôi đổ đầy bình xăng đúng như lúc trước khi đi lòng vòng khắp Orlando. Chỗ ngồi trong chiếc Chrysler sẽ ươn ướt tí chút khi mẹ lái xe đi làm, nhưng tôi vẫn nhấp nhỉnh hi vọng rằng mẹ sẽ không phát hiện ra, vì mẹ tôi vốn khá xuề xòa những chuyện kiểu này. Nhìn chung bố mẹ tin rằng tôi là đứa nghiêm chỉnh, ít có hành-vi-gây-nguy-cơ-đột-nhập-vào-Sea-World nhất quả đất, và rằng sự phát triển lành mạnh về tâm thần kinh của tôi chính là minh chứng hùng hồn cho chuyên môn nghề nghiệp của bố mẹ.
tr: IBulvarı’ndaki 7Eleven’dan kurulama bezleri aldık ve hendekten gelen çamur ile pis kokuyu giysilerimizden ve cildimizden temizlemek için elimizden geleni yaptık; benzin deposunu Orlando çevresinde gezinmemizden önce olduğu yere kadar doldurdum. Annem işe giderken, Chrysler’ın koltuklan biraz ıslak olacaktı ama oldukça dikkatsiz olduğundan fark etmeyeceğini umdum. Annemle babam genelde gezegendeki en iyi yetiştirilmiş ve “SeaWorld’e izinsiz girmesi olası olmayan” insan olduğuma inanırlardı çünkü psikolojimin sağlığı onların profesyonel yeteneklerinin kanıtıydı.
es: Compramos trapos de cocina en un 7-Eleven de International Drive e intentamos quitarnos de la ropa y de la piel el barro y la peste del foso. Llené el depósito de gasolina hasta donde estaba antes de que empezáramos la gira turística por Orlando. Los asientos del Chrysler iban a estar algo húmedos cuando mi madre fuera al trabajo, pero esperaba que no se diera cuenta, porque era bastante despistada. Mis padres creían que yo era la persona más equilibrada y con menos posibilidades de allanar el SeaWorld del mundo, ya que mi salud psicológica era prueba de su talento profesional.
vi_translation: We bought towels at a 7-Eleven store on I-Drive, trying to wipe off the sticky, smelly stuff from our clothes and skin. I filled up the gas tank just like before we drove all around Orlando. The seats in the Chrysler would be a bit damp when Mom drove to work, but I still held a slight hope that she wouldn't notice, as my mom was quite easygoing about these kinds of things. Overall, my parents believed that I was a serious kid, the least likely to engage in activities that could risk breaking into Sea World, and that my healthy neurodevelopment was a strong testament to their professional expertise.
tr_translation: We bought drying cloths from the 7-Eleven on the Boulevard and did our best to clean the mud and foul smell from the ditch off our clothes and skin; I filled up the gas tank to where it was before our wandering around Orlando. When my mom went to work, the seats of the Chrysler would be a bit wet, but I hoped she wouldn’t notice since she was quite careless. My mom and dad generally believed that I was the best-raised and “least likely to sneak into SeaWorld” person on the planet because my psychological health was proof of their professional abilities.
es_translation: We bought kitchen rags at a 7-Eleven on International Drive and tried to get the mud and stench from the pit off our clothes and skin. I filled the gas tank back to where it was before we started the sightseeing tour of Orlando. The seats of the Chrysler were going to be a bit damp when my mother went to work, but I hoped she wouldn't notice because she was quite absent-minded. My parents believed I was the most balanced person with the least likelihood of breaking into SeaWorld in the world, as my psychological health was proof of their professional talent.

en: I took my time going home, avoiding interstates in favor of back roads. Margo and I were listening to the radio, trying to figure out what station had been playing “Stars Fell on Alabama,” but then she turned it down and said, “All in all, I think it was a success.”
vi: Tôi lập tức tranh thủ thời gian về nhà, tránh cao tốc liên bang mà đi theo các đường nhỏ. Margo và tôi cùng nghe radio, cố dò xem đài nào đã phát bài “Sao sa ở Alabama,” nhưng rồi Margo tắt đi và nói, “Tóm lại, tớ nghĩ thế là đã thành công.
tr: Otoyoldan uzak durup ara yolları kullanarak eve gitmek için acele etmedim. Margo’yla radyo dinliyor ve hangi istasyonun Stars Fell on Alabama’yı çaldığım çözmeye çalışıyorduk ama sonra Margo radyoyu kapatıp, “Neticede, bunun bir başarı olduğunu düşünüyorum,” dedi.
es: Me tomé mi tiempo para volver a casa. Evité las autopistas en favor de las carreteras alternativas. Margo y yo escuchábamos la radio e intentábamos descubrir qué emisora había puesto «Stars Fell on Alabama», pero de repente la apagó y dijo: —En general, creo que ha sido un éxito.
vi_translation: I immediately took the time to go home, avoiding the interstate highway and taking the smaller roads. Margo and I listened to the radio together, trying to find which station had played "Stars Fell on Alabama," but then Margo turned it off and said, "In short, I think it was a success."
tr_translation: I did not hurry to get home by avoiding the highway and using side roads. Margo and I were listening to the radio and trying to figure out which station was playing Stars Fell on Alabama, but then Margo turned off the radio and said, "In the end, I think this is a success."
es_translation: I took my time to return home. I avoided the highways in favor of alternative roads. Margo and I were listening to the radio and trying to figure out which station had played "Stars Fell on Alabama," but suddenly she turned it off and said: —In general, I think it has been a success.

en: “Absolutely,” I said, although by now I was already wondering what tomorrow would be like. Would she show up by the band room before school to hang out? Eat lunch with me and Ben? “I do wonder if it will be different tomorrow,” I said.
vi: “Đồng ý,” tôi nói, dù lúc này đang tự hỏi không biết ngày mai sẽ ra sao. Margo có đến chỗ phòng tập nhạc trước giờ vào lớp để tụ bạ với bọn tôi không? Có ăn trưa với tôi và Ben không? “Tớ thắc mắc quá ta, không biết ngày mai có gì khác không nhỉ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Kesinlikle,” dedim, bununla birlikte şimdiden ertesi günün nasıl olacağım merak ediyordum. Margo okuldan önce takılmak için bando odasının orada boy gösterecek miydi? Benimle ve Ben’le öğle yemeği yiyecek miydi? “Yarın her şeyin farklı olup olmayacağım gerçekten merak ediyorum,” dedim.
es: —Totalmente —le contesté. Aunque en aquellos momentos empezaba a preguntarme cómo sería el día siguiente. ¿Se pasaría por la sala de ensayo antes de las clases? ¿Comería conmigo y con Ben? —Me pregunto si mañana cambiarán las cosas —le dije.
vi_translation: “Agreed,” I said, even though I was wondering what tomorrow would be like. Will Margo come to the music room before class to hang out with us? Will she have lunch with Ben and me? “I really wonder if tomorrow will be any different,” I said.
tr_translation: “Absolutely,” I said, but at the same time, I was already wondering how the next day would be. Would Margo show up by the band room to hang out before school? Would she have lunch with me and Ben? “I really wonder if everything will be different tomorrow,” I said.
es_translation: —Totally —I replied to him. Although at that moment I began to wonder what the next day would be like. Would he stop by the rehearsal room before classes? Would he have lunch with Ben and me? —I wonder if things will change tomorrow —I said to him.

en: “Yeah,” she said. “Me, too.” She left it hanging in the air, and then said, “Hey, speaking of tomorrow, as thanks for your hard work and dedication on this remarkable evening, I would like to give you a small gift.” She dug around beneath her feet and then produced the digital camera. “Take it,” she said. “And use the Power of the Tiny Winky wisely.”
vi: “Ừ,” Margo đáp. “Tớ cũng vậy.” Cô ấy buông những lời ấy vào gió, rồi tiếp, “Này, nói đến ngày mai, để tỏ lòng cảm kích vì cậu đã vất vả tận tụy trong đêm đáng nhớ vừa qua, tớ có món quà nhỏ tặng cậu.” Cô ấy mò dưới chân rồi giơ lên cái máy ảnh kĩ thuật số. “Cầm lấy đi,” Margo nói. “Và sử dụng sức mạnh của cái chớp mắt thần thánh thật thông thái nhé.”
tr: “Evet,” dedi. “Ben de.” Konuyu sonuçsuz bir şekilde bıraktı ve sonra, “Hey, yarından bahsetmişken, bu kayda değer akşamki sıkı çalışmana ve kendini adamana bir teşekkür olarak sana küçük bir hediye vermek istiyorum,” dedi. Ayaklarının altında bir şey arayıp fotoğraf makinesini çıkardı. “Al bunu,” dedi. “Ve Küçük Penisin Gücü’nü akıllıca kullan.
es: —Sí —añadió ella—. Yo también. —Dejó el comentario colgado en el aire y luego añadió—: Oye, hablando de mañana, me gustaría hacerte un pequeño regalo para agradecerte tu duro trabajo y tu dedicación en esta noche excepcional. Rebuscó entre sus pies y sacó la cámara digital. —Toma —me dijo—. Y utiliza con prudencia el poder de Tiny Winky.
vi_translation: “Yeah,” Margo replied. “Me too.” She let those words drift into the wind, then continued, “Hey, speaking of tomorrow, to show my appreciation for your hard work and dedication during the unforgettable night we just had, I have a small gift for you.” She rummaged around her feet and then held up a digital camera. “Take it,” Margo said. “And use the power of the divine blink wisely.”
tr_translation: “Yes,” he said. “Me too.” He left the subject unresolved and then, “Hey, speaking of tomorrow, as a thank you for your remarkable hard work and dedication this evening, here's a small "I want to give a gift," he said. He searched for something under his feet and took out a camera. "Take this," he said. "And use the Power of the Little Penis wisely."
es_translation: —Yes —she added—. Me too. —She left the comment hanging in the air and then added—: Hey, speaking of tomorrow, I would like to give you a small gift to thank you for your hard work and dedication on this exceptional night. He searched among his feet and pulled out the digital camera. —Take it —he said to me—. And use the power of Tiny Winky wisely.

en: I laughed and put the camera in my pocket. “I’ll download the pic when we get home and then give it back to you at school?” I asked. I still wanted her to say, Yes, at school, where things will be different, where I will be your friend in public, and also decidedly single, but she just said, “Yeah, or whenever.”
vi: Tôi bật cười và nhét máy ảnh vào túi. “Về nhà tớ sẽ tải ảnh ngay, đến trường sẽ đưa cậu nhé?” tôi hỏi, những muốn Margo trả lời, Ừ, ở trường, nơi mọi thứ sẽ khác đi, nơi mọi người sẽ thấy rằng tớ là bạn của cậu, và rằng tớ đã quyết định đá gã bạn trai cũ đi, nhưng cô ấy chỉ nói, “Ừ, lúc nào cũng được.”
tr: Güldüm ve makineyi cebime koydum. “Eve vardığımızda fotoğrafı bilgisayara yükleyeceğim ve sonra okulda sana geri mi vereceğim?” diye sordum. Hâlâ şöyle demesini istiyordum: Evet, okulda, her şeyin farklı olacağı, toplum içinde arkadaşın olacağım ve apaçık bir şekilde sevgilisiz olacağım yerde, ama yalnızca, “Evet, ya da ne zaman olursa,” dedi.
es: Me reí y me metí la cámara en el bolsillo. —¿Descargo la foto cuando llegue a casa y te la devuelvo en el instituto? —le pregunté. Quería que me dijera: «Sí, en el instituto, donde todo será diferente, donde seré tu amiga públicamente y, además, sin novio», pero se limitó a contestarme: «Sí, o cuando sea».
vi_translation: I laughed and put the camera in my bag. "I'll upload the photos when I get home, and I'll give them to you at school, okay?" I asked, hoping Margo would reply, Yes, at school, where everything will be different, where everyone will see that I'm your friend, and that I've decided to dump my ex-boyfriend, but she just said, "Yeah, anytime."
tr_translation: I laughed and put the machine in my pocket. “When we get home, I'll upload the photo to the computer and then give it back to you at school?” I asked. I still wanted him to say: Yes, at school, where everything will be different, where I will be your friend in public and obviously without a girlfriend, but he only said, “Yes, or whenever.”
es_translation: I laughed and put the camera in my pocket. —Should I download the photo when I get home and return it to you at the institute? —I asked him. I wanted her to say to me: "Yes, in high school, where everything will be different, where I will be your friend publicly and, moreover, without a boyfriend," but she simply replied: "Yes, or whenever."

en: It was 5:42 when I turned into Jefferson Park. We drove down Jefferson Drive to Jefferson Court and then turned onto our road, Jefferson Way. I killed the headlights one last time and idled up my driveway. I didn’t know what to say, and Margo wasn’t saying anything. We filled a 7-Eleven bag with trash, trying to make the Chrysler look and feel as if the past six hours had not happened. In another bag, she gave me the remnants of the Vaseline, the spray paint, and the last full Mountain Dew. My brain raced with fatigue.
vi: Lúc ấy là 5:42 khi tôi rẽ vào khu Jefferson Park. Chúng tôi lái xe xuôi Jefferson Drive đến Jefferson Court, rẽ vào phố nhà tôi, Jefferson Way. Tôi tắt đèn pha lần cuối và rê xe vào sân nhà. Tôi không biết nói gì, và Margo cũng không định nói gì. Chúng tôi nhét hết rác vào một túi 7-Eleven, cố gắng xóa dấu vết để chiếc Chrysler trông như thể chưa từng trải qua sáu tiếng đồng hồ vừa rồi. Một túi khác, Margo đưa tôi những thứ còn lại, Vaseline, sơn xịt, và chai Mountain Dew cuối cùng. Trí não tôi chạy đua với cơn mệt mỏi rã rời.
tr: Jefferson Park’a döndüğümde saat 05:42’ydi. Jefferson Caddesinden Jefferson Adliyesi’ne doğru ilerledik, sonra kendi sokağımıza, Jefferson Yolu’na döndük. Son bir kez daha farları kapatıp rölantide garaja doğru ilerledim. Ne diyeceğimi bilmiyordum ve Margo da hiçbir şey söylemiyordu. Bir 7Eleven poşetini çöple doldurduk, Chrysler’ın son altı saat hiç olmamış gibi görünmesi için uğraşıyorduk. Margo başka bir poşette bana vazelinden kalanları, sprey boyayı ve kalan son dolu Mountain Dew’u verdi. Beynim bitkinlikle mücadele ediyordu.
es: Eran las 5:42 cuando entramos en Jefferson Park. Bajamos por Jefferson Drive hasta Jefferson Court y luego giramos en nuestra calle, Jefferson Way. Apagué las luces por última vez y me metí por el camino que llevaba a mi casa. No sabía qué decir y Margo tampoco abría la boca. Llenamos una bolsa del 7-Eleven con basura para que pareciera que el Chrysler estaba como si las últimas seis horas no hubieran existido. Margo me dio otra bolsa con los restos de la vaselina, el bote de pintura y la última lata de Mountain Dew. Mi cerebro luchaba contra el agotamiento.
vi_translation: It was 5:42 when I turned into Jefferson Park. We drove down Jefferson Drive to Jefferson Court, turned onto my street, Jefferson Way. I turned off the headlights one last time and eased the car into the driveway. I didn't know what to say, and Margo didn't intend to say anything either. We stuffed all the trash into a 7-Eleven bag, trying to erase any traces so the Chrysler would look as if it hadn't just been through the past six hours. In another bag, Margo handed me the remaining items, Vaseline, spray paint, and the last bottle of Mountain Dew. My mind was racing with overwhelming fatigue.
tr_translation: When I returned to Jefferson Park, it was 05:42. We proceeded from Jefferson Street towards the Jefferson Courthouse, then turned onto our own street, Jefferson Road. One last time, I turned off the headlights and idled towards the garage. I didn't know what to say, and Margo wasn't saying anything either. We filled a 7-Eleven bag with trash, trying to make it look like the Chrysler hadn't existed for the last six hours. Margo handed me the remaining Vaseline, spray paint, and the last full Mountain Dew in another bag. My brain was struggling with exhaustion.
es_translation: It was 5:42 when we entered Jefferson Park. We went down Jefferson Drive to Jefferson Court and then turned onto our street, Jefferson Way. I turned off the lights for the last time and took the path that led to my house. I didn't know what to say and Margo didn't open her mouth either. We filled a bag from 7-Eleven with trash to make it look like the Chrysler was as if the last six hours hadn't existed. Margo gave me another bag with the remains of the Vaseline, the paint can, and the last can of Mountain Dew. My brain was fighting against exhaustion.

en: With a bag in each hand, I paused for a moment outside the van, staring at her. “Well, it was a helluva night,” I said finally.
vi: Mỗi tay xách một túi, tôi đứng lại cạnh chiếc xe, nhìn cô ấy. “Chà, một đêm địa ngục thần thánh,” rút cục tôi nói.
tr: iki elimde poşetlerle, minivamn önünde bir anlığına ona bakarak duraksadım. “Şey, müthiş bir geceydi,” dedim sonunda.
es: Me quedé un momento parado delante del monovolumen, con una bolsa en cada mano, y miré a Margo. —Bueno, ha sido una noche fantástica —admití por fin.
vi_translation: With a bag in each hand, I stood next to the car, looking at her. "Wow, what a hell of a night," I finally said.
tr_translation: With bags in both hands, I paused for a moment in front of the minivan, looking at him. "Well, it was a great night," I said finally.
es_translation: I stood for a moment in front of the minivan, with a bag in each hand, and looked at Margo. —Well, it has been a fantastic night —I finally admitted.

en: “Come here,” she said, and I took a step forward. She hugged me, and the bags made it hard to hug her back, but if I dropped them I might wake someone. I could feel her on her tiptoes and then her mouth was right up against my ear and she said, very clearly, “I. Will. Miss. Hanging. Out. With. You.”
vi: “Lại đây nào,” Margo nói, và tôi tiến lên một bước. Cô ấy ôm tôi, đám túi làm tôi khó có thể ôm lại cô ấy được, nhưng nếu tôi thả túi xuống thì có thể đánh thức ai đó dậy mất. Tôi cảm thấy Margo kiễng lên và môi cô ấy ngay sát tai tôi, từng lời rành mạch, “Tớ. Sẽ. Nhớ. Những. Lúc. Chơi. Với. Cậu.”
tr: “Buraya gel,” dedi, öne doğru bir adım attım. Bana sarıldı, poşetler benim de ona sarılmamı zorlaştırdı ama bıraksaydım birini uyandırabilirdim. Parmak uçlarında durduğunu hissedebihyordum, dudakları kulağıma dayalıydı ve açıkça, “Seninle. Takılmayı. Özleyeceğim,” dedi.
es: —Ven aquí —me dijo. Di un paso al frente. Me abrazó, y las bolsas me dificultaron devolverle el abrazo, pero si las soltaba, podría despertar a alguien. Noté que se ponía de puntillas y de repente acercó la boca a mi oído y me dijo muy claramente: —Echaré de menos salir por ahí contigo. —No tienes por qué —le contesté en voz alta.
vi_translation: “Come here,” Margo said, and I took a step forward. She hugged me, the bags made it difficult for me to hug her back, but if I put the bags down, I might wake someone up. I felt Margo rise on her toes and her lips right next to my ear, each word clear, “I. Will. Miss. The. Times. Playing. With. You.”
tr_translation: “Come here,” he said, and I took a step forward. He hugged me, the bags made it difficult for me to hug him back, but if I let go, I might wake someone up. I could feel him standing on his tiptoes, his lips were close to my ear and clearly, “With you. Hanging out. I will miss it,” he said.
es_translation: —Come here —he told me. I took a step forward. He hugged me, and the bags made it difficult for me to hug him back, but if I let them go, I might wake someone up. I noticed that he stood on tiptoe and suddenly brought his mouth close to my ear and said very clearly: —I will miss going out with you. —You don't have to —I replied out loud.

en: “You don’t have to,” I answered aloud. I tried to hide my disappointment. “If you don’t like them anymore,” I said, “just hang out with me. My friends are actually, like, nice.”
vi: “Việc gì phải thế,” tôi nói to, cố gắng che giấu sự thất vọng của mình. “Nếu cậu không thích chúng nó nữa thì chơi với tớ. Tụi bạn tớ thực ra cũng vui lắm.”
tr: ‘Yapmak zorunda değilsin,” diye karşılık verdim yüksek sesle. Hayal kırıklığımı saklamaya çalışıyordum. “Eğer onlardan artık hoşlanmıyorsan,” dedim, “benimle takıl. Arkadaşlarım aslında iyi sayılırlar.
es: —No tienes por qué —le contesté en voz alta. Intenté ocultar mi decepción—. Si ya no te caen bien tus amigos, sal conmigo. Los míos son muy majos.
vi_translation: “Why does it have to be like this,” I said loudly, trying to hide my disappointment. “If you don't like them anymore, then hang out with me. My friends are actually quite fun.”
tr_translation: "You don't have to," I replied loudly. I was trying to hide my disappointment. "If you don't like them anymore," I said, "hang out with me. My friends are actually quite nice."
es_translation: —You don't have to —I replied out loud. I tried to hide my disappointment—. If you no longer get along with your friends, go out with me. Mine are very nice.

en: Her lips were so close to me that I could feel her smile. “I’m afraid it’s not possible,” she whispered. She let go then, but kept looking at me, taking step after step backward. She raised her eyebrows finally, and smiled, and I believed the smile. I watched her climb up a tree and then lift herself onto the roof outside of her second-floor bedroom window. She jimmied her window open and crawled inside.
vi: Bờ môi Margo ở gần đến mức tôi có thể cảm thấy cô ấy mỉm cười. “Tớ sợ chẳng được đâu,” cô ấy thì thầm. Rồi cô ấy rời ra, nhưng vẫn nhìn tôi, bước lùi từng bước. Cuối cùng cô ấy nhướn lông mày lên, mỉm cười, và tôi tin ở nụ cười ấy. Tôi nhìn Margo trèo lên cây, bám sang mái nhà phía trên cửa sổ phòng ngủ của cô ấy ở tầng hai. Cô ấy cạy mở cửa và bò vào trong.
tr: Dudakları bana o kadar yakındı ki gülümsediğini hissedebiliyordum. “Korkarım bu mümkün değil,” diye fısıldadı. Sonra beni bıraktı ama adım adım geri çekilirken bana bakmaya devam etti. Sonunda kaşlarını kaldırdı ve gülümsedi ve gülümsemesine inandım. Bir ağaca tırmanmasını, ardından ikinci kattaki yatak odası penceresinin önündeki çıkıntıya çıkmasını izledim. Penceresini zorlayarak açtı ve içeri emekledi.
es: Sus labios estaban tan cerca de mí que sentía su sonrisa. —Me temo que no es posible —susurró. Se apartó, pero siguió mirándome mientras retrocedía paso a paso. Al final alzó las cejas, sonrió y me creí su sonrisa. La observé trepando a un árbol y subiendo hasta la repisa de la ventana de su habitación, en el segundo piso. Abrió la ventana y se coló dentro.
vi_translation: Margo's lips were so close that I could feel her smile. “I’m afraid it won’t work,” she whispered. Then she moved away, but still looked at me, stepping back one step at a time. Finally, she raised her eyebrows, smiled, and I believed in that smile. I watched Margo climb up the tree, reaching the roof above her second-floor bedroom window. She pried open the window and crawled inside.
tr_translation: His lips were so close to me that I could feel him smiling. "I'm afraid that's not possible," he whispered. Then he let me go, but as he stepped back, he continued to look at me ended. Finally, he raised his eyebrows and smiled, and I believed his smile. I watched him climb a tree, then step onto the ledge in front of the second-floor bedroom window. He forced the window open and crawled inside.
es_translation: Her lips were so close to me that I could feel her smile. —I'm afraid it's not possible —he whispered. He stepped back, but kept looking at me as he retreated step by step. In the end, he raised his eyebrows, smiled, and I believed his smile. I watched her climb a tree and ascend to the ledge of her bedroom window on the second floor. She opened the window and slipped inside.

en: I walked through my unlocked front door, tiptoed through the kitchen to my bedroom, peeled off my jeans, threw them into a corner of the closet back near the window screen, downloaded the picture of Jase, and got into bed, my mind booming with the things I would say to her at school.
vi: Tôi vào nhà qua cửa chính không khóa, rón rén qua bếp vào phòng mình, lột quần jeans ném vào góc tủ gần cửa sổ, tải bức ảnh Jase, rồi vào giường, đầu như muốn nổ tung với những điều tôi định đến trường sẽ nói với Margo.
tr: Kilitlenmemiş ön kapıma doğru gittim, mutfaktan odama kadar parmak uçlarımda yürüdüm, kot pantolonumu sıyırdım ve arkaya, pencere telinin yanındaki dolabın bir köşesine attım, Jase’in fotoğrafım bilgisayara yükledim ve aklım ona okulda söyleyeceğim şeylerle uğuldarken yatağa girdim.
es: Entré por la puerta principal, que no estaba cerrada con llave, crucé la cocina de puntillas hasta mi habitación, me quité los vaqueros, los tiré en un rincón del armario, al lado de la mosquitera de la ventana, descargué la foto de Jase y me metí en la cama pensando en lo que le diría a Margo en el instituto.
vi_translation: I entered the house through the unlocked front door, tiptoed through the kitchen into my room, stripped off my jeans and threw them into the corner of the closet near the window, downloaded Jase's photo, then got into bed, my head about to explode with the things I planned to tell Margo at school.
tr_translation: I went to my unlocked front door, tiptoed from the kitchen to my room, pulled off my jeans and threw them into a corner of the closet next to the window screen, uploaded Jase's photo to the computer, and got into bed while my mind buzzed with the things I would tell him at school.
es_translation: I entered through the main door, which was not locked, tiptoed across the kitchen to my room, took off my jeans, threw them in a corner of the closet next to the window screen, downloaded Jase's photo, and got into bed thinking about what I would say to Margo at school.

en: PART TWO
vi: PHẦN II
tr: İKİNCİ KISIM
es: SEGUNDA PARTE
vi_translation: PART II
tr_translation: SECOND PART
es_translation: SECOND PART

en: The Grass
vi: Cỏ 8
tr: Çimen
es: La hierba
vi_translation: Grass 8
tr_translation: Grass
es_translation: The grass

en: I’d been asleep for just about thirty minutes when my alarm clock went off at 6:32. But I did not personally notice that my alarm clock was going off for seventeen minutes, not until I felt hands on my shoulders and heard the distant voice of my mother saying, “Good morning, sleepyhead.”
vi: Tôi ngủ được chừng nửa tiếng khi đồng hồ báo thức réo lúc 6:32. Nhưng chính tôi không mảy may biết báo thức đã rền rĩ suốt mười bảy phút. Mãi đến khi cảm thấy ai đó đang lay vai mình và mơ hồ nghe thấy mẹ gọi, “Dậy thôi sâu ngủ,” tôi mới hơi tinh tỉnh.
tr: Çalar saatim 06:32’de çalmaya başladığında, yalnızca yarım saat kadar uyumuştum. Ama çalar saatin çaldığım kendim fark etmedim, omuzlarımdaki elleri hissedene ve annemin, “Günaydın, uykucu,” diyen uzaktan gelen sesini duyana kadar.
es: Había dormido una media hora cuando sonó el despertador. Las 6:32. Pero durante diecisiete minutos ni me enteré de que estaba sonando el despertador, hasta que sentí unas manos en los hombros y oí la voz lejana de mi madre. —Buenos días, dormilón —me dijo.
vi_translation: I slept for about half an hour when the alarm clock rang at 6:32. But I was completely unaware that the alarm had been blaring for seventeen minutes. It wasn't until I felt someone shaking my shoulder and vaguely heard my mother calling, "Wake up, sleepyhead," that I started to become slightly alert.
tr_translation: When my alarm clock started ringing at 06:32, I had only slept for about half an hour. But I didn't notice the alarm clock ringing until I felt the hands on my shoulders and heard my mother's distant voice saying, "Good morning, sleepyhead."
es_translation: I had slept for about half an hour when the alarm clock went off. 6:32. But for seventeen minutes I didn't even realize that the alarm clock was ringing, until I felt hands on my shoulders and heard my mother's distant voice. —Good morning, sleepyhead —he said to me.

en: “Uhh,” I responded. I felt significantly more tired than I had back at 5:55, and I would have skipped school, except I had perfect attendance, and while I realized that perfect attendance is not particularly impressive or even necessarily admirable, I wanted to keep the streak alive. Plus, I wanted to see how Margo would act around me.
vi: “Vầầầng,” tôi đáp, vẫn mắt nhắm mắt mở, cảm thấy còn bải hoải hơn cả lúc 5:55. Có lẽ kiếm cớ trốn học luôn cho rồi, nhưng ngặt nỗi tôi có thành tích chuyên cần hoàn hảo. Dù biết rằng thành tích chuyên cần hoàn hảo không phải điều đặc biệt ấn tượng hoặc thậm chí đáng ngưỡng mộ gì, tôi vẫn muốn giữ vững phong độ. Thêm nữa, tôi muốn biết Margo sẽ cư xử thế nào khi ở trường.
tr: “Ahh,” diye karşılık verdim. Belirgin bir şekilde, 05:55’tekinden daha yorgun hissediyordum ve okulu asabilirdim ancak hiç devamsızlık yapmamıştım ve tüm derslere girmenin özellikle etkileyici, hatta pek takdire şayan olmadığını bilmeme rağmen başladığım işin arkasını getirmek istiyordum. Bir de Margo’nun yanında nasıl davranacağını görmek istiyordum.
es: —Uf —le contesté. Me sentía bastante más cansado que a las 5:55, y me habría saltado las clases, pero no tenía ni una falta de asistencia, y aunque era consciente de que no tener faltas de asistencia no era especialmente impresionante ni necesariamente admirable, quería seguir con esa racha. Además, quería ver cómo Margo reaccionaba conmigo.
vi_translation: “Yeeesss,” I replied, still half-asleep, feeling even more exhausted than at 5:55. Maybe I should just find an excuse to skip school, but the problem is I have a perfect attendance record. Even though I know that a perfect attendance record is not particularly impressive or even admirable, I still want to maintain it. Besides, I want to see how Margo will behave at school.
tr_translation: “Ahh,” I replied. Clearly, I felt more tired than I did at 05:55, and I could have skipped school, but I had never been absent and, even though I knew that attending all classes was not particularly impressive or even very commendable, I wanted to see through what I had started. Also, I wanted to see how he would behave around Margo.
es_translation: —Ugh —I replied. I felt quite a bit more tired than at 5:55, and I would have skipped classes, but I didn't have a single absence, and although I was aware that not having absences was not particularly impressive nor necessarily admirable, I wanted to keep that streak going. Besides, I wanted to see how Margo would react to me.

en: When I walked into the kitchen, Dad was telling Mom something while they ate at the breakfast counter. Dad paused when he saw me and said, “How’d you sleep?”
vi: Vào bếp, tôi thấy bố đang nói gì đó với mẹ khi cả hai cùng ăn sáng. Bố ngừng lại khi thấy tôi và hỏi, “Ngủ nghê thế nào con?”
tr: Mutfağa girdiğimde babam sofrada kahvaltı ederlerken anneme bir şey anlatıyordu. Beni görünce ara verdi ve “Nasıl uyudun?” diye sordu.
es: Cuando entré en la cocina, mi padre estaba contándole algo a mi madre mientras desayunaban en la barra. Al verme, mi padre interrumpió lo que estaba diciendo y me preguntó: —¿Qué tal has dormido?
vi_translation: Entering the kitchen, I saw my dad saying something to my mom as they both had breakfast. Dad stopped when he saw me and asked, "How did you sleep, kid?"
tr_translation: When I entered the kitchen, my father was having breakfast at the table and telling my mother something. When he saw me, he paused and asked, "How did you sleep?"
es_translation: When I entered the kitchen, my father was telling my mother something while they were having breakfast at the counter. Upon seeing me, my father interrupted what he was saying and asked me: —How did you sleep?

en: “I slept fantastically,” I said, which was true. Briefly, but well.
vi: “Say sưa ngon lành ạ,” tôi đáp, vì đúng thế thật. Ngủ được chốc lát thôi nhưng rất sâu.
tr: “Fevkalade,” dedim ki bu doğruydu. Kısa ama iyi.
es: —De maravilla —le dije. Y era verdad. Había dormido poco, pero bien.
vi_translation: “Slept soundly,” I replied, because it was true. Slept only for a short while but very deeply.
tr_translation: “Extraordinary,” I said, which was true. Short but good.
es_translation: —Marvelous —I told him. And it was true. He had slept little, but well.

en: He smiled. “I was just telling your mom that I have this recurring anxiety dream,” he said. “So I’m in college. And I’m taking a Hebrew class, except the professor doesn’t speak Hebrew, and the tests aren’t in Hebrew—they’re in gibberish. But everyone is acting like this made-up language with a made-up alphabet is Hebrew. And so I have this test, and I have to write in a language I don’t know using an alphabet I can’t decipher.”
vi: Bố mỉm cười. “Bố vừa kể với mẹ là bố cứ mơ đi mơ lại một chuyện cũng khá căng thẳng,” bố nói. “Trong mơ bố đi học đại học và theo một lớp tiếng Hebrew, nhưng thầy giáo không biết tiếng Hebrew, và bài kiểm tra cũng không bằng tiếng Hebrew nốt–tất cả đều là một mớ rối rắm vô nghĩa. Nhưng ai cũng làm như thể thứ ngôn ngữ và bảng chữ cái chắp vá lấp liếm ấy chính là tiếng Hebrew. Bố vẫn phải làm bài kiểm tra, và phải viết bằng thứ tiếng bố hoàn toàn không biết, dùng những con chữ bố hoàn toàn mù tịt.”
tr: Gülümsedi. “Tam da annene sürekli tekrar eden bir anksiyete rüyası gördüğümü anlatıyordum,” dedi. “Üniversitedeyim. Ve İbranice dersi alıyorum fakat profesör İbranice konuşmuyor ve sınavlar da ibranice değil... abuk sabuk bir dildeler. Ama herkes uydurma bir alfabeden oluşan bu uydurma dil İbraniceymiş gibi davranıyor. Sonuçta sınava giriyorum ve çözemediğim bir alfabeyi kullanarak bilmediğim bir dilde yazmak zorunda kalıyorum.
es: Sonrió. —Estaba contándole a tu madre que tengo un sueño recurrente y angustioso —me explicó—. Estoy en la universidad, en clase de hebreo, aunque el profesor no habla hebreo y los exámenes no son en hebreo. Son en una jerga incomprensible. Pero todo el mundo actúa como si esa lengua inventada, con un alfabeto inventado, fuera hebreo. Así que tengo delante ese examen y debo escribir en una lengua que no sé empleando un alfabeto que no puedo descifrar.
vi_translation: Dad smiled. "I just told Mom that I keep having this recurring dream that's quite stressful," Dad said. "In the dream, I go to college and take a Hebrew class, but the teacher doesn't know Hebrew, and the test isn't in Hebrew either—it's all a bunch of meaningless gibberish. But everyone acts as if that patched-up, nonsensical language and alphabet is actually Hebrew. I still have to take the test and write in a language I don't know at all, using letters I'm completely unfamiliar with."
tr_translation: She smiled. "I was just telling your mother about a recurring anxiety dream I had," she said. "I'm in college. And I'm taking a Hebrew class, but the professor doesn't speak Hebrew and the exams aren't in Hebrew either... they're in some gibberish language. But everyone acts like this made-up language with a made-up alphabet is Hebrew. So I end up taking the exam and have to write in a language I don't know using an alphabet I can't decipher."
es_translation: He smiled. —I was telling your mother that I have a recurring and distressing dream —he explained to me—. I'm at the university, in a Hebrew class, although the professor doesn't speak Hebrew and the exams are not in Hebrew. They are in an incomprehensible jargon. But everyone acts as if that invented language, with an invented alphabet, were Hebrew. So I have that exam in front of me and I must write in a language I don't know using an alphabet I can't decipher.

en: “Interesting,” I said, although in point of fact it wasn’t. Nothing is as boring as other people’s dreams.
vi: “Nghe hay đấy ạ,” tôi nói, dù thực ra cũng chẳng hay mấy. Chẳng có gì nhạt nhẽo nhàm chán bằng giấc mơ của người khác.
tr: “İlginç,” dedim, aslında öyle olmamasına rağmen. Başkalarının rüyaları kadar sıkıcı olan hiçbir şey yoktur.
es: —Interesante —le dije, aunque en realidad no me lo parecía. No hay nada más aburrido que los sueños de los demás.
vi_translation: "Sounds interesting," I said, though it actually wasn't that interesting. Nothing is as dull and boring as someone else's dream.
tr_translation: "Interesting," I said, although it wasn't actually so. There is nothing as boring as other people's dreams.
es_translation: —Interesting —I said, although it didn't really seem that way to me. There is nothing more boring than other people's dreams.

en: “It’s a metaphor for adolescence,” my mother piped up. “Writing in a language—adulthood—you can’t comprehend, using an alphabet—mature social interaction—you can’t recognize.” My mother worked with crazy teenagers in juvenile detention centers and prisons. I think that’s why she never really worried about me—as long as I wasn’t ritually decapitating gerbils or urinating on my own face, she figured I was a success.
vi: “Đó là một ẩn dụ ám chỉ tuổi thanh niên,” mẹ tôi lên tiếng. “Viết bằng một thứ tiếng–tuổi trưởng thành–ta không hiểu được, sử dụng một bảng chữ cái–tương tác xã hội theo nhận thức chín chắn–ta không nhận ra được.” Mẹ tôi làm việc với đám trẻ vị thành niên khùng khùng điên điên trong các trung tâm giáo dưỡng và trại giam dành cho thanh thiếu niên. Tôi nghĩ đó là lí do mẹ không bao giờ thực sự lo ngại gì về tôi–miễn là tôi không phanh thây chuột cảnh để cúng tế hay tự tè vào mặt mình, thì mẹ rút ra kết luận rằng đã nuôi dạy tôi thành công.
tr: “Bu ergenliğinin bir metaforu,” diye başladı annem. “Anlayamadığın bir dilde yazmakyetişkinlik, tanımadığın bir alfabe kullanmakolgun sosyal iletişim.” Annem ıslah evlerinde ve çocuk hapishanelerinde çatlak gençlerle çalışıyordu. Sanırım benim için asla cidden endişelenmemesinin nedeni bu... Ayin yapacağım diye kemirgenlerin kafalarını koparmadığım ve kendi yüzüme işemediğim sürece benim bir başan olduğumu düşünüyordu.
es: —Es una metáfora de la adolescencia —intervino mi madre—. Escribir en una lengua (la edad adulta) que no entiendes y emplear un alfabeto (la interacción social madura) que no reconoces. Mi madre trabajaba con adolescentes locos en centros de menores y cárceles. Creo que por eso yo nunca le preocupaba. Como no me dedicaba a decapitar roedores ni me meaba en mi propia cara, estaba claro que era un triunfador.
vi_translation: “That is a metaphor referring to youth,” my mother spoke up. “Written in a language–adulthood–that we do not understand, using an alphabet–social interactions perceived with maturity–that we do not recognize.” My mother worked with crazy and insane teenagers in reform schools and juvenile detention centers. I think that’s why she never really worried about me–as long as I wasn’t dismembering pet mice for sacrifices or peeing on my own face, she concluded that she had successfully raised me.
tr_translation: “This is a metaphor for your adolescence,” my mother began. “Writing in a language you don't understand is adulthood, using an unfamiliar alphabet is mature social communication.” My mother worked with troubled youths in reformatories and juvenile prisons. I think the reason she never seriously worried about me was this... As long as I wasn't tearing off rodents' heads for rituals or peeing on my own face, she considered me a success.
es_translation: —It's a metaphor for adolescence —my mother interjected—. Writing in a language (adulthood) that you don't understand and using an alphabet (mature social interaction) that you don't recognize. My mother worked with crazy teenagers in juvenile centers and prisons. I think that's why she never worried about me. Since I didn't spend my time decapitating rodents or peeing on my own face, it was clear that I was a success.

en: A normal mother might have said, “Hey, I notice you look like you’re coming down off a meth binge and smell vaguely of algae. Were you perchance dancing with a snakebit Margo Roth Spiegelman a couple hours ago?” But no. They preferred dreams.
vi: Một người mẹ bình thường chắc sẽ nói, “Này, mẹ phát hiện ra rồi nhé, trông con như vừa say chất kích thích thế kia, lại còn tanh tanh mùi bùn rêu. Có phải mấy tiếng trước con vừa nhảy với con bé Margo Roth Spiegelman bị rắn cắn không?” Nhưng không. Bố mẹ tôi thích bàn chuyện những giấc mơ hơn.
tr: Normal bir anne şöyle diyebilirdi: “Hey, esrar âleminden dönmüş gibi görünüyorsun ve belli belirsiz yosun kokuyorsun. Birkaç saat önce bir ihtimal yılan tarafından sokulmuş Margo Roth Spiegelman’la dans etmiş olabilir inisin?” Ama hayır. Rüyaları tercih ediyorlardı.
es: Una madre normal podría haber dicho: «Oye, tienes pinta de estar de bajón después de haberte pegado un atracón de metanfetaminas y hueles a algo parecido a algas. ¿Por casualidad hace un par de horas estabas bailando con Margo Roth Spiegelman, a la que acababa de morder una serpiente?». Pero no. Mis padres preferían los sueños.
vi_translation: A typical mother would probably say, "Hey, I found out, you look like you're high on something, and you smell like mud and algae. Did you just dance with that girl Margo Roth Spiegelman who got bitten by a snake a few hours ago?" But no. My parents prefer to talk about dreams.
tr_translation: A normal mother might have said: "Hey, you look like you've returned from a weed trip and you faintly smell of seaweed. Is it possible that a few hours ago you danced with Margo Roth Spiegelman, who might have been bitten by a snake?” But no. They preferred dreams.
es_translation: A normal mother might have said, "Hey, you look like you're feeling down after bingeing on methamphetamines and you smell like something similar to seaweed. By any chance, were you dancing with Margo Roth Spiegelman a couple of hours ago, who had just been bitten by a snake?" But no. My parents preferred dreams.

en: I showered, put on a T-shirt and a pair of jeans. I was late, but then again, I was always late.
vi: Tôi tắm rửa, mặc cái áo phông và quần jeans. Muộn mất rồi, cơ mà một lần nữa, tôi vẫn luôn đi trễ mà.
tr: Duş aldım, bir tişört ile kot pantolon giyindim. Geç kalmıştım ama ne de olsa her zaman geç kalıyordum.
es: Me duché y me puse una camiseta y unos vaqueros. Iba tarde, pero siempre iba tarde.
vi_translation: I took a shower, put on a T-shirt and jeans. It's late, but then again, I'm always late anyway.
tr_translation: I took a shower, put on a t-shirt and jeans. I was late, but after all, I was always late.
es_translation: I took a shower and put on a t-shirt and some jeans. I was running late, but I was always running late.

en: “You’re late,” Mom said when I made it back to the kitchen. I tried to shake the fog in my brain enough to remember how to tie my sneakers.
vi: “Muộn đấy con,” mẹ nói khi tôi quay lại bếp. Tôi lúc lắc đầu cho thứ sương mù lùng bùng trong não văng bớt đi, đủ để nhớ lại phải thắt dây giày như thế nào.
tr: “Geç kaldın,” dedi annem, mutfağa dönmeyi başardığımda. Beynimdeki sisi, spor ayakkabılarımı nasıl bağlayacağımı hatırlamama yetecek kadar dağıtmaya çalıştım.
es: —Vas tarde —me dijo mi madre cuando volví a la cocina. Intenté despejarme lo suficiente como para recordar cómo atarme las zapatillas de deporte.
vi_translation: "You're late, dear," Mom said as I returned to the kitchen. I shook my head to clear away the fog in my brain, just enough to remember how to tie my shoelaces.
tr_translation: "You're late," said my mother when I finally managed to return to the kitchen. I tried to clear the fog in my brain just enough to remember how to tie my sneakers.
es_translation: —You're late —my mother told me when I returned to the kitchen. I tried to clear my mind enough to remember how to tie my sneakers.

en: “I am aware,” I answered groggily.
vi: “Con biết rồi ạ,” tôi lào phào như hết hơi.
tr: “Farkındayım,” diye cevap verdim halsiz bir şekilde.
es: —Soy consciente —le contesté medio dormido.
vi_translation: "I know already," I whispered breathlessly.
tr_translation: "I'm aware," I replied weakly.
es_translation: —I am aware —I replied half asleep.

en: Mom drove me to school. I sat in the seat that had been Margo’s. Mom was mostly quiet on the drive, which was good, because I was entirely asleep, the side of my head against the minivan window.
vi: Mẹ chở tôi đến trường. Tôi ngồi chỗ Margo từng ngồi. Mẹ hầu như không nói gì trên đường đi, như vậy thực tốt, vì tôi lại ngủ chết giấc, đầu dựa vào cửa sổ xe.
tr: Annem arabayla beni okula götürdü. Daha önce Margo’nun olduğu koltuğa oturdum. Annem araba sürerken sessizdi ki bu iyi bir şeydi, çünkü başım arabanın camına dayalı halde uyuyordum.
es: Mi madre me llevó al instituto. Me senté en el asiento en el que se había sentado Margo. Mi madre apenas habló en el trayecto, por suerte, porque iba completamente dormido, con la cabeza apoyada en la ventanilla del coche.
vi_translation: Mom drove me to school. I sat where Margo used to sit. Mom hardly said anything on the way, which was really good, because I fell asleep again, my head resting against the car window.
tr_translation: My mother drove me to school. I sat in the seat where Margo used to sit. My mother was silent while driving, which was a good thing because I was sleeping with my head resting against the car window.
es_translation: My mother took me to the institute. I sat in the seat where Margo had sat. My mother barely spoke during the trip, luckily, because I was completely asleep, with my head resting on the car window.

en: As Mom pulled up to school, I saw Margo’s usual spot empty in the senior parking lot. Couldn’t blame her for being late, really. Her friends didn’t gather as early as mine.
vi: Khi mẹ dừng trước trường, tôi thấy chỗ Margo thường đỗ xe trong bãi trống không. Thực ra không trách cô ấy đi muộn được. Đám bạn của Margo không tụ bạ sớm như mấy thằng bạn tôi.
tr: Annem okula varınca, son sınıfların park alanında Margo’nun her zamanki yerinin boş olduğunu gördüm. Geç kaldığı için onu suçlayamazdım. Arkadaşları benimkiler kadar erken toplanmıyordu.
es: Cuando mi madre me dejó en el instituto, vi que la plaza del aparcamiento de los alumnos de último curso en la que solía aparcar Margo estaba vacía. La verdad es que no podía culparla por llegar tarde. Sus amigos no quedaban tan temprano como los míos.
vi_translation: When Mom stopped in front of the school, I saw that the spot where Margo usually parked was empty. Actually, you can't blame her for being late. Margo's friends don't gather as early as my friends do.
tr_translation: When I arrived at school, I saw that Margo's usual spot in the senior parking lot was empty. I couldn't blame her for being late. Her friends didn't gather as early as mine did.
es_translation: When my mother dropped me off at the high school, I saw that the senior student parking spot where Margo usually parked was empty. The truth is, I couldn't blame her for being late. Her friends didn't meet up as early as mine did.

en: As I walked up toward the band kids, Ben shouted, “Jacobsen, was I dreaming or did you—” I gave him the slightest shake of my head, and he changed gears midsentence— “and me go on a wild adventure in French Polynesia last night, traveling in a sailboat made of bananas?”
vi: Tôi đi về phía mấy thằng loi choi trong ban nhạc thì Ben đã réo ầm lên, “Jacobsen ơi, có phải đêm qua tôi đã mơ không hay chính ông–” tôi ra hiệu cho nó bằng cái lắc đầu khẽ nhất có thể, và nó lập tức chuyển tông ngay giữa câu–“và tôi đã chu du qua quần đảo Thái Bình Dương, lênh đênh trên một du thuyền làm tuyền bằng chuối hả ông?”
tr: Bandocuların yanına doğru yürürken Ben bağırdı: “Jacobsen, rüya mı görüyordum yoksa sen...” Ona bakıp belli belirsiz başımı salladım ve cümlenin ortasında vites değiştirdi: “... ve ben dün gece, muzlardan yapılmış bir yelkenliyle seyahat ederek, Fransız Polinezyası’nda vahşi bir macera mı yaşadık?
es: Al acercarme a los chicos de la banda, Ben gritó: —Jacobsen, ¿estaba soñando o…? —Le hice un discreto gesto con la cabeza y cambió la segunda parte de la frase—. ¿O tú y yo vivimos anoche una aventura salvaje en la Polinesia francesa, viajando en un barco hecho de plátanos?
vi_translation: I walked towards the bunch of rowdy guys in the band when Ben suddenly shouted, "Jacobsen, did I dream last night or did you–" I signaled to him with the slightest shake of my head, and he immediately changed his tone mid-sentence–"and I traveled through the Pacific Islands, drifting on a yacht made of bananas, didn't I?"
tr_translation: As I walked towards the binoculars, Ben shouted: "Jacobsen, was I dreaming or did you..." I looked at him and nodded slightly, and he shifted gears mid-sentence: "... and I yesterday Did we have a wild adventure in French Polynesia, traveling by night on a sailboat made of bananas?"
es_translation: As I approached the boys in the band, Ben shouted: —Jacobsen, was I dreaming or…? —I gave him a discreet nod and he changed the second part of the sentence—. Or did you and I have a wild adventure last night in French Polynesia, traveling on a boat made of bananas?

en: “That was one delicious sailboat,” I answered. Radar raised his eyes at me and ambled into the shade of a tree. I followed him. “Asked Angela about a date for Ben. No dice.” I glanced over at Ben, who was talking animatedly, a coffee stirrer dancing in his mouth as he spoke.
vi: “Du thuyền đó ăn ngon phải biết,” tôi đáp. Radar nhướn mắt với tôi và thủng thẳng đi vào một bóng cây. Tôi đi theo nó. “Đã nhờ Angela kiếm một mối cho Ben. Không ăn thua.” Tôi liếc nhìn Ben, thằng khỉ ấy đang liến thoắng tía lia, một cái que khuấy cà phê nhún nhảy trong miệng nó theo từng lời nói.
tr: “Çok lezzetli bir yelkenliydi,” diye cevap verdim. Radar bana bakıp sallana sallana bir ağacın gölgesine doğru yürüdü. Onu takip ettim. “Angela’ya Ben için bir kız sordum. Nafile.” Neşeli bir şekilde konuşan Ben’e bir bakış attım, o konuştukça ağzının içinde dans eden bir içecek karıştırıcısı vardı.
es: —Un barco precioso —le contesté. Radar me miró, alzó las cejas y se dirigió hacia un árbol. Lo seguí. —He preguntado a Angela si quería ir al baile con Ben. Ni borracha. Miré a Ben, que estaba charlando animadamente. Una cucharilla de plástico bailaba en su boca mientras hablaba.
vi_translation: “The food on that yacht must be delicious,” I replied. Radar raised his eyebrows at me and leisurely walked into the shade of a tree. I followed him. “I asked Angela to find a match for Ben. No luck.” I glanced at Ben, that monkey was chattering away, a coffee stirrer bouncing in his mouth with every word.
tr_translation: “It was a very delicious sailboat,” I replied. Radar looked at me and walked, swaying, towards the shade of a tree. I followed him. “I asked Angela for a girl for Ben. In vain.” I glanced at Ben, who was speaking cheerfully, with a drink stirrer dancing in his mouth as he talked.
es_translation: —A beautiful ship —I replied. Radar looked at me, raised his eyebrows, and walked towards a tree. I followed him. —I asked Angela if she wanted to go to the dance with Ben. Not even drunk. I looked at Ben, who was chatting animatedly. A plastic spoon was dancing in his mouth as he spoke.

en: “That sucks,” I said. “It’s all good, though. He and I will hang out and have a marathon session of Resurrection or something.”
vi: “Chán thế,” tôi nói. “Nhưng thế cũng tốt. Nó và tôi sẽ đàn đúm với nhau và làm một chầu ma-ra-tông chơi Hồi Sinh vậy, đại khái thế.”
tr: “Berbat,” dedim. “Yine de sorun yok. ikimiz beraber takılacağız ve Diriliş maratonu falan yapacağız.
es: —Qué mierda —dije—. Pero está bien. Quedaremos los dos y nos pegaremos una sesión maratoniana de Resurrection o algo así.
vi_translation: "So boring," I said. "But that's okay too. It and I will hang out together and have a marathon session of playing Resurrection, something like that."

es_translation: —What the hell —I said—. But it's okay. We'll stay together and have a marathon session of Resurrection or something like that.

en: Ben came over then, and said, “Are you trying to be subtle? Because I know you’re talking about the honeybunnyless prom tragedy that is my life.” He turned around and headed inside. Radar and I followed him, talking as we went past the band room, where freshmen and sophomores were sitting and chatting amid a slew of instrument cases.
vi: Ben xẹt đến và nói huỵch luôn, “Các ông đang bày trò nho nhã đấy phỏng? Tôi biết thừa các ông đang nói đến thảm kịch dạ hội phi-thỏ-non của đời tôi.” Nó quay ngoắt và đi vào trong. Radar và tôi theo sau, vừa nói chuyện vừa đi ngang qua phòng tập nhạc, nơi tụi lớp chín, lớp mười đang ngồi buôn chuyện giữa ngổn ngang hộp đựng nhạc cụ.
tr: Sonra Ben yanımıza geldi ve “Bana çaktırmadığınızı mı sanıyorsunuz? Çünkü hayatımı oluşturan tavşancıksız balo trajedisi hakkında konuştuğunuzu biliyorum.” Arkasını dönüp içeri doğru yürüdü. Radar’la onu takip ettik, birinci sınıflar ile ikinci sınıfların oturup aralarında çalgı aletlerinin kılıfları arasında muhabbet çevirdikleri bando odasının yanından geçerken konuşuyorduk.
es: Ben se acercó. —¿Estáis disimulando? Porque sé que estáis hablando del drama del baile sin pavas que es mi vida. Se dio media vuelta y se dirigió adentro. Radar y yo lo seguimos y cruzamos hablando la sala de ensayo, donde los alumnos de primero y de segundo charlaban sentados entre un montón de fundas de instrumentos.

He turned sharply and went inside. Radar and I followed, chatting as we walked past the music room, where the ninth and tenth graders were gossiping amidst a mess of instrument cases.
tr_translation: Then Ben came to us and said, "Do you think I don't notice? Because I know you're talking about the ball tragedy that makes up my life without the little bunny." He turned around and walked inside. We followed him with Radar, talking as we passed by the band room where freshmen and sophomores were sitting and chatting among the instrument cases.

Radar and I followed him and crossed through the rehearsal room, where the first and second-year students were chatting while sitting among a bunch of instrument cases.

en: “Why do you even want to go?” I asked.

es: —¿Por qué quieres ir? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: "Why are you so keen on it?" I asked.
tr_translation: “Why do you want to leave?” I asked.

en: “Bro, it’s our senior prom. It’s my last best chance to be some honeybunny’s fondest high school memory.” I rolled my eyes.
vi: “Dạ hội tốt nghiệp năm cuối phổ thông mà ông. Cơ hội hoàn hảo cuối cùng của tôi để lưu lại kí ức thổn thức nhất đời học sinh trong tim một em thỏ non ngon ngon đó.” Tôi nghe mà hai mắt trợn tròn.
tr: “Dostum, bu mezuniyet balomuz. Bir tavşancığm en aşk dolu lise anısı olmak için son şansım.” Gözlerimi devirdim.
es: —Colega, es nuestro baile de graduación. Es mi última oportunidad para pasar a ser un grato recuerdo del instituto para alguna pava. Miré al techo.
vi_translation: “The senior prom, man. My last perfect chance to create the most heart-throbbing memory of my school life with a sweet, innocent girl.” I listened with my eyes wide open.
tr_translation: "My friend, this is our graduation ball. It's my last chance to be the most love-filled high school memory of a little bunny." I rolled my eyes.
es_translation: —Buddy, it's our prom. It's my last chance to become a fond memory of high school for some girl. I looked at the ceiling.

en: The first bell rang, meaning five minutes to class, and like Pavlov’s dogs, people started rushing around, filling up the hallways. Ben and Radar and I stood by Radar’s locker. “So why’d you call me at three in the morning for Chuck Parson’s address?”
vi: Hồi chuông thứ nhất báo còn năm phút nữa đến giờ vào lớp. Lập tức như những con cún của Pavlov, mọi người theo phản xạ có điều kiện bắt đầu rảo cẳng lên, đi lại chật ních trong hành lang. Ben, Radar và tôi đứng cạnh ngăn tủ đựng đồ của Radar. “Thế quái nào lúc ba giờ sáng ông lại gọi tôi hỏi địa chỉ nhà Chuck Parson vậy?”
tr: Derse beş dakika kaldığını gösteren ilk zil çaldı ve insanlar, Pavlov’un köpekleri gibi aceleyle koşuşturarak koridorları doldurmaya başladılar. Ben ve Radar’la, Radar’m dolabının yanında durduk. “Peki, Chuck Parson’m adresini almak için neden sabahın üçünde beni aradın?
es: Sonó el primer timbre, lo que significaba que faltaban cinco minutos para que empezaran las clases, y todo el mundo se puso a correr como perros de Pavlov. Los pasillos se llenaron de gente. Ben, Radar y yo nos detuvimos junto a la taquilla de Radar. —Bueno, ¿por qué me llamaste a las tres de la madrugada para pedirme la dirección de Chuck Parson?
vi_translation: The first bell signaled that there were five minutes left until class started. Immediately, like Pavlov's dogs, everyone began to move quickly, crowding the hallway. Ben, Radar, and I stood next to Radar's locker. "Why the heck did you call me at three in the morning asking for Chuck Parson's address?"

es_translation: The first bell rang, which meant that there were five minutes left before classes started, and everyone started running like Pavlov's dogs. The hallways filled with people. Ben, Radar, and I stopped next to Radar's locker. —Well, why did you call me at three in the morning to ask for Chuck Parson's address?

en: I was mulling over how to best answer that question when I saw Chuck Parson walking toward us. I elbowed Ben’s side and cut my eyes toward Chuck. Chuck, incidentally, had decided that the best strategy was to shave off Lefty. “Holy shitstickers,” Ben said.
vi: Tôi đang uốn ba tấc lưỡi cho ra câu trả lời thỏa đáng nhất thì chợt thấy Chuck Parson tiến lại. Tôi huých Ben và đá ánh mắt về phía Chuck. Hệ quả từ sự kiện đêm qua, Chuck đã quyết định chiến lược hữu hiệu nhất là cạo nhẵn cánh tả. “Móa ơi,” Ben rớt hàm.
tr: Bize doğru gelen Chuck Parson’ı gördüğümde, bu soruyu nasıl en iyi şekilde cevaplayabilirim diye kafa patlatıyordum. Ben’in böğrünü dirseğimle dürttüm ve göz ucuyla Chuck’ı gösterdim. Tesadüfen Chuck en iyi stratejinin solu da tıraş etmek olduğuna karar vermişti. “Vay anasını,” dedi Ben.
es: Estaba pensando cómo responder a su pregunta cuando vi a Chuck Parson viniendo hacia nosotros. Le pegué un codazo a Ben y le señalé a Chuck con los ojos. Por cierto, Chuck había decidido que la mejor estrategia era afeitarse la ceja izquierda. —Qué coñazo —dijo Ben.
vi_translation: I was racking my brain to come up with the most satisfactory answer when I suddenly saw Chuck Parson approaching. I nudged Ben and glanced towards Chuck. As a consequence of last night's event, Chuck had decided that the most effective strategy was to shave his left side clean. "Oh my god," Ben's jaw dropped.

es_translation: I was thinking about how to respond to his question when I saw Chuck Parson coming towards us. I elbowed Ben and pointed at Chuck with my eyes. By the way, Chuck had decided that the best strategy was to shave his left eyebrow. —What a pain in the ass —said Ben.

en: Soon enough, Chuck was in my face as I scrunched back against the locker, his forehead deliciously hairless. “What are you assholes looking at?”
