tr: Hemen ardından Chuck burnumun dibine girince dolaba doğru büzüldüm, alm müthiş bir şekilde tüysüzdü. “Siz göt suratlılar neye bakıyorsunuz?
es: Al momento Chuck me empujó contra la taquilla y acercó su cara a la mía, una bonita cara sin cejas. —¿Qué miráis, gilipollas?
vi_translation: Immediately, Chuck was looming in front of me as I leaned against the locker, his smooth forehead looking quite appealing. "What are you damn bastards looking at?"
tr_translation: Immediately after, when Chuck got right up in my face, I shrank back towards the cupboard; his arm was incredibly hairless. "What are you assholes looking at?""
es_translation: At that moment, Chuck pushed me against the locker and brought his face close to mine, a pretty face without eyebrows. —What are you looking at, dumbass?

en: “Nothing,” said Radar. “We’re certainly not looking at your eyebrows.” Chuck flicked Radar off, slammed an open palm against the locker next to me, and walked away.
vi: “Nhìn gì đâu,” Radar đáp. “Chắc như ăn bắp là tụi này không nhìn lông mày của đằng ấy.” Chuck đẩy Radar ra, xòe bàn tay nện uỳnh vào ngăn tủ cạnh tôi, bỏ đi thẳng.
tr: “Hiçbir şeye,” dedi Radar. “Kesinlikle kaşlarına bakmıyoruz.” Chuck, Radar’a işaret çekti, avcunun içiyle yanımdaki dolaba vurdu ve uzaklaştı.
es: —Nada —le contestó Radar—. Seguro que no estamos mirándote las cejas. Chuck pegó un empujón a Radar, golpeó la taquilla con la palma de la mano y se marchó.
vi_translation: “What are you looking at,” Radar replied. “It's as sure as corn that we weren't looking at your eyebrows.” Chuck pushed Radar away, spread his hand, and slammed it against the locker next to me, then walked off straight away.
tr_translation: “Nothing at all,” said Radar. “We are definitely not looking at your eyebrows.” Chuck gestured to Radar, hit the cabinet next to me with the palm of his hand, and walked away.
es_translation: —Nothing —Radar replied to him—. We're definitely not looking at your eyebrows. Chuck shoved Radar, hit the locker with the palm of his hand, and walked away.

en: “You did that?” Ben asked, incredulous.
vi: “Tác phẩm của ông hả?” Ben mắt tròn mắt dẹt.

es: —¿Se lo has hecho tú? —me preguntó Ben, incrédulo.

tr_translation: "Did you do this?" Ben asked incredulously.
es_translation: —Did you do it? —Ben asked me, incredulous.

en: “You can never tell anyone,” I said to both of them. And then quietly added, “I was with Margo Roth Spiegelman.”

tr: “Hiç kimseye söylemeyin,” dedim ikisine de. Sonra sessizce, “Margo Roth Spiegelman’laydım,” diye ekledim.

tr_translation: "Don't tell anyone," I said to both of them. Then quietly, I added, "I was with Margo Roth Spiegelman."
es_translation: —Don't tell anyone —I said to both of them. And I added in a low voice—: I was with Margo Roth Spiegelman.

en: Ben’s voice rose with excitement. “You were with Margo Roth Spiegelman last night? At THREE A.M.?” I nodded. “Alone?” I nodded. “Oh my God, if you hooked up with her, you have to tell me every single thing that happened. You have to write me a term paper on the look and feel of Margo Roth Spiegelman’s breasts. Thirty pages, minimum!”

Vào lúc BA GIỜ SÁNG?” Tôi gật. “Chỉ có hai mình thôi?” Tôi gật. “Ôi trời đất ơi, nếu ông đã quặp nàng ấy, ông phải kể cho tôi tỉ mỉ từng chi tiết đã diễn ra. Ông phải viết cho tôi một bài luận về hai tòa thiên nhiên của Margo Roth Spiegelman, trông thế nào, cảm nhận ra sao, tối thiểu dài ba mươi trang!”
tr: Ben’in sesi heyecanla yükseldi. “Dün gece Margo Roth Spiegelman’la miydin? SABAH ÜÇTE!” Başımı salladım. “Baş başa?” Başımı salladım. “Ah Tanrım, onunla işi pişirdiysen, bana her şeyi anlatmalısın. Bana Margo Roth Spiegelman’ın göğüslerinin nasıl göründüğü ve ele nasıl geldiğiyle ilgili bir dönem ödevi yazmak zorundasın. Otuz sayfa, en az!
es: Ben alzó la voz emocionado. —¿Anoche estabas con Margo Roth Spiegelman? ¿A las tres de la madrugada? —Asentí—. ¿Solos? —Asentí—. Joder, si te has enrollado con ella, tienes que contarme hasta el último detalle. Tienes que escribirme un ensayo sobre el aspecto y el tacto de las tetas de Margo Roth Spiegelman. Treinta páginas como mínimo.

"Oh my God, if you hooked up with her, you have to tell me every single detail of what happened. You have to write me an essay about Margo Roth Spiegelman's two natural wonders, how they look, how they feel, at least thirty pages long!"

Damn, if you hooked up with her, you have to tell me every single detail. You have to write me an essay about the look and feel of Margo Roth Spiegelman's boobs. Thirty pages at least.

en: “I want you to do a photo-realistic pencil drawing,” Radar said.

tr_translation: “I want you to do a pencil drawing with photographic realism,” said Radar.

en: Radar half raised his hand. I dutifully called on him. “Yes, I was wondering if it would be possible for you to write a sestina about Margo Roth Spiegelman’s breasts? Your six words are: pink, round, firmness, succulent, supple, and pillowy.”

es: Radar alzó una mano. Se la choqué obedientemente. —Sí, me preguntaba si sería posible que escribieras una sextina sobre las tetas de Margo Roth Spiegelman. Tus palabras clave son: «Rosadas», «Redondas», «Firmes», «Suculentas», «Flexibles» y «Blandas» —me dijo Radar.
vi_translation: Radar tentatively raised his hand, so I had to let him speak. "Uh, I was wondering if you could write a sestina about Margo's breasts? The six words to rhyme with are: pink, round, firm, soft, smooth, and gentle."

en: “Personally,” Ben said, “I think at least one of the words should be buhbuhbuhbuh.”

es_translation: —Personally —said Ben—, I think at least one of the words should be "turturturtur."

en: “I don’t think I’m familiar with that word,” I said.

tr_translation: "I don't think I'm familiar with that word," I said.
es_translation: —I don't think I know that word —I added.

en: “It’s the sound my mouth makes when I’m giving a honey-bunny the patented Ben Starling Speedboat.” At which point Ben mimicked what he would do in the unlikely event that his face ever encountered cleavage.
vi: “Đó là âm thanh cái miệng tôi phát ra khi tôi trao tặng Tàu Siêu Tốc Ben Sao Xẹt đã được bảo hộ bản quyền cho một nàng thỏ non.” Đến đây Ben giả bộ biểu diễn như nó sẽ làm trong tình huống hi hữu rằng nó được thưởng lãm một tòa thiên nhiên.
tr: “Bu bir tavşancığa patentli Ben Starling Sürat Motoru verdiğimde ağzımdan çıkan ses.” Tam bu noktada, Ben bir göğüs dekoltesiyle karşı karşıya kalması gibi pek mümkün olmayan bir durumda ne yapacağını taklit etti.
es: —Es el sonido que hago con la boca cuando meto la cara entre las tetas de una pava. En ese punto Ben imitó lo que haría en el improbable caso de que su cara se topara alguna vez con unas tetas.
vi_translation: "That is the sound my mouth makes when I present the Copyrighted Super Speedy Ben to a young bunny." At this point, Ben pretended to perform as he would in the rare situation of being able to admire a natural wonder.
tr_translation: “This is the sound that comes out of my mouth when I give a patented Ben Starling Speed Motor to a little bunny.” At this point, Ben mimicked what he would do in the highly unlikely event of being confronted with a cleavage.
es_translation: —It's the sound I make with my mouth when I stick my face between a chick's tits. At that point, Ben mimicked what he would do in the unlikely event that his face ever encountered some breasts.

en: “Right now,” I said, “although they have no idea why, thousands of girls all across America are feeling a chill of fear and disgust run down their spines. Anyway, I didn’t hook up with her, perv.”
vi: “Ngay lúc này,” tôi nói, “hàng ngàn cô gái trên khắp nước Mĩ đang cảm thấy cơn ớn lạnh đầy sợ hãi và ghê tởm bò dọc sống lưng, dù họ không hề hay biết lí do. Thực ra thì tôi không có gặm Margo, các ông chỉ có suy diễn biến thái là nhanh.
tr: “Tam şu anda,” dedim, “neden olduğunu bilmeseler de Amerika’ nın dört bir yanındaki binlerce kız korkudan titriyor ve iliklerine kadar iğreniyor. Her neyse, Margo’yla işi pişirmedim, sapık.
es: —Ahora mismo —dije—, aunque no saben por qué, miles de chicas de todo el país sienten que un escalofrío de miedo y asco les recorre la columna vertebral. De todas formas, no me enrollé con ella, pervertido.
vi_translation: “Right now,” I said, “thousands of girls across America are feeling a chilling fear and disgust creeping up their spines, even though they have no idea why. In fact, I did not bite Margo, you guys just have a twisted imagination.”
tr_translation: “Right now,” I said, “thousands of girls all across America are trembling with fear and feeling disgusted to their core, even though they don't know why. Anyway, I didn't hook up with Margo, you pervert.”
es_translation: —Right now —I said—, although they don't know why, thousands of girls all over the country feel a shiver of fear and disgust running down their spines. Anyway, I didn't hook up with her, pervert.

en: “Typical,” Ben said. “I’m the only guy I know with the balls to give a honeybunny what she wants, and the only one with no opportunities.”
vi: “Mẫu mực đây,” Ben vênh mặt. “Theo hiểu biết của mình, tôi là chàng trai duy nhất có cặp trứng cò sẵn sàng dâng hiến cho một nàng thỏ non những gì nàng muốn, đồng thời là chàng duy nhất không có cơ hội thực hiện tâm nguyện đó.
tr: “Her zamanki gibi,” dedi Ben. “Bir tavşancığa istediğini verebilecek tek erkeğim ve buna hiç fırsatı olmayan tek kişiyim.
es: —Siempre igual —me contestó Ben—. Soy el único tío que conozco con huevos para darle a una pava lo que quiere y el único que no tiene oportunidades de hacerlo.
vi_translation: “Here is the model,” Ben said arrogantly. “To my knowledge, I am the only guy with a pair of eggs ready to offer a young bunny whatever she wants, and at the same time, the only guy who has no chance to fulfill that wish.”
tr_translation: “As usual,” said Ben. “I am the only man who can give a bunny what it wants and the only one who never gets the chance.”
es_translation: —Always the same —Ben replied to me—. I'm the only guy I know with the balls to give a chick what she wants and the only one who doesn't get the chance to do it.

en: “What an amazing coincidence,” I said. It was life as it had always been—only more fatigued. I had hoped that last night would change my life, but it hadn’t—at least not yet.
vi: “Trùng hợp kì diệu thật,” tôi bình luận. Vẫn là cuộc sống như nó luôn như vậy–chỉ thêm cảm giác mệt mỏi trong người. Tôi đã hi vọng rằng đêm qua sẽ thay đổi cuộc đời tôi, nhưng cũng chẳng có gì thay đổi–chí ít là chưa.
tr: “Ne şaşırtıcı bir tesadüf,” dedim. Hayat her zaman olduğu gibiydi... yalnızca daha yorgundum. Dün gecenin hayatım değiştireceğini ummuştum ama değiştirmemişti... en azından şimdilik.
es: —Qué extraña casualidad —le dije. La vida era como siempre, solo que estaba más cansado. Había esperado que la noche anterior cambiara mi vida, pero no había sido así. Al menos de momento.
vi_translation: “What a miraculous coincidence,” I commented. Life is still the same as it always has been—just with an added feeling of fatigue. I had hoped that last night would change my life, but nothing has changed—at least not yet.
tr_translation: “What a surprising coincidence,” I said. Life was as it always was... only I was more tired. I had hoped that last night would change my life, but it hadn't... at least not yet.
es_translation: —What a strange coincidence —I told him. Life was as usual, only I was more tired. I had hoped that the previous night would change my life, but it hadn't been so. At least for now.

en: The second bell rang. We hustled off to class.
vi: Hồi chuông thứ hai reo. Chúng tôi vội kéo nhau vào lớp.
tr: İkinci zil çaldı. Aceleyle derse gittik.
es: Sonó el segundo timbre y nos fuimos inmediatamente a clase.
vi_translation: The second bell rang. We hurriedly pulled each other into the classroom.
tr_translation: The second bell rang. We hurried to class.
es_translation: The second bell rang and we immediately went to class.

en: I became extremely tired during calc first period. I mean, I had been tired since waking, but combining fatigue with calculus seemed unfair. To stay awake, I was scribbling a note to Margo— nothing I’d ever send to her, just a summary of my favorite moments from the night before—but even that could not keep me awake. At some point, my pen just stopped moving, and I found my field of vision shrinking and shrinking, and then I was trying to remember if tunnel vision was a symptom of fatigue. I decided it must be, because there was only one thing in front of me, and it was Mr. Jiminez at the blackboard, and this was the only thing that my brain could process, and so when Mr. Jiminez said, “Quentin?” I was extraordinarily confused, because the one thing happening in my universe was Mr. Jiminez writing on the blackboard, and I couldn’t fathom how he could be both an auditory and a visual presence in my life.
vi: Tôi bắt đầu thấy mệt rã rời trong suốt giờ giải tích tiết một. Thực ra tôi đã thấy bải hoải từ lúc thức dậy, nhưng cộng cái sự mệt với môn giải tích thì hình như hơi bất công. Để tỉnh táo được, tôi ngồi ngoáy mấy dòng cho Margo– không đời nào tôi sẽ gửi cho cô ấy, chỉ là tóm tắt lại những khoảnh khắc tôi ưng nhất từ đêm hôm trước–thế mà hai mắt vẫn díp tịt. Ở một thời điểm nào đó, tôi không đưa nổi bút nữa, góc nhìn cứ hẹp dần, hẹp dần, và tôi lục trí nhớ xem không biết thị trường hình ống có phải là triệu chứng của cơn kiệt sức hay không. Tôi cho rằng ắt đúng vậy rồi, vì tôi chỉ nhìn thấy duy nhất một người ở phía trước, chính là thầy Jiminez trước bảng đen. Có lẽ đây là thông tin duy nhất bộ não tôi còn xử lí được, nên khi thầy Jiminez nói, “Quentin?”, tôi cực kì bối rối. Điều duy nhất đang diễn ra trong vũ trụ của tôi là thầy Jiminez viết gì đó lên bảng, và tôi không tài nào hiểu được sao thầy có thể tồn tại trong cuộc đời tôi dưới dạng thức vừa hữu thanh vừa hữu hình như vậy.
tr: İlk matematik dersinde aşın derecede yorgun hissetmeye başladım. Yani uyandığımdan beri yorgundum ama yorgunluk ile matematiğin birleşmesi haksızlık gibi geliyordu. Uyanık kalmak için Margo’ya bir not karalıyordumasla ona göndereceğim bir şey değildi, sadece önceki geceden en sevdiğim anlann bir özetiydiama bu bile beni uyanık tutamadı. Bir noktada, kalemim hareket etmeyi bıraktı ve görüş alanımı gittikçe daralırken buldum, ardından tünel görüşünün yorgunluğun bir belirtisi olup olmadığım hatırlamaya çalıştım. Öyle olması gerektiğine karar verdim çünkü önümde tek bir şey vardı ve o da tahtadaki Bay Jiminez’di, beynimin algılayabildiği tek şey buydu ve bunun üstüne Bay Jiminez, “Quentin?” dediği zaman, aşırı derecede kafam karışmıştı çünkü benim evrenimde olan tek şey Bay Jiminez’in tahtaya yazı yazmasıydı ve onun hayatımda nasıl hem işitsel hem de görsel bir varlığı olduğunu idrak ■ edemiyordum.
es: Durante la primera clase de cálculo me sentí tremendamente cansado. Bueno, estaba cansado desde que me había despertado, pero combinar el cansancio con el cálculo me pareció injusto. Para mantenerme despierto me dediqué a escribirle una nota a Margo —teniendo en cuenta que no iba a mandársela, era un simple resumen de mis momentos favoritos de la noche anterior—, pero ni siquiera así lo conseguía. En un determinado momento mi boli dejó de moverse y sentí que mi campo visual se reducía cada vez más, de modo que intenté recordar si la visión en túnel era un síntoma de cansancio. Llegué a la conclusión de que debía de serlo, porque ante mí veía una sola cosa, al señor Jiminez en la pizarra, era lo único que mi cerebro procesaba, y cuando el señor Jiminez dijo «¿Quentin?», me quedé muy confuso, porque lo único que sucedía en mi universo era que el señor Jiminez escribía en la pizarra, así que no entendía cómo podía ser una presencia acústica y visual a la vez.
vi_translation: I started feeling utterly exhausted during the first period of calculus. In fact, I had felt weary since waking up, but combining that fatigue with calculus seemed somewhat unfair. To stay awake, I scribbled a few lines for Margo—there was no way I would ever send them to her, just a summary of my favorite moments from the previous night—yet my eyes were still drooping shut. At some point, I couldn't even hold my pen anymore, my field of vision kept narrowing, narrowing, and I racked my brain to recall if tunnel vision was a symptom of exhaustion. I figured it must be, because the only person I could see in front of me was Mr. Jiminez at the blackboard. Perhaps this was the only information my brain could process, so when Mr. Jiminez said, "Quentin?", I was extremely confused. The only thing happening in my universe was Mr. Jiminez writing something on the board, and I couldn't understand how he could exist in my life in both audible and visible forms like that.
tr_translation: I started to feel extremely tired during the first math class. I mean, I had been tired since I woke up, but the combination of tiredness and math seemed unfair. To stay awake, I scribbled a note to Margo—it wasn't something I would actually send her, just a summary of my favorite moments from the previous night—but even that couldn't keep me awake. At one point, my pen stopped moving, and I found my field of vision narrowing; then I tried to remember if tunnel vision was a symptom of tiredness. I decided it must be because there was only one thing in front of me, and that was Mr. Jiminez on the board, the only thing my brain could perceive, and on top of that, when Mr. Jiminez said, "Quentin?" I was extremely confused because the only thing in my universe was Mr. Jiminez writing on the board, and I couldn't comprehend how he could have both an auditory and visual presence in my life.
es_translation: During the first calculus class, I felt tremendously tired. Well, I had been tired since I woke up, but combining tiredness with calculus seemed unfair to me. To stay awake, I dedicated myself to writing a note to Margo —considering that I wasn't going to send it, it was just a simple summary of my favorite moments from the previous night—, but even that didn't work. At a certain point, my pen stopped moving and I felt my field of vision narrowing more and more, so I tried to remember if tunnel vision was a symptom of tiredness. I concluded that it must be, because before me I saw only one thing, Mr. Jiminez at the board, it was the only thing my brain processed, and when Mr. Jiminez said "Quentin?", I was very confused, because the only thing happening in my universe was Mr. Jiminez writing on the board, so I didn't understand how he could be both an acoustic and visual presence at the same time.

en: “Yes?” I asked.
vi: “Vâng?” tôi hỏi lại.
tr: “Evet?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Sí? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: “Yes?” I asked again.
tr_translation: "Yes?" I asked.
es_translation: —Yes? —I asked him.

en: “Did you hear the question?”
vi: “Em có nghe thấy câu hỏi không?”
tr: “Soruyu duydun mu?
es: —¿Has oído la pregunta?
vi_translation: "Can you hear the question?"
tr_translation: “Did you hear the question?”
es_translation: —Have you heard the question?

en: “Yes?” I asked again.
vi: “Vâng?” tôi lại hỏi lại.
tr: “Evet?” diye sordum tekrar.
es: —¿Sí? —volví a preguntar.
vi_translation: “Yes?” I asked again.
tr_translation: “Yes?” I asked again.
es_translation: —Yes? —I asked again.

en: “And you raised your hand to answer it?” I looked up, and sure enough my hand was raised, but I did not know how it had come to be raised, and I only sort of knew how to go about de-raising it. But then after considerable struggle, my brain was able to tell my arm to lower itself, and my arm was able to do so, and then finally I said, “I just needed to ask to go to the bathroom?”
vi: “Em giơ tay để trả lời phải không?” Tôi ngước nhìn, đúng là tay tôi đang giơ lên, nhưng không hiểu thế quái nào nó lại giơ lên như vậy, và hình như tôi chỉ hơi hơi biết phải làm gì để đảo ngược hành động ấy. Rồi bằng nỗ lực không nhỏ, bộ não của tôi mới bảo được cánh tay hãy hạ xuống, cánh tay cũng chịu nghe lời, và cuối cùng tôi nói, “Em xin phép đi nhà vệ sinh được không ạ?”
tr: “Ve cevap vermek için mi elini kaldırdın?” Yukarı baktım, hakikaten elim yukan kalkmıştı ama nasıl kalktığını bilmiyordum, yalnızca nasıl indirmeyi başaracağımı biliyor gibiydim. Ancak hatırı sayılır bir mücadeleden sonra, beynim koluma kendini indirmesini söyleyebildi ve kolum denileni yapabildi, sonra nihayet, “Sadece tuvalete gidebilir miyim diye sormam gerekiyordu,” dedim.
es: —¿Y has levantado la mano para contestar? Levanté los ojos, y por supuesto tenía la mano levantada, pero no sabía cómo había llegado hasta allí. Lo único que más o menos sabía era cómo bajarla. Tras un considerable esfuerzo, mi cerebro consiguió decirle a mi brazo que bajara, y mi brazo consiguió bajar. —Solo quería preguntar si puedo ir al baño —dije por fin.
vi_translation: “Did you raise your hand to answer?” I looked up, indeed my hand was raised, but I had no idea how it got there, and it seemed like I only slightly knew what to do to reverse that action. Then with considerable effort, my brain finally told my arm to lower, the arm obeyed, and finally I said, “May I go to the restroom?”
tr_translation: “And did you raise your hand to answer?” I looked up, indeed my hand was raised but I didn't know how it had happened, I only seemed to know how to manage lowering it. However, after a considerable struggle, my brain was able to tell my arm to lower itself and my arm was able to comply, then finally, I said, “I just needed to ask if I could go to the bathroom.”
es_translation: —And did you raise your hand to answer? I raised my eyes, and of course, my hand was raised, but I didn't know how it had gotten there. The only thing I somewhat knew was how to lower it. After considerable effort, my brain managed to tell my arm to lower, and my arm managed to lower. —I just wanted to ask if I can go to the bathroom —I finally said.

en: And he said, “Go ahead,” and then someone else raised a hand and answered some question about some kind of differential equation.
vi: Thầy bảo, “Cứ đi đi,” rồi đứa nào đó trong lớp giơ tay trả lời câu hỏi nào đó về dạng phương trình vi phân nào đó.
tr: O da, “Tabii,” dedi, sonra başka biri elini kaldırıp diferansiyel denklemle ilgili bir soruyu cevapladı.
es: —Ve —me contestó el profesor. Y entonces alguien levantó la mano y preguntó algo sobre las ecuaciones diferenciales.
vi_translation: The teacher said, "Just go," then someone in the class raised their hand to answer some question about some type of differential equation.
tr_translation: He also said, "Of course," then someone else raised their hand and answered a question about the differential equation.
es_translation: —Go —the professor replied to me. And then someone raised their hand and asked something about differential equations.

en: I walked to the bathroom, splashed water on my face, and then leaned over the sink, close to the mirror, and appraised myself. I tried to rub the bloodshotedness out of my eyes, but I couldn’t. And then I had a brilliant idea. I went into a stall, put the seat down, sat down, leaned against the side, and fell asleep. The sleep lasted for about sixteen milliseconds before the second period bell rang. I got up and walked to Latin, and then to physics, and then finally it was fourth period, and I found Ben in the cafeteria and said, “I really need a nap or something.”
vi: Tôi vào nhà vệ sinh, vã nước lên mặt, rồi tì lên bồn rửa, ghé sát vào gương, săm soi mặt mình. Tôi cố dụi hai con mắt đỏ ngầu mà chẳng thấy đỡ chút nào. Và rồi tôi nảy ra một ý tưởng hết xảy. Tôi vào một ngăn vệ sinh, đậy nắp bồn cầu xuống, ngồi lên, dựa vào vách, và ngủ. Giấc ngủ kéo dài khoảng mười sáu mili giây thì chuông báo tiết hai reo. Tôi đứng dậy đi vào lớp học giờ tiếng La-tinh, rồi vật lí. Rút cục cũng đến tiết bốn, tôi vớ được Ben trong căng-tin và nói, “Tôi thực sự cần chợp mắt một lúc hoặc đại loại thế.”
tr: Tuvalete gidip yüzüme su çarptım, sonra lavabonun üstüne eğilip aynaya yanaştım ve kendimi inceledim. Kanlanmış gözlerimi ovuşturarak düzeltmeye çalıştım ama yapamadım. Sonra aklıma harika bir fikir geldi. Tuvaletlerden birine girdim, klozet kapağını kapatıp oturdum, yan tarafa dayandım ve uykuya daldım, ikinci ders zili çalmadan önce yaklaşık on altı milisaniye uyuyabilmiştim. Kalkıp Latince dersine, sonra fiziğe girdim, ardından nihayet teneffüs geldi, Ben’i kafeteryada buldum ve “Gerçekten kısa bir uykuya ihtiyacım var,” dedim.
es: Me dirigí al baño, me eché agua en la cara, me acerqué al espejo por encima del lavabo y me observé. Me froté los ojos para eliminar la rojez, pero no pude. Y entonces se me ocurrió una idea brillante. Entré en un retrete, bajé la tapa, me senté, me apoyé en la pared y me quedé dormido. El sueño duró unos dieciséis milisegundos, hasta que sonó el timbre de la segunda hora. Me levanté y me dirigí a clase de latín, luego a física y por fin llegó la hora de comer. Encontré a Ben en la cafetería. —Necesito una siesta —le dije.
vi_translation: I went into the bathroom, splashed water on my face, then leaned on the sink, got close to the mirror, and scrutinized my face. I tried rubbing my bloodshot eyes but it didn't help at all. And then I came up with a brilliant idea. I went into a stall, closed the toilet lid, sat on it, leaned against the wall, and slept. The sleep lasted about sixteen milliseconds before the bell for the second period rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then physics. Finally, it was the fourth period, I caught up with Ben in the cafeteria and said, “I really need to take a nap or something.”
tr_translation: I went to the bathroom and splashed water on my face, then leaned over the sink, approached the mirror, and examined myself. I tried to fix my bloodshot eyes by rubbing them, but I couldn't. Then a great idea came to my mind. I entered one of the stalls, closed the toilet lid, sat down, leaned to the side, and fell asleep; I managed to sleep for about sixteen milliseconds before the second bell rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then physics, and finally, the break came. I found Ben in the cafeteria and said, "I really need a short nap."
es_translation: I went to the bathroom, splashed water on my face, approached the mirror above the sink, and observed myself. I rubbed my eyes to eliminate the redness, but I couldn't. And then a brilliant idea occurred to me. I entered a stall, lowered the lid, sat down, leaned against the wall, and fell asleep. The sleep lasted about sixteen milliseconds, until the bell for the second period rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then to physics, and finally it was lunchtime. I found Ben in the cafeteria. —I need a nap —I told him.

en: “Let’s have lunch with RHAPAW,” he answered.
vi: “Chúng ta ăn trưa cùng RHAPAW thôi,” Ben đáp.
tr: “Haydi, SESIB’la öğle yemeğine çıkalım,” dedi.
es: —Vamos a comer al Chuco —me contestó.
vi_translation: “Let's have lunch with RHAPAW,” Ben replied.
tr_translation: “Come on, let's go out for lunch with SESIB,” he said.
es_translation: —Let's go eat at Chuco —he answered me.

en: RHAPAW was a fifteen-year-old Buick that had been driven with impunity by all three of Ben’s older siblings and was, by the time it reached Ben, composed primarily out of duct tape and spackle. Her full name was Rode Hard And Put Away Wet, but we called her RHAPAW for short. RHAPAW ran not on gasoline, but on the inexhaustible fuel of human hope. You would sit on the blisteringly hot vinyl seat and hope she would start, and then Ben would turn the key and the engine would turn over a couple times, like a fish on land making its last, meager, dying flops. And then you would hope harder, and the engine would turn over a couple more times. You hoped some more, and it would finally catch.
vi: RHAPAW là một chiếc Buick mười lăm tuổi, từng được ba ông anh bà chị của Ben hồn nhiên lái suốt năm này sang năm khác. Đến khi vào tay Ben, cấu tạo chính của RHAPAW đã là băng keo và bột bả. Tên đầy đủ của ẻm là “Rồ Hơi Ả Pắn Ả Wa”, gọi tắt là RHAPAW cho gọn. Ẻm không chạy bằng xăng mà bằng thứ nhiên liệu vĩnh cửu tên là “hi vọng của nhân loại.” Cứ việc an tọa trên nệm ghế ni-lông nóng muốn bỏng mông và hi vọng ẻm sẽ chạy, rồi Ben sẽ mở khóa, động cơ khởi động lên xuống vài lần, như chú cá trên bờ ngắc ngoải quẫy đạp những cú cuối cùng trước lúc lâm chung. Thế là càng phải hi vọng mãnh liệt, động cơ chết đi sống lại thêm vài lần nữa. Lại đặt hi vọng nữa, và rút cục ẻm cũng chịu lấy hơi.
tr: SESIB, Ben’in üç ağabeyi tarafından da fütursuzca kullanılmış, on beş yıllık bir Buick’ti ve Ben’e verildiği zaman, esasen izole bant ve dolgu macunundan oluşuyordu. Tam adı Sert Sür Islak Bırak’tı ama biz ona kısaca SESIB diyorduk. SESIB benzinle değil ama bitmek tükenmek bilmez insan umudu yakıtıyla çalışırdı. Haşlak denecek kadar sıcak olan vinil koltuğuna oturur ve çalışmasını umardınız, sonra Ben anahtarı çevirir ve motor birkaç kere teklerdi; cılız, cansız, son çırpınışlarını yapan karaya vurmuş bir balık gibi. Sonra daha fazla umut ederdiniz ve motor birkaç defa daha teklerdi. Biraz daha umut ederdiniz ve nihayet çalışırdı.
es: El Chuco era un Buick de quince años que habían conducido impunemente los tres hermanos mayores de Ben, así que, cuando le llegó a él, era básicamente cinta adhesiva y masilla. Su nombre completo era Churro de Coche, pero lo llamábamos Chuco para abreviar. El Chuco no funcionaba con gasolina, sino con el inagotable combustible de la esperanza. Te sentabas en el abrasador asiento de plástico y esperabas a que arrancara, luego Ben giraba la llave y el motor daba un par de vueltas, como un pez fuera del agua dando los últimos aletazos antes de morir. Seguías esperando y el motor volvía a girar un par de veces más. Esperabas más y al final arrancaba.
vi_translation: RHAPAW was a fifteen-year-old Buick, which Ben's three older siblings had driven carefree year after year. By the time it came into Ben's possession, RHAPAW's main structure was duct tape and putty. Its full name was "Rồ Hơi Ả Pắn Ả Wa," abbreviated to RHAPAW for short. It didn't run on gasoline but on an eternal fuel called "the hope of humanity." Just sit on the burning hot nylon seat and hope it would run, then Ben would turn the key, the engine would start up and down a few times, like a fish on land flailing its last desperate kicks before dying. So you had to hope even more intensely, and the engine would come back to life a few more times. Hope again, and finally, it would take a breath.
tr_translation: SESIB was a fifteen-year-old Buick that had been recklessly used by Ben's three older brothers, and by the time it was given to Ben, it was essentially made up of duct tape and filler. Its full name was Drive Hard Leave Wet, but we simply called it SESIB. SESIB didn't run on gasoline but on the inexhaustible fuel of human hope. You would sit on its vinyl seat, hot enough to be called scorching, and hope it would start; then Ben would turn the key and the engine would sputter a few times, like a weak, lifeless fish gasping its last on dry land. Then you would hope some more, and the engine would sputter a few more times. You would hope a bit more, and finally, it would start.
es_translation: The Chuco was a fifteen-year-old Buick that Ben's three older brothers had driven with impunity, so by the time it got to him, it was basically duct tape and putty. Its full name was Churro de Coche, but we called it Chuco for short. The Chuco didn't run on gasoline, but on the inexhaustible fuel of hope. You would sit on the scorching plastic seat and wait for it to start, then Ben would turn the key and the engine would turn over a couple of times, like a fish out of water giving its last flaps before dying. You kept waiting and the engine would turn over a couple more times. You waited some more and eventually it would start.

en: Ben started RHAPAW and turned the AC on high. Three of the four windows didn’t even open, but the air conditioner worked magnificently, though for the first few minutes it was just hot air blasting out of the vents and mixing with the hot stale air in the car. I reclined the passenger seat all the way back, so that I was almost lying down, and I told him everything: Margo at my window, the Wal-Mart, the revenge, the SunTrust Building, entering the wrong house, SeaWorld, the I-will-miss-hanging-out-with-you.
vi: Ben khởi động RHAPAW và bật điều hòa nhiệt độ ở công suất cao. Ba trong bốn cửa sổ thậm chí còn không mở được, nhưng điều hòa chạy mát lịm, dù mấy phút đầu chỉ có khí nóng phả ra quyện với bầu không khí nóng bức ngột ngạt trong xe. Tôi duỗi ra ở băng ghế sau, gần như nằm thẳng cẳng, và tôi kể với Ben tất cả: Margo bên cửa sổ phòng tôi, Wal-Mart, màn trả thù, tòa nhà SunTrust, đột nhập nhầm nhà, SeaWorld, và tớ-sẽ-nhớ-những-lúc-chơi-với-cậu.
tr: Ben, SESIB’ı çalıştırıp klimayı açtı. Dört pencerenin üçü açılmıyordu bile ama klima ihtişamlı bir şekilde çalışıyordu, yine de ilk birkaç dakika deliklerden yalnızca sıcak hava fışkırıyor ve arabanın içindeki sıcak, bayat havayla karışıyordu. Neredeyse uzanmış gibi olayım diye, yolcu koltuğunu arkaya yatırdım ve Ben’e her şeyi anlattım: penceremdeki Margo’yu, Walmart’ı, intikamı, SunTrust binasını, yanlış eve girmemizi, SeaWorld’ü, “seninle takılmayı özleyeceğim”i.
es: Ben encendió el Chuco y puso el aire acondicionado a tope. Tres de las cuatro ventanillas no se abrían, pero el aire acondicionado funcionaba de maravilla, aunque los primeros minutos no era más que aire caliente que salía de los conductos y se mezclaba con el aire rancio del coche. Recliné al máximo el asiento del copiloto hasta quedarme casi tumbado y se lo conté todo: Margo en mi ventana, el Walmart, la venganza, el SunTrust Building, la entrada en una casa que no era, el SeaWorld y el echaré de menos salir por ahí contigo.
vi_translation: Ben started RHAPAW and turned on the air conditioner at full power. Three out of four windows couldn't even open, but the air conditioner ran cool, although for the first few minutes it only blew hot air, mixing with the stifling hot atmosphere inside the car. I stretched out on the back seat, almost lying flat, and I told Ben everything: Margo at my window, Wal-Mart, the revenge plot, the SunTrust building, breaking into the wrong house, SeaWorld, and the I'll-miss-hanging-out-with-you moment.
tr_translation: Ben started the SESIB and turned on the air conditioner. Three of the four windows wouldn't even open, but the air conditioner was working magnificently; still, for the first few minutes, only hot air was gushing out of the vents, mixing with the hot, stale air inside the car. Wanting to almost lie down, I reclined the passenger seat and told Ben everything: Margo at my window, Walmart, the revenge, the SunTrust building, entering the wrong house, SeaWorld, "I'll miss hanging out with you."
es_translation: Ben turned on the Chuco and cranked the air conditioning to the max. Three of the four windows wouldn't open, but the air conditioning worked wonderfully, although for the first few minutes it was nothing but hot air coming out of the vents and mixing with the stale air of the car. I reclined the passenger seat all the way back until I was almost lying down and told him everything: Margo at my window, the Walmart, the revenge, the SunTrust Building, entering a house that wasn't ours, the SeaWorld, and the I'll miss going out with you.

en: He didn’t interrupt me once—Ben was a good friend in the not-interrupting way—but when I finished, he immediately asked me the most pressing question in his mind.
vi: Ben không chen ngang lần nào–nó là một thằng bạn tốt theo cách biết khi nào không-chen-ngang–nhưng khi tôi vừa dứt lời, lập tức nó đặt ngay câu hỏi đang hết sức bức thiết trong đầu.
tr: Bir kere bile sözümü kesmediBen sözünü kesmeme bakımından iyi bir arkadaştıfakat bitirdiğimde, hemen bana aklındaki en acil soruyu sordu.
es: Ben no me interrumpió ni una vez —era un buen amigo cuando se trataba de no interrumpir—, pero nada más acabar me hizo la pregunta más apremiante para él.
vi_translation: Ben didn't interrupt at all–he's a good friend in the sense that he knows when not to interrupt–but as soon as I finished speaking, he immediately asked the pressing question on his mind.
tr_translation: He didn't interrupt me even once. He was a good friend in terms of not interrupting, but as soon as I finished, he immediately asked me the most urgent question on his mind.
es_translation: Ben did not interrupt me even once —he was a good friend when it came to not interrupting—, but as soon as I finished, he asked me the most pressing question for him.

en: “Wait, so about Jase Worthington, how small are we talking?”
vi: “Về Jase Worthington đó, ông bảo nó nhỏ đến mức nào cơ?”
tr: “Bekle, Jase Worthington hakkında... ne kadar küçüklükten bahsediyoruz?
es: —Espera, cuando dices que Jase Worthington la tiene pequeña, ¿cómo de pequeña exactamente?
vi_translation: “About Jase Worthington, how small did you say he was?”
tr_translation: “Wait, about Jase Worthington... how young are we talking?”
es_translation: —Wait, when you say that Jase Worthington has a small one, how small exactly?

en: “Shrinkage may have played a role, since he was under significant anxiety, but have you ever seen a pencil?” I asked him, and Ben nodded. “Well, have you ever seen a pencil eraser?” He nodded again. “Well, have you ever seen the little shavings of rubber left on the paper after you erase something?” More nodding. “I’d say three shavings long and one shaving wide,” I said. Ben had taken a lot of crap from guys like Jason Worthington and Chuck Parson, so I figured he was entitled to enjoy it a little. But he didn’t even laugh. He was just shaking his head slowly, awestruck.
vi: “Sun lại có thể là một yếu tố tác động, vì lúc đó chú bé đang căng thẳng tột độ, cơ mà đã bao giờ ông thấy cái bút chì chưa?” tôi hỏi và Ben gật đầu. “Chà, thế ông đã bao giờ thấy cục gôm cắm ở đuôi bút chì chưa?” Ben lại gật. “Chà, thế ông đã bao giờ thấy những vân ghét xinh xinh còn trên trang giấy khi ông tẩy cái gì đó đi chưa?” Gật tiếp. “Tôi nghĩ chiều dài cỡ ba vân, chiều rộng cỡ một vân,” tôi kết luận. Ben từng phải trải qua rất nhiều trò lố của những thằng như Jase Worthington và Chuck Parson, nên tôi nghĩ nó xứng đáng được hưởng chút niềm vui nho nhỏ. Nhưng Ben thậm chí còn không cười. Nó chỉ chầm chậm lắc đầu, ra chiều bàng hoàng.
tr: “Büzülme bir rol oynamış olabilir çünkü kayda değer bir endişe yaşıyordu ama... hiç kalem gördün mü?’ diye sordum, Ben başım salladı. “Peki, hiç silgi gördün mü?’ Tekrar başım salladı. “Peki, bir şeyi sildikten sonra kâğıtta kalan küçük silgi kırıntılarını hiç gördün mü?” Biraz daha başım salladı. “Ben üç kırıntı uzunluğunda ve bir kırıntı genişliğinde diyorum,” dedim. Ben, Jason Worthington ve Chuck Parson gibi çocuklardan çok çekmişti, bu yüzden bu durumun biraz keyfini çıkarmayı hak ettiğini düşünüyordum. Ama gülmedi bile. Sadece yavaşça başım salladı, huşuya kapılmıştı.
es: —Es posible que se le encogiera, porque estaba superagobiado, pero ¿has visto alguna vez un lápiz? —le pregunté, y Ben asintió—. Bueno, pues ¿has visto alguna vez la goma de un lápiz? —Volvió a asentir—. Bueno, pues ¿has visto alguna vez las virutas de goma que quedan en el papel cuando has borrado algo? —Asintió otra vez—. Diría que tres virutas de largo por una de ancho. Ben había tragado mucha mierda de tipos como Jason Worthington y Chuck Parson, así que pensé que tenía derecho a divertirse un poco. Pero ni siquiera se rió. Se limitó a mover la cabeza despacio, anonadado.
vi_translation: “Sun could be a contributing factor, because at that time the boy was extremely stressed, but have you ever seen a pencil?” I asked, and Ben nodded. “Well, have you ever seen the eraser attached to the end of the pencil?” Ben nodded again. “Well, have you ever seen the tiny eraser shavings left on the paper when you erase something?” Another nod. “I think the length is about three shavings, the width about one shaving,” I concluded. Ben had to endure a lot of pranks from guys like Jase Worthington and Chuck Parson, so I thought he deserved a little bit of fun. But Ben didn't even laugh. He just slowly shook his head, looking bewildered.
tr_translation: “Shrinking might have played a role because he was experiencing considerable anxiety, but... ‘have you ever seen a pencil?’ I asked, I nodded. ‘Well, have you ever seen an eraser?’ I nodded again. ‘Well, have you ever seen the little eraser crumbs left on the paper after erasing something?’ I nodded a bit more. ‘I’m saying three crumbs long and one crumb wide,’ I said. He had suffered a lot from kids like Jason Worthington and Chuck Parson, so I thought he deserved to enjoy this situation a bit. But he didn’t even laugh. He just slowly nodded, entranced.
es_translation: —It’s possible it shrank, because he was super stressed, but have you ever seen a pencil? —I asked him, and Ben nodded—. Well, have you ever seen the eraser on a pencil? —He nodded again—. Well, have you ever seen the eraser shavings left on the paper when you've erased something? —He nodded again—. I’d say three shavings long by one wide. Ben had swallowed a lot of crap from guys like Jason Worthington and Chuck Parson, so I thought he had the right to have a little fun. But he didn't even laugh. He just shook his head slowly, astonished.

en: “God, she is such a badass.”
vi: “Chèn đét ơi, Margo cao tay thật.”
tr: ‘Tanrım, Margo tam bir baş belası.
es: —Joder, Margo es de puta madre.
vi_translation: "Oh my God, Margo is really skillful."
tr_translation: ‘My God, Margo is a real pain in the neck.”
es_translation: —Damn, Margo is freaking awesome.

en: “I know.”
vi: “Tôi biết.”
tr: “Biliyorum.
es: —Lo sé.
vi_translation: "I know."
tr_translation: “I know.”
es_translation: —I know.

Multiple_ents: ['janis jopli', 'cá nhân kiệt xuất', 'jimi hendrix', 'janis joplin']
en: “She’s the kind of person who either dies tragically at twenty-seven, like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin, or else grows up to win, like, the first-ever Nobel Prize for Awesome.”
vi: “Margo là kiểu người sẵn sàng giã từ cuộc đời một cách oanh liệt ở tuổi hai mươi bảy, như Jimi Hendrix và Janis Joplin, hoặc trưởng thành để chinh phục, gì được nhỉ, giải Nobel đầu tiên cho Cá Nhân Kiệt Xuất chẳng hạn.”
tr: ‘Ya Jimi Hendrix ve Janis Joplin gibi yirmi yedi yaşında trajik bir şekilde ölecek türde bir insan ya da tersine, ilk Nobel Müthişlik Ödülü’nü falan kazanmak için yaşayacak.
es: —Es una de esas personas que o muere trágicamente a los veintisiete años, como Jimi Hendrix y Janis Joplin, o de mayor gana el primer Premio Nobel de Genialidad.
vi_translation: “Margo is the type of person who is ready to bid farewell to life in a glorious manner at the age of twenty-seven, like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin, or grow up to conquer, what could it be, the first Nobel Prize for Outstanding Individual, for example.”
tr_translation: ‘Either the kind of person who will tragically die at twenty-seven like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin, or conversely, someone who will live to win the first Nobel Awesomeness Prize or something.”
es_translation: —He is one of those people who either dies tragically at twenty-seven, like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin, or later in life wins the first Nobel Prize for Genius.

en: “Yeah,” I said. I rarely tired of talking about Margo Roth Spiegelman, but I was rarely this tired. I leaned back against the cracked vinyl headrest and fell immediately asleep. When I woke up, a Wendy’s hamburger was sitting in my lap with a note. Had to go to class, bro. See you after band.
vi: “Ừ,” tôi đáp. Tôi hầu như không bao giờ chán nói về Margo Roth Spiegelman, nhưng tôi hầu như chưa bao giờ mệt rã như lúc này. Tôi dựa vào lưng ghế ni-lông nứt nẻ và lập tức ngủ mất. Khi tỉnh giấc, tôi thấy một gói bánh hamburger Wendy’s trong lòng mình với lời nhắn. Tôi phải vào lớp đây, gặp ông sau buổi tập nhạc nhé.
tr: “Evet,” dedim. Margo Roth Spiegelman hakkında konuşmaktan nadiren yorulurdum ama zaten nadiren bu kadar yorgun olurdum. Çatlak vinil koltuk başlığına tekrar yaslandım ve hemen uykuya daldım. Uyandığımda kucağımda bir not ile bir Wendy’s hamburgeri duruyordu. Derse gitmek zorunda kaldım, dostum. Bandodan sonra görüşürüz.
es: —Sí —le dije. Rara vez me cansaba de hablar de Margo Roth Spiegelman, pero rara vez estaba tan cansado. Me recliné sobre el reposacabezas de plástico rajado y me quedé dormido al momento. Cuando me desperté, tenía encima de las rodillas una hamburguesa del Wendy y una nota: «He tenido que irme a clase, colega. Nos vemos después del ensayo».
vi_translation: “Yes,” I replied. I almost never get tired of talking about Margo Roth Spiegelman, but I was almost never as exhausted as I was at that moment. I leaned back against the cracked nylon seat and immediately fell asleep. When I woke up, I found a Wendy’s hamburger bag on my lap with a note. I have to go to class, see you after band practice.
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said. I rarely got tired of talking about Margo Roth Spiegelman, but I was rarely this tired anyway. I leaned back against the cracked vinyl headrest and immediately fell asleep. When I woke up, there was a note and a Wendy’s hamburger on my lap. Had to go to class, buddy. See you after band practice.
es_translation: —Yes —I told him. Rarely did I tire of talking about Margo Roth Spiegelman, but rarely was I this tired. I leaned back against the cracked plastic headrest and fell asleep instantly. When I woke up, I had a Wendy's burger on my knees and a note: "Had to go to class, buddy. See you after rehearsal."

en: Later, after my last class, I translated Ovid while sitting up against the cinder-block wall outside the band room, trying to ignore the groaning cacophony coming from inside. I always hung around school for the extra hour during band practice, because to leave before Ben and Radar meant enduring the unbearable humiliation of being the lone senior on the bus.
vi: Hết tiết cuối ngày hôm đó, tôi dịch Ovid khi ngồi dựa vào mảng tường tổ ong bên ngoài phòng tập nhạc, cố gắng bỏ ngoài tai những âm thanh hỗn tạp rền rĩ vọng ra. Tôi luôn loanh quanh nán lại trường cho hết giờ tập nhạc, vì về trước Ben và Radar đồng nghĩa với việc phải chịu sự kinh miệt khôn kham khi là thằng năm cuối duy nhất trên xe buýt.
tr: Daha sonra, son dersimden sonra, bando odasının dışmda, beton duvarın üstünde otururken içeriden gelen inleyen kakofoniyi yok saymaya çalışarak Ovid çevirisi yaptım. Bando çalışması sırasında fazladan bir saat boyunca okulda takılırdım çünkü Ben ve Radar olmadan okulu terk etmek, otobüsteki yalnız son sınıf öğrencisi olmanın dayanılmaz utancına katlanmak anlamına geliyordu.
es: Más tarde, después de mi última clase, traduje a Ovidio apoyado en la pared exterior de cemento de la sala de ensayo intentando ignorar las disonancias procedentes del interior. Siempre me quedaba en el instituto durante la hora extra de ensayo, porque marcharme antes que Ben y que Radar implicaba la insoportable humillación de ser el único alumno de último curso del autobús.
vi_translation: After the last class of that day, I translated Ovid while leaning against the honeycomb wall outside the music room, trying to ignore the cacophonous sounds emanating from within. I always hung around school until the music practice was over, because leaving before Ben and Radar meant enduring the unbearable scorn of being the only senior on the bus.
tr_translation: Later, after my last class, I did an Ovid translation while sitting on the concrete wall outside the band room, trying to ignore the wailing cacophony coming from inside. I would hang around the school for an extra hour during band practice because leaving school without Ben and Radar meant enduring the unbearable shame of being the lone senior on the bus.
es_translation: Later, after my last class, I translated Ovid while leaning against the exterior cement wall of the rehearsal room, trying to ignore the dissonances coming from inside. I always stayed at the school during the extra rehearsal hour, because leaving before Ben and Radar meant the unbearable humiliation of being the only senior on the bus.

en: After they got out, Ben dropped Radar off at his house right by the Jefferson Park “village center,” near where Lacey lived. Then he took me home. I noticed Margo’s car was not parked in her driveway, either. So she hadn’t skipped school to sleep. She’d skipped school for another adventure—a me-less adventure. She’d probably spent her day spreading hair-removal cream on the pillows of other enemies or something. I felt a little left out as I walked into the house, but of course she knew I would never have joined her anyway—I cared too much about a day of school. And who even knew if it would be just a day for Margo. Maybe she was off on another three-day jaunt to Mississippi, or temporarily joining the circus. But it wasn’t either of those, of course. It was something I couldn’t imagine, that I would never imagine, because I couldn’t be Margo.
vi: Rời phòng tập, Ben thả Radar về nhà, ở ngay cạnh “cái rốn làng” Công viên Jefferson, gần nhà Lacey. Rồi nó đưa tôi về. Tôi nhận thấy xe của Margo cũng không đỗ ở lối đi nhà cô ấy. Tức là cô ấy không trốn học ở nhà ngủ. Margo không đến trường vì bận một cuộc phiêu lưu khác–một cuộc phiêu lưu phi-Quentin. Có thể cô ấy đã dành cả ngày trát kem tẩy lông lên gối của những kẻ thù khác, hoặc gì đó đại loại thế. Vừa đi bộ vào nhà, tôi vừa thấy mình bị ra rìa, nhưng dĩ nhiên Margo biết tôi sẽ không đời nào nhập bọn cùng cô ấy nữa–tôi quá ưu tiên một ngày ở trường. Ai mà biết được, có thể chỉ là một ngày dành cho Margo. Có thể cô ấy lại phượt thêm một chuyến ba ngày đến Mississippi, hoặc rong ruổi theo đoàn xiếc. Nhưng tất nhiên thực tế không phải là bất cứ kịch bản nào nói trên. Mà là điều gì đó tôi không thể tưởng tượng nổi, vì tôi sao có thể là Margo được.
tr: Onlar dışarı çıktıktan sonra Ben, Radar’ı Lacey’nin oturduğu yerin yakınında bulunan Jefferson Park “köy merkezı’nin tam yanındaki evine bıraktı. Sonra beni eve götürdü. Margo’nun arabasının garaj yoluna da park edilmemiş olduğunu fark ettim. Yani uyumak için okulu asmamıştı. Okulu başka bir macera için asmıştı... bensiz bir macera. Muhtemelen gününü başka düşmanlarının yastıklarına tüy dökücü krem falan sürerek geçirmişti. Eve girerken kendimi biraz dışlanmış hissettim ama elbette ona asla, hiçbir şekilde katılmayacağımı biliyordu... okul gününü gereğinden fazla önemsiyordum. Ve bunun Margo için yalnızca tek bir gün olacağım kimbilebilirdi ki. Belki Mississippi’ye doğru üç günlük bir gezintiye çıkmıştı ya da geçici olarak sirke katılıyordu. Ama bunlardan hiçbiri değildi tabii ki. Hayal edemeyeceğim bir şeydi, asla hayal etmeyeceğim bir şey, çünkü Margo gibi olamazdım.
es: Cuando salieron, Ben llevó a Radar a su casa, hacia el «centro» de Jefferson Park, cerca de donde vivía Lacey, y luego me acompañó a mí. Vi que el coche de Margo tampoco estaba aparcado en su casa, así que no se había saltado las clases para dormir. Se habría saltado las clases por otra de sus aventuras, una aventura sin mí. Seguramente pasaría el día extendiendo crema depilatoria en las almohadas de otros enemigos o algo así. Entré en casa sintiéndome un poco abandonado, aunque por supuesto Margo sabía que de todas formas no habría ido con ella, porque no querría perder un día de clase. Y quién sabía si habría sido solo un día. Quizá se había ido a otra excursión de tres días por Mississippi o se había unido temporalmente al circo. Pero no sería ninguna de las dos cosas, por supuesto. Era algo que no podía imaginar, que nunca imaginaría, porque yo no podía ser Margo.
vi_translation: Leaving the gym, Ben dropped Radar off at his house, right next to the "navel of the village" Jefferson Park, near Lacey's house. Then he took me home. I noticed that Margo's car wasn't parked in her driveway either. So she wasn't skipping school to sleep at home. Margo wasn't coming to school because she was busy with another adventure—a non-Quentin adventure. Maybe she spent the whole day smearing hair removal cream on the pillows of other enemies, or something like that. As I walked into the house, I felt left out, but of course, Margo knew I would never join her again—I prioritized a day at school too much. Who knows, maybe it was just a day for Margo. Maybe she took another three-day trip to Mississippi, or wandered off with a circus troupe. But of course, reality wasn't any of the above scenarios. But it is something I cannot imagine, because how could I possibly be Margo.
tr_translation: After they went outside, I took Radar to Jefferson Park "village center" near where Lacey was sitting He dropped her off at the house right next to mine. Then he took me home. I noticed that Margo's car wasn't parked in the driveway either. So she hadn't skipped school to sleep. She had skipped school for another adventure...an adventure without me. She had probably spent her day putting hair removal cream on the pillows of her other enemies or something. I felt a bit left out as I walked into the house, but of course, she knew I would never, under any circumstances, join her...I cared too much about the school day. And who could have known that I would be just one day for Margo. Maybe she had gone on a three-day trip to Mississippi or temporarily joined a circus. But of course, it was none of those things. It was something I couldn't imagine, something I would never imagine, because I couldn't be like Margo.
es_translation: When they left, Ben took Radar to his house, towards the "center" of Jefferson Park, near where Lacey lived, and then he accompanied me. I saw that Margo's car wasn't parked at her house either, so she hadn't skipped classes to sleep. She would have skipped classes for another one of her adventures, an adventure without me. She was probably spending the day spreading depilatory cream on the pillows of other enemies or something like that. I entered the house feeling a bit abandoned, although of course Margo knew that I wouldn't have gone with her anyway, because I wouldn't want to miss a day of class. And who knew if it would have been just one day. Maybe she had gone on another three-day excursion through Mississippi or had temporarily joined the circus. But it wouldn't be either of those things, of course. It was something I couldn't imagine, would never imagine, because I couldn't be Margo.

en: I wondered what stories she would come home with this time. And I wondered if she would tell them to me, sitting across from me at lunch. Maybe, I thought, this is what she meant by I will miss hanging out with you. She knew she was heading somewhere for another of her brief respites from Orlando’s paperness. But when she came back, who knew? She couldn’t spend the last weeks of school with the friends she’d always had, so maybe she would spend them with me after all.
vi: Tôi tự hỏi lần này cô ấy sẽ mang chuyện gì về nhà. Và tôi tự hỏi không biết cô ấy có kể với tôi không khi hai đứa ngồi đối diện nhau ăn trưa. Có thể, tôi nghĩ, đây chính là điều Margo ám chỉ khi nói tớ sẽ nhớ những lúc chơi với cậu. Cô ấy biết rằng mình đã có sẵn một nơi để đến, tạm lánh đi cái nhàn nhạt bờn bợt như giấy của Orlando. Nhưng khi nào Margo mới về? Ai mà biết được chứ. Cô ấy không muốn qua nốt những tuần cuối ở trường phổ thông cùng đám bạn lâu nay của cô ấy, vậy chưa biết chừng rút cục cô ấy sẽ muốn dành thời gian cho tôi.
tr: Bu sürede eve ne hikâyelerle döneceğim merak ettim. Ve onlan bana, öğle yemeğinde karşımda oturarak anlatıp anlatmayacağını. Belki, diye düşündüm, seninle takılmayı özleyeceğim derken bunu kastediyordu. Orlando’nun kâğıtlığından soluklanmak için bir yerlere doğru yola koyulacağım biliyordu. Ama kimbilir ne zaman geri gelecekti. Okulun son haftalarını her zamanki arkadaşlarıyla geçiremezdi, yani belki her şeye rağmen benimle geçirecekti.
es: Me preguntaba con qué historias volvería a casa esa vez. Y me preguntaba si se sentaría frente a mí a la hora de comer y me las contaría. Pensé que quizá a eso se refería cuando me dijo que echaría de menos salir conmigo. Sabía que se iría a alguna parte para tomarse otro de sus breves descansos de Orlando, la ciudad de papel. Pero cuando volviera, ¿quién sabía? No podría pasar las últimas semanas de clase con los amigos que siempre había tenido, así que después de todo quizá las pasaría conmigo.
vi_translation: I wonder what she will bring home this time. And I wonder if she will tell me when the two of us sit across from each other having lunch. Maybe, I think, this is what Margo meant when she said she would miss the times playing with me. She knew that she already had a place to go, to temporarily escape the dull, paper-like monotony of Orlando. But when will Margo come back? Who knows. She didn't want to spend the last weeks of high school with her longtime friends, so maybe she will end up wanting to spend time with me.
tr_translation: I wondered what stories I would come home with during this time. And whether you would tell them to me while sitting across from me at lunch. Maybe, I thought, when you said you would miss hanging out with me, this is what you meant. He knew I would set out somewhere to take a break from Orlando's paperwork. But who knows when he would come back. He couldn't spend the last weeks of school with his usual friends, so maybe despite everything, he would spend them with me.
es_translation: I wondered what stories he would come home with this time. And I wondered if he would sit in front of me at mealtime and tell me about them. I thought that maybe that's what he meant when he said he would miss going out with me. I knew he would go somewhere to take another of his brief breaks from Orlando, the paper town. But when he came back, who knew? He couldn't spend the last weeks of school with the friends he had always had, so maybe after all, he would spend them with me.

en: She didn’t have to be gone long for the rumors to start. Ben called me that night after dinner. “I hear she’s not answering her phone. Someone on Facebook said she’d told them she might move into a secret storage room in Tomorrowland at Disney.”
vi: Chẳng cần Margo phải biến mất lâu thì đồn thổi đã bay tứ tán. Tối hôm đó sau bữa tối Ben gọi điện cho tôi. “Nghe nói Margo không trả lời điện thoại. Có đứa trên Facebook bảo Margo đã nói rằng sẽ chuyển đến một phòng kho bí mật trong Tomorrowland ở Disney.”
tr: Söylentilerin başlaması için Margo’nun uzun süre gitmesine gerek yoktu. O gece yemekten sonra Ben aradı. “Margo’nun telefonuna cevap vermediğini duydum. Facebook’ta biri dedi ki, onlara Disney Tommorrowland’de gizli bir depoya taşınabileceğini söylemiş.”
es: No tuvo que pasar mucho tiempo para que los rumores empezaran a correr. Ben me llamó aquella noche, después de cenar. —He oído decir que no contesta el teléfono. Alguien ha comentado en Facebook que dijo que quizá se mudaría a un almacén secreto de Tomorrowland, en Disneyland.
vi_translation: It didn't take long for rumors to spread once Margo disappeared. That evening, after dinner, Ben called me. "I heard that Margo isn't answering her phone. Someone on Facebook said that Margo mentioned she was moving to a secret storage room in Tomorrowland at Disney."
tr_translation: It didn't take long for rumors to start once Margo was gone. That night, after dinner, Ben called. "I heard Margo isn't answering her phone. Someone on Facebook said she told them she might move to a secret warehouse in Disney Tomorrowland."
es_translation: It didn't take long for the rumors to start spreading. Ben called me that night, after dinner. —I have heard that he doesn't answer the phone. Someone mentioned on Facebook that he said he might move to a secret warehouse in Tomorrowland, at Disneyland.

en: “That’s idiotic,” I said.
vi: “Vớ vẩn,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bu çok aptalca,” dedim.
es: —Qué tontería —le dije.
vi_translation: "Nonsense," I said.
tr_translation: "That's so stupid," I said.
es_translation: —What nonsense —I told him.

en: “I know. I mean, Tomorrowland is by far the crappiest of the Lands. Someone else said she met a guy online.”
vi: “Tôi biết chứ, Tomorrowland là nơi bựa nhất trong các loại Xứ sở. Có đứa còn bảo Margo đã gặp một gã trên mạng.”
tr: “Biliyorum. Yani, Tomorrowland açık ara farkla Disney’in en boktan parkı. Başka biri de Margo’nun internette bir çocukla tanıştığım söyledi.
es: —Ya lo sé. Vaya, Tomorrowland es de lejos la parte más cutre. Y alguien dijo que ha conocido a un tipo en la red.
vi_translation: “I know, Tomorrowland is the weirdest of all the Lands. Someone even said Margo met a guy online.”
tr_translation: "I know. I mean, Tomorrowland is by far Disney's crappiest park. Someone else also said that Margo met a boy online."
es_translation: —I already know. Well, Tomorrowland is by far the tackiest part. And someone said they met a guy online.

en: “Ridiculous,” I said.
vi: “Tầm bậy,” tôi gắt.
tr: “Çok saçma,” dedim.
es: —Ridículo —insistí.
vi_translation: "Nonsense," I snapped.
tr_translation: “Very silly,” I said.
es_translation: —Ridiculous —I insisted.

en: “Okay, fine, but what?”
vi: “Ừ, được rồi, nhưng thế thì sao?”
tr: “Tamam, peki ama ne olmuş olabilir?
es: —Vale, muy bien, pero ¿entonces?
vi_translation: “Okay, fine, but so what?”
tr_translation: “Alright, but what could have happened?”
es_translation: —Okay, very well, but then?

en: “She’s somewhere by herself having the kind of fun we can only imagine,” I said.
vi: “Margo đang tự mình ở đâu đó, trải qua những trò vui mà chúng ta chỉ có thể có trong tưởng tượng,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bir yerlerde bizim sadece hayal edebileceğimiz şekilde kendi başına eğleniyordur,” dedim.
es: —Andará por ahí divirtiéndose por su cuenta en algo que no podemos ni imaginar —le contesté.
vi_translation: “Margo is somewhere on her own, experiencing the kind of fun that we can only imagine,” I said.
tr_translation: “Somewhere, he must be amusing himself in a way we can only dream of,” I said.
es_translation: —He must be out there having fun on his own in something we can't even imagine —I replied to him.

en: Ben giggled. “Are you saying that she’s playing with herself?”
vi: Ben khúc khích. “Ông muốn nói rằng Margo tự chơi ấy phỏng?”
tr: Ben kıkır kıkır güldü. “Kendisiyle mi oynuyor diyorsun?” Sızlandım.
es: Ben soltó una risita. —¿Estás diciendo que le gusta divertirse sola?
vi_translation: Ben giggled. "You mean Margo played by herself?"
tr_translation: Ben giggled. “Are you saying she's playing with herself?” I whined.
es_translation: Ben let out a chuckle. —Are you saying she likes to have fun alone?

en: I groaned. “Come on, Ben. I mean she’s just doing Margo stuff. Making stories. Rocking worlds.”
vi: Tôi rên hừ hừ. “Thôi ngay, Ben. Margo đang làm những việc theo phong cách Margo. Dệt nên những câu chuyện. Làm rung chuyển những thế giới.
tr: “Yapma, Ben. Sadece Margo tarzı şeyler yapıyordur demek istedim. Hikâyeler yaratıyor. Dünyaları sarsıyor.
es: Gruñí. —Venga ya, Ben. Quiero decir que estará haciendo sus cosas. Montándose historias. Poniendo el mundo patas arriba.
vi_translation: I groaned. "Stop it, Ben. Margo is doing things in Margo's style. Weaving stories. Shaking worlds."
tr_translation: “Don't, Ben. I just meant she's doing Margo-like things. Creating stories. Shaking worlds.”
es_translation: I grunted. —Come on, Ben. I mean, he must be doing his own things. Making up stories. Turning the world upside down.

en: That night, I lay on my side, staring out the window into the invisible world outside. I kept trying to fall asleep, but then my eyes would dart open, just to check. I couldn’t help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would return to my window and drag my tired ass through one more night I’d never forget.
vi: Đêm đó, tôi nằm nghiêng, dõi qua cửa sổ nhìn vào thế giới vô hình bên ngoài. Tôi ráng ngủ, nhưng rồi hai mắt lại mở trừng, chỉ để kiểm tra. Tôi không khỏi phấp phỏng hi vọng rằng Margo Roth Spiegelman sẽ quay lại bên cửa sổ và kéo lê cái mông mệt xụi lơ của tôi phiêu lưu thêm một đêm tôi sẽ không thể nào quên.
tr: O gece yan yatıp pencereden, dışarıdaki görünmeyen dünyaya baktım. Uyumaya çalıştım ama gözlerim sürekli açıldı... sadece kontrol etmek için. Margo Roth Spiegelman’m pencereme dönüp yorgun kıçımı asla unutamayacağım bir geceye daha sürüklemesini ummaktan başka bir şey yapamıyordum.
es: Aquella noche me tumbé de lado en mi cama y observé el invisible mundo al otro lado de la ventana. Intentaba dormirme, pero los ojos se me abrían cada dos por tres para controlar. No podía evitar esperar que Margo Roth Spiegelman volviera a mi ventana y arrastrara mi cansado culo por otra noche inolvidable.
vi_translation: That night, I lay on my side, gazing out the window into the invisible world outside. I tried to sleep, but then my eyes would snap open, just to check. I couldn't help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would come back to the window and drag my exhausted self on another unforgettable adventure.
tr_translation: That night, I lay on my side and looked out the window at the invisible world outside. I tried to sleep, but my eyes kept opening... just to check. All I could do was hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would turn up at my window and drag my tired ass into another night I would never forget.
es_translation: That night I lay on my side in bed and observed the invisible world on the other side of the window. I tried to fall asleep, but my eyes kept opening every so often to check. I couldn't help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would come back to my window and drag my tired ass through another unforgettable night.

en: Margo left often enough that there weren’t any Find Margo rallies at school or anything, but we all felt her absence. High school is neither a democracy nor a dictatorship—nor, contrary to popular belief, an anarchic state. High school is a divine-right monarchy. And when the queen goes on vacation, things change. Specifically, they get worse. It was during Margo’s trip to Mississippi sophomore year, for example, that Becca had unleashed the Bloody Ben story to the world. And this was no different. The little girl with her finger in the dam had run off. Flooding was inevitable.
vi: Thỉnh thoảng Margo lại biến mất nên sẽ không có những chiến dịch Đi Tìm Margo ở trường hay gì đó đại loại thế, nhưng chúng tôi đều cảm nhận được sự thiếu vắng cô ấy. Trường phổ thông không phải là chính quyền dân chủ hay chế độ độc tài–cũng không phải là một nhà nước bát nháo như nhiều người nhầm tưởng. Trường phổ thông là một nền quân chủ sùng bái thánh nữ. Nên khi nữ hoàng đi nghỉ thì lập tức có biến. Cụ thể, mọi thứ bắt đầu loạn lên và xấu đi. Chẳng hạn, trong thời gian Margo vi vu đi Mississippi hồi lớp mười, Becca đã rỉ ra câu chuyện chàng Ben Bỉ Bựa cho cả thế giới bàn tán. Lần này sẽ vẫn là kịch bản cũ. Cô bé cứu con đê bằng ngón tay mình đã đi mất rồi. Lũ lụt vỡ bờ là không tránh khỏi[6].
tr: Margo o kadar sık çekip giderdi ki okulda Margo’yu Bulun toplantıları falan düzenlenmese de yokluğunu hepimiz hissettik. Lise ne bir demokrasidir ne de bir diktatörlük... ne de genel inanca karşı olan anarşik bir düzen. Lise ilahi yönetme hakkı olan bir monarşidir. Ve Kraliçe tatile çıktığı zaman işler değişir. Daha spesifik olmak gerekirse, işler kötüleşir. Örneğin Becca’nın Kanlı Ben hikâyesini dünyaya salması, Margo’nun ikinci sınıfta Mississippi’ye gitmesi sırasında yaşanmıştı. Şimdi de durum farklı değildi. Baraja parmağını sokmuş olan küçük kız kaçmıştı. Sel kaçınılmazdı.
es: Margo se escapaba tan a menudo que en el instituto no se organizaban patrullas para buscarla, pero todos sentíamos su ausencia. El instituto no es ni una democracia ni una dictadura. Tampoco, como suele creerse, un estado anárquico. El instituto es una monarquía por derecho divino. Y cuando la reina se va de vacaciones, las cosas cambian. En concreto, a peor. Por ejemplo, el segundo año, cuando Margo recorría Mississippi, Becca soltó al mundo la historia de Ben el Sangriento. Y esa vez no fue diferente. La niña que se dedicaba a tapar agujeros se había marchado. La inundación era inevitable.
vi_translation: Occasionally, Margo would disappear, so there wouldn't be any Find Margo campaigns at school or anything like that, but we all felt her absence. High school is not a democracy or a dictatorship—nor is it a chaotic state as many people mistakenly believe. High school is a monarchy that worships its queen. So when the queen goes on vacation, things immediately go awry. Specifically, everything starts to get chaotic and deteriorate. For instance, during the time Margo was off to Mississippi in tenth grade, Becca leaked the story of Ben the Bloody to the entire world. This time, it would be the same old scenario. The girl who saved the dike with her finger was gone. Flooding was inevitable.
tr_translation: Margo used to leave so often that even though there were no Find Margo meetings organized at school, we all felt her absence. High school is neither a democracy nor a dictatorship... nor an anarchic system contrary to popular belief. High school is a monarchy with a divine right to rule. And when the Queen goes on vacation, things change. To be more specific, things get worse. For example, Becca's Bloody Ben story was unleashed upon the world when Margo went to Mississippi in her sophomore year. Now, the situation was no different. The little girl who had her finger in the dam had fled. A flood was inevitable.
es_translation: Margo escaped so often that in high school no patrols were organized to look for her, but we all felt her absence. High school is neither a democracy nor a dictatorship. Nor, as is often believed, an anarchic state. High school is a monarchy by divine right. And when the queen goes on vacation, things change. Specifically, for the worse. For example, in sophomore year, when Margo was traveling through Mississippi, Becca released the story of Bloody Ben to the world. And this time was no different. The girl who used to plug the holes had left. The flood was inevitable.

en: That morning, I was on time for once and got a ride with Ben. We found everyone unusually quiet outside the band room. “Dude,” our friend Frank said with great seriousness.
vi: Sáng hôm đó, tôi đi học được đúng giờ và quá giang Ben. Tụi tôi thấy ai cũng lặng lẽ một cách bất thường bên ngoài phòng tập nhạc. “Này ông,” thằng Frank trong đám nói bằng giọng hết sức nghiêm trọng.
tr: O sabah ilk defa zamanında çıkıp Ben’le okula gittim. Bando odasının dışında, herkesi olağandışı bir şekilde sessiz halde bulduk. Arkadaşımız Frank büyük bir ciddiyetle, “Dostum,” dedi.
es: Aquella mañana, como por una vez fui puntual, Ben me llevó al instituto en coche. Encontramos a todo el mundo extrañamente silencioso ante la puerta de la sala de ensayo. —Tío —dijo nuestro amigo Frank muy serio.
vi_translation: That morning, I got to school on time and hitched a ride with Ben. We noticed that everyone was unusually quiet outside the music room. "Hey man," Frank from the group said in a very serious tone.
tr_translation: That morning, for the first time, I left on time and went to school with Ben. Outside the band room, we found everyone unusually quiet. Our friend Frank said with great seriousness, "Dude."
es_translation: That morning, since for once I was punctual, Ben drove me to school. We found everyone strangely silent at the door of the rehearsal room. —Uncle —said our friend Frank very seriously.

en: “What?”
vi: “Chuyện gì thế?”
tr: “Ne oldu?
es: —¿Qué pasa?
vi_translation: "What's going on?"
tr_translation: “What happened?”
es_translation: —What's happening?

en: “Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac, and Clint Bauer took Clint’s Tahoe and ran over twelve bikes belonging to freshmen and sophomores.”
vi: “Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac và Clint Bauer đã leo lên con xe Tahoe của Clint và cán qua mười hai cái xe đạp của tụi lớp chín, lớp mười.”
tr: “Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac ve Clint Bauer, Clint’in Tahoe’sunu alıp birinci ve ikinci sınıflara ait on iki bisikleti ezip geçtiler.
es: —Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac y Clint Bauer han cogido el Tahoe de Clint y se han llevado por delante doce bicis de alumnos de primero y segundo.
vi_translation: "Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac, and Clint Bauer got into Clint's Tahoe and ran over twelve bicycles belonging to the ninth and tenth graders."
tr_translation: “Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac, and Clint Bauer took Clint’s Tahoe and ran over twelve bicycles belonging to the first and second graders.”
es_translation: —Chuck Parson, Taddy Mac, and Clint Bauer took Clint's Tahoe and ran over twelve bikes belonging to first and second-year students.

en: “That sucks,” I said, shaking my head.
vi: “Chèn đét ơi,” tôi lắc đầu thốt lên.
tr: “Berbat,” dedim başımı sallayarak.
es: —No me jodas —le contesté negando con la cabeza.
vi_translation: "Oh my goodness," I shook my head and exclaimed.
tr_translation: “Terrible,” I said, shaking my head.
es_translation: —Don't mess with me —I replied, shaking my head.

en: Our friend Ashley added, “Also, yesterday somebody posted our phone numbers in the boys’ bathroom with—well, with dirty stuff.”
vi: Ashley nói thêm, “Chưa hết đâu, hôm qua đứa nào đó đã dán số điện thoại của chúng ta lên tường nhà vệ sinh nam với... hừm... những lời rất mất vệ sinh.
tr: Arkadaşımız Ashley, “Ayrıca, dün biri telefon numaralarımızı erkekler tuvaletine yazmış, şeyle... pis bir şeyle,” diye ekledi.
es: —Y ayer alguien colgó nuestros números de teléfono en el baño de los chicos con… bueno, con guarradas —añadió nuestra amiga Ashley.
vi_translation: Ashley added, "That's not all, yesterday someone put our phone number on the wall of the men's restroom with... hmm... some very unsanitary comments."
tr_translation: Our friend Ashley added, "Also, yesterday someone wrote our phone numbers in the men's restroom, with some... dirty thing," she added.
es_translation: —And yesterday someone posted our phone numbers in the boys' bathroom with... well, with obscenities —added our friend Ashley.

en: I shook my head again, and then joined the silence. We couldn’t turn them in; we’d tried that plenty in middle school, and it inevitably resulted in more punishment. Usually, we’d just have to wait until someone like Margo reminded everyone what immature jackasses they all were.
vi: Tôi lại lắc đầu rồi hòa cùng im lặng với chúng nó. Tụi tôi không thể xì những thằng ấy ra được; hồi học trung học cơ sở chúng tôi đã nhiều lần cố gắng làm vậy và hệ quả tất yếu là hình phạt dành cho chúng tôi càng chồng chất hơn. Thường bọn tôi sẽ đợi cho đến khi ai đó như Margo nhắc nhở chúng rằng chúng rặt là một đám ngốc nghếch dại dột ra sao.
tr: Tekrar başımı salladım, sonra sessizliğe katıldım. Onları şikâyet edemezdik; ortaokulda pek çok kez denemiştik ve kaçınılmaz olarak daha fazla cezayla sonuçlanmıştı. Genellikle Margo gibi birinin herkese nasıl olgunlaşmamış ahmaklar olduklarını hatırlatmasını beklemek zorundaydık.
es: Volví a menear la cabeza y yo también me quedé en silencio. No podíamos denunciarlos. Lo habíamos intentado muchas veces antes del instituto, y el resultado inevitable había sido que nos acosaran todavía más. En general solo podíamos esperar a que alguien como Margo les recordara lo inmaduros y gilipollas que eran.
vi_translation: I shook my head again and joined the silence with them. We couldn't expose those guys; back in middle school, we had tried many times, and the inevitable consequence was that the punishments for us kept piling up. Usually, we would wait until someone like Margo reminded them of how utterly foolish and stupid they were.
tr_translation: I nodded my head again, then joined the silence. We couldn't complain about them; we had tried many times in middle school and it had inevitably resulted in more punishment. We usually had to rely on someone like Margo to remind everyone how immature fools they were.
es_translation: I shook my head again and I too remained silent. We couldn't report them. We had tried many times before high school, and the inevitable result had been that they bullied us even more. In general, we could only hope that someone like Margo would remind them how immature and idiotic they were.

en: But Margo had given me a way of starting a counteroffensive. And I was just about to say something when, in my peripheral vision, I saw a large individual running toward us at a full sprint. He wore a black ski mask and carried a large, complex green water cannon. As he ran past he tagged me on the shoulder and I lost my footing, landing against the cracked concrete on my left side. As he reached the door, he turned back and shouted toward me, “You screw with us and you’re gonna get smackdown.” The voice was not familiar to me.
vi: Nhưng Margo đã vén màn cho tôi thấy cách chống trả những trò ma cũ bắt nạt ma mới, ỷ mạnh hiếp yếu ấy. Tôi toan nói thì chợt lé mắt thấy một vóc người to lớn đang huỳnh huỵch chạy hết tốc lực về phía chúng tôi. Hắn đeo mặt nạ trượt tuyết màu đen và cắp theo cây súng phun nước xanh lục to đùng hầm hố. Khi vụt qua, hắn huých phải vai tôi khiến tôi mất thăng bằng, ngã nghiêng người xuống nền bê-tông thô ráp. “Mày chơi bọn ông thì mày sẽ bị được dính chưởng.” Tôi không nhận ra được là giọng đứa nào.
tr: Ama Margo bana bir karşı saldın başlatma yolu vermişti. Bize doğru son hızla koşan cüsseli birisini göz ucuyla gördüğümde tam bir şey söylemek üzereydim. Siyah bir kar maskesi giyiyor ve geniş, yeşil bir tazyikli su tabancası taşıyordu. Beni koşarak geçerken omzuma çarptı, dengemi kaybederek sol tarafımın üstüne, çatlak betona düştüm. Kapıya ulaştığında, geri dönüp bana bağırdı: “Bizimle dalga geçersen hezimeti alırsın.” Ses tanıdık değildi.
es: Pero Margo me había enseñado un modo de iniciar la contraofensiva. Y estaba a punto de decir algo cuando vi de reojo a un tipo alto corriendo hacia nosotros. Llevaba un pasamontañas negro y un sofisticado cañón de agua de color verde en las manos. Al pasar me dio un golpe en el hombro, perdí el equilibrio y aterricé de lado en el cemento agrietado. Al llegar a la puerta, se giró y me gritó: —Te dedicas a putearnos, así que te vamos a empalizar. La voz no me sonaba de nada.
vi_translation: But Margo had unveiled to me how to resist those old tricks of bullying the newcomers, the strong preying on the weak. I was about to speak when I suddenly caught sight of a large figure running at full speed towards us. He was wearing a black ski mask and carrying a huge, menacing green water gun. As he rushed past, he bumped into my shoulder, causing me to lose my balance and fall sideways onto the rough concrete. "If you mess with us, you'll get what's coming to you." I couldn't recognize whose voice it was.
tr_translation: Ama Margo had given me a way to initiate a counterattack. I was just about to say something when I saw, out of the corner of my eye, a burly figure running towards us at full speed. He was wearing a black ski mask and carrying a large, green water gun. As he ran past me, he bumped into my shoulder, causing me to lose my balance and fall onto my left side on the cracked concrete. When he reached the door, he turned back and shouted at me: "If you mess with us, you'll face defeat." The voice was not familiar.
es_translation: But Margo had taught me a way to start the counteroffensive. And I was about to say something when I saw out of the corner of my eye a tall guy running towards us. He was wearing a black ski mask and holding a sophisticated green water cannon in his hands. As he passed, he hit me on the shoulder, I lost my balance and landed on my side on the cracked cement. When he reached the door, he turned and shouted at me: —You dedicate yourself to screwing us over, so we're going to impale you. The voice didn't sound familiar to me at all.
