en: Ben and another of our friends picked me up. My shoulder hurt, but I didn’t want to rub it. “You okay?” asked Radar.
vi: Ben và một đứa nữa trong đám đỡ tôi đứng dậy. Vai đau ê ẩm nhưng tôi không muốn nắn thử. “Có sao không?” Radar hỏi.
tr: Ben ile bir başka arkadaş beni kaldırdı. Omzum acıyordu ama ovuşturmak istemedim. “İyi misin?” diye sordu Radar.
es: Ben y otro amigo me ayudaron a levantarme. Me dolía el hombro, pero no quería frotármelo. —¿Estás bien? —me preguntó Radar.
vi_translation: Ben and another kid from the group helped me stand up. My shoulder ached, but I didn't want to test it. "Are you okay?" Radar asked.
tr_translation: Ben and another friend lifted me up. My shoulder was hurting, but I didn't want to rub it. "Are you okay?" asked Radar.
es_translation: Ben and another friend helped me get up. My shoulder hurt, but I didn't want to rub it. —Are you okay? —Radar asked me.

en: “Yeah, I’m fine.” I rubbed the shoulder now.
vi: “Không sao,” tôi đáp, bắt đầu nắn nắn vai.
tr: “Evet, iyiyim.” Artık omzumu ovuşturuyordum.
es: —Sí, muy bien. Entonces sí que me froté el hombro.
vi_translation: “It's okay,” I replied, starting to massage my shoulders.
tr_translation: “Yes, I'm fine.” I was now rubbing my shoulder.
es_translation: —Yes, very well. Then I did rub my shoulder.

en: Radar shook his head. “Someone needs to tell him that while it is possible to get smacked down, and it is also possible to get a smackdown, it is not possible to get ‘smackdown.’” I laughed. Someone nodded toward the parking lot, and I looked up to see two little freshmen guys walking toward us, their T-shirts hanging wet and limp from their narrow frames.
vi: Radar lắc đầu. “Ai đó cần cho thằng ấy biết rằng có thể bị dính chưởng, cũng có thể được dính chưởng, nhưng không thể bị được dính chưởng.” Tôi bật cười. Có đứa hất đầu về phía bãi đỗ xe, tôi nhìn theo và thấy hai cậu lớp chín tò te đang đi lại, áo phông lùng bùng ướt trên khung người lẳng khẳng.
tr: Radar başını salladı. “Hezimete uğramak ve hatta hezimete uğratılmak mümkünken, hezimeti ‘almanın’ mümkün olmadığını birinin ona söylemesi gerekiyor.” Güldüm. Biri başıyla park alanım gösterdi, başımı kaldırınca bize doğru yürüyen birinci smıftan iki çocuğu gördüm, tişörtleri sıska bedenlerine ıslak ve pörsümüş bir halde yapışmıştı.
es: Radar negó con la cabeza. —Alguien debería explicarle que, aunque es posible dar una paliza, y también pegar una paliza, no es posible empalizar a nadie. Me reí. Alguien señaló el aparcamiento, levanté la mirada y vi a dos chavalines de primero acercándose a nosotros con la camiseta mojada y colgando.
vi_translation: Radar shook his head. "Someone needs to tell that guy that you can get hit, you can also hit, but you can't get hit." I laughed. Someone nodded towards the parking lot, I looked over and saw two ninth graders walking around, their baggy t-shirts wet on their skinny frames.
tr_translation: Radar nodded his head. “Someone needs to tell him that while it is possible to be defeated and even to be made to suffer defeat, it is not possible to 'take' defeat.” I laughed. Someone pointed with their head towards my parking spot, and when I looked up, I saw two first graders walking towards us, their t-shirts clinging wet and limp to their skinny bodies.
es_translation: Radar shook his head. —Someone should explain to him that, although it is possible to give a beating, and also to administer a beating, it is not possible to "beating-ize" anyone. I laughed. Someone pointed to the parking lot, I looked up and saw two first-year kids approaching us with wet and sagging shirts.

en: “It was pee!” one of them shouted at us. The other one didn’t say anything; he just held his hands far away from his T-shirt, which only sort of worked. I could see rivulets of liquid snaking from his sleeve down his arm.
vi: “Nước tiểu đó mấy anh!” một cậu nói lớn với chúng tôi. Cậu kia không nói gì, chỉ cố gắng giơ tay ra xa cái áo của mình, trông có vẻ có chút tác dụng. Tôi thấy mấy vệt chất lỏng loằng ngoằng như rắn bò từ tay áo xuống cánh tay cậu ta.
tr: Aralarından biri, “Çişti!” diye bize doğru bağırdı. Diğeri hiçbir şey söylemedi; sadece ellerini tişörtünden uzakta tutuyordu, ne var ki bu pek işe yaramıyordu. Tişörtünden kollarına doğru kıvrıla kıvrıla inen sıvı derecikleri gördüm.
es: —¡Eran meados! —nos gritó uno de ellos. El otro no dijo nada. Se limitaba a apartar las manos de la camiseta, lo que no terminaba de funcionar. Vi chorretones resbalándole desde las mangas hasta los brazos.
vi_translation: “That’s urine, guys!” one boy shouted at us. The other boy said nothing, just tried to hold his shirt sleeve away, which seemed to help a bit. I saw streaks of liquid snaking down his arm from the sleeve.
tr_translation: One of them shouted at us, "Pee!" The other one didn't say anything; he was just holding his hands away from his t-shirt, but it wasn't doing much good. I saw trickles of liquid winding down from his t-shirt to his arms.
es_translation: —They were pissed! —one of them shouted at us. The other said nothing. He just kept pulling his hands away from the shirt, which didn't quite work. I saw streams running down from the sleeves to his arms.

en: “Was it animal pee or human pee?” someone asked.
vi: “Nước tiểu của con gì hay của người hả em?” đứa nào đó hỏi.
tr: “Hayvan çişi miydi, yoksa insan çişi mi?” diye sordu biri.
es: —¿Meados animales o humanos? —preguntó alguien.
vi_translation: “Is this the urine of an animal or a person?” someone asked.
tr_translation: “Was it animal pee, or human pee?” someone asked.
es_translation: —Animal or human urine? —someone asked.

en: “How would I know! What, am I an expert in the study of pee?”
vi: “Sao em biết được ạ! Chẳng lẽ em là chuyên gia nước-tiểu-học sao?”
tr: “Nereden bileyim! Çiş alamnda uzman mıyım ben?
es: —¡Cómo voy a saberlo! ¿Qué pasa, que soy un experto en meados?
vi_translation: "How would I know! Am I supposed to be a urine expert or something?"
tr_translation: “How should I know! Am I an expert in pee?”
es_translation: —How am I supposed to know! What, am I an expert in piss?

en: I walked over to the kid. I put my hand on the top of his head, the only place that seemed totally dry. “We’ll fix this,” I said. The second bell rang, and Radar and I raced to calc. As I slid into my desk I dinged my arm, and the pain radiated into my shoulder. Radar tapped his notebook, where he’d circled a note: Shoulder okay?
vi: Tôi đi lại phía cậu lớp chín, đặt tay lên đầu cậu ta, chỗ duy nhất có vẻ hoàn toàn khô ráo. “Tụi anh sẽ chấn chỉnh chuyện này,” tôi nói. Hồi chuông thứ hai vang lên, Radar và tôi bổ vào lớp giải tích. Khi xẹt vào chỗ ngồi, tôi vô tình bị va khuỷu tay, đau thốn tới tận vai. Radar gõ gõ vào vở, trên trang giấy nó viết và khoanh tròn: Vai sao rồi?
tr: Çocuğa yaklaştım. Tamamen kuru gibi görünen tek yerine, başının üstüne elimi koydum. “Bunu düzelteceğiz,” dedim. İkinci zil çaldı, Radarla aceleyle matematik dersine koştuk. Sırama geçerken kolumu çıtlattım ve acı omzuma yayıldı. Radar bir notu daire içine aldığı defterini tıklattı: Omzun iyi mi?
es: Me acerqué al chaval y le apoyé la mano en la cabeza, que era lo único que parecía totalmente seco. —Esto no va a quedar así —le dije. Sonó el segundo timbre y Radar y yo corrimos a clase de cálculo. Mientras me sentaba a mi mesa, me di un golpe en el brazo, y el dolor me subió hasta el hombro. Radar me señaló su libreta, en la que había escrito una nota rodeada por un círculo: «Hombro OK?».
vi_translation: I walked over to the ninth grader, placed my hand on his head, the only spot that seemed completely dry. "We will sort this out," I said. The second bell rang, Radar and I rushed into calculus class. As I slid into my seat, I accidentally hit my elbow, pain shooting up to my shoulder. Radar tapped on his notebook, on the page he had written and circled: How's the shoulder?
tr_translation: I approached the child. I placed my hand on the only part of him that seemed completely dry, the top of his head. “We will fix this,” I said. The second bell rang, and we rushed to math class with Radar. As I took my seat, I cracked my arm and pain spread to my shoulder. Radar tapped his notebook, where he had circled a note: Is your shoulder okay?
es_translation: I approached the boy and placed my hand on his head, which was the only thing that seemed completely dry. —This is not going to stay like this —I told him. The second bell rang and Radar and I ran to calculus class. As I sat down at my desk, I hit my arm, and the pain shot up to my shoulder. Radar pointed to his notebook, where he had written a note surrounded by a circle: "Shoulder OK?".

en: I wrote on the corner of my notebook: Compared to those freshmen, I spent the morning in a field of rainbows frolicking with puppies.
vi: Tôi viết trả trên góc vở của mình: So với hai cậu lính mới ấy, tôi đã có một buổi sáng tung tăng cùng bầy cún con giữa những dải cầu vồng.
tr: Ben de defterimin köşesine yazdım: O birinci sınıflarla karşılaştırılırsa, sabahı gökkuşaklanyla dolu bir çayırda yavru köpeklerle sıçrayıp oynayarak geçirdim.
es: Escribí en la esquina de mi libreta: «Comparado con los chavalines, he pasado la mañana en un campo de arcoíris jugueteando con animalitos».
vi_translation: I wrote on the corner of my notebook: Compared to those two new soldiers, I had a morning frolicking with a litter of puppies under the rainbows.
tr_translation: I also wrote in the corner of my notebook: Compared to the first graders, I spent the morning jumping and playing with puppies in a meadow filled with rainbows.
es_translation: I wrote in the corner of my notebook: "Compared to the little kids, I have spent the morning in a field of rainbows playing with little animals."

en: Radar laughed enough for Mr. Jiminez to shoot him a look. I wrote, I have a plan, but we have to figure out who it was.
vi: Radar khụt khịt cười, đủ để thầy Jiminez bắn ánh mắt nhìn nó. Tôi viết tiếp, Tôi có một kế hoạch, nhưng tôi phải biết chủ mưu là đứa nào đã.
tr: Radar, Bay Jiminez’in ona bir bakış atmasına yetecek kadar güldü. Bir planım var ama onun kim olduğunu çözmemiz gerekiyor, diye yazdım.
es: Radar se rió tan alto que el señor Jiminez le lanzó una mirada. Escribí: «Tengo un plan, pero tenemos que descubrir quién era».
vi_translation: Radar chuckled softly, enough for Mr. Jiminez to shoot him a glance. I continued writing, I have a plan, but I need to know who the mastermind is first.
tr_translation: Radar laughed just enough for Bay Jiminez to give him a look. I wrote, I have a plan, but we need to figure out who he is.
es_translation: Radar laughed so loudly that Mr. Jiminez gave him a look. I wrote: "I have a plan, but we need to find out who he was."

en: Radar wrote back, Jasper Hanson, and circled it several times. That was a surprise.
vi: Radar viết lại, Jasper Hanson, và khoanh tròn vài lần quanh cái tên ấy. Bất ngờ thật.
tr: Radar karşılık olarak, Jasper Hanson, diye yazıp birkaç kere daire içine aldı. Bu şaşırtıcıydı işte.
es: Radar escribió «Jasper Hanson» y lo rodeó varias veces con un círculo. Me sorprendió.
vi_translation: Radar rewrote, Jasper Hanson, and circled the name several times. What a surprise.
tr_translation: In response to the radar, Jasper Hanson wrote and circled it several times. This was surprising indeed.
es_translation: Radar wrote "Jasper Hanson" and circled it several times. I was surprised.

en: How do you know?
vi: Sao ông biết?
tr: Nereden biliyorsun?
es: «¿Cómo lo sabes?».
vi_translation: How did you know?
tr_translation: How do you know?
es_translation: "How do you know?"

en: Radar wrote, You didn’t notice? Dumbass was wearing his own football jersey.
vi: Radar viết tiếp, Ông không nhận ra sao? Thằng đần ấy mặc luôn áo thi đấu của nó.
tr: Radar, Sen fark etmedin mi? Salak herif kendi futbol formasını giyiyordu, diye yazdı.
es: Radar escribió: «¿No lo has visto? El muy imbécil llevaba la camiseta de fútbol con su nombre».
vi_translation: Radar continued, "Don't you recognize him?" "That idiot is always wearing his uniform."
tr_translation: Radar, didn't you notice? That idiot was wearing his own football jersey, he wrote.
es_translation: Radar wrote: "Didn't you see him? The idiot was wearing the football jersey with his name on it."

en: Jasper Hanson was a junior. I’d always thought him harmless, and actually sort of nice—in that bumbling, dude-how’s-it-going kind of way. Not the kind of guy you’d expect to see shooting geysers of pee at freshmen. Honestly, in the governmental bureaucracy of Winter Park High School, Jasper Hanson was like Deputy Assistant Undersecretary of Athletics and Malfeasance. When a guy like that gets promoted to Executive Vice President of Urine Gunning, immediate action must be taken.
vi: Jasper Hanson học lớp mười một. Tôi cứ ngỡ nó là thằng vô hại, thậm chí còn dễ mến–theo kiểu con nhà lành chào-bồ-hôm-nay-có-gì-vui-không? Không phải kiểu dám xịt nước tiểu tứ tóe vào người bọn lớp chín. Thành thực thì, trong cái thể chế quan liêu Phổ Thông Trung Học Winter Park này, Jasper Hanson thuộc hạng Phó Trợ Lí Thứ Trưởng về Thể Thao và Chơi Khăm. Khi một thằng như vầy được đôn lên chức Phó Tổng Thống phụ trách Súng Ống Đường Tiết Niệu, thì cần phải có động thái khẩn cấp.
tr: Jasper Hanson bizden bir alt sınıftaydı. Onu her zaman zararsız, hatta bir nevi iyi biri olarak düşünmüştüm... beceriksizce “dostum nasıl gidiyor” diye soranlar gibi. Birinci sınıfların üstüne çiş püskürtmesini bekleyeceğiniz türde bir çocuk değildi. Ashnda Winter Park Lisesi’nin idari bürokrasisinde Jasper Hanson, Atletizm ve Suistimalden Sorumlu Müsteşar Yardımcısıydı. Böyle bir çocuk, İdrar Püskürtme Başkan Vekilliğine terfi ediyorsa acilen harekete geçilmesi gerekir.
es: Jasper Hanson era un alumno de tercero. Siempre había pensado que era un chaval tranquilo y majete, de esos un poco torpes que te preguntan: «Tío, ¿qué tal?». No esperaba verlo lanzando géiseres de pis a los de primero. Sinceramente, en la jerarquía gubernamental del instituto Winter Park, Jasper Hanson era como el ayudante adjunto del subsecretario de Atletismo y Actividades Ilícitas. Cuando un tipo así asciende a vicepresidente ejecutivo de Armamento Urinario, hay que tomar cartas en el asunto de inmediato.
vi_translation: Jasper Hanson is in the eleventh grade. I always thought he was harmless, even likable–the kind of kid who says "Hey buddy, what's up?" Not the kind who would dare to spray urine all over the ninth graders. Honestly, in the bureaucratic system of Winter Park High School, Jasper Hanson holds the rank of Assistant Deputy Undersecretary of Sports and Pranks. When a guy like this gets promoted to Vice President in charge of Urinary Tract Weaponry, urgent action is required.
tr_translation: Jasper Hanson was in a grade below us. I had always thought of him as harmless, even somewhat a good person... like those who awkwardly ask "how's it going, buddy". He wasn't the type of kid you'd expect to spray pee on freshmen. In fact, at Winter Park High School's administrative bureaucracy, Jasper Hanson was the Deputy Undersecretary for Athletics and Misconduct. If such a kid is being promoted to Vice President of Pee Spraying, immediate action is necessary.
es_translation: Jasper Hanson was a third-year student. He had always thought he was a quiet and nice guy, one of those slightly clumsy ones who ask you: "Dude, how's it going?". He didn't expect to see him launching geysers of pee at the first-years. Honestly, in the governmental hierarchy of Winter Park High School, Jasper Hanson was like the assistant deputy of Athletics and Illicit Activities. When a guy like that gets promoted to executive vice president of Urinary Armament, you have to take immediate action.

en: So when I got home that afternoon, I created an email account and wrote my old friend Jason Worthington.
vi: Chiều hôm đó khi về đến nhà, tôi lập một tài khoản e-mail và viết cho người bạn lâu năm Jason Worthington.
tr: Bunun üstüne o öğleden sonra eve gittiğimde, bir eposta hesabı açıp eski dostum Jason Worthington’a bir eposta yazdım.
es: Así que en cuanto llegué a casa aquella tarde, me creé una cuenta de correo y escribí inmediatamente a mi viejo amigo Jason Worthington.
vi_translation: That afternoon, when I got home, I created an email account and wrote to my long-time friend Jason Worthington.
tr_translation: That afternoon, when I went home, I opened an email account and wrote an email to my old friend Jason Worthington.
es_translation: So as soon as I got home that afternoon, I created an email account and immediately wrote to my old friend Jason Worthington.

en: From: mavenger@gmail.com
vi: Từ: mavenger@gmail. com
tr: Kimden: intikamci@gmail. com
es: De: mvengador@gmail. com
vi_translation: From: mavenger@gmail. com
tr_translation: From: intikamci@gmail. com
es_translation: From: mvengador@gmail. com

en: To: jworthington90@yahoo.com
vi: com Tới: jworthington90@yahoo. com
tr: com Kime: jworthington90@yahoo. com
es: com A: jworthington90@yahoo. com
vi_translation: To: jworthington90@yahoo. com
tr_translation: To: jworthington90@yahoo. com
es_translation: A: jworthington90@yahoo. com

en: Subject: You, Me, Becca Arrington’s House, Your Penis, Etc.
vi: Chủ đề: Cậu, Tôi, Nhà Becca Arrington, Tờ-rym của cậu, v. v...
tr: Konu: Sen, Ben, Becca Arringtonin Evi, Penisin, vs.
es: Asunto: Usted, yo, la casa de Becca Arrington, su pene, etc.
vi_translation: Topic: You, Me, Becca Arrington's House, Your Dream, etc...
tr_translation: Subject: You, Me, Becca Arrington's House, Your Penis, etc.
es_translation: Subject: You, me, Becca Arrington's house, your penis, etc.

en: Dear Mr. Worthington,
vi: Cậu Worthington thân mến,
tr: Sevgili Bay Worthington,
es: Querido señor Worthington:
vi_translation: Dear Worthington,
tr_translation: Dear Mr. Worthington,
es_translation: Dear Mr. Worthington,

en: 1. $200 in cash should be provided to each of the 12 people whose bikes your colleagues destroyed via Chevy Tahoe. This shouldn’t be a problem, given your magnificent wealth.
vi: 1. 200 đô-la tiền mặt cần được trao cho từng người trong số 12 học sinh có xe đạp bị cậu và các bạn học của cậu nghiền nát dưới bánh xe Chevy Tahoe. Khoản này hẳn không thành vấn đề, xét trên tài sản rủng rỉnh của cậu. 2.
tr: İş arkadaşlarınızın Chevy Tahoe vasıtasıyla tahrip ettiği bisikletlerin sahibi olan 12 kişinin her birine 200$ nakit temin edilmeli. Görkemli servetiniz göz önünde bulundurulursa, bu bir sorun teşkil etmeyecektir.
es: 1. Deberá entregar doscientos dólares en efectivo a cada una de las doce personas cuyas bicicletas destrozaron sus amigos con el Chevy Tahoe. No debería suponerle un problema, dada su inmensa riqueza.
vi_translation: 1. 200 dollars in cash need to be given to each of the 12 students whose bicycles were crushed under the wheels of your Chevy Tahoe by you and your classmates. This amount should not be an issue, considering your ample wealth.
tr_translation: Each of the 12 people whose bicycles were destroyed by your coworkers' Chevy Tahoe should be provided with $200 in cash. Considering your magnificent wealth, this should not be an issue.
es_translation: 1. You must give two hundred dollars in cash to each of the twelve people whose bicycles were destroyed by your friends with the Chevy Tahoe. It shouldn't be a problem for you, given your immense wealth.

en: 2. This graffiti situation in the boys’ bathroom has to stop.
vi: 2. Trò viết graffiti trong nhà vệ sinh nam phải được chấm dứt.
tr: Erkekler tuvaletindeki şu grafiti durumu son bulmah.
es: 2. El tema de las pintadas en el baño de los chicos debe concluir.
vi_translation: 2. The act of writing graffiti in the men's restroom must be stopped.
tr_translation: The graffiti situation in the men's restroom must end.
es_translation: 2. The issue of graffiti in the boys' bathroom must come to an end.

en: 3. Water guns? With pee? Really? Grow up.
vi: 3. Súng phun nước ư? Phun nước tiểu ư? Thật ư? Các cậu hãy đứng đắn lên đi.
tr: Su tabancaları? Çişle? Gerçekten mi? Büyüyün biraz.
es: 3. ¿Cañones de agua? ¿Con meados? ¿De verdad? Madure un poco.
vi_translation: 3. Water guns? Peeing? Really? Come on, guys, be serious.
tr_translation: Water guns? With pee? Really? Grow up a little.
es_translation: 3. Water cannons? With urine? Really? Grow up a little.

en: 4. You should treat your fellow students with respect, particularly those less socially fortunate than you.
vi: 4. Cậu cần cư xử hòa nhã với các học sinh trong trường, đặc biệt những người kém may mắn về mặt xã hội hơn cậu.
tr: Okul arkadaşlarınıza saygılı davranmalısınız, özellikle sosyal bakımdan sizden daha az talihli olanlara.
es: 4. Debería tratar a los compañeros con respeto, especialmente a los que son socialmente menos afortunados que usted.
vi_translation: 4. You need to behave kindly towards the students in the school, especially those who are less fortunate socially than you.
tr_translation: You should treat your schoolmates with respect, especially those who are less fortunate socially.
es_translation: 4. You should treat your peers with respect, especially those who are socially less fortunate than you.

en: 5. You should probably instruct members of your clan to behave in similarly considerate ways.
vi: 5. Có thể cậu cũng cần nhắc nhở tụi đàn em cánh hẩu của cậu cư xử theo cách chín chắn đứng đắn tương tự.
tr: Muhtemelen klanınızın üyelerine de benzer düşünceli davranışlarda bulunmaları için talimat vermelisiniz.
es: 5. Probablemente debería aleccionar a los miembros de su clan para que se comporten también con consideración.
vi_translation: 5. You might also need to remind your younger associates to behave in a similarly mature and proper manner.
tr_translation: You should probably instruct the members of your clan to behave similarly thoughtfully.
es_translation: 5. He should probably instruct the members of his clan to behave considerately as well.

en: I realize that it will be very difficult to accomplish some of these tasks. But then again, it will also be very difficult not to share the attached photograph with the world.
vi: Tôi nhận thấy một số nhiệm vụ trên sẽ rất khó được hoàn thành. Nhưng một lần nữa, không chia sẻ bức ảnh đính kèm đây với cả thế giới cũng là một việc rất khó thực hiện.
tr: Bu görevlerin bazılarının tamamlanmasının çok zor olacağmın farkındayım. Fakat öte yandan ekteki fotoğrafı dünyayla paylaşmamak da çok zor olacak.
es: Soy consciente de que cumplir alguna de estas tareas resultará muy difícil. Pero en ese caso también resultará muy difícil no compartir con todo el mundo la fotografía adjunta.
vi_translation: I realize that some of the tasks above will be very difficult to complete. But once again, not sharing the attached photo with the whole world is also a very difficult thing to do.
tr_translation: I am aware that completing some of these tasks will be very difficult. However, on the other hand, it will also be very difficult not to share the attached photo with the world.
es_translation: I am aware that completing some of these tasks will be very difficult. But in that case, it will also be very difficult not to share the attached photograph with everyone.

en: Yours truly,
vi: Thân mến,
tr: Saygılarımla,
es: Cordialmente,
vi_translation: Dear,
tr_translation: Yours sincerely,
es_translation: Cordially,

en: Your Friendly Neighborhood Nemesis
vi: Thần Báo Thù Thân Thiện của của cậu
tr: Dostane Ezeli Düşman Komşunuz Cevap on iki dakika sonra geldi.
es: su amistoso vecino Némesis
vi_translation: Your Friendly Avenger
tr_translation: Your Eternal Enemy Neighbor's Response arrived twelve minutes later.
es_translation: your friendly neighbor Nemesis

en: The reply came twelve minutes later.
vi: Hồi âm xuất hiện mười hai phút sau đó.
tr: Dostane Ezeli Düşman Komşunuz Cevap on iki dakika sonra geldi.
es: A los doce minutos llegó su respuesta.
vi_translation: The response appeared twelve minutes later.
tr_translation: Your Eternal Enemy Neighbor's Response arrived twelve minutes later.
es_translation: Twelve minutes later, his response arrived.

en: Look, Quentin, and yeah, I know it’s you. You know it wasn’t me who squirt-peed those freshmen. I’m sorry, but it’s not like I control the actions of other people.
vi: Nghe đây Quentin, phải, tao biết là mày. Mày biết không phải tao tiểu phun bọn lính mới. Rất tiếc, nhưng tao không kiểm soát hành động của những đứa khác được.
tr: Bak, Quentin, ve evet bunun sen olduğunu biliyorum. O birinci sınıflara çiş fışkırtan ben değilim, biliyorsun. Üzgünüm ama diğer insanların hareketlerini kontrol falan edemiyorum.
es: Mira, Quentin, porque sí, sé que eres tú. Sabes que no fui yo el que chorreó con meados a los chicos de primero. Lo siento, pero no controlo lo que hacen los demás.
vi_translation: Listen here Quentin, yes, I know it's you. You know it wasn't me who sprayed the new soldiers. Sorry, but I can't control the actions of others.
tr_translation: Look, Quentin, and yes, I know this is you. I'm not the one spraying pee on the freshmen, you know that. Sorry, but I can't control other people's actions or anything.
es_translation: Look, Quentin, because yes, I know it's you. You know it wasn't me who sprayed the first-year kids with pee. I'm sorry, but I can't control what others do.

en: My answer:
vi: Tôi trả lời:
tr: Cevabım:
es: Mi respuesta:
vi_translation: I replied:
tr_translation: My answer:
es_translation: My response:

en: Mr. Worthington,
vi: Cậu Worthington,
tr: Bay Worthington,
es: Señor Worthington:
vi_translation: Mr. Worthington,
tr_translation: Bay Worthington,
es_translation: Mr. Worthington:

en: I understand that you do not control Chuck and Jasper.
vi: Tôi hiểu rằng cậu không kiểm soát Chuck và Jasper.
tr: Chuck ve Jasper’ı kontrol etmediğinizi anlıyorum.
es: Entiendo que no controle a Chuck y Jasper.
vi_translation: I understand that you don't control Chuck and Jasper.
tr_translation: I understand that you do not control Chuck and Jasper.
es_translation: I understand that you don't control Chuck and Jasper.

en: But you see, I am in a similar situation. I do not control the little devil sitting on my left shoulder. The devil is saying, “PRINT THE PICTURE PRINT THE PICTURE TAPE IT UP ALL OVER SCHOOL DO IT DO IT DO IT.” And then on my right shoulder, there is a little tiny white angel. And the angel is saying, “Man, I sure as shit hope all those freshmen get their money bright and early on Monday morning.”
vi: Nhưng cậu thấy đấy, tôi cũng trong hoàn cảnh tương tự. Tôi không quản lí con quỉ nhỏ ngồi trên vai trái mình. Tiểu quỉ ấy đang gào lên rằng, “IN ẢNH RA IN ẢNH RA DÁN LÊN KHẮP TRƯỜNG LÀM NGAY LÀM NGAY LÀM NGAY.” Và rồi trên vai phải tôi, có một thiên thần trắng bé bỏng, thì thầm rằng, “Trời ơi, ta có niềm hi vọng vững chắc như chất thải rắn rằng sáng sớm thứ Hai tụi lính mới sẽ nhận được tiền đâu ra đấy.”
tr: Ama görüyorsunuz ki ben de benzer bir durumdayım. Sol omzumda duran küçük şeytanı kontrol edemiyorum. Şeytan diyor ki: “FOTOĞRAFIN ÇIKTISINI AL FOTOĞRAFI ÇIKTISINI AL OKULUN HER YERİNE YAPIŞTIR YAP ŞUNU YAP ŞUNU YAP ŞUNU.” Sonra sağ omzumda, küçük, küçücük beyaz bir melek var. Ve melek diyor ki; “Dostum, bütün o birinci sınıfların paralarım pazartesi sabah erkenden almalarım umuyorum.
es: Pero, ya ve, estoy en una situación similar a la suya. No controlo al diablillo que está sentado en mi hombro izquierdo. El diablo me dice: «IMPRIME LA FOTO IMPRIME LA FOTO CUÉLGALA POR TODO EL INSTITUTO HAZLO HAZLO HAZLO». Pero en el hombro derecho tengo un angelito blanco. Y el ángel me dice: «Hombre, me juego el cuello a que esos chicos de primero reciben su dinero a primera hora de la mañana del lunes».
vi_translation: But you see, I'm in a similar situation. I don't manage the little devil sitting on my left shoulder. That little devil is screaming, "PRINT THE PICTURES PRINT THE PICTURES POST THEM ALL OVER THE SCHOOL DO IT NOW DO IT NOW DO IT NOW." And then on my right shoulder, there's a tiny white angel, whispering, "Oh my, I have a firm hope as solid as waste that by early Monday morning the new recruits will get their money properly."
tr_translation: But you see, I am in a similar situation. I cannot control the little devil sitting on my left shoulder. The devil says: "PRINT THE PHOTO PRINT THE PHOTO STICK IT EVERYWHERE IN THE SCHOOL DO IT DO IT DO IT." Then on my right shoulder, there is a small, tiny white angel. And the angel says; "My friend, all those first graders' money on Monday" I hope they will pick me up early in the morning."
es_translation: But, you see, I am in a situation similar to yours. I don't control the little devil sitting on my left shoulder. The devil tells me: "PRINT THE PHOTO PRINT THE PHOTO HANG IT ALL OVER THE INSTITUTE DO IT DO IT DO IT." But on my right shoulder, I have a little white angel. And the angel tells me: "Man, I bet those first-year kids get their money first thing Monday morning."

en: So do I, little angel. So do I.
vi: Tôi cũng vậy, thiên thần nhỏ ạ. Tôi cũng hi vọng như vậy.
tr: Ben de, küçük melek. Ben de.
es: También yo, angelito, también yo.
vi_translation: Me too, little angel. I hope so too.
tr_translation: Me too, little angel. Me too.
es_translation: Me too, little angel, me too.

en: Best wishes,
vi: Những lời chúc tốt đẹp nhất,
tr: İyi dileklerimle,
es: Mis mejores deseos,
vi_translation: Best wishes,
tr_translation: With my best wishes,
es_translation: My best wishes,

en: Your Friendly Neighborhood Nemesis
vi: Thần Báo Thù Thân Thiện của cậu
tr: Dostane Ezeli Düşman Komşunuz
es: Su amistoso vecino Némesis.
vi_translation: Your Friendly Avenger
tr_translation: You Get Your Eternal Enemy Neighbor
es_translation: Your friendly neighbor Nemesis.

en: He did not reply, and he didn’t need to. Everything had been said.
vi: Hắn không trả lời, và hắn cũng không cần làm như vậy. Mọi thứ đã đặt bài ngửa rõ ràng.
tr: Jase cevap vermedi ve vermesine de gerek yoktu. Her şey söylenmişti.
es: No me contestó, aunque no era necesario. Ya nos lo habíamos dicho todo.
vi_translation: He did not answer, and he did not need to. Everything was laid out clearly.
tr_translation: Jase didn't respond, and he didn't need to. Everything had been said.
es_translation: He didn't answer me, although it wasn't necessary. We had already said everything to each other.

en: Ben came over after dinner and we played Resurrection, pausing every half hour or so to call Radar, who was on a date with Angela. We left him eleven messages, each more annoying and salacious than the last. It was after nine o’clock when the doorbell rang. “Quentin!” my mom shouted. Ben and I figured it was Radar, so we paused the game and walked out into the living room. Chuck Parson and Jason Worthington were standing in my doorway. I walked over to them, and Jason said, “Hey, Quentin,” and I nodded my head. Jason glanced over at Chuck, who looked at me and mumbled, “Sorry, Quentin.”
vi: Sau bữa tối, Ben tạt qua và chúng tôi chơi Hồi Sinh, khoảng nửa tiếng lại dừng lại để gọi điện cho chàng Radar đang hẹn hò với nàng Angela. Tụi tôi gửi cho Radar mười một tin nhắn, cái sau lại càng gợi tình và gợi đòn hơn cái trước. Quá chín giờ tối, chuông cửa reo. “Quentin ơi!” mẹ tôi gọi. Ben và tôi đoán rằng Radar đến nên hai thằng tạm nghỉ trò chơi, cùng vào phòng khách. Chuck Parson và Jason Worthington đang đứng trên ngưỡng cửa nhà tôi. Tôi tiến đến, Jason nói, “Chào, Quentin”, tôi gật đầu. Jason liếc Chuck, và thằng này nhìn tôi, lúng búng, “Xin lỗi nha, Quentin.”
tr: Akşam yemeğinden sonra Ben geldi, Angela’yla randevuya çıkan Radar’ı aramak için yaklaşık her yarım saatte bir durarak Diriliş oynadık. Her biri sonuncusundan daha sinir bozucu ve daha müstehcen olan on bir mesaj bıraktık. Kapı zili çaldığında, saat dokuzu geçmişti. Annem, “Quentin!” diye bağırdı. Radar olduğunu düşündüğümüz için oyunu durdurup oturma odasma gittik. Kapımın önünde Chuck Parson ve Jason Worthington duruyordu. Onlara doğru yaklaştım, Jason, “Hey, Quentin,” dedi, ben de başımla selam verdim. Jason bana bakıp, “Üzgünüm, Quentin,” diye mırıldanan Chuck’a bir bakış attı.
es: Ben se pasó por mi casa después de cenar y estuvimos jugando al Resurrection parando más o menos cada media hora para llamar a Radar, que había salido con Angela. Le dejamos once mensajes, cada uno más impertinente y lascivo que el anterior. Eran las nueve pasadas cuando sonó el timbre. —¡Quentin! —gritó mi madre. Ben y yo supusimos que era Radar, así que paramos el juego y salimos al comedor. Chuck Parson y Jason Worthington estaban en la entrada. Me acerqué a ellos. —Hola, Quentin —dijo Jason. Lo saludé con la cabeza. Jason lanzó una mirada a Chuck, que me miró y murmuró: —Perdona, Quentin.
vi_translation: After dinner, Ben dropped by and we played Resurrection, pausing every half hour to call Radar, who was on a date with Angela. We sent Radar eleven messages, each one more suggestive and provocative than the last. Past nine in the evening, the doorbell rang. “Quentin!” my mom called. Ben and I guessed that Radar had arrived, so we took a break from the game and went to the living room together. Chuck Parson and Jason Worthington were standing at my doorstep. I approached, and Jason said, “Hi, Quentin,” to which I nodded. Jason glanced at Chuck, and he looked at me, mumbling, “Sorry, Quentin.”
tr_translation: After dinner, Ben came over, and we played Resurrection, pausing about every half hour to call Radar, who was out on a date with Angela. We left eleven messages, each more annoying and obscene than the last. When the doorbell rang, it was past nine o'clock. My mom shouted, "Quentin!" Thinking it was Radar, we paused the game and went to the living room. Standing at my door were Chuck Parson and Jason Worthington. I approached them, and Jason said, "Hey, Quentin," to which I nodded in greeting. Jason glanced at Chuck, who muttered, "Sorry, Quentin," while looking at me.
es_translation: Ben stopped by my house after dinner and we were playing Resurrection, pausing roughly every half hour to call Radar, who had gone out with Angela. We left him eleven messages, each one more impertinent and lascivious than the previous. It was past nine when the doorbell rang. —Quentin! —shouted my mother. Ben and I assumed it was Radar, so we paused the game and went out to the dining room. Chuck Parson and Jason Worthington were at the entrance. I approached them. —Hello, Quentin —said Jason. I greeted him with a nod. Jason glanced at Chuck, who looked at me and murmured: —Sorry, Quentin.

en: “For what?” I asked.
vi: “Vì chuyện gì?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Niçin?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Por qué? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: “For what reason?” I asked.
tr_translation: "Why?" I asked.
es_translation: —Why? —I asked him.

en: “For telling Jasper to piss-gun those freshmen,” he mumbled. He paused, and then said, “And the bikes.”
vi: “Vì xúi Jasper bắn súng phun vào bọn lớp chín,” nó vẫn lúng búng, ngừng lại rồi nói nốt, “Và vì mấy cái xe đạp.”
tr: “Jasper’a o birinci sınıflara çiş fışkırtmasını söylediğim için,” diye mırıldandı. Durdu ve sonra, “Bir de bisikletler için,” dedi.
es: —Por decirle a Jasper que disparara meados a los chavales de primero —murmuró. Hizo una pausa y siguió diciendo—: Y por lo de las bicis.
vi_translation: “Because I urged Jasper to shoot the water gun at the ninth graders,” he continued to mumble, pausing before finishing, “And because of the bikes.”
tr_translation: “Because I told Jasper to squirt pee at the first graders,” he muttered. He paused and then said, “And also for the bikes.”
es_translation: —For telling Jasper to shoot pee at the first-year kids —he murmured. He paused and continued—: And for the bikes.

en: Ben opened his arms, as if to hug. “C’mere, bro,” he said.
vi: Ben dang tay như thể muốn ôm, “Người anh em, lại đây,” nó nói.
tr: Ben sarılacakmış gibi kollarını açtı. “Gel buraya, kardeşim,” dedi.
es: Ben abrió los brazos, como si fuera a abrazarlo. —Ven aquí, colega —le dijo.
vi_translation: Ben stretched out his arms as if wanting to hug, "Brother, come here," he said.
tr_translation: He opened his arms as if to hug. "Come here, brother," he said.
es_translation: Ben opened his arms, as if he were going to hug him. —Come here, buddy —he said to him.

en: “What?”
vi: “Gì cơ?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —What?

en: “C’mere,” he said again. Chuck stepped forward. “Closer,” Ben said. Chuck was standing fully in the entryway now, maybe a foot from Ben. Out of nowhere, Ben slammed a punch into Chuck’s gut. Chuck barely flinched, but he immediately reared back to clobber Ben. Jase grabbed his arm, though. “Chill, bro,” Jase said. “It’s not like it hurt.” Jase reached out his hand, to shake. “I like your guts, bro,” he said. “I mean, you’re an asshole. But still.” I shook his hand.
vi: “Lại đây nào,” nó nói lại. Chuck tiến lên, “Gần hơn đi,” Ben nói. Chuck đã hoàn toàn đứng hẳn trong nhà tôi, cách Ben khoảng ba chục phân. Bất thình lình, Ben thoi một cú vào bụng Chuck. Chuck chẳng hề hấn gì, nhưng nó lập tức lùi lại lấy đà để nện Ben. Tuy nhiên Jase đã giữ tay nó. “Bình tĩnh đi ông,” Jase nói. “Không có vẻ đau đớn gì nhỉ.” Jase chìa tay ra để bắt, “Tôi khoái màn bất khuất của ông đấy chiến hữu,” nó nói. “Ông là đồ của nợ, nhưng tôi khoái đấy.” Tôi bắt tay Jase.
tr: “Gel buraya,” dedi tekrar. Chuck öne doğru bir adım attı. “Daha yakma,” dedi Ben. Chuck şimdi tamamen girişte duruyordu, Ben’den yaklaşık yanın metre uzaklıkta. Aniden Ben, Chuck’ın kamına bir yumruk attı. Chuck yüzünü bile buruşturmamıştı ama hemen Ben’i benzetmek için harekete geçti. Jase neyse ki kolunu yakaladı. “Sakin ol, kardeşim,” dedi. “Canın bile acımadı.” Jase elini el sıkışmak için uzattı. “Cesaretini sevdim, kardeşim,” dedi. “Yani, tam bir götsün. Ama yine de.” Elini sıktım.
es: —Que vengas —le repitió. Chuck dio un paso adelante. —Más cerca —dijo Ben. Chuck avanzó hasta la entrada, a un paso de Ben. Y de repente, Ben le pegó un puñetazo en la barriga. Chuck apenas se encogió. Dio un paso atrás para darle a Ben, pero Jase lo agarró del brazo. —Tranquilo, colega —le dijo Jase—. Tampoco te ha dolido tanto. Me tendió la mano para que se la estrechara. —Me gusta que tengas huevos, colega. Bueno, eres un capullo. Pero da igual. Le estreché la mano.
vi_translation: “Come here,” it repeated. Chuck stepped forward, “Closer,” Ben said. Chuck was now completely inside my house, about a foot away from Ben. Suddenly, Ben punched Chuck in the stomach. Chuck wasn't hurt at all, but he immediately stepped back to get ready to hit Ben. However, Jase held his hand. “Calm down, man,” Jase said. “Doesn't seem like it hurt.” Jase extended his hand for a shake, “I like your resilience, buddy,” he said. “You're a pain, but I like you.” I shook Jase's hand.
tr_translation: "Come here," he said again. Chuck took a step forward. "Closer," said Ben. Chuck was now standing completely in the entrance, about half a meter away from Ben. Suddenly, Ben punched Chuck in the stomach. Chuck didn't even flinch but immediately moved to retaliate against Ben. Luckily, Jase grabbed his arm caught. “Calm down, brother,” he said. “It didn't even hurt.” Jase extended his hand for a handshake. “I like your courage, brother,” he said. “I mean, you're a total ass. But still.” I shook his hand.
es_translation: —That you come —he repeated to her. Chuck took a step forward. —Closer —said Ben. Chuck advanced to the entrance, a step ahead of Ben. And suddenly, Ben punched him in the stomach. Chuck barely flinched. He took a step back to hit Ben, but Jase grabbed him by the arm. —Calm down, buddy —Jase told him—. It didn't hurt that much either. He extended his hand for me to shake it. —I like that you have guts, mate. Well, you're an asshole. But it doesn't matter. I shook his hand.

en: They left then, getting into Jase’s Lexus and backing down the driveway. As soon as I closed the front door, Ben let out a mighty groan. “Ahhhhhhhggg. Oh, sweet Lord Jesus, my hand.” He attempted to make a fist and winced. “I think Chuck Parson had a textbook strapped to his stomach.”
vi: Rồi hai thằng ấy rời đi trên chiếc Lexus của Jase, lái lùi xuống đường. Tôi vừa đóng cửa trước, Ben đã tuôn ra một tràng rên rẩm, “Ahhhhhhhhggg. Ôi thưa Đức Chúa ngọt ngào, bàn tay của con.” Nó cố nắm tay lại và mặt nhăn như bị rách. “Thằng Chuck Parson hộ thân bằng một cuốn sách giáo khoa dày cui thì phải.”
tr: Sonra Jase’in Lexus’una binip garaj yolunda geri geri giderek, gittiler. Ön kapıyı kapatır kapatmaz, Ben feryat kopardı. “Ahhhhhhh. Ah, sevgili Tanrım, elim.” Yumruğunu sıkmayı denedi ve irkildi. “Sanırım Chuck Parson karnına bir ders kitabı yapıştırmıştı.
es: Se metieron en el Lexus de Jase, dieron marcha atrás y se marcharon. En cuanto cerré la puerta, Ben soltó un fuerte rugido. —Ayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy. Joder, mi mano. —Ben intentó cerrar el puño e hizo una mueca de dolor—. Creo que Chuck Parson se había metido un libro en la barriga.
vi_translation: Then those two guys left in Jase's Lexus, reversing down the road. I had just closed the front door when Ben let out a stream of groans, "Ahhhhhhhhggg." "Oh sweet Lord, my hand." He tried to clench his hand and his face twisted as if it were torn. "Chuck Parson must have shielded himself with a thick textbook."
tr_translation: Then they got into Jase's Lexus and reversed down the driveway. As soon as the front door closed, Ben let out a scream. “Ahhhhhhh. Oh, dear God, my hand.” He tried to clench his fist and winced. “I think Chuck Parson had stuck a textbook to his stomach.”
es_translation: They got into Jase's Lexus, backed up, and drove away. As soon as I closed the door, Ben let out a loud roar. —Ayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy. Damn, my hand. —Ben tried to close his fist and grimaced in pain—. I think Chuck Parson had put a book in his stomach.

en: “Those are called abs,” I told him.
vi: “Cái đó gọi là múi bụng đấy ông ạ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Onlara karm kası deniyor,” dedim.
es: —Se llaman abdominales —le expliqué.
vi_translation: "That's called abdominal muscles, sir," I said.
tr_translation: “They are called karm muscles,” I said.
es_translation: —They are called sit-ups —I explained to him.

en: “Oh, yeah. I’ve heard of those.” I clapped him on the back and we headed back to the bedroom to play Resurrection. We’d just unpaused it when Ben said, “By the way, did you notice that Jase says ‘bro’? I’ve totally brought bro back. Just with the sheer force of my own awesomeness.”
vi: “Ờ, phải. Tôi cũng đã nghe qua qua.” Tôi vỗ vỗ lên lưng nó và cả hai cùng quay lại phòng tôi chơi Hồi Sinh. Chúng tôi vừa bắt đầu chơi lại thì Ben nói, “Mà này, ông có thấy thằng Jase nói ‘chiến hữu’ không? Tôi xin kiếu cái danh chiến hữu ấy. Chỉ với xung lực từ sự ảo diệu của chính tôi.”
tr: “Ah, evet. Onlar hakkında bir şeyler duymuştum.” Sırtına hafifçe vurdum ve Diriliş oynamak için tekrar yatak odasma yöneldik. Tam oyunu tekrar başlatmıştık ki Ben, “Bu arada, Jase’in ‘kardeşim’ dediğim fark ettin mi? Kardeşim kelimesini geri getirdim. Sadece kendi muhteşemliğimin saf gücüyle.
es: —Sí, claro. He oído hablar de ellos. Le di una palmadita en la espalda y volvimos a la habitación a seguir jugando al Resurrection. Justo habíamos quitado la pausa cuando Ben dijo: —Por cierto, ¿te has dado cuenta de que Jase dice «colega»? He vuelto a ponerlo de moda. Y solo con la fuerza de mi genialidad.
vi_translation: “Oh, right. I've heard about it too.” I patted its back and we both went back to my room to play Resurrection. We had just started playing again when Ben said, “Hey, did you hear Jase say 'comrade'? I decline that comrade title. Only with the impulse from my own magic.”
tr_translation: “Ah, yes. I had heard something about them.” I patted him lightly on the back and we headed back to the bedroom to play Resurrection again. We had just restarted the game when Ben said, “By the way, did you notice that Jase called me ‘brother’? I brought back the word brother. Just by the sheer power of my own magnificence.”
es_translation: —Yes, of course. I've heard of them. I gave him a pat on the back and we went back to the room to continue playing Resurrection. We had just taken off the pause when Ben said: —By the way, have you noticed that Jase says "mate"? I've brought it back into fashion. And only with the power of my brilliance.

en: “Yeah, you’re spending Friday night gaming and nursing the hand you broke while trying to sucker punch somebody. No wonder Jase Worthington has chosen to hitch his star to your wagon.”
vi: “Ừa, tối thứ Sáu ông mần trò chơi điện tử và băng bó bàn tay tàn tạ vì đã hão huyền tưởng có thể đấm một cú thôi sơn vào bụng người ta. Chẳng trách Jase Worthington đã phải ngậm ngùi hạ mình trước ông.”
tr: “Evet, cuma geceni oyun oynayarak ve birine beklenmedik bir yumruk atmaya çalışırken kırdığın elini ovalayarak geçiriyorsun. Jason Worthington’m yükselmek için seni örnek almasına şaşmamalı.
es: —Sí, te pasas el viernes por la noche jugando y curándote la mano, que te has roto intentando pegarle un puñetazo a un tipo. No me extraña que Jase Worthington haya decidido arrimarse a tu árbol.
vi_translation: “Yeah, on Friday night he played video games and bandaged his ruined hand because he foolishly thought he could land a single punch to someone's stomach. No wonder Jase Worthington had to humbly lower himself before him.”
tr_translation: “Yes, you spend your Friday night playing games and rubbing the hand you broke while trying to throw an unexpected punch at someone. No wonder Jason Worthington looks up to you as an example to rise.”
es_translation: —Yes, you spend Friday night playing and nursing your hand, which you broke trying to punch a guy. No wonder Jase Worthington has decided to cozy up to your tree.

en: “At least I’m good at Resurrection,” he said, whereupon he shot me in the back even though we were playing in team mode.
vi: “Nói đi nói lại thì tôi cũng là siêu sao Hồi Sinh mà,” Ben nói, lập tức bắn luôn vào lưng tôi dù chúng tôi đang chơi ở chế độ đồng đội.
tr: “En azından Diriliş’te iyiyim,” dedi ve hemen ardından bir takım olmamıza rağmen beni sırtımdan vurdu.
es: —Al menos soy bueno al Resurrection —me dijo. Y me disparó por la espalda, aunque estábamos jugando en equipo.
vi_translation: "When all is said and done, I am a Resurrection superstar," Ben said, immediately shooting me in the back even though we were playing in team mode.
tr_translation: “At least I'm good at Resurrection,” he said, and immediately after, despite us being a team, he shot me in the back.
es_translation: —At least I'm good at Resurrection —he told me. And he shot me in the back, even though we were playing as a team.

en: We played for a while longer, until Ben just curled onto the floor, holding the controller up to his chest, and went to sleep. I was tired, too—it had been a long day. I figured Margo would be back by Monday anyway, but even so, I felt a little pride at having been the person who stemmed the tide of lame.
vi: Bọn tôi chơi thêm một lúc nữa, cho đến khi Ben nằm cuộn tròn trên sàn, giữ khư khư bộ điều khiển trò chơi trong lòng và ngủ khì khì. Tôi cũng mệt–đã qua một ngày dài. Tôi đoán chắc đến thứ Hai kiểu gì Margo cũng về, nhưng dẫu vậy, tôi cũng cảm thấy một chút hãnh diện khi là người ngăn chặn cơn sóng triều của những đều đều tẻ nhạt này.
tr: Bir süre daha oynadık, ta ki Ben gamepad’i göğsünde, öylece yerde kıvrılıp uyuyana kadar. Ben de yorgundum... uzun bir gün olmuştu. Margo’nun pazartesi her halükârda dönmüş olacağını düşündüm ama yine de sıkıcılığı engelleyen kişi olmaktan birazcık gurur duydum.
es: Jugamos un rato más, hasta que Ben se acurrucó en el suelo, con el mando pegado al pecho, y se quedó dormido. Yo también estaba cansado. Había sido un día largo. Suponía que Margo estaría de vuelta el lunes, pero aun así me sentí un poco orgulloso de haber sido la persona que había detenido la tormenta.
vi_translation: We played for a while longer, until Ben curled up on the floor, clutching the game controller to his chest, and fell fast asleep. I was tired too—it had been a long day. I was sure Margo would be back by Monday, but even so, I felt a bit proud of being the one to hold back the tide of monotony.
tr_translation: We played for a while longer, until Ben, with the gamepad on his chest, curled up on the floor and fell asleep. I was tired too... it had been a long day. I thought Margo would have returned by Monday anyway, but I still felt a bit proud of being the one who prevented the boredom.
es_translation: We played a little longer, until Ben curled up on the floor, with the controller pressed to his chest, and fell asleep. I was tired too. It had been a long day. I assumed that Margo would be back on Monday, but even so, I felt a bit proud of having been the person who had stopped the storm.

en: Every morning, I now looked up through my bedroom window to check whether there was any sign of life in Margo’s room. She always kept her rattan shades closed, but since she’d left, her mom or somebody had pulled them up, so I could see a little snippet of blue wall and white ceiling. On that Saturday morning, with her only forty-eight hours gone, I figured she wouldn’t be home yet, but even so, I felt a flicker of disappointment when I saw the shade still pulled up.
vi: Bây giờ cứ sáng dậy tôi đều nhìn qua cửa sổ phòng mình xem có dấu hiệu gì cho thấy có người trong phòng Margo không. Cô ấy thường hạ tấm rèm mây xuống, nhưng từ hôm Margo không ở nhà, mẹ cô ấy hoặc ai đó đã kéo rèm lên, nên tôi thấy được một mảng tường xanh dương và trần nhà màu trắng. Sáng thứ Bảy hôm ấy, Margo mới biến mất có bốn mươi tám tiếng đồng hồ, tôi đoán có lẽ cô ấy chưa về ngay được. Dù vậy, tôi vẫn thấy cợn lên chút thất vọng khi nhìn sang tấm rèm mây được cuốn gọn.
tr: Artık her sabah Margo’nun odasında herhangi bir yaşam belirtisi olup olmadığını kontrol etmek için, odamın penceresinden dışarı bakıyordum. Bambu jaluzilerini her zaman kapak tutardı ama o gittikten sonra annesi ya da başka biri jaluzileri açmıştı, böylece mavi duvardan ve beyaz tavandan ufak bir parça görebiliyordum. O cumartesi sabahı, gitmesinin üstünden kırk sekiz saat geçmişken, henüz eve dönmediğini hesaplamıştım ama yine de jaluzinin hâlâ açık olduğunu görünce bir hayal kırıklığı kıpırtısı hissettim.
es: Todas las mañanas miraba por la ventana de mi habitación para comprobar si en la habitación de Margo había algún signo de vida. Siempre tenía las persianas de mimbre bajadas, pero, desde que se había marchado, su madre o alguna otra persona de la casa las había subido, de modo que veía un trocito de pared azul y techo blanco. Aquel sábado por la mañana, como hacía solo cuarenta y ocho horas que se había escapado, suponía que todavía no estaría en casa, pero aun así me sentí un poco decepcionado al ver que la persiana seguía subida.
vi_translation: Now every morning when I wake up, I look out the window of my room to see if there are any signs that someone is in Margo's room. She usually lowers the bamboo blinds, but since Margo hasn't been home, her mother or someone else has pulled the blinds up, so I can see a patch of blue wall and a white ceiling. That Saturday morning, Margo had only been missing for forty-eight hours, so I guessed she probably wouldn't be back right away. Even so, I still felt a bit of disappointment when I saw the neatly rolled-up bamboo blinds.
tr_translation: Now, every morning, I would look out of my window to check if there was any sign of life in Margo's room. She always kept her bamboo blinds closed, but after she left, her mother or someone else had opened them, so I could see a small piece of the blue wall and the white ceiling. That Saturday morning, forty-eight hours after she had left, I had calculated that she had not yet returned home, but still felt a twinge of disappointment when I saw that the blinds were still open.
es_translation: Every morning I looked out the window of my room to check if there was any sign of life in Margo's room. She always had the wicker blinds down, but since she had left, her mother or someone else in the house had raised them, so I could see a bit of blue wall and white ceiling. That Saturday morning, since it had only been forty-eight hours since she had run away, I assumed she still wouldn't be home, but I still felt a bit disappointed to see that the blind was still up.

en: I brushed my teeth and then, after briefly kicking at Ben in an attempt to wake him, walked out in shorts and a T-shirt. Five people were seated at the dining room table. My mom and dad. Margo’s mom and dad. And a tall, stout African-American man with oversize glasses wearing a gray suit, holding a manila folder.
vi: Sau khi đá Ben mấy cước mà nó vẫn không chịu dậy, tôi đánh răng, mặc quần soóc và áo phông ra khỏi phòng. Có năm người đang ngồi bên bàn ăn. Bố mẹ tôi. Bố mẹ của Margo. Và một người đàn ông gốc Phi cao lớn đậm đà, đeo đôi kính bự chảng, mặc bộ com-plê màu xám, tay cầm một cặp hồ sơ.
tr: Dişlerimi fırçaladım, ardından uyandırmak amacıyla Ben’i kısa bir süre tekmeledikten sonra, üstümde bir şort ve tişörtle odadan çıktım. Yemek masasında beş kişi vardı. Annem, babam. Margo’nun annesi ve babası. Bir de uzun boylu, iri yarı, aşın büyük gözlüklü, gri takım giyen, karton bir dosya tutan siyahi bir adam.
es: Me lavé los dientes y después, tras darle unas pataditas a Ben intentando despertarlo, salí en pantalón corto y camiseta. Había cinco personas sentadas a la mesa del comedor: mis padres, los padres de Margo y un afroamericano alto y corpulento con unas gafas enormes, un traje gris y una carpeta marrón en las manos.
vi_translation: After kicking Ben a few times and he still wouldn't get up, I brushed my teeth, put on shorts and a t-shirt, and left the room. There were five people sitting at the dining table. My parents. Margo's parents. And a tall, well-built African man, wearing large glasses, a gray suit, and holding a briefcase.
tr_translation: I brushed my teeth, then after kicking Ben briefly to wake him up, I left the room wearing shorts and a t-shirt. There were five people at the dining table. My mom, my dad. Margo's mom and dad. And a tall, burly, black man with oversized glasses, wearing a gray suit, holding a cardboard file.
es_translation: I brushed my teeth and then, after giving Ben a few little kicks to try to wake him up, I went out in shorts and a t-shirt. There were five people sitting at the dining table: my parents, Margo's parents, and a tall, burly African American man with huge glasses, a gray suit, and a brown folder in his hands.

en: “Uh, hi,” I said.
vi: “Ơ, con chào cả nhà ạ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Şey, selam,” dedim.
es: —Ay, hola —dije.
vi_translation: “Oh, hello everyone,” I said.
tr_translation: "Uh, hi," I said.
es_translation: —Oh, hi —I said.

en: “Quentin,” my mom asked, “did you see Margo on Wednesday night?”
vi: “Quentin ơi,” mẹ hỏi tôi, “tối hôm thứ Tư con có gặp bạn Margo không?”
tr: “Quentin,” dedi annem, “çarşamba gecesi Margo’yu gördün mü?”
es: —Quentin, ¿viste a Margo el miércoles por la noche? —me preguntó mi madre.
vi_translation: "Quentin," my mom asked me, "did you see your friend Margo on Wednesday night?"
tr_translation: “Quentin,” my mom said, “did you see Margo on Wednesday night?”
es_translation: —Quentin, did you see Margo on Wednesday night? —my mother asked me.

en: I walked into the dining room and leaned against the wall, standing opposite the stranger. I’d thought of my answer to this question already. “Yeah,” I said. “She showed up at my window at like midnight and we talked for a minute and then Mr. Spiegelman caught her and she went back to her house.”
vi: Tôi vào hẳn phòng ăn và đứng dựa vào tường, đối diện người khách lạ mặt. Tôi đã tính trước phải trả lời câu này thế nào rồi. “Có ạ,” tôi đáp. “Khoảng nửa đêm bạn ấy đứng cạnh cửa sổ phòng con, tụi con nói chuyện độ một phút thì chú Spiegelman gọi và bạn ấy về nhà ạ.”
tr: Yemek odasma girip yabancı adamın karşısında durarak duvara yaslandım. Bu soruya cevabımı çoktan düşünmüştüm. “Evet,” dedim. “Geceyansı gibi penceremde ortaya çıktı, bir dakika konuştuk, sonra Bay Spiegelman onu yakaladı ve Margo eve geri döndü.”
es: Entré en el comedor y me apoyé en la pared, enfrente del desconocido. Ya tenía pensada la respuesta a esa pregunta. —Sí —le contesté—. Apareció por mi ventana hacia las doce, hablamos un minuto y luego el señor Spiegelman la pilló y tuvo que volver a casa.
vi_translation: I went straight into the dining room and stood leaning against the wall, facing the strange guest. I had already planned how to answer this question. "Yes," I replied. "Around midnight, he stood by my window, we talked for about a minute, then Mr. Spiegelman called and he went home."
tr_translation: I walked into the dining room and leaned against the wall, standing in front of the stranger. I had already thought about my answer to this question. “Yes,” I said. “She appeared at my window around midnight, we talked for a minute, then Mr. Spiegelman caught her and Margo went back home.”
es_translation: I entered the dining room and leaned against the wall, facing the stranger. I already had the answer to that question thought out. —Yes —I answered him—. She appeared at my window around twelve, we talked for a minute and then Mr. Spiegelman caught her and she had to go back home.

en: “And was that—? Did you see her after that?” Mr. Spiegelman asked. He seemed quite calm.
vi: “Có thế thôi à? Sau đó con có gặp nó nữa không?” Chú Spiegelman hỏi, trông có vẻ khá điềm tĩnh.
tr: “Ve bu... Onu bundan sonra gördün mü?” diye sordu Bay Spiegelman. Oldukça sakin görünüyordu.
es: —¿Y esa fue…? ¿La has visto después? —me preguntó el señor Spiegelman. Parecía bastante tranquilo.
vi_translation: “Is that all? Did you see him again after that?” Uncle Spiegelman asked, looking quite calm.
tr_translation: “And this... Did you see her after that?” asked Mr. Spiegelman. He seemed quite calm.
es_translation: —And that was...? Have you seen her since? —Mr. Spiegelman asked me. He seemed quite calm.

en: “No, why?” I asked.
vi: “Không ạ. Có chuyện gì thế ạ?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Hayır, neden?” diye sordum.
es: —No, ¿por qué? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "No." "What's the matter?" I asked.
tr_translation: “No, why?” I asked.
es_translation: —No, why? —I asked.

en: Margo’s mom answered, her voice shrill. “Well,” she said, “it seems that Margo has run away. Again.” She sighed. “This would be—what is it, Josh, the fourth time?”
vi: Mẹ Margo the thé trả lời. “Xem ra con bé bỏ nhà đi rồi. Thêm một lần nữa.” Cô ấy thở dài. “Đây là–mấy nhỉ anh Josh, lần thứ tư phải không?”
tr: Margo’nun annesi tiz bir sesle cevapladı. “Şey,” dedi, “görünüşe göre Margo evden kaçtı. Yine.” İç çekti. “Bu kaçıncı Josh... dördüncü defa mı?
es: —Bueno —contestó la madre de Margo con un tono agudo—, parece que Margo se ha escapado. Otra vez. —Suspiró—. Debe de ser… ¿cuántas veces van ya, Josh? ¿Cuatro?
vi_translation: Margo's mother answered. “It looks like she has run away from home.” “Once again.” She sighed. “This is–how many times now, Josh, the fourth time, right?”
tr_translation: Margo's mother answered in a high-pitched voice. "Well," she said, "it looks like Margo ran away from home. Again." She sighed. "How many times is this, Josh... the fourth time?"
es_translation: —Well —Margo's mother replied in a sharp tone—, it looks like Margo has run away. Again. —She sighed—. This must be… how many times now, Josh? Four?

en: “Oh, I’ve lost count,” her dad answered, annoyed.
vi: “Ôi nhiều quá chẳng nhớ nổi nữa,” bố Margo cau có đáp.
tr: “Ah, sayısım unuttum,” diye cevap verdi babası sinirli bir şekilde.
es: —Uf, he perdido la cuenta —contestó su marido, enfadado.
vi_translation: “Oh, there are too many to remember,” Margo's dad replied grumpily.
tr_translation: “Ah, I forgot my number,” his father replied angrily.
es_translation: —Ugh, I've lost count —replied her husband, annoyed.

en: The African-American man spoke up then. “Fifth time you’ve filed a report.” The man nodded at me and said, “Detective Otis Warren.”
vi: Khi đó người đàn ông da màu kia mới lên tiếng. “Lần thứ năm anh chị trình báo.” Bác ấy gật đầu với tôi và nói, “Bác là thám tử Otis Warren.”
tr: Bunun üzerine siyahi adam araya girdi. “Beş kez rapor ediyorsunuz.” Adam bana doğru başım salladı ve “Dedektif Otis Warren,” dedi.
es: Entonces intervino el afroamericano. —La quinta vez que han presentado una denuncia. —Me saludó con la cabeza y dijo—: Detective Otis Warren.
vi_translation: Then the man of color spoke up. “This is the fifth time you have reported.” He nodded to me and said, “I am Detective Otis Warren.”
tr_translation: At that point, the black man intervened. “You are reporting five times.” The man nodded towards me and said, “Detective Otis Warren.”
es_translation: Then the African American intervened. —The fifth time they have filed a complaint. —He greeted me with a nod and said—: Detective Otis Warren.

en: “Quentin Jacobsen,” I said.
vi: “Con là Quentin Jacobsen ạ,” tôi tự giới thiệu.
tr: “Quentin Jacobsen,” dedim.
es: —Quentin Jacobsen —le dije yo.
vi_translation: "I am Quentin Jacobsen," I introduced myself.
tr_translation: "Quentin Jacobsen," I said.
es_translation: —Quentin Jacobsen —I said.

en: Mom stood up and put her hands on Mrs. Spiegelman’s shoulders. “Debbie,” she said, “I’m so sorry. It’s a very frustrating situation.” I knew this trick. It was a psychology trick called empathic listening. You say what the person is feeling so they feel understood. Mom does it to me all the time.
vi: Mẹ đứng dậy và đặt hai tay mình lên vai cô Spiegelman. “Chị Debbie à,” mẹ nói, “em rất lấy làm tiếc. Chuyện này vất vả mệt mỏi cho chị quá.” Tôi biết thừa trò này của mẹ. Đó là một kĩ thuật trong tâm lí học, tên là lắng nghe thông cảm và thấu hiểu. Ta nói lên cảm giác của người đang đối thoại với mình để người đó cảm thấy đã được trải lòng. Mẹ bày trò này với tôi suốt.
tr: Annem ayağa kalkıp ellerini Bayan Spiegelman’m omuzlarına koydu. “Debbie,” dedi, “çok üzgünüm. Çok sinir bozucu bir durum.” Bu numarayı biliyordum. Empatik dinleme adı verilen bir psikoloji hilesiydi. Anlaşıldığını düşünsün diye kişinin hissettiği şeyi söylersiniz. Annem bana bunu sürekli yapardı.
es: Mi madre se levantó y apoyó las manos en los hombros de la señora Spiegelman. —Debbie —le dijo—, lo siento mucho. Es una situación muy frustrante. Conocía aquel truco. Era un truco psicológico llamado escucha empática. Dices lo que la persona está sintiendo para que se sienta comprendida. Mi madre lo hace conmigo a todas horas.
vi_translation: Mom stood up and placed her hands on Ms. Spiegelman's shoulders. "Debbie," she said, "I'm so sorry. This must be so exhausting for you." I knew my mom's trick all too well. It's a technique in psychology called empathetic listening and understanding. You articulate the feelings of the person you're talking to so that they feel heard. Mom uses this trick on me all the time.
tr_translation: Mom stood up and put her hands on Mrs. Spiegelman's shoulders. “Debbie,” she said, “I’m very sorry. It’s a very frustrating situation.” I knew this trick. It was a psychology trick called empathetic listening. You say what the person is feeling so they think they are understood. Mom used to do this to me all the time.
es_translation: My mother stood up and placed her hands on Mrs. Spiegelman's shoulders. —Debbie —he said—, I'm very sorry. It's a very frustrating situation. I knew that trick. It was a psychological trick called empathetic listening. You say what the person is feeling so that they feel understood. My mother does it with me all the time.

en: “I’m not frustrated,” Mrs. Spiegelman answered. “I’m done.”
vi: “Tôi không vất vả mệt mỏi gì sất,” cô Spiegelman đáp. “Tôi ngấy lắm rồi.”
tr: “Sinirim bozulmadı,” diye karşılık verdi Bayan Spiegelman. “Artık bıktım.
es: —No estoy frustrada —le contestó la señora Spiegelman—. Se acabó.
vi_translation: “I am not tired or exhausted at all,” Ms. Spiegelman replied. “I am really fed up.”
tr_translation: “I’m not upset,” replied Mrs. Spiegelman. “I’m just tired of it.”
es_translation: —I am not frustrated —Mrs. Spiegelman replied to him—. It's over.

en: “That’s right,” Mr. Spiegelman said. “We’ve got a locksmith coming this afternoon. We’re changing the locks. She’s eighteen. I mean, the detective has just said there’s nothing we can do—”
vi: “Đúng vậy,” chú Spiegelman tán thành. “Nhà tôi đã hẹn thợ khóa chiều nay đến. Chúng tôi sẽ thay tất cả các ổ khóa. Nó mười tám rồi. Bác thám tử cũng vừa bảo rằng chúng tôi không thể làm g ì–”
tr: “Doğru,” dedi Bay Spiegelman. “Bu Öğleden sonra bir çilingir gelecek. Kilitleri değiştiriyoruz. Margo on sekiz yaşında. Yani, dedektif az önce yapacak hiçbir şeyimizin olmadığını söyledi...
es: —Exacto —dijo el señor Spiegelman—. Esta tarde vendrá un cerrajero. Cambiaremos las cerraduras. Tiene dieciocho años. En fin, el detective acaba de decirnos que no podemos hacer nada…
vi_translation: “That's right,” Mr. Spiegelman agreed. “We have an appointment with the locksmith this afternoon. We will change all the locks. He's eighteen now. The detective also just said that we can't do anything–”
tr_translation: “Right,” said Mr. Spiegelman. “A locksmith will come this afternoon. We are changing the locks. Margo is eighteen years old. So, the detective just said there’s nothing we can do...”
es_translation: —Exactly —said Mr. Spiegelman—. This afternoon a locksmith will come. We will change the locks. He is eighteen years old. Anyway, the detective just told us that we can't do anything...

en: “Well,” Detective Warren interrupted, “I didn’t quite say that. I said that she’s not a missing minor, and so she has the right to leave home.”
vi: ì–” “E hèm,” thám tử Warren ngắt lời, “không hẳn tôi đã nói như vậy. Tôi nói rằng Margo không phải là trẻ vị thành niên bị mất tích, tức là con bé có quyền đi khỏi nhà.
tr: “Şey,” diye sözünü kesti Dedektif Warren, “tam olarak böyle söylemedim. Reşit olmayan bir kayıp olmadığını, bu nedenle evi terk etme hakkı olduğunu söyledim.
es: —Bueno —lo interrumpió el detective Warren—, no he dicho eso exactamente. He dicho que no es menor de edad, de modo que tiene derecho a marcharse de casa.
vi_translation: “Ahem,” Detective Warren interrupted, “I didn't exactly say that. I said that Margo is not a missing minor, meaning she has the right to leave home.”
tr_translation: "Well," Detective Warren interrupted, "I didn't say it exactly like that. I said that since she is not a minor, she has the right to leave home."
es_translation: —Well —Detective Warren interrupted him—, I didn't say that exactly. I said that she is not a minor, so she has the right to leave home.

en: Mr. Spiegelman continued talking to my mom. “We’re happy to pay for her to go to college, but we can’t support this . . . this silliness. Connie, she’s eighteen! And still so self-centered! She needs to see some consequences.”
vi: Chú Spiegelman tiếp tục nói với mẹ tôi. “Vợ chồng tôi sẵn sàng trả tiền để nó đi học đại học, nhưng chúng tôi không thể dung túng cho... cho trò ngớ ngẩn thế này được. Connie ạ, con bé nhà tôi mười tám tuổi rồi! Thế mà vẫn ích kỉ thích gì làm nấy! Nó cần phải nếm trải chút hệ quả.”
tr: Bay Spiegelman annemle konuşmaya devam etti. “Üniversite masraflarım karşılayacağız elbette ama bu... bu aptallığı destekleyemeyiz. Connie, o on sekiz yaşında! Ve hâlâ çok bencil! Bunun sonuçlarını görmesi gerekiyor.
es: El señor Spiegelman siguió hablando con mi madre. —Nos parece bien pagarle la universidad, pero no vamos a tolerar estas… estas tonterías. Connie, ¡tiene dieciocho años! ¡Y sigue siendo una egocéntrica! Tiene que ver las consecuencias.
vi_translation: Uncle Spiegelman continued talking to my mother. "My wife and I are willing to pay for her to go to college, but we cannot tolerate... such foolishness." "Connie, my daughter is eighteen years old! And yet she is still selfish and does whatever she wants!" "She needs to experience some consequences."
tr_translation: Mr. Spiegelman continued talking with my mother. “We will, of course, cover the university expenses, but this... we cannot support this foolishness. Connie, she is eighteen years old! And still very selfish! She needs to see the consequences of this.”
es_translation: Mr. Spiegelman continued talking with my mother. —We are okay with paying for her college, but we are not going to tolerate these… these foolishness. Connie, she is eighteen years old! And she is still self-centered! She needs to see the consequences.

en: My mom removed her hands from Mrs. Spiegelman. “I would argue she needs to see loving consequences,” my mom said.
vi: Mẹ tôi nhấc tay khỏi vai cô Spiegelman. “Em nghĩ con bé cần được nếm trải những hệ quả yêu thương trìu mến,” mẹ nói.
tr: Annem ellerini Bayan Spiegelman’dan çekti. “Ben sevgi dolu sonuçlar görmesi gerektiğini savunurdum,” dedi annem.
es: Mi madre retiró las manos de los hombros de la señora Spiegelman. —Diría que las consecuencias que tiene que ver son las del cariño —le dijo mi madre.
vi_translation: My mother lifted her hand off Ms. Spiegelman's shoulder. "I think the girl needs to experience the consequences of loving affection," my mother said.
tr_translation: My mother withdrew her hands from Mrs. Spiegelman. "I would argue that it should yield loving results," my mother said.
es_translation: My mother removed her hands from Mrs. Spiegelman's shoulders. —I would say that the consequences to consider are those of affection —my mother told him.

en: “Well, she’s not your daughter, Connie. She hasn’t walked all over you like a doormat for a decade. We’ve got another child to think about.”
vi: “Ơ kìa Connie, nó có phải con cô đâu. Dễ cả chục năm nay nó có thăm hỏi cô lần nào đâu. Nhà tôi còn một đứa nữa phải nuôi.”
tr: “0 senin kızın değil, Connie. On yıldır bir paspasmışsın gibi seni ezip geçmedi. Düşünmemiz gereken bir çocuğumuz daha var.
es: —Bueno, no es tu hija, Connie. A ti no lleva diez años pisándote como si fueras un felpudo. Tenemos que pensar en nuestra otra hija.
vi_translation: "Oh Connie, it's not your child. It hasn't visited you in almost ten years. My family still has another one to take care of."
tr_translation: "She is not your daughter, Connie. She hasn't been trampling over you like a doormat for ten years. We have another child to think about."
es_translation: —Well, she's not your daughter, Connie. She hasn't been walking all over you like a doormat for ten years. We have to think about our other daughter.

en: “And ourselves,” Mr. Spiegelman added. He looked up at me then. “Quentin, I’m sorry if she tried to drag you into her little game. You can imagine how . . . just how embarrassing this is for us. You’re such a good boy, and she . . . well.”
vi: “Và chính chúng tôi nữa,” chú Spiegelman bổ sung, rồi quay sang tôi. “Quentin à, chú xin lỗi nếu Margo đã lôi kéo con vào những trò vớ vẩn của nó. Con có hiểu... cô chú thấy muối mặt vì chuyện này đến thế nào không. Con là một cậu bé nghiêm chỉnh, còn nó... ôi.”
tr: “Ve bir de kendimiz,” diye ekledi Bay Spiegelman. Sonra bana baktı. “Quentin, küçük oyununa seni de sürüklemeye çalıştıysa üzgünüm. Bunun bizim için ne kadar... ne kadar utanç verici olduğunu tasavvur edebilirsin. Sen çok iyi bir çocuksun, o ise... şey.”
es: —Y en nosotros —añadió el señor Spiegelman. Levantó la mirada hacia mí—. Quentin, lamento que intentara involucrarte en su jueguecito. Ya te imaginas lo… lo avergonzados que estamos. Eres un buen chico, y ella… Bueno.
vi_translation: “And us too,” Uncle Spiegelman added, then turned to me. “Quentin, I'm sorry if Margo has dragged you into her nonsense. Do you understand... how embarrassed we are about this. You are a serious boy, and she... oh.”
tr_translation: “And also ourselves,” added Mr. Spiegelman. Then he looked at me. “Quentin, I'm sorry if he tried to drag you into his little game. You can imagine how... how embarrassing this is for us. You are a very good kid, but he is... a thing.”
es_translation: —And in us —added Mr. Spiegelman. He looked up at me—. Quentin, I'm sorry she tried to involve you in her little game. You can imagine how... how embarrassed we are. You're a good boy, and she... Well.

en: I pushed myself off the wall and stood up straight. I knew Margo’s parents a little, but I’d never seen them act so bitchy. No wonder she was annoyed with them Wednesday night. I glanced over at the detective. He was flipping through pages in the folder. “She’s been known to leave a bit of a bread crumb trail; is that right?”
vi: Tôi không dựa tường nữa mà đứng thẳng. Tôi có biết qua loa về bố mẹ Margo, nhưng chưa bao giờ thấy họ cư xử tệ bạc như vậy. Chẳng trách đêm hôm thứ Tư Margo đã cáu bố mẹ. Tôi liếc viên thanh tra, bác ấy đang lật qua các trang trong tập hồ sơ. “Từ trước đến giờ Margo vẫn để lại chút vụn bánh mì làm dấu đúng không?”
tr: Kendimi duvardan iterek dik durdum. Margo’nun ebeveynlerim biraz tanıyordum ama bu kadar şirret davrandıklarını hiç görmemiştim. Çarşamba gecesi Margo’nun onlara kızdığına şaşmamak gerekirdi. Dedektife bir bakış attım. Dosyanın sayfalarım çeviriyordu. “Ekmek kırıntılarından iz bıraktığı biliniyor, doğru mu?” “İpuçları,” dedi Bay Spiegelman, artık ayaktaydı.
es: Me separé de la pared y me quedé de pie, muy tieso. Conocía un poco a los padres de Margo, pero nunca los había visto actuar con tan mala leche. No me extrañaba que estuviera enfadada con ellos el miércoles por la noche. Miré al detective. Estaba pasando hojas de la carpeta.
vi_translation: I no longer lean against the wall but stand upright. I have a vague understanding of Margo's parents, but I have never seen them behave so poorly. No wonder Margo was angry with her parents on Wednesday night. I glance at the inspector, who is flipping through the pages of the file. "Margo has always left some breadcrumbs as a sign, hasn't she?"
tr_translation: I pushed myself off the wall and stood up straight. I knew Margo's parents a little, but I had never seen them act so viciously. It was no wonder Margo was mad at them on Wednesday night. I glanced at the detective. He was flipping through the pages of the file. “She is known to leave trails of breadcrumbs, correct?” “Clues,” said Mr. Spiegelman, now standing.
es_translation: I separated myself from the wall and stood up, very stiff. I knew Margo's parents a little, but I had never seen them act with such bad temper. It didn't surprise me that she was angry with them on Wednesday night. I looked at the detective. He was flipping through the pages of the folder. —He has always left some trace, hasn't he?

en: “Clues,” Mr. Spiegelman said, standing up now. The detective had placed the folder on the table, and Margo’s dad leaned forward to look at it with him. “Clues everywhere. The day she ran away to Mississippi, she ate alphabet soup and left exactly four letters in her soup bowl: An M, an I, an S, and a P. She was disappointed when we didn’t piece it together, although as I told her when she finally returned: ‘How can we find you when all we know is Mississippi? It’s a big state, Margo!’”
vi: “Những manh mối,” chú Spiegelman nói, đứng dậy. Viên thám tử đặt tập hồ sơ lên bàn, bố Margo cúi xuống cùng xem. “Manh mối ở khắp nơi. Hôm bỏ đi Mississippi, nó ăn súp chữ cái và để lại đúng bốn chữ trong bát: chữ M, I, S, và P. Nó đã thất vọng khi chúng tôi không ghép các chữ đó lại với nhau, dù khi nó rút cục chịu về nhà, tôi đã nói rằng: ‘Sao bố mẹ có thể tìm được mày khi chỉ biết có mỗi Mississippi? Margo, đó là một bang rộng mênh mông!’”
tr: “İpuçları,” dedi Bay Spiegelman, artık ayaktaydı. Dedektif dosyayı masaya koymuştu, Margo’nun babası dedektifle birlikte bakmak için öne eğildi. “Her yerde ipuçları. Mississippi’ye kaçtığı gün, harf şeklinde eriştelerden yapılmış bir çorba içti ve çorba kâsesinde tam dört harf bıraktı: Bir M, bir I, bir S ve bir P. Biz parçaları birleştiremediğimizde hayal kırıklığına uğramıştı, oysa nihayet döndüğünde ona da söyledim: Tek bildiğimiz Mississippi’yken seni nasıl bulabiliriz? Orası büyük bir eyalet, Margo!
es: —Siempre ha dejado algún rastro, ¿no? —dijo. —Pistas —le contestó el señor Spiegelman levantándose. El detective dejó la carpeta en la mesa, y el padre de Margo se inclinó para echar un vistazo. —Pistas por todas partes. El día que se marchó a Mississippi, comió sopa de letras y dejó exactamente cuatro letras en el plato: una M, una I, una S y una P. Se quedó decepcionada porque no supimos juntarlas, aunque, como le dije cuando por fin volvió: «¿Cómo vamos a encontrarte si lo único que sabemos es “Mississippi”? Es un estado grande, Margo».
vi_translation: “The clues,” Mr. Spiegelman said, standing up. The detective placed the file on the table, and Margo's father leaned in to look at it. “Clues are everywhere. On the day she left for Mississippi, she ate alphabet soup and left exactly four letters in the bowl: M, I, S, and P. She was disappointed when we didn't put those letters together, even though when she finally came home, I said: ‘How could we find you knowing only Mississippi? Margo, that's a huge state!’”
tr_translation: “She is known to leave trails of breadcrumbs, correct?” “Clues,” said Mr. Spiegelman, now standing. The detective had placed the file on the table, and Margo's father leaned forward to look at it with him. “Clues everywhere. The day she ran away to Mississippi, she had a soup made of letter-shaped noodles and left exactly four letters in the soup bowl: An M, an I, an S, and a P. She was disappointed when we couldn't piece it together, but when she finally returned, I told her: How can we find you when all we know is Mississippi? It's a big state, Margo!”
es_translation: —he said. —Clues —Mr. Spiegelman replied, standing up. The detective left the folder on the table, and Margo's father leaned in to take a look. —Clues everywhere. The day she left for Mississippi, she ate alphabet soup and left exactly four letters in the bowl: an M, an I, an S, and a P. She was disappointed because we couldn't put them together, although, as I told her when she finally returned: "How are we supposed to find you if all we know is 'Mississippi'? It's a big state, Margo."

en: The detective cleared his throat. “And she left Minnie Mouse on her bed when she spent a night inside Disney World.”
vi: Viên thanh tra hắng giọng. “Và Margo đã để con chuột bông Minnie trên giường khi cô bé ở một đêm trong Disney World.”
tr: Dedektif boğazını temizledi. “Ve Disney World’ün içinde bir gece geçirdiğinde, yatağına Minnie Mouse bırakmış.
es: El detective carraspeó. —Y dejó a Minnie Mouse en su cama cuando se metió en Disney World una noche.
vi_translation: The inspector cleared his throat. "And Margo left the Minnie Mouse plush toy on the bed when she stayed a night at Disney World."
tr_translation: The detective cleared his throat. “And when he spent a night inside Disney World, he left Minnie Mouse in his bed.”
es_translation: The detective cleared his throat. —And he left Minnie Mouse on his bed when he sneaked into Disney World one night.

en: “Yes,” her mom said. “The clues. The stupid clues. But you can never follow them anywhere, trust me.”
vi: “Đúng vậy,” mẹ Margo nói. “Những manh mối. Những manh mối ngu ngốc. Những manh mối chẳng đi đến đâu cả, hãy tin tôi đi.
tr: “Evet,” dedi annesi. “İpuçları. Aptal ipuçları. Ama onları asla takip edemezsiniz, inanın bana.
es: —Sí —dijo su madre—. Pistas. Estúpidas pistas. Pero nunca puedes seguirlas, créame.
vi_translation: “That's right,” Margo's mother said. “The clues. The stupid clues. The clues that lead nowhere, trust me.”
tr_translation: “Yes,” said her mother. “Clues. Stupid clues. But you can never follow them, believe me.”
es_translation: —Yes —said his mother—. Clues. Stupid clues. But you can never follow them, believe me.
