tr_translation: you must neither look through the eyes of the dead... nor feed on the whispers in books.
es_translation: you will look through the eyes of the dead, nor will you feed on the specters of books.

en: I tramp a perpetual journey
vi: Ta dấn mình vào chuyến đi miên viễn
tr: Ebedî bir yolculukta ağır ağır ilerliyorum
es: El viaje que he emprendido es eterno
vi_translation: He embarked on an endless journey
tr_translation: I am slowly progressing on an eternal journey
es_translation: The journey I have undertaken is eternal

en: All goes onward and outward . . . . and nothing collapses,
vi: Tất thảy đều nảy sinh lan tỏa... và không gì co tụ lại,
tr: Hepsi ileriye ve dışarıya akıyor... ve bozulmuyor hiçbir şey, Ve ölmek herkesin varsaydığından daha farklı ve daha talihli.
es: Todo progresa y se dilata, nada se viene abajo,
vi_translation: Everything arises and spreads... and nothing contracts,
tr_translation: Everything flows forward and outward... and nothing is spoiled, And dying is different and more fortunate than everyone assumes.
es_translation: Everything progresses and expands, nothing falls apart,

en: And to die is different from what any one supposed, and
vi: Và chết chẳng giống những gì người ta huyễn tưởng, và thêm phước phận.
tr: Hepsi ileriye ve dışarıya akıyor... ve bozulmuyor hiçbir şey, Ve ölmek herkesin varsaydığından daha farklı ve daha talihli.
es: y morir es algo distinto de lo que muchos supusieron, y de mejor augurio.
vi_translation: And death is not like what people imagine, and it brings additional blessings.
tr_translation: Everything flows forward and outward... and nothing is spoiled, And dying is different and more fortunate than everyone assumes.
es_translation: and to die is something different from what many supposed, and of better omen.

en: If no other in the world be aware I sit content,
vi: Nếu không ai khác trên thế gian này diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên, Và nếu mỗi và mọi người diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên.
tr: Memnun kalacağım, dünyadaki hiç kimse farkına varmazsa, Ve memnun kalacağım, her biri ve hepsi farkına varsa da.
es: Si nadie en el mundo lo sabe, estoy satisfecho,
vi_translation: If no one else in this world attains enlightenment, I sit in peace, And if everyone attains enlightenment, I sit in peace.
tr_translation: I will be content if no one in the world notices, And I will be content if each and every one of them does.
es_translation: If no one in the world knows it, I am satisfied,

en: And if each and all be aware I sit content.
vi: Nếu không ai khác trên thế gian này diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên, Và nếu mỗi và mọi người diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên.
tr: Memnun kalacağım, dünyadaki hiç kimse farkına varmazsa, Ve memnun kalacağım, her biri ve hepsi farkına varsa da.
es: si todos y cada uno lo saben, estoy satisfecho.
vi_translation: If no one else in this world attains enlightenment, I sit in peace, And if everyone attains enlightenment, I sit in peace.
tr_translation: I will be content if no one in the world notices, And I will be content if each and every one of them does.
es_translation: if everyone knows it, I am satisfied.

en: The final three stanzas of “Song of Myself” were also highlighted.
vi: Ba khổ cuối trong bài “Tự khúc” cũng được đánh dấu.
tr: Kendi Şarkım’m son üç kıtasının da altı çizilmişti.
es: Las tres últimas estrofas del «Canto de mí mismo» también estaban marcadas con fluorescente.
vi_translation: The last three stanzas in the poem "Tự khúc" are also marked.
tr_translation: The last three stanzas of "My Own Song" were also underlined.
es_translation: The last three stanzas of "Song of Myself" were also highlighted with fluorescent marker.

en: I bequeath myself to the dirt to grow from the grass I love,
vi: Ta trả mình về đất, nuôi những thân cỏ ta yêu, Nếu ngươi muốn ta, hãy tìm ta dưới đế ủng.
tr: Toprağa, sevdiğim çimenden büyümeye bırakıyorum kendimi, Eğer tekrar istiyorsan, tabanlarının altında ara beni.
es: Que el lodo sea mi heredero, quiero crecer del pasto que amo;
vi_translation: I return myself to the earth, nurturing the grasses I love.
tr_translation: I leave myself to grow from the grass I love into the soil, If you want me again, look for me under your soles.
es_translation: Let the mud be my heir, I want to grow from the grass I love;

en: If you want me again look for me under your bootsoles.
vi: Ta trả mình về đất, nuôi những thân cỏ ta yêu, Nếu ngươi muốn ta, hãy tìm ta dưới đế ủng.
tr: Toprağa, sevdiğim çimenden büyümeye bırakıyorum kendimi, Eğer tekrar istiyorsan, tabanlarının altında ara beni.
es: Si quieres encontrarte conmigo, búscame bajo la suela de tus zapatos.
vi_translation: If you want me, look for me under your boots.
tr_translation: I leave myself to grow from the grass I love into the soil, If you want me again, look for me under your soles.
es_translation: If you want to find me, look for me under the sole of your shoes.

en: Failing to fetch me at first keep encouraged,
vi: Thoạt không tìm được ta, hãy bền gan vững bước, Mất dấu ta nơi này, hãy đi tìm nơi khác, Ở đâu đó, ta dừng lại đợi ngươi.
tr: İlk seferinde alıp getirmekte başarısız olursan beni, koru cesaretini,
es: Si no me encuentras al principio no te descorazones,
vi_translation: If at first you cannot find me, stay determined and keep moving forward.
tr_translation: If you fail to bring me back the first time, protect your courage,
es_translation: If you don't find me at first, don't lose heart,

en: It became a weekend of reading, of trying to see her in the fragments of the poem she’d left for me. I could never get anywhere with the lines, but I kept thinking about them anyway, because I didn’t want to disappoint her. She wanted me to play out the string, to find the place where she had stopped and was waiting for me, to follow the bread crumb trail until it dead-ended into her.
vi: Cả cuối tuần tôi chỉ đọc, cố gắng tìm Margo trong những mảnh thơ cô ấy để lại cho tôi. Có thể những dòng thơ sẽ chẳng dẫn tôi đến đâu cả, nhưng dù sao tôi cũng nghĩ về chúng, vì tôi không muốn làm Margo thất vọng. Cô ấy muốn tôi lần theo dây nối, tìm nơi cô ấy đã dừng lại và đợi tôi, đi theo dải vụn bánh mì cho đến khi nó kết thúc ở Margo.
tr: Hafta sonu okumak, benim için bıraktığı şiir parçalarında onu görmeye çalışmakla geçti. Dizelerle bir yere yaramıyordum ama yine de onlar hakkında düşünmeye devam ettim çünkü onu hayal kırıklığına uğratmak istemiyordum. Bütün ipleri çekmemi, durup beni beklediği yeri bulmamı, ekmek komitalarından bıraktığı izleri ondan başka çıkışı olmayana kadar takip etmemi istiyordu.
es: Pasé el fin de semana leyendo, intentando verla en los fragmentos del poema que me había dejado. No llegaba a ninguna parte con aquellas líneas, pero seguí pensando en ellas porque no quería defraudarla. Margo quería que siguiera el hilo, que encontrara el lugar en el que estaba esperándome, que siguiera su rastro hasta llegar a ella.
vi_translation: All weekend I just read, trying to find Margo in the pieces of poetry she left for me. Maybe the lines of poetry wouldn't lead me anywhere, but I thought about them anyway, because I didn't want to disappoint Margo. She wanted me to follow the thread, find where she had stopped and waited for me, follow the trail of breadcrumbs until it ended at Margo.
tr_translation: The weekend was spent reading, trying to see her in the fragments of poetry she left behind for me. I wasn't getting anywhere with the verses, but I kept thinking about them because I didn't want to disappoint her. She wanted me to pull all the strings, find the place where she was waiting for me, and follow the traces she left from the breadcrumb trails until there was no other way out but her.
es_translation: I spent the weekend reading, trying to see her in the fragments of the poem she had left me. I wasn't getting anywhere with those lines, but I kept thinking about them because I didn't want to disappoint her. Margo wanted me to follow the thread, to find the place where she was waiting for me, to follow her trail until I reached her.

en: Monday morning, an extraordinary event occurred. I was late, which was normal; and then my mom dropped me off at school, which was normal; and then I stood outside talking with everyone for a while, which was normal; and then Ben and I headed inside, which was normal. But as soon as we swung open the steel door, Ben’s face became a mix of excitement and panic, like he’d just been picked out of a crowd by a magician for the get-sawn-in-half trick. I followed his gaze down the hall.
vi: Sáng thứ Hai, một sự kiện dị thường xảy ra. Tôi đi học muộn, điều này bình thường; mẹ thả tôi ở trường, điều này bình thường; tôi đứng ngoài tụ bạ tán chuyện với những đứa khác, điều này bình thường; rồi Ben và tôi đi vào trong, điều này cũng bình thường nốt. Nhưng vừa đẩy mở cánh cửa kim loại, mặt Ben đã biến thành một thể hỗn mang của phấn kích và kinh hãi, như thể một ảo thuật gia vừa nhón được nó từ đám đông để phụ biểu diễn màn cưa-đứt-đục-suốt. Theo ánh mắt Ben, tôi nhìn ra hành lang.
tr: Pazartesi sabahı sıradışı bir olay meydana geldi. Geç kalmıştım, bu normaldi; sonra annem beni okula bıraktı, bu normaldi; sonra bir süre dışarıda herkesle konuşarak durdum, bu normaldi; sonra Ben ve Radar içeri yöneldiler, bu da normaldi. Ama biz çelik kapıyı çekip açar açmaz, Ben’in yüzü panik ve heyecan karışımı bir ifade aldı... sanki az önce bir sihirbaz kalabalığın arasından iki parçaya ayırma numarası yapmak için onu seçmiş gibi. Koridorun ilerisine doğru bakışını takip ettim.
es: El lunes por la mañana sucedió un acontecimiento extraordinario. Iba tarde, lo que era normal, así que mi madre me llevó al instituto, lo que también era normal. Me quedé fuera charlando un rato con todo el mundo, lo que era normal, y luego Ben y yo entramos, lo que también era normal. Pero en cuanto empujamos la puerta de acero, la cara de Ben se convirtió en una mezcla de nervios y pánico, como si un mago acabara de elegirlo para hacer el truco de serrarlo por la mitad. Seguí su mirada por el pasillo.
vi_translation: Monday morning, an unusual event occurred. I was late for school, which was normal; my mom dropped me off at school, which was normal; I stood outside chatting with other kids, which was normal; then Ben and I went inside, which was also normal. But as soon as he pushed open the metal door, Ben's face turned into a chaotic mix of excitement and terror, as if a magician had just picked him out of the crowd to assist in a saw-through-the-body trick. Following Ben's gaze, I looked down the hallway.
tr_translation: An extraordinary event occurred on Monday morning. I was late, that was normal; then my mom dropped me off at school, that was normal; then I stood outside for a while talking to everyone, that was normal; then Ben and Radar headed inside, that was also normal. But as soon as we pulled open the steel door, Ben's face took on a mixture of panic and excitement... as if a magician had just picked him out of the crowd to perform a sawing-in-half trick. I followed his gaze down the corridor.
es_translation: On Monday morning, an extraordinary event occurred. I was running late, which was normal, so my mother drove me to school, which was also normal. I stayed outside chatting for a while with everyone, which was normal, and then Ben and I went inside, which was also normal. But as soon as we pushed the steel door, Ben's face turned into a mix of nerves and panic, as if a magician had just chosen him to perform the trick of sawing him in half. I followed his gaze down the hallway.

en: Denim miniskirt. Tight white T-shirt. Scooped neck. Extraordinarily olive skin. Legs that make you care about legs. Perfectly coiffed curly brown hair. A laminated button reading ME FOR PROM QUEEN. Lacey Pemberton. Walking toward us. By the band room.
vi: Váy jeans ngắn. Áo phông trắng ôm sát. Cổ trần. Nước da bánh mật xinh giòn. Đôi chân khiến người ta mơ tưởng đến chân. Mái tóc nâu gợn sóng hoàn hảo. Chiếc huy hiệu bóng loáng với dòng chữ HÃY CHỌN TÔI LÀ NỮ HOÀNG ĐÊM TỐT NGHIỆP. Lacey Pemberton. Đi về phía chúng tôi. Ngay cạnh phòng tập nhạc.
tr: Kot mini etek. Dar beyaz tişört. Düşük yaka. Alışılmadık derecede buğday ten. Bacakları önemsemenizi sağlayacak bacaklar. Kusursuzca model verilmiş kıvırcık, kahverengi saçlar. BALO KRALİÇESİ OLARAK BEN yazan bir rozet. Lacey Pemberton. Bize doğru yürüyordu. Bando odasının yanma.
es: Minifalda vaquera. Camiseta blanca ceñida. Escote generoso. Piel extraordinariamente aceitunada. Piernas que despertaban tu interés por las piernas. Pelo castaño rizado perfectamente peinado. Una chapa que decía VÓTAME PARA REINA DEL BAILE. Lacey Pemberton. Acercándose a nosotros junto a la sala de ensayo.
vi_translation: Short denim skirt. Tight white t-shirt. Bare neck. Beautifully tanned skin. Legs that make people dream of legs. Perfect wavy brown hair. A shiny badge with the words CHOOSE ME AS PROM QUEEN. Lacey Pemberton. Walking towards us. Right next to the music room.
tr_translation: Denim mini skirt. Tight white t-shirt. Low neckline. Unusually tan skin. Legs that make you notice legs. Perfectly styled curly, brown hair. A badge that says PROM QUEEN AS ME. Lacey Pemberton. She was walking towards us. Next to the band room.
es_translation: Denim miniskirt. Tight white t-shirt. Generous neckline. Extraordinarily olive skin. Legs that sparked your interest in legs. Perfectly styled curly brown hair. A button that said VOTE ME FOR PROM QUEEN. Lacey Pemberton. Approaching us by the rehearsal room.

en: “Lacey Pemberton,” Ben whispered, even though she was about three steps from us and could clearly hear him, and in fact flashed a faux-bashful smile upon hearing her name.
vi: “Lacey Pemberton,” Ben thì thào, dù cô ấy chỉ cách bọn tôi ba bước và hoàn toàn nghe rõ những lời ấy. Thực ra nụ cười giả nai đã thoáng qua môi Lacey khi cô ấy nghe nhắc đến tên mình.
tr: “Lacey Pemberton,” diye fısıldadı Ben, Lacey bizden yaklaşık üç adım uzakta olduğu ve onu açıkça duyabildiği halde ve hakikaten adını duymasının üstüne yüzünde yapmacık bir gülümseme hızla görünüp kayboldu.
es: —Lacey Pemberton —susurró Ben, aunque la chica estaba a unos tres pasos de nosotros y perfectamente podía oírlo. Y, de hecho, esbozó una sonrisa falsamente tímida al oír su nombre.
vi_translation: "Lacey Pemberton," Ben whispered, even though she was only three steps away from us and could clearly hear those words. In fact, a fake smile briefly appeared on Lacey's lips when she heard her name mentioned.
tr_translation: "Lacey Pemberton," Ben whispered, even though Lacey was only about three steps away from us and could clearly hear him, and indeed, upon hearing her name, a fake smile quickly appeared and disappeared on her face.
es_translation: —Lacey Pemberton —whispered Ben, even though the girl was about three steps away from us and could perfectly hear him. And, in fact, she flashed a falsely shy smile upon hearing her name.

en: “Quentin,” she said to me, and more than anything else, I found it impossible that she knew my name. She motioned with her head, and I followed her past the band room, over to a bank of lockers. Ben kept pace with me.
vi: “Quentin ơi,” Lacey nói với tôi, và hơn tất thảy, việc Lacey biết tên tôi là một sự bất khả thi. Cô ấy ngoắc đầu ra hiệu, tôi đi theo Lacey qua phòng tập nhạc, đến trước dãy tủ đựng đồ cá nhân. Ben theo tôi bén gót.
tr: “Quentin,” dedi bana, her şeyden önce adımı bilmesini inanılmaz buldum. Başıyla işaret etti ve bando odasını geçerek dolaplara doğru onu takip ettim. Ben de bana ayak uydurdu.
es: —Quentin —me dijo. Lo que me pareció más increíble de todo fue que supiera mi nombre. Hizo un gesto con la cabeza y crucé detrás de ella la sala de ensayo hasta llegar a un bloque de taquillas. Ben se mantuvo a mi lado.
vi_translation: "Quentin," Lacey said to me, and above all, the fact that Lacey knew my name was an impossibility. She nodded her head to signal, and I followed Lacey through the music room, to the front of the row of personal lockers. Ben followed closely behind me.
tr_translation: “Quentin,” she said to me, and first of all, I found it incredible that she knew my name. She nodded and I followed her past the band room towards the lockers. She matched my pace.
es_translation: —Quentin —he said to me. What seemed most incredible to me was that she knew my name. She made a gesture with her head and I crossed the rehearsal room behind her until we reached a block of lockers. Ben stayed by my side.

en: “Hi, Lacey,” I said once she stopped walking. I could smell her perfume, and I remembered the smell of it in her SUV, remembered the crunch of the catfish as Margo and I slammed her seat down.
vi: “Chào Lacey,” tôi nói khi cô ấy đã dừng lại. Tôi ngửi thấy mùi nước hoa của Lacey, và tôi vẫn nhớ có mùi này trong chiếc SUV của cô ấy, nhớ cả tiếng lép bép phát ra từ con cá da trơn khi Margo và tôi đè ghế ô-tô lên nó.
tr: “Selam, Lacey,” dedim durduğunda. Parfümünün kokusunu alabiliyordum, cipindeki kokusunu da hatırlamıştım, tıpkı Margo’yla koltuğunu yere indirdiğimizde kedi balığının çıkardığı sesi hatırladığım gibi.
es: —Hola, Lacey —saludé cuando se detuvo. Como me llegaba su perfume, recordé aquel olor en su todoterreno y el crujido del pez gato mientras Margo y yo bajábamos el asiento.
vi_translation: "Hello Lacey," I said when she had stopped. I smelled Lacey's perfume, and I still remembered this scent in her SUV, remembered the crackling sound from the catfish when Margo and I pressed the car seat against it.
tr_translation: "Hi, Lacey," I said when she stopped. I could smell her perfume, and I remembered the scent from her car, just like with Margo Like I remember the sound the catfish made when we lowered your chair to the ground.
es_translation: —Hello, Lacey —I greeted when she stopped. As her perfume reached me, I remembered that smell in her SUV and the crunch of the catfish while Margo and I lowered the seat.

en: “I hear you were with Margo.”
vi: “Tớ nghe nói cậu đã đi cùng Margo.” Tôi chỉ nhìn Lacey.
tr: “Margo’yla olduğunu duydum.
es: —Me han dicho que estabas con Margo.
vi_translation: "I heard you went with Margo."
tr_translation: “I heard you were with Margo.”
es_translation: —They told me you were with Margo.

en: I just looked at her.
vi: “Tớ nghe nói cậu đã đi cùng Margo.” Tôi chỉ nhìn Lacey.
tr: Ona bakmakla yetindim.
es: Me limité a mirarla.
vi_translation: I just looked at Lacey.
tr_translation: I just looked at her.
es_translation: I limited myself to looking at her.

en: “That night, with the fish? In my car? And in Becca’s closet? And through Jase’s window?”
vi: “Đêm hôm đó, và con cá? Trong xe của tớ? Trong phòng Becca? Và qua cửa sổ nhà Jase?”
tr: “O gece, hani balık olayı sırasında? Arabamda? Ve Becca’nın dolabında? Jase’in penceresinde?
es: —La otra noche, con el pescado. En mi coche. Y en el armario de Becca. Y en la ventana de Jase.
vi_translation: “That night, and the fish? In my car? In Becca's room? And through Jase's window?”
tr_translation: “That night, you know, during the fish incident? In my car? And in Becca’s closet? At Jase’s window?”
es_translation: —The other night, with the fish. In my car. And in Becca's closet. And at Jase's window.

en: I kept looking. I wasn’t sure what to say. A man can live a long and adventurous life without ever being spoken to by Lacey Pemberton, and when that rare opportunity does arise, one does not wish to misspeak. So Ben spoke for me. “Yeah, they hung out,” Ben said, as if Margo and I were tight.
vi: Tôi vẫn nhìn. Tôi không biết nên nói gì. Người ta có thể sống một cuộc đời dài đầy phiêu lưu mạo hiểm mà không kể lại với Lacey Pemberton, nhưng khi cơ hội hiếm hoi đó chợt đến, người ta sẽ không muốn hàm hồ vạ miệng. Thế là Ben lên tiếng thay tôi, “Ừa, hai người họ đấy.” Ben nói như thể Margo và tôi gần gũi nhau lắm.
tr: Bakmaya devam ettim. Ne söylemem gerektiğinden emin değildim, insan, Lacey Pemberton’la hiç konuşmadan Uzun ve macera dolu bir hayat yaşayabilir ve bu nadir fırsatla karşılaştığında, kendini yanlış ifade etmek istemez. Böylece Ben, benim yerime konuştu. “Evet, takılmışlar,” dedi, sanki Margo’yla sıkı Ilkıymışız gibi.
es: Seguí mirándola. No sabía qué decir. Uno puede tener una larga e intrépida vida sin que Lacey Pemberton le haya dirigido la palabra jamás, pero cuando esa rara ocasión se presenta, uno no desea decir lo que no debe. Así que Ben habló por mí. —Sí, salieron juntos —dijo Ben, como si Margo y yo fuéramos íntimos.
vi_translation: I kept looking. I didn't know what to say. One can live a long life full of adventurous exploits without recounting it to Lacey Pemberton, but when that rare opportunity suddenly arises, one wouldn't want to speak carelessly. So Ben spoke up for me, “Yeah, it's those two.” Ben spoke as if Margo and I were very close.
tr_translation: I kept looking. I wasn't sure what to say; one could live a long and adventurous life without ever talking to Lacey Pemberton, and when faced with this rare opportunity, you wouldn't want to misrepresent yourself. So Ben spoke for me. "Yeah, they're hooked," he said, as if we were tight with Margo.
es_translation: I kept looking at her. I didn't know what to say. One can have a long and adventurous life without Lacey Pemberton ever having spoken a word to them, but when that rare occasion arises, one does not want to say the wrong thing. So Ben spoke for me. —Yes, they went out together —said Ben, as if Margo and I were close.

en: “Was she mad at me?” Lacey asked after a moment. She was looking down; I could see her brown eye shadow.
vi: “Margo có cáu tớ lắm không?” Lát sau Lacey hỏi. Cô ấy cụp mắt nhìn xuống, tôi có thể thấy hàng mi nâu rợp.
tr: “Bana kızgın mıydı?’ diye sordu Lacey kısa bir süre sonra. Aşağı bakıyordu; kahverengi göz farım görebiliyordum.
es: —¿Estaba enfadada conmigo? —preguntó Lacey algo después. Miraba al suelo. Vi su sombra de ojos marrón.
vi_translation: "Is Margo really mad at me?" Lacey asked after a while. She lowered her eyes, and I could see her thick brown eyelashes.
tr_translation: “Was he angry with me?” Lacey asked shortly after. She was looking down; I could see her brown eye shadow.
es_translation: —Was she angry with me? —asked Lacey a little later. She was looking at the ground. I saw her brown eye shadow.

en: “What?”
vi: “Gì cơ?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —What?

en: She spoke quietly then, the tiniest crack in her voice, and all at once Lacey Pemberton was not Lacey Pemberton. She was just—like, a person. “Was she, you know, pissed at me about something?”
vi: Lúc ấy Lacey nói rất khẽ, rạn nứt li ti trong giọng nói, và lập tức Lacey Pemberton không phải là Lacey Pemberton nữa. Cô ấy chỉ–như, một người bình thường. “Cậu biết đấy, Margo có điên tiết với tớ vì chuyện gì không?”
tr: Bunun üzerine sessizce konuştu, sesi azıcık çatladı ve birdenbire sanki Lacey Pemberton, Lacey Pemberton değildi. Tam bir... insan gibiydi. “Bana, bilirsin, bir şey hakkında kızgın mıydı?’
es: Entonces habló muy despacio, con la voz ligeramente rota, y de repente Lacey Pemberton ya no era Lacey Pemberton. Era solo… una persona. —Ya sabes, que si estaba enfadada conmigo por algo.
vi_translation: At that moment, Lacey spoke very softly, with tiny cracks in her voice, and immediately Lacey Pemberton was no longer Lacey Pemberton. She was just–like, an ordinary person. "You know, do you have any idea why Margo is so mad at me?"
tr_translation: Then she spoke quietly, her voice cracked a little, and suddenly it was as if Lacey Pemberton was not Lacey Pemberton. She was a complete... human being. “Was she, you know, angry about something?”
es_translation: Then she spoke very slowly, with a slightly broken voice, and suddenly Lacey Pemberton was no longer Lacey Pemberton. She was just... a person. —You know, if she was mad at me for something.

en: I thought about how to answer that for a while. “Uh, she was a little disappointed that you didn’t tell her about Jase and Becca, but you know Margo. She’ll get over it.”
vi: Trong chốc lát tôi nghĩ xem nên trả lời thế nào cho phải. “Ừ, Margo hơi thất vọng vì cậu đã không cho cậu ấy biết về Jase và Becca, nhưng cậu biết tính Margo rồi đấy. Cậu ấy sẽ vượt qua được thôi.”
tr: Bir süre buna nasıl cevap vereceğimi düşündüm. “Ah, Jase ve Becca hakkında ona hiçbir şey söylemediğin için biraz hayal kırıklığına uğramıştı ama Margo’yu tanırsın. Atlatacaktır.
es: Pensé un segundo qué contestarle. —Bueno, estaba un poco defraudada porque no le habías dicho lo de Jase y Becca, pero ya conoces a Margo. Lo superará.
vi_translation: For a moment, I thought about how to respond properly. "Well, Margo was a bit disappointed that you didn't tell her about Jase and Becca, but you know how Margo is. She'll get over it."
tr_translation: I thought for a while about how to answer this. “Oh, she was a bit disappointed that you didn't tell her anything about Jase and Becca, but you know Margo. She'll get over it.”
es_translation: I thought for a second about what to answer. —Well, she was a bit disappointed because you hadn't told her about Jase and Becca, but you know Margo. She'll get over it.

en: Lacey started walking down the hall. Ben and I let her go, but then she slowed down. She wanted us to walk with her. Ben nudged me, and then we started walking together. “I didn’t even know about Jase and Becca. That’s the thing. God, I hope I can explain that to her soon. For a while, I was really worried that maybe she had like really left, but then I went into her locker ’cause I know her combination and she still has all her pictures up and everything, and all her books are stacked there.”
vi: Lacey bắt đầu đi xuôi hành lang. Ben và tôi để cô ấy đi, nhưng rồi Lacey đi chậm lại. Cô ấy muốn chúng tôi đi cùng. Ben khẽ huých tôi, và chúng tôi cùng đi với nhau. “Tớ có biết gì về Jase và Becca đâu. Vấn đề là ở đó. Trời ơi, tớ mong sớm giải thích với Margo được quá. Có lúc tớ thực sự lo sợ rằng chưa biết chừng Margo đã bỏ đi luôn rồi, nhưng tớ xem ngăn tủ đựng đồ vì biết mã số khóa của cậu ấy, thấy tất cả tranh ảnh, sách vở, mọi thứ vẫn còn nguyên trong đó.”
tr: Lacey koridorda ilerlemeye başladı. Ben’le gitmesine izin verdik ama sonra yavaşladı. Onunla yürümemizi istedi. Ben beni dirseğiyle dürttü ve birlikte yürümeye başladık. “Jase ile Becca’yı bilmiyordum bile. Mesele bu. Tanrım, umarım bunu yakmda ona açıklayabilirim. Bir süre boyunca, belki gerçekten gitmiştir diye endişelendim ama sonra dolabım inceledim, çünkü şifresini biliyorum ve hâlâ bütün resimleri falan orada, bütün kitapları orada yığılı.”
es: Lacey echó a andar por el pasillo. Ben y yo la dejamos irse, pero de repente aminoró el paso. Quería que fuéramos con ella. Ben me dio un empujoncito y empezamos a andar juntos. —El problema es que ni siquiera sabía lo de Jase y Becca —dijo Lacey—. Espero poder explicárselo pronto. Por un momento me preocupó que realmente hubiera querido marcharse, pero luego abrí su taquilla, porque me sé su combinación, y siguen estando todas sus fotos y lo demás, los libros también.
vi_translation: Lacey started walking down the hallway. Ben and I let her go, but then Lacey slowed down. She wanted us to go with her. Ben gently nudged me, and we went together. “I don't know anything about Jase and Becca. That's the problem. God, I hope I can explain to Margo soon. Sometimes I'm really afraid that maybe Margo has left for good, but I checked her locker because I know her combination, and I saw all her pictures, books, everything still there.”
tr_translation: Lacey started to move down the corridor. We allowed her to go with Ben, but then she slowed down. She wanted us to walk with her. Ben nudged me with his elbow and we started walking together. “I didn’t even know Jase and Becca. That’s the point. God, I hope I can explain this to her soon. For a while, I was worried she might really be gone, but then I checked her locker, because I know the combination, and all her pictures and stuff are still there, all her books piled up.”
es_translation: Lacey started walking down the hallway. Ben and I let her go, but suddenly she slowed down. She wanted us to go with her. Ben gave me a little push and we started walking together. —The problem is that I didn't even know about Jase and Becca —said Lacey—. I hope I can explain it to her soon. For a moment I was worried that she really wanted to leave, but then I opened her locker, because I know her combination, and all her photos and everything else are still there, the books too.

en: “That’s good,” I said.
vi: “Thế thì tốt,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bu iyi,” dedim.
es: —Buena señal —le contesté.
vi_translation: "That's good," I said.
tr_translation: “That’s good,” I said.
es_translation: —Good sign —I replied to him.

en: “Yeah, but it’s been like four days. That’s almost a record for her. And you know, this has really sucked, because Craig knew, and I was so pissed at him for not telling me that I broke up with him, and now I’m out a prom date, and my best friend is off wherever, in New York or whatever, thinking I did something I would NEVER do.” I shot a look to Ben. Ben shot a look back to me.
vi: “Ừ, nhưng đã chừng bốn ngày rồi. Đó gần như là kỉ lục đối với Margo. Và các cậu biết không, có chuyện này thật là chán không để đâu cho hết, vì Craig biết chuyện Jase và Becca, tớ giận cậu ta sao không nói gì với tớ cả nên đã cắt đứt luôn rồi. Bây giờ tớ đã phá sản vụ dạ hội tốt nghiệp, bạn thân nhất của tớ đang vi vu ở nơi chỉ có trời mới biết, có thể là New York hoặc bất cứ đâu, trong lòng vẫn còn giận tớ vì một chuyện tớ CHƯA TỪNG làm.” Tôi lé mắt nhìn Ben. Ben cũng lé mắt nhìn tôi.
tr: “Evet ama dört gün falan oldu. Bu onun için neredeyse bir rekor. Ve bu gerçekten berbat bir durum çünkü Craig biliyormuş, bana söylemediği için ona o kadar kızdım ki ondan ayrıldım ve şimdi bir balo kavalyem yok, en iyi arkadaşım da bir yerlerde, New York’ta falan, ASLA yapmayacağım bir şeyi yaptığımı düşünüyor.” Ben’e bir bakış attım. Ben de bana bir bakış atta.
es: —Sí, pero ya son cuatro días. Es casi un récord en ella. Y bueno, es una mierda, porque Craig lo sabía, y me he enfadado tanto porque no me lo había dicho que he cortado con él, y ahora no tengo pareja para el baile, y mi mejor amiga se ha largado vete a saber dónde, a Nueva York o a cualquier otro sitio, pensando que hice algo que JAMÁS haría. Lancé una mirada a Ben, y Ben me lanzó una mirada a mí.
vi_translation: “Yeah, but it's been about four days already. That's almost a record for Margo. And you know what, there's this really annoying thing, because Craig knew about Jase and Becca, and I'm mad at him for not telling me, so I broke up with him. Now I've ruined my prom plans, my best friend is off somewhere only God knows, maybe New York or anywhere, still mad at me for something I NEVER did.” I squinted at Ben. Ben squinted back at me.
tr_translation: “Yes, but it has been about four days. This is almost a record for him. And this is really a terrible situation because Craig knew, and I was so mad at him for not telling me that I broke up with him and "Now I don't have a ball escort, and my best friend is somewhere, in New York or something, thinking that I did something I would NEVER do." I glanced at Ben. Ben glanced at me too.
es_translation: —Yes, but it's already been four days. It's almost a record for her. And well, it's crap, because Craig knew it, and I got so mad because he didn't tell me that I broke up with him, and now I don't have a date for the dance, and my best friend has taken off who knows where, to New York or some other place, thinking I did something I would NEVER do. I glanced at Ben, and Ben glanced at me.

en: “I have to run to class,” I said. “But why do you say she’s in New York?”
vi: “Tớ phải vào lớp đây,” tôi nói. “Nhưng sao cậu lại nói Margo ở New York?”
tr: “Derse yetişmeliyim,” dedim. “Ama neden New York’ta olduğunu söylüyorsun?
es: —Tengo que irme corriendo a clase —le dije—. ¿Por qué has dicho que está en Nueva York?
vi_translation: “I have to go to class,” I said. “But why did you say Margo is in New York?”
tr_translation: “I need to get to class,” I said. “But why do you say it's in New York?”
es_translation: —I have to run to class —I told him—. Why did you say he is in New York?

en: “I guess she told Jase like two days before she left that New York was the only place in America where a person could actually live a halfway livable life. Maybe she was just saying it. I don’t know.”
vi: “Hình như hai hôm trước khi bỏ đi, Margo đã nói với Jase rằng New York là nơi duy nhất ở Mĩ mà người ta có thể thực sự sống một cuộc đời đáng sống nửa chừng. Có thể cậu ấy chỉ nói vu vơ thôi. Tớ không biết nữa.”
tr: “Sanırım gitmesinden iki gün önce falan Jase’e, New York’un Amerika’da bir insanın gerçekten yanyaşanabilir bir hayat yaşayabileceği tek yer olduğunu söylemiş. Belki öylesine söylüyordu. Bilmiyorum.
es: —Creo que dos días antes de marcharse le dijo a Jase que Nueva York era el único sitio del país en el que se podía llevar una vida medio decente. Quizá lo dijo por decir. No lo sé.
vi_translation: “It seems that two days before leaving, Margo told Jase that New York is the only place in America where one can truly live a halfway decent life. Maybe she was just speaking offhandedly. I don't know.”
tr_translation: “I think he told Jase, like two days before he left, that New York is the only place in America where a person can really live a decent life. Maybe he was just saying it. I don't know.”
es_translation: —I think two days before leaving, he told Jase that New York was the only place in the country where one could live a halfway decent life. Maybe he said it just to say something. I don't know.

en: “Okay, I gotta run,” I said.
vi: “Được rồi, tớ phải chạy đây,” tôi nói.
tr: “Tamam, gitmeliyim,” dedim.
es: —Vale, me voy corriendo —le dije.
vi_translation: “Alright, I have to run,” I said.
tr_translation: “Okay, I have to go,” I said.
es_translation: —Okay, I'm running off —I told him.

en: I knew Ben would never convince Lacey to go to prom with him, but I figured he at least deserved the opportunity. I jogged through the halls toward my locker, rubbing Radar’s head as I ran past him. He was talking to Angela and a freshman girl in band. “Don’t thank me. Thank Q,” I heard him say to the freshman, and she called out, “Thank you for my two hundred dollars!” Without looking back I shouted, “Don’t thank me, thank Margo Roth Spiegelman!” because of course she’d given me the tools I needed.
vi: Tôi biết Ben khó mà mời được Lacey đi dạ hội cùng, nhưng ít ra nó cũng xứng đáng có một cơ hội. Tôi rảo bước qua hành lang về phía tủ đựng đồ của mình, quờ tay ra cào cào đầu Radar khi đi ngang chỗ nó. Nó đang nói chuyện với Angela và một cô bé lớp chín cũng chơi trong ban nhạc. “Đừng cảm ơn anh. Cảm ơn Q ấy,” tôi nghe thấy Radar nói với cô bé kia, và con bé kêu lớn, “Cảm ơn anh vì em được hai trăm đô-la!” Không ngoái lại, tôi cũng gào lên, “Đừng cảm ơn anh, hãy cảm ơn chị Margo Roth Spiegelman!” bởi tất nhiên cô ấy đã trao cho tôi công cụ mà tôi cần.
tr: Ben’in Lacey’yi onunla baloya gelmesi için asla ikna edemeyeceğini biliyordum ama en azından bir fırsatı hak ettiğini düşündüm. Koridorlardan dolabıma doğru koşarken yanmdan geçtiğim Radar’m başını ovuşturdum. Angela ve bandodan, birinci sınıftaki bir kızla konuşuyordu. Birinci sınıftaki kıza, “Bana teşekkür etme. Q’ya teşekkür et,” dediğini duydum, sonra kız bağırarak, “İki yüz dolar için teşekkürler!” dedi. Geriye bakmadan, “Bana teşekkür etme, Margo Roth Spiegelman’a teşekkür et!” diye bağırdım, ne de olsa ihtiyacım olan araçları bana o vermişti.
es: Sabía que Ben nunca convencería a Lacey de que fuera al baile con él, pero pensé que al menos merecía una oportunidad. Corrí por los pasillos hasta mi taquilla y al pasar por al lado de Radar le di un golpecito en la cabeza. Radar estaba hablando con Angela y una alumna de primero de la banda de música. —No me lo agradezcas a mí. Agradéceselo a Q —le oí decirle a la chica de primero. —¡Gracias por los doscientos dólares! —me dijo la chica. —¡No me lo agradezcas a mí, agradéceselo a Margo Roth Spiegelman! —le grité sin volver la cabeza. Porque estaba claro que Margo era la que me había proporcionado las herramientas necesarias.
vi_translation: I know it's hard for Ben to invite Lacey to the prom, but at least he deserves a chance. I walked briskly down the hallway towards my locker, reaching out to ruffle Radar's hair as I passed by him. He was talking to Angela and a ninth-grade girl who also played in the band. "Don't thank me. Thank Q," I heard Radar say to the girl, and she exclaimed, "Thank you for the two hundred dollars!" Without looking back, I shouted, "Don't thank me, thank Margo Roth Spiegelman!" because of course she had given me the tool I needed.
tr_translation: I knew that Ben could never convince Lacey to go to the prom with him, but I thought he at least deserved a chance. As I was running through the corridors towards my locker, I patted Radar on the head as I passed by him. He was talking to Angela and a freshman girl from the band. To the freshman girl, he said, “Don’t thank me. Thank Q,” I heard him say, and then the girl shouted, “Thanks for the two hundred dollars!” Without looking back, I shouted, “Don’t thank me, thank Margo Roth Spiegelman!” after all, she was the one who gave me the tools I needed.
es_translation: I knew that Ben would never convince Lacey to go to the dance with him, but I thought he at least deserved a chance. I ran through the hallways to my locker and as I passed by Radar, I gave him a tap on the head. Radar was talking to Angela and a freshman from the band. —Don't thank me. Thank Q —I heard him say to the first-year girl. —Thank you for the two hundred dollars! —the girl said to me. —Don't thank me, thank Margo Roth Spiegelman! —I shouted without turning my head. Because it was clear that Margo was the one who had provided me with the necessary tools.

en: I made it to my locker and grabbed my calc notebook, but then I just stayed, even after the second bell rang, standing still in the middle of the hallway while people rushed past me in both directions, like I was the median in their freeway. Another kid thanked me for his two hundred dollars. I smiled at him. The school felt more mine than in all my four years there. We’d gotten a measure of justice for the bikeless band geeks. Lacey Pemberton had spoken to me. Chuck Parson had apologized.
vi: Tôi mở ngăn tủ của mình, vớ cuốn vở giải tích, nhưng tôi vẫn đứng đó, dù hồi chuông thứ hai đã kêu, đứng yên giữa hành lang trong khi mọi người xung quanh xoẹt qua tôi theo cả hai hướng, như thể tôi là dải phân cách trên con đường cao tốc của họ vậy. Một nhóc nữa cũng cảm ơn tôi vì hai trăm đô-la nó được nhận. Tôi mỉm cười với thằng bé. Tôi cảm thấy ngôi trường là của tôi hơn lúc nào hết trong suốt bốn năm qua. Chúng tôi đã tìm được giải pháp công bằng cho tầng lớp vô-xe-đạp. Lacey Pemberton đã nói chuyện với tôi. Chuck Parson đã chịu xin lỗi.
tr: Dolabıma vardım ve matematik defterimi aldım ama ikinci zil çaldıktan sonra bile orada öylece kalakaldım, insanlar sanki onların yolundaki orta şeritmişim gibi iki yöne doğru yanımdan geçerek koşuştururken koridorun ortasında kıpırdamadan duruyordum. Başka bir çocuk iki yüz dolar için bana teşekkür etti. Gülümsedim. Okul, oradaki dört yılım boyunca olduğundan daha benimmiş gibi geliyordu. Bisikletsiz bando inekleri için bir miktar adalet sağlamıştık. Lacey Pemberton benimle konuşmuştu. Chuck Parson özür dilemişti.
es: Abrí la taquilla y cogí la libreta de cálculo, pero luego me quedé parado, aunque ya había sonado el segundo timbre, inmóvil en medio del pasillo mientras la gente pasaba corriendo ante mí en ambas direcciones, como si yo fuera la mediana de su autopista. Otro chico me dio las gracias por los doscientos dólares. Le sonreí. El instituto parecía más mío que en los cuatro años que llevaba en él. Habíamos hecho justicia con los frikis de la banda que se habían quedado sin bicicleta. Lacey Pemberton había hablado conmigo. Chuck Parson había pedido perdón.
vi_translation: I opened my locker, grabbed my calculus notebook, but I still stood there, even though the second bell had rung, standing still in the hallway while everyone around me zipped past in both directions, as if I were the divider on their highway. Another kid thanked me for the two hundred dollars he received. I smiled at the boy. I felt the school was more mine than ever in the past four years. We had found a fair solution for the bike-less class. Lacey Pemberton had talked to me. Chuck Parson had apologized.
tr_translation: I reached my locker and took my math notebook, but even after the second bell rang, I just stood there, motionless in the middle of the corridor as people rushed past me in both directions as if I were the median strip in their path. Another kid thanked me for the two hundred dollars. I smiled. The school felt more like mine than it had during the four years I had been there. We had provided some justice for the band geeks without bikes. Lacey Pemberton had talked to me. Chuck Parson had apologized.
es_translation: I opened the locker and grabbed the calculus notebook, but then I stood still, even though the second bell had already rung, motionless in the middle of the hallway while people ran past me in both directions, as if I were the median of their highway. Another boy thanked me for the two hundred dollars. I smiled at him. The high school felt more like mine than it had in the four years I had been there. We had done justice for the band geeks who had lost their bicycles. Lacey Pemberton had talked to me. Chuck Parson had apologized.

en: I knew these halls so well—and finally it was starting to feel like they knew me, too. I stood there as the third bell rang and the crowds dwindled. Only then did I walk to calc, sitting down just after Mr. Jiminez had started another interminable lecture.
vi: Tôi quá biết những hành lang này–và rút cục cũng bắt đầu có cảm giác rằng chúng biết tôi. Tôi vẫn đứng đó khi hồi chuông thứ ba vang lên và đám đông bắt đầu tản mát. Chỉ khi ấy tôi mới vào lớp giải tích, ngồi xuống ngay sau khi thầy Jiminez bắt đầu một bài học lê thê vô tận khác.
tr: Bu koridorları o kadar iyi tanıyordum ki... ve sonunda onlar da beni tanıyorlarmış gibi gelmeye başhyordu. Üçüncü zil çaldığında kalabalık git gide azalırken orada durdum. Ancak daha sonra matematiğe girdim ve Bay Jiminez başka bir bitmek bilmez derse başladıktan hemen sonra yerime oturdum.
es: Conocía muy bien aquellos pasillos y al final empezaba a parecer que también ellos me conocían a mí. Me quedé allí parado mientras sonaba el tercer timbre y la multitud se dispersaba. Solo entonces me dirigí a la clase de cálculo y me senté justo después de que el señor Jiminez hubiera empezado otra de sus interminables lecciones.
vi_translation: I know these hallways all too well–and eventually, I even started to feel that they knew me. I was still standing there when the third bell rang and the crowd began to disperse. Only then did I enter the calculus class, sitting down right after Mr. Jiminez began another interminable lecture.
tr_translation: I knew these corridors so well... and eventually, it felt like they were starting to know me too. I stood there as the crowd gradually thinned out when the third bell rang. But later I entered math class and sat down in my seat right after Mr. Jiminez started another endless lesson.
es_translation: I knew those hallways very well, and in the end, it started to seem like they knew me too. I stood there while the third bell rang and the crowd dispersed. Only then did I head to calculus class and sit down just after Mr. Jiminez had started another of his endless lessons.

en: I’d brought Margo’s copy of Leaves of Grass to school, and I started reading the highlighted parts of “Song of Myself” again, under the desk while Mr. Jiminez scratched away at the blackboard. There were no direct references to New York that I could see. I handed it to Radar after a few minutes, and he looked at it for a while before writing on the corner of his notebook closest to me, The green highlighting must mean something. Maybe she wants you to open the door of your mind? I shrugged, and wrote back, Or maybe she just read the poem on two different days with two different highlighters.
vi: Tôi mang bản Những cánh cỏ của Margo đến trường, giấu sách trong hộc bàn và bắt đầu đọc lại những câu được đánh dấu trong bài “Tự khúc” trong khi thầy Jiminez cào chữ trên bảng. Không thấy có điểm nào ám chỉ New York. Mấy phút sau tôi đưa sách cho Radar, nó xem một lúc rồi viết lên góc vở của nó, phía gần tôi nhất, Phần đánh dấu màu xanh lá cây phải có ý nghĩa gì đó. Có thể Margo muốn ông mở cánh cửa tư duy của ông ra chăng? Tôi nhún vai, viết lại, Hoặc có thể Margo chỉ đọc bài thơ vào hai ngày khác nhau, với hai cái bút đánh dấu khác nhau.
tr: Margo’nun Çimen Yapraklarim okula getirmiştim, Bay Jiminez tahtaya bir şeyler çiziktirirken sıranın altmda, Kendi Şarkım’m altı çizili bölümlerini tekrar okumaya başladım. Görebildiğim kadarıyla New York’la ilgili doğrudan bir gönderme yoktu. Birkaç dakika sonra kitabı Radar’a uzattım, defterinin bana en yakın köşesine bir not yazmadan önce bir süre kitaba baktı. Yeşil renkle çizilenler bir şey ifade ediyor olmalı. Belki akimın kapısını açmanı istiyordur? Omuzlarımı silktim ve karşılık olarak, Belki de şiiri iki farklı günde, iki farklı kalemle okudu, yazdım.
es: Me había llevado el ejemplar de Hojas de hierba de Margo a clase, así que lo abrí por debajo de la mesa y empecé a leer de nuevo los fragmentos marcados del «Canto de mí mismo» mientras el señor Jiminez escribía en la pizarra. No vi alusiones directas a Nueva York. Unos minutos después le pasé el libro a Radar, que lo hojeó un rato y luego escribió en la esquina de su libreta: «El subrayado verde debe de querer decir algo. Quizá quiere que abras la puerta de tu mente». Me encogí de hombros y le escribí: «O quizá simplemente leyó el poema dos días diferentes con dos rotuladores diferentes».
vi_translation: I brought Margo's "The Grass Wings" to school, hid the book in my desk, and started rereading the marked lines in the poem "Soliloquy" while Mr. Jiminez scratched words on the board. There was no mention of New York. A few minutes later, I handed the book to Radar, who looked at it for a moment and then wrote on the corner of his notebook, closest to me, The green highlights must mean something. Maybe Margo wants you to open your mind? I shrugged, wrote back, Or maybe Margo just read the poem on two different days, with two different highlighters.
tr_translation: I had brought Margo's Leaves of Grass to school, and while Mr. Jiminez was scribbling something on the board, I started rereading the underlined sections of Song of Myself under the desk. As far as I could see, there was no direct reference to New York. A few minutes later, I handed the book to Radar, and before writing a note on the corner of his notebook closest to me, he looked at the book for a while. Those marked in green must mean something. Maybe it wants you to open the door of your mind? I shrugged and in response, wrote, Maybe he read the poem on two different days with two different pens.
es_translation: I had taken Margo's copy of Leaves of Grass to class, so I opened it under the table and started reading the marked passages from "Song of Myself" again while Mr. Jiminez wrote on the board. I didn't see any direct references to New York. A few minutes later, I passed the book to Radar, who flipped through it for a while and then wrote in the corner of his notebook: "The green highlighting must mean something. Maybe it wants you to open the door of your mind." I shrugged and wrote back: "Or maybe she just read the poem on two different days with two different highlighters."

en: A few minutes later, as I glanced toward the clock for only the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling standing outside the classroom door, a hall pass in his hand, dancing a spastic jig.
vi: Mấy phút sau, khi liếc đồng hồ mới tới lần thứ ba mươi bảy, tôi thấy Ben Starling đứng ngoài cửa lớp, tấm thẻ thông hành[7] trong tay, nhún nhảy như điên theo điệu jig.
tr: Birkaç dakika sonra, saate yalnızca otuz yedinci kez bakarken, Ben Starling’in sınıfın kapısının dışında durduğunu gördüm, elinde bir izin kâğıdıyla saçma sapan bir dans ediyordu.
es: A los pocos minutos, al mirar el reloj solo por trigésimo séptima vez, vi a Ben Starling al otro lado de la puerta de la clase, pegándose un bailoteo espasmódico y con un permiso para estar fuera de clase en la mano.
vi_translation: A few minutes later, when I glanced at the clock for the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling standing outside the classroom door, a hall pass[7] in his hand, bouncing like crazy to a jig.
tr_translation: A few minutes later, while looking at the clock for only the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling standing outside the classroom door, doing a silly dance with a permission slip in his hand.
es_translation: A few minutes later, after looking at the clock for only the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling on the other side of the classroom door, doing a jerky dance and holding a hall pass in his hand.

en: When the bell rang for lunch, I raced to my locker, but somehow Ben had beaten me there, and somehow he was talking to Lacey Pemberton. He was crowding her, slumping slightly so he could talk toward her face. Talking to Ben could make me feel a little claustrophobic sometimes, and I wasn’t even a hot girl.
vi: Khi chuông báo giờ ăn trưa, tôi lao ngay đến ngăn tủ của mình, nhưng bằng cách nào đó Ben đã cán đích trước tôi, và bằng cách nào đó nó đang nói chuyện với Lacey Pemberton. Ben đứng sát bên Lacey, hơi nghiêng đầu để nhìn được trực diện cô ấy. Nói chuyện với Ben thỉnh thoảng khiến tôi có cảm giác bị sợ không gian hẹp, mà tôi có phải là cô nàng nóng bỏng nào cho cam đâu.
tr: Öğlen arası zili çaldığında dolabıma koştum ama her nasılsa Ben beni geçmişti, oradaydı ve her nasılsa Lacey Pembertonla konuşuyordu. Lacey’nin üstüne doğru eğiliyor, yüzüne doğru konuşabilmek için âdeta üstüne çıkıyordu. Ben’le konuşmak bazen bana bile klostrofobik hissettirirdi ki ben seksi bir kız bile değildim.
es: Cuando sonó el timbre de la hora de comer, corrí a mi taquilla, pero Ben se las había arreglado para llegar antes que yo y estaba hablando con Lacey Pemberton. Se acercaba a ella, ligeramente encogido para hablarle cara a cara. Hablar con Ben me resultaba a veces un tanto claustrofóbico, y eso que yo no era una tía buena.
vi_translation: When the lunch bell rang, I rushed straight to my locker, but somehow Ben had beaten me there, and somehow he was talking to Lacey Pemberton. Ben stood close to Lacey, slightly tilting his head to look directly at her. Talking to Ben sometimes made me feel claustrophobic, and it's not like I was some hot girl or anything.
tr_translation: When the lunch bell rang, I ran to my locker, but somehow Ben had beaten me there, and somehow he was talking to Lacey Pemberton. He was leaning towards Lacey, almost climbing on top of her to talk to her face. Talking to Ben sometimes made me feel claustrophobic, and I wasn't even a sexy girl.
es_translation: When the lunch bell rang, I ran to my locker, but Ben had managed to get there before me and was talking to Lacey Pemberton. He was leaning in towards her, slightly hunched to speak to her face to face. Talking to Ben sometimes felt a bit claustrophobic, and that was even though I wasn't a hot girl.

en: “Hey, guys,” I said when I got up to them.
vi: “Chào mấy bồ,” tôi nói khi đến nơi.
tr: “Selam, çocuklar,” dedim onlara ulaştığımda.
es: —Hola, chicos —les dije al llegar.
vi_translation: "Hello, friends," I said upon arriving.
tr_translation: "Hey, guys," I said when I reached them.
es_translation: —Hello, guys —I said to them upon arriving.

en: “Hey,” Lacey answered, taking an obvious step back from Ben. “Ben was just bringing me up-to-date on Margo. No one ever went into her room, you know. She said her parents didn’t allow her to have friends over.”
vi: “Chào,” Lacey nói, lùi một bước rõ ràng tránh khỏi Ben. “Ben mới nói với tớ mấy chuyện về Margo. Cậu biết không, chưa ai từng vào phòng cậu ấy đâu. Margo bảo rằng bố mẹ cậu ấy không cho mời bạn đến nhà.”
tr: “Selam,” diye karşılık verdi Lacey, Ben’den geriye doğru belirgin bir adım atarak. “Ben bana Margo’yla ilgili güncel bilgileri veriyordu. Biliyor musun, odasına kimse girmemişti. Annesiyle babasının, arkadaşlarım getirmesine izin vermediğini söylerdi.”
es: —Hola —me contestó Lacey dando un paso atrás para apartarse un poco de Ben—. Ben estaba comentándome las novedades de Margo. Nadie entraba jamás en su habitación, ya sabéis. Decía que sus padres no le permitían que sus amigos fueran a casa.
vi_translation: “Hi,” Lacey said, taking a clear step back to avoid Ben. “Ben just told me some things about Margo. You know, no one has ever been in her room. Margo said that her parents don't allow her to invite friends over.”
tr_translation: “Hi,” Lacey responded, taking a noticeable step back from Ben. “Ben was giving me the latest updates about Margo. You know, no one had entered her room. She used to say that her parents didn’t allow her to bring friends over.”
es_translation: —Hello —Lacey replied, taking a step back to move away from Ben—. Ben was telling me the latest news about Margo. No one ever went into her room, you know. She said that her parents didn't allow her friends to come over.

en: “Really?” Lacey nodded. “Did you know that Margo owns, like, a thousand records?”
vi: “Thật à?” Lacey gật đầu. “Thế cậu có biết Margo có khoảng, xem nào, một ngàn đĩa ghi âm không?”
tr: “Gerçekten mi?” Lacey başıyla onayladı. “Margo’nun bin kadar plağı olduğunu biliyor muydun?
es: —¿De verdad? Lacey asintió.
vi_translation: “Really?” Lacey nodded. “So, do you know that Margo has about, let's see, one thousand records?”
tr_translation: “Really?” Lacey nodded. “Did you know that Margo had about a thousand records?”
es_translation: —Really? Lacey nodded. —Did you know that Margo has about a thousand records?

en: Lacey threw up her hands. “No, that’s what Ben was saying! Margo never talked about music. I mean, she would say she liked something on the radio or whatever. But—no. She’s so weird.”
vi: Lacey giơ hai tay lên. “Không hề, Ben cũng vừa hỏi như vậy! Margo không bao giờ nói chuyện về âm nhạc. Thực ra cậu ấy có nói thích nghe cái này cái kia trên radio hoặc đâu đó. Nhưng–không đả động gì đến đĩa ghi âm cả. Cậu ấy kì lạ thật đấy.”
tr: Lacey ellerini kaldırdı. “Hayır, Ben de bunu söylüyordu! Margo müzikten hiç bahsetmezdi. Yani radyoda falan bir şeyi sevdiğini söylerdi. Ama... hayır. Margo çok tuhaf?
es: —¿Sabías que Margo tiene unos mil discos? —le pregunté. Lacey levantó las manos. —No. Es lo que estaba contándome Ben. Margo nunca hablaba de música. Bueno, decía que le gustaba una canción que sonaba en la radio y cosas así. Pero… no. Es muy rara.
vi_translation: Lacey raised both hands. "Not at all, Ben just asked the same thing! Margo never talks about music. Actually, she does mention liking this or that on the radio or somewhere. But–no mention of records at all. She's really strange."
tr_translation: Lacey raised her hands. “No, I was saying that too! Margo never talked about music. I mean, she would say she liked something on the radio or whatever. But... no. Is Margo very strange?’
es_translation: —I asked her. Lacey raised her hands. —No. That’s what Ben was telling me. Margo never talked about music. Well, she would say she liked a song that was playing on the radio and things like that. But… no. She’s very strange.

en: I shrugged. Maybe she was weird, or maybe the rest of us were weird. Lacey kept talking. “But we were just saying that Walt Whitman was from New York.”
vi: Tôi nhún vai. Có thể Margo kì lạ, hoặc có thể những đứa còn lại là bọn tôi kì lạ. Lacey nói tiếp. “Nhưng bọn tớ vừa nói đến đoạn Walt Whitman xuất thân từ New York.”
tr: Omuzlarımı silktim. Belki Margo tuhaftı ya da geri kalanlarımız tuhaftı. Lacey konuşmaya devam etti. “Ama biz de tam Walt Whitman’m New York’lu olduğundan bahsediyorduk.
es: Me encogí de hombros. Quizá era rara, o quizá los raros éramos los demás. Lacey siguió hablando. —Pero estábamos diciendo que Walt Whitman era de Nueva York.
vi_translation: I shrugged. Maybe Margo is strange, or maybe the rest of us are the strange ones. Lacey continued. “But we were just talking about how Walt Whitman was from New York.”
tr_translation: I shrugged my shoulders. Maybe Margo was weird or the rest of us were weird. Lacey kept talking. “But we were just talking about how Walt Whitman was from New York.”
es_translation: I shrugged. Maybe she was strange, or maybe the strange ones were the rest of us. Lacey kept talking. —But we were saying that Walt Whitman was from New York.

en: “And according to Omnictionary, Woody Guthrie lived there for a long time, too,” Ben said.
vi: “Và theo Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ, Woody Guthrie cũng đã sống ở đó một thời gian dài,” Ben nói thêm.
tr: “Ve Omnictionary’ye göre, Woody Guthrie de uzun süre orada yaşamış,” dedi Ben.
es: —Y según el Omnictionary, Woody Guthrie también vivió en Nueva York mucho tiempo —dijo Ben.
vi_translation: "And according to the Complete Chronicles, Woody Guthrie also lived there for a long time," Ben added.
tr_translation: "And according to Omnictionary, Woody Guthrie also lived there for a long time," said Ben.
es_translation: —And according to the Omnictionary, Woody Guthrie also lived in New York for a long time —said Ben.

en: I nodded. “I can totally see her in New York. I think we have to figure out the next clue, though. It can’t end with the book. There must be some code in the highlighted lines or something.”
vi: Tôi gật đầu. “Tớ thấy mọi khả năng là Margo ở New York. Nhưng chắc bọn mình phải tìm ra manh mối tiếp theo. Không thể chỉ dừng ở cuốn sách được. Hẳn phải có gì đó chưa giải mã được từ những dòng thơ được đánh dấu.”
tr: Başımı salladım. “Margo’yu New York’ta hayal edebiliyorum. Yine de bir sonraki ipucunu çözmeliyiz. Kitapla bitmiyordur bence. Altı çizili dizelerde bir şifre falan olmalı.
es: Asentí. —Me la imagino perfectamente en Nueva York. Pero creo que tenemos que descubrir la siguiente pista. No puede ser solo el libro. Debe de haber algún código en los versos marcados o algo así.
vi_translation: I nodded. "I think it's very likely that Margo is in New York. But we probably have to find the next clue. We can't just stop at the book. There must be something undeciphered from the marked lines of poetry."
tr_translation: I nodded my head. “I can imagine Margo in New York. Still, we need to solve the next clue. I don't think it ends with the book. There must be some kind of code in the underlined lines.”
es_translation: I nodded. —I can perfectly imagine her in New York. But I think we need to discover the next clue. It can't be just the book. There must be some kind of code in the marked verses or something like that.

en: “Yeah, can I look at it during lunch?”
vi: “Ừ, cho tớ xem qua cuốn sách trong giờ ăn trưa được không?”
tr: “Evet, öğle yemeğinde kitaba bakabilir miyim?
es: —Sí. ¿Puedo echar un vistazo mientras como?
vi_translation: "Sure, can I take a look at the book during lunch?"
tr_translation: “Yes, can I look at the book during lunch?”
es_translation: —Yes. Can I take a look while I eat?

en: “Yeah,” I said. “Or I can make you a copy in the library if you want.”
vi: “Được chứ,” tôi nói. “Hoặc nếu cậu muốn, để tớ sao cho cậu một bản trong thư viện.”
tr: “Tabii,” dedim. ‘Ya da istersen kütüphanede sana bir kopyasını çıkarabilirim.
es: —Claro —le contesté—. O si quieres, puedo hacerte fotocopias en la biblioteca.
vi_translation: "Sure," I said. "Or if you want, I can make a copy for you in the library."
tr_translation: “Of course,” I said. “Or if you prefer, I can make a copy for you in the library.”
es_translation: —Sure —I replied—. Or if you want, I can make photocopies for you at the library.

en: “Nah, I can just read it. I mean, I don’t know crap about poetry. Oh, but anyway, I have a cousin in college there, at NYU, and I sent her a flyer she could print. So I’m going to tell her to put them up in record stores. I mean, I know there are a lot of record stores, but still.”
vi: “Không cần đâu, tớ chỉ đọc thôi mà. Thực ra tớ chả hiểu ngang biết dọc gì về thơ thẩn cả. Ô, nhưng dù sao, tớ có bà chị họ đang học ở đó, Đại học New York ấy mà, tớ có thể gửi tờ rao vặt để chị ấy in ra. Tớ sẽ bảo chị ấy bỏ tờ rơi ở các cửa hàng đĩa nhạc. Tất nhiên có rất nhiều cửa hàng đĩa nhạc, nhưng thử vẫn hơn.”
tr: Yok, okusam yeter. Yani şiir hakkında hiçbir şey bilmem. Ah, her neyse... Orada bir kuzenim var, Nevv York Üniversitesi’nde, ona çıktısını alabileceği bir el ilanı gönderdim. İlanları müzik mağazalarına asmasını söyleyeceğim. Yani orada çok fazla müzik mağazası olduğunu biliyorum ama yine de...
es: —No hace falta. Solo quiero leerlo. Vaya, que no entiendo una mierda de poesía. Pero una prima mía va a la Universidad de Nueva York, y le he mandado un cartel para que lo imprima. Voy a pedirle que lo cuelgue en tiendas de discos. Bueno, ya sé que hay muchas tiendas de discos, pero en fin.
vi_translation: “No need, I'm just reading. Actually, I don't understand much about poetry at all. Oh, but anyway, I have a cousin who's studying there, at New York University, I can send her the flyer to print out. I'll ask her to leave the flyers at the music stores. Of course, there are many music stores, but it's worth a try.”
tr_translation: No, just reading is enough. I mean, I don't know anything about poetry. Ah, whatever... I have a cousin there, at New York University, I sent him a flyer that he can print out. I'll tell him to post the flyers in music stores. I mean, I know there are a lot of music stores there, but still...”
es_translation: —No need. I just want to read it. Wow, I don't understand a damn thing about poetry. But a cousin of mine goes to New York University, and I sent her a poster to print. I'm going to ask her to hang it in record stores. Well, I know there are a lot of record stores, but anyway.

en: “Good idea,” I said. They started to walk to the cafeteria, and I followed them.
vi: “Ý hay đấy,” tôi nói. Ben và Lacey bắt đầu đi đến căngtin, tôi liền đi theo.
tr: “İyi fikir,” dedim. Kafeteryaya doğru yürümeye başladılar, ben de onları takip ettim.
es: —Buena idea —le dije. Se dirigieron a la cafetería y los seguí.
vi_translation: "That's a good idea," I said. Ben and Lacey started heading to the cafeteria, and I followed them.
tr_translation: “Good idea,” I said. They started walking towards the cafeteria, and I followed them.
es_translation: —Good idea —I told him. They headed to the cafeteria and I followed them.

en: “Hey,” Ben asked Lacey, “what color is your dress?”
vi: “Này,” Ben hỏi Lacey, “váy của cậu màu gì?”
tr: Ben, “Hey,” diye seslendi 1 ;acey’ye, “elbisen ne renk?
es: —Oye —preguntó Ben a Lacey—, ¿de qué color es tu vestido?
vi_translation: “Hey,” Ben asked Lacey, “what color is your dress?”
tr_translation: Ben called out, "Hey, Acey, what color is your dress?""
es_translation: —Hey —asked Ben to Lacey—, what color is your dress?

en: “Um, it’s kind of sapphire, why?”
vi: “Ờ, kiểu màu xanh đá xa-phia, thì sao?”
tr: “Hımm, safir gibi, neden?
es: —Hum, tirando a azul zafiro. ¿Por qué?
vi_translation: "Uh, like sapphire blue, how about that?"
tr_translation: “Hmm, like a sapphire, why?””
es_translation: —Hmm, except for the sapphire blue. Why?

en: “Just want to make sure my tux matches,” Ben said. I’d never seen Ben’s smile so giddy-ridiculous, and that’s saying something, because he was a fairly giddy-ridiculous person.
vi: “Thì để bộ lễ phục của tớ tiệp màu theo,” Ben đáp. Tôi chưa bao giờ thấy Ben cười kiểu ngu-ngơ-ngớ-ngẩn đến vậy, và như thế hẳn nói lên điều gì đó, vì nó vốn cũng khá ngu-ngơ-ngớ-ngẩn.
tr: “Sadece smokinimin uyacağından emin olmak istedim,” dedi Ben. Ben’in gülümseyişinin hiç bu kadar sulu ve gülünç olduğunu görmemiştim ve bu gerçekten önemli bir detaydı çünkü Ben normalde gayet sulu ve gülünç bir insandı.
es: —Para asegurarme de que hace juego con mi esmoquin —le contestó Ben. Nunca había visto una sonrisa de Ben tan ridícula y atontada, y ya es decir, porque era una persona bastante ridícula y atontada.
vi_translation: “Then I'll match my formal suit to it,” Ben replied. I had never seen Ben smile so goofily, and that says something, because he was already quite goofy.
tr_translation: “I just wanted to make sure my tuxedo would fit,” said Ben. I had never seen Ben's smile so cheesy and ridiculous, and this was really an important detail because Ben was normally quite a cheesy and ridiculous person.
es_translation: —To make sure it matches my tuxedo —Ben replied. I had never seen such a ridiculous and silly smile on Ben, and that's saying something, because he was quite a ridiculous and silly person.

en: Lacey nodded. “Well, but we don’t want to be too matchy-matchy. Maybe if you go traditional: black tux and a black vest?”
vi: Lacey gật đầu. “Tốt thôi, nhưng chúng ta không nên quá đôi lứa xứng đôi. Có lẽ cậu cứ theo truyền thống đi: lễ phục màu đen nhé?”
tr: Lacey başını salladı. “Peki ama fazla uygun olmak istemeyiz. Belki sen geleneksel takılırsın: Siyah smokin ile siyah yelek?
es: Lacey asintió. —Bueno, pero tampoco vayamos demasiado conjuntados. Podrías ir tradicional, con esmoquin negro y chaleco negro.
vi_translation: Lacey nodded. “Alright, but we shouldn't be too much of a perfect match. Maybe you should just stick to tradition: a black suit?”
tr_translation: Lacey nodded. “Okay, but we don't want to be too conventional. Maybe you can go traditional: Black tuxedo with a black vest?”
es_translation: Lacey nodded. —Well, but let's not go too coordinated either. You could go traditional, with a black tuxedo and a black vest.

en: “No cummerbund, you don’t think?”
vi: “Không đeo dải thắt lưng to bản, cậu thấy như thế có nên không?”
tr: “Kuşak giysem mi?
es: —Sin faja, ¿te parece?
vi_translation: “Not wearing a wide belt, do you think that's appropriate?”
tr_translation: "Should I wear a sash?""
es_translation: —Without a girdle, what do you think?

en: “Well, they’re okay, but you don’t want to get one with really fat pleats, you know?”
vi: “Ừ, thế cũng được. Mà đừng có diện áo xếp bèo nhún li nhiều quá đấy nhé.”
tr: “Peki, o olur ama gerçekten kalın pilileri olanlardan almasan daha iyi olur.
es: —Bueno, las fajas están bien, pero sin muchos pliegues, ¿sabes?
vi_translation: "Alright, that's fine. But don't wear too many frilly, ruffled clothes."
tr_translation: “Well, that would be fine, but it would be better if you didn't buy the ones with really thick pleats.”
es_translation: —Well, the sashes are fine, but without too many folds, you know?

en: They kept talking—apparently, the ideal level of pleat-fatness is a conversational topic to which hours can be devoted—but I stopped listening as I waited in the Pizza Hut line. Ben had found his prom date, and Lacey had found a boy who would happily talk prom for hours. Now everyone had a date—except me, and I wasn’t going. The only girl I’d want to take was off tramping some kind of perpetual journey or something.
vi: Hai đứa cứ nói mãi–rõ ràng, tỉ lệ bèo li lí tưởng là một chủ đề có thể bàn bạc nhiều giờ liền–nhưng tôi thôi không chú ý nghe nữa trong khi xếp hàng vào hiệu Pizza Hut. Ben đã tìm được cô bạn đi dự dạ hội tốt nghiệp cùng, và Lacey đã tìm được cậu bạn hào hứng bàn luận hàng giờ đồng hồ về dạ hội. Giờ ai cũng có đôi cả–trừ tôi, và tôi sẽ không đến dạ hội. Cô bạn duy nhất mà tôi muốn tháp tùng đang dấn mình vào chuyến đi miên viễn hay gì đó đại loại thế.
tr: Konuşmaya devam ettileranlaşılan, pili kalınlığının ideal ölçüsü saatler boyunca konuşulabilir bir konuyduama Pizza Hut sırasında beklerken dinlemeyi bırakmıştım. Ben balo eşini bulmuştu, Lacey de saatlerce halinden memnun bir şekilde balodan konuşacak bir erkek bulmuştu. Artık herkesin bir eşi vardı... ben hariç ve ben baloya gitmiyordum. Götürmek isteyeceğim tek kız bir tür ebedî yolculukta ağır ağır ilerliyordu.
es: Siguieron hablando —al parecer, el nivel ideal de pliegues es un tema de conversación al que pueden dedicarse horas—, pero dejé de escucharlos mientras esperaba en la cola del Pizza Hut. Ben había encontrado pareja para el baile, y Lacey había encontrado a un chico que podía pegarse horas hablando del baile encantado de la vida. Ahora todo el mundo tenía pareja… menos yo, que no iba a ir. La única chica a la que me habría gustado llevar había emprendido un viaje eterno.
vi_translation: The two kept talking endlessly–clearly, the ideal ratio of water spinach to water was a topic that could be discussed for hours–but I stopped paying attention while queuing up at Pizza Hut. Ben had found a date for the prom, and Lacey had found a guy who was excited to talk about the prom for hours. Now everyone had a partner–except for me, and I wasn't going to the prom. The only girl I wanted to accompany was embarking on an endless journey or something like that.
tr_translation: They kept talking, apparently, the ideal thickness of the battery was a topic that could be discussed for hours, but Pizza Hut I had stopped listening while waiting. I had found my prom date, and Lacey had found a guy to talk about the prom with for hours, contentedly. Now everyone had a date... except me, and I wasn't going to the prom. The only girl I would want to take was slowly advancing on some kind of eternal journey.
es_translation: They kept talking —apparently, the ideal level of folds is a topic of conversation to which they can dedicate hours—, but I stopped listening while I waited in line at Pizza Hut. Ben had found a partner for the dance, and Lacey had found a guy who could spend hours talking about the dance, enchanted by life. Now everyone had a partner… except me, who wasn't going to go. The only girl I would have liked to take had embarked on an eternal journey.

en: When we sat down, Lacey started reading “Song of Myself,” and she agreed that none of it sounded like anything and certainly none of it sounded like Margo. We still had no idea what, if anything, Margo was trying to say. She gave the book back to me, and they started talking about prom again.
vi: Khi chúng tôi ngồi xuống ăn, Lacey bắt đầu đọc “Tự khúc,” và đồng tình rằng những câu thơ chẳng nói lên điều gì, cũng chẳng giống Margo chút nào. Chúng tôi vẫn chưa luận ra được Margo muốn nói điều gì, nếu thực sự cô ấy ám chỉ gì đó. Lacey đưa cuốn sách lại cho tôi, rồi chàng và nàng lại tiếp tục ríu rít với nhau về dạ hội.
tr: Oturduğumuzda Lacey, Kendi Şarkım’ı okumaya başladı ve hiçbirinin hiçbir şeye ve kesinlikle Margo’ya benzemediğine katıldı. Hâlâ Margo’nun bize ne söylemeye çalıştığını bilmiyorduk, tabii bir şey söylemeye çalışıyorduysa. Lacey kitabı bana geri verdi ve tekrar baloyla ilgili konuşmaya başladılar.
es: Cuando nos sentamos, Lacey empezó a leer el «Canto de mí mismo» y estuvo de acuerdo en que no le sonaba a nada, y desde luego no le sonaba como Margo. Seguíamos sin tener ni idea de lo que Margo intentaba decir, si es que intentaba decir algo. Me devolvió el libro y se pusieron a hablar del baile otra vez.
vi_translation: When we sat down to eat, Lacey began reading "Song of Myself," and agreed that the verses didn't convey anything, nor did they resemble Margo at all. We still hadn't figured out what Margo meant, if she was indeed implying something. Lacey handed the book back to me, then she and he continued to chatter about the prom.
tr_translation: When we sat down, Lacey started reading My Song and agreed that none of them resembled anything, and certainly not Margo. We still didn't know what Margo was trying to tell us, if she was trying to say anything at all. Lacey handed the book back to me and they started talking about the prom again.
es_translation: When we sat down, Lacey started to read "Song of Myself" and agreed that it didn't sound like anything, and certainly didn't sound like Margo. We still had no idea what Margo was trying to say, if she was trying to say anything at all. She handed the book back to me and they started talking about the dance again.

en: All afternoon, I kept feeling like it wasn’t doing any good to look at the highlighted quotes, but then I would get bored and reach into my backpack and put the book on my lap and go back to it. I had English at the end of the day, seventh period, and we were just starting to read Moby Dick, so Dr. Holden was talking quite a lot about fishing in the nineteenth century. I kept Moby Dick on the desk and Whitman in my lap, but even being in English class couldn’t help. For once, I went a few minutes without looking at the clock, so I was surprised by the bell ringing, and took longer than everyone else to get my backpack packed. As I slung it over one shoulder and started to leave, Dr. Holden smiled at me and said, “Walt Whitman, huh?”
vi: Cả buổi chiều, tôi có cảm giác rằng cứ nhìn những dòng thơ được đánh dấu ấy thì cũng chẳng ích gì. Nhưng rồi tôi lại chán, lại mò ba-lô, lấy cuốn thơ đặt lên lòng và đọc lại. Môn cuối cùng của tôi là Quốc ngữ, tiết thứ bảy, cả lớp mới bắt đầu vào bài Moby Dick nên cô Holden giảng khá nhiều về đánh cá ở thế kỉ mười chín. Tôi để Moby Dick trên mặt bàn và Whitman trong lòng, nhưng thậm chí ngồi trong giờ Quốc ngữ cũng không thêm hiệu ứng gì. Có lúc mấy phút liền tôi không nhìn đồng hồ, nên hơi bất ngờ khi chuông reo, do vậy mất nhiều thời gian cất dọn sách vở hơn những đứa khác. Khi tôi lẳng ba-lô lên vai và bắt đầu ra khỏi lớp, cô Holden cười với tôi và bảo, “Walt Whitman hả?”
tr: Bütün öğleden sonra, altı çizili sözlere bakmanın hiçbir faydası yokmuş gibi hissetmeye devam ettim ama sonra sıkılıp arka cebime uzanarak kitabı kucağıma koydum ve satırlara bakmaya geri döndüm. Günün sonunda, yedinci derste edebiyat dersi vardı ve Moby Dick’i yeni okumaya başlıyorduk, bu yüzden dr Holden on dokuzuncu yüzyılda balık tutmakla ilgili oldukça fazla konuşuyordu. Moby Dick’i sıramda, Whitman’ı kucağımda tuttum ama edebiyat dersinde olmak bile yardımcı olamadı. İlk defa, saate bakmadan birkaç dakika devam ettim, bu yüzden zil çalınca şaşırdım ve sırt çantamı toplamam diğer herkesten uzun sürdü. Çantamı bir omzuma asıp çıkarken dr Holden bana gülümseyip, “Demek Walt Whitman,” dedi.
es: Durante toda la tarde tuve la sensación de que no iba bien encaminado buscando en las citas marcadas, pero al final me aburría, sacaba el libro de la mochila, me lo ponía en las rodillas y seguía con él. La última clase era literatura y estábamos empezando a leer Moby Dick, así que la doctora Holden no dejaba de hablar de la pesca en el siglo XIX. Dejé Moby Dick en la mesa y a Whitman en las rodillas, pero ni siquiera estar en clase de literatura servía de algo. Por una vez no miré el reloj en varios minutos, de modo que el timbre me sorprendió y tardé más que los demás en recoger mis cosas. Mientras me colgaba la mochila de un hombro y empezaba a salir, la doctora Holden me sonrió. —Walt Whitman, ¿eh? —me preguntó.
vi_translation: All afternoon, I had the feeling that just looking at those marked lines of poetry wouldn't help at all. But then I got bored, rummaged through my backpack, took out the poetry book, placed it on my lap, and read it again. My last subject was National Language, seventh period, and the whole class had just started on Moby Dick, so Ms. Holden was lecturing quite a bit about nineteenth-century whaling. I placed Moby Dick on the desk and Whitman on my lap, but even sitting in National Language class didn't add any effect. There were moments when I didn't look at the clock for several minutes, so I was a bit surprised when the bell rang, thus taking more time to pack up my books than the others. As I slung my backpack over my shoulder and started to leave the class, Ms. Holden smiled at me and said, "Walt Whitman, huh?"
tr_translation: All afternoon, I kept feeling like there was no point in looking at the underlined words, but then I got bored and reached into my back pocket, put the book on my lap, and went back to looking at the lines. At the end of the day, we had literature class in the seventh period and we were just starting to read Moby Dick, so Dr. Holden was talking quite a bit about fishing in the nineteenth century. I held Moby Dick on my desk and Whitman on my lap, but even being in literature class didn't help. For the first time, I went on for a few minutes without looking at the clock, so when the bell rang, I was surprised, and it took me longer than everyone else to gather my backpack. As I slung my bag over one shoulder and walked out, Dr. Holden smiled at me and said, "So, Walt Whitman."
es_translation: All afternoon I had the feeling that I wasn't on the right track searching through the marked quotes, but in the end, I got bored, took the book out of my backpack, put it on my knees, and continued with it. The last class was literature and we were starting to read Moby Dick, so Dr. Holden kept talking about fishing in the 19th century. I left Moby Dick on the table and Whitman on my knees, but even being in literature class didn't help. For once, I didn't look at the clock for several minutes, so the bell surprised me and I took longer than the others to gather my things. As I slung my backpack over one shoulder and started to leave, Dr. Holden smiled at me. —Walt Whitman, eh? —he asked me.

en: I nodded sheepishly.
vi: Tôi xấu hổ gật đầu.
tr: Mahcup bir halde başımı salladım.
es: Asentí avergonzado.
vi_translation: I nodded in embarrassment.
tr_translation: I nodded my head in an embarrassed manner.
es_translation: I nodded, embarrassed.

en: “Good stuff,” she said. “So good that I’m almost okay with you reading it in class. But not quite.” I mumbled sorry and then walked out to the senior parking lot.
vi: “Hay đấy,” cô nói. “Hay đến mức tôi gần như đồng ý cho em đọc trong giờ. Nhưng không quá lâu đâu nhé.” Tôi lí nhí em xin lỗi ạ rồi đi bộ ra bãi đỗ xe của học sinh năm cuối.
tr: “İyi kitap,” dedi. “O kadar iyi ki derste okuman benim için neredeyse sorun değil. Neredeyse.” Üzgünüm diye mırıldandım, sonra çıkıp son sınıfların park alanına gittim.
es: —Es muy bueno —me dijo—. Tan bueno que estoy casi de acuerdo en que lo leas en clase. Pero no del todo. Murmuré una disculpa y me dirigí al aparcamiento de los alumnos de último curso.
vi_translation: “Not bad,” she said. “Good enough that I almost agreed to let you read during class. But not for too long.” I mumbled an apology and walked to the senior student parking lot.
tr_translation: “Good book,” he said. “So good that reading it in class is almost not a problem for me. Almost.” “I'm sorry,” I murmured, then went out to the senior parking lot.
es_translation: —It's very good —he told me—. So good that I'm almost in agreement for you to read it in class. But not entirely. I murmured an apology and headed to the senior student parking lot.

en: While Ben and Radar banded, I sat in RHAPAW with the doors open, a slow husky breeze blowing through. I read from The Federalist Papers to prepare for a quiz I had the next day in government, but my mind kept returning to its continuous loop: Guthrie and Whitman and New York and Margo. Had she gone to New York to immerse herself in folk music? Was there some secret folk music-loving Margo I’d never known? Was she maybe staying in an apartment where one of them had once lived? And why did she want to tell me about it?
vi: Trong khi Ben và Radar tập nhạc, tôi ngồi trong RHAPAW và để mở cửa xe, một làn gió chầm chậm mơn man thổi qua.
