tr: “Katılıyorum,” dedi babam ama akşam yemeğinden sonra, ben odama dönüp sessizde Diriliş oynarken, onların da fısır fısır konuştuklarını duyabiliyordum. Kelimeleri duyamıyordum belki ama endişeyi hissedebiliyordum.
es: —Estoy de acuerdo —dijo mi padre. Pero después de cenar, cuando volví a mi habitación y jugué al Resurrection sin volumen, los oí hablando del tema en voz baja. No oía lo que decían, pero notaba que estaban preocupados.
vi_translation: "Dad agrees with mom," dad affirmed. But after dinner, when I went to my room and played Resurrection on mute, I overheard my parents quietly talking to each other. I couldn't make out the specific words, but I sensed a tone of worry in their voices.
tr_translation: "I agree," said my father, but after dinner, when I went back to my room to play Resurrection in silence, I could hear them whispering. I couldn't hear the words, but I could feel the anxiety.
es_translation: —I agree —said my father. But after dinner, when I returned to my room and played Resurrection without sound, I heard them talking about the matter in low voices. I couldn't hear what they were saying, but I could tell they were worried.

en: Later that night, Ben called my cell.
vi: Khuya hôm ấy, Ben gọi vào điện thoại di động của tôi.
tr: O gece ilerleyen saatlerde, Ben cep telefonumu aradı.
es: Aquella misma noche, un rato después, Ben me llamó al móvil.
vi_translation: Late that night, Ben called my cell phone.
tr_translation: That night, in the later hours, Ben called my cell phone.
es_translation: That same night, a little while later, Ben called me on my cell phone.

en: “Hey,” I said.
vi: “Chào,” tôi nói. “Này bồ tèo,” Ben gọi.
tr: “Hey,” dedim. “Kardeşim,” dedi.
es: —Hola —le dije.
vi_translation: "Hello," I said. "Hey buddy," Ben called.
tr_translation: "Hey," I said. “My brother,” he said.
es_translation: —Hello —I said to him.

en: “Bro,” he said.
vi: “Ừ, nghe đây,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Evet,” diye cevapladım.
es: —Colega —me dijo.
vi_translation: “Okay, listen,” I replied.
tr_translation: “Yes,” I replied.
es_translation: —Colleague —he said to me.

en: “Yes,” I answered.
vi: “Ừ, nghe đây,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Evet,” diye cevapladım.
es: —Dime —le contesté.
vi_translation: “Okay, listen,” I replied.
tr_translation: “Yes,” I replied.
es_translation: —Tell me —I replied to him.

en: “I’m about to go shoe shopping with Lacey.”
vi: “Tôi sắp đi mua giày với Lacey.”
tr: “Lacey’yle ayakkabı alışverişine gitmek üzereyim.
es: —Voy a ir a comprar zapatos con Lacey.
vi_translation: “I'm about to go shoe shopping with Lacey.”
tr_translation: “I'm about to go shoe shopping with Lacey.”
es_translation: —I'm going to buy shoes with Lacey.

en: “Shoe shopping?”
vi: “Đi mua giày á?”
tr: “Ayakkabı alışverişi mi?
es: —¿A comprar zapatos?
vi_translation: “Going to buy shoes?”
tr_translation: “Shoe shopping?”
es_translation: —To buy shoes?

en: “Yeah. Everything’s thirty percent off from ten to midnight. She wants me to help her pick out her prom shoes. I mean, she had some, but I was over at her house yesterday and we agreed that they weren’t . . . you know, you want the perfect shoes for prom. So she’s going to return them and then we’re going to Burdines and we’re going to like pi—”
vi: “Ừa. Mọi thứ giảm giá ba mươi phần trăm từ mười giờ tối đến nửa đêm. Lacey muốn tôi giúp cậu ấy lựa giày diện đi dạ tiệc. Tất nhiên Lacey có giày rồi, nhưng hôm qua tôi đến nhà cậu ấy và tụi tôi nhất trí rằng mấy đôi ấy... ông biết đấy, người ta muốn đi đôi giày hoàn hảo đến dạ tiệc tốt nghiệp mà. Thế nên Lacey sẽ hoàn lại đôi đã mua, rồi tụi tôi sẽ đến tiệm Burdines và sẽ–”
tr: “Evet. Saat ondan geceyarısma kadar her şey yüzde otuz indirimli. Balo ayakkabılarını seçmesine yardım etmemi istiyor. Yani birkaç ayakkabısı var ama dün evindeydim ve onların pek... neyse işte, sonuçta balo için mükemmel olan ayakkabıları istersin. Bu yüzden onları iade edecek, sonra Burdines’e gideceğiz ve şey yapacağız...
es: —Sí. De diez a doce de la noche hacen un treinta por ciento de descuento. Quiere que la ayude a elegir los zapatos para el baile. Bueno, había comprado unos, pero pasé ayer por su casa y estuvimos de acuerdo en que no eran… ya sabes, quiere los zapatos perfectos para la ocasión. Así que va a devolverlos y luego iremos a Burdines y…
vi_translation: “Yeah. Everything is thirty percent off from ten PM to midnight. Lacey wants me to help her pick out shoes for the prom. Of course, Lacey already has shoes, but I went to her house yesterday and we both agreed that those pairs... you know, people want to wear the perfect shoes to the prom. So Lacey will return the pair she bought, and then we’ll go to Burdines and we’ll–”
tr_translation: “Yes. Everything is thirty percent off from ten o'clock to midnight. She wants me to help her choose prom shoes. So, she has a few shoes but I was at her place yesterday and they are not quite... anyway, in the end, you want the perfect shoes for the prom. So she will return them, then we will go to Burdines and do the thing...”
es_translation: —Yes. From ten to twelve at night, they offer a thirty percent discount. She wants me to help her choose the shoes for the dance. Well, she had bought some, but I went by her house yesterday and we agreed that they weren't... you know, she wants the perfect shoes for the occasion. So she's going to return them and then we'll go to Burdines and...

en: “Ben,” I said.
vi: “Ben này,” tôi ngắt lời nó.
tr: “Ben,” dedim.
es: —Ben —lo interrumpí.
vi_translation: "Ben," I interrupted him.
tr_translation: “Me,” I said.
es_translation: —Ben —I interrupted him.

en: “Dude, I don’t want to talk about Lacey’s prom shoes. And I’ll tell you why: I have this thing that makes me really uninterested in prom shoes. It’s called a penis.”
vi: “Tôi không muốn nhai mãi chuyện giày đi dạ tiệc của Lacey, ông tướng ạ. Và tôi sẽ nói ngay tại sao: tôi có thứ này khiến tôi thực sự không hứng thú gì với giày nhảy cả. Đó là một cái tờ-rym.
tr: “Dostum, Lacey’nin balo ayakkabıları hakkında konuşmak istemiyorum. Ve sana nedenini söyleyeyim: Balo ayakkabılarıyla ilgilenmememe sebep olan bir şeyim var. Ona penis deniyor.
es: —Tío, no me apetece hablar de los zapatos de Lacey para el baile. Y te diré por qué: tengo una cosa que me impide interesarme por los zapatos para los bailes. Se llama polla.
vi_translation: “I don't want to keep chewing over Lacey's party shoes, buddy. And I'll tell you right away why: I have something that makes me really uninterested in dancing shoes. It's a torym.”
tr_translation: “Dude, I don't want to talk about Lacey's prom shoes. And let me tell you why: I have something that makes me not care about prom shoes. It's called a penis.”
es_translation: —Uncle, I don't feel like talking about Lacey's shoes for the dance. And I'll tell you why: I have something that prevents me from being interested in shoes for dances. It's called a dick.

en: “I’m really nervous and I can’t stop thinking that I actually kinda really like her not just in the she’s-a-hot-prom-date way but in the she’s-actually-really-cool-and-I-like-hanging-out-with-her kinda way. And, like, maybe we’re going to go to prom and we’ll be, like, kissing in the middle of the dance floor and everyone will be like, holy shit and, you know, everything they ever thought about me will just go out the window—”
vi: “Thật ra tôi căng thẳng và không tài nào không nghĩ rằng tôi thực sự thích Lacey, không phải chỉ theo kiểu cô-nàng-nóng-bỏng-sánh-đôi-tới-dạ-tiệc, mà quả là cậu-ấy-sao-mà-hay-thế-và-mình-khoái-dính-lấy-cậu-ấy cơ. Và xem chừng, có lẽ tôi và Lacey sẽ cùng tới dạ tiệc, và hai đứa, chà, sẽ mi nhau giữa sàn nhảy, rồi tất cả chúng nó, trời đất quỉ thần ơi, ông biết mà, mọi thứ nhố nhăng chúng nó nghĩ về tôi sẽ bị quẳng qua cửa sổ hết–”
tr: “Gerçekten çok gerginim ve ondan gerçekten hoşlandığımı düşünmekten vazgeçemiyorum, sadece ‘seksi bir balo eşi’ şeklinde değil, ‘aslında gerçekten havalı ve onunla takılmaktan hoşlanıyorum’ şeklinde gibi. Ve ne bileyim, belki baloya gideceğiz, dans pistinin ortasında öpüşeceğiz falan ve herkes aman Tanrım falan olacak ve benimle ilgili düşündükleri her şey öylece pencereden uçup gidecek...
es: —Estoy muy nervioso y no puedo dejar de pensar que en realidad me gusta, no solo para ir con ella al baile de graduación, sino que me parece una tía muy maja y me gusta salir con ella. Y quizá iremos al baile y nos besaremos en medio de la pista y todo será, joder, ya sabes, todo lo que han pensado de mí se lo llevará el viento…
vi_translation: "Actually, I was nervous and couldn't help but think that I really liked Lacey, not just in the she's-a-hot-girl-to-take-to-the-prom way, but more like she's-so-cool-and-I-really-want-to-be-around-her way." "And it seems, maybe Lacey and I will go to the prom together, and the two of us, well, will kiss on the dance floor, and all of them, oh my god, you know, all the ridiculous things they think about me will be thrown out the window—"
tr_translation: “I’m really nervous and I can't stop thinking that I really like him, not just as a ‘sexy prom date,’ but more like ‘he's actually really cool and I enjoy hanging out with him.’ And I don't know, maybe we'll go to the prom, kiss in the middle of the dance floor or something, and everyone will be like oh my God or whatever, and everything they think about me will just fly out the window...”
es_translation: —I am very nervous and I can't stop thinking that I actually like her, not just to go with her to the prom, but I think she's a really nice girl and I like going out with her. And maybe we'll go to the prom and we'll kiss in the middle of the dance floor and everything will be, damn, you know, everything they've thought about me will be gone with the wind...

en: “Ben,” I said, “stop the dork babble and you’ll be fine.” He kept talking for a while, but I finally got off the phone with him.
vi: “Ben ơi,” tôi nói. “Thôi màn lảm nhảm xuẩn này đi, rồi ông sẽ ổn cả thôi.” Nó liên tu bất tận thêm một lúc nữa, nhưng rút cục tôi cũng đặt được điện thoại xuống.
tr: “Ben,” dedim. “Aptalca gevezelik etmeyi bırakırsan her şey olması gerektiği gibi gider.” Bir süre daha konuşmaya devam etti ama sonunda telefonu kapatabildik.
es: —Ben —le dije—, deja de decir chorradas y todo irá bien. Siguió hablando un rato más, pero al final me libré de él.
vi_translation: "Ben," I said. "Stop this nonsense rambling, and you'll be fine." It went on incessantly for a while longer, but eventually, I managed to put the phone down.
tr_translation: “Ben,” I said. “If you stop babbling foolishly, everything will go as it should.” He continued talking for a while longer, but we were finally able to hang up the phone.
es_translation: —Ben —I said to him—, stop talking nonsense and everything will be fine. He kept talking for a while longer, but in the end, I got rid of him.

en: I lay down and started to feel a little depressed about prom. I refused to feel any kind of sadness over the fact that I wasn’t going to prom, but I had—stupidly, embarrassingly—thought of finding Margo, and getting her to come home with me just in time for prom, like late on Saturday night, and we’d walk into the Hilton ballroom wearing jeans and ratty T-shirts, and we’d be just in time for the last dance, and we’d dance while everyone pointed at us and marveled at the return of Margo, and then we’d fox-trot the hell out of there and go get ice cream at Friendly’s. So yes, like Ben, I harbored ridiculous prom fantasies. But at least I didn’t say mine out loud.
vi: Tôi nằm xuống và bắt đầu cảm thấy hơi nản vì buổi dạ tiệc. Tôi đã không dung túng bất cứ thể loại buồn rầu sầu thảm nào trước thực tế rằng tôi sẽ không đến dạ tiệc, nhưng–một cách ngốc nghếch và đáng xấu hổ–tôi đã mơ tưởng tìm được Margo, đưa cô ấy về nhà cùng tôi, vừa kịp đi dự dạ tiệc, như kiểu khuya ngày thứ Bảy chẳng hạn. Rồi hai đứa sẽ sóng bước vào sảnh khiêu vũ Hilton, mặc quần jeans và áo phông te tua. Và chúng tôi sẽ vừa kịp điệu nhảy cuối cùng, hai đứa sẽ nhảy cùng nhau trong khi mọi người chỉ trỏ và trầm trồ vì Margo đã trở lại. Cuối cùng tôi và cô ấy sẽ uyển chuyển nhảy fox-trot ra khỏi đó, rồi đi kiếm kem ở hiệu Friendly’s. Thế nên đúng vậy, cũng giống Ben, tôi đã thầm ấp ủ những tưởng tượng kì diệu về buổi dạ tiệc khôi hài đó. Nhưng ít ra tôi không làm toáng lên như thế.
tr: Uzandım ve baloyla ilgili kendimi hüzünlü hissetmeye başladım. Baloya gitmediğim gerçeğiyle ilgili her türlü üzüntüyü reddediyordum amaaptalca, utanç verici bir şekildeMargo’yu bulup tam balo zamanında eve gelmeye ikna etmeyi düşündüm, cumartesi gecesi geç saatlerde falan, sonra kot pantolon ve pasaklı tişörtlerle Hilton’un balo salonuna girerdik, son dans için tam zamanında orada olurduk ve herkes bizi işaret edip Margo’nun dönüşüne hayret ederken dans ederdik, sonra oranın canını çıkarana kadar fokstrot yapıp Friendly’s’e dondurma almaya giderdik. Yani evet, Ben gibi, ben de gülünç balo fantezileri kuruyordum. Ama en azından ben kendiminkileri yüksek sesle söylemiyordum.
es: Me tumbé y empecé a deprimirme por el baile. Me negaba a sentir la más mínima tristeza por el hecho de no ir, pero —estúpida y fastidiosamente— había pensado en encontrar a Margo, traérmela a casa conmigo justo a tiempo para el baile, el sábado por la noche, a última hora, y entrar en el salón del Hilton con vaqueros y camisetas raídas, justo a tiempo para el último baile, y bailar mientras todo el mundo nos señalaría y se maravillaría de que Margo hubiera vuelto, y entonces saldríamos bailando el foxtrot e iríamos a comprar un helado al Friendly’s. Así que sí, como Ben, albergaba ridículas fantasías con el baile. Pero al menos no decía las mías en voz alta.
vi_translation: I lay down and began to feel a bit disheartened about the prom. I had not indulged in any sort of sorrowful lamentation over the fact that I wouldn't be attending the prom, but–foolishly and embarrassingly–I had fantasized about finding Margo, bringing her home with me, just in time to go to the prom, like late Saturday night or something. Then the two of us would walk into the Hilton ballroom, wearing jeans and tattered T-shirts. And we would just make it for the last dance, the two of us dancing together while everyone pointed and marveled because Margo had returned. Finally, she and I would gracefully fox-trot out of there, then go get ice cream at Friendly’s. So yes, just like Ben, I had secretly harbored wonderful fantasies about that ridiculous prom. But at least I didn't make a big fuss about it.
tr_translation: I lay down and started to feel sad about the prom. I was rejecting any kind of sadness about the fact that I didn't go to the prom, but foolishly, embarrassingly, I thought about finding Margo and convincing her to come home just in time for the prom, like late Saturday night, then we'd walk into the Hilton's ballroom in jeans and messy t-shirts, just in time for the last dance, and everyone would point at us and marvel at Margo's return while we danced, then we'd foxtrot until we wore the place out and go to Friendly's for ice cream. So yes, like Ben, I was having ridiculous prom fantasies. But at least I wasn't saying mine out loud.
es_translation: I lay down and started to get depressed about the dance. I refused to feel the slightest bit of sadness about not going, but —stupidly and annoyingly— I had thought about finding Margo, bringing her home with me just in time for the dance, on Saturday night, at the last minute, and entering the Hilton ballroom in jeans and worn-out t-shirts, just in time for the last dance, and dancing while everyone would point at us and marvel that Margo had returned, and then we would leave dancing the foxtrot and go get ice cream at Friendly’s. So yes, like Ben, I harbored ridiculous fantasies about the dance. But at least I didn't say mine out loud.

en: Ben was such a self-absorbed idiot sometimes, and I had to remind myself why I still liked him. If nothing else, he sometimes got surprisingly bright ideas. The door thing was a good idea. It didn’t work, but it was a good idea. But obviously Margo had intended it to mean something else to me.
vi: Có những lúc Ben đích thị là thằng hâm chỉ biết có mình, và tôi đã phải tự nhắc nhở bản thân tại sao tôi vẫn khoái nó. Nếu không vướng khúc mắc gì, thỉnh thoảng nó có những sáng kiến táo bạo ra trò. Suy luận về khung cửa của nó chẳng hạn. Dù không trực tiếp có hiệu quả, nhưng đó vẫn là một ý tưởng xuất sắc. Cơ mà rõ ràng là Margo đã chủ ý muốn nói gì đó khác với tôi.
tr: Ben bazen öylesine bencil bir ahmak oluyordu ki kendime neden hâlâ onu sevdiğimi hatırlatmak zorunda kalıyordum. Hiç değilse bazen şaşırtıcı derecede parlak fikirleri olurdu. Kapı olayı iyi bir fikirdi. İşe yaramamıştı fakat iyi bir fikirdi. Ama belli ki Margo onun bana başka bir şey ifade etmesini amaçlamıştı.
es: A veces Ben era un idiota tan egocéntrico que tenía que recordarme a mí mismo por qué me seguía cayendo bien. Al menos algunas veces tenía ideas sorprendentemente brillantes. Lo de la puerta había sido una buena idea, aunque no funcionara. Y era obvio que la intención de Margo había sido decirme algo más.
vi_translation: There are times when Ben is truly an idiot who only thinks of himself, and I have to remind myself why I still like him. If there are no obstacles, occasionally he comes up with some pretty bold ideas. For instance, his reasoning about the window frame. Even though it wasn't directly effective, it was still an excellent idea. But clearly, Margo intended to say something different to me.
tr_translation: Sometimes I was such a selfish fool that I had to remind myself why I still loved him. At least sometimes he had surprisingly brilliant ideas. The door incident was a good idea. It hadn't worked, but it was a good idea. But clearly, Margo intended it to mean something else to me.
es_translation: Sometimes Ben was such a self-centered idiot that I had to remind myself why I still liked him. At least sometimes he had surprisingly brilliant ideas. The door thing had been a good idea, even if it didn't work. And it was obvious that Margo's intention had been to tell me something more.

en: To me.
vi: Với tôi.
tr: Bana.
es: A mí.
vi_translation: For me.
tr_translation: To me.
es_translation: To me.

en: The clue was mine. The doors were mine!
vi: Manh mối là của tôi. Những cánh cửa là của tôi!
tr: İpucu benimdi. Kapılar benimdi!
es: La pista era mía. Las puertas eran mías.
vi_translation: The clue is mine. The doors are mine!
tr_translation: The clue was mine. The doors were mine!
es_translation: The track was mine. The doors were mine.

en: On my way to the garage, I had to walk through the living room, where Mom and Dad were watching TV. “Want to watch?” my mom asked. “They’re about to crack the case.” It was one of those solve-the-murder crime shows.
vi: Muốn ra ga-ra, tôi phải đi qua phòng khách, nơi bố mẹ đang ngồi xem ti-vi. “Xem không con?” mẹ hỏi tôi. “Vụ này sắp bể rồi.” Đó là một trong những chương trình thể loại hình sự, kiểu đi-tìm-hung-thủ.
tr: Garaja giderken, annemle babanım televizyon izlediği salondan geçmek zorunda kaldım. “İzlemek ister misin?” diye sordu annem. “Olayı çözmek üzereler.” Şu cinayeti çözme dizilerinden biriydi.
es: De camino al garaje, tuve que pasar por el salón, donde mi madre y mi padre estaban viendo la tele. —¿Quieres verlo? —me preguntó mi madre—. Están a punto de resolver el caso. Era un programa de resolver casos de asesinato.
vi_translation: To get to the garage, I had to go through the living room, where my parents were sitting and watching TV. "Want to watch?" my mom asked me. "This case is about to be solved." It was one of those crime shows, the kind where they find the culprit.
tr_translation: While going to the garage, I had to pass through the living room where my mom and dad were watching TV. “Would you like to watch?” my mom asked. “They are about to solve the case.” It was one of those crime-solving shows.
es_translation: On the way to the garage, I had to pass through the living room, where my mother and father were watching TV. —Do you want to see it? —my mother asked me—. They are about to solve the case. It was a program to solve murder cases.

en: “No, thanks,” I said, and breezed past them through the kitchen and into the garage. I found the widest flathead screwdriver and then stuck it in the waistband of my khaki shorts, cinching my belt tight. I grabbed a cookie out of the kitchen and then walked back through the living room, my gait only slightly awkward, and while they watched the televised mystery unfold, I removed the three pins from my bedroom door. When the last one came off, the door creaked and started to fall, so I swung it all the way open against the wall with one hand, and as I swung it, I saw a tiny piece of paper—about the size of my thumbnail—flutter down from the door’s top hinge. Typical Margo. Why hide something in her own room when she could hide it in mine? I wondered when she’d done it, how she’d gotten in. I couldn’t help but smile.
vi: “Không ạ,” tôi đáp, chạy ù từ phòng khách qua bếp, vào ga-ra. Tôi tìm được cái tua-vít đầu bẹt to nhất, giắt nó vào cạp quần soóc ka-ki, kéo thắt lưng cho chặt. Tôi vớ đại một cái bánh qui trong bếp rồi ngược qua phòng khách về phòng mình, bước đi hơi có chút kì kì gượng gạo. Trong khi bố mẹ chăm chú theo dõi bí mật vụ án trên ti-vi được bật mí, tôi lặng lẽ tháo ba cái đinh khỏi bản lề cửa phòng mình. Khi cái cuối cùng trật ra, cánh cửa kêu “rắc” một tiếng và lỏng ra. Tôi đẩy tới đẩy lui cánh cửa quanh gờ tường bằng một tay, và khi đẩy như vậy, tôi thấy một mẩu giấy nhỏ xíu–cỡ móng tay cái của tôi–rơi từ bản lề trên cùng xuống. Đúng kiểu Margo rồi nhé. Tại sao phải giấu thứ gì đó trong phòng cô ấy trong khi cô ấy có thể giấu ngay trong phòng tôi? Không biết cô ấy đã hành động lúc nào, làm thế nào lại vào được nhỉ. Tôi không thể nhịn được mỉm cười.
tr: “Hayır, sağ ol,” dedim ve onları geçip mutfaktan garaja rüzgâr gibi geçtim. En geniş düz uçlu tornavidayı buldum, sonra onu hâki şortumun kemerine sokup kemerimi sıktım. Mutfaktan bir kurabiye aldım, tekrar salondan geçtim, yürüyüş şeklim hafiften tuhaf görünüyor olmalıydı ve onlar televizyondaki gizemin çözümlenme sini izlerlerken, ben odamın kapısından üç menteşeyi çıkardım. Sonuncusu çıkınca kapı gıcırdadı ve düşmeye başladı, bu yüzden bir elimle duvara yaslayıp tamamen açtım, kapıyı iterken ufacık bir kâğıt parçasınınyaklaşık olarak başparmağımın tırnağı boyutundaydıkapının üst menteşesinden aşağı doğru uçtuğunu gördüm. Her zamanki Margo işte. Benimkine saklayabilecekken neden kendi odasına bir şey saklayacaktı ki? Bunu ne zaman yaptığını merak ediyordum... nasıl içeri girdiğini. Gülümsemekten kendimi alamadım.
es: —No, gracias —le contesté. Crucé la cocina y entré en el garaje. Busqué el destornillador plano más grande que teníamos, me lo metí en la cintura de los pantalones cortos caquis y me apreté bien el cinturón. Cogí una galleta de la cocina, volví a cruzar el salón con pasos solo ligeramente torpes y, mientras veían en la tele cómo se resolvía el misterio, quité los tres clavos de la puerta de mi habitación. Cuando salió el último, la puerta crujió y empezó a inclinarse, así que con una mano la empujé contra la pared, y mientras la colocaba, vi que de la bisagra de arriba salía volando un trocito de papel del tamaño de la uña de mi pulgar. Típico de Margo. ¿Para qué esconder algo en su habitación si podía esconderlo en la mía? Me pregunté cuándo lo había hecho, cómo se había metido en mi habitación. No pude evitar sonreír.
vi_translation: "No," I replied, running from the living room through the kitchen, into the garage. I found the largest flathead screwdriver, tucked it into the waistband of my khaki shorts, and tightened my belt. I grabbed a cookie from the kitchen and then went back through the living room to my room, walking a bit awkwardly. While my parents were engrossed in the TV show revealing the mystery of the case, I quietly removed the three screws from the hinge of my room door. When the last one came out, the door made a "crack" sound and loosened. I pushed and pulled the door around the edge of the wall with one hand, and as I did so, I saw a tiny piece of paper—about the size of my thumbnail—fall from the top hinge. Classic Margo. Why hide something in her own room when she could hide it in mine? I wondered when she had done it, and how she had gotten in. I couldn't help but smile.
tr_translation: “No, thanks,” I said and breezed past them from the kitchen to the garage. I found the largest flathead screwdriver, then tucked it into the belt of my khaki shorts and tightened my belt. I grabbed a cookie from the kitchen, passed through the living room again, my walking style must have looked slightly odd, and they were engrossed in the unraveling mystery on the television. While they were following the tracks, I removed three hinges from my room's door. When the last one came out, the door creaked and started to fall, so I leaned it against the wall with one hand and fully opened it. As I pushed the door, I saw a tiny piece of paper, roughly the size of my thumbnail, fluttering down from the top hinge of the door. Typical Margo. Why would she hide something in her own room when she could have hidden it in mine? I wondered when she did this... how she got inside. I couldn't help but smile.
es_translation: —No, thank you —I replied. I crossed the kitchen and entered the garage. I looked for the largest flathead screwdriver we had, tucked it into the waistband of my khaki shorts, and tightened my belt. I grabbed a cookie from the kitchen, crossed the living room again with only slightly clumsy steps, and while they watched on TV how the mystery was solved, I removed the three nails from my bedroom door. When the last one came out, the door creaked and started to tilt, so with one hand I pushed it against the wall, and while positioning it, I saw a tiny piece of paper the size of my thumbnail fly out from the top hinge. Typical of Margo. Why hide something in her room if she could hide it in mine? I wondered when she had done it, how she had gotten into my room. I couldn't help but smile.

en: It was a sliver of the Orlando Sentinel, half straight edges and half ripped. I could tell it was the Sentinel because one ripped edge read “do Sentinel May 6, 2.” The day she’d left. The message was clearly from her. I recognized her handwriting:
vi: Đó là một mẩu xé từ tờ Người bảo vệ Orlando ra, nửa xén thẳng, nửa nham nhở. Tôi biết đó là tờ Người bảo vệ vì ở góc xé có mấy chữ “vệ Orlando 6 tháng Năm, 2.” Ngày Margo bỏ đi. Rõ ràng đây là thông điệp từ cô ấy. Tôi nhận ra chữ viết tay của Margo: 8328 đại Lộ bartlesville.
tr: Orlando Sentimi gazetesinin bir parçasıydı, kenarlan yamuktu ve biraz yırtılmıştı. Sentimi olduğunu anlamıştım çünkü yırtılmış bir kenarmda “do Sentinel Mayıs 6,2.” yazıyordu. Margo’nun gittiği gün. Mesaj kesinlikle ondandı. El yazısını tanıyordum.
es: Era un trozo de papel del periódico Orlando Sentinel, con los bordes rectos por un lado y desgarrados por el otro. Sabía que era del Sentinel porque en un lado se leía: «do Sentinel, 6 de mayo de 2». El día que se marchó. No había duda de que el mensaje era suyo. Reconocí su letra.
vi_translation: It was a piece torn from the Orlando Sentinel, half neatly cut, half jagged. I knew it was the Sentinel because at the torn corner were the words “ntinel Orlando May 6, 2.” The day Margo disappeared. Clearly, this was a message from her. I recognized Margo's handwriting: 8328 Bartlesville Avenue.
tr_translation: Orlando Sentinel newspaper was a part of it, the edges were crooked and it was a bit torn. I understood it was Sentinel because on a torn edge it said "do Sentinel May 6,2." The day Margo left. The message was definitely from her. I recognized her handwriting.
es_translation: It was a piece of paper from the Orlando Sentinel newspaper, with straight edges on one side and torn on the other. I knew it was from the Sentinel because on one side it read: "do Sentinel, May 6, 2". The day he left. There was no doubt that the message was his. I recognized his handwriting.

en: 8328 bartlesville Avenue
vi: Tôi nhận ra chữ viết tay của Margo: 8328 đại Lộ bartlesville.
tr: 8328 bartlesville Caddesi
es: Avenida bartlesville 8328
vi_translation: I recognized Margo's handwriting: 8328 Bartlesville Avenue.
tr_translation: 8328 Bartlesville Street
es_translation: Bartlesville Avenue 8328

en: I couldn’t put the door back on without beating the pins back into place with the screwdriver, which would have definitely alerted my parents, so I just propped the door on its hinges and kept it all the way open. I pocketed the pins and then went to my computer and looked up a map of 8328 Bartlesville Avenue. I’d never heard of the street.
vi: Tôi không thể lắp cửa mà không nện đinh trở lại chỗ cũ bằng tua-vít, như thế ắt đánh động bố mẹ. Thế nên tôi chỉ cài cánh cửa vào bản lề và cứ để ngỏ. Tôi thả mấy cái đinh vào túi, đến máy tính dò địa chỉ 8328 Đại lộ Bartlesville trên bản đồ. Tôi chưa từng nghe nhắc đến nơi này.
tr: 8328 bartlesville Caddesi Tornavidayla menteşeleri yerine oturtmadan kapıyı yerine koyamazdım, bu kesinlikle ebeveynlerimi alarm durumuna geçirirdi, bu yüzden kapıyı yalnızca menteşelerine dayayıp tamamen açık bıraktım. Bilgisayarıma gidip 8328 Bartlesville Caddesinin haritasını aradım. Bu caddeyi hiç duymamıştım.
es: No podía volver a colocar la puerta en su sitio sin golpear los clavos con el destornillador, lo que seguro que habría alertado a mis padres, así que puse la puerta en las bisagras y la dejé abierta. Me metí los clavos en el bolsillo, fui hasta el ordenador y busqué un plano en el que apareciera el 8328 de la avenida Bartlesville. Nunca había oído hablar de aquella calle.
vi_translation: I can't install the door without hammering the nails back into place with a screwdriver, which would surely alert my parents. So I just hooked the door onto the hinges and left it ajar. I dropped the nails into my pocket, went to the computer to look up 8328 Bartlesville Avenue on the map. I had never heard of this place before.
tr_translation: I couldn't put the door back in place without fitting the hinges with the screwdriver, which would definitely alert my parents, so I just leaned the door against the hinges and left it completely open. I went to my computer and searched for a map of 8328 Bartlesville Street. I had never heard of this street.
es_translation: I couldn't put the door back in place without hitting the nails with the screwdriver, which would surely have alerted my parents, so I put the door on the hinges and left it open. I put the nails in my pocket, went to the computer, and looked for a map that showed 8328 Bartlesville Avenue. I had never heard of that street.

en: It was 34.6 miles away, way the hell out Colonial Drive almost to the town of Christmas, Florida. When I zoomed in on the satellite image of the building, it looked like a black rectangle fronted by dull silver and then grass behind. A mobile home, maybe? It was hard to get a sense of scale, because it was surrounded by so much green.
vi: Chỗ đó cách đây ba mươi tư phẩy sáu dặm, ở cuối Colonial Drive và gần sang thành phố Christmas, bang Floria. Khi tôi phóng to ảnh chụp tòa nhà từ vệ tinh, nó trông như một hình chữ nhật đen, đằng trước màu bàng bạc buồn buồn, đằng sau là cỏ. Một căn nhà di động chăng? Khó có thể hình dung được tỉ lệ vì xung quanh lúp xúp cây cối.
tr: 55. 6 kilometre uzaklıktaydı, ta Colonial Bulvarinda, neredeyse Florida, Christmas Kasabası yakmlanndaydı. Binanın uydu görüntüsüne zum yaptığımda yapı, ön cephesinde mat gümüş bir alan olan, arka cephesi çimenle düzenlenmiş siyah bir dikdörtgen gibi göründü. Bir karavandı belki. Ölçeği anlamak çok zordu çünkü çok fazla yeşille çevrelenmişti.
es: Estaba en el quinto pino, a 55. 5 kilómetros por la autopista Colonial Drive, casi en la ciudad de Christmas, Florida. Cuando amplié el plano en el que aparecía el edificio, parecía un rectángulo negro con una franja plateada delante y hierba detrás. ¿Una casa móvil quizá? Era difícil hacerse una idea de la escala, porque estaba rodeada de verde.
vi_translation: That place is thirty-four point six miles away, at the end of Colonial Drive and near the city of Christmas, Florida. When I zoomed in on the satellite image of the building, it looked like a black rectangle, with a dull silvery front and grass behind it. A mobile home, perhaps? It's hard to gauge the scale because of the surrounding shrubs.
tr_translation: 55. It was 6 kilometers away, all the way on Colonial Boulevard, almost near Florida, in the vicinity of Christmas Town. When I zoomed in on the satellite image of the building, it looked like a black rectangle with a matte silver area on its front facade, and a grass-arranged back facade. Maybe it was a caravan. It was very difficult to understand the scale because it was surrounded by so much greenery.
es_translation: It was in the middle of nowhere, at 55. 5 kilometers along the Colonial Drive highway, almost in the city of Christmas, Florida. When I enlarged the map where the building appeared, it looked like a black rectangle with a silver strip in front and grass behind. A mobile home perhaps? It was difficult to get an idea of the scale because it was surrounded by greenery.

en: I called Ben and told him. “So I was right!” he said. “I can’t wait to tell Lacey, because she totally thought it was a good idea, too!”
vi: Tôi gọi điện cho Ben và kể lại. “Thế là tôi đúng nhá!” nó đắc thắng. “Phải kể ngay với Lacey mới được, vì cậu ấy cũng tuyệt đối tin rằng đó là một suy luận xác đáng.
tr: Ben’i arayıp durumu anlattım. “Yani haklıydım!” dedi. “Lacey’ye söylemek için sabırsızlanıyorum, çünkü o da gerçekten iyi bir fikir olduğunu düşünmüştü!
es: Llamé a Ben para contárselo. —¡Tenía yo razón! —exclamó—. Estoy impaciente por contárselo a Lacey, que también estaba convencida de que era buena idea.
vi_translation: I called Ben and recounted. "So I was right, huh!" he said triumphantly. "I must tell Lacey immediately, because she also absolutely believes that it's a sound deduction."
tr_translation: I called Ben and explained the situation. “So I was right!” he said. “I can't wait to tell Lacey, because she also thought it was a really good idea!”
es_translation: I called Ben to tell him about it. —I was right! —he exclaimed—. I'm eager to tell Lacey, who was also convinced that it was a good idea.

en: I ignored the Lacey comment. “I think I’m gonna go,” I said.
vi: Tôi phớt lờ bình luận về Lacey. “Chắc tôi sẽ đi xem sao,” tôi nói.
tr: Lacey yorumunu duymazlıktan geldim. “Sanırım gideceğim,” dedim.
es: Pasé por alto el comentario sobre Lacey. —Creo que voy a ir —le espeté.
vi_translation: I ignored the comment about Lacey. "I guess I'll go check it out," I said.
tr_translation: I ignored Lacey's comment. “I think I'll go,” I said.
es_translation: I overlooked the comment about Lacey. —I think I'm going to go —I snapped at him.

en: “Well, yeah, of course you’ve gotta go. I’m coming. Let’s go on Sunday morning. I’ll be tired from all-night prom partying, but whatever.”
vi: “Ái chà, ừa, tất nhiên sẽ đi chứ. Tôi cũng đi. Sáng Chủ nhật xuất phát nhé. Vừa tiệc tưng bừng tối hôm trước xong thì chắc cũng bơ phờ, nhưng kệ.
tr: “Şey, evet, tabii ki gitmelisin. Ben de geliyorum. Pazar sabahı gidelim. Bütün gece sürecek balodan yorulmuş olacağım ama olsun.
es: —Sí, claro, por supuesto que tienes que ir. Iré contigo. Podemos ir el domingo por la mañana. Estaré cansado después de haber pasado la noche en el baile, pero no importa.
vi_translation: “Oh wow, yes, of course, I'll go. I'll go too. Let's start on Sunday morning. We'll probably be exhausted after the big party the night before, but who cares.”
tr_translation: “Well, yes, of course you should go. I'm coming too. Let's go on Sunday morning. I will be tired from the ball that will last all night, but it's okay.”
es_translation: —Yes, of course, of course you have to go. I will go with you. We can go on Sunday morning. I will be tired after spending the night at the dance, but it doesn't matter.

en: “No, I mean I’m going tonight,” I said.
vi: “Không, ý tôi là tôi sẽ đi ngay tối nay,” tôi nói.
tr: “Hayır, bu gece gidiyorum demek istedim,” dedim.
es: —No, quiero decir que voy a ir esta noche —le dije.
vi_translation: “No, I mean I will leave tonight,” I said.
tr_translation: “No, I meant to say that I am leaving tonight,” I said.
es_translation: —No, I mean that I am going to go tonight —I told him.

en: “Bro, it’s dark. You can’t go to a strange building with a mysterious address in the dark. Haven’t you ever seen a horror movie?”
vi: “Trời đã tối rồi người anh em ạ. Ông không thể đến một tòa nhà xa lạ với một địa chỉ bí hiểm trong lúc tối lửa tắt đèn được. Ông chưa xem phim kinh dị bao giờ sao?”
tr: “Kardeşim, hava karanlık. Gizemli bir adresi olan, tanımadığın bir binaya karanlıkta gidemezsin. Hiç korku filmi izlemedin mi?
es: —Colega, está oscuro. No puedes ir a oscuras a un edificio que no sabes lo que es y con una dirección misteriosa. ¿Nunca has visto una película de terror?
vi_translation: "It's already dark, my friend. You can't go to a strange building with a mysterious address in the dead of night. Haven't you ever watched a horror movie before?"
tr_translation: “Brother, it is dark outside. You can't go to an unfamiliar building with a mysterious address in the dark. Have you never watched a horror movie?”
es_translation: —Colleague, it's dark. You can't go into a building you don't know in the dark with a mysterious address. Have you never seen a horror movie?

en: “She could be there,” I said.
vi: “Có khả năng Margo đang ở đó,” tôi nói.
tr: “Margo orada olabilir,” dedim.
es: —Quizá Margo esté allí —le dije.
vi_translation: “It's possible that Margo is there,” I said.
tr_translation: “Margo might be there,” I said.
es_translation: —Maybe Margo is there —I told him.

en: “Yeah, and a demon who can only be nourished by the pancreases of young boys could also be there,” he said. “Christ, at least wait till tomorrow, although I’ve got to order her corsage after band, and then I want to be home in case Lacey IM’s, because we’ve been IM’ing a lot—”
vi: “Ừa, cũng có khả năng một thứ quái vật chỉ thích chén tụy của giai trẻ đang ở đó nữa,” Ben thao thao. “Lạy Chúa, ít nhất hãy đợi đến mai, dù sau giờ tập nhạc tôi phải đặt hoa cài áo cho Lacey, và rồi tôi còn muốn ở nhà phòng trường hợp cậu ấy nhắn tin, vì dạo này bọn tôi nhắn tin nhiều vô thiên–”
tr: “Evet, ve yalnızca genç çocukların pankreaslarıyla beslenen bir şeytan da orada olabilir,” dedi. “Tanrım, en azından yarma kadar bekle, gerçi bandodan sonra Lacey’nin süs çiçeğini sipariş etmem lazım, sonra da Lacey’nin internetten bana mesaj atma ihtimaline karşı evde olmak istiyorum çünkü çok fazla mesajlaşıyoruz...
es: —Sí, y también puede estar allí un demonio que se alimenta de páncreas de chavales —me contestó—. Joder, al menos espera a mañana, aunque después del ensayo tengo que ir a encargar el ramo de Lacey y luego quiero quedarme en casa por si entra en el chat, porque últimamente chateamos mucho…
vi_translation: “Yeah, there’s also a possibility that some monster that only likes to feast on the pancreas of young guys is there too,” Ben rambled. “Dear God, at least wait until tomorrow, even though after band practice I have to pin a boutonniere on Lacey, and then I want to stay home in case she texts, because lately we’ve been texting a ton—”
tr_translation: “Yes, and there might also be a demon that feeds only on the pancreases of young children,” he said. “My God, at least wait until noon, although I need to order Lacey's corsage after the band, and then I want to be home in case Lacey messages me online because we text a lot...”
es_translation: —Yes, and there could also be a demon there that feeds on kids' pancreases —he replied to me—. Damn, at least wait until tomorrow, although after rehearsal I have to go order Lacey's bouquet and then I want to stay home in case she logs into the chat, because we've been chatting a lot lately…

en: I cut him off. “No, tonight. I want to see her.” I could feel the circle closing. In an hour, if I hurried, I could be looking at her.
vi: Tôi ngắt lời Ben. “Không, đêm nay. Tôi muốn thấy Margo.” Tôi cảm thấy vòng tròn đang hẹp lại. Trong một tiếng đồng hồ nữa, nếu nhanh chân, có thể tôi sẽ được thấy cô ấy.
tr: Sözünü kestim. “Hayır, bu gece. Onu görmek istiyorum.” Çemberin daraldığını hissedebiliyordum. Eğer acele edersem bir saat içinde ona bakıyor olabilirdim.
es: Lo corté. —No. Esta noche. Quiero verla. Sentía que el círculo empezaba a cerrarse. Si me daba prisa, en una hora podría verla.
vi_translation: I interrupted Ben. "No, tonight." "I want to see Margo." I felt the circle tightening. In another hour, if I hurry, I might get to see her.
tr_translation: I interrupted him. “No, tonight. I want to see him.” I could feel the circle tightening. If I hurried, I could be looking at him within an hour.
es_translation: I cut it. —No. Tonight. I want to see her. I felt that the circle was beginning to close. If I hurried, I could see her in an hour.

en: “Bro, I am not letting you go to some sketchy address in the middle of the night. I will Tase your ass if necessary.”
vi: “Thôi đi bồ tèo, tôi không để ông mò đường đến một địa chỉ mơ hồ trong lúc đêm hôm khuya khoắt đâu. Lằng nhằng nữa là tôi lấy kìm chích điện cho ông một phát ngay mông đó.”
tr: “Kardeşim, gecenin bir yarısı şüpheli bir adrese gitmene izin vermiyorum. Gerekirse kıçına elektrik şoku veririm.
es: —Colega, no voy a dejar que vayas a vete a saber qué dirección en plena noche. Si es necesario, te dispararé en el culo con una Taser para inmovilizarte.
vi_translation: "Come on, buddy, I'm not going to let you wander around to some vague address in the middle of the night." "If you keep messing around, I'll zap you with a stun gun right on your butt."
tr_translation: “Brother, I am not allowing you to go to a suspicious address in the middle of the night. If necessary, I'll give you an electric shock on your butt.”
es_translation: —Colleague, I'm not going to let you go off to who knows where in the middle of the night. If necessary, I'll shoot you in the butt with a Taser to immobilize you.

en: “Tomorrow morning,” I said, mostly to myself. “I’ll just go tomorrow morning.” I was tired of having perfect attendance anyway. Ben was quiet. I heard him blowing air between his front teeth.
vi: “Được rồi, sáng mai vậy,” tôi nói, gần như với chính mình. “Sáng mai sẽ đi.” Dù sao tôi cũng oải cái thành tích chuyên cần hoàn hảo rồi. Ben không nói gì. Tôi nghe thấy tiếng nó huýt gió qua răng cửa.
tr: ‘Yarın sabah,” dedim, daha çok kendi kendime. ‘Yarın sabah gideceğim.” Okula devamlılığımın tam olmasından bıkmıştım nasılsa. Ben sessizdi. On dişlerinden hava üflediğini duydum.
es: —Mañana por la mañana —me dije sobre todo a mí mismo—. Iré mañana por la mañana. De todas formas, estaba cansado de no tener ni una falta de asistencia. Ben no dijo nada. Lo oí resoplar entre dientes.
vi_translation: “Alright, tomorrow morning then,” I said, almost to myself. “We'll go tomorrow morning.” Anyway, I was already tired of my perfect attendance record. Ben didn't say anything. I heard him whistling through his front teeth.
tr_translation: “Tomorrow morning,” I said, more to myself. “I will leave tomorrow morning.” I was tired of my perfect attendance at school anyway. I was silent. I heard him blow air through his teeth.
es_translation: —Tomorrow morning —I said mostly to myself—. I will go tomorrow morning. Anyway, he was tired of not having a single absence. Ben didn't say anything. I heard him snort under his breath.

en: “I do feel a little something coming on,” he said. “Fever. Cough. Aches. Pains.” I smiled. After I hung up, I called Radar.
vi: “Tôi thực sự cảm thấy một chứng bệnh gì đó đang chớm đến,” nó nói. “Sốt. Ho. Đau. Mỏi.” Tôi mỉm cười. Sau khi đặt máy, tôi gọi tiếp cho Radar.
tr: “Bir şeyler kapmışım gibi hissediyorum,” dedi. “Ateş. Öksürük. Ağrılar. Sızılar.” Gülümsedim. Kapattıktan sonra Radar’ı aradım.
es: —Creo que estoy a punto de pillar algo —me comentó—. Fiebre. Tos. Molestias. Dolores. Sonreí. Colgué y llamé a Radar.
vi_translation: “I really feel like some kind of illness is coming on,” it said. “Fever. Cough. Pain. Fatigue.” I smiled. After hanging up, I called Radar.
tr_translation: “I feel like I've caught something,” he said. “Fever. Cough. Pains. Aches.” I smiled. After hanging up, I called Radar.
es_translation: —I think I'm about to catch something —he told me—. Fever. Cough. Discomfort. Pains. I smiled. I hung up and called Radar.

en: “I’m on the other line with Ben,” he said. “Let me call you back.”
vi: “Tôi đang dở với Ben ở một đường dây khác,” Radar nói. “Để tôi gọi lại cho.”
tr: “Diğer hatta Ben’le konuşuyorum,” dedi. “Ben seni geri arayayım.
es: —Estoy hablando con Ben —me dijo—. Ahora te llamo.
vi_translation: “I’m on another line with Ben,” Radar said. “Let me call you back.”
tr_translation: “I am talking to Ben on the other line,” she said. “Let me call you back.”
es_translation: —I am talking to Ben —he told me—. I'll call you back now.

en: He called back a minute later. Before I could even say hello, Radar said, “Q, I’ve got this terrible migraine. There’s no way I can go to school tomorrow.” I laughed.
vi: Một phút sau Radar gọi lại. Tôi chưa kịp chào hỏi gì thì nó đã vào đề, “Q ơi, tôi bị chứng đau nửa đầu trầm kha. Ngày mai không cách gì tôi có thể đi học được.” Tôi cười ngất.
tr: Bir dakika sonra aradı. Ben merhaba bile diyemeden Radar, “Q, şu korkunç migrenim başladı. Yarın okula gidebilmem mümkün değil,” dedi. Güldüm.
es: Me llamó un minuto después. Antes de que hubiera podido saludarlo siquiera, Radar me dijo: —Q, tengo una migraña horrorosa. Imposible que pueda ir a clase mañana. Me reí.
vi_translation: A minute later, Radar called back. I hadn't even had a chance to say hello when he started, "Q, I have a severe migraine. There's no way I can go to school tomorrow." I burst out laughing.
tr_translation: He called a minute later. Before I could even say hello, Radar said, "Q, my terrible migraine has started. It's impossible for me to go to school tomorrow," he said. I laughed.
es_translation: He called me a minute later. Before I could even greet him, Radar said to me: —Q, I have a terrible migraine. It's impossible for me to go to class tomorrow. I laughed.

en: After I got off the phone, I stripped down to T-shirt and boxers, emptied my garbage can into a drawer, and put the can next to the bed. I set my alarm for the ungodly hour of six in the morning, and spent the next few hours trying in vain to fall asleep.
vi: Gác điện thoại, tôi cởi bớt quần áo, chỉ còn áo phông và quần cộc. Tôi đổ rác trong thùng vào hộc bàn, và đặt thùng rác cạnh giường. Tôi đặt chuông báo thức vào thời điểm không chút thánh thiện nào, sáu giờ sáng. Mấy tiếng tiếp theo tôi cố công vô ích vì không tài nào ngủ được.
tr: Telefonu kapattıktan sonra, soyunup tişört ve boxer’la kaldım, çöp kutumu bir çekmeceye boşaltıp kutuyu yatağın yanma koydum. Alarmımı lanet olasıca bir erken saate, altıya ayarladım ve sonraki birkaç saatimi boş yere uyumaya çalışarak geçirdim.
es: Después de colgar, me quedé en camiseta y calzoncillos, vacié la papelera en un cajón y la dejé al lado de la cama. Puse la alarma a una hora intempestiva, las seis de la mañana, y pasé las horas siguientes intentando en vano quedarme dormido.
vi_translation: Hanging up the phone, I took off some clothes, leaving only a t-shirt and shorts. I emptied the trash bin into the desk drawer and placed the trash bin next to the bed. I set the alarm clock to an ungodly hour, six in the morning. The next few hours I spent in vain, unable to sleep.
tr_translation: After hanging up the phone, I stripped down to a t-shirt and boxers, emptied my trash can into a drawer, and placed the can next to the bed. I set my alarm for a damn early hour, six o'clock, and spent the next few hours trying to sleep in vain.
es_translation: After hanging up, I stayed in my t-shirt and underwear, emptied the trash can into a drawer, and left it next to the bed. I set the alarm for an ungodly hour, six in the morning, and spent the following hours trying in vain to fall asleep.

en: Mom came into my room the next morning and said, “You didn’t even close the door last night, sleepyhead,” and I opened my eyes and said, “I think I have a stomach bug.” And then I motioned toward the trash can, which contained puke.
vi: Sáng hôm sau mẹ vào phòng tôi và bảo, “Hôm qua con còn chẳng buồn đóng cửa phòng nữa hả sâu ngủ?” Tôi mở mắt đáp, “Bụng con khó chịu quá mẹ,” và nhích người ra phía cái thùng rác giờ đang chứa đám ói của tôi.
tr: Ertesi sabah annem odama girdi ve “Dün gece kapıyı bile kapatmadın, uykucu,” dedi, gözlerimi açıp, “Sanırım yediğim bir şeyden zehirlendim,” dedim. Sonra içinde kusmuk olan çöp kutusunu işaret ettim.
es: A la mañana siguiente mi madre entró en mi habitación. —Ayer noche ni siquiera cerraste la puerta, dormilón —me dijo. Abrí los ojos. —Creo que tengo gastroenteritis —le contesté. Y me acerqué a la papelera, que contenía vómitos.
vi_translation: The next morning, my mother came into my room and said, "Yesterday, you didn't even bother to close your door, did you, sleepyhead?" I opened my eyes and replied, "My stomach hurts too much, Mom," and shifted towards the trash can now holding my vomit.
tr_translation: The next morning, my mother entered my room and said, "You didn't even close the door last night, sleepyhead." I opened my eyes and said, "I think I got food poisoning from something I ate." Then I pointed to the trash can with vomit in it.
es_translation: The next morning my mother entered my room. —Last night you didn't even close the door, sleepyhead —he told me. I opened my eyes. —I think I have gastroenteritis —I replied to him. And I approached the trash can, which contained vomit.

en: “Quentin! Oh, goodness. When did this happen?”
vi: “Quentin! Ôi trời ơi! Con thấy khó chịu từ khi nào?”
tr: “Quentin! Ah, Tanrım. Ne zaman oldu bu?
es: —¡Quentin! Vaya por Dios. ¿Cuándo ha sido?
vi_translation: "Quentin! Oh my God! Since when have you been feeling unwell?"
tr_translation: “Quentin! Oh, my God. When did this happen?”
es_translation: —Quentin! Good heavens. When did it happen?

en: “About six,” I said, which was true.
vi: “Từ khoảng sáu giờ ạ,” tôi đáp, đúng thế thật.
tr: “Altı gibi,” dedim ki bu doğruydu.
es: —Hacia las seis —le contesté, y era verdad.
vi_translation: “Since around six o'clock,” I replied, and it was indeed true.
tr_translation: “Around six,” I said, which was true.
es_translation: —Around six —I answered, and it was true.

en: “Why didn’t you come get us?”
vi: “Sao không gọi bố mẹ?”
tr: “Niye bize gelmedin?
es: —¿Por qué no nos has avisado?
vi_translation: “Why not call your parents?”
tr_translation: "Why didn't you come to us?"
es_translation: —Why didn't you let us know?

en: “Too tired,” I said, which was also true.
vi: “Con mệt quá ạ,” tôi đáp, lại đúng thế thật.
tr: “Çok yorgundum,” dedim ki bu da doğruydu.
es: —Estaba agotado —le dije, y también era verdad.
vi_translation: "I'm so tired," I replied, and it was true.
tr_translation: “I was very tired,” I said, which was also true.
es_translation: —I was exhausted —I told him, and it was also true.

en: “You just woke up feeling ill?” she asked.
vi: “Khó chịu quá nên con không ngủ được à?” mẹ rối rít.
tr: “Hasta hissederek mi uyandın?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Te has despertado porque te encontrabas mal? —me preguntó.
vi_translation: "Is it too uncomfortable for you to sleep?" mother asked anxiously.
tr_translation: "Did you wake up feeling sick?" he asked.
es_translation: —Did you wake up because you were feeling unwell? —he asked me.

en: “Yeah,” I said, which was untrue. I woke up because my alarm went off at six, and then I snuck into the kitchen and ate a granola bar and some orange juice. Ten minutes later, I stuck two fingers down my throat. I didn’t want to do it the night before because I didn’t want it stinking the room up all night. The puking sucked, but it was over quickly.
vi: “Vâng,” điều này thì không đúng. Tôi thức dậy vì đồng hồ réo sáu giờ, rồi tôi rón rén vào bếp, ăn một thanh ngũ cốc và uống ít nước cam. Mười phút sau, tôi móc hai ngón tay vào họng. Tôi không muốn làm vậy từ đêm vì sợ món ói bốc mùi khắp phòng cả đêm. Màn nôn ọe khá rùng rợn nhưng cũng qua nhanh thôi.
tr: “Evet,” dedim ki bu doğru değildi. Alarmım altıda çalmaya başladığı için uyanmış, sonra gizlice mutfağa gidip bir tahıllı gofret yiyip portakal suyu içmiştim. On dakika sonra boğazıma iki parmağımı sokmuştum. Bunu önceki gece yapmak istememiştim çünkü bütün gece odayı kokutsun istemiyordum. Kusmak berbattı ama çabucak bitmişti.
es: —Sí —le contesté, y esa vez no era verdad. Me había despertado porque la alarma había sonado a las seis, luego entré sigilosamente en la cocina, me comí una barrita de cereales y me bebí un vaso de zumo de naranja. A los diez minutos me metí dos dedos en la garganta. No lo había hecho antes de meterme en la cama porque no quería que la habitación apestara toda la noche. Echar la papa era una mierda, pero fue un momento.
vi_translation: “Yes,” this is not correct. I woke up because the alarm clock rang at six o'clock, then I tiptoed into the kitchen, ate a cereal bar, and drank some orange juice. Ten minutes later, I stuck two fingers down my throat. I didn't want to do that at night because I was afraid the vomit would smell up the room all night. The vomiting was quite horrifying but it passed quickly.
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said, which wasn't true. Since my alarm started ringing at six, I had woken up, then secretly went to the kitchen to eat a cereal bar and drink orange juice. Ten minutes later, I had stuck two fingers down my throat. I didn't want to do it the night before because I didn't want the room to smell all night. Vomiting was awful but it was over quickly.
es_translation: —Yes —I replied, and this time it wasn't true. I had woken up because the alarm had gone off at six, then I stealthily entered the kitchen, ate a cereal bar, and drank a glass of orange juice. Ten minutes later, I stuck two fingers down my throat. I hadn't done it before getting into bed because I didn't want the room to stink all night. Throwing up was awful, but it was over quickly.

en: Mom took the bucket, and I could hear her cleaning it out in the kitchen. She returned with a fresh bucket, her lips pouting with worry. “Well, I feel like I should take the day—” she started, but I cut her off.
vi: Mẹ mang thùng rác đi, tôi nghe thấy tiếng mẹ cọ rửa nó trong bếp. Mẹ quay lại với cái thùng sạch, môi bặm lại đầy lo lắng. “Thế này có lẽ mẹ nên nghỉ một hôm–” mẹ chưa nói hết tôi đã lập tức can luôn.
tr: Annem kovayı götürdü, mutfakta temizlediğini duyabiliyordum. Temiz kovayla geri döndü, dudakları endişeyle bükülmüştü. “Peki, izin almam gerekiyormuş gibi...” diye başladı ama sözünü kestim.
es: Mi madre se llevó la papelera y la oí limpiándola en la cocina. Volvió con la papelera limpia. Frunció los labios preocupada. —Bueno, creo que tendré que tomarme el día… —empezó a decir, pero la corté.
vi_translation: Mom took the trash can away, I heard her scrubbing it in the kitchen. Mom returned with the clean can, her lips pressed together in worry. "Maybe I should take a day off–" she hadn't finished speaking when I immediately interrupted.
tr_translation: My mother took the bucket away, I could hear her cleaning it in the kitchen. She returned with the clean bucket, her lips pursed with worry. “Well, as if I needed permission...” she began, but I interrupted her.
es_translation: My mother took the wastebasket and I heard her cleaning it in the kitchen. She returned with the clean wastebasket. She pursed her lips worriedly. —Well, I think I'll have to take the day off... —he started to say, but I cut him off.

en: “I’m honestly fine,” I said. “Just queasy. Something I ate.”
vi: “Thực sự con không sao đâu ạ. Chỉ hơi muốn ói. Chắc con ăn phải cái gì đấy.”
tr: “Sahiden iyiyim,” dedim. “Sadece midem bulanıyor. Yediğim bir şeyden.
es: —Estoy bien, de verdad —le dije—. Solo tengo el estómago revuelto. Algo me habrá sentado mal.
vi_translation: "I'm really fine, Dad. Just feeling a bit nauseous. Probably ate something bad."
tr_translation: “I'm really fine,” I said. “It's just that my stomach is upset. From something I ate.”
es_translation: —I'm fine, really —I told him—. I just have an upset stomach. Something must have disagreed with me.

en: “Are you sure?”
vi: “Con chắc là không sao chứ?”
tr: “Emin misin?
es: —¿Estás seguro?
vi_translation: "Are you sure you're okay?"
tr_translation: “Are you sure?”
es_translation: —Are you sure?

en: “I’ll call if it gets worse,” I said. She kissed my forehead. I could feel her sticky lipstick on my skin. I wasn’t really sick, but still, somehow she’d made me feel better.
vi: “Nếu thấy khó chịu hơn thì con sẽ gọi điện ạ,” tôi nói. Mẹ hôn lên trán tôi, lớp son của mẹ dinh dính trên da tôi. Thực ra tôi không ốm đau gì sất, nhưng gì thì gì, mẹ đã khiến tôi thấy khá hơn.
tr: “Kötüleşirsem ararım,” dedim. Alnımdan öptü. Tenimde yapışkan rujunu hissedebiliyordum. Gerçekten hasta değildim ama yine de bir şekilde beni daha iyi hissettirmeyi başarmıştı.
es: —Te llamaré si me encuentro peor —le dije. Me dio un beso en la frente. Sentí en la piel el pintalabios pegajoso. Aunque en realidad no estaba enfermo, por alguna razón hizo que me sintiera mejor.
vi_translation: "If I feel worse, I'll call," I said. Mom kissed my forehead, her lipstick sticky on my skin. Actually, I wasn't sick at all, but regardless, Mom made me feel better.
tr_translation: “If I get worse, I'll call,” I said. She kissed me on the forehead. I could feel her sticky lipstick on my skin. I wasn't really sick, but somehow she had still managed to make me feel better.
es_translation: —I will call you if I feel worse —I told him. He gave me a kiss on the forehead. I felt the sticky lipstick on my skin. Although I wasn't really sick, for some reason it made me feel better.

en: “Do you want me to close the door?” she asked, one hand on it. The door clung to its hinges, but only barely.
vi: “Con muốn mẹ đóng cửa phòng không?” mẹ hỏi, một tay đặt lên cửa. Cánh cửa vẫn chỉ đang cài hờ vào bản lề.
tr: “Kapıyı kapatmamı ister misin?” diye sordu bir eli kapıdayken. Kapı menteşelerine tutunuyordu ama zar zor.
es: —¿Quieres que cierre la puerta? —me preguntó alargando la mano hacia ella. La puerta se mantuvo en las bisagras, pero por poco.
vi_translation: "Do you want me to close the door?" Mom asked, one hand on the door. The door was still just loosely hanging on its hinges.
tr_translation: "Do you want me to close the door?" he asked while one hand was on the door. The door was holding onto its hinges, but barely.
es_translation: —Do you want me to close the door? —he asked me, reaching out his hand towards it. The door stayed on the hinges, but barely.

en: “No no no,” I said, perhaps too nervously.
vi: “Đừng, đừng, mẹ đừng đóng ạ,” tôi lắp bắp, chắc tại căng thẳng quá.
tr: “Yo yo, hayır,” dedim, sanırım fazla gergin bir halde.
es: —No no no —le dije, quizá demasiado nervioso.
vi_translation: "Don't, don't, mom, please don't close it," I stammered, probably because I was too nervous.
tr_translation: “No no, no,” I said, I think in a rather tense state.
es_translation: —No no no —I said, perhaps too nervously.

en: “Okay,” she said. “I’ll call school on my way to work. You let me know if you need anything. Anything. Or if you want me to come home. And you can always call Dad. And I’ll check up on you this afternoon, okay?”
vi: “Được rồi,” mẹ nói. “Trên đường đi làm mẹ sẽ gọi điện đến trường cho con. Cần gì thì con báo với mẹ ngay nghe chưa? Bất cứ cái gì. Hoặc nếu muốn mẹ về nhé. Mới cả gọi cho bố bất cứ lúc nào cũng được. Chiều mẹ sẽ gọi về xem tình hình thế nào nhé.”
tr: “Tamam,” dedi. “İşe giderken okulu arayacağım. Eğer bir şeye ihtiyacın olursa bana haber ver. Ne olursa. Ya da eve gelmemi istersen. Ye her zaman babanı arayabilirsin. Öğleden sonra seni kontrol edeceğim, tamam mı?
es: —Vale —me contestó—. Llamaré al instituto de camino al trabajo. Si necesitas algo, llámame. Lo que sea. O si quieres que vuelva a casa. Y siempre puedes llamar a papá. Y vendré a echarte un vistazo esta tarde, ¿vale?
vi_translation: “Alright,” mom said. “On my way to work, I'll call the school for you. If you need anything, let me know immediately, okay? Anything at all. Or if you want me to come home, just say so. And you can call dad anytime as well. I'll call in the afternoon to check how things are going, alright?”
tr_translation: “Okay,” he said. “I will call the school on my way to work. If you need anything, let me know. Whatever it is. Or if you want me to come home. You can always call your dad. I will check on you in the afternoon, okay?”
es_translation: —Okay —he answered me—. I'll call the institute on my way to work. If you need anything, call me. Whatever it is. Or if you want me to come back home. And you can always call dad. And I'll come to check on you this afternoon, okay?

en: I nodded, and then pulled the covers back up to my chin. Even though the bucket had been cleaned, I could smell the puke underneath the detergent, and the smell of it reminded me of the act of puking, which for some reason made me want to puke again, but I just took slow, even mouth breaths until I heard the Chrysler backing down the driveway. It was 7:32. For once, I thought, I would be on time. Not to school, admittedly. But still.
vi: Tôi gật đầu rồi kéo chăn kín tới tận cằm. Dù cái thùng rác đã sạch, nhưng tôi vẫn ngửi thấy mùi ói thoang thoảng lẫn trong mùi xà phòng, khiến tôi nhớ lại màn nôn ọe trước đấy, và chả hiểu sao khiến tôi muốn ói thêm. Nhưng tôi chỉ thở từ từ, thậm chí há miệng ra thở cho đến khi nghe thấy tiếng chiếc Chrysler lùi xa khỏi nhà. Đồng hồ chỉ 7:32. Ít nhất lúc này, tôi nghĩ mình sẽ đúng giờ. Không phải đúng giờ vào lớp, phải thừa nhận là vậy. Nhưng vẫn là đúng giờ.
tr: Başımı salladım ve çarşafı tekrar çeneme doğru çektim. Kova temizlenmiş olmasına rağmen, deterjanın altından kusmuğun kokusunu alabiliyordum, her nedense kokusu bana tekrar kusmak istememe sebep olan, kusma eylemini hatırlattı ama Chrysler’m garaj yolundan geri geri gittiğini duyana kadar, ağzımdan daha yavaş nefes aldım. Saat 07:32’ydi. İlk defa diye düşündüm, vaktinde gidebilirdim. Okula değil, kuşkusuz. Ama yine de.
es: Asentí y tiré de las mantas hasta la barbilla. Aunque la papelera estaba limpia, seguía llegándome el olor a vómito bajo el detergente, y ese olor me recordaba al acto de vomitar, que por alguna razón me dio ganas de volver a vomitar, pero respiré despacio por la boca hasta que oí el Chrysler retrocediendo por el camino. Eran las 7:32. Pensé que por una vez no me retrasaría. No para ir al instituto, lo admito. Pero aun así.
vi_translation: I nodded and then pulled the blanket up to my chin. Even though the trash can was clean, I could still smell a faint odor of vomit mixed with the scent of soap, which reminded me of the earlier vomiting episode, and for some reason, made me want to vomit again. But I just breathed slowly, even opening my mouth to breathe until I heard the sound of the Chrysler backing away from the house. The clock showed 7:32. At least for now, I thought I would be on time. Not exactly on time for class, have to admit that. But still on time.
tr_translation: I nodded my head and pulled the sheet back up to my chin. Even though the bucket had been cleaned, I could still smell the vomit beneath the detergent, for some reason the smell reminded me of the act of vomiting, making me want to vomit again, but I breathed more slowly until I heard the Chrysler backing out of the driveway. It was 07:32. For the first time, I thought, I could leave on time. Not to school, of course. But still.
es_translation: I nodded and pulled the blankets up to my chin. Although the trash can was clean, I could still smell vomit beneath the detergent, and that smell reminded me of the act of vomiting, which for some reason made me want to vomit again, but I breathed slowly through my mouth until I heard the Chrysler backing down the driveway. It was 7:32. I thought that for once I wouldn't be late. Not for going to school, I admit. But still.

en: I showered and brushed my teeth and put on dark jeans and a plain black T-shirt. I put Margo’s scrap of newspaper in my pocket. I hammered the pins back into their hinges, and then packed. I didn’t really know what to throw into my backpack, but I included the doorjamb-opening screwdriver, a printout of the satellite map, directions, a bottle of water, and in case she was there, the Whitman. I wanted to ask her about it.
vi: Tôi tắm, đánh răng, tròng vào người cái quần jeans tối màu và áo phông đen tuyền, nhét mẩu báo của Margo vào túi quần. Tôi đóng đinh lại vào bản lề, rồi chuẩn bị lên đường. Tôi không chắc nên bỏ những gì vào ba-lô, nhưng có cái tua-vít để tháo thanh dọc khung cửa, bản in tấm bản đồ chụp từ vệ tinh, những hướng dẫn, chai nước, và cuốn thơ Whitman, phòng khi Margo ở đó. Tôi muốn hỏi cô ấy về tập thơ đó.
tr: Duş alıp dişlerimi fırçaladım ve koyu renk kot pantolonum ile düz siyah bir tişört giydim. Margo’nun gazete parçasım cebime koydum. Menteşeleri yerlerine çaktım ve toplandım. Sırt çantama ne atmam gerektiğini tam olarak bilmiyordum ama kapı kasası açan tornavidayı, uydu haritasının çıktısını, yol tarifini, bir şişe suyu ve Margo’nun orada olma ihtimaline karşı Whitman’ı ekledim. Kitap hakkında ona soru sormak istiyordum.
es: Me duché, me lavé los dientes y me puse unos vaqueros oscuros y una camiseta negra. Me metí el trozo de papel de periódico en el bolsillo. Coloqué los clavos en las bisagras y preparé la mochila. La verdad es que no sabía qué meter, pero incluí el destornillador para abrir puertas, una copia del plano, indicaciones para llegar, una botella de agua y el libro de Whitman, por si estaba allí. Quería hacerle algunas preguntas.
vi_translation: I showered, brushed my teeth, slipped into a pair of dark jeans and a plain black t-shirt, and tucked Margo's newspaper clipping into my pocket. I nailed the hinge back in place, then got ready to hit the road. I wasn't sure what to pack in my backpack, but I had a screwdriver to remove the door frame's vertical bar, a printed satellite map, directions, a water bottle, and a book of Whitman's poetry, just in case Margo was there. I wanted to ask her about that poetry book.
tr_translation: I took a shower, brushed my teeth, and put on my dark jeans and a plain black t-shirt. I put Margo's piece of newspaper in my pocket. I hammered the hinges into place and got ready. I wasn't exactly sure what to pack in my backpack, but I added a screwdriver for opening door frames, a printout of the satellite map, the directions, a bottle of water, and Whitman in case Margo was there. I wanted to ask her questions about the book.
es_translation: I took a shower, brushed my teeth, and put on some dark jeans and a black t-shirt. I slipped the piece of newspaper into my pocket. I placed the nails in the hinges and prepared the backpack. The truth is, I didn't know what to pack, but I included the screwdriver to open doors, a copy of the map, directions to get there, a bottle of water, and the Whitman book, just in case it was there. I wanted to ask him some questions.

en: Ben and Radar showed up at eight on the dot. I got in the backseat. They were shouting along to a song by the Mountain Goats.
vi: Ben và Radar có mặt lúc tám giờ đúng, không sớm không muộn một tích tắc nào. Tôi ngồi ở ghế sau. Hai thằng đang hát ông ổng theo một bài của ban nhạc Mountain Goats.
tr: Ben ile Radar dakikası dakikasına saat sekizde geldiler. Arka koltuğa oturdum. Mountain Goats’un bir şarkısına bağırarak eşlik ediyorlardı.
es: Ben y Radar aparecieron a las ocho en punto. Me senté en el asiento de atrás. Iban cantando a gritos una canción de los Mountain Goats.
vi_translation: Ben and Radar arrived at exactly eight o'clock, not a second early or late. I sat in the back seat. The two of them were loudly singing along to a song by the band Mountain Goats.
tr_translation: Ben and Radar arrived exactly at eight o'clock. I sat in the back seat. They were shouting along to a song by the Mountain Goats.
es_translation: Ben and Radar showed up at eight o'clock sharp. I sat in the back seat. They were loudly singing a song by the Mountain Goats.

en: Ben turned around and offered me his fist. I punched it softly, even though I hated that greeting. “Q!” he shouted over the music. “How good does this feel?”
vi: Ben quay xuống và chìa nắm tay ra với tôi. Tôi khẽ đấm lại, dù không thích kiểu chào hỏi đó. “Q!” nó hét toáng át tiếng nhạc. “Thấy trò này bá cháy đến chừng nào?”
tr: Ben arkasını dönüp yumruğunu bana doğru uzattı. Bu selamlamadan nefret etmeme rağmen hafifçe yumrukladım. “Q!” diye bağırdı müziği bastırarak. “Bu ne kadar iyi hissettiriyor, değil mi?
es: Ben se giró y me tendió el puño. Le di un puñetazo suave, aunque odiaba esa forma de saludar. —¡Q! —gritó por encima de la música—. ¿Qué te parece?
vi_translation: Ben turned around and extended his fist towards me. I lightly bumped it back, even though I didn't like that way of greeting. "Q!" he shouted, drowning out the music. "How awesome is this game?"
tr_translation: He turned his back and extended his fist towards me. Even though I hated this greeting, I lightly bumped his fist. “Q!” he shouted, overpowering the music. “Doesn't this feel so good?”
es_translation: Ben turned around and extended his fist to me. I gave him a gentle punch, even though I hated that way of greeting. —Q! —he shouted over the music—. What do you think?

en: And I knew exactly what Ben meant: he meant listening to the Mountain Goats with your friends in a car that runs on a Wednesday morning in May on the way to Margo and whatever Margotastic prize came with finding her. “It beats calculus,” I answered. The music was too loud for us to talk. Once we got out of Jefferson Park, we rolled down the one window that worked so the world would know we had good taste in music.
vi: Tôi hiểu chính xác Ben muốn nói gì: nghe nhạc của Mountain Goats cùng các chiến hữu trong một cái xe đang bon bon vào một sáng thứ Tư, tháng Năm, trên cung đường dẫn đến Margo, và bất cứ giải thưởng tuyệt-như-Margo nào nếu tìm thấy cô ấy. “Bá cháy hơn món giải tích,” tôi đáp. Nhạc to rộn rã nên khó nói chuyện với nhau. Ra khỏi khu Jefferson Park, chúng tôi hạ một tấm kính cửa sổ còn hoạt động xuống để thiên hạ biết rằng chúng tôi nghe nhạc có gu ra sao.
tr: Ben’in ne demek istediğini çok iyi anlıyordum: Mayısta, bir çarşamba sabahı Margo’ya ve onu bulmakla her ne Margosal ödül kazanılacaksa ona doğru giden bir arabada arkadaşlarınla Mountain Goats dinlemeyi kastediyordu. “Matematiği yener,” diye cevap verdim. Müzik konuşamayacağımız kadar yüksekti. Jefferson Park’tan çıktığımız anda, dünya müzik zevkimizin iyi olduğunu öğrensin diye bozuk olmayan tek pencereyi aşağı indirdik.
es: Supe exactamente lo que quería decir. Se refería a escuchar a los Mountain Goats con tus amigos en un coche, la mañana de un miércoles de mayo, en busca de Margo y del margotástico premio que supusiera encontrarla. —Nada que ver con cálculo —le contesté. La música estaba demasiado alta para hablar. En cuanto salimos de Jefferson Park, bajamos la única ventanilla que funcionaba para que el mundo supiera que teníamos buen gusto musical.
vi_translation: I understand exactly what Ben means: listening to Mountain Goats music with comrades in a car cruising on a Wednesday morning in May, on the road leading to Margo, and any award as awesome-as-Margo if we find her. "Way cooler than calculus," I respond. The music is loud and lively, making it hard to talk to each other. Leaving the Jefferson Park area, we roll down a functioning window so that people know we have great taste in music.
tr_translation: I understood very well what Ben meant: In May, on a Wednesday morning, he was referring to listening to Mountain Goats with your friends in a car heading towards Margo and whatever Margoesque prize would be won by finding her. "It beats math," I replied. The music was too loud for us to talk. As soon as we left Jefferson Park, we rolled down the only window that wasn't broken so the world could learn that our taste in music was good.
es_translation: I knew exactly what he meant. He was referring to listening to the Mountain Goats with your friends in a car, on a Wednesday morning in May, in search of Margo and the fantastic prize that finding her would entail. —Nothing to do with calculus —I replied to him. The music was too loud to talk. As soon as we left Jefferson Park, we rolled down the only window that worked so the world would know we had good musical taste.

en: We drove all the way out Colonial Drive, past the movie theaters and the bookstores that I had been driving to and past my whole life. But this drive was different and better because it occurred during calculus, because it occurred with Ben and Radar, because it occurred on our way to where I believed I would find her. And finally, after twenty miles, Orlando gave way to the last remaining orange tree groves and undeveloped ranches—the endlessly flat land grown over thick with brush, the Spanish moss hanging off the branches of oak trees, still in the windless heat. This was the Florida where I used to spend mosquito-bitten, armadillo-chasing nights as a Boy Scout. The road was dominated now by pickup trucks, and every mile or so you could see a subdivision off the highway—little streets winding for no reason around houses that rose up out of nothing like a volcano of vinyl siding.
vi: Bọn tôi chạy dọc Colonial Drive, qua những rạp chiếu phim và hiệu sách mà tôi đã ghé qua ghé lại cả đời mình. Nhưng chuyến đi này khác và khoái hơn nhiều, vì hành trình diễn ra trùng giờ môn giải tích, vì đồng hành cùng Ben và Radar, vì chúng tôi đang trên đường tới nơi tôi tin mình sẽ tìm thấy Margo. Và rút cục, sau hai chục dặm, thành phố Orlando nhường chỗ cho những trảng cam cuối cùng và những nông trang còn ban sơ–mặt đất bằng phẳng trải ra ngút ngàn, dày lên dưới lớp cây bụi, thiết lan bám trên những cành sồi, tự tại buông xuống trong cái nóng không một gợn gió. Đây là Florida mà tôi từng trải qua những đêm đuổi bắt con ta-tu, bị muỗi đốt chi chít, từ hồi còn là cậu nhóc hướng đạo sinh. Trên đường lúc này toàn xe bán tải, đi chừng một dặm lại gặp một tiểu khu nằm cách đường cao tốc–những phố nhỏ ngoằn ngoèo chẳng vì lí do gì, chạy quanh những căn nhà mọc lên giữa đồng không mông quạnh, như một ngọn núi lửa bọc chất dẻo vậy.
tr: Hayatım boyunca arabayla önlerinden geçtiğim sinema salonları ile kitapçıları geçerek, Colonial Bulvarına doğru devam ettik. Ama bu seferki daha farklı ve iyiydi çünkü matematik dersi sırasında gerçekleşiyordu, çünkü Radar ve Ben’le gerçekleşiyordu, çünkü Margo’yu bulacağıma inandığım yere giderken gerçekleşiyordu. Nihayet yaklaşık otuz beş kilometre sonra Orlando, kalan son portakal ağaçlarına ve gelişmemiş çiftliklere yol verdi... bu sonsuz düz arazi çalılıklarla örtülmüştü, meşe ağaçlarının dallarından, rüzgârsız sıcak havada hareketsiz duran parazitimsi bitkiler sarkıyordu. Bu, benim genç bir izciyken armadillo peşinde sinek ısırıklı geceler geçirdiğim Florida’ydı işte. Şimdi caddeye pikaplar hâkimdi ve her kilometrede, anayoldan ayrılan bir semt görmek mümkündü... hiçlikten tıpkı izolasyonlu cephelerden oluşan bir volkan gibi yükselen evleri sebepsiz yere saran dar sokaklar.
es: Avanzamos por la Colonial Drive y dejamos atrás los cines y las librerías por las que había pasado toda mi vida. Pero esa vez era diferente y mejor, porque era a la hora de cálculo, porque estaba con Ben y con Radar y porque íbamos de camino hacia el lugar en el que creía que encontraría a Margo. Y al final, después de treinta kilómetros, Orlando dio paso a los últimos campos de naranjos y a ranchos no urbanizados: la interminable llanura toda cubierta de matorrales, el musgo negro colgando de las ramas de los robles, inmóvil en la cálida mañana sin viento. Era la Florida en la que había pasado noches acribillado por los mosquitos y cazando armadillos cuando era boy scout. La carretera iba llena de furgonetas, y cada dos kilómetros, más o menos, se veía una salida de la autopista: pequeñas calles que serpenteaban caprichosamente alrededor de casas surgidas de la nada, como un volcán cubierto de plástico.
vi_translation: We ran along Colonial Drive, past the movie theaters and bookstores that I had frequented my entire life. But this trip was different and much more enjoyable, because the journey took place during calculus class, because I was accompanied by Ben and Radar, because we were on our way to where I believed I would find Margo. And finally, after twenty miles, the city of Orlando gave way to the last orange groves and the still-untouched farms—the flat land stretching endlessly, thickening under the brush, Spanish moss clinging to the oak branches, freely hanging down in the windless heat. This is the Florida where I spent nights chasing armadillos, getting bitten all over by mosquitoes, back when I was a Boy Scout. On the road now were only pickup trucks, and every mile or so, there was a small subdivision off the highway—winding little streets for no reason, circling around houses that sprang up in the middle of nowhere, like a plastic-coated volcano.
tr_translation: Throughout my life, we passed by the movie theaters and bookstores that I had driven past countless times, continuing towards Colonial Boulevard. But this time it was different and better because it was happening during math class, because it was happening with Radar and Ben, because it was happening while I was heading to the place where I believed I would find Margo. Finally, after about thirty-five kilometers, Orlando gave way to the last remaining orange groves and undeveloped farms... this endless flat land was covered with shrubs, parasitic plants hanging motionless in the windless hot air from the branches of oak trees. This was the Florida where I had spent mosquito-bitten nights chasing armadillos as a young scout. Now the street was dominated by pickup trucks, and every kilometer, it was possible to see a neighborhood branching off from the main road... narrow streets inexplicably surrounding houses that rose from nothing like a volcano made of insulated facades.
es_translation: We advanced along Colonial Drive and left behind the cinemas and bookstores that I had passed by all my life. But this time it was different and better, because it was during calculus hour, because I was with Ben and Radar, and because we were on our way to the place where I believed I would find Margo. And in the end, after thirty kilometers, Orlando gave way to the last orange groves and undeveloped ranches: the endless plain all covered with shrubs, the black moss hanging from the branches of the oaks, motionless in the warm, windless morning. It was the Florida where I had spent nights being bitten by mosquitoes and hunting armadillos when I was a boy scout. The road was full of vans, and every two kilometers or so, there was an exit from the highway: small streets that whimsically wound around houses that appeared out of nowhere, like a volcano covered in plastic.

en: Farther out we passed a rotting wooden sign that said GROVE-POINT ACRES. A cracked blacktop road lasted only a couple hundred feet before dead-ending into an expanse of gray dirt, signaling that Grovepoint Acres was what my mom called a pseudovision—a subdivision abandoned before it could be completed.
