tr_translation: He sat at his desk and motioned for me to sit as well. "He never attended my class," said Dr. Holden, "but I definitely heard about him. I know he ran away from home."
es_translation: He sat at his table and indicated with a gesture that I should sit as well. —I've never had her in class —Dr. Holden replied to me—, but I've heard of her, of course. I know she has escaped.

en: “She sort of left me this book of poems before she, uh, disappeared.” I handed the book over, and Dr. Holden began paging through it slowly. As she did, I told her, “I’ve been thinking a lot about the highlighted parts. If you go to the end of ‘Song of Myself,’ she highlights this stuff about dying. Like, ‘If you want me again look for me under your bootsoles.’”
vi: “Bạn ấy để lại cho em cuốn sách này trước khi bạn ấy, ơ, biến mất ạ.” Tôi đưa cuốn sách ra, cô Holden bắt đầu từ tốn giở từng trang. Trong khi đó, tôi nói tiếp, “Em đã nghĩ nhiều đến những đoạn được đánh dấu. Nếu cô xem đến phần cuối bài ‘Tự khúc’, sẽ thấy Margo đánh dấu những câu thơ về cái chết. Như câu ‘Nếu ngươi muốn ta, hãy tìm ta dưới đế ủng’ ạ.”
tr: “Bu şiir kitabım bana bıraktı sayılır, şey, ortadan kaybolmadan önce.” Kitabı ona uzattım ve dr Holden yavaşça sayfaları çevirmeye başladı. Çevirirken konuşmaya devam ettim. “Altı çizili bölümler hakkında çok fazla düşündüm. Kendi Şarkım’m sonuna giderseniz, ölmekle ilgili şu şeylerin altını çizmiş. Şey gibi: ‘Eğer tekrar istiyorsan, tabanlarının altında ara beni.
es: —Bueno, me dejó este libro de poemas antes de… desaparecer. Le tendí el libro, y la doctora Holden empezó a hojearlo despacio. Mientras pasaba las páginas le dije: —He dado muchas vueltas a los versos marcados. Al final del «Canto de mí mismo» señala eso sobre la muerte. Eso de «Si quieres encontrarte conmigo, búscame bajo la suela de tus zapatos».
vi_translation: “She left me this book before she, uh, disappeared.” I handed over the book, and Ms. Holden began to slowly turn each page. Meanwhile, I continued, “I’ve thought a lot about the highlighted passages. If you look at the end of the poem ‘Song of Myself,’ you’ll see that Margo highlighted the lines about death. Like the line ‘If you want me, look for me under your boot-soles.’”
tr_translation: “This poetry book was left to me, well, before disappearing.” I handed the book to him and Dr. Holden slowly started turning the pages. I continued talking as he turned the pages. “I thought a lot about the underlined sections. If you go to the end of My Own Song, he underlined these things about dying. Things like: ‘If you want me again, look for me under your soles.’”
es_translation: —Well, he left me this book of poems before… disappearing. I handed her the book, and Dr. Holden began to leaf through it slowly. As she turned the pages, I said to her: —I have pondered a lot over the marked verses. At the end of the "Song of Myself" it points out that about death. That part of "If you want to find me, look for me under the sole of your shoes."

en: “She left this for you,” Dr. Holden said quietly.
vi: “Bạn ấy để cuốn sách lại cho em hả?” Cô Holden nói khẽ.
tr: “Bunu senin için bıraktı,” dedi dr Holden sessizce.
es: —Te dejó este libro —murmuró la doctora Holden como para sí.
vi_translation: “Did he leave the book for you?” Miss Holden said softly.
tr_translation: “He left this for you,” said Dr. Holden quietly.
es_translation: —He left you this book —murmured Dr. Holden as if to herself.

en: “Yeah,” I said.
vi: “Vâng ạ,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Evet,” dedim.
es: —Sí —le contesté.
vi_translation: "Yes," I replied.
tr_translation: "Yes," I said.
es_translation: —Yes —I replied to him.

en: She flipped back and tapped at the green highlighted quote with her fingernail. “What is this about the doorjambs? That’s a great moment in the poem, where Whitman—I mean, you can feel him shouting at you: ‘Open the doors! In fact, remove the doors!’”
vi: Cô Holden giở ngược lại, đầu ngón tay chỉ đoạn được đánh dấu màu xanh lá cây. “Đoạn về những khung cửa này thì sao? Một khoảnh khắc chói sáng trong cả bài thơ, khi mà Whitman–em như cảm thấy ông ấy đang nói to với chính em: ‘Mở cửa ra! Hãy tháo tung cửa ra!’”
tr: Tekrar çevirip yeşil renkle altı çizilmiş sözün üzerine tırnağıyla hafifçe vurdu. “Kapı kasalarındaki olay ne? Bu, şiirde harika bir andır, Whitman’m sana bağırdığını hissedebilirsin: ‘Açın kapılan! Aslında, sökün kapılan!
es: Siguió pasando las páginas y señaló con la uña la cita marcada en fluorescente verde. —¿Qué es esto de los goznes? Es un gran momento en el poema, en el que Whitman… Bueno, lo oyes gritarte: «¡Abre las puertas! De hecho, ¡arráncalas!».
vi_translation: Ms. Holden flipped back, her fingertip pointing to the section marked in green. "What about the part about these doors?" "A brilliant moment in the entire poem, when Whitman—it feels like he's speaking directly to you: 'Open the doors! Throw the doors wide open!'"
tr_translation: He turned it over again and lightly tapped the word underlined in green with his fingernail. “What's the deal with the door frames? This is a wonderful moment in the poem, you can feel Whitman shouting at you: ‘Open the doors! In fact, break down the doors!”’
es_translation: He kept turning the pages and pointed with his nail to the quote highlighted in green fluorescent. —What is this about the hinges? It is a great moment in the poem, in which Whitman... Well, you hear him shouting at you: "Open the doors! In fact, tear them off!"

en: “She actually left me something else inside my doorjamb.”
vi: “Đúng là Margo đã để lại một thứ khác trong khung cửa phòng em ạ.”
tr: “Aslında kapımın kasasının içine başka bir şey bırakmış.
es: —Me dejó algo dentro de la bisagra de mi puerta.
vi_translation: "Indeed, Margo left something else in the door frame of my room."
tr_translation: “Actually, he left something else inside the frame of my door.”
es_translation: —He left something inside the hinge of my door.

en: Dr. Holden laughed. “Wow. Clever. But it’s such a great poem—I hate to see it reduced to such a literal reading. And she seems to have responded very darkly to what is finally a very optimistic poem. The poem is about our connectedness—each of us sharing the same root system like leaves of grass.”
vi: Cô Holden bật cười. “Chà! Thông minh đấy! Nhưng đây thực sự là một áng thơ lớn–tôi không thích chỉ hiểu thuần túy nghĩa đen như vậy. Hình như Margo đã có cách phản ứng hơi ám muội với một áng thơ thật ra rất đỗi lạc quan tươi tắn. Bài thơ này nói về mạch nối kết chúng ta lại với nhau–mỗi chúng ta có chung hệ gốc rễ, như những cánh cỏ vậy.”
tr: dr Holden güldü. “Vay canına. Zekice. Ama bu öyle harika bir şiir ki... onun böylesine düz bir okumaya indirgendiğini görmekten nefret ediyorum. Ve neticede çok iyimser olan bir şiire, çok karanlık bir şekilde tepki vermiş gibi görünüyor. Bu şiir bağlanmışlığımız hakkındadır... her birimizin çimen yapraklan gibi aynı kök sistemini paylaşması hakkında.
es: La doctora Holden se rió. —Uau. Inteligente. Pero es un poema muy bueno… No me gusta nada que se reduzca a una lectura literal. Y parece que ha reaccionado muy enigmáticamente ante un poema que al final es muy optimista. El poema trata de nuestra conexión, de que todos nosotros compartimos las mismas raíces, como hojas de hierba.
vi_translation: Ms. Holden burst out laughing. "Wow! That's clever! But this is truly a great poem—I don't like to just understand it in a purely literal sense. It seems that Margo had a somewhat ambiguous reaction to a poem that is actually very optimistic and cheerful. This poem talks about the connection that binds us together—we all share the same root system, like blades of grass."
tr_translation: Dr. Holden laughed. “Wow. Smart. But this is such a wonderful poem that... I hate to see it reduced to such a plain reading. And it seems like you have reacted very darkly to a poem that is ultimately very optimistic. This poem is about our connectedness... about each of us sharing the same root system like blades of grass.”
es_translation: The doctor Holden laughed. —Wow. Smart. But it's a very good poem... I don't like it at all when it's reduced to a literal reading. And it seems that he reacted very enigmatically to a poem that is ultimately very optimistic. The poem is about our connection, that we all share the same roots, like blades of grass.

en: “But, I mean, from what she highlighted, it seems kinda like a suicide note,” I said. Dr. Holden read the last stanzas again and then looked up at me.
vi: “Nhưng với những đoạn đánh dấu, hình như Margo cũng có ý tuyệt mệnh cô ạ.” tôi nói. Cô Holden đọc lại những khổ thơ cuối rồi nhìn tôi.
tr: “Ama yani altım çizdiklerinden intihar mektubu gibi görünüyor,” dedim. dr Holden tekrar son kıtaları okudu ve başmı kaldırıp bana baktı.
es: —Pero, bueno, por lo que marcó, parece una especie de nota de suicidio —le dije. La doctora Holden volvió a leer las últimas estrofas y me miró.
vi_translation: “But with the marked passages, it seems like Margo also had a death wish, ma'am.” I said. Ms. Holden reread the final stanzas and then looked at me.
tr_translation: “But I mean, from what you underlined, it looks like a suicide note,” I said. Dr. Holden read the last stanzas again and looked up at me.
es_translation: —But, well, from what it indicated, it seems like some kind of suicide note —I told him. Dr. Holden read the last stanzas again and looked at me.

en: “What a mistake it is to distill this poem into something hopeless. I hope that’s not the case, Quentin. If you read the whole poem, I don’t see how you can come to any conclusion except that life is sacred and valuable. But—who knows. Maybe she skimmed it for what she was looking for. We often read poems that way. But if so, she completely misunderstood what Whitman was asking of her.”
vi: “Áp ý nghĩa tuyệt vọng vào bài thơ này là một lầm lẫn. Tôi hi vọng trường hợp này không phải như vậy, Quentin ạ. Nếu em đọc toàn bộ bài thơ, tôi không nghĩ em có thể đi đến kết luận nào khác ngoài nhận ra rằng sự sống là thiêng liêng và đáng quí. Nhưng–ai mà biết được. Có thể Margo chỉ lọc lấy những đoạn em ấy cần tìm. Đôi khi chúng ta vẫn đọc thơ theo cách đó. Nhưng nếu đúng như vậy, thì Margo đã hoàn toàn hiểu nhầm những gì Whitman mong đợi ở độc giả.”
tr: “Bu şiiri umutsuz bir şeye ayrıştırmak ne büyük bir hata. Umarım durum bu değildir, Quentin. Eğer bütün şiiri okursan, yaşamın kutsal ve değerli olduğundan başka bir sonuca nasıl varabilirsin, anlamıyorum. Ama... kimbilir. Belki de aradığı şey için şiirde bir göz gezdirdi. Genelde şiirleri böyle okuruz. Ama öyleyse Whitman’ın ondan istediğini tamamen yanlış anlamış.
es: —Es un gran error resumir este poema en algo sin esperanza. Espero que no sea el caso, Quentin. Si lees todo el poema, no entiendo cómo puedes llegar a otra conclusión que la de que la vida es sagrada y valiosa. Pero… quién sabe. Quizá echó un vistazo para encontrar lo que estaba buscando. A menudo leemos los poemas así. Pero si fue el caso, malinterpretó totalmente lo que Whitman estaba pidiéndole.
vi_translation: “Imputing a sense of despair to this poem is a mistake. I hope that’s not the case here, Quentin. If you read the entire poem, I don’t think you could come to any conclusion other than recognizing that life is sacred and precious. But—who knows. Maybe Margo just picked out the parts she needed to find. Sometimes we do read poetry that way. But if that’s the case, then Margo completely misunderstood what Whitman expected of his readers.”
tr_translation: “What a great mistake it is to dissect this poem into something hopeless. I hope that's not the case, Quentin. If you read the entire poem, I don't understand how you could come to any other conclusion than that life is sacred and valuable. But... who knows. Maybe he skimmed through the poem for what he was looking for. That's usually how we read poems. But if that's the case, he completely misunderstood what Whitman wanted from him.”
es_translation: —It is a big mistake to summarize this poem as something without hope. I hope that is not the case, Quentin. If you read the whole poem, I don't understand how you can come to any other conclusion than that life is sacred and valuable. But... who knows. Maybe he took a glance to find what he was looking for. We often read poems like that. But if that was the case, he totally misunderstood what Whitman was asking of him.

en: “And what’s that?”
vi: “Và mong đợi đó là gì ạ?”
tr: “Nedir o?
es: —¿Y qué le pedía?
vi_translation: "And what is that expectation?"
tr_translation: “What is that?”
es_translation: —And what did he ask for?

en: She closed the book and looked right at me in a way that made it impossible for me to hold her gaze. “What do you think of it?”
vi: Cô Holden gập sách lại, nhìn thẳng vào tôi bằng ánh mắt khiến tôi bối rối không nhìn lại được. “Em nghĩ đó là gì?”
tr: Kitabı kapattı ve bakışma karşılık vermemi imkânsız hale getirecek bir şekilde yüzüme baktı. “Sen ne düşünüyorsun?
es: Cerró el libro y me miró tan fijamente que no pude sostenerle la mirada. —¿Qué crees tú?
vi_translation: Ms. Holden closed the book, looking straight at me with eyes that made me too embarrassed to look back. "What do you think it is?"
tr_translation: He closed the book and looked at me in a way that made it impossible for me to return his gaze. “What are you thinking?”
es_translation: He closed the book and looked at me so intently that I couldn't hold his gaze. —What do you think?

en: “I don’t know,” I said, staring at a stack of graded papers on her desk. “I’ve tried to read it straight through a bunch of times, but I haven’t gotten very far. Mostly I just read the parts she highlighted. I’m reading it to try to understand Margo, not to try to understand Whitman.”
vi: “Em không biết ạ,” tôi đáp, dán mắt vào chồng bài đã chấm trên bàn cô. “Vô số lần em cố gắng đọc cho ra ý nghĩa, nhưng không đi xa được mấy. Đa phần em chỉ đọc những đoạn có đánh dấu thôi ạ. Em đọc để cố gắng hiểu Margo, chứ không phải để cố hiểu Whitman.”
tr: “Bilmiyorum,” dedim masasındaki puanlanmış ödev yığınına bakarak. “Birçok defa düz bir şekilde okumayı denedim ama fazla ilerleyemedim. Çoğunlukla sadece altım çizdiği bölümleri okudum. Şiiri Margo’yu anlamaya çabşmak için okuyorum, Whitman’ı anlamaya çalışmak için değil.
es: —No lo sé —le contesté mirando un montón de trabajos corregidos encima de su mesa—. He intentado leerlo entero un montón de veces, pero no he llegado muy lejos. Prácticamente solo leo las partes que Margo tiene marcadas. Lo leo para intentar entenderla a ella, no a Whitman.
vi_translation: “I don't know,” I replied, my eyes glued to the stack of graded papers on her desk. “Countless times I've tried to read and understand, but I never get very far. Mostly, I just read the highlighted parts. I read to try to understand Margo, not to try to understand Whitman.”
tr_translation: “I don't know,” I said, looking at the pile of graded assignments on his desk. “I tried to read it straight through many times, but I couldn't get very far. Mostly, I just read the sections she underlined. I'm reading the poem to try to understand Margo, not to try to understand Whitman.”
es_translation: —I don't know —I replied, looking at a pile of graded papers on her desk—. I've tried to read it all the way through many times, but I haven't gotten very far. I practically only read the parts that Margo has marked. I read it to try to understand her, not Whitman.

en: She picked up a pencil and wrote something on the back of an envelope. “Hold on. I’m writing that down.”
vi: Cô lấy bút chì viết gì đó lên mặt sau một tấm phong bì. “Khoan đã. Tôi đang viết lại ý đó.”
tr: Bir kalem alıp bir zarfın arkasına bir şeyler yazdı. “Dur. Bunu yazıyorum.
es: Cogió un lápiz y escribió algo en la parte de atrás de un sobre. —Sigue. Estoy escribiéndolo.
vi_translation: She took a pencil and wrote something on the back of an envelope. "Wait a minute. I am rewriting that idea."
tr_translation: He took a pen and wrote something on the back of an envelope. “Wait. I'm writing this down.”
es_translation: He took a pencil and wrote something on the back of an envelope. —Go on. I'm writing it down.

en: “What you just said,” she explained.
vi: “Điều em vừa nói,” cô giải thích.
tr: “Demin söylediğini,” diye açıkladı.
es: —Lo que acabas de decir —me explicó.
vi_translation: “What you just said,” she explained.
tr_translation: “As you said,” he explained.
es_translation: —What you just said —he explained to me.

en: “Why?”
vi: “Tại sao ạ?”
tr: “Neden?
es: —¿Por qué?
vi_translation: “Why?”
tr_translation: “Why?”
es_translation: —Why?

en: “Because I think that is precisely what Whitman would have wanted. For you to see ‘Song of Myself’ not just as a poem but as a way into understanding another. But I wonder if maybe you have to read it as a poem, instead of just reading these fragments for quotes and clues. I do think there are some interesting connections between the poet in ‘Song of Myself’ and Margo Spiegelman—all that wild charisma and wanderlust. But a poem can’t do its work if you only read snippets of it.”
vi: “Vì tôi cho rằng đó chính là điều Whitman đã mong đợi. Để em thấy rằng ‘Tự khúc’ không chỉ là một bài thơ mà còn là một cách để hiểu về người khác. Nhưng tôi không biết liệu em có thể đọc như đọc một bài thơ bình thường được không, chứ không phải chỉ đọc những mảnh trích và tìm manh mối. Tôi thực sự cho rằng có những liên hệ thú vị giữa thi sĩ trong ‘Tự khúc’ và Margo Spiegelman–tất cả những cá tính hoang dã và chất lãng du đó. Nhưng một bài thơ không thể trọn vẹn nếu em chỉ đọc những mảnh vụn của nó.”
tr: “Çünkü sanırım VVhitman’ın isteyebileceği şey tam olarak bu. Senin Kendi Şarkım’ı sadece bir şiir olarak değil, aynı zamanda başkasını anlamanın bir yolu olarak görmen. Ama sadece alıntılar ve ipuçlarından oluşan bu parçaları okumak yerine, acaba bunu bir şiir olarak mi okumalısın. Kendi Şarkım’daki şair ile Margo Spiegelman arasında ilginç bağlantılar olduğunu düşünüyorum... bütün o vahşi karizma ve seyahat tutkusu. Yalnızca ufak parçalarını okursan, bir şiir amacına ulaşmaz.
es: —Porque creo que es exactamente lo que Whitman habría querido. Que consideraras el «Canto de mí mismo» no un mero poema, sino una vía para entender otra cosa. Pero me pregunto si no deberías leerlo como poema, no leer solo esos fragmentos en busca de citas y pistas. Creo que hay conexiones interesantes entre el poeta del «Canto de mí mismo» y Margo Spiegelman… Ese carisma salvaje y ese espíritu viajero. Pero los poemas no funcionan si solo los lees a trozos.
vi_translation: "Because I believe that is exactly what Whitman intended. For you to see that 'Song of Myself' is not just a poem but also a way to understand others. But I don't know if you can read it like an ordinary poem, rather than just reading excerpts and looking for clues. I truly believe there are interesting connections between the poet in 'Song of Myself' and Margo Spiegelman—all those wild personalities and the wandering spirit. But a poem cannot be complete if you only read fragments of it."
tr_translation: “Because I think this is exactly what Whitman would want. For you to see Your Own Song not just as a poem, but also as a way to understand someone else. But instead of reading these pieces made up of just quotes and hints, perhaps you should read it as a poem. I think there are interesting connections between the poet in Your Own Song and Margo Spiegelman... all that wild charisma and passion for travel. If you only read small parts of it, a poem doesn't achieve its purpose.”
es_translation: —Because I believe it is exactly what Whitman would have wanted. For you to consider "Song of Myself" not as a mere poem, but as a way to understand something else. But I wonder if you shouldn't read it as a poem, not just those fragments in search of quotes and clues. I think there are interesting connections between the poet of "Song of Myself" and Margo Spiegelman... That wild charisma and that wandering spirit. But poems don't work if you only read them in pieces.

en: “Okay, thanks,” I said. I took the book and stood up. I didn’t feel much better.
vi: “Vâng, em cảm ơn cô ạ,” tôi nói, cầm lấy cuốn sách và đứng lên. Tôi không cảm thấy khá hơn là bao.
tr: “Peki, teşekkürler,” dedim. Kitabı alıp ayağa kalktım. Kendimi daha iyi hissettiğim söylenemezdi.
es: —De acuerdo, gracias —le dije. Cogí el libro y me levanté. No me sentía mucho mejor.
vi_translation: "Yes, thank you, ma'am," I said, taking the book and standing up. I didn't feel much better.
tr_translation: “Well, thank you,” I said. I took the book and stood up. It couldn't be said that I felt any better. ()
es_translation: —Alright, thank you —I said to him. I grabbed the book and stood up. I didn't feel much better.

en: I got a ride home with Ben that afternoon and stayed at his house until he left to go pick up Radar for some pre-prom party being thrown by our friend Jake, whose parents were out of town. Ben asked me to go, but I didn’t feel like it.
vi: Buổi chiều tôi về nhà cùng Ben, ở nhà nó cho đến khi nó phải đi đón Radar, đến một buổi tiệc tiền-dạ-tiệc ở chỗ Jake, bạn của bọn tôi, nhân dịp bố mẹ Jake không có nhà. Ben rủ tôi đi luôn nhưng tôi không thích lắm.
tr: () öğleden sonra Ben’le eve gittik ve ebeveynleri şehir dışında olan arkadaşımız Jake’in verdiği bir balo öncesi partisi için Radar’ı almaya gidene kadar Ben’in evinde kaldım. Ben, benim de gitmemi istedi ama havamda değildim.
es: Aquella tarde volví en coche con Ben y me quedé en su casa hasta que fue a buscar a Radar para ir a una especie de fiesta previa al baile en casa de nuestro amigo Jake, cuyos padres no estaban en la ciudad. Ben me pidió que me apuntara, pero no me apetecía.
vi_translation: In the afternoon, I went home with Ben and stayed at his place until he had to go pick up Radar for a pre-prom party at Jake's, our friend's house, since Jake's parents were not home. Ben invited me to go along, but I wasn't very interested.
tr_translation: In the afternoon, I went home with Ben and stayed at his house until we went to pick up Radar for a pre-prom party given by our friend Jake, whose parents were out of town. Ben wanted me to go too, but I wasn't in the mood.
es_translation: That afternoon I drove back with Ben and stayed at his house until he went to pick up Radar to go to a sort of pre-prom party at our friend Jake's house, whose parents were out of town. Ben asked me to join, but I didn't feel like it.

en: I walked back to my house, across the park where Margo and I had found the dead guy. I remembered that morning, and I felt something twist at my gut in the remembering of it—not because of the dead guy, but because I remembered that she had found him first. Even in my own neighborhood’s playground, I’d been unable to find a body on my own—how the hell would I do it now?
vi: Tôi đi bộ về nhà, qua công viên nơi Margo và tôi đã tìm thấy người đàn ông tự vẫn năm nào. Tôi còn nhớ buổi sáng ấy, và bụng tôi chợt quặn lên khi nhớ lại–không phải tại xác chết, mà vì tôi nhớ ra cô ấy đã tìm thấy ông ta trước. Ngay cả ở sân chơi quanh quẩn gần nhà, tôi còn chưa bao giờ tự tìm được cái xác nào–giờ thì quỉ tha ma bắt tôi phải làm thế nào đây?
tr: Yürüyerek Margo’yla ölü adamı bulduğumuz parktan geçerek i ve döndüm. O sabahı hatırladım ve hatırlamamla karnımda bir şeyin döndüğünü hissettim... ölü adam yüzünden değil, onu ilk önce Margo’nun bulduğunu hatırladığım için. Kendi muhitimdeki I >ir oyun alamnda bile, kendi başıma bir ceset bulmaktan acizdim... Iı unu şimdi nasıl yapacaktım ki?
es: Volví a mi casa andando y crucé el parque en el que Margo y yo habíamos encontrado al muerto. Recordé aquella mañana, y al recordarla sentí que se me revolvían las tripas, no por el muerto, sino porque recordaba que ella lo había visto primero. Ni siquiera en el parque infantil de nuestro barrio había sido capaz de encontrar un cadáver por mí mismo… ¿Cómo demonios iba a encontrarlo en ese momento?
vi_translation: I walked home, passing through the park where Margo and I had found the man who had committed suicide years ago. I still remember that morning, and my stomach suddenly churned at the memory—not because of the dead body, but because I recalled that she had found him first. Even in the playground near my house, I had never found a dead body myself—so now, what the hell am I supposed to do?
tr_translation: Walking, I passed through the park where Margo and I found the dead man and turned back. I remembered that morning, and with that memory, I felt something turning in my stomach... not because of the dead man, but because I remembered that Margo was the one who found him first. Even in a playground in my own neighborhood, I was incapable of finding a dead body on my own... How was I going to do it now?
es_translation: I walked back home and crossed the park where Margo and I had found the dead body. I remembered that morning, and as I recalled it, I felt my stomach churn, not because of the dead body, but because I remembered that she had seen it first. Not even in the playground of our neighborhood had I been able to find a corpse by myself... How the hell was I going to find it at that moment?

en: I tried to read “Song of Myself” again when I got home that night, but despite Dr. Holden’s advice, it still turned into a jumble of nonsensical words.
vi: Tôi cố gắng đọc lại “Tự khúc” khi ở nhà tối hôm đó, nhưng bất chấp lời khuyên của cô Holden, bài thơ vẫn lùng bùng là một mớ từ ngữ vô nghĩa.
tr: O gece eve geldiğimde, Kendi Şarkım’ı tekrar okumaya çalıştım ama dr Holden’m tavsiyesine rağmen, şiir hâlâ anlamsız sözcüklerden oluşan bir karmaşaya dönüşüyordu.
es: Intenté volver a leer el «Canto de mí mismo» al llegar a casa aquella noche, pero, pese al consejo de la doctora Holden, seguía pareciéndome un batiburrillo de palabras sin sentido.
vi_translation: I tried to read "Tự khúc" again when I was at home that night, but despite Ms. Holden's advice, the poem still jumbled into a bunch of meaningless words.
tr_translation: That night when I came home, I tried to read My Own Song again, but despite Dr. Holden's advice, the poem was still turning into a jumble of meaningless words.
es_translation: I tried to read "Song of Myself" again when I got home that night, but, despite Dr. Holden's advice, it still seemed like a jumble of meaningless words to me.

en: I woke up early the next morning, just after eight, and went to the computer. Ben was online, so I IM’ed him.
vi: Sáng hôm sau tôi dậy sớm, sau tám giờ chút xíu, và bật ngay máy tính lên. Ben đang trực tuyến, tôi liền gửi tin nhắn cho nó.
tr: Krtesi sabah erken saatte, sekizden biraz sonra kalktım ve bilgisayarıma gittim. Ben çevrimiçiydi, bu yüzden ona bir mesaj gönderdim.
es: Al día siguiente me desperté temprano, poco después de las ocho, y encendí el ordenador. Ben estaba conectado, así que le mandé un mensaje.
vi_translation: The next morning, I woke up early, just after eight o'clock, and immediately turned on the computer. Ben was online, so I sent him a message right away.
tr_translation: I woke up early in the morning, a little after eight, and went to my computer. He was online, so I sent him a message.
es_translation: The next day I woke up early, shortly after eight, and turned on the computer. Ben was online, so I sent him a message.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: How was the party?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Tiệc hôm qua thế nào?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Parti nasıldı?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: ¿Qué tal la fiesta?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: How was the party yesterday?
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: How was the party?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: How was the party?

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Lame, of course. Every party I go to is lame.
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Chán òm, dĩ nhiên rồi. Tiệc nào tôi đến cũng thấy chán òm.
tr: OBİRBÖBREKEN FEKSİYONUYDU: Boktan, tabii ki. Benim gittiğim her parti boktan.
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: Aburrida, claro. Todas las fiestas a las que voy son aburridas.
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Boring, of course. Every party I go to is boring.
tr_translation: IT WAS A KIDNEY INFECTION: Crap, of course. Every party I go to is crap.
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Boring, of course. All the parties I go to are boring.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Sorry I missed it. You’re up early. Want to come over, play Resurrection?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Xin lỗi tôi không đi cùng được. Hôm nay dậy sớm thế. Sang đây không, chơi Hồi Sinh không?
tr: DİRILİŞÇIQ: Üzgünüm kaçırdım. Erken kalkmışsın. Gelip Diriliş oynamak ister misin?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Siento no haber ido. Te has levantado pronto. ¿Quieres venir a jugar al Resurrection?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Sorry, I can't go with you. Woke up early today. Come over, want to play Resurrection?
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONIST: Sorry, I missed it. You woke up early. Do you want to come and play Resurrection?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: I'm sorry I didn't go. You got up early. Do you want to come play Resurrection?

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Are you kidding?
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Ông đùa đấy à?
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Şaka mı yapıyorsun?
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: ¿Estás de broma?
vi_translation: CHRONICNEPHRITIS: Are you kidding?
tr_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Are you kidding?
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Are you kidding?

en: QTHERESURRECTION: uh . . . no?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Ơ... không. Sao thế?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Ee... hayır?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: No…
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Uh... no. Why?
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONISTQ: Uh... no?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: No…

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Do you know what day it is?
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Ông không biết hôm nay ngày gì à
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Bugün günlerden ne, biliyor musun?
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: ¿Sabes qué día es?
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Don't you know what day it is today??
tr_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Do you know what day it is today?
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Do you know what day it is?

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Saturday May 15?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Thứ Bảy 15 tháng Năm. Sao vậy?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Cumartesi 15 Mayıs?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Sábado, 15 de mayo.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Saturday, May 15. Why?
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONIST: Saturday, May 15?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Saturday, May 15.

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Bro, prom starts in eleven hours and fourteen minutes. I have to pick Lacey up in less than nine hours. I haven’t even washed and waxed RHAPAW yet, which by the way you did a nice job of dirtying up. Then after that I have to shower and shave and trim nasal hairs and wash and wax myself. God, don’t even get me started. I have a lot to do. Listen, I’ll call you later if I have a chance.
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Này người anh em, dạ tiệc tốt nghiệp sẽ bắt đầu sau mười một tiếng và mười bốn phút nữa. Còn chưa đầy chín tiếng đồng hồ nữa tôi phải đi đón Lacey. Mà tôi còn chưa tắm rửa gì ẻm RHAPAW, sau chiến công ông quết đất lên ẻm. Rồi tôi còn phải tắm, cạo râu, cắt tỉa lông mũi, và tút tát cho chính tôi nữa. Giời ạ, lu bu công việc mà tôi còn chưa động được vào việc gì. Bận lắm lắm. Nghe này, tôi sẽ gọi cho ông sau nhá, nếu sểnh ra được lúc nào.
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Kardeşim, on bir saat ve on dört dakika içinde balo başlıyor. Dokuz saatten az bir süre içinde Lacey’yi almam lazım. Daha SESIB’ı yıkayıp cilalamadım bile, bu arada kirletmekte iyi iş çıkarmışsın. Ondan sonra duş almak, tıraş olmak, burun kıllarımı düzeltmek ve kendimi yıkayıp cilalamak zorundayım. Tanrım, o konuya hiç girmeyeyim. Yapacak çok işim var. Bak, fırsatım olursa seni daha sonra ararım.
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: Colega, el baile empieza dentro de once horas y cuarenta minutos. Tengo que recoger a Lacey en menos de nueve horas. Todavía no he limpiado y abrillantado el Chuco, que, por cierto, lo dejaste hecho una pena. Luego tengo que ducharme, afeitarme, sacarme los pelos de la nariz y sacarme brillo también yo. Joder, no empecemos. Tengo mucho que hacer. Mira, te llamo luego si puedo.
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Hey brother, the graduation banquet will start in eleven hours and fourteen minutes. In less than nine hours, I have to pick up Lacey. And I haven't even cleaned her RHAPAW, after the feat of getting dirt all over her. Then I still have to shower, shave, trim my nose hair, and spruce myself up. Oh my God, so much work and I haven't even started anything yet. Super busy. Listen, I'll call you later, if I can find a moment.
tr_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Brother, the ball starts in eleven hours and fourteen minutes. I need to pick up Lacey in less than nine hours. I haven't even washed and polished the SESIB yet, by the way, you did a good job of getting it dirty. After that, I have to take a shower, shave, trim my nose hairs, and wash and polish myself. God, let's not even go there. I have a lot to do. Look, if I get a chance, I'll call you later.
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Colleague, the dance starts in eleven hours and forty minutes. I have to pick up Lacey in less than nine hours. I still haven't cleaned and polished the Chuco, which, by the way, you left in a terrible state. Then I have to shower, shave, trim my nose hairs, and polish myself up too. Damn, let's not start. I have a lot to do. Look, I'll call you later if I can.

en: Radar was on, too, so I IM’ed him.
vi: Radar cũng đang trực tuyến, tôi nhắn tiếp cho nó.
tr: Radar da çevrimiçiydi, bu yüzden ona mesaj attım.
es: Radar también estaba conectado, así que le mandé un mensaje.
vi_translation: Radar is also online, I continue to message it.
tr_translation: Radar was online, so I sent him a message.
es_translation: Radar was also connected, so I sent him a message.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: What is Ben’s problem?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Ben ăn nhầm cái gì vậy?
tr: DİRİLİŞ ÇİQ: Ben’in sorunu ne?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: ¿Qué le pasa a Ben?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Ben, what did you eat by mistake?
tr_translation: RESURRECTION ÇİQ: What is Ben's problem?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: What is happening to Ben?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Whoa there, cowboy.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Hựa, sao thế?
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yavaş ol, kovboy.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Para el carro, vaquero.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: Hựa, what's wrong?
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Take it easy, cowboy.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Hold your horses, cowboy.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Sorry, I’m just pissed that he thinks prom is oh-so important.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Xin lỗi, tôi đang cáu vì thằng khỉ ấy làm rối lên cái màn dạ tiệc ôi-chao-quá-trọng-đại đó.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Üzgünüm, sadece Ben’in balonun çok önemli olduğunu düşünmesine kızdım.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Perdona, solo me cabrea que piense que el baile es tan importante.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Sorry, I'm upset because that monkey messed up the oh-so-important gala dinner.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: I'm sorry, I just got upset because I thought Ben's balloon was very important.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Sorry, it just pisses me off that you think dancing is so important.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: You’re going to be pretty pissed when you hear that the only reason I’m up this early is that I really need to go because I have to pick up my tux, aren’t you?
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Ông sẽ còn cáu cho ra cáu nếu biết lí do duy nhất tôi dậy sớm thế này là do tôi thực sự phải té đi đây, vì tôi phải đi lấy bộ lễ phục đuôi tôm. Sắp cáu chưa?
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Benim bu kadar erken kalkmamın tek nedeni smokinimi almam gerektiği için gerçekten gitmek zorunda olmam, bunu duyunca da oldukça kızacaksın, değil mi?
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Pues vas a cabrearte bastante cuando sepas que me he levantado tan temprano solo porque tengo que ir a recoger mi esmoquin, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: He would be even more upset if he knew the only reason I got up this early is because I really have to leave now, as I need to go get my tailcoat. Getting upset yet?
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: The only reason I have to leave so early is that I really need to pick up my tuxedo, and you're going to be quite mad when you hear this, aren't you?
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Well, you're going to get pretty mad when you find out that I got up so early just because I have to go pick up my tuxedo, right?

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Jesus Christ. Seriously?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Lạy Chúa lòng lành, ông đang nghiêm túc ư?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Tanrım. Cidden mi?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Joder. ¿En serio?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Dear merciful Lord, are you being serious?
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: My God. Seriously?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Damn. Seriously?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Q, tomorrow and the next day and the day after that and all the days for the rest of my life, I am happy to participate in your investigation. But I have a girlfriend. She wants to have a nice prom. I want to have a nice prom. It’s not my fault that Margo Roth Spiegelman didn’t want us to have a nice prom.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Q ơi, ngày mai, ngày kia, ngày kỉa ngày kìa, và tất cả những ngày còn lại của đời tôi, tôi sẽ lấy làm hân hạnh được tham gia cuộc điều tra của ông. Nhưng tôi có một cô bạn gái. Cô ấy muốn có một dạ tiệc mĩ mãn. Tôi muốn có một dạ tiệc mĩ mãn. Không phải lỗi của tôi nếu Margo Roth Spiegelman không muốn chúng ta có một dạ tiệc mĩ mãn.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Q, yann, ondan sonraki gün ve ondan sonraki gün ve ömrümün geri kalanındaki bütün günler, araştırmana katılmaktan mutlu olurum. Ama bir kız arkadaşım var. Güzel bir balo geçirmek istiyor. Ben de güzel bir balo geçirmek istiyorum. Margo Roth Spiegelman’ın güzel bir balo geçirmemizi istememesi benim suçum değil.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Q, mañana, pasado mañana, el día siguiente y todos los días que me quedan de vida estaré encantado de participar en tu investigación. Pero tengo novia. Quiere que el baile de graduación sea bonito. Yo también quiero que el baile de graduación sea bonito. No es culpa mía que Margo Roth Spiegelman no quisiera que nuestro baile de graduación fuera bonito.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: Q, tomorrow, the day after tomorrow, the day after that, and all the remaining days of my life, I will be honored to participate in your investigation. But I have a girlfriend. She wants to have a perfect prom night. I want to have a perfect prom night. It's not my fault if Margo Roth Spiegelman doesn't want us to have a perfect prom night.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Q, yann, the next day and the day after that and every day for the rest of my life, I would be happy to join your research. But I have a girlfriend. She wants to have a nice prom. I want to have a nice prom too. It's not my fault that Margo Roth Spiegelman doesn't want us to have a nice prom.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Q, tomorrow, the day after tomorrow, the following day, and every day I have left in my life, I will be delighted to participate in your research. But I have a girlfriend. She wants the prom to be beautiful. I also want the prom to be beautiful. It's not my fault that Margo Roth Spiegelman didn't want our prom to be beautiful.

en: I didn’t know what to say. He was right, maybe. Maybe she deserved to be forgotten. But at any rate, I couldn’t forget her.
vi: Tôi không biết phải nói gì. Có lẽ Radar đã đúng. Có lẽ Margo đáng bị quên luôn đi cho rồi. Nhưng ở bất cứ góc độ nào, tôi không thể quên được cô ấy.
tr: Ne diyeceğimi bilemedim. Haklıydı belki de. Belki de Margo unutulmayı hak ediyordu. Ama her halükârda, ben onu unutamazdım.
es: No supe qué decir. Quizá tenía razón. Quizá Margo merecía que la olvidaran. Pero, en cualquier caso, yo no podía olvidarla.
vi_translation: I don't know what to say. Maybe Radar was right. Maybe Margo deserves to be forgotten. But from any angle, I can't forget her.
tr_translation: I didn't know what to say. Maybe he was right. Maybe Margo deserved to be forgotten. But in any case, I couldn't forget her.
es_translation: I didn't know what to say. Maybe she was right. Maybe Margo deserved to be forgotten. But, in any case, I couldn't forget her.

en: My mom and dad were still in bed, watching an old movie on TV. “Can I take the minivan?” I asked.
vi: Bố mẹ vẫn chưa ra khỏi giường, đang xem một bộ phim cũ trên ti-vi. “Con lấy xe đi được không ạ?” tôi hỏi.
tr: Annemle babam hâlâ yataktaydı, televizyonda eski bir film izliyorlardı. “Minivanı alabilir miyim?” diye sordum.
es: Mi madre y mi padre estaban aún en la cama, viendo una película antigua en la tele. —¿Puedo coger el coche? —pregunté.
vi_translation: Mom and Dad are still in bed, watching an old movie on TV. "Can I take the car?" I asked.
tr_translation: My mom and dad were still in bed, watching an old movie on TV. "Can I take the minivan?" I asked.
es_translation: My mother and my father were still in bed, watching an old movie on TV. —Can I take the car? —I asked.

en: “Sure, why?”
vi: “Được chứ, sao thế con?”
tr: “Tabii, neden?
es: —Claro, ¿por qué?
vi_translation: "Sure, what's the matter, dear?"
tr_translation: “Of course, why?”
es_translation: —Of course, why?

en: “Decided to go to prom,” I answered hurriedly. The lie occurred to me as I told it. “Gotta pick out a tux and then get over to Ben’s. We’re both going stag.” My mom sat up, smiling.
vi: “Con đổi ý, sẽ đi dạ tiệc ạ,” tôi đáp nhanh. Lời nói dối cứ thế bật ra khi tôi mở miệng. “Con đi chọn lễ phục rồi qua chỗ Ben, hai thằng đi với nhau ạ.” Mẹ liền nhỏm dậy, miệng nở nụ cười.
tr: “Baloya gitmeye karar verdim,” diye aceleyle cevapladım. Bu yalan söylerken aklıma geldi. “Bir smokin seçtikten sonra Ben’lere gitmeliyim, ikimiz de damsız gidiyoruz.” Annem gülümseyerek doğruldu.
es: —He decidido ir al baile de graduación —contesté de inmediato. Se me ocurrió la mentira mientras la decía—. Tengo que recoger un esmoquin y pasarme por casa de Ben. Iremos los dos solos. Mi madre se incorporó sonriendo.
vi_translation: “I've changed my mind, I'll go to the party,” I replied quickly. The lie just slipped out as I opened my mouth. “I'll go pick out a suit and then head over to Ben's place, we'll go together.” Mom immediately sat up, a smile spreading across her face.
tr_translation: “I decided to go to Baloya,” I replied hastily. This lie came to my mind as I spoke. “After choosing a tuxedo, I must go to Ben’s; we are both going without dates.” My mother straightened up with a smile.
es_translation: —I have decided to go to the prom —I answered immediately. The lie occurred to me as I was saying it—. I have to pick up a tuxedo and stop by Ben's house. We will go just the two of us. My mother sat up smiling.

en: “Well, I think that’s great, hon. It’ll be great for you. Will you come back so we can take pictures?”
vi: “Có thế chứ, thế là tốt rồi. Hai đứa đi với nhau vui nhé, có về qua nhà không để bố mẹ làm kiểu ảnh kỉ niệm?”
tr: “Peki, bence bu harika, tatlım. Senin için çok iyi olacak. Fotoğraf çekelim diye geri dönecek misin?
es: —Bueno, estupendo, cariño. Te lo pasarás genial. ¿Volverás para que podamos hacerte fotos?
vi_translation: "That's more like it, that's good." "You two have fun together, are you coming home so that your parents can take a commemorative photo?"
tr_translation: “Well, I think this is great, sweetie. It will be very good for you. Will you come back so we can take a photo?”
es_translation: —Well, great, darling. You will have a fantastic time. Will you come back so we can take pictures of you?

en: “Mom, do you really need pictures of me going to prom stag? I mean, hasn’t my life been humiliating enough?”
vi: “Mẹ ơi, mẹ thực sự cần ảnh tang chứng con đi tiệc ạ? Đời con cám cảnh đến mức này chưa đủ sao ạ?” Mẹ cười rũ.
tr: “Anne, damsız baloya gittiğime dair fotoğrafa ihtiyacın var mı gerçekten? Yani hayatım yeterince utanç verici olmadı mı?”
es: —Mamá, ¿de verdad necesitas fotos mías yendo al baile solo? Quiero decir, ¿no ha sido mi vida ya lo bastante humillante?
vi_translation: "Mom, do you really need evidence photos of me going to a party? Isn't my life pathetic enough already?"
tr_translation: “Anne, do you really need a photo of me going to the prom without a date? I mean, hasn't my life been embarrassing enough already?”
es_translation: —Mom, do you really need pictures of me going to the dance alone? I mean, hasn't my life been humiliating enough already?

en: “Call before curfew,” my dad said, which was midnight.
vi: “Gọi điện trước giờ giới nghiêm nhé,” bố dặn, tức là trước nửa đêm.
tr: “Eve dönme saatinden önce gel,” dedi babam ki bu geceyansıydı.
es: —Llama antes del toque de queda —me dijo mi padre. El toque de queda era a las doce de la noche.
vi_translation: "Call before curfew," Dad reminded, which means before midnight.
tr_translation: "Come back before your curfew," said my father, as it was midnight.
es_translation: —Call before curfew —my father told me. The curfew was at midnight.

en: “Sure thing,” I said. It was so easy to lie to them that I found myself wondering why I’d never much done it before that night with Margo.
vi: “Nhất định ạ,” tôi đáp. Màn nói dối bố mẹ trơn tru đến mức tôi tự hỏi sao mình chưa từng phát huy khả năng này trước cái đêm đi cùng Margo.
tr: “Kesinlikle,” dedim. Onlara yalan söylemek o kadar kolaydı ki Margo’yla geçen o geceden önce bunu neden daha fazla yapmadığımı kendime sordum.
es: —Claro —le contesté. Fue tan fácil mentirles que me descubrí a mí mismo preguntándome por qué hasta aquella noche con Margo apenas lo había hecho.
vi_translation: "Definitely," I replied. The lie to my parents was so smooth that I wondered why I had never utilized this ability before the night I went with Margo.
tr_translation: “Absolutely,” I said. It was so easy to lie to them that I wondered why I hadn't done it more often before that night with Margo.
es_translation: —Of course —I replied. It was so easy to lie to them that I found myself wondering why, until that night with Margo, I had hardly done it.

en: I took I-4 west toward Kissimmee and the theme parks, and then passed I-Drive where Margo and I had broken into SeaWorld, and then took Highway 27 down toward Haines City. There are a lot of lakes down there, and wherever there are lakes in Florida, there are rich people to congregate around them, so it seemed an unlikely place for a pseudovision. But the Website I’d found had been very specific about there being this huge parcel of oft-foreclosed land that no one had ever managed to develop. I recognized the place immediately, because every other subdivision on the access road was walled in, whereas Quail Hollow was just a plastic sign hammered into the ground. As I turned in, little plastic posters read FOR SALE, PRIME LOCATION, and GREAT DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIE$!
vi: Tôi vào cao tốc I-4, theo hướng tây về phía Kissimmee và các công viên chủ đề, qua I-Drive nơi Margo và tôi đã lén vào SeaWorld, rồi theo Cao tốc 27 đi xuôi xuống thành phố Haines. Khu này có nhiều hồ, và ở Florida cứ chỗ nào có hồ là lại lắm người giàu kéo nhau đến ở, nên nơi này khó có thể thích hợp với một khu đô thị ma. Nhưng trang mạng tôi tra đã nói rất cụ thể rằng có một khu đất lớn bị tịch biên đã lâu mà chưa có ai ngó ngàng tới xây dựng. Tôi lập tức nhận ra lô đất ấy, vì mỗi tiểu khu bên đường đều có tường bao, trong khi Quail Hollow chỉ có tấm bảng nhựa đóng xuống đất. Khi đến nơi, tôi đọc được những tờ quảng cáo rao vặt đề BÁN ĐẤT, ĐỊA ĐIỂM LÍ TƯỞNG và CƠ HỘI THÚC ĐẨY $
tr: Kissimmee ve eğlence parklarına doğru giderek 14 yoluna çıktım, sonra Margo’yla SeaWoı*ld’e izinsiz girdiğimiz IBulvarı’m geçtim, ondan sonra Haines Citv’ye doğru giden 27. Karayolu’na çıktım. Haines City’de birçok göl vardır ve Florida’da nerede göl varsa, göllerin etrafında toplanan zenginler de vardır, bu yüzden burası bir semtimsi için pek olası bir yer gibi değildi. Fakat bulduğum internet sitesi, oranın kimsenin gelişt irmeyi başaramadığı arazinin kocaman bir parseli olduğu konusunda iddialıydı. Orayı hemen tamdım çünkü yol üstündeki diğer semtlerin hepsinin etrafı duvarlarla çevrilmişti, oysa Quail Hollow sadece zemine çakılmış plastik bir tabelaydı. İçeri saparken, SATILIK, MERKEZİ BÖLGE ve BÜYÜK GELİŞİM FIR$ATLARI! yazan küçük plastik tabelalar gördüm.
es: Tomé la I-4 hacia Kissimmee y los parques temáticos, pasé a la I-Drive, desde donde Margo y yo nos habíamos metido en el SeaWorld, y luego tomé la autopista 27 hacia Haines City. En esa zona hay muchos lagos, y alrededor de los lagos de Florida siempre se congregan los ricos, de modo que parecía poco probable encontrar una pseudovisión. Pero la página de internet que había consultado ofrecía detalles concretos sobre un terreno embargado en el que nadie había llegado a edificar. Lo reconocí de inmediato, porque el acceso a todas las demás urbanizaciones estaba vallado, mientras que en Quail Hollow había un simple letrero de plástico clavado en el suelo. Al entrar vi carteles de plástico de EN VENTA, UBICACIÓN IDEAL y GRANDES OPORTUNIDADES DE URBANIZACIÓN.
vi_translation: I entered the I-4 highway, heading west towards Kissimmee and the theme parks, passing I-Drive where Margo and I had sneaked into SeaWorld, then followed Highway 27 down to the city of Haines. This area has many lakes, and in Florida, wherever there are lakes, the wealthy tend to gather, so this place is unlikely to be suitable for a ghost town. But the website I checked had specifically mentioned that there was a large foreclosed property that had long been abandoned and untouched for development. I immediately recognized that lot, because every subdivision along the road had walls, while Quail Hollow only had a plastic sign stuck in the ground. When I arrived, I read the flyers advertising LAND FOR SALE, IDEAL LOCATION, and OPPORTUNITY TO BOOST $!
tr_translation: I headed towards Kissimmee and the amusement parks, getting onto Route 14, then passed the Boulevard where Margo and I had trespassed into SeaWorld, and then onto Route 27 heading towards Haines City. I got onto the highway. There are many lakes in Haines City, and wherever there are lakes in Florida, there are also wealthy people gathered around them, so it didn't seem like a likely place for a neighborhood. However, the website I found was adamant that it was a huge parcel of land that no one had managed to develop. I recognized it immediately because while all the other neighborhoods along the road were surrounded by walls, Quail Hollow was just a plastic sign staked into the ground. As I turned in, I saw small plastic signs that read FOR SALE, CENTRAL AREA, and GREAT DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES!
es_translation: I took the I-4 towards Kissimmee and the theme parks, passed onto I-Drive, from where Margo and I had entered SeaWorld, and then took Highway 27 towards Haines City. In that area, there are many lakes, and around the lakes in Florida, the rich always congregate, so it seemed unlikely to find a pseudovision. But the website I had consulted offered concrete details about a foreclosed land where no one had yet built. I recognized it immediately because access to all the other developments was fenced off, while in Quail Hollow there was just a simple plastic sign stuck in the ground. Upon entering, I saw plastic signs saying FOR SALE, IDEAL LOCATION, and GREAT DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.

en: Unlike the previous pseudovisions, someone was keeping up Quail Hollow. No houses had been built, but the lots were marked with surveying stakes, and the grass was freshly mown. All the streets were paved and named with road signs. In the subdivision’s center, a perfectly circular lake had been dug and then, for some reason, drained. As I drove up in the minivan, I could see it was about ten feet deep and several hundred feet in diameter. A hose snaked across the bottom of the crater to the middle, where a steel-and-aluminum fountain rose from the bottom to eye level. I found myself feeling thankful the lake was empty, so I wouldn’t have to stare into the water and wonder if she was in the bottom somewhere, expecting me to put on scuba gear to find her.
vi: Không giống như những đô thị ma trước, Quail Hollow có người nhòm nom đến. Chưa có ngôi nhà nào được xây, nhưng các lô đất được đánh dấu bằng cọc địa giới, và thảm cỏ mới được cắt. Các con phố trong khu này được lát và đề tên đàng hoàng. Ở trung tâm tiểu khu, một cái hồ tròn vành vạnh đã được đào xong, nhưng không hiểu sao chưa dẫn nước vào. Chạy xe qua, tôi ước chừng cái hồ sâu khoảng ba mét, đường kính tầm hơn một trăm mét. Một đường ống cao su chạy ngoằn ngoèo trong lòng hồ, nối vào chính giữa, nơi một đài phun nước bằng nhôm và thép được dựng từ đáy lên ngang tầm mắt. Tôi lấy làm mừng vì hồ đang cạn, tức là tôi không phải chằm chằm nhìn mặt nước, tự hỏi không biết Margo có ở dưới đáy không, có đang đợi tôi mặc bộ đồ lặn xuống tìm cô ấy không.
tr: Önceki semtimsilerin aksine, birileri Quail Hollow’u ayakta tutuyordu. Hiç ev inşa edilmemişti ama arsalar tetkik çubuklarıyla işaretlenmişti ve çimler yeni biçilmişti. Bütün sokaklar asfaltlanmış ve sokak tabelalarıyla isimlendirilmişti. Semtin merkezinde mükemmel bir şekilde dairesel bir göl kazılmış ve sonra nedense boşaltılmıştı. Minivanla ilerlerken gölün yaklaşık üç metre de rinliğinde ve yaklaşık 100 metre çapında olduğunu görebildim. Bir hortum, kraterin dibinden geçerek, çelik ve alüminyum bir çeşmenin dipten göz hizasına doğru yükseldiği orta kısma doğru kıvrıla kıvrıla gidiyordu. Kendimi gölün boş olduğuna şükrederken buldum, böylece suya bakmak ve Margo’nun, onu bulmak için tüple dalmamı bekleyerek, dipte bir yerlerde olup olmadığını merak etmek zorunda kalmayacaktım.
es: A diferencia de las pseudovisiones anteriores, alguien se ocupaba del mantenimiento de Quail Hollow. No habían construido casas, pero las parcelas estaban señaladas con postes y el césped estaba recién podado. Todas las calles estaban asfaltadas y tenían placas con el nombre. En el centro de la urbanización habían construido un lago perfectamente circular y, por alguna razón, lo habían vaciado. Mientras me acercaba con el coche vi que debía de tener un metro de profundidad y unos ciento cincuenta de diámetro. Una manguera zigzagueaba por el fondo hasta el centro, donde se alzaba una fuente de acero y aluminio. Me descubrí a mí mismo alegrándome de que el lago estuviera vacío, porque así no tendría que mirar fijamente el agua preguntándome si Margo estaba en el fondo, esperando que me pusiera un traje de buzo para encontrarla.
vi_translation: Unlike previous ghost towns, Quail Hollow has someone looking after it. No houses have been built yet, but the lots are marked with boundary stakes, and the grass has been freshly cut. The streets in this area are paved and properly named. In the center of the subdivision, a perfectly round lake has been dug, but for some reason, no water has been led into it yet. Driving by, I estimated the lake to be about three meters deep, with a diameter of over a hundred meters. A rubber pipe runs windingly inside the lake, connected to the center, where a fountain made of aluminum and steel is erected from the bottom up to eye level. I was glad the lake was dry, meaning I didn't have to stare at the water, wondering if Margo was at the bottom, waiting for me to dive in and find her.
tr_translation: Unlike the previous neighborhoods, someone was keeping Quail Hollow alive. No houses had been built, but the plots were marked with survey stakes and the lawns were freshly mowed. All the streets were paved and named with street signs. In the center of the neighborhood, a perfectly circular lake had been dug and then for some reason drained. As we moved forward in the minivan, about three meters of the lake I could see that it was round and about 100 meters in diameter. A hose, passing from the bottom of the crater, was winding its way towards the middle part where a steel and aluminum fountain rose from the bottom to eye level. I found myself grateful that the lake was empty, so I wouldn't have to look into the water and wonder if Margo was somewhere at the bottom, waiting for me to dive in with a scuba tank to find her.
es_translation: Unlike the previous pseudovisions, someone was in charge of maintaining Quail Hollow. They hadn't built houses, but the plots were marked with posts and the grass was freshly mowed. All the streets were paved and had name plates. In the center of the development, they had built a perfectly circular lake and, for some reason, they had drained it. As I approached with the car, I saw that it must have been about a meter deep and about one hundred fifty in diameter. A hose zigzagged across the bottom to the center, where a steel and aluminum fountain stood. I found myself glad that the lake was empty, because that way I wouldn't have to stare at the water wondering if Margo was at the bottom, waiting for me to put on a diving suit to find her.

en: I felt certain Margo could not be in Quail Hollow. It abutted too many subdivisions for it to be a good place to hide, whether you were a person or a body. But I looked anyway, and as I idled down the streets in the minivan, I felt so hopeless. I wanted to be happy that it wasn’t here. But if it wasn’t Quail Hollow, it would be the next place, or the one after that, or the one after that. Or maybe I’d never find her. Was that the better fate?
vi: Tôi cảm thấy chắc chắn rằng Margo không ở Quail Hollow. Nơi này nằm lọt giữa quá nhiều tiểu khu, không thể là địa điểm lí tưởng để ẩn náu, dù là người sống hay xác chết. Nhưng tôi vẫn xem xét kĩ, và khi ngồi trong xe lơ đãng nhìn theo những con phố, tôi thấy thật tuyệt vọng. Tôi những muốn vui vì không phải nơi này. Nhưng nếu không phải Quail Hollow, thì có thể là địa điểm tiếp theo, hoặc tiếp theo nữa, hoặc tiếp theo nữa nữa. Hoặc có thể tôi sẽ không bao giờ tìm thấy Margo. Liệu đó có phải là định mệnh tốt đẹp hơn không?
tr: Margo’nun Quail Hollovv’da olamayacağından emindim. Burası, 'ister bir insan ister bir ceset olun, saklanmaya uygun olamayacak kadar diğer semtlere bitişikti. Ama ne olursa olsun baktım ve sokaklarda boş boş gezerken kendimi çok umutsuz hissettim. Orası olmadığı için mutlu olmak istedim. Ama Quail Hollow değildiyse, sıradaki yer olacaktı ya da ondan sonraki ya da ondan sonraki... Ya da belki de onu hiç bulamayacaktım. Bu daha iyi bir kader miydi?
es: Estaba seguro de que no podía estar en Quail Hollow. Lindaba con demasiadas urbanizaciones para ser un buen sitio para esconderse, tanto si estabas vivo como si estabas muerto. Pero, de todas formas, miré, y mientras recorría las calles en coche me sentía cada vez más desesperanzado. Quería alegrarme de que no estuviera allí. Pero si no era Quail Hollow, sería la siguiente, o la siguiente, o la siguiente. O quizá nunca la hallaría. ¿Era lo mejor que podía pasar?
vi_translation: I feel certain that Margo is not at Quail Hollow. This place is surrounded by too many subdivisions, it can't be an ideal spot to hide, whether alive or dead. But I still examined it carefully, and as I sat in the car absentmindedly looking down the streets, I felt truly hopeless. I almost wanted to be glad that it wasn't this place. But if it's not Quail Hollow, then it could be the next location, or the one after that, or the one after that again. Or maybe I will never find Margo. Is that a better fate?
tr_translation: I was sure that Margo couldn’t be in Quail Hollow. This place was too adjacent to other neighborhoods to be suitable for hiding, whether you were a person or a corpse. But I looked anyway, and as I wandered the streets aimlessly, I felt very hopeless. I wanted to be happy that it wasn’t the place. But if it wasn’t Quail Hollow, it would be the next place or the one after that or the one after that... Or maybe I would never find her. Was that a better fate?
es_translation: I was sure I couldn't be in Quail Hollow. It bordered too many developments to be a good place to hide, whether you were alive or dead. But, anyway, I looked, and as I drove through the streets, I felt increasingly hopeless. I wanted to be glad that it wasn't there. But if it wasn't Quail Hollow, it would be the next one, or the next one, or the next one. Or maybe I would never find it. Was that the best thing that could happen?

en: I finished my rounds, finding nothing, and headed back toward the highway. I got lunch at a drive-thru and then ate as I drove out west toward the minimall.
vi: Chốt lại là không có gì ở Quail Hollow, tôi trở lại đường cao tốc. Tôi mua đồ ăn trưa ở một tiệm phục vụ tận cửa xe, vừa ăn vừa lái về hướng tây, tới khu mua sắm mini hôm trước.
tr: Devriyemi hiçbir şey bulmadan bitirdim ve ana yola geri döndüm. Arabalara servis veren bir yerden öğle yemeği aldım, sonra batıya, küçük alışveriş merkezine doğru sürerken yemeği yedim.
es: Terminé la ronda sin haber encontrado nada y volví a la autopista. Compré algo de comer en un restaurante con servicio para coches y comí conduciendo hacia el oeste, hacia el pequeño centro comercial abandonado.
vi_translation: In conclusion, there was nothing at Quail Hollow, so I got back on the highway. I bought lunch at a drive-in, eating while driving west, heading to the mini shopping center from the other day.
tr_translation: I finished my patrol without finding anything and returned to the main road. I got lunch from a place that serves cars, then ate it while driving west towards the small shopping mall.
es_translation: I finished the round without having found anything and returned to the highway. I bought something to eat at a drive-thru restaurant and ate while driving west, towards the small abandoned shopping center.

en: As I pulled into the minimall parking lot, I noticed that blue painters’ tape had been used to seal our hole in the board. I wondered who could have been there after us.
vi: Khi tấp bãi đỗ bên khu mua sắm mini, tôi nhận thấy ai đó đã dán băng dính dày màu xanh da trời bít cái lỗ bọn tôi phá trên ván gỗ ép hôm nọ. Không biết ai đã ở đây sau khi bọn tôi rời đi nhỉ.
tr: Küçük alışveriş merkezinin park alanına çekerken, bizim levhada açtığımız deliği kapatmak için mavi elektrik bandı kullanıldığını fark ettim. Bizden sonra buraya kimin gelmiş olabileceğini merak ettim.
es: Al entrar en el aparcamiento observé que habían tapado con cinta adhesiva azul el agujero que habíamos hecho en el conglomerado. Me pregunté quién habría estado allí después de nosotros.
vi_translation: When I pulled into the parking lot next to the mini shopping area, I noticed that someone had covered the hole we made in the plywood the other day with thick blue tape. I wonder who was here after we left.
tr_translation: As I was pulling into the parking lot of the small shopping center, I noticed that blue electrical tape was used to cover the hole we had made in our sign. I wondered who could have come here after us.
es_translation: Upon entering the parking lot, I noticed that they had covered the hole we had made in the particle board with blue adhesive tape. I wondered who had been there after us.

en: I drove around to the back and parked the minivan next to a rusted Dumpster that hadn’t encountered a garbage truck in decades. I figured I could bust through the painters’ tape if I needed to, and I was walking around toward the front when I noticed that the steel back doors to the stores didn’t have any visible hinges.
vi: Tôi lái xe ra phía sau, đỗ cạnh một thùng rác to hoen gỉ, hàng thập kỉ nay chưa được gặp cái xe chở rác nào. Tôi tính nếu cần thì cứ lao mình qua đám băng dính, nên toan đi vòng lại phía trước thì phát hiện ra những cánh cửa hậu bằng kim loại không gắn với tấm bản lề nào cả.
tr: Dolaşıp arabayı arka tarafa sürdüm ve minivanı on yıllardır bir çöp kamyonuyla karşılaşmamış pasb bir çöp konteynırının yanına park ettim. Eğer gerekirse elektrik bandını delip geçebileceğimi düşündüm; mağazalara açılan çelik arka kapıların görünürde hiç menteşeleri olmadığını fark ettiğimde ön tarafa doğru gidiyordum.
es: Avancé con el coche hasta la parte de atrás y aparqué al lado de un contenedor oxidado por el que no había pasado un camión de basura en décadas. Supuse que podría colarme entre la cinta adhesiva si era necesario, y me dirigía hacia la fachada cuando observé que en las puertas de acero de la parte de atrás de las tiendas no se veían las bisagras.
vi_translation: I drove to the back, parked next to a large rusty dumpster that hadn't seen a garbage truck in decades. I figured if necessary, I would just push through the tape, so I started to walk around to the front but then noticed that the metal back doors weren't attached to any hinges.
tr_translation: I drove around and moved the car to the back, parking the minivan next to a shabby dumpster that hadn't encountered a garbage truck in decades. I thought I could pierce through the electrical tape if necessary; I was heading towards the front when I noticed that the steel back doors leading to the stores had no visible hinges.
es_translation: I drove the car to the back and parked next to a rusty dumpster that hadn't seen a garbage truck in decades. I figured I could slip through the adhesive tape if necessary, and I was heading towards the facade when I noticed that the steel doors at the back of the stores didn't have visible hinges.

en: I’d learned a thing or two about hinges thanks to Margo, and I realized why we hadn’t had any luck pulling on all those doors: they opened in. I walked up to the door to the mortgage company office and pushed. It opened with no resistance whatsoever. God, we were such idiots. Surely, whoever cared for the building knew about the unlocked door, which made the painters’ tape seem even more out of place.
vi: Nhờ Margo, tôi đã thêm chút chuyên môn về bản lề cửa, và kịp nhận ra rằng tại sao ba thằng không cách gì kéo được những cánh cửa ấy ra: vì chúng đều mở vào trong. Tôi đến trước cửa văn phòng công ti thế chấp và đẩy vào. Cánh cửa bật ra dễ như bỡn. Trời ạ, hôm nọ rặt cả ba thằng đều ngố. Chắc chắn ai đó quan tâm đến tòa nhà này cũng đã biết về cánh cửa không khóa, cho nên những dải băng dính xanh bên kia xem ra càng thừa thãi.
tr: Margo sayesinde menteşelerle ilgili bir iki şey öğrenmiştim ve bütün o kapılan çekerken neden hiç şansımız olmadığım kavradım: İçeri doğru açılıyorlardı. Mortgage şirketinin ofisine gidip kapıyı ittim. Herhangi bir direnç göstermeden açıldı. Tanrım, o kadar aptaldık ki. Şüphesiz binayla ilgilenen her kimse, kilitlenmemiş kapıdan haberdardı ki bu elektrik bandını daha da yersiz hale getiriyordu.
es: Gracias a Margo había aprendido un par de cosas sobre bisagras, así que entendí por qué no habíamos tenido suerte al tirar de aquellas puertas: se abrían hacia dentro. Me acerqué a la puerta del despacho de la empresa hipotecaria y empujé. Se abrió sin ofrecer la más mínima resistencia. Joder, qué idiotas éramos. Sin duda la persona que se ocupaba del edificio sabía que la puerta no estaba cerrada con llave, lo cual hacía que la cinta adhesiva pareciera todavía más fuera de lugar.
vi_translation: Thanks to Margo, I gained a bit of expertise about door hinges and realized why the three of us couldn't pull those doors open: because they all opened inward. I went to the office door of the mortgage company and pushed in. The door swung open effortlessly. My God, the other day all three of us were really clueless. Surely someone concerned about this building already knew about the unlocked door, so the blue tape on the other side seemed even more redundant.
tr_translation: Thanks to Margo, I had learned a thing or two about hinges and realized why we never had any luck pulling all those doors: They opened inward. I went to the mortgage company's office and pushed the door. It opened without any resistance. God, we were so stupid. Surely whoever was in charge of the building was aware of the unlocked door, which made the electrical tape even more pointless.
es_translation: Thanks to Margo, I had learned a couple of things about hinges, so I understood why we hadn't had any luck pulling on those doors: they opened inward. I approached the door of the mortgage company's office and pushed. It opened without the slightest resistance. Damn, we were such idiots. Undoubtedly, the person in charge of the building knew that the door wasn't locked, which made the adhesive tape seem even more out of place.

en: I wiggled out of the backpack I’d packed that morning and pulled out my dad’s high-powered Maglite and flashed it around the room. Something sizable in the rafters scurried. I shivered. Little lizards jump-ran through the path of the light.
vi: Tôi lẳng cái ba-lô đã gói ghém từ sáng xuống, lấy đèn pin Maglite công suất lớn của bố ra và rọi khắp căn phòng. Tuồng như thứ gì đó to lớn ở giữa những xà rầm trên mái vừa lẩn đi. Tôi rùng mình. Mấy con thằn lằn con nhảy vào góc tối, tránh đường đi của ánh sáng.
tr: O sabah hazırladığım sırt çantasını çıkardım ve babamın yüksek güçlü Maglite’mı alıp odayı aydınlattım. Çatı kirişinden büyükçe bir şey hızla kaçtı. Ürperdim. Küçük kertenkeleler ışığın aydınlattığı yerlerden zıplayarak kaçıştılar.
es: Me quité la mochila que me había preparado por la mañana, saqué la potente linterna de mi padre y pasé la luz por toda la sala. Algo de tamaño considerable corrió por las vigas. Me estremecí. Varias lagartijas se movieron en el foco de luz.
vi_translation: I dropped the backpack I had packed since the morning, took out my dad's high-powered Maglite flashlight, and shone it around the room. It seemed like something large had just scurried away among the beams on the roof. I shivered. Some small lizards jumped into the dark corner, avoiding the path of the light.
tr_translation: I took out the backpack I had prepared that morning and lit up the room with my dad's high-powered Maglite. Something rather large quickly fled from the roof beam. I shuddered. Small lizards scurried away, jumping from the places illuminated by the light.
es_translation: I took off the backpack I had prepared in the morning, took out my father's powerful flashlight, and shone the light around the entire room. Something of considerable size ran across the beams. I shuddered. Several lizards moved in the beam of light.

en: A single shaft of light from a hole in the ceiling shone in the front corner of the room, and sunlight peeked out from behind the particleboard, but I mostly relied on the flashlight. I walked up and down the rows of desks, looking at the items we’d found in the drawers, which we’d left. It was profoundly creepy to see desktop after desktop with the same unmarked calendar: February 1986. February 1986. February 1986. June 1986. February 1986. I spun around and shone the light on a desk in the very center of the room. The calendar had been changed to June. I leaned in close and looked at the paper of the calendar, hoping to see a jagged edge where previous months had been torn off, or some marks on the page where a pen had pushed through the paper, but there was nothing different from the other calendars, save the date.
vi: Dải sáng duy nhất qua một lỗ thủng trên trần rơi xuống góc phía trước căn phòng, và chút nắng le lói sau những ván gỗ ép, nhưng tôi hầu như chỉ dựa vào ánh đèn pin. Tôi đi qua đi lại những dãy bàn, xem những thứ chúng tôi đã thấy trong các ngăn kéo và để lại. Cảm giác rờn rợn cuộn lên ghê gớm khi nhìn từ bàn này sang bàn kia đều là một trang lịch không kèm bất cứ ghi chú nào: tháng Hai 1986. Tháng Hai 1986. Tháng Hai 1986. Tháng Sáu 1986. Tháng Hai 1986. Tôi quay một vòng rồi chiếu đèn vào cái bàn ở chính giữa phòng. Lịch được giở đến tháng Sáu. Tôi cúi gần lại và săm soi tờ lịch, hi vọng thấy một góc nham nhở, chỗ mấy tháng trước được xé đi, hoặc dấu tích gì đó trên giấy chứng tỏ bút đã lướt qua, nhưng chẳng có gì khác những tờ lịch khác, trừ ngày tháng.
tr: Tavandaki delikten gelen tek bir ışık hüzmesi odamn ön köşesini aydınlatıyordu ve sunta levhanın arkasından güneş ışığı içeriye sızıyordu ama ben çoğunlukla fenere güvendim. Masa sıralannın arasında, çekmecelerde bulup orada bıraktığımız eşyalara bakarak ileri geri yürüdüm. Art arda masaların üstünde aynı işaretlenmemiş takvimi görmek, insanın içine işleyecek kadar tüyler ürperticiydi: Şubat 1986. Şubat 1986. Şubat 1986. Haziran 1986. Şubat 1986. Arkaya dönüp ışığı odamn tam ortasındaki masaya yansıttım. Takvim hazirana gitmişti. Eğilip yaklaştım ve önceki ayların koparılmış olduğu tırtıldı bir kenar ya da kalemin kâğıtta iz bıraktığı yerlerde bazı işaretler görmeyi umarak takvim yaprağına baktım ama diğer takvimlerden farklı bir şey yoktu, tarih hariç.
es: Se veía un único rayo de luz procedente de un agujero del techo, en la esquina delantera de la sala, y desde el otro lado del conglomerado se filtraba algo de luz, pero prácticamente dependía de la linterna. Recorrí las filas de mesas observando los objetos que habíamos encontrado en los cajones y que habíamos dejado allí. Era absolutamente espeluznante ver mesa tras mesa con el mismo calendario: febrero de 1986. Febrero de 1986. Febrero de 1986. Junio de 1986. Febrero de 1986. Me giré y enfoqué a una mesa situada en el centro de la sala. Habían cambiado el calendario a junio. Me incliné y observé el papel del calendario esperando ver el bloque dentado que queda después de haber arrancado las páginas, o alguna marca de bolígrafo en la página, pero la única diferencia respecto a los demás calendarios era la fecha.
vi_translation: The only beam of light through a hole in the ceiling fell into the front corner of the room, and a bit of sunlight peeked through the plywood, but I mostly relied on the flashlight. I walked back and forth through the rows of tables, looking at the things we had seen in the drawers and left behind. A creepy feeling surged up terribly as I looked from table to table, each one holding a calendar page without any notes: February 1986. February 1986. February 1986. June 1986. February 1986. I turned around and shone the light on the table in the middle of the room. The calendar was turned to June. I leaned in closer and scrutinized the calendar page, hoping to see a ragged edge where the previous months had been torn off, or some mark on the paper indicating that a pen had passed over it, but there was nothing different from the other calendar pages, except the dates.
tr_translation: A single beam of light coming from the hole in the ceiling illuminated the front corner of the room, and sunlight was seeping in from behind the chipboard, but I mostly relied on the flashlight. I walked back and forth among the rows of desks, looking at the items we found in the drawers and left there. Seeing the same unmarked calendar on the desks one after another was chilling enough to seep into one's soul: February 1986. February 1986. February 1986. June 1986. February 1986. I turned around and shone the light on the desk in the very center of the room. The calendar had moved to June. I leaned in closer and looked at the calendar page, hoping to see a jagged edge where previous months had been torn off or some marks where a pen had left an impression on the paper, but there was nothing different from the other calendars, except for the date.
es_translation: A single ray of light could be seen coming from a hole in the ceiling, in the front corner of the room, and some light filtered in from the other side of the conglomerate, but it practically depended on the flashlight. I walked through the rows of tables observing the objects we had found in the drawers and had left there. It was absolutely creepy to see table after table with the same calendar: February 1986. February 1986. February 1986. June 1986. February 1986. I turned and focused on a table located in the center of the room. They had changed the calendar to June. I leaned in and observed the calendar paper expecting to see the jagged block left after tearing off the pages, or some pen mark on the page, but the only difference from the other calendars was the date.

en: With the flashlight crooked between my neck and shoulder, I started to look through desk drawers again, paying special attention to the June desk: some napkins, some still-sharp pencils, memos about mortgages addressed to one Dennis McMahon, an empty pack of Marlboro Lights, and an almost-full bottle of red nail polish.
vi: Kẹp đèn pin giữa cổ và vai, tôi kiểm tra lại các hộc bàn lần nữa, đặc biệt chú ý đến cái bàn tháng Sáu: vài tờ khăn ăn, mấy cái bút chì còn nhọn, ghi chú về những thế chấp của một vị Dennis McMahon nào đó, bao thuốc lá Marlboro rỗng không, và lọ sơn móng tay màu đỏ còn gần đầy.
tr: Boynumla omzumun arasına sıkıştırdığım fenerle haziran masasına özel bir dikkat göstererek masa çekmecelerini tekrar incelemeye başladım: birkaç peçete, birkaç tane hâlâ sivri uçlu olan kurşun kalem, Dennis McMahon adında birine yönelik mortgage’larla ilgili notlar, boş bir Marlboro Iights paketi ve neredeyse dolu bir kırmızı oje şişesi.
es: Me coloqué la linterna entre el cuello y el hombro, y empecé a buscar otra vez en los cajones, prestando especial atención a la mesa de junio: servilletas, lápices con punta, informes de hipotecas dirigidas a un tal Dennis McMahon, un paquete vacío de Marlboro Light y un frasco casi lleno de esmalte de uñas rojo.
vi_translation: Holding the flashlight between my neck and shoulder, I checked the drawers again, paying special attention to the June desk: a few napkins, some still-sharp pencils, notes on the mortgages of a certain Dennis McMahon, an empty pack of Marlboro cigarettes, and a nearly full bottle of red nail polish.
tr_translation: With the flashlight wedged between my neck and shoulder, I began to carefully examine the desk drawers again, paying special attention to the June table: a few napkins, a few still sharp pencils, notes about mortgages addressed to someone named Dennis McMahon, an empty pack of Marlboro Lights, and an almost full bottle of red nail polish.
es_translation: I placed the flashlight between my neck and shoulder, and started searching the drawers again, paying special attention to the June table: napkins, sharpened pencils, mortgage reports addressed to a certain Dennis McMahon, an empty pack of Marlboro Light, and an almost full bottle of red nail polish.

en: I took the flashlight in one hand and the nail polish in the other and stared at it closely. So red it was almost black. I’d seen this color before. It had been on the minivan’s dash that night. Suddenly, the scurrying in the rafters and the creaking in the building became irrelevant—I felt a perverted euphoria. I couldn’t know if it was the same bottle, of course, but it was certainly the same color.
vi: Tôi chuyển đèn pin sang một tay, tay kia cầm lọ sơn móng tay và quan sát thật kĩ. Màu đỏ bầm đến mức như ngả sang đen. Tôi từng nhìn thấy màu đỏ này. Trên bảng điều khiển chiếc minivan đêm hôm đó. Đột nhiên, những sinh vật to lớn lẩn khuất trên mái và tiếng cót két trong tòa nhà chẳng còn nghĩa lí gì nữa–tôi chỉ cảm thấy một niềm hân hoan kì dị. Tất nhiên tôi không thể biết được có phải cùng một lọ sơn hay không, nhưng chắc chắn là cùng một gam màu.
tr: Bir elime feneri diğer elime ojeyi alıp şişeye yakından baktım. O kadar kırmızıydı ki neredeyse siyahtı. Bu rengi daha önce de görmüştüm. Bu oje o gece minivanın panelinin üstündeydi. Birden, kirişlerdeki koşuşturmalar ve binanın içindeki gıcırdamalar önemsizleşti... sapıkça bir coşku hissettim. Aynı şişe olup olmadığını bilemezdim tabii ki ama kesinlikle aynı renkti.
es: Cogí la linterna con una mano, el pintaúñas con la otra, y lo observé de cerca. Era tan rojo que casi parecía negro. Había visto antes ese color aquella noche. En el salpicadero del monovolumen. De pronto, las carreras por las vigas y los crujidos del edificio se volvieron irrelevantes. Sentí una euforia perversa. No podía saber si era el mismo frasco, por supuesto, pero sin duda era el mismo color.
