A brief journey to Nepal; Majestic Canada; Roaming by car across America; Fodor's guide to the Bahamas; Onward to Bhutan. There seemed to be no connection between the books, except that they were all travel guides and were published after this mini-mall was abandoned. I tucked the flashlight under my chin, stacked all the books into a pile from waist-high to chest-high, and carried them to the empty room that I now imagined as the bedroom.
tr_translation: As the last light escaped through the holes in the ceiling, I found other books on top of the other bookshelves. “Nepal Travel Guide”; “Canada’s "Important Landscapes"; "America by Car"; "Fodor's Bahamas Guide"; "Let's Go to Bhutan". There seemed to be no connection between all these books, except that they were all about travel and all published after the mall had been abandoned. I wedged the Maglite under my chin, embraced the books in a stack that stretched from my waist to my chest, and carried them to the empty room I now imagined as a bedroom.
es_translation: As the last rays of light came through the holes in the roof, I found more books on other shelves: General Guide to Nepal, Great Attractions of Canada, America by Car, Fodor's Guide to the Bahamas, and Let's Go to Bhutan. There didn't seem to be the slightest connection between the books, except that they were all travel books and the publication date was after the building was abandoned. I tucked the flashlight under my chin, loaded the pile of books, which reached from my waist to my chest, into my arms, and carried them to the empty room, which I then imagined was the bedroom.

en: So it turned out that I did spend prom night with Margo, just not quite as I’d dreamed. Instead of busting into prom together, I sat against her rolled-up carpet with her ratty blanket draped over my knees, alternately reading travel guides by flashlight and sitting still in the dark as the cicadas hummed above and around me.
vi: Rút cục hóa ra tôi đã trải qua đêm dạ tiệc với Margo, chỉ là không giống lắm với những mơ mộng của tôi. Không cùng nhau oanh tạc sàn nhảy, tôi ngồi dựa vào cuộn thảm của cô ấy, phủ tấm chăn cũ của cô ấy qua đầu gối, dò đèn pin đọc những cuốn hướng dẫn du lịch, ngồi tĩnh lặng trong bóng tối khi lũ ve sầu du dương hòa âm trên đầu và xung quanh tôi.
tr: Böylece balo gecesini Margo’yla geçirmiş gibi oldum, sadece tam olarak hayal ettiğim gibi değildi. Baloyu birlikte basmak yerine, sanlmış halısına dayanarak dizlerimin üstüne serili pasaklı battaniyesiyle oturdum, ağustos böcekleri üstümde ve etrafımda öterken, karanlıkta hareketsiz oturup fenerle sırayla seyahat rehberlerini okudum.
es: De modo que resultó que sí pasé la noche del baile de graduación con Margo, solo que no como había soñado. En lugar de irrumpir en el baile juntos, me senté, me apoyé en su moqueta enrollada, con su manta de punto tapándome las rodillas, y me puse a leer las guías de viajes a la luz de la linterna, inmóvil en la oscuridad mientras las cigarras cantaban a mi alrededor.
vi_translation: It turns out I spent the prom night with Margo, just not quite like in my dreams. Instead of tearing up the dance floor together, I sat leaning against her rolled-up carpet, covering my knees with her old blanket, reading travel guides by flashlight, and sitting quietly in the dark as the cicadas harmonized melodiously above and around me.
tr_translation: Thus, it felt like I spent the prom night with Margo, just not exactly as I had imagined. Instead of crashing the prom together, I sat on her messy blanket, leaning on the worn-out carpet, with cicadas chirping above and around me, sitting still in the dark and taking turns reading travel guides with a flashlight.
es_translation: So it turned out that I did spend prom night with Margo, just not in the way I had dreamed. Instead of bursting into the dance together, I sat, leaning against her rolled-up carpet, with her knitted blanket covering my knees, and started reading travel guides by flashlight, motionless in the dark while the cicadas sang around me.

en: Maybe she had sat here in the cacophonous darkness and felt some kind of desperation take her over, and maybe she found it impossible to unthink the thought of death. I could imagine that, of course.
vi: Có lẽ Margo từng ngồi đây, trong thứ bóng tối gào thét, cảm thấy nỗi tuyệt vọng nào đó trào dâng lên mãi. Và có lẽ cô ấy nhận ra rằng không thể không tua ngược suy nghĩ về cái chết. Tôi tưởng tượng như vậy, tất nhiên rồi.
tr: Belki o da burada ahenksiz karanlıkta oturmuş, bir tür çaresizliğin onu ele geçirdiğini hissetmişti ve belki ölümü düşünmemek imkânsız gibi gelmişti. Bunu hayal edebiliyordum, elbette.
es: Quizá se había sentado allí, en la ruidosa oscuridad, y sintió que le invadía la desesperación, y quizá le resultó imposible no pensar en la muerte. Podía imaginármelo, por supuesto.
vi_translation: Perhaps Margo had sat here, in this screaming darkness, feeling some kind of despair rising endlessly. And perhaps she realized that it was impossible not to rewind her thoughts about death. I imagine so, of course.
tr_translation: Maybe he too had sat here in the discordant darkness, feeling a kind of helplessness take hold of him, and perhaps it had seemed impossible not to think of death. I could imagine this, of course.
es_translation: Perhaps he had sat there, in the noisy darkness, and felt despair overwhelming him, and perhaps it was impossible for him not to think about death. I could imagine it, of course.

en: But I could also imagine this: Margo picking these books up at various garage sales, buying every travel guide she could get her hands on for a quarter or less. And then coming here—even before she disappeared—to read the books away from prying eyes. Reading them, trying to decide on destinations. Yes. She would stay on the road and in hiding, a balloon floating through the sky, eating up hundreds of miles a day with the help of a perpetual tailwind. And in this imagining, she was alive. Had she brought me here to give me the clues to piece together an itinerary? Maybe. Of course I was nowhere near an itinerary. Judging from the books, she could be in Jamaica or Namibia, Topeka or Beijing. But I had only just begun to look.
vi: Nhưng tôi cũng tưởng tượng thế này nữa: Margo nhặt nhạnh những sách này từ nhiều đợt bán hàng thanh lí, mua bất cứ cuốn hướng dẫn du lịch nào với giá dưới hai mươi lăm xu mà cô ấy tìm được. Rồi Margo đến đây–trước cả khi cô ấy biến mất–đọc sách và tránh xa những cặp mắt tò mò. Đọc hết, cố gắng vạch ra hành trình. Đúng vậy. Cô ấy sẽ rong ruổi và không để lại dấu vết, một quả bóng bay phiêu du trên bầu trời, thuận chiều ngọn gió miên viễn, mỗi ngày bỏ lại đằng sau hàng trăm dặm đường. Và trong tưởng tượng này của tôi, Margo đầy sức sống. Có phải Margo dẫn tôi đến đây để trao cho tôi những manh mối ghép lại với nhau thành một hành trình hay không? Có thể. Tất nhiên tới giờ tôi vẫn chưa mon men tới gần được hành trình ấy. Dựa theo những cuốn sách, Margo có thể đang ở Jamaica hoặc Namibia, Topeka hoặc Bắc Kinh. Nhưng tôi chỉ mới bắt đầu tìm kiếm thôi mà.
tr: Ama şunu da hayal edebiliyordum: Margo’nun çeşitli indirimli satışlardan bu kitapları rastgele bulduğunu ve eline geçirdiği tüm seyahat rehberlerini bir çeyrekliğe ya da daha azma satın aldığını. Sonra bu kitapları meraklı gözlerden uzakta okumak içinortadan kaybolmasından bile önceburaya geldiğini. Gideceği yerlere karar vermeye çalışarak onları okuduğunu. Evet. Saklanarak yol alacaktı; ardından esen bir rüzgâr yardımıyla bir günde yüzlerce kilometre kateden, gökyüzünde süzülen bir balon. Ve bu hayalde Margo hayattaydı. Beni buraya bir güzergâhın parçalarını birleştirmem için gereken ipuçlarını vermek için mi getirmişti? Belki. Elbette bir güzergâhın yakınında bile değildim. Kitaplardan anlaşıldığı kadarıyla Jamaika, Namibya, Topeka ya da Pekin’de olabilirdi. Fakat bakmaya daha yeni başlamıştım.
es: Pero también podía imaginarme lo siguiente: Margo comprando esos libros en diversos mercadillos, comprando todas las guías de viajes que caían en sus manos a precio de saldo. Luego yendo allí —incluso antes de que desapareciera— para leerlas alejada de miradas indiscretas. Leyéndolas e intentando decidir adónde dirigirse. Sí. Viajaría y se escondería, un globo volando por el cielo, haciendo cientos de kilómetros al día con la ayuda de un perpetuo viento de cola. Y la imaginaba viva. ¿Me había llevado hasta allí para darme las pistas para que descifrara el itinerario? Quizá. Por supuesto, yo estaba bien lejos de haber descifrado el itinerario. A juzgar por los libros, podía estar en Jamaica, Namibia, Topeka o Pekín. Pero no había hecho más que empezar a mirar.
vi_translation: But I also imagine this: Margo collected these books from various clearance sales, buying any travel guide she could find for under twenty-five cents. Then Margo came here—even before she disappeared—reading books and staying away from prying eyes. Read them all, trying to map out a journey. Exactly. She would wander without leaving a trace, a balloon drifting in the sky, following the eternal wind, leaving behind hundreds of miles each day. And in this imagination of mine, Margo is full of life. Did Margo lead me here to give me clues to piece together into a journey? Maybe. Of course, so far I haven't even come close to that journey. Based on the books, Margo could be in Jamaica or Namibia, Topeka or Beijing. But I have only just started searching.
tr_translation: But I could also imagine this: that Margo had randomly found these books from various discount sales and bought all the travel guides she could get her hands on for a quarter or less. Then, even before she disappeared to read these books away from prying eyes, she had come here. Reading them while trying to decide where to go. Yes. She would travel in hiding; then, with the help of a gust of wind, she would cover hundreds of kilometers in a day, floating in the sky like a balloon. And in this dream, Margo was alive. Had she brought me here to give me the clues I needed to piece together a route? Maybe. Of course, I wasn't even close to a route. From what I could gather from the books, she could be in Jamaica, Namibia, Topeka, or Beijing. But I had just started looking.
es_translation: But I could also imagine the following: Margo buying those books at various flea markets, buying all the travel guides that fell into her hands at bargain prices. Then going there—even before she disappeared—to read them away from prying eyes. Reading them and trying to decide where to go. Yes. She would travel and hide, a balloon flying through the sky, covering hundreds of kilometers a day with the help of a perpetual tailwind. And I imagined her alive. Had she brought me there to give me the clues to decipher the itinerary? Maybe. Of course, I was far from having deciphered the itinerary. Judging by the books, she could be in Jamaica, Namibia, Topeka, or Beijing. But I had only just begun to look.

en: In my dream, her head was on my shoulder as I lay on my back, only the corner of carpet between us and the concrete floor. Her arm was around my rib cage. We were just lying there, sleeping.
vi: Tôi nằm mơ, mái đầu Margo gối lên vai tôi còn tôi nằm thẳng, chỉ có góc thảm giữa chúng tôi và sàn bê-tông. Cánh tay cô ấy ôm ngang người tôi. Chúng tôi nằm đó, say ngủ.
tr: Ivüyamda, ben sırtüstü yatarken Margo’nun başı omzumdaydı, aramızda yalnızca halının köşesi ve beton zemin vardı. Kolu göğsüme sarılıydı. Orada öylece uyuyarak yatıyorduk.
es: En mi sueño, yo estaba tumbado boca arriba, y ella tenía la cabeza apoyada en mi hombro. Solo la moqueta nos separaba del suelo de cemento. Me rodeaba el pecho con el brazo. Estábamos simplemente tumbados, durmiendo.
vi_translation: I dreamed, Margo's head resting on my shoulder while I lay straight, with only the corner of the carpet between us and the concrete floor. Her arm wrapped around me. We lay there, sound asleep.
tr_translation: In my room, while I was lying on my back, Margo's head was on my shoulder, with only the corner of the carpet and the concrete floor between us. Her arm was wrapped around my chest. We were just lying there, sleeping.
es_translation: In my dream, I was lying on my back, and she had her head resting on my shoulder. Only the carpet separated us from the cement floor. She had her arm around my chest. We were simply lying down, sleeping.

en: God help me. The only teenaged guy in America who dreams of sleeping with girls, and just sleeping with them. And then my phone rang. It took two more rings before my fumbling hands found the phone lying on the unrolled carpet. It was 3:18 A.M. Ben was calling.
vi: Chúa phù hộ cho tôi. Tôi là gã mới lớn duy nhất trên đất Mĩ mơ tưởng ngủ với các cô gái, và chỉ ngủ với họ thôi. Rồi điện thoại đổ chuông. Chuông reo thêm hai hồi nữa tay tôi mới loạng quạng quờ thấy điện thoại trong nếp thảm. Lúc này là 3:18 sáng. Ben gọi.
tr: Tanrı yardımcım olsun. Amerika’da kızlarla yatmayı, sadece yatmayı hayal eden tek genç. Sonra telefonum çaldı. Ellerimin beceriksizce arayarak açılmış halının üstündeki telefonu bulması, telefon iki kere daha çalana kadar sürdü. Saat sabah 03:18’di. Ben arıyordu.
es: Dios mío, ayúdame. El único adolescente del país que sueña con dormir con chicas, y solo dormir. Pero entonces sonó el móvil. Mis manos tardaron dos tonos más en encontrar a tientas el teléfono, que estaba encima de la moqueta sin enrollar. Eran las 3:18 de la madrugada. El que me llamaba era Ben.
vi_translation: God bless me. I am the only teenager in America who dreams of sleeping with girls, and just sleeping with them. Then the phone rang. It rang two more times before my hand fumbled to find the phone in the fold of the carpet. It was 3:18 AM. Ben was calling.
tr_translation: God help me. The only young man in America who dreams of lying with girls, just lying. Then my phone rang. It took until the phone rang two more times for my clumsy hands to find the phone on the carpet. It was 3:18 AM. Ben was calling.
es_translation: My God, help me. The only teenager in the country who dreams of sleeping with girls, and just sleeping. But then the mobile rang. My hands took two more rings to fumble for the phone, which was on top of the unrolled carpet. It was 3:18 in the morning. The one calling me was Ben.

en: “Good morning, Ben,” I said.
vi: “Chào Ben,” tôi nói.
tr: “Günaydın, Ben,” dedim.
es: —Buenos días, Ben —le dije.
vi_translation: “Hello Ben,” I said.
tr_translation: "Good morning, Ben," I said.
es_translation: —Good morning, Ben —I said to him.

en: “YESSS!!!!!” he answered, screaming, and I could tell right away that now was not the time to try to explain to him all I had learned and imagined about Margo. I could damn near smell the booze on his breath. That one word, in the way it was shouted, contained more exclamation points than anything Ben had ever said to me in his entire life.
vi: “ỪAAA!!!! !” Ben gào lên đáp lại, tôi biết ngay rằng giờ không phải lúc cố công giải thích với nó về tất cả những gì tôi mới biết và hình dung về Margo. Tôi xém ngửi thấy mùi cồn trong hơi thở của nó. Chỉ một từ “ừa” thôi, theo cái cách vừa được tuôn ra như vậy, đã chứa đựng nhiều cảm thán hơn bất cứ điều gì Ben từng nói với tôi trong suốt cuộc đời nó.
tr: “EVEETÜH!” diye çığlık atarak cevap verdi ve o anda, Margo hakkında bütün öğrendiklerimi ve hayal ettiklerimi ona açıklamaya çalışmak için iyi bir zaman olmadığım anladım. Neredeyse nefesindeki içkinin kokusunu alabiliyordum. O tek kelime, onun bağırma şekliyle, Ben’in hayatı boyunca bana söylediği her şeyden daha çok ünlem işareti içeriyordu.
es: —¡¡¡¡¡¡SÍÍÍ!!!!!! —me gritó. Supe de inmediato que no era el momento de explicarle todo lo que había descubierto e imaginado sobre Margo. Casi me llegaba su tufo a alcohol. Aquella única palabra, tal y como la había gritado, tenía más signos de exclamación que cualquier cosa que me hubiera dicho en toda su vida.
vi_translation: “YEAHHH!!!!!” Ben screamed in response, and I knew right away that now was not the time to try to explain to him all that I had just learned and imagined about Margo. I almost smelled the alcohol on his breath. Just the one word “yeah,” uttered in that manner, contained more emotion than anything Ben had ever said to me in his entire life.
tr_translation: “YESSS!” he screamed in response, and at that moment, I realized it was not a good time to try to explain to him everything I had learned and imagined about Margo. I could almost smell the alcohol on his breath. That single word, the way he shouted it, contained more exclamation marks than anything Ben had ever said to me in his entire life.
es_translation: —YESSS!!!!!! —he shouted at me. I knew immediately that it was not the time to explain everything I had discovered and imagined about Margo. I could almost smell his alcohol breath. That single word, as he had shouted it, had more exclamation marks than anything he had ever said to me in his entire life.

en: “I take it prom is going well?”
vi: “Tôi tự hiểu là tiệc vui lắm hả?”
tr: “Bundan balonun iyi gittiğini anlıyorum?
es: —Entiendo que el baile va bien.
vi_translation: “I understand that the party was very fun, right?”
tr_translation: “So, I take it the ball is going well?”
es_translation: —I understand that the dance is going well.

en: “YESSSS! Quentin Jacobsen! The Q! America’s greatest Quentin! Yes!” His voice got distant then but I could still hear him. “Everybody, hey, shut up, hold on, shut up—QUENTIN! JACOBSEN! IS INSIDE MY PHONE!” There was a cheer then, and Ben’s voice returned. “Yes, Quentin! Yes! Bro, you have got to come over here.”
vi: “ỪAAA! Quentin Jacobsen! Ngài Q! Quentin vĩ đại nhất nước Mĩ! Đúng vậy!” Giọng nó có vẻ ra xa điện thoại nhưng tôi vẫn nghe rõ. “Mọi người ơi, nào, yên lặng, yên nào, yên lặng–QUENTIN! JACOBSEN! ĐANG NÓI CHUYỆN VỚI TÔI!” Một tràng chúc tụng rộ lên, rồi lại là giọng Ben. “Đúng, Quentin! Đúng! Chiến hữu ơi, ông phải đến đây.”
tr: “EVEEET! Quentin Jacobsen! Q! Amerika’nın en büyük Quentin’i! Evet!” O sırada sesi uzaklaştı ama onu hâlâ duyabiliyordum. “Millet, hey, kapayın çenenizi, bekle, kapayın çenenizi... QUENTIN! JACOBSEN! TELEFONUMUN İÇİNDE!” Daha sonra bir tezahürat oldu ve Ben’in sesi geri döndü. “Evet, Quentin! Evet! Kardeşim, buraya gelmelisin.
es: —¡SÍÍÍ! ¡Quentin Jacobsen! ¡El Q! ¡El mejor Quentin del país! ¡Sí! —Su voz se alejó, aunque seguía oyéndola—. A ver, callaos todo el mundo, espera, callaos… ¡TENGO A QUENTIN DENTRO DEL TELÉFONO! —Oí una aclamación y luego volvió la voz de Ben—. ¡Sí, Quentin! ¡Sí! Colega, tienes que venir.
vi_translation: “YEAH! Quentin Jacobsen! Mr. Q! The greatest Quentin in America! That's right!” His voice seemed to move away from the phone but I could still hear it clearly. “Everyone, hey, quiet, quiet, quiet–QUENTIN! JACOBSEN! IS TALKING TO ME!” A burst of cheers erupted, followed by Ben's voice again. "Yes, Quentin! Yes! Comrade, you must come here."
tr_translation: "YES! Quentin Jacobsen! Q! The greatest Quentin in America! Yes!" At that moment, his voice faded, but I could still hear him. "Guys, hey, shut up, wait, shut up... QUENTIN! JACOBSEN! INSIDE MY PHONE!" Then there was a cheer and Ben's voice returned. "Yes, Quentin! Yes! Brother, you need to come here."
es_translation: —YESSS! Quentin Jacobsen! The Q! The best Quentin in the country! Yes! —His voice faded, though I could still hear it—. Alright, everyone shut up, wait, shut up... I HAVE QUENTIN ON THE PHONE! —I heard a cheer and then Ben's voice returned—. Yes, Quentin! Yes! Dude, you have to come.

en: “Where is here?” I asked.
vi: “Đây là đâu?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Orası neresi?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Adónde? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: "Where is this?" I asked.
tr_translation: “Where is that place?” I asked.
es_translation: —Where to? —I asked him.

en: “Becca’s! Do you know where it is?”
vi: “Nhà Becca! Ông có biết ở đâu không?”
tr: “Becca’lar! Nerede olduğunu biliyor musun?
es: —¡A casa de Becca! ¿Sabes dónde está?
vi_translation: "Becca's house! Do you know where it is?"
tr_translation: “Becca! Do you know where you are?”
es_translation: —To Becca's house! Do you know where it is?

en: As it happened, I knew precisely where it was. I’d been in her basement. “I know where it is, but it’s the middle of the night, Ben. And I’m in—”
vi: Hú hồn thật, tôi biết chính xác chỗ đó ở đâu. Tôi đã vào tầng hầm nhà Becca. “Tôi biết, nhưng đang nửa đêm. Và tôi đang–”
tr: Nerede olduğunu tam olarak biliyordum. Becca’mn bodrumuna gitmiştim. “Nerede olduğunu biliyorum ama geceyansı oldu, Ben. Ve ben şu anda...
es: Resultó que sabía perfectamente dónde estaba. Había estado en su sótano. —Sé dónde está, pero son las tantas de la madrugada, Ben. Y estoy en…
vi_translation: That was a close call, I know exactly where that place is. I went into Becca's basement. "I know, but it's midnight." And I am–”
tr_translation: I knew exactly where it was. I had gone to Becca's basement. “I know where it is, but it's midnight, Ben. And right now I...”
es_translation: It turned out he knew exactly where it was. He had been in his basement. —I know where it is, but it's the middle of the night, Ben. And I'm in…

en: “YESSS!!! You have to come right now. Right now!”
vi: “ỪAAA!!! Ông phải đến ngay! Ngay và luôn!”
tr: “EVEEETÜ! Hemen gelmelisin. Hemen!”
es: —¡SÍÍÍ! Tienes que venir ahora mismo. ¡Ahora mismo!
vi_translation: "Yes!!! You have to come right away! Right now and immediately!"
tr_translation: "YESSS! You must come immediately. Immediately!"
es_translation: —YESSS! You have to come right now. Right now!

en: “Ben, there are more important things going on,” I answered.
vi: “Ben ơi, có nhiều chuyện quan trọng hơn,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Ben, daha önemli şeyler oluyor,” diye karşılık verdim.
es: —Ben, tengo cosas más importantes que hacer —le contesté.
vi_translation: "Ben, there are more important things," I replied.
tr_translation: “Ben, daha önemli şeyler oluyor,” diye karşılık verdim.
es_translation: —Ben, I have more important things to do —I replied.

en: “DESIGNATED DRIVER!”
vi: “TÀI XẾ ĐƯỢC BỔ NHIỆM!”
tr: “AYIK ŞOFÖR!
es: —¡TE HA TOCADO CONDUCIR!
vi_translation: "DRIVER APPOINTED!"
tr_translation: “DESIGNATED DRIVER!”
es_translation: —IT'S YOUR TURN TO DRIVE!

en: “What?”
vi: “Hả?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: “Huh?”
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —What?

en: “You’re my designated driver! Yes! You are so designated! I love that you answered! That’s so awesome! I have to be home by six! And I designate you to get me there! YESSSSSSS!”
vi: “Tôi bổ nhiệm ông làm tài xế cho tôi! Phải! Ông xứng đáng được bổ nhiệm! Ông trả lời điện thoại tôi ưng lắm! Bá cháy con bọ chét! Tôi phải về nhà trước sáu giờ! Và tôi bổ nhiệm ông đưa tôi về! ỪAAAAAAA!”
tr: “Sen benim seçilmiş ayık şoförümsün! Evet! Öylesine seçilmişsin ki! Telefonu açmana bayıldım! Çok müthiş! Altıda evde olmalıyım! Ve beni oraya götürmen için seni seçiyorum! EVEEET!
es: —¡Que te ha tocado conducir! ¡Sí! ¡Te ha tocado! ¡Me alegro de que hayas contestado! ¡Es fantástico! ¡Tengo que estar en casa a las seis! ¡Y te ha tocado llevarme! ¡SÍÍÍÍÍÍ!
vi_translation: “I appoint you as my driver! Yes! You deserve to be appointed! Your phone answering skills are excellent! Absolutely amazing! I must be home before six o'clock! And I appoint you to take me home! YAAAAAAA!”
tr_translation: “You are my designated sober driver! Yes! You are so chosen! I loved that you answered the phone! So awesome! I need to be home by six! And I choose you to take me there! YEEES!”
es_translation: —You have to drive! Yes! You have to! I'm glad you answered! It's fantastic! I have to be home by six! And you have to take me! YEEEESSSS!

en: “Can’t you just spend the night there?” I asked.
vi: “Ông ở lại cả đêm không được sao?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Geceyi orada geçiremez misin?” diye sordum.
es: —¿No puedes quedarte a pasar la noche? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: “Can't you stay the whole night?” I asked.
tr_translation: "Can't you spend the night there?" I asked.
es_translation: —Can't you stay the night? —I asked him.

en: “NOOOO! Booooo. Booo on Quentin. Hey, everybody! Boooo Quentin!” And then I was booed. “Everybody’s drunk. Ben drunk. Lacey drunk. Radar drunk. Nobody drive. Home by six. Promised Mom. Boo, Sleepy Quentin! Yay, Designated Driver! YESSSS!”
vi: “KHÔÔÔNG! Lêu lêuuuuu. Lêu lêuuuu Quentin. Này, mọi người ơi! Lêu lêuuuu Quentin!” Và cả lũ cùng lêu lêu tôi. “Đứa nào cũng say. Ben say. Lacey say. Radar say. Không có ai lái xe cả. Về nhà trước sáu giờ. Đã hứa với mẹ rồi. Lêu lêu, đồ Quentin hám ngủ! Chậc, tài xế được bổ nhiệm! ỪAAA!”
tr: “HAYIIIR! Yuuuh. Yuuh Quentin. Hey, millet! Quentin’i yuhalayın!” Ve sonra yuhalandım. “Herkes sarhoş. Ben sarhoş. Lacey sarhoş. Radar sarhoş. Kimse süremez. Altıda evde. Anneme söz verdim. Yuh, Uykucu Quentin! Yaşasın Seçilmiş Ayık Şoför! EVEEET!
es: —¡NOOO! Buuu. Un buuu para Quentin. ¡Venga, todos! ¡Buuuu, Quentin! —Y me abuchearon—. Están todos borrachos. Ben, borracho. Lacey, borracha. Radar, borracho. Nadie puede conducir. En casa a las seis. Se lo prometí a mi madre. ¡Buuu, Quentin, dormilón! ¡Te ha tocado conducir! ¡SÍÍÍ!
vi_translation: “NOOOO! Boo hoo hoo. Boo hoo hoo Quentin. Hey, everyone! Boo hoo hoo Quentin!” And the whole group booed me. “Everyone is drunk. Ben is drunk. Lacey is drunk. Radar is drunk. No one can drive. Be home before six o'clock. Promised mom already. Boo hoo, sleepyhead Quentin! Well, the designated driver! Yeah!”
tr_translation: “NOOO! Boo. Boo Quentin. Hey, people! Boo Quentin!” And then I was booed. “Everyone is drunk. I'm drunk. Lacey is drunk. Radar is drunk. No one can drive. Home by six. I promised my mom. Boo, Sleepy Quentin! Long live the Designated Sober Driver! YES!”
es_translation: —NOOO! Booo. A boo for Quentin. Come on, everyone! Boooo, Quentin! —And they booed me—. They're all drunk. Ben, drunk. Lacey, drunk. Radar, drunk. No one can drive. Home by six. I promised my mom. Booo, Quentin, sleepyhead! You have to drive! YESSS!

en: I took a long breath. If Margo were going to show up, she would have showed up by three. “I’ll be there in half an hour.”
vi: Tôi hít một hơi thật sâu. Nếu Margo quay lại nơi này, hẳn là cô ấy đã đến trước ba giờ sáng. “Nửa tiếng nữa tôi qua.”
tr: Derin bir nefes aldım. Eğer Margo ortaya çıkacak olsaydı, üçe kadar ortaya çıkardı. “Yarım saate orada olacağım!
es: Respiré hondo. Si Margo hubiera querido aparecer, habría aparecido antes de las tres. —Estaré allí dentro de media hora.
vi_translation: I took a deep breath. If Margo came back to this place, she must have arrived before three in the morning. "I'll be there in half an hour."
tr_translation: I took a deep breath. If Margo were going to show up, she would have appeared by the count of three. "I'll be there in half an hour!"
es_translation: I took a deep breath. If Margo had wanted to show up, she would have shown up before three. —I will be there in half an hour.

en: “YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YESSSSSS!!!! YES! YES!”
vi: “CÓ THẾ CHỨ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! Ừ! ỪỪỪỪỪỪ!! Ừ! Ừ!”
tr: “EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVET EVEEEETÜÜ EVET! EVET!
es: —¡¡¡¡¡¡SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍ SÍÍÍÍÍÍ!!!!!! ¡SÍ! ¡SÍ!
vi_translation: “THAT'S IT! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! YESS!!!! YES! YES!”
tr_translation: “YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YEEEEEES YES! YES!”
es_translation: —YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YESSSSS!!!!!! YES! YES!

en: Ben was still making assertions of affirmation when I hung up the phone. I lay there for a moment, telling myself to get up, and then I did. Still half asleep, I crawled through Troll Holes past the library and into the office, then pulled open the back door and got into the minivan.
vi: Ben vẫn còn điên cuồng xác nhận sự khẳng định khi tôi cắt điện thoại. Tôi nằm thêm lúc nữa, tự bảo mình phải dậy thôi, và tôi nhỏm dậy. Vẫn còn ngái ngủ, tôi chui qua Lỗ Quỉ, đi ngang thư viện vào văn phòng, rồi kéo mở cửa sau và đi ra xe.
tr: Telefonu kapattığımda, Ben hâlâ onaylama evetlerine devam ediyordu. Kısa bir süre kendime kalkmayı telkin ederek orada uzandım ve sonra kalktım. Hâlâ yarı uykulu halde, Cüce Delikleri’nden emekleyerek kütüphaneden geçip ofise gittim, sonra arka kapıyı çekip açtım ve minivana bindim.
es: Ben seguía afirmando cuando colgué el teléfono. Me quedé un momento tumbado, diciéndome a mí mismo que tenía que levantarme, y por fin me levanté. Gateé por los Agujeros de Trol medio dormido, pasé por la biblioteca, llegué al despacho, abrí la puerta de atrás del edificio y me metí en el coche.
vi_translation: Ben was still frantically affirming when I hung up the phone. I lay there for a while longer, telling myself I had to get up, and then I sat up. Still groggy, I crawled through the Devil's Hole, passed the library into the office, then pulled open the back door and went out to the car.
tr_translation: When I hung up the phone, Ben was still continuing with his affirmations. For a short while, I lay there, encouraging myself to get up, and then I got up. Still half-asleep, I crawled through the Dwarf Holes, passed through the library to the office, then pulled open the back door and got into the minivan.
es_translation: Ben was still insisting when I hung up the phone. I stayed lying down for a moment, telling myself that I had to get up, and finally, I got up. I crawled through the Troll Holes half-asleep, passed by the library, reached the office, opened the back door of the building, and got into the car.

en: I turned in to Becca Arrington’s subdivision just before four. There were dozens of cars parked along both sides of Becca’s street, and I knew there would be more people inside, since many of them had been dropped off via limo. I found a spot a couple cars away from RHAPAW.
vi: Chớm bốn giờ sáng, tôi rẽ vào khu nhà Becca Arrington. Có hàng chục ô-tô đỗ dọc hai vỉa hè phố nhà Becca. Tôi biết trong nhà còn đông hơn vì nhiều đứa được xe limo chở đến. Tôi tìm được chỗ đỗ cách RHAPAW vài xe.
tr: Gece dörtten kısa bir süre önce Becca Arrington’m mahallesine döndüm. Becca’nın sokağının iki tarafı boyunca park edilmiş düzinelerce araba vardı ve içeride daha da fazla insan olacağını biliyordum çünkü çoğu, limuzinle oraya bırakılmıştı. SESIB’dan birkaç araba uzaklıkta boş bir yer buldum.
es: Llegué a la urbanización de Becca Arrington poco antes de las cuatro. A ambos lados de su calle había decenas de coches aparcados, y sabía que dentro habría todavía más gente, porque muchos habían llegado en limusina. Encontré sitio a un par de coches del Chuco.
vi_translation: At the crack of four in the morning, I turned into Becca Arrington's neighborhood. There were dozens of cars parked along both sidewalks of Becca's street. I knew it was even more crowded inside because many kids had been brought by limousines. I found a parking spot a few cars away from RHAPAW.
tr_translation: I returned to Becca Arrington's neighborhood shortly before four in the morning. There were dozens of cars parked along both sides of Becca's street, and I knew there would be even more people inside because most of them had been dropped off by limousine. I found an empty spot a few cars away from SESIB.
es_translation: I arrived at Becca Arrington's neighborhood a little before four. On both sides of her street, there were dozens of parked cars, and I knew there would be even more people inside, because many had arrived in limousines. I found a spot a couple of cars away from Chuco.

en: I had never seen Ben drunk. In tenth grade, I once drank a bottle of pink “wine” at a band party. It tasted as bad going down as it did coming up. It was Ben who sat with me in Cassie Hiney’s Winnie-the-Pooh–themed bathroom while I projectile-vomited pink liquid all over a painting of Eeyore. I think the experience soured both of us on alcoholic pursuits. Until tonight, anyway.
vi: Tôi chưa bao giờ thấy Ben say xỉn. Hồi lớp mười, tôi từng uống một chai “vang” hồng ở một buổi tiệc của ban nhạc. Mùi vị kinh đến nỗi nuốt vào hay phun ra cũng không khác nhau là mấy. Chính Ben đã ngồi với tôi trong phòng tắm theo-chủ-đề-gấu-Pooh của Cassie Hiney trong khi tôi nôn thốc thứ chất lỏng màu hồng ấy lên bức tranh chú lừa Eeyore. Có lẽ trải nghiệm ấy đã chặn đường bia rượu của cả hai đứa tôi. Cho đến đêm nay, dù sao cũng là như vậy.
tr: Ben’i hiç sarhoş görmemiştim. Bir keresinde onuncu sınıfta, bando partisinde bir şişe pembe “şarap” içmiştim. İçeri girerken ladı dışarı çıkarkenki kadar kötüydü. Cassie Hiney’lerin Winnie l he Pooh temalı banyosunda, pembe sıvıyı bir Eeyore resminin her verine saçarak kusarken, benimle birlikte oturan Ben’di. Sanırım bu deneyim ikimizin de alkollü etkinliklerle arasını bozdu. En azından bu geceye kadar.
es: Nunca había visto a Ben borracho. Unos años atrás me había bebido una botella de «vino» rosado en una fiesta de la banda de música. Tenía tan mal sabor al tragarlo como al vomitarlo. Fue Ben el que se sentó conmigo en el baño estilo Winnie the Pooh de Cassie Hiney mientras yo lanzaba proyectiles de líquido rosa hacia un cuadro de Ígor. Creo que la experiencia nos amargó a los dos las borracheras para siempre. Bueno, hasta esa noche.
vi_translation: I have never seen Ben drunk. Back in tenth grade, I once drank a bottle of pink “wine” at a band party. The taste was so awful that swallowing it or spitting it out made little difference. It was Ben who sat with me in Cassie Hiney's Pooh-bear-themed bathroom while I vomited that pink liquid all over the picture of Eeyore the donkey. Perhaps that experience blocked the path of alcohol for both of us. Until tonight, anyway.
tr_translation: I had never seen Ben drunk. Once, in tenth grade, I drank a bottle of pink "wine" at a band party. It was as bad going out as it was going in. Ben was the one sitting with me in Cassie Hiney's Winnie the Pooh-themed bathroom, as I vomited the pink liquid all over an Eeyore picture. I guess that experience soured both of us on alcohol-related events. At least until tonight.
es_translation: I had never seen Ben drunk. A few years ago, I had drunk a bottle of "wine" rosé at a band party. It tasted just as bad going down as it did coming back up. It was Ben who sat with me in Cassie Hiney's Winnie the Pooh-themed bathroom while I projectile vomited pink liquid towards an Igor painting. I think the experience soured both of us on getting drunk forever. Well, until that night.

en: Now, I knew Ben was going to be drunk. I’d heard him on the phone. No sober person says “yes” that many times per minute. Nonetheless, when I pushed past some people smoking cigarettes on Becca’s front lawn and opened the door to her house, I did not expect to see Jase Worthington and two other baseball players holding a tuxedo-clad Ben upside down above a keg of beer. The spout of the beer keg was in Ben’s mouth, and the entire room was transfixed on him. They were all chanting in unison, “Eighteen, nineteen, twenty,” and for a moment, I thought Ben was getting—like—hazed or something. But no, as he sucked on that beer spout like it was mother’s milk, little trickles of beer spilled from the sides of his mouth, because he was smiling. “Twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five,” the people shouted, and you could hear their enthusiasm. Apparently, something remarkable was taking place.
vi: Lần này tôi biết Ben say mềm. Nghe giọng nó trong điện thoại là đủ biết. Không có ai tỉnh táo mà lại tuôn ra hàng tràng “ừ” với “ừa” đậm đặc trong một phút như vậy. Tuy nhiên, khi chen qua mấy người đang hút thuốc trên thảm cỏ trước nhà Becca và mở cửa vào, tôi không ngờ lại thấy cảnh Jase Worthington và hai cậu khác trong đội bóng chày đang dốc ngược anh chàng Ben xúng xính lễ phục đuôi tôm, giữ anh chàng lơ lửng trên một bom bia. Vòi từ bom bia cắm vào mồm Ben, và toàn bộ căn phòng đang đổ dồn vào nó. Tất cả cùng đồng thanh đếm, “Mười tám, mười chín, hai mươi.” Tôi thoạt tưởng như Ben đang bị bắt nạt hội đồng hay chơi đểu gì đó. Nhưng không, nó đang nhiệt liệt hút bia như thể đó là sữa mẹ vậy, mấy rãnh bia còn trào ra từ mép vì nó đang cười. “Hai mươi ba, hai mươi tư, hai mươi lăm,” mọi người vẫn hô, có thể nghe thấy lẫn trong đó là cơn phấn khích cuồng nhiệt. Rõ ràng đang diễn ra một sự kiện trong đại.
tr: Şimdi, Ben’in sarhoş olacağım biliyordum. Onu telefonda duymuştum. Hiçbir ayık insan bir dakikada bu kadar çok “evet” demez. I îununla birlikte, Becca’larm ön taraftaki çimenliğinde sigara içen birkaç kişiyi iterek geçtikten sonra kapıyı açıp eve girdiğimde, rlase Worthington ile iki beyzbol oyuncusunun, smokinli Ben’i bir bira fıçısının üstünde baş aşağı tuttuğunu görmeyi beklemiyordum. Bira fıçısının hortumu Ben’in ağzmdaydı ve bütün oda ona kilitlenmişti. Hepsi bir ağızdan, “On sekiz, on dokuz, yirmi,” diye tezahürat ediyordu ve bir anlığına Ben’le uğraştıklarını falan düşündüm. Ama hayır, Ben o bira hortumunu annesinin sütüymüş gibi emerken, ağzının kenarlarından küçük bira dereleri akıyordu çünkü gülümsüyordu. “Yirmi üç, yirmi dört, yirmi beş,” diye bağırdılar, coşkularını duymak mümkündü. Anlaşılan dikkate değer bir şey gerçekleşiyordu.
es: Ya sabía que Ben estaría borracho. Lo había oído al teléfono. Nadie sobrio dice «sí» tantas veces por minuto. Sin embargo, cuando pasé entre varias personas que estaban fumando en el césped de Becca y abrí la puerta de su casa, no esperaba ver a Jase Worthington y a otros dos jugadores de béisbol sujetando a un Ben con esmoquin, patas arriba, sobre un barril de cerveza. Tenía metido en la boca el grifo del barril, y toda la sala lo miraba. Todos cantaban al unísono: «Dieciocho, diecinueve, veinte», y por un momento pensé que estaban haciéndole una putada o algo así. Pero no. Mientras chupaba del grifo como si fuera la leche de su madre, pequeños chorros de cerveza le resbalaban a ambos lados de la boca, porque estaba sonriendo. «Veintitrés, veinticuatro, veinticinco», gritaban todos entusiasmados. Al parecer, estaba sucediendo algo importante.
vi_translation: This time I knew Ben was completely drunk. Just hearing his voice on the phone was enough to tell. No one sober would spew out a string of "uh-huhs" and "yeahs" so densely in a minute like that. However, when I squeezed past a few people smoking on the lawn in front of Becca's house and opened the door, I didn't expect to see Jase Worthington and two other guys from the baseball team holding Ben, dressed in a tuxedo, upside down over a beer keg. The keg's tap was in Ben's mouth, and the whole room was focused on him. Everyone was counting in unison, "Eighteen, nineteen, twenty." At first, I thought Ben was being bullied or pranked. But no, he was eagerly chugging the beer as if it were mother's milk, with beer streams spilling from the corners of his mouth because he was laughing. "Twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five," everyone continued to chant, and you could hear the wild excitement in their voices. Clearly, a major event was taking place.
tr_translation: Now, I knew Ben was going to get drunk. I had heard it on the phone. No sober person says "yes" that many times in a minute. However, after pushing past a few people smoking on the front lawn of Becca's place and opening the door to go inside, I did not expect to see Chase Worthington and two baseball players holding Ben, in a tuxedo, upside down over a beer keg. The hose from the beer keg was in Ben's mouth, and the whole room was focused on him. They were all chanting in unison, "Eighteen, nineteen, twenty," and for a moment, I thought they were messing with Ben. But no, as Ben sucked on that beer hose like it was his mother's milk, small streams of beer were running down the sides of his mouth because he was smiling. "Twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five," they shouted, and you could hear their excitement. Apparently, something remarkable was happening.
es_translation: I already knew that Ben would be drunk. I had heard him on the phone. Nobody sober says "yes" so many times per minute. However, when I walked past several people who were smoking on Becca's lawn and opened the door to her house, I didn't expect to see Jase Worthington and two other baseball players holding an upside-down Ben in a tuxedo over a beer keg. He had the keg tap in his mouth, and the whole room was watching him. Everyone was chanting in unison: "Eighteen, nineteen, twenty," and for a moment I thought they were playing a prank on him or something. But no. While he sucked on the tap as if it were his mother's milk, small streams of beer dribbled down both sides of his mouth because he was smiling. "Twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five," everyone shouted enthusiastically. Apparently, something important was happening.

en: It all seemed so trivial, so embarrassing. It all seemed like paper kids having their paper fun. I made my way through the crowd toward Ben, and was surprised to happen across Radar and Angela.
vi: Nhưng tất cả đều thật trẻ con, thật đáng xấu hổ. Tất cả đều là những đứa trẻ giấy đang tiêu khiển bằng trò vui giấy. Tôi len qua đám đông đi về phía Ben, ngạc nhiên vì giữa đường gặp ngay Radar và Angela.
tr: Hepsi öyle saçma, öyle utanç verici görünüyordu ki. Hepsi kâğıttan eğlencelerini yapan kâğıttan çocuklar gibi görünüyordu. Kalabalığın arasında kendime yol açarak Ben’e doğru ilerledim ve Radar ile Angela’ya rastlayınca şaşırdım.
es: Toda la escena me resultaba trivial y bochornosa. Chicos de papel con su diversión de papel. Me abrí camino hacia Ben entre la multitud y me sorprendió encontrarme con Radar y Angela.
vi_translation: But it was all so childish, so shameful. They were all just paper kids amusing themselves with paper fun. I weaved through the crowd towards Ben, surprised to run into Radar and Angela along the way.
tr_translation: It all seemed so absurd, so shameful. They all looked like paper children making paper amusements. I made my way through the crowd towards Ben and was surprised when I ran into Radar and Angela.
es_translation: The whole scene seemed trivial and embarrassing to me. Paper kids with their paper fun. I made my way to Ben through the crowd and was surprised to run into Radar and Angela.

en: “What the hell is this?” I asked.
vi: “Chuyện quái gì vậy?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Bu saçmalık da ne böyle?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Qué mierda es esto? —les pregunté.
vi_translation: “What the hell is going on?” I asked.
tr_translation: “What is this nonsense?” I asked.
es_translation: —What the hell is this? —I asked them.

en: Radar paused from counting and looked over at me. “Yes!” he said. “The Designated Driver cometh! Yes!”
vi: Radar không đếm nữa và quay sang tôi. “Phải!” Nó cũng loạn lên. “Tài xế được bổ nhiệm tới òi! Phải!”
tr: Radar saymaya ara verip bana baktı. “Evet!” dedi. “Seçilmiş Şoför geldi! Evet!
es: Radar dejó de contar y me miró. —¡Sí! —exclamó—. ¡Ha llegado el conductor! ¡Sí!
vi_translation: Radar stopped counting and turned to me. "Yes!" It also got excited. "The driver has been appointed already! Yes!"
tr_translation: Radar stopped counting and looked at me. "Yes!" he said. "The Chosen Driver has arrived! Yes!"
es_translation: Radar stopped counting and looked at me. —Yes! —he exclaimed—. The driver has arrived! Yes!

en: “Why is everyone saying ‘yes’ so much tonight?”
vi: “Sao đêm nay ai cũng ‘ừ’ với ‘phải’ vậy?”
tr: “Bu gece neden herkes çok fazla ‘evet’ diyor?
es: —¿Por qué todo el mundo se dedica a decir «sí»?
vi_translation: “Why is everyone saying 'yes' and 'right' tonight?”
tr_translation: “Why is everyone saying 'yes' so much tonight?”
es_translation: —Why does everyone go around saying "yes"?

en: “Good question,” Angela shouted to me. She puffed out her cheeks and sighed. She looked almost as annoyed as I felt.
vi: “Hỏi hay đấy,” Angela hét lên trả lời tôi. Cậu ấy phồng má và thở dài, trông có vẻ cũng đang khó chịu y như tôi.
tr: “İyi soru,” diye bağırdı Angela. Yanaklarını şişirip iç geçirdi. Neredeyse benim kadar sıkılmış görünüyordu.
es: —Buena pregunta —me gritó Angela. Resopló y suspiró. Parecía tan molesta como yo.
vi_translation: “Good question,” Angela shouted in response to me. She puffed her cheeks and sighed, looking just as upset as I was.
tr_translation: “Good question,” shouted Angela. She puffed out her cheeks and sighed. She looked almost as bored as I was.
es_translation: —Good question —Angela shouted at me. She huffed and sighed. She seemed as annoyed as I was.

en: “Hell yes, it’s a good question!” Radar said, holding a red plastic cup full of beer in each hand.
vi: “Khỉ ạ, ừ, hỏi hay đấy!” Radar nói, mỗi tay cầm một cốc nhựa đỏ sóng sánh bia.
tr: “Çok doğru, iyi bir soru!” dedi Radar, iki elinde de bira dolu kırmızı, plastik birer bardak tutuyordu.
es: —¡Sí, joder, es una buena pregunta! —dijo Radar con un vaso rojo de plástico lleno de cerveza en cada mano.
vi_translation: "Damn, yeah, good question!" Radar said, holding a sloshing red plastic cup of beer in each hand.
tr_translation: "Very true, a good question!" said Radar, holding a red plastic cup full of beer in each hand.
es_translation: —Yeah, damn, that's a good question! —said Radar with a red plastic cup full of beer in each hand.

en: “They’re both his,” Angela explained to me calmly.
vi: “Của cậu ấy cả đấy,” Angela bình tĩnh giải thích cho tôi.
tr: “İkisi de onun,” diye açıkladı Angela sakin bir şekilde.
es: —Los dos son suyos —me explicó Angela con un tono tranquilo.
vi_translation: “It's all his,” Angela calmly explained to me.
tr_translation: “Both of them are his,” Angela explained calmly.
es_translation: —Both of them are his —Angela explained to me in a calm tone.

en: “They wanted you,” she said. “Thought it would get you here.” I rolled my eyes. She rolled hers back, sympathetically.
vi: “Sao cậu không phải là tài xế được bổ nhiệm?” tôi hỏi. “Vì mọi người muốn cậu,” Angela đáp. “Cho là như thế thì mới lôi được cậu đến.” Tôi trợn mắt. Angela cũng trợn mắt đầy thông cảm.
tr: “Seni istediler,” dedi. “Seni buraya getireceğini düşündüler.” Gözlerimi devirdim. O da aynı hislerle, kendininkileri devirerek karşılık verdi.
es: —¿Por qué no te han pedido a ti que los lleves a casa? —le pregunté. —Te querían a ti —me contestó—. Pensaron que así vendrías. Miré al techo. Angela miró también al techo compadeciéndome.
vi_translation: “Because everyone wants you,” Angela replied. “They thought that would be the only way to get you here.” I rolled my eyes. Angela also rolled her eyes sympathetically.
tr_translation: “They wanted you,” he said. “They thought you would bring yourself here.” I rolled my eyes. He responded with the same feeling, rolling his own eyes.
es_translation: —I asked him. —They wanted you —he answered me—. They thought that way you would come. I looked at the ceiling. Angela also looked at the ceiling, pitying me.

en: “You must really like him,” I said, nodding toward Radar, who was holding both beers over his head, joining in the counting. Everybody seemed so proud of the fact that they could count.
vi: “Cậu thích cậu ấy lắm hả?” tôi hỏi, hất đầu về phía Radar, lúc này đang giơ hai cốc bia lên cao quá đầu và hòa vào đám đếm đồng thanh. Đứa nào cũng có vẻ tự hào rằng giờ này mình vẫn còn đếm được.
tr: “Ondan gerçekten hoşlanıyor olmalısın,” dedim, başımı, iki birayı da başının üstünde tutmuş, saymaya eşlik eden Radar’a doğru sallayarak. Herkes sayabiliyor olmaları gerçeğinden oldukça gurur duyuyor gibi görünüyordu.
es: —Debe de gustarte mucho —le dije señalando con la cabeza a Radar, que levantó los dos vasos de cerveza y siguió contando. Parecían todos muy orgullosos de saber contar.
vi_translation: "Do you like him a lot?" I asked, nodding towards Radar, who was now holding two cups of beer high above his head and joining in the synchronized counting. Everyone seemed proud that they could still count at this hour.
tr_translation: “You must really like her,” I said, nodding my head towards Radar, who was holding both beers above his head, accompanying the counting. Everyone seemed quite proud of the fact that they could count.
es_translation: —You must like it a lot —I said to him, nodding towards Radar, who lifted the two beer glasses and continued counting. They all seemed very proud of knowing how to count.

en: “Even now he’s sort of adorable,” she answered.
vi: “Kể cả bây giờ thì cậu ấy đáng yêu mà,” Angela đáp.
tr: “Şu anda bile bir bakıma sevimli,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —Incluso ahora es monísimo —me contestó.
vi_translation: “Even now, she's adorable,” Angela replied.
tr_translation: “In a way, it's still charming even now,” he replied.
es_translation: —Even now, he's super cute —she replied to me.

en: “Gross,” I said.
vi: “Chịu cậu đấy!” tôi nói.
tr: “iğrenç,” dedim.
es: —Qué asco —le dije.
vi_translation: "I give up on you!" I said.
tr_translation: "Disgusting," I said.
es_translation: —How disgusting —I told him.

en: Radar nudged me with one of the beer cups. “Look at our boy Ben! He’s some kind of autistic savant when it comes to keg stands. Apparently he’s like setting a world record right now or something.”
vi: Radar khều tôi bằng một trong mấy cốc bia của nó. “Nhìn Ben bé bỏng của chúng ta xem! Động đến màn quán quân bom bia thì anh chàng thành thiên tài thông thái đấy. Xem nó lập kỉ lục thế giới đến nơi rồi.”
tr: Radar bira bardaklarından biriyle beni dürttü. “Oğlumuz Ben’e bak! Konu fıçı duruşuysa bir tür otistik bilgin oluyor. Görünüşe göre tam şu anda bir dünya rekoru falan kırıyor.
es: Radar me dio un golpecito con un vaso de cerveza. —¡Mira a nuestro Ben! Es como un sabio autista en un keg stand. Parece que quiere batir un récord o algo así.
vi_translation: Radar nudged me with one of his beer mugs. "Look at our little Ben! When it comes to beer pong, he turns into a genius." "He's about to set a world record."
tr_translation: Radar nudged me with one of the beer mugs. “Look at our son Ben! When it comes to keg stance, he becomes a kind of autistic savant. Apparently, right now he's breaking some sort of world record or something.”
es_translation: Radar tapped me with a beer glass. —Look at our Ben! He's like an autistic savant at a keg stand. It looks like he wants to break a record or something.

en: “What is a keg stand?” I asked.
vi: “Quán quân bom bia là sao?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Fıçı duruşu ne?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Qué es un keg stand? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: “What does 'beer bomb champion' mean?” I asked.
tr_translation: “What is the barrel stance?” I asked.
es_translation: —What is a keg stand? —I asked him.

en: Angela pointed at Ben. “That,” she said.
vi: Angela chỉ phía Ben, nói. “Đó.”
tr: Angela, Ben’i işaret etti. “Şu,” dedi.
es: —Eso —me contestó Angela señalando a Ben.
vi_translation: Angela pointed towards Ben and said, "There."
tr_translation: Angela pointed at Ben. "That one," she said.
es_translation: —That —Angela replied to me, pointing at Ben.

en: “Oh,” I said. “Well, it’s—I mean, how hard can it be to hang upside down?”
vi: “Ờ,” tôi nói, “Chà, sao mà–bị dốc ngược thế kia thì khó chịu lắm nhỉ?”
tr: ‘Ya,” dedim. “Şey, bu... yani, baş aşağı asılmak ne kadar zor olabilir ki?
es: —Ah —dije—. Bueno, es… Vaya, ¿no es muy duro estar colgado cabeza abajo?
vi_translation: "Well," I said, "Wow, being upside down like that must be really uncomfortable, right?"
tr_translation: ‘Yeah,’ I said. ‘Well, this... I mean, how hard could it be to hang upside down?’
es_translation: —Ah —I said—. Well, it's… Wow, isn't it very hard to be hanging upside down?

en: “Apparently, the longest keg stand in Winter Park history is sixty-two seconds,” she explained. “And it was set by Tony Yorrick,” who’s this gigantic guy who’d graduated when we were freshmen and now played for the University of Florida football team.
vi: “Thì rõ, hiện giờ kỉ lục quán quân bom bia trong lịch sử trường Winter Park là sáu mươi hai giây,” Angela giải thích. “Người giữ kỉ lục là Tony Yorrick,” một anh chàng khổng lồ đã ra trường khi tôi mới vào lớp chín, hiện đang chơi cho đội bóng bầu dục của Đại học Florida.
tr: “Winter Park tarihindeki en uzun fıçı duruşu altmış iki saniyeymiş,” diye açıkladı. ‘Ye bu Tony Yorrick tarafından yapılmış.” Tony biz birinci sınıftayken mezun olan ve artık Florida Üniversitesi’nin Amerikan futbolu takımında oynayan şu devasa çocuktu.
es: —Al parecer, el keg stand más largo de la historia de Winter Park es de sesenta y dos segundos —me explicó—. Lo consiguió Tony Yorrick. Tony Yorrick era un tipo gigantesco que se graduó cuando nosotros estábamos en primero de instituto y que en ese momento jugaba en el equipo de fútbol americano de la Universidad de Florida.
vi_translation: “Well, currently the record for the beer chugging champion in the history of Winter Park school is sixty-two seconds,” Angela explained. “The record holder is Tony Yorrick,” a giant guy who had graduated when I was just starting ninth grade, now playing for the University of Florida's football team.
tr_translation: “The longest keg stand in Winter Park history was sixty-two seconds,” he explained. “And it was done by Tony Yorrick.” Tony was that huge kid who graduated when we were freshmen and now plays for the University of Florida's American football team.
es_translation: —Apparently, the longest keg stand in the history of Winter Park is sixty-two seconds —he explained to me—. Tony Yorrick achieved it. Tony Yorrick was a gigantic guy who graduated when we were freshmen in high school and who at that time played on the University of Florida's football team.

en: I was all for Ben setting records, but I couldn’t bring myself to join in as everyone shouted, “Fifty-eight, fifty-nine, sixty, sixty-one, sixty-two, sixty-three!” And then Ben pulled the spout out of his mouth and screamed, “YESSS! I MUST BE THE GREATEST! I SHOOK UP THE WORLD!” Jase and some baseball players flipped him right-side-up and carried him around on their shoulders. And then Ben caught sight of me, pointed, and let out the loudest and most passionate “YESSSS!!!!!!” I’d ever heard. I mean, soccer players don’t get that excited about winning the World Cup.
vi: Tôi hoàn toàn ủng hộ màn lập kỉ lục của Ben, nhưng không thể nào bắt bản thân tham gia màn gào đếm của mọi người, “Năm mươi tám, năm mươi chín, sáu mươi, sáu mươi mốt, sáu mươi hai, sáu mươi ba!” Và khi đó Ben nhả vòi bia ra và hét lên: “ỪAAA! TA LÀ QUÁN QUÂN! TA LÀM RUNG CHUYỂN THẾ GIỚI!” Jase và mấy cậu nữa trong đội bóng chày xoay Ben trở lại bình thường rồi công kênh nó luôn trên vai. Lúc đó Ben nhác thấy tôi, giơ tay chỉ tôi và tuôn ra từ “ỪAAAA!!! !” dõng dạc nhất, nhiệt thành nhất mà tôi từng nghe thấy. Mấy anh cầu thủ bóng đá khi giành cúp vô địch thế giới cũng không đạt đến độ phấn khích ấy.
tr: Ben’in rekor kırmasına filan gönülden inanıyordum tabii ama herkes, “Elli sekiz, elli dokuz, altmış, altmış bir, altmış iki, altmış üç!” diye bağırırken onlara katılmayı başaramıyordum. Sonra Ben hortumu ağzından çekip çıkardı ve çığlık attı: “EVEEET! EN BÜYÜK BEN OLMALIYIM! DÜNYAYI ALTÜST ETTİM!” Jase’le birkaç beyzbolcu, Ben’i düz çevirip omuzlarının üzerinde taşıyarak etrafta gezdirdiler. Sonra Ben, beni fark etti, işaret ederek ıluyduğum en yüksek, en tutkulu sesle, “EVEEET!” diye haykırdı. Yani futbolcular bile Dünya Kupası’nı kazandıklarında bu kadar 11< 'yecanlanmazlar.
es: No tenía nada en contra de que Ben batiera un récord, pero no pude unirme al grupo, que gritaba: «¡Cincuenta y ocho, cincuenta y nueve, sesenta, sesenta y uno, sesenta y dos, sesenta y tres!». Entonces Ben sacó la boca del grifo y gritó: —¡SÍÍÍ! ¡SOY EL MEJOR! ¡QUE TIEMBLE EL MUNDO! Jase y varios jugadores de béisbol le dieron la vuelta y se lo subieron a hombros. Entonces Ben me vio, me señaló y soltó el más apasionado «SÍÍÍ» que he oído en mi vida. Vaya, ni los jugadores de fútbol se entusiasman tanto cuando ganan la copa del mundo.
vi_translation: I fully support Ben's record-setting performance, but I can't bring myself to join in the shouting count of everyone, “Fifty-eight, fifty-nine, sixty, sixty-one, sixty-two, sixty-three!” And then Ben released the beer tap and shouted: “YEAH! I AM THE CHAMPION! I SHAKE THE WORLD!” Jase and a few other guys from the baseball team got Ben back to normal and then carried him on their shoulders. At that moment, Ben caught sight of me, raised his hand to point at me, and let out the most resounding, enthusiastic “YEAH!!!!” I had ever heard. Even the football players when winning the world championship didn't reach that level of excitement.
tr_translation: Of course, I wholeheartedly believed that Ben would break the record, but while everyone was shouting, "Fifty-eight, fifty-nine, sixty, sixty-one, sixty-two, sixty-three!" I couldn't manage to join them. Then Ben pulled the hose out of his mouth and screamed: "YES! I MUST BE THE GREATEST! I TURNED THE WORLD UPSIDE DOWN!" Jase and a few baseball players picked Ben up, turned him right side up, and carried him around on their shoulders. Then Ben noticed me, pointing He shouted with the highest, most passionate voice I had ever heard, "YEEES!" I mean, even football players wouldn't get this excited when they win the World Cup.
es_translation: I had nothing against Ben breaking a record, but I couldn't join the group that was shouting: "Fifty-eight, fifty-nine, sixty, sixty-one, sixty-two, sixty-three!". Then Ben took his mouth off the faucet and shouted: —YESSS! I AM THE BEST! LET THE WORLD TREMBLE! Jase and several baseball players turned him around and lifted him onto their shoulders. Then Ben saw me, pointed at me, and let out the most passionate "YESSS" I have ever heard in my life. Wow, not even soccer players get that excited when they win the World Cup.

en: Ben jumped off the baseball players’ shoulders, landing in an awkward crouch, and then swayed a bit on his way to standing. He wrapped his arm around my shoulders. “YES!” he said again. “Quentin is here! The Great Man! Let’s hear it for Quentin, the best friend of the fucking keg stand world record holder!” Jase rubbed the top of my head and said, “You’re the man, Q!” and then I heard Radar in my ear, “By the way, we are like folk heroes to these people. Angela and I left our afterparty to come here because Ben told me I’d be greeted as a king. I mean, they were chanting my name. Apparently they all think Ben is hilarious or something, and so they like us, too.”
vi: Ben nhảy từ vai mấy cậu bóng chày xuống, chạm đất trong tư thế khá khôi hài rồi loạng choạng đứng dậy. Nó khoác vai tôi, vẫn bắn tía lia, “PHẢI RỒI! Quentin đây rồi! Vĩ Nhân đây rồi! Hãy nghe vì Quentin, chiến hữu xịn nhất của nhà quán quân bom bia thế giới!” Jase quờ quờ đầu tôi nói, “Đáng mặt đàn ông đấy Q!” rồi cả Radar rót vào tai tôi, “Tiện nói với ông luôn, bọn mình đều là anh hùng kiệt xuất trong mắt mọi người hết. Angela và tôi đã gác màn hậu-dạ-tiệc của bọn tôi sang một bên để đến đây, vì Ben nói rằng tôi sẽ được đối đãi như vua. Cả lũ hát tên tôi thật. Rõ là mọi người khoái Ben lắm nên cũng khoái luôn bọn mình.”
tr: Ben beyzbolculann omuzlarından atlayıp biçimsiz bir hareketle yöre indi, sonra ayağa kalkarken birazcık sallandı. Kolunu omzuma doladı. “EVET!” dedi tekrar. “Quentin burada! Büyük Adam! I laydi, lanet fıçı duruşunda dünya rekortmeninin en iyi arkadaşı Quentin için ses çıkartın!” Jase başımı ovaladı ve “Adamımsm (i!” dedi, sonra kulağımın dibinde seslenen Radar’ı duydum: “Bu insanlar için halk kahramanları gibiyiz. Angela’yla balo sonrası [lartimizi bırakıp buraya geldik çünkü Ben, kral gibi karşılanacağımı söyledi. Yani tezahürat ederek adımı söylüyorlardı. Anlaşılan hepsi Ben’in çok eğlenceli falan olduğunu düşünüyor ve bu yüzden bizi de seviyorlar.
es: Ben saltó de los hombros de los jugadores de béisbol, aterrizó agachado, en una incómoda postura, y luego se tambaleó hasta ponerse de pie. Me pasó un brazo por el hombro. —¡SÍ! —repitió—. ¡Quentin está aquí! ¡El gran Quentin! ¡Un aplauso para Quentin, el mejor amigo del puto campeón del mundo de keg stand! Jase me pasó la mano por la cabeza y me dijo: —¡Ese eres tú, Q! —Por cierto —me dijo Radar al oído—, somos como héroes para esta peña. Angela y yo hemos venido porque Ben me ha dicho que me recibirían como a un rey. Vaya, coreaban mi nombre. Al parecer, todos creen que Ben es divertidísimo, y por eso les caemos simpáticos nosotros también.
vi_translation: Ben jumped off the shoulders of some baseball guys, landed in a rather comical position, and then staggered to his feet. He put his arm around me, still chattering away, "RIGHT! Quentin is here! The Great Man is here! Listen up, because Quentin, the best comrade of the world beer pong champions, is here!” Jase tousled my hair and said, “That’s manly of you, Q!” and then Radar whispered in my ear, “Just so you know, we’re all heroes in everyone’s eyes. Angela and I put our post-party plans on hold to come here because Ben said I’d be treated like a king. The whole group was chanting my name. Clearly, everyone likes Ben a lot, so they like us too.”
tr_translation: Ben jumped off the shoulders of the baseball players and landed awkwardly, then wobbled a bit as he stood up. He wrapped his arm around my shoulder. “YES!” he said again. “Quentin is here! The Big Man! Come on, make some noise for Quentin, the best friend of the world record holder in the barrel stance!” Jase rubbed my head and said, “My man!” then I heard Radar shouting right next to my ear: “We’re like folk heroes to these people. We left our prom after-party with Angela and came here because Ben said I would be welcomed like a king. So they were cheering and calling my name. Apparently, they all think Ben is really fun or something, and that’s why they like us too.”
es_translation: Ben jumped off the shoulders of the baseball players, landed crouched in an awkward position, and then staggered to his feet. He put an arm around my shoulder. —YES! —he repeated—. Quentin is here! The great Quentin! A round of applause for Quentin, the best friend of the fucking world champion of keg stand! Jase ran his hand over my head and said to me: —That's you, Q! —By the way —Radar whispered in my ear—, we are like heroes to this crowd. Angela and I came because Ben told me they would welcome me like a king. Wow, they were chanting my name. Apparently, everyone thinks Ben is hilarious, and that's why they like us too.

en: To Radar, and also to everyone else, I said, “Wow.”
vi: Với Radar, và cũng là với tất cả những người khác, tôi thốt lên, “Ôi tuyệt
tr: Radar’a ve diğer herkese, ‘Vay canına,” dedim.
es: —Uau —exclamé dirigiéndome tanto a Radar como a todos los demás.
vi_translation: To Radar, and also to everyone else, I exclaimed, "Oh great!"
tr_translation: To Radar and everyone else, I said, "Wow."
es_translation: —Wow —I exclaimed, addressing both Radar and everyone else.

en: Ben turned away from us, and I watched him grab Cassie Hiney. His hands were on her shoulders, and she put her hands on his shoulders, and he said, “My prom date was almost prom queen,” and Cassie said, “I know. That’s great,” and Ben said, “I’ve wanted to kiss you every single day for the last three years,” and Cassie said, “I think you should,” and then Ben said, “YES! That’s awesome!” But he didn’t kiss Cassie. He just turned around to me and said, “Cassie wants to kiss me!” And I said, “Yeah,” and he said, “That’s so awesome.” And then he seemed to forget about Cassie and me both, as if the idea of kissing Cassie Hiney felt better than actually kissing her ever could.
vi: Ben nguẩy mông đi, tôi thấy nó dính lấy Cassie Hiney, tay chàng trên vai nàng, tay nàng trên vai chàng, và chàng thổ lộ, “Nàng đi cùng tớ hôm nay suýt thành nữ hoàng dạ tiệc đấy,” còn Cassie đáp, “Tớ biết. Tuyệt thật!” Ben lại liến thoắng, “Ba năm vừa qua không ngày nào tớ không ao ước được hôn cậu!” Cassie trả lời, “Cậu nên làm thế,” và Ben reo lên, “ĐÚNG! Bá cháy thiệt!” Nhưng nó không hôn Cassie. Ben quay lại chỗ tôi và tuyên bố, “Cassie muốn hôn tôi ông ạ!” Tôi hưởng ứng, “Tốt!” và Ben bồi nốt, “Bá cháy thiệt!” Nhưng rồi hình như nó quên luôn cả Cassie lẫn tôi, như thể ý niệm hôn Cassie Hiney còn tuyệt hơn cả nụ hôn thực sự.
tr: Ben arkasını döndü, onun Cassie Hiney’yi yakalayıp tutmasını izledim. Elleri Cassie’nin omuzlanndaydı, Cassie de ellerini Ben’in omzuna koydu ve Ben, “Balodaki eşim neredeyse balo krahçesi oluyordu,” dedi, Cassie de “Biliyorum. Bu harika,” dedi ve Ben, “Son üç yıldır seni her gün öpmek isterdim,” dedi, Cassie de “Sanırım öpmelisin,” dedi ve sonra Ben, “EVET! Bu müthişi dedi. Ama Cassie’yi öpmedi. Sadece bana döndü ve “Bu çok müthiş,” dedi. Sonra Cassie’yi de beni de unutmuş gibi durmaya başladı; sanki Cassie Hiney’yi öpme fikri, onu gerçekten öpmenin yapamayacağı kadar iyi hissettirmiş gibi.
es: Ben se apartó de nosotros y lo vi agarrando a Cassie Hiney. Le puso las manos en los hombros y ella puso las suyas en las de Ben. —Mi pareja esta noche casi ha sido la reina del baile —le dijo Ben. —Lo sé —repuso Cassie—. Es genial. —He deseado besarte cada día en los últimos tres años —dijo Ben. —Creo que deberías hacerlo —le contestó Cassie. —¡SÍ! —exclamó Ben—. ¡Impresionante! Pero no besó a Cassie. Se giró y me dijo: —¡Cassie quiere besarme! —Sí —le contesté. —Es impresionante —dijo. Y luego pareció olvidarse tanto de Cassie como de mí, como si la idea de besar a Cassie Hiney fuera mejor que besarla en realidad.
vi_translation: Ben swayed his hips as he walked away, and I saw him sticking close to Cassie Hiney, his hand on her shoulder, her hand on his shoulder, and he confessed, "The girl who came with me today almost became the prom queen," and Cassie replied, "I know. That's awesome!" Ben chattered on, "For the past three years, not a day has gone by that I haven't wished to kiss you!" Cassie responded, "You should do it," and Ben exclaimed, "YES! That's amazing!" But he didn't kiss Cassie. Ben turned back to me and declared, "Cassie wants to kiss me, man!" I responded, "Good!" and Ben added, "That's amazing!" But then it seemed like he forgot both Cassie and me, as if the idea of kissing Cassie Hiney was better than the actual kiss.
tr_translation: Ben turned around, and I watched him catch and hold Cassie Hiney. His hands were on Cassie’s shoulders, Cassie put her hands on Ben’s shoulders, and Ben said, “My partner at the ball was almost the ball queen,” and Cassie said, “I know. This is wonderful,” and Ben said, “I’ve wanted to kiss you every day for the last three years,” and Cassie said, “I think you should,” and then Ben said, “YES! This is amazing,” he said. But he didn’t kiss Cassie. He just turned to me and said, “This is so amazing.” Then he started to act like he had forgotten both Cassie and me; as if the idea of kissing Cassie Hiney made him feel better than actually kissing her could.
es_translation: Ben moved away from us and I saw him grabbing Cassie Hiney. He put his hands on her shoulders and she put hers on Ben's. —My partner tonight was almost the queen of the dance —Ben said to her. —I know —replied Cassie—. It's great. —I have wanted to kiss you every day for the last three years —said Ben. —I think you should do it —Cassie replied to him. —YES! —exclaimed Ben—. Impressive! But he didn't kiss Cassie. He turned and said to me: —Cassie wants to kiss me! —Yes —I replied to him. —It's impressive —he said. And then he seemed to forget both Cassie and me, as if the idea of kissing Cassie Hiney was better than actually kissing her.

en: Cassie said to me, “This party is so great, isn’t it?” and I said, “Yeah,” and she said, “This is like the opposite of band parties, huh?” And I said, “Yeah,” and she said, “Ben is a spaz, but I love him.” And I said, “Yeah.” “Plus he’s got really green eyes,” she added, and I said, “Uh-huh,” and then she said, “Everyone says you’re cuter, but I like Ben,” and I said, “Okay,” and she said, “This party is so great, isn’t it?” And I said, “Yeah.” Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
vi: Cassie nói với tôi, “Tiệc vui quá phải không?” nên tôi đáp, “Ừ.” “Trái ngược hẳn tiệc của ban nhạc nhỉ,” Cassie nói. “Ừ,” tôi đáp. “Ben ngu nga ngu ngơ, nhưng tớ thích cậu ấy,” Cassie nói. “Ừ,” tôi đáp. “Thêm nữa mắt cậu ấy xanh ơi là xanh,” Cassie bổ sung. “Ừm, ừ,” tôi đáp. “Ai cũng bảo cậu đáng yêu hơn, nhưng tớ thích Ben,” Cassie nói tiếp. “Tốt thôi,” tôi đáp. “Tiệc vui quá phải không?” Cassie lại hỏi, và tôi đáp, “Ừ.” Tiếp chuyện người say giống hệt như bi bô với một đứa trẻ lên ba có vấn đề về não nặng và đang lên cơn phấn kích cao trào vậy.
tr: Cassie bana, “Bu parti harika, değil mi?” dedi, ben de “Evet,” dedim, o, “Bando partilerinin zıttı gibi, değil mi?” dedi. Ben de “Evet,” dedim, “Ben aptal biri ama onu seviyorum,” dedi. Ben de “Evet,” dedim. “Üstelik gerçekten yeşil gözleri var,” diye ekledi ve ben de “Hı hı,” dedim, sonra, “Herkes senin daha sevimli olduğunu söylüyor ama ben, Ben’den hoşlanıyorum,” dedi ve ben de “Peki,” dedim, o, “Bu parti harika, değil mi?” dedi. Ben de “Evet,” dedim. Sarhoş biriyle konuşmak, aşırı derecede mutlu ve beyni ciddi derecede hasarlı üç yaşmdaki bir çocukla konuşmak gibiydi.
es: —Esta fiesta es genial, ¿verdad? —preguntó Cassie. —Sí —le contesté. —Nada que ver con las fiestas de la banda, ¿eh? —preguntó. —Sí —repuse yo. —Ben está sonado, pero me encanta —me dijo. —Sí. —Y tiene los ojos muy verdes —añadió. —Ay, ay. —Todas dicen que tú eres más mono, pero me gusta Ben. —Vale —le contesté. —Esta fiesta es genial, ¿verdad? —dijo. —Sí —le contesté. Hablar con una persona borracha era como hablar con un niño de tres años muy alegre y con serias lesiones cerebrales.
vi_translation: Cassie said to me, "The party is so fun, isn't it?" so I replied, "Yeah." “Quite the opposite of the band's party, huh,” Cassie said. “Yeah,” I replied. “Ben is so clueless, but I like him,” Cassie said. “Yeah,” I replied. “Plus, his eyes are so blue,” Cassie added. “Uh-huh, yeah,” I replied. “Everyone says you're cuter, but I like Ben,” Cassie continued. “That's fine,” I replied. “The party is fun, isn't it?” Cassie asked again, and I replied, “Yeah.” Talking to a drunk person is exactly like babbling with a three-year-old child who has severe brain issues and is in a state of high excitement.
tr_translation: Cassie said to me, "This party is great, isn't it?" and I said, "Yes," and she said, "It's like the opposite of band parties, isn't it?" And I said, "Yes," and she said, "I'm a fool but I love him." And I said, "Yes." "Besides, he really has green eyes," she added, and I said, "Uh-huh," then she said, "Everyone says you're cuter but I like Ben," and I said, "Okay," and she said, "This party is great, isn't it?" And I said, "Yes." Talking to a drunk person was like talking to a three-year-old child who was extremely happy and had a severely damaged brain.
es_translation: —This party is great, isn't it? —asked Cassie. —Yes —I replied to him. —Nothing like the band's parties, huh? —he asked. —Yes —I replied. —Ben is crazy, but I love it —she told me. —Yes. —And he has very green eyes —he added. —Yes, yes. —Everyone says that you are cuter, but I like Ben. —Okay —I replied. —This party is great, isn't it? —he said. —Yes —I replied to him. Talking to a drunk person was like talking to a very cheerful three-year-old child with serious brain injuries.

en: Chuck Parson walked up to me just as Cassie walked away. “Jacobsen,” he said, matter-of-factly.
vi: Cassie vừa đi thì Chuck Parson tiến đến trước tôi. “Jacobsen,” nó nói, sặc mùi ta-đây-người-trong-cuộc.
tr: Cassie tam uzaklaşırken, Chuck Parson bana doğru geldi. “Jacobsen,” dedi, bir gerçeğe parmak basıyormuşçasına.
es: Mientras Cassie se alejaba, Chuck Parson se acercó a mí. —Jacobsen —me dijo de manera casual.
vi_translation: As soon as Cassie left, Chuck Parson approached me. “Jacobsen,” it said, reeking of insider arrogance.
tr_translation: As Cassie walked away, Chuck Parson came towards me. "Jacobsen," he said, as if stating a fact.
es_translation: As Cassie walked away, Chuck Parson approached me. —Jacobsen —he said to me casually.

en: “Parson,” I answered.
vi: “Chào Parson,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Parson,” diye karşılık verdim.
es: —Parson —le contesté.
vi_translation: "Hello Parson," I replied.
tr_translation: “Parson,” I replied.
es_translation: —Parson —I replied.

en: “You shaved my fucking eyebrow, didn’t you?”
vi: “Mày cạo lông mày của tao phải không?”
tr: “Lanet olası kaşımı sen tıraş ettin, değil mi?
es: —Tú me afeitaste la puta ceja, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: "Did you shave my eyebrows?"
tr_translation: “You shaved my damn eyebrow, didn't you?”
es_translation: —You shaved my damn eyebrow, didn't you?

en: “I didn’t shave it, actually,” I said. “I used a depilatory cream.”
vi: “Thực ra tao không cạo,” tôi trần tình. “Tao chỉ dùng kem triệt mao thôi.
tr: “Tıraş etmedim aslında,” dedim. ‘Tüy dökücü krem kullandım.
es: —En realidad no te la afeité —le contesté—. Utilicé crema depilatoria.
vi_translation: "Actually, I didn't shave," I explained. "I just used hair removal cream."
tr_translation: “I didn't actually shave,” I said. “I used a depilatory cream.”
es_translation: —Actually, I didn't shave it for you —I replied—. I used depilatory cream.

en: He poked me quite hard in the middle of my chest. “You’re a douche,” he said, but he was laughing. “That took such big balls, bro. And now you’re all puppet master and shit. I mean, maybe I’m just drunk, but I’m feeling a little love for your douchey ass right now.”
vi: Nó túm mạnh ngay giữa ngực tôi. “Mày là đồ chuyên gia làm lông,” nó nói rồi cười hô hố. “Cũng cần bi khơ khớ đấy chú em. Bây giờ còn bày trò múa rối này nữa. Chắc tao say thật, nhưng tao hơi hơi mến cái mông nhẵn thín của mày rồi đấy.”
tr: Oldukça sert bir şekilde beni göğsümün tam ortasından dürttü. ‘Tam bir dangalaksın,” dedi ama gülüyordu. “Bu iş taşaklı olmayı gerektirir, kardeşim. Şimdi kukla ustası gibi bir şey oldun. Yani belki sadece sarhoşum ama şu anda senin o dangalak kıçım biraz seviyorum.
es: Me pegó un manotazo bastante fuerte en todo el pecho. —Eres un capullo —me dijo, aunque se reía—. Hay que tener cojones, colega. Y ahora eres como un kapo de mierda. Bueno, quizá solo estoy borracho, pero ahora mismo me encanta tu culo de capullo.
vi_translation: It grabbed me hard right in the chest. "You're a professional scammer," it said and then laughed out loud. "You need to be careful, kid. Now you're even putting on this puppet show. I might really be drunk, but I'm kind of fond of your smooth butt.
tr_translation: He poked me quite hard right in the middle of my chest. "You're a complete idiot," he said, but he was laughing. "This job requires some balls, my brother. Now you've become something like a puppet master. So maybe I'm just drunk, but right now I kind of like your idiot ass."
es_translation: He hit me with a pretty strong slap across the chest. —You're an asshole —he told me, although he was laughing—. You gotta have balls, buddy. And now you're like a shitty kapo. Well, maybe I'm just drunk, but right now I love your asshole ass.

en: “Thank you,” I said. I felt so detached from all this shit, all this high-school-is-ending-so-we-have-to-reveal-that-deep-down-we-all-love-everybody bullshit. And I imagined her at this party, or at thousands like this one. The life drawn out of her eyes. I imagined her listening to Chuck Parson babble at her and thinking about ways out, about the living ways out and the dead ways out. I could imagine the two paths with equal clarity.
vi: “Cảm ơn,” tôi nói, thấy mình thờ ơ với tất cả những món hổ lốn này, những màn màu mè sắp-tốt-nghiệp-rồi-hãy-thổ-lộ-cõi-lòng-rằng-ta-yêu-tất-cả-mọi-người-đi. Và tôi tưởng tượng Margo ở đây, hoặc trong hàng ngàn những tiệc tùng kiểu này. Đời sống lụi đi trong mắt cô ấy. Tôi tưởng tượng cô ấy nghe Chuck Parson ậm ọe bắt chuyện và cô ấy tìm cách thoát ra, bằng cả đường sống lẫn đường chết. Tôi hình dung được cả hai đường ấy với sự sáng tỏ tương đương.
tr: “Teşekkür ederim,” dedim. Kendimi bütün bu saçmalıktan, bütün bu “lise bitiyor, bu yüzden hepimiz derinlerde birbirimizi sevdiğimizi açığa vurmalıyız” saçmalığından o kadar kopuk hissediyordum ki. Ve Margo’yu bu partide hayal ettim ya da bunun gibi binlercesinde. Yaşam gözlerinden çekilmiş gibi. Chuck Parson’m ona bir şeyler gevelediğini dinlemesini ve çıkış yollarını, yaşam ve ölüm içeren çıkış yollarını düşünmesini hayal ettim, iki yolu da eşit netlikte hayal edebiliyordum.
es: —Gracias —le contesté. Me sentía totalmente al margen de aquella mierda, de aquel rollo de que se acaba el instituto y tiene que quedar claro que en el fondo todos nos queremos mucho. Y me imaginé a Margo en aquella fiesta, o en miles de fiestas como aquella. La vida vista con sus ojos. La imaginé escuchando las chorradas de Chuck Parson y pensando en largarse, tanto viva como muerta. Imaginaba los dos caminos con igual claridad.
vi_translation: “Thank you,” I said, feeling indifferent to all this mess, these flashy almost-graduation-let's-bare-our-souls-and-proclaim-our-love-for-everyone moments. And I imagined Margo here, or at thousands of parties like this. Life fading from her eyes. I imagined her listening to Chuck Parson's awkward attempts at conversation and her trying to escape, by any means necessary, whether through life or death. I could envision both paths with equal clarity.
tr_translation: “Thank you,” I said. I felt so detached from all this nonsense, all this “high school is ending, so we must reveal that we deeply love each other” nonsense. And I imagined Margo at this party or at thousands like it. As if life had been drained from her eyes. I imagined her listening to Chuck Parson mumbling something to her and thinking about escape routes, escape routes involving life and death, and I could imagine both paths with equal clarity.
es_translation: —Thank you —I replied. I felt completely detached from that crap, from that whole thing about finishing high school and having to make it clear that deep down we all love each other very much. And I imagined Margo at that party, or at thousands of parties like that one. Life seen through her eyes. I imagined her listening to Chuck Parson's nonsense and thinking about leaving, whether alive or dead. I imagined both paths with equal clarity.

en: “You want a beer, dicklicker?” Chuck asked. I might have forgotten he was even there, but the smell of booze on his breath made it hard to overlook his presence. I just shook my head, and he wandered off.
vi: “Bia không mày?” Chuck hỏi. Có lẽ tôi đã quên là nó vẫn ở đấy, nhưng với mùi cồn phả ra từ hơi thở của nó thì khó mà vờ như không thấy được. Tôi chỉ lắc đầu, và nó đảo đi chỗ khác.
tr: “Bira ister misin, saksocu?” diye sordu Chuck. Orada olduğunu bile unutmuş olabilirdim ama nefesindeki içki kokusu varlığını görmezden gelmeyi zorlaştırıyordu. Sadece başımı salladım ve Chuck uzaklaştı.
es: —¿Quieres una cerveza, comepollas? —me preguntó Chuck. Podría haber olvidado que estaba ahí, pero la peste a alcohol de su aliento hacía difícil pasar por alto su presencia. Negué con la cabeza y se marchó.
vi_translation: "Got beer?" Chuck asked. Maybe I had forgotten it was still there, but with the smell of alcohol coming from his breath, it was hard to pretend not to notice. I just shook my head, and he turned away.
tr_translation: "Do you want a beer, saxophonist?" Chuck asked. I might have even forgotten he was there, but the smell of alcohol on his breath made it hard to ignore his presence. I just nodded and Chuck walked away.
es_translation: —Do you want a beer, cocksucker? —Chuck asked me. I might have forgotten he was there, but the stench of alcohol on his breath made it hard to overlook his presence. I shook my head and he left.

en: I wanted to go home, but I knew I couldn’t rush Ben. This was probably the single greatest day of his life. He was entitled to it.
