vi: Tôi muốn về nhà, nhưng cũng biết rằng không thể giục Ben được. Đây có lẽ là đêm huy hoàng duy nhất trong đời Ben. Nó xứng đáng được vui.
tr: Eve gitmek istiyordum ama Ben’i acele ettiremeyeceğimi biliyordum. Bu muhtemelen hayatındaki tek harika geceydi. Buna hakkı vardı.
es: Quería volver a casa, pero sabía que no podía meter prisa a Ben. Seguramente era el mejor día de su vida. Tenía derecho a disfrutarlo.
vi_translation: I want to go home, but I also know that I can't rush Ben. This is probably the only glorious night in Ben's life. He deserves to enjoy it.
tr_translation: I wanted to go home, but I knew I couldn't make Ben hurry. This was probably the only wonderful night of his life. He deserved it.
es_translation: I wanted to go back home, but I knew I couldn't rush Ben. It was probably the best day of his life. He had the right to enjoy it.

en: So instead, I found a stairway and headed down to the basement. I’d been in the dark so long I was still craving it, and I just wanted to lie down somewhere halfway quiet and halfway dark and go back to imagining Margo. But as I walked past Becca’s bedroom, I heard some muffled noises—specifically, moanish noises—and so I paused outside her door, which was open just a crack.
vi: Trong khi chờ đợi, tôi theo cầu thang đi xuống tầng hầm. Tôi đã ở trong bóng tối rất lâu nhưng vẫn thấy thèm, muốn ngả lưng đâu đó nửa yên tĩnh nửa tối tăm, và trở lại với những tưởng tượng về Margo. Nhưng khi đi ngang qua phòng Becca, tôi nghe thấy những tiếng rủ rỉ–đặc biệt nghe như tiếng rên–nên tôi dừng lại trước cửa phòng khép hờ.
tr: Bu yüzden bir merdiven bulup bodruma indim. Karanhkta o kadar uzun kalmıştım ki hâlâ karanlığı arzuluyordum ve sadece biraz sessiz, biraz karanlık bir yerde uzanıp yine Margo’yu hayal etmek istiyordum. Fakat Becca’mn yatak odasının yanından geçerken bazı boğuk seslerdaha özel bir ifadeyle, inleme gibi seslerduydum ve bu yüzden, sadece aralık bırakılmış kapısının önünde duraksadım.
es: Así que encontré una escalera y me dirigí al sótano. Había pasado tantas horas a oscuras que me apetecía seguir estándolo. Solo quería tumbarme en algún sitio medio tranquilo y medio oscuro, y seguir imaginando a Margo. Pero al pasar por la habitación de Becca oí unos ruidos amortiguados —para ser exacto, gemidos—, así que me detuve en la puerta, que estaba entreabierta.
vi_translation: While waiting, I followed the stairs down to the basement. I had been in the dark for a long time but still felt a craving, wanting to lie down somewhere half quiet, half dark, and return to my imaginations about Margo. But as I passed by Becca's room, I heard murmuring sounds—particularly sounding like moaning—so I stopped in front of the slightly ajar door.
tr_translation: So I found a ladder and went down to the basement. I had been in the dark for so long that I still craved it, and I just wanted to lie down in a quiet, dark place and imagine Margo again. But from beside Becca's bedroom As I was passing by, I heard some muffled sounds—more specifically, sounds like moaning—and because of this, I paused in front of the door that was left slightly ajar.
es_translation: So I found a staircase and headed to the basement. I had spent so many hours in the dark that I wanted to continue being in it. I just wanted to lie down somewhere half quiet and half dark, and keep imagining Margo. But as I passed by Becca's room, I heard some muffled noises — to be exact, moans — so I stopped at the door, which was ajar.

en: I could see the top two-thirds of Jase, shirtless, on top of Becca, and she had her legs wrapped around him. Nobody was naked or anything, but they were headed in that direction. And maybe a better person would have turned away, but people like me don’t get a lot of chances to see people like Becca Arrington naked, so I stayed there in the doorway, peering into the room. And then they rolled around so Becca was on top of Jason, and she was sighing as she kissed him, and she was reaching down for her shirt. “Do you think I’m hot?” she said.
vi: Tôi thấy hai phần ba phía trên người Jase, mình trần, đang ở trên Becca, còn hai chân cô nàng quặp quanh anh chàng. Cả hai đều không khỏa thân, nhưng đang tiến triển theo chiều hướng đó. Có lẽ một người đứng đắn hơn sẽ quay đi, nhưng những đứa như tôi không có nhiều cơ hội thấy những nàng như Becca Arrington khỏa thân, nên tôi vẫn đứng nguyên trước ngưỡng cửa, lom lom nhìn vào trong. Rồi hai người đó lộn một vòng, Becca ở trên Jase, thở dài mơn trớn theo nụ hôn, bắt đầu lần cởi áo. “Anh thấy em nóng bỏng không?” Becca lả lướt.
tr: Jase’in üst bölümünün üçte ikisini görebiliyordum, tişörtsüzdü, Becca’nın üstündeydi ve Becca bacaklarını ona dolamıştı. Kimse çıplak falan değildi ama o istikamete doğru gidiyorlardı. Belki daha iyi bir insan arkasını dönebilirdi ama benim gibi insanların Becca Arrington gibi insanları çıplak görmeye çok fırsatı olmaz, bu nedenle odayı gözetleyerek orada, kapının eşiğinde kaldım. Sonra yuvarlandılar ve Becca, Jason’m üstüne çıktı, Jason’ı öperken iç çekiyor ve bluzunu çıkarmak için aşağı uzanıyordu. “Sence seksi miyim?” diye sordu.
es: Vi los dos tercios superiores de Jase, sin camisa, encima de Becca, que lo rodeaba con las piernas. No estaban desnudos, pero iban en camino. Y quizá una buena persona se habría marchado, pero la gente como yo no tiene muchas oportunidades de ver a gente como Becca Arrington desnuda, de modo que me quedé en la puerta fisgando. Entonces se dieron la vuelta, Becca quedó encima de Jason, suspiraba mientras lo besaba y empezaba a bajarse la blusa. —¿Crees que estoy buena? —le preguntó.

vi: “Tớ rất tiếc chuyện đã xảy ra như vậy,” tôi nói. “Vấn đề là Becca ghen tị thôi mà.”
tr: “Üzgünüm,” dedim. “Olay şu ki, Becca sadece kıskanıyor.
es: —Lo siento —le dije—. El problema es que Becca está celosa.
vi_translation: “I'm very sorry that it happened like that,” I said. “The problem is that Becca is just jealous.”
tr_translation: “I'm sorry,” I said. “The thing is, Becca is just jealous.”
es_translation: —I'm sorry —I told her—. The problem is that Becca is jealous.

en: “Why would she be jealous? She’s prom queen. She’s dating Jase. She’s the new Margo.”
vi: “Sao Becca phải ghen tị chứ? Cậu ấy là nữ hoàng dạ tiệc. Cậu ấy hẹn hò với Jase. Cậu ấy là Margo mới.
tr: “Neden kıskansın ki? O balo kraliçesi. Jase’le çıkıyor. O yeni Margo.
es: —¿Por qué iba a estar celosa? Es la reina del baile. Está saliendo con Jase. Es la nueva Margo.
vi_translation: “Why would Becca be jealous? She's the queen of the party. She's dating Jase. She's the new Margo.”
tr_translation: “Why would she be jealous? She is the prom queen. She is dating Jase. She is the new Margo.”
es_translation: —Why would she be jealous? She is the queen of the dance. She is dating Jase. She is the new Margo.

en: My butt was sore against the porcelain, so I tried to rearrange myself. My knees were touching her knees. “No one will ever be the new Margo,” I said. “Anyway, you have what she really wants. People like you. People think you’re cuter.”
vi: Mông tôi tê rần vì tì vào men sứ, nên tôi cố gắng nhúc nhích đổi tư thế. Đầu gối tôi chạm vào đầu gối Lacey. “Không bao giờ có ai có thể là Margo mới cả,” tôi nói. “Cậu có thứ mà Becca thực sự rất muốn. Mọi người quí cậu. Mọi người thấy cậu đáng mến hơn.”
tr: Seramiğe dayalı popom acıyordu, bu yüzden yeniden yerleşmeye çalıştım. Dizlerim onun dizlerine değiyordu. “Hiç kimse yeni Margo olmayacak,” dedim. “Her neyse, istediği şey sende var. İnsanlar senden hoşlanıyor. İnsanlar senin daha sevimli olduğunu düşünüyor.
es: Tenía el culo dolorido contra la porcelana, así que intenté recolocarme. Mis rodillas tocaron las suyas. —Nadie será jamás la nueva Margo —añadí—. De todas formas, tienes lo que ella realmente quiere. Gustas a la gente. Creen que eres más guapa que ella.
vi_translation: My butt was numb from pressing against the porcelain, so I tried to shift my position. My knee touched Lacey's knee. “No one can ever be the new Margo,” I said. “You have something that Becca really wants. People like you. People find you more likable.”
tr_translation: My butt was hurting from the ceramic, so I tried to reposition myself. My knees were touching his knees. “No one will ever be the new Margo,” I said. “Anyway, you have what she wants. People like you. People think you're cuter.”
es_translation: My butt was sore against the porcelain, so I tried to reposition myself. My knees touched hers. —No one will ever be the new Margo —I added—. Anyway, you have what she really wants. People like you. They think you are prettier than her.

en: Lacey shrugged bashfully. “Do you think I’m superficial?”
vi: Lacey bẽn lẽn nhún vai, “Cậu có nghĩ tớ phù phiếm nông cạn không?”
tr: Lacey çekinerek omuzlarını silkti. “Sence yüzeysel miyim?
es: Lacey se encogió de hombros tímidamente. —¿Crees que soy superficial?
vi_translation: Lacey shyly shrugged, "Do you think I'm frivolous and shallow?"
tr_translation: Lacey hesitantly shrugged her shoulders. "Do you think I'm superficial?"
es_translation: Lacey shrugged timidly. —Do you think I'm superficial?

en: “Well, yeah.” I thought of myself standing outside Becca’s bedroom, hoping she’d take her shirt off. “But so am I,” I added. “So is everyone.” I’d often thought, If only I had the body of Jase Worthington. Walked like I knew how to walk. Kissed like I knew how to kiss.
vi: “Ờ, cũng hơi hơi.” Tôi nghĩ lại cảnh tôi đứng bên ngoài phòng ngủ của Becca, hăm hở hi vọng Becca sẽ khỏa thân. “Nhưng tớ cũng thế mà,” tôi nói thêm. “Ai chả thế.” Tôi vẫn thường nghĩ, Giá mà mình có thân hình chuẩn như Jase Worthington. Đi đứng đĩnh đạc như thể mình biết phải đi thế nào. Hôn điệu nghệ như thể mình biết phải hôn thế nào.
tr: “Şey, evet.” Becca’nın bluzunu çıkarmasını umarak, yatak odasının dışmda duran kendimi düşündüm. “Ama ben de öyleyim,” diye ekledim. “Herkes öyle.” Sık sık, keşke Jase Worthington'ın vücuduna sahip olsaydım, diye düşünürdüm. Nasıl yürüneceğini biliyormuş gibi yürüseydim. Nasıl öpüleceğini biliyormuş gibi öpseydim.
es: —Bueno, sí. —Pensé en mí mismo en la puerta de la habitación de Becca, esperando que se quitara la blusa—. Pero yo también lo soy. Como todo el mundo. Muchas veces había pensado: «Ojalá tuviera el cuerpo de Jase Worthington. Andaría como si supiera andar. Besaría como si supiera besar».
vi_translation: “Uh, kind of.” I thought back to the scene where I was standing outside Becca's bedroom, eagerly hoping she would be naked. “But I'm the same way,” I added. “Who isn't.” I often thought, If only I had a body like Jase Worthington. Walking confidently as if I knew how to walk. Kissing skillfully as if I knew how to kiss.
tr_translation: “Well, yes.” I thought of myself standing outside the bedroom, hoping Becca would take off her blouse. “But I am too,” I added. “Everyone is.” Often, I would think, I wish I had Jase Worthington's body. If I walked as if I knew how to walk. If I kissed as if I knew how to kiss.
es_translation: —Well, yes. —I thought of myself at Becca's room door, waiting for her to take off her blouse—. But I am too. Like everyone else. Many times he had thought: "I wish I had Jase Worthington's body. I would walk as if I knew how to walk. I would kiss as if I knew how to kiss."

en: “But not in the same way. Ben and I are superficial in the same way. You don’t give a shit if people like you.”
vi: “Nhưng theo những cách khác nhau. Ben và tớ cùng phù phiếm nông cạn một kiểu. Cậu thì chẳng để tâm liệu mọi người có mến cậu hay không.”
tr: “Ama aynı şekilde değil. Ben’le aynı şekilde yüzeyseliz, insanların senden hoşlanmasıysa senin umurunda değil.
es: —Pero no de la misma manera. Ben y yo somos superficiales de la misma manera. A ti no te importa una mierda caer bien a los demás.
vi_translation: “But in different ways. Ben and I are both frivolous and shallow in the same way. You, on the other hand, don't care whether people like you or not.”
tr_translation: “But not in the same way. We are superficial in the same way, but you don't care if people like you.”
es_translation: —But not in the same way. Ben and I are superficial in the same way. You don't give a damn about being liked by others.

en: Which was both true and not. “I care more than I’d like to,” I said.
vi: Điều đó vừa đúng vừa không đúng. “Tớ để tâm nhiều hơn là tớ muốn đấy,” tôi nói.
tr: Bu hem doğru hem de değildi. “İstediğimden daha çok önemsiyorum,” dedim.
es: Lo que en parte era cierto, y en parte no. —Me importa más de lo que quisiera —le dije.
vi_translation: That is both true and not true. "I care more than I want to," I said.
tr_translation: This was both true and not true. "I care more than I want to," I said.
es_translation: Which was partly true, and partly not. —It matters to me more than I would like —I told him.

en: “Everything sucks without Margo,” she said. She was drunk, too, but I didn’t mind her variety of drunk.
vi: “Không có Margo mọi thứ cứ loạn lên,” Lacey nói. Cậu ấy cũng say rồi, nhưng tôi không thấy khó chịu vì kiểu say này.
tr: “Margo olmadan her şey berbat,” dedi. Lacey de sarhoştu ama onun sarhoş hah çok sorun değildi.
es: —Sin Margo todo es una mierda —repuso. También ella estaba borracha, pero su modalidad de borrachera no me molestaba.
vi_translation: "Without Margo, everything is just chaotic," Lacey said. She was also drunk, but I didn't mind this kind of drunkenness.
tr_translation: “Everything is awful without Margo,” he said. Lacey was also drunk, but her being drunk wasn't much of a problem.
es_translation: —Without Margo, everything is shit —he replied. She was also drunk, but her way of being drunk didn't bother me.

en: “Yeah,” I said.
vi: “Ừ,” tôi đồng tình.
tr: “Evet,” dedim.
es: —Sí —admití.
vi_translation: "Yes," I agreed.
tr_translation: "Yes," I said.
es_translation: —Yes —I admitted.

en: “I want you to take me to that place,” she said. “That strip mall. Ben told me about it.”
vi: “Tớ muốn cậu đưa tớ đến đó,” Lacey nói tiếp. “Mấy gian cửa hàng bỏ không ấy. Ben đã nói với tớ rồi.”
tr: “Beni o yere götürmeni istiyorum,” dedi. “O alışveriş merkezine. Ben bana oradan bahsetti.
es: —Quiero que me lleves a ese sitio —me dijo—. Al centro comercial. Ben me lo contó.
vi_translation: “I want you to take me there,” Lacey continued. “Those empty stores. Ben already told me about them.”
tr_translation: “I want you to take me to that place,” he said. “To that shopping mall. Ben told me about it from there.”
es_translation: —I want you to take me to that place —he told me—. To the shopping mall. Ben told me about it.

en: “Yeah, we can go whenever you want,” I said. I told her I’d been there all night, that I’d found Margo’s nail polish and her blanket.
vi: “Ừ, chúng ta có thể đi bất cứ khi nào cậu muốn,” tôi đáp, rồi kể với Lacey rằng tôi đã ở đó cả đêm, rằng tôi đã tìm thấy lọ sơn móng tay và chăn của Margo.
tr: “Evet, ne zaman istersen gidebiliriz,” dedim. Ona bütün gece orada olduğumu, Margo’nun ojesini ve battaniyesini bulduğumu anlattım.
es: —Sí, podemos ir cuando quieras —le contesté. Le conté que había pasado allí la noche, que había encontrado un frasco de pintaúñas y una manta de Margo.
vi_translation: “Sure, we can go whenever you want,” I replied, then told Lacey that I had been there all night, that I had found Margo's nail polish and blanket.
tr_translation: “Yes, we can go whenever you want,” I said. I told her that I had been there all night, and that I had found Margo's nail polish and blanket.
es_translation: —Yes, we can go whenever you want —I replied to him/her. I told him that I had spent the night there, that I had found a bottle of nail polish and a blanket of Margo's.

en: Lacey was quiet for a while, breathing through her open mouth. When she finally said it, she almost whispered it. Worded like a question and spoken like a statement: “She’s dead, isn’t she.”
vi: Lacey yên lặng một lúc, há miệng ra thở. Rút cục khi lên tiếng, cậu ấy gần như thì thầm. Tìm từ cho một câu hỏi và nói ra như một khẳng định, “Margo chết rồi, phải không.”
tr: Lacey, açık ağzmdan nefes alarak bir süre sessiz kaldı. Sonunda konuştuğunda neredeyse fısıldıyordu. Bir soru gibi kelimelere dökülmüş, bir açıklama olarak dile getirilmiş bir cümle: “O öldü, değil mi.
es: Lacey se quedó un momento callada, respirando por la boca. Cuando por fin lo dijo, fue casi en un susurro. Parecía una pregunta, aunque lo pronunció como una afirmación: —Está muerta, verdad.
vi_translation: Lacey was silent for a moment, mouth open, breathing. Finally, when she spoke, it was almost a whisper. Finding the words for a question and stating it as a fact, “Margo is dead, isn't she.”
tr_translation: Lacey remained silent for a while, breathing through her open mouth. When she finally spoke, she was almost whispering. Her words sounded like a question a sentence uttered as an explanation: "He died, didn't he."
es_translation: Lacey stayed silent for a moment, breathing through her mouth. When she finally spoke, it was almost in a whisper. It seemed like a question, though she pronounced it as a statement: —She is dead, right.

en: “I don’t know, Lacey. I thought so until tonight, but now I don’t know.”
vi: “Lacey à, tớ không biết. Cho đến tối hôm nay, tớ cũng nghĩ vậy, nhưng giờ tớ không biết nữa.”
tr: “Bilmiyorum, Lacey. Bu geceye kadar öyle düşünüyordum ama şimdi bilmiyorum.
es: —No lo sé, Lacey. Lo pensaba hasta esta noche, pero ahora no lo sé.
vi_translation: "Lacey, I don't know. Until tonight, I thought so too, but now I don't know anymore."
tr_translation: “I don't know, Lacey. Until tonight, I thought so, but now I don't know.”
es_translation: —I don't know, Lacey. I thought so until tonight, but now I don't know.

en: “She’s dead and we’re all . . . doing this.”
vi: “Cậu ấy chết rồi còn chúng ta... bày ra những trò này.”
tr: “O öldü ve hepimiz... bunları yapıyoruz.
es: —Ella muerta, y nosotros… haciendo todo esto.
vi_translation: "He is dead, and yet we... are playing these games."
tr_translation: “He died and all of us... are doing these things.”
es_translation: —She dead, and us... doing all this.

en: I thought of the highlighted Whitman: “If no other in the world be aware I sit content, / And if each and all be aware I sit content.” I said, “Maybe that’s what she wanted, for life to go on.”
vi: Tôi chợt nghĩ đến một câu được đánh dấu trong Whitman: “Nếu không ai khác trên thế gian này diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên, / Và nếu mỗi và mọi người diệu ngộ, ta ngồi an nhiên.” Tôi nói với Lacey, “Có thể đó là những gì Margo muốn, cuộc sống hãy cứ tiếp diễn.”
tr: Altı çizilmiş Whitman’ı düşündüm: “Memnun kalacağım, dünyadaki hiç kimse farkına varmazsa, / Ve memnun kalacağım, her biri ve hepsi farkına varsa da.” “Belki istediği budur, hayatın devam etmesi,” dedim.
es: Pensé en los versos marcados de Whitman: «Si nadie en el mundo lo sabe, estoy satisfecho, / Si todos y cada uno lo saben, estoy satisfecho». —Quizá es lo que quería, que la vida siguiera —dije.
vi_translation: I suddenly thought of a marked line in Whitman: “If no one else in the world realizes, I sit peacefully, / And if everyone realizes, I sit peacefully.” I said to Lacey, “Maybe that's what Margo wants, for life to just go on.”
tr_translation: I thought of Whitman underlined: "I shall be satisfied, even if no one in the world notices, / And I shall be satisfied, even if each and every one notices." "Maybe that's what he wants, for life to go on," I said.
es_translation: I thought of the marked verses of Whitman: "If no one in the world knows it, I am satisfied, / If everyone and each one knows it, I am satisfied." —Maybe that's what he wanted, for life to go on —I said.

en: “That doesn’t sound like my Margo,” she said, and I thought of my Margo, and Lacey’s Margo, and Mrs. Spiegelman’s Margo, and all of us looking at her reflection in different fun house mirrors. I was going to say something, but Lacey’s open mouth became truly slack-jawed, and she leaned her head against the cold gray tile of the bathroom wall, asleep.
vi: “Như thế chẳng giống Margo chút nào,” Lacey nói, và tôi nghĩ đến Margo của tôi, Margo của Lacey, Margo của cô Spiegelman, tất cả chúng tôi đều nhìn hình phản chiếu của Margo lên những tấm gương khác nhau trong nhà cười. Tôi định nói gì đó, nhưng Lacey thực sự đã há hốc miệng, đầu tựa vào tường phòng tắm lát đá men lạnh ngắt, ngủ ngon lành.
tr: “Bu kulağa benim bildiğim Margo gibi gelmiyor,” dedi; kendi Margom’u, Lacey’nin Margo’sunu, Bayan Spiegelman’m Margo’sunu ve hepimizi, onun, eğlence parklarının farklı aynalarındaki yansımalarına bakarken düşündüm. Bir şeyler söyleyecektim ama Lacey’nin açılmış ağzı gerçekten gevşek bir çeneye dönüştü ve başını banyo duvarının soğuk, gri fayansına yaslayıp uykuya daldı.
es: —No suena a mi Margo —comentó. Y pensé en mi Margo, en la Margo de Lacey, en la Margo de la señora Spiegelman, y en todos nosotros observando su imagen en un espejo distinto de una casa de los espejos. Iba a decir algo, pero la boca abierta de Lacey se terminó de abrir del todo y apoyó la cabeza en las frías baldosas del baño, dormida.
vi_translation: “That doesn't seem like Margo at all,” Lacey said, and I thought about my Margo, Lacey's Margo, Ms. Spiegelman's Margo, all of us seeing reflections of Margo in different mirrors in the funhouse. I was about to say something, but Lacey had actually fallen asleep, mouth agape, head resting against the cold, tiled bathroom wall.
tr_translation: “This doesn't sound like the Margo I know,” he said; I thought about my Margo, Lacey's Margo, Mrs. Spiegelman's Margo, and all of us, looking at her reflections in the different mirrors of amusement parks. I was about to say something, but Lacey's open mouth really turned into a slack jaw, and she leaned her head against the cold, gray tiles of the bathroom wall and fell asleep.
es_translation: —That doesn't sound like my Margo —he commented. And I thought about my Margo, Lacey's Margo, Mrs. Spiegelman's Margo, and all of us watching her image in a different mirror from a house of mirrors. I was going to say something, but Lacey's open mouth opened completely and she rested her head on the cold bathroom tiles, asleep.

en: It wasn’t until after two people had come into the bathroom to pee that I decided to wake her up. It was almost 5 A.M., and I needed to take Ben home.
vi: Sau khi có thêm hai người nữa vào phòng tắm đi tiểu, tôi quyết định đánh thức Lacey. Gần 5 giờ sáng, tôi cần đưa Ben về nhà.
tr: İki kişi çişini yapmak için banyoya geldikten sonra Lace/yi uyandırmaya karar verdim. Saat sabahın beşiydi ve Ben’i eve götürmem gerekiyordu.
es: No decidí despertarla hasta que dos personas entraron en el baño a mear. Eran casi las cinco de la madrugada y tenía que llevar a Ben a su casa.
vi_translation: After two more people entered the bathroom to urinate, I decided to wake Lacey. At nearly 5 AM, I needed to take Ben home.
tr_translation: After two people came to the bathroom to pee, I decided to wake Lace up. It was five in the morning and I needed to take Ben home.
es_translation: I didn't decide to wake her up until two people entered the bathroom to pee. It was almost five in the morning and I had to take Ben to his house.

en: “Lace, wake up,” I said, touching her flip-flop with my shoe.
vi: “Lacey ơi, dậy thôi,” tôi gọi, giày khẽ khều sang đôi dép của cậu ấy.
tr: “Lace, uyan,” dedim ayakkabımla terliğine dokunarak.
es: —Lace, despierta —le dije rozándole la sandalia con mi zapato.
vi_translation: "Lacey, wake up," I called, gently nudging his slippers with my shoe.
tr_translation: "Lace, wake up," I said, touching her slipper with my shoe.
es_translation: —Lace, wake up —I said, touching her sandal with my shoe.

en: She shook her head. “I like being called that,” she said. “You know that you’re, like, currently my best friend?”
vi: Lacey lúc lắc đầu. “Tớ thích được đánh thức như vậy đấy,” cậu ấy nói. “Cậu biết không, hiện giờ cậu cứ như bạn thân nhất của tớ vậy.”
tr: Başını salladı. “Bu şekilde çağınlmayı seviyorum,” dedi. “Biliyor musun, şu anda benim en iyi arkadaşım gibisin.
es: Movió la cabeza. —Me gusta que me llamen así —me dijo—. ¿Sabes que ahora mismo eres mi mejor amigo?
vi_translation: Lacey shook her head. "I like being woken up like this," she said. "You know, right now you feel like my best friend."
tr_translation: He nodded. “I like being called that way,” he said. “You know, right now you are like my best friend.”
es_translation: He moved his head. —I like being called that —he told me—. Do you know that right now you are my best friend?

en: “I’m thrilled,” I said, even though she was drunk and tired and lying. “So listen, we’re going to go upstairs together, and if anybody says anything about you, I will defend your honor.”
vi: “Hân hạnh quá,” tôi nói, Lacey vẫn còn ngà ngà, mệt và chưa chịu dậy. “Vậy nghe tớ, chúng ta cùng lên gác, nếu có đứa nào dám động đến cậu thì tớ sẽ bảo vệ danh dự cho cậu.”
tr: “Çok mutlu oldum,” dedim, sarhoş, yorgun ve yalan söylüyor olmasına rağmen. “Bak, beraber üst kata çıkacağız ve eğer biri senin hakkında bir şey söylerse onurunu koruyacağım.
es: —Me alegro mucho —le contesté, aunque estaba borracha y cansada, y mentía—. Mira, vamos a subir los dos, y si alguien dice algo de ti, defenderé tu honor.
vi_translation: “It's a pleasure,” I said, Lacey still tipsy, tired, and not willing to get up. “So listen to me, we'll go upstairs together, and if anyone dares to touch you, I'll defend your honor.”
tr_translation: “I am very happy,” I said, despite being drunk, tired, and lying. “Look, we will go upstairs together and if anyone says anything about you, I will defend your honor.”
es_translation: —I'm very glad —I replied, although I was drunk and tired, and I was lying—. Look, we're both going to go up, and if anyone says anything about you, I'll defend your honor.

en: “Okay,” she said. And so we went upstairs together, and the party had thinned out a little, but there were still some baseball players, including Jase, over by the keg. Mostly there were people sleeping in sleeping bags all over the floor; some of them were squeezed onto the pullout couch. Angela and Radar were lying together on a love seat, Radar’s legs dangling over the side. They were sleeping over.
vi: “Đồng ý,” Lacey nói. Chúng tôi cùng đi lên gác, bữa tiệc đã vãn bớt, nhưng vẫn còn mấy cậu trong đội bóng chày, có cả Jase, ngồi quanh bom bia. Đa phần mọi người đang ngủ trong những túi ngủ la liệt trên sàn; có mấy đứa thu mình nằm cho vừa ghế xô-pha. Angela và Radar nằm cạnh nhau trên một xô-pha đôi, chân Radar duỗi sang một bên. Cả hai đang ngủ say.
tr: “Tamam,” dedi. Ve böylece birlikte üst kata çıktık; partideki insanlar biraz azalmıştı ama hâlâ fıçının yanında, Jase de dâhil, birkaç beyzbol oyuncusu vardı. Çoğunlukla zeminin her yerinde uyku tulumlarının içinde uyuyan insanlar vardı; bazıları çekyata sıkışmıştı. Angela ile Radar iki kişilik bir koltukta uzanıyorlardı, Radar’m bacakları yan taraftan sarkıyordu. Gece orada kalıyorlardı.
es: —Vale —me dijo. Así que subimos juntos. La fiesta se había dispersado un poco, pero todavía quedaban varios jugadores de béisbol, incluido Jase, encima del barril de cerveza. La mayoría estaban durmiendo en sacos de dormir tirados por el suelo. Había varios apretujados en un sofá cama. Angela y Radar estaban tumbados juntos en un sofá de dos plazas. A Radar le colgaban las piernas por un lado. Iban a quedarse a dormir.
vi_translation: “Agreed,” Lacey said. We went upstairs together; the party had thinned out, but there were still a few guys from the baseball team, including Jase, sitting around a beer keg. Most people were sleeping in sleeping bags scattered across the floor; a few were curled up to fit on the sofas. Angela and Radar were lying next to each other on a loveseat, with Radar's legs stretched out to one side. Both were fast asleep.
tr_translation: “Okay,” he said. And so we went upstairs together; the number of people at the party had dwindled a bit, but there were still a few baseball players, including Jase, by the keg. Mostly, there were people sleeping in sleeping bags all over the floor; some were crammed onto the pull-out couch. Angela and Radar were sprawled on a loveseat, Radar's legs dangling off the side. They were staying there for the night.
es_translation: —Okay —he told me. So we went up together. The party had dispersed a bit, but there were still several baseball players, including Jase, on top of the beer barrel. Most were sleeping in sleeping bags scattered on the floor. There were several crammed onto a sofa bed. Angela and Radar were lying together on a loveseat. Radar's legs were hanging off one side. They were going to stay the night.

en: Just as I was about to ask the guys by the keg if they’d seen Ben, he ran into the living room. He wore a blue baby bonnet on his head and was wielding a sword made out of eight empty cans of Milwaukee’s Best Light, which had, I assumed, been glued together.
vi: Tôi đang định hỏi mấy cậu tụ tập quanh bom bia xem có thấy Ben đâu không, thì Ben đã chạy sầm sầm vào phòng khách. Nó đội cái mũ nồi trẻ con màu xanh da trời trên đầu, tay lăm lăm thanh gươm chế từ tám lon bia Milwaukee’s Best Light rỗng. Xem chừng Ben đã lấy keo dính tất cả lại.
tr: Tam fıçının yanındaki çocuklara Ben’i görüp görmediklerini sormak üzereydim ki Ben koşarak salona girdi. Kafasına açık mavi renkli bir bone takmıştı ve elinde, birbirine yapıştırıldığım düşündüğüm, sekiz tane boş Milwaukee’s Best Light8 kutusundan oluşturulmuş bir kılıç tutuyordu.
es: Estaba a punto de preguntar a los tipos que había junto al barril si habían visto a Ben cuando entró corriendo en la sala. Llevaba en la cabeza un gorro azul de bebé y blandía una espada hecha con ocho latas vacías de Milwaukee’s Best Light, que supuse que había pegado.
vi_translation: I was about to ask the guys gathered around the beer keg if they had seen Ben, when Ben came charging into the living room. He was wearing a sky-blue child's beret on his head, holding a sword made from eight empty cans of Milwaukee’s Best Light. It looked like Ben had glued them all together.

en: “I SEE YOU!” Ben shouted, pointing at me with the sword. “I SPY QUENTIN JACOBSEN! YESSS! Come here! Get on your knees!” he shouted.

tr: “SENİ GÖRÜYORUM!” diye bağırdı Ben, kılıçla beni işaret ederek. “QUENTEN JACOBSENT GÖRDÜM! EVEEET! Gel buraya! Dizlerinin üstüne çök!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡TE HE VISTO! —gritó Ben apuntándome con la espada—. ¡HE AVISTADO A QUENTIN JACOBSEN! ¡SÍ! ¡Ven aquí! ¡Arrodíllate!

es: Levantó la espada de latas de cerveza y me dio un golpecito en cada hombro. —Por el poder de la espada de latas de cerveza pegadas, por la presente te nombro mi conductor.

es: —¡SÍ! —gritó. Y cuando intentaba levantarme, me empujó hacia abajo con la mano que tenía libre y volvió a pasarme por los hombros la espada de latas de cerveza. —Por la fuerza de la espada de latas de cerveza, por la presente declaro que en la graduación no llevarás ropa debajo de la toga.

es_translation: —YES! —he shouted. And when I tried to get up, he pushed me down with his free hand and once again passed the sword made of beer cans over my shoulders. —By the power of the sword of beer cans, I hereby declare that at the graduation you shall not wear clothes under the gown.

es_translation: —YES! Radar, you and me! Naked under the gown! At graduation! It will be incredible!

es_translation: —YES! —he answered me—. Swear that you will do it! I've already gotten Radar to swear it. RADAR, YOU SWORE IT, DIDN'T YOU?

tr_translation: Radar slightly turned his head and opened his eyes. “I did,” he murmured.
es_translation: Radar slightly turned his head and opened his eyes a little. —I have sworn it —he murmured.

tr: “Hayır, ben seni seviyorum. Bir kızın erkek kardeşini ya da bir arkadaşın arkadaşım sevdiği gibi değil. Seni sarhoş bir adamın gelmiş geçmiş en iyi kızı sevdiği gibi seviyorum.” Lacey gülümsedi.
es: —No, yo te quiero. No como una hermana quiere a su hermano ni como un amigo quiere a su amigo. Te quiero como un tipo totalmente borracho quiere a la mejor chica del mundo. Sonrió.

es_translation: —No, I love you. Not like a sister loves her brother nor like a friend loves a friend. I love you like a completely drunk guy loves the best girl in the world. He smiled.

en: I took a step forward, trying to save him from further embarrassment, and placed a hand on his shoulder. “If we’re gonna get you home by six, we should be leaving,” I said.
vi: Tôi tiến tới, nỗ lực giải cứu nó khỏi sa đà thêm vào trò gì đáng xấu hổ, đặt tay lên vai nó và nói, “Nếu muốn về nhà trước sáu giờ thì phải đi thôi.”
tr: One bir adım attım, Ben’i daha büyük bir utançtan kurtarmaya çalışarak bir elimi omzuna koydum. “Eğer seni altıya kadar eve götürmemiz gerekiyorsa artık çıkmalıyız,” dedim.
es: Di un paso adelante con la intención de evitar que siguiera haciendo el ridículo y le puse una mano en el hombro. —Si tenemos que estar en tu casa a las seis, deberíamos ir saliendo —le dije.
vi_translation: I stepped forward, trying to rescue him from further embarrassing himself, placed my hand on his shoulder, and said, "If you want to get home before six, we have to go."
tr_translation: I took a step forward, placing a hand on Ben's shoulder to try to save him from a greater embarrassment. "If we need to get you home by six, we should leave now," I said.
es_translation: I took a step forward with the intention of preventing him from continuing to make a fool of himself and placed a hand on his shoulder. —If we have to be at your house by six, we should be heading out —I told him.

en: “Okay,” he said. “I just gotta thank Becca for this awesome party.”
vi: “Được rồi mà,” Ben nói. “Tôi chỉ đi cảm ơn Becca đã tổ chức tiệc tưng bừng thôi.

es: —Vale —me contestó—. Voy a darle las gracias a Becca por esta increíble fiesta.

tr_translation: “Okay,” he said. “I just need to thank Becca for this amazing party.”
es_translation: —Okay —he replied to me—. I'm going to thank Becca for this incredible party.

en: So Lacey and I followed Ben downstairs, where he opened the door to Becca’s room and said, “Your party kicked so much ass! Even though you suck so much! It’s like instead of blood, your heart pumps liquid suck! But thanks for the beer!” Becca was alone, lying on top of her covers, staring at the ceiling. She didn’t even glance over at him. She just mumbled, “Oh, go to hell, shit-face. I hope your date gives you her crabs.”
vi: Lacey và tôi theo Ben xuống dưới, Ben mở cửa phòng Becca và nói, “Tiệc của cậu khôi hài thật đấy! Cơ mà cậu gớm quá! Cứ như tim cậu không bơm máu mà bơm đi toàn dung-dịch-gớm ấy. Nhưng cảm ơn đã đãi bia nhé!” Becca chỉ có một mình, đang nằm trên giường, nhìn chòng chọc lên trần nhà. Chẳng buồn liếc nhìn Ben, Becca lầm bầm, “Cuốn xéo xuống địa ngục đi, đồ mặt thộn, chúc con cua bò từ cô nàng ấy sang mày.”
tr: Böylece Lacey’yle, Ben’i alt kata doğru takip ettik, Ben, Becca’mn yatak odasının kapısını açtı ve “Partin o kadar iyiydi ki! Sen oldukça berbat olsan da!.. Sanki kalbin kan yerine, berbatlığın sıvı halini pompalıyor gibi! Ama bira için teşekkürler!” dedi. Becca tek başına, çarşaflarının üstünde uzamyor ve tavana bakıyordu. Ben’e bakmadı bile. Sadece, “Ah, cehenneme kadar yolun var, bok suratlı. Umarım sevgilin sana kasık bitlerini geçirir,” diye mırıldandı.
es: Lacey y yo lo seguimos al piso de abajo, donde abrió la puerta de la habitación de Becca y dijo: —¡Tu fiesta ha molado un huevo! ¡Aunque tú das asco! Tu corazón no bombea sangre, sino mierda. Pero gracias por la cerveza. Becca estaba sola, tumbada encima de la colcha y mirando al techo. Ni siquiera miró a Ben. Se limitó a murmurar: —Uf, vete a la mierda, imbécil. Espero que tu pareja te pegue las ladillas.
vi_translation: Lacey and I followed Ben downstairs, Ben opened Becca's room door and said, "Your party is really funny! But you're so gross! It's like your heart pumps not blood but that gross-fluid. But thanks for the beer!" Becca was alone, lying on the bed, staring at the ceiling. Without bothering to look at Ben, Becca muttered, "Go to hell, you dumb face, I hope the crabs crawl from her to you."
tr_translation: So, with Lacey, we followed Ben downstairs, Ben opened the door to Becca's bedroom and said, "Your party was so good! Even though you were pretty awful!.. It's like your heart pumps the liquid form of awfulness instead of blood! But thanks for the beer!” he said. Becca was lying alone on her sheets, staring at the ceiling. She didn't even look at Ben. She just muttered, "Oh, go to hell, shit face. I hope your girlfriend gives you pubic lice,” she mumbled.
es_translation: Lacey and I followed him downstairs, where he opened the door to Becca's room and said: —Your party was awesome! Even though you suck! Your heart doesn't pump blood, but shit. But thanks for the beer. Becca was alone, lying on top of the bedspread and staring at the ceiling. She didn't even look at Ben. She merely murmured: —Ugh, go to hell, idiot. I hope your partner gives you crabs.

en: Without a hint of irony in his voice, Ben answered, “Great talking to you!” and then closed the door. I don’t think he had the faintest idea he’d just been insulted.
vi: Không chút mỉa mai ác ý, Ben đáp, “Rất vui được nói chuyện với cậu!” và đóng cửa lại. Tôi nghĩ Ben không có chút ý niệm nào rằng những lời của Becca thực ra rất xúc phạm.
tr: Sesinde dalga geçmenin belirtisi bile olmadan Ben, “Seninle konuşmak harikaydı!” diye karşılık verdi ve kapıyı kapattı. Az önce aşağılandığına dair en ufak bir fikri olduğunu sanmıyorum.
es: —Encantado de hablar contigo —le contestó Ben sin un ápice de ironía. Y cerró la puerta. Creo que ni se había enterado de que acababan de insultarle.

tr_translation: Without the slightest hint of mockery in his voice, Ben replied, "It was great talking to you!" and closed the door. I don't think he has the slightest idea that he was just insulted.

en: And then we were upstairs again and getting ready to walk out the door. “Ben,” I said, “you’re going to have to leave the beer sword here.”

en: “Right,” he said, and then I grabbed the sword’s tip and tugged, but Ben refused to relinquish it. I was about to start screaming at his drunk ass when I realized he couldn’t let go of the sword.
vi: “Ừ nhỉ,” Ben nói. Tôi cầm một đầu thanh gươm và giật ra, nhưng Ben không chịu thả. Tôi sắp sửa nổi cáu với thằng khỉ say xỉn này thì phát hiện ra nó không thể buông thanh gươm được.
tr: “Doğru,” dedi, kılıcın ucunu tutup kuvvetlice çektim ama Ben bırakmayı reddetti. Sarhoş suratına doğru haykırmaya başlayacaktım ki kılıcı bırakamadığmı fark ettim.
es: Cogí el extremo de la espada y tiré, pero Ben se negó a soltarla. Estaba a punto de empezar a gritarle que era un borracho de mierda cuando me di cuenta de que no podía soltar la espada.
vi_translation: "Oh right," Ben said. I grabbed one end of the sword and pulled, but Ben wouldn't let go. I was about to get mad at this drunken monkey when I realized he couldn't release the sword.
tr_translation: “Right,” he said, I grabbed the tip of the sword and pulled hard, but Ben refused to let go. Just as I was about to start yelling at his drunken face, I realized I couldn't let go of the sword.
es_translation: I grabbed the end of the sword and pulled, but Ben refused to let it go. I was about to start yelling at him that he was a worthless drunk when I realized that I couldn't let go of the sword. —Ben, have you stuck the sword to your hand?

en: Lacey laughed. “Ben, did you glue yourself to the beer sword?”
vi: Lacey cười phá lên, “Ben ơi, cậu dính luôn chính mình vào gươm à
tr: Lacey kahkaha attı. “Ben, kendini bira kılıcına mı yapıştırdın?
es: —Ben, ¿te has pegado la espada a la mano? —le preguntó Lacey riéndose. —Sí —le contestó Ben—, me la he pegado con Super Glue.
vi_translation: Lacey burst out laughing, "Ben, did you just stick yourself with the sword?"
tr_translation: Lacey laughed. "Did you stick yourself to a beer sword?""
es_translation: —Lacey asked him, laughing. —Yes —Ben replied—, I have glued it with Super Glue.

en: “No,” Ben answered. “I superglued. That way no one can steal it from me!”
vi: “Không,” Ben đáp. “Tớ siêu dính luôn. Như thế mới không bị trộm mất!”
tr: “Hayır,” diye cevap verdi Ben. “Süper bir şekilde yapıştırdım. Böylece kimse onu benden çalamayacak!
es: —Sí —le contestó Ben—, me la he pegado con Super Glue. Así nadie me la robará.
vi_translation: “No,” Ben replied. “I’m super attached. That way it won’t get stolen!”
tr_translation: “No,” Ben replied. “I glued it super well. That way, no one can steal it from me!”
es_translation: —Yes —Ben replied—, I have glued it with Super Glue. That way, no one will steal it from me.

en: “Good thinking,” Lacey deadpanned.
vi: “Tư duy sắc bén đấy,” Lacey cố tỏ ra nghiêm túc.
tr: “İyi düşünmüşsün,” dedi Lacey duygusuz bir ifadeyle.
es: —Bien pensado —dijo Lacey, impávida.
vi_translation: “Sharp thinking,” Lacey tried to appear serious.
tr_translation: “You’ve thought it through,” said Lacey with an emotionless expression.
es_translation: —Well thought out —said Lacey, impassively.

en: Lacey and I managed to break off all the beer cans except the one that was superglued directly to Ben’s hand. No matter how hard I pulled, Ben’s hand just limply followed along, like the beer was the string and his hand the puppet. Finally, Lacey just said, “We gotta go.” So we did. We strapped Ben into the backseat of the minivan. Lacey sat next to him, because “I should make sure he doesn’t puke or beat himself to death with his beer hand or whatever.”
vi: Lacey và tôi gỡ được các lon bia ra, chỉ trừ lon cuối siêu dính trực tiếp vào tay Ben. Tôi kéo mạnh đến đâu, tay Ben liền xụi lơ đi theo đến đấy, như thể lon bia là sợi dây và tay Ben là con rối. Cuối cùng Lacey nói, “Phải đi thôi.” Thế là chúng tôi ra xe, tống Ben lên ghế sau trong chiếc minivan. Lacey ngồi cạnh nó, vì “Tớ nên trông chừng để cậu ấy không nôn hoặc tự đánh mình đến chết bằng cái tay lon bia này.”
tr: Lacey’yle, süper yapıştırıcıyla doğrudan Ben’in eline yapıştırılmış olan dışmda, bütün bira kutularım koparmayı başardık. Ne kadar kuvvetli çekersem çekeyim, Ben’in eh gevşek bir şekilde kutuyu takip etti, sanki bira ip, eli de kuklaymış gibi. Sonunda Lacey, “Gitmeliyiz,” dedi. Böylece gittik. Emniyet kemeriyle Ben’i minivanın arka koltuğuna bağladık. Lacey yanma oturdu çünkü “kusmayacağından ya da kendini bira eliyle öldüresiye dövmeyeceğinden falan emin olmalıydı.
es: Lacey y yo conseguimos despegar todas las latas menos la que estaba pegada a la mano de Ben. Por más que tirara, su mano iba detrás, como si la lata fuera el hilo y su mano la marioneta. —Tenemos que irnos —dijo Lacey por fin. Y nos fuimos. Sentamos a Ben en el asiento de atrás y le abrochamos el cinturón. Lacey se sentó a su lado porque «así controlo que no vomite, se pegue un golpe con la lata de cerveza y se mate, o algo así».
vi_translation: Lacey and I managed to remove the beer cans, except for the last one which was stuck directly to Ben's hand. No matter how hard I pulled, Ben's hand would go limp and follow, as if the beer can was the string and Ben's hand was the puppet. Finally, Lacey said, "We have to go." So we got in the car, shoving Ben into the back seat of the minivan. Lacey sat next to him, because "I should keep an eye on him so he doesn't throw up or beat himself to death with this beer can hand."
tr_translation: We managed to tear off all my beer cans with Lacey, except for the one that was directly glued to Ben's hand with super glue. No matter how hard I pulled, Ben's hand remained loosely attached. He followed the box, as if it were a string and his hand a puppet. Finally, Lacey said, "We should go." So we went. We strapped Ben into the back seat of the minivan with a seatbelt. Lacey sat next to him because she had to make sure he wouldn't throw up or beat himself to death with his own hand or something."
es_translation: Lacey and I managed to remove all the cans except the one that was stuck to Ben's hand. No matter how hard he pulled, his hand followed, as if the can were the string and his hand the puppet. —We have to go —said Lacey finally. And we left. We sat Ben in the back seat and fastened his seatbelt. Lacey sat next to him because "this way I can make sure he doesn't throw up, hit himself with the beer can, and kill himself, or something like that."

en: “I guess so,” I said. Ben’s head was lolling around, seemingly unconnected to a spine. He didn’t strike me as particularly sweet, but whatever.
vi: “Tớ cũng nghĩ vậy,” tôi đáp. Đầu Ben lắc lư lung tung, trông như đã lìa khỏi cột sống vậy. Đối với tôi Ben không đặc biệt ngọt ngào, nhưng không hề gì.
tr: “Öyle sanırım,” dedim. Ben’in kafası oraya buraya sallanıyordu, görünüşe göre bir omurgaya bağlı değildi. Bende tatlı olduğuna dair bir etki bırakmamıştı ama her neyse.
es: —Supongo —le contesté. A Ben le colgaba la cabeza, como si no la tuviera unida a la columna vertebral. No me pareció especialmente dulce, pero bueno.
vi_translation: “I think so too,” I replied. Ben's head wobbled all over the place, looking as if it had detached from his spine. To me, Ben wasn't particularly sweet, but it didn't matter.
tr_translation: "I suppose so," I said. Ben's head was bobbing around, apparently not attached to a spine. It hadn't left an impression of sweetness on me, but whatever.
es_translation: —I suppose —I replied to him. Ben's head hung as if it were not attached to his spine. It didn't seem particularly sweet to me, but oh well.

en: I dropped Lacey off first on the other side of Jefferson Park. When she leaned over and pecked him on the mouth, he perked up enough to mumble, “Yes.” She walked up to the driver’s-side door on the way to her condo. “Thanks,” she said. I just nodded.
vi: Tôi thả Lacey xuống trước, ở phía bên kia Công viên Jefferson. Khi Lacey cúi xuống hôn phớt lên môi Ben, nó chóp chép miệng đủ thành một tiếng “Ừ. Lacey đi về phía bên cổng cho xe ô-tô để lên căn hộ nhà mình. “Cảm ơn nhé,” Lacey nói. Tôi chỉ gật đầu.
tr: Önce Jefferson Park’m diğer tarafında Lacey’yi bıraktım. Lacey eğilip Ben’in dudağına bir öpücük kondurduğunda, Ben, “Evet,” diye mırıldanacak kadar canlandı. Lacey evine doğru giderken şoför tarafındaki kapıya yaklaştı. “Teşekkürler,” dedi. Sadece başımı salladım.
es: Llevé primero a Lacey al otro extremo de Jefferson Park. Cuando Lacey se inclinó y le dio un pico, se espabiló lo suficiente para murmurar: «Sí». Lacey se acercó a la puerta del conductor de camino a su casa. —Gracias —me dijo. Asentí.
vi_translation: I dropped Lacey off first, on the other side of Jefferson Park. When Lacey bent down to give Ben a light kiss on the lips, it made a smacking sound that was enough to form a "Mm-hmm."" Lacey walked towards the car gate to go up to her apartment. "Thank you," Lacey said. I just nodded.
tr_translation: First, I dropped Lacey off on the other side of Jefferson Park. When Lacey leaned in and planted a kiss on Ben's lips, Ben was animated enough to murmur, "Yes." As Lacey walked towards the car, she approached the driver's side door. "Thank you," she said. I just nodded.
es_translation: I first took Lacey to the other end of Jefferson Park. When Lacey leaned in and gave him a peck, he perked up enough to murmur, "Yes." Lacey approached the driver's door on her way home. —Thank you —he said to me. I nodded.

en: I drove across the subdivision. It wasn’t night and it wasn’t morning. Ben snored quietly in the back. I pulled up in front of his house, got out, opened the sliding door of the minivan, and unfastened his seat belt.
vi: Tôi lái xe qua tiểu khu này. Trời không còn tối và chưa hẳn sáng. Ben ngáy bình yên trên băng ghế sau. Tôi dừng lại trước nhà nó, xuống mở cửa xe và tháo đai an toàn cho Ben.
tr: Arabayı semtin öbür tarafına doğru sürdüm. Gece de gündüz de değildi. Ben, arkada sessizce horluyordu. Evinin önünde kenara çektim, indim, minivanın sürgülü kapısını açtım ve emniyet kemerini çıkardım.
es: Crucé la urbanización. Ya no era de noche, pero todavía no había amanecido. Ben roncaba flojito en el asiento de atrás. Aparqué delante de su casa, salí del coche, abrí la puerta corredera del monovolumen y le desabroché el cinturón de seguridad.
vi_translation: I drove through this neighborhood. The sky was no longer dark but not yet light. Ben snored peacefully on the back seat. I stopped in front of his house, got out to open the car door, and unbuckled Ben's seatbelt.
tr_translation: I drove the car to the other side of the neighborhood. It was neither night nor day. Ben was snoring quietly in the back. I pulled over in front of his house, got out, opened the sliding door of the minivan, and unbuckled the seatbelt.
es_translation: I crossed the housing development. It was no longer night, but it still hadn't dawned. Ben was snoring softly in the back seat. I parked in front of his house, got out of the car, opened the sliding door of the minivan, and unbuckled his seatbelt.

en: “Time to go home, Benners.”
vi: “Về nhà rồi Ben ơi.
tr: “Eve gitme zamanı, Benners.
es: —Hora de irse a casa, Benners.
vi_translation: "We're home, Ben."
tr_translation: “It's time to go home, Benners.”
es_translation: —Time to go home, Benners.

en: He sniffed and shook his head, then awoke. He reached up to rub his eyes and seemed surprised to find an empty can of Milwaukee’s Best Light attached to his right hand. He tried to make a fist and dented the can some, but did not dislodge it. He looked at it for a minute, and then nodded. “The Beast is stuck to me,” he noted.
vi: Nó khụt khịt lúc lắc đầu, rồi tỉnh ngủ. Nó định dụi mắt và có vẻ ngạc nhiên thấy một lon Milwaukee’s Best Light rỗng dính trên tay phải. Nó cố nắm tay lại bóp bẹp cái lon nhưng không ăn thua. Ben nhìn lon bia chừng một phút rồi gật đầu thốt lên, “Quái vật cứ bám riết lấy tôi!”
tr: Burnunu çekti, başım salladı, sonra uyandı. Gözlerini ovuşturmak için ellerini yukan kaldırdı ve sağ eline yapışık boş Müwaukee’s Best Light kutusu bulunca şaşırmış gibi göründü. Elini yumruk yapmaya çalıştı ve kutuyu biraz ezdi ama yerinden çıkarmadı. Kısa bir süre kutuya baktı, sonra başmı salladı. “Canavar9 bana yapışıp kalmış,” diye bildirdi. 9 MIwaukee’s Best birası “The Beast” yani “Canavar” olarak da adlandırılmaktadır. (ç. n.
es: Olisqueó, movió la cabeza y se despertó. Levantó las manos para frotarse los ojos y pareció sorprenderse de ver una lata de Milwaukee’s Best Light pegada en su mano. Intentó cerrar el puño y abollar un poco la lata, pero no se la pudo arrancar. La miró un minuto y movió la cabeza. —La Bestia está pegada a mí —observó.
vi_translation: It sniffled and shook its head, then woke up. It intended to rub its eyes and seemed surprised to see an empty Milwaukee’s Best Light can stuck to its right hand. It tried to crush the can by squeezing it but to no avail. Ben looked at the beer can for about a minute, then nodded and exclaimed, "The monster keeps clinging to me!"
tr_translation: He sniffled, nodded his head, then woke up. He raised his hands to rub his eyes and seemed surprised when he found an empty Milwaukee’s Best Light can stuck to his right hand. He tried to make a fist and crushed the can a bit but didn’t remove it. He looked at the can for a short while, then nodded his head. “The monster9 has stuck to me,” he reported. Milwaukee’s Best beer is also referred to as "The Beast" or "Canavar". (tr. n.)
es_translation: He sniffed, moved his head, and woke up. He raised his hands to rub his eyes and seemed surprised to see a can of Milwaukee’s Best Light stuck to his hand. He tried to close his fist and dent the can a bit, but he couldn't tear it off. He looked at it for a minute and shook his head. "The Beast is stuck to me," he observed.

en: He climbed out of the minivan and staggered up the sidewalk to his house, and when he was standing on the front porch, he turned around, smiling. I waved at him. The beer waved back.
vi: Nó ra khỏi xe, loạng choạng lên vỉa hè để vào nhà. Khi đã đứng dưới mái hiên trước nhà, Ben quay lại, mỉm cười. Tôi vẫy nó. Lon bia vẫy lại.
tr: n. Mirlivandan inip sendeleyerek evinin kaldırımına çıktı ve ön verandada durunca, gülümseyerek arkasını döndü. Ona el salladım. Bira da el salladı.
es: Saltó del coche y avanzó tambaleándose por la acera de su casa. Cuando llegó al porche, se giró sonriendo. Lo saludé con la mano. La cerveza me devolvió el saludo.
vi_translation: He got out of the car, staggered onto the sidewalk to enter the house. When he was standing under the front porch, Ben turned around and smiled. I waved at it. The beer can waved back.
tr_translation: Mirlivandan stumbled out of the car and onto the sidewalk in front of his house, and when he stopped on the front porch, he turned around with a smile. I waved at him. He waved back.
es_translation: He jumped out of the car and staggered along the sidewalk to his house. When he reached the porch, he turned around smiling. I waved at him. The beer waved back at me.

en: I slept for a few hours and then spent the morning poring over the travel guides I’d discovered the day before. I waited until noon to call Ben and Radar. I called Ben first. “Good morning, Sunshine,” I said.
vi: Tôi ngủ mấy tiếng, rồi dành cả buổi sáng đọc không sót đám sách du lịch vừa khui được hôm trước. Tôi đợi đến trưa mới gọi cho Ben và Radar. Tôi gọi Ben trước, “Chào buổi sáng, vầng thái dương đã lên cao ngất rồi.”
tr: Birkaç saat uyudum ve sonra sabahı, önceki gün keşfettiğim seyahat rehberlerini inceleyerek geçirdim. Radar ile Ben’i aramak için öğlene kadar bekledim. Önce Ben’i aradım. “Günaydın, gün ışığı,” dedim.
es: Dormí unas horas y luego pasé la mañana leyendo atentamente las guías de viajes que había encontrado el día anterior. Esperé a las doce para llamar a Ben y a Radar. Llamé primero a Ben. —Buenos días, su señoría —le dije.
vi_translation: I slept for a few hours, then spent the entire morning reading through the travel books I had just opened the day before. I waited until noon to call Ben and Radar. I called Ben first, "Good morning, the sun is already high in the sky."
tr_translation: I slept for a few hours and then spent the morning reviewing the travel guides I had discovered the previous day. I waited until noon to call Radar and Ben. I called Ben first. "Good morning, sunshine," I said.
es_translation: I slept for a few hours and then spent the morning carefully reading the travel guides I had found the day before. I waited until twelve to call Ben and Radar. I called Ben first. —Good morning, Your Honor —I said to him.

en: “Oh, God,” Ben said, his voice dripping abject misery. “Oh, sweet baby Jesus, come and comfort your little bro Ben. Oh, Lord. Shower me with your mercy.”
vi: “Ôi, Chúa ơi,” Ben đáp, giọng nó chảy ra nghe như nỗi thống khổ tuyệt vọng. “Ôi, Chúa Trời bé bỏng ngọt ngào ơi, hãy đến đây và xoa dịu người anh em Ben này đi. Ôi, xin hãy đổ xuống tôi sự cứu rỗi của Người.”
tr: “Ah, Tanrım,” dedi Ben, rezilliğin ızdırabı sesinden akıyordu. “Ah, tatlı İsa, gel ve küçük kardeşin Ben’i rahatlat. Ah, Tanrım. İleni merhametinle yıka.
es: —Oh, Dios mío —dijo Ben con un tono que destilaba la más abyecta miseria—. Oh, Jesusito de mi vida, ven a consolar a tu hermano Ben. Oh, Señor, cólmame de tu gracia.
vi_translation: “Oh, God,” Ben replied, his voice dripping with what sounded like utter despair. “Oh, sweet little God, please come here and soothe this brother Ben. Oh, please pour down upon me Your salvation.”
tr_translation: “Oh, my God,” said Ben, the agony of disgrace flowing from his voice. “Oh, sweet Jesus, come and comfort your little brother Ben. Oh, my God. Wash the cursed one with your mercy.”
es_translation: —Oh, my God —said Ben in a tone that exuded the most abject misery—. Oh, little Jesus of my life, come to console your brother Ben. Oh, Lord, fill me with your grace.

en: “There’ve been a lot of Margo developments,” I said excitedly, “so you need to come over. I’m gonna call Radar, too.”
vi: “Có nhiều tiến triển về Margo lắm nhé,” tôi hào hứng, “Bê cái mông của ông đến đây. Tôi sẽ gọi cả Radar nữa.”
tr: “Birçok Margo gelişmesi oldu,” dedim heyecanla, “yani buraya gelmen gerekiyor. Radar’ı da arayacağım.
es: —Tengo un montón de novedades sobre Margo —le dije entusiasmado—, así que tienes que venir. Voy a llamar también a Radar.
vi_translation: “There has been a lot of progress regarding Margo,” I said excitedly, “Get your butt over here. I will call Radar too.”
tr_translation: “There have been many Margo developments,” I said excitedly, “so you need to come here. I will also call Radar.”
es_translation: —I have a ton of news about Margo —I told him excitedly—, so you have to come. I'm going to call Radar too.

en: Ben seemed not to have heard me. “Hey, when my mom came into my room at nine o’clock this morning, why is it that as I reached up to yawn, she and I both discovered a beer can was stuck to my hand?”
vi: Hình như Ben không cho vào tai những điều tôi vừa nói. “Này, mẹ vào phòng tôi lúc chín giờ sáng nay, lúc ấy tôi nhỏm dậy ngáp, mẹ con tôi cùng phát hiện ra có lon bia dính vào tay tôi là sao hả ông?”
tr: Ben beni duymamış gibi görünüyordu. “Hey, bu sabah annem saat dokuzda odama geldiğinde, esnemek için elimi ağzıma götürürken ikimiz de elime bir bira kutusunun yapışmış olduğunu keşfettik?
es: Ben no pareció haberme oído. —Oye, ¿cómo es posible que cuando mi madre ha entrado en mi habitación esta mañana, a las nueve, y he estirado los brazos, hayamos descubierto una lata de cerveza pegada en mi mano?
vi_translation: It seems like Ben didn't pay attention to what I just said. "Hey, my mom came into my room at nine o'clock this morning, and as I was sitting up yawning, my mom and I both discovered a beer can stuck to my hand. What's up with that?"
tr_translation: Ben seemed like he hadn't heard me. "Hey, this morning when my mom came into my room at nine o'clock, while I was yawning and bringing my hand to my mouth, we both discovered that a beer can was stuck to my hand?"
es_translation: Ben didn't seem to have heard me. —Hey, how is it possible that when my mother entered my room this morning at nine, and I stretched my arms, we discovered a beer can stuck to my hand?

en: “You superglued a bunch of beers together to make a beer sword, and then you superglued your hand to it.”
vi: “Ông siêu dính một lô lon vào nhau thành một thanh gươm lon bia, rồi ông siêu dính tay ông vào đó.”
tr: “Bir bira kılıcı yapmak için, süper yapıştırıcıyla bir sürü birayı birbirine yapıştırdın ve sonra elini de ona yapıştırdın.
es: —Pegaste un montón de latas de cerveza para hacerte una espada, y luego te la pegaste a la mano.
vi_translation: "He super-glued a bunch of cans together into a beer can sword, then he super-glued his hand to it."
tr_translation: “To make a beer sword, you glued a bunch of beers together with super glue and then glued your hand to it.”
es_translation: —You glued a bunch of beer cans together to make a sword, and then you glued it to your hand.

en: “Oh, yeah. The beer sword. That rings a bell. ”
vi: “Ờ ờ. Gươm lon bia. Nghe quen quen.
tr: “Ah, evet. Bira kılıcı. Bu bir şeyler çağrıştırıyor.
es: —Oh, sí. La espada de cerveza. Me suena de algo.
vi_translation: "Uh uh. Sword of the beer can. Sounds familiar."
tr_translation: “Ah, yes. The beer sword. This rings a bell.”
es_translation: —Oh, yes. The beer sword. It rings a bell.

en: “Ben, come over.”
vi: “Ben, sang nhà tôi đi.”
tr: “Ben, buraya gel.
es: —Ben, pásate por aquí.
vi_translation: "Ben, come to my house."
tr_translation: “Ben, come here.”
es_translation: —Ben, come over here.

en: “Bro. I feel like shit.”
vi: “Tôi thấy trong người loạn lắm ông ạ.”
tr: “Kardeşim. Bok gibi hissediyorum.
es: —Colega, estoy hecho una mierda.
vi_translation: "I feel very confused, sir."
tr_translation: “Brother. I feel like crap.”
es_translation: —Colleague, I'm feeling like crap.

en: “Then I’ll come over to your house. How soon?”
vi: “Thế để tôi sang nhà ông. Khi nào ông sẵn sàng?”
tr: “O zaman ben, senin evine geleyim.
es: —Entonces me pasaré yo por tu casa. ¿A qué hora?
vi_translation: “Then let me come over to your house. When will you be ready?”
tr_translation: "Then I should come to your house. How long will it take?"
es_translation: —Then I will stop by your house. What time?

en: “Bro, you can’t come over here. I have to sleep for ten thousand hours. I have to drink ten thousand gallons of water, and take ten thousand Advils. I’ll just see you tomorrow at school.”
vi: “Bồ tèo đừng có đến. Tôi phải ngủ thêm mười ngàn giờ đồng hồ nữa. Còn phải uống mười ngàn ga-lông nước, và cần một liều mười ngàn viên giảm đau Advil. Hẹn mai gặp ông ở trường nhá.”
tr: Ne kadar sonra?” “Kardeşim, buraya gelemezsin. On bin saat uyumak zorundayım. On bin galon su içmek ve on bin tane Advil almak zorundayım. Yarın okulda görüşürüz.
es: —Colega, no puedes venir. Tengo que dormir diez mil horas. Tengo que beberme diez mil litros de agua y tomarme diez mil ibuprofenos. Te veré mañana en el instituto.
vi_translation: "Buddy, don't come over. I need to sleep for another ten thousand hours. I also need to drink ten thousand gallons of water, and take a dose of ten thousand Advil painkillers. See you at school tomorrow."
tr_translation: "Brother, you can't come here. I need to sleep for ten thousand hours. I need to drink ten thousand gallons of water and take ten thousand Advils. See you at school tomorrow."
es_translation: —Colleague, you can't come. I have to sleep ten thousand hours. I have to drink ten thousand liters of water and take ten thousand ibuprofens. I'll see you tomorrow at the institute.

en: I took a deep breath and tried not to sound pissed. “I drove across Central Florida in the middle of the night to be sober at the world’s drunkest party and drive your soggy ass home, and this is—” I would have kept talking, but I noticed that Ben had hung up. He hung up on me. Asshole.
vi: Tôi hít một hơi thật sâu cho khỏi cáu. “Tôi đã lái xe băng ngang Trung Florida vào lúc nửa đêm để đóng vai kẻ tỉnh táo duy nhất tại bữa tiệc say xỉn nhất thế giới, đưa cái mông chảy nước của ông về nhà, và đây–” Tôi còn chưa nói xong nhưng nhận ra Ben đã gác máy rồi. Nó dám gác máy với tôi. Thằng bựa này.
tr: Derin bir nefes aldım ve sesim kızgın çıkmasın diye uğraştım. “Dünyanın en sarhoş partisinde ayık olmak ve senin hantal kıçını eve götürmek için gecenin bir yarısı, bütün Florida boyunca araba sürdüm ve bu.. Konuşmaya devam edecektim ama Ben’in telefonu kapattığını fark ettim. Suratıma kapatmıştı. Göt herif.
es: Respiré hondo e intenté no parecer defraudado. —Crucé Florida central en plena noche para llegar sobrio a la fiesta más borracha del mundo y dejar tu culo gordo en casa, y es… Habría seguido hablando, pero me di cuenta de que Ben había colgado. Me había colgado. Gilipollas.
vi_translation: I took a deep breath to keep from getting angry. “I drove across Central Florida at midnight to play the role of the only sober person at the world's drunkest party, to take your leaking ass home, and here–” I hadn't even finished speaking when I realized Ben had already hung up. He dared to hang up on me. That bastard.
tr_translation: I took a deep breath and tried not to sound angry. “I drove all the way across Florida in the middle of the night, staying sober at the world's drunkest party just to get your clumsy ass home, and this.. I was going to continue talking, but I realized Ben had hung up. He had hung up on me. Jerk.
es_translation: I took a deep breath and tried not to look disappointed. —I crossed central Florida in the middle of the night to arrive sober at the drunkest party in the world and leave your fat ass at home, and it's… I would have kept talking, but I realized that Ben had hung up. He had hung up on me. Asshole.

en: As time passed, I only got more pissed. It’s one thing not to give a shit about Margo. But really, Ben didn’t give a shit about me, either. Maybe our friendship had always been about convenience— he didn’t have anyone cooler than me to play video games with. And now he didn’t have to be nice to me, or care about the things I cared about, because he had Jase Worthington. He had the school keg stand record. He had a hot prom date. He’d jumped at his first opportunity to join the fraternity of vapid asshats.
vi: Thời gian càng trôi, tôi càng cáu tợn. Không quan tâm đến Margo đã đành. Đằng này, Ben còn không đoái hoài gì đến tôi nữa. Có lẽ tình bạn của hai thằng luôn chỉ là một tiện nghi đối với nó–nó chẳng kiếm được thằng nào oách hơn tôi để cùng bắn trò chơi điện tử. Bây giờ nó không cần phải tử tế với tôi nữa, hoặc quan tâm đến những điều tôi quan tâm, vì nó đã có Jase Worthington. Ben đã là quán quân bom bia ở trường. Nó đã mời được một nàng nóng bỏng đến dạ tiệc. Nó đã chớp được cơ hội đầu tiên để gia nhập hàng ngũ những thằng bỉ bựa chân chính.
tr: Zaman geçtikçe sadece daha çok sinirlendim. Margo’yu hiç umursamaması bir yana... Ben, beni de hiç umursamıyordu. Belki de arkadaşlığımız her zaman uygun koşullarla alakalı olmuştu... Birlikte bilgisayar oyunu oynamak için benden daha havalı kimsesi yoktu. Ve artık bana iyi davranmak ya da benim önemsediğim şeyleri önemsemek zorunda değildi çünkü Jase Worthington’ı vardı. Okulun fıçı duruşu rekorunu kırmıştı. Seksi bir balo eşi vardı. Ruhsuz götler kardeşliğine katılmak için sahip olduğu ilk fırsatın üzerine atlamıştı.
es: A medida que pasaba el tiempo iba cabreándome cada vez más. Una cosa era que Margo le importara una mierda, pero la verdad era que a Ben también le había importado una mierda yo. Quizá nuestra amistad siempre había sido por conveniencia, porque no tenía a nadie mejor con quien jugar a videojuegos. Pero a partir de entonces ya no tenía que ser amable conmigo ni preocuparse por las cosas que me importaban, porque tenía a Jase Worthington. Tenía el récord del instituto de keg stand. Había ido al baile con una tía buena. Había aprovechado la primera oportunidad para pasarse al grupo de los imbéciles insulsos.
vi_translation: The more time passed, the more irritable I became. Not caring about Margo was one thing. But now, Ben didn't pay any attention to me either. Perhaps our friendship had always been just a convenience for him—he couldn't find anyone cooler than me to play video games with. Now he didn't need to be nice to me anymore, or care about the things I cared about, because he had Jase Worthington. Ben had become the beer pong champion at school. He had invited a hot girl to the prom. He had seized his first chance to join the ranks of the truly obnoxious guys.
tr_translation: As time passed, I just got angrier. Not only did he not care about Margo at all... He didn't care about me either. Maybe our friendship had always been about the right circumstances... He had no one cooler than me to play computer games with. And now he didn't have to treat me well or care about the things I cared about because he had Jase Worthington. He had broken the school's keg stand record. He had a sexy prom date. He had jumped at the first opportunity to join the soulless jerks fraternity.
es_translation: As time went by, I was getting more and more pissed off. One thing was that Margo didn't give a damn about him, but the truth was that Ben didn't give a damn about me either. Maybe our friendship had always been out of convenience, because he didn't have anyone better to play video games with. But from then on, he didn't have to be nice to me or care about the things that mattered to me, because he had Jase Worthington. He held the school record for keg stand. He had gone to the dance with a hot chick. He had taken the first opportunity to switch to the group of bland assholes.

en: Five minutes after he hung up on me, I called his cell again. He didn’t answer, so I left a message. “You want to be cool like Chuck, Bloody Ben? That’s what you always wanted? Well, congratulations. You got it. And you deserve him, because you’re also a shitbag. Don’t call back.”
vi: Năm phút sau khi Ben gác máy, tôi gọi lại vào điện thoại di động của nó. Ben không bắt máy, nên tôi để lại tin nhắn, “Ông muốn hoành tờ-ráng như Chuck phải không Ben Bỉ Bựa? Ông vẫn thèm được như vậy lắm hả? Ồ, chúc mừng nhé! Ông làm được rồi đó. Ông và nó đôi lứa xứng đôi, vì ông cũng là một đống bốc mùi. Đừng gọi lại.”
tr: Suratıma kapattıktan beş dakika sonra, cep telefonunu tekrar aradım. Açmadı, bu yüzden mesaj bıraktım. “Chuck gibi havalı mı olmak istiyorsun, Kanlı Ben? Hep istediğin şey bu muydu? Peki, tebrikler. Artık bu elinde. Ve onu hak ediyorsun çünkü sen de bok gibisin. Geri arama.
es: Cinco minutos después de que me colgara volví a llamarlo al móvil. Como no me contestó, le dejé un mensaje: «¿Quieres ser guay como Chuck, Ben el Sangriento? ¿Es lo que siempre has querido? Pues felicidades. Ya lo has conseguido. Y te lo mereces, porque eres un mierda. No hace falta que me llames».
vi_translation: Five minutes after Ben hung up, I called back on his mobile phone. Ben didn't answer, so I left a message, "You want to be a big shot like Chuck, don't you, Ben the Jerk? You still crave that, huh? Oh, congratulations! You did it. You and he are a perfect match, because you're also a stinking pile. Don't call back."
tr_translation: Five minutes after he hung up on me, I called his cell phone again. He didn't answer, so I left a message. “Do you want to be cool like Chuck, Bloody Ben? Is this what you've always wanted? Well, congratulations. Now it's in your hands. And you deserve it because you're crap too. Don't call back.”
es_translation: Five minutes after he hung up on me, I called him back on his cell phone. Since he didn't answer, I left him a message: "Do you want to be cool like Chuck, Bloody Ben? Is that what you've always wanted? Well, congratulations. You've achieved it. And you deserve it because you're a piece of shit. No need to call me back."

en: Then I called Radar. “Hey,” I said.
vi: Rồi tôi gọi điện cho Radar. “Chào,” tôi nói.
tr: Sonra Radar’ı aradım. “Hey,” dedim.
es: Luego llamé a Radar. —Hola —le dije.
vi_translation: Then I called Radar. "Hello," I said.
tr_translation: Then I called Radar. "Hey," I said.
es_translation: Then I called Radar. —Hello —I said to him.

en: “Hey,” he answered. “I just threw up in the shower. Can I call you back?”
vi: “Chào,” nó đáp. “Tôi vừa ói trong khi đang tắm. Tôi gọi lại sau được không?”
tr: “Hey,” diye açtı. “Az önce duşta kustum. Seni sonra arayabilir miyim?
es: —Hola —me contestó—. Acabo de potar en la ducha. ¿Puedo llamarte luego?
vi_translation: "Hi," it replied. "I just threw up while I was showering. Can I call you back later?"
tr_translation: "Hey," he said. "I just threw up in the shower. Can I call you later?"
es_translation: —Hello —he/she answered me—. I just puked in the shower. Can I call you later?

en: “Sure,” I said, trying not to sound angry. I just wanted someone to help me sort through the world according to Margo. But Radar wasn’t Ben; he called back just a couple minutes later.
vi: “Được thôi,” tôi đáp, cố không tỏ ra cáu kỉnh khó chịu. Tôi chỉ muốn ai đó giúp tôi sắp xếp lại thế giới này theo qui chiếu Margo mà thôi. Nhưng Radar không phải là Ben, mấy phút sau nó gọi lại ngay.
tr: “Tabii,” dedim, sesimdeki öfkeyi gizlemeye çalışarak. Sadece Margo’nun dünyasını çözümlemem için birinin bana yardım etmesini istiyordum. Ama Radar, Ben değildi; yalnızca birkaç dakika sonra geri aradı.
es: —Claro —le dije intentando no parecer enfadado. Solo quería que alguien me ayudara a analizar el mundo de Margo. Pero Radar no era Ben. Me llamó a los dos minutos.
vi_translation: "Alright," I replied, trying not to sound irritated. I just wanted someone to help me rearrange this world according to Margo's perspective. But Radar wasn't like Ben; a few minutes later, he called back immediately.
tr_translation: "Of course," I said, trying to hide the anger in my voice. I just wanted someone to help me unravel Margo's world. But Radar wasn't Ben; he called back only a few minutes later.
es_translation: —Sure —I said, trying not to seem angry. I just wanted someone to help me analyze Margo's world. But Radar wasn't Ben. He called me two minutes later.

en: “It was so disgusting that I puked while cleaning it up, and then while cleaning that up, I puked again. It’s like a perpetual motion machine. If you just kept feeding me, I could have just kept puking forever.”
vi: “Kinh đến mức tôi đã ói trong khi lau dọn, và khi lau dọn đám đó, tôi lại ói. Cứ như động cơ vĩnh cửu vậy. Chỉ cần cho tôi ăn là tôi có thể ói nữa ói mãi.
tr: “O kadar iğrençti ki temizlerken kustum ve sonra onu temizlerken tekrar kustum. Bir devinim makinesi gibi. Eğer sadece beni beslemeye devam etseydin, sonsuza kadar öylece kusmaya devam edebilirdim.
es: —Era tan asqueroso que he potado mientras lo limpiaba, y luego, mientras lo limpiaba por segunda vez, he vuelto a potar. Es como una máquina que no para. Si sigo comiendo, puedo pasarme el resto de la vida potando.
vi_translation: "It was so disgusting that I vomited while cleaning, and when cleaning that mess, I vomited again. It was like a perpetual motion machine. Just feed me and I can keep vomiting endlessly."
tr_translation: “It was so disgusting that I vomited while cleaning it, and then I vomited again while cleaning that up. Like a perpetual motion machine. If you had just kept feeding me, I could have continued vomiting like that forever.”
es_translation: —It was so disgusting that I threw up while cleaning it, and then, while cleaning it a second time, I threw up again. It's like a machine that doesn't stop. If I keep eating, I could spend the rest of my life throwing up.

en: “Can you come over? Or can I come over to your house?”
vi: “Ông qua đây được không? Hay để tôi sang nhà ông?”
tr: “Buraya gelebilir misin? Ya da ben senin evine gelebilir miyim?
es: —¿Puedes venir? ¿O puedo pasarme yo por tu casa?
vi_translation: "Can you come over here? Or should I come to your house?"
tr_translation: “Can you come here? Or can I come to your house?’
es_translation: —Can you come over? Or should I come by your house?

en: “Yeah, of course. What’s up?”
vi: “Hả, được chứ. Có chuyện gì vậy?”
tr: “Kvet, elbette. Ne oldu?
es: —Sí, claro. ¿Qué pasa?
vi_translation: "Huh, sure." "What's going on?"
tr_translation: “Of course, Kvet. What happened?”
es_translation: —Yes, of course. What's going on?

en: “Margo was alive and in the minimall for at least one night after her disappearance.”
vi: “Margo đã ở trong khu mua sắm mini ít nhất một đêm sau khi cậu ấy biến mất.”
tr: “Margo hayattaydı ve ortadan kaybolmasından en azından İm gece sonra alışveriş merkezindeydi.
es: —Margo estuvo viva en el centro comercial abandonado por lo menos una noche después de que desapareciera.
vi_translation: “Margo was in the mini-mall for at least one night after she disappeared.”
tr_translation: "Margo was alive and was at the mall at least the night after she disappeared."
es_translation: —Margo was alive in the abandoned mall for at least one night after she disappeared.

en: “I’ll come to you. Four minutes.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ qua chỗ ông. Bốn phút nữa.”
tr: “Sana geliyorum. Dört dakika.
es: —Voy para allá. Cuatro minutos.
vi_translation: “I will come to your place. In four minutes.”
tr_translation: “I'm coming to you. Four minutes.”
es_translation: —I'm on my way. Four minutes.

en: Radar showed up at my window precisely four minutes later.
vi: Radar có mặt ở cửa sổ phòng tôi chính xác bốn phút sau đó.
tr: Kınlar tam tamına dört dakika sonra penceremde göründü.
es: Radar apareció por mi ventana al cabo de cuatro minutos exactos.
vi_translation: Radar was at my window exactly four minutes later.
tr_translation: The Kıns appeared at my window exactly four minutes later.
es_translation: Radar appeared by my window after exactly four minutes.

en: “You should know I’m having a huge fight with Ben,” I said as he climbed in.
vi: “Ông nên biết là tôi đang đại chiến với Ben,” tôi nói khi Radar trèo vào phòng.
tr: “Ben’le İm. yük bir kavga ettiğimi bilmelisin,” dedim, o içeri tırmanırken.
es: —Que sepas que me he cabreado con Ben —le dije mientras trepaba.
vi_translation: "You should know that I'm in a major battle with Ben," I said as Radar climbed into the room.
tr_translation: “You should know that I had a big fight with Im.,” I said, as he climbed inside.
es_translation: —Just so you know, I'm pissed off at Ben —I told him while climbing.

en: “I’m too hungover to mediate,” Radar answered quietly. He lay down on the bed, his eyes half closed, and rubbed his buzzed hair. “It’s like I got hit by lightning.” He sniffed. “Okay, bring me up-to-date.” I sat down in the desk chair and told Radar about my evening in Margo’s vacation house, trying hard not to leave out any possibly helpful details. I knew Radar was better at puzzles than I, and I was hoping he’d piece together this one.
vi: “Tôi oải đến mức chẳng buồn hòa giải hai ông nữa,” Radar khẽ đáp. Nó nằm vật xuống giường, mắt nhắm hờ, bới bới mái đầu bù xù. “Cảm giác như tôi vừa bị trúng sét vậy,” nó khụt khịt nói. “Được rồi, ông cập nhật tình hình đi.” Tôi ngồi xuống ghế bên bàn học và kể cho Radar nghe cả đêm tôi đã ở trong chỗ trú chân của Margo ra sao, hết sức cố gắng không bỏ sót bất cứ chi tiết nào có thể hữu ích. Tôi biết Radar có tài giải mã câu đố hơn tôi, và tôi mong là lần này nó có thể khớp được các mảnh ghép vào nhau.
tr: “Ara buluculuk yapmak için fazla akşamdan kalmayım,” ıliye cevapladı Radar sessizce. Yatağa uzandı, gözleri yarı kapalı, kazınmış saçlarım ovuşturdu. “Sanki yıldırım çarpmış gibiyim.” Burnunu çekti. “Tamam, yeni haberleri ver.” Sandalyeye oturdum ve faydalı olma ihtimali bulunan hiçbir detayı atlamamaya gayret ederek, Radar’a Margo’nun tatil evindeki akşamımı anlattım. Kadar’m bulmacalarda benden daha iyi olduğunu biliyordum ve bu bulmacanın parçalarını birleştireceğini umuyordum.
es: —Estoy demasiado resacoso para mediar entre vosotros —me contestó con tono calmado. Se tumbó en la cama, con los ojos medio cerrados, y se frotó el pelo, casi rapado—. Es como si me hubiera caído encima un rayo. —Resopló—. Bueno, ponme al día. Me senté en la silla del escritorio y le conté a Radar lo de mi noche en el edificio por el que había pasado Margo, intentando no dejarme ningún detalle significativo. Sabía que Radar era mejor que yo con los rompecabezas, así que esperaba que ensamblara las piezas de este.
vi_translation: “I'm so exhausted that I don't even want to mediate between you two anymore,” Radar quietly replied. He collapsed onto the bed, eyes half-closed, scratching his messy hair. “I feel like I've just been struck by lightning,” he sniffled. “Alright, give me an update.” I sat down on the chair by the study desk and told Radar about how I had spent the entire night in Margo's hideout, trying my best not to leave out any potentially useful details. I knew Radar was better at solving puzzles than I was, and I hoped that this time he could piece everything together.
tr_translation: “I'm too hungover to play mediator,” Radar replied quietly. He lay down on the bed, eyes half-closed, rubbing his shaved head. “I feel like I've been struck by lightning.” He sniffled. “Alright, give me the latest news.” I sat down on the chair and, trying not to omit any potentially useful detail, recounted my evening at Margo's vacation house to Radar. I knew Kadar was better at puzzles than I was, and I hoped he would piece together this puzzle.
es_translation: —I'm too hungover to mediate between you —he answered me in a calm tone. He lay down on the bed, with his eyes half-closed, and rubbed his nearly shaved hair—. It's like a lightning bolt hit me. —He sighed—. Well, catch me up. I sat in the desk chair and told Radar about my night in the building Margo had passed through, trying not to leave out any significant details. I knew that Radar was better than me with puzzles, so I hoped he would assemble the pieces of this one.
