Margo Roth Spiegelman también era una persona. Nunca había pensado en ella así, la verdad. En todas mis elucubraciones previas había un fallo. Siempre —no solo desde que se había marchado, sino desde hacía diez años— la había imaginado sin escucharla, sin saber que su ventana estaba tan cerrada como la mía. Y por eso no me la imaginaba como una persona que pudiera tener miedo, que pudiera sentirse aislada en una sala llena de gente, que pudiera avergonzarse de su colección de discos porque era demasiado personal para compartirla. Alguien que quizá leía libros de viajes para escapar porque tenía que vivir en una ciudad de la que escapa tanta gente. Alguien que —como nadie pensaba que era una persona— no tenía a nadie con quien hablar.
vi_translation: I sit in the back. I am listening. And I hear something about her, the windows and mirrors. Chuck Parson is a person. Just like me. Margo Roth Spiegelman is also a person. And I had never thought of her that way, not really; that was the failure of all my previous imaginings. For a long time—not just after she left, but for the decade before that—I had imagined Margo without listening, not knowing that the windows she put up were just as flawed as mine. Thus, I couldn't imagine her as a person who might also feel fear, feel isolated in a crowd, ashamed to keep a record collection because it was too personal to share. A person who might have read travel books to escape from life in a city where too many people flocked to. A person—because no one thought of her as a person—had no one to really talk to.
tr_translation: I was leaning back. I was listening. And I was hearing something about Margo, windows, and mirrors. Chuck Parson He was a person. Like me. Margo Roth Spiegelman was also a person. And I had never thought of her this way, not exactly; this was the failure of all my previous conceptions. From the very beginning—not just since she left, but for the past ten years—I had imagined Margo without listening, without knowing that she had created a window as narrow as mine. And because of this, I couldn't conceive of her as a person; someone who could be scared, who could feel excluded in a room full of people, who could be shy about her record collection because it was too personal to share. Someone who could read travel guides to escape to a city where many people flee to live. Someone who really had no one to talk to because no one thought of her as a person.
es_translation: I leaned back in the chair and listened. I heard things about my mother, about windows, and about mirrors. Chuck Parson was a person. Like me. Margo Roth Spiegelman was also a person. I had never thought of her that way, to be honest. In all my previous speculations, there was a flaw. Always — not just since she had left, but for the past ten years — I had imagined her without listening to her, without knowing that her window was as closed as mine. And that's why I didn't imagine her as a person who could be afraid, who could feel isolated in a room full of people, who could be embarrassed by her record collection because it was too personal to share. Someone who might read travel books to escape because she had to live in a city from which so many people escape. Someone who — since no one thought she was a person — had no one to talk to.

Multiple_ents: ['margo roth spiegelma', 'margo', 'margo roth spiegelmanin', 'margo roth spiegelman']
en: And all at once I knew how Margo Roth Spiegelman felt when she wasn’t being Margo Roth Spiegelman: she felt empty. She felt the unscaleable wall surrounding her. I thought of her asleep on the carpet with only that jagged sliver of sky above her. Maybe Margo felt comfortable there because Margo the person lived like that all the time: in an abandoned room with blocked-out windows, the only light pouring in through holes in the roof. Yes. The fundamental mistake I had always made—and that she had, in fairness, always led me to make—was this: Margo was not a miracle. She was not an adventure. She was not a fine and precious thing. She was a girl.
vi: Và lập tức tôi nhận ra Margo Roth Spiegelman cảm thấy thế nào khi cô ấy không phải là Margo Roth Spiegelman: cô ấy trống rỗng. Cô ấy cảm thấy có bức tường vô tận bủa vây mình. Tôi nghĩ đến cô ấy nằm ngủ trên thảm với mảnh trời rách ở phía trên. Có lẽ Margo thấy dễ chịu khi ở đó vì Margo-con-người luôn sống như vậy: trong căn phòng bị bỏ hoang với những ô cửa sổ kín mít, ánh sáng duy nhất rơi xuống qua những lỗ thủng trên trần. Đúng vậy. Lỗi nghiêm trọng tôi đã luôn mắc phải–nói công bằng, cô ấy đã luôn khiến tôi mắc phải–chính là: Margo không phải là một điều kì diệu. Cô ấy không phải là một cuộc phiêu lưu. Cô ấy không phải là một món đẹp đẽ quí giá. Margo là một cô gái.
tr: Ve birdenbire Margo Roth Spiegelmanin, Margo Roth Spiegelman değilken nasıl hissettiğini anladım: Boş hissediyordu. Tırmanılamayacak duvarlarm onu kuşattığım hissediyordu. Onu, üstünde yalnızca gökyüzünün o dar parçasıyla, halının üstünde uyurken düşündüm. Belki Margo orada rahat hissetmişti çünkü insan olan Margo her zaman böyle yaşıyordu: Kapatılmış pencerelerle terk edilmiş bir odada, içeri sızan tek ışık çatıdaki deliklerden gelirken. Evet. Her zaman yaptığımve dürüst olmak gerekirse, onun her zaman beni yapmaya yönlendirdiğiesas hata şuydu: Margo bir mucize değildi. Bir macera değildi. İyi ve kıymetli bir şey değildi. O bir genç kızdı.
es: Y de repente entendí cómo se sentía Margo Roth Spiegelman cuando no estaba siendo Margo Roth Spiegelman: vacía. Se sentía rodeada por un muro infranqueable. Pensé en ella durmiendo en la moqueta con solo aquel trocito dentado de cielo por encima de su cabeza. Quizá se sentía cómoda allí porque la Margo persona vivía siempre así, en una habitación abandonada, con las ventanas tapadas, en la que solo entraba luz por los agujeros del techo. Sí. El error fundamental que siempre había cometido —y que, para ser justos, ella siempre me inducía a cometer— era el siguiente: Margo no era un milagro. No era una aventura. No era algo perfecto y precioso. Era una chica.
vi_translation: And immediately I realized how Margo Roth Spiegelman felt when she was not Margo Roth Spiegelman: she was empty. She felt surrounded by an endless wall. I thought of her sleeping on the carpet with the torn sky above. Perhaps Margo felt comfortable there because Margo-the-person always lived like that: in an abandoned room with sealed windows, the only light coming through the holes in the ceiling. Exactly. The serious mistake I had always made–to be fair, she had always made me make–was this: Margo was not a miracle. She was not an adventure. She was not a precious, beautiful thing. Margo was a girl.
tr_translation: And suddenly I understood how Margo Roth Spiegelman felt when she wasn't Margo Roth Spiegelman: She felt empty. She felt surrounded by walls that couldn't be climbed. I thought of her sleeping on the carpet, with only that narrow piece of sky above her. Maybe Margo felt comfortable there because the human Margo always lived like this: In an abandoned room with closed windows, the only light coming from the holes in the roof. Yes. The main mistake I always made, and to be honest, the one she always led me to make, was this: Margo was not a miracle. She was not an adventure. She was not something good and precious. She was a teenage girl.
es_translation: And suddenly I understood how Margo Roth Spiegelman felt when she wasn't being Margo Roth Spiegelman: empty. She felt surrounded by an insurmountable wall. I thought of her sleeping on the carpet with only that jagged piece of sky above her head. Maybe she felt comfortable there because the person Margo always lived like that, in an abandoned room, with the windows covered, where light only came in through the holes in the ceiling. Yes. The fundamental mistake I had always made —and to be fair, she always led me to make— was this: Margo was not a miracle. She was not an adventure. She was not something perfect and precious. She was a girl.

en: The clock was always punishing, but feeling like I was closer to unraveling the knots made time seem to stop entirely on Tuesday. We’d all decided to go to the minimall right after school, and the waiting was unbearable. When the bell finally rang for the end of English, I raced downstairs and was almost out the door when I realized we couldn’t leave until Ben and Radar finished band practice. I sat down outside the band room and took a personal pizza wrapped in napkins from my backpack, where I’d had it since lunch. I was through the first quarter when Lacey Pemberton sat down next to me. I offered her a piece. She declined.
vi: Cái đồng hồ như tra tấn tôi, nhưng linh cảm rằng mình sắp gỡ được nút thắt khiến thời gian dường như hoàn toàn đứng lại ở ngày thứ Ba. Chúng tôi đều quyết định sẽ đến khu mua sắm mini ngay sau khi tan học, sự chờ đợi thật không thể chịu đựng được. Rút cục chuông báo hết giờ Quốc ngữ, tôi chạy vội xuống cầu thang và suýt ra khỏi cổng thì nhớ ra Ben và Radar còn tập nhạc nên chưa đi ngay được. Tôi ngồi bên ngoài phòng tập nhạc, lấy cái bánh pizza cỡ nhỏ gói trong khăn giấy từ ba-lô ra, tôi đã để đấy từ lúc ăn trưa. Tôi ăn được chừng một phần tư thì Lacey Pemberton tới ngồi cạnh. Tôi mời pizza nhưng Lacey từ chối.
tr: Saat her zaman cezalandırıcıydı ama düğümleri çözmeye yaklaştığımı hissetmem, sah günü, zamanın tamamen durmuş gibi görünmesine neden oldu. Hepimiz okuldan hemen sonra alışveriş merkezine gitmeye karar vermiştik ve beklemek katlanılmazdı. Edebiyat dersinin bittiğini haber veren zil nihayet çaldığında koşarak aşağı indim ve Ben ile Radar bando provasını bitirinceye kadar gidemeyeceğimizi fark ettiğimde, neredeyse kapıdan çıkmıştım. Bando odasının dışında oturdum ve sırt çantamdan, öğle yemeğinden beri sakladığım, peçetelere sarılmış tek kişilik bir pizza aldım. Lacey Pemberton yanıma oturduğunda ilk çeyreğini bitirmiştim. Ona da bir dilim ikram ettim. Geri çevirdi.
es: El reloj era siempre implacable, pero sentir que estaba cerca de desatar los nudos hizo que el martes pareciera haberse detenido. Habíamos decidido ir al centro comercial abandonado justo después de clase, así que la espera se me hizo insoportable. Cuando el timbre sonó por fin, después de la clase de literatura, corrí escaleras abajo, y estaba casi en la puerta cuando me di cuenta de que no podíamos marcharnos hasta que Ben y Radar hubieran salido del ensayo. Me senté a esperarlos y saqué de mi mochila una ración de pizza envuelta en servilletas de papel que me había sobrado de la comida. Todavía no me había comido una cuarta parte cuando Lacey Pemberton se sentó a mi lado. Le ofrecí un trozo, pero me dijo que no.
vi_translation: The clock seemed to torture me, but the intuition that I was about to untangle the knot made time seem to completely stand still on Tuesday. We all decided to go to the mini shopping mall right after school, the wait was unbearable. Finally, the bell signaling the end of Vietnamese class rang, I rushed down the stairs and was about to leave the gate when I remembered that Ben and Radar were still practicing music, so they couldn't leave immediately. I sat outside the music room, took a small pizza wrapped in a napkin from my backpack, which I had kept since lunch. I had eaten about a quarter when Lacey Pemberton came and sat next to me. I offered her some pizza, but Lacey declined.
tr_translation: The clock was always punitive, but feeling that I was close to untying the knots made the day of the event seem like time had completely stopped. We had all decided to go to the mall right after school, and the wait was unbearable. When the bell finally rang, signaling the end of the literature class, I ran downstairs and was almost out the door when I realized we couldn't leave until Ben and Radar finished band practice. I sat outside the band room and took out a single-serving pizza wrapped in napkins that I had saved since lunch from my backpack. I had finished the first quarter when Lacey Pemberton sat down next to me. I offered her a slice too. She declined.
es_translation: The clock was always relentless, but feeling that I was close to untying the knots made Tuesday seem to have stopped. We had decided to go to the abandoned mall right after class, so the wait became unbearable for me. When the bell finally rang, after literature class, I ran downstairs, and I was almost at the door when I realized that we couldn't leave until Ben and Radar had finished rehearsal. I sat down to wait for them and took out from my backpack a slice of pizza wrapped in paper napkins that I had left over from lunch. I hadn't eaten even a quarter of it when Lacey Pemberton sat down next to me. I offered her a piece, but she said no.

en: We talked about Margo, of course. The hole we had in common. “What I need to figure out,” I said, rubbing pizza grease onto my jeans, “is a place. But I don’t even know if I’m close with the pseudovisions. Sometimes I think we’re just entirely off track.”
vi: Chúng tôi nói chuyện về Margo, tất nhiên rồi, lỗ hổng chung giữa chúng tôi. “Tớ cần xác định được,” tôi nói, chùi tay dính mỡ vào quần jeans, “một địa điểm. Nhưng tớ cũng không chắc suy luận về những đô thị ma có đúng hướng không. Có lúc tớ nghĩ chúng ta hoàn toàn trật lất rồi.”
tr: Margo hakkında konuştuk elbette. Ortak sorunumuz. “Kestirmem gereken şey,” dedim, pizzanın yağını kot pantolonuma silerek, “bir yer. Ama semtimsilerle çözmeye yaklaşıp yaklaşmadığımı bile bilmiyorum. Bazen tamamen alakasız bir yöne gittiğimizi düşünüyorum.
es: Hablamos de Margo, claro. El problema que compartíamos. —Lo que tengo que descubrir es el sitio —le dije limpiándome el aceite de la pizza en los pantalones—. Pero ni siquiera sé si voy por buen camino con las pseudovisiones. A veces pienso que vamos totalmente desencaminados.
vi_translation: We talked about Margo, of course, the common gap between us. "I need to pinpoint," I said, wiping greasy hands on my jeans, "a location. But I'm not even sure if reasoning about ghost towns is the right direction. Sometimes I think we're completely off track."
tr_translation: Of course, we talked about Margo. Our common problem. "The thing I need to figure out," I said, wiping the pizza grease on my jeans, "is a place. But I don't even know if I'm getting closer to solving it with the clues. Sometimes I think we're heading in a completely unrelated direction."
es_translation: We are talking about Margo, of course. The problem we shared. —What I need to find out is the place —I said, wiping the pizza oil on my pants—. But I don't even know if I'm on the right track with the pseudovisions. Sometimes I think we are completely off track.

en: “Yeah, I don’t know. Honestly, everything else aside, I like finding stuff out about her. I mean, that I didn’t know before. I had no idea who she really was. I honestly never thought of her as anything but my crazy beautiful friend who does all the crazy beautiful things.”
vi: “Ừ, tớ cũng không biết nữa. Nói thật nhé, gạt tất cả sang bên, tớ thích tìm lại những gì có liên quan đến Margo. Những gì trước đây tớ chưa từng biết. Tớ đã không biết cậu ấy thực sự là ai. Thật lòng tớ chưa bao giờ nghĩ gì khác ngoài coi Margo là cô bạn tuyệt đẹp điên rồ, làm đủ mọi trò điên rồ tuyệt đẹp.
tr: “Evet. Bilmiyorum. Doğrusu, her şey bir yana, onun hakkında bir şeyler keşfetmeyi seviyorum. Yani önceden bilmediğim şeyleri. Onun gerçekte kim olduğu hakkında hiçbir fikrim yok. Doğrusu onu çılgınca güzel şeyler yapan, çılgın ve güzel bir arkadaştan başka birisi olarak hiç düşünmedim.
es: —Sí, no sé. Sinceramente, dejando de lado todo lo demás, me gusta descubrir cosas de ella. Quiero decir, cosas que no sabía. No tenía ni idea de quién era en realidad. La verdad es que siempre había pensado en ella como una amiga guapa y loca que hace todo tipo de locuras bonitas.
vi_translation: “Yeah, I don't know either. To be honest, putting everything aside, I like finding things related to Margo. Things I never knew before. I didn't know who she really was. Honestly, I never thought of anything other than seeing Margo as a crazy beautiful friend, doing all sorts of crazy beautiful things.”
tr_translation: “Yes. I don't know. Honestly, above all, I love discovering things about him. Things I didn't know before, that is. I have no idea who he really is. Honestly, I never thought of him as anyone other than a crazy and beautiful friend who does insanely beautiful things.”
es_translation: —Yes, I don't know. Honestly, putting everything else aside, I like discovering things about her. I mean, things I didn't know. I had no idea who she really was. The truth is that I always thought of her as a pretty and crazy friend who does all kinds of beautiful craziness.

en: “Right, but she didn’t come up with these things on the fly,” I said. “I mean, all of her adventures had a certain . . . I don’t know.”
vi: “Ừ, nhưng Margo không bột phát thực hiện tất cả,” tôi nói. “Tất cả những cuộc phiêu lưu của cậu ấy đều có gì đó... tớ không biết nữa.”
tr: “Doğru ama bunları bir anda aklına estiği için yapmadı,” dedim. “Yani bütün maceralarının belli bir... Bilmiyorum.
es: —Cierto, pero no se ponía a hacer esas cosas por las buenas —le dije—. Quiero decir que todas sus aventuras tenían cierta… No sé.
vi_translation: “Yeah, but Margo didn't impulsively do everything,” I said. “All of her adventures had something... I don't know.”
tr_translation: “True, but he didn't do these things on a whim,” I said. “I mean, all his adventures had a certain... I don't know.”
es_translation: —True, but he wouldn't do those things willingly —I told him—. I mean that all his adventures had a certain… I don't know.

en: “Elegance,” Lacey said. “She is the only person I know who’s not, like, grown up who has total elegance.”
vi: “Duyên dáng và lộng lẫy,” Lacey nói. “Margo là người duy nhất mà tớ biết chưa phải, ờ, người lớn, mà đã có sự duyên dáng lộng lẫy đó rồi.”
tr: “Zarafet,” dedi Lacey. “O tanıdığım, yetişkin olmayan ve tam bir zarafete sahip olan tek kişi.
es: —Elegancia —añadió Lacey—. Es la única persona joven totalmente elegante que conozco.
vi_translation: “Charming and glamorous,” Lacey said. “Margo is the only person I know who isn't, uh, an adult yet, but already has that charming glamour.”
tr_translation: “Grace,” said Lacey. “She is the only person I know who is not an adult and possesses complete grace.”
es_translation: —Elegance —added Lacey—. She is the only completely elegant young person I know.

en: “Yeah.”
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: "Yes."
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “So it’s hard to imagine her in some gross unlit dusty room.”
vi: “Nên khó có thể hình dung nổi cậu ấy ở trong một căn phòng bụi bặm tối tăm ẩm thấp.”
tr: “Bu yüzden onu ışıksız, iğrenç, tozlu bir odada düşünmek zor.
es: —Por eso me cuesta imaginarla en una sala asquerosa, oscura y llena de polvo.
vi_translation: “So it's hard to imagine him in a dusty, dark, and damp room.”
tr_translation: “That's why it's hard to imagine him in a lightless, disgusting, dusty room.”
es_translation: —That's why it's hard for me to imagine her in a filthy, dark, and dusty room.

en: “Yeah,” I said. “With rats.”
vi: “Ừ,” tôi nói. “Có cả chuột nữa.”
tr: “Evet,” dedim. “Farelerle.
es: —Sí —le dije—. Y con ratas.
vi_translation: "Yes," I said. "There are also rats."
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said. “With the mice.”
es_translation: —Yes —I told him—. And with rats.

en: Lacey pulled her knees to her chest and assumed the fetal position. “Ick. That’s so not Margo.”
vi: Lacey co đầu gối trước ngực, dáng ngồi như em bé trong bụng mẹ. “Eo. Như thế không giống Margo lắm.”
tr: Lacey dizlerini göğsüne doğru çekip cenin şeklini aldı. “Iyy. Bu hiç de Margo’ya göre değil.
es: Lacey acercó las rodillas al pecho y adoptó la posición fetal. —Qué asco. Tampoco eso es propio de Margo.
vi_translation: Lacey hugged her knees to her chest, sitting like a baby in the womb. "Ugh. That doesn't seem much like Margo."
tr_translation: Lacey pulled her knees to her chest and curled into a fetal position. "Eww. This is not like Margo at all."
es_translation: Lacey brought her knees to her chest and adopted the fetal position. —How disgusting. That's not like Margo either.

en: Somehow Lacey got shotgun, although she was the shortest of us. Ben was driving. I sighed quite loudly as Radar, seated next to me, pulled out his handheld and started working on Omnictionary.
vi: Lacey ngồi ở ghế trước cạnh lái xe, dù gì cậu ấy cũng là đứa thấp nhất bọn. Ben lái xe. Tôi thở dài thườn thượt trong khi Radar ngồi cạnh tôi đã rút máy tính cầm tay ra và bắt đầu công việc trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ.
tr: Her nasılsa en kısamız olmasına rağmen, Lacey ön koltuğa oturdu. Arabayı Ben sürüyordu. Yanımda oturan Radar, el bilgisayarım çıkarıp Omnictionary üzerine çalışmaya başladığında, oldukça yüksek sesle iç geçirdim.
es: No sé cómo Lacey se adjudicó el asiento del copiloto, aunque era la más bajita de todos. Ben conducía. Suspiré ruidosamente cuando Radar, que estaba sentado a mi lado, sacó su ordenador de bolsillo y empezó a trabajar en el Omnictionary.
vi_translation: Lacey sat in the front seat next to the driver, as she was the shortest of the group. Ben was driving. I sighed deeply while Radar, sitting next to me, had taken out his handheld computer and started working on the Omnictionary.
tr_translation: Even though she was somehow the shortest of us, Lacey sat in the front seat. Ben was driving the car. When Radar, who was sitting next to me, took out his handheld computer and started working on Omnictionary, I sighed quite loudly.
es_translation: I don't know how Lacey claimed the front passenger seat, even though she was the shortest of all. Ben was driving. I sighed loudly when Radar, who was sitting next to me, took out his pocket computer and started working on the Omnictionary.

en: “Just deleting vandalism on the Chuck Norris page,” he said. “For instance, while I do think Chuck Norris specializes in the roundhouse kick, I don’t think it’s accurate to say, ‘Chuck Norris’s tears can cure cancer, but unfortunately he has never cried.’ Anyway, vandalism-deletion only takes like four percent of my brain.”
vi: “Vừa xóa những thứ tào lao trong bài về Chuck Norris,” nó nói. “Chẳng hạn, tôi cực kì đồng ý rằng tuyệt chiêu của Chuck Norris là cú đá vòng cầu, cơ mà tôi nghĩ viết thế này thì nhảm quá, ‘Nước mắt của Chuck Norris chữa được ung thư, nhưng rủi thay, ông chẳng bao giờ khóc.’ Thao tác xóa-những-thứ-tào-lao dù sao cũng chỉ chiếm khoảng bốn phần trăm trí óc của tôi thôi.”
tr: “Sadece Chuck Norris sayfasındaki Vandalizmi siliyorum,” dedi. “Mesela, Chuck Norris’in uçan tekme konusunda uzman olduğunu düşünmeme rağmen, şunun söylenmesinin doğru olduğunu sanmıyorum: ‘Chuck Norris’in gözyaşları kanseri tedavi edebiliyor ama ne yazık ki hiç ağlamadı.’ Her. neyse, Vandalizmsilme beynimin yüzde dördünü falan meşgul ediyor.
es: —Estoy borrando las gamberradas de la página de Chuck Norris —me dijo—. Por ejemplo, aunque estoy de acuerdo en que es especialista en patadas circulares, no creo que sea correcto decir: «Las lágrimas de Chuck Norris curan el cáncer, pero desgraciadamente nunca ha llorado». Pero, bueno, borrar las gamberradas solo me exige un cuatro por ciento del cerebro.
vi_translation: “Just deleted the nonsense in the article about Chuck Norris,” it said. “For example, I totally agree that Chuck Norris's signature move is the roundhouse kick, but I think it's too ridiculous to write something like this, ‘Chuck Norris's tears can cure cancer, but unfortunately, he never cries.’” The task of deleting-the-nonsense only occupies about four percent of my brain anyway.”
tr_translation: “I am just deleting the vandalism on the Chuck Norris page,” he said. “For example, although I think Chuck Norris is an expert in flying kicks, I don't think it's right to say this: ‘Chuck Norris's tears can cure cancer, but unfortunately, he has never cried.’ Anyway, deleting vandalism occupies about four percent of my brain.”
es_translation: —I am deleting the pranks from Chuck Norris's page —he told me—. For example, although I agree that he is a specialist in roundhouse kicks, I don't think it's correct to say: "Chuck Norris's tears cure cancer, but unfortunately he has never cried." But, well, deleting the pranks only requires four percent of my brain.

en: I understood Radar was trying to make me laugh, but I only wanted to talk about one thing. “I’m not convinced she’s in a pseudovision. Maybe that’s not even what she meant by ‘paper towns,’ you know? There are so many place hints, but nothing specific.”
vi: Dù hiểu rằng Radar đang cố chọc cười, nhưng tôi vẫn chỉ muốn nói đến một việc thôi. “Tôi không tin là Margo đang ở khu đô thị ma nào đó. Thậm chí đấy chưa chắc đã là ‘những thành phố giấy’ mà Margo nói đến. Có quá nhiều manh mối về các địa điểm, nhưng chẳng có gì cụ thể cả.
tr: Radar’m beni güldürmeye çalıştığını anlamıştım ama sadece tek bir şey hakkında konuşmak istiyordum. ‘Margo’nun bir semtimside olduğuna ikna olmadım. Belki de ‘kâğıttan kentler’ sözüyle kastettiği bu değil bile. Bir sürü yer iması var ama belirli bir şey yok.
es: Entendí que Radar intentaba hacerme reír, pero yo solo quería hablar de una cosa. —No estoy convencido de que esté en una pseudovisión. Quizá ni siquiera se refería a eso con lo de «ciudades de papel», ¿sabes? Tenemos muchas pistas de sitios, pero nada concreto.
vi_translation: Even though I understood that Radar was trying to make a joke, I still only wanted to talk about one thing. "I don't believe that Margo is in some ghost town. That might not even be the 'paper towns' that Margo was talking about. There are too many clues about the locations, but nothing concrete."
tr_translation: I understood that Radar was trying to make me laugh, but I only wanted to talk about one thing. ‘I am not convinced that Margo is in any part of town. Maybe this is not even what she meant by ‘paper towns’. There are a lot of hints, but nothing specific.”
es_translation: I understood that Radar was trying to make me laugh, but I only wanted to talk about one thing. —I'm not convinced that she's in a pseudovision. Maybe she wasn't even referring to that with the "paper towns," you know? We have many clues about places, but nothing concrete.

en: Radar looked up for a second and then back down at the screen. “Personally, I think she’s far away, doing some ridiculous roadside attraction tour that she wrongly thinks she left enough clues to explain. So I think she’s currently in, like, Omaha, Nebraska, visiting the world’s largest ball of stamps, or in Minnesota checking out the world’s largest ball of twine.”
vi: Radar nhìn lên một giây rồi lại đưa mắt xuống màn hình, “Cá nhân tôi nghĩ Margo đang ở xa rồi, theo một tua du lịch kì thú nào đó và nhầm tưởng là đã để lại đủ manh mối. Nên tôi cho rằng cậu ấy đang ở, xem nào, Omaha, bang Nebraska, đi thăm quả cầu tem lớn nhất thế giới, hoặc đến bang Minnesota thưởng lãm cuộn dây thừng lớn nhất thế giới.”
tr: Radar bir saniyeliğine başını kaldırdı, sonra tekrar ekrana döndü. “Şahsen, anlaşılması için yeterince ipucu bıraktığım sandığı, saçma bir gezi yaparak çok uzaklara gittiğini düşünüyorum. Bu yüzden şu anda Omaha, Nebraska’da dünyanın en büyük pul topunu ziyaret ettiğini ya da Minnesota’da dünyanın en büyük iplik topuna göz attığını falan düşünüyorum.
es: Radar levantó la mirada un segundo y volvió a bajarla hacia la pantalla. —Personalmente, creo que está lejos, haciendo una ridícula gira por lugares turísticos y creyendo equivocadamente que ha sabido dejar suficientes pistas para encontrarla. Así que creo que ahora mismo está en Omaha, Nebraska, viendo la bola de sellos más grande del mundo, o en Minnesota, echando un vistazo a la bola de cuerda más grande del mundo.
vi_translation: Radar looked up for a second and then turned his eyes back to the screen, "Personally, I think Margo is far away by now, on some kind of thrilling tour and mistakenly believes she has left enough clues. So I think she is, let's see, in Omaha, Nebraska, visiting the world's largest ball of stamps, or in Minnesota admiring the world's largest ball of twine."
tr_translation: Radar lifted his head for a second, then turned back to the screen. “Personally, I think the chest, which I left enough clues to be understood, has gone very far away on a ridiculous trip. So right now, I think he's visiting the world's largest ball of stamps in Omaha, Nebraska, or checking out the world's largest ball of yarn in Minnesota or something.”
es_translation: Radar lifted his gaze for a second and then lowered it back to the screen. —Personally, I think she's far away, on a ridiculous tour of tourist spots and mistakenly believing that she has left enough clues to be found. So I think right now she's in Omaha, Nebraska, looking at the world's largest ball of stamps, or in Minnesota, checking out the world's largest ball of twine.

en: With a glance into the rearview mirror, Ben said, “So you think that Margo is on a national tour in search of various World’s Largest Balls?” Radar nodded.
vi: Lé mắt nhìn qua gương chiếu hậu, Ben lên tiếng, “Tức là ông cho rằng Margo đang đi một tua xuyên quốc gia chiêm ngưỡng đủ thể loại Tròn Tròn Lớn Nhất Thế Giới phỏng?” Radar gật gù.
tr: Ben dikiz aynasından bir bakış atarak, “Yani Margo’nun, I Kinyanın En Büyük Topları’nın peşinde ulusal bir tur yaptığını mı düşünüyorsun?” dedi. Radar başıyla onayladı.
es: —Entonces ¿crees que Margo está haciendo una gira turística por el país en busca de las bolas más grandes del mundo? —preguntó Ben mirando por el retrovisor. Radar asintió.
vi_translation: Glancing through the rearview mirror, Ben spoke up, "So you think Margo is on a cross-country tour admiring all kinds of the World's Largest Round Things, huh?" Radar nodded in agreement.
tr_translation: Ben glanced in the rearview mirror and said, "So you think Margo is on a national tour chasing The Biggest Balls in Kenya?" Radar nodded in agreement.
es_translation: —So, do you think Margo is on a tour around the country looking for the world's biggest balls? —asked Ben, looking in the rearview mirror. Radar nodded.

en: “Well,” Ben went on, “someone should just tell her to come on home, because she can find the world’s largest balls right here in Orlando, Florida. They’re located in a special display case known as ‘my scrotum.’”
vi: “Ái chà,” Ben tiếp tục, “ai đó cần nói với Margo rằng chỉ cần về nhà thôi, vì cậu ấy sẽ sững sờ trước đôi bi lớn nhất thế giới ở ngay đây, chính thành phố Orlando, bang Florida. Bảo vật ấy tại vị trong gian trưng bày đặc biệt có tên là ‘chỗ ấy của tôi’.
tr: “Peki,” diye devam etti Ben, “birinin artık ona eve dön demesi gerekiyor, çünkü dünyanın en büyük toplarını tam burada, Orlando, Florida’da bulabilir. ‘Benim testislerim’ diye bilinen özel bir vitrine yerleştirilmişler.
es: —Bueno —siguió diciendo Ben—, alguien tendría que decirle que volviera a casa, porque aquí mismo, en Orlando, Florida, puede encontrar las bolas más grandes del mundo. Están en una vitrina especial conocida como «mi escroto».
vi_translation: "Oh wow," Ben continued, "someone needs to tell Margo that she just needs to come home, because she will be stunned by the biggest pair of balls in the world right here, in the city of Orlando, Florida. That treasure is on display in a special exhibit called 'my place.'"
tr_translation: “Well,” Ben continued, “someone needs to tell him to come home now, because he can find the world's largest balls right here in Orlando, Florida. They are placed in a special showcase known as ‘My Testicles’.”
es_translation: —Well —Ben continued—, someone should tell him to come back home, because right here in Orlando, Florida, he can find the biggest balls in the world. They are in a special display case known as "my scrotum."

en: Radar laughed, and Ben continued. “I mean, seriously. My balls are so big that when you order french fries from McDonald’s, you can choose one of four sizes: small, medium, large, and my balls.”
vi: Radar cười lớn, Ben bồi thêm, “Tôi nói nghiêm túc đó. Đôi bi của tôi bự đến mức khi gọi khoai tây chiên ở McDonald’s, các ông cứ việc chọn bốn kích cỡ: nhỏ, vừa, lớn, và cỡ bi của Ben.”
tr: Radar güldü ve Ben devam etti: ‘Yani, cidden. Hayalarım kadar büyük ki, McDonald’s’tan kızarmış patates sipariş ettiğinde, dört boydan birini seçebiliyorsun: küçük, orta, büyük ve hayalarım.”
es: Radar se rió. —Lo digo en serio —siguió diciendo Ben—. Tengo las bolas tan grandes que, cuando pides patatas fritas en el McDonald’s, puedes elegir entre cuatro tamaños: pequeño, mediano, grande y mis bolas.
vi_translation: Radar laughed loudly, Ben added, "I'm serious." “My balls are so big that when you order fries at McDonald's, you can choose from four sizes: small, medium, large, and Ben's balls size.”
tr_translation: Radar laughed and Ben continued: ‘I mean, seriously. They are as big as my balls, when you order fries from McDonald’s, you can choose from four sizes: small, medium, large, and my balls.”
es_translation: Radar laughed. —I'm serious —Ben continued saying—. My balls are so big that, when you order fries at McDonald's, you can choose from four sizes: small, medium, large, and my balls.

en: Lacey cut her eyes at Ben and said, “Not. Appropriate.”
vi: Lacey không nhìn nổi Ben nữa, nói, “Chuyện. Chả. Liên. Quan.”
tr: Lacey göz ucuyla Ben’e baktı.
es: Lacey le lanzó una mirada y le dijo:
vi_translation: Lacey couldn't bear to look at Ben anymore, saying, "None. Of. Your. Business."
tr_translation: Lacey glanced at Ben out of the corner of her eye.
es_translation: Lacey gave him a look and said to him:

en: “Sorry,” Ben mumbled. “I think she’s in Orlando,” he said. “Watching us look. And watching her parents not look.”
vi: “Xin lỗi mà,” Ben thì thào. “Chắc Margo ở Orlando đấy,” nó nói. “Đang quan sát tụi mình đi tìm cậu ấy. Và quan sát bố mẹ cậu ấy không đi tìm.”
tr: “Hiç. Yakışık. Almıyor.” “Üzgünüm,” diye mırıldandı Ben. “Bence Orlando’da,” dedi. “Onu arayışımızı izliyor. Ve ebeveynlerinin aramayışım izliyor.”
es: —Comentario fuera de lugar. —Perdón —murmuró Ben—. Creo que Margo está en Orlando. Observando cómo la buscamos. Y observando que sus padres no la buscan.
vi_translation: “I'm sorry,” Ben whispered. “Margo is probably in Orlando,” he said. “Watching us look for her. And watching her parents not look.”
tr_translation: “Not. Appropriate. At all.” “Sorry,” Ben muttered. “I think she’s in Orlando,” he said. “Watching us search for her. And watching her parents not search for her.”
es_translation: —Out of place comment. —Sorry —murmured Ben—. I think Margo is in Orlando. Watching us look for her. And watching that her parents aren't looking for her.

en: “I’m still for New York,” Lacey said.
vi: “Tớ vẫn ủng hộ giả thuyết New York,” Lacey nói.
tr: “Ben hâlâ New York diyorum,” dedi Lacey.
es: —Yo sigo apostando por Nueva York —dijo Lacey.
vi_translation: "I still support the New York hypothesis," Lacey said.
tr_translation: “I still say New York,” said Lacey.
es_translation: —I still bet on New York —said Lacey.

en: “All still possible,” I said. A Margo for each of us—and each more mirror than window.
vi: “Mọi khả năng đều có thể xảy ra,” tôi nói. Mỗi Margo cho mỗi đứa chúng tôi–và thêm mỗi tấm gương hơn là cửa sổ.
tr: “Hepsi hâlâ mümkün,” dedim. Her birimiz için bir Margo... ve her biri pencereden daha çok aynaya benziyor.
es: —Todo es posible —repuse. Una Margo para cada uno de nosotros… y cada una era más un espejo que una ventana.
vi_translation: “Anything is possible,” I said. Each Margo for each of us–and more mirrors than windows.
tr_translation: “It’s all still possible,” I said. For each of us, a Margo... and each one resembles a mirror more than a window.
es_translation: —Everything is possible —I replied. A Margo for each one of us... and each one was more a mirror than a window.

en: The minimall looked as it had a couple days before. Ben parked, and I took them through the push-open door to the office. Once everyone was inside, I said softly, “Don’t turn on the flashlight yet. Give your eyes a chance to adjust.” I felt fingernails dig at my forearm. I whispered, “It’s okay, Lace.”
vi: Khu mua sắm mini trông vẫn như mấy ngày trước. Ben đỗ xe, tôi đưa cả bọn qua cánh cửa đẩy-vào-trong vào gian văn phòng. Khi tất cả đã ở trong hết, tôi nói khẽ: “Đừng bật đèn pin vội, cứ để mắt điều tiết một lúc đã.” Có mấy móng tay cắm vào cẳng tay tôi. “Không sao đâu Lacey,” tôi thì thầm.
tr: Küçük alışveriş merkezi birkaç gün önceki gibi görünüyordu. Ben aracı park etti ve onları iterekaçılaıı kapıdan geçirip ofise götürdüm. Herkes içeri girer girmez usulca, “1 lenüz fenerleri açmayın. Gözlerinize alışmaları için bir şans verin,” dedim. Koluma batan tırnaklar hissetim. “Sorun değil, Lace,” diye fısıldadım.
es: El centro comercial parecía igual que un par de días antes. Ben aparcó y los llevé hasta el despacho por la puerta que se abría empujando. —No encendáis todavía las linternas —les dije cuando ya estábamos todos dentro—. Esperad a que los ojos se acostumbren a la oscuridad. —Sentí unas uñas recorriéndome el brazo—. Tranquila, Lace.
vi_translation: The mini shopping area still looked the same as a few days ago. Ben parked the car, and I led the group through the push-in door into the office area. Once everyone was inside, I whispered, "Don't turn on the flashlights yet, let your eyes adjust for a moment." There were a few fingernails digging into my forearm. "It's okay, Lacey," I murmured.
tr_translation: The small shopping mall looked the same as it did a few days ago. I parked the car and led them through the door, pushing it open, and took them to the office. As soon as everyone entered, I quietly said, “Don't turn on the lights yet. Give your eyes a chance to adjust,” I said. I felt nails digging into my arm. “It's okay, Lace,” I whispered.
es_translation: The shopping center looked the same as it did a couple of days before. Ben parked and I took them to the office through the door that opened by pushing. —Don't turn on the lanterns yet —I told them when we were all inside—. Wait until your eyes get used to the darkness. —I felt some nails running down my arm—. Calm down, Lace.

en: “Whoops,” she said. “Wrong arm.” She’d been searching, I realized, for Ben.
vi: “Ối,” Lacey thốt lên. “Nhầm tay rồi.” Hóa ra là cô nàng tìm tay của Ben.
tr: “Ay,” dedi. ‘Yanlış kol.” Fark ettim ki Ben’i arıyordu.
es: —Ups —dijo Lacey—. Me he equivocado de brazo. Entendí que buscaba el de Ben.
vi_translation: "Oops," Lacey exclaimed. "Wrong hand." It turned out she was looking for Ben's hand.
tr_translation: “Yes,” he said. “Wrong arm.” I realized he was looking for Ben.
es_translation: —Oops —said Lacey—. I used the wrong arm. I understood that he was looking for Ben's.

en: Slowly, the room came into a hazy gray focus. I could see the desks lined up, still waiting for workers. I turned on my flashlight, and then everyone else turned theirs on as well. Ben and Lacey stayed together, walking toward the Troll Hole to explore the other rooms. Radar walked with me to Margo’s desk. He knelt down to look closely at the paper calendar frozen on June.
vi: Từ từ, căn phòng bắt đầu rõ ra những hình khối mờ mờ xam xám. Tôi thấy mấy dãy bàn, vẫn đang đợi nhân viên đến. Tôi bật đèn pin, mấy đứa kia cũng bật đèn pin của mình lên. Ben và Lacey đi cùng nhau, chui qua Lỗ Quỉ thăm dò những phòng khác. Radar đi cùng tôi đến bên bàn của Margo. Nó quì xuống nhìn sát vào tờ lịch đã ngưng lại ở tháng Sáu.
tr: Yavaşça, oda puslu gri bir görünüm kazandı. Hâlâ çalışanları bekleyen, sıralanmış masaları görebiliyordum. Fenerimi yaktım ve sonra diğerleri de kendilerinkileri yaktılar. Öteki odaları incelemek için Cüce Deliği’ne doğru giden Ben ile Lacey birlikte kaldılar. Radar benimle Margo’nun masasına doğru yürüdü. Haziranda donakalmış kâğıt takvime daha yakından bakmak için diz çöktü.
es: Poco a poco la sala empezó a dibujarse en gris borroso. Veía las mesas alineadas, todavía esperando a los empleados. Encendí la linterna, y los demás encendieron también las suyas. Ben y Lacey se dirigieron juntos hacia el Agujero de Trol para inspeccionar las demás salas. Radar vino conmigo a la mesa de Margo. Se arrodilló para observar de cerca el calendario congelado en el mes de junio.
vi_translation: Slowly, the room began to reveal faint, grayish shapes. I saw rows of tables, still waiting for the staff to arrive. I turned on my flashlight, and the others turned on theirs as well. Ben and Lacey went together, crawling through the Hole to explore other rooms. Radar went with me to Margo's desk. He knelt down to closely examine the calendar that had stopped at June.
tr_translation: Slowly, the room took on a hazy gray appearance. I could still see the lined-up desks, waiting for the workers. I turned on my flashlight and then the others turned on theirs. Ben and Lacey stayed together, heading towards the Dwarf Hole to examine the other rooms. Radar walked with me towards Margo’s desk. He knelt down to take a closer look at the paper calendar frozen in June.
es_translation: Little by little, the room began to take shape in a blurry gray. I saw the tables lined up, still waiting for the employees. I turned on the flashlight, and the others turned on theirs as well. Ben and Lacey headed together towards the Troll Hole to inspect the other rooms. Radar came with me to Margo's desk. He knelt down to closely observe the calendar frozen in the month of June.

en: I was leaning in next to him when I heard fast footsteps coming toward us.
vi: Tôi đang cúi theo nó thì bất ngờ nghe thấy tiếng bước chân đi nhanh về phía chúng tôi.
tr: Bize yaklaşan hızlı adımları duyduğumda Radar’ın yanma eğiliyordum.
es: Estaba inclinándome a su lado cuando oí pasos rápidos acercándose a nosotros.
vi_translation: I was bending down towards it when I suddenly heard the sound of footsteps quickly approaching us.
tr_translation: When I heard the fast approaching footsteps, I was leaning towards Radar.
es_translation: I was leaning by his side when I heard quick steps approaching us.

en: “People,” Ben whispered urgently. He ducked down behind Margo’s desk, pulling Lacey with him.
vi: “Có người,” Ben gấp gáp thì thào. Nó chui ngay xuống gầm bàn của Margo, kéo Lacey theo.
tr: “Binleri var,” diye fısıldadı Ben aceleyle. Lacey’yi çekiştirerek, Margo’nun masasının arkasına çöktü.
es: —Gente —murmuró Ben agachándose detrás de la mesa de Margo y tirando de Lacey.
vi_translation: "Someone's here," Ben whispered urgently. He immediately crawled under Margo's table, pulling Lacey along.
tr_translation: “There are thousands,” Ben whispered hurriedly. Pulling Lacey, he crouched behind Margo's desk.
es_translation: —People —murmured Ben, crouching behind Margo's table and pulling Lacey.

en: “What? Where?”
vi: “Gì cơ? Ở đâu?”
tr: “Ne? Nerede?
es: —¿Qué? ¿Dónde?
vi_translation: “What? Where?”
tr_translation: “What? Where?”
es_translation: —What? Where?

en: “Next room!” he said. “Wearing masks. Official-looking. Gotta go.”
vi: “Phòng bên cạnh!” nó nói. “Đeo mặt nạ. Trông như người của chính quyền. Biến thôi.”
tr: ‘Yan odada!” dedi. “Maske takıyorlar. Resmî görünümlüler. Gitmeliyiz.
es: —¡En la otra sala! —dijo—. Llevan máscaras. Parecen polis. Vámonos.
vi_translation: “Next room!” it said. “Wear a mask. Looks like government people. Let's go.”
tr_translation: "They're in that room!" he said. "They are wearing masks. They look official. We need to go."
es_translation: —In the other room! —he said—. They are wearing masks. They look like cops. Let's go.

en: Radar shone his flashlight in the direction of the Troll Hole but Ben knocked it down forcefully. “We. Have. To. Get. Out. Of. Here.” Lacey was looking up at me, big-eyed and probably a little bit pissed off that I’d falsely promised her safety.
vi: Radar soi đèn pin về phía Lỗ Quỉ nhưng Ben kéo mạnh. “Chúng. Ta. Phải. Ra. Khỏi. Đây.” Lacey nhìn tôi, đôi mắt mở to, chắc hơi cáu vì tôi đã hứa hươu hứa vượn rằng cậu ấy sẽ được an toàn.
tr: Radar fenerini Cüce Deliği’ne doğru tuttu ama Ben kuvvetlice vurup feneri yere indirdi. “Buradan. Çıkmak. Zorundayız.” Lacey bana bakıyordu, büyük gözlerle ve muhtemelen yanılarak, ona güvende olacağımıza söz verdiğim için biraz kızmış bir şekilde.
es: Radar enfocó su linterna hacia el Agujero de Trol, pero Ben la bajó de un manotazo. —¡Tenemos que salir de aquí! Lacey me miraba con los ojos como platos, seguramente un poco cabreada, porque le había prometido que no correría peligro, y no parecía cierto.
vi_translation: Radar shone the flashlight towards the Hole of Evil but Ben pulled him back forcefully. “We. Have. To. Get. Out. Of. Here.” Lacey looked at me, her eyes wide open, probably a bit annoyed because I had promised her that she would be safe.
tr_translation: He aimed the radar flashlight at the Dwarf Hole, but Ben struck it forcefully, knocking the flashlight to the ground. “From here. We must. Get out.” Lacey was looking at me with wide eyes and, probably mistakenly, a bit angry because I had promised her we would be safe.
es_translation: Radar focused his flashlight towards the Troll Hole, but Ben knocked it down with a swipe. —We have to get out of here! Lacey was staring at me with wide eyes, probably a little angry, because I had promised her that she wouldn't be in danger, and it didn't seem true.

en: “Okay,” I whispered. “Okay, everybody out, through the door. Very cool, very quick.” I had just started to walk when I heard a booming voice shout, “WHO GOES THERE!”
vi: “Được rồi,” tôi nói. “Ta ra thôi, qua cửa ra vào nhé. Gọn gàng mau lẹ nhé.” Tôi mới dợm bước thì nghe thấy một giọng nổ như sấm rền: “AI TRONG ĐÓ!”
tr: “Tamam,” diye fısıldadım. “Tamam, herkes dışarı, kapıdan. Çok sakin, çok hızlı bir şekilde.” Gürleyen bir sesin bağırdığını duyduğumda daha yürümeye yeni başlamıştım. “KİM VAR ORADA!
es: —Vale —susurré—. Vale, todo el mundo fuera, por la puerta. Tranquilos pero deprisa. Acababa de dar un paso cuando oí un vozarrón gritando: ¿QUIÉN ANDA AHÍ?
vi_translation: “Alright,” I said. “Let's go out, through the doorway. Quick and tidy.” I had just taken a step when I heard a thunderous voice: “WHO'S IN THERE!”
tr_translation: "Okay," I whispered. "Okay, everyone out, through the door. Very calmly, very quickly." I had just started to walk when I heard a booming voice shout. "WHO'S THERE!"
es_translation: —Okay —I whispered—. Okay, everyone out, through the door. Calmly but quickly. I had just taken a step when I heard a booming voice shouting: WHO GOES THERE?

en: Shit. “Um,” I said, “we’re just visiting.” What an outlandishly lame thing to say. Through the Troll Hole, a white light blinded me. It might have been God Himself.
vi: Bực thật. “Ừm,” tôi đáp, “tụi này đi xem loanh quanh thôi.” Đúng là lời chống chế chết nhát hạng nhất. Từ Lỗ Quỉ, một luồng sáng trắng khiến tôi lóa mắt. Có thể chính là Chúa Trời lắm chứ.
tr: Kahretsin. “Eee,” dedim, “sadece geziyoruz.” Söylemek için aşırı derecede korkunç bir şeydi. Cüce Deliği’nden gelen beyaz ışık beni kör etti. Bu, Tann’nın kendisi bile olabilirdi.
es: Mierda. —Ejem —dije—, solo hemos venido a echar un vistazo. Menuda gilipollez estrafalaria. Una luz blanca procedente del Agujero de Trol me cegó. Podría haber sido Dios en persona.
vi_translation: How annoying. “Um,” I replied, “we're just looking around.” Truly a first-class cowardly excuse. From Lo Qui, a beam of white light blinded me. It could very well be God.
tr_translation: Damn it. “Well,” I said, “we're just wandering around.” It was an extremely terrifying thing to say. The white light coming from the Dwarf Hole blinded me. This could have even been Tann himself.
es_translation: Shit. —Ahem —I said—, we just came to take a look. What an outlandish nonsense. A white light coming from the Troll Hole blinded me. It could have been God himself.

en: “What are your intentions?” The voice had a slight faked Britishness to it.
vi: “Ý đồ gì đây?” Tiếng nói hơi cố giả giọng Anh–Anh.
tr: “Niyetiniz nedir?” Bu seste belli belirsiz sahte bir Ingilizlik vardı.
es: —¿Cuáles son vuestras intenciones? La voz imitaba ligeramente el acento británico.
vi_translation: "What's the intention here?" The voice slightly feigned an English–English accent.
tr_translation: "What is your intention?" There was a faint hint of a fake English accent in this voice.
es_translation: —What are your intentions? The voice slightly imitated a British accent.

en: I watched Ben stand up next to me. It felt good not to be alone. “We’re here investigating a disappearance,” he said with great confidence. “We weren’t going to break anything.” The light snapped off, and I blinked away the blindness until I saw three figures, each wearing jeans, a T-shirt, and a mask with two circular filters. One of them pulled the mask up to his forehead and looked at us. I recognized the goatee and flat, wide mouth.
vi: Tôi thấy Ben đã đứng dậy cạnh tôi. Thật tốt khi không phải đơn độc. “Tụi này đang điều tra một vụ mất tích,” nó nói với vẻ tự tin ngời ngời. “Tụi này không định gây ra thiệt hại gì cả.” Ánh đèn lái đi chỗ khác, tôi chớp chớp mắt trong bóng tối cho đến khi thấy hình dáng ba người, đều mặc quần jeans, áo phông, đeo mặt nạ chống độc. Một người kéo mặt nạ lên trán và nhìn chúng tôi. Tôi nhận ra chòm râu dê và cái miệng rộng, môi mỏng.
tr: Ben’in yanımda ayağa kalkmasını izledim. Yalnız olmamak iyi hissettiriyordu. “Bir ortadan kaybolma olayını araştırmak için buradayız,” dedi büyük bir güvenle. “Hiçbir şeyi kırmayacaktık.” Işık kapandı, ikisi de kot pantolon, tişört giymiş ve iki filtresi olan maskeler takmış üç silüeti görene kadar gözlerimi kırpıştırarak körlüğü giderdim. İçlerinden biri maskesini alnına kaldırıp bize baktı. Bu keçisakallı, düz ve geniş ağzı tamdım.
es: Observé a Ben, que se acercó a mí. Me sentí mejor acompañado. —Estamos investigando una desaparición —dijo Ben muy seguro de sí mismo—. No íbamos a romper nada. La luz se apartó y parpadeé hasta que vi tres figuras, las tres con vaqueros, camiseta y una máscara con dos filtros redondos. Una de ellas se subió la máscara a la frente y nos miró. Reconocí la perilla y la boca grande.
vi_translation: I saw Ben standing up next to me. It's good not to be alone. "We are investigating a missing person case," he said with radiant confidence. "We don't intend to cause any harm." The light moved away, and I blinked in the darkness until I saw the shapes of three people, all wearing jeans, t-shirts, and gas masks. One person pulled the mask up to their forehead and looked at us. I recognized the goatee and the wide mouth with thin lips.
tr_translation: I watched Ben stand up beside me. It felt good not to be alone. “We’re here to investigate a disappearance,” he said with great confidence. “We weren’t going to break anything.” The light went out, and I blinked away the blindness until I saw three silhouettes, both wearing jeans, t-shirts, and masks with two filters. One of them lifted his mask to his forehead and looked at us. I recognized this goatee, straight and wide mouth.
es_translation: I observed Ben, who approached me. I felt better accompanied. —We are investigating a disappearance —said Ben very confidently—. We weren't going to break anything. The light moved away and I blinked until I saw three figures, all three wearing jeans, a t-shirt, and a mask with two round filters. One of them lifted the mask to their forehead and looked at us. I recognized the goatee and the large mouth.

en: “Gus?” asked Lacey. She stood up. The SunTrust security guard.
vi: “Anh Gus ạ?” Lacey hỏi, đứng dậy. Anh bảo vệ tòa nhà SunTrust.
tr: “Gus?” diye sordu Lacey. Ayağa kalktı. SunTrust güvenlik görevlisi.
es: —¿Gus? —dijo Lacey levantándose. Era el vigilante del SunTrust.
vi_translation: "Mr. Gus?" Lacey asked, standing up. He is the security guard at the SunTrust building.
tr_translation: “Gus?” asked Lacey. She stood up. The SunTrust security guard.
es_translation: —Gus? —said Lacey, standing up. He was the SunTrust guard.

en: “Lacey Pemberton. Jesus. What are you doing here? With no mask? This place has a ton of asbestos.”
vi: “Lacey Pemberton. Trời ơi. Các cô cậu làm gì ở đây? Không có mặt nạ à? Ở đây có cả tấn a-mi-ăng đấy.”
tr: “Lacey Pemberton. Tanrım. Ne yapıyorsun burada? Maskesiz hem de? Burada bir ton asbest var. “Sen burada ne yapıyorsun?
es: —Lacey Pemberton. Por Dios, ¿qué estáis haciendo aquí? Y sin máscaras… Aquí hay toneladas de asbesto.
vi_translation: “Lacey Pemberton. Oh my God. What are you guys doing here? No masks? There's a ton of asbestos here.”
tr_translation: "Lacey Pemberton. My God. What are you doing here? And without a mask? There's a ton of asbestos here."
es_translation: —Lacey Pemberton. For God's sake, what are you doing here? And without masks... There are tons of asbestos here.

en: “What are you doing here?”
vi: “Các anh làm gì ở đây ạ?”
tr: “Sen burada ne yapıyorsun?
es: —¿Qué haces tú aquí?
vi_translation: "What are you doing here?"
tr_translation: “What are you doing here?”
es_translation: —What are you doing here?

en: “Exploring,” he said. Somehow Ben was emboldened with enough confidence to walk up to the other guys and offer handshakes. They introduced themselves as Ace and the Carpenter. I would venture to guess that these were pseudonyms.
vi: “Thám hiểm,” anh ta đáp. Không hiểu sao Ben lên phong độ hẳn, tự tin tiến đến trước hai người kia và chủ động giơ tay ra bắt. Họ giới thiệu mình là Át và Thợ Mộc. Tôi đoán mò rằng đó là những cái tên “ma.”
tr: “Araştırıyorum,” dedi. Her nasılsa Ben diğer adamlara yaklaşıp tokalaşmak için onlara elini uzatacak kadar güven dolmuştu. Kendilerini As ve Marangoz olarak tanıttılar. Bahse varım bunlar takma adlarıydı.
es: —Explorando —contestó. Ben se sintió lo bastante seguro como para acercarse a los otros dos chicos y tenderles la mano. Se presentaron como As y el Carpintero. Me atrevería a suponer que eran seudónimos.
vi_translation: “Exploring,” he replied. For some reason, Ben suddenly became more confident, stepping forward in front of the other two and proactively extending his hand for a handshake. They introduced themselves as Ace and Carpenter. I guessed that those were their “ghost” names.
tr_translation: “I am investigating,” he said. Somehow, Ben had become confident enough to approach the other men and extend his hand to shake theirs. They introduced themselves as As and Carpenter. I'll bet these were their pseudonyms.
es_translation: —Exploring —he replied. Ben felt confident enough to approach the other two boys and extend his hand to them. They introduced themselves as As and the Carpenter. I would dare to assume that they were pseudonyms.

en: We pulled around some rolling desk chairs and sat in an approximate circle. “Did you guys break the particleboard?” Gus asked.
vi: Chúng tôi kéo mấy cái ghế xoay lại, ngồi thành vòng gần tròn quay mặt vào nhau. “Mấy đứa nện thủng ván gỗ ngoài kia phải không?” Gus hỏi.
tr: Etraftan birkaç tane döner sandalye çektik ve çember oluşturacak şekilde oturduk. “Sunta levhayı siz mi kırdınız?” diye sordu Gus.
es: Cogimos sillas de oficina con ruedas y nos sentamos formando más o menos un círculo. —¿Fuisteis vosotros los que rompisteis el tablón? —preguntó Gus.
vi_translation: We pulled a few swivel chairs together, sitting in a near circle facing each other. "Were you the ones who punched through the wooden boards out there?" Gus asked.
tr_translation: We pulled a few swivel chairs from around and sat in a circle. “Did you break the chipboard?” Gus asked.
es_translation: We took office chairs with wheels and sat down forming more or less a circle. —Was it you who broke the plank? —asked Gus.

en: “Well, I did,” Ben explained.
vi: “Em nện thôi ạ,” Ben giải thích.
tr: “Şey, ben kırdım,” diye açıkladı Ben.
es: —Bueno, fui yo —le explicó Ben.
vi_translation: "I just hit it," Ben explained.
tr_translation: "Well, I broke it," Ben explained.
es_translation: —Well, it was me —Ben explained to him.

en: “We taped that up because we didn’t want anyone else in. If people can see a way in from the road, you get a lot of people coming in who don’t know shit about exploring. Bums and crack addicts and everything.”
vi: “Bọn anh dán lại vì không muốn người khác vào trong. Nếu từ ngoài đường thấy có lối vào thì nhiều người sẽ kéo đến, toàn những loại không biết gì về thám hiểm cả. Những gã lang thang vô công rồi nghề, nghiện ngập đủ thứ.”
tr: “içeriye başka kimsenin girmesini istemediğimiz için onu biz bantladık. Eğer insanlar yoldan içeri girilecek bir yol görürlerse, araştırma hakkında bir bok bilmeyen birçok kişi içeri girer. Dilenciler, keşler filan.
es: —Lo cerramos con cinta porque no queríamos que nadie más entrara. Si desde la carretera se ve que se puede entrar, vendría un montón de gente que no tiene ni puta idea de explorar. Vagabundos, adictos al crack y todo eso.
vi_translation: “We sealed it up because we didn't want others to get inside. If people from the street see an entrance, many will come, mostly those who know nothing about exploration. Wanderers, idlers, and addicts of all kinds.”
tr_translation: "We taped it ourselves because we didn't want anyone else to come inside. If people see a way to get in from the road, many who don't know a damn thing about the research will come inside. Beggars, junkies, and the like."
es_translation: —We sealed it with tape because we didn't want anyone else to enter. If from the road it looks like you can get in, a bunch of people who have no clue about exploring would come. Vagrants, crack addicts, and all that.

en: I stepped forward toward them and said, “So, you, uh, knew that Margo came here?”
vi: Tôi tiến về phía họ và hỏi, “Vậy, các anh, ơ, có biết là Margo đã đến đây không?”
tr: Onlara doğru bir adım attım. “Yani, siz, şey, Margo’nun buraya geldiğini biüyor musunuz?” dedim.
es: Di un paso hacia ellos.
vi_translation: I walked towards them and asked, "So, do you guys, uh, know if Margo has been here?"
tr_translation: I took a step towards them. "So, do you, um, know that Margo came here?" I said.
es_translation: I took a step towards them. —So you guys… well… did you know that Margo was here?

en: Before Gus answered, Ace spoke through the mask. His voice was slightly modulated but easy to understand. “Man, Margo was here all the damned time. We only come here a few times a year; it’s got asbestos, and anyway, it’s not even that good. But we probably saw her, like, what, like more than half the time we came here in the last couple years. She was hot, huh?”
vi: Gus chưa kịp trả lời thì Át đã nói qua lớp mặt nạ. Giọng anh ta hơi bị méo đi nhưng vẫn dễ hiểu. “Trời, Margo ở đây suốt mà. Bọn anh một năm ghé có vài lần thôi; chỗ này nhiều a-mi-ăng, mới cả cũng không có gì đặc sắc lắm. Nhưng mấy năm nay, dễ quá nửa những lần bọn anh đến đều thấy con bé ở đây. Cũng đã ngon lành lắm, nhỉ?”
tr: Gus cevap veremeden, As maskenin ardından konuştu. Sesi hafifçe değişmişti ama anlaması kolaydı. “Dostum, Margo bütün bu lanet olası zaman boyunca buradaydı. Buraya yalnızca yılda birkaç defa geüriz; burada asbest var, hem o kadar iyi bir yer bile değil. Ama muhtemelen, son birkaç yıldır buraya geldiğimiz zamanların, yani, yansında falan onu gördük. Seksiydi, değil mi?
es: —Entonces vosotros… bueno… ¿sabíais que Margo estuvo aquí? —pregunté. Antes de que Gus contestara, As habló sin quitarse la máscara. Su voz era ligeramente modulada, pero resultaba fácil entenderlo. —Tío, Margo se pasaba la vida aquí. Nosotros solo venimos un par de veces al año. Hay asbesto y, en fin, tampoco es nada del otro mundo. Pero seguramente la hemos visto, no sé, más de la mitad de las veces que hemos venido en los dos últimos años. Estaba buena, ¿eh?
vi_translation: Gus hadn't had time to reply when At spoke through the mask. His voice was slightly distorted but still understandable. “Heavens, Margo has been here all the time. We only come by a few times a year; this place has a lot of asbestos, and there's nothing particularly special about it. But in recent years, more than half the times we've come, we've seen the girl here. She's been doing quite well, hasn't she?”
tr_translation: Before Gus could answer, As spoke from behind the mask. His voice had slightly changed, but it was easy to understand. “Dude, Margo was here all this damn time. We only come here a few times a year; there's asbestos here, and it's not even that good of a place. But probably, in the last few years when we came here, I mean, we saw her around half the time. She was sexy, wasn't she?”
es_translation: —I asked. Before Gus could answer, As spoke without removing the mask. His voice was slightly modulated, but it was easy to understand him. —Uncle, Margo spent her life here. We only come a couple of times a year. There's asbestos and, well, it's nothing special. But surely we've seen her, I don't know, more than half the times we've come in the last two years. She was hot, huh? —Was he?

en: “Was?” asked Lacey pointedly.
vi: “Sao lại là ‘đã’?” Lacey tinh ý.
tr: “di?” diye sordu Lacey manalı bir şekilde.
es: —¿Estaba? —preguntó Lacey con énfasis.
vi_translation: “Why 'already'?” Lacey asked perceptively.
tr_translation: “What?” Lacey asked meaningfully.
es_translation: —asked Lacey with emphasis.

en: “She ran away, right?”
vi: “Con bé bỏ đi rồi còn gì, đúng chứ?”
tr: “Kaçtı, değil mi?
es: —Se ha escapado, ¿no?
vi_translation: “The girl has left, hasn't she?”
tr_translation: “He ran away, didn't he?”
es_translation: —He has escaped, hasn't he?

en: “What do you know about that?” Lacey asked.
vi: “Anh biết gì về chuyện đó?” “Chúa ơi, chẳng biết gì cả.
tr: “Bununla ilgili ne biliyorsun?” diye sordu Lacey.
es: —¿Qué sabéis del tema? —les preguntó Lacey.
vi_translation: "What do you know about that?" “Oh God, I don't know anything.
tr_translation: “What do you know about this?” asked Lacey.
es_translation: —What do you know about the matter? —Lacey asked them.

en: “Nothing, Jesus. I saw Margo with him,” Gus said, nodding toward me, “a couple weeks ago. And then I heard that she ran away. It occurred to me a few days later she might be here, so we visited.”
vi: “Chúa ơi, chẳng biết gì cả. Anh thấy Margo từng đi chung với cậu này,” Gus nói và chỉ vào tôi, “cách đây mấy tuần. Rồi anh nghe tin con bé bỏ nhà đi rồi. Mấy ngày sau anh sực nhớ có khi con bé đến đây, nên bọn anh ghé qua xem sao.”
tr: “Hiçbir şey. Margo’yu onunla gördüm,” dedi Gus, bana doğru başmı sallayarak, “birkaç hafta önce. Ondan sonra kaçtığını duydum. Birkaç gün sonra burada olabileceği aklıma geldi, bu yüzden buraya geldik.
es: —Nada, por favor. Hace un par de semanas vi a Margo con él —dijo Gus señalándome—. Y luego me dijeron que se había escapado. Unos días después se me ocurrió que podría estar aquí, así que vinimos.
vi_translation: “Oh God, I don't know anything. I saw Margo hanging out with this guy,” Gus said, pointing at me, “a few weeks ago. Then I heard she ran away from home. A few days later, I suddenly remembered she might have come here, so we decided to drop by and check it out.”
tr_translation: "Nothing. I saw Margo with him," said Gus, nodding his head towards me, "a few weeks ago. Then I heard she ran away. A few days later, it occurred to me that she might be here, so we came here."
es_translation: —Nothing, please. A couple of weeks ago I saw Margo with him —said Gus pointing at me—. And then they told me she had run away. A few days later it occurred to me that she might be here, so we came.

en: “I never got why she liked this place so much. There’s not much here,” said the Carpenter. “It’s not great exploring.”
vi: “Chẳng hiểu sao con bé thích chỗ này thế. Có quái gì đâu,” Thợ Mộc nói. “Chẳng có vị gì mà thám hiểm.
tr: “Burayı neden bu kadar sevdiğini hiç anlamadım. Burada pek bir şey yok,” dedi Marangoz. “Keşif için iyi değil.
es: —Nunca he entendido por qué le gustaba tanto este lugar. Apenas hay nada —dijo el Carpintero—. Explorar aquí no tiene gracia.
vi_translation: “I don't understand why the girl likes this place so much. There's nothing special about it,” said the Carpenter. “There's nothing exciting to explore.”
tr_translation: “I never understood why you like this place so much. There isn't much here,” said the Carpenter. “It's not good for exploration.”
es_translation: —I have never understood why he liked this place so much. There is hardly anything here —said the Carpenter—. Exploring here is no fun. —What is this "exploring"?

en: “What do you mean exploring?” Lacey asked Gus.
vi: “Anh nói thám hiểm là sao?” Lacey hỏi Gus.
tr: Lacey, Gus’a, “Keşif derken ne demek istiyorsun?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Qué es eso de «explorar»? —preguntó Lacey a Gus.
vi_translation: “What do you mean by exploring?” Lacey asked Gus.
tr_translation: Lacey asked Gus, "What do you mean by discovery?"
es_translation: —asked Lacey to Gus.

en: “Urban exploring. We enter abandoned buildings, explore them, photograph them. We take nothing; we leave nothing. We’re just observers.”
vi: “Thám hiểm thành phố. Bọn anh vào những tòa nhà hoang, khám phá và chụp ảnh. Bọn anh không lấy gì đi cả, cũng không để lại gì, chỉ thích quan sát thôi.
tr: “Kentsel keşif. Terk edilmiş binalara gireriz, araştırırız, fotoğraflarını çekeriz. Hiçbir şey almayız; hiçbir şey bırakmayız. Biz sadece gözlemciyiz.
es: —Exploración urbana. Entramos en edificios abandonados, los exploramos y hacemos fotos. Ni cogemos ni dejamos nada. Somos simples observadores.
vi_translation: “Exploring the city. We go into abandoned buildings, explore and take photos. We don't take anything, nor do we leave anything behind, we just like to observe.”
tr_translation: “Urban exploration. We enter abandoned buildings, explore them, take photographs. We take nothing; we leave nothing. We are just observers.”
es_translation: —Urban exploration. We enter abandoned buildings, explore them, and take photos. We neither take nor leave anything. We are mere observers.

en: “It’s a hobby,” said Ace. “Gus used to let Margo tag along on exploring trips when we were still in school.”
vi: “Một sở thích ấy mà,” Át nói. “Hồi còn đi học, Gus hay kéo Margo lẵng nhẵng theo những chuyến thám hiểm như vậy.”
tr: “Bu bir hobi,” dedi As. “Biz daha okuldayken Gus, Margo’nun keşif gezilerinde peşine takılmasına izin verdi.
es: —Es un hobby —dijo As—. Gus solía dejar que Margo se apuntara a explorar con nosotros cuando todavía íbamos al instituto.
vi_translation: “Just a hobby,” At said. “Back in school, Gus often dragged Margo along on such adventures.”
tr_translation: “This is a hobby,” said As. “When we were still in school, Gus allowed Margo to follow him on his expeditions.”
es_translation: —It's a hobby —said As—. Gus used to let Margo join us in exploring when we were still in high school.

en: “She had a great eye, even though she was only, like, thirteen,” Gus said. “She could figure a way into anywhere. It was just occasional back then, but now we go out like three times a week. There’s places all over. There’s an abandoned mental hospital over in Clearwater. It’s amazing. You can see where they strapped down the crazies and gave them electroshock. And there’s an old jail out west of here. But she wasn’t really into it. She liked to break into the places, but then she just wanted to stay.”
vi: “Con bé có con mắt sắc sảo lắm, mà hồi đó mới có, xem nào, mười ba tuổi,” Gus nói. “Nó tìm được đường vào bất cứ đâu. Hồi đó chỉ thỉnh thoảng thôi, còn bây giờ bọn anh đi thám hiểm ba lần một tuần. Khắp nơi đều có chỗ để xem. Mới có một bệnh viện tâm thần bị bỏ không ở Clearwater. Một nơi hết sảy. Được xem chỗ người ta đã trói gô những gã điên và chích sốc điện như thế nào. Có một nhà tù cũ ở phía tây chỗ này. Nhưng Margo không thực sự ham khám phá. Nó thích vào bên trong, nhưng rồi chỉ muốn ở một chỗ thôi.”
tr: “Harika bir gözü vardı, on üç yaşında falan olmasına rağmen,” dedi Gus. “Her yere girmenin bir yolunu buluyordu. O zamanlar fırsat buldukça gidiyorduk ama şimdi haftada üç kere falan çıkıyoruz. Her tarafta böyle yerler var. Clearwater’m orada terk edilmiş bir akıl hastanesi var. Hayret verici. Delileri kayışla bağlayıp elektroşok verdikleri yeri görebilirsiniz. Ve buranın batısında eski bir hapishane var. Ama Margo fazla ilgili değildi. Bir yerlere izinsiz girmeyi sever ama sonra sadece orada kalmak isterdi.
es: —Tenía muy buen ojo, aunque solo tenía trece años —dijo Gus—. Encontraba la manera de entrar en cualquier sitio. En aquella época lo hacíamos de vez en cuando, pero ahora salimos unas tres veces por semana. Hay sitios por todas partes. En Clearwater hay un psiquiátrico abandonado. Es increíble. Se puede ver dónde ataban a los locos para darles electrochoques. Y cerca de aquí, hacia el oeste, hay una antigua cárcel. Pero Margo no estaba realmente metida en el tema. Le gustaba entrar, pero luego quería quedarse.
vi_translation: “The girl has a very keen eye, and back then she was only, let's see, thirteen years old,” Gus said. “She could find her way into anywhere. Back then it was only occasionally, but now we go exploring three times a week. There are places to see everywhere. There was a recently abandoned mental hospital in Clearwater. An amazing place. We got to see how they used to tie up the crazies and give them electric shocks. There's an old prison to the west of here. But Margo isn't really into exploring. She likes to get inside, but then she just wants to stay in one spot.”
tr_translation: “He had an amazing eye, even though he was about thirteen years old,” said Gus. “He always found a way to get into everywhere. Back then, we would go whenever we had the chance, but now we go out about three times a week. There are places like this everywhere. There’s an abandoned mental hospital in Clearwater. It’s astonishing. You can see the place where they used to strap down the insane and give them electroshock therapy. And to the west of here, there’s an old prison. But Margo wasn’t too interested. She liked breaking into places but then just wanted to stay there.”
es_translation: —He had a very good eye, even though he was only thirteen years old —said Gus—. He found a way to get into any place. Back then we did it occasionally, but now we go out about three times a week. There are places everywhere. In Clearwater, there is an abandoned psychiatric hospital. It's incredible. You can see where they used to tie up the crazies to give them electroshocks. And near here, to the west, there is an old jail. But Margo wasn't really into it. She liked to get in, but then she wanted to stay.

en: “Yeah, God that was annoying,” added Ace.
vi: “Ừ, khó chịu chết đi được,” Át nói thêm.
tr: “Evet, Tanrım bu çok can sıkıcıydı,” diye ekledi As.
es: —Sí, joder, era un fastidio —añadió As.
vi_translation: “Yeah, it's so annoying I could die,” Át added.
tr_translation: “Yes, my God, that was very annoying,” added As.
es_translation: —Yeah, damn, it was a hassle —added As.

en: The Carpenter said, “She wouldn’t even, like, take pictures. Or run around and find stuff. She just wanted to go inside and, like, sit. Remember, she had that black notebook? And she would just sit in the corner and write, like she was in her house, doing homework or something.”
vi: Thợ Mộc nói, “Con bé còn chẳng buồn chụp ảnh. Cũng không chạy tới chạy lui xem cái này cái kia. Nó chỉ muốn vào được bên trong và ngồi. Có nhớ nó hay mang theo quyển sổ đen không? Nó chỉ ngồi trong góc và viết, cứ như đang ở nhà, kiểu như ngồi làm bài tập.”
tr: Marangoz, “Fotoğraf falan bile çekmezdi. Ya da etrafta koşuşturup bir şeyler bulmazdı. Sadece içeri girmek ve oturmak falan isterdi. Şu siyah defterini hatırlıyor musunuz? Öylece bir köşede oturur ve yazardı, evindeymiş ve ödev falan yapıyormuş gibi,” dedi.
es: —Ni siquiera hacía fotos —dijo el Carpintero—. Ni buscaba cosas por ahí. Solo quería entrar y sentarse. ¿Os acordáis de la libreta negra? Se sentaba en un rincón y escribía, como si estuviera en su casa haciendo deberes o algo así.
vi_translation: The Carpenter said, "The girl didn't even bother to take pictures. She also didn't run around looking at this and that. She just wanted to get inside and sit down. Do you remember she always carried that black notebook? She would just sit in the corner and write, as if she were at home, like doing homework."
tr_translation: The carpenter said, "He wouldn't even take photos or anything. Nor would he run around finding things. He just wanted to come in and sit down or something. Do you remember that black notebook of his? He would just sit in a corner and write, as if he were at home doing homework or something," he said.
es_translation: —He didn't even take photos —said the Carpenter—. He didn't look for things around. He just wanted to come in and sit down. Do you remember the black notebook? He would sit in a corner and write, as if he were at home doing homework or something like that.

en: “Honestly,” Gus said, “she never really got what it’s all about. The adventure. She seemed pretty depressed, actually.”
vi: “Thật ra,” Gus nói, “Margo chưa bao giờ thực sự tham gia vào trò vui cả. Tất cả những phiêu lưu đó. Mà thực tế con bé có vẻ rầu rĩ lắm.”
tr: “Doğrusu,” dedi Gus, “bütün bunların gerçekte neyle ilgili olduğunu hiç anlamadı. Macera. Depresyonda gibi görünüyordu aslında.
es: —Sinceramente, nunca entendió de qué iba el tema —dijo Gus—. La aventura. En realidad, parecía bastante deprimida.
vi_translation: “Actually,” Gus said, “Margo never really participated in the fun. All those adventures. In fact, she seemed quite gloomy.”
tr_translation: “Honestly,” said Gus, “he never really understood what all this was about. Adventure. He actually seemed to be depressed.”
es_translation: —Honestly, she never understood what it was about —said Gus—. The adventure. In reality, she seemed quite depressed.

en: I wanted to let them keep talking, because I figured everything they said would help me imagine Margo. But all of a sudden, Lacey stood up and kicked her chair behind her. “And you never thought to ask her about how she was pretty depressed actually? Or why she hung out in these sketch-ass places? That never bothered you?” She was standing above him now, shouting, and he stood up, too, half a foot taller than her, and then the Carpenter said, “Jesus, somebody calm that bitch down.”
vi: Tôi muốn để họ nói, vì tôi nhận ra tất cả những lời ấy sẽ giúp tôi tưởng tượng ra Margo. Nhưng bỗng nhiên, Lacey đứng bật dậy và đá cái ghế ra phía sau. “Các anh chưa bao giờ nghĩ đến chuyện hỏi xem sao Margo lại rầu rĩ thế ư? Hay tại sao Margo lại theo các anh đến những xó thế này? Các anh chưa bao giờ thắc mắc sao?” Lacey đứng ngay trước mặt Gus, gào loạn lên. Gus cũng đứng dậy, cao hơn Lacey cả một cái đầu. Thợ Mộc chen vào, “Trời ơi, ai đó hạ hỏa bà chằn này lại đi.”
tr: Konuşmaya devam etmelerini istedim çünkü söyledikleri her şeyin Margo’yu hayal etmeme yardım edeceğini düşündüm. Ama birdenbire Lacey ayağa kalkıp sandalyesini geriye doğru tekmeledi. “Ve siz, ona aslında neden depresyonda olduğunu sormayı hiç düşünmediniz öyle mi? Ya da neden bu kıçı kırık mekânlarda takıldığını? Bu sizi hiç rahatsız etmedi mi?” Artık Gus’m tepesinde duruyor, bağırıyordu. Gus da ayağa kalktı, Lacey’den on beş santimetre uzundu ve sonra Marangoz, “Tanrım, biri şu fahişeyi sakinleştirsin,” dedi.
es: Quería dejar que siguieran hablando, porque pensaba que todo lo que dijeran me ayudaría a imaginar a Margo, pero de repente Lacey se levantó y pegó una patada a su silla. —¿Y nunca se os ocurrió preguntarle por qué estaba deprimida? ¿O por qué se pasaba el día en estos tugurios de mierda? ¿Nunca te lo has planteado? Estaba delante de él, gritándole desde arriba, así que Gus se levantó también. Era casi un palmo más alto que ella. —Por Dios, que alguien tranquilice un poco a esta zorra —dijo el Carpintero.
vi_translation: I wanted to let them talk, because I realized that all those words would help me imagine Margo. But suddenly, Lacey stood up abruptly and kicked the chair behind her. "Have you guys never thought about asking why Margo was so down?" "Or why Margo followed you guys to these obscure places?" "Have you guys never wondered why?" Lacey stood right in front of Gus, screaming wildly. Gus also stood up, towering over Lacey by a whole head. The Carpenter intervened, "Oh my God, someone calm this shrew down."
tr_translation: I wanted them to keep talking because I thought everything they said would help me imagine Margo. But suddenly, Lacey stood up and kicked her chair back. "And you, you never thought to ask her why she was actually depressed, did you? Or why she hung out in these crappy places? Didn't that ever bother you?" She was now standing over Gus, shouting. Gus stood up too, he was fifteen centimeters taller than Lacey, and then Carpenter said, "God, someone calm this whore down."
es_translation: I wanted to let them keep talking, because I thought that everything they said would help me imagine Margo, but suddenly Lacey stood up and kicked her chair. —And it never occurred to you to ask her why she was depressed? Or why she spent the day in these shithole dives? Have you never considered it? He was in front of him, shouting at him from above, so Gus stood up as well. He was almost a handspan taller than her. —For God's sake, someone calm this bitch down a bit —said the Carpenter.

en: “Oh no you didn’t!” Ben yelled, and before I even knew what was going on, Ben tackled the Carpenter, who fell awkwardly out of his chair onto his shoulder. Ben straddled the guy and started pounding on him, furiously and awkwardly smacking and punching his mask, shouting, “SHE’S NOT THE BITCH, YOU ARE!” I scrambled up and grabbed one of Ben’s arms as Radar grabbed the other. We pulled him away, but he was still shouting, “I have a lot of anger right now! I was enjoying punching the guy! I want to go back to punching him!”
vi: “Ồ không đâu!” Ben gào lên. Tôi còn chưa hiểu chuyện gì, Ben đã xáp đến giáp lá cà với Thợ Mộc, anh ta ngã khỏi ghế, nện vai xuống sàn. Ben ngồi hẳn lên anh ta và bắt đầu nện túi bụi, giận dữ và ngớ ngẩn vừa đấm vừa tát cái mặt nạ của anh ta, hét ầm lên, “ANH LÀ ĐỒ BÀ CHẰN THÌ CÓ!” Tôi chồm lên giữ một cánh tay Ben, Radar ghì cánh tay bên kia. Bọn tôi kéo Ben ra, nhưng nó vẫn la lối om sòm, “Tôi đang điên tiết đây! Đánh anh vui ghê! Được đánh tiếp càng vui!”
tr: “Ah, işte bunu demeyecektin!” diye bağırdı Ben ve ben daha ne olup bittiğini anlayamadan, Ben Marangoz’a saldırdı ve Marangoz sandalyesinden biçimsiz bir şekilde omzunun üstüne düştü. Ben bacaklarını açıp adamm üstüne oturdu ve hem öfkeyle hem de beceriksiz bir şekilde maskesini tokatlayıp yumruklayarak ve “FAHİŞE OLAN O DEĞİL, SENSİN!” diye bağırarak adamı dövmeye başladı. Ayağa kalktım ve Radar kolunu yakalarken Ben’in öteki kolunu yakalayıp tuttum. Onu çekip uzaklaştırdık ama hâlâ bağırıyordu. “Şu anda çok sinirliyim! Bu adamı yumruklamaktan zevk alıyorum! Onu yumruklamaya devam etmek istiyorum!
es: —¿Qué has dicho? —gritó Ben. Y antes de que me diera cuenta de lo que estaba pasando, Ben pegó un empujón al Carpintero, que resbaló aparatosamente de la silla y fue a parar al suelo. Ben se sentó a horcajadas encima del tipo y empezó a pegarle, a darle fuertes bofetadas y puñetazos en la máscara. —¡NO ES UNA ZORRA! ¡ESO LO SERÁS TÚ! Me levanté y agarré a Ben por un brazo mientras Radar lo sujetaba por el otro. —¡Estoy muy cabreado! —gritó mientras lo apartábamos—. ¡Estaba divirtiéndome pegando a ese tipo! ¡Quiero volver a pegarle!
vi_translation: "Oh no!" Ben screamed. Before I could understand what was happening, Ben had already closed in on the Carpenter, knocking him off his chair and slamming his shoulder onto the floor. Ben sat on top of him and began to pummel him furiously and foolishly, punching and slapping his mask, shouting, "YOU'RE NOTHING BUT A WITCH!"
