I lunged forward to grab one of Ben's arms, while Radar held the other. We pulled Ben away, but he kept yelling, "I'm furious! Hitting you is so much fun! Hitting you more would be even better!"
tr_translation: “Ah, you shouldn't have said that!” shouted Ben, and before I could understand what was happening, Ben attacked the Carpenter, who fell awkwardly over his shoulder from his chair. Ben spread his legs and sat on top of the man, slapping and punching his mask both angrily and clumsily. “THE WHORE ISN'T HER, IT'S YOU!” she shouted, starting to beat the man. I stood up and grabbed Radar's arm while Ben grabbed and held his other arm. We pulled him away, but he was still shouting. “I am very angry right now! I enjoy punching this man! I want to keep punching him!”
es_translation: —What did you say? —shouted Ben. And before I realized what was happening, Ben shoved the Carpenter, who slipped clumsily from the chair and ended up on the floor. Ben straddled the guy and started hitting him, delivering strong slaps and punches to his mask. —SHE IS NOT A BITCH! THAT'S WHAT YOU ARE! I got up and grabbed Ben by one arm while Radar held him by the other. —I'm very pissed off! —he shouted as we pulled him away—. I was having fun hitting that guy! I want to hit him again!

en: “Ben,” I said, trying to sound calm, trying to sound like my mom. “Ben, it’s okay. You made your point.”
vi: “Ben,” tôi gọi, cố gắng giữ giọng bình tĩnh, cố gắng tỏ vẻ giống mẹ tôi. “Ben ơi, được rồi mà. Ông nói rõ quan điểm rồi mà.”
tr: “Ben,” dedim, sesimin sakin çıkmasına, sesimin annem gibi çıkmasına çalışarak. “Ben, her şey yolunda. Ne demek istediğini anladık.
es: —Ben —le dije, intentando parecer tranquilo, con el tono que suele emplear mi madre—. Ben, ya está. Ya lo has dejado claro.
vi_translation: “Ben,” I called, trying to keep my voice calm, trying to sound like my mother. “Ben, it's okay. You've made your point clear.”
tr_translation: “Ben,” I said, trying to make my voice sound calm, trying to make my voice sound like my mother's. “Ben, everything is fine. We understood what you meant.”
es_translation: —Ben —I said, trying to appear calm, with the tone my mother usually uses—. Ben, that's enough. You've made your point clear.

en: Gus and Ace picked up the Carpenter, and Gus said, “Jesus Christ, we’re getting out of here, okay? It’s all yours.”
vi: Gus và Át đỡ Thợ Mộc dậy, Gus nói, “Chúa ơi, bọn này đi là được chứ gì? Của mấy đứa hết đấy.”
tr: Gus ile As, Marangoz’u yerden kaldırdı ve Gus, “Tannm, buradan çıkıyoruz, tamam mı? Burası tamamen sizin,” dedi.
es: Gus y As levantaron al Carpintero. —Joder, nos vamos de aquí, ¿vale? Todo vuestro.
vi_translation: Gus and Art helped the Carpenter up, Gus said, "My God, we can leave, right? It's all yours."
tr_translation: Gus and As lifted the Carpenter off the ground, and Gus said, "God, we're getting out of here, okay? This place is all yours," he said.
es_translation: Gus and As lifted the Carpenter. —Fuck, we're getting out of here, alright? All yours.

en: Ace picked up their camera equipment, and they hustled out the back door. Lacey started to explain to me how she knew him, saying, “He was a senior when we were fr—.” But I waved it off. None of it mattered anyway.
vi: Át nhặt máy ảnh của họ lên rồi cả ba đi nhanh ra cửa sau. Lacey bắt đầu giải thích chuyện quen biết Gus, “Anh ta học năm cuối còn tụi mình mới lớp–.” Nhưng tôi xua đi, chuyện ấy chẳng còn quan trọng nữa.
tr: As kamera takımlarım topladı ve aceleyle arka kapıdan çıktüar. Lacey, Gus’ı nereden tanıdığım bana açıklamaya başladı. “O son sınıftaydı, biz...” Ama elimi sallayarak sözünü kestim. Hiçbirinin önemi yoktu nasılsa.
es: As cogió su equipo fotográfico y los tres salieron corriendo por la puerta trasera. Lacey empezó a explicarme de qué lo conocía. —Él estaba en el último curso cuando nosotros… Pero le indiqué con la mano que lo dejara correr. No importaba.
vi_translation: Picked up their cameras and all three quickly went out the back door. Lacey began to explain how she knew Gus, "He was a senior while we were just freshmen–." But I brushed it off, that didn't matter anymore.
tr_translation: They gathered my camera equipment and hurriedly exited through the back door. Lacey started to explain to me how she knew Gus. “He was a senior, we...” But I interrupted her by waving my hand. None of it mattered anyway.
es_translation: He grabbed his photography equipment and the three of them ran out the back door. Lacey began to explain to me how she knew him. —He was in the final year when we... But I signaled with my hand to let it go. It didn't matter.

en: Radar knew what mattered. He returned immediately to the calendar, his eyes an inch away from the paper. “I don’t think anything was written on the May page,” he says. “The paper is pretty thin and I can’t see any marks. But it’s impossible to say for sure.” He went off to search for more clues, and I saw Lacey’s and Ben’s flashlights dipping as they went through a Troll Hole, but I just stood there in the office, imagining her. I thought of her following these guys, four years older than her, into abandoned buildings. That was Margo as I’d seen her. But then, inside the buildings, she is not the Margo I’d always imagined. While everyone else walks off to explore and take pictures and bounce around the walls, Margo sits on the floor, writing something.
vi: Radar biết chuyện gì là quan trọng. Nó lập tức quay lại cuốn lịch, mắt chỉ cách trang giấy vài phân. “Chắc không có gì đó được viết trên tờ tháng Năm đâu,” nó nói. “Giấy rất mỏng và tôi không thấy dấu vết gì. Nhưng cũng khó nói chắc chắn lắm.” Nó tiếp tục tìm thêm các đầu mối. Tôi thấy ánh đèn của Lacey và Ben chúc xuống khi hai đứa chui qua một Lỗ Quỉ, nhưng tôi chỉ đứng đó trong gian văn phòng, tưởng tượng về Margo. Tôi nghĩ đến cô ấy đã theo mấy anh chàng vừa rồi, lớn hơn cô ấy bốn tuổi, vào những tòa nhà bị bỏ hoang. Đó là Margo mà tôi từng thấy. Nhưng rồi, bên trong những tòa nhà, cô ấy không phải Margo mà tôi luôn hình dung nữa. Trong khi mọi người khám phá xung quanh, chụp ảnh và nhảy qua những bức tường, Margo ngồi trên sàn, viết lách gì đó.
tr: Radar neyin önemi olduğunu biliyordu. Hemen takvime döndü, gözleri kâğıttan üç santimetre uzaklıktaydı. “Mayıs sayfasına bir şey yazıldığım sanmıyorum,” dedi. “Kâğıt oldukça ince ve hiç iz göremiyorum. Ama kesin olarak söylemek imkânsız.” Daha fazla ipucu aramak için uzaklaştı ve Cüce Deliğinden geçerlerken, Lacey ile Ben’in fenerlerinin ışığının azaldığını gördüm ama ben Margo’yu hayal ederek öylece orada, ofiste dikildim. Kendinden dört yaş büyük olan bu adamları, terk edilmiş binalara girerken takip ettiğini düşündüm. Bu benim gördüğüm Margo’ydu. Ama sonra, binaların içinde, her zaman hayal ettiğim Margo olmaktan çıkıyor. Herkes araştırmaya giderken, fotoğraflar çekip duvarlardan atlarken, Margo bir şeyler yazarak yerde oturuyor.
es: Radar sabía lo que importaba. Volvió inmediatamente al calendario y acercó los ojos a dos centímetros del papel. —Creo que no escribieron nada en la página de mayo —dijo—. El papel es muy fino y no veo marcas. Pero no puedo asegurarlo. Se puso a buscar más pistas y vi las linternas de Lacey y de Ben metiéndose por un Agujero de Trol, pero yo me quedé en el despacho imaginándome a Margo. Pensé en ella yendo a edificios abandonados con aquellos tipos, cuatro años mayores que ella. Aquella era la Margo a la que había visto. Pero la que se quedaba en los edificios no era la Margo que siempre había imaginado. Mientras todos los demás salen a explorar, a hacer fotos y a saltar por las paredes, Margo se sienta en el suelo a escribir.
vi_translation: Radar knows what is important. He immediately turned back to the calendar, his eyes only a few inches from the page. “There’s probably nothing written on the May page,” he said. “The paper is very thin and I don't see any marks. But it's hard to be sure.” He continued to look for more clues. I saw the lights of Lacey and Ben dip down as they crawled through a Devil's Hole, but I just stood there in the office, imagining Margo. I thought about her following those guys earlier, four years older than her, into abandoned buildings. That was the Margo I had seen. But then, inside those buildings, she wasn’t the Margo I always imagined anymore. While everyone else was exploring, taking pictures, and jumping over walls, Margo sat on the floor, writing something.
tr_translation: Radar knew what was important. He immediately turned to the calendar, his eyes were three centimeters away from the paper. “I don't think anything was written on the May page,” he said. “The paper is quite thin and I can't see any marks. But it's impossible to say for sure.” He moved away to look for more clues and as they passed through the Dwarf Hole, I saw the light from Lacey and Ben’s flashlights dim, but I just stood there in the office, imagining Margo. I thought about her following these men, who were four years older than her, into abandoned buildings. This was the Margo I saw. But then, inside the buildings, she stops being the Margo I always imagined. While everyone else is exploring, taking photos, and jumping over walls, Margo sits on the ground writing something.
es_translation: Radar knew what mattered. He immediately returned to the calendar and brought his eyes two centimeters from the paper. —I think they didn't write anything on the May page —he said—. The paper is very thin and I don't see any marks. But I can't be sure. He started looking for more clues and I saw Lacey's and Ben's flashlights going into a Troll Hole, but I stayed in the office imagining Margo. I thought of her going to abandoned buildings with those guys, four years older than her. That was the Margo I had seen. But the one who stayed in the buildings was not the Margo I had always imagined. While everyone else goes out to explore, take photos, and jump off the walls, Margo sits on the floor to write.

en: From next door, Ben shouted, “Q! We got something!”
vi: Tiếng Ben kêu lên từ phòng bên cạnh, “Q ơi! Bọn tôi có cái này!”
tr: Ben, yan kapıdan bağırdı: “Q! Bir şey bulduk!
es: —¡Q! ¡Tenemos algo! —gritó Ben desde la puerta.
vi_translation: Ben's voice called out from the next room, "Q! We have something!"
tr_translation: Ben shouted from the side door: "Q! We found something!"
es_translation: —Q! We have something!

en: I wiped sweat from my face with both sleeves and used Margo’s desk to pull myself up. I walked across the room, ducked through the Troll Hole, and headed toward the three flashlights scanning the wall above the rolled-up carpet.
vi: Tôi đưa ống tay áo lên quệt mồ hôi trên mặt, tì vào bàn của Margo để đứng cho thẳng. Tôi đi ngang gian phòng, chui qua Lỗ Quỉ, theo hướng ba luồng sáng đang quét lên mảng tường phía trên cuộn thảm.
tr: Tişörtümün iki koluyla yüzümdeki teri sildim ve kendimi yukarı çekmek için Margo’nun masasını kullandım. Odanın diğer tarafına yürüdüm, Cüce Deliği’nden süründüm ve sarılmış halının üstündeki duvarı tarayan üç fenere doğru ilerledim.
es: —¡Q! ¡Tenemos algo! —gritó Ben desde la puerta. Me sequé el sudor de la cara con las dos mangas y me agarré a la mesa para levantarme. Crucé la sala, gateé por el Agujero de Trol y me dirigí hacia las tres linternas que recorrían la pared por encima de la moqueta enrollada.
vi_translation: I raised my sleeve to wipe the sweat off my face, leaning on Margo's desk to stand up straight. I walked across the room, crawled through the Devil's Hole, heading towards the three beams of light sweeping across the wall above the rolled carpet.
tr_translation: I wiped the sweat from my face with the two sleeves of my t-shirt and used Margo's desk to pull myself up. I walked to the other side of the room, crawled through the Hobbit Hole, and moved towards the three flashlights scanning the wall over the rolled-up carpet.
es_translation: —shouted Ben from the door. I wiped the sweat from my face with both sleeves and grabbed the table to stand up. I crossed the room, crawled through the Troll Hole, and headed towards the three lanterns that lined the wall above the rolled-up carpet.

en: “Look,” Ben said, using the beam to draw a square on the wall. “You know those little holes you mentioned?”
vi: “Coi nè,” Ben bảo, rọi đèn vẽ một hình vuông trên tường. “Ông nhớ mấy cái lỗ nhỏ mà ông đã kể không?”
tr: “Bak,” dedi Ben, duvarda bir kare çizmek için ışığı kullanarak. “Bahsettiğin küçük delikler vardı ya?
es: —Mira —dijo Ben trazando un cuadrado en la pared con el foco—. ¿Te acuerdas de los agujeritos que nos comentaste?
vi_translation: "Look at this," Ben said, shining a light to draw a square on the wall. "Do you remember the small holes you talked about?"
tr_translation: “Look,” said Ben, using the light to draw a square on the wall. “Those small holes you mentioned?”
es_translation: —Look —said Ben, tracing a square on the wall with the flashlight—. Do you remember the little holes you told us about?

en: “They had to have been mementos tacked up there. Postcards or pictures, we think, from the spacing of the holes. Which maybe she took with her,” Ben said.
vi: “Ắt phải có những món lưu niệm được đính ở đây. Bưu thiếp này, tranh ảnh này, bọn tôi nghĩ thế, căn cứ vào khoảng cách giữa các lỗ. Có lẽ Margo đã mang những thứ ấy theo rồi,” Ben nói.
tr: “Oraya, yukarıya raptiyelenmiş notlar olmalılar. Deliklerin arasındaki boşluklardan, kartpostal ya da resim olduklarını düşünüyoruz. Belki yanında götürdü,” dedi Ben.
es: —Deben de haber sido cosas clavadas aquí —dijo Ben—. Por el espacio que hay entre los agujeros, creemos que postales o fotos que quizá se llevó al marcharse.
vi_translation: "There must have been some souvenirs attached here. This postcard, these pictures, we thought so, based on the spacing between the holes. Maybe Margo already took those things with her," Ben said.
tr_translation: “There should be notes pinned up there. We think they are postcards or pictures, judging by the gaps between the holes. Maybe he took them with him,” said Ben.
es_translation: —There must have been things pinned here —said Ben—. From the space between the holes, we believe they were postcards or photos that he might have taken with him when he left.

en: “Yeah, maybe,” I said. “I wish we could find that notebook Gus was talking about.”
vi: “Ừ, có thể,” tôi đáp. “Giá mà chúng ta tìm thấy cuốn sổ Gus vừa nói đến nhỉ.”
tr: “Evet, belki,” dedim. “Keşke Gus’m bahsettiği defteri bulabilseydik.
es: —Sí, puede ser —le contesté—. Ojalá encontráramos la libreta de la que ha hablado Gus. —Sí.
vi_translation: "Yes, maybe," I replied. "If only we could find the notebook Gus just mentioned."
tr_translation: “Yes, maybe,” I said. “I wish we could find the notebook Gus mentioned.”
es_translation: —Yes, it could be —I replied to him—. I hope we find the notebook Gus talked about.

en: “Yeah, when he said that, I remembered that notebook,” Lacey said, the beam of my flashlight lighting up only her legs. “She had one with her all the time. I never saw her write in it, but I just figured it was like a day planner or whatever. God, I never asked about it. I get pissed at Gus, who wasn’t even her friend. But what did I ever ask her?”
vi: “Ừ, nghe anh ta kể, tớ nhớ đã thấy cuốn sổ đó,” Lacey nói, chùm sáng từ đèn pin của tôi chỉ chiếu lên chân cậu ấy. “Margo lúc nào cũng có cuốn sổ. Tớ chưa bao giờ thấy cậu ấy viết vào đó, nhưng tớ đoán đó là lịch kế hoạch hay gì đó như vậy. Trời ạ, tớ chưa bao giờ hỏi Margo cả. Tớ làm loạn lên với Gus, anh ta còn không phải bạn của Margo. Nhưng chính tớ đã bao giờ hỏi cậu ấy đâu?”
tr: “Evet, söylediğinde, o defteri hatırladım,” dedi Lacey, fenerimin ışığı yalnızca onun bacaklarını aydınlatıyordu. “Hep yanında olan bir tane vardı. Hiç yazdığım görmedim ama sadece bir ajanda falan olduğunu düşündüm. Tanrım, hiç sormadım. Arkadaşı bile olmayan Gus’a kızdım. Ama ben ona ne sordum ki?
es: —Sí. Cuando lo ha dicho, he recordado esa libreta —dijo Lacey. El foco de mi linterna le iluminaba solo las piernas—. Siempre llevaba una encima. Nunca la vi escribiendo, pero supuse que era una agenda o algo así. Vaya, nunca le pregunté por esa libreta. Me he cabreado con Gus, que ni siquiera era amigo suyo, pero ¿alguna vez le pregunté algo yo?
vi_translation: “Yeah, hearing him talk about it, I remember seeing that notebook,” Lacey said, the beam from my flashlight only illuminating her feet. “Margo always had that notebook. I never saw her write in it, but I guess it was a planner or something like that. God, I never asked Margo about it. I made a fuss with Gus, and he wasn’t even Margo’s friend. But did I ever ask her myself?”
tr_translation: “Yes, when you mentioned it, I remembered that notebook,” said Lacey, my flashlight's beam only illuminating her legs. “There was always one with him. I never saw him write in it, but I just thought it was some kind of agenda or something. God, I never asked. I got mad at Gus, who didn't even have a friend. But what did I ever ask him?”
es_translation: —Yes. When he said it, I remembered that notebook —said Lacey. The beam of my flashlight only illuminated her legs—. She always carried one with her. I never saw her writing in it, but I assumed it was a planner or something like that. Wow, I never asked her about that notebook. I got mad at Gus, who wasn't even her friend, but did I ever ask her anything?

en: “She wouldn’t have answered anyway,” I said. It was dishonest to act like Margo hadn’t participated in her own obfuscation.
vi: “Margo cũng sẽ không trả lời đâu,” tôi nói. Thật xạo sự khi làm như Margo không tham gia vào màn đánh lạc hướng của chính cô ấy.
tr: “Cevap vermezdi nasılsa,” dedim. Margo’nun, kendi gizlenişine dâhil olmamış gibi davranmak dürüstçe değildi.
es: —De todas formas, no te habría contestado —le dije. No era honesto fingir que Margo no había participado en su propia confusión.
vi_translation: “Margo won't answer either,” I said. It's such a lie to pretend that Margo isn't involved in her own distraction.
tr_translation: “She wouldn't answer anyway,” I said. It wasn't honest for Margo to act as if she hadn't been part of her own disappearance.
es_translation: —In any case, I wouldn't have answered you —I told him. It wasn't honest to pretend that Margo hadn't participated in her own confusion.

en: We walked around for another hour, and just when I felt sure the trip had been a waste, my flashlight happened over the subdivision brochures that had been built into a house of cards when we first came here. One of the brochures was for Grovepoint Acres. My breath caught as I spread out the other brochures. I jogged to my backpack by the door and came back with a pen and a notebook and wrote down the names of all the advertised subdivisions. I recognized one immediately: Collier Farms—one of the two pseudovisions on my list I hadn’t yet visited. I finished copying the subdivision names and returned my notebook to my backpack. Call me selfish, but if I found her, I wanted it to be alone.
vi: Bọn tôi đi quanh thêm một tiếng đồng hồ nữa. Khi tôi bắt đầu thấy chắc rằng chuyến đi này chẳng thu được gì, đèn pin của tôi tình cờ quét qua mấy cuốn quảng cáo các tiểu khu từng được dựng thành hình ngôi nhà khi bọn tôi tới đây lần đầu. Một trong các cuốn quảng cáo là khu Grovepoint Acres. Tôi nghẹn thở khi dàn các cuốn khác ra. Tôi đi nhanh đến ba-lô đặt cạnh cửa và quay lại với cây bút, cuốn sổ, ghi lại tên tất cả các tiểu khu được quảng cáo. Một cái tên tôi lập tức nhận ra: Collier Farms–một trong hai khu đô thị ma tôi đã khoanh vùng mà chưa đến. Tôi ghi lại hết rồi cất sổ vào ba-lô. Bảo tôi ích kỉ cũng được, nhưng nếu tôi tìm thấy Margo, tôi muốn chỉ có hai đứa.
tr: Bir saat daha etrafta gezindik ve tam ben bu gezintinin faydasız olduğuna emin olduğumda, fenerim, buraya ilk geldiğimizde kartlardan bir eve benzetilmiş olan semt broşürlerine rast geldi. Broşürlerden biri Grovepoint Acres içindi. Diğer broşürleri yayarken nefesim kesildi. Kapının yanında duran sırt çantama koşup bir kalem ve defterle geri döndüm ve reklamı yapılan bütün semtlerin isimlerini yazdım. Birini hemen tamdım: Collier Farms... listemdeki henüz ziyaret etmediğim iki semtimsiden biri. Semtlerin isimlerini yazmayı bitirdim ve defteri çantama geri götürdüm. Bana bencil diyebilirsiniz ama eğer onu bulursam, bunu tek başıma yapmak istiyordum.
es: Seguimos dando vueltas por allí durante una hora, y justo cuando estaba convencido de que habíamos hecho el viaje en balde, mi linterna pasó por los folletos que estaban colocados en forma de casa la primera vez que entramos. Uno de los folletos era de Grovepoint Acres. Esparcí los demás conteniendo la respiración. Corrí a buscar mi mochila, que estaba al lado de la puerta, volví corriendo con un boli y una libreta, y anoté los nombres de todas las urbanizaciones que aparecían en los folletos. Reconocí una de inmediato: Collier Farms, una de las dos urbanizaciones de mi lista a las que todavía no había ido. Terminé de copiar los nombres y volví a meter la libreta en la mochila. Llamadme egoísta, pero si la encontraba, prefería hacerlo yo solo.
vi_translation: We walked around for another hour. Just as I was beginning to feel sure that this trip would yield nothing, my flashlight happened to sweep over some brochures of subdivisions that had been arranged into the shape of a house when we first arrived here. One of the brochures was for Grovepoint Acres. I held my breath as I spread out the other brochures. I quickly went to the backpack by the door and came back with a pen and notebook, writing down the names of all the subdivisions advertised. One name I immediately recognized: Collier Farms—one of the two ghost towns I had marked but not yet visited. I wrote them all down and put the notebook back in the backpack. Call me selfish, but if I found Margo, I wanted it to be just the two of us.
tr_translation: We wandered around for another hour, and just when I was certain that this walk was useless, my lantern came across the neighborhood brochures, which had been likened to a house of cards when we first arrived here. One of the brochures was for Grovepoint Acres. My breath was taken away as I spread out the other brochures. I ran to my backpack, which was standing by the door, and returned with a pen and notebook, writing down the names of all the advertised neighborhoods. I immediately recognized one: Collier Farms... one of the two neighborhoods on my list that I had not yet visited. I finished writing down the names of the neighborhoods and put the notebook back in my bag. You can call me selfish, but if I found it, I wanted to do it alone.
es_translation: We kept wandering around there for an hour, and just when I was convinced that we had made the trip in vain, my flashlight passed over the brochures that were arranged like a house the first time we entered. One of the brochures was from Grovepoint Acres. I spread out the others, holding my breath. I ran to get my backpack, which was next to the door, ran back with a pen and a notebook, and wrote down the names of all the developments that appeared in the brochures. I recognized one immediately: Collier Farms, one of the two developments on my list that I hadn't visited yet. I finished copying the names and put the notebook back in the backpack. Call me selfish, but if I found it, I preferred to do it alone.

en: The moment Mom got home from work on Friday, I told her that I was going to a concert with Radar and then proceeded to drive out to rural Seminole County to see Collier Farms. All the other subdivisions from the brochures turned out to exist— most of them on the north side of town, which had been totally developed a long time ago.
vi: Thứ Sáu, lúc mẹ đi làm về, tôi báo cáo là sẽ đi xem ca nhạc với Radar, nhưng rồi dong xe chạy thẳng ra vùng nông thôn, hạt Seminole, tới Collier Farms. Tất cả các tiểu khu khác trong tập quảng cáo rút cục đều đã được hoàn thiện–đa phần nằm ở phía bắc thành phố, khu vực được phát triển hoàn toàn từ cách đây rất lâu rồi.
tr: Cuma günü annem işten eve geldiği anda, ona Radar’la bir konsere gideceğimi söyledim ve sonra Collier Farms’ı görmek için arabayla kırsal Seminole County’nin dışına doğru gitmeye başladım. Broşürlerdeki diğer semtlerin hepsinin var olduğu ortaya çıktıçoğu, şehrin kuzey tarafındaydıki burası uzun zaman önce tamamen yerleşik düzene geçmişti.
es: En cuanto mi madre llegó a casa el viernes, le dije que iba a un concierto con Radar, cogí el coche y me dirigí a las afueras del condado de Seminole para ver Collier Farms. Resultó que todas las demás urbanizaciones que aparecían en los folletos existían, la mayoría de ellas al norte de la ciudad. Las habían terminado hacía tiempo.
vi_translation: Friday, when my mom came home from work, I reported that I was going to see a concert with Radar, but then I drove straight out to the countryside, Seminole County, to Collier Farms. All the other subdivisions in the brochure had ultimately been completed–most of them located to the north of the city, an area that had been fully developed a long time ago.
tr_translation: On Friday, the moment my mom came home from work, I told her that I was going to a concert with Radar and then started driving out to rural Seminole County to see Collier Farms. It turned out that all the other neighborhoods in the brochures existed—most of them were on the north side of the city, which had been fully settled a long time ago.
es_translation: As soon as my mother got home on Friday, I told her I was going to a concert with Radar, took the car, and headed to the outskirts of Seminole County to see Collier Farms. It turned out that all the other developments that appeared in the brochures existed, most of them north of the city. They had been completed a long time ago.

en: I only recognized the turnoff for Collier Farms because I’d become something of an expert in hard-to-see dirt access roads. But Collier Farms was like none of the other pseudovisions I’d seen, because it was wildly overgrown, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. I didn’t know if it was older than the other pseudovisions, or if the low-lying, swamp-wet land made everything grow faster, but the Collier Farms access road became impassable just after I turned in because a thick grove of brambly brush had sprouted across the entire road.
vi: Tôi nhận ra lối rẽ vào Collier Farms chỉ vì tôi đã thành chuyên gia xác định những con đường lờ mờ lẫn vào đất. Nhưng Collier Farms không giống khu đô thị ma nào tôi từng đến. Nơi này cỏ dại mọc um tùm, như thể đã bị bỏ hoang năm chục năm nay rồi. Không rõ thâm niên nơi này có cao hơn những đô thị ma khác không, hay do địa thế thấp, đất đầm lầy ẩm mà mọi thứ mọc nhanh hơn. Tôi vừa rẽ đã thấy không thể đi tiếp được theo đường vào Collier Farms vì những bụi mâm xôi đâm lên um tùm chắn hết lối đi.
tr: Collier Farms sapağını fark edebildim çünkü görülmesi zor toprak yolları görmede uzman gibi bir şey olmuştum. Fakat Collier Farms gördüğüm diğer semtimsilere hiç benzemiyordu, çünkü sanki elli yıl önce terk edilmiş gibi yabani bir şekilde çalılarla kaplanmıştı. Diğer semtimsilerden daha eski olup olmadığını ya da her şeyin daha hızlı büyümesine neden olan bataklıklı bir zemini olup olmadığım bilmiyordum ancak Collier Farms’m giriş yolu ben oraya döndükten hemen sonra geçit vermez hale geldi çünkü yolun iki tarafında da sık bir dikenli çalı korusu yetişmişti.
es: Solo reconocí el desvío hacia Collier Farms porque me había convertido en un experto en caminos sin asfaltar difíciles de ver. Pero Collier Farms era diferente de las demás pseudovisiones que había visitado. Estaba extremadamente descuidada, como si llevara cincuenta años abandonada. No supe si era más antigua que las otras o si la tierra baja y pantanosa había hecho que todo creciera más deprisa, pero en cuanto me metí por el desvío me resultó imposible seguir avanzando, porque todo el camino estaba cubierto de gruesos arbustos.
vi_translation: I recognized the turn into Collier Farms only because I had become an expert at identifying the faint roads blending into the ground. But Collier Farms was unlike any ghost town I had ever been to. This place was overgrown with weeds, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. It was unclear whether this place had been abandoned longer than other ghost towns, or if the low terrain and swampy, damp soil caused everything to grow faster. As soon as I turned, I saw that I couldn't continue down the road into Collier Farms because the overgrown blackberry bushes blocked the entire path.
tr_translation: I was able to notice the Collier Farms turnoff because I had become something of an expert at spotting hard-to-see dirt roads. But Collier Farms was unlike any other neighborhood I had seen, because it was overgrown with wild bushes as if it had been abandoned fifty years ago. I didn't know if it was older than the other neighborhoods or if it had a swampy ground that caused everything to grow faster, but the entrance road to Collier Farms became impassable right after I turned onto it because a dense thicket of thorny bushes had grown on both sides of the road.
es_translation: I only recognized the turnoff to Collier Farms because I had become an expert in spotting hard-to-see unpaved roads. But Collier Farms was different from the other pseudovisions I had visited. It was extremely neglected, as if it had been abandoned for fifty years. I didn't know if it was older than the others or if the low, swampy land had made everything grow faster, but as soon as I took the turnoff, it became impossible to keep going because the entire road was covered with thick bushes.

en: I got out and walked. The overgrown grass scraped at my shins, and my sneakers sunk into the mud with each step. I couldn’t help but hope she had a tent pitched out here somewhere on some little piece of land two feet higher than everything else, keeping the rain off. I walked slowly, because there was more to see than at any of the others, more places to hide, and because I knew this pseudovision had a direct connection to the minimall. The ground was so thick I had to walk slowly as I let myself take in each new landscape, checking each place big enough to fit a person. At the end of the street I saw a blue-and-white cardboard box in the mud, and for a second it looked like the same nutrition bars I’d found in the minimall. But, no. A rotting container for a twelve-pack of beer. I trudged back to the minivan and headed for a place called Logan Pines farther to the north.
vi: Tôi xuống cuốc bộ. Cỏ lác quệt vào ống chân tôi, đôi giày thể thao dận xuống bùn theo mỗi bước đi. Tôi không thể không hi vọng rằng Margo dựng một căn lều ở đâu đó, trên một vạt đất nhỏ nhắn cao hơn những thứ khác chừng nửa mét và không bị úng nước mưa. Tôi đi từ từ, vì nơi này cần được quan sát nhiều hơn những nơi khác, vì có nhiều chỗ trú ẩn hơn, và vì tôi biết khu đô thị ma này có liên hệ trực tiếp với khu mua sắm mini. Mặt đất rất dày, tôi đi thật chậm để thu vào tầm mắt từng cảnh quan mới, kiểm tra những chỗ đủ lớn để chứa được một người. Đến cuối phố, tôi thấy một hộp các-tông màu xanh da trời và trắng trên đất bùn, trong tích tắc trông nó rất giống hộp đựng thanh dinh dưỡng tổng hợp tôi đã thấy trong khu mua sắm mini. Nhưng, không. Đó là cái hộp cũ nát, loại đựng mười hai chai bia. Tôi chật vật quay lại xe, đi về phía bắc, đến một nơi tên là Logan Pines.
tr: Arabadan çıkıp yürüdüm. Aşırı büyümüş otlar bacaklarımı sıyırıyor ve spor ayakkabılarım her adımda çamura batıyordu. Orada bir yerlerde, geri kalan her şeyden bir metre yukarıda olan bir toprak parçasının üstüne kurulmuş, onu yağmurdan koruyan bir çadırı olmasını ummaktan başka çarem yoktu. Yavaşça yürüyordum çünkü diğer yerlerde olduğundan daha fazla görülecek şey, daha çok saklanacak yer vardı, ayrıca bu semtimsinin, alışveriş merkezine doğrudan bir bağlantısı olduğunu biliyordum. Zemin o kadar yoğundu ki her düz alanda, bir insana uyacak büyüklükteki her yeri kontrol ederken yavaş yavaş yürümek zorunda kalıyordum. Yolun sonunda, çamurun içinde mavibeyaz karton bir kutu gördüm ve bir saniyeliğine bu kutu, alışveriş merkezinde gördüğüm gofretlerinkinin aynısı gibi göründü. Ama, hayır. Bu, çürümekte olan on ikilik bir bira kutusuydu. Ağır adımlarla minivana döndüm ve kuzeyde yer alan, daha uzaktaki Logan Pines isimli bir yere doğru yola çıktım.
es: Salí del coche y seguí a pie. La maleza me arañaba las pantorrillas y a cada paso que daba se me hundían las zapatillas en el fango. No pude evitar esperar que hubiera montado una tienda de campaña en algún trozo del terreno a unos metros por encima del resto para que el agua de la lluvia no se quedase estancada. Caminaba despacio porque había más cosas que ver que en cualquiera de las demás pseudovisiones, más lugares en los que esconderse, y porque sabía que aquel complejo estaba directamente relacionado con el centro comercial abandonado. El suelo estaba tan lleno de maleza que tenía que avanzar muy despacio por cada nuevo escenario y comprobar que todos los sitios fueran lo bastante grandes para que cupiera una persona. Al final de la calle vi entre el barro una caja de cartulina azul y blanca, y por un momento me pareció la misma caja de barritas de cereales que había encontrado en el centro comercial. Pero no. Era la caja destrozada de un pack de doce cervezas. Volví con esfuerzo al coche y me dirigí a un lugar llamado Logan Pines, más al norte.
vi_translation: I walked down on foot. The sedge grass brushed against my shins, and my sneakers sank into the mud with each step. I couldn't help but hope that Margo had set up a tent somewhere, on a small patch of land slightly higher than the rest by about half a meter and not waterlogged by rain. I walked slowly, because this place needed more observation than others, because there were more hiding spots, and because I knew this ghost town was directly connected to the mini-mall. The ground was very thick, and I walked really slowly to take in every new landscape, checking spots large enough to hide a person. At the end of the street, I saw a blue and white cardboard box on the muddy ground, for a moment it looked very much like the nutrition bar box I had seen in the mini-mall. But, no. It was an old, tattered box, the kind that holds twelve bottles of beer. I struggled back to the car, headed north, to a place called Logan Pines.
tr_translation: I got out of the car and started walking. Overgrown weeds were brushing against my legs, and my sneakers were sinking into the mud with every step. Somewhere out there, I had no choice but to hope for a piece of land elevated a meter above everything else, with a tent protecting it from the rain. I was walking slowly because there were more things to see and more places to hide than in other areas, and I also knew that this neighborhood had a direct connection to the shopping mall. Ground It was so dense that I had to walk slowly, checking every place large enough to fit a person on every flat surface. At the end of the road, I saw a blue and white cardboard box in the mud, and for a second, this box looked exactly like the ones I had seen in the shopping mall. But, no. This was a decaying twelve-pack of beer. I walked back to the minivan with heavy steps and set off towards a farther place to the north called Logan Pines.
es_translation: I got out of the car and continued on foot. The undergrowth scratched my calves, and with each step, my sneakers sank into the mud. I couldn't help but hope that I had set up a tent on some piece of ground a few meters above the rest so that the rainwater wouldn't stagnate. I walked slowly because there were more things to see than in any of the other pseudo-visions, more places to hide, and because I knew that this complex was directly related to the abandoned shopping mall. The ground was so full of undergrowth that I had to move very slowly through each new scene and check that all the places were big enough to fit a person. At the end of the street, I saw a blue and white cardboard box in the mud, and for a moment, it seemed like the same box of cereal bars I had found in the shopping mall. But no. It was the torn-up box of a twelve-pack of beers. I struggled back to the car and headed to a place called Logan Pines, further north.

en: It took an hour to get there, and by now I was up near the Ocala National Forest, not really even the Orlando metro area anymore. I was a few miles away when Ben called.
vi: Đường đi mất một tiếng đồng hồ, giờ tôi đang ở mạn gần rừng quốc gia Ocala, không thực sự còn nằm trong khu vực có tàu điện ngầm Orlando nữa. Tôi còn cách vài dặm thì Ben gọi điện.
tr: Oraya ulaşmam bir saatimi aldı, artık Ocala Ulusal Ormanı’nın yakmlarmdaydım ve Orlando kent sınırlarının içinde bile değildim. Birkaç kilometre ilerlemiştim ki Ben aradı.
es: Tardé una hora en llegar. Había dejado atrás el Bosque Nacional de Ocala, ya casi fuera del área metropolitana de Orlando, cuando me llamó Ben.
vi_translation: The journey took an hour, now I am near the Ocala National Forest, no longer really within the Orlando metropolitan area. I was a few miles away when Ben called.
tr_translation: It took me an hour to get there; I was now near the Ocala National Forest and not even within the city limits of Orlando. I had advanced a few kilometers when Ben called.
es_translation: It took me an hour to get there. I had left behind the Ocala National Forest, almost out of the Orlando metropolitan area, when Ben called me.

en: “What’s up?”
vi: “Có chuyện gì đấy?”
tr: “Nasılsın?
es: —¿Qué pasa?
vi_translation: "What's going on?"
tr_translation: “How are you?”
es_translation: —What's happening?

en: “You hittin’ those paper towns?” he asked.
vi: “Ông đang đến những thành phố giấy đấy phỏng?” Ben hỏi.
tr: “Şu kâğıttan kentlere doğru yola mı koyuldun?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Has ido a esas ciudades de papel? —me preguntó.
vi_translation: “Are you going to the paper towns?” Ben asked.
tr_translation: "Have you set out towards those paper cities?" he asked.
es_translation: —Have you been to those paper towns? —he asked me.

en: “Yeah, I’m almost to the last one I know of. Nothing yet.”
vi: “Ừ, tôi gần đến nơi cuối cùng mà tôi biết rồi. Chưa có gì.”
tr: “Evet, bildiklerimden sonuncusuna geldim neredeyse. Henüz bir şey yok.
es: —Sí, ya casi he llegado a la última. Todavía no he encontrado nada.
vi_translation: "Yes, I am almost at the last place that I know." "Nothing yet."
tr_translation: “Yes, I have almost reached the last of what I know. There is still nothing.”
es_translation: —Yes, I'm almost at the last one. I still haven't found anything.

en: “So listen, bro, Radar’s parents had to leave town real suddenly.”
vi: “Vậy bồ tèo nghe đây, bố mẹ của Radar phải ra khỏi thành phố vì công chuyện cực kì đột xuất.”
tr: “Peki, dinle, kardeşim, Radar’m ebeveynleri birdenbire şehri terk etmek zorunda kaldılar.
es: —Oye, colega, los padres de Radar han tenido que marcharse de la ciudad a toda prisa.
vi_translation: "So listen up, buddy, Radar's parents had to leave the city because of some extremely urgent business."
tr_translation: “Well, listen, brother, Radar's parents suddenly had to leave the city.”
es_translation: —Hey, buddy, Radar's parents had to leave the city in a hurry.

en: “Is everything okay?” I asked. I knew Radar’s grandparents were really old and lived in a nursing home down in Miami.
vi: “Tất cả vẫn ổn chứ?” tôi hỏi, biết rằng ông bà của Radar đã rất cao tuổi và sống trong một khu điều dưỡng ở Miami.
tr: “Her şey yolunda mı?” diye sordum. Radar’m büyükannesi ile büyükbabasının oldukça yaşb olduklarını ve Miami’de bir bakımevinde yaşadıklarını biliyordum.
es: —¿Pasa algo? —le pregunté. Sabía que los abuelos de Radar eran muy mayores y vivían en una residencia de ancianos de Miami.
vi_translation: "Is everything still okay?" I asked, knowing that Radar's grandparents were very old and lived in a nursing home in Miami.
tr_translation: “Is everything okay?” I asked. I knew that Radar’s grandparents were quite old and lived in a nursing home in Miami.
es_translation: —Is something wrong? —I asked him. I knew that Radar's grandparents were very old and lived in a nursing home in Miami.

en: “Yeah, get this: you know the guy in Pittsburgh with the world’s second-largest collection of black Santas?”
vi: “Ổn, chuyện là: ông có nhớ ông cụ ở Pittsburgh có bộ sưu tập ông già Noel da đen đồ sộ thứ nhì thế giới không?”
tr: “Evet, al bakalım: Dünyadaki ikinci büyük zenci Noel baba koleksiyonu olan Pittsburgh’da yaşayan şu adamı biliyorsun, değil mi? “Evet?
es: —Sí, escúchame: ¿recuerdas al tipo de Pittsburgh que tenía la segunda colección más grande del mundo de Santa Claus negros?
vi_translation: “Alright, the thing is: do you remember the old man in Pittsburgh who has the second largest collection of black Santas in the world?”
tr_translation: "Yes, take a look: You know this man living in Pittsburgh who has the second largest black Santa Claus collection in the world, right?""
es_translation: —Yes, listen to me: do you remember the guy from Pittsburgh who had the second largest collection in the world of Black Santas?

en: “Yeah?”
vi: “Ừ, sao?”
tr: “Evet?
es: —Sí, ¿y?
vi_translation: "Yes, what?"
tr_translation: “Yes?”
es_translation: —Yes, and?

en: “He just bit it.”
vi: “Cụ ấy vừa thăng rồi.”
tr: “Az önce nalları dikti.
es: —Acaba de palmar.
vi_translation: "He has just passed away."
tr_translation: “He just kicked the bucket.”
es_translation: —He just kicked the bucket.

en: “You’re kidding.”
vi: “Đùa à?”
tr: “Şaka yapıyorsun.
es: —Estás de broma.
vi_translation: "Are you kidding?"
tr_translation: “You are joking.”
es_translation: —You're joking.

en: “Bro, I don’t kid about the demise of black Santa collectors. This guy had an aneurysm, and so Radar’s folks are flying to Pennsylvania to try to buy his entire collection. So we’re having a few people over.”
vi: “Này, tôi không đùa về chuyện sinh tử của những nhà sưu tầm ông già Noel da đen đâu. Cụ ấy bị chứng phình động mạch. Bố mẹ Radar đang trên đường bay tới Pennsylvania tìm cách mua lại bộ sưu tập của ông cụ. Thế là chúng ta sẽ có mấy vị khách.
tr: “Kardeşim, zenci Noel baba koleksiyoncularının vefatı hakkında şaka yapmam. Adamın bir anevrizması varmış, bu yüzden Radar’ınkiler bütün koleksiyonunu satm almak için Pennsylvania’ya uçuyorlar. Yani, birkaç kişiyi buraya çağırıyoruz.
es: —Colega, yo no hago bromas sobre el fallecimiento de coleccionistas de Santa Claus negros. Al tipo le ha dado un derrame cerebral, y los viejos de Radar están volando a Pennsylvania para intentar comprar toda su colección. Así que vamos a invitar a la peña.
vi_translation: “Hey, I'm not joking about the life and death of those black Santa Claus collectors. He had an aneurysm. Radar's parents are on a flight to Pennsylvania to try to buy back the old man's collection. So we'll have some guests.”
tr_translation: “Brother, I wouldn't joke about the death of black Santa Claus collectors. The man had an aneurysm, so Radar's people are flying to Pennsylvania to buy his entire collection. So, we're calling a few people over here.”
es_translation: —Colleague, I don't joke about the death of black Santa Claus collectors. The guy had a stroke, and the old folks from Radar are flying to Pennsylvania to try to buy his entire collection. So let's invite the gang.

en: “Who’s we?”
vi: “Chúng ta là ai?”
tr: “Biz kim?
es: —¿Quiénes?
vi_translation: "Who are we?"
tr_translation: “Who are we?”
es_translation: —Who?

en: “You and me and Radar. We’re the hosts.”
vi: “Ông, tôi, và Radar. Bọn mình là chủ.”
tr: “Ben, sen ve Radar. Ev sahibi biziz.
es: —Tú, Radar y yo. Somos los anfitriones.
vi_translation: "You, me, and Radar." "We are the owners."
tr_translation: “Me, you, and Radar. We are the hosts.”
es_translation: —You, Radar, and I. We are the hosts.

en: “I don’t know,” I said.
vi: “Tôi chưa biết được,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bilmiyorum,” dedim.
es: —No sé —le dije.
vi_translation: "I don't know yet," I said.
tr_translation: “I don't know,” I said.
es_translation: —I don't know —I told him.

en: There was a pause, and then Ben used my full name. “Quentin,” he said, “I know you want to find her. I know she is the most important thing to you. And that’s cool. But we graduate in, like, a week. I’m not asking you to abandon the search. I’m asking you to come to a party with your two best friends who you have known for half your life. I’m asking you to spend two to three hours drinking sugary wine coolers like the pretty little girl you are, and then another two to three hours vomiting the aforementioned wine coolers through your nose. And then you can go back to poking around abandoned housing projects.”
vi: Im lặng một hồi, rồi Ben réo nguyên tên tôi, “Quentin,” nó nói, “tôi biết ông muốn tìm Margo. Tôi biết Margo là điều quan trọng nhất với ông. Như thế đáng mặt đấy. Nhưng còn một tuần nữa là cả lũ tốt nghiệp. Tôi không bảo ông hãy từ bỏ cuộc tìm kiếm. Tôi mời ông hãy đến dự tiệc với hai cạ cứng mà ông đã quen biết trong phân nửa cuộc đời. Tôi mời ông hãy dành khoảng hai, ba tiếng đồng hồ nhâm nhi mấy món đồ uống ngọt ngọt lạnh lạnh hơi hơi vị rượu, như một cô bé ngoan, và khoảng hai, ba tiếng đồng hồ nữa ói món đồ uống trên qua đằng mũi.
tr: Bir duraksama oldu, sonra Ben tam ismimi kullandı. “Quentin,” dedi, “onu bulmak istediğini biliyorum. Senin için en önemli şeyin Margo olduğunu biliyorum. Ve bu sorun değil. Ama bir haftaya kadar falan mezun oluyoruz. Senden aramayı bırakmam istemiyorum. Senden, hayatının yansı boyunca tanıdığın en iyi iki arkadaşınla bir partiye gelmeni istiyorum. Senden, küçük, tatlı bir kız olup iki üç saatini şekerli şaraplardan içerek geçirmeni ve sonra iki üç saatini daha, bahsi geçen şaraplan burnundan kusarak geçirmeni istiyorum. Ondan sonra terk edilmiş yerleşim birimi projelerine bakınmaya geri dönebilirsin.
es: Nos quedamos un momento en silencio y luego Ben me llamó por mi nombre completo. —Quentin —me dijo—, sé que quieres encontrarla. Sé que es lo más importante para ti. Perfecto. Pero nos graduamos la semana que viene. No estoy pidiéndote que dejes de buscarla. Estoy pidiéndote que vengas a una fiesta con tus dos mejores amigos, a los que conoces desde hace media vida. Estoy pidiéndote que pases dos o tres horas bebiendo cócteles de vino como una nenaza, y otras dos o tres horas vomitando dichos cócteles por la nariz. Y luego puedes seguir paseándote por urbanizaciones abandonadas.
vi_translation: After a moment of silence, Ben called my full name, "Quentin," he said, "I know you want to find Margo. I know Margo is the most important thing to you. That's commendable. But we have just one more week until graduation. I'm not telling you to give up your search. I'm inviting you to come to a party with the two best friends you've known for half your life. I'm inviting you to spend about two or three hours sipping some sweet, cold drinks with a hint of alcohol, like a good girl, and another two or three hours throwing up those drinks through your nose. Then you can continue investigating abandoned house projects.”
tr_translation: There was a pause, then Ben used my full name. “Quentin,” he said, “I know you want to find her. I know that Margo is the most important thing to you. And that's okay. But we are graduating in about a week. I don't want you to stop searching. I want you to come to a party with the two best friends you've known your whole life. I want you to be a little, sweet girl and spend two or three hours drinking sugary wines and then spend another two or three hours throwing up the aforementioned wines through your nose. After that, you can go back to looking at abandoned subdivisions.”
es_translation: We stayed silent for a moment, and then Ben called me by my full name. —Quentin —he said to me—, I know you want to find her. I know it's the most important thing to you. Perfect. But we graduate next week. I'm not asking you to stop looking for her. I'm asking you to come to a party with your two best friends, whom you've known for half your life. I'm asking you to spend two or three hours drinking wine coolers like a sissy, and another two or three hours throwing up said coolers through your nose. And then you can continue wandering through abandoned neighborhoods.

en: It bothered me that Ben only wanted to talk about Margo when it involved an adventure that appealed to him, that he thought there was something wrong with me for focusing on her over my friends, even though she was missing and they weren’t. But Ben was Ben, like Radar said. And I had nothing left to search after Logan Pines anyway. “I’ve got to go to this last place and then I’ll be over.”
vi: Rồi xin mời ông tiếp tục điều tra các dự án nhà bỏ hoang.” Tôi thấy khó chịu vì Ben chỉ muốn nói đến Margo khi có mùi phiêu lưu thu hút nó, vì nó nghĩ tôi có vấn đề khi chỉ biết có Margo mà quên cả bạn bè, dù cô ấy mất tích còn chúng nó thì không. Nhưng Ben là Ben, như Radar đã nói. Và dù sao sau Logan Pines, tôi cũng chẳng còn gì để tìm kiếm nữa. “Tôi đến khu cuối cùng này rồi sẽ qua chỗ các ông.”
tr: Ben’in yalnızca hoşuna giden bir macerayla ilişkili olduğu zaman Margo hakkında konuşmak istemesi ve Margo kayıp, onlar kayıp değilken bile, arkadaşlarım yerine Margo’ya odaklandığım için bende bir sorun olduğunu düşünmesi beni rahatsız etti. Ama Ben Ben’di, Radar’m dediği gibi. Ve nasılsa Logan Pines’tan sonra arayacak hiçbir şeyim yoktu. “Tek bir yere gitmek zorundayım, ondan sonra geleceğim.
es: Me molestaba que Ben solo quisiera hablar de Margo cuando se trataba de una aventura que le atraía, que pensara que me equivocaba centrándome más en ella que en mis amigos, porque ella no estaba, pero ellos sí. Pero Ben era Ben, como había dicho Radar. Y, de todas formas, no tenía nada más que buscar después de Logan Pines. —Iré a esta última y luego me pasaré por casa de Radar.
vi_translation: I felt uncomfortable because Ben only wanted to talk about Margo when the adventure intrigued him, because he thought I had a problem for only thinking about Margo and forgetting my friends, even though she was missing and they were not. But Ben is Ben, as Radar said. And anyway, after Logan Pines, I had nothing left to search for. “I'll go to this last place and then I'll come over to you guys.”
tr_translation: It bothered me that Ben only wanted to talk about Margo when it was related to an adventure he enjoyed, and that he thought there was something wrong with me for focusing on Margo instead of my friends, even when Margo was missing and they were not. But Ben was Ben, as Radar would say. And anyway, I had nothing left to search for after Logan Pines. "I have to go to one place, and then I'll come.""
es_translation: It bothered me that Ben only wanted to talk about Margo when it was about an adventure that attracted him, that he thought I was wrong to focus more on her than on my friends, because she wasn't there, but they were. But Ben was Ben, as Radar had said. And, anyway, I had nothing else to look for after Logan Pines. —I will go to this last one and then I will stop by Radar's house.

en: Because Logan Pines was the last pseudovision in Central Florida— or at least the last one I knew about—I had placed so much hope in it. But as I walked around its single dead-end street with a flashlight, I saw no tent. No campfire. No food wrappers. No sign of people. No Margo. At the end of the road, I found a single concrete foundation dug into the dirt. But there was nothing built atop it, just the hole cut into the earth like a dead mouth agape, tangles of briars and waist-high grass growing up all around. If she’d wanted me to see these places, I could not understand why. And if Margo had gone to the pseudovisions never to come back, she knew about a place I hadn’t uncovered in all my research.
vi: Vì Logan Pines là đô thị ma cuối cùng ở Trung Florida– hoặc ít nhất là khu cuối cùng mà tôi biết–nên tôi đặt rất nhiều hi vọng vào nơi này. Nhưng khi cầm đèn pin đi quanh con phố cụt duy nhất, tôi không thấy căn lều nào. Không có dấu lửa nào. Không có bao bì thực phẩm. Không dấu tích của con người. Không Margo. Ở cuối con đường, tôi thấy một móng bê-tông duy nhất ăn vào đất. Nhưng không có gì được xây ở phía trên, chỉ có hố móng lõm xuống như cái miệng há hốc của một xác chết, cây gai và cỏ dại cao đến hông rối vào nhau đâm lên xung quanh. Nếu đúng là Margo muốn tôi thấy những nơi này, tôi cũng không hiểu tại sao cô ấy muốn vậy. Và nếu Margo đã đến những khu đô thị ma và không bao giờ trở lại, cô ấy biết một nơi mà những tìm kiếm của tôi đã không phát hiện ra được.
tr: Logan Pines, Orta Florida’daki son semtimsiya da en azından benim bildiğim son semtimsiolduğu için buraya dair pek umut beslemiştim. Ama tek çıkmaz yolunda el feneriyle gezinirken hiç çadır görmedim. Kamp ateşi yoktu. Yiyecek ambalajı yoktu, insana dair herhangi bir iz yoktu. Margo yoktu. Yolun sonunda, toprağa kazılmış tek bir beton temel buldum. Ama üstüne inşa edilmiş hiçbir şey yoktu, yalnızca şaşırıp kalmış ölü bir ağız gibi toprağa kazılmış delik, çalılardan oluşan kördüğüm ve her yerde biten bel hizasında otlar vardı. Eğer Margo benim bu yerleri görmemi istemişse nedenini anlayamıyordum. Ve asla geri dönmemek üzere semtimsilere gitmişse, bütün araştırmam boyunca açığa çıkarmamış olduğum bir yer biliyordu.
es: Había depositado grandes esperanzas en Logan Pines porque era la última pseudovisión de Florida central, o al menos la última de la que yo tenía noticias. Pero no vi ninguna tienda de campaña mientras recorría con la linterna en la mano su única calle sin salida. Ningún indicio de hoguera. Ningún envoltorio de comida. Ni rastro de gente. Ni rastro de Margo. Al final del camino encontré un agujero de hormigón hundido en la tierra, pero no habían construido nada encima. Era solo el agujero, como la boca abierta de un muerto, rodeado de una maraña de zarzas y maleza de casi un metro de altura. No entendía por qué Margo habría querido que viera estos sitios. Y si había ido a las pseudovisiones para no volver, conocía un lugar que yo no había descubierto en mis investigaciones.
vi_translation: Because Logan Pines is the last ghost town in Central Florida—or at least the last one I know of—I placed a lot of hope in this place. But when I walked around the only dead-end street with a flashlight, I didn't see any shacks. There were no signs of fire. No food packaging. No traces of humans. No Margo. At the end of the road, I saw a single concrete foundation embedded in the ground. But nothing was built on top of it, just a sunken foundation pit like the gaping mouth of a corpse, with thorny bushes and waist-high weeds tangled and growing around it. If Margo really wanted me to see these places, I still don't understand why she wanted that. And if Margo had gone to these ghost towns and never returned, she knew of a place that my searches had not uncovered.
tr_translation: Since Logan Pines was the last subdivision in Central Florida, or at least the last one I knew of, I had high hopes for this place. But as I wandered down its only dead-end street with a flashlight, I saw no tents. There were no campfires. There were no food wrappers, no signs of human presence. There was no Margo. At the end of the road, I found a single concrete foundation dug into the ground. But nothing had been built on it, just a hole dug into the ground like a dead, gaping mouth, a tangle of bushes, and waist-high weeds growing everywhere. If Margo had wanted me to see these places, I couldn't understand why. And if she had gone to subdivisions never to return, she knew of a place that I had not uncovered throughout my entire investigation.
es_translation: I had placed great hopes in Logan Pines because it was the last pseudovision in central Florida, or at least the last one I had heard of. But I didn't see any tents as I walked down its only dead-end street with the flashlight in my hand. No sign of a campfire. No food wrappers. No trace of people. No trace of Margo. At the end of the road, I found a concrete hole sunk into the ground, but nothing had been built on top of it. It was just the hole, like the open mouth of a dead person, surrounded by a tangle of brambles and weeds almost a meter high. I didn't understand why Margo would have wanted me to see these places. And if she had gone to the pseudovisions never to return, she knew of a place I hadn't discovered in my research.

en: It took an hour and a half to drive back to Jefferson Park. I parked the minivan at home, changed into a polo shirt and my only nice pair of jeans, and walked down Jefferson Way to Jefferson Court, and then took a right onto Jefferson Road. A few cars were already lined up on both sides of Jefferson Place, Radar’s street. It was only eight-forty-five.
vi: Mất một tiếng rưỡi lái xe về Jefferson Park, tôi về nhà cất xe, mặc áo phông có cổ và cái quần jeans đẹp nhất, rồi đi bộ qua Jefferson Way sang Jefferson Court, rẽ phải vào Jefferson Road. Có mấy chiếc xe đã đỗ dọc hai bên Jefferson Place, phố nhà Radar. Mới tám-giờ-bốn-mươi-lăm-phút.
tr: Jefferson Park’a dönmem bir buçuk saatimi aldı. Minivam eve park ettim, üstümü değiştirip balıkçı yaka bir gömlek ile tek şık kot pantolonumu giydim ve Jefferson Yolu’ndan Jefferson Adliyesi’ne doğru yürüdüm, sonra Jefferson Caddesi’nden sağa döndüm. Radar’m sokağı olan Jefferson Meydam’nın iki tarafına da çoktan birkaç araba dizilmişti. Saat daha sekiz kırk beşti.
es: Tardé una hora y media en volver a Jefferson Park. Aparqué el coche en casa, me puse un polo y mis únicos vaqueros decentes, recorrí Jefferson Way hasta Jefferson Court y luego giré a la derecha hasta Jefferson Road. En Jefferson Place, la calle de Radar, había ya varios coches aparcados a ambos lados. Solo eran las nueve menos cuarto.
vi_translation: It took an hour and a half to drive back to Jefferson Park, I went home to park the car, put on a collared T-shirt and my best jeans, then walked through Jefferson Way to Jefferson Court, turned right onto Jefferson Road. There were a few cars already parked along both sides of Jefferson Place, Radar's street. It was only eight-forty-five.
tr_translation: It took me an hour and a half to get back to Jefferson Park. I parked the minivan at home, changed my clothes, put on a turtleneck shirt and my only stylish jeans, and walked from Jefferson Road towards Jefferson Courthouse, then turned right onto Jefferson Street. A few cars had already lined up on both sides of Jefferson Square, which is Radar's street. It was only eight forty-five.
es_translation: It took me an hour and a half to get back to Jefferson Park. I parked the car at home, put on a polo shirt and my only decent jeans, walked down Jefferson Way to Jefferson Court, and then turned right onto Jefferson Road. On Jefferson Place, Radar's street, there were already several cars parked on both sides. It was only a quarter to nine.

en: I opened the door and was greeted by Radar, who had an armful of plaster black Santas. “Gotta put away all of the nice ones,” he said. “God forbid one of them breaks.”
vi: Tôi mở cửa. Radar đón tôi, tay ôm đầy nhóc các ông già Noel da đen bằng thạch cao. “Phải cất những ông đẹp nhất đi,” nó nói. “Chúa cấm làm vỡ bất cứ ông nào.”
tr: Kapıyı açtım ve bir kucak dolusu alçıdan yapılmış zenci Noel baba tutan Radar tarafından karşılandım. “Güzel olanların hepsini kaldırmalıyım,” dedi. “Tanrı korusun, içlerinden biri kınlır.
es: Abrí la puerta y me encontré con Radar, que llevaba en las manos un montón de Santa Claus negros de yeso. —Tengo que guardar los más bonitos —me dijo—, no sea que alguno se rompa.
vi_translation: I opened the door. Radar greeted me, arms full of black Santa Claus figurines made of plaster. "We have to put away the nicest ones," it said. "God forbid any of them get broken."
tr_translation: I opened the door and was greeted by Radar holding an armful of plaster-made black Santa Clauses. “I must put away all the nice ones,” he said. “God forbid, one of them might break.”
es_translation: I opened the door and found myself face to face with Radar, who was holding a bunch of black Santa Claus figurines made of plaster in his hands. —I have to keep the prettiest ones —he told me—, just in case one of them breaks.

en: “Need any help?” I asked. Radar nodded toward the living room, where the tables on either side of the couch held three sets of unnested black Santa nesting dolls. As I renested them, I couldn’t help but notice that they were really very beautiful— hand-painted and extraordinarily detailed. I didn’t say this to Radar, though, for fear that he would beat me to death with the black Santa lamp in the living room.
vi: “Cần tôi giúp gì không?” tôi hỏi. Radar hất đầu về phía phòng khách. Trên các bàn kê dọc xô-pha có bày ba bộ búp bê làm tổ hình ông già Noel da đen. Trong khi lồng chúng vào nhau, búp bê nhỏ nằm gọn trong bụng búp bê lớn hơn, tôi không khỏi thán phục bộ búp bê rất đẹp–sơn thủ công và cực kì tinh tế. Nhưng tôi không dám hở ra với Radar vì sợ nó sẽ xử tôi tới chết bằng cây đèn hình ông già Noel da đen trong phòng khách.
tr: ‘Yardım lazım mı?” diye sordum. Radar kanepenin iki tarafındaki sehpalarda, üç grup iç içe geçirilmemiş zenci Noel Baba matruşka bebekleri bulunan salona doğru başını salladı. Onları iç içe geçirirken, gerçekten çok güzel olduklarım fark etmekten kendimi alamadım... Elle boyanmış ve olağanüstü biçimde ayrıntılıydılar. Gerçi bunu Radar’a söylemedim, beni oturma odasındaki zenci Noel baba lambasıyla öldüresiye döver diye korktuğum için.
es: —¿Necesitas ayuda? —le pregunté. Radar me señaló con la cabeza el comedor. En las mesas a ambos lados del sofá había tres juegos de muñecas rusas con forma de Santa Claus negros. Mientras metía unos dentro de los otros no pude evitar observar que en realidad eran muy bonitos. Estaban pintados a mano con todo lujo de detalles. Aunque no se lo dije a Radar, porque temía que me matara a golpes con la lámpara del Santa Claus negro del comedor.
vi_translation: “Do you need my help?” I asked. Radar nodded towards the living room. On the tables along the sofa were three sets of nesting dolls shaped like black Santa Clauses. While nesting them together, the smaller doll fitting neatly inside the larger one, I couldn't help but admire the very beautiful dolls—hand-painted and extremely delicate. But I didn't dare mention it to Radar for fear he would kill me with the black Santa Claus lamp in the living room.
tr_translation: “Do you need help?” I asked. Radar nodded towards the living room, where there were three groups of unstacked black Santa Claus nesting dolls on the side tables of the sofa. While stacking them, I couldn't help but notice how beautiful they really were... They were hand-painted and extraordinarily detailed. Though I didn't tell Radar this, fearing he might beat me to death with the black Santa Claus lamp in the living room.
es_translation: —Do you need help? —I asked him. Radar pointed out the dining room to me with his head. On the tables on either side of the sofa, there were three sets of Russian dolls shaped like black Santa Clauses. As I nested some inside the others, I couldn't help but notice that they were actually very beautiful. They were hand-painted with great detail. Although I didn't tell Radar, because I feared he might beat me to death with the black Santa Claus lamp from the dining room.

en: I carried the matryoshka dolls into the guest bedroom, where Radar was carefully stashing Santas into a dresser. “You know, when you see them all together, it really does make you question the way we imagine our myths.”
vi: Tôi mang bộ búp bê sang phòng ngủ dự phòng để Radar cẩn thận cất vào ngăn tủ. “Ông biết không, khi thấy tất cả các ông già Noel da đen này ở cùng một chỗ, điều đó thực sự khiến ta phải đặt câu hỏi về cách chúng ta tưởng tượng ra những giai thoại.”
tr: Matruşka bebekleri, Radar’m Noel babalan dikkathce şifonyere sakladığı misafir odasına taşıdım. “Hepsini bir arada gördüğün zaman, bu gerçekten mitlerimizi hayal etme şeklimizi sorgulamana sebep oluyor.
es: Llevé las muñecas rusas a la habitación de invitados, donde Radar estaba guardando Santa Claus en un tocador con mucho cuidado. —¿Sabes? Cuando los ves todos juntos, te preguntas cómo imaginamos nuestros mitos.
vi_translation: I brought the set of dolls to the guest bedroom for Radar to carefully store in the drawer. "You know, seeing all these Black Santas together in one place really makes you question the way we imagine folklore."
tr_translation: I moved the Matryoshka dolls to the guest room where Radar carefully hid Santa Clauses in the chiffonier. “When you see them all together, it really makes you question the way we imagine our myths.”
es_translation: I took the Russian dolls to the guest room, where Radar was carefully placing Santa Claus in a dresser. —You know? When you see them all together, you wonder how we imagine our myths.

en: Radar rolled his eyes. “Yeah, I always find myself questioning the way I imagine my myths when I’m eating my Lucky Charms every morning with a goddamned black Santa spoon.”
vi: Radar tròn mắt. “Ừ, tôi luôn tự đặt câu hỏi về cách tôi tưởng tượng ra các giai thoại của mình khi tôi ăn ngũ cốc Bùa May Mắn mỗi sáng bằng thìa có hình ông già Noel da đen.
tr: Radar gözlerini devirdi. “Evet, her sabah Lucky Charms kahvaltılık gevreğimi lanet olası bir zenci Noel baba kaşığıyla yerken, kendimi sürekli mitlerimi hayal etme şeklimi sorgularken buluyorum.”
es: Radar miró al techo. —Sí, me descubro a mí mismo preguntándome cómo imagino mis mitos todas las mañanas, cuando estoy comiéndome mis cereales con una puta cuchara de Santa Claus negro.
vi_translation: Radar's eyes widened. "Yeah, I always ask myself how I come up with my anecdotes while eating Lucky Charms cereal every morning with a spoon shaped like a Black Santa Claus."
tr_translation: Radar rolled his eyes. “Yes, every morning while eating my Lucky Charms cereal with a damn black Santa Claus spoon, I constantly find myself questioning the way I imagine my myths.”
es_translation: Radar looked at the ceiling. —Yes, I find myself wondering how I imagine my myths every morning, when I'm eating my cereal with a damn black Santa Claus spoon.

en: I felt a hand on my shoulder spinning me around. It was Ben, his feet fidgeting in fast-motion like he needed to pee or something. “We kissed. Like, she kissed me. About ten minutes ago. On Radar’s parents’ bed.”
vi: Bàn tay ai đó đặt lên vai tôi và xoay tôi lại. Là Ben, hai chân nó nhún nhảy chộn rộn trông như đang mắc tiểu. “Tụi tui hun nhau rùi. Lacey đã hôn tôi. Khoảng mười phút trước. Trên giường của bố mẹ Radar.”
tr: Omzumda, beni arkaya döndüren bir el hissettim. Ben’di, ayaklan hızh bir şekilde kıpırdanıyordu, çişini yapması falan gerekiyormuş gibi. “Öpüştük. Yani, o beni öptü. Yaklaşık on dakika önce. Radar’m ebeveynlerinin yatağında.
es: Sentí una mano frotándome el hombro. Era Ben, que movía los pies a toda velocidad, como si estuviera meándose. —Nos hemos besado. Bueno, me ha besado ella. Hace unos diez minutos. En la cama de los padres de Radar.
vi_translation: A hand placed on my shoulder and turned me around. It was Ben, his legs bouncing around like he needed to pee. "We kissed." Lacey kissed me. About ten minutes ago. On Radar's parents' bed."
tr_translation: I felt a hand on my shoulder, turning me around. It was Ben, his feet were shuffling quickly, as if he needed to pee or something. “We kissed. I mean, she kissed me. About ten minutes ago. In Radar’s parents’ bed.”
es_translation: I felt a hand rubbing my shoulder. It was Ben, who was moving his feet at full speed, as if he were about to pee himself. —We kissed. Well, she kissed me. About ten minutes ago. On Radar's parents' bed.

en: “That’s disgusting,” Radar said. “Don’t make out in my parents’ bed.”
vi: “Gớm quá,” Radar nói. “Đừng có mà gặm nhau trên giường bố mẹ tôi chứ.”
tr: “Bu iğrenç,” dedi Radar. “Ebeveynlerimin yatak odasında oynaşmayın.
es: —¡Qué asco! —exclamó Radar—. No os enrolléis en la cama de mis padres.
vi_translation: "Gross," Radar said. "Don't be making out on my parents' bed."
tr_translation: “This is disgusting,” said Radar. “Don't mess around in my parents' bedroom.”
es_translation: —How disgusting! —exclaimed Radar—. Don't mess around in my parents' bed.

en: “Wow, I figured you’d already gotten past that,” I said. “What with you being such a pimp and everything.”
vi: “Ái chà chà, tôi hiểu là ông đã thạo rồi nhá,” tôi trêu. “Đồ tú ông!”
tr: ‘Yay canına, bütün bunları aştığını düşünüyordum,” dedim. “Tam bir pezevenk filan olduğun için.
es: —Uau, pensaba que ya habías superado esa fase —le dije a Ben—. ¿No eras tan chulito?
vi_translation: “Oh wow, I see you’ve got the hang of it already,” I teased. "You pimp!"
tr_translation: "Oh my, I thought you were over all this," I said. "Because you're a complete pimp or something."
es_translation: —Wow, I thought you were over that phase by now —I said to Ben—. Weren't you so cocky?

en: “Shut up, bro. I’m freaked out,” he said, looking at me, his eyes almost crossed. “I don’t think I’m very good.”
vi: “Thôi ngay, ghê răng quá!” Ben nói, nó nhìn tôi, gần như thẳng vào mắt, “Tôi không nghĩ mình làm tốt lắm.”
tr: “Kapa çeneni, kardeşim. Aklımı kaçıracağım,” dedi bana bakarak, gözleri neredeyse şaşıydı. “Çok iyi olduğumu sanmıyorum.
es: —Cállate, colega. Estoy acojonado —me contestó mirándome con los ojos casi bizcos—. No creo que sea muy bueno.
vi_translation: "Stop it, it's so annoying!" Ben said, looking at me, almost straight in the eyes, "I don't think I did very well."
tr_translation: "Shut up, brother. I'm going to lose my mind," he said, looking at me, his eyes almost crossed. "I don't think I'm very well."
es_translation: —Shut up, buddy. I'm terrified —he replied, looking at me with almost cross-eyed eyes—. I don't think this is very good.

en: “At what?”
vi: “Làm gì cơ?”
tr: “Neyde?
es: —¿En qué?
vi_translation: “What are you doing?”
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —In what?

en: “At kissing. And, I mean, she’s done a lot more kissing than me over the years. I don’t want to suck so bad she dumps me. Girls dig you,” he said to me, which was at best true only if you defined the word girls as “girls in the marching band.” “Bro, I’m asking for advice.”
vi: “Hun ấy mà. Nghĩ mà xem, suốt những năm tháng qua Lacey đã hôn nhiều hơn tôi rất nhiều. Tôi không muốn mình động khẩu dở ẹc đến mức làm cậu ấy đá tôi. Các cô gái chôn ông luôn đấy,” nó nói với tôi, điều đó tối đa chỉ đúng nếu định nghĩa các cô gái theo kiểu “các cô gái trong đội diễu hành. “Này ông, tôi đang hỏi xin lời khuyên đấy.”
tr: “Öpüşmekte. Ve yani, o, yıllar boyunca öpüşme işini benden çok daha fazla yapmıştır. Beni terk edeceği kadar berbat olmak istemiyorum. Kızlar seni beğenirler,” dedi bana ki bu olsa olsa kızlar kelimesini “bando takımındaki kızlar” olarak tanımlarsanız doğruydu. “Kardeşim, tavsiye istiyorum.
es: —Besando. Y bueno, ella ha besado mucho más que yo en los últimos años. No quiero morrear tan mal que me deje. Tú gustas a las chicas —me dijo, lo que solo era cierto, y con suerte, si se entendía por «chicas» las chicas de la banda—. Colega, estoy pidiéndote consejo.
vi_translation: “It's her. Think about it, over the years Lacey has kissed way more than I have. I don't want to be so bad at kissing that she dumps me. The girls would bury you,” he said to me, which is only true if you define girls as “the girls in the marching band.” “Hey sir, I am asking for advice here.”
tr_translation: “Kissing. And I mean, he has done the kissing thing much more than I have over the years. I don't want to be so terrible that he leaves me. Girls like you,” he said to me, which was only true if you defined girls as “the girls in the band.” “Brother, I need advice.”
es_translation: —Kissing. And well, she has kissed much more than I have in recent years. I don't want to kiss so badly that she leaves me. You are liked by girls —he told me, which was only true, and hopefully, if by "girls" he meant the girls in the band—. Buddy, I'm asking you for advice.

en: I was tempted to bring up all Ben’s endless blather about the various ways in which he would rock various bodies, but I just said, “As far as I can tell, there are two basic rules: 1. Don’t bite anything without permission, and 2. The human tongue is like wasabi: it’s very powerful, and should be used sparingly.”
vi: Suýt chút nữa tôi đã khuấy động bầu nhặng xị vô đáy của Ben về những cách khác nhau nó thể áp dụng với các cô gái khác nhau, nhưng rồi tôi chỉ nói, “Theo thiển ý của tôi, có hai nguyên tắc căn bản: 1. Đừng cắn lung tung nếu không được phép, và 2. Lưỡi con người như mù tạt vậy: nồng nàn khó quên, nhưng sử dụng thận trọng thôi.”
tr: Ben’in, muhtelif vücutları sarstığı muhtelif yollarla ilgili bütün o bitmez tükenmez zırvalamalarından bahsetmeye niyetlendim ama sadece, “Söyleyebileceğim kadarıyla, iki temel kural var: 1. İzin almadan hiçbir şeyi ısırma ve 2. İnsan dili wasabi gibidir: Çok güçlüdür ve tutumlu bir şekilde kullanılmalıdır,” dedim.
es: Estuve tentado de preguntarle por los interminables rollos que nos pegaba sobre las diversas maneras de excitar cuerpos diversos, pero me limité a decirle: —Hasta donde yo sé, hay dos normas básicas: 1) No muerdas nada sin permiso, y 2) La lengua humana es como el wasabi. Es muy potente y debe utilizarse con moderación.
vi_translation: I almost stirred up Ben's endless chatter about the different ways it could be applied with different girls, but then I just said, "In my humble opinion, there are two basic principles: 1. Don't bite randomly without permission, and 2. The human tongue is like mustard: intensely memorable, but use it sparingly."
tr_translation: I intended to talk about all those endless ramblings of Ben's about the various ways he shakes various bodies, but I just said, "As far as I can tell, there are two basic rules: 1. Don't bite anything without permission and 2. The human tongue is like wasabi: It's very powerful and should be used sparingly."
es_translation: I was tempted to ask him about the endless lectures he gave us on the various ways to excite different bodies, but I limited myself to saying: —As far as I know, there are two basic rules: 1) Don't bite anything without permission, and 2) The human tongue is like wasabi. It is very potent and should be used sparingly.

en: Ben’s eyes suddenly grew bright with panic. I winced, and said, “She’s standing behind me, isn’t she?”
vi: Hai mắt Ben đột nhiên hoảng hốt sáng trưng lên. Tôi đỏ mặt nói, “Cậu ấy đang đứng sau tôi, phải không?”
tr: Ben’in gözleri aniden panikle büyüyüp parlaklaştı. İrkildim ve “Arkamda duruyor, değil mi?” dedim.
es: De repente le brillaron los ojos de pánico. Hice una mueca y dije: —Está detrás de mí, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: Ben's eyes suddenly lit up with panic. I blushed and said, "He's standing behind me, isn't he?"
tr_translation: Ben's eyes suddenly widened and brightened with panic. I flinched and said, "He's standing right behind me, isn't he?"
es_translation: Suddenly, their eyes shone with panic. I made a face and said: —It's behind me, isn't it?

en: “‘The human tongue is like wasabi,’” Lacey mimicked in a deep, goofy voice that I hoped didn’t really resemble mine.
vi: “‘Lưỡi con người như mù tạt vậy,’” Lacey nhại tôi bằng thứ giọng trầm trầm đờ đẫn mà tôi hi vọng rằng không thực sự giống giọng tôi.
tr: “İnsan dili wasabi gibidir,” diye taklit etti Lacey, kendiminkine gerçekten benzemediğini umduğum, kalın ve şapşal bir sesle.
es: —«La lengua humana es como el wasabi» —repitió Lacey con una voz profunda y ridícula que esperé que no se pareciera a la mía.
vi_translation: “‘The human tongue is like mustard,’” Lacey mimicked me in a dull, deep voice that I hoped did not actually resemble mine.
tr_translation: "Human language is like wasabi," Lacey mimicked in a thick and silly voice, which I hoped didn't really resemble mine.
es_translation: —"The human tongue is like wasabi," —repeated Lacey in a deep and ridiculous voice that I hoped did not resemble mine.

en: I wheeled around. “I actually think Ben’s tongue is like sunscreen,” she said. “It’s good for your health and should be applied liberally.”
vi: Tôi quay lại. “Thực ra tớ thấy lưỡi Ben giống kem chống nắng,” Lacey nói tiếp. “Tốt cho sức khỏe và cần được áp dụng rộng rãi.
tr: Hızla arkama döndüm. “Aslında Ben’in dilinin güneş kremi gibi olduğunu düşünüyorum,” dedi. “Sağlık için iyi ve cömert bir şekilde kullanılmalı.
es: Me giré—. La verdad es que creo que la lengua de Ben es como el protector solar. Es bueno para la salud y debes aplicarlo generosamente.
vi_translation: I turned around. “Actually, I think Ben's tongue is more like sunscreen,” Lacey continued. “Good for health and needs to be applied generously.”
tr_translation: I quickly turned around. "Actually, I think Ben's language is like sunscreen," she said. "Good for health and should be used generously."
es_translation: I turned around—. The truth is, I think Ben's tongue is like sunscreen. It's good for your health and you should apply it generously.

en: “I just threw up in my mouth,” Radar said.
vi: “Tôi nôn trong chính miệng mình mất,” Radar rên rỉ.
tr: “Az önce ağzımın içine kustum,” dedi Radar.
es: —Estoy a punto de potar —dijo Radar.
vi_translation: "I'm going to throw up in my own mouth," Radar groaned.
tr_translation: “I just threw up into my mouth,” said Radar.
es_translation: —I'm about to puke —said Radar.

en: “Lacey, you just kind of took away my will to go on,” I added.
vi: “Lacey ơi, cậu vừa lấy đi ý chí tiến lên của tớ rồi,” tôi nói thêm.
tr: “Lacey, az önce devam etme isteğimi alıp götürdün,” diye ekledim.
es: —Lacey, acabas de quitarme las ganas de seguir hablando —añadí.
vi_translation: "Lacey, you just took away my will to move forward," I added.
tr_translation: "Lacey, you just took away my desire to continue," I added.
es_translation: —Lacey, you just made me lose the desire to keep talking —I added.

en: “I wish I could stop imagining that,” Radar said.
vi: “Giá mà tôi có thể ngăn được trí tưởng tượng của mình,” Radar nói.
tr: “Keşke bunu hayal etmeyi bırakabilsem,” dedi Radar.
es: —Ojalá pudiera dejar de imaginármelo —contestó Radar.
vi_translation: "I wish I could stop my imagination," Radar said.
tr_translation: "I wish I could stop imagining this," said Radar.
es_translation: "I wish I could stop imagining it," replied Radar.

en: I said, “The very idea is so offensive that it’s actually illegal to say the words ‘Ben Starling’s tongue’ on television.”
vi: Tôi tiếp, “Chính ý tưởng đó gây xúc phạm đến mức trên thực tế, đề cập đến cụm từ ‘lưỡi của Ben Starling’ trên truyền hình là hành vi phạm pháp.
tr: “Fikrin kendisi o kadar çirkin ki, aslında ‘Ben Starling’in dili’ kelimelerini televizyonda söylemek yasadışı,” dedim.
es: —La mera idea es tan ofensiva que está prohibido decir «la lengua de Ben Starling» en la tele —dije yo.
vi_translation: I continued, "That very idea is so offensive that, in fact, mentioning the phrase 'Ben Starling's tongue' on television is illegal."
tr_translation: "The idea itself is so ugly that, in fact, it is illegal to say the words 'I am Starling's tongue' on television," I said.
es_translation: —The mere idea is so offensive that it is forbidden to say "Ben Starling's tongue" on TV —I said.

en: “The penalty for violating that law is either ten years in prison or one Ben Starling tongue bath,” Radar said.
vi: “Hình phạt đối với đối tượng vi phạm pháp luật là mười năm tù hoặc một chầu tắm lưỡi Ben Starling,” Radar tuyên án.
tr: “Bu kanunu ihlal etmenin cezası ya on yıl hapis ya da bir Ben Starling dil banyosu,” dedi Radar.
es: —El castigo por violar esta norma son diez años de cárcel o un chupeteo de Ben Starling —añadió Radar.
