vi_translation: “The punishment for the lawbreaker is ten years in prison or a tongue bath from Ben Starling,” Radar sentenced.
tr_translation: “The penalty for violating this law is either ten years in prison or a Ben Starling language bath,” said Radar.
es_translation: —The punishment for violating this rule is ten years in prison or a blowjob from Ben Starling —added Radar.

en: “Everyone,” I said.
vi: “Ai ai,” tôi nói.
tr: “Herkesin,” dedim.
es: —Todo el mundo… —dije.
vi_translation: "Oh dear," I said.
tr_translation: "Everyone's," I said.
es_translation: —Everyone… —I said.

en: “Chooses,” Radar said, smiling.
vi: “Cũng chọn,” Radar cười mím chi.
tr: “Seçtiği,” dedi Radar gülümseyerek.
es: —Prefiere… —dijo Radar sonriendo.
vi_translation: "Also chose," Radar smiled with closed lips.
tr_translation: “The one he chose,” said Radar, smiling.
es_translation: —He prefers… —said Radar, smiling.

en: “Prison,” we finished together.
vi: “Nhà tù,” bọn tôi cùng kết thúc.
tr: “Hapis,” diye birlikte bitirdik.
es: —La cárcel —dijimos los dos a la vez.
vi_translation: “The prison,” we both concluded.
tr_translation: “Prison,” we finished together.
es_translation: —The jail —we both said at the same time.

en: And then Lacey kissed Ben in front of us. “Oh God,” Radar said, waving his arms in front of his face. “Oh, God. I’m blind. I’m blind.”
vi: Và rồi Lacey hôn Ben ngay trước mặt chúng tôi. “Chúa ơi,” Radar than, vắt cánh tay trước mặt. “Ôi Chúa ơi, con mù rồi, con mù rồi.”
tr: Sonra Lacey Ben’i Önümüzde öptü. “Ah, Tanrım,” dedi Radar, kollarını yüzünün önünde sallayarak. “Ah, Tanrım. Kör oldum. Kör oldum.
es: Y entonces Lacey besó a Ben delante de nosotros. —Dios mío —exclamó Radar pasándose las manos por delante de la cara—, Dios mío, me he quedado ciego. Me he quedado ciego.
vi_translation: And then Lacey kissed Ben right in front of us. "Oh my God," Radar groaned, throwing his arm in front of his face. "Oh my God, I'm blind, I'm blind."
tr_translation: Then Lacey kissed Ben in front of us. "Oh, God," said Radar, waving his arms in front of his face. "Oh, God. I'm blind. I'm blind."
es_translation: And then Lacey kissed Ben in front of us. —My God —exclaimed Radar, passing his hands in front of his face—, My God, I have gone blind. I have gone blind.

en: “Please stop,” I said. “You’re upsetting the black Santas.”
vi: “Thôi thôi,” tôi nói, “các cậu làm các ông già Noel da đen buồn đấy.”
tr: “Lütfen dur,” dedim. “Zenci Noel babaları üzüyorsun.
es: —Basta, por favor —supliqué yo—. Estáis molestando a los Santa Claus negros.
vi_translation: "Oh no," I said, "you guys are making the black Santas sad."
tr_translation: "Please stop," I said. "You are upsetting the Black Santas."
es_translation: —Enough, please —I begged—. You are bothering the black Santa Clauses.

en: The party ended up in the formal living room on the second floor of Radar’s house, all twenty of us. I leaned against a wall, my head inches from a black Santa portrait painted on velvet. Radar had one of those sectional couches, and everyone was crowded onto it. There was beer in a cooler by the TV, but no one was drinking. Instead, they were telling stories about one another. I’d heard most of them before—band camp stories and Ben Starling stories and first kiss stories—but Lacey hadn’t heard any of them, and anyway, they were still entertaining.
vi: Bữa tiệc khép lại ở phòng tiếp khách quí trên lầu hai nhà Radar, tất cả có hai mươi đứa. Tôi dựa vào tường, đầu cách bức chân dung ông già Noel da đen vẽ trên nhung vài phân. Nhà Radar có bộ xô-pha rất bự nên mọi người đều tụ tập quanh đó. Có bia trong thùng giữ lạnh cạnh ti-vi, nhưng không ai uống cả. Thay vào đó, hết đứa nọ đến đứa kia kể chuyện. Hầu hết tôi đã từng nghe rồi–những chuyện éo le dở khóc dở cười, chuyện về Ben Starling, chuyện nụ hôn đầu–nhưng Lacey chưa nghe chuyện nào, và dù sao đó đều là những chuyện rất vui.
tr: Parti, Radar’ın evinin ikinci katındaki salonda yapıldı, yirmimiz de oradaydık. Bir duvara yaslandım, başım ile bir kadife üzerine çizilmiş Noel baba portresi arasında santimetreler vardı. Radar’da şu parçalı kanepelerden vardı ve herkes onun üstüne üşüşmüştü. Televizyonun yarımdaki soğutucuda bira vardı ama kimse içmiyordu. Bunun yerine birbirleri hakkında hikâyeler anlatıyorlardı. Çoğunu daha önce duymuştumbando kampı hikâyeleri, Ben Starling hikâyeleri ve ilk öpücük hikâyeleriama Lacey hiçbirini duymamıştı ve nasılsa, hâlâ eğlenceliydiler.
es: La fiesta acabó con las veinte personas metidas en la sala de estar de la segunda planta de la casa de Radar. Me apoyé en una pared, con la cabeza a escasos centímetros de un Santa Claus negro pintado sobre terciopelo. La gente se había amontonado en uno de esos sofás por módulos. Al lado de la tele había un frigorífico con cervezas, pero nadie bebía. Se contaban historias entre sí. Había oído la mayoría de ellas —historias de la banda, de Ben Starling, de los primeros besos—, pero Lacey no, y de todas formas seguían siendo divertidas.
vi_translation: The party wrapped up in the VIP lounge on the second floor of Radar's house, with a total of twenty kids. I leaned against the wall, my head a few inches away from a portrait of a black Santa Claus painted on velvet. Radar's house had a very large sofa, so everyone gathered around it. There was beer in a cooler next to the TV, but no one drank any. Instead, one after another, they told stories. Most of them I had heard before—awkward and hilarious stories, stories about Ben Starling, stories about first kisses—but Lacey hadn't heard any of them, and anyway, they were all very funny.
tr_translation: The party was held in the living room on the second floor of Radar's house, all twenty of us were there. I leaned against a wall, with only centimeters between my head and a portrait of Santa Claus drawn on velvet. Radar had one of those sectional sofas, and everyone was piled onto it. There was beer in the cooler next to the TV, but no one was drinking. Instead, they were telling stories about each other. I had heard most of them beforeband camp stories, Ben Starling stories, and first kiss storiesbut Lacey hadn't heard any of them, and somehow, they were still fun.
es_translation: The party ended with twenty people crammed into the living room on the second floor of Radar's house. I leaned against a wall, with my head just a few centimeters away from a black Santa Claus painted on velvet. People had crowded onto one of those modular sofas. Next to the TV, there was a fridge with beers, but no one was drinking. They were telling stories to each other. I had heard most of them —stories about the band, about Ben Starling, about first kisses— but Lacey hadn't, and they were still funny anyway.

en: I stayed mostly out of it until Ben said, “Q, how are we going to graduate?”
vi: Tôi hầu như đứng ngoài cuộc cho đến khi bị Ben tóm gáy, “Q ơi, ông sẽ tốt nghiệp ra sao ta?”
tr: Çoğunlukla konuşmanın dışında kaldım, ta ki Ben, “Q, nasıl mezun olacağız?” diyene kadar.
es: Me quedé bastante al margen hasta que Ben dijo: —Q, ¿cómo vamos a graduarnos?
vi_translation: I was mostly an outsider until Ben grabbed me by the neck, “Q, how do you think you'll graduate?”
tr_translation: I mostly stayed out of the conversation until Ben said, "Q, how are we going to graduate?"
es_translation: I stayed quite on the sidelines until Ben said: —Q, how are we going to graduate?

en: I smirked. “Naked but for our robes,” I said.
vi: Tôi mím chi nói, “Nhân trần dưới áo chùng.
tr: Sırıttım. “Çıplak ama cübbelerimizle,” dedim.
es: —Sin ropa debajo de la toga —le contesté sonriendo.
vi_translation: I bit my lip and said, "The mortal under the robe." "That's more like it!"
tr_translation: I grinned. "Naked but with our robes," I said.
es_translation: —Without clothes under the toga —I replied, smiling.

en: “Yes!” Ben sipped a Dr Pepper.
vi: “Có thế chứ!” Ben nhấp một ngụm Dr Pepper.
tr: “Evet!” Ben Dr Pepper’dan bir yudum aldı.
es: —¡Sí! Ben dio un trago a su refresco.
vi_translation: Ben took a sip of Dr Pepper.
tr_translation: “Yes!” Ben took a sip of Dr Pepper.
es_translation: —Yes! Ben took a sip of his soda.

en: “I’m not even bringing clothes, so I don’t wuss out,” Radar said.
vi: “Đây sẽ không mang quần áo đâu, đừng tưởng đây sợ nhé,” Radar tuyên bố.
tr: “Kıyafet bile getirmeyeceğim, böylece ödleklik etme şansım olmaz,” dedi Radar.
es: —Yo ni siquiera me llevaré ropa para no rajarme —dijo Radar.
vi_translation: "I won't be wearing any clothes, don't think I'm scared," Radar declared.
tr_translation: "I won't even bring any clothes, so I won't have a chance to chicken out," said Radar.
es_translation: —I won't even bring clothes so I don't chicken out —said Radar.

en: “Me neither! Q, swear not to bring clothes.”
vi: “Tôi cũng vậy! Q, ông thề là ông sẽ không mang quần áo theo đi.”
tr: “Ben de! Q, kıyafet getirmeyeceğine yemin et.
es: —¡Yo tampoco! Q, jura que no te llevarás ropa.
vi_translation: “Me too!” Q, you swore you wouldn't bring any clothes.”
tr_translation: “Me too! Q, swear that you won't bring any clothes.”
es_translation: —Me neither! Q, swear that you won't take any clothes.

en: I smiled. “Duly sworn,” I said.
vi: Tôi cười, “Long trọng xin thề.”
tr: Gülümsedim. “Yemin ederim.
es: Sonreí. —Jurado queda —le dije.
vi_translation: I laughed, "I solemnly swear."
tr_translation: I smiled. “I swear.”
es_translation: I smiled. —Jury remains —I told him.

en: “I’m in!” said our friend Frank. And then more and more of the guys got behind the idea. The girls, for some reason, were resistant.
vi: “Tôi nhập cuộc với!” Frank bạn của bọn tôi nói. Cứ thế càng có thêm mấy thằng con trai gia tăng quân số nhân trần dưới áo chùng. Tụi con gái có lí do để kháng cự.
tr: “Ben de varım!” dedi arkadaşımız Frank. Ve sonra gittikçe daha fazla kişi bu fikrin arkasmda durdu. Kızlar, nedense, direniyordu.
es: —¡Me apunto! —exclamó nuestro amigo Frank. Y entonces los chicos empezaron a sumarse a la idea. Por alguna razón, las chicas se resistían.
vi_translation: "I'm joining in!" our friend Frank said. More and more boys joined in, increasing the number of naked bodies under the robes. The girls had reasons to resist.
tr_translation: "I'm in too!" said our friend Frank. And then more and more people stood behind this idea. The girls, for some reason, were resisting.
es_translation: —I'm in! —exclaimed our friend Frank. And then the boys started to join the idea. For some reason, the girls resisted.

en: Radar said to Angela, “Your refusal to do this makes me question the whole foundation of our love.”
vi: Radar quay sang Angela, “Sự phủ quyết của cậu khiến tớ phải đặt dấu hỏi cho nền móng tình cảm của chúng ta.”
tr: Radar, Angela’ya, “Bunu yapmayı reddetmen, aşkımızın bütün temelini sorgulamama neden oluyor,” dedi.
es: —Tu negativa hace que me cuestione el sentido de nuestro amor —dijo Radar a Angela.
vi_translation: Radar turned to Angela, "Your veto makes me question the foundation of our relationship."
tr_translation: Radar said to Angela, "Your refusal to do this makes me question the very foundation of our love."
es_translation: —Your refusal makes me question the meaning of our love —said Radar to Angela.

en: “You don’t get it,” Lacey said. “It’s not that we’re afraid. It’s just that we already have our dresses picked out.”
vi: “Cậu chẳng hiểu gì cả,” Lacey nói. “Tụi này không sợ. Chỉ là tụi này đã chọn sẵn áo đầm để diện rồi.”
tr: “Anlamıyorsun,” dedi Lacey. “Korktuğumuzdan değil. Sadece elbiselerimizi çoktan seçtiğimiz için.
es: —No lo entiendes —comentó Lacey—. No es que nos dé miedo. Es solo que ya hemos elegido el vestido.
vi_translation: “You don't understand anything,” Lacey said. “We are not afraid. It's just that we have already chosen the dresses to wear.”
tr_translation: “You don't understand,” said Lacey. “It's not because we're scared. It's just that we've already chosen our dresses.”
es_translation: —You don't understand —commented Lacey—. It's not that we're scared. It's just that we've already chosen the dress.

en: Angela pointed at Lacey. “Exactly.” Angela added, “Y’all better hope it’s not windy.”
vi: Angela chỉ vào Lacey, hưởng ứng ngay. “Chính xác.” Rồi Angela còn dặn, “Các cậu nên hi vọng hôm ấy trời đừng trở gió.”
tr: Angela, Lacey’yi işaret etti. “Kesinlikle.
es: —Exacto —dijo Angela señalando a Lacey. —Más os vale que no haga viento —añadió Angela.
vi_translation: Angela pointed at Lacey, immediately responding. "Exactly." Then Angela added, "You guys should hope it doesn't get windy that day."
tr_translation: Angela pointed at Lacey. "Definitely."
es_translation: —Exactly —said Angela pointing at Lacey. —You better hope it's not windy —added Angela.

en: “I hope it is windy,” Ben said. “The world’s largest balls benefit from fresh air.”
vi: “Tớ lại mong gió to,” Ben nói. “Không khí trong lành có lợi cho đôi bi bự nhất thế giới.
tr: Hepiniz havanın rüzgârlı olmayacağını umsanız iyi olur,” diye ekledi. “Umarım rüzgârlı olur,” dedi Ben. “Dünyanın en büyük topları temiz havadan faydalanır.
es: —Espero que sí haga viento —dijo Ben—. A las bolas más grandes del mundo les sienta bien el aire fresco.
vi_translation: "I actually hope for strong winds," Ben said. "Fresh air is good for the world's biggest marbles."
tr_translation: "You all better hope the weather won't be windy," she added. “I hope it will be windy,” said Ben. “The largest balloons in the world benefit from fresh air.”
es_translation: —I hope it is windy —said Ben—. The world's biggest balls benefit from fresh air.

en: Lacey put a hand to her face, ashamed. “You’re a challenging boyfriend,” she said. “Rewarding, but challenging.” We laughed.
vi: Lacey che mặt xấu hổ. “Cậu là anh bạn trai khó nhằn,” Lacey nói. “Ra tấm ra món, nhưng khó nhằn.” Bọn tôi cười nghiêng ngả.
tr: Lacey utanarak bir elini yüzüne koydu. “Zorlu bir erkek arkadaşsın,” dedi. “Değerli ama zorlu.” Güldük.
es: Lacey, avergonzada, se llevó una mano a la cara. —Eres un novio desafiante —comentó—. Gratificante, pero desafiante. Nos reímos.
vi_translation: Lacey covered her face in embarrassment. "You are a difficult boyfriend," Lacey said. "A proper one, but difficult." We laughed uproariously.
tr_translation: Lacey, blushing, put a hand to her face. “You’re a challenging boyfriend,” she said. “Valuable but challenging.” We laughed.
es_translation: Lacey, embarrassed, brought a hand to her face. —You are a challenging boyfriend —she commented—. Rewarding, but challenging. We laughed.

en: This was what I liked most about my friends: just sitting around and telling stories. Window stories and mirror stories. I only listened—the stories on my mind weren’t that funny.
vi: Đây là những gì tôi yêu nhất ở những người bạn của mình: chỉ ngồi với nhau và tán chuyện. Những câu chuyện cửa sổ và những câu chuyện gương soi. Tôi chỉ lắng nghe– những câu chuyện trong tâm trí tôi không vui vẻ rộn rã đến vậy.
tr: Bu, arkadaşlarımla ilgili en sevdiğim şeydi: boş boş oturup hikâyeler anlatmak. Pencere hikâyeleri ve ayna hikâyeleri. Yalnızca dinledim... Aklımdaki hikâyeler o kadar eğlenceli değildi.
es: Era lo que más me gustaba de mis amigos, que nos bastaba con sentarnos a contar historias. Historias ventana e historias espejo. Yo solo escuchaba. Las historias que tenía en mente no eran tan divertidas.
vi_translation: This is what I love most about my friends: just sitting together and chatting. Window stories and mirror stories. I just listen– the stories in my mind are not as cheerful and lively.
tr_translation: This was my favorite thing about my friends: sitting idly and telling stories. Window stories and mirror stories. I only listened... The stories in my mind were not as fun.
es_translation: It was what I liked most about my friends, that we were content just sitting and telling stories. Window stories and mirror stories. I just listened. The stories I had in mind weren't as fun.

en: I couldn’t help but think about school and everything else ending. I liked standing just outside the couches and watching them—it was a kind of sad I didn’t mind, and so I just listened, letting all the happiness and the sadness of this ending swirl around in me, each sharpening the other. For the longest time, it felt kind of like my chest was cracking open, but not precisely in an unpleasant way.
vi: Tôi không thể không nghĩ đến trường phổ thông và kết thúc của tất cả. Tôi thích chỉ đứng cạnh xô-pha và nhìn ngắm đám bạn–có vẻ hơi buồn một chút nhưng tôi thấy ổn, và tôi chỉ lắng nghe, mặc tất cả những niềm vui và nỗi buồn của kết cục này xoáy cuộn quanh tôi, cái này mài vào cái kia. Trong khoảnh khắc dài nhất, dường như lồng ngực tôi đang rạn mở, nhưng không phải là một cách không dễ chịu.
tr: Okulun ve diğer her şeyin bittiğini düşünmekten kendimi alamadım. Sadece kanepelerin dışında durup onları izlemek hoşuma gitti... Benim için sakıncası olmayan bir hüzün türüydü ve sadece dinledim, içimdeki bu bitiş girdabının bütün mutluluğunun ve hüznünün birbirini bilemesine izin vererek. Uzun zaman boyunca sanki göğsüm çatlayıp açıhyormuş gibi geldi ama tam olarak kötü bir şekilde değil.
es: No podía evitar pensar que el instituto y todo lo demás se acababa. Me gustaba estar algo apartado de los sofás, observándolos. No me importaba que fuera un poco triste. Me limitaba a escuchar dejando que toda la alegría y toda la tristeza de aquel final giraran a mi alrededor, cada una intensificando la otra. Casi todo el tiempo parecía que fuera a explotarme el pecho, pero no era exactamente una sensación desagradable.
vi_translation: I can't help but think about high school and the end of it all. I like just standing next to the sofa and watching my friends—it seems a bit sad, but I feel okay, and I just listen, letting all the joys and sorrows of this ending swirl around me, one grinding against the other. For the longest moment, it felt like my chest was splitting open, but not in an unpleasant way.
tr_translation: I couldn't help but think that school and everything else was over. I just enjoyed standing outside the couches and watching them... It was a kind of sadness that didn't bother me, and I just listened, allowing all the joy and sorrow of this ending vortex inside me to sharpen each other. For a long time, it felt like my chest was cracking open, but not exactly in a bad way.
es_translation: I couldn't help thinking that high school and everything else was coming to an end. I liked being somewhat apart from the sofas, observing them. I didn't mind that it was a bit sad. I just listened, letting all the joy and all the sadness of that ending swirl around me, each intensifying the other. Almost all the time it felt like my chest was going to explode, but it wasn't exactly an unpleasant sensation.

en: I left just before midnight. Some people were staying later, but it was my curfew, and plus I didn’t feel like staying. Mom was half asleep on the couch, but she perked up when she saw me. “Did you have fun?”
vi: Tôi ra về trước nửa đêm. Mấy đứa khác ở lại muộn hơn, nhưng đó là giờ giới nghiêm của tôi, mà tôi cũng không muốn ở lại thêm. Mẹ lơ mơ ngủ trên xô-pha, nhưng nhỏm dậy khi thấy tôi. “Vui không con?”
tr: Geceyarısmdan hemen önce çıktım. Bazıları hâlâ oradaydı ama benim için eve dönme saatiydi ve canım kalmak istemiyordu. Annem kanepede uyukluyordu ama beni görünce kendine geldi. “Eğlendin mi?
es: Me marché justo antes de las doce. Algunos iban a quedarse hasta más tarde, pero yo tenía que estar en casa a esa hora, y además no me apetecía quedarme. Mi madre estaba medio dormida en el sofá, pero se espabiló nada más verme. —¿Te lo has pasado bien?
vi_translation: I went home before midnight. The others stayed later, but that was my curfew, and I didn't want to stay any longer. Mom was dozing on the sofa, but she sat up when she saw me. "Did you have fun, dear?"
tr_translation: I left just before midnight. Some were still there, but it was time for me to go home and I didn't feel like staying. My mother was dozing on the couch, but she perked up when she saw me. "Did you have fun?"
es_translation: I left just before twelve. Some were going to stay until later, but I had to be home at that time, and besides, I didn't feel like staying. My mother was half asleep on the couch, but she perked up as soon as she saw me. —Did you have a good time?

en: “Yeah,” I said. “It was pretty chill.”
vi: “Dạ,” tôi đáp, “vui run cả người ạ.”
tr: “Evet,” dedim. “Oldukça iyiydi.
es: —Sí —le contesté—. Ha sido una fiesta muy tranquila.
vi_translation: “Yes,” I replied, “I'm trembling with excitement.”
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said. “It was quite good.”
es_translation: —Yes —I replied—. It has been a very quiet party.

en: “Just like you,” she said, smiling. This sentiment struck me as hilarious, but I didn’t say anything. She stood up and pulled me into her, kissing me on the cheek. “I really like being your mom,” she said.
vi: “Y như con nhỉ,” mẹ cười. Cảm giác đó làm tôi thấy phấn chấn, nhưng tôi không nói gì. Mẹ đứng dậy kéo tôi vào lòng, hôn lên má tôi. “Mẹ thích làm mẹ của con lắm.”
tr: “Tıpkı senin gibi,” dedi gülümseyerek. Bu yorum bana komik geldi ama hiçbir şey söylemedim. Ayağa kalkıp beni kendine çekti ve yanağımdan öptü. “Senin annen olmak gerçekten hoşuma gidiyor,” dedi.
es: —Como tú —me dijo sonriendo. Aquel ataque sentimental me pareció un tanto hilarante, pero no dije nada. Se levantó, tiró de mí y me dio un beso en la mejilla. —Me gusta mucho ser tu madre —me dijo.
vi_translation: “Just like you, huh,” mom laughed. That feeling made me feel elated, but I didn't say anything. Mom stood up, pulled me into her arms, and kissed my cheek. “I love being your mom.”
tr_translation: “Just like you,” she said, smiling. This comment seemed funny to me, but I didn't say anything. She stood up, pulled me towards her, and kissed me on the cheek. “I really enjoy being your mother,” she said.
es_translation: —Like you —he told me, smiling. That sentimental outburst seemed somewhat hilarious to me, but I didn't say anything. She stood up, pulled me, and gave me a kiss on the cheek. —I really like being your mother —she told me.

en: “Thanks,” I said.
vi: “Cảm ơn mẹ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Teşekkürler,” dedim.
es: —Gracias —le contesté.
vi_translation: "Thank you, Mom," I said.
tr_translation: "Thank you," I said.
es_translation: —Thank you —I replied.

en: I went to bed with the Whitman, flipping to the part I’d liked before, where he spends all the time hearing the opera and the people.
vi: Tôi leo lên giường với cuốn Whitman, giở đến đoạn tôi thích, khi ông ấy dành toàn bộ thời gian nghe opera và những người khác.
tr: Whitman’la beraber yatağa girdim, daha önce sevdiğim bölüme, bütün zamanım operayı ve insanları duyarak geçirdiği yere doğru sayfaları çevirdim.
es: Me metí en la cama con el libro de Whitman y pasé las páginas hasta la parte que me había gustado, donde se dedica a escuchar ópera y a la gente.
vi_translation: I climbed into bed with a Whitman book, turned to the part I like, where he spends all his time listening to opera and others.
tr_translation: I got into bed with Whitman, turned the pages to the section I loved before, the place where all my time was spent hearing the opera and the people.
es_translation: I got into bed with Whitman's book and flipped through the pages to the part I liked, where he dedicates himself to listening to opera and to people.

en: After all that hearing, he writes, “I am exposed . . . . cut by bitter and poisoned hail.” That was perfect, I thought: you listen to people so that you can imagine them, and you hear all the terrible and wonderful things people do to themselves and to one another, but in the end the listening exposes you even more than it exposes the people you’re trying to listen to.
vi: Sau tất cả những ngồi nghe ấy, ông viết, “Ta được phô bày... bị cắt rời trong mưa đá đắng độc.” Thật hoàn hảo, tôi nghĩ: mình lắng nghe người khác để mình có thể tưởng tượng được về họ, mình nghe thấy tất cả những khủng khiếp và kì diệu con người gây ra cho bản thân và cho những người khác, nhưng rút cục sự lắng nghe phô bày chính mình nhiều hơn là nó phô bày những người mình đang gắng sức lắng nghe.
tr: Bütün o işittiklerinden sonra şöyle yazıyor: “Açıktayım... acı ve zehirli doluyla parçalanıyorum.” Bu mükemmel, diye düşündüm: İnsanları hayal edebilmek için onları dinliyorsun ve insanların kendilerine ve birbirlerine yaptığı bütün korkunç ve harika şey leri duyuyorsun ama sonuçta dinlemek seni, dinlemeye çalıştığın insanlardan daha fazla açığa çıkarıyor.
es: Después de escucharlo todo, escribe: «Iracundas y amargas olas me cortan, casi me ahogo». Pensé que era perfecto. Escuchas a las personas para poder imaginarlas, oyes todas las cosas terribles y maravillosas que las personas se hacen a sí mismas y a los demás, pero al final escuchar te ahoga todavía más que la gente a la que intentas escuchar.
vi_translation: After all that listening, he wrote, "I am revealed... severed in the bitter hail." Perfect, I thought: I listen to others so that I can imagine them, I hear all the horrors and wonders that people inflict upon themselves and upon others, but ultimately, the act of listening reveals more about myself than it does about those I am striving to listen to.
tr_translation: After hearing all of that, he writes: "I am exposed... I am being shattered by the bitter and poisonous hail." This is perfect, I thought: You listen to people to be able to imagine them and all the terrible and wonderful things people do to themselves and to each other You hear them, but in the end, listening reveals more about you than the people you are trying to listen to.
es_translation: After listening to everything, he writes: "Angry and bitter waves cut me, I almost drown." I thought it was perfect. You listen to people to be able to imagine them, you hear all the terrible and wonderful things that people do to themselves and to others, but in the end, listening drowns you even more than the people you are trying to listen to.

en: Walking through pseudovisions and trying to listen to her does not crack the Margo Roth Spiegelman case so much as it cracks me. Pages later—hearing and exposed—Whitman starts to write about all the travel he can do by imagining, and lists all the places he can visit while loafing on the grass. “My palms cover continents,” he writes.
vi: Lang thang trong những đô thị ma và cố gắng lắng nghe cô ấy không làm nứt được cái vỏ bọc Margo Roth Spiegelman nhiều như đã làm nứt chính tôi. Mấy trang sau–nghe và bị phô bày–Whitman bắt đầu viết về tất cả những viễn du ông có thể thực hiện trong tưởng tượng, và liệt kê tất cả những nơi ông có thể ghé thăm trong khi an nhiên trên cỏ. “Lòng bàn tay ta trùm lên những lục địa,” ông viết.
tr: Semtimsilerde gezinmek ve onu dinlemeye çalışmak, Margo Roth Spiegelman esrarım beni araladığı kadar aralamıyor. Sonraki sayfalardaduyan ve açıkta kalanWhitman hayal ederek yapabildiği bütün seyahatleri yazmaya başhyor ve çimenin üzerinde aylaklık ederek gidebildiği bütün yerleri sıralıyor. “Avuçlarım kıtaları kaplar,” diye yazıyor.
es: Recorrer pseudovisiones e intentar escuchar a Margo no resquebraja tanto el caso de Margo Roth Spiegelman como me resquebraja a mí. Unas páginas después —escuchando y ahogándose—. Whitman empieza a escribir sobre los viajes que puede hacer con la imaginación, y enumera todos los lugares a los que puede ir tumbado en la hierba. «Las palmas de mis manos abarcan continentes», escribe.
vi_translation: Wandering through ghost towns and trying to listen to her didn't crack the shell of Margo Roth Spiegelman as much as it cracked me. A few pages later–listening and being exposed–Whitman began to write about all the journeys he could undertake in his imagination, and listed all the places he could visit while lying peacefully on the grass. “My palm covers continents,” he wrote.
tr_translation: Wandering through the suburbs and trying to listen to him doesn't unravel the mystery of Margo Roth Spiegelman as much as it unravels me. On the following pages, Whitman starts writing about all the travels he can imagine, hearing and exposing, and lists all the places he can go by idling on the grass. “My palms cover continents,” he writes.
es_translation: Exploring pseudovisions and trying to listen to Margo doesn't fracture the case of Margo Roth Spiegelman as much as it fractures me. A few pages later —listening and drowning—. Whitman begins to write about the journeys he can take with his imagination, and lists all the places he can go while lying in the grass. “The palms of my hands encompass continents,” he writes.

en: I kept thinking about maps, like the way sometimes when I was a kid I would look at atlases, and just the looking was kind of like being somewhere else. This is what I had to do. I had to hear and imagine my way into her map.
vi: Tôi vẫn nghĩ về những tấm bản đồ, như hồi bé thỉnh thoảng tôi xem bản đồ, và chỉ xem thôi cũng có chút cảm giác như mình đang ở nơi khác rồi. Đây là những gì tôi phải làm. Tôi phải nghe và tưởng tượng con đường của tôi trong bản đồ của cô ấy.
tr: Çocukken bazen atlaslara baktığım şekilde, haritaları düşünmeye devam ettim ve sadece bakma eylemi bile bir bakıma başka bir yerde olmak gibiydi. Yapmam gereken şey buydu. Onun haritasına giriş yolumu duymam ve hayal etmem gerekiyordu.
es: Pienso en mapas, en cómo de niño observaba de vez en cuando un atlas, y el mero hecho de observarlo era como estar en otro sitio. Eso era lo que tenía que hacer. Tenía que oír e imaginar mi camino en su mapa.
vi_translation: I still think about maps, like when I was a child, sometimes I would look at maps, and just looking at them gave me a feeling as if I were somewhere else. This is what I have to do. I have to listen and imagine my path in her map.
tr_translation: When I was a child, I continued to think about maps in the way I sometimes looked at atlases, and even the act of looking itself was in a way like being somewhere else. This was what I needed to do. I needed to hear and imagine my way into his map.
es_translation: I think about maps, about how as a child I would occasionally look at an atlas, and just observing it was like being somewhere else. That was what I had to do. I had to listen and imagine my way on its map.

en: But hadn’t I been trying to do that? I looked up at the maps above my computer. I had tried to plot her possible travels, but just as the grass stood for too much, so Margo stood for too much. It seemed impossible to pin her down with maps. She was too small and the space covered by the maps too big. They were more than a waste of time—they were the physical representation of the total fruitlessness of all of it, my absolute inability to develop the kinds of palms that cover continents, to have the kind of mind that correctly imagines.
vi: Nhưng chẳng phải tôi đã cố làm vậy rồi hay sao? Tôi đã xem những bản đồ treo phía trên máy tính của tôi. Tôi đã cố gắng vạch ra lộ trình cô ấy có thể đi, nhưng giống như cánh cỏ mang quá nhiều ẩn dụ, ở Margo cũng có quá nhiều. Dường như không thể nào ghim được cô ấy xuống những bản đồ. Cô ấy quá bé nhỏ và không gian những tấm bản đồ quá lớn. Những bản đồ này còn hơn cả sự lãng phí thời gian–chúng là biểu hiện hữu hình của những kết luận hoàn toàn vô ích, sự bất lực tuyệt đối của tôi khi muốn tạo ra những lòng bàn tay trùm lên các lục địa, muốn có bộ óc biết tưởng tượng đúng.
tr: Ama bunu yapmaya çalışmamış mıydım? Bilgisayarımın üstündeki haritalara baktım. Muhtemel yolculuklarını çizmeye çalışmıştım ama tıpkı çimenin çok fazla şey ifade etmesi gibi Margo da çok fazla şey ifade ediyordu. Onu haritalarla saptamak imkânsız gibi görünüyordu. 0 çok küçük, haritaların kapladığı alansa çok büyüktü. Haritalar zaman kaybından çok daha fazlasıydı... onlar, benim kıtaları kaplayan avuçlar geliştirmedeki ve doğru düzgün hayal eden türde bir zihne sahip olmadaki mutlak acizliğimin, bütün bunların toplam verimsizliğinin fiziksel temsilleriydi.
es: Pero ¿no lo había intentado? Levanté la mirada hacia los mapas que estaban por encima del ordenador. Había intentado trazar sus posibles viajes, pero Margo representaba demasiadas cosas, como la hierba. Parecía imposible ubicarla en los mapas. Era demasiado pequeña y el espacio que abarcaban los mapas, demasiado grande. Eran más que una pérdida de tiempo. Eran la representación física de la ineficacia de todo aquello, mi absoluta incapacidad de desarrollar palmas que abarcaran continentes, de tener una cabeza que imaginara correctamente.
vi_translation: But hadn't I already tried to do that? I had looked at the maps hanging above my computer. I had tried to chart out the route she might take, but like the grass carrying too many metaphors, Margo also had too many. It seemed impossible to pin her down on the maps. She was too small and the space on the maps was too large. These maps were more than just a waste of time—they were the tangible manifestation of completely useless conclusions, my absolute inability to create palms that could cover continents, to have a mind that could imagine correctly.
tr_translation: But hadn't I tried to do this? I looked at the maps on top of my computer. I had tried to chart her possible journeys, but just as grass meant too much, Margo also meant too much. It seemed impossible to pinpoint her with maps. She was very small, while the area covered by the maps was very large. The maps were much more than a waste of time... they were physical representations of my absolute inability to develop continent-spanning hands and to possess the kind of mind that imagines properly, the total inefficiency of all this.
es_translation: But hadn't I tried? I looked up at the maps that were above the computer. I had tried to trace her possible journeys, but Margo represented too many things, like the grass. It seemed impossible to locate her on the maps. She was too small and the space covered by the maps, too large. They were more than a waste of time. They were the physical representation of the inefficacy of it all, my absolute incapacity to develop palms that could encompass continents, to have a mind that could imagine correctly.

en: I got up and walked over to the maps and tore them off the wall, the pins and tacks flying out with the paper and falling to the ground. I balled up the maps and threw them in the garbage can. On my way back to bed I stepped on a tack, like an idiot, and even though I was annoyed and exhausted and out of pseudovisions and ideas, I had to pick up all the thumbtacks scattered around the carpet so I didn’t step on them later. I just wanted to punch the wall, but I had to pick up those stupid goddamned thumbtacks. When I finished, I got back into bed and socked my pillow, my teeth clenched.
vi: Tôi đứng dậy, đến trước những tấm bản đồ và giật chúng khỏi tường, những ghim mũ bung khỏi mặt giấy, rơi vương xuống sàn. Tôi vo tròn lũ bản đồ và ném hết vào thùng rác. Khi quay về giường, tôi ngớ ngẩn dẫm phải một ghim mũ. Dù đang cáu, cạn kiệt sức lực và ý tưởng, cạn kiệt cả những khu đô thị ma, tôi vẫn phải nhặt đám ghim mũ lăn lung tung trên thảm lên để không dẫm phải nữa. Tôi chỉ muốn dồn sức nện lên tường, nhưng tôi phải nhặt hết đám ghim mũ ngu ngốc chết tiệt này đã. Xong hết, tôi quay về giường, đấm thật lực vào gối, hai hàm răng nghiến chặt.
tr: Yataktan kalkıp haritalara doğru yürüdüm ve onları duvardan söktüm, iğneler ve raptiyeler kâğıttan fırlıyor ve yere düşüyordu. Haritaları top haline getirip çöp kutusuna attım. Yatağa dönerken, aptal gibi, bir raptiyeye bastım ve sıkkın, yorgun, semtimsilerim ve fikirlerim tükenmiş olmasına rağmen daha sonra üstlerine basmayayım diye halının üstüne saçılmış bütün raptiyeleri kaldırmak zorunda kaldım. Sadece duvarı yumruklamak istiyordum ama o lanet olası aptal raptiyeleri toplamak zorundaydım. Bitirdiğimde yatağa geri döndüm ve dişlerimi sıkarak yastığı yumrukladım.
es: Me levanté, me dirigí a los mapas y tiré de ellos. Las chinchetas se desprendieron con el papel y cayeron al suelo. Arrugué los mapas y los lancé a la papelera. De vuelta a la cama pisé una chincheta, como un idiota, y aunque estaba enfadado, agotado y me había quedado sin pseudovisiones y sin ideas, tuve que recoger todas las chinchetas esparcidas por la moqueta para no pisarlas después. Lo que me pedía el cuerpo era pegarle un puñetazo a la pared, pero tuve que recoger las putas chinchetas. Cuando hube acabado, volví a meterme en la cama y le pegué un puñetazo a la almohada con los dientes apretados.
vi_translation: I stood up, went to the maps, and tore them off the wall, the thumbtacks popping out of the paper and scattering on the floor. I crumpled the maps and threw them all into the trash can. When I returned to the bed, I stupidly stepped on a thumbtack. Even though I was angry, exhausted, and out of ideas, drained of even the ghost towns, I still had to pick up the scattered thumbtacks on the carpet to avoid stepping on them again. I just wanted to pound the wall with all my might, but I had to pick up all these damn stupid thumbtacks first. Once done, I returned to the bed, punched the pillow hard, my teeth clenched tightly.
tr_translation: I got out of bed, walked towards the maps, and took them off the wall, pins and tacks flying out of the paper and falling to the floor. I crumpled the maps into a ball and threw them into the trash can. As I was returning to bed, like an idiot, I stepped on a tack and, annoyed, tired, drained of my energy and ideas, I had to pick up all the tacks scattered on the carpet so I wouldn't step on them later. I just wanted to punch the wall, but I had to pick up those damn stupid tacks. When I finished, I went back to bed and punched the pillow, gritting my teeth.
es_translation: I got up, went to the maps, and pulled them down. The thumbtacks came off with the paper and fell to the floor. I crumpled the maps and threw them in the trash can. On my way back to bed, I stepped on a thumbtack, like an idiot, and although I was angry, exhausted, and had run out of pseudo-visions and ideas, I had to pick up all the thumbtacks scattered on the carpet so I wouldn't step on them later. What my body wanted was to punch the wall, but I had to pick up the damn thumbtacks. When I was done, I got back into bed and punched the pillow with clenched teeth.

en: I started trying to read the Whitman again, but between it and thinking of Margo, I felt exposed enough for this night. So finally I put the book down. I couldn’t be bothered to get up and turn off the light. I just stared at the wall, my blinks growing longer. And every time I opened my eyes, I saw where each map had been—the four holes marking the rectangle, and the pinholes seemingly randomly distributed inside the rectangle. I’d seen a similar pattern before. In the empty room above the rolled-up carpet.
vi: Tôi cố đọc Whitman trở lại, nhưng giữa những trang sách và suy nghĩ về Margo, tôi cảm thấy đêm nay mình bị phơi bày thế là quá đủ rồi. Cuối cùng tôi đặt sách xuống, không buồn dậy tắt đèn nữa. Tôi chỉ nhìn chong chong lên tường, dần dần nhắm mắt lại lâu hơn. Mỗi lần mở mắt ra, tôi lại thấy mảng tường treo từng tấm bản đồ–bốn lỗ thành hình chữ nhật, những lỗ cắm ghim mũ rải rác trong hình chữ nhật đó. Tôi từng nhìn thấy khuôn hình kiểu này rồi. Trong gian phòng trống, phía trên tấm thảm được cuộn lại.
tr: Tekrar Whitman’ı okumaya çalışmaya başladım ama şiir ile Margo’yu düşünmenin arasında, bu gece için yeterince açıkta kalmış hissediyordum. Bu yüzden sonunda kitabı kenara koydum. Kalkıp ışığı kapatabilecek halim bile yoktu. Sadece gözlerimi dikip duvara baktım, göz kırpmalarım gittikçe uzadı. Ve her gözümü açtığımda, her bir haritanın önceden bulunduğu yeri gördüm... dört delik bir dikdörtgen oluşturuyordu ve iğne delikleri dikdörtgenin içine rastgele dağıtılmış gibiydi. Benzer bir şekli daha önce görmüştüm. Boş odada, sarılmış halının üstünde.
es: Intenté seguir leyendo el libro de Whitman, pero entre la lectura y el no dejar de pensar en Margo, me sentí lo bastante ahogado por esa noche, así que al final dejé el libro. Ni me molesté en levantarme a apagar la luz. Me quedé mirando la pared, parpadeando cada vez más. Y cada vez que abría los ojos veía el trozo de pared en el que habían estado los mapas, los cuatro agujeros formando un rectángulo, y los agujeros dentro del rectángulo, repartidos al azar. Había visto antes un dibujo similar. En la sala vacía, por encima de la moqueta.
vi_translation: I tried to read Whitman again, but between the pages of the book and thoughts of Margo, I felt that tonight I had been exposed enough already. Finally, I put the book down, not even bothering to get up and turn off the light. I just stared at the wall, gradually closing my eyes for longer periods. Every time I opened my eyes, I saw the wall with maps hanging on it—four holes forming a rectangle, with pinholes scattered within that rectangle. I had seen this pattern before. In the empty room, above the rolled-up carpet.
tr_translation: I started trying to read Whitman again, but between thinking about poetry and Margo, I've had enough exposure for tonight I was feeling it. That's why I finally put the book aside. I didn't even have the strength to get up and turn off the light. I just stared at the wall, my blinks growing longer and longer. And every time I opened my eyes, I saw where each map used to be... four holes forming a rectangle, and the pinholes seemed randomly distributed within the rectangle. I had seen a similar shape before. In the empty room, on the rolled-up carpet.
es_translation: I tried to keep reading Whitman's book, but between reading and not stopping thinking about Margo, I felt suffocated enough for that night, so in the end, I put the book down. I didn't even bother to get up to turn off the light. I stayed staring at the wall, blinking more and more. And every time I opened my eyes, I saw the piece of wall where the maps had been, the four holes forming a rectangle, and the holes inside the rectangle, scattered randomly. I had seen a similar drawing before. In the empty room, above the carpet.

en: A map. With plotted points.
vi: Một bản đồ. Với những địa danh được đánh dấu.
tr: Bir harita, işaretlenmiş noktalarla.
es: Un mapa. Con puntos marcados.
vi_translation: A map. With marked locations.
tr_translation: A map with marked points.
es_translation: A map. With marked points.

en: I woke up with the sunlight just before seven on Saturday morning. Amazingly, Radar was online.
vi: Tôi thức dậy trong nắng, chưa đến bảy giờ sáng thứ Bảy. Đáng ngạc nhiên, Radar đang ở trên mạng.
tr: Cumartesi sabahı, yediden hemen önce günışığıyla uyandım. Şaşırtıcı bir şekilde Radar çevrimiçiydi.
es: El sábado, la luz me despertó poco antes de las siete de la mañana. Por increíble que parezca, Radar estaba conectado en el ordenador.
vi_translation: I woke up in the sunlight, not yet seven o'clock on Saturday morning. Surprisingly, Radar was already online.
tr_translation: I woke up with daylight just before seven on Saturday morning. Surprisingly, Radar was online.
es_translation: On Saturday, the light woke me up a little before seven in the morning. Incredibly, Radar was already logged in on the computer.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: I thought you’d be sleeping for sure.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Tôi tưởng ông còn ngủ.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Kesinlikle uyuduğunu düşünüyordum.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Pensaba que estarías durmiendo.
vi_translation: RESURRECTED: I thought you were still sleeping.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: I definitely thought you were asleep.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: I thought you would be sleeping.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Nah, man. I’ve been up since six, expanding the article on this Malaysian pop singer.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Đời nào. Tôi dậy từ sáu giờ, viết thêm vào một bài về một ca sĩ nhạc pop Malaysia.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yo, dostum. Altından beri ayaktayım, şu Malezyak pop şarkıcısıyla ilgili sayfayı genişletiyorum.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: No, tío. Estoy despierto desde las seis, ampliando el artículo de un cantante pop malayo.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: What era. I woke up at six o'clock, adding to an article about a Malaysian pop singer.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: No, dude. I've been up since dawn, expanding the page about that Malaysian pop singer.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: No, dude. I've been up since six, expanding the article on a Malaysian pop singer.

en: Angela’s still in bed, though.
vi: Nhưng Angela còn ngủ.
tr: Angela hâlâ yatakta gerçi.
es: Pero Angela sigue en la cama.
vi_translation: But Angela was still sleeping.
tr_translation: Angela is still in bed though.
es_translation: But Angela is still in bed.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Ooh she stayed over?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Ồồ, Angela ở lại qua đêm à
tr: DİRİLİŞ ÇİQ: Oo, orada mı kaldı?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Ooh, ¿se ha quedado en tu casa?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Oh, Angela stayed overnight?
tr_translation: RESURRECTION ÇİQ: Oh, did it stay there?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Ooh, has he/she stayed at your house?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yeah but my purity is still intact.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Ừ, nhưng sự thanh tân của tôi vẫn bảo toàn.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Evet ama masumiyetim hâlâ el değmemiş halde.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Sí, pero mi pureza sigue intacta.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: Yes, but my youthfulness is still intact.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yes, but my innocence is still untouched.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yes, but my purity remains intact.

en: Graduation night, though . . . I think maybe.
vi: Cơ mà đêm tốt nghiệp...
tr: Gerçi mezuniyet gecesi... Olabilir diye düşünüyorum.
es: Aunque la noche de la graduación… Puede ser.
vi_translation: But on graduation night... That's the plan.
tr_translation: Although on graduation night... I think it might happen.
es_translation: Although on graduation night... Maybe.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Hey, I thought of something last night. The little holes in that wall in the strip mall— maybe a map that plotted points with thumbtacks?
vi: Dự là thế. QKẺHỒISINH: Này ông, đêm qua tôi chợt nghĩ chuyện này. Mấy cái lỗ nhỏ trên tường ở khu mua sắm bị bỏ hoang ấy–có khả năng trước đây từng có bản đồ và những điểm được đánh dấu bằng ghim mũ không?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Hey, dün gece bir şey düşündüm. Alışveriş merkezinin duvarındaki şu küçük delikler... belki de raptiyelerle işaretlenmiş noktalan olan bir haritadır?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Oye, ayer se me ocurrió una cosa. Los agujeros de la pared del centro comercial… ¿No serán agujeros de chincheta clavadas en un mapa?
vi_translation: THE RESURRECTED: Hey man, last night I suddenly thought about this. Those small holes on the wall in the abandoned shopping area—could it be that there used to be a map and points marked with thumbtacks?
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Hey, I thought of something last night. Those small holes on the wall of the shopping mall... could they be a map marked with pushpins?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Hey, yesterday I thought of something. The holes in the wall of the shopping center... Could they be pinholes stuck in a map?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Like a route.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Như một tuyến đường.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Bir güzergâh gibi.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Como una ruta.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHEWHOLEBOOK96: Like a route.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Like a route.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Like a route.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Exactly.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Chính xác.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Kesinlikle.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Exacto.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Exactly.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Absolutely.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Exactly.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Wanna go over? I have to wait till Ange gets up, though.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Muốn đi xem sao không?
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Oraya gitmek ister misin? Ange kalkana kadar beklemem lazım gerçi.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: ¿Quieres que vayamos? Aunque tengo que esperar a que Angela se levante.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTAL96: Do you want to go see the stars? But I have to wait for Ange to wake up.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Do you want to go there? Actually, I need to wait until Ange wakes up.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Do you want us to go? Although I have to wait for Angela to get up.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Sounds good.
vi: Nhưng tôi phải đợi Ange dậy đã. QKẺHỒISINH: Nghe ổn đấy.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Harika.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Muy bien.
vi_translation: THE RESURRECTED: Sounds good.
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONIST: Wonderful.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Very well.

en: He called at ten. I picked him up in the minivan and then we drove to Ben’s house, figuring that a surprise attack would be the only way to wake him up. But even singing “You Are My Sunshine” outside his window only resulted in him opening the window and spitting at us. “I’m not doing anything until noon,” he said authoritatively.
vi: Radar gọi điện thoại lúc mười giờ. Tôi lái minivan qua đón nó rồi đến nhà Ben, mong rằng đòn tấn công bất ngờ là cách duy nhất để dựng nó dậy. Nhưng dù có hát sái quai hàm “Chàng là ánh dương của em” bên ngoài cửa sổ phòng nó thì kết quả thu được chỉ là nó hé cửa sổ ra hách dịch xùy bọn tôi, “Từ giờ đến trưa tôi không làm gì cả.”
tr: Saat onda aradı. Minivanla onu aldım ve sonra, sürpriz bir saldırının onu uyandırmanın tek yolu olacağım düşünerek Ben’in evine gittik. Ama penceresinin dışında You Are My Sunshine söylemek bile yalnızca pencereyi açıp bize tükürmesiyle sonuçlandı. “Öğlene kadar hiçbir şey yapmayacağım,” dedi otoriter bir şekilde.
es: Me llamó a las diez. Pasé a recogerlo en coche y luego fuimos a casa de Ben, porque supusimos que la única manera de despertarlo era con un ataque por sorpresa. Pero aunque cantamos «You Are My Sunshine» delante de su ventana, solo conseguimos que la abriera y nos pegara la bronca. —No pienso hacer nada hasta las doce —dijo con tono autoritario.
vi_translation: Radar called at ten o'clock. I drove the minivan to pick him up and then went to Ben's house, hoping that a surprise attack was the only way to wake him up. But even singing "You Are My Sunshine" at the top of our lungs outside his window only resulted in him cracking the window open and haughtily telling us, "I'm not doing anything until noon."
tr_translation: He called at ten o'clock. I picked him up with the minivan and then, thinking that a surprise attack would be the only way to wake him up, we went to Ben's house. But singing You Are My Sunshine outside his window it only resulted in him opening the window and spitting at us. "I won't do anything until noon," he said authoritatively.
es_translation: He called me at ten. I picked him up by car and then we went to Ben's house, because we figured the only way to wake him up was with a surprise attack. But even though we sang "You Are My Sunshine" in front of his window, all we managed to do was get him to open it and yell at us. —I don't plan to do anything until twelve —he said authoritatively.

en: So it was just Radar and me on the drive out. He talked a little about Angela and how much he liked her and how weird it was to fall in love just a few months before they would leave for different colleges, but I found it hard to listen very well. I wanted that map. I wanted to see the places she’d pinpointed. I wanted to get those tacks back into the wall.
vi: Thế là chỉ có Radar và tôi lên đường. Nó kể chút chút về Angela, nó thích cậu ấy đến mức nào, và cảm thấy lạ lùng ra sao khi mới mến nhau được mấy tháng thì đã mỗi đứa theo một trường đại học. Nhưng tôi khó có thể nghe được thấu đáo. Tôi muốn tấm bản đồ đó. Tôi muốn thấy những nơi Margo đã đánh dấu. Tôi muốn găm lại những ghim mũ đó lên tường.
tr: Sonuçta arabada Radar’la yalnızdık. Radar, biraz Angela’dan, ondan ne kadar hoşlandığından ve farklı üniversitelere gitmelerinden sadece birkaç ay önce âşık olmanın ne kadar tuhaf olduğundan bahsetti fakat onu doğru düzgün dinlemek zordu. O haritayı istiyordum. Belirlediği yerleri görmek istiyordum. O raptiyeleri tekrar duvara saplamak istiyordum.
es: Así que fuimos Radar y yo solos. Me habló un rato de Angela, me contó que le gustaba mucho y que era raro enamorarse unos meses antes de que cada uno fuera a una universidad diferente, pero me costaba prestarle atención. Quería aquel mapa. Quería ver los lugares que había marcado. Quería volver a clavar las chinchetas en la pared.
vi_translation: So it was just Radar and me hitting the road. He talked a little about Angela, how much he liked her, and how strange it felt that after only a few months of dating, they were going to different colleges. But I could hardly listen properly. I wanted that map. I wanted to see the places Margo had marked. I wanted to pin those thumbtacks back on the wall.
tr_translation: In the end, I was alone in the car with Radar. Radar talked a bit about Angela, how much he liked her, and how strange it was to fall in love just a few months before going to different universities, but it was hard to listen to him properly. I wanted that map. I wanted to see the places he had marked. I wanted to pin those tacks back on the wall.
es_translation: So Radar and I went alone. He talked to me for a while about Angela, told me that he liked her a lot and that it was weird to fall in love a few months before each of them went to a different university, but I found it hard to pay attention. I wanted that map. I wanted to see the places she had marked. I wanted to pin the tacks back on the wall.

en: We walked in through the office, hustled through the library, paused briefly to examine the holes in the bedroom wall, and entered the souvenir shop. The place didn’t scare me at all anymore. Once we’d been in each room and established we were alone, I felt as safe as I did at home. Beneath a display counter, I found the box of maps and brochures I’d rifled through on prom night. I lifted it out and balanced it on the corners of a broken glass counter. Radar sorted through them initially, looking for anything with a map, and then I unfolded them, scanning for pinholes.
vi: Tụi tôi vào từ gian văn phòng, đi vội qua thư viện, dừng lại kiểm tra nhanh các lỗ trên tường phòng ngủ, rồi sang cửa hàng lưu niệm. Nơi này không khiến tôi sợ chút nào nữa. Một khi đã ở bên trong và biết chắc rằng chỉ có mình, tôi thấy an toàn như đang ở nhà. Dưới một quầy trưng bày, tôi thấy hộp đựng bản đồ và quảng cáo du lịch tôi đã bới trong đêm dạ tiệc. Tôi bê cái hộp lên, đặt thăng bằng trên các góc một tủ trưng bày đã vỡ hết kính. Radar lọc trước một lượt, lấy ra tất cả những gì có bản đồ, rồi tôi mở ra, soi xem có lỗ thủng nào không.
tr: Ofisten geçerek içeri girdik, kütüphaneden aceleyle geçip yatak odasımn duvarındaki delikleri incelemek için kısa bir süre duraksadık ve hediyelik eşya dükkânına girdik. Burası artık beni hiç korkutmuyordu. Her odaya girip yalnız olduğumuzu tespit eder etmez, kendimi evde olduğum kadar güvende hissediyordum. Bir vitrin tezgâhının altında, balo gecesi çabucak göz gezdirdiğim harita ve broşür kutusunu buldum. Kutuyu çıkarıp kaldırdım ve kırılmış bir cam tezgâhın köşelerinin üstünde dengeledim. Önce Radar haritayla ilgili bir şeyler arayarak sırasıyla içindekilere baktı, sonra ben iğne delikleri görmeyi umarak onları yaydım.
es: Entramos en el despacho, corrimos a la biblioteca, nos paramos un momento a revisar los agujeros de la pared y entramos en la tienda de souvenirs. El edificio ya no me asustaba lo más mínimo. En cuanto hubimos recorrido todas las salas y confirmado que estábamos solos, me sentí tan seguro como en mi casa. Debajo de una vitrina encontré la caja de mapas y folletos en la que había rebuscado la noche del baile. La levanté y la apoyé en la esquina de una vitrina con el cristal roto. Radar buscaba cualquier cosa que tuviera un mapa, y yo la desplegaba y revisaba si tenía agujeros.
vi_translation: We entered through the office area, hurried through the library, stopped to quickly check the holes in the bedroom walls, and then went to the souvenir shop. This place no longer scared me at all. Once inside and certain that I was alone, I felt as safe as if I were at home. Under a display counter, I saw the box containing maps and travel brochures that I had rummaged through during the night of the party. I picked up the box, balancing it on the corners of a display cabinet with broken glass. Radar sifted through it first, taking out everything with maps, then I opened them up to check for any holes.
tr_translation: We entered inside by passing through the office, hurriedly passed through the library, paused briefly to examine the holes in the wall of the bedroom, and entered the gift shop. This place no longer scared me at all. As soon as we entered each room and confirmed we were alone, I felt as safe as I did at home. Under a display counter, I found the box of maps and brochures that I had quickly glanced at on the night of the ball. I took out the box, lifted it, and balanced it on the corners of a broken glass counter. First, Radar looked through the contents one by one, searching for something related to the map, then I spread them out, hoping to see pinholes.
es_translation: We entered the office, rushed to the library, stopped for a moment to check the holes in the wall, and entered the souvenir shop. The building no longer scared me in the slightest. As soon as we had gone through all the rooms and confirmed that we were alone, I felt as safe as I did at home. Under a display case, I found the box of maps and brochures that I had rummaged through on the night of the dance. I lifted it and leaned it against the corner of a display case with broken glass. Radar was looking for anything that had a map, and I unfolded it and checked if it had holes.

en: We were getting near the bottom of the box when Radar pulled out a black-and-white brochure entitled FIVE THOUSAND AMERICAN CITIES. It was copyrighted 1972 by the Esso company. As I carefully unfolded the map, trying to smooth the creases, I saw a pinhole in a corner. “This is it,” I said, my voice rising. There was a small rip around the pinhole, like it’d been torn off the wall. It was a yellowing, brittle, classroom-size map of the United States printed thick with potential destinations. The rips in the map told me that she had not intended this as a clue— Margo was too precise and assured with her clues to muddy the waters. Somehow or another, we’d stumbled into something she hadn’t planned, and in seeing what she hadn’t planned, I thought again of how much she had planned. And maybe, I thought, that’s what she did in the quiet dark here. Traveling while loafing, like Whitman had, as she prepared for the real thing.
vi: Gần đến đáy hộp, Radar nhấc lên một tập in đen trắng, tựa đề NĂM NGÀN THÀNH PHỐ MĨ. Bản quyền năm 1972 của công ti Esso. Khi thận trọng mở ra, cố gắng vuốt phẳng các mép quăn, tôi thấy một lỗ cắm ghim ở góc. “Đây rồi,” tôi khẽ reo. Quanh lỗ ghim có chút rách nhỏ, trông như giấy bị giật khỏi tường. Đó là tấm bản đồ nước Mĩ cỡ treo trong lớp học, giấy giòn và ngả vàng, in dày đặc những điểm đến tiềm năng. Chút rách ở góc nói với tôi rằng Margo không chủ định để bản đồ này lại làm manh mối–cô ấy quá chính xác và chắc chắn với những manh mối nên sẽ không chơi trò tung hỏa mù. Trời xui đất khiến chúng tôi rơi đúng vào phần Margo không dự kiến trước, và khi thấy được những gì cô ấy không dự kiến, tôi nghĩ lại cô ấy đã dự kiến nhiều đến mức nào. Và có lẽ, tôi nghĩ, đó là những gì cô ấy đã làm trong bóng tối tĩnh lặng ở đây. Phiêu du trong khi ngồi an nhiên, như Whitman, trong khi chuẩn bị cho những gì đích thực.
tr: Kutunun dibine yaklaşıyorduk ki Radar BEŞ BİN AMERİKAN ŞEHRİ başlıklı siyah beyaz bir broşürü çekip çıkardı. Telif hakları 1972’den beri Esso şirketine aitti. Buruşuklukları düzeltmeye çalışarak dikkatlice haritayı açarken, köşede bir iğne deliği gördüm. ‘İşte,” dedim sesim yükselerek. İğne deliğinin etrafında bir yırtık vardı, duvardan yırtılıp koparılmış gibi. Sararmış, ince, sınıflarda kullanılan boyutta ve olası istikamet isimlerinin kalın harflerle yazıldığı bir Birleşik Devletler haritasıydı. Haritadaki yırtıklar, bana bunu bir ipucu olarak tasarlamadığını gösteriyordu... Margo suyu bulandıracak tarzda ipuçları bırakmıyordu. Öyle ya da böyle planlamadığı bir şeye denk gelmiştik ve onun planlamadıklarını görünce, ne kadar çok şeyi planlamış olduğunu tekrar düşündüm. Ve belki, diye düşündüm, buradaki bu sessiz karanlıkta yaptığı şey buydu. Gerçek olana hazırlandığı sırada aylaklık ederken seyahat etmek, Whitman’ın yaptığı gibi.
es: Estábamos llegando al fondo de la caja cuando Radar sacó un folleto en blanco y negro titulado CINCO MIL CIUDADES ESTADOUNIDENSES. El copyright era de 1972, de la empresa Esso. Mientras desplegaba el mapa con cuidado e intentaba alisar los pliegues, vi un agujero en la esquina. —Es este —dije alzando la voz. Junto al agujero había un trozo roto, como si hubieran arrancado el mapa de la pared. Era un mapa amarillento y quebradizo de Estados Unidos, del tamaño de los que hay en las clases, marcado con posibles destinos. Por las arrugas del mapa entendí que Margo no había pretendido que fuera una pista. Era demasiado exacta y segura con sus pistas como para enturbiar las aguas. En cualquier caso, habíamos encontrado algo que no había previsto, y al ver lo que no había previsto, volví a pensar que había previsto muchas cosas. Y pensé que quizá era lo que había hecho en aquella oscura y silenciosa sala. Viajar tumbada, como Whitman, mientras se preparaba para lo que realmente iba a hacer.
vi_translation: Near the bottom of the box, Radar lifted up a stack of black and white prints titled FIVE THOUSAND AMERICAN CITIES. Copyright 1972 by the Esso company. When carefully opening it, trying to smooth out the curled edges, I saw a pinhole in the corner. “Here it is,” I whispered excitedly. Around the pinhole, there was a small tear, looking like the paper had been ripped off the wall. It was a map of the United States, the kind you hang in a classroom, with brittle and yellowed paper, densely printed with potential destinations. The small tear in the corner told me that Margo did not intend to leave this map as a clue—she was too precise and certain with her clues to play a misleading game. Fate had led us to a part Margo had not anticipated, and seeing what she had not anticipated made me think about how much she had planned. And perhaps, I thought, that’s what she had been doing in the quiet darkness here. Wandering while sitting still, like Whitman, while preparing for what was real.
tr_translation: We were approaching the bottom of the box when Radar pulled out a black and white brochure titled FIVE THOUSAND AMERICAN CITIES. Copyrights had belonged to the Esso company since 1972. As he carefully opened the map, trying to smooth out the wrinkles, I saw a pinhole in the corner. “Here it is,” I said, my voice rising. There was a tear around the pinhole, as if it had been ripped off a wall. It was a yellowed, thin map of the United States, the kind used in classrooms, with possible direction names written in bold letters. The tears on the map showed me that this wasn’t designed as a clue... Margo didn’t leave clues that would muddy the waters. One way or another, we had stumbled upon something she hadn’t planned, and seeing what she hadn’t planned made me think again about how much she had planned. And maybe, I thought, in this silent darkness, what she was doing here It was. Traveling while idling as he prepared for the real thing, like Whitman did.
es_translation: We were reaching the bottom of the box when Radar pulled out a black and white pamphlet titled FIVE THOUSAND AMERICAN CITIES. The copyright was from 1972, by the Esso company. As he carefully unfolded the map and tried to smooth out the creases, I saw a hole in the corner. "It's this one," I said, raising my voice. Next to the hole there was a torn piece, as if they had ripped the map off the wall. It was a yellowed and brittle map of the United States, the kind you find in classrooms, marked with possible destinations. From the creases in the map, I understood that Margo hadn't intended it to be a clue. She was too precise and sure with her clues to muddy the waters. In any case, we had found something she hadn't anticipated, and seeing what she hadn't anticipated, I thought again that she had anticipated many things. And I thought that maybe that was what she had done in that dark and silent room. Traveling while lying down, like Whitman, as she prepared for what she was really going to do.

en: I ran all the way back to the office and found a bunch of thumbtacks in a desk adjacent to Margo’s, before Radar and I carefully carried the unfurled map back to Margo’s room. I held it up against the wall while Radar tried to get the tacks into the corners, but three of the four corners had ripped, as had three of the five locations, presumably when the map was taken off the wall. “Higher and to the left,” he said. “No, down. Yeah. Don’t move.” Finally we got the map on the wall, and then we started lining up the holes in the map with the ones on the wall. We got all five pins in pretty easily. But some of these pinholes were also ripped, so it was impossible to tell their EXACT location. And exact location mattered in a map blackened with the names of five thousand places. The lettering was so small and exact that I had to stand up on the carpet and put my bare eyeballs inches away from the map even to guess each location. As I suggested town names, Radar pulled out his handheld and looked them up on Omnictionary.
vi: Tôi chạy một mạch sang văn phòng, thấy một nắm ghim mũ trên cái bàn cạnh bàn của Margo. Rồi Radar và tôi cẩn thận mang bản đồ đã vuốt phẳng sang phòng Margo. Tôi giơ nó lên trước tường trong khi Radar tìm cách ghim các góc, nhưng ba trong bốn góc đã rách, cả ba trong số năm điểm trên bản đồ cũng vậy, chắc bị rách khi bản đồ được gỡ khỏi tường. “Cao lên, sang trái,” Radar nói. “Không, xuống. Thế. Đừng nhúc nhích.” Cuối cùng bọn tôi đã có tấm bản đồ trên tường. Chúng tôi căn các lỗ trên giấy với các lỗ trên tường, năm ghim mũ dễ dàng về vị trí. Nhưng có mấy lỗ trên bản đồ bị rách hơi to nên không thể xác định được vị trí CHÍNH XÁC. Và vị trí chính xác rất có giá trị trên một tấm bản đồ đen đặc năm ngàn địa danh. Những con chữ nhỏ li ti san sát, tôi phải đứng lên cuộn thảm, gí mắt lại gần đoán từng địa danh. Trong khi tôi đọc tên các thành phố lên, Radar lấy máy tính cầm tay ra và tra trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ.
tr: Ofise kadar koştum ve Radar’la açılmış haritayı dikkatlice Margo’nun odasına geri taşımadan önce, Margo’nunkine yakm olan bir masada birkaç tane raptiye buldum. Radar raptiyeleri köşelere koymaya çalışırken, haritayı yukarı kaldırıp duvara yapıştırdım ama muhtemelen harita duvardan çıkarıldığı zaman dört köşeden üçü yırtılmıştı, beş işaretli yerden üçü de öyle. “Daha yukarı ve sola,” dedi Radar. “Hayır, aşağı. Evet. Kıpırdama.” Nihayet harita duvardaydı, sonra haritadaki delikleri duvardakilerle hizaya getirmeye başladık. Beş iğnenin hepsini oldukça kolay bir şekilde taktık. Ama iğne deliklerinin birkaçı da yırtılmıştı, bu nedenle KESİN konumlarını söylemek imkânsızdı. Ve kesin konum, beş bin yerin ismiyle kararmış bir haritada önem taşıyordu. Harfler o kadar küçük ve inceydi ki her bir konumu tahmin etmek için bile, halının üstüne çıkıp göz küremi haritanın birkaç santim yakınma getirmem gerekiyordu. Ben ortaya şehir isimleri atarken, Radar el bilgisayarını çıkarıp bu isimleri Omnictionary’de aradı.
es: Volví al despacho y encontré un puñado de chinchetas en una mesa contigua a la de Margo. Luego Radar y yo llevamos con cuidado el mapa desplegado a la habitación de Margo. Lo sujeté contra la pared mientras Radar intentaba meter las chinchetas por los agujeros, pero tres de las cuatro esquinas se habían roto, y también tres de las cinco localizaciones, seguramente al retirar el mapa de la pared. —Más arriba y a la izquierda —me dijo Radar—. No, baja. Sí. No te muevas. Clavamos por fin el mapa y empezamos a cuadrar los agujeros del mapa con los de la pared. No nos costó demasiado ensamblar los cinco puntos. Pero, como algunos agujeros estaban rasgados, era imposible determinar la localización EXACTA. Y la localización exacta era importante en un mapa en el que aparecían los nombres de cinco mil poblaciones. La letra era tan pequeña que tuve que subirme a la moqueta y acercar los ojos a unos centímetros del mapa para intentar descubrir cada población. Empecé a decir nombres, y Radar sacó su ordenador de bolsillo y los buscó en el Omnictionary.
vi_translation: I ran straight to the office and saw a handful of push pins on the table next to Margo's desk. Then Radar and I carefully carried the flattened map to Margo's room. I held it up against the wall while Radar tried to pin the corners, but three out of the four corners were torn, as were three out of the five points on the map, likely torn when the map was removed from the wall. "Higher, to the left," Radar said. "No, down. There. Don't move." Finally, we had the map on the wall. We aligned the holes in the paper with the holes in the wall, and the five push pins easily went into place. But some holes on the map were torn too large to determine the EXACT position. And exact positioning is very valuable on a map densely packed with five thousand place names. The tiny, densely packed letters required me to stand on the rolled-up carpet and press my eyes close to guess each place name. While I read the city names aloud, Radar took out a handheld calculator and looked them up in the Everything Encyclopedia.
tr_translation: I ran to the office and found a few thumbtacks on a desk close to Margo's before carefully carrying the map opened with Radar back to Margo's room. While Radar tried to place the thumbtacks in the corners, I lifted the map and stuck it to the wall, but probably three of the four corners were torn when the map was removed from the wall, as were three of the five marked places. "Higher and to the left," said Radar. "No, lower. Yes. Don't move." Finally, the map was on the wall, and then we started aligning the holes on the map with those on the wall. We placed all five pins quite easily. But a few of the pinholes were also torn, so it was impossible to determine their EXACT locations. And exact location mattered on a map darkened with the names of five thousand places. The letters were so small and thin that even to guess each location, I had to get on the carpet and bring my eyeball within a few centimeters of the map. While I threw out city names, Radar took out his handheld computer and looked up these names on Omnictionary.
es_translation: I returned to the office and found a handful of thumbtacks on a table next to Margo's. Then Radar and I carefully carried the unfolded map to Margo's room. I held it against the wall while Radar tried to insert the thumbtacks into the holes, but three of the four corners had broken, as well as three of the five locations, probably from removing the map from the wall. —Higher up and to the left —Radar told me—. No, lower. Yes. Don't move. We finally pinned the map and started aligning the holes in the map with those on the wall. It didn't take us too long to assemble the five points. But, since some holes were torn, it was impossible to determine the EXACT location. And the exact location was important on a map that showed the names of five thousand towns. The lettering was so small that I had to get on the carpet and bring my eyes a few centimeters from the map to try to identify each town. I started saying names, and Radar took out his pocket computer and looked them up on the Omnictionary.

en: There were two unripped dots: one looked like Los Angeles, although there were a bunch of towns clustered so close together in Southern California that the type overlapped. The other unripped hole was over Chicago. There was a ripped one in New York that, judging from the location of the hole in the wall, was one of the five boroughs of New York City.
vi: Có hai chỗ cắm ghim không bị rách: một có vẻ là Los Angeles, dù có vô khối thành phố cụm lại gần nhau ở Nam California nên chữ in bị lấn lên nhau. Một lỗ ghim còn nguyên nữa là ở phía trên Chicago. Một lỗ ghim bị rách ở New York, căn cứ theo vị trí lỗ thủng trên tường, là một trong năm khu của thành phố New York.
tr: İki yırtılmamış nokta vardı: Biri Los Angeles gibi görünüyordu ancak Güney Kaliforniya’da şehirler birbirlerine o kadar yakın kümelenmişlerdi ki yazılar üst üste biniyordu. Diğer yırtılmamış delik Şikago tarafındaydı. New York’ta yırtılmış bir delik vardı; deliğin duvardaki konumuna bakılırsa, New York’un beş bölgesinden biriydi.
es: Había dos agujeros sin rasgaduras. Uno parecía ser Los Ángeles, aunque en el sur de California había tantas ciudades juntas que los nombres se solapaban. El otro agujero intacto estaba en Chicago. Había uno rasgado en Nueva York, que, a juzgar por su posición en la pared, correspondía a uno de los cinco distritos de la ciudad.
vi_translation: There are two pinholes that are not torn: one seems to be Los Angeles, although there are a multitude of cities clustered together in Southern California, causing the print to overlap. Another intact pinhole is above Chicago. A torn pinhole in New York, based on the position of the hole on the wall, is in one of the five boroughs of New York City.
tr_translation: There were two intact points: One looked like Los Angeles, but in Southern California, the cities were so closely clustered that the writings overlapped. The other intact spot was towards Chicago. There was a torn spot in New York; judging by the position of the hole on the wall, it was one of New York's five boroughs.
es_translation: There were two holes without tears. One seemed to be Los Angeles, although in Southern California there were so many cities together that the names overlapped. The other intact hole was in Chicago. There was a torn one in New York, which, judging by its position on the wall, corresponded to one of the city's five boroughs.

en: “That makes sense with what we know.”
vi: “Khớp với những gì chúng ta đã biết.
tr: “Elimizdeki bilgilerle birlikte bu mantıklı geliyor.
es: —Encaja con lo que sabemos.
vi_translation: “Matches with what we already know.”
tr_translation: "With the information we have, this makes sense."
es_translation: —It fits with what we know.

en: “Yeah,” I said. “But God, where in New York? That’s the question.”
vi: “Ừ,” tôi nói. “Nhưng Chúa ơi, nơi nào ở New York đây? Vấn đề là ở đó.”
tr: “Evet,” dedim. “Ama Tanrım, New York’ta neresi? Soru bu.
es: —Sí —le dije—. Pero, joder, ¿en qué parte de Nueva York? Esa es la cuestión.
vi_translation: “Yes,” I said. “But my God, where in New York is this? That’s the problem.”
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said. “But my God, where in New York? That’s the question.”
es_translation: —Yes —I told him—. But, damn, which part of New York? That's the question.

en: “We’re missing something,” he says. “Some locational hint. What’re the other dots?”
vi: “Tụi mình đang bỏ sót gì đó,” Radar nói. “Gợi ý nào đó về địa điểm. Những lỗ ghim còn lại là gì?”
tr: “Bir şeyleri kaçırıyoruz,” dedi. “Konumla ilgili bir ipucunu. Diğer noktalar hangileri?
es: —Nos dejamos algo —repuso—. Alguna pista. ¿Dónde están los otros puntos?
vi_translation: “We are missing something,” Radar said. “Some clue about the location. What are the remaining pinholes?”
tr_translation: “We are missing something,” he said. “A clue about the location. What are the other points?”
es_translation: —We missed something —he replied—. Some clue. Where are the other points?

en: “There’s another in New York State, but not near the city. I mean, look, all the towns are tiny. It might be Poughkeepsie or Woodstock or the Catskill Park.”
vi: “Một cái nữa ở bang New York, nhưng không gần thành phố. Ông xem, tất cả các địa danh đều nhỏ xíu. Có thể là Poughkeepsie hoặc Woodstock hoặc Catskill Park.”
tr: “New York Eyaleti’nde bir tane daha var ama şehre yakm değil. Yani, baksana, bütün kasabalar küçücük. Poughkeepsie, Woodstock ya da Catskill Park olabilir.
es: —Hay otro en el estado de Nueva York, pero no está cerca de la ciudad. Bueno, mira, todas las ciudades son diminutas. Podría ser Poughkeepsie, Woodstock o el parque de Catskill.
vi_translation: "Another one in New York State, but not near the city." "You see, all the places are tiny." "It could be Poughkeepsie or Woodstock or Catskill Park."
tr_translation: "There is one more in the State of New York, but it is not close to the city. I mean, look, all the towns are tiny. It could be Poughkeepsie, Woodstock, or Catskill Park."
es_translation: —There is another one in the state of New York, but it is not near the city. Well, look, all the cities are tiny. It could be Poughkeepsie, Woodstock, or the Catskill park.

en: “Woodstock,” Radar said. “That’d be interesting. She’s not much of a hippie, but she has that whole free-spirit vibe.”
vi: “Woodstock,” Radar nói. “Chỗ này hay đấy. Margo không có vẻ gì là dân hippie, nhưng cậu ấy mang khí chất của tâm hồn tự do đó.”
tr: “Woodstock,” dedi Radar. ‘İlginç olurdu. Margo pek hippi değil ama bütün o özgür ruh olayları ona uyuyor.
es: —Woodstock —dijo Radar—. Sería interesante. Margo no es muy hippy, pero lleva ese rollo de espíritu libre.
vi_translation: “Woodstock,” Radar said. “This place is cool. Margo doesn't seem like a hippie, but she has the spirit of a free soul.”
tr_translation: “Woodstock,” said Radar. “It would be interesting. Margo is not much of a hippie, but all that free spirit stuff suits her.”
es_translation: —Woodstock —said Radar—. It would be interesting. Margo isn't very hippy, but she has that free spirit vibe.

en: “I don’t know,” I said. “The last one is either Washington, D.C., or else maybe Annapolis or Chesapeake Bay. That one could be a bunch of things, actually.”
vi: “Tôi không biết nữa,” tôi nói. “Điểm cuối cùng có thể là Washington, D. C., hoặc Annapolis, hoặc vịnh Chesapeake. Thực ra điểm này có thể là vô thiên lủng.
tr: “Bilmiyorum,” dedim. “Sonuncusu ya Washington D. C., ya da Annapolis ya da Chesapeake Körfezi. Bu, bir sürü yerden biri olabilir aslında.
es: —No sé —le contesté—. El último está en la ciudad de Washington o quizá en Annapolis o la bahía de Chesapeake. En realidad puede estar en un montón de sitios.
vi_translation: “I don't know,” I said. “The final point could be Washington, D.C., or Annapolis, or Chesapeake Bay. Actually, this point could be endless.”
tr_translation: “I don't know,” I said. “The last one is either Washington D. C., or Annapolis or Chesapeake Bay. It could actually be one of many places.”
es_translation: —I don't know —I replied—. The last one is in the city of Washington or maybe in Annapolis or the Chesapeake Bay. Actually, it could be in a bunch of places.

en: “It’d be helpful if there was only one point on the map,” Radar said sullenly.
vi: “Nếu chỉ có một điểm trên bản đồ thì hữu ích hơn đấy,” Radar gắt.
tr: “Eğer haritada yalnızca bir nokta olsaydı iyi olurdu,” dedi Radar asık suratla.
es: —Ayudaría un poco que solo hubiera un punto en el mapa —dijo Radar con tono sombrío.
vi_translation: “It would be more useful if there was only one point on the map,” Radar snapped.
tr_translation: "It would be good if there was only one point on the map," said Radar with a sullen face.
es_translation: —It would help a bit if there was only one point on the map —said Radar in a somber tone.

en: “But she’s probably going from place to place,” I said. Tramping her perpetual journey.
vi: “Nhưng biết đâu Margo muốn đi từ nơi này sang nơi khác,” tôi nói. Dấn mình vào chuyến đi miên viễn của cô ấy.
tr: “Ama muhtemelen bir yerden bir yere gidiyor,” dedim. Ebedî yolculuğunda ağır ağır ilerleyerek.
