es: —Pero seguramente va de un sitio a otro —le dije. Emprendiendo su viaje eterno.
vi_translation: “But who knows if Margo wants to go from one place to another,” I said. Immersing herself in her endless journey.
tr_translation: “But he is probably going from one place to another,” I said. Slowly progressing on his eternal journey.
es_translation: —But surely he goes from one place to another —I told him. Embarking on his eternal journey.

en: I sat on the carpet for a while as Radar read to me more about New York, about the Catskill Mountains, about the nation’s capital, about the concert at Woodstock in 1969. Nothing seemed to help. I felt as if we’d played out the string and found nothing.
vi: Tôi ngồi xuống thảm một lát trong khi Radar đọc to thông tin về New York, dãy núi Catskill, thủ đô, buổi hòa nhạc ở Woodstock năm 1969. Hình như chẳng có gì liên quan. Tôi cảm thấy như chúng tôi đang lần theo dây nối và chẳng tìm thấy gì.
tr: Radar, bana New York hakkında, Catskill Dağları hakkında, millî sermaye hakkında, 1969’da Woodstock’taki festival hakkında bir şeyler okurken, bir süre halının üstünde oturdum. Hiçbir şey yardım edecekmiş gibi görünmüyordu. Sanki bütün ipleri çekmişiz ancak hiçbir şey bulamamışız gibi hissettim.
es: Me senté un rato en la moqueta mientras Radar me leía información sobre Nueva York, sobre las montañas de Catskill, sobre la capital del país y sobre el concierto de 1969 en Woodstock. Nada parecía servir. Me sentí como si hubiéramos tirado del hilo y no hubiéramos encontrado nada.
vi_translation: I sat down on the carpet for a while as Radar read aloud information about New York, the Catskill Mountains, the capital, the Woodstock concert in 1969. It seemed like nothing was related. I felt like we were following a thread and finding nothing.
tr_translation: Radar, while I was reading something about New York, the Catskill Mountains, national capital, the festival in Woodstock in 1969, I sat on the carpet for a while. Nothing seemed to help. I felt as if we had pulled all the strings but found nothing.
es_translation: I sat for a while on the carpet while Radar read me information about New York, about the Catskill Mountains, about the capital of the country, and about the 1969 concert in Woodstock. Nothing seemed to help. I felt as if we had pulled the thread and found nothing.

en: After I dropped Radar off that afternoon, I sat around the house reading “Song of Myself” and halfheartedly studying for finals.
vi: Chiều hôm đó, sau khi đưa Radar về, tôi ngồi quanh nhà đọc “Tự khúc”, nửa để tâm vào chuyện học thi. Thứ Hai thi giải tích và tiếng La-tinh, có lẽ là hai môn khó nhất, tôi không thể hoàn toàn bỏ bê được.
tr: O ikindi vakti Radar’ı bıraktıktan sonra, Kendi Şarkım’ı okuyarak ve sınavlara gönülsüzce çalışarak evde boş boş oturdum.
es: Aquella tarde, después de haber dejado a Radar en su casa, me senté a leer el «Canto de mí mismo» y a estudiar sin demasiado entusiasmo para los exámenes finales.
vi_translation: That afternoon, after bringing Radar home, I sat around the house reading "Autobiography," half-focused on studying for exams.
tr_translation: After dropping off Radar that afternoon, I sat around the house aimlessly, singing My Own Song and reluctantly studying for exams.
es_translation: That afternoon, after dropping Radar off at his house, I sat down to read "Song of Myself" and study without much enthusiasm for the final exams.

en: I had calc and Latin on Monday, probably my two toughest subjects, and I couldn’t afford to ignore them completely. I studied most of Saturday night and throughout the day Sunday, but then a Margo idea popped into my head just after dinner, so I took a break from practicing Ovid translations and logged onto IM. I saw Lacey online. I’d only just gotten her screen name from Ben, but I figured I knew her well enough to IM her.
vi: Chiều hôm đó, sau khi đưa Radar về, tôi ngồi quanh nhà đọc “Tự khúc”, nửa để tâm vào chuyện học thi. Thứ Hai thi giải tích và tiếng La-tinh, có lẽ là hai môn khó nhất, tôi không thể hoàn toàn bỏ bê được. Tôi học gần hết tối thứ Bảy và cả ngày Chủ nhật, nhưng vừa sau bữa tối, suy nghĩ về Margo chợt hiện lên trong đầu tôi. Tôi tạm rời bài luyện dịch Ovid và đăng nhập vào tin nhắn trực tuyến. Lacey đang ở trên mạng. Tôi mới biết biệt hiệu dùng trên mạng của Lacey qua Ben, nhưng chắc tôi và Lacey đã đủ quen biết để tôi gửi tin nhắn trực tiếp tới cậu ấy luôn.
tr: Pazartesi günü matematik ile Latince sınavım vardı; sanırım en zor iki dersimdi ve onlan tamamen yok saymam mümkün değildi. Cumartesi gecesinin çoğunda ve pazar sabahı boyunca çalıştım ama ardından, tam akşam yemeğinden sonra aklıma pat diye bir Margo fikri geldi, bu yüzden Ovid tercümelerine çalışmayı bırakıp sohbet programına girdim. Lacey’nin çevrimiçi olduğunu gördüm. Rumuzunu Ben’den daha yeni öğrenmiştim ama artık onunla mesajlaşacak kadar arkadaş olduğumuzu düşündüm.
es: El lunes tenía cálculo y latín, probablemente las dos asignaturas más duras, así que no podía permitirme pasarlas del todo por alto. Estudié casi todo el sábado por la noche y el domingo, pero justo después de cenar se me ocurrió una idea. Dejé un momento de lado las traducciones de Ovidio y encendí el ordenador. Vi a Lacey conectada. Acababa de enterarme de su nick por Ben, pero supuse que la conocía lo suficiente para escribirle un mensaje.
vi_translation: Monday's exams were calculus and Latin, probably the two hardest subjects, so I couldn't completely neglect them. I studied almost all of Saturday night and all day Sunday, but just after dinner, thoughts of Margo suddenly popped into my head. I temporarily set aside my Ovid translation exercises and logged into online messaging. Lacey was online. I had just learned Lacey's online nickname through Ben, but I figured Lacey and I were familiar enough for me to send her a direct message right away.
tr_translation: On Monday, I had exams in math and Latin; I think they were my two hardest subjects, and it was impossible to completely ignore them. I studied for most of Saturday night and throughout Sunday morning, but then, just after dinner, a sudden idea about Margo popped into my head, so I stopped working on Ovid translations and logged into the chat program. I saw that Lacey was online. I had just recently learned her username from Ben, but I thought we were now friends enough to message her.
es_translation: On Monday, I had calculus and Latin, probably the two toughest subjects, so I couldn't afford to completely overlook them. I studied almost all Saturday night and Sunday, but right after dinner, an idea occurred to me. I set aside Ovid's translations for a moment and turned on the computer. I saw Lacey was online. I had just found out her nickname from Ben, but I figured I knew her well enough to write her a message.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Hey, it’s Q.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Chào, tớ Q đây.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Hey, ben Q.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Hola, soy Q.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Hi, it's Q here.
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONIST: Hey, I'm Q.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Hello, I am Q.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Hi!
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Chào cậu!
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Selam!
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: ¡Hola!
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Hello there!
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Hello!
es_translation: PENITENCEHABIT: Hello!

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Did you ever think about how much time Margo must have spent planning everything?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Có bao giờ cậu nghĩ đến chuyện Margo đã mất bao nhiêu thời gian lên kế hoạch tất cả không?
tr: DIRILIŞÇIQ: Hiç Margo’nun her şeyi planlamak için ne kadar zaman harcadığım düşündün mü?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: ¿Has pensado alguna vez cuánto tiempo tuvo que dedicar Margo a planearlo todo?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Have you ever thought about how much time Margo spent planning it all?
tr_translation: REVIVALIST: Do you know how much Margo plans everything? Have you thought about the time I spent?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Have you ever thought about how much time Margo had to spend planning everything?

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Yeah, like leaving the letters in the alphabet soup before Mississippi and leading you to the minimall, you mean?
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Ờ, như để lại chữ trong bát súp trước khi đi Mississippi và chỉ dẫn cậu đến khu mua sắm mini ấy hả?
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Mississippi’den önce çorbada harfler bırakması ve seni alışveriş merkezine yönlendirmesi gibi mi demek istiyorsun?
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Sí, ¿te refieres a dejar letras en el plato de sopa antes de ir a Mississippi y orientarte hacia el centro comercial?
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Oh, like leaving a note in the soup bowl before going to Mississippi and directing you to that mini shopping mall?
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Do you mean like leaving letters in the soup before Mississippi and directing you to the shopping mall?
es_translation: HABIT OF PENANCE: Yes, are you referring to leaving letters in the soup bowl before going to Mississippi and orienting yourself towards the shopping center?

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Yeah, these aren’t things you think up in ten minutes.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Ừ, những việc đó không thể chỉ nghĩ mười phút là xong.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Evet, bunlar on dakikada düşüneceğin şeyler değil.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Sí, no son cosas que se te ocurren en diez minutos.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Yes, those things cannot be resolved by just thinking for ten minutes.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Yes, these are not things you can think about in ten minutes.
es_translation: THERESURRECTION: Yes, these are not things that come to mind in ten minutes.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Maybe the notebook.
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Cuốn sổ chăng? QKẺHỒISINH: Chính xác.
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Belki de defter.
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Quizá la libreta…
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: The notebook?
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Maybe a notebook.
es_translation: PENITENCEHABIT: Perhaps the notebook...

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Exactly.
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Cuốn sổ chăng? QKẺHỒISINH: Chính xác.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Kesinlikle.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Exacto.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Exactly.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Absolutely.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Exactly.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Yeah. I was thinking about it today because I remembered one time when we were shopping, she kept sticking the notebook into purses she liked, to make sure it fit.
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Ừ nhỉ. Hôm nay tớ cũng nghĩ đến cuốn sổ. Tớ nhớ có lần đi mua sắm với nhau, Margo cứ cố thử nhét sổ vào mấy cái ví cậu ấy thích xem có vừa không.
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Evet. Bugün bunu düşünüyordum, çünkü alışveriş yaptığımız bir zamanı hatırladım, içine sığacağından emin olmak için beğendiği çantalara defteri koyup duruyordu.
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Sí. Lo he pensado hoy porque he recordado que una vez, estando de compras, se dedicó a acercar la libreta a los bolsos que le gustaban para asegurarse de que cabía.
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Oh right. Today I also thought about the notebook. I remember once when we went shopping together, Margo kept trying to fit the notebook into the wallets she liked to see if it would fit.
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Yes. Today I was thinking about this because I remembered a time when we were shopping, and she kept putting her notebook into the bags she liked to make sure it would fit.
es_translation: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Yes. I thought about it today because I remembered that once, while shopping, she made sure to place the notebook next to the bags she liked to ensure it would fit.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: I wish I had that notebook.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Giá có cuốn sổ ấy thì tốt.
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Keşke o defter bende olsaydı.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Ojalá tuviera esa libreta.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: It would be good to have that notebook.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: I wish I had that notebook.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: I wish I had that notebook.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Yeah, probably with her, though.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Giá có cuốn sổ ấy thì tốt.
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Evet, muhtemelen yanında.
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Seguramente la lleve encima.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: It would be good to have that notebook.
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Yes, probably with you.
es_translation: HABITOFREPENTANCE: Surely he carries it with him.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Yeah. It wasn’t in her locker?
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Ừ, nhưng chắc cậu ấy mang theo rồi. QKẺHỒISINH: Ừ, không có trong ngăn tủ ở trường của Margo à
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Evet. Dolabında değil miydi?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Sí. ¿No estaba en su taquilla?
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Yes, but I'm sure he brought it along. QKẺHỒISINH: Hmm, it's not in Margo's locker at school?
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Yes. Wasn't it in the closet?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Yes. Wasn't it in your locker?

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: No, just textbooks, stacked neat like they always were.
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Không, trong đó chỉ có sách giáo khoa, xếp ngay ngắn như thường ngày.
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Hayır, sadece ders kitapları, her zamanki gibi düzgün bir şekilde duruyordu.
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: No, solo libros de texto perfectamente apilados, como siempre.
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: No, there are only textbooks in there, neatly arranged as usual.
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: No, only the textbooks were there, neatly as always.
es_translation: HABITODEPENITENCIA: No, just perfectly stacked textbooks, as always.

en: I studied at my desk and waited for other people to come online. Ben did after a while, and I invited him into a chat room with me and Lacey. They did most of the talking—I was still sort of translating—until Radar logged in and joined the room. Then I put down my pencil for the night.
vi: Tôi ngồi học và đợi những đứa khác lên mạng. Một lúc sau Ben xuất hiện, tôi mời nó vào phòng tán gẫu với tôi và Lacey. Chàng và nàng nói với nhau là chính–tôi vẫn đang dịch nửa chừng–cho đến khi Radar đăng nhập và cùng tham gia. Lúc ấy tôi đặt bút xuống không học nữa.
tr: Masamda ders çalışıp diğerlerinin çevrimiçi olmasını bekledim. Ben bir süre sonra çevrimiçi oldu, onu Lacey ile benim olduğumuz sohbet odasına davet ettim. Konuşmanın çoğunu onlar yaptıben hâlâ tercüme yapıyor sayılırdım, Radar oturum açıp odaya girene kadar. Sonra o gecelik kalemimi bıraktım.
es: Seguí estudiando en mi mesa y esperé a que se conectara alguien más. Al rato entró Ben, y lo invité a una sala de chat conmigo y con Lacey. Hablaron ellos dos casi todo el tiempo —yo seguía traduciendo—, hasta que se conectó Radar y lo invité a la sala. Entonces dejé el estudio por aquella noche.
vi_translation: I sat studying and waiting for the others to come online. A while later, Ben appeared, and I invited him into the chat room with me and Lacey. The two of them mostly talked to each other—I was still halfway through translating—until Radar logged in and joined us. At that point, I put down my pen and stopped studying.
tr_translation: I studied in my room and waited for the others to come online. After a while, Ben came online, and I invited him to the chat room where Lacey and I were. They did most of the talking; I was still more or less translating until Radar logged in and joined the room. Then I put down my pen for the night.
es_translation: I continued studying at my desk and waited for someone else to log in. After a while, Ben joined, and I invited him to a chat room with me and Lacey. The two of them talked almost the entire time —I kept translating— until Radar logged in and I invited him to the room. Then I stopped studying for the night.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Someone from New York City searched Omnictionary for Margo Roth Spiegelman today.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Hôm nay có người ở thành phố New York đã tìm tên Margo Roth Spiegelman trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Bugün New York’tan birisi Omnictionary’de Margo Roth Spiegelman’ı aramış.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Alguien de Nueva York ha buscado hoy a Margo Roth Spiegelman en el Omnictionary.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFENCYCLOPEDIA96: Today, someone in New York City searched for the name Margo Roth Spiegelman in the Encyclopedia of Everything.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Today, someone from New York searched for Margo Roth Spiegelman on Omnictionary.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Someone from New York searched for Margo Roth Spiegelman on the Omnictionary today.

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Can you tell where in New York City?
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Ông có biết chỗ nào ở thành phố New York không?
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: New York’ta neresi olduğunu söyleyebilir misin?
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: ¿Sabes exactamente de dónde?
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Do you know any place in New York City?
tr_translation: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Can you tell me where in New York?
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Do you know exactly where from?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Unfortunately, no.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Rất tiếc, không.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Ne yazık ki hayır.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Desgraciadamente, no.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHETOTALBOOK96: Sorry, no.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Unfortunately, no.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Unfortunately, no.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Also there are still some posters up in record stores there. It was probably just someone trying to find out about her.
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Vẫn còn mấy tờ rơi trong các cửa hàng băng đĩa ở đó mà. Có khi ai đó đang thử tìm hiểu về Margo.
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Oradaki müzik dükkânlarında hâlâ birkaç poster var. Büyük ihtimalle sadece onunla ilgili bir şeyler öğrenmeye çahşan biridir.
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Todavía hay carteles en varias tiendas de discos. Seguramente ha sido alguien que quería saber quién era.
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: There are still some flyers in the record stores there. Maybe someone is trying to learn about Margo.
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: There are still a few posters in the music shops there. It's most likely someone just trying to learn something about him.
es_translation: HABITODEPENITENCIA: There are still posters in various record stores. Surely it was someone who wanted to know who it was.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Oh, right. I forgot about that.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Ồ, có lí đấy. Tớ quên mất vụ đó.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Ah, doğru. Onu unutmuşum.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Ah, claro. Lo había olvidado.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHEWORLD96: Oh, that makes sense. I forgot about that.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Ah, right. I forgot that.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Oh, right. I had forgotten.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Hey, I’m in and out because I’m using that site Radar showed me to map routes between the places she pinholed.
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Này, tôi lúc có lúc không xuất hiện ở đây nhé, vì tôi đang vào trang mạng mà Radar chỉ, cái trang vạch được nhiều lộ trình từ những nơi Margo đã đánh dấu ấy.
tr: DİRİLİŞ ÇIQ: Hey, ben girip çıkıyorum, çünkü Radar’ın Margo’nun iğneyle işaretlediği yerler arasında güzergâh haritası çıkarmayı gösterdiği şu siteyi kullanıyorum.
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Eh, entro y salgo porque estoy con la página que me mostró Radar para trazar rutas entre los lugares que marcó con una chincheta.
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Hey, I might appear here on and off, because I'm accessing the website that Radar pointed out, the one that maps out many routes from the places Margo has marked.
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞ ÇIQ: Hey, I'm coming and going because I'm using this site where Radar shows how to map out the route between the places Margo marked with pins.
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Eh, I come and go because I'm working with the page that Radar showed me to plot routes between the places he marked with a pushpin.

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Link?
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Đường dẫn thế nào?
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Adres? DİRİLİŞÇİQ: uzunyoldan.
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: Link?
vi_translation: CHRONIC NEPHRITIS: What is the pathway?
tr_translation: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Address? DİRİLİŞÇİQ: uzunyoldan.
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Link?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: I have a new theory. She’s going to show up for graduation, sitting in the audience.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Tôi có một giả thuyết mới. Margo sẽ xuất hiện ở lễ tốt nghiệp, ngồi trong đám khán giả.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Yeni bir teorim var. Mezuniyette izleyiciler arasında otururken ortaya çıkacak.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Tengo una nueva teoría. Va a aparecer en la graduación, sentada entre el público.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHEWORLD96: I have a new hypothesis. Margo will appear at the graduation ceremony, sitting in the audience.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: I have a new theory. It will emerge while sitting among the audience at graduation.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: I have a new theory. She is going to appear at the graduation, sitting among the audience.

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: I have an old theory, that she is somewhere in Orlando, screwing with us and making sure that she’s the center of our universe.
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Tôi theo giả thuyết cũ, Margo vẫn ở đâu đó tại Orlando, khuấy đảo bọn mình và đảm bảo rằng cậu ấy là trung tâm vũ trụ của chúng ta.
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Eski bir teorim var, Orlando’da bir yerlerde, bizimle dalga geçiyor ve evrenimizin merkezi olduğundan emin oluyor.
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: Yo tengo una vieja teoría: está en algún lugar de Orlando, manipulándonos y asegurándose de que es el centro de nuestro universo.
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: I follow the old hypothesis, Margo is still somewhere in Orlando, stirring us up and ensuring that she is the center of our universe.
tr_translation: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: I have an old theory, somewhere in Orlando, mocking us and making sure it's the center of our universe.
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: I have an old theory: it is somewhere in Orlando, manipulating us and making sure it is the center of our universe.

en: SACKCLOTHANDASHES: Ben!
vi: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Ben!
tr: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Ben!
es: HABITODEPENITENCIA: ¡Ben!
vi_translation: VẢIGAIVÀTROTÀN: Ben!
tr_translation: KARALARBAĞLAMIŞ: Me!
es_translation: HABITODEPENITENCIA: Ben!

en: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: Sorry, but I’m totally right.
vi: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Xin lỗi, nhưng tớ đúng triệt để đấy.
tr: OBİRBÖBREKENFEKSİYONUYDU: Üzgünüm ama kesinlikle haklıyım.
es: FUEUNAINFECCIONRENAL: Lo siento, pero tengo toda la razón.
vi_translation: CHỈVIÊMTHẬNTHUIMÀ: Sorry, but I'm absolutely right.
tr_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: I'm sorry but I'm definitely right.
es_translation: ITWASAKIDNEYINFECTION: I'm sorry, but I am completely right.

en: They went on like that, talking about their Margos, as I tried to map her route. If she hadn’t intended the map as a clue—and the ripped tack holes told me she hadn’t—I figured we’d gotten all the clues she’d intended for us and now much more. Surely I had what I needed, then. But I still felt very far away from her.
vi: Tụi nó cứ tiếp tục như thế, nói với nhau về Margo của mình, trong khi tôi tìm cách vạch ra lộ trình của cô ấy. Nếu Margo không dự định rằng tấm bản đồ là một manh mối–và những lỗ rách trên bản đồ đã chỉ ra rằng cô ấy không định thế–tôi rút ra kết luận chúng tôi đã có mọi manh mối cô ấy chủ ý để lại, và giờ còn được thêm. Vậy chắc chắn tôi đã có thứ mình cần. Nhưng sao tôi vẫn thấy xa cách Margo đến thế.
tr: Ben Margo’nun güzergâhının haritasını çıkarmaya çakşırken, onlar böyle, kendi Margo’larından bahsederek devam ettiler. Eğer haritayı bir ipucu olarak belirlememişseve yırtık delikler bana öyle yapmadığını gösteriyordubizim için tasarladığı bütün ipuçlarına ve daha bile fazlasma sahip olduğumuzu düşündüm. O zaman kesinlikle ihtiyacım olan şeye sahiptim. Fakat hâlâ kendimi ondan çok uzakta hissediyordum.
es: Siguieron así, charlando de sus Margos, mientras yo intentaba trazar su ruta. Si no pretendía que el mapa fuera una pista —y los agujeros desgarrados parecían indicar que no lo pretendía—, suponía que teníamos todas las pistas que había previsto y mucho más. Sin duda, tenía lo que necesitaba. Pero seguía sintiéndome muy lejos de ella.
vi_translation: They just kept going like that, talking to each other about their Margo, while I tried to map out her route. If Margo did not intend for the map to be a clue—and the torn holes on the map indicated that she did not—I concluded that we had all the clues she intentionally left behind, and now we had even more. So surely I had what I needed. But why did I still feel so distant from Margo.
tr_translation: While I was trying to map out Ben's route, they continued talking about their own Margo like that. If he hadn't designated the map as a clue and the torn holes showed me he hadn't, I thought we had all the clues he designed for us and even more. Then I definitely had what I needed. But I still felt very far away from her.
es_translation: They continued like this, chatting about their Margos, while I tried to trace their route. If he didn't intend for the map to be a clue —and the torn holes seemed to indicate he didn't—, I supposed we had all the clues he had anticipated and much more. Without a doubt, I had what I needed. But I still felt very far from her.

en: After three long hours alone with eight hundred words from Ovid on Monday morning, I walked through the halls feeling as if my brain might drip out of my ears. But I’d done okay. We had an hour and a half for lunch, to give our minds time to firm back up before the second exam period of the day. Radar was waiting for me at my locker.
vi: Sau ba tiếng đồng hồ một mình với tám trăm chữ của Ovid vào sáng thứ Hai, tôi đi trong hành lang, cảm tưởng như bộ óc mình sắp nhỏ tong tong từ tai ra. Nhưng tôi làm bài ổn. Chúng tôi có một tiếng rưỡi ăn trưa, để não có thời gian đông trở lại trước buổi thi thứ hai trong ngày. Radar đang đợi trước ngăn tủ đựng đồ của tôi.
tr: Pazartesi sabahı, Ovid’den sekiz yüz kelimeyle geçen üç uzun ve yalnız saatten sonra, sanki beynim kulaklarımdan akacakmış gibi hissederek koridorlarda gezindim. Ama iyi geçmişti. Öğle yemeği ve zihinlerimizin günün ikinci sınavından önce tekrar sağlamlaşması için bir buçuk saatimiz vardı. Radar dolabımm başmda beni bekliyordu.
es: El lunes por la mañana, tras tres largas horas a solas con ochocientas palabras de Ovidio, crucé los pasillos con la sensación de que iba a salírseme el cerebro por las orejas. Pero me había ido bien. Tuvimos hora y media para comer y para despejarnos antes del segundo turno de exámenes. Radar estaba esperándome en mi taquilla.
vi_translation: After three hours alone with eight hundred words of Ovid on Monday morning, I walked down the hallway, feeling like my brain was about to drip out of my ears. But I did fine on the test. We had an hour and a half for lunch, to give our brains time to solidify again before the second exam of the day. Radar was waiting in front of my locker.
tr_translation: On Monday morning, after three long and lonely hours spent on eight hundred words of Ovid, feeling as if my brain was about to ooze out of my ears, I wandered the corridors. But it had gone well. We had an hour and a half for lunch and for our minds to solidify again before the second exam of the day. Radar was waiting for me at my locker.
es_translation: On Monday morning, after three long hours alone with eight hundred words of Ovid, I crossed the hallways with the feeling that my brain was going to spill out of my ears. But I had done well. We had an hour and a half to eat and clear our heads before the second round of exams. Radar was waiting for me at my locker.

en: “I just bombed me some Spanish,” Radar said.
vi: “Tôi vừa đánh bom tôi bằng tiếng Tây Ban Nha,” Radar nói.
tr: “Az önce Ispanyolcayla kendimi bombaladım.
es: —Acabo de catear español —me dijo.
vi_translation: “I just bombed myself in Spanish,” Radar said.
tr_translation: “I just bombarded myself with Spanish.”
es_translation: —I just failed Spanish —he told me.

en: “I’m sure you did okay.” He was going to Dartmouth on a huge scholarship. He was plenty smart.
vi: “Chắc chắn ông làm tốt mà.” Nó sẽ đến Dartmouth bằng một học bổng khổng lồ. Radar thừa thông minh.
tr: “Eminim iyi geçmiştir.” Muazzam bir bursla Dartmouth’a gidiyordu. Gayet zekiydi.
es: —Seguro que te ha ido bien. Radar tenía una buena beca para Dartmouth. Era muy inteligente.
vi_translation: “You will definitely do well.” He will go to Dartmouth on a huge scholarship. Radar is more than smart enough.
tr_translation: “I'm sure it went well.” He was going to Dartmouth with an enormous scholarship. He was very intelligent.
es_translation: —I'm sure it went well for you. Radar had a good scholarship for Dartmouth. He was very intelligent.

en: “Dude, I don’t know. I kept falling asleep during the oral part. But listen, I was up half the night building this program. It’s so awesome. What it does is it allows you to enter a category—it can be a geographical area or like a family in the animal kingdom— and then you can read the first sentences of up to a hundred Omnictionary articles about your topic on a single page. So, like, say you are trying to find a particular kind of rabbit but can’t remember its name. You can read an introduction to all twenty-one species of rabbits on the same page in, like, three minutes.”
vi: “Tôi cũng chẳng biết ông ạ. Tôi cứ gà gật suốt lúc thi vấn đáp. Nhưng này, tôi đã thức đến nửa đêm để viết chương trình này. Ngon lành lắm. Nó cho phép ông nhập một mục từ vào–có thể là vùng địa lí hoặc chi họ động vật nào đó–và rồi ông có thể đọc được những câu đầu tiên của khoảng một trăm bài trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ về chủ đề ông đang cần, chỉ trên một trang duy nhất. Ví dụ, ông đang tìm một giống thỏ nào đó nhưng không nhớ tên chính xác. Ông có thể đọc phần giới thiệu tất cả hai mươi mốt loài thỏ trên cùng một trang, trong, xem nào, ba phút.”
tr: “Dostum, bilmiyorum. Sözlü kısmında uyuyakalıp durdum. Ama bak, bu programı kurmak için neredeyse tüm geceyi ayakta geçirdim. Müthiş bir şey. Yaptığı şey şu: Bir kategori girmene imkân veriyorcoğrafi bir alan ya da hayvanlar âleminde bir tür falan olabilirve sonra tek bir sayfada aradığın kategoriyle ilgili yüz Omnictionary makalesinin ilk cümlelerini okuyabiliyorsun. Yani, şöyle, diyelim belli bir tavşan türü bulmaya çalışıyorsun ama adım hatırlayamıyorsun. Uç dakikada falan, yirmi bir tavşan türünün hepsinin girişini aynı sayfada okuyabilirsin.
es: —Tío, no lo sé. Casi me duermo en el oral. Pero es que me he pasado la mitad de la noche despierto haciendo un programa. Es increíble. Tecleas una categoría (puede ser tanto una zona geográfica como una especie animal) y luego puedes leer en una sola página las primeras líneas de unos cien artículos del Omnictionary que tratan sobre ese tema. Pongamos que estás buscando una especie de conejo en concreto, pero no te acuerdas del nombre. Puedes leer la introducción de las veintiuna especies de conejo en la misma página en tres minutos.
vi_translation: “I don't know either, sir. I was dozing off during the oral exam. But hey, I stayed up until midnight to write this program. It's pretty neat. It allows you to enter an entry—maybe a geographical region or some animal genus—and then you can read the first sentences of about a hundred articles in the Encyclopedia of Everything on the subject you need, all on a single page. For example, you're looking for a certain type of rabbit but can't remember the exact name. You can read the introductions of all twenty-one rabbit species on the same page, in, let's see, three minutes.”
tr_translation: “Dude, I don't know. I kept falling asleep during the oral part. But look, I stayed up almost all night to set up this program. It's an amazing thing. What it does is this: It allows you to enter a category—it could be a geographic area or a species in the animal kingdom or something—and then you can read the first sentences of a hundred Omnictionary articles related to the category you're looking for on a single page. So, like, let's say you're trying to find a specific type of rabbit but you can't remember its name. In about three minutes or so, you can read the entries of all twenty-one types of rabbits on the same page.”
es_translation: —Uncle, I don't know. I almost fell asleep during the oral exam. But it's because I spent half the night awake working on a program. It's incredible. You type in a category (it can be either a geographical area or an animal species) and then you can read on a single page the first lines of about a hundred Omnictionary articles related to that topic. Let's say you're looking for a specific species of rabbit, but you can't remember the name. You can read the introduction of the twenty-one species of rabbit on the same page in three minutes.

en: “You did this the night before finals?” I asked.
vi: “Ông làm việc này trong đêm trước ngày thi sao?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Bunu finallerden önceki gece mi yaptın?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Has hecho ese programa la noche antes de los exámenes finales? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: "Are you doing this the night before the exam?" I asked.
tr_translation: “Did you do this the night before the finals?” I asked.
es_translation: —Did you make that program the night before the final exams? —I asked him.

en: “Yeah, I know, right? Anyway I’ll email it to you. It’s nerd-tastic.”
vi: “Ừ, tôi biết, sao chứ? Cơ mà tôi sẽ gửi vào e-mail cho ông. Trò này vui não lắm.”
tr: “Evet, evet biliyorum. Her neyse, sana epostayla gönderirim. Çok inek işi bir şey.
es: —Sí, ya lo sé, ¿vale? Bueno, te lo mandaré por correo. Es una frikada.
vi_translation: “Yeah, I know, so what? But I'll send it to you via email. This game is really mind-bending.”
tr_translation: “Yes, yes I know. Anyway, I will send it to you by email. It's a very nerdy thing.”
es_translation: —Yes, I already know, okay? Alright, I'll send it to you by mail. It's a geeky thing.

en: Ben showed up then. “I swear to God, Q, Lacey and I were up on IM until two o’clock in the morning playing on that site, the-longwayround? And having now plotted every single possible trip that Margo could have taken between Orlando and those five points, I realize I was wrong all this time. She’s not in Orlando. Radar’s right. She’s coming back here for graduation day.”
vi: Ben xuất hiện. “Q ơi, thề có Chúa chứng giám, Lacey và tôi ngồi trên mạng đến hai giờ sáng, nghịch cái trang duongdaivongquanh ấy. Sau khi soát hết từng tuyến Margo có thể đi từ Orlando đến năm điểm kia, tôi kết luận hóa ra suốt từ đầu tôi đã sai lè. Margo không ở Orlando. Radar nói đúng. Cậu ấy sẽ quay lại vào ngày lễ tốt nghiệp.”
tr: O sırada Ben ortaya çıktı. ‘Yemin ederim, Q, Laceyyle şu sitede oynayarak sabahın ikisine kadar sohbet programında takıldık, şu uzunyoldan sitesinde? Margo’nun Orlando ile şu beş nokta arasında yapmış olabileceği her olası geziyi saptayınca, bunca zamandır yanılmış olduğumu fark ettim. O Orlando’da değil. Radar haklı. Mezuniyet günü için buraya geri dönecek.
es: Entonces apareció Ben. —Q, te juro por Dios que Lacey y yo estuvimos en el chat hasta las dos de la mañana liados con la página que nos pasaste. Y ahora que hemos trazado todas las rutas que Margo podría haber hecho entre Orlando y esos cinco puntos, me doy cuenta de que he estado equivocado en todo momento. No está en Orlando. Radar tiene razón. Volverá para la graduación.
vi_translation: Ben appeared. "Q, I swear to God, Lacey and I were online until two in the morning, messing around with that duongdaivongquanh site. After checking every route Margo could take from Orlando to those five points, I concluded that I had been completely wrong from the start. Margo is not in Orlando. Radar was right. She will come back on graduation day."
tr_translation: At that moment, Ben appeared. ‘I swear, Q, Lacey and I were playing on that site and hanging out on the chat program until two in the morning, that On the uzunyoldan site? When I identified every possible trip Margo could have taken between these five points with Orlando, I realized that I had been wrong all this time. She is not in Orlando. Radar is right. She will come back here for graduation day.”
es_translation: Then Ben appeared. —Q, I swear to God that Lacey and I were on the chat until two in the morning tangled up with the page you gave us. And now that we have mapped out all the routes Margo could have taken between Orlando and those five points, I realize that I have been wrong all along. She is not in Orlando. Radar is right. She will come back for graduation.

en: “Why?”
vi: “Tại sao?”
tr: “Neden?
es: —¿Por qué?
vi_translation: "Why?"
tr_translation: “Why?”
es_translation: —Why?

en: “The timing is perfect. To drive from Orlando to New York to the mountains to Chicago to Los Angeles back to Orlando is like exactly a twenty-three-day trip. Plus, it’s a totally retarded joke, but it’s a Margo joke. You make everyone think you offed yourself. Surround yourself with an air of mystery so that everyone pays attention. And then right as all the attention starts to go away, you show up at graduation.”
vi: “Thời điểm hoàn hảo. Lái xe từ Orlando đến New York đến rặng núi đến Chicago đến Los Angeles rồi quay về Orlando là một chuyến đi chính xác hai mươi ba ngày. Thêm nữa, trò này thâm thật, nhưng đó là kiểu của Margo. Khiến mọi người tin rằng mình đã tiêu rồi. Giăng một màn khói bí ẩn, giấu mình trong đó để ai cũng phải chú ý. Và rồi khi sự chú ý bắt đầu nhạt đi, thì đột ngột lộ diện ở lễ tốt nghiệp.”
tr: “Zamanlama mükemmel. Orlando’dan New York’a, dağlara, Şikago’ya, Los Angeles’a, tekrar Orlando’ya arabayla gitmek tam olarak yirmi üç günlük bir yolculuk. Bu gerçekten özürlü bir şaka ama bir Margo şakası. Herkes ilgi göstersin diye kendini bir gizem havasıyla çevrele. Sonra tam bütün ilgi dağılmaya başlarken, mezuniyette ortaya çık.
es: —Está perfectamente cronometrado. Ir en coche desde Orlando a Nueva York, a las montañas de Chicago, a Los Ángeles y volver a Orlando son exactamente veintitrés días. Además, es una broma de anormal, pero es cosa de Margo. Haces que todo el mundo piense que te has quitado de en medio. Te rodeas de un halo de misterio para que todos te presten atención. Y justo cuando empieza a esfumarse el interés, apareces en la graduación.
vi_translation: “The perfect timing. Driving from Orlando to New York to the mountains to Chicago to Los Angeles and then back to Orlando is exactly a twenty-three-day trip. Moreover, this trick is really deep, but that's Margo's style. Making everyone believe that she's gone. Creating a mysterious smoke screen, hiding herself in it so that everyone has to pay attention. And then when the attention starts to fade, suddenly showing up at graduation.”
tr_translation: “The timing is perfect. Driving from Orlando to New York, to the mountains, to Chicago, to Los Angeles, and back to Orlando is exactly a twenty-three-day journey. This is really a lame joke but a Margo joke. Surround yourself with an air of mystery so everyone pays attention. Then, just as all the attention starts to fade, show up at graduation.”
es_translation: —It is perfectly timed. Driving from Orlando to New York, to the mountains of Chicago, to Los Angeles and back to Orlando takes exactly twenty-three days. Besides, it’s a crazy joke, but it’s Margo’s thing. You make everyone think you’ve disappeared. You surround yourself with an aura of mystery so that everyone pays attention to you. And just when the interest starts to fade, you show up at graduation.

en: “No,” I said. “No way.” I knew Margo better than that by now. She did want attention. I believed that. But Margo didn’t play life for laughs. She didn’t get off on mere trickery.
vi: “Không,” tôi nói. “Không thể nào.” Bây giờ tôi đã hiểu Margo rõ hơn. Cô ấy muốn được chú ý. Tôi tin như vậy. Nhưng Margo không đùa với sinh mạng để mua vui. Cô ấy không bỏ đi chỉ để chơi khăm như vậy.
tr: “Hayır,” dedim. “Mümkün değil.” Şimdiye kadar Margo’yu bundan daha iyi tanımıştım. İlgi istiyordu. Buna inanırdım. Ama Margo eğlence olsun diye hayatla oynamazdı. Salt düzenbazlıktan zevk almazdı.
es: —No —le dije—. Imposible. Ya conocía mejor a Margo. Sí que creía que le gustaba llamar la atención, pero Margo no se tomaba la vida a risa. No se había quitado de en medio para engañarnos.
vi_translation: “No,” I said. “No way.” Now I understand Margo better. She wants to be noticed. I believe so. But Margo doesn't joke with life to have fun. She didn't leave just to play a prank like that.
tr_translation: “No,” I said. “It's not possible.” By now, I had known Margo better than this. She wanted attention. I believed that. But Margo wouldn't play with life just for fun. She didn't take pleasure in sheer trickery.
es_translation: —No —I said—. Impossible. I already knew Margo better. I did believe that she liked to attract attention, but Margo did not take life lightly. She hadn't disappeared to deceive us.

en: “I’m telling you, bro. Look for her at graduation. She’s gonna be there.” I just shook my head. Since everyone had the same lunch period, the cafeteria was beyond packed, so we exercised our rights as seniors and drove to Wendy’s. I tried to stay focused on my coming calc exam, but I was starting to feel like maybe there was more string to the story. If Ben was right about the twenty-three-day trip, that was very interesting, indeed. Maybe that’s what she’d been planning in her black notebook, a long and lonesome road trip. It didn’t explain everything, but it did fit with Margo as a planner. Not that this brought me closer to her. As hard as it is to pinpoint a dot inside a ripped segment of a map, it only becomes harder when the dot is moving.
vi: “Này bồ, tôi đang nói với ông đấy. Hãy tìm Margo ở lễ tốt nghiệp ấy. Cậu ấy sẽ xuất hiện cho coi.” Tôi chỉ lắc đầu. Mọi người ăn trưa cùng một thời gian nên căng-tin đông như nêm, bọn tôi bèn thực hành quyền của học sinh năm cuối và lái xe đến tiệm kem Wendy’s. Cố gắng tập trung vào bài thi giải tích sắp tới, nhưng tôi bắt đầu cảm thấy hình như câu chuyện còn cần thêm dây nối. Nếu Ben đúng về chặng đường hai mươi ba ngày, điều đó quả cũng rất thú vị. Có thể đó là những gì Margo đã lập kế hoạch trong cuốn sổ màu đen, một hành trình bằng ô-tô, dài và đơn độc. Điều đó không giải thích được tất cả, nhưng hợp với một Margo thích lập kế hoạch. Như thế không có nghĩa là điều đó nhích tôi đến gần cô ấy hơn. Xác định một chấm trong mảnh bản đồ rách đã khó, khi cái chấm di chuyển thì còn khó hơn.
tr: “Sana söylüyorum, kardeşim. Mezuniyette onu ara. Orada olacak.” Sadece başımı salladım. Herkesin öğle arası aynı olduğu için, kafeterya tıka basa dolu olmanın da ötesindeydi, bu yüzden son sınıflar olarak hakkımızı kullanıp arabayla Wendy’s’e gittik. Yaklaşan matematik sınavıma odaklanmaya çalıştım ama hikâyede daha fazla ip varmış gibi hissetmeye başlamıştım. Eğer Ben yirmi üç günlük gezide haklıysa, bu gerçekten çok ilginçti. Belki siyah defterinde planladığı şey buydu, uzun ve yapayalnız çıkılacak bir gezi. Her şeyi açıklamıyordu ama bir plancı olarak Margo’ya uyuyordu. Bu beni ona daha çok yaklaştırmıyordu tabii. Yırtılmış bir haritada bir noktayı saptamak zordur; üstüne üstlük bu nokta bir de hareket ediyorsa saptamak daha da zorlaşır.
es: —Te lo digo, colega. Búscala en la graduación. Allí estará. Negué con la cabeza. Como todo el mundo tenía la misma hora para comer, la cafetería estaba hasta los topes, así que ejercimos nuestro derecho como alumnos de último curso y fuimos en coche al Wendy’s. Intenté centrarme en el examen de cálculo, pero empecé a sentir que la historia tenía más hilos. Si Ben tenía razón en lo de los veintitrés días de viaje, el dato era sin duda interesante. Quizá era lo que había planificado en su libreta negra, un largo y solitario viaje por carretera. No lo explicaba todo, pero encajaba con el talante planificador de Margo. Y tampoco me acercaba a ella. Bastante difícil era ya localizar un punto en un trozo de mapa arrugado para que encima el punto se moviera.
vi_translation: "Hey buddy, I'm talking to you." "Find Margo at that graduation ceremony." "She will show up, you'll see." I just shook my head. Everyone had lunch at the same time, so the cafeteria was packed, and we exercised our senior privilege by driving to Wendy's for ice cream. Trying to focus on the upcoming calculus exam, but I started to feel like the story needed more connections. If Ben was right about the twenty-three-day journey, that would indeed be very interesting. Maybe that's what Margo had planned in her black notebook, a long and solitary road trip. That doesn't explain everything, but it fits with a Margo who likes to plan. That doesn't mean it brings me any closer to her. Identifying a dot on a torn map was hard enough; when the dot moves, it's even harder.
tr_translation: “I’m telling you, my brother. Call her at graduation. She will be there.” I just nodded. Since everyone had the same lunch break, the cafeteria was beyond packed, so as seniors, we used our privilege and drove to Wendy’s. I tried to focus on my upcoming math exam, but I started to feel like there were more threads in the story. If Ben was right about the twenty-three-day trip, this was really interesting. Maybe this was what he had planned in his black notebook, a long and lonely trip. It didn’t explain everything, but it fit Margo as a planner. Of course, this didn’t bring me any closer to her. It’s hard to pinpoint a spot on a torn map; moreover, if this spot is also moving, it becomes even harder to pinpoint.
es_translation: —I'm telling you, buddy. Look for her at the graduation. She'll be there. I shook my head. Since everyone had the same lunch hour, the cafeteria was packed, so we exercised our right as seniors and drove to Wendy’s. I tried to focus on the calculus exam, but I started to feel that the story had more threads. If Ben was right about the twenty-three days of travel, the fact was certainly interesting. Maybe it was what he had planned in his black notebook, a long and lonely road trip. It didn’t explain everything, but it fit with Margo’s planning nature. And it didn’t bring me any closer to her. It was already hard enough to locate a point on a crumpled piece of map without the point moving.

en: After a long day of finals, returning to the comfortable impenetrability of “Song of Myself” was almost a relief. I had reached a weird part of the poem—after all this time listening and hearing people, and then traveling alongside them, Whitman stops hearing and he stops visiting, and he starts to become other people. Like, actually inhabit them. He tells the story of a ship’s captain who saved everyone on his boat except himself. The poet can tell the story, he argues, because he has become the captain. As he writes, “I am the man . . . . I suffered . . . . I was there.” A few lines later, it becomes even more clear that Whitman no longer needs to listen to become another: “I do not ask the wounded person how he feels . . . . I myself become the wounded person.”
vi: Sau một ngày dài toàn thi cử, trở về với sự bất khả xâm phạm dễ chịu của “Tự khúc” gần như là một giải tỏa nhẹ nhõm. Tôi đọc đến một đoạn rất lạ của bài thơ–sau tất cả thời gian nghe và lắng nghe con người, rồi phiêu du cùng họ, Whitman không nghe nữa và không phiêu du nữa, ông bắt đầu trở thành những người khác. Như thể thực sự ở trong họ. Ông kể chuyện vị thuyền trưởng một con tàu đã cứu được tất cả mọi người trên tàu, trừ chính ông ta. Whitman nói rằng thi sĩ kể được câu chuyện vì ông đã trở thành vị thuyền trưởng đó. Khi ông viết, “Ta là người đàn ông ấy... Ta chịu đựng... Ta đã ở đó.” Mấy dòng sau, càng rõ ràng là Whitman không cần phải lắng nghe để trở thành người khác nữa: “Ta không hỏi người mang vết thương rằng anh có thấy đau không... Chính ta trở thành người mang vết thương.”
tr: Uzun bir sınav gününden sonra, Kendi Şarkım’m huzurlu anlaşılmazlığına dönmek neredeyse rahatlatıcıydı. Şiirin tuhaf bir bölümüne ulaşmıştım... İnsanları duymak, dinlemek ve yanlarında gezinmekle geçen bunca zamandan sonra, Whitman duymayı ve ziyaret etmeyi bırakıyor ve diğer insanlar olmaya başlıyor. Aslında içlerinde yaşıyormuş gibi. Kendisi hariç gemisindeki herkesi kurtaran bir kaptanın hikâyesini anlatıyor. Şair hikâyeyi anlatabildiğim çünkü kaptan olduğunu söylüyor. “Ben o adamım... Acı çektim... Oradaydım,” diye yazıyor. Birkaç dize sonra, Whitman’ın başkaları olmak için artık dinlemeye ihtiyaç duymadığı daha da netleşiyor: “Yaralı kişiye nasıl hissettiğini sormam... Ben, kendim o yaralı insan olurum.
es: Después de un largo día de exámenes finales, volver al cómodo hermetismo del «Canto de mí mismo» era casi un alivio. Había llegado a una parte rara del poema. Después de haber estado escuchando y oyendo a la gente, y viajando con ella, Whitman deja de escuchar y de viajar y empieza a convertirse en otras personas. Como si habitara en ellas. Cuenta la historia de un capitán de barco que salvó a todo el mundo menos a sí mismo. El poeta dice que puede contar esa historia porque se ha convertido en el capitán. Y escribe: «Yo soy el hombre, yo padecí, yo estaba allí». Unos versos después queda todavía más claro que Whitman ya no necesita escuchar para convertirse en otra persona: «No pregunto al herido cómo se siente, soy el herido».
vi_translation: After a long day full of exams, returning to the pleasant inviolability of "Tự khúc" is almost a light relief. I read a very strange passage of the poem—after all the time listening and hearing people, then wandering with them, Whitman no longer listens and no longer wanders, he begins to become other people. As if truly being inside them. He tells the story of the captain of a ship who saved everyone on board, except himself. Whitman says that the poet can tell the story because he has become that captain. When he writes, "I am that man... I endure... I was there." A few lines later, it becomes even clearer that Whitman no longer needs to listen to become someone else: "I do not ask the wounded person how he feels... I myself become the wounded person."
tr_translation: After a long exam day, returning to the peaceful incomprehensibility of My Own Song was almost comforting. I had reached a strange part of the poem... After spending so much time hearing, listening to, and wandering among people, Whitman hearing and stops visiting and starts becoming other people. As if he were living inside them. He tells the story of a captain who saved everyone on his ship except himself. The poet says he can tell the story because he is the captain. “I am that man... I suffered... I was there,” he writes. A few lines later, it becomes even clearer that Whitman no longer needs to listen to become others: “I do not ask the wounded person how he feels... I myself become the wounded person.”
es_translation: After a long day of final exams, returning to the comfortable seclusion of "Song of Myself" was almost a relief. I had reached a strange part of the poem. After having been listening to and hearing people, and traveling with them, Whitman stops listening and traveling and starts becoming other people. As if he inhabited them. He tells the story of a ship captain who saved everyone except himself. The poet says he can tell that story because he has become the captain. And he writes: "I am the man, I suffered, I was there." A few verses later it becomes even clearer that Whitman no longer needs to listen to become another person: "I do not ask the wounded how he feels, I am the wounded."

en: I put the book down and lay on my side, staring out the window that had always been between us. It is not enough just to see her or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi: Tôi đặt cuốn sách xuống và nằm nghiêng, nhìn ra ô cửa sổ đã luôn ở giữa tôi và cô ấy. Chỉ nhìn hoặc nghe thấy cô ấy là không đủ. Để tìm được Margo Roth Spiegelman, ta phải trở thành Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr: Kitabı kenara koyup hep aramızda olan pencereden dışarı bakarak yan dönüyorum. Onu yalnızca görmek ya da duymak yeterli değil. Margo Roth Spiegelman’ı bulmak için Margo Roth Spiegelman olmalısınız.
es: Dejé el libro y me tumbé de lado, mirando por la ventana que siempre había estado entre nosotros. No basta con verla o escucharla. Para encontrar a Margo Roth Spiegelman tienes que convertirte en Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi_translation: I put the book down and lay on my side, looking out the window that had always been between me and her. Just seeing or hearing her was not enough. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, one must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr_translation: I put the book aside and turn sideways to look outside through the window that has always been between us. It is not enough to just see or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
es_translation: I put down the book and lay on my side, looking through the window that had always been between us. It's not enough to see her or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you have to become Margo Roth Spiegelman.

en: And I had done many of the things she might have done: I had engineered a most unlikely prom coupling. I had quieted the hounds of caste warfare. I had come to feel comfortable inside the rat-infested haunted house where she did her best thinking. I had seen. I had listened. But I could not yet become the wounded person.
vi: Tôi đã làm nhiều điều cô ấy có thể đã làm: Tôi đã chế ra một đôi ít có khả năng đi dạ tiệc cùng nhau nhất. Tôi đã dẹp yên bầy chó săn của cuộc chiến đẳng cấp. Tôi đã tự nhiên thoải mái ở trong căn nhà ma nơi bọn chuột là bá chủ, nơi cô ấy đã suy tư nhiều nhất. Tôi đã thấy. Tôi đã lắng nghe. Nhưng tôi chưa thể trở thành người mang vết thương.
tr: Ve onun yapmış olabileceklerinin birçoğunu yapmıştım: Birlikteliği imkânsız bir balo çifti ayarlamıştım. Sosyal sınıf savaşının köpeklerini susturmuştum. Düşünme eylemim en iyi yaptığı yer olan farelerin istila ettiği, perili evde rahat hissetmeyi başarmıştım. Görmüştüm. Dinlemiştim. Ama henüz o yaralı insan olamamıştım.
es: Y había hecho muchas de las cosas que quizá ella había hecho. Había conseguido unir a la pareja más inverosímil del baile. Había acallado a los perros de la guerra de castas. Había conseguido sentirme cómodo en la casa encantada y llena de ratas en la que Margo lo había planificado todo. Había visto. Había escuchado. Pero todavía no podía convertirme en la persona herida.
vi_translation: I did many things she might have done: I created a pair least likely to attend a gala together. I silenced the hounds of the class war. I was naturally comfortable in the haunted house where the rats reigned supreme, where she had done most of her thinking. I saw. I listened. But I have yet to become the bearer of the wound.
tr_translation: And I had done many of the things he might have done: I had arranged an impossible ballroom couple. I had silenced the dogs of social class warfare. I had managed to feel comfortable in the haunted house infested with mice, where my thinking action was at its best. I had seen. I had listened. But I had not yet become that wounded person.
es_translation: And I had done many of the things that perhaps she had done. I had managed to unite the most unlikely couple at the dance. I had silenced the dogs of the caste war. I had managed to feel comfortable in the haunted, rat-filled house where Margo had planned everything. I had seen. I had listened. But I still couldn't become the wounded person.

en: I limped through my physics and government finals the next day and then stayed up till 2 A.M. on Tuesday finishing my final reaction paper for English about Moby Dick. Ahab was a hero, I decided. I had no particular reason for having decided this—particularly given that I hadn’t read the book—but I decided it and reacted thusly.
vi: Ngày hôm sau, tôi lờ đờ suốt bài thi vật lí và môn nhà nước và chính quyền, rồi thứ Ba thức đến 2 giờ sáng hoàn thành bài luận cuối cùng môn Quốc ngữ, về Moby Dick. Ahab là anh hùng, tôi đã quyết định như vậy. Không có lí do gì đặc biệt cho quyết định đó–đặc biệt trong hoàn cảnh tôi chưa đọc cuốn sách–nhưng tôi đã quyết định vậy và cứ thế viết nốt thôi.
tr: Ertesi gün, ağır aksak fizik ve siyaset sınavlarımı geçtim ve sonra edebiyattan Moby Dick’le ilgili final ödevimi bitirmek için sah günü sabah ikiye kadar uyumadım. Ahab’ın bir kahraman olduğuna karar verdim. Buna karar vermek için özel bir nedenim yoktuözellikle de kitabı okumadığım düşünülürseama buna karar verdim ve öyle tepki gösterdim.
es: Al día siguiente hice como pude los exámenes de física y política, y el martes me quedé hasta las dos de la madrugada terminando el trabajo de fin de curso de literatura sobre Moby Dick. Decidí que Ahab era un héroe. No tenía especiales motivos para tomar esa decisión —sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que no había leído el libro—, pero lo decidí y actué en consecuencia.
vi_translation: The next day, I was sluggish throughout the physics exam and the government and politics class, then on Tuesday stayed up until 2 AM to finish the final essay for the National Language subject, about Moby Dick. Ahab is a hero, I have decided that. There is no particular reason for this decision—especially since I haven't read the book—but I have decided it and just went on writing.
tr_translation: The next day, I barely passed my physics and politics exams, and then I stayed up until two in the morning to finish my final assignment on Moby Dick for literature. I decided that Ahab was a hero. I had no particular reason for this decision—especially considering I hadn't read the book—but I made the decision and reacted accordingly.
es_translation: The next day I did the physics and politics exams as best as I could, and on Tuesday I stayed up until two in the morning finishing the end-of-course literature paper on Moby Dick. I decided that Ahab was a hero. I had no particular reason for making that decision—especially considering that I hadn't read the book—but I decided it and acted accordingly.

en: The abbreviated exam week meant that Wednesday was the last day of school for us. And all day long, it was hard not to walk around thinking about the lastness of it all: The last time I stand in a circle outside the band room in the shade of this oak tree that has protected generations of band geeks. The last time I eat pizza in the cafeteria with Ben. The last time I sit in this school scrawling an essay with a cramped hand into a blue book. The last time I glance up at the clock. The last time I see Chuck Parson prowling the halls, his smile half a sneer. God. I was becoming nostalgic for Chuck Parson. Something sick was happening inside of me.
vi: Tuần thi được rút gọn đồng nghĩa rằng thứ Tư là ngày cuối của chúng tôi ở trường. Suốt cả ngày hôm đó, khó mà không đi vòng vòng, nghĩ đến những sự cuối cùng của tất cả: Lần cuối đứng với mấy đứa thành một vòng tròn bên ngoài phòng tập nhạc, dưới bóng sồi đã bảo bọc bao thế hệ nhạc công kì tài này. Lần cuối ăn pizza trong căng-tin với Ben. Lần cuối ngồi trong ngôi trường này, một tay viết vội bài luận, một tay kẹp giữa cuốn sách màu xanh. Lần cuối lé mắt liếc đồng hồ. Lần cuối thấy Chuck Parson lầm lầm đi qua hành lang, nụ cười thoáng vẻ khinh mạn bất cần đời. Trời đất. Tôi bắt đầu lưu luyến Chuck Parson mới ghê chứ. Thứ bệnh gì đó đang hoành hành trong tôi mất rồi.
tr: Kısaltılmış sınav haftası, çarşambanın bizim için okulun son günü olduğu anlamına geliyordu. Ve bütün gün, etrafta dolaşıp hepsinin sonluluğunu düşünmemek zordu: bando odasının önünde, nesiller boyu bando ineklerini korumuş olan o meşe ağacının gölgesinde, bir çember içinde son duruşum. Kafeteryada Ben’le son pizza yiyişim. Bu okulda oturup büzdüğüm elimle, mavi bir deftere son kompozisyon karalayışım. Saate son bakışım. Chuck Parson’m kısmen küçümseyen gülümseyişiyle koridorları kolaçan edişini son görüşüm. Tanrım. Chuck Parson için özlem duyuyordum. İçimde hastalıklı bir şey oluyordu.
es: La reducida semana de exámenes implicaba que el miércoles fuera nuestro último día de clase. Y durante todo el día me resultó difícil no pasear por ahí pensando en todo lo que hacía por última vez. La última vez que formaba un corro junto a la puerta de la sala de ensayo, a la sombra del roble que ha protegido a generaciones de frikis de la banda. La última vez que comía pizza en la cafetería con Ben. La última vez que me sentaba en ese instituto a escribir un trabajo con una mano metida en un libro azul. La última vez que miraba el reloj. La última vez que veía a Chuck Parson merodeando por los pasillos con una sonrisa medio desdeñosa. Joder. Empezaba a sentir nostalgia de Chuck Parson. Debía de estar enfermo.
vi_translation: The shortened exam week means that Wednesday is our last day at school. Throughout that day, it was hard not to wander around, thinking about all the lasts: The last time standing with the group in a circle outside the music room, under the oak tree that has sheltered generations of talented musicians. The last time eating pizza in the cafeteria with Ben. The last time sitting in this school, one hand hurriedly writing an essay, the other hand wedged between the pages of a blue book. The last time glancing at the clock. The last time seeing Chuck Parson trudging through the hallway, with a fleetingly disdainful and nonchalant smile. Oh my. I'm starting to feel nostalgic about Chuck Parson, of all people. Some kind of illness must be taking over me.
tr_translation: The shortened exam week meant that Wednesday was our last day of school. And all day, it was hard not to think about the finality of it all: in front of the band room, under the shade of that oak tree that had sheltered generations of band geeks, my last stand in a circle. My last pizza with Ben in the cafeteria. My last scribbled essay in a blue notebook, sitting in this school with my clenched hand. My last glance at the clock. Chuck Parson’s partially scornful smile as he patrolled the hallways for the last time. my view. My God. I was longing for Chuck Parson. Something sickly was happening inside me.
es_translation: The shortened exam week meant that Wednesday was our last day of class. And throughout the day, I found it difficult not to wander around thinking about everything I was doing for the last time. The last time forming a circle by the rehearsal room door, in the shade of the oak tree that has sheltered generations of band geeks. The last time eating pizza in the cafeteria with Ben. The last time sitting in that high school writing a paper with one hand tucked into a blue book. The last time looking at the clock. The last time seeing Chuck Parson lurking in the hallways with a half-contemptuous smile. Damn. I was starting to feel nostalgic for Chuck Parson. I must have been sick.

en: It must have been like this for Margo, too. With all the planning she’d done, she must have known she was leaving, and even she couldn’t have been totally immune to the feeling. She’d had good days here. And on the last day, the bad days become so difficult to recall, because one way or another, she had made a life here, just as I had. The town was paper, but the memories were not. All the things I’d done here, all the love and pity and compassion and violence and spite, kept welling up inside me. These whitewashed cinder-block walls. My white walls. Margo’s white walls. We’d been captive in them for so long, stuck in their belly like Jonah.
vi: Với Margo hẳn tất cả cũng như vậy. Với tất cả thời gian lập kế hoạch, hẳn cô ấy biết mình sẽ ra đi, thậm chí lẽ ra cô ấy đã không hoàn toàn miễn dịch với cảm xúc. Cô ấy đã có những ngày tươi đẹp ở đây. Những giờ phút cuối cùng, thật khó gợi lại những ngày tồi tệ, vì bằng cách này hay cách khác, cô ấy đã qua một phần đời ở nơi này, cũng giống như tôi. Thành phố này là giấy, nhưng những kỉ niệm thì không. Tất cả những gì tôi đã làm ở đây, tất cả những trìu mến, xót xa, thương cảm, tàn bạo và độc ác, tất cả đang đầy lên trong tôi. Những bức tường tổ ong sơn trắng. Những bức tường trắng của tôi. Những bức tường trắng của Margo. Chúng tôi đã bị hãm giữa những bức tường ấy quá lâu, bị mắc kẹt trong bụng nó như Jonah bị mắc kẹt trong bụng cá vậy.
tr: Margo için de böyle olmuş olmalıydı. Yaptığı bütün o planlamaya göre, gideceğini biliyor olmalıydı ve o bile duygulardan tamamen muaf değildi. Burada iyi günler geçirmişti. İnsanın son gününde, kötü günleri hatırlamak çok zor hale gelir çünkü öyle ya da böyle, o da burada tıpkı benim yaptığım gibi bir yaşam kurmuştu. Kent kâğıttandı ama hatıralar değildi. Burada yaptıklarımın hepsi, bütün o sevgi, merhamet, şefkat, şiddet ve kin, içimde birikmeye devam ediyordu. Bu badanalanmış beton duvarlar. Benim beyaz duvarlarım. Margo’nun beyaz duvarları. Onlar arasında öyle uzun zamandır tutsaktık ki, Yunus gibi midelerinde sıkışıp kalmıştık.
es: Algo así debió de sentir también Margo. Mientras hacía sus planes, sin duda sabía que se marcharía, y seguramente ni siquiera ella pudo ser del todo inmune a aquel sentimiento. Había pasado buenos momentos en aquel instituto. Y el último día es muy difícil recordar los malos, porque en cualquier caso había hecho su vida allí, como yo. La ciudad era papel, pero los recuerdos no. Todo lo que había hecho allí, todo el amor, la pena, la compasión, la violencia y el rencor seguían manando desde mi interior. Aquellas paredes de hormigón encaladas. Mis paredes blancas. Las paredes blancas de Margo. Durante mucho tiempo habíamos estado cautivos entre ellas, atrapados en su estómago, como Jonah.
vi_translation: For Margo, it must have been the same. With all the time spent planning, she must have known she was going to leave, even though she wasn't entirely immune to emotions. She had some beautiful days here. In the final moments, it was hard to recall the bad days, because in one way or another, she had spent part of her life in this place, just like I did. This city is paper, but the memories are not. Everything I did here, all the affection, sorrow, compassion, cruelty, and malice, it's all filling up inside me. The white-painted honeycomb walls. My white walls. Margo's white walls. We had been trapped between those walls for too long, stuck in its belly like Jonah was stuck in the belly of the whale.
tr_translation: It must have been the same for Margo. According to all the planning she did, she must have known she was going to leave, and even she wasn't completely devoid of emotions. She had had good days here. On one's last day, it becomes very difficult to remember the bad days because, one way or another, she too had built a life here just like I did. The city was made of paper, but the memories were not. Everything I did here, all that love, compassion, tenderness, violence, and hatred, continued to accumulate inside me. These whitewashed concrete walls. My white walls. Margo's white walls. We had been trapped among them for so long that we were stuck in their stomachs like Jonah.
es_translation: Something like that Margo must have felt too. While she was making her plans, she undoubtedly knew she would leave, and surely even she couldn't be completely immune to that feeling. She had had good times at that school. And on the last day, it's very hard to remember the bad times, because in any case, she had made her life there, just like I did. The city was paper, but the memories were not. Everything she had done there, all the love, the sorrow, the compassion, the violence, and the resentment kept flowing from within me. Those whitewashed concrete walls. My white walls. Margo's white walls. For a long time, we had been captives within them, trapped in their stomach, like Jonah.

en: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that maybe this feeling was why she’d planned everything so intricately and precisely: even if you want to leave, it is so hard. It took preparation, and maybe sitting in that minimall scrawling her plans was both intellectual and emotional practice—Margo’s way of imagining herself into her fate.
vi: Suốt cả ngày, tôi đã nghĩ có lẽ chính cảm xúc này là lí do tại sao cô ấy lại lên kế hoạch tất cả thật chi tiết và chính xác: dù có muốn đi nữa, ra đi vẫn thật khó khăn. Cần được chuẩn bị, và có lẽ ngồi vạch kế hoạch trong khu mua sắm bỏ hoang đó là một việc vừa trí tuệ vừa đầy cảm xúc–cách Margo hình dung về chính mình dấn thân vào số phận.
tr: Gün boyunca, Margo’nun her şeyi bu kadar detaylı ve kesin olarak planlamasının nedeni belki de bu duyguydu, diye düşünürken buldum kendimi: Gitmek isteseniz bile, bu öyle zordu ki. Hazırlanmak gerekiyordu ve belki de abşveriş merkezinde oturup planlarım karalamak hem zihinsel hem de duygusal alıştırmaydı... Margo’nun kaderini yaşarkenki halini hayal etme yoluydu.
es: A lo largo del día me descubrí pensando que quizá aquel sentimiento era la razón por la que Margo lo había planificado todo de forma tan compleja y precisa. Aunque quieras marcharte, es muy difícil. Necesitó preparación, y quizá sentarse en aquel centro comercial a escribir sus planes era una labor tanto intelectual como emocional, su manera de imaginarse a sí misma en su destino.
vi_translation: All day long, I had thought that perhaps this emotion was the reason why she planned everything so meticulously and precisely: even if you want to go, leaving is still very difficult. It needs to be prepared, and perhaps sitting down to plan in that abandoned shopping mall was both an intellectual and emotional task—the way Margo envisioned herself embarking on her destiny.
tr_translation: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that perhaps this was the reason Margo planned everything so meticulously and precisely: Even if you wanted to leave, it was so difficult. You had to prepare, and maybe sitting in the shopping mall scribbling my plans was both a mental and emotional exercise... A way to imagine Margo living out her destiny.
es_translation: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that perhaps that feeling was the reason why Margo had planned everything so complexly and precisely. Even if you want to leave, it is very difficult. It required preparation, and perhaps sitting in that shopping mall to write her plans was both an intellectual and emotional task, her way of imagining herself at her destination.

en: Ben and Radar both had a marathon band practice to make sure they would rock “Pomp and Circumstance” at graduation. Lacey offered me a ride, but I decided to clean out my locker, because I didn’t really want to come back here and again have to feel like my lungs were drowning in this perverse nostalgia.
vi: Ben và Radar tập nhạc ròng rã để đảm bảo rằng tụi nó sẽ khiến tất cả phải rung chuyển trong hành khúc “Pomp and Circumstance” ở lễ tốt nghiệp. Lacey nói có thể đưa tôi về, nhưng tôi quyết định dọn dẹp ngăn tủ cá nhân vì không muốn quay lại trường và lại phải cảm thấy hai lá phổi mình sắp chết chìm trong những nhớ nhung ngang ngạnh trào lên.
tr: Hem Ben’in hem de Radar’ın, mezuniyette Pomp and Circumstance marşını hakkıyla çalacaklarından emin olmak için yapmaları gereken uzun soluklu bir bando provası vardı. Lacey beni arabayla götürmeyi teklif etti ama ben dolabımı temizlemeye karar verdim çünkü buraya daha sonra geri dönüp ciğerlerimin bu sapkın özlem içinde boğulduğunu hissetmek zorunda kalmayı gerçekten istemiyordum.
es: Ben y Radar tenían un ensayo maratoniano con la banda para asegurarse de que tocarían «Pompa y circunstancia» en la graduación. Lacey se ofreció a llevarme a casa, pero decidí vaciar mi taquilla, porque la verdad era que no me apetecía volver al instituto y tener que sentir de nuevo mis pulmones ahogándose en aquella obstinada nostalgia.
vi_translation: Ben and Radar practiced music tirelessly to ensure that they would make everyone rock during the "Pomp and Circumstance" march at the graduation ceremony. Lacey said she could give me a ride home, but I decided to clean out my locker because I didn't want to come back to school and feel my lungs drowning in the stubborn nostalgia that surged up.
tr_translation: Both Ben and Radar had a long band rehearsal to ensure they could play the Pomp and Circumstance march properly at graduation. Lacey offered to drive me, but I decided to clean out my locker because I really didn't want to have to come back here later and feel my lungs choking with this perverse longing.
es_translation: Ben and Radar had a marathon rehearsal with the band to make sure they would play "Pomp and Circumstance" at graduation. Lacey offered to take me home, but I decided to empty my locker, because the truth was that I didn't feel like going back to the school and having to feel my lungs drowning in that stubborn nostalgia again.

en: My locker was an unadulterated crap hole—half trash can, half book storage. Her locker had been neatly stacked with textbooks when Lacey opened it, I remembered, as if she intended to come to school the next day. I pulled a garbage can over to the bank of lockers and opened mine up. I began by pulling off a picture of Radar and Ben and me goofing off. I put it inside my backpack and then started the disgusting process of picking through a year’s worth of accumulated filth—gum wrapped in scraps of notebook paper, pens out of ink, greasy napkins—and scraping it all into the garbage. All along, I kept thinking, I will never do this again, I will never be here again, this will never be my locker again, Radar and I will never write notes in calculus again, I will never see Margo across the hall again. This was the first time in my life that so many things would never happen again.
vi: Ngăn tủ của tôi thuần túy là một hố tạp nham–nửa đựng rác, nửa đựng sách. Ngăn của Margo sách vở vẫn gọn gàng đâu ra đấy khi Lacey mở nó ra, tôi vẫn nhớ thế, như thể Margo định quay lại trường ngay hôm sau. Tôi kéo thùng rác lại gần dãy tủ và mở ngăn của mình. Tôi bắt đầu từ bức ảnh chụp Radar, Ben và tôi, ba thằng đều làm biếng đang thộn mặt ra. Tôi bỏ bức ảnh vào ba-lô, rồi khởi động qui trình kinh hoàng nhặt ra đủ thứ bẩn thỉu tích tụ cả năm trời–bã kẹo cao su vo viên trong giấy xé vở, cơ man bút hết mực, khăn giấy lem nhem dầu mỡ–tôi lẳng hết vào thùng rác. Suốt lúc đó, tôi cứ nghĩ, Mình sẽ không bao giờ làm lại việc này nữa, mình sẽ không bao giờ ở đây nữa, đây không bao giờ còn là ngăn tủ đựng đồ của mình nữa, Radar và mình sẽ không bao giờ viết giấy nói chuyện riêng trong giờ giải tích nữa, mình sẽ không bao giờ thấy Margo đi ngoài hành lang nữa. Lần đầu tiên trong đời tôi, có nhiều đến thế những điều sẽ không bao giờ xảy ra nữa.
tr: Dolabım katıksız bir ıvır zıvır yuvasıydı... kısmen çöp kutusu, kısmen kitap deposu. Lacey açtığında Margo’nun ders kitapları dolabına muntazam bir şekilde dizilmişti, diye hatırladım, sanki ertesi gün okula gelmeye niyetliymiş gibi. Dolap sırasının yanına bir çöp kovası çekip kendiminkini açtım, içindekileri çıkarmaya, Radar ve Ben’le haylazlık ettiğimiz bir fotoğrafla başladım. Fotoğrafı sırt çantama koydum, sonra bir yıldır birikmiş pisliğidefter kâğıdı parçalarına sarılmış sakızlar, mürekkebi bitmiş kalemler, yağlı peçetelerçöpe sıyırmanın iğrenç sürecine başladım. Başından beri düşünüp duruyordum: Bunu bir daha asla yapmayacağım, bir daha asla burada olmayacağım, bu bir daha asla benim dolabım olmayacak, Radarla bir daha asla matematikte not yazmayacağız, Margo’yu bir daha asla koridorun öbür tarafından görmeyeceğim. Bu hayatımda, bir sürü şeyin bir daha asla olmayacağı ilk zamandı.
es: Mi taquilla era un auténtico agujero de mierda, mitad cubo de la basura y mitad almacén de libros. Recordé que cuando Lacey abrió la taquilla de Margo, los libros estaban perfectamente apilados, como si tuviera la intención de ir a clase al día siguiente. Coloqué una papelera en el banco y abrí mi taquilla. Lo primero que hice fue despegar una foto de Radar, Ben y yo sonriendo de oreja a oreja. La metí en mi mochila y empecé el asqueroso proceso de revolver entre la porquería acumulada durante todo un año —chicles envueltos en trozos de papel de libreta, bolis sin tinta, servilletas grasientas— y tirarla a la papelera. Mientras lo hacía, pensaba: «Nunca volveré a hacer esto, nunca volveré a estar aquí, esta taquilla no volverá a ser mía, Radar y yo no volveremos a escribirnos notas en la clase de cálculo, nunca volveré a ver a Margo en el pasillo». Era la primera vez en mi vida que tantas cosas no volverían a suceder.
vi_translation: My locker is purely a chaotic mess–half filled with trash, half filled with books. Margo's locker was still neatly organized when Lacey opened it, I still remember, as if Margo planned to return to school the very next day. I pulled the trash can closer to the row of lockers and opened mine. I started with a photo of Radar, Ben, and me, the three of us lazily staring blankly. I put the photo into my backpack, then began the horrifying process of picking out all the filthy things accumulated over the year–wads of gum wrapped in torn notebook paper, countless empty pens, grease-stained tissues–I tossed them all into the trash can. All the while, I kept thinking, I will never do this again, I will never be here again, this will never be my locker again, Radar and I will never pass notes in calculus again, I will never see Margo walking in the hallway again. For the first time in my life, there were so many things that would never happen again.
tr_translation: My locker was a pure junk nest... partly a trash can, partly a book depot. I remembered that when Lacey opened it, Margo's textbooks were neatly arranged in her locker, as if she intended to come to school the next day. I pulled a trash can next to the row of lockers and opened mine, starting to take out the contents with a photo of Radar, Ben, and me goofing around. I put the photo in my backpack, then the filth that had accumulated over a year, notebook Gums wrapped in pieces of paper, pens with no ink, greasy napkins—I began the disgusting process of scraping them into the trash. From the beginning, I kept thinking: I will never do this again, I will never be here again, this will never be my locker again, I will never write notes in math with Radar again, I will never see Margo from the other side of the hallway again. This was the first time in my life that many things would never happen again.
es_translation: My locker was a real shithole, half trash can and half book storage. I remembered that when Lacey opened Margo's locker, the books were perfectly stacked, as if she intended to go to class the next day. I placed a trash can on the bench and opened my locker. The first thing I did was peel off a photo of Radar, Ben, and me grinning from ear to ear. I put it in my backpack and started the disgusting process of rummaging through the junk accumulated over the whole year—gum wrapped in pieces of notebook paper, pens without ink, greasy napkins—and throwing it into the trash can. As I did so, I thought: "I will never do this again, I will never be here again, this locker will never be mine again, Radar and I will never write notes to each other in calculus class again, I will never see Margo in the hallway again." It was the first time in my life that so many things would never happen again.

en: And finally it was too much. I could not talk myself down from the feeling, and the feeling became unbearable. I reached in deep to the recesses of my locker. I pushed everything—photographs and notes and books—into the trash can. I left the locker open and walked away. As I walked past the band room, I could hear through the walls the muffled sounds of “Pomp and Circumstance.” I kept walking. It was hot outside, but not as hot as usual. It was bearable. There are sidewalks most of the way home, I thought. So I kept walking.
vi: Và cuối cùng thì quá nhiều rồi. Tôi không thể lái được dòng cảm xúc, và những xúc cảm trở thành bất khả chịu đựng.
