Tôi sục sâu vào ngăn tủ, lôi ra tất cả–những tranh ảnh, ghi chép và sách vở–gạt hết vào thùng rác. Tôi để ngỏ ngăn tủ đấy mà đi. Ngang phòng tập nhạc, tôi nghe thấy bài “Pomp and Circumstance” lùng bùng vọng ra qua những bức tường. Tôi cứ đi. Bên ngoài trời nóng, nhưng không nóng như mọi khi. Có thể chịu đựng được. Đường về nhà đa phần là vỉa hè, tôi nghĩ. Thế là tôi cứ đi tiếp.
tr: Ve neticede bu çok fazla geldi. Bu duyguyu aşamıyordum ve duygu katlanılmaz hale geldi. Dolabımın derinliklerine, iç taraflarına doğru uzandım. Her şeyifotoğrafları, notlan, kitaplançöp kutusuna attım. Dolabı açık bırakıp oradan uzaklaştım. Bando odasının yanından geçerken duvarların arkasından Pomp and Circumstance’m boğuk sesini duyabiliyordum. Dışansı sıcaktı ama her zamanki kadar değil. Katlanılabilirdi. Eve gidiş yolunun çoğunda kaldırım var, diye düşündüm. Böylece yürümeye devam ettim.
es: Y al final fue demasiado. No pude quitarme de encima aquel sentimiento y se me hizo insoportable. Extendí los brazos, los metí hasta el fondo de la taquilla y lo empujé todo —fotos, notas y libros— a la papelera. Dejé la taquilla abierta y me marché. Al pasar por la sala de ensayo, oí al otro lado de la pared el sonido amortiguado de «Pompa y circunstancia». Seguí andando. Fuera hacía calor, aunque no tanto como de costumbre. Era soportable. «En casi todo el camino hasta casa hay aceras», pensé. Y seguí andando.
vi_translation: And finally, it was too much. I couldn't control the flow of emotions, and the feelings became unbearable. I delved deep into the drawer, pulling out everything—photos, notes, and books—and swept them all into the trash. I left the drawer open and walked away. Passing by the music room, I heard the song "Pomp and Circumstance" muffled through the walls. I kept walking. Outside, it was hot, but not as hot as usual. Bearable. The way home was mostly sidewalk, I thought. So I kept walking.
tr_translation: And in the end, it was too much. I couldn't overcome this feeling and it became unbearable. I reached into the depths, the insides of my closet. I threw everything—photos, notes, books—into the trash can. I left the closet open and walked away. As I passed by the band room, I could hear the muffled sound of "Pomp and Circumstance" from behind the walls. It was hot outside but not as much as usual. It was bearable. Most of the way home has a sidewalk, I thought. So I kept walking.
es_translation: And in the end, it was too much. I couldn't shake off that feeling and it became unbearable. I extended my arms, reached deep into the locker, and pushed everything —photos, notes, and books— into the trash bin. I left the locker open and walked away. As I passed by the rehearsal room, I heard the muffled sound of "Pomp and Circumstance" on the other side of the wall. I kept walking. Outside, it was hot, though not as much as usual. It was bearable. "There are sidewalks for almost the entire way home," I thought. And I kept walking.

en: And as paralyzing and upsetting as all the never agains were, the final leaving felt perfect. Pure. The most distilled possible form of liberation. Everything that mattered except one lousy picture was in the trash, but it felt so great. I started jogging, wanting to put even more distance between myself and school.
vi: Cũng đờ đẫn và rệu rã như tất cả những không-bao-giờ-nữa, sự rời bỏ cuối cùng này thật hoàn hảo. Thuần khiết. Dạng thức dễ chắt lọc được nhất của sự giải phóng. Tất cả những dính mắc, trừ một tấm ảnh dở ẹc, đều ở yên trong thùng rác, nhưng cảm giác thật tuyệt vời. Tôi bắt đầu bước nhanh, muốn doãng thêm khoảng cách giữa tôi và ngôi trường.
tr: Bir daha aslalar ne kadar felç edici ve üzücü olursa olsun son çıkışın verdiği his mükemmeldi. Saftı. Kurtuluşun mümkün olan en damıtılmış haliydi. O dandik fotoğraf dışında önem taşıyan her şey çöpteydi ama çok iyi hissediyordum. Okulla arama daha da fazla mesafe koyma isteğiyle koşmaya başladım.
es: Y por paralizantes y tristes que fueran todos aquellos «nunca más», me pareció perfecto marcharme así por última vez. Una marcha pura. La forma más depurada posible de liberación. Todo lo importante, menos una foto malísima, estaba en la basura, pero me sentía genial. Empecé a correr, porque quería poner todavía más distancia entre el instituto y yo.
vi_translation: Just as dazed and worn out as all the never-agains, this final departure was truly perfect. Pure. The most easily distilled form of liberation. All attachments, except for a lousy photo, stayed in the trash, but the feeling was wonderful. I started to walk quickly, wanting to widen the distance between me and the school.
tr_translation: No matter how paralyzing and upsetting the never-agains were, the feeling given by the last exit was perfect. It was pure. It was the most distilled form of salvation. Everything that mattered, except that lousy photo, was in the trash, but I felt great. I started running with the desire to put even more distance between me and the school.
es_translation: And as paralyzing and sad as all those "never agains" were, it seemed perfect to leave like this for the last time. A pure departure. The most refined form of liberation possible. Everything important, except for one terrible photo, was in the trash, but I felt great. I started to run, because I wanted to put even more distance between the school and me.

en: It is so hard to leave—until you leave. And then it is the easiest goddamned thing in the world.
vi: Ra đi thật khó khăn–cho đến khi ta ra đi. Và sau đó là điều dễ dàng nhất trên thế giới này.
tr: Terk etmek çok zordur... ta ki terk edene kadar. Ondan sonra dünyadaki en lanet olası kolay şeydir.
es: Marcharse es muy duro… hasta que te marchas. Entonces es lo más sencillo del mundo.
vi_translation: Leaving is truly difficult—until we leave. And then it becomes the easiest thing in the world.
tr_translation: Leaving is very hard... until you leave. After that, it's the easiest damn thing in the world.
es_translation: Leaving is very hard... until you leave. Then it is the easiest thing in the world.

en: As I ran, I felt myself for the first time becoming Margo. I knew: she is not in Orlando. She is not in Florida. Leaving feels too good, once you leave. If I’d been in a car, and not on foot, I might have kept going, too. She was gone and not coming back for graduation or anything else. I felt sure of that now.
vi: Trong khi chạy, tôi cảm thấy mình lần đầu tiên trở thành Margo. Tôi biết: cô ấy không ở Orlando. Cô ấy không ở bang Florida. Ra đi mang lại cảm giác quá tuyệt vời, một khi đã ra đi. Nếu đang ngồi ô-tô, không phải đang đi bộ, hẳn tôi cũng sẽ lái xe đi mãi. Margo đã ra đi và sẽ không quay lại lễ tốt nghiệp hay bất cứ gì khác. Bây giờ tôi đã cảm thấy chắc chắn.
tr: Koşarken kendimi ilk defa Margo oluyormuşum gibi hissettim. Biliyordum: O Orlando’da değil. Florida’da değil. Bir kere terk ettiğinizde, terk etmek çok iyi hissettiriyor. Eğer yayan değil de bir arabada olsaydım, ben de gitmeye devam edebilirdim. Margo gitmişti ve mezuniyet ya da başka bir şey için geri gelmeyecekti. Artık bundan emindim.
es: Mientras corría, sentí que por primera vez me convertía en Margo. Lo sabía: «No está en Orlando. No está en Florida». Marcharse es fantástico en cuanto te has marchado. Si hubiera ido en coche, no a pie, seguramente también habría seguido adelante. Margo se había marchado y no iba a volver ni para la graduación ni para ninguna otra cosa. Estaba seguro.
vi_translation: While running, I felt like I was becoming Margo for the first time. I knew: she was not in Orlando. She was not in the state of Florida. Leaving felt too wonderful, once you had left. If I were in a car, not walking, I would have driven away forever. Margo had left and would not return for graduation or anything else. Now I felt certain.
tr_translation: While running, for the first time, I felt like I was becoming Margo. I knew: She is not in Orlando. She is not in Florida. Once you leave, leaving feels really good. If I were in a car instead of on foot, I could have kept going too. Margo was gone and she wasn't coming back for graduation or anything else. I was sure of that now.
es_translation: While I was running, I felt that for the first time I was becoming Margo. I knew it: "She is not in Orlando. She is not in Florida." Leaving is fantastic once you have left. If I had gone by car, not on foot, I probably would have kept going as well. Margo had left and was not going to return, neither for graduation nor for anything else. I was sure of it.

en: I leave, and the leaving is so exhilarating I know I can never go back. But then what? Do I just keep leaving places, and leaving them, and leaving them, tramping a perpetual journey?
vi: Tôi ra đi, và sự ra đi quá phấn chấn nên tôi biết mình có thể không bao giờ trở lại. Nhưng rồi sao? Liệu tôi có tiếp tục rời bỏ nơi nào đó, ra đi và lại ra đi, dấn mình vào một chuyến đi miên viễn hay không?
tr: Terk ediyorum ve terk etmek o kadar canlandırıcı ki, bir daha asla geri dönemeyeceğimi biliyorum. Ama ya sonra? Sadece bir yerleri terk etmeye, ebedî bir yolculukta ağır ağır ilerlemeye devam mı edeceğim?
es: Me marcho, y marcharme es tan estimulante que sé que no puedo volver atrás. ¿Y entonces? ¿Me dedico a marcharme de sitios una y otra vez? ¿Emprendo un viaje eterno?
vi_translation: I left, and the departure was so exhilarating that I knew I might never return. But then what? Would I continue to leave somewhere, to depart and depart again, plunging myself into an endless journey?
tr_translation: I am leaving, and leaving is so invigorating that I know I can never return. But what then? Will I just continue to leave places, slowly progressing on an eternal journey?
es_translation: I'm leaving, and leaving is so stimulating that I know I can't go back. And then? Do I devote myself to leaving places over and over again? Do I embark on an eternal journey?

en: Ben and Radar drove past me a quarter mile from Jefferson Park, and Ben brought RHAPAW to a screeching halt right on Lakemont in spite of traffic everywhere, and I ran up to the car and got in. They wanted to play Resurrection at my house, but I had to tell them no, because I was closer than I’d ever been before.
vi: Ben và Radar lái xe ngang qua khi tôi còn cách Công viên Jefferson một phần tư dặm. Ben dừng huỵch RHAPAW ngay ở Lakemont, bất chấp giao thông tứ phía. Tôi chạy đến và vào xe. Hai thằng muốn đến nhà tôi chơi Hồi Sinh, nhưng tôi phải nói rằng không được, vì tôi đang ở gần hơn lúc nào hết.
tr: Ben ile Radar, Jefferson Park’tan beş yüz metre ileride arabayla yanımdan geçtiler ve Ben, her yerde trafik olmasına rağmen SESIB’ı tam Lakemont’ta tiz bir sesle durdurdu, arabaya koşup bindim. Benim evimde Diriliş oynamak istediler ama onlara hayır demek zorundaydım, çünkü daha önce olmadığım kadar yaklaşmıştım.
es: Ben y Radar pasaron por mi lado a medio kilómetro de Jefferson Park. Ben pegó un frenazo justo delante de Lakemont, pese a que la carretera estaba llena de coches. Corrí al coche y subí. Querían jugar al Resurrection en mi casa, pero tuve que decirles que no, porque estaba más cerca de Margo que nunca.
vi_translation: Ben and Radar drove by when I was a quarter mile from Jefferson Park. Ben abruptly stopped RHAPAW right on Lakemont, despite the surrounding traffic. I ran over and got into the car. The two guys wanted to come to my house to play Resurrection, but I had to say no, because I was closer than ever.
tr_translation: Ben and Radar drove past me in a car five hundred meters from Jefferson Park, and despite there being traffic everywhere, Ben stopped the SESIB with a high-pitched sound right at Lakemont. I ran to the car and got in. They wanted to play Resurrection at my house, but I had to say no to them because I was closer than I had ever been before.
es_translation: Ben and Radar passed by me half a kilometer from Jefferson Park. Ben slammed on the brakes right in front of Lakemont, even though the road was full of cars. I ran to the car and got in. They wanted to play Resurrection at my house, but I had to tell them no, because I was closer to Margo than ever.

en: All night Wednesday, and all day Thursday, I tried to use my new understanding of her to figure out some meaning to the clues I had—some relationship between the map and the travel books, or else some link between the Whitman and the map that would allow me to understand her travelogue. But increasingly I felt like maybe she had become too enthralled with the pleasure of leaving to construct a proper bread crumb trail. And if that were the case, the map she had never intended for us to see might be our best chance to find her. But no site on the map was adequately specific. Even the Catskill Park dot, which interested me because it was the only location not in or near a big city, was far too big and populous to find a single person. “Song of Myself” made references to places in New York City, but there were too many locations to track them all down. How do you pinpoint a spot on the map when the spot seems to be moving from metropolis to metropolis?
vi: Suốt đêm thứ Tư, và cả ngày thứ Năm, tôi cố gắng tận dụng những hiểu biết mới của tôi về Margo để rút ra ý nghĩa nào đó từ những manh mối đã có–mối liên hệ giữa tấm bản đồ và những cuốn sách du lịch, hoặc giữa Whitman và tấm bản đồ, những liên hệ sẽ khiến tôi hiểu được phiêu-du-ngữ của cô ấy. Nhưng tôi càng cảm thấy rõ hơn rằng có lẽ niềm hân hoan của sự ra đi đã cuốn hút Margo đến mức cô ấy không thực sự để tâm rắc một dải vụn bánh mì hoàn chỉnh. Nếu đúng như vậy, tấm bản đồ Margo không định để cho bọn tôi phát hiện ra có thể là cơ hội khả quan nhất để tìm thấy cô ấy. Nhưng không có địa điểm nào trên bản đồ đủ chính xác. Ngay cả Catskill Park, chỗ khiến tôi chú ý vì là nơi duy nhất không ở trong hoặc gần thành phố lớn, vẫn quá rộng lớn, quá đông đúc để đi tìm một cá nhân duy nhất. “Tự khúc” dẫn đến những nơi ở thành phố New York, nhưng có quá nhiều địa điểm phải lần theo. Làm thế nào xác định được một điểm trên bản đồ khi điểm ấy dường như luôn di chuyển từ thị thành này sang thị thành khác?
tr: Tüm çarşamba gecesi ve perşembe günü, sahip olduğum ipuçlarından biraz anlamharita ile seyahat rehberleri arasında, yoksa Whitman ile harita arasında bir ilişki; yolculuğunu anlamamı sağlayacak bir bağlantıçıkarmak için onu yeni anlayış şeklimi kullanmaya çalıştım. Ama giderek daha çok, belki de ekmek kırıntılarından doğru dürüst bir iz oluşturmayacak kadar terk etmenin zevkine kapılmıştır, diye düşünüyordum. Ve durum buysa, görmemizi hiç planlamadığı harita onu bulmak için en iyi şansımız olabilirdi. Fakat haritadaki hiçbir konum yeterince belirgin değildi. Büyük bir şehrin içinde ya da yakınında olmayan tek yer olduğu için ilgimi çeken Catskill Park noktası bile, tek bir kişiyi bulmak için çok fazla büyük ve kalabalıktı. Kendi Şarkım New York’taki yerlere gönderme yapıyordu ama hepsinin izini sürmek için çok fazla yer vardı. Nokta, bir büyük şehirden ötekine gidiyor gibi görünüyorsa, o noktanın yerini haritada nasıl saptarsınız?
es: El miércoles por la noche y el jueves entero intenté emplear todo lo que ya sabía de Margo para descubrir algún sentido en las pistas de las que disponía, alguna relación entre el mapa y los libros de viajes, o quizá algún vínculo entre Whitman y el mapa que me permitiera entender su diario de viaje. Pero cada vez me daba más la impresión de que quizá estaba demasiado fascinada por el placer de marcharse como para ir dejando el camino señalado con migas de pan. Y si ese era el caso, el mapa que no había pretendido que viéramos podría ser nuestra mejor baza para encontrarla. Pero las marcas del mapa no eran lo bastante concretas. Incluso el parque de Catskill, que me interesaba porque era el único punto que no estaba en una gran ciudad, ni siquiera cerca, era demasiado grande y tenía demasiados habitantes como para encontrar a una persona. El «Canto de mí mismo» mencionaba lugares de la ciudad de Nueva York, pero había demasiadas localizaciones como para rastrearlas todas. ¿Cómo ubicar un punto en un mapa cuando parece que el punto se mueve de una ciudad a otra?
vi_translation: Throughout Wednesday night and all day Thursday, I tried to leverage my new understanding of Margo to derive some meaning from the clues I had—the connection between the map and the travel books, or between Whitman and the map, connections that would help me understand her wanderlust language. But I increasingly felt that perhaps the joy of departure had captivated Margo to the extent that she didn't really care to leave a complete trail of breadcrumbs. If that were the case, the map Margo didn't intend for us to discover might be the best chance to find her. But no location on the map was precise enough. Even Catskill Park, which caught my attention because it was the only place not in or near a major city, was still too vast, too crowded to search for a single individual. "Song of Myself" led to places in New York City, but there were too many locations to track. How could one pinpoint a location on the map when that point seemed to always be moving from one city to another?
tr_translation: All Wednesday night and Thursday, I tried to use my new understanding to find a connection between the clues I had, the travel guides, and the map; or between Whitman and the map, to understand his journey. But more and more, I was thinking, perhaps he had taken pleasure in abandoning the trail so much that it wouldn't form a proper trace from breadcrumbs. And if that was the case, the map he never planned for us to see might be our best chance to find him. But none of the locations on the map were clear enough. Even the point of interest, Catskill Park, which caught my attention because it was the only place not in or near a big city, was too large and crowded to find a single person. My Song referred to places in New York, but there were too many places to track them all. If the point seemed to be moving from one big city to another, how would you pinpoint that location on the map?
es_translation: On Wednesday night and all of Thursday, I tried to use everything I already knew about Margo to find some meaning in the clues I had, some connection between the map and the travel books, or perhaps some link between Whitman and the map that would help me understand her travel diary. But I increasingly got the impression that maybe she was too fascinated by the pleasure of leaving to leave a breadcrumb trail. And if that was the case, the map she hadn't intended for us to see could be our best bet to find her. But the markings on the map weren't concrete enough. Even the Catskill Park, which interested me because it was the only spot not in a big city, not even close, was too large and had too many inhabitants to find one person. "Song of Myself" mentioned places in New York City, but there were too many locations to track them all. How do you locate a point on a map when it seems the point moves from one city to another?

en: I was already up and paging through travel guides when my parents came into my room on Friday morning. They rarely both entered the room at the same time, and I felt a ripple of nausea—maybe they had bad news about Margo—before I remembered it was my graduation day.
vi: Sáng thứ Sáu, tôi đã dậy và đang lật giở các cuốn hướng dẫn du lịch thì bố mẹ vào phòng tôi. Cả hai hiếm khi cùng vào phòng tôi một lúc, tôi chớm cảm thấy nhộn nhạo trong người–hay là có tin không hay về Margo–rồi chợt nhớ ra hôm nay là ngày tôi tốt nghiệp.
tr: Cuma günü annemle babam odama girdiğinde çoktan kalkmış, seyahat rehberlerinin sayfalarını çeviriyordum. İkisi nadiren aynı anda odama girerdi ve mezuniyet günüm olduğunu hatırlamadan önce, bir mide bulantısı dalgası hissettim... Belki de Margo hakkında kötü haberleri vardı.
es: El viernes por la mañana estaba ya levantado, hojeando guías de viajes, cuando mis padres entraron en mi habitación. Como rara vez entraban los dos juntos, me dio un vuelco el estómago —quizá tenían malas noticias de Margo—, pero de pronto recordé que era el día de mi graduación.
vi_translation: On Friday morning, I had woken up and was flipping through travel guides when my parents came into my room. Both of them rarely came into my room at the same time, I started to feel uneasy—maybe there was bad news about Margo—then suddenly remembered that today was my graduation day.
tr_translation: When my mom and dad entered my room on Friday, I had already gotten up and was flipping through the pages of travel guides. They rarely entered my room at the same time, and before I remembered that it was my graduation day, I felt a wave of nausea... Maybe they had bad news about Margo.
es_translation: On Friday morning, I was already up, leafing through travel guides, when my parents entered my room. Since they rarely came in together, my stomach turned —maybe they had bad news about Margo—, but then I suddenly remembered it was my graduation day.

en: “Ready, bud?”
vi: “Sẵn sàng chưa con giai?”
tr: “Hazır mısın, dostum?
es: —¿Estás listo?
vi_translation: "Ready, son?"
tr_translation: “Are you ready, my friend?”
es_translation: —Are you ready?

en: “Yeah. I mean, it’s not that big of a deal, but it’ll be fun.”
vi: “Rồi ạ. Cũng không có gì linh đình lắm, nhưng sẽ vui ạ.”
tr: “Hazır mısın, dostum? “Evet, yani büyük bir mesele değil ama eğlenceli olacak.
es: —Sí. Bueno, no es tan importante, pero será divertido.
vi_translation: "Yes. It's not very grand, but it will be fun."
tr_translation: “Are you ready, my friend?” “Yes, I mean, it's not a big deal but it will be fun.”
es_translation: —Yes. Well, it's not that important, but it will be fun.

en: “You only graduate from high school once,” Mom said.
vi: “Con chỉ tốt nghiệp phổ thông có một lần trong đời thôi đấy,” mẹ nói.
tr: “Liseden yalnızca bir kere mezun olursun,” dedi annem.
es: —Solo te gradúas una vez —me dijo mi madre.
vi_translation: “You only graduate from high school once in your life,” said Mom.
tr_translation: "You only graduate from high school once," said my mom.
es_translation: "You only graduate once," my mother told me.

en: “Yeah,” I said. They sat down on the bed across from me. I noticed them share a glance and giggle. “What?” I asked.
vi: “Vâng,” tôi đáp. Bố mẹ ngồi xuống mép giường và nhìn tôi. Cả hai khúc khích liếc nhau. “Có chuyện gì thế ạ?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Evet,” dedim. Karşıma geçip yatağa oturdular. Bakışıp kıkır kıkır gülüştüklerini fark ettim. “Ne?” diye sordum.
es: —Sí —le contesté. Se sentaron en la cama. Observé que se miraban y sonreían. —¿Qué pasa? —les pregunté.
vi_translation: "Yes," I replied. My parents sat down on the edge of the bed and looked at me. Both of them giggled and glanced at each other. "What's going on?" I asked.
tr_translation: “Yes,” I said. They sat on the bed across from me. I noticed them glancing at each other and giggling. “What?” I asked.
es_translation: —Yes —I answered him. They sat on the bed. I noticed that they looked at each other and smiled. —What's happening? —I asked them.

en: “Well, we want to give you your graduation present,” Mom said. “We’re really proud of you, Quentin. You’re the greatest accomplishment of our lives, and this is just such a great day for you, and we’re— You’re just a great young man.”
vi: “Chà, bố mẹ muốn tặng quà tốt nghiệp cho con,” mẹ nói. “Quentin à, bố mẹ thực sự tự hào về con lắm. Con là bảo bối quí giá nhất trong đời bố mẹ, hôm nay là một ngày trọng đại với con, và bố mẹ–Con thực sự là một chàng trai tốt đấy.”
tr: “Şey, sana mezuniyet hediyeni vermek istiyoruz,” dedi annem. “Seninle gerçekten gurur duyuyoruz, Quentin. Sen hayatımızın en büyük başarısısm ve bu senin için öyle büyük bir gün ki ve biz... Sadece harika bir delikanlısın.
es: —Bueno, queremos darte tu regalo de graduación —dijo mi madre—. Estamos muy orgullosos de ti, Quentin. Eres el mayor logro de nuestra vida, hoy es un gran día para ti y estamos… Eres un chico genial.
vi_translation: “Well, your father and I wanted to give you a graduation gift,” Mom said. “Quentin, we are really proud of you. You are the most precious treasure in our lives, today is a big day for you, and we–You really are a good boy.”
tr_translation: “Well, we want to give you your graduation gift,” said my mom. “We are really proud of you, Quentin. You are the greatest achievement of our lives, and this is such a big day for you, and we... You are just a wonderful young man.”
es_translation: —Well, we want to give you your graduation gift —said my mother—. We are very proud of you, Quentin. You are the greatest achievement of our life, today is a great day for you and we are… You are a great kid.

en: I smiled and looked down. And then my dad produced a very small gift wrapped in blue wrapping paper.
vi: Tôi mỉm cười và nhìn xuống. Và rồi bố rút ra một hộp quà rất nhỏ, được bọc bằng giấy gói màu xanh da trời.
tr: Gülümseyip aşağı doğru baktım. Sonra babam mavi bir paket kâğıdına sarılmış çok küçük bir hediye çıkardı.
es: Sonreí y bajé la mirada. Entonces mi padre sacó un regalo muy pequeño envuelto en papel azul.
vi_translation: I smiled and looked down. And then Dad took out a very small gift box, wrapped in sky-blue wrapping paper.
tr_translation: I smiled and looked down. Then my father took out a very small gift wrapped in blue paper.
es_translation: I smiled and lowered my gaze. Then my father took out a very small gift wrapped in blue paper.

en: “No,” I said, snatching it from him.
vi: “Không,” tôi thốt lên, vội cầm lấy nó.
tr: “Hayır,” dedim elinden kaparak.
es: —No —dije quitándoselo de las manos.
vi_translation: “No,” I exclaimed, hastily grabbing it.
tr_translation: "No," I said, grabbing it from his hand.
es_translation: —No —I said, taking it out of his hands.

en: “Go ahead and open it.”
vi: “Mở ra đi con trai.
tr: “Devam et, aç.
es: —Venga, ábrelo.
vi_translation: "Open it, son.""
tr_translation: “Go on, open it.”
es_translation: —Come on, open it.

en: “No way,” I said, staring at it. It was the size of a key. It was the weight of a key. When I shook the box, it rattled like a key.
vi: “Không thể nào,” tôi nói, vẫn chằm chằm nhìn cái hộp. Kích cỡ một chiếc chìa khóa. Trọng lượng một chiếc chìa khóa. Tôi lắc lắc, cái hộp lọc xọc tiếng một chiếc chìa khóa.
tr: “Olamaz,” dedim hediyeye bakarak. Bir anahtar boyutundaydı. Bir anahtar ağırbğmdaydı. Kutuyu salladığımda bir anahtar gibi tıkırdadı.
es: —No puede ser —dije mirando el paquetito. Era del tamaño de una llave. Pesaba como una llave. Al agitar la caja, sonó como una llave.
vi_translation: “Impossible,” I said, still staring at the box. The size of a key. The weight of a key. I shook it, the box rattled like a key.
tr_translation: "It can't be," I said, looking at the gift. It was the size of a key. It was the weight of a key. When I shook the box, it rattled like a key.
es_translation: —It can't be —I said, looking at the little package. It was the size of a key. It weighed like a key. When shaking the box, it sounded like a key.

en: “Just open it, sweetie,” my mom urged.
vi: “Mau mở đi con,” mẹ giục tôi.
tr: “Sadece aç, tatlım,” diye ısrar etti annem.
es: —Ábrelo ya, cariño —me instó mi madre.
vi_translation: “Hurry up and open it, dear,” my mother urged me.
tr_translation: "Just eat, sweetie," insisted my mom.
es_translation: —Open it now, honey —my mother urged me.

en: I tore off the wrapping paper. A KEY! I examined it closely. A Ford key! Neither of our cars was a Ford. “You got me a car?!”
vi: Tôi xé giấy bọc. MỘT CHIẾC CHÌA KHÓA! Tôi xem kĩ. Chìa khóa xe Ford! Nhà tôi không có cái Ford nào. “Bố mẹ mua xe cho con ạ?”
tr: Paket kâğıdını yırttım. BİR ANAHTAR! Yakından inceledim. Bir Ford anahtarı! Arabalarımızın ikisi de Ford değildi. “Bana bir araba mı aldınız?!
es: Arranqué el papel. ¡UNA LLAVE! La observé de cerca. ¡La llave de un Ford! Ninguno de nuestros coches era un Ford. —¿Me habéis comprado un coche?
vi_translation: I tore the wrapping paper. A KEY! I looked closely. A Ford car key! My family doesn't have any Ford. "Did you buy a car for me, Mom and Dad?"
tr_translation: I tore the wrapping paper. A KEY! I examined it closely. A Ford key! Neither of our cars was a Ford. “Did you buy me a car?!””
es_translation: I tore off the paper. A KEY! I examined it closely. The key to a Ford! None of our cars was a Ford. —Have you bought me a car?

en: “We did,” my dad said. “It’s not brand-new—but only two years old and just twenty thousand miles on it.” I jumped up and hugged both of them.
vi: “Ừ,” bố nói. “Không phải xe mới tinh–nhưng mới chạy có hai năm và đi khoảng hai mươi ngàn dặm thôi.
tr: “Aldık,” dedi babam. ‘Yeni değil... ama sadece iki yıllık ve sadece yirmi bin kilometrede.” Zıplayıp ikisine de sarıldım.
es: —Exacto —me contestó mi padre—. No es nuevo, pero tiene solo dos años y treinta mil kilómetros. Salté de la cama y los abracé a los dos.
vi_translation: "Yes," Dad said. "It's not brand new—but it's only been driven for two years and about twenty thousand miles."" I jumped up and hugged both my dad and mom.
tr_translation: “We bought it,” said my dad. “It’s not new... but it’s only two years old and has only twenty thousand kilometers.” I jumped and hugged both of them.
es_translation: —Exactly —my father replied to me—. It's not new, but it has only two years and thirty thousand kilometers. I jumped out of bed and hugged them both.

en: “Yeah!” my mom almost shouted. I had a car! A car! Of my own!
vi: “Ừ!” mẹ suýt hét lên. Tôi có xe! Một cái xe ô-tô! Của riêng tôi!
tr: “Benim mi? “Evet!” diye neredeyse bağırdı annem. Bir arabam vardı! Bir araba! Benim!
es: —¡Sí! —casi gritó mi madre. ¡Ya tenía coche! ¡Coche! ¡Mío!
vi_translation: "Yes!" Mom almost shouted. I have a car! A car! My very own!
tr_translation: “Yes!” my mom almost shouted. I had a car! A car! Mine!
es_translation: —Yes! —my mother almost shouted. I already had a car! A car! Mine!

en: I disentangled myself from my parents and shouted “thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you” as I raced through the living room, and yanked open the front door wearing only an old T-shirt and boxer shorts. There, parked in the driveway with a huge blue bow on it, was a Ford minivan.
vi: Tôi gỡ mình ra khỏi bố mẹ và hét toáng lên “cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ cảm ơn bố cảm ơn mẹ” trong khi chạy vù qua phòng khách, mở vèo cửa trước, trên người chỉ có cái áo phông cũ và quần đùi. Kia, đỗ ở lối đi và được thắt một cái nơ xanh da trời bự chảng, là một chiếc Ford minivan.
tr: Kendimi onlardan kurtardım, oturma odasma doğru koşarken, “teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler’’ diye bağırdım ve üstümde yalnızca eski bir tişört ve boxer’la sokak kapısını hızla çekip açtım. Orada, üstünde kocaman mavi bir fiyonkla garaj yoluna park edilmiş bir Ford minivan vardı.
es: Solté a mis padres, grité «gracias gracias gracias gracias gracias gracias» corriendo por el comedor y abrí la puerta de la calle vestido solo con una camiseta vieja y calzoncillos. Aparcado en el camino de entrada, con un enorme lazo azul, había un monovolumen Ford.
vi_translation: I pulled myself away from my parents and screamed, "Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom! Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom! Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mom!" while dashing through the living room, flinging open the front door, wearing only an old t-shirt and shorts. There, parked in the driveway and adorned with a huge sky-blue bow, was a Ford minivan.
tr_translation: I freed myself from them, running towards the living room, shouting, "thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you" and quickly opened the street door, wearing only an old t-shirt and boxers. There, parked on the driveway with a huge blue bow on it, was a Ford minivan.
es_translation: I let go of my parents, shouted "thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you" while running through the dining room, and opened the front door dressed only in an old t-shirt and underwear. Parked in the driveway, with a huge blue bow, was a Ford minivan.

en: They’d given me a minivan. They could have picked any car, and they picked a minivan. A minivan. O God of Vehicular Justice, why dost thou mock me? Minivan, you albatross around my neck! You mark of Cain! You wretched beast of high ceilings and few horsepower!
vi: Bố mẹ cho tôi một chiếc minivan. Bố mẹ có thể chọn bất cứ loại xe nào, và đã chọn minivan. Một chiếc minivan. Ôi thưa Thần Công Lí Xe Cộ, sao ngài đùa dai với con vậy? Minivan, mi là cái gông đeo cổ, là nỗi xấu hổ không trôi! Mi là đồ quái vật trần cao lênh khênh mã lực thấp tè!
tr: Bana bir minivan vermişlerdi. Herhangi bir arabayı seçebilirlerdi ve bir minivan seçmişlerdi. Bir minivan. Ah, Araç Adaleti Tanrısı, neden benimle dalga geçiyorsun? Minivan, ayağımın bağı! Son benim lanetim! Sen yüksek tavanların ve düşük beygir güçlerinin sefil canavarı!
es: Me habían regalado un monovolumen. Podrían haber elegido cualquier coche, pero eligieron un monovolumen. Un monovolumen. Oh, Dios de la Justicia Vehicular, ¿por qué te burlas de mí? ¡Monovolumen, eres mi cruz! ¡Tú, marca de Caín! ¡Tú, miserable bestia de techo alto y pocos caballos!
vi_translation: My parents gave me a minivan. They could have chosen any type of car, and they chose a minivan. A minivan. Oh, Vehicle Justice God, why do you mock me so? Minivan, you are a yoke around my neck, an indelible shame! You are a high-roofed, low-powered monster!
tr_translation: They had given me a minivan. They could have chosen any car, and they chose a minivan. A minivan. Oh, God of Vehicle Justice, why are you mocking me? Minivan, the bane of my existence! You are my final curse! You miserable monster of high ceilings and low horsepower!
es_translation: They had given me a minivan. They could have chosen any car, but they chose a minivan. A minivan. Oh, God of Vehicular Justice, why do you mock me? Minivan, you are my cross! You, mark of Cain! You, miserable beast with a high roof and few horsepower!

en: I put on a brave face when I turned around. “Thank you thank you thank you!” I said, although surely I didn’t sound quite as effusive now that I was completely faking it.
vi: Tôi nặn ra một vẻ mặt quả cảm và quay lại. “Con cảm ơn bố, con cảm ơn mẹ ạ!” tôi nói, dù giọng nói hơi kém nồng nhiệt vì tôi hoàn toàn đang diễn.
tr: Arkamı döndüğümde, cesur bir yüz ifadesi takındım. “Teşekkürler teşekkürler teşekkürler!” dedim, buna rağmen tamamen yapmacık olduğu için sesim kesinlikle artık o kadar coşkulu çıkmıyordu.
es: Puse buena cara cuando me giré. —¡Gracias gracias gracias! —les dije, aunque seguro que no parecía tan efusivo ahora que estaba fingiendo.
vi_translation: I put on a brave face and turned around. "Thank you, Dad. Thank you, Mom!" I said, though my voice lacked enthusiasm because I was completely acting.
tr_translation: When I turned my back, I put on a brave face. "Thank you thank you thank you!" I said, but since it was completely fake, my voice definitely didn't sound as enthusiastic anymore.
es_translation: I put on a good face when I turned around. —Thank you, thank you, thank you! —I told them, although I was sure I didn't seem as effusive now that I was pretending.

en: “Well, we just knew how much you loved driving mine,” Mom said. She and Dad were beaming—clearly convinced they’d landed me the transportation of my dreams. “It’s great for getting around with your friends!” added my dad. And to think: these people specialize in the analysis and understanding of the human psyche.
vi: “Bố mẹ để ý con rất thích lái xe của mẹ,” mẹ nói. Bố mẹ tôi cười rạng rỡ–rõ là hoàn toàn tin tưởng rằng mình đã trao cho thằng con phương tiện đi lại mơ ước của đời nó. “Chơi bời loanh quanh với bạn bè sẽ vui lắm đấy!” bố nói thêm. Và hãy nghĩ xem: chuyên môn chính của hai vị này là phân tích và thấu hiểu tâm lí con người đấy.
tr: “Şey, benimkini sürmeyi ne kadar çok sevdiğini biliyorduk,” dedi annem. Onun da babamın da gözleri parlıyordu... belli ki bana hayallerimin arabasını sağladıklarına ikna olmuşlardı. “Arkadaşlarınla etrafta dolaşmak için harika,” diye ekledi babam. Bu insanların, insan ruhunu analiz etmede ve anlamada uzmanlaştıklarını düşününce...
es: —Bueno, sabíamos que te encantaba el mío —me dijo mi madre. Estaban los dos radiantes, sin duda convencidos de que me habían regalado el vehículo de mis sueños. —Es fantástico para que vayas por ahí con tus amigos —añadió mi padre. Y pensar que eran especialistas en analizar y entender la psicología humana…
vi_translation: “We noticed that you really like driving your mom's car,” mom said. My parents beamed—clearly believing that they had given their son the vehicle of his dreams. “Hanging out with friends will be a lot of fun!” dad added. And just think: these two specialize in analyzing and understanding human psychology.
tr_translation: “Well, we knew how much you loved driving mine,” said my mom. Both her and my dad's eyes were shining... clearly convinced they had provided me with the car of my dreams. “Great for driving around with your friends,” added my dad. Considering these people specialized in analyzing and understanding the human soul...
es_translation: —Well, we knew you loved mine —my mother told me. They were both radiant, undoubtedly convinced that they had given me the vehicle of my dreams. —It's fantastic for you to go out there with your friends —added my father. And to think that they were specialists in analyzing and understanding human psychology...

en: “Listen,” Dad said, “we should get going pretty soon if we want to get good seats.”
vi: “Chà,” bố nói, “ta nên đi sớm thì mới có chỗ ngồi tốt được.
tr: “Bak,” dedi babam, “eğer iyi yerlere oturmak istiyorsak, az sonra çıkmalıyız.
es: —Oye —dijo mi padre—, deberíamos ir pensando en salir si queremos pillar buenos asientos.
vi_translation: “Well,” Dad said, “we should go early to get good seats.”
tr_translation: "Look," said my father, "if we want to get good seats, we should leave soon."
es_translation: —Hey —said my father—, we should start thinking about leaving if we want to get good seats.

en: I hadn’t showered or dressed or anything. Well, not that I would technically be dressing, but still. “I don’t have to be there until twelve-thirty,” I said. “I need to, like, get ready.”
vi: Tôi chưa tắm rửa thay quần áo, chưa bất cứ gì cả. Ờ, như vậy không có nghĩa là tôi sẽ thực sự mặc đồ, nhưng vẫn cần thời gian chứ. “Mười hai rưỡi con mới phải có mặt,” tôi nói. “Con cần chuẩn bị nữa ạ.”
tr: Ne duş almıştım ne de giyinmiştim. Şey, teknik olarak giyinik olacağımdan değil ama yine de... “Saat yanma kadar orada olmak zorunda değilim,” dedim. “Hazırlanmam falan gerekiyor.
es: No me había duchado, ni vestido, ni nada. Bueno, para ser exacto, tampoco tenía que vestirme, pero en fin. —No tengo que estar allí hasta las doce y media —les dije—. Tengo que arreglarme.
vi_translation: I haven't showered or changed clothes, haven't done anything at all. Well, that doesn't mean I'll actually get dressed, but it still takes time. "You don't have to be there until twelve-thirty," I said. "I still need to get ready."
tr_translation: I had neither taken a shower nor gotten dressed. Well, technically I wouldn't be dressed anyway, but still... “I don't have to be there until about the time of the fire,” I said. “I need to get ready and all.”
es_translation: I hadn't showered, nor dressed, nor anything. Well, to be exact, I didn't have to dress either, but anyway. —I don't have to be there until twelve-thirty —I told them—. I have to get ready.

en: Dad frowned. “Well, I really want to have a good sight line so I can take some pic— ”
vi: Bố nhíu mày, “Ừ, nhưng bố muốn ngồi chỗ có tầm nhìn tốt để chụp–”
tr: Babam kaşlarım çattı. “Şey, gerçekten iyi bir görüş açım olsun istiyorum, böylece fotoğraf çeke...
es: Mi padre frunció el entrecejo. —Bueno, la verdad es que quiero sentarme en una buena fila para poder hacer fo…
vi_translation: Dad furrowed his brow, "Yes, but I want to sit somewhere with a good view to take pictures–"
tr_translation: My father frowned. "Well, I really want to have a good perspective, so I can take photos..."
es_translation: My father furrowed his brow. —Well, the truth is that I want to sit in a good row so I can take pho…

en: I interrupted him. “I can just take MY CAR,” I said. “I can drive MYSELF in MY CAR.” I smiled broadly.
vi: Tôi ngắt lời bố, “Con TỰ ĐI được ạ,” tôi nói. “Con có thể TỰ LÁI XE CỦA CON đến trường mà,” tôi cười toe toét.
tr: Sözünü kestim. “KENDİ ARABAMI alabilirim,” dedim. “KENDİ ARABAMLA, KENDİM gelebilirim.” Genişçe gülümsedim.
es: —Puedo coger MI COCHE —lo interrumpí—. Puedo ir SOLO en MI COCHE. Sonreí de oreja a oreja.
vi_translation: I interrupted my dad, "I can GO BY MYSELF," I said. "I can DRIVE MY OWN CAR to school," I grinned.
tr_translation: I interrupted him. “I can take MY OWN CAR,” I said. “I can come with MY OWN CAR, BY MYSELF.” I smiled broadly.
es_translation: —I can take MY CAR —I interrupted him—. I can go ALONE in MY CAR. I smiled from ear to ear.

en: “I know!” my mom said excitedly. And what the hell—a car’s a car, after all. Driving my own minivan was surely a step up from driving someone else’s.
vi: “Mẹ biết rồi!” mẹ cũng rất vui. Trời đất quỉ thần ơi, dù gì thì một cái ô-tô là một cái ô-tô. Lái minivan của tôi chắc chắn là một bước tiến so với lái minivan của người khác.
tr: “Biliyorum!” dedi annem heyecanla. Ne olmuş yani... bir araba her şeye rağmen bir arabadır. Kendi minivanımı sürmem, başkasınınkini sürmemden kesinlikle ileriye doğru atılmış bir adımdı.
es: —¡Ya lo sé! —me contestó mi madre entusiasmada. Y qué cojones, al fin y al cabo un coche es un coche. Seguro que conducir mi monovolumen estaba un peldaño por encima de conducir el monovolumen de otra persona.
vi_translation: "Mom knows already!" Mom was also very happy. Heavens and earth, a car is still a car no matter what. Driving my minivan is definitely a step up compared to driving someone else's minivan.
tr_translation: “I know!” my mother said excitedly. So what... a car is a car after all. Driving my own minivan was definitely a step forward compared to driving someone else's.
es_translation: —I already know! —my mother replied enthusiastically. And what the hell, after all, a car is a car. I'm sure driving my minivan was a step above driving someone else's minivan.

en: I went back to my computer then and informed Radar and Lacey (Ben wasn’t online) about the minivan.
vi: Tôi quay lại máy tính, khoe ngay với Radar và Lacey (Ben không trực tuyến) về chiếc minivan.
tr: Sonra bilgisayanmm başına dönüp Radar ile Lacey’yi (Ben çevrimiçi değildi) minivandan haberdar ettim.
es: Volví al ordenador e informé a Radar y a Lacey (Ben no estaba conectado) de lo del coche.
vi_translation: I went back to the computer and immediately bragged to Radar and Lacey (Ben was not online) about the minivan.
tr_translation: Then I went back to my computer and informed Radar and Lacey (Ben wasn't online) about the minivan.
es_translation: I went back to the computer and informed Radar and Lacey (Ben wasn't online) about the car.

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Actually that’s really good news. Can I stop by and put a cooler in your trunk? I gotta drive my parents to graduation and don’t want them to see.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Tin quá tốt đấy! Tôi qua bỏ nhờ cái thùng giữ lạnh vào sau xe ông được không? Tôi phải đưa bố mẹ đến lễ tốt nghiệp và không muốn hai vị nghía thấy cái thùng đó.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Aslında bu gerçekten iyi haber. Uğrayıp bagajına bir soğutucu koyabilir miyim? Annemle babamı mezuniyete götürmek zorundayım ve onların görmesini istemiyorum.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Es una noticia estupenda, de verdad. ¿Puedo pasar por tu casa a dejar una nevera en el maletero? Tengo que llevar a mis padres a la graduación y no quiero que la vean.
vi_translation: GLOBALCITIZEN96: That's great news! Can I leave my cooler in the back of your car? I have to take my parents to the graduation ceremony and don't want them to see the cooler.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Actually, this is really good news. Can I stop by and put a cooler in your trunk? I have to take my mom and dad to the graduation, and I don't want them to see it.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: It's really great news, truly. Can I stop by your house to leave a fridge in the trunk? I have to take my parents to the graduation and I don't want them to see it.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: Sure, it’s unlocked. Cooler for what?
vi: QKẺHỒISINH: Được, xe không khóa đâu. Thùng giữ lạnh để làm gì vậy?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Tabii, kilitlemedim. Ne için soğutucu?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: Claro, está abierto. ¿Para qué es la nevera?
vi_translation: QKẺHỒISINH: Sure, the car isn't locked. What is the cooler for?
tr_translation: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: Of course, I didn't lock it. What is the cooler for?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: Of course, it's open. What is the fridge for?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Well, since no one drank at my party, there were 212 beers left over, and we’re taking them over to Lacey’s for her party tonight.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Ờ, hôm tiệc ở nhà tôi chả có ai uống bia, vẫn còn 212 chai, mang đến nhà Lacey cho cậu ấy mở tiệc tối nay luôn.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Şey, kimse içmediği için partimden kalan 212 bira var ve bu geceki partisi için onları Lacey’lere götüreceğiz.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Bueno, como nadie bebió en mi fiesta, quedaron 212 cervezas, así que las llevaremos a casa de Lacey para su fiesta de esta noche.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHEREALM96: Well, at the party at my house, no one drank beer, there are still 212 bottles left, I'll bring them to Lacey's house for her to throw a party tonight.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Well, since no one drank them, I have 212 beers left from my party and we're going to take them to Lacey's for tonight's party.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Well, since nobody drank at my party, there are 212 beers left, so we will take them to Lacey's house for her party tonight.

en: QTHERESURRECTION: 212 beers?
vi: QKẺ HỒI SINH: 212 chai bia?
tr: DİRİLİŞÇİQ: 212 bira mı?
es: QTHERESURRECTION: ¿212 cervezas?
vi_translation: THE RESURRECTED ONE: 212 bottles of beer?
tr_translation: RESURRECTIONIST: 212 beers?
es_translation: QTHERESURRECTION: 212 beers?

en: OMNICTIONARIAN96: It’s a big cooler.
vi: CÔNGDÂNCỦATOÀNTHƯ96: Cái thùng to đấy.
tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Büyük bir soğutucu.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Es una nevera grande.
vi_translation: CITIZENOFTHEWORLD96: That big box.
tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: A large cooler.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: It is a big refrigerator.

en: Ben came online then, SHOUTING about how he was already showered and naked and just needed to put on the cap and gown. We were all talking back and forth about our naked graduation. After everyone logged off to get ready, I got in the shower and stood up straight so that the water shot directly at my face, and I started thinking as the water pounded away at me. New York or California? Chicago or D.C.? I could go now, too, I thought. I had a car just as much as she did. I could go to the five spots on the map, and even if I didn’t find her, it would be more fun than another boiling summer in Orlando. But no. It’s like breaking into SeaWorld. It takes an immaculate plan, and then you execute it brilliantly, and then—nothing. And then it’s just Sea-World, except darker. She’d told me: the pleasure isn’t in doing the thing; the pleasure is in planning it.
vi: Ben vào mạng, GÀO THÉT rằng nó đã tắm rửa tinh tươm, nhân trần như nhộng và chỉ cần đội mũ, tròng áo chùng vào nữa thôi. Bọn tôi tán hươu tán vượn về lễ tốt nghiệp nhân trần. Sau khi cả lũ đều đã thoát khỏi mạng để đi chuẩn bị, tôi vào phòng tắm, đứng thẳng để nước bắn trực tiếp lên mặt, bắt đầu suy nghĩ trong khi nước vẫn xối. New York hay California? Chicago hay D. C.? Bây giờ mình cũng có thể đi được rồi, tôi nghĩ. Tôi có xe, như cô ấy cũng có một chiếc. Tôi có thể đến cả năm điểm trên bản đồ, dù có thể không tìm được cô ấy, thì cũng vui hơn một mùa hè nóng chảy nước ở Orlando. Nhưng không. Giống như lẻn vào SeaWorld vậy. Cần lập kế hoạch tỉ mỉ, cần thực thi kế hoạch một cách xuất sắc, rồi sau đó–không gì cả. Và cũng giống như SeaWorld, trừ chuyện tối hơn. Margo đã nói với tôi: phần vui nhất không nằm ở khâu thực thi; phần vui nhất là chính quá trình lên kế hoạch.
tr: Daha sonra Ben çevrimiçi oldu; çoktan duş aldığını, çıplak olduğunu ve sadece kep ile cübbeyi giymesi gerektiğini BAĞIRARAK. Hepimiz çıplak mezuniyetimiz hakkında konuşuyorduk. Herkes hazırlanmak için çevrimdışı olduktan sonra, duşa girip su doğrudan yüzüme çarpsın diye dik durdum ve su bana vururken düşünmeye başladım. New York mu Kaliforniya mı? Şikago mu Washington mı? Şimdi ben de gidebilirim, diye düşündüm. Tıpkı onun olduğu gibi benim de bir arabam vardı. Haritadaki beş konuma gidebilirdim ve onu bulamasam bile bu, Orlando’da başka bir kavurucu yazdan daha eğlenceli olurdu. Ama hayır. Bu SeaWorld’e izinsiz girmek gibi. Kusursuz bir plan gerekiyor, plan ustalıklı bir şekilde uygulanıyor, ardından... hiçbir yere varmıyor. Sonra, daha karanlık olması dışmda tıpkı SeaWorld gibi oluyor. Margo bana, işin keyfinin yapmakta değil, planlamakta olduğunu söylemişti.
es: Entonces Ben entró en el chat GRITANDO que ya se había duchado, que estaba desnudo y que solo le faltaba ponerse la toga y el birrete. Hablamos todos un buen rato sobre nuestra graduación desnudos. Cuando ya todos se habían desconectado para prepararse, me metí en la ducha, levanté la cabeza para que el agua me cayera directamente en la cara y mientras el agua me aporreaba empecé a pensar. ¿Nueva York o California? ¿Chicago o Washington? También podría ir, pensé. Tenía coche, como ella. Podría ir a los cinco puntos del mapa y, aunque no la encontrara, sería más divertido que pasarme otro verano abrasador en Orlando. Pero no. Era como colarte en el SeaWorld. Exige un plan impecable, luego lo llevas a cabo brillantemente, y luego… nada. Luego es el SeaWorld, solo que más oscuro. Margo me dijo que el placer no es hacer algo. El placer es planificarlo.
vi_translation: Ben went online, SCREAMING that he had bathed thoroughly, stark naked, and just needed to put on a hat and slip into his robe. We chatted about the graduation ceremony in the nude. After everyone had logged off to get ready, I went into the bathroom, stood straight to let the water hit my face directly, and started thinking while the water kept pouring. New York or California? Chicago or D.C.? Now I could go too, I thought. I have a car, just like she has one. I could go to all five points on the map, and even if I didn't find her, it would be more fun than a melting hot summer in Orlando. But no. It's like sneaking into SeaWorld. It requires meticulous planning, excellent execution, and then–nothing. And just like SeaWorld, except darker. Margo had told me: the fun part isn't in the execution; the fun part is in the planning process itself.
tr_translation: Then Ben came online; he was already showered, naked, and just needed to put on the cap and gown, SHOUTING. We were all talking about our naked graduation. After everyone went offline to get ready, I stood up straight in the shower so the water would hit me directly in the face and started thinking as the water hit me. New York or California? Chicago or Washington? Now I can go too, I thought. Just like he had, I also had a car. I could go to the five locations on the map, and even if I didn't find her, it would be more fun than another scorching summer in Orlando. But no. It's like sneaking into SeaWorld. It requires a flawless plan, the plan is executed masterfully, and then... it leads nowhere. Then, it's just like SeaWorld, except darker. Margo had told me that the fun of it was not in the doing, but in the planning.
es_translation: Then Ben entered the chat SHOUTING that he had already showered, that he was naked, and that he only needed to put on the gown and cap. We all talked for a good while about our graduation while naked. When everyone had disconnected to get ready, I got into the shower, lifted my head so the water would fall directly on my face, and as the water pounded me, I started to think. New York or California? Chicago or Washington? I could also go, I thought. I had a car, like her. I could go to the five points on the map and, even if I didn't find her, it would be more fun than spending another scorching summer in Orlando. But no. It was like sneaking into SeaWorld. It requires an impeccable plan, then you execute it brilliantly, and then… nothing. Then it's SeaWorld, only darker. Margo told me that the pleasure isn't in doing something. The pleasure is in planning it.

en: And that’s what I thought about as I stood beneath the showerhead: the planning. She sits in the minimall with her notebook, planning. Maybe she’s planning a road trip, using the map to imagine routes. She reads the Whitman and highlights “I tramp a perpetual journey,” because that’s the kind of thing she likes to imagine herself doing, the kind of thing she likes to plan.
vi: Đó là những điều tôi đã nghĩ khi đứng dưới vòi hoa sen: quá trình lên kế hoạch. Margo ngồi trong khu mua sắm mini với cuốn sổ tay, vạch ra các kế hoạch. Có thể cô ấy đang sắp xếp một hành trình đi bằng ô-tô, dùng tấm bản đồ để hình dung các tuyến đường. Cô ấy đọc Whitman và đánh dấu “Ta dấn mình vào chuyến đi miên viễn,” vì đó là thể loại việc cô ấy thích tưởng tượng mình đang làm, thể loại việc cô ấy thích lên kế hoạch.
tr: Ve duş başlığının altında dururken düşündüğüm şey buydu: planlamak. Margo defteriyle alışveriş merkezinde bir şeyler planlayarak oturuyor. Belki güzergâhları hayal etmek için haritayı kullanarak bir yolculuk planlıyor. Whitman’ı okuyor ve “Ebedî bir yolculukta ağır ağır ilerliyorum” cümlesinin altını çiziyor çünkü bu, kendini yaparken hayal etmekten hoşlanacağı türde bir şey, planlamaktan hoşlanacağı türde bir şey.
es: Y en eso pensaba debajo del chorro de la ducha: en el plan. Está sentada en el centro comercial abandonado con su libreta, haciendo planes. Quizá está planificando un viaje por carretera y utiliza el mapa para ver las rutas. Lee a Whitman y señala «El viaje que he emprendido es eterno», porque es lo que le gusta imaginarse, el tipo de cosas que le gusta planificar.
vi_translation: Those were the things I thought about while standing under the shower: the planning process. Margo sat in the mini-mall with a notebook, outlining plans. She might be arranging a road trip, using the map to visualize the routes. She read Whitman and marked “I embark on the perpetual journey,” because that’s the kind of thing she likes to imagine herself doing, the kind of thing she likes to plan.
tr_translation: And this is what I was thinking while standing under the showerhead: planning. Margo is sitting in the mall with her notebook, planning something. Maybe she's using the map to imagine routes and plan a journey. She's reading Whitman and underlining the sentence "I am slowly advancing on an eternal journey" because it's the kind of thing she would enjoy imagining herself doing, the kind of thing she would enjoy planning.
es_translation: And that's what she was thinking about under the shower stream: the plan. She is sitting in the abandoned shopping mall with her notebook, making plans. Maybe she is planning a road trip and using the map to see the routes. She reads Whitman and marks "The journey I have undertaken is eternal," because that's what she likes to imagine, the kind of things she likes to plan.

en: But is it the kind of thing she likes to actually do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret I have only just now learned: leaving feels good and pure only when you leave something important, something that mattered to you. Pulling life out by the roots. But you can’t do that until your life has grown roots.
vi: Nhưng đó có phải thể loại việc cô ấy thích thực sự thực hiện không? Không. Vì Margo biết bí mật của sự ra đi, cái bí mật tôi vừa mới hiểu được: sự ra đi chỉ tuyệt diệu và thuần khiết khi ta rời bỏ điều gì đó quan trọng, điều gì đó có ý nghĩa với ta. Kéo bật sự sống lên từ gốc rễ. Nhưng ta không thể làm như vậy cho đến khi cuộc đời ta đã bén rễ.
tr: Ama gerçekten yapmaktan hoşlanacağı türde bir şey mi? Hayır. Çünkü Margo bir yeri terk etmenin sırrım biliyor, benim ancak şimdi öğrendiğim sim: Terk etmek, yalnızca önemli bir yer, an lamı olan bir yer terk edildiğinde iyi ve saf hissettiriyor. Hayatı köklerinden çekip çıkarmak gibi. Ama bunu, hayat kök salmadıkça yapmak mümkün değil.
es: Pero ¿es el tipo de cosas que realmente le gusta hacer? No. Porque Margo conoce el secreto de marcharse, el secreto que yo acabo de aprender: marcharse te hace sentirte bien y es auténtico solo cuando dejas atrás algo importante, algo que te importaba. Arrancar la vida desde la raíz. Pero no puedes hacerlo mientras tu vida no haya echado raíces.
vi_translation: But is that the kind of work she really likes to do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret I have just understood: leaving is only wonderful and pure when you leave something important, something meaningful to you. Uprooting life from its roots. But you can't do that until your life has taken root.
tr_translation: But is it really the kind of thing she would enjoy doing? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving a place, a secret I have only now learned: Leaving is only about an important place, a moment When a place with a soul is abandoned, it feels good and pure. Like uprooting life from its roots. But this is not possible until life has taken root.
es_translation: But is it the kind of thing that he really likes to do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret that I have just learned: leaving makes you feel good and is only authentic when you leave behind something important, something that mattered to you. Uprooting life from its roots. But you can't do it while your life hasn't taken root.

en: And so when she left, she left for good. But I could not believe she had left for a perpetual journey. She had, I felt sure, left for a place—a place where she could stay long enough for it to matter, long enough for the next leaving to feel as good as the last one had. There is a corner of the world somewhere far away from here where no one knows what “Margo Roth Spiegelman” means. And Margo is sitting in that corner, scrawling in her black notebook.
vi: Thế nên khi Margo ra đi, cô ấy ra đi mãi mãi. Nhưng tôi không tin rằng cô ấy ra đi vì một hành trình miên viễn. Tôi cảm thấy chắc chắn rằng cô ấy ra đi để đến một nơi–nơi cô ấy có thể ở lại đủ lâu để chỗ đó trở nên có ý nghĩa, đủ lâu để lần ra đi sau cũng đem lại cảm giác tuyệt diệu như lần ra đi trước. Có một góc trên thế gian này, đâu đó cách xa đây, nơi không ai biết “Margo Roth Spiegelman” nghĩa là gì. Và Margo đang ngồi ở góc đó, đang viết vào cuốn sổ màu đen của cô ấy.
tr: Yani terk ettiğinde geri dönmemek üzere terk etti. Fakat ebedî bir yolculuğa çıktığına inanmam mümkün değildi. Bir yere gitmek için ayrıldığından emindim... anlamı olması için, bir dahaki terk edişin sonuncusu kadar iyi hissettirmesi için, yeterince uzun kalabileceği bir yer. Buradan uzaklarda bir yerde, dünyanın, kimsenin “Margo Roth Spiegelman” isminin ne demek olduğunu bilmediği bir köşesi var ve Margo o köşede, siyah not defterine bir şeyler karalayarak oturuyor.
es: Por eso cuando se marchó, se marchó para siempre. Pero no podía creerme que hubiera emprendido un viaje eterno. Estaba seguro de que había ido a algún sitio, a un sitio en el que pudiera quedarse el tiempo suficiente para que le importara, el tiempo suficiente para que la siguiente marcha la hiciera sentirse tan bien como la anterior. «Hay un rincón en el mundo, en algún lugar lejano, en el que nadie sabe lo que significa “Margo Roth Spiegelman”. Y Margo está sentada allí, escribiendo en su libreta negra».
vi_translation: So when Margo left, she left forever. But I don't believe that she left for an endless journey. I feel certain that she left to go to a place—a place where she could stay long enough for it to become meaningful, long enough so that the next departure would feel as wonderful as the previous one. There is a corner in this world, somewhere far from here, where no one knows what "Margo Roth Spiegelman" means. And Margo is sitting in that corner, writing in her black notebook.
tr_translation: So when she left, she left never to return. But it was impossible for me to believe that she had embarked on an eternal journey. I was sure she had left to go somewhere... somewhere she could stay long enough for it to mean something, for the next departure to feel as good as the last one. Somewhere far from here, in a corner of the world where no one knows what the name "Margo Roth Spiegelman" means, Margo is sitting, scribbling something in her black notebook.
es_translation: That's why when she left, she left for good. But I couldn't believe that she had embarked on an eternal journey. I was sure she had gone somewhere, to a place where she could stay long enough for it to matter to her, long enough so that the next departure would make her feel as good as the previous one. “There is a corner in the world, somewhere far away, where no one knows what 'Margo Roth Spiegelman' means. And Margo is sitting there, writing in her black notebook.”

en: The water began to get cold. I hadn’t so much as touched a bar of soap, but I got out, wrapped a towel around my waist, and sat down at the computer.
vi: Nước bắt đầu lạnh. Còn chưa động đến bánh xà-phòng, nhưng tôi đi ra, cuốn khăn bông quanh hông và ngồi xuống bên máy tính.
tr: Su soğumaya başladı. Sabun kalıbına dokunmamıştım bile ama çıktım; belime bir havlu sardım ve bilgisayarın başına oturdum.
es: El agua empezó a enfriarse. Ni siquiera había tocado la pastilla de jabón, pero salí, me enrollé una toalla en la cintura y me senté frente al ordenador.
vi_translation: The water is starting to get cold. Still haven't touched the soap, but I get out, wrap a towel around my waist, and sit down by the computer.
tr_translation: The water started to cool down. I hadn't even touched the bar of soap, but I got out; I wrapped a towel around my waist and sat down at the computer.
es_translation: The water started to cool down. I hadn't even touched the bar of soap, but I got out, wrapped a towel around my waist, and sat in front of the computer.

en: I dug up Radar’s email about his Omnictionary program and downloaded the plug-in. It really was pretty cool. First, I entered a zip code in downtown Chicago, clicked “location,” and asked for a radius of twenty miles. It spit back a hundred responses, from Navy Pier to Deerfield. The first sentence of each entry came up on my screen, and I read through them in about five minutes. Nothing stood out. Then I tried a zip code near the Catskill Park in New York. Fewer responses this time, eighty-two, organized by the date on which the Omnictionary page had been created. I started to read.
vi: Tôi mò lại e-mail Radar gửi chương trình trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ của nó, tải về máy mình. Chương trình chạy rất ổn. Đầu tiên, tôi gõ mã vùng khu trung tâm Chicago, chọn “địa điểm”, và tìm trong bán kín hai mươi dặm. Ra cả trăm câu trả lời, từ Navy Pier đến Deerfield. Câu đầu tiên của mỗi bài viết hiện lên màn hình của tôi, tôi đọc lướt qua mất chừng năm phút. Không có gì nổi bật.
tr: Radarın Omnictionary programıyla ilgili epostasını arayıp buldum ve yazılımı indirdim. Hakikaten oldukça iyiydi. Önce, Şikago şehir merkezinde bir alan kodu girdim, “konum” butonuna tıkladım ve otuz kilometrelik bir yarıçap talep ettim. Navy Pier’dan Deerfield’a kadar yüz tane sonuç sundu. Her girdinin ilk cümlesi ekranıma geldi ve yaklaşık beş dakikada hepsini okudum. Gözüme çarpan hiçbir şey olmadı. Sonra New York, Catskill Park’ın yakınındaki bir alan kodunu denedim. Bu sefer daha az sonuç vardı, seksen iki taneydi ve Omnictionary sayfalarının yaratıldığı tarihe göre düzenlenmişlerdi. Okumaya başladım.
es: Abrí el correo de Radar con el programa del Omnictionary y me lo descargué. La verdad es que era genial. Primero entré el código postal del centro de Chicago, cliqué «localización» y pedí un radio de treinta kilómetros. Me salieron cien respuestas, desde Navy Pier a Deerfield. En la pantalla aparecía la primera línea de cada entrada, así que las leí en unos cinco minutos. No vi nada destacable. Luego lo intenté con el código postal del parque de Catskill, en Nueva York. Esa vez hubo menos resultados, ochenta y dos, organizados por la fecha en la que se había creado la página en el Omnictionary. Empecé a leer.
vi_translation: I searched through Radar's email for the program in his Encyclopedia of Everything, and downloaded it to my computer. The program ran very smoothly. First, I entered the central Chicago area code, selected "location," and searched within a twenty-mile radius. Hundreds of results came up, from Navy Pier to Deerfield. The first sentence of each entry appeared on my screen, and I skimmed through them in about five minutes. Nothing stood out. I tried again with an area code near Catskill Park in New York. This time there were fewer results, eighty-two, sorted by the date the entries were created in the Encyclopedia of Everything.
tr_translation: I searched for and found Radar's email about the Omnictionary program and downloaded the software. It was indeed quite good. First, I entered an area code in downtown Chicago, clicked the "location" button, and requested a radius of thirty kilometers. It provided a hundred results from Navy Pier to Deerfield. The first sentence of each entry appeared on my screen, and I read them all in about five minutes. Nothing caught my eye. Then I tried an area code near Catskill Park in New York. This time there were fewer results, eighty-two, and they were organized by the date the Omnictionary pages were created. I started reading.
es_translation: I opened Radar's email with the Omnictionary program and downloaded it. The truth is that it was great. First, I entered the postal code for downtown Chicago, clicked "location," and requested a radius of thirty kilometers. I got a hundred responses, from Navy Pier to Deerfield. The first line of each entry appeared on the screen, so I read them in about five minutes. I didn't see anything noteworthy. Then I tried with the postal code for Catskill Park in New York. This time there were fewer results, eighty-two, organized by the date the page was created on Omnictionary. I started reading.

en: Woodstock, New York, is a town in Ulster County, New York, perhaps best known for the eponymous Woodstock concert [see Woodstock Concert] in 1969, a three-day event featuring acts from Jimi Hendrix to Janis Joplin, which actually occurred in a nearby town.
vi: Tôi thử tiếp bằng một mã vùng gần Catskill Park ở New York. Lần này có ít trả lời hơn, tám mươi hai, sắp xếp theo ngày tháng bài viết được tạo ra trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ. Tôi bắt đầu đọc: Woodstock, bang New York, là một thành phố ở hạt Ulster, New York, có lẽ được biết đến nhiều nhất nhờ cuộc hòa nhạc cùng tên [xem Hòa nhạc Woodstock] năm 1969, một sự kiện kéo dài ba ngày, với sự tham gia của các nghệ sĩ từ Jimi Hendrix đến Janis Joplin, thực tế diễn ra ở một thành phố gần đó. Hồ Katrine là một hồ nhỏ thuộc hạt Ulster, New York, thường được Henry David Thoreau ghé thăm.
tr: Woodstock, New York, Ulster Ilçesi’nde bulunan, Jimi Hendrix’ten Janis Joplin’e kadar birçok kişinin sahne aldığı üç günlük bir festival olan, ashnda yakınlardaki bir kasabada gerçekleştirilmiş 1969 Woodstock konseriyle [bkz. Woodstock Konseri] tanınan bir şehirdir.
es: Woodstock, Nueva York, es una ciudad del condado de Ulster, Nueva York, muy conocida por el concierto de 1969 que llevó su nombre (véase Concierto de Woodstock), un evento de tres días en el que actuaron artistas como Jimi Hendrix y Janis Joplin, aunque en realidad el concierto se celebró en una población cercana.
vi_translation: I began reading: Woodstock, New York, is a town in Ulster County, New York, perhaps best known for the namesake music festival [see Woodstock Festival] in 1969, a three-day event featuring artists from Jimi Hendrix to Janis Joplin, which actually took place in a nearby town.
tr_translation: Woodstock, New York, located in Ulster County, is a city known for the 1969 Woodstock concert, a three-day festival where many performers, from Jimi Hendrix to Janis Joplin, took the stage, although it was actually held in a nearby town [see. Woodstock Concert].
es_translation: Woodstock, New York, is a city in Ulster County, New York, well known for the 1969 concert that bore its name (see Woodstock Concert), a three-day event where artists like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin performed, although the concert was actually held in a nearby town.

en: The Catskill Park comprises 700,000 acres of land in the Catskill Mountains owned jointly by state and local governments, including a 5 percent share held by New York City, which gets much of its water from reservoirs partly inside the park.
vi: Catskill Park rộng 2. 800 cây số vuông, nằm trên dãy núi Catskill, do chính phủ liên bang và chính quyền địa phương đồng quản lí, bao gồm 5 phần trăm cổ phần của thành phố New York; một phần nước sinh hoạt cho thành phố được lấy từ các hồ ở Catskill Park.
tr: Catskill Park, suyunun çoğunu kısmen parkın içinde yer alan rezervlerden toplayan, New York Şehri’nin tuttuğu yüzde beş hisse de dâhil, yerel hükümetler ile devletin ortaklaşa elinde tuttuğu Catskill Dağları’ndaki 700. 000 dönümlük alanı kapsar.
es: El parque de Catskill abarca casi tres mil kilómetros cuadrados de las montañas de Catskill y es propiedad conjunta del Estado y del gobierno local, con un 5 por ciento de participación de la ciudad de Nueva York, que recibe buena parte de su agua de los embalses situados parcialmente dentro del parque.
vi_translation: Catskill Park covers 2,800 square kilometers, located in the Catskill Mountains, co-managed by the federal government and local authorities, including 5 percent ownership by New York City; part of the city's drinking water is sourced from lakes in Catskill Park.
tr_translation: Catskill Park encompasses a 700,000-acre area in the Catskill Mountains, jointly held by local governments and the state, including a five percent share held by New York City, which collects most of its water from reservoirs partially located within the park.
es_translation: The Catskill Park covers almost three thousand square kilometers of the Catskill Mountains and is jointly owned by the State and local government, with a 5 percent stake held by New York City, which receives a good portion of its water from reservoirs located partially within the park.

en: Roscoe, New York, is a hamlet in New York State, which according to a recent census contains 261 households.
vi: Roscoe, bang New York, là một khu dân cư nhỏ, theo điều tra dân số gần đây gồm 261 hộ gia đình.
tr: Roscoe, New York, son nüfus sayımına göre 261 hane barındıran, New York Eyaleti’ndeki bir mezradır.
es: Roscoe, Nueva York, es una aldea del estado de Nueva York que, según un censo reciente, cuenta con 261 familias.
vi_translation: Roscoe, New York, is a small community, according to the most recent census, consisting of 261 households.
tr_translation: Roscoe, New York, according to the latest census, is a hamlet in the State of New York that houses 261 households.
es_translation: Roscoe, New York, is a village in the state of New York that, according to a recent census, has 261 families.

en: Agloe, New York, is a fictitious village created by the Esso company in the early 1930s and inserted into tourist maps as a copyright trap, or paper town.
vi: Agloe, bang New York, là một ngôi làng không có thật, do công ti Esso đưa ra vào đầu những năm 1930 và xuất hiện trong các bản đồ du lịch, đóng vai trò là một cái bẫy bản quyền, hoặc một thành phố giấy.
tr: Agloe, New York, 1930’larm başlarında Esso şirketi tarafından kurulmuş ve bir telif hakkı tuzağı ya da kâğıttan kent olarak turistik haritalara sokulmuş, hayalî bir köydür.
es: Agloe, Nueva York, es un pueblo ficticio creado por la empresa Esso a principios de la década de 1930 y que incluyó en los mapas turísticos como trampa para controlar los derechos de autor. A estos pueblos ficticios también se les llama ciudades de papel.
vi_translation: Agloe, New York, is a fictitious village, created by the Esso company in the early 1930s and appearing on tourist maps, serving as a copyright trap, or a paper town.
tr_translation: Agloe, New York, is an imaginary village established by the Esso company in the early 1930s and inserted into tourist maps as a copyright trap or a paper town.
es_translation: Agloe, New York, is a fictional town created by the Esso company in the early 1930s and included in tourist maps as a trap to control copyright. These fictional towns are also called paper towns.

en: I clicked on the link and it took me to the full article, which continued:
vi: Tôi nhấn vào đường dẫn để đọc toàn bài, tiếp tục là:
tr: linke tıkladım ve bu link beni şöyle devam eden makalenin tamamına götürdü:
es: Pinché en el link y me llevó al artículo completo, que seguía diciendo:
vi_translation: I clicked on the link to read the full article, continuing with:
tr_translation: I clicked on the link and this link took me to the full article that continued as follows:
es_translation: I clicked on the link and it took me to the full article, which continued saying:

en: Located at the intersection of two dirt roads just north of Roscoe, NY, Agloe was the creation of mapmakers Otto G. Lindberg and Ernest Alpers, who invented the town name by anagramming their initials. Copyright traps have featured in mapmaking for centuries. Cartographers create fictional landmarks, streets, and municipalities and place them obscurely into their maps. If the fictional entry is found on another cartographer’s map, it becomes clear a map has been plagiarized. Copyright traps are also sometimes known as key traps, paper streets, and paper towns [see also fictitious entries]. Although few cartographic corporations acknowledge their existence, copyright traps remain a common feature even in contemporary maps.
vi: Nằm ở giao lộ của hai con đường đất về phía bắc Roscoe, NY, Agloe là sản phẩm của các nhà làm bản đồ Otto G. Lindberg và Ernest Alpers, họ đã tạo ra tên Agloe bằng cách ghép các chữ cái đầu trong tên mình lại. Các bẫy bản quyền xuất hiện trong ngành làm bản đồ từ nhiều thế kỉ nay. Các nhà bản đồ học tạo ra những địa điểm, phố và thành phố không có thật, đặt vào những chỗ khó tìm trên bản đồ của họ. Nếu những địa danh không có thật đó được tìm thấy trên bản đồ của một người làm bản đồ khác, chắc chắn rằng một tấm bản đồ đã nghiễm nhiên bị sao chép trái phép. Bẫy bản quyền cũng được gọi là bẫy khóa, phố giấy, và thành phố giấy [xem những tra cứu không có thật]. Dù chỉ một số đơn vị làm bản đồ ghi nhận sự tồn tại của các bẫy bản quyền, những bẫy này vẫn là một đặc điểm phổ biến trong các bản đồ ngày nay.
tr: Roscoe, New York’un hemen kuzeyinde iki toprak yolun kesiştiği yerde konumlanmış olan Agloe ismini, kendi isimlerinin ilk harflerinden anagram yapan haritacı Otto G. Lindberg ve Ernest Alpers’tan alır. Telif hakkı tuzakları harita yapımında yüzyıllardır yer almıştır. Kartograflar hayalî sınır işaretleri, sokaklar ve bölgeler yaratıp bunları anlaşılması zor bir biçimde haritalarına yerleştirirler. Eğer hayalî girdi başka bir kartografın haritasında da yer alırsa, haritanın çalınarak yayımlandığı ortaya çıkar. Telif hakkı tuzakları bazen anahtar tuzakları, kâğıttan sokaklar ve kâğıttan kentler olarak adlandırılır [ayrıca bkz. hayalî girdiler]. Az sayıda kartografi kurumu varlıklarım kabul etse de telif hakkı tuzakları modem haritalarda bile yaygın bir özellik olarak kalmıştır.
es: Agloe, situado en el cruce de dos carreteras sin asfaltar al norte de Roscoe, Nueva York, fue creado por los cartógrafos Otto G. Lindberg y Ernest Alpers, que se inventaron el nombre de la población formando un anagrama con sus iniciales. Desde hace siglos se introducen trampas en los mapas para controlar los derechos de autor. Los cartógrafos crean lugares, calles y municipios ficticios y los colocan en un lugar poco visible de su mapa. Si la entrada ficticia aparece en el mapa de otro cartógrafo, es evidente que ese mapa ha sido plagiado. A estas trampas también se las denomina trampas clave, calles de papel y ciudades de papel (véase también entradas ficiticias). Aunque muy pocas empresas cartográficas admiten su existencia, las trampas siguen siendo un rasgo frecuente incluso en mapas contemporáneos.
vi_translation: Located at the intersection of two dirt roads north of Roscoe, NY, Agloe is the creation of mapmakers Otto G. Lindberg and Ernest Alpers, who formed the name Agloe by combining the initials of their names. Copyright traps have existed in the cartography industry for many centuries. Cartographers create fictitious locations, streets, and cities, placing them in hard-to-find spots on their maps. If those fictitious place names are found on another cartographer's map, it is certain that a map has been illicitly copied. Copyright traps are also known as trap streets, paper streets, and paper towns [see fictitious entries]. Although only a few mapping entities acknowledge the existence of copyright traps, they remain a common feature in today's maps.
tr_translation: Roscoe, located at the intersection of two dirt roads just north of New York, gets its name from the cartographer Otto G., who made an anagram from the first letters of their names. It is derived from Lindberg and Ernest Alpers. Copyright traps have been a part of mapmaking for centuries. Cartographers create imaginary boundary markers, streets, and areas and place them on their maps in a way that is difficult to understand. If the imaginary input appears on another cartographer's map, it reveals that the map has been copied and published. Copyright traps are sometimes called key traps, paper streets, and paper towns [see also imaginary inputs]. There are a few cartography institutions that exist Even if accepted, copyright traps have remained a common feature even in modern maps.
es_translation: Agloe, situated at the intersection of two unpaved roads north of Roscoe, New York, was created by cartographers Otto G. Lindberg and Ernest Alpers, who invented the name of the town by forming an anagram with their initials. For centuries, traps have been introduced into maps to control copyright. Cartographers create fictitious places, streets, and towns and place them in an inconspicuous spot on their map. If the fictitious entry appears on another cartographer's map, it is evident that the map has been plagiarized. These traps are also known as key traps, paper streets, and paper towns (see also fictitious entries). Although very few cartographic companies admit their existence, the traps remain a frequent feature even in contemporary maps.

en: In the 1940s, Agloe, New York, began appearing on maps created by other companies. Esso suspected copyright infringement and prepared several lawsuits, but in fact, an unknown resident had built “The Agloe General Store” at the intersection that appeared on the Esso map.
vi: Trong những năm 1940, Agloe, New York, bắt đầu xuất hiện trên bản đồ của các công ti khác. Esso nghi ngờ có hiện tượng vi phạm bản quyền và chuẩn bị thủ tục tố tụng, nhưng trên thực tế, một người dân không rõ danh tính đã xây một “Hiệu Tạp Hóa Agloe” tại giao lộ xuất hiện trong bản đồ của Esso.
tr: 1940larda Agloe, New York diğer şirketler tarafından yapılan haritalarda görülmeye başladı. Esso telif hakkı ihlalinden şüphelenip birçok dava açtı ama aslında İçimliği bilinmeyen bir mukim, Esso haritasında görünen kavşağa Agloe Market’i kurmuştu.
