es: En la década de 1940, Agloe, Nueva York, empezó a aparecer en mapas de otras empresas. Esso sospechó que habían infringido las leyes de derechos de autor y se dispuso a demandarlas, pero en realidad un habitante desconocido había construido el Supermercado Agloe en el cruce que aparecía en el mapa de la Esso.
vi_translation: In the 1940s, Agloe, New York, began appearing on the maps of other companies. Esso suspected copyright infringement and prepared legal proceedings, but in reality, an unidentified person had built an "Agloe General Store" at the intersection that appeared on Esso's map.
tr_translation: In the 1940s, Agloe, New York started appearing on maps made by other companies. Esso suspected copyright infringement and filed numerous lawsuits, but in fact, an unknown resident had established the Agloe Market at the intersection shown on the Esso map.
es_translation: In the 1940s, Agloe, New York, began to appear on maps from other companies. Esso suspected that they had infringed copyright laws and prepared to sue them, but in reality, an unknown resident had built the Agloe Supermarket at the intersection that appeared on Esso's map.

en: The building, which still stands [needs citation], is the only structure in Agloe, which continues to appear on many maps and is traditionally recorded as having a population of zero.
vi: Căn nhà này, hiện vẫn tồn tại [cần trích nguồn], là công trình duy nhất tại Agloe, tiếp tục xuất hiện trên nhiều bản đồ và thường kèm thống kê dân số là không.
tr: Hâlâ var olan [alıntı gerekli] bina, sıfır nüfuslu olarak kaydedilegelen ve birçok haritada görülmeye devam eden Agloe’daki tek yapıdır.
es: El supermercado, que sigue en pie (falta cita), es el único edificio de Agloe, que sigue apareciendo en muchos mapas y cuya población suele consignarse como cero.
vi_translation: This house, which still exists [citation needed], is the only building in Agloe, continues to appear on many maps, and is often accompanied by a population statistic of zero.
tr_translation: The still existing [citation needed] building is the only structure in Agloe, which continues to be recorded as having a population of zero and continues to appear on many maps.
es_translation: The supermarket, which still stands (citation needed), is the only building in Agloe, which continues to appear on many maps and whose population is usually recorded as zero.

en: Every Omnictionary entry contains subpages where you can view all the edits ever made to the page and any discussion by Omnictionary members about it. The Agloe page hadn’t been edited by anyone in almost a year, but there was one recent comment on the talk page by an anonymous user:
vi: Mỗi bài trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ đều có trang phụ để xem tất cả các lượt sửa chữa, biên tập được thực hiện, và bất cứ bình luận nào của các thành viên Toàn Thư về bài viết đó. Bài về Agloe không được chỉnh sửa gì từ gần một năm nay, nhưng mới đây có một bình luận của một người truy cập ẩn danh.
tr: Her Omnictionary girdisi, sayfada yapılan bütün düzenlemeleri ve Omnictionaıy üyelerinin girdi hakkında yaptığı bütün tartışmaları görebileceği alt sayfalar içerirdi. Agloe sayfası neredeyse bir yıldır hiç kimse tarafından düzeltilmemişti ama konuşma sayfasında anonim bir kullanıcı tarafından yazılmış yeni bir yorum vardı:
es: Todas las entradas del Omnictionary contienen subpáginas en las que pueden verse todas las ediciones que se han hecho en la página y cualquier comentario al respecto de los miembros del Omnictionary. La página de Agloe no había sido editada por nadie en casi un año, pero había un comentario reciente de un usuario anónimo:
vi_translation: Each article in the Encyclopedia of Everything has a supplementary page to view all the edits, revisions made, and any comments from Encyclopedia members about that article. The article about Agloe has not been edited for nearly a year, but recently there was a comment from an anonymous visitor.
tr_translation: This Omnictionary entry contained subpages where all the edits made on the page and all the discussions about the entry by Omnictionary members could be seen. The Agloe page had not been edited by anyone for almost a year, but there was a new comment written by an anonymous user on the discussion page:
es_translation: All entries in the Omnictionary contain subpages where all the edits made to the page and any comments from Omnictionary members can be seen. The Agloe page had not been edited by anyone in almost a year, but there was a recent comment from an anonymous user:

en: fyi, whoever Edits this—the Population of agloe Will actually be One until may 29th at Noon.
vi: Để biết, cho bất cứ ai Biên tập bài này–dân Số agloe thực tế Là Một tính đến Trưa ngày 29 tháng năm.
tr: bunu Düzenleyen kimse onun bilgisine... agloe Nüfusu aslında 29 mayıs Öğleye kadar Bir olacak.
es: para la información de quien Edite esto: la Población de agloe Será de Una persona hasta el 29 de mayo a las Doce del mediodía.
vi_translation: To know, for anyone editing this article–the population of Agloe is actually counted as of noon on May 29.
tr_translation: Whoever arranged this, it is to his knowledge... The population of Agloe will actually be one until noon on May 29.
es_translation: For the information of whoever edits this: the population of Agloe will be one person until May 29 at noon.

en: I recognized the capitalization immediately. The rules of capitalization are so unfair to words in the middle of a sentence. My throat tightened, but I forced myself to calm down. The comment had been left fifteen days ago. It had been sitting there all that time, waiting for me. I looked at the clock on the computer. I had just under twenty-four hours.
vi: Tôi lập tức nhận ra kiểu viết hoa này. Quy tắc viết hoa thông thường rất bất công với các từ không đứng đầu câu. Cổ họng đột nhiên cứng lại, nhưng tôi bắt bản thân phải bình tĩnh lại. Bình luận được viết cách đây mười lăm ngày. Nó đã luôn ở đó, đợi tôi. Nhìn đồng hồ ở máy tính, tôi chỉ còn chưa đến hai mươi tư tiếng nữa.
tr: Büyük harf kullanma şeklini hemen tamdım. Büyük harf kullanma kuralları cümlenin ortasındaki kelimeler için hiç adil değil. Boğazım sıkıştı ama kendimi sakinleşmeye zorladım. Yorum on beş gün önce bırakılmıştı. Bunca zamandır orada beni bekliyordu. Bilgisayarın saatine baktım. Tam şu anda yirmi dört saatten az zamamm vardı.
es: Reconocí las mayúsculas de inmediato. «Las reglas de las mayúsculas son muy injustas con las palabras que están en medio». Sentí un nudo en la garganta, pero me obligué a tranquilizarme. Había dejado el comentario hacía quince días. Se había quedado allí todo ese tiempo, esperándome. Miré el reloj del ordenador. No me quedaban ni veinticuatro horas.
vi_translation: I immediately recognized this capitalization style. The conventional capitalization rules are very unfair to words that are not at the beginning of a sentence. My throat suddenly tightened, but I forced myself to calm down. The comment was written fifteen days ago. It had always been there, waiting for me. Looking at the clock on the computer, I had less than twenty-four hours left.
tr_translation: I immediately recognized the way of using capital letters. The rules for using capital letters are not fair at all for words in the middle of a sentence. My throat tightened, but I forced myself to calm down. The comment had been left fifteen days ago. It had been waiting for me there all this time. I looked at the computer's clock. Right now, I had less than twenty-four hours.
es_translation: I recognized the capital letters immediately. “The rules of capitalization are very unfair to the words that are in the middle.” I felt a lump in my throat, but I forced myself to calm down. I had left the comment fifteen days ago. It had stayed there all that time, waiting for me. I looked at the computer clock. I had less than twenty-four hours left.

en: For the first time in weeks, she seemed completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. For one more day at least, she was alive. I had focused on her whereabouts for so long in an attempt to keep me from obsessively wondering whether she was alive that I had no idea how terrified I’d been until now, but oh, my God. She was alive.
vi: Lần đầu tiên từ mấy tuần nay, Margo trở nên hoàn toàn, không thể phủ nhận được, sống động đối với tôi. Cô ấy còn sống. Ít nhất thêm một ngày nữa, cô ấy vẫn còn sống. Tôi đã chú tâm quá lâu đến những lang bạt của Margo, để không bị ám ảnh trong mớ bòng bong băn khoăn không biết cô ấy còn sống hay không, lâu đến mức tôi không nhận ra rằng mình đã cảm thấy sợ hãi chừng nào, cho đến lúc này. Ôi, ơn Chúa. Cô ấy còn sống.
tr: Haftalardır ilk defa, Margo bana tamamen ve reddedilemez bir biçimde hayatta görünüyordu. Hayattaydı. En azından bir gün daha hayattaydı. Onun hayatta olup olmadığını merak etmekten kendimi alıkoymak amacıyla o kadar uzun zamandır bulunduğu yere odaklanmıştım ki, şimdiye kadar ne kadar korktuğum hakkında hiçbir fikrim yoktu ama ah, Tannm... Hayattaydı.
es: Por primera vez en semanas no tuve la menor duda de que estaba viva. Estaba viva. Y estaría viva al menos un día más. Me había centrado tanto tiempo en localizarla, sobre todo para evitar preguntarme obsesivamente si estaba viva, que no me había dado cuenta de lo aterrorizado que había estado hasta entonces, pero, oh, Dios mío. Estaba viva.
vi_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo became completely, undeniably, alive to me. She was still alive. At least for one more day, she was still alive. I had focused for so long on Margo's wanderings, being obsessed with the tangled mess of wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long that I didn't realize how scared I had been until now. Oh, thank God. She was still alive.
tr_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo looked completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. At least for one more day, she was alive. To stop myself from wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long she had been I was so focused on the place that I had no idea how scared I had been until now, but oh, my God... He was alive.
es_translation: For the first time in weeks, I had no doubt that she was alive. She was alive. And she would be alive for at least one more day. I had focused so much time on locating her, mainly to avoid obsessively asking myself if she was alive, that I hadn't realized how terrified I had been until then, but, oh, my God. She was alive.

en: I jumped up, let the towel drop, and called Radar. I cradled the phone in the crook of my neck while pulling on boxers and then shorts. “I know what paper towns means! Do you have your handheld?”
vi: Tôi nhảy lên, kệ chiếc khăn bông rơi xuống, gọi điện ngay cho Radar. Tôi kẹp điện thoại vào hõm cổ trong khi tròng quần lót và quần soóc vào người. “Tôi biết những thành phố giấy nghĩa là gì rồi! Ông có máy tính cầm tay ở đó không?”
tr: Zıpladım, havlunun düşmesini umursamadım ve Radar’ı aradım. Boxer’ımı ve şortumu çekerken telefonu boynumun kıvrımına yerleştirdim. “Kâğıttan kentlerin ne demek olduğunu biliyorum! El bilgisayarın yanında mı?
es: Me levanté de un salto, dejé que la toalla se cayera y llamé a Radar. Apoyé el teléfono en un hombro y lo sujeté con la barbilla mientras me ponía unos calzoncillos y unos pantalones cortos. —¡Sé lo que significa ciudades de papel! ¿Llevas encima el ordenador portátil?
vi_translation: I jumped up, letting the towel fall, and immediately called Radar. I wedged the phone between my neck and shoulder while putting on my underwear and shorts. “I know what paper towns mean now! Do you have a handheld computer there?”
tr_translation: I jumped, didn't care that the towel fell, and called Radar. While pulling on my boxers and shorts, I placed the phone in the crook of my neck. “I know what paper towns mean! Is the handheld computer next to you?”
es_translation: I jumped up, let the towel fall, and called Radar. I rested the phone on one shoulder and held it with my chin while I put on some underwear and shorts. —I know what paper towns means! Do you have the laptop with you?

en: “Yeah. You should really be here, dude. They’re about to make us line up.”
vi: “Có. Ông rất nên có mặt ở đây rồi đấy. Họ sắp bắt bọn mình xếp hàng rồi.”
tr: “Evet. Gerçekten burada olmalısın, dostum. Bizi sıraya dizmek üzereler.
es: —Sí. Tío, deberías estar ya aquí. Estamos a punto de formar la fila.
vi_translation: “Yes. You really should be here already. They're about to make us line up.”
tr_translation: “Yes. You really should be here, my friend. They are about to line us up.”
es_translation: —Yes. Dude, you should be here already. We're about to form the line.

en: I heard Ben shout into the phone, “Tell him he better be naked!”
vi: Tôi nghe thấy Ben gào qua điện thoại. “Bảo nó diện nhân trần không áo chùng thì hơn!”
tr: Ben’in telefona doğru bağırdığını duydum: “Söyle ona, çıplak olsa iyi olur!
es: Oí a Ben gritándole: —¡Dile que más le vale que esté desnudo!
vi_translation: I heard Ben shouting over the phone. "Tell him to dress in casual clothes rather than a robe!"
tr_translation: I heard Ben shouting at the phone: "Tell her, she better be naked!"
es_translation: I heard Ben shouting at him: —Tell him he better be naked!

en: “Radar,” I said, trying to convey the importance of it. “Look up the page for Agloe, New York. Got it?”
vi: “Radar,” tôi gọi, cố gắng để nó hiểu được tính hệ trọng của vấn đề. “Hãy tra trang viết về Agloe, New York đi. Được chứ?”
tr: “Radar,” dedim, olayın önemini iletmeye çalışarak. “Agloe, New York sayfasına bak. Buldun mu?
es: —Radar —le dije intentando expresar que era importante—. Busca la página de Agloe, Nueva York. ¿La tienes?
vi_translation: "Radar," I called, trying to make it understand the gravity of the situation. "Look up the page about Agloe, New York. Alright?"
tr_translation: “Radar,” I said, trying to convey the importance of the situation. “Look at the Agloe, New York page. Did you find it?”
es_translation: —Radar —I told him, trying to convey that it was important—. Look up the page for Agloe, New York. Do you have it?

en: “Yes. Reading. Hold on. Wow. Wow. This could be the Catskills spot on the map?”
vi: “Ừ. Đang đọc. Đợi đã. Ôi. Ôi. Chắc là lỗ ghim ở Catskill trên bản đồ đúng không?”
tr: “Evet. Okuyorum. Bekle. Vay canına. Vay canına. Bu haritadaki Catskills noktası olabilir mi?
es: —Sí, estoy leyendo. Espera. Uau. Uau. ¿Podría ser el Catskills señalado en el mapa?
vi_translation: “Yeah. Reading. Wait a minute. Oh. Oh. It must be the pinhole in Catskill on the map, right?”
tr_translation: “Yes. I'm reading. Wait. Wow. Wow. Could this be the Catskills point on the map?”
es_translation: —Yes, I am reading. Wait. Wow. Wow. Could it be the Catskills marked on the map?

en: “Yes, I think so. It’s pretty close. Go to the discussion page.”
vi: “Đúng, tôi cũng nghĩ thế. Rất gần mà. Xem tiếp phần thảo luận đi.”
tr: “Evet, öyle galiba. Oldukça yakında. Tartışma sayfasına git.
es: —Sí, creo que sí. Está muy cerca. Ve a la página de comentarios.
vi_translation: "Yes, I think so too. It's very close." "Continue reading the discussion."
tr_translation: “Yes, I guess so. Quite close. Go to the discussion page.”
es_translation: —Yes, I think so. It's very close. Go to the comments page.

en: “Radar?”
vi: “Radar?”
tr: “Radar?
es: —¿Radar?
vi_translation: "Radar?"
tr_translation: “Radar?”
es_translation: —Radar?

en: “Jesus Christ.”
vi: “Ôi Chúa ơi.”
tr: “Aman Tannm.
es: —Joder.
vi_translation: "Oh my God."
tr_translation: “Aman Tannm.”
es_translation: —Damn.

en: “I know, I know!” I shouted. I didn’t hear his response because I was pulling my shirt on, but when the phone got back to my ear, I could hear him talking to Ben. I just hung up.
vi: “Tôi biết, tôi biết!” tôi hét lên. Tôi không nghe nó trả lời vì phải mặc vội áo phông, nhưng khi áp lại điện thoại vào tai, tôi chỉ nghe thấy tiếng Radar đang nói với Ben. Tôi ngắt luôn.
tr: “Biliyorum, biliyorum!” diye bağırdım. Verdiği karşılığı duymadım çünkü tişörtümü başımdan geçiriyordum ama telefon tekrar kulağıma geldiğinde, Radar’m Ben’le konuştuğunu duyabildim. Telefonu kapattım.
es: —¡Lo sé, lo sé! —grité. No oí su respuesta porque estaba poniéndome la camiseta, pero cuando el teléfono volvió a mi oreja, lo oí hablando con Ben. Colgué.
vi_translation: “I know, I know!” I shouted. I didn't hear him respond because I was quickly putting on a t-shirt, but when I put the phone back to my ear, I only heard Radar talking to Ben. I hung up immediately.
tr_translation: “I know, I know!” I shouted. I didn't hear his response because I was pulling my T-shirt over my head, but when the phone was back to my ear, I could hear Radar talking to Ben. I hung up the phone.
es_translation: —I know, I know! —I shouted. I didn't hear his response because I was putting on my shirt, but when the phone was back to my ear, I heard him talking to Ben. I hung up.

en: Online, I searched for driving directions from Orlando to Agloe, but the map system had never heard of Agloe, so instead I searched for Roscoe. Averaging sixty-five miles per hour, the computer said it would be a nineteen-hour-and-four-minute trip. It was two fifteen. I had twenty-one hours and forty-five minutes to get there. I printed the directions, grabbed the keys to the minivan, and locked the front door behind me.
vi: Quay lại máy tính, tôi tìm chỉ dẫn lái xe từ Orlando đến Agloe, nhưng hệ thống bản đồ chưa bao giờ biết đến Agloe, nên tôi thay bằng Roscoe. Với tốc độ trung bình sáu mươi lăm dặm một giờ, máy tính nói chuyến đi cần mười chín tiếng và bốn phút. Đang là hai giờ mười lăm phút. Tôi có hai mươi mốt tiếng và bốn mươi lăm phút để đến đó. Tôi in bản hướng dẫn ra, vớ chìa khóa chiếc minivan, quay lưng khóa cửa trước.
tr: İnternette Orlando’dan Agloe’ya giden yolun tarifini aradım ama harita sistemi Agloe’dan haberdar değildi, bu yüzden onun yerine Roscoe’yu aradım. Bilgisayar, saatte ortalama yüz kilometre hızla, on dokuz saat dört dakikalık bir yolculuk olacağım söylüyordu. Saat iki on beşti. Oraya ulaşmak için yirmi bir saat kırk beş dakikam vardı. Yol tarifinin çıktısını aldım, mirlivanın anahtarlarını kaptım ve sokak kapışım arkamdan kilitledim.
es: Busqué en la red rutas en coche desde Orlando hasta Agloe, pero el programa de mapas nunca había oído hablar de Agloe, de modo que lo cambié por Roscoe. El ordenador decía que, a una media de cien kilómetros por hora, el viaje duraría diecinueve horas y cuatro minutos. Eran las dos y cuarto. Tenía veintiuna horas y cuarenta y cinco minutos para llegar. Imprimí la ruta, cogí las llaves del coche y cerré la puerta de la calle.
vi_translation: Returning to the computer, I searched for driving directions from Orlando to Agloe, but the map system had never heard of Agloe, so I substituted it with Roscoe. At an average speed of sixty-five miles per hour, the computer said the trip would take nineteen hours and four minutes. It was two fifteen. I had twenty-one hours and forty-five minutes to get there. I printed out the directions, grabbed the keys to the minivan, and turned to lock the front door.
tr_translation: I searched the internet for directions from Orlando to Agloe, but the map system was unaware of Agloe, so I looked up Roscoe instead. The computer said it would be a nineteen-hour and four-minute journey at an average speed of one hundred kilometers per hour. It was two fifteen. I had twenty-one hours and forty-five minutes to get there. I printed out the directions, grabbed the keys to the car, and locked the front door behind me.
es_translation: I searched the web for driving routes from Orlando to Agloe, but the map program had never heard of Agloe, so I changed it to Roscoe. The computer said that, at an average of one hundred kilometers per hour, the trip would take nineteen hours and four minutes. It was a quarter past two. I had twenty-one hours and forty-five minutes to get there. I printed the route, grabbed the car keys, and closed the front door.

en: “It’s nineteen hours and four minutes away,” I said into the cell phone. It was Radar’s cell phone, but Ben had answered it.
vi: “Đi mất mười chín tiếng bốn phút,” tôi nói vào điện thoại di động. Bên kia là di động của Radar, nhưng Ben đang nói.
tr: “On dokuz saat dört dakikalık uzaklıkta,” dedim cep telefonuna. Radar’m cep telefonuydu ama Ben açmıştı.
es: —Está a diecinueve horas y cuatro minutos de distancia —dije por el móvil. Había llamado al móvil de Radar, pero había contestado Ben.
vi_translation: “It took nineteen hours and four minutes,” I said into the cell phone. On the other end was Radar's cell phone, but Ben was speaking.
tr_translation: “Nineteen hours and four minutes away,” I said to the cell phone. Radar's cell phone, but Ben had answered it.
es_translation: —It is nineteen hours and four minutes away —I said on the phone. I had called Radar's cell phone, but Ben had answered.

en: “So what are you going to do?” he asked. “Are you flying there?”
vi: “Ông định thế nào?” nó hỏi. “Có bay đến không?”
tr: “Peki, ne yapacaksın?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Y qué vas a hacer? —me preguntó—. ¿Vas a coger un avión?
vi_translation: “What do you intend to do?” it asked. “Are you going to fly there?”
tr_translation: “So, what are you going to do?” he asked. “Are you flying there?”
es_translation: —And what are you going to do? —he asked me—. Are you going to catch a plane?

en: “No, I don’t have enough money, and anyway it’s like eight hours away from New York City. So I’m driving.”
vi: “Không, tôi không đủ tiền, mà chỗ đó cũng cách thành phố New York khoảng tám tiếng. Cho nên tôi sẽ lái xe đi.”
tr: “Oraya mı uçuyorsun?” “Hayır, o kadar param yok, her neyse, New York’tan sekiz saat uzaklıkta falan. Bu yüzden arabayla gidiyorum.
es: —No, no tengo bastante dinero, y además está a unas ocho horas de Nueva York, así que iré en coche.
vi_translation: "No, I don't have enough money, and that place is also about eight hours away from New York City. So I will drive there."
tr_translation: “No, I don't have that much money, anyway, it's about eight hours away from New York. That's why I'm driving.”
es_translation: —No, I don't have enough money, and besides, it's about eight hours from New York, so I'll go by car.

en: Suddenly Radar had the phone back. “How long is the trip?”
vi: Đột nhiên Radar lấy lại điện thoại. “Đi mất bao lâu?”
tr: Aniden Radar telefonu geri aldı. ‘Yolculuk ne kadar sürüyor?” “On dokuz saat dört dakika.
es: De repente Radar recuperó el teléfono. —¿Cuánto dura el viaje?
vi_translation: Suddenly, Radar took back the phone. “How long will it take?”
tr_translation: Suddenly, Radar took the phone back. “How long does the journey take?” “Nineteen hours and four minutes.””
es_translation: Suddenly, Radar retrieved the phone. —How long does the trip take?

en: “Nineteen hours and four minutes.”
vi: “Mười chín tiếng bốn phút.
tr: ‘Yolculuk ne kadar sürüyor?” “On dokuz saat dört dakika.
es: —Diecinueve horas y cuatro minutos.
vi_translation: "Nineteen hours and four minutes."
tr_translation: “How long does the journey take?” “Nineteen hours and four minutes.””
es_translation: —Nineteen hours and four minutes.

en: “According to who?”
vi: “Ai nói vậy?”
tr: “Kime göre?
es: —¿De dónde es el dato?
vi_translation: "Who said that?"
tr_translation: “According to whom?”
es_translation: —Where is the information from?

en: “Google maps.”
vi: “Google Maps.”
tr: “Google haritalarına.
es: —Google Maps.
vi_translation: "Google Maps."
tr_translation: “Google Maps.”
es_translation: —Google Maps.

en: “Crap,” Radar said. “None of those map programs calculate for traffic. I’ll call you back. And hurry. We’ve got to line up like right now!”
vi: “Không ổn,” Radar nói. “Những chương trình bản đồ đó đều không tính đến giao thông. Tôi sẽ gọi lại. Ông nhanh lên. Đang phải xếp hàng rồi đấy!”
tr: “Kahretsin,” dedi Radar. “O harita programlarının hiçbiri trafiği hesaplamaz. Seni tekrar arayacağım. Ve acele et. Tam şu anda falan sıraya girmeliyiz.
es: —Mierda —dijo Radar—. Ninguno de esos programas de mapas calcula el tráfico. Ahora te llamo. Y corre. ¡Tenemos que ponernos en la fila ahora mismo!
vi_translation: "Not good," Radar said. "Those map programs don't account for traffic. I'll call back. Hurry up. We're already in line!"
tr_translation: “Damn it,” said Radar. “None of those map programs account for traffic. I’ll call you back. And hurry up. We should be getting in line right about now.”
es_translation: —Shit —said Radar—. None of those map programs calculate traffic. I'll call you now. And hurry. We have to get in line right now!

en: “I’m not going. Can’t risk the time,” I said, but I was talking to dead air. Radar called back a minute later. “If you average sixty-five miles per hour, don’t stop, and account for average traffic patterns, it’s going to take you twenty-three hours and nine minutes. Which puts you there just after one P.M., so you’re going to have to make up time when you can.”
vi: “Tôi không đến đâu. Không thể hên xui với thời gian được,” tôi nói, nhưng chỉ có không khí nghe. Một phút sau Radar gọi lại. “Nếu tốc độ trung bình là sáu mươi lăm dặm một giờ, không dừng, và tính trên lưu lượng giao thông trung bình, sẽ mất hai mươi ba tiếng chín phút. Như vậy ông sẽ đến nơi sau một giờ chiều, cho nên phải vừa đi vừa bù thời gian.
tr: “Gelmiyorum. Zamam tehlikeye atamam,” dedim ama havaya konuşuyordum. Bir dakika sonra Radar geri aradı. “Eğer saatte ortalama yüz kilometreyi bulursan, durmazsan ve ortalama trafiği hesaba katarsan, sana yirmi üç saat dokuz dakikaya mal olacak. Ki bu da öğlen birden sonra orada olacağın anlamma geliyor, bu . yüzden zaman filan yaratsan iyi olur.
es: —No voy a ir. No puedo arriesgarme a perder tiempo —le dije. Pero estaba hablando al aire. Radar me llamó un minuto después. —A una media de cien kilómetros por hora, sin pararte y teniendo en cuenta el promedio de la densidad de tráfico, tardarás veintitrés horas y nueve minutos. Eso supone que llegarías después de la una, así que vas a tener que ganar tiempo cuando puedas.
vi_translation: "I'm not going." "You can't gamble with time," I said, but only the air listened. One minute later, Radar called back. “If the average speed is sixty-five miles per hour, without stopping, and considering average traffic flow, it will take twenty-three hours and nine minutes. So you will arrive after one o'clock in the afternoon, which means you have to make up time as you go.”
tr_translation: “I am not coming. I can't risk the time,” I said, but I was talking to the air. A minute later, Radar called back. “If you average a hundred kilometers per hour, don't stop, and account for average traffic, it will take you twenty-three hours and nine minutes. Which means you'll be there after one in the afternoon, so you'd better create some time.”
es_translation: —I'm not going to go. I can't risk wasting time —I told him. But I was talking to the air. Radar called me a minute later. —At an average speed of one hundred kilometers per hour, without stopping and taking into account the average traffic density, it will take you twenty-three hours and nine minutes. That means you would arrive after one o'clock, so you're going to have to make up time whenever you can.

en: “What? But the—”
vi: “Sao cơ? Nhưng–”
tr: “Ne? Ama...
es: —¿Qué? Pero el…
vi_translation: “What? But–”
tr_translation: “What? But...”
es_translation: —What? But the...

en: Radar said, “I don’t want to criticize, but maybe on this particular topic, the person who is chronically late needs to listen to the person who is always punctual. But you gotta come here at least for a second because otherwise your parents will freak out when you don’t show when your name is called, and also, not that it is the most important consideration or anything, but I’m just saying—you have all our beer in there.”
vi: Radar ngắt lời tôi, “Tôi không phê bình gì đâu, nhưng có lẽ với vấn đề cụ thể này, người đi muộn kinh niên cần nghe người luôn đúng giờ. Nhưng ông sẽ phải qua đây ít nhất một giây, nếu không bố mẹ ông sẽ tá hỏa khi tên ông được gọi mà không thấy người đâu. Vả lại, dù đây không phải vấn đề quan trọng nhất, tiện thì tôi nói luôn–tất cả bia của bọn tôi ở trong xe ông đó.”
tr: Radar araya girdi. “Eleştirmek istemiyorum ama belki bu konuda, kronik olarak geç kalan kişinin her zaman dakik olanı dinlemesi gerekiyordun Ne olursa olsun, en azından bir saniyeliğine buraya gelmelisin, aksi takdirde ismin okunduğunda ortaya çıkmayınca annenle baban çıldıracak ve aynca çok önemli bir faktör olduğundan falan değil ama yine de söyleyeyim dedim... bütün biramız sende.
es: —No es por criticar, pero quizá en este tema concreto la persona con impuntualidad crónica debería escuchar a la persona que siempre es puntual. Pero tienes que venir al menos un segundo, porque tus padres se van a poner histéricos si te llaman y no apareces, y, además, no es que sea lo más importante, pero… toda nuestra cerveza está en tu coche.
vi_translation: Radar interrupted me, "I'm not criticizing, but perhaps for this specific issue, the chronically late person needs to listen to the always-on-time person. But you will have to be here for at least a second, otherwise your parents will freak out when your name is called and you're nowhere to be seen. Besides, although this isn't the most important issue, I might as well mention it now–all our beer is in your car."
tr_translation: Radar intervened. “I don't want to criticize, but maybe in this case, the chronically late person should always listen to the punctual one. No matter what, you should at least come here for a second, otherwise, when your name is called and you don't show up, your mom and dad will go crazy. And it's not because it's a very important factor or anything, but I just thought I'd mention it... all our beer is with you.”
es_translation: —It's not to criticize, but maybe in this specific matter, the person with chronic lateness should listen to the person who is always punctual. But you have to come at least for a second, because your parents are going to get hysterical if they call you and you don't show up, and, besides, it's not the most important thing, but... all our beer is in your car.

en: “I obviously don’t have time,” I answered.
vi: “Cơ mà tôi không có thời gian,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Belli ki vaktim yok,” diye cevapladım.
es: —Está claro que no tengo tiempo —le contesté.
vi_translation: “But I don't have time,” I replied.
tr_translation: “Clearly, I don't have time,” I replied.
es_translation: —It's clear that I don't have time —I replied to him.

en: Ben leaned into the phone. “Don’t be an asshat. It’ll cost you five minutes.”
vi: Ben ghé vào điện thoại. “Đừng có mà xuẩn thế. Chỉ mất có năm phút thôi.”
tr: Ben telefona doğru eğildi. “Götleşme. Beş dakikana mal olur.”
es: Ben se acercó al teléfono. —No seas gilipollas. Serán cinco minutos.
vi_translation: Ben leaned into the phone. “Don't be so foolish. It only takes five minutes.”
tr_translation: I leaned towards the phone. “Don't be an ass. It will cost you five minutes.”
es_translation: Ben approached the phone. —Don't be an idiot. It will be five minutes.

en: “Okay, fine.” I hooked a right on red and gunned the minivan— it had better pickup than Mom’s but only just barely— toward school. I made it to the gym parking lot in three minutes. I did not park the minivan so much as I stopped it in the middle of the parking lot and jumped out. As I sprinted toward the gym I saw three robed individuals running toward me. I could see Radar’s spindly dark legs as his robe blew up around him, and next to him Ben, wearing sneakers without socks. Lacey was just behind them.
vi: “Thôi đành.” Tôi vượt một đèn vừa chuyển sang đỏ, phóng thật nhanh–xe này tăng tốc tốt hơn xe mẹ, nhưng chỉ hơn chút xíu thôi–đến trường. Tôi đến được bãi đỗ xe của khu thể thao đa năng sau ba phút. Tôi không lái vào chỗ đỗ hẳn hoi mà chỉ dừng xe giữa bãi và nhảy ra. Đang chạy về phía nhà tập đa năng, tôi thấy ba người mặc áo chùng chạy lại phía mình. Có thể thấy ngay hai cẳng chân như hai ống sậy sẫm màu của Radar dưới áo chùng phấp phới, Ben chạy ngay cạnh, đi giày thể thao không tất. Lacey chạy phía sau.
tr: ‘Tamam, iyi.” Kırmızı ışıkta sağa dönüp minivanı gazladım... anneminkinden daha iyi hızlanıyordu ama yalmzca ucu ucuna. Üç dakika içinde spor salonunun park alanına girmeyi başardım. Minivanı pek park etmiş sayılmazdım, park alanının ortasında durdum ve arabadan dışarı atladım. Spor salonuna doğru hızla koşarken, bana doğru koşan cübbeli üç kişi gördüm. Cübbesi uçuşan Radar’ın cılız, siyah bacaklarım görebiliyordum ve onun yanındaki Ben çorapsız spor ayakkabı giymişti. Lacey tam onların arkasındaydı.
es: —Vale, de acuerdo. Giré a la derecha en rojo y pisé el acelerador —mi coche era mejor que el de mi madre, pero no mucho más— hacia el instituto. Llegué al aparcamiento del gimnasio en tres minutos. No aparqué. Paré el coche en mitad del aparcamiento y salté. Mientras corría hacia el gimnasio vi a tres tipos con toga corriendo hacia mí. La toga de Radar volaba hacia los lados, así que vi sus largas piernas oscuras, y a su lado estaba Ben, que llevaba las zapatillas de deporte sin calcetines. Lacey iba detrás de ellos.
vi_translation: “Well, I guess I have to.” I ran a red light that had just turned red, sped quickly—this car accelerates better than mom's car, but only just a bit—towards the school. I reached the parking lot of the multi-purpose sports complex in three minutes. I didn't park properly but just stopped the car in the middle of the lot and jumped out. Running towards the multi-purpose gym, I saw three people in robes running towards me. I could immediately see Radar's dark, reed-like legs under his flapping robe, Ben running right next to him, wearing sneakers without socks. Lacey was running behind.
tr_translation: ‘Okay, fine.” I turned right at the red light and floored the minivan... it accelerated better than my mom's but just barely. I managed to enter the gym's parking lot within three minutes. I wouldn't exactly say I parked the minivan; I stopped in the middle of the parking area and jumped out of the car. As I was running quickly towards the gym, I saw three people in robes running towards me. I could see Radar's skinny, black legs under his flying robe, and next to him, Ben was wearing sneakers without socks. Lacey was right behind them.
es_translation: —Okay, agreed. I turned right on red and stepped on the accelerator —my car was better than my mother's, but not by much— towards the high school. I arrived at the gym parking lot in three minutes. I didn't park. I stopped the car in the middle of the parking lot and jumped out. As I ran towards the gym, I saw three guys in robes running towards me. Radar's robe was flying to the sides, so I saw his long dark legs, and next to him was Ben, who was wearing sneakers without socks. Lacey was behind them.

en: “You get the beer,” I said as I ran past them. “I gotta talk to my parents.”
vi: “Các ông lấy bia ra đi,” tôi vừa nói vừa chạy qua chúng nó. “Tôi vào báo cáo bố mẹ.”
tr: “Siz biraları alın,” dedim koşarak onları geçerken. “Bizimkilerle konuşmalıyım.
es: —Coged la cerveza —les dije sin dejar de correr—. Tengo que hablar con mis padres.
vi_translation: "Take the beer out," I said as I ran past them. "I'll go report to my parents."
tr_translation: "You grab the beers," I said as I ran past them. "I need to talk to our guys."
es_translation: —Grab the beer —I told them without stopping running—. I have to talk to my parents.

en: The families of graduates were spread out across the bleachers, and I ran back and forth across the basketball court a couple times before I spotted Mom and Dad about halfway up. They were waving at me. I ran up the stairs two at a time, and so was a little out of breath when I knelt down next to them and said, “Okay, so I’m not going [breath] to walk, because I [breath] think I found Margo and [breath] I just have to go, and I’ll have my cell phone on [breath] and please don’t be pissed at me and thank you again for the car.”
vi: Người nhà của học sinh năm cuối ngồi theo các dãy ghế khán giả. Tôi chạy tới chạy lui trong sân bóng rổ mới thấy bố mẹ ngồi ở lưng chừng khán đài. Cả hai đang vẫy tôi. Tôi nhảy hai bậc thang một lên nên hơi hổn hển khi cúi xuống chỗ bố mẹ và nói, “Thế này ạ, con sẽ không [thở] ra khi được gọi, vì con [thở] nghĩ đã tìm thấy Margo và [thở] phải đi ngay, con bật điện thoại di động [thở] bố mẹ đừng cáu, con cảm ơn bố mẹ vì cái xe.”
tr: Mezun olanların aileleri tribüne dağılmışlardı, annemle babanım yerini saptamadan önce, basketbol sahasında birkaç kez ileri geri koştum. Bana el sallıyorlardı. Merdivenlerden ikişer ikişer çıktığım için onların yanma diz çöküp konuştuğumda biraz nefesim kesilmişti: “Tamam, ben çıkmayacağım [nefes] çünkü sanırım [nefes] Margo’yu buldum ve [nefes] sadece gitmeliyim, cep telefonum yanımda [nefes] lütfen bana kızmayın ve araba için tekrar teşekkür ederim.
es: Las familias de los graduados estaban repartidas por las gradas. Recorrí el campo de baloncesto un par de veces hasta divisar a mis padres, más o menos en el centro. Estaban haciéndome gestos con las manos. Como subí los peldaños de dos en dos, estaba casi sin aliento cuando me arrodillé a su lado. —Bueno —les dije—, no voy a [respiración] quedarme porque [respiración] creo que he encontrado a Margo y [respiración] tengo que marcharme ahora mismo, llevo el móvil encima [respiración], por favor, no os enfadéis conmigo y muchas gracias de nuevo por el coche.
vi_translation: The family members of the final-year students sat in the rows of audience seats. I ran back and forth in the basketball court and finally saw my parents sitting halfway up the stands. Both of them were waving at me. I jumped up two steps at a time, so I was a bit breathless when I bent down to my parents and said, "So, I won't [breath] out when I'm called, because I [breath] think I found Margo and [breath] have to go right away, I turned on my mobile phone [breath] please don't be mad, thank you for the car."
tr_translation: The families of the graduates were scattered in the stands, before locating my mom and dad, I ran back and forth a few times on the basketball court. They were waving at me. Because I climbed the stairs two at a time, I was a bit out of breath when I knelt down and spoke to them: “Okay, I won’t go up [breath] because I think [breath] I found Margo and [breath] I just have to go, my cell phone is with me [breath] please don’t be mad at me and thanks again for the car.”
es_translation: The families of the graduates were spread out across the stands. I walked across the basketball court a couple of times until I spotted my parents, roughly in the center. They were making hand gestures at me. Since I climbed the steps two at a time, I was almost out of breath when I knelt beside them. —Well —I told them—, I'm not going to [breath] stay because [breath] I think I have found Margo and [breath] I have to leave right now, I have my phone with me [breath], please, don't be mad at me and thank you very much again for the car.

en: And my mom wrapped her hand around my wrist and said, “What? Quentin, what are you talking about? Slow down.”
vi: Mẹ nắm lấy cổ tay tôi, hỏi, “Sao thế? Con đang nói chuyện gì thế hả Quentin? Bình tĩnh đã nào.”
tr: Annem kolunu belime dolayıp, “Ne? Quentin, neden bahsediyorsun? Yavaş ol,” dedi.
es: —¿Qué? —dijo mi madre pasándome el brazo por la cintura—. Quentin, ¿qué estás diciendo? Cálmate.
vi_translation: Mom grabbed my wrist and asked, "What's wrong? What are you talking about, Quentin? Calm down."
tr_translation: My mother wrapped her arm around my waist and said, "What? Quentin, what are you talking about? Slow down," she said.
es_translation: —What? —said my mother, putting her arm around my waist—. Quentin, what are you saying? Calm down.

en: I said, “I’m going to Agloe, New York, and I have to go right now. That’s the whole story. Okay, I gotta go. I’m crunched for time here. I have my cell. Okay, love you.”
vi: Tôi nói tiếp, “Con sẽ đến Agloe, New York, và con phải đi ngay. Tất cả chỉ có thế thôi ạ. Thế, con đi đây ạ, còn ít thời gian lắm. Con có mang theo di động. Thế ạ, con yêu bố mẹ.”
tr: “Agloe, New York’a gidiyorum ve hemen gitmeliyim. Bütün hikâye bu. Tamam, gitmeliyim. Hiç zamanım yok. Cep telefonum yanımda. Tamam, sizi seviyorum,” dedim.
es: —Me voy a Agloe, Nueva York, y tengo que irme ahora mismo —le contesté—. Nada más. Vale, tengo que irme. No puedo perder más tiempo. Llevo el móvil. Vale. Os quiero.
vi_translation: I continued, "I will go to Agloe, New York, and I have to go right away." That's all there is to it. So, I'm leaving now, there's very little time left. I have my mobile phone with me. So, I love you, Mom and Dad."
tr_translation: “I am going to Agloe, New York, and I must go immediately. That's the whole story. Okay, I must go. I have no time. My cell phone is with me. Okay, I love you all,” I said.
es_translation: —I'm going to Agloe, New York, and I have to leave right now —I replied—. Nothing else. Okay, I have to go. I can't waste any more time. I'm taking my phone. Okay. I love you all.

en: I had to pull free from her light grasp. Before they could say anything, I bounded down the stairs and took off, sprinting back toward the minivan. I was inside and had the thing in gear and was starting to move when I looked over and saw Ben sitting in the passenger’s seat.
vi: Tôi phải rút ngay khỏi bàn tay đang nắm hờ của mẹ. Trước khi bố mẹ kịp nói gì, tôi đã sải chân chạy xuống cầu thang, lao trở ra xe. Tôi vào xe, khởi động và chuẩn bị lăn bánh, nhìn sang thì thấy Ben đang ngồi trên ghế cạnh lái xe.
tr: Annemin hafifçe beni kavrayışından kendimi çekip kurtarmak zorunda kaldım. Onlar bir şey diyemeden merdivenlerden atladım ve hızla minivana koştum. Binmiştim ve elim vitesteydi ve yana bakıp Ben’in yolcu koltuğunda oturduğunu gördüğümde arabayı hareket ettirmeye başlıyordum.
es: Me sujetó sin excesiva fuerza, pero me liberé de su mano. Antes de que hubieran podido decir nada, bajé la escalera y corrí hacia el coche. Estaba dentro, había arrancado y empezaba a moverme cuando vi a Ben sentado en el asiento del copiloto.
vi_translation: I had to immediately withdraw from my mother's loosely holding hand. Before my parents could say anything, I had already sprinted down the stairs and dashed back to the car. I got into the car, started it, and was about to drive off when I looked over and saw Ben sitting in the passenger seat.
tr_translation: I had to pull myself away from my mother's gentle grasp. Before they could say anything, I jumped down the stairs and ran quickly to the minivan. I had gotten in, my hand was on the gear, and as I looked to the side and saw Ben sitting in the passenger seat, I was starting to move the car.
es_translation: He held me without excessive force, but I freed myself from his hand. Before they could say anything, I went down the stairs and ran towards the car. I was inside, had started the engine, and was beginning to move when I saw Ben sitting in the passenger seat.

en: “Get the beer and get out of the car!” I shouted.
vi: “Lấy thùng bia rồi ra khỏi xe đi!” tôi nói lớn.
tr: “Birayı alıp arabadan çık!” diye bağırdım.
es: —¡Coge las cervezas y sal del coche! —le grité.
vi_translation: "Get the beer crate and get out of the car!" I shouted.
tr_translation: "Grab the beer and get out of the car!" I shouted.
es_translation: —Grab the beers and get out of the car! —I shouted at him.

en: “We’re coming with,” he said. “You’d fall asleep if you tried to drive for that long anyway.”
vi: “Bọn này đi luôn,” nó nói. “Lái đường trường như vậy thì ông sẽ ngủ gật cho coi.”
tr: “Seninle geliyoruz,” dedi. “O kadar uzun zaman araba sürmeye çalışırsan uyuyakalırsm zaten.
es: —Vamos contigo —me contestó—. Te quedarías dormido si condujeras tantas horas.
vi_translation: "We're leaving now," he said. "Driving long distances like this, you'll fall asleep for sure."
tr_translation: “We are coming with you,” he said. “If you try to drive for that long, you will fall asleep anyway.”
es_translation: —We will go with you —he answered me—. You would fall asleep if you drove for so many hours.

en: I turned back, and Lacey and Radar were both holding cell phones to their ears. “Gotta tell my parents,” Lacey explained, tapping the phone. “C’mon, Q. Go go go go go go.”
vi: Tôi quay ra sau, Lacey và Radar đều đang áp điện thoại vào tai. “Sắp báo với bố mẹ,” Lacey giải thích, nhịp tay lên điện thoại. “Kìa Q. Đi thôi đi thôi đi thôi.”
tr: Arkama döndüm, hem Lacey hem de Radar cep telefonlarım kulaklarına tutuyorlardı. “Annemle babama söylemeliyim,” diye açıkladı Lacey, telefona hafifçe vurarak. “Haydi, Q. Yürü yürü yürü.
es: Me giré y vi a Lacey y a Radar con el móvil pegado a la oreja. —Tengo que decírselo a mis padres —me explicó Lacey tapando el teléfono—. Vamos, Q. Vamos vamos vamos vamos vamos vamos.
vi_translation: I turned around, Lacey and Radar were both holding their phones to their ears. “About to tell my parents,” Lacey explained, tapping her phone. “Come on Q. Let's go, let's go, let's go.”
tr_translation: I turned around, both Lacey and Radar were holding their cell phones to their ears. “I have to tell my mom and dad,” Lacey explained, tapping lightly on the phone. “Come on, Q. Walk walk walk.”
es_translation: I turned around and saw Lacey and Radar with their phones glued to their ears. —I have to tell my parents —Lacey explained to me, covering the phone—. Come on, Q. Let's go let's go let's go let's go let's go let's go.

en: PART THREE
vi: PHẦN III
tr: ÜÇÜNCÜ KISIM
es: TERCERA PARTE
vi_translation: PART III
tr_translation: THIRD PART
es_translation: THIRD PART

en: The First Hour
vi: Giờ đầu tiên
tr: Birinci Saat
es: HORA UNO
vi_translation: The first hour
tr_translation: First Hour
es_translation: HOUR ONE

en: It takes a little while for everyone to explain to their parents that 1. We’re all going to miss graduation, and 2. We’re driving to New York, to 3. See a town that may or may not technically exist, and hopefully 4. Intercept the Omnictionary poster, who according to the Randomly capitalized Evidence is 5. Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi: Đứa nào cũng mất một lúc mới giải thích được với bố mẹ rằng 1. Chúng tôi đều sẽ không dự lễ tốt nghiệp, và 2. Chúng tôi đang lái xe đến New York để 3. Kiểm tra xem một thành phố có thực sự tồn tại hay không, và hi vọng rằng 4. Kịp gặp người đã đăng bình luận trên Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ, vì căn cứ trên Bằng chứng viết hoa Ngẫu nhiên đó chính là 5. Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr: Herkesin annesiyle babasına, 1. Hepimiz mezuniyeti kaçıracağız ve 2. Arabayla New York’a, 3. Teknik olarak var olma veya olmama ihtimali olan bir köyü görmek için gidiyoruz ve 4. içinde Rastgele büyük Harf kullanılmış Delile göre 5. Margo Roth Spiegelman olan Omnictionary kullanıcısını yakalamayı umuyoruz, gibi bir açıklama yapması uzun zaman alıyor.
es: Se necesita un rato para que cada uno explique a sus padres que 1) ninguno vamos a ir a la graduación, que 2) nos vamos en coche a Nueva York, a 3) una ciudad que técnicamente puede existir o puede no existir, con la esperanza de 4) localizar a la persona que ha colgado un comentario en el Omnictionary, que, por lo que Indica el uso Aleatorio de las mayúsculas, es 5) Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi_translation: Each of us took a while to explain to our parents that 1. We would not be attending the graduation ceremony, and 2. We were driving to New York to 3. Check if a city really exists, and hopefully 4. Meet the person who posted a comment on Omnictionary, because based on the Random Capitalization Evidence, it was 5. Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr_translation: To everyone's parents, 1. We are all going to miss graduation and 2. We are driving to New York, 3. To see a village that may or may not technically exist and 4. according to Randomly capitalized Evidence 5. We hope to catch the Omnictionary user who is Margo Roth Spiegelman, takes a long time to explain.
es_translation: It takes a while for each of us to explain to our parents that 1) none of us are going to the graduation, that 2) we are driving to New York, to 3) a city that technically may or may not exist, with the hope of 4) locating the person who posted a comment on the Omnictionary, who, judging by the Random use of capital letters, is 5) Margo Roth Spiegelman.

en: Radar is the last to get off the phone, and when he finally does, he says, “I’d like to make an announcement. My parents are very annoyed that I’m missing graduation. My girlfriend is also annoyed, because we were scheduled to do something very special in about eight hours. I don’t want to get into details about it, but this had better be one fun road trip.”
vi: Radar là đứa cuối cùng đặt điện thoại xuống, rút cục nó thông báo, “Tôi xin tuyên bố đây. Bố mẹ tôi rất cáu vì tôi không dự lễ tốt nghiệp. Bạn gái tôi cũng cáu, vì hai đứa đã lên kế hoạch làm một việc đặc biệt trong vòng tám tiếng nữa. Tôi không muốn đi vào tiểu tiết, nhưng tốt hơn hết đây nên là một chuyến bám đường hoành tráng.
tr: Radar telefondan kurtulan son kişi ve nihayet kurtulduğunda şöyle diyor: “Bir duyuru yapmak istiyorum. Ebeveynlerim mezuniyeti kaçırmama sinirlendiler. Kız arkadaşım da sinirlendi çünkü yaklaşık sekiz saat içinde çok özel bir şey yapmayı planlıyorduk. Ayrıntıya girmek istemiyorum ama gerçekten eğlenceli bir yolculuk olsa iyi olur.
es: Radar es el último en colgar el teléfono, y cuando por fin lo hace, dice: —Me gustaría comunicaros algo: mis padres están muy enfadados porque no esté en la graduación. Mi novia también está muy enfadada, porque habíamos organizado algo muy especial dentro de ocho horas. No quiero entrar en detalles, pero más vale que el viaje sea divertido.
vi_translation: Radar was the last one to put down the phone, finally announcing, "I declare this. My parents are very angry because I'm not attending the graduation ceremony. My girlfriend is also angry because we had planned to do something special in the next eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but this better be an epic road trip."
tr_translation: The last person to escape from the radar phone, and when he finally escaped, he said: "I want to make an announcement. My parents were angry that I missed the graduation. My girlfriend was also angry because we were planning to do something very special in about eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but it better be a really fun trip."
es_translation: Radar is the last one to hang up the phone, and when he finally does, he says: —I would like to tell you something: my parents are very angry because I am not at the graduation. My girlfriend is also very angry, because we had organized something very special in eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but the trip better be fun.

en: “Your ability to not lose your virginity is an inspiration to us all,” Ben says next to me.
vi: “Khả năng giữ gìn thanh tân của ông là nguồn cảm hứng lớn cho tất cả chúng tôi,” Ben ngồi cạnh tôi nói.
tr: “Bakirliğini kaybetmeme yeteneğin hepimiz için bir ilham kaynağı,” diyor yammda oturan Ben.
es: —Tu habilidad para no perder la virginidad es una inspiración para todos nosotros —le dice Ben, que está sentado a mi lado.
vi_translation: “Your ability to maintain your youthfulness is a great inspiration to all of us,” Ben, sitting next to me, said.
tr_translation: “Your ability to maintain your innocence is an inspiration to all of us,” says Ben, who is sitting next to me.
es_translation: —Your ability to not lose your virginity is an inspiration to all of us —says Ben, who is sitting next to me.

en: I glance at Radar through the rearview mirror. “WOOHOO ROAD TRIP!” I tell him. In spite of himself, a smile creeps across his face. The pleasure of leaving.
vi: Tôi liếc Radar qua gương chiếu hậu. “BÁM ĐƯỜNG HOÀNH TỜ-RÁNG!” tôi hét lên với nó. Bất chấp chính mình, một nụ cười từ từ giãn ra trên mặt nó. Cảm giác hân hoan tuyệt diệu của những lần ra đi.
tr: Dikiz aynasından Radar’a bir bakış atıyorum. “HAHAAA YOLCULUK!” diyorum. Her şeye rağmen yüzünden bir gülümseme yayılıyor. Terk etmenin keyfi.
es: Miro a Radar por el espejo retrovisor. —¡UN VIAJE EN COCHE, YUJU! —le digo. A su pesar, se le dibuja una sonrisa en la cara. El placer de marcharse.
vi_translation: I glanced at Radar through the rearview mirror. "HOLD THE LINE, HOANG!" I shouted at him. Despite himself, a smile slowly spread across his face. The wonderful exhilaration of departures.
tr_translation: I take a glance at Radar through the rearview mirror. “HAHAAA TRIP!” I say. Despite everything, a smile spreads across his face. The joy of leaving.
es_translation: I look at Radar through the rearview mirror. —A CAR TRIP, YAY! —I say to him. Despite himself, a smile appears on his face. The pleasure of leaving.

en: By now we are on I-4, and traffic is fairly light, which in and of itself is borderline miraculous. I’m in the far left lane driving eight miles an hour over the fifty-five-miles-per-hour speed limit, because I heard once that you don’t get pulled over until you’re going nine miles an hour over the speed limit.
vi: Chúng tôi đang đi trên cao tốc liên bang I-4, giao thông tương đối thưa, chính thế càng thêm phần may mắn không ngờ. Tôi đang chạy xe ở làn ngoài cùng bên trái, vượt tám dặm một giờ so với tốc độ cho phép năm mươi lăm dặm một giờ, vì có lần tôi từng nghe nói rằng phải vượt đến chín dặm một giờ mới bị cảnh sát bắt dừng lại.
tr: Artık I4’teyiz ve trafik oldukça az ki bu gerçekten bir mucize. Saatte doksan kilometrelik hız sınırından on dört kilometre fazla hızla, en sol şeritte gidiyorum çünkü bir keresinde hız sınırından on beş kilometre hızh sürünce arabanın polis tarafından kenara çekilmediğini duydum.
es: Estamos en la I-4, y el tráfico es fluido, lo que en sí mismo roza lo milagroso. Vamos por el carril de la izquierda a diez kilómetros por hora por encima del límite de velocidad, que es de noventa, porque una vez me dijeron que solo te pillan si te pasas más de quince kilómetros.
vi_translation: We are driving on the I-4 interstate, the traffic is relatively sparse, which makes it even more unexpectedly fortunate. I am driving in the far left lane, exceeding the speed limit of fifty-five miles per hour by eight miles per hour, because I once heard that you have to exceed by nine miles per hour to be stopped by the police.
tr_translation: We are now on I4 and the traffic is quite light, which is truly a miracle. I am driving in the far left lane at fourteen kilometers per hour over the ninety kilometers per hour speed limit because I once heard that the police don't pull over cars that are only fifteen kilometers per hour over the speed limit.
es_translation: We are on the I-4, and the traffic is smooth, which in itself borders on the miraculous. We are in the left lane going ten kilometers per hour above the speed limit, which is ninety, because once I was told that they only catch you if you exceed by more than fifteen kilometers.

en: Very quickly, we all settle into our roles.
vi: Rất nhanh, bọn tôi xác định vai trò của từng đứa.
tr: Hepimiz çok hızh bir şekilde rollerimize alışıyoruz.
es: No tardamos en repartir los papeles.
vi_translation: Very quickly, we determined the roles of each person.
tr_translation: We are all quickly getting used to our roles.
es_translation: We didn't take long to distribute the papers.

en: In the wayback, Lacey is the provisioner. She lists aloud everything we currently have for the trip: the half of a Snickers that Ben was eating when I called about Margo; the 212 beers in the back; the directions I printed out; and the following items from her purse: eight sticks of wintergreen gum, a pencil, some tissue, three tampons, one pair of sunglasses, some ChapStick, her house keys, a YMCA membership card, a library card, some receipts, thirty-five dollars, and a BP card.
vi: Ở hàng ghế cuối, Lacey là người cung ứng. Cậu ấy dõng dạc kiểm kê tất cả những gì chúng tôi hiện có cho chuyến đi: nửa thanh kẹo Snicker Ben ăn dở chừng khi tôi gọi điện báo về Margo; 212 chai bia ở phía sau xe; bản hướng dẫn đi đường tôi đã in ra; và những thứ sau trong ví Lacey: tám thanh kẹo the, một bút chì, một ít khăn giấy, ba băng vệ sinh, một đôi kính râm, son dưỡng môi ChapStick gì đó, chùm chìa khóa nhà Lacey, một thẻ hội viên YMCA, một thẻ thư viện, mấy tờ hóa đơn, ba mươi lăm đô-la tiền mặt, và một thẻ BP.
tr: Arka koltuktaki Lacey tedarikçi. Yolculuk için şu anda sahip olduğumuz her şeyi yüksek sesle sıralıyor: Margo’yla ilgili aradığımda Ben’in yemekte olduğu yarım Snickers; bagajdaki 212 bira; yazıcıdan çıkardığım yol tarifi ve Lacey’nin el çantasındaki şu eşyalar: sekiz tane bitki özlü sakız, bir kurşunkalem, birkaç peçete, üç tampon, bir güneş gözlüğü, ChapStick dudak merhemi, evinin anahtarları, bir Genç Hristiyan Erkekler Birliği üyelik kartı, bir kütüphane kartı, birkaç makbuz, otuz beş dolar ve bir BP kartı.
es: Lacey, en la parte de atrás del todo, se ocupa del abastecimiento. Enumera en voz alta las provisiones de que disponemos para el viaje: la mitad de un Snickers que Ben estaba comiéndose cuando he llamado para contarles lo de Margo; las doscientas doce cervezas del maletero; las rutas que he imprimido y los siguientes artículos de su bolso: ocho chicles de menta, un lápiz, pañuelos de papel, tres tampones, unas gafas de sol, una barra de protector labial, las llaves de su casa, un carnet de la Asociación de Jóvenes Cristianos, un carnet de la biblioteca, varios tíquets de compra, treinta y cinco dólares y una tarjeta de las gasolineras BP.
vi_translation: In the back row, Lacey was the supplier. She loudly took inventory of everything we currently had for the trip: half a Snickers bar that Ben had been eating when I called to report about Margo; 212 bottles of beer in the back of the car; the printed directions I had made; and the following items in Lacey's purse: eight breath mints, a pencil, some tissues, three tampons, a pair of sunglasses, some ChapStick lip balm, Lacey's house keys, a YMCA membership card, a library card, some receipts, thirty-five dollars in cash, and a BP card.
tr_translation: Lacey in the back seat is the supplier. She is loudly listing everything we currently have for the trip: the half Snickers that Ben was eating when I called Margo; the 212 beers in the trunk; the directions I printed from the printer; and the following items in Lacey's handbag: eight herbal gums, a pencil, a few napkins, three tampons, a pair of sunglasses, ChapStick lip balm, her house keys, a Young Men's Christian Association membership card, a library card, a few receipts, thirty-five dollars, and a BP card.
es_translation: Lacey, in the very back, is in charge of the supplies. She lists out loud the provisions we have for the trip: half of a Snickers bar that Ben was eating when I called to tell them about Margo; the two hundred and twelve beers in the trunk; the routes I printed out and the following items from her purse: eight mint gums, a pencil, tissues, three tampons, a pair of sunglasses, a lip balm stick, her house keys, a Young Christians Association card, a library card, several purchase receipts, thirty-five dollars, and a BP gas station card.

en: From the back, Lacey says, “This is exciting! We’re like under-provisioned pioneers! I wish we had more money, though.”
vi: Từ chỗ ngồi, Lacey reo lên, “Vui ghê! Bọn mình giống như lính tiên phong tay không bắt giặc! Nhưng giá có nhiều tiền mặt hơn thì tốt.”
tr: Arkadan Lacey, “Çok heyecan verici! Eksik malzemeli istihkam askerleri gibiyiz! Keşke daha fazla paramız olsaydı gerçi,” diyor.
es: —¡Qué emocionante! —dice Lacey desde la parte trasera del monovolumen—. ¡Somos como pioneros sin provisiones! Aunque ojalá tuviéramos más dinero.
vi_translation: From her seat, Lacey exclaimed, "How fun! We’re like pioneers fighting bare-handed! But it would be better if we had more cash."
tr_translation: Arkadan Lacey, "Very exciting! We are like sappers with missing equipment! I wish we had more money though," he says.
es_translation: —How exciting! —says Lacey from the back of the minivan—. We are like pioneers without supplies! Although I wish we had more money.

en: “At least we have the BP card,” I say. “We can get gas and food.”
vi: “Ít nhất bọn mình có thẻ BP mà,” tôi nói. “Vậy có thể mua xăng và đồ ăn.
tr: “En azından BP kartımız var,” diyorum. “Benzin ve yiyecek alabiliriz.
es: —Al menos tenemos la tarjeta BP —le digo—. Podemos comprar gasolina y comida.
vi_translation: “At least we have the BP card,” I said. “So we can buy gas and food.”
tr_translation: “At least we have a BP card,” I say. “We can get gas and food.”
es_translation: —At least we have the BP card —I tell him—. We can buy gas and food.

en: I look up into the rearview mirror and see Radar, wearing his graduation gown, looking over into Lacey’s purse. The graduation gown has a bit of a low-cut neck, so I can see some curled chest hairs. “You got any boxers in there?” he asks.
vi: Tôi nhìn qua gương chiếu hậu, thấy Radar trong bộ áo chùng đang nghía xuống ví của Lacey. Áo chùng cắt cổ hơi rộng nên có thể thấy thấp thoáng lông trên ngực Radar. “Trong ví cậu có quần soóc nam không vậy?” nó hỏi Lacey.
tr: Başımı kaldırıp dikiz aynasına bakıyorum ve Radar’ı görüyorum, mezuniyet cübbesiyle Lacey’nin çantasının içine bakıyor. Mezuniyet cübbesinin yakası biraz düşük kesimli, bu yüzden kıvırcık göğüs kıllarının birazını görebiliyorum. “Orada hiç boxer var mı?” diye soruyor.
es: Miro por el retrovisor y veo a Radar, con su toga de graduación, mirando en el bolso de Lacey. Como la toga tiene el cuello bastante bajo, le veo varios pelillos rizados del pecho. —¿No llevarás algún calzoncillo aquí dentro? —le pregunta.
vi_translation: I looked through the rearview mirror and saw Radar in a robe glancing down at Lacey's wallet. The robe's neckline was a bit wide, so you could see a hint of Radar's chest hair. "Do you have men's shorts in your wallet?" he asked Lacey.
tr_translation: I lift my head and look in the rearview mirror and see Radar, looking into Lacey's bag while wearing a graduation gown. The collar of the graduation gown is a bit low-cut, so I can see some of his curly chest hair. "Are there any boxers in there?" he asks.
es_translation: I look in the rearview mirror and see Radar, wearing his graduation gown, looking into Lacey's bag. Since the gown has a rather low neckline, I can see several curly hairs on his chest. —You wouldn't happen to have any underwear in here, would you? —he asks her.

en: “Seriously, we better be stopping at the Gap,” Ben adds.
vi: “Nói nghiêm túc nhé, chúng ta nên dừng lại ở hiệu quần áo GAP,” Ben chêm vào.
tr: “Cidden, Gap’te dursak iyi olur,” diye ekliyor Ben.
es: —En serio, mejor hacemos una parada en una tienda de ropa —añade Ben.
vi_translation: "Seriously, we should stop at the GAP clothing store," Ben interjected.
tr_translation: "Indeed, it would be good if we stopped at Gap," Ben adds.
es_translation: —Seriously, we better make a stop at a clothing store —adds Ben.

en: Radar’s job, which he begins with the calculator on his handheld, is Research and Calculations. He’s alone in the row of seats behind me, with the directions and the minivan’s owner’s manual spread out next to him. He’s figuring out how fast we need to travel in order to make it by noon tomorrow, how many times we’ll need to stop in order to keep the car from running out of gas, the locations of BP stations on our route and how long each stop will be, and how much time we’ll lose in the process of slowing down to exit.
vi: Nhiệm vụ của Radar, nó đã bắt đầu với cái máy tính cầm tay, là Nghiên cứu và Tính toán. Nó ngồi một mình ở hàng ghế ngay sau tôi, với bản chỉ đường và cuốn hướng dẫn sử dụng xe minivan này trải ra bên cạnh. Nó tính xem chúng tôi cần đi với tốc nào để đến nơi trước trưa mai, cần dừng lại bao nhiêu lần để đổ xăng, vị trí của các trạm BP trên đường mà chúng tôi sẽ qua và mỗi lần được dừng lại trong bao lâu, mỗi lần đi chậm lại để ra khỏi đường cao tốc sẽ mất bao nhiêu thời gian.
tr: Radar’m, el bilgisayarındaki hesap makinesiyle başladığı işi, Araştırma ve Hesaplamalar. Arkamdaki koltukta yol tarifiyle tek başına ve minivanın kılavuzu yanında açık. Yann öğlene kadar orada olabilmek için ne kadar hızlı gitmemiz gerektiğini, benzin doldurmak için kaç kere durmamız gerekeceğini, yol üzerindeki BP istasyonlarını, her molamn ne kadar süreceğini ve ana yoldan ayrılırken yavaşlayacağımızda ne kadar zaman kaybedeceğimizi hesaplıyor.
es: Radar saca su ordenador de bolsillo y empieza con su labor: documentación y cálculos. Está sentado solo detrás de mí, con las rutas y el manual del monovolumen extendidos a su lado. Está calculando a qué velocidad tenemos que viajar para llegar antes de las doce del mediodía de mañana, cuántas veces tendremos que parar para que el coche no se quede sin gasolina, las gasolineras BP que hay en nuestro camino, cuánto durará cada parada y cuánto tiempo perderemos reduciendo la velocidad del coche en las salidas de la autopista.
vi_translation: The task of Radar, which started with the handheld computer, is Research and Calculation. He sat alone in the row of seats right behind me, with the map and the user manual of this minivan spread out beside him. He calculated how fast we needed to go to arrive before noon tomorrow, how many times we needed to stop for gas, the locations of the BP stations along the route we would take, and how long each stop should be, how much time each slowdown to exit the highway would take.
tr_translation: Radar, starting the task on his handheld computer's calculator, Research and Calculations. Alone with the directions on the seat behind me and the minivan's manual open beside him. He's calculating how fast we need to go to get there by noon, how many times we need to stop for gas, the BP stations along the way, how long each break will take, and how much time we'll lose slowing down when we exit the main road.
es_translation: Radar takes out his pocket computer and begins his work: documentation and calculations. He is sitting alone behind me, with the routes and the minivan manual spread out beside him. He is calculating the speed we need to travel to arrive before noon tomorrow, how many times we will need to stop so the car doesn't run out of gas, the BP gas stations along our route, how long each stop will take, and how much time we will lose slowing down the car at highway exits.

en: “We gotta stop four times for gas. The stops will have to be very very short. Six minutes at the most off-highway. We’re looking at three long areas of construction, plus traffic in Jacksonville, Washington, D.C., and Philadelphia, although it will help that we’re driving through D.C. around three in the morning. According to my calculations, our average cruising speed should be around seventy-two. How fast are you going?”
vi: “Bọn mình sẽ dừng bốn lần để đổ xăng. Mỗi lần dừng phải rất rất khẩn trương. Tối đa mất sáu phút để ra khỏi đường cao tốc. Phải dè chừng ba khúc khá dài đang có thi công xây dựng, cộng thêm lưu lượng giao thông ở Jacksonville, Washington, D. C. và Philadelphia, dù bọn mình có lợi thế là sẽ qua D. C. lúc khoảng ba giờ sáng. Theo tính toán của tôi, vận tốc hành trình trung bình nên đạt khoảng bảy mươi hai dặm. Hiện giờ đang là bao nhiêu?”
tr: “Benzin için dört kere durmalıyız. Molalar çok çok kısa olmak zorunda. Karayolunun dışında, en fazla altı dakika. Üç uzun yol çalışması, ayrıca Jacksonville, Washington D. C. ve Philedelphia’da trafikle karşı karşıyayız, bununla birlikte Washington’dan sabah üç sularında geçmemiz yardımcı olacaktır. Hesaplamalarıma göre, ortalama sabit hızımız yüz on beş kilometre civarında olmalı. Kaçla gidiyorsun?
es: —Pararemos cuatro veces para poner gasolina. Las paradas tendrán que ser muy muy cortas. Seis minutos como máximo fuera de la carretera. Pasaremos por tres grandes zonas en obras, más el tráfico en Jacksonville, Washington y Filadelfia, aunque estaría bien que cruzáramos Washington hacia las tres de la madrugada. Según mis cálculos, nuestra velocidad de crucero debería ser ciento quince kilómetros por hora. ¿A qué velocidad vas?
vi_translation: “We will stop four times to refuel. Each stop must be very, very quick. It should take a maximum of six minutes to get off the highway. We need to be cautious of three fairly long sections under construction, plus the traffic in Jacksonville, Washington, D.C., and Philadelphia, although we have the advantage of passing through D.C. at around three in the morning. According to my calculations, the average cruising speed should be about seventy-two miles per hour. What is it right now?”
tr_translation: “We need to stop for gas four times. The breaks have to be very, very short. Off the highway, no more than six minutes. Three long roadworks, plus traffic in Jacksonville, Washington D. C., and Philadelphia, but passing through Washington around three in the morning will help. According to my calculations, Our average constant speed should be around one hundred fifteen kilometers. How fast are you going?”
es_translation: —We will stop four times to refuel. The stops will have to be very, very short. Six minutes maximum off the road. We will pass through three major construction zones, plus the traffic in Jacksonville, Washington, and Philadelphia, although it would be good if we crossed Washington around three in the morning. According to my calculations, our cruising speed should be one hundred fifteen kilometers per hour. What speed are you going?

en: “Sixty-three,” I say. “The speed limit is fifty-five.”
vi: “Sáu mươi ba,” tôi đáp. “Tốc độ giới hạn là năm mươi lăm đấy.”
tr: ‘Yüz dört,” diyorum. “Hız sınırı doksan.
es: —A cien —le contesto—. El límite es noventa. —Ponlo a ciento quince —me dice.
vi_translation: “Sixty-three,” I replied. “The speed limit is fifty-five.”
tr_translation: "One hundred and four," I say. "The speed limit is ninety."
es_translation: —A hundred —I replied—. The limit is ninety. —Put it at one hundred fifteen —he tells me.

en: “Go seventy-two,” he says.
vi: “Tăng lên bảy mươi hai đi,” nó nói.
tr: ‘Yüz on beşle git,” diyor.
es: —No puedo.
vi_translation: “Increase it to seventy-two,” it said.
tr_translation: "Go at one hundred fifteen," he says.
es_translation: —I can't.

en: “I can’t; it’s dangerous, and I’ll get a ticket.”
vi: “Không được, nguy hiểm đấy, tôi sẽ bị phạt.
tr: “Gidemem, tehlikeli ve ceza yerim.
es: Es peligroso y me pondrán una multa.
vi_translation: "No, it's dangerous, I will be punished."
tr_translation: “I can't go, it's dangerous and I'll get punished.”
es_translation: It's dangerous and they will fine me.

en: “Go seventy-two,” he says again. I press my foot down hard on the gas. The difficulty is partly that I am hesitant to go seventy-two and partly that the minivan itself is hesitant to go seventy-two. It begins to shake in a way that implies it might fall apart. I stay in the far left lane, even though I’m still not the fastest car on the road, and I feel bad that people are passing me on the right, but I need clear road ahead, because unlike everyone else on this road, I can’t slow down. And this is my role: my role is to drive, and to be nervous. It occurs to me that I have played this role before.
vi: “Lên bảy mươi hai đi,” nó nhắc lại. Tôi ấn mạnh chân ga. Cái khó một phần là tôi miễn cưỡng tăng tốc bảy mươi hai dặm, và phần nữa là chính cái minivan cũng miễn cưỡng tăng tốc bảy mươi hai dặm. Nó bắt đầu rung rung theo cái cách ngầm ám chỉ nó sắp rời ra đến nơi rồi. Tôi vẫn ở làn ngoài cùng bên trái, dù không phải xe chạy nhanh nhất trên đường. Tôi cảm thấy rất tồi tệ khi mình cứ liên tục vượt lên, để những xe khác tụt lại phía bên phải, nhưng tôi cần vượt lên đầu, vì không giống mọi người đang đi trên đường, tôi không thể chậm lại được. Và đây là vai trò của tôi: lái xe và cảm thấy căng thẳng. Hóa ra tôi đã từng đảm nhiệm vai trò này rồi.
tr: ‘Yüz on beşle git,” diyor tekrar. Ayağımı sertçe gaz pedalına bastırıyorum. Sorun, kısmen benim yüz on beşle gitmekte tereddüt etmem, kısmen de minivamn yüz on beşle gitmekte tereddüt etmesi. Minivan parçalanacakmış gibi titremeye başhyor. Hâlâ yoldaki en hızlı araba olmamama rağmen, en sol şeritte kalıyorum ve insanlar beni sağdan geçtiği için kötü hissediyorum ama önümde açık bir yol olması gerek, çünkü bu yoldaki diğer herkesin aksine, ben yavaşlayamam. Ve bu benim rolüm: rolüm arabayı sürmek ve gergin olmak. Bu rolü daha önce de oynadığım aklıma geliyor.
es: —Ponlo a ciento quince —me repite. Piso a fondo el acelerador. La dificultad radica en parte en que no me decido a ir a ciento quince, y en parte también que el monovolumen no se decide a ir a ciento quince. Empieza a temblar y parece que vaya a descuajaringarse. Sigo en el carril de la izquierda, aunque no soy el coche más rápido de la carretera y me sabe mal que tengan que adelantarme por la derecha, pero necesito tener la carretera despejada, porque, a diferencia de los demás, no puedo reducir la velocidad. Y este es mi papel. Mi papel consiste en conducir y en ponerme nervioso. Se me ocurre que ya he hecho este papel alguna vez.
vi_translation: “Go seventy-two,” it reminded. I pressed down on the gas pedal. The difficulty was partly because I was reluctant to speed up to seventy-two miles, and partly because the minivan itself was also reluctant to speed up to seventy-two miles. It started to shake in a way that subtly hinted it was about to fall apart. I was still in the far left lane, even though I wasn't the fastest car on the road. I felt terrible as I kept overtaking, leaving other cars behind on the right, but I needed to get ahead, because unlike everyone else on the road, I couldn't slow down. And this was my role: driving and feeling stressed. It turned out I had played this role before.
tr_translation: “Drive at one hundred fifteen,” he says again. I press my foot hard on the gas pedal. The problem is partly my hesitation to drive at one hundred fifteen, and partly the minivan's hesitation to drive at one hundred fifteen. The minivan starts to shake as if it’s going to fall apart. Even though I’m still not the fastest car on the road, I stay in the far left lane and feel bad because people are passing me on the right, but there has to be an open road ahead of me, because unlike everyone else on this road, I can’t slow down. And this is my role: my role is to drive the car and be anxious. It occurs to me that I’ve played this role before.
es_translation: —Set it to one hundred fifteen —he repeats to me. I floor the accelerator. The difficulty lies partly in that I can't decide to go at one hundred fifteen, and partly also that the minivan can't decide to go at one hundred fifteen. It starts to shake and it seems like it's going to fall apart. I'm still in the left lane, although I'm not the fastest car on the road and I feel bad that they have to overtake me on the right, but I need to keep the road clear, because, unlike the others, I can't slow down. And this is my role. My role is to drive and to get nervous. It occurs to me that I've played this role before.

en: And Ben? Ben’s role is to need to pee. At first it seems like his main role is going to be complaining about how we don’t have any CDs and that all the radio stations in Orlando suck except for the college radio station, which is already out of range. But soon enough, he abandons that role for his true and faithful calling: needing to pee.
vi: Còn Ben? Vai trò của Ben là cần đi tiểu. Thoạt đầu có vẻ vai trò chủ đạo của nó là càm ràm tại sao chúng tôi không có đĩa nhạc nào và rằng tất cả các đài phát thanh ở Orlando đều chán òm, trừ đài của trường đại học, hiện đã ngoài vùng phủ sóng. Nhưng chẳng bao lâu sau, nó thổi bay vai trò đó vì một tiếng gọi thủy chung và chân chính: cần đi tiểu.
tr: Ya Ben? Ben’in rolü çişini yapma ihtiyacı duymak. Başta, esas rolü nasıl hiç CD’mizin olmadığından ve çoktan menzil dışmda kalan üniversite radyosu hariç, Orlando’daki bütün radyo istasyonlarının berbat olduğundan yalanmak olacakmış gibi görünüyor. Ama çok geçmeden gerçek ve vefah isteği için bu rolü bırakıyor: Çişini yapma ihtiyacı.
es: ¿Y Ben? El papel de Ben es tener que mear. Al principio parece que su papel principal vaya a ser quejarse de que no tenemos CD y de que todas las emisoras de radio de Orlando son una mierda menos la de la universidad, que ya no pillamos. Pero enseguida deja de lado ese papel en favor de su verdadera y fiel vocación: tener que mear.
vi_translation: And Ben? Ben's role was to need to pee. At first, it seemed his main role was to complain about why we didn't have any music CDs and that all the radio stations in Orlando were boring, except for the university station, which was now out of range. But soon enough, he blew that role away for a more faithful and genuine call: the need to pee.
tr_translation: What about Ben? Ben's role is to feel the need to pee. At first, it seems like his main role will be to complain about how we don't have any CDs and how all the radio stations in Orlando are terrible, except for the university radio station which is already out of range. But soon enough, he abandons this role for a more genuine and urgent need: the need to pee.
es_translation: And Ben? Ben's role is having to pee. At first, it seems like his main role is going to be complaining that we don't have a CD and that all the radio stations in Orlando are crap except for the university one, which we no longer get. But he quickly sets aside that role in favor of his true and faithful vocation: having to pee.

en: “I need to pee,” he says at 3:06. We’ve been on the road for forty-three minutes. We have approximately a day left in our drive.
vi: “Tôi cần đi tiểu,” nó nói lúc 3:06. Chúng tôi đã khởi hành được bốn mươi ba phút, còn gần một ngày chạy xe nữa.
tr: “Çişimi yapmam gerek,” diyor 15:06’da. Kırk üç dakikadır yoldayız. Yolculuğumuzun bitişine tahminen bir gün var.
es: —Estoy meándome —dice a las 3:06. Llevamos cuarenta y tres minutos en la carretera. Nos queda aproximadamente un día de camino.
vi_translation: "I need to pee," it said at 3:06. We had been on the road for forty-three minutes, with nearly a day of driving left.
tr_translation: “I need to pee,” he says at 15:06. We have been on the road for forty-three minutes. We have approximately one day left until the end of our journey.
es_translation: —I'm peeing myself —he says at 3:06. We have been on the road for forty-three minutes. We have approximately one day of travel left.

en: “Well,” says Radar, “the good news is that we will be stopping. The bad news is that it won’t be for another four hours and thirty minutes.”
vi: “Ờ,” Radar đáp, “tin tốt là chúng ta sẽ dừng lại. Tin xấu là sẽ dừng lại sau bốn tiếng và ba mươi phút nữa.”
tr: “Peki,” diyor Radar, “iyi haber, duracağız. Kötü haber, bu dört saat otuz dakika sonra olacak.
es: —Bueno —dice Radar—, la buena noticia es que pararemos. La mala noticia es que no será antes de cuatro horas y media.
vi_translation: “Well,” Radar replied, “the good news is we will stop. The bad news is we will stop in four hours and thirty minutes.”
tr_translation: “Okay,” says Radar, “the good news is, we will stop. The bad news is, this will be in four hours and thirty minutes.”
es_translation: —Well —says Radar—, the good news is that we will stop. The bad news is that it won't be for another four and a half hours.

en: “I think I can hold it,” Ben says. At 3:10, he announces, “Actually, I really need to pee. Really.”
vi: “Chắc tôi nhịn được,” Ben nói. Vào hồi 3:10, nó tuyên bố, “Thực ra, tôi thật sự cần đi tiểu. Thật sự.”
tr: “Sanırım tutabilirim,” diyor Ben. 15:10’da, “Aslında, gerçekten çişimi yapmam gerek. Gerçekten,” diye bildiriyor.
