es: —Creo que aguantaré —le contesta Ben. Pero a las 3:10 nos comunica: —De verdad que tengo que mear. De verdad.
vi_translation: "I think I can hold it," Ben said. At 3:10, he declared, "Actually, I really need to pee. Really."
tr_translation: "I think I can hold it," says Ben. At 15:10, "Actually, I really need to pee. Really," he reports.
es_translation: —I think I'll hold on —Ben replies to him. But at 3:10, he informs us: —I really have to pee. Really.

en: The chorus responds, “Hold it.” He says, “But I—” And the chorus responds again, “Hold it!” It is fun, for now, Ben needing to pee and us needing him to hold it. He is laughing, and complaining that laughing makes him need to pee more. Lacey jumps forward and leans in behind him and starts tickling at his sides. He laughs and whines and I laugh, too, keeping the speedometer on seventy-two. I wonder if she created this journey for us on purpose or by accident—regardless, it’s the most fun I’ve had since the last time I spent hours behind the wheel of a minivan.
vi: Dàn hợp xướng đáp, “Nhịn đi!” Nó nói, “Nhưng tôi–” Và dàn hợp xướng lại đáp, “Nhịn đi!” Vui thật, ít nhất lúc này, Ben cần đi tiểu và bọn tôi cần nó nhịn tiểu. Nó cười ngặt nghẽo, liến thoắng rằng cứ cười thế này thì nó càng mắc tiểu. Lacey nhảy lên, ngả về phía Ben và bắt đầu cù sườn nó. Ben cười rú lên và tôi cũng cười, giữ vững tốc độ bảy mươi hai dặm. Tôi tự hỏi, không biết Margo tình cờ hay có chủ ý tạo ra chuyến đi này cho chúng tôi–dù gì đi nữa, đây là điều vui vẻ nhất tôi trải qua kể từ lần cuối tôi ngồi hàng giờ sau tay lái một chiếc minivan.
tr: Koro halinde karşılık veriyoruz: ‘Tut.” “Ama ben...” diyor. Ve koro tekrar karşılık veriyor: “Tut!” Şimdilik, Ben’in çişini yapmaya ve bizim de tutmasma ihtiyacımız varken, yolculuk eğlenceli geçiyor. Ben gülüyor ve gülmenin daha çok işeme ihtiyacı duymasına neden olmasından yakınıyor. Lacey arkasından uzamyor ve onu gıdıkla maya başlıyor. Ben gülüyor, inliyor ve ben de hız göstergesini yüz on beşte tutarak gülüyorum. Margo’nun bu yolculuğu bizim için kasten mi yoksa tesadüfen mi hazırladığım merak ediyorum... ne olursa olsun bu, son kez bir minivanın direksiyonunun arkasında saatler geçirmemden beri en çok eğlendiğim zaman.
es: —Te aguantas —le contestamos a coro. —Pero… —dice. —Te aguantas —volvemos a contestarle a coro. De momento tiene gracia que Ben tenga que mear y que nosotros tengamos que decirle que se aguante. Se ríe y se queja de que si se ríe todavía le entran más ganas de mear. Lacey se adelanta de un salto, se coloca detrás de él y empieza a hacerle cosquillas en la cintura. Ben se ríe y se queja, y yo me río también sin dejar que el indicador de velocidad baje de los ciento quince kilómetros por hora. Me pregunto si Margo ha provocado este viaje conjunto a propósito o por accidente, pero en cualquier caso es lo más divertido que he hecho desde la última vez que me pasé horas al volante de un monovolumen.
vi_translation: The chorus responded, "Hold it!" It said, "But I–" And the chorus responded again, "Hold it!" It was fun, at least for now, Ben needed to pee and we needed him to hold it. He laughed uncontrollably, chattering that the more he laughed, the more he needed to pee. Lacey jumped up, leaned towards Ben, and started tickling his ribs. Ben shrieked with laughter and I laughed too, maintaining a speed of seventy-two miles per hour. I wondered whether Margo had accidentally or intentionally created this trip for us—either way, this was the most fun I had had since the last time I spent hours behind the wheel of a minivan.
tr_translation: We respond in unison: 'Hold it.' 'But I...' he says. And the chorus responds again: 'Hold it!' For now, while Ben needs to pee and we need to hold it, the journey is fun. Ben laughs and complains that laughing makes him need to pee more. Lacey reaches back and tickles him. May is starting. I am laughing, moaning, and I am also laughing while keeping the speedometer at one hundred and fifteen. I wonder if Margo prepared this trip for us intentionally or by coincidence... Regardless, this is the most fun I've had since I last spent hours behind the wheel of a minivan.
es_translation: —You deal with it —we answered in unison. —But… —he says. —You deal with it —we answered back in unison. At the moment, it's funny that Ben has to pee and that we have to tell him to hold it in. He laughs and complains that if he laughs, he feels an even stronger urge to pee. Lacey jumps ahead, positions herself behind him, and starts tickling his waist. Ben laughs and complains, and I laugh too without letting the speed indicator drop below one hundred fifteen kilometers per hour. I wonder if Margo has orchestrated this joint trip on purpose or by accident, but in any case, it's the most fun I've had since the last time I spent hours behind the wheel of a minivan.

en: Hour Two
vi: Giờ thứ hai
tr: İkinci Saat
es: HORA DOS
vi_translation: Second hour
tr_translation: Second Hour
es_translation: HOUR TWO

en: I’m still driving. We turn north, onto I-95, snaking our way up Florida, near the coast but not quite on it. It is all pine trees here, too skinny for their height, built like I am. But there is mostly just the road, passing cars and occasionally being passed by them, always having to remember who is in front of you and who behind, who is approaching and who is drifting away.
vi: Tôi vẫn lái xe. Chúng tôi rẽ về hướng bắc, vào cao tốc liên bang I-95, rong ruổi cung đường uốn lượn theo bờ biển Florida, dù không hẳn là ngay sát biển. Ở đây toàn là thông, quá còm nhom so với chiều cao của chúng, dáng trông giống tôi. Nhưng hầu như chỉ có con đường, vượt qua xe khác và thỉnh thoảng bị xe khác vượt, luôn phải nhớ ai đang ở phía trước, ai ở phía sau mình, ai đang gần lại và ai đang trượt xa.
tr: Hâlâ sürüyorum. Kuzeye, I95’e dönüyoruz, Florida’nın yukarısına doğru kıvrıla kıvrıla gidiyoruz, sahile yakınız ama tam yanmda değiliz. Burada her yer çam ağacı; uzunluklarına göre fazla cılızlar, benim gibi. Ama çoğunlukla sadece yol, yanından geçtiğimiz ve ara sıra yanımızdan geçen arabalar, sürekli önde kim var, arkada kim var, kim yaklaşıyor ve kim uzaklaşıyor hatırlamak zorunda olmak var.
es: Sigo conduciendo. Giramos hacia el norte y nos metemos en la I-95 para subir por la costa de Florida, aunque no exactamente por la costa. Aquí todo son pinos demasiado delgados para su altura, como yo. Pero básicamente solo veo la carretera, adelanto coches y de vez en cuando nos adelanta alguno, estoy siempre atento a los que van delante y a los que van detrás, a los que se acercan y a los que salen del carril.
vi_translation: I am still driving. We turn north, onto the interstate I-95, cruising along the winding road that follows the Florida coastline, though not exactly right by the sea. Here, it's all pine trees, too spindly for their height, looking somewhat like me. But mostly it's just the road, overtaking other cars and occasionally being overtaken, always having to remember who is ahead, who is behind, who is getting closer and who is drifting away.
tr_translation: I'm still driving. We're turning north onto I95, winding our way up through Florida, close to the coast but not right next to it. Here, everything is pine trees; they're too scrawny for their height, like me. But mostly it's just the road, the cars we pass and the ones that occasionally pass us, always having to remember who's in front, who's behind, who's approaching and who's moving away.
es_translation: I keep driving. We turn north and get onto I-95 to head up the coast of Florida, though not exactly along the coast. Here, everything is pine trees that are too thin for their height, like me. But basically, I only see the road, I overtake cars and occasionally one overtakes us, I'm always attentive to those in front and those behind, to those approaching and those leaving the lane.

en: Lacey and Ben are sitting together on the bench seat now, and Radar is in the wayback, and they’re all playing a retarded version of I Spy in which they are only allowed to spy things that cannot physically be seen.
vi: Lúc này Lacey và Ben đang ngồi cạnh nhau trên ghế băng, Radar ở ghế cuối, ba đứa đang chơi trò Tôi Phát Hiện theo phiên bản cũ, người chơi chỉ được phép phát hiện những thứ không thể nhìn thấy bằng mắt thường.
tr: Lacey ile Ben artık iki kişilik koltukta beraber oturuyorlar, Radar da arka tarafta ve hepsi, etrafta gördüklerini birbirlerine anlatmalarım ve karşı tarafın görülen şeyin tahmin edilmesini içeren “Görüyorum” oyununun, fiziksel olarak görünmeyen şeyleri birbirlerine anlatmaya çalıştıkları özürlü bir versiyonunu oynuyorlar.
es: Ahora Lacey y Ben se han sentado juntos, Radar está en el asiento de atrás y juegan a una estúpida versión del veo veo que consiste en decir solo cosas que no pueden verse físicamente.
vi_translation: At this moment, Lacey and Ben are sitting next to each other on the bench, Radar at the end seat, the three of them playing the game I Spy in its old version, where players are only allowed to spot things that cannot be seen with the naked eye.
tr_translation: Lacey and Ben are now sitting together on a two-seater couch, with Radar in the back. They are all playing a flawed version of the "I Spy" game, where instead of describing things they can see, they try to describe things that are not physically visible to each other.
es_translation: Now Lacey and Ben are sitting together, Radar is in the back seat, and they are playing a silly version of I spy that consists of saying only things that cannot be seen physically.

en: “I Spy with my little eye something tragically hip,” Radar says.
vi: “Tôi Phát Hiện bằng con mắt bé nhỏ của mình, có điều gì đó sành điệu khủng khiếp,” Radar nói.
tr: “Şu anda etrafta trajik bir şekilde moda olan bir şey Görüyorum,” diyor Radar.
es: —Veo veo algo trágicamente a la última —dice Radar.
vi_translation: "I spy with my little eye, something terribly stylish," Radar said.
tr_translation: "I see something that is tragically fashionable around right now," says Radar.
es_translation: —I spy something tragically up-to-date —says Radar.

en: “Is it the way Ben smiles mostly with the right side of his mouth?” asks Lacey.
vi: “Có phải cách Ben cười nửa miệng, khẽ vén mép bên phải lên không?” Lacey hỏi.
tr: “Ben’in daha çok ağzının sağ tarafıyla gülümseme şekli mi?” diye soruyor Lacey.
es: —¿La sonrisa torcida hacia la derecha de Ben? —pregunta Lacey.
vi_translation: “Is it the way Ben half-smiles, slightly lifting the right side of his mouth?” Lacey asked.
tr_translation: “Is it the way Ben smiles more with the right side of his mouth?” asks Lacey.
es_translation: —Ben's crooked smile to the right? —asks Lacey.

en: “No,” says Radar. “Also don’t be so gooey about Ben. It’s gross.”
vi: “Không,” Radar đáp. “Mới cả đừng dành cho Ben những lời êm ái ấy, nghe ghê răng quá.”
tr: “Hayır,” diyor Radar. “Aynca Ben hakkında bu kadar vıcık vıcık olma. Bu iğrenç.
es: —No —le contesta Radar—. Y no seas tan empalagosa con Ben. Es repugnante.
vi_translation: “No,” Radar replied. “And don't give Ben those sweet words, they sound too cheesy.”
tr_translation: "No," says Radar. "Also, don't be so mushy about Ben. It's disgusting."
es_translation: —No —Radar replies—. And don't be so clingy with Ben. It's disgusting.

en: “Is it the idea of wearing nothing under your graduation gown and then having to drive to New York while all the people in passing cars assume you’re wearing a dress?”
vi: “Có phải phong cách nhân trần dưới áo chùng tốt nghiệp và lái xe đến New York trong khi người đi đường đều tưởng chúng ta đang mặc váy không?”
tr: “Mezuniyet cübbenin altına hiçbir şey giymemen, sonra geçen arabalardaki bütün insanlar senin bir elbise giydiğini düşünürken, New York’a gitmek zorunda kalman fikri mi?
es: —¿La idea de viajar hasta Nueva York sin llevar nada debajo de la toga, cuando los de los coches que nos adelantan dan por sentado que llevas un traje?
vi_translation: “Is it the style of wearing cassocks under graduation gowns and driving to New York while passersby think we're wearing skirts?”
tr_translation: “The idea of wearing nothing under your graduation gown, then having to go to New York while everyone in the passing cars thinks you're wearing a dress?”
es_translation: —The idea of traveling to New York without wearing anything under the robe, when the people in the cars passing us assume you're wearing a suit?

en: “No,” says Radar. “That’s just tragic.”
vi: “Không,” Radar đáp. “Thế thì chỉ khủng khiếp thôi.
tr: “Hayır,” diyor Radar. “Bu sadece trajik.
es: —No —le contesta Radar—. Eso solo es trágico.
vi_translation: “No,” Radar replied. “Then it would just be terrible.”
tr_translation: “No,” says Radar. “This is just tragic.”
es_translation: —No —Radar replies—. That is just tragic.

en: Lacey smiles. “You’ll learn to like dresses. You get to enjoy the breeze.”
vi: Lacey cười. “Rồi cậu sẽ học cách thích váy vóc cho coi. Phải tận hưởng gió mát chứ.”
tr: Lacey gülümsüyor. “Elbiseleri sevmeyi öğreneceksin. Esintinin keyfini çıkaracaksın.
es: —Al final te gustarán los vestidos —dice Lacey sonriendo—. Disfrutas de la brisa.
vi_translation: Lacey laughed. "You'll learn to like dresses, you'll see. You have to enjoy the cool breeze."
tr_translation: Lacey is smiling. “You will learn to love the dresses. You will enjoy the breeze.”
es_translation: —In the end, you will like the dresses —says Lacey, smiling—. You enjoy the breeze.

en: “Oh, I know!” I say from the front. “You spy a twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. Hip because road trips always are; tragic because the gas we’re guzzling will destroy the planet.”
vi: “Ồ, tôi biết!” tôi nói vọng xuống. “Ông phát hiện ra hành trình bám đường dài hai mươi tư tiếng trong một chiếc minivan. Sành điệu vì những chuyến bám đường luôn như vậy; khủng khiếp vì lượng xăng bọn mình ngốn sẽ phá hủy hành tinh này.”
tr: “Ah, biliyorum!” diyorum ön taraftan. “Minivanda yirmi dört saatlik bir yolculuk görüyorsun. Moda, çünkü yolculuklar her zaman öyledir; trajik çünkü lıkır lıkır içtiğimiz benzin gezegeni yok edecek.”
es: —¡Ya sé! —digo yo—. Ves un viaje por carretera de veinticuatro horas en un monovolumen. Está a la última porque los viajes por carretera siempre están a la última, y es trágico porque la gasolina que chupa este coche destruirá el planeta.
vi_translation: “Oh, I know!” I shouted down. “You discovered the twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. Stylish because road trips are always like that; terrible because the amount of gas we consume will destroy the planet.”
tr_translation: “Ah, I know!” I say from the front. “You see a twenty-four-hour journey in a minivan. Fashionable, because journeys are always like that; tragic because the gasoline we guzzle will destroy the planet.”
es_translation: —I know! —I say—. You see a twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. It's trendy because road trips are always trendy, and it's tragic because the gas this car guzzles will destroy the planet.

en: Radar says no, and they keep guessing. I am driving and going seventy-two and praying not to get a ticket and playing Metaphysical I Spy. The tragically hip thing turns out to be failing to turn in your rented graduation robes on time. I blow past a cop parked on the grass median. I grip the steering wheel hard with both hands, feeling sure he’ll race up to pull us over. But he doesn’t. Maybe he knows I’m only speeding because I have to.
vi: Radar vẫn bảo không phải, và chúng tôi lại đoán tiếp. Tôi đang lái xe, giữ tốc độ bảy mươi hai dặm một giờ, cầu mong không bị phạt vi phạm giao thông và đang chơi Tôi Phát Hiện phiên bản siêu hình. Điều sành điệu khủng khiếp hóa ra là việc mớ áo chùng đi thuê này sẽ không được đem trả đúng hẹn. Tôi nhấn ga chạy nhanh qua một cảnh sát đang dừng trên dải cỏ phân cách. Tôi nắm chặt vô-lăng bằng cả hai tay, cảm tưởng chắc như ăn bắp là chú cảnh sát sẽ đuổi theo và tấp tôi vào lề đường. Nhưng chú ấy không đuổi theo, chắc biết rằng tôi chỉ phóng nhanh vì tôi buộc phải như vậy.
tr: Radar hayır diyor ve tahmin yürütmeye devam ediyorlar. Arabayı sürüyorum, yüz on beşle gidiyorum ve trafik cezası almamak için dua ederken Fizikötesi Görüyorum oynuyorum. Trajik bir şekilde moda olan şeyin, kiralık mezuniyet cübbesini zamanında iade etmemek olduğu ortaya çıkıyor. Refüjde park etmiş bir polis arabasının yamndan rüzgâr gibi geçiyorum. Bizi kenara çekmek için hızla geleceğinden emin bir şekilde iki elimle direksiyona sıkıca yapışıyorum. Ama öyle yapmıyor. Belki de yalnızca mecbur olduğum için hız yaptığımı biliyor.
es: Radar dice que no y siguen intentando adivinarlo. Me mantengo en ciento quince kilómetros por hora, rezo para que no me pongan una multa y juego al veo veo metafísico. Lo trágicamente a la última resulta ser no conseguir devolver las togas alquiladas a tiempo. Dejo atrás a toda velocidad un coche de policía parado en la mediana de hierba. Sujeto el volante con fuerza, con las dos manos, convencido de que va a perseguirnos y a hacernos parar. Pero no. Quizá el poli sabe que voy a esa velocidad porque no me queda más remedio.
vi_translation: Radar still insisted it wasn't, and we continued guessing. I was driving, maintaining a speed of seventy-two miles per hour, hoping not to get a traffic ticket, and playing a metaphysical version of I Spy. The terribly stylish thing turned out to be that this rented robe wouldn't be returned on time. I pressed the gas pedal to speed past a police officer who was stopped on the median strip. I gripped the steering wheel with both hands, feeling certain that the officer would chase after me and pull me over. But he didn't chase after me, probably knowing that I was speeding because I had to.
tr_translation: Radar says no and they continue to guess. I'm driving the car, going at one hundred fifteen, and playing Metaphysical I Spy while praying not to get a speeding ticket. It turns out that the tragically fashionable thing is not returning the rented graduation gown on time. I speed past a police car parked on the median like the wind. Gripping the steering wheel tightly with both hands, I'm certain it will quickly come to pull us over. But it doesn't. Maybe it knows that I'm speeding only because I have to.
es_translation: Radar says no and they keep trying to guess it. I maintain a speed of one hundred and fifteen kilometers per hour, pray that I don't get a ticket, and play metaphysical I spy. The tragically up-to-date thing turns out to be not being able to return the rented robes on time. I speed past a police car stopped in the grassy median. I grip the steering wheel tightly with both hands, convinced that it will chase us and make us stop. But no. Maybe the cop knows that I'm going at this speed because I have no other choice.

en: Hour Three
vi: Giờ thứ ba
tr: üçüncü Saat
es: HORA TRES
vi_translation: The third hour
tr_translation: Third Hour
es_translation: THREE O'CLOCK

en: Ben is sitting shotgun again. I’m still driving. We’re all hungry. Lacey distributes one piece of wintergreen gum to each of us, but it’s cold comfort. She’s writing a gigantic list of everything we’re going to buy at the BP when we stop for the first time. This had better be one extraordinarily well-stocked BP station, because we are going to clear the bitch out.
vi: Ben trở lại ghế trước. Tôi vẫn lái xe. Cả lũ đều đói meo. Lacey phân phát chỉ một miếng kẹo the cho từng người, dù sao cũng có chút mát lạnh dễ chịu. Cậu ấy đang viết một danh sách dằng dặc những thứ chúng tôi sẽ mua ở trạm BP trong lần dừng lại đầu tiên. Chỗ đó nên là một trạm BP có lượng hàng cực kì dồi dào, vì chúng tôi sẽ càn quét sạch sành sanh.
tr: Ben yine önde oturuyor. Ben hâlâ sürüyorum. Hepimiz açız. Lacey her birimize bir bitki özlü sakız dağıtıyor ama bu pek teselli etmiyor. İlk durduğumuzda BP’den alacağımız her şeyin devasa bir listesini yazıyor. Olağandışı derecede iyi stoku olan bir BP istasyonu olsa iyi olur, çünkü orayı silip süpürecekmişiz gibi duruyor.
es: Ben ha vuelto a sentarse en el asiento del copiloto. Sigo conduciendo. Todos tenemos hambre. Lacey reparte un chicle de menta a cada uno, pero es un triste consuelo. Está haciendo una lista interminable de todo lo que vamos a comprar en la gasolinera cuando paremos por primera vez. Mejor que sea una gasolinera excepcionalmente abastecida, porque vamos a arrasarla.
vi_translation: Ben returned to the front seat. I was still driving. We were all starving. Lacey handed out just one mint candy to each person, at least it was a bit refreshingly cool. He was writing a long list of things we would buy at the BP station during our first stop. That place better be a BP station with an extremely abundant stock because we were going to clean it out.
tr_translation: I'm still sitting in the front. I'm still driving. We're all hungry. Lacey is handing out a plant-based gum to each of us, but it's not much of a consolation. When we first stop, she writes a massive list of everything we need to get from BP. It better be an unusually well-stocked BP station because it looks like we're going to clean it out.
es_translation: Ben has sat back down in the passenger seat. I keep driving. We are all hungry. Lacey hands out a mint gum to each of us, but it is a poor consolation. She is making an endless list of everything we are going to buy at the gas station when we stop for the first time. It better be an exceptionally stocked gas station because we are going to clean it out.

en: Ben keeps bouncing his legs up and down.
vi: Ben tiếp tục dọ doạy hai chân.
tr: Ben bacaklarını aşağı yukarı sallıyor.
es: Ben no deja de mover las piernas.
vi_translation: Ben continued to stagger with his legs.
tr_translation: I'm swinging my legs up and down.
es_translation: Ben doesn't stop moving his legs.

en: “Will you stop that?”
vi: “Ông thôi đi được không?”
tr: “Şunu keser misin?
es: —¿Quieres parar?
vi_translation: "Can you stop?"
tr_translation: “Can you cut this?”
es_translation: —Do you want to stop?

en: “I’ve had to pee for three hours.”
vi: “Tôi cần đi tiểu từ ba tiếng nay rồi.”
tr: “Üç saattir çişimi yapmam gerek.
es: —Hace tres horas que me meo.
vi_translation: “I have needed to pee for three hours now.”
tr_translation: "I have needed to pee for three hours.""
es_translation: —I've been needing to pee for three hours.

en: “You’ve mentioned that.”
vi: “Ông nói rồi mà.”
tr: “Bundan bahsetmiştin.
es: —Ya lo has dicho.
vi_translation: “He already said that.”
tr_translation: “You had mentioned this.”
es_translation: —You already said it.

en: “I can feel the pee all the way up to my rib cage,” he says. “I am honestly full of pee. Bro, right now, seventy percent of my body weight is pee.”
vi: “Tôi cảm thấy nước tiểu đang trào ngược lên khắp lồng ngực,” nó nói. “Thành thực là tôi đang chứa đầy nước tiểu. Ngay lúc này, bảy mươi phần trăm trọng lượng cơ thể tôi là nước tiểu.
tr: ‘Ta göğüs kafesime kadar çişi hissedebiliyorum,” diyor. “Gerçekten çişle doluyum. Kardeşim, şu anda vücut ağırlığımın yüzde yetmişi çiş.
es: —El pis me ha subido hasta las costillas —dice—. De verdad que estoy hasta arriba. Colega, ahora mismo el setenta por ciento de mi peso es pis.
vi_translation: “I feel the urine rising up all over my chest,” it said. “Honestly, I am filled with urine. Right now, seventy percent of my body weight is urine.”
tr_translation: “I can feel the pee up to my chest,” he says. “I am really full of pee. Brother, right now seventy percent of my body weight is pee.”
es_translation: —The piss has risen up to my ribs —he says—. Seriously, I'm up to my neck in it. Dude, right now seventy percent of my weight is piss.

en: “Uh-huh,” I say, barely cracking a smile. It’s funny and all, but I’m tired.
vi: “Ừ, rồi,” tôi nói, khẽ cười khổ. Vẫn rất vui, nhưng tôi mệt quá rồi.
tr: “Hı hı,” diyorum, zar zor tebessüm ederek. Aslında komik ama yorgunum.
es: —Vaya —le digo esbozando apenas una sonrisa. Tiene gracia, no digo que no, pero estoy cansado.
vi_translation: “Alright, then,” I said, with a faint, bitter smile. Still very happy, but I was too tired.
tr_translation: "Uh-huh," I say, barely managing a smile. It's actually funny, but I'm tired.
es_translation: —Wow —I say, barely managing a smile. It's funny, I'm not saying it isn't, but I'm tired.

en: “I feel like I might start crying, and that I’m going to cry pee.”
vi: “Bây giờ mà khóc thì tôi sẽ khóc ra nước tiểu.
tr: “Ağlamaya başlayacakmışım ve gözlerimden çiş çıkacakmış gibi geliyor.
es: —Creo que si me pongo a llorar, lloraré pis.
vi_translation: “If I cry now, I will cry out urine.”
tr_translation: “I feel like I'm about to cry and pee will come out of my eyes.”
es_translation: —I think that if I start crying, I'll cry pee.

en: That gets me. I laugh a little.
vi: Thằng khỉ, tôi khẽ cười thành tiếng.
tr: Bu sefer biraz gülüyorum.
es: Esta vez sí. Me río un poco.
vi_translation: The little monkey, I chuckled softly.
tr_translation: This time, I am laughing a little.
es_translation: This time, yes. I laugh a little.

en: The next time I glance over, a few minutes later, Ben has a hand tight around his crotch, the fabric of the gown bunched up.
vi: Mấy phút sau tôi liếc sang, Ben úp một tay lên chỗ kín, vải áo chùng cộm cộm.
tr: Birkaç dakika sonra bir daha baktığımda Ben’in bir elini apış arasına sımsıkı koyduğunu ve cübbenin kumaşının büzüldüğünü görüyorum.
es: La siguiente vez que echo un vistazo, a los pocos minutos, Ben tiene la toga levantada y se aprieta la entrepierna con una mano.
vi_translation: A few minutes later, I glanced over, and Ben had one hand covering his private area, the fabric of his robe bulging.
tr_translation: When I look again a few minutes later, I see that Ben has tightly placed one of his hands between his legs and the fabric of the robe is wrinkled.
es_translation: The next time I take a look, a few minutes later, Ben has his toga lifted and is squeezing his groin with one hand.

en: “What the hell?” I ask.
vi: “Quái quỉ gì thế không biết?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Ne oluyor?” diye soruyorum.
es: —¿Qué mierda haces? —le pregunto.
vi_translation: “What the hell is this?” I asked.
tr_translation: “What is happening?” I ask.
es_translation: —What the hell are you doing? —I ask him.

en: “We have to go at least a hundred forty-three more miles in order to keep it down to four stops, which means about one hour and fifty-eight-point-five minutes if Q keeps pace.”
vi: “Chúng ta phải đi ít nhất một trăm bốn mươi ba dặm nữa để giữ mốc bốn lần dừng, tức là còn một tiếng và năm mươi tám phẩy năm phút nữa, nếu Q duy trì được tốc độ.
tr: “Sadece dört mola vermemiz için en az iki yüz otuz kilometre daha gitmeliyiz ki bu da bir saat elli sekiz buçuk dakika demek oluyor, eğer Q aynı hızı korursa.
es: —Tenemos que seguir por lo menos doscientos veinte kilómetros más para no pasar de las cuatro paradas, es decir, si Q mantiene el ritmo, una hora y cincuenta y cuatro coma seis minutos.
vi_translation: “We have to travel at least one hundred and forty-three more miles to maintain the four-stop mark, which means we have one hour and fifty-eight point five minutes left, if Q can maintain the speed.”
tr_translation: “We need to travel at least two hundred and thirty more kilometers to make just four stops, which means one hour and fifty-eight and a half minutes, if Q maintains the same speed.”
es_translation: —We have to continue for at least two hundred and twenty more kilometers to not exceed four stops, that is, if Q maintains the pace, one hour and fifty-four point six minutes.

en: “I’m keeping up!” I shout. We are just north of Jacksonville, getting close to Georgia.
vi: “Tôi đang giữ vững đây!” tôi kêu lên. Chúng tôi đang ở phía bắc Jacksonville, gần tới Georgia.
tr: “Koruyorum!” diye bağırıyorum. Jacksonville’in tam kuzeyindeyiz, Georgia’ya yaklaşıyoruz.
es: —¡Estoy manteniendo el ritmo! —exclamo. Estamos al norte de Jacksonville, acercándonos a Georgia.
vi_translation: "I'm holding on tight!" I shouted. We were north of Jacksonville, near Georgia.
tr_translation: “I’m protecting!” I shout. We are just north of Jacksonville, approaching Georgia.
es_translation: —I'm keeping the pace! —I exclaimed. We are north of Jacksonville, approaching Georgia.

en: “I can’t make it, Radar. Get me something to pee in.”
vi: “Tôi không nhịn nổi đâu, Radar ạ. Cho tôi cái gì để tôi xả vào đi.
tr: “Başaramayacağım, Radar. Bana içine işeyeceğim bir şey bul.
es: —No aguanto, Radar. Dadme algo para que mee.
vi_translation: "I can't hold it in, Radar." "Give me something to vent on.""
tr_translation: “I won't be able to do it, Radar. Find me something to pee into.”
es_translation: —I can't hold it, Radar. Give me something so I can pee.

en: The chorus erupts: NO. Absolutely not. Just hold it like a man. Hold it like a Victorian lady holds on to her maidenhead. Hold it with dignity and grace, like the president of the United States is supposed to hold the fate of the free world.
vi: Dàn hợp xướng bùng lên: KHÔNG. Tuyệt đối không được. Hãy nhịn như một người đàn ông đi. Hãy giữ cơn mắc tiểu lại như một quí cô thời Nữ hoàng Victoria giữ gìn sự trong trắng. Hãy giữ lại với phẩm giá và tự trọng, như tổng thống Hợp Chúng Quốc Hoa Kì được cho là người nắm giữ số phận thế giới tự do.
tr: Koro haykırıyor: HAYIR. Kesinlikle hayır. Bir erkek gibi çişini tut. Victoria dönemindeki bir hanımın bekâretine tutunduğu gibi tut. Asalet ve zarafetle tut, Birleşik Devletler başkamnın özgür dünyanın kaderini elinde tutması gerektiği gibi tut.
es: Gritamos a coro: NO. De ninguna manera. Aguanta como un hombre. Mantenlo dentro como una dama victoriana mantiene su virginidad. Sostenlo con dignidad y elegancia, como se supone que el presidente de Estados Unidos tiene que sostener el destino del mundo libre.
vi_translation: The choir erupted: NO. Absolutely not. Hold it in like a man. Hold your urge to urinate like a Victorian lady preserving her chastity. Hold it with dignity and self-respect, like the President of the United States, who is believed to hold the fate of the free world.
tr_translation: The chorus shouts: NO. Absolutely not. Hold your pee like a man. Hold it like a Victorian lady clings to her virginity. Hold it with nobility and grace, as the President of the United States should hold the fate of the free world in his hands.
es_translation: We shouted in unison: NO. By no means. Endure it like a man. Keep it inside like a Victorian lady keeps her virginity. Hold it with dignity and elegance, as the President of the United States is supposed to hold the fate of the free world.

en: “GIVE ME SOMETHING OR I WILL PEE ON THIS SEAT. AND HURRY!”
vi: “ĐƯA CÁI GÌ ĐÂY NẾU KHÔNG TÔI SẼ TIỂU LUÔN TẠI TRẬN. NHANH LÊN!”
tr: “BİR ŞEY VER YOKSA BU KOLTUĞA İŞEYECEĞİM. ACELE ET!”
es: —SI NO ME DAIS ALGO VOY A MEARME EN EL ASIENTO. ¡Y RÁPIDO!
vi_translation: "GIVE ME SOMETHING OR I'LL PEE RIGHT HERE. HURRY UP!"
tr_translation: "GIVE ME SOMETHING OR I'LL PEE ON THIS CHAIR." "HURRY UP!"
es_translation: —IF YOU DON'T GIVE ME SOMETHING, I'M GOING TO PEE ON THE SEAT. AND QUICKLY!

en: “Oh, Christ,” Radar says as he unbuckles his seat belt. He climbs into the wayback, and then reaches down and opens the cooler. He returns to his seat, leans forward, and hands Ben a beer.
vi: “Ôi, lạy Chúa,” Radar thốt lên và tháo đai an toàn. Nó trườn xuống ghế cuối, lần mò mở thùng giữ lạnh. Nó quay lại chỗ ngồi, rướn lên đưa chai bia cho Ben.
tr: “Ah, Tanrım,” diyor Radar emniyet kemerini çözerken. Arka tarafa uzanıyor, sonra soğutucuyu açıyor. Koltuğuna dönüyor, öne eğiliyor ve Ben’e bir bira uzatıyor.
es: —Joder —dice Radar desabrochándose el cinturón de seguridad. Se inclina sobre el respaldo, alarga el brazo y abre la nevera. Vuelve a sentarse, se inclina hacia delante y le da a Ben una cerveza.
vi_translation: “Oh, my God,” Radar exclaimed and unbuckled his seatbelt. He crawled to the back seat, fumbling to open the cooler. He returned to his seat, stretched out to hand a beer bottle to Ben.
tr_translation: "Oh, God," says Radar as he unbuckles his seatbelt. He reaches to the back, then opens the cooler. He turns back to his seat, leans forward, and hands a beer to Ben.
es_translation: —Fuck —says Radar, unbuckling his seatbelt. He leans over the backrest, extends his arm, and opens the fridge. He sits back down, leans forward, and gives Ben a beer.

en: “Thank God it’s a twist off,” Ben says, gathering a handful of robe and then opening the bottle. Ben rolls down the window, and I watch out the side-view mirror as the beer floats past the car and splashes onto the interstate. Ben manages to get the bottle underneath his robe without showing us the world’s purportedly largest balls, and then we all sit and wait, too disgusted to look.
vi: “Tạ ơn Chúa loại này vặn được,” Ben nói, bọc áo chùng ra ngoài tay và vặn mở chai. Nó hạ kính cửa sổ xuống, tôi nhìn ra gương cạnh thấy dòng bia chảy khỏi xe và tóe xuống mặt đường. Ben luồn được cái chai xuống dưới áo chùng mà không cho chúng tôi mục kích đôi bi được cho là bự nhất thế giới. Bọn tôi ngồi và đợi, thấy quá ghê nên không nhìn.
tr: “Neyse ki çevir aç kapak,” diyor Ben, avcunda sıktığı kumaşla şişeyi açarken. Pencereyi indiriyor ve bira arabanın yanından süzülüp eyaletler arası yola çarparken, yan aynadan izliyorum. Ben, iddiasına göre dünyanın en büyük toplarını bize gösterm den, şişeyi cübbesinin altma sokmayı başarıyor ve hepimiz oturup bekliyoruz, bakmak için fazla iğrenç.
es: —Menos mal que el tapón es de rosca —dice Ben cubriéndose la mano con un trozo de toga y abriendo la botella. Ben baja la ventanilla, y yo observo por el retrovisor lateral el chorro de cerveza volando y salpicando la carretera. Ben consigue meterse la botella debajo de la toga sin que veamos las bolas supuestamente más grandes del mundo, y los demás esperamos, porque nos da asco mirar.
vi_translation: "Thank God this type can be unscrewed," Ben said, wrapping his robe around his hand and unscrewing the bottle. He lowered the window, and I looked out the side mirror to see the stream of beer flowing out of the car and splashing onto the road. Ben managed to get the bottle under his robe without letting us witness what were claimed to be the biggest balls in the world. We sat and waited, feeling too grossed out to look.
tr_translation: “Anyway, open the cap,” says Ben, opening the bottle with the cloth he squeezed in his palm. He lowers the window and as the beer slips out from the side of the car and hits the interstate road, I watch it from the side mirror. Ben, according to him, is going to show us the biggest balls in the world. then, he manages to slip the bottle under his robe and we all sit and wait, too disgusted to look.
es_translation: —Good thing the cap is a screw top —says Ben, covering his hand with a piece of toga and opening the bottle. Ben lowers the window, and I watch through the side mirror as the stream of beer flies and splashes onto the road. Ben manages to get the bottle under his toga without us seeing the supposedly largest balls in the world, and the rest of us wait, because we're disgusted to look.

en: Lacey is just saying, “Can’t you just hold it,” when we all hear it. I have never heard the sound before, but I recognize it anyway: it is the sound of pee hitting the bottom of a beer bottle. It sounds almost like music. Revolting music with a very fast beat. I glance over and I can see the relief in Ben’s eyes. He is smiling, staring into the middle distance.
vi: Lacey vừa nói, “Cậu không thể nhịn nổi sao,” thì cả lũ đều nghe thấy nó. Tôi chưa từng nghe thấy âm thanh như thế này, nhưng vẫn biết ngay đó là: tiếng nước tiểu tuôn xuống đáy một chai bia. Nghe gần như âm nhạc. Một thứ nhạc rùng rợn nhịp rất nhanh. Tôi lé mắt sang và thấy vẻ thư thái trong mắt Ben. Nó đang mỉm cười, ánh mắt xa xăm vô định.
tr: Lacey tam, “Sadece tutamaz mıydm?” derken hepimiz duyuyoruz. Bu sesi daha önce duymadım ama her halükârda tanıyorum: Bu, çişin bir bira şişesinin dibine çarparken çıkardığı ses. Kulağa neredeyse müzik gibi geliyor. Çok hızlı temposu olan iğrenç bir müzik. O tarafa bir bakış atıyorum ve Ben’in gözlerindeki rahatlamayı görebiliyorum. Uzaklara doğru bakarak gülümsüyor.
es: —No puedes esperar un… —empieza a decir Lacey. Pero todos lo oímos. Es la primera vez que oigo ese sonido, pero lo reconozco: el ruido del pis golpeando el fondo de una botella de cerveza. Casi parece música. Música asquerosa a ritmo muy rápido. Echo un vistazo y veo el alivio en los ojos de Ben. Sonríe mirando al frente.
vi_translation: Lacey just said, "You can't hold it in, can you," when everyone heard it. I've never heard a sound like this before, but I knew right away what it was: the sound of urine hitting the bottom of a beer bottle. It almost sounded like music. A creepy kind of music with a very fast rhythm. I squinted over and saw the look of relief in Ben's eyes. He was smiling, his gaze distant and unfocused.
tr_translation: Lacey says, "Couldn't I just hold it?" and we all hear it. I haven't heard this sound before, but I recognize it nonetheless: It's the sound of pee hitting the bottom of a beer bottle. It almost sounds like music. Disgusting music with a very fast tempo. I glance over in that direction and see the relief in Ben's eyes. He's smiling as he looks off into the distance.
es_translation: —You can't expect a... —Lacey begins to say. But we all hear it. It's the first time I hear that sound, but I recognize it: the noise of pee hitting the bottom of a beer bottle. It almost sounds like music. Disgusting music at a very fast pace. I glance over and see the relief in Ben's eyes. He smiles looking ahead.

en: “The longer you wait, the better it feels,” he says. The sound soon changes from the clinking of pee-on-bottle to the blopping of pee-on-pee. And then, slowly, Ben’s smile fades.
vi: “Càng đợi lâu thì càng thấy khoái,” nó nói. Âm thanh chuyển từ tách tách nước-tiểu-va-vào-chai sang lộp lộp nước-tiểu-rơi-trên-nước-tiểu. Rồi từ từ, nụ cười của Ben tắt dần.
tr: “Ne kadar uzun beklersen, o kadar iyi hissettirir,” diyor. Kısa zamanda ses, çişin şişede tıkırdamasından çişin çişte şıpırtısına dönüşüyor. Sonra Ben’in tebessümü yavaşça soluyor.
es: —Cuanto más esperas, mejor te sientes —dice. El tintineo del pis golpeando la botella da paso al ruido del chorro del pis en el pis. Y luego la sonrisa de Ben se desvanece lentamente.
vi_translation: "The longer you wait, the more enjoyable it gets," he said. The sound shifted from the splattering of urine hitting the bottle to the plopping of urine falling on urine. Then slowly, Ben's smile faded.
tr_translation: “The longer you wait, the better it feels,” he says. In a short time, the sound changes from the tinkling of pee in the bottle to the splashing of pee in pee. Then Ben's smile slowly fades.
es_translation: —The longer you wait, the better you feel —he says. The tinkling of the pee hitting the bottle gives way to the sound of the stream of pee in the pee. And then Ben's smile slowly fades away.

en: “Bro, I think I need another bottle,” he says suddenly.
vi: “Này bồ tèo, chắc tôi cần chai nữa quá,” nó đột ngột tuyên bố.
tr: ‘Kardeşim, sanırım bir şişeye daha ihtiyacım var,” diyor aniden.
es: —Colega, creo que necesito otra botella —dice de repente.
vi_translation: "Hey buddy, I probably need another bottle," he suddenly declared.
tr_translation: “Brother, I think I need another bottle,” he says suddenly.
es_translation: —Colleague, I think I need another bottle —he says suddenly.

en: “Another bottle STAT,” I shout.
vi: “CẤP CỨU một chai nữa!” tôi kêu toáng lên.
tr: “Bir şişe daha, HEMEN,” diye bağırıyorum.
es: —¡Otra botella ahora mismo! —grito.
vi_translation: “EMERGENCY, another bottle!” I shouted loudly.
tr_translation: “One more bottle, NOW,” I shout.
es_translation: —Another bottle right now! —I shouted.

en: “Another bottle coming up!” In a flash, I can see Radar bent over the backseat, his head in the cooler, digging a bottle out of the ice. He opens it with his bare hand, cracks one of the back windows open, and pours the beer out through the crack. Then he leaps to the front, his head between Ben and me, and holds the bottle out for Ben, whose eyes are darting around in panic.
vi: “Một chai nữa tới đây!” Trong chớp nhoáng, tôi thấy Radar vặn mình ra sau, cắm đầu vào thùng giữ lạnh, bới vội một chai trong đống đá. Nó vặn nắp bằng tay không, cạy mở một cửa sổ ở phía sau, lách chai bia ra và đổ đi. Rồi nó nhào về phía trước, đầu nhô giữa Ben và tôi, giơ cái chai ra cho Ben. Hai mắt Ben đang lồi ra vì kinh hãi.
tr: “Bir şişe daha geliyor!” Bir anda Radar’m arka koltuğa eğildiğini, kafası soğutucunun içinde, buzun içinden bir şişe bulup çıkardığını görebiliyorum. Şişeyi eliyle açıyor, arka pencerelerden birini aralıyor ve birayı aralıktan dışarı döküyor. Sonra öne doğru uzamyor, kafası Ben ile benim aramda ve şişeyi, gözleri panikle dolu Ben’e uzatıyor.
es: —¡Marchando otra botella! En un segundo veo a Radar inclinado sobre el respaldo, con la cabeza en la nevera, sacando una botella de entre el hielo. La abre directamente, baja una ventanilla, saca la botella y la vacía. Luego salta hacia delante, mete la cabeza entre Ben y yo y le tiende la botella a Ben, que mira de un lado al otro aterrorizado.
vi_translation: “Another bottle over here!” In a flash, I saw Radar twist around, dive into the cooler, and quickly grab a bottle from the pile of ice. He twisted the cap off with his bare hands, pried open a window at the back, slipped the beer bottle out, and poured it away. Then he lunged forward, his head popping up between Ben and me, holding the bottle out to Ben. Ben's eyes were bulging with fright.
tr_translation: “Another bottle is coming!” Suddenly, I can see Radar leaning towards the back seat, his head inside the cooler, pulling out a bottle from the ice. He opens the bottle with his hand, cracks open one of the rear windows, and pours the beer out through the gap. Then he leans forward, his head between Ben and me, and hands the bottle to Ben, whose eyes are filled with panic.
es_translation: —Coming right up, another bottle! In a second, I see Radar leaning over the backrest, with his head in the cooler, pulling out a bottle from the ice. He opens it directly, lowers a window, sticks out the bottle, and empties it. Then he jumps forward, sticks his head between Ben and me, and hands the bottle to Ben, who looks from side to side terrified.

en: “The, uh, exchange is going to be, uh, complicated,” Ben says. There’s a lot of fumbling going on beneath that robe, and I’m trying not to imagine what’s happening when out from underneath a robe comes a Miller Lite bottle filled with pee (which looks astoundingly similar to Miller Lite). Ben deposits the full bottle in the cup holder, grabs the new one from Radar, and then sighs with relief.
vi: “Cuộc, ơ, chuyển giao có chút, ơ phức tạp,” Ben nói. Một loạt hành động lùng bùng dưới lớp áo chùng. Tôi cố không tưởng tượng điều gì đang xảy ra thì từ tà áo nhô ra một chai Miller Lite đong đầy nước tiểu (trông giống bia Miller Lite lạ lùng). Ben đặt cái chai đầy vào chỗ cắm cốc, tóm lấy chai mới từ Radar, rồi lại thở dài sung sướng.
tr: “Eee, değiştirme işi biraz, şey, karmaşık olacak,” diyor Ben. O cübbenin altında çok fazla el yordamıyla yoklama yapılıyor ve cübbenin altmdan (şaşırtıcı bir şekilde Miller Lite’a benzeyen) çişle dolu bir Miller Lite şişesi çıktığında, neler olduğunu gözümde canlandırmamaya çalışıyorum. Ben, dolu şişeyi bardak tutucuya emanet edip Radar’dan yenisini kapıyor ve sonra rahatlamayla iç geçiriyor.
es: —Uf, va a ser… complicado… cambiar la botella —dice Ben. Veo movimientos debajo de su toga e intento no imaginar qué pasa cuando de debajo de una toga aparece una botella de cerveza llena de pis (que se parece muchísimo a la cerveza). Ben deja la botella llena en el posavasos, coge la vacía de la mano de Radar y suspira aliviado.
vi_translation: “The, uh, transfer is a bit, uh, complicated,” Ben said. A series of actions rustled under the robe. I tried not to imagine what was happening when a bottle of Miller Lite filled with urine (strangely resembling Miller Lite) emerged from the hem of the robe. Ben placed the full bottle into the cup holder, grabbed a new one from Radar, and sighed contentedly.
tr_translation: “Uh, the replacement thing is a bit, um, complicated,” says Ben. There’s a lot of fumbling happening under that robe, and when a bottle of Miller Lite (surprisingly resembling urine) emerges from under the robe, I try not to visualize what’s going on. Ben places the full bottle in the cup holder, grabs a new one from Radar, and then sighs with relief.
es_translation: —Ugh, it's going to be... complicated... to change the bottle —says Ben. I see movements under his toga and try not to imagine what happens when a bottle of beer full of piss (which looks a lot like beer) appears from under a toga. Ben leaves the full bottle in the cup holder, takes the empty one from Radar's hand, and sighs with relief.

en: The rest of us, meanwhile, are left to contemplate the pee in the cup holder. The road is not particularly bumpy, but the shocks on the minivan leave something to be desired, so the pee swishes back and forth at the top of the bottle.
vi: Trong khi đó, những đứa còn lại được mãn nhãn ngắm chai nước tiểu ở chỗ cắm cốc. Đường không đặc biệt gồ ghề, nhưng những rung xóc trên xe cũng là quá đủ, nước tiểu sóng sánh ngấp nghé ngay miệng chai.
tr: Bu sırada geri kalanımıza, bardak tutucusundaki çiş konusunda düşünmek kalıyor. Yol fazla engebeli değil ama minivandaki sarsıntılar hiç hoş değil, bu yüzden çiş şişenin ağzında ileri geri şıpırdıyor.
es: Entretanto, los demás no podemos evitar contemplar el pis del posavasos. La carretera no tiene excesivos baches, pero las sacudidas del monovolumen no están nada mal, de modo que el pis va de un lado al otro del cuello de la botella.
vi_translation: Meanwhile, the remaining kids were delighted to gaze at the bottle of urine in the cup holder. The road wasn't particularly bumpy, but the jolts on the bus were more than enough, causing the urine to slosh right up to the bottle's mouth.
tr_translation: Meanwhile, the rest of us are left to think about the pee in the cup holder. The road isn't too bumpy, but the jolts in the minivan are quite unpleasant, so the pee sloshes back and forth at the mouth of the bottle.
es_translation: However, the rest of us cannot help but stare at the coaster's pee. The road does not have too many potholes, but the jolts of the minivan are quite significant, so the pee goes from one side to the other of the bottle's neck.

en: “Ben, if you get pee in my brand-new car, I am going to cut your balls off.”
vi: “Ben ơi, nếu ông làm rơi giọt nào trong xe mới toanh của tôi, thì tôi sẽ xử hai bé bi của ông.”
tr: “Ben, eğer yepyeni arabama çiş bulaştırırsan, toplarını kesip koparacağım.
es: —Ben, si me salpicas de meados el coche nuevo, te corto las pelotas.
vi_translation: "Ben, if you spill a drop in my brand new car, I'll deal with your two little balls."
tr_translation: "Ben, if you get pee on my brand new car, I'll cut off your balls.""
es_translation: —Ben, if you splash my new car with piss, I'll cut your balls off.

en: Still peeing, Ben looks over at me, smirking. “You’re gonna need a hell of a big knife, bro.” And then finally I hear the stream slow. He’s soon finished, and then in one swift motion he throws the new bottle out the window. The full one follows.
vi: Vẫn đang tiểu, Ben nhìn sang tôi cười gian manh. “Ông sẽ cần đến một con dao to quỉ khốc thần sầu đấy.” Rồi cuối cùng tôi nghe thấy dòng chảy chậm lại. Nó sắp xong rồi, và bằng động tác nhanh như cắt nó ném cái chai mới qua cửa sổ. Tiếp theo là chai đầy.
tr: Hâlâ işeyen Ben bana bakıp sırıtıyor. “Gerçekten büyük bir bıçağa ihtiyacın olacak, kardeşim.” Sonra nihayet akışın yavaşladığını duyuyorum. Kısa süre sonra işini bitiriyor ve tek bir çevik hareketle yeni şişeyi pencereden dışarı atıyor. Dolu olan da onu takip ediyor.
es: Levanta los ojos hacia mí y me lanza una sonrisa de superioridad sin dejar de mear. —Vas a necesitar un cuchillo gigante, colega —me contesta. Y por fin oigo que el chorro afloja. Acaba enseguida, y con un movimiento rápido lanza la segunda botella por la ventana. Y después la primera.
vi_translation: Still peeing, Ben looked over at me with a sly smile. "You're going to need a huge, terrifying knife." Then finally, I heard the flow slow down. It was almost done, and with a swift motion, he threw the new bottle out the window. Next came the full bottle.
tr_translation: Ben, who is still peeing, looks at me and grins. "You really need a big knife, brother." Then I finally hear the flow slowing down. Soon after, he finishes his business and with a single swift motion, throws the new bottle out the window. The full one follows it.
es_translation: He lifts his eyes towards me and throws me a superior smile without stopping peeing. —You're going to need a giant knife, buddy —he replies to me. And finally I hear that the stream weakens. It ends quickly, and with a swift motion, he throws the second bottle out the window. And then the first one.

en: Lacey is fake-gagging—or maybe really gagging. Radar says, “God, did you wake up this morning and drink eighteen gallons of water?”
vi: Lacey giả vờ–mà cũng có thể thực sự–bụm miệng ọe. Radar nói, “Trời ơi, sáng nay ông tỉnh dậy và uống mười tám ga-lông nước hả?”
tr: Lacey yalandan öğürüyor... ya da belki gerçekten öğürüyor. Radar, “Tanrım, bu sabah uyanıp yetmiş litre su mu içtin?” diyor.
es: Lacey finge tener arcadas, o quizá las tiene de verdad. —Joder, ¿te has despertado esta mañana y te has bebido setenta litros de agua? —dice Radar.
vi_translation: Lacey pretended—or maybe actually—covered her mouth and gagged. Radar said, "Oh my God, did you wake up this morning and drink eighteen gallons of water?"
tr_translation: Lacey is fake gagging... or maybe she's really gagging. Radar says, "God, did you wake up and drink seventy liters of water this morning?"
es_translation: Lacey pretends to gag, or maybe she really is gagging. —Damn, did you wake up this morning and drink seventy liters of water? —says Radar.

en: But Ben is beaming. He is holding his fists in the air, triumphant, and he is shouting, “Not a drop on the seat! I’m Ben Starling. First clarinet, WPHS Marching Band. Keg Stand Record Holder. Pee-in-the-car champion. I shook up the world! I must be the greatest!”
vi: Nhưng Ben cười nhăn nhở. Nó đắc thắng đấm vào không khí, reo hò inh ỏi, “Không rơi giọt nào ra xe! Mình là Ben Starling. Cây clarinet số một của dàn diễu hành trường Winter Park. Quán Quân Bom Bia! Vô địch tiểu-ở-trong-xe. Mình làm rung chuyển thế giới! Mình là người xuất sắc nhất!”
tr: Ama Ben’in gözleri parlıyor. Yumruklarını zafer edasıyla havaya kaldırıyor ve bağırıyor: “Koltukta bir damla bile yok! Benim adım Ben Starling. WPL bandosunda, birinci klarnet. Fıçı duruşu rekortmeni. Arabada işeme şampiyonu. Dünyayı yerinden oynattım! En büyük benim!
es: Pero Ben está radiante. Levanta el puño triunfante, y grita: —¡Ni una gota en el asiento! Soy Ben Starling. Primer clarinete de la banda del Winter Park. Récord de keg stand. Campeón de mear en coche. ¡Que tiemble el mundo! ¡Soy el mejor!
vi_translation: But Ben grinned widely. He triumphantly punched the air, shouting loudly, "Not a drop spilled in the car! I am Ben Starling. The number one clarinet of the Winter Park school marching band. Beer Pong Champion! Car-internal champion. I shake the world! I am the best!”
tr_translation: But Ben's eyes are shining. He raises his fists in a gesture of victory and shouts: "Not a single drop on the seat! My name is Ben Starling. First clarinet in the WPL band. Barrel stance record holder. Champion of peeing in the car. I moved the world! I am the greatest!"
es_translation: But Ben is radiant. He raises his triumphant fist and shouts: —Not a drop on the seat! I'm Ben Starling. First clarinet of the Winter Park band. Keg stand record holder. Champion of peeing in the car. Let the world tremble! I'm the best!

en: Thirty-five minutes later, as our third hour comes to a close, he asks in a small voice, “When are we stopping again?”
vi: Ba mươi lăm phút sau, sau khi xuất phát được gần ba tiếng đồng hồ, Ben thỏ thẻ hỏi, “Khi nào chúng ta lại dừng?”
tr: Otuz beş dakika sonra, üçüncü saatimiz biterken kısık sesle soruyor: “Ne zaman duruyorduk?
es: Treinta y cinco minutos después, cuando llevamos ya casi tres horas de camino, pregunta en voz baja: —¿Cuándo vamos a parar?
vi_translation: Thirty-five minutes later, after having been on the road for nearly three hours, Ben softly asked, "When will we stop again?"
tr_translation: Thirty-five minutes later, as our third hour is ending, he asks in a low voice: "When were we stopping?"
es_translation: Thirty-five minutes later, when we have already been on the road for almost three hours, he asks in a low voice: —When are we going to stop?

en: “One hour and three minutes, if Q keeps pace,” Radar answers.
vi: “Một tiếng và ba phút nữa, nếu Q duy trì được tốc độ,” Radar đáp.
tr: “Bir saat üç dakika sonra, eğer Q aynı hızı korursa,” diye cevaplıyor Radar.
es: —Dentro de una hora y tres minutos, si Q mantiene el ritmo —le contesta Radar.
vi_translation: "One hour and three minutes more, if Q can maintain the speed," Radar replied.
tr_translation: “In one hour and three minutes, if Q maintains the same speed,” answers Radar.
es_translation: —In one hour and three minutes, if Q keeps the pace —Radar answers him.

en: “Okay,” Ben says. “Okay. Good. Because I have to pee.”
vi: “Được rồi,” Ben nói. “Được. Tốt. Vì tôi phải đi tiểu.
tr: “Tamam,” diyor Ben. “Tamam. İyi. Çünkü çişimi yapmam gerek.
es: —Vale —dice Ben—. Vale. Bien. Porque tengo que mear.
vi_translation: “Alright,” Ben said. “Okay. Good. Because I need to pee.”
tr_translation: “Okay,” says Ben. “Okay. Good. Because I need to pee.”
es_translation: —Okay —says Ben—. Okay. Fine. Because I have to pee.

en: Hour Four
vi: Giờ thứ tư
tr: Dördüncü Saat
es: HORA CUATRO
vi_translation: Fourth hour
tr_translation: Fourth Hour
es_translation: HOUR FOUR

en: For the first time, Lacey asks, “Are we there yet?” We laugh.
vi: Lần đầu tiên Lacey hỏi, “Sắp đến chưa?” Chúng tôi cười rộ.
tr: İlk defa Lacey, “Daha gelmedik mi?” diye soruyor. Gülüyoruz.
es: —¿Ya llegamos? —pregunta Lacey por primera vez. Nos reímos.
vi_translation: The first time Lacey asked, "Are we there yet?" We burst out laughing.
tr_translation: For the first time, Lacey asks, "Aren't we there yet?" We laugh.
es_translation: —Are we there yet? —asks Lacey for the first time. We laughed.

en: We are, however, in Georgia, a state I love and adore for this reason and this reason only: the speed limit here is seventy, which means I can up my speed to seventy-seven. Aside from that, Georgia reminds me of Florida.
vi: Nhưng chúng tôi đang ở Georgia, bang tôi vừa yêu vừa mến vì một và chỉ một lí do: tốc độ giới hạn ở đây là bảy mươi, tức là tôi có thể tăng tốc lên bảy mươi bảy. Bên cạnh đó, Georgia khiến tôi nhớ đến Florida.
tr: Ne var ki Georgia’dayız, sadece ve sadece tek bir nedenle sevdiğim ve taptığım eyalette: Burada hız sının yüz on beş kilometre ve bu da hızımı yüz yirmi dokuza yükseltebilirim demek oluyor. Bunun yam sıra, Georgia bana Florida’yı hatırlatıyor.
es: Pero estamos en Georgia, un estado que amo y adoro única y exclusivamente por la siguiente razón: el límite de velocidad es de ciento diez, lo que significa que puedo subir a ciento veinticinco. Por lo demás, Georgia me recuerda a Florida.
vi_translation: But we were in Georgia, a state I both love and cherish for one and only one reason: the speed limit here is seventy, which means I can speed up to seventy-seven. Besides that, Georgia reminds me of Florida.
tr_translation: However, we are in Georgia, the state I love and adore for one reason and one reason only: The speed limit here is one hundred fifteen kilometers per hour, which means I can increase my speed to one hundred twenty-nine. Besides, Georgia reminds me of Florida.
es_translation: But we are in Georgia, a state I love and adore solely and exclusively for the following reason: the speed limit is one hundred and ten, which means I can go up to one hundred and twenty-five. Otherwise, Georgia reminds me of Florida.

en: We spend the hour preparing for our first stop. This is an important stop, because I am very, very, very, very hungry and dehydrated. For some reason, talking about the food we’ll buy at the BP eases the pangs. Lacey prepares a grocery list for each of us, written in small letters on the backs of receipts she found in her purse. She makes Ben lean out the passenger-side window to see which side the gas cap is on. She forces us to memorize our grocery lists and then quizzes us. We talk through our visit to the gas station several times; it needs to be as well-executed as a stock car pit stop.
vi: Chúng tôi dành cả tiếng chuẩn bị cho chặng dừng đầu tiên. Dừng lần này quan trọng, vì tôi đang rất, rất, rất, rất đói và mất nước. Chẳng hiểu sao, nói đến những đồ ăn chúng tôi sẽ mua ở BP khiến cơn cồn cào dịu lại. Lacey lập danh mục các mặt hàng cho từng người, viết chữ thật nhỏ lên mặt sau những hóa đơn còn trong ví của cậu ấy. Lacey bảo Ben hãy thò đầu qua cửa sổ chỗ ghế trước xem nắp bình xăng ở phía bên nào. Cậu ấy bắt bọn tôi ghi nhớ danh mục và kiểm tra xem đã thuộc chưa. Chúng tôi ôn đi ôn lại các việc ở trạm xăng, tất cả cần trơn tru mau lẹ như một chiếc xe đua dừng ở đường pit.
tr: Bu saati ilk molamıza hazırlanarak geçiriyoruz. Bu önemli bir mola, çünkü çok çok çok çok aç ve susuzum. Nedense, BFde alacağımız yiyecekler hakkında konuşmak, mide ağrılarım dindinyor. Lacey, çantasında bulduğu makbuzların arkasına her bilimiz için, küçük harflerle yazılmış alışveriş listeleri hazırlıyor. Benzin kapağının ne tarafta olduğunu görmesi için Ben’in ön koltuğun penceresinden dışarı sarkmasını istiyor. Bizi yiyecek listelerimizi ezberlemeye zorluyor ve sonra sınav yapıyor. Benzin istasyonuna olan ziyaretimizi baştan sona birçok kez tartışıyoruz; bunun bir yarış arabasının pit duruşu kadar iyi uygulanması gerek.
es: Pasamos la cuarta hora preparando nuestra primera parada. Es una parada importante, porque tengo mucha mucha mucha mucha hambre y estoy deshidratado. Por alguna razón, hablar de la comida que vamos a comprar en la gasolinera alivia las punzadas. Lacey prepara una lista de la compra para cada uno de nosotros, que escribe con letra pequeña en la parte de atrás de los tíquets que había encontrado en su bolso. Le pide a Ben que se asome por la ventanilla del copiloto para ver en qué lado está la tapa del depósito de gasolina. Nos obliga a memorizar la lista y luego nos la pregunta. Repasamos la incursión en la gasolinera varias veces. Tiene que ser tan eficaz como una parada en boxes.
vi_translation: We spent an entire hour preparing for the first stop. This stop was important because I was very, very, very, very hungry and dehydrated. For some reason, talking about the food we would buy at BP made the hunger pangs subside. Lacey made a list of items for each person, writing very small on the back of the receipts still in his wallet. Lacey told Ben to stick his head out the front seat window to see which side the gas cap was on. He made us memorize the list and check if we had it down. We went over the tasks at the gas station repeatedly, everything needed to be smooth and quick like a race car stopping at the pit lane.
tr_translation: We are spending this hour preparing for our first break. This is an important break because I am very, very, very, very hungry and thirsty. For some reason, talking about the food we will get at BF eases my stomach pains. Lacey is preparing shopping lists for each of us, written in small letters on the back of receipts she found in her bag. She asks Ben to lean out of the front seat window to see which side the gas cap is on. She forces us to memorize our food lists and then quizzes us. We discuss our visit to the gas station from start to finish many times; it needs to be executed as well as a pit stop for a race car.
es_translation: We spent the fourth hour preparing for our first stop. It's an important stop because I am very very very very hungry and dehydrated. For some reason, talking about the food we are going to buy at the gas station eases the pangs. Lacey prepares a shopping list for each of us, which she writes in small letters on the back of the receipts she found in her purse. She asks Ben to lean out the passenger window to see which side the gas tank cap is on. She makes us memorize the list and then quizzes us on it. We review the gas station raid several times. It has to be as efficient as a pit stop.

en: “One more time,” Lacey says.
vi: “Tổng duyệt lần nữa,” Lacey nói.
tr: “Bir kez daha,” diyor Lacey.
es: —Otra vez —dice Lacey.
vi_translation: “Final rehearsal again,” Lacey said.
tr_translation: “Once more,” says Lacey.
es_translation: —Again —says Lacey.

en: “I’m the gas man,” Radar says. “After I start the fill-up, I run inside while the pump is pumping even though I’m supposed to stay near the pump at all times, and I give you the card. Then I return to the gas.”
vi: “Tớ phụ trách xăng,” Radar nói. “Sau khi khởi động cây xăng, tớ chạy vào trong trong khi vòi bơm vẫn hoạt động, dù theo luật tớ phải liên tục đứng cạnh cây xăng, và đưa thẻ cho cậu. Rồi tớ chạy về cây xăng.
tr: “Ben benzini dolduracağım,” diyor Radar. “Doldurmaya başladıktan sonra, normalde arabanın yamnda kalmam gerekse de pompa pompalarken içeri koşup size kartı veriyorum. Sonra arabanın başma geri dönüyorum.
es: —Soy el hombre de la gasolina —dice Radar—. En cuanto empiece a llenarse el depósito, entro corriendo mientras el surtidor bombea gasolina, aunque se supone que no puedo moverme del surtidor en ningún momento, y te doy la tarjeta. Luego vuelvo al surtidor.
vi_translation: “I'll handle the gas,” Radar said. “After starting the pump, I'll run inside while the nozzle is still pumping, even though by law I have to stay by the pump, and give you the card. Then I'll run back to the pump.”
tr_translation: “I will fill up the gas,” says Radar. “After I start filling, although I normally need to stay by the car, I run inside to give you the card while the pump is pumping. Then I return to the car.”
es_translation: —I am the gas man —says Radar—. As soon as the tank starts filling up, I run inside while the pump is pumping gas, even though I'm not supposed to leave the pump at any time, and I give you the card. Then I go back to the pump.

en: “I take the card to the guy behind the counter,” Lacey says.
vi: “Tớ đưa thẻ cho anh ở quầy thanh toán,” Lacey nói.
tr: “Ben kartı kasadaki adama götürüyorum,” diyor Lacey.
es: —Yo le doy la tarjeta al tipo que esté en el mostrador —dice Lacey.
vi_translation: “I gave the card to the guy at the checkout counter,” Lacey said.
tr_translation: "I'm taking the card to the man at the counter," says Lacey.
es_translation: —I give the card to the guy at the counter —says Lacey.

en: “Or girl,” I add.
vi: “Hoặc chị,” tôi bổ sung.
tr: “Ya da kadına,” diye ekliyorum.
es: —O chica —añado.
vi_translation: "Or you," I added.
tr_translation: "Or to the woman," I add.
es_translation: —Oh girl —I add.

en: “Not relevant,” Lacey answers.
vi: “Chả liên quan,” Lacey nói.
tr: “Alakasız,” diye cevap veriyor Lacey.
es: —No es importante —me contesta Lacey.
vi_translation: "It's irrelevant," Lacey said.
tr_translation: “Irrelevant,” Lacey replies.
es_translation: —It's not important —Lacey answers me.

en: “I’m just saying—don’t be so sexist.”
vi: “Tớ chỉ muốn nói–cậu đừng phân biệt giới thế chứ.”
tr: “Sadece söylemek istedim... bu kadar seksist olma.
es: —Solo digo que… no seas tan sexista.
vi_translation: "I just want to say—don't be sexist."
tr_translation: “I just wanted to say... don't be so sexist.”
es_translation: —I'm just saying... don't be so sexist.

en: “Oh whatever, Q. I take the card to the person behind the counter. I tell her or him to ring up everything we bring. Then I pee.”
vi: “Ừ, sao cũng được. Tớ đưa thẻ cho người đứng ở quầy toán. Tớ bảo anh hoặc chị ấy hãy nhập ngay tất cả những gì bọn mình mang ra. Rồi tớ đi tiểu.”
tr: “Of, her neyse, Q. Ben kartı kasadaki kişiye götürüyorum. Kadına ya da adama getirdiğimiz her şeyi kasadan geçirmesini söylüyorum. Sonra çişimi yapıyorum.
es: —Da igual, Q. Le doy la tarjeta a la persona que esté en el mostrador. Le digo que pase todo lo que llevamos. Y me voy a hacer pis.
vi_translation: “Okay, whatever. I give the card to the person at the checkout counter. I tell him or her to immediately enter everything we are taking out. Then I go to the bathroom.”
tr_translation: "Oh, whatever, Q." "I take the card to the person at the checkout." "I tell the woman or man to scan everything we brought." "Then I go to the bathroom.""
es_translation: —It doesn't matter, Q. I'll give the card to the person at the counter. I'll tell them to ring up everything we have. And I'm going to go pee.

en: I add, “Meanwhile, I’m getting everything on my list and bringing it up to the front.”
vi: Tôi nói thêm, “Trong khi đó, tớ lấy các thứ trong danh mục của mình và mang đến quầy thanh toán.
tr: Ekliyorum: “Bu sırada listemdeki her şeyi alıp ön tarafa getiriyorum.
es: —Entretanto, yo estoy cogiendo todo lo de mi lista y lo llevo al mostrador —añado.
vi_translation: I added, "Meanwhile, I'll take the items from my list and bring them to the checkout counter.""
tr_translation: I'm adding: "In the meantime, I'm taking everything on my list and bringing it to the front."
es_translation: —Meanwhile, I am picking up everything on my list and taking it to the counter —I add.

en: Ben says, “And I’m peeing. Then when I finish peeing, I’ll get the stuff on my list.”
vi: Ben nói, “Tớ đi tiểu. Sau khi tiểu xong tớ sẽ lấy các thứ trong danh mục của mình.”
tr: Ben, ‘Ve ben çişimi yapıyorum. Sonra çişimi yapmayı bitirince, listemdeki malzemeleri alıyorum,” diyor.
es: —Y yo estoy meando —dice Ben—. Cuando acabo de mear, cojo las cosas de mi lista.
vi_translation: Ben said, "I need to pee." "After I finish peeing, I will get the items on my list."
tr_translation: Ben, 'And I am peeing.' Then, when I finish peeing, I get the items on my list," he says.
es_translation: —And I'm peeing —says Ben—. When I finish peeing, I grab the things from my list.

en: “Most importantly shirts,” Radar says. “People keep looking at me funny.”
vi: “Quan trọng nhất là áo,” Radar nói. “Người ta cứ nhìn tớ cười cười.
tr: “En önemlisi tişörtler,” diyor Radar, “insanlar bana tuhaf bakıyor.
es: —Lo más importante son las camisetas —dice Radar—. La gente no deja de mirarme y de sonreír.
vi_translation: “The most important thing is the shirt,” Radar said. “People keep looking at me and laughing.”
tr_translation: “The most important thing is the t-shirts,” says Radar, “people look at me strangely.”
es_translation: —The most important thing is the T-shirts —says Radar—. People keep looking at me and smiling.

en: Lacey says, “I sign the receipt when I get out of the bathroom.”
vi: Lacey nói, “Tớ kí vào hóa đơn sau khi ra từ nhà vệ sinh.”
tr: Lacey, “Tuvaletten çıkınca makbuzu imzalıyorum,” diyor.
es: —Yo firmo el tíquet cuando salgo del baño —dice Lacey.
vi_translation: Lacey said, "I signed the bill after coming out of the restroom."
tr_translation: Lacey says, "I'll sign the receipt after I come out of the bathroom."
es_translation: —I sign the ticket when I leave the bathroom —says Lacey.

en: “And then the moment the tank is full, I’m going to get in the minivan and drive away, so y’all had better be in there. I will seriously leave your asses. You have six minutes,” Radar says.
vi: “Ngay khi xăng đầy bình, tớ sẽ vào xe và phóng đi luôn, vậy các bồ tèo nên có mặt trong xe rồi. Tớ sẽ nghiêm túc để cái mông của các bồ lại nếu mọi người không đúng giờ. Chúng ta có sáu phút,” Radar nói.
tr: “Depo dolduğu anda minivana binip gideceğim, bu yüzden orada olsaniz iyi olur. Cidden kıçlarınızı burada bırakırım. Altı dakikanız var,” diyor Radar.
es: —Y en cuanto el depósito esté lleno, me meto en el coche y arranco, así que más os vale estar todos dentro. Si no, os juro que os dejo tirados. Tenéis seis minutos —dice Radar.
vi_translation: "As soon as the tank is full, I'll get in the car and drive off immediately, so you guys should already be in the car. I'll seriously leave your butts behind if you're not on time. We have six minutes," Radar said.
tr_translation: “As soon as the tank is full, I'm getting in the minivan and leaving, so you better be there. Seriously, I'll leave your asses here. You have six minutes,” says Radar.
es_translation: —And as soon as the tank is full, I'm getting in the car and starting it, so you all better be inside. If not, I swear I'll leave you behind. You have six minutes —says Radar.

en: “Six minutes,” I say, nodding my head. And Lacey and Ben repeat it also. “Six minutes.” “Six minutes.” At 5:35 P.M., with nine hundred miles to go, Radar informs us that, according to his handheld, the next exit will have a BP.
vi: “Sáu phút,” tôi nói, gật gật đầu. Lacey và Ben cũng nhắc lại. “Sáu phút. “Sáu phút.” Vào 5:35 chiều, với chín trăm dặm đã đi, Radar thông báo rằng, theo máy tính cầm tay của nó, lối ra tiếp theo sẽ có một trạm BP.
tr: “Altı dakika,” diyorum başımı sallayarak. Lacey ile Ben de tekrar ediyorlar. “Altı dakika.” “Altı dakika.” Öğleden sonra 17:35’te, gidilecek bin dört yüz elli kilometrelik yol varken Radar bize, el bilgisayarına göre sonraki çıkışta bir BP olduğunu bildiriyor.
es: —Seis minutos —digo asintiendo. —Seis minutos —repiten también Lacey y Ben. A las 5:35 de la tarde, con mil cuatrocientos kilómetros por delante, Radar nos informa de que, según su ordenador, en la siguiente salida hay una gasolinera BP.
vi_translation: “Six minutes,” I said, nodding my head. Lacey and Ben repeated. “Six minutes.” "Six minutes." At 5:35 PM, with nine hundred miles traveled, Radar announced that, according to its handheld computer, the next exit would have a BP station.
tr_translation: “Six minutes,” I say, nodding my head. Lacey and Ben repeat it too. “Six minutes.” “Six minutes.” At 5:35 in the afternoon, While there are one thousand four hundred and fifty kilometers to go, Radar informs us, according to the handheld computer, that there is a BP at the next exit.
es_translation: —Six minutes —I say, nodding. —Six minutes —repeat Lacey and Ben as well. At 5:35 in the afternoon, with fourteen hundred kilometers ahead of us, Radar informs us that, according to his computer, there is a BP gas station at the next exit.

en: As I pull into the gas station, Lacey and Radar are crouched behind the sliding door in the back. Ben, seat belt unbuckled, has one hand on the passenger-door handle and the other on the dashboard. I maintain as much speed as I can for as long as I can, and then slam on the brakes right in front of the gas tank. The minivan jolts to a halt, and we fly out the doors. Radar and I cross in front of the car; I toss him the keys and then run all out to the food mart. Lacey and Ben have beaten me to the doors, but only just barely. While Ben bolts for the bathroom, Lacey explains to the gray-haired woman (it is a woman!) that we’re going to be buying a lot of stuff, and that we’re in a huge hurry, and that she should just ring items up as we deliver them and that it will all go on her BP card, and the woman seems a little bewildered but agrees. Radar runs in, his robe aflutter, and hands Lacey the card.
vi: Trong khi tôi tấp xe gần vào trạm, Lacey và Radar đã trong tư thế sẵn sàng sau cánh cửa trượt ở hông xe. Ben, đã tháo đai an toàn, đặt một tay lên chỗ mở cửa, tay kia trên bảng điều khiển. Tôi cố gắng giữ tốc độ cao nhất có thể, trong lâu nhất có thể, rồi dận phanh ngay trước cây xăng. Chiếc xe khựng lại, bọn tôi vọt ra khỏi xe. Radar và tôi cắt nhau trước mũi xe, tôi ném chìa khóa cho nó và chạy một mạch vào cửa hàng tạp phẩm. Lacey và Ben cán cửa trước tôi, nhưng chỉ trước chút xíu. Trong khi Ben vắt chân chạy vào nhà vệ sinh, Lacey giải thích với người phụ nữ tóc muối tiêu (hóa ra là một bác gái!) rằng chúng tôi sẽ mua rất nhiều và đang rất vội, nên bác cứ nhập hóa đơn ngay khi bọn tôi mang đồ ra quầy, tất cả sẽ được thanh toán bằng thẻ BP của Lacey. Bác gái có vẻ không hiểu mô tê gì, nhưng cũng đồng ý. Radar chạy vào, áo chùng bồng bềnh, đưa thẻ cho Lacey.
tr: Ben benzin istasyonuna çekerken, Lacey ile Radar arkadaki sürgülü kapının yanında çömelmişler. Kemeri çözülmüş olan Ben’iıı bir eli ön kapının kolunda, diğeri de panelin üstünde. Yapabileceğim kadar uzun süre boyunca, koruyabileceğim kadar hızı koruyorum ve sonra benzin pompasının tam önünde frene asılıyorum. Minivan sarsılarak duruyor ve uçarak kapılardan dışarı çıkıyoruz. Arabanın önünde Radarla karşılaşıyoruz; anahtarları ona atıyorum ve markete kadar bütün yolu koşuyorum. Lacey ile Ben kapıya giderken beni geçmişler ama sadece çok az. Ben tuvalete doğru fırlarken, Lacey gri saçh kadına (bir kadm gerçekten!) bir sürü şey alacağımızı, çok acelemiz olduğunu, biz getirdikçe ürünleri kasadan geçirmesi gerektiğini ve hepsinin BP kartından alınacağını açıklıyor; kadm biraz afallamış görünüyor ama onaylıyor. Radar cübbesi uçuşarak içeri koşuyor ve Lacey’ye kartı veriyor.
es: Mientras entro en la gasolinera, Lacey y Radar se agachan detrás de la puerta corredera de la parte de atrás. Ben, con el cinturón de seguridad desabrochado, tiene una mano en el tirador de la puerta del copiloto y la otra en el salpicadero. Mantengo la máxima velocidad que puedo durante el máximo tiempo que puedo, y luego freno en seco delante del dispensador de gasolina. El monovolumen pega una sacudida y salimos a toda velocidad. Radar y yo nos cruzamos delante del coche. Le tiro las llaves y corro hacia la sección de comida. Lacey y Ben me empujan contra las puertas, pero no es grave. Mientras Ben corre al baño, Lacey le explica a la mujer de pelo canoso (es efectivamente una mujer) que vamos a comprar un montón de cosas, que tenemos muchísima prisa y que vaya pasando los artículos a medida que los vayamos dejando, que lo cargue todo a su tarjeta BP. La mujer parece algo desconcertada, pero acepta. Radar entra corriendo, con la toga volando, y le da la tarjeta a Lacey.
vi_translation: As I pulled the car close to the station, Lacey and Radar were ready by the sliding door on the side of the car. Ben, having unbuckled his seatbelt, placed one hand on the door handle and the other on the dashboard. I tried to maintain the highest speed possible for as long as possible, then slammed the brakes right in front of the gas station. The car jerked to a stop, and we burst out of the car. Radar and I crossed paths in front of the car, I tossed the keys to him and sprinted straight into the convenience store. Lacey and Ben reached the door before me, but just barely. While Ben dashed into the restroom, Lacey explained to the salt-and-pepper-haired woman (who turned out to be an older lady!) that we were going to buy a lot and were in a hurry, so she should start ringing up the items as soon as we brought them to the counter, and everything would be paid for with Lacey's BP card. The older lady seemed a bit confused, but agreed nonetheless. Radar ran in, his robe billowing, and handed the card to Lacey.
tr_translation: As I pull into the gas station, Lacey and Radar are crouched by the sliding door in the back. Ben, whose seatbelt is unfastened, has one hand on the front door handle and the other on the panel. I maintain as much speed as I can for as long as I can, and then I slam on the brakes right in front of the gas pump. The minivan comes to a jarring stop, and we fly out of the doors. We meet Radar in front of the car; I toss him the keys and run all the way to the store. Lacey and Ben have passed me on their way to the door, but only just barely. As Ben darts towards the restroom, Lacey explains to the gray-haired woman (a woman, really!) that we’re going to buy a lot of things, we’re in a big hurry, she needs to ring up the items as we bring them, and it will all be charged to the BP card; the woman looks a bit bewildered but agrees. Radar runs in with his robe flapping and hands the card to Lacey.
es_translation: As I enter the gas station, Lacey and Radar crouch behind the sliding door in the back. Ben, with his seatbelt unbuckled, has one hand on the passenger door handle and the other on the dashboard. I maintain the highest speed I can for as long as I can, and then brake hard in front of the gas pump. The minivan jerks and we rush out at full speed. Radar and I cross paths in front of the car. I toss him the keys and run towards the food section. Lacey and Ben push me against the doors, but it's not serious. While Ben runs to the bathroom, Lacey explains to the gray-haired woman (it is indeed a woman) that we are going to buy a lot of things, that we are in a huge hurry, and that she should start scanning the items as we bring them, charging everything to her BP card. The woman looks somewhat bewildered, but agrees. Radar runs in, with his gown flying, and hands the card to Lacey.

en: Meanwhile, I’m running through the aisles getting everything on my list. Lacey’s on liquids; Ben’s on nonperishable supplies; I’m on food. I sweep through the place like I’m a cheetah and the tortilla chips are injured gazelles. I run an armful of chips and beef jerky and peanuts to the front counter, then jog to the candy aisle. A handful of Mentos, a handful of Snickers, and— Oh, it’s not on the list, but screw it, I love Nerds, so I add three packages of Nerds. I run back and then head over to the “deli” counter, which consists of ancient turkey sandwiches wherein the turkey strongly resembles ham. I grab two of those. On my way back to the cash register, I stop for a couple Starbursts, a package of Twinkies, and an indeterminate number of GoFast nutrition bars. I run back. Ben’s standing there in his graduation gown, handing the woman T-shirts and four-dollar sunglasses. Lacey runs up with gallons of soda, energy drinks, and bottles of water. Big bottles, the kind of bottles that even Ben’s pee can’t fill.
vi: Trong khi đó, tôi chạy dọc các gian hàng để lấy các thứ trong danh mục của mình. Lacey phụ trách đồ uống, Ben đảm nhận các đồ không tươi sống, tôi lấy thực phẩm. Tôi quét qua nơi này như thể tôi là báo gấm và đám khoai tây chiên đóng gói là đàn linh dương đã trúng thương. Tôi ôm cả đống khoai tây chiên, thịt bò khô và lạc chạy lại quầy, rồi lao tiếp đến khu kẹo. Một nắm kẹo Mentos, một nắm kẹo Snickers, và–ồ, không có trong danh mục, nhưng kệ, tôi thích kẹo Nerds, nên lấy luôn ba gói. Tôi chạy về quầy thanh toán rồi tiếp tục với đồ ăn tươi, gồm có bánh kẹp thịt gà tây kiểu cổ điển, trong đó gà tây giống hệt thịt xông khói. Tôi lấy hai. Trên đường ra quầy thanh toán, tôi dừng lại lấy ít kẹo Starburst và bánh Twinkies, thêm một lượng không xác định các thanh dinh dưỡng GoFast. Tôi chạy ra quầy. Ben đang đứng đó trong bộ áo chùng tốt nghiệp, đưa thanh toán áo phông và kính râm loại bốn đô-la. Lacey chạy đến với mấy ga-lông xô-đa, nước tăng lực, và nước đóng chai. Những chai lớn, loại mà kể cả nước tiểu của Ben cũng không đong đầy được.
tr: Bu sırada ben reyonların arasında koşarak listemdekileri alıyorum. Lacey içeceklerde; Ben dayanıklı ürünlerde; bense yiyeceklerdeyim. Marketi, ben bir çitaymışım, cipsler de yaralı ceylanlarmış gibi hızla silip süpürüyorum. Bir kucak dolusu cips, kurutulmuş et ve yer fıstığıyla ön kasaya koşuyorum, sonra şeker reyonuna dönüyorum. Bir avuç dolusu Mentos, bir avuç dolusu Snickers ve... Ah, listede yok ama boş ver, Nerds’e bayılırım... Böylece üç paket de Nerds ekliyorum. Tekrar koşuyorum ve sonra, içindeki hindi fazlasıyla jambona benzeyen, antik dönemden kalma hindi sandviçlerinden oluşan meze reyonuna yöneliyorum. İki tane alıyorum.
