es_translation: Scattered across the carpet under the passenger seat is the dispatch, which contains a map of the United States that Ben picked up at the gas station, the routes I printed out, and the piece of paper on which Radar did the calculations about speed and distance. Radar is in the driver's seat. The dining room. It looks a lot like the living room, but in the dining room, you can't relax as much. It's also cleaner.

en: Between the living room and the den, we have the center console, or kitchen. Here we keep a plentiful supply of beef jerky and GoFast bars and this magical energy drink called Bluefin, which Lacey put on the shopping list. Bluefin comes in small, fancily contoured glass bottles, and it tastes like blue cotton candy. It also keeps you awake better than anything in all of human history, although it makes you a bit twitchy. Radar and I have agreed to keep drinking it until two hours before our rest periods. Mine starts at midnight, when Ben gets up.
vi: Giữa phòng khách và phòng thư giãn, bọn tôi có bộ điều khiển trung tâm, hoặc là phòng bếp. Ở đây tích trữ rất nhiều nhu yếu phẩm như thịt bò khô, các thanh GoFast, thứ đồ uống tăng lực kì diệu hiệu Bluefin mà Lacey đã kê vào danh mục mua sắm. Bluefin được đóng vào các chai thủy tinh nhỏ, cong đầy gợi cảm, có vị như kẹo bông màu xanh da trời. Nó cũng khiến ta tỉnh táo hơn bất cứ thứ gì trong lịch sử nhân loại, có điều uống xong sẽ cảm thấy hơi bồn chồn. Radar và tôi thống nhất rằng sẽ tiếp tục uống cho đến hai tiếng trước ca nghỉ của hai thằng. Ca của tôi bắt đầu lúc nửa đêm, khi Ben thức dậy.
tr: Oturma odası ile dinlenme odasının arasında orta konsolumuz var, ya da mutfağımız. Burada bol bol kurutulmuş et stokumuz, GoFast gofretlerimiz ve Lacey’nin alışveriş listesine koyduğu Bluefin adındaki sihirli enerji içeceğimiz var. Bluefin küçük, havalı şeritleri olan cam şişelerde satılıyor ve tadı mavi pamuk şeker gibi. Ayrıca sizi insanlık tarihindeki her şeyden daha iyi uyamk tutuyor, bununla birlikte biraz seğirmenize neden oluyor. Radar’la, dinlenme periyotlarımızdan iki saat önceye kadar Bluefin içmeye devam etme konusunda anlaştık. Benimki geceyarısı başlıyor, Ben kalkınca.
es: Entre el comedor y la sala tenemos el compartimento central, o la cocina. Aquí tenemos una buena reserva de cecina, barritas y una bebida energética mágica llamada Bluefin, que Lacey había añadido a la lista de la compra. El Bluefin está envasado en pequeñas botellas de cristal de forma estrambótica y sabe a algodón de azúcar azul. También te mantiene despierto mejor que cualquier otra cosa en toda la historia de la humanidad, aunque te pone algo nervioso. Radar y yo hemos decidido tomarlo hasta dos horas antes de nuestro turno de descanso. El mío empieza a las doce, cuando Ben se levante.
vi_translation: Between the living room and the relaxation room, we have a central control unit, or the kitchen. Here, we store a lot of essentials like beef jerky, GoFast bars, and the miraculous energy drink Bluefin that Lacey added to the shopping list. Bluefin is packaged in small, curvy glass bottles, with a taste reminiscent of blue cotton candy. It also makes you more alert than anything in human history, though it does leave you feeling a bit jittery afterward. Radar and I agreed to keep drinking it until two hours before our shift break. My shift starts at midnight, when Ben wakes up.
tr_translation: We have a central console between the living room and the lounge, or our kitchen. Here, we have plenty of dried meat stock, GoFast wafers, and our magical energy drink called Bluefin, which Lacey added to the shopping list. Bluefin is sold in small glass bottles with cool stripes and tastes like blue cotton candy. It also keeps you awake better than anything in human history, although it does cause a bit of twitching. Radar and I agreed to keep drinking Bluefin until two hours before our rest periods. Mine starts at midnight, when Ben wakes up.
es_translation: Between the dining room and the living room, we have the central compartment, or the kitchen. Here we have a good supply of jerky, bars, and a magical energy drink called Bluefin, which Lacey had added to the shopping list. Bluefin is packaged in small, oddly-shaped glass bottles and tastes like blue cotton candy. It also keeps you awake better than anything else in the history of humanity, although it makes you a bit nervous. Radar and I have decided to take it up to two hours before our rest shift. Mine starts at twelve, when Ben gets up.

en: This first bench seat is the first bedroom. It’s the less desirable bedroom, because it is close to the kitchen and the living room, where people are awake and talking, and sometimes there is music on the radio.
vi: Hàng ghế băng đầu tiên là phòng ngủ số một. Không phải là phòng ngủ đáng ao ước lắm vì gần bếp và phòng khách, nơi mọi người thức, nói chuyện, thỉnh thoảng có nhạc qua sóng phát thanh.
tr: En öndeki çift kişilik koltuk, ilk yatak odası. Ez az istenen yatak odası çünkü insanların uyanık olduğu, konuştuğu ve bazen de radyoda müziğin olduğu mutfak ile oturma odasına yakın.
es: La primera fila de asientos es la primera habitación. Es la menos cómoda, porque está cerca de la cocina y de la sala, donde la gente está despierta charlando y a veces está puesta la radio.
vi_translation: The first row of benches is bedroom number one. It's not a very desirable bedroom because it's near the kitchen and living room, where people are awake, talking, and occasionally there's music on the radio.
tr_translation: The front double seat, the first bedroom. This is the desired bedroom because it is close to the kitchen and living room where people are awake, talking, and sometimes there is music on the radio.
es_translation: The first row of seats is the first room. It is the least comfortable because it is near the kitchen and the living room, where people are awake chatting and sometimes the radio is on.

en: Behind that is the second bedroom, which is darker and quieter and altogether superior to the first bedroom.
vi: Phía sau đó là phòng ngủ số hai, tối hơn, yên tĩnh hơn, về tổng thể là sang hơn phòng ngủ số một.
tr: Onun arkasında, daha karanlık ve sessiz olan ve ilkinden kesinlikle daha üstün olan ikinci yatak odası var.
es: Detrás está la segunda habitación, que es más oscura, más tranquila y mejor que la primera.
vi_translation: Behind that is the second bedroom, darker, quieter, and overall more luxurious than the first bedroom.
tr_translation: Behind it, there is a second bedroom that is darker and quieter, and definitely superior to the first one.
es_translation: Behind is the second room, which is darker, quieter, and better than the first.

en: And behind that is the refrigerator, or cooler, which currently contains the 210 beers that Ben has not yet peed into, the turkey-that-looks-like-ham sandwiches, and some Coke.
vi: Và cuối cùng là tủ lạnh, tức là cái thùng giữ lạnh, hiện đang chứa 210 chai bia Ben chưa tiểu vào, bánh kẹp thịt-gà-tây-trông-như-thịt-xông-khói, và một ít Coke.
tr: Ve onun arkasında, içinde Ben’in henüz içine çişini yapmadığı 210 biranın, jambona benzeyen hindi sandviçlerinin ve birkaç kolanın olduğu buzdolabı ya da soğutucu var.
es: Y detrás está el frigorífico, o la nevera, que en estos momentos contiene 210 cervezas en las que Ben todavía no ha meado, los sándwiches de pavo que parece jamón y varias Coca-Colas.
vi_translation: And finally, the refrigerator, which is the cold storage box, currently contains 210 bottles of beer that Ben hasn't peed in, turkey-bacon-lookalike sandwiches, and some Coke.
tr_translation: And behind it, there is a refrigerator or cooler containing 210 beers that Ben hasn't yet peed in, turkey sandwiches that resemble ham, and a few sodas.
es_translation: And behind it is the refrigerator, or the fridge, which at this moment contains 210 beers that Ben has not yet peed in, the turkey sandwiches that look like ham, and several Coca-Colas.

en: There is much to recommend this house. It is carpeted throughout. It has central air-conditioning and heating. The whole place is wired for surround sound. Admittedly, it contains only fifty-five square feet of living space. But you can’t beat the open floor plan.
vi: Còn có nhiều điểm cộng cho ngôi nhà này. Khắp sàn được trải thảm. Có máy điều hòa nhiệt độ hai chiều nóng, lạnh ở trung tâm. Có mắc hệ thống loa phát âm thanh nổi. Phải thừa nhận, chỉ có hơn năm mét vuông không gian sinh hoạt. Mà ta không thể bài trí tất cả trên mặt sàn mở.
tr: Bu evde tavsiye edilecek çok fazla şey var. Her tarafı hah kaph. Merkezi havalandırması ve ısıtması var. Her yerinde ses sistemi mevcut. Yalnızca on yedi metre karelik yaşam alanı olduğu doğru. Fakat açık stüdyo daire tasarımı kıyas kabul etmiyor.
es: La casa es muy recomendable. Está tapizada de arriba abajo. Tiene aire acondicionado y calefacción central. Dispone de altavoces. Es cierto que el espacio habitable es de solo cinco metros cuadrados, pero la amplitud es insuperable.
vi_translation: There are many more advantages to this house. The entire floor is carpeted. There is a central air conditioning system with both heating and cooling functions. It is equipped with a surround sound speaker system. Admittedly, there is only a little over five square meters of living space. And you can't arrange everything on an open floor plan.
tr_translation: There are many things to recommend in this house. Everywhere is fully equipped. It has central air conditioning and heating. There is a sound system throughout. It's true that there is only seventeen square meters of living space. But the open studio apartment design is incomparable.
es_translation: The house is highly recommended. It is carpeted from top to bottom. It has air conditioning and central heating. It is equipped with speakers. It is true that the living space is only five square meters, but the spaciousness is unbeatable.

en: Just after we pass into South Carolina, I catch Radar yawning and insist upon a driver switch. I like driving, anyway—this vehicle may be a minivan, but it’s my minivan. Radar scoots out of his seat and into the first bedroom, while I grab the steering wheel and hold it steady, quickly stepping over the kitchen and into the driver’s seat.
vi: Vừa tới Nam Carolina, tôi nhác thấy Radar ngáp nên khăng khăng bảo nó hãy để tôi lái. Dù sao tôi cũng thích lái–chiếc xe này là minivan thôi, nhưng nó là minivan của tôi. Radar lách khỏi ghế lái sang phòng ngủ số một, trong khi tôi giữ vội tay lái, nắm chắc, nhảy nhanh từ bếp sang ghế lái.
tr: i Güney Carolina’ya girdikten hemen sonra Radar’ı esnerken yakalıyorum ve sürücü değiştirme konusunda ısrar ediyorum. Araba sürmeyi severim nasılsa... Bu araç bir minivan olabibr ama benim minivamm. Mutfağın üstünden hızla bir adım atıp sürücü koltuğuna geçerek direksiyonu yakaladığım ve sabit tuttuğum sırada, Radar koltuğundan kalkıp ilk yatak odasma firkyor.
es: Justo después de entrar en Carolina del Sur, pillo a Radar bostezando e insisto en conducir yo. De todas formas, me gusta conducir. Vale que estamos hablando de un monovolumen, pero es mi monovolumen. Radar se desplaza a un lado del asiento y se mete en la primera habitación mientras yo sujeto el volante con fuerza, salto por encima de la cocina y me coloco en el asiento del conductor.
vi_translation: As soon as we arrived in South Carolina, I noticed Radar yawning, so I insisted on driving. Anyway, I like driving–this car is just a minivan, but it's my minivan. Radar slipped out of the driver's seat to bedroom number one, while I quickly grabbed the wheel, held it firmly, and swiftly moved from the kitchen to the driver's seat.
tr_translation: i Right after entering South Carolina, I catch Radar yawning and insist on changing drivers. I love driving anyway... This vehicle might be a minivan, but it's my minivan. As I quickly step over the kitchen and move to the driver's seat, grabbing and holding the steering wheel steady, Radar gets up from his seat and rushes to the first bedroom.
es_translation: Just after entering South Carolina, I catch Radar yawning and insist on driving. Anyway, I like driving. Sure, we're talking about a minivan, but it's my minivan. Radar shifts to one side of the seat and goes into the first room while I grip the steering wheel tightly, jump over the kitchen, and settle into the driver's seat.

en: Traveling, I am finding, teaches you a lot of things about yourself. For instance, I never thought myself to be the kind of person who pees into a mostly empty bottle of Bluefin energy drink while driving through South Carolina at seventy-seven miles per hour—but in fact I am that kind of person. Also, I never previously knew that if you mix a lot of pee with a little Bluefin energy drink, the result is this amazing incandescent turquoise color. It looks so pretty that I want to put the cap on the bottle and leave it in the cup holder so Lacey and Ben can see it when they wake up.
vi: Tôi đang dần nhận ra, có đi tôi mới hiểu được nhiều điều về bản thân. Chẳng hạn, tôi chưa bao giờ nghĩ mình là loại người có thể tiểu vào một chai nước tăng lực Bluefin đã gần cạn trong khi lái xe qua Nam Carolina với vận tốc bảy mươi bảy dặm một giờ–nhưng thực tế tôi là loại người như vậy. Thêm nữa, tôi chưa từng nhận ra rằng nếu trộn kha khá nước tiểu với một chút nước tăng lực Bluefin, kết quả sẽ là một sắc lam ngọc sáng bừng lên lạ lùng. Màu đẹp đến mức tôi muốn đóng nắp chai lại và đặt nó lên chỗ để cốc cho Lacey và Ben xem khi hai đứa thức dậy.
tr: Seyahat etmenin kendinizle ilgili size çok şey öğrettiğini keşfediyorum. Mesela saatte yüz yirmi dört kilometreyle Güney Carolina’dan geçerken, çoğunlukla boş olan bir Bluefin enerji içeceği şişesine çişini yapacak türde bir insan olduğumu hiç düşünmezdim. ama aslında o türde bir insanım. Aynca, biraz Bluefin enerji içeceği ile çok miktarda çişi karıştırınca sonucun şaşırtıcı derecede göz kamaştırıcı bir turkuaz tonu olacağım önceden bilmezdim. O kadar güzel görünüyor ki, Lacey ile Ben uyandıklarında görebilsinler diye, şişenin kapağını kapatıp bardak tutucuda bırakmak istiyorum.
es: Estoy descubriendo que viajando aprendes muchas cosas de ti mismo. Por ejemplo, nunca había pensado que fuera una de esas personas que mean en una botella casi vacía de la bebida energética Bluefin mientras conducen por Carolina del Sur a ciento quince kilómetros por hora, pero resulta que sí lo soy. Además, no sabía que si mezclas un montón de meados con un poco de Bluefin, el resultado es un sorprendente color turquesa brillante. Es tan bonito que me dan ganas de poner el tapón a la botella y dejarla en el salpicadero para que Lacey y Ben la vean cuando se despierten.
vi_translation: I'm gradually realizing that only by traveling can I understand many things about myself. For instance, I never thought I was the kind of person who could pee into an almost empty Bluefin energy drink bottle while driving through South Carolina at seventy-seven miles per hour–but in reality, I am that kind of person. Moreover, I never realized that if you mix a fair amount of urine with a bit of Bluefin energy drink, the result would be a strangely bright turquoise color. The color was so beautiful that I wanted to cap the bottle and place it in the cup holder for Lacey and Ben to see when they woke up.
tr_translation: I am discovering that traveling teaches you a lot about yourself. For instance, I never thought I was the type of person who would pee into a mostly empty Bluefin energy drink bottle while speeding through South Carolina at one hundred and twenty-four kilometers per hour. .. but it turns out I am that type of person. Also, I didn't know beforehand that mixing a little Bluefin energy drink with a large amount of pee would result in a surprisingly dazzling turquoise hue. It looks so beautiful that I want to cap the bottle and leave it in the cup holder so that Lacey and Ben can see it when they wake up.
es_translation: I'm discovering that by traveling you learn many things about yourself. For example, I never thought I would be one of those people who pee in an almost empty bottle of Bluefin energy drink while driving through South Carolina at one hundred fifteen kilometers per hour, but it turns out I am. Additionally, I didn't know that if you mix a bunch of pee with a little Bluefin, the result is a surprisingly bright turquoise color. It's so pretty that it makes me want to put the cap on the bottle and leave it on the dashboard for Lacey and Ben to see when they wake up.

en: But Radar feels differently. “If you don’t throw that shit out the window right now, I’m ending our eleven-year friendship,” he says.
vi: Nhưng Radar có cảm nhận khác. “Nếu ông không ném thứ ị ẹ đó qua cửa sổ ngay bây giờ thì tôi sẽ chấm dứt tình hữu nghị mười một năm nay giữa chúng ta,” nó nói.
tr: Ama Radar benimle aynı fikirde değil. “Eğer o boku hemen pencereden dışarı atmazsan, on bir yılhk arkadaşhğımızı bitiriyorum,” diyor.
es: Pero Radar no opina lo mismo. —Si no lanzas esa mierda por la ventana ahora mismo, acabaré con nuestros once años de amistad —me dice.
vi_translation: But Radar had a different feeling. "If you don't throw that crap out the window right now, I will end our eleven-year friendship," it said.
tr_translation: Ama Radar benimle aynı fikirde değil. “Eğer o boku hemen pencereden dışarı atmazsan, on bir yıllık arkadaşlığımızı bitiriyorum,” diyor.
es_translation: But Radar does not think the same. "If you don't throw that crap out the window right now, I'll end our eleven years of friendship," he tells me.

en: “It’s not shit,” I say. “It’s pee.”
vi: “Có phải ị đâu,” tôi cố cãi. “Tè thôi mà.”
tr: “Bok değil,” diyorum. “Çiş.
es: —No es mierda —le contesto—. Es pipi.
vi_translation: "I didn't poop," I tried to argue. "I just peed."
tr_translation: “Not poop,” I say. “Pee.”
es_translation: —It's not shit —he replied—. It's pee.

en: “Out,” he says. And so I litter. In the side-view mirror, I can see the bottle hit the asphalt and burst open like a water balloon. Radar sees it, too.
vi: “Ra ngoài ngay,” Radar không động lòng. Tôi đành vứt đi. Qua gương bên, tôi thấy cái chai chạm mặt đường nhựa, vỡ tóe lên như một quả bóng nước. Radar cũng ngó xem.
tr: “Dışarı,” diyor. Bunun üstüne çöpü atıyorum. Yan aynada, şişenin asfalta çarpıp bir su balonu gibi patladığım görebiliyorum. Radar da görüyor.
es: —Fuera —me dice. Así que la tiro. La veo por el retrovisor lateral aterrizando en el asfalto y explotando como un globo lleno de agua. Radar también la ve.
vi_translation: "Get out now," Radar said unemotionally. I had no choice but to throw it away. Through the side mirror, I saw the bottle hit the asphalt, shattering like a water balloon. Radar also glanced over.
tr_translation: “Outside,” he says. Upon this, I throw out the garbage. In the side mirror, I can see the bottle hitting the asphalt and bursting like a water balloon. Radar sees it too.
es_translation: —Out —he says to me. So I throw it. I see it in the side mirror landing on the asphalt and exploding like a water-filled balloon. Radar sees it too.

en: “Oh, my God,” Radar says. “I hope that’s like one of those traumatic events that is so damaging to my psyche that I just forget it ever happened.”
vi: “Ôi, lạy Chúa,” nó nói. “Con hi vọng rằng đó chỉ như một trong những trải nghiệm tồi tệ hại, quá tổn hao thần kinh của con đến mức con sẽ quên ngay khi nó vừa xảy ra.”
tr: “Ah, Tanrım,” diyor Radar. “Umarım bu, ruhuma korkunç derecede zarar veren travmatik olaylardan biridir de, gerçekleştiğini hemen unuturum.
es: —Joder —dice Radar—. Espero que sea uno de esos episodios traumáticos que hieren tanto mi sensibilidad que directamente olvido que han sucedido.
vi_translation: “Oh, dear Lord,” it said. “I hope that it is just one of those terrible, nerve-wracking experiences that I will forget as soon as it happens.”
tr_translation: “Ah, God,” says Radar. “I hope this is one of those traumatic events that terribly damages my soul, so I can forget it immediately.”
es_translation: —Fuck —says Radar—. I hope this is one of those traumatic episodes that hurt my sensitivity so much that I directly forget they happened.

en: Hour Nine
vi: Giờ thứ chín
tr: Dokuzuncu Saat
es: HORA NUEVE
vi_translation: Ninth hour
tr_translation: Ninth Hour
es_translation: NINE O'CLOCK

en: I never previously knew that it is possible to become tired of eating GoFast nutrition bars. But it is possible. I’m only two bites into my fourth of the day when my stomach turns. I pull open the center console and stick it back inside. We refer to this part of the kitchen as the pantry.
vi: Tôi chưa từng nghĩ rằng có thể ngán được thanh dinh dưỡng GoFast. Nhưng hóa ra là có thể. Mới cắn được hai miếng của thanh thứ tư trong ngày, tôi đã thấy dạ dày mình cuộn lên. Tôi mở ngăn kéo trước mặt và thả nó lại vào trong. Chúng tôi gọi chỗ đó là tủ bếp.
tr: GoFast gofretlerini yemekten yorulmanın mümkün olduğunu önceden hiç bilmezdim. Ama mümkün. Midem bulandığı sırada, günün dördüncüsünden yalnızca iki ısırık almıştım. Orta konsolu çekip açıyorum ve GoFast’i içine sokuyorum. Mutfağın bu bölümünü kiler olarak adlandırıyoruz.
es: No sabía que es posible cansarse de comer barritas energéticas. Pero lo es. Le he dado solo dos mordiscos a la cuarta del día y se me ha revuelto el estómago. Abro la guantera del medio y la dejo ahí. A esta parte de la cocina la llamamos la despensa.
vi_translation: I never thought that I could get tired of GoFast nutrition bars. But it turns out I can. After just two bites of the fourth bar of the day, my stomach started to churn. I opened the drawer in front of me and put it back in. We called that place the kitchen cabinet.
tr_translation: I never knew it was possible to get tired of eating GoFast wafers. But it is possible. By the time I felt nauseous, I had only taken two bites of the fourth one of the day. I pull open the center console and put the GoFast inside. We call this part of the kitchen the pantry.
es_translation: I didn't know it was possible to get tired of eating energy bars. But it is. I've only taken two bites of the fourth one today and my stomach turned. I open the middle glove compartment and leave it there. We call this part of the kitchen the pantry.

en: “I wish we had some apples,” Radar said. “God, wouldn’t an apple taste good right now?”
vi: “Có mấy quả táo thì tốt nhỉ,” Radar nói. “Trời, ăn táo bây giờ thì có phải là tốt không?”
tr: “Keşke birkaç elmamız olsaydı,” diyor Radar. “Tannm, şu anda bir elma iyi olmaz mıydı?
es: —Ojalá tuviéramos manzanas —dice Radar—. Joder, ¿no sería fantástica una manzana ahora mismo?
vi_translation: "A few apples would be nice," Radar said. "Oh, would it be good to eat apples now?"
tr_translation: “I wish we had a few apples,” says Radar. “God, wouldn't an apple be nice right now?”
es_translation: —I wish we had apples —says Radar—. Damn, wouldn't an apple be fantastic right now?

en: I sigh. Stupid fourth food group. Also, even though I stopped drinking Bluefin a few hours ago, I still feel exceedingly twitchy.
vi: Tôi thở dài. Nhầm lẫn ngớ ngẩn nhóm đồ ăn thứ tư. Thêm nữa, dù mấy tiếng nay không uống Bluefin nữa, tôi vẫn thấy bồn chồn ghê gớm.
tr: İç çekiyorum. Aptal dördüncü besin grubu. Ayrıca birkaç saat önce Bluefin içmeyi bırakmama rağmen, kendimi hâlâ fazlasıyla gergin hissediyorum.
es: Suspiro. Mierda de cuarto grupo. Además, aunque hace horas que he dejado de beber Bluefin, sigo extremadamente nervioso.
vi_translation: I sighed. Confusedly mistaking the fourth food group. Moreover, even though I haven't had Bluefin for hours, I still feel terribly restless.
tr_translation: I sigh. Stupid fourth food group. Also, even though I stopped drinking Bluefin a few hours ago, I still feel extremely tense.
es_translation: Sigh. Damn fourth group. Besides, even though I stopped drinking Bluefin hours ago, I'm still extremely nervous.

en: “I still feel kinda twitchy,” I say.
vi: “Tôi cứ thấy bồn chồn sao sao ấy ông ạ,” tôi nói.
tr: “Hâlâ gergin hissediyorum,” diyorum.
es: —Sigo muy nervioso —digo.
vi_translation: "I feel so restless, you know," I said.
tr_translation: “I still feel tense,” I say.
es_translation: —I'm still very nervous —I say.

en: “Yeah,” Radar says. “I can’t stop tapping my fingers.” I look down. He is drumming his fingers silently against his knees. “I mean,” he says, “I actually cannot stop.”
vi: “Ừ,” Radar đáp. “Tôi không thể nào ngừng gõ ngón tay được.” Tôi nhìn xuống. Radar đang gõ ngón tay không thành tiếng lên đầu gối. “Tôi thực sự không dừng lại được ấy.
tr: “Evet,” diyor Radar. “Parmaklarımı tıkırdatmayı bırakamıyorum.” Aşağı doğru bakıyorum. Parmaklarıyla sessizce dizlerinin üzerinde davul çalıyor. “Yani,” diyor, “gerçekten duramıyorum.
es: —Sí —me contesta Radar—. Yo no puedo dejar los dedos quietos. Echo un vistazo y lo veo tamborileando con los dedos en las rodillas. —De verdad que no puedo parar —me dice.
vi_translation: "Yeah," Radar replied. "I can't stop tapping my fingers." I looked down. Radar was silently tapping his fingers on his knee. "I really can't stop." “Alright, fine, I'm not tired.
tr_translation: “Yes,” says Radar. “I can't stop tapping my fingers.” I look down. He is quietly drumming on his knees with his fingers. “I mean,” he says, “I really can't stop.”
es_translation: —Yes —Radar answers me—. I can't keep my fingers still. I take a look and see him drumming his fingers on his knees. —I really can't stop —he tells me.

en: “Okay, yeah I’m not tired, so we’ll stay up till four and then we’ll get them up and we’ll sleep till eight.”
vi: “Ờ, được rồi, tôi không mệt, bọn mình cùng thức đến bốn giờ, đánh thức hai đứa kia dậy rồi mình ngủ đến tám giờ nhé.
tr: “Tamam, evet, yorgun değifrm, öyleyse dörde kadar ayakta kalırız, sonra onları kaldırıp sekize kadar uyuruz.
es: —Bueno, yo no estoy cansado, así que seguiremos hasta las cuatro, luego los despertamos y nos echamos a dormir hasta las ocho.
vi_translation: Let's stay up until four o'clock, wake the other two up, and then we'll sleep until eight o'clock.”
tr_translation: “Alright, yes, I'm not tired, so we will stay up until four, then wake them up and sleep until eight.”
es_translation: —Well, I'm not tired, so we'll continue until four, then we'll wake them up and go to sleep until eight.

en: “Okay,” he says. There is a pause. The road has emptied out now; there is only me and the semitrucks, and I feel like my brain is processing information at eleven thousand times its usual pace, and it occurs to me that what I’m doing is very easy, that driving on the interstate is the easiest and most pleasant thing in the world: all I have to do is stay in between the lines and make sure that no one is too close to me and I am not too close to anyone and keep leaving. Maybe it felt like this for her, too, but I could never feel like this alone.
vi: “Đồng ý,” nó đáp. Một khoảng ngưng. Giờ đường đã vắng, chỉ có chúng tôi và những chiếc bán tải. Tôi thấy như não mình đang xử lí thông tin nhanh gấp mười một ngàn lần tốc độ bình thường. Hóa ra việc tôi đang làm rất đơn giản, lái xe trên đường liên bang là điều đơn giản và dễ chịu nhất thế giới: tất cả những gì tôi phải làm là đi đúng làn đường, đảm bảo rằng không có ai đến quá gần tôi và tôi không đến quá gần ai, và tiếp tục ra đi. Có lẽ cảm giác trong cô ấy cũng là như vậy, nhưng tôi không bao giờ có thể cảm thấy thế này nếu chỉ có một mình.
tr: “Tamam,” diyor. Bir duraksama oluyor. Artık yol boş; yalnızca römorklu kamyonlar ile ben varım, beynimin bilgiyi her zamanki temposunun on bir bin katı hızla işlediğini hissediyorum ve yaptığım şeyin çok basit olduğunu, eyaletler arası yolda araba sürmenin dünyadaki en kolay ve zevkh şey olduğunu fark ediyorum: Yapmam gereken tek şey çizgilerin arasında kalmak, kimsenin bana fazla yakın olmadığından ve benim kimseye çok yakın olmadığımdan emin olmak ve gitmeye devam etmek. Belki Margo’ya da böyle gelmişti ama ben tek başıma asla böyle hissedemezdim.
es: —Vale —me contesta. Nos quedamos callados. Ahora la carretera se ha quedado vacía. Estoy solo yo y los camiones, y siento que mi cerebro procesa información a un ritmo once mil veces superior al habitual. Pienso de repente que lo que estoy haciendo es muy fácil, que conducir por la autopista es lo más fácil y lo más placentero del mundo. Lo único que tengo que hacer es mantenerme entre las líneas, asegurarme de que nadie se me acerca demasiado y de que yo no me acerco demasiado a nadie, y seguir avanzando. Quizá también Margo sintió lo mismo, pero nunca me habría sentido así yo solo.
vi_translation: “Agreed,” she replied. A pause. Now the road was empty, only us and the pickup trucks. I felt like my brain was processing information eleven thousand times faster than normal. It turned out that what I was doing was very simple, driving on the interstate was the simplest and most pleasant thing in the world: all I had to do was stay in my lane, make sure no one got too close to me and I didn't get too close to anyone, and keep going. Perhaps she felt the same way, but I could never feel like this if I were alone.
tr_translation: “Okay,” he says. There is a pause. The road is now empty; only the trailer trucks and I are here, I feel my brain processing information at eleven thousand times its usual speed, and I realize that what I'm doing is very simple, that driving on the interstate is the easiest and most enjoyable thing in the world: All I have to do is stay between the lines, make sure no one is too close to me and that I'm not too close to anyone, and keep going. Maybe it felt the same way to Margo, but I could never feel this way alone.
es_translation: —Okay —he answers me. We remained silent. Now the road has become empty. It's just me and the trucks, and I feel like my brain is processing information at a rate eleven thousand times faster than usual. I suddenly think that what I'm doing is very easy, that driving on the highway is the easiest and most pleasant thing in the world. The only thing I have to do is stay between the lines, make sure no one gets too close to me and that I don't get too close to anyone, and keep moving forward. Maybe Margo felt the same way too, but I would never have felt this way on my own.

en: Radar breaks the silence. “Well, if we’re not going to sleep until four . . .”
vi: Radar phá bầu im lặng. “Này, nếu bốn giờ mới ngủ...”
tr: Radar sessizbği bozuyor. “Peki, eğer dörde kadar uyumayacaksak...
es: Radar rompe el silencio. —Bueno, si no vamos a dormir hasta las cuatro…
vi_translation: Radar breaks the silence. "Hey, if you only sleep at four..."
tr_translation: Radar breaks the silence. “Well, if we're not going to sleep until four...”
es_translation: Radar breaks the silence. —Well, if we're not going to sleep until four...

en: I finish his sentence. “Yeah, then we should probably just open another bottle of Bluefin.”
vi: Tôi nói nốt câu. “Ừ, thì bọn mình mở thêm chai Bluefin nữa thôi.”
tr: Cümlesini bitiriyorum. “Evet, o zaman muhtemelen bir şişe daha Bluefin açmalıyız.
es: Termino su frase: —Sí, quizá podríamos abrir otra botella de Bluefin.
vi_translation: I finished my sentence. "Alright, let's just open another bottle of Bluefin."
tr_translation: I'm finishing my sentence. "Yes, then we should probably open another bottle of Bluefin."
es_translation: He finished his sentence: —Yes, maybe we could open another bottle of Bluefin.

en: And so we do.
vi: Và chúng tôi làm như vậy.
tr: Ve öyle yapıyoruz.
es: Y la abrimos.
vi_translation: And we did so.
tr_translation: And that's what we do.
es_translation: And we opened it.

en: Hour Ten
vi: Giờ thứ mười
tr: Onuncu Saat
es: HORA DIEZ
vi_translation: The tenth hour
tr_translation: Tenth Hour
es_translation: TEN O'CLOCK

en: It is time for our second stop. It is 12:13 in the morning. My fingers do not feel like they are made of fingers; they feel like they are made of motion. I am tickling the steering wheel as I drive.
vi: Đã đến lúc dừng lần thứ hai. Đang là 12:13 sáng. Ngón tay tôi không còn cảm giác là những ngón tay nữa, mà như được tạo ra từ chuyển động. Tôi liên tục cọ ngón tay vào vô-lăng trong khi lái.
tr: İkinci mola vaktimiz. Saat sabah 00:13. Parmaklarım, parmaktan yapılma gibi değil, hareketten yapılma gibi geliyorlar. Arabayı sürerken direksiyonu gıdıklıyorum.
es: Ha llegado la hora de volver a parar. Son las 12:13 de la noche. Mis dedos no parecen dedos. Parecen movimiento en estado puro. Repiquetean el volante mientras conduzco.
vi_translation: It's time to stop for the second time. It is 12:13 AM. My fingers no longer feel like fingers, but as if they are made of motion. I continuously rub my fingers on the steering wheel while driving.
tr_translation: Our second break time. The time is 00:13 in the morning. My fingers feel like they are made of movement, not flesh. While driving, I tickle the steering wheel.
es_translation: The time has come to stop again. It is 12:13 at night. My fingers do not seem like fingers. They seem like pure motion. They tap on the steering wheel as I drive.

en: After Radar finds the nearest BP on his handheld, we decide to wake up Lacey and Ben.
vi: Sau khi Radar xác định trạm BP gần nhất trên máy tính cầm tay, bọn tôi quyết định đánh thức Lacey và Ben.
tr: Radar, el bilgisayarında en yakın BP'yi bulduktan sonra, Lacey ile Ben’i uyandırmaya karar veriyoruz.
es: Radar busca en el ordenador la siguiente gasolinera BP y decidimos despertar a Lacey y a Ben.
vi_translation: After Radar identified the nearest BP station on the handheld computer, we decided to wake up Lacey and Ben.
tr_translation: After finding the nearest BP on the handheld computer, we decide to wake up Lacey and Ben.
es_translation: Radar searches on the computer for the next BP gas station and we decide to wake up Lacey and Ben.

en: I say, “Hey, guys, we’re about to stop.” No reaction.
vi: Tôi gọi, “Này các bồ, sắp dừng lại đấy.” Chẳng có phản ứng gì.
tr: “Hey, çocuklar, durmak üzereyiz,” diyorum. Tepki yok.
es: —Hey, chicos, vamos a parar —les digo. No reaccionan.
vi_translation: I called, "Hey guys, we're about to stop." There was no reaction.
tr_translation: "Hey, kids, we're about to stop," I say. No reaction.
es_translation: —Hey, guys, let's stop —I tell them. They do not react.

en: Radar turns around and puts a hand on Lacey’s shoulder.
vi: Radar quay sang đặt một tay lên vai Lacey.
tr: Radar arkasmı dönüyor ve Lacey’nin omzuna elini koyuyor.
es: Radar se gira y apoya una mano en el hombro de Lacey.
vi_translation: Radar turned and placed a hand on Lacey's shoulder.
tr_translation: Radar turns around and places his hand on Lacey's shoulder.
es_translation: Radar turns and places a hand on Lacey's shoulder.

en: “Lace, time to get up.” Nothing.
vi: “Lacey ơi, dậy thôi.” Không nhúc nhích.
tr: “Lace, uyanma vakti.” Hiçbir şey yok.
es: —Lace, es hora de levantarse. Nada.
vi_translation: "Lacey, wake up." No movement.
tr_translation: "Lace, it's time to wake up." Nothing happens.
es_translation: —Lace, it's time to get up. Nothing.

en: I turn on the radio. I find an oldies station. It’s the Beatles. The song is “Good Morning.” I turn it up some. No response. So Radar turns it up more. And then more. And then the chorus comes, and he starts singing along. And then I start singing along. I think it is finally my atonal screeching that awakes them.
vi: Tôi bật radio, dò được một đài cổ lỗ sĩ. Ban nhạc Beatles. Bài “Chào buổi sáng.” Tôi vặn tiếng to lên. Không phản ứng gì. Radar liền vặn to lên nữa. Thêm nữa. Đến đoạn điệp khúc, nó bắt đầu hát theo. Tôi cũng hòa vào, rút cục chắc giọng ông ổng lệch nhịp của mình đã đánh thức hai đứa dậy.
tr: Radyoyu açıyorum. Eski şarkılar çalan bir istasyon buluyorum. Beatles. Şarkı Good Morning. Biraz sesini açıyorum. Tık yok. Bu yüzden Radar sesi biraz daha açıyor. Ve sonra biraz daha. Ardından nakarat geliyor ve Radar şarkıya eşlik etmeye başlıyor. Sonra ben de eşlik etmeye başlıyorum. Sanırım sonuçta onları uyandıran benim ahenksiz çığlıklarım oluyor.
es: Enciendo la radio y encuentro una emisora de canciones antiguas. Suenan los Beatles, la canción «Good Morning». Subo el volumen. No reaccionan. Entonces Radar lo sube todavía más. Y más. Y cuando llega el estribillo, se pone a cantar. Y yo me pongo a cantar también. Creo que lo que al final los despierta son mis gallos.
vi_translation: I turned on the radio and found an old-fashioned station. The Beatles band. The song “Good Morning.” I turned up the volume. No reaction. Radar then turned it up even more. More and more. By the chorus, it started singing along. I joined in too, and eventually, my off-key booming voice probably woke the two of them up.
tr_translation: I turn on the radio. I find a station playing old songs. The Beatles. The song is Good Morning. I turn up the volume a bit. Not a peep. So Radar turns it up a bit more. And then a bit more. Then the chorus comes, and Radar starts to sing along. Then I start to sing along too. I think in the end, it's my off-key screams that wake them up.
es_translation: I turn on the radio and find a station playing old songs. The Beatles are playing, the song "Good Morning." I turn up the volume. They don't react. Then Radar turns it up even more. And more. And when the chorus comes, he starts singing. And I start singing too. I think what finally wakes them up are my off-key notes.

en: “MAKE IT STOP!” Ben shouts. We turn down the music.
vi: “TẮT NGAY!” Ben kêu ầm lên.
tr: “DURDUR ŞUNU!” diye bağırıyor Ben. Müziği kapatıyoruz.
es: —¡APAGA ESO! —grita Ben. Apagamos la música.
vi_translation: "TURN IT OFF NOW!" Ben shouted loudly. We turned the music down.
tr_translation: “STOP THAT!” Ben shouts. We turn off the music.
es_translation: —TURN THAT OFF! —yells Ben. We turned off the music.

en: “Ben, we’re stopping. Do you have to pee?”
vi: Bọn tôi vặn nhỏ nhạc đi. “Ben, sắp dừng rồi đó. Ông có xuống tè không?”
tr: “Ben, duruyoruz. Çişini yapman gerekiyor mu?
es: —Ben, vamos a parar. ¿Tienes que mear? Silencio.
vi_translation: "Ben, it's almost stopping. Do you want to get off to pee?"
tr_translation: "Ben, we're stopping. Do you need to pee?"
es_translation: —Ben, let's stop. Do you need to pee? Silence.

en: He pauses, and there’s a kerfuffle in the darkness back there, and I wonder if he has some physical strategy for checking the fullness of his bladder. “I think I’m okay, actually,” he says.
vi: Nó không nói gì, có tiếng lục đục trong góc tối đằng đó. Không biết thằng khỉ đang áp dụng chiến lược thể chất gì để đo độ phồng căng của bàng quang nữa. “Tôi không cần, thật,” nó đáp.
tr: Duraksıyor ve arkada, karanlığın içinde bir gürültü patırtı olunca idrar torbasının doluluğunu kontrol etmek için fiziksel bir stratejisi mi var, diye merak ediyorum. “Sanırım gerek yok,” diyor.
es: Oigo ruido en la parte de atrás y me pregunto si tiene alguna estrategia para comprobar el nivel de su vejiga. —Creo que voy bien —me contesta.
vi_translation: It didn't say anything, there was a rustling sound in that dark corner. Who knows what physical strategy the monkey was using to measure the swelling of its bladder. “I don't need it, really,” it replied.
tr_translation: He hesitates, and I wonder if he has a physical strategy to check the fullness of his bladder when there's a commotion in the darkness behind him. "I guess it's not necessary," he says.
es_translation: I hear noise in the back and wonder if he has some strategy to check the level of his bladder. —I think I'm doing well —he answers me.

en: “Okay, then you’re on gas.”
vi: “Rồi, vậy bọn tôi sẽ xuống mua xăng.
tr: “Tamam, o zaman sen benzindesin.
es: —Vale, entonces te ocupas de la gasolina.
vi_translation: “Alright, then we will go down to buy gasoline.”
tr_translation: “Alright, then you are at the gas station.”
es_translation: —Okay, then you take care of the gasoline.

en: “As the only boy who has not yet peed inside this car, I call first bathroom,” says Radar.
vi: “Với tư cách chàng trai duy nhất chưa tè trong xe này, tôi sẽ vào nhà vệ sinh đầu tiên,” Radar nói.
tr: “Bu arabanın içinde çişini yapmamış tek erkek olarak, önce tuvalete gidiyorum,” diyor Radar.
es: —Como soy el único chico que todavía no ha meado en el coche, pido ir al baño el primero —dice Radar.
vi_translation: “As the only guy who hasn't peed in this car, I'll go to the bathroom first,” Radar said.
tr_translation: "As the only guy in this car who hasn't peed himself, I'm going to the bathroom first," says Radar.
es_translation: —Since I'm the only guy who hasn't peed in the car yet, I ask to go to the bathroom first —says Radar.

en: “Shhh,” mumbles Lacey. “Shhh. Everybody stop talking.”
vi: “Suỵt...,” Lacey lúng búng. “Suỵt... mọi người đừng nói chuyện nữa.”
tr: “Şişşt,” diye homurdanıyor Lacey. “Şişşt. Herkes konuşmayı bıraksın.
es: —Chis —murmura Lacey—. Chis. Callaos todos.
vi_translation: "Shh...," Lacey mumbled. "Shh... everyone, stop talking."
tr_translation: "Shh," Lacey grumbles. "Shh. Everyone stop talking."
es_translation: —Shush —murmurs Lacey—. Shush. Everyone be quiet.

en: “Lacey, you have to get up and pee,” Radar says. “We’re stopping.”
vi: “Lacey ơi, cậu phải dậy và xuống đi nhà vệ sinh thôi,” Radar nói. “Chúng ta sắp dừng lại.”
tr: “Lacey, kalkıp çişini yapmalısın,” diyor Radar. “Duruyoruz.
es: —Lacey, tienes que levantarte y mear —le dice Radar—. Vamos a parar.
vi_translation: "Lacey, you have to get up and go to the bathroom," Radar said. "We are about to stop."
tr_translation: “Lacey, you need to get up and pee,” says Radar. “We're stopping.”
es_translation: —Lacey, you have to get up and pee —says Radar—. We're going to stop.

en: “You can buy apples,” I tell her.
vi: “Cho cậu vào mua táo đấy,” tôi bảo Lacey.
tr: “Elma alabilirsin,” diyorum.
es: —Compra manzanas —le digo.
vi_translation: “Let you go in and buy apples,” I told Lacey.
tr_translation: "You can take an apple," I say.
es_translation: —Buy apples —I tell him.

en: “Apples,” she mumbles happily in a cute little girl voice. “I likey the apples.”
vi: “Táo,” Lacey hồn nhiên chóp chép bằng giọng của một cô bé con đáng yêu. “Thích táo thế.”
tr: “Elma,” diye küçük, şirin bir kız sesiyle mırıldanıyor mutlulukla. “Elmaları seviyoyum.
es: —Manzanas —murmura contenta con una bonita voz femenina—. Me encantan las manzanas.
vi_translation: “Apple,” Lacey innocently chirped in the voice of an adorable little girl. “I love apples so much.”
tr_translation: “Apple,” she murmurs happily in a small, sweet girl’s voice. “I love apples.”
es_translation: —Apples —she murmurs contentedly with a pretty feminine voice—. I love apples.

en: “And then after that you get to drive,” Radar says. “So you really gotta wake up.”
vi: “Sau đó tới phiên cậu lái xe,” Radar nói. “Cho nên cậu thực sự phải dậy thôi.”
tr: “Ondan sonra sürmeye geçiyorsun,” diyor Radar. “Bu yüzden gerçekten uyanmalısın.
es: —Y luego tienes que conducir —le dice Radar—, así que despiértate de una vez.
vi_translation: "Then it's your turn to drive," Radar said. "So you really have to wake up."
tr_translation: “Then you move on to driving,” says Radar. “That's why you really need to wake up.”
es_translation: —And then you have to drive —Radar tells him—, so wake up already.

en: She sits up, and in her regular Lacey voice, she says, “I don’t so much likey that.”
vi: Lacey ngồi dậy, nói lại giọng bình thường, “Tớ cũng không thích lắm.”
tr: Doğruluyor ve her zamanki Lacey sesiyle, “Onu pek fazla sevmiyoyum,” diyor.
es: Se incorpora y, con su voz de siempre, dice: —Eso ya no me encanta tanto.
vi_translation: Lacey sat up, speaking in a normal tone, "I don't like it much either."
tr_translation: Confirming and in her usual Lacey voice, she says, "I don't like him very much."
es_translation: He sits up and, with his usual voice, says: —That doesn't thrill me as much anymore.

en: We take the exit and it’s .9 miles to the BP, which doesn’t seem like much but Radar says that it’s probably going to cost us four minutes, and the South Carolina traffic hurt us, so it could be real trouble with the construction Radar says is an hour ahead of us. But I am not allowed to worry. Lacey and Ben have now shaken off their sleep well enough to line up together by the sliding door, just like last time, and when we come to a stop in front of the pump, everybody flies out, and I flip the keys to Ben, who catches them in midair.
vi: Chúng tôi rẽ ở lối ra, cách trạm BP 0,9 dặm, tưởng ngay gần nhưng Radar nói sẽ mất chừng bốn phút. Giao thông Nam Carolina đang bủa vây bọn tôi. Cho nên công trình đang xây, còn cách chừng một tiếng nữa là đến, có thể sẽ trở thành vấn đề cực kì nghiêm trọng. Nhưng tôi không được phép lo lắng. Lacey và Ben đã kịp tan giấc mộng điệp, hai đứa đang sẵn sàng ở cửa xe. Như lần trước, vừa dừng ở trạm xăng, mọi người đã lao ra khỏi xe, tôi tung chìa khóa cho Ben, nó bắt lấy ngay trên không.
tr: Çıkışa sapıyoruz, BP’ye yaklaşık bir kilometre var ki bu çokmuş gibi görünmüyor ama Radar muhtemelen bize dört dakikaya mal olacağım ve Güney Carolina trafiğinin bize zarar verdiğini, bu yüzden dediğine göre bir saatlik mesafede olan yol çalışmasının bize gerçekten sorun yaratabileceğini söylüyor. Ama endişelenme imkânım yok. Lacey ile Ben, tıpkı son seferdeki gibi, sürgülü kapının önünde sıraya girecek kadar uykularım silkip atmışlar ve pompanın önünde durduğumuzda herkes uçarak dışan çıkıyor, anahtarları Ben’e fırlatıyorum, o da havada yakalıyor.
es: Nos metemos por la salida. La gasolinera está a un kilómetro y medio, que no es tanto, pero Radar dice que seguramente perderemos cuatro minutos, que el tráfico de Carolina del Sur nos ha hecho perder tiempo y que podemos encontrarnos con serios problemas dentro de una hora, cuando empiecen las obras. Pero no me permito preocuparme. Lacey y Ben se han despertado lo suficiente para colocarse junto a la puerta corredera, como la vez anterior, y cuando paramos delante del surtidor, todos salimos corriendo. Le lanzo las llaves a Ben, que las pilla en el aire.
vi_translation: We turned off at the exit, 0.9 miles from the BP station, thinking it was close, but Radar said it would take about four minutes. South Carolina traffic was surrounding us. So the construction ahead, still about an hour away, could become a very serious problem. But I wasn't allowed to worry. Lacey and Ben had already woken up from their deep sleep, both ready at the car door. Just like before, as soon as we stopped at the gas station, everyone jumped out of the car, I tossed the keys to Ben, and he caught them mid-air.
tr_translation: We are taking the exit, and it's about a kilometer to the BP, which doesn't seem like much, but Radar says it will probably cost us four minutes and that the South Carolina traffic is hurting us, so according to him, the roadwork that is an hour away could really cause us problems. But I have no chance to worry. Lacey and I, just like last time, have shaken off our sleep enough to line up in front of the sliding door, and when we stop in front of the pump, everyone flies out, I toss the keys to Ben, and he catches them in mid-air.
es_translation: We go in through the exit. The gas station is a kilometer and a half away, which isn't much, but Radar says we'll probably lose four minutes, that South Carolina traffic has made us lose time, and that we could run into serious problems in an hour when the construction starts. But I don't allow myself to worry. Lacey and Ben have woken up enough to position themselves by the sliding door, like last time, and when we stop in front of the pump, we all run out. I throw the keys to Ben, who catches them in the air.

en: As Radar and I walk briskly past the white man behind the counter, Radar stops when he notices the guy is staring. “Yes,” Radar says without embarrassment. “I’m wearing a HERITAGE NOT HATE shirt over my graduation gown,” he says. “By the way, do you sell pants here?”
vi: Khi Radar và tôi ba chân bốn cẳng chạy qua một nhân viên da trắng đứng sau quầy thanh toán, thấy anh ta nhìn chăm chăm, Radar dừng lại nói không chút xấu hổ, “Vâng, em đang mặt áo DI SẢN KHÔNG HẬN THÙ ra ngoài áo chùng tốt nghiệp. Tiện đây anh có bán quần không?”
tr: Radar’la ikimiz kasadaki beyaz tenli adamın yanından hızla geçerken adamın dik dik baktığını fark edince Radar duruyor. “Evet,” diyor Radar utanmadan. “Mezuniyet cübbemin üstüne bir NEFRET DEĞİL MİRAS tişörtü giyiyorum,” diyor. “Bu arada, burada pantolon satıyor musunuz?
es: Radar y yo pasamos como una flecha por delante del hombre que está en el mostrador, pero Radar se detiene al ver que el tipo está mirándolo fijamente. —Sí —le dice Radar tan tranquilo—, llevo una camiseta de PATRIMONIO CULTURAL NO ODIO encima de la toga de graduación. Por cierto, ¿tiene pantalones?
vi_translation: When Radar and I were running as fast as we could past a white employee standing behind the checkout counter, seeing him staring, Radar stopped and said without any embarrassment, "Yes, I'm wearing a NO HATE HERITAGE shirt over my graduation gown. By the way, do you sell pants?"
tr_translation: As Radar and I quickly pass by the fair-skinned man at the counter, Radar stops when he notices the man staring intently. "Yes," says Radar unashamedly. "I'm wearing a shirt that says NOT HATE BUT HERITAGE over my graduation gown," he says. "By the way, do you sell pants here?"
es_translation: Radar and I zoom past the man at the counter like a flash, but Radar stops when he notices the guy staring at him intently. —Yes —Radar says to him calmly—, I'm wearing a CULTURAL HERITAGE NOT HATE t-shirt over my graduation gown. By the way, are you wearing pants?

en: The guy looks nonplussed. “We got some camo pants over by the motor oil.”
vi: Ông anh đó trông như muốn á khẩu, “Có mấy cái quần rằn ri gần chỗ để dầu máy đấy.”
tr: Adam şaşkına dönmüş görünüyor. “Motor yağlarının orada birkaç komando pantolonumuz var.
es: El tipo lo mira desconcertado. —Tenemos pantalones de camuflaje al lado del aceite para motores.
vi_translation: That guy looked like he was about to be speechless, "There are some camouflage pants near the machine oil."
tr_translation: Adam looks bewildered. "There are a few commando pants by the motor oils."
es_translation: The guy looks at him puzzled. —We have camouflage pants next to the motor oil.

en: “Excellent,” Radar says. And then he turns to me and says, “Be a dear and pick me out some camo pants. And maybe a better T-shirt?”
vi: “Mừng quá,” Radar đáp, rồi quay sang tôi nói tiếp, “Hãy là một người bạn tốt và đi lấy mấy cái quần cho tôi. Nếu được thì áo phông nào dễ coi hơn nhá?”
tr: “Mükemmel,” diyor Radar. Sonra bana dönüyor. “Sevimli biri ol ve bana bir komando pantolonu seç. Bir de daha iyi bir tişört.
es: —Perfecto —le contesta Radar. Y entonces se gira hacia mí y me dice—: Sé bueno y cógeme unos pantalones de camuflaje. ¿Y quizá una camiseta?
vi_translation: “So happy,” Radar replied, then turned to me and continued, “Be a good friend and go get me some pants. If possible, which t-shirt looks better?”
tr_translation: “Perfect,” says Radar. Then he turns to me. “Be a darling and pick out a pair of cargo pants for me. And a better t-shirt too.”
es_translation: —Perfect —Radar replies. And then he turns to me and says—: Be a pal and grab me some camouflage pants. And maybe a T-shirt?

en: “Done and done,” I answer. Camo pants, it turns out, do not come in regular numbered sizes. They come in medium and large. I grab a pair of medium pants, and then a large pink T-shirt that reads WORLD’S BEST GRANDMA. I also grab three bottles of Bluefin.
vi: “Được và được,” tôi đáp. Quần rằn ri, hóa ra, không đánh số như bình thường. Chỉ có cỡ vừa và cỡ lớn. Tôi nhặt một quần cỡ vừa, và một áo phông màu hồng rộng thùng thình với dòng chữ BÀ NGOẠI HIỀN NHẤT QUẢ ĐẤT. Tôi cũng lấy thêm ba chai Bluefin.
tr: “Olmuş bil ve olmuş bil,” diye karşılık veriyorum. Komando pantolonlarının bedenlerinin klasik numaralı olmadığı ortaya çıkıyor. Orta ve geniş bedenleri var. Bir orta beden pantolon ve üstünde DÜNYANIN EN İYİ BÜYÜKANNESİ yazan, geniş beden pembe bir tişört alıyorum. Bir de üç şişe Bluefin.
es: —Eso está hecho —le contesto. Resulta que los pantalones de camuflaje no llevan las tallas habituales. Hay solo medianos y grandes. Cojo unos medianos y una camiseta grande de color rosa en la que pone LA MEJOR ABUELA DEL MUNDO. Cojo también tres botellas de Bluefin.
vi_translation: “Alright, alright,” I replied. Camouflage pants, it turned out, were not numbered as usual. There were only medium and large sizes. I picked a pair of medium pants, and an oversized pink T-shirt with the words THE NICEST GRANDMA ON EARTH. I also grabbed three bottles of Bluefin.
tr_translation: “Consider it done and consider it done,” I reply. It turns out that commando pants do not have classic numbered sizes. They come in medium and large sizes. I get a pair of medium-sized pants and a large-sized pink t-shirt that says WORLD'S BEST GRANDMA on it. And also three bottles of Bluefin.
es_translation: —It's done —I answered him. It turns out that camouflage pants don't come in the usual sizes. There are only medium and large. I grab a pair of medium ones and a large pink t-shirt that says THE BEST GRANDMA IN THE WORLD. I also grab three bottles of Bluefin.

en: I hand everything to Lacey when she comes out of the bathroom and then walk into the girls’ room, since Radar is still in the guys’. I don’t know that I’ve ever been inside a girls’ bathroom in a gas station before.
vi: Tôi đưa tất cả cho Lacey khi cậu ấy từ nhà vệ sinh đi ra. Tôi vào luôn nhà vệ sinh nữ vì Radar vẫn ở bên nam. Tôi không nghĩ là mình từng ở trong một nhà vệ sinh nữ tại trạm xăng.
tr: Lacey tuvaletten çıkınca her şeyi ona veriyorum ve Radar hâlâ erkekler tuvaletinde olduğu için kızlar tuvaletine giriyorum. Daha önce hiç, bir benzin istasyonundaki kızlar tuvaletine girip girmediğimi hatırlamıyorum.
es: Le paso todo a Lacey cuando sale del baño y me meto en el de chicas, porque Radar todavía está en el de chicos. No recuerdo si había entrado alguna vez en el baño de chicas de una gasolinera.
vi_translation: I handed everything to Lacey when she came out of the restroom. I went straight into the women's restroom because Radar was still in the men's. I don't think I've ever been in a women's restroom at a gas station.
tr_translation: When Lacey comes out of the bathroom, I give her everything, and since Radar is still in the men's room, I go into the women's bathroom. I can't remember if I've ever been in a women's bathroom at a gas station before.
es_translation: I hand everything to Lacey when she comes out of the bathroom and I go into the girls' bathroom, because Radar is still in the boys' bathroom. I don't remember if I had ever been in a gas station's girls' bathroom before.

en: Differences:
vi: Những điểm khác:
tr: Farklar.
es: Diferencias:
vi_translation: Other points:
tr_translation: Differences.
es_translation: Differences:

en: No condom machine
vi: Không có máy bán bao cao su
tr: Prezervatif makinesi yok
es: No hay máquina de condones
vi_translation: There is no condom vending machine
tr_translation: There is no condom machine
es_translation: There is no condom machine

en: No urinal
vi: Không có bồn tiểu nam
tr: Pisuar yok
es: No hay urinarios
vi_translation: No urinals
tr_translation: No urinal
es_translation: There are no urinals

en: The smell is more or less the same, which is rather disappointing.
vi: Mùi cũng na ná như nhau, điểm này làm tôi hơi thất vọng.
tr: Koku az çok aynı ki bu biraz hayal kırıklığı.
es: El olor es más o menos el mismo, lo que me parece bastante decepcionante.
vi_translation: The smell is quite similar, which makes me a bit disappointed.
tr_translation: The taste is more or less the same, which is a bit disappointing.
es_translation: The smell is more or less the same, which I find quite disappointing.

en: When I come out, Lacey is paying and Ben is honking the horn, and after a moment of confusion, I jog toward the car.
vi: Khi tôi ra, Lacey đang thanh toán và Ben bấm còi. Chững một tích tắc chưa hiểu gì, rồi tôi vọt ra xe.
tr: Dışarı çıktığımda Lacey ödeme yapıyor ve Ben korna çalıyor, bir anlık kafa karışıklığından sonra, arabaya doğru koşuyorum.
es: Cuando salgo, Lacey está pagando y Ben toca la bocina. Tras un momento de confusión, corro al coche.
vi_translation: When I came out, Lacey was paying and Ben was honking the horn. For a split second, I didn't understand anything, then I dashed to the car.
tr_translation: When I step outside, Lacey is paying and Ben is honking the horn. After a moment of confusion, I run towards the car.
es_translation: When I come out, Lacey is paying and Ben is honking the horn. After a moment of confusion, I run to the car.

en: “We lost a minute,” Ben says from the passenger seat. Lacey is turning onto the road that will take us back to the interstate.
vi: “Bọn mình mất một phút,” Ben nói từ ghế cạnh lái xe. Lacey đang cho xe rẽ vào đường nhánh để quay lại đường liên bang.
tr: “Bir dakika kaybettik,” diyor Ben ön koltuktan. Lacey bizi eyaletler arası yola geri götürecek olan caddeye dönüyor.
es: —Hemos perdido un minuto —dice Ben desde el asiento del copiloto. Lacey se mete en la carretera que nos llevará de vuelta a la autopista.
vi_translation: "We lost a minute," Ben said from the passenger seat. Lacey was turning the car onto a side road to get back to the highway.
tr_translation: “We lost a minute,” says Ben from the front seat. Lacey turns onto the street that will take us back to the interstate.
es_translation: —We have lost a minute —says Ben from the passenger seat. Lacey gets on the road that will take us back to the highway.

en: “Sorry,” Radar answers from the back, where he is sitting next to me, wiggling into his new camo pants beneath his robe. “On the upside, I got pants. And a new T-shirt. Where’s the shirt, Q?” Lacey hands it to him. “Very funny.” He pulls off the robe and replaces it with the grandma shirt while Ben complains that no one got him any pants. His ass itches, he says. And on second thought, he kind of does need to pee.
vi: “Xin lỗi,” Radar đáp từ phía sau, nó đang ngồi cạnh tôi, loay hoay xỏ quần dưới áo chùng. “Bù lại, tôi đã có quần. Và áo mới. Áo đâu hả Q?” Lacey đưa cho nó. “Ngộ thật.” Nó cởi áo chùng, mặc áo phông bà ngoại vào trong khi Ben càm ràm sao không ai mua quần cho nó. Bị ngứa mông, nó nói thế. Và khi nghĩ lại, đại khái là bây giờ nó cần đi tiểu.
tr: “Üzgünüm,” diye karşılık veriyor Radar, yanımda oturduğu arka taraftan, cübbesinin altından yeni komando pantolonuna girmeye çalışarak. “İyi tarafından bakarsak, pantolon aldım. Ve yeni bir tişört. Tişört nerede Q?” Lacey tişörtü ona uzatıyor. “Çok komik.” Cübbeyi çıkarıp yerine büyükanne tişörtünü geçiriyor, o sırada Ben kimsenin ona pantolon almadığından yakınıyor. Kıçı kaşnıyormuş. Ve şimdi farkına varmış, çişini yapması gerekiyor gibiymiş.
es: —Perdón —dice Radar desde el asiento de atrás, donde está sentado a mi lado, poniéndose los pantalones de camuflaje por debajo de la toga—. Pero al menos tengo pantalones. Y otra camiseta. ¿Dónde está la camiseta, Q? Lacey se la da. —Muy divertido. Se quita la camiseta y se pone la de la abuela. Ben se queja de que nadie le haya comprado unos pantalones. Dice que le pica el culo. Y pensándolo bien, tiene ganas de mear.
vi_translation: “Sorry,” Radar replied from behind, he was sitting next to me, fumbling to put on pants under his robe. “On the bright side, I have pants. And a new shirt. Where's the shirt, Q?” Lacey handed it to him. “Weird.” He took off the robe and put on the grandma's T-shirt while Ben grumbled about why no one bought him pants. He said it was because his butt itched. And upon reflection, he kind of needed to pee now.
tr_translation: “Sorry,” replies Radar from the back seat where he’s sitting next to me, trying to get into his new commando pants under his robe. “On the bright side, I got pants. And a new T-shirt. Where’s the T-shirt, Q?” Lacey hands him the T-shirt. “Very funny.” He takes off the robe and puts on the grandma T-shirt, while Ben complains that no one got him pants. His butt itches. And now he realizes, he feels like he needs to pee.
es_translation: —Sorry —says Radar from the back seat, where he is sitting next to me, putting on his camouflage pants under his gown—. But at least I have pants. And another t-shirt. Where's the t-shirt, Q? Lacey gives it to her. —Very funny. He takes off his shirt and puts on his grandmother's. Ben complains that no one has bought him any pants. He says his butt itches. And thinking about it, he feels like peeing.

en: Hour Eleven
vi: Giờ thứ mười một
tr: On Birinci Saat
es: HORA ONCE
vi_translation: The eleventh hour
tr_translation: Eleventh Hour
es_translation: ELEVEN O'CLOCK

en: We hit the construction. The highway narrows to one lane, and we’re stuck behind a tractor-trailer driving the precise roadwork speed limit of thirty-five mph. Lacey is the right driver for the situation; I’d be pounding the steering wheel, but she’s just amiably chatting with Ben until she turns half around and says, “Q, I really need to go to the bathroom, and we’re losing time behind this truck anyway.”
vi: Chúng tôi đến đoạn công trường. Đường cao tốc hẹp lại còn một làn. Chúng tôi bị ách lại sau một xe tải chở hàng cỡ lớn đang đi với đúng tốc độ cho phép là ba mươi lăm dặm một giờ. Lacey lái xe lúc này là rất hợp lí, nếu là tôi chắc đã nện thình thình lên vô-lăng, còn Lacey chỉ tươi cười nói chuyện với Ben, cho đến khi quay lại bảo tôi, “Q ơi, tớ cần vào nhà vệ sinh, đằng nào bọn mình cũng đang mất thời gian sau chú xe tải này.”
tr: Yol çalışmasının olduğu kısma geliyoruz. Anayol tek şeride daralıyor ve yol çalışması hız sının olan elli beş kilometrelik hızla giden bir traktörün arkasında kalıyoruz. Lacey bu durum için doğru sürücü; ben direksiyonu yumrukluyor olurdum ama o tatlılıkla Ben’le sohbet ediyor, ta ki arkaya dönene kadar: “Q, gerçekten tuvalete gitmem gerek, nasılsa bu traktörün arkasında zaman kaybediyoruz.
es: Llegamos a las obras. La autopista se estrecha en un carril y nos quedamos atascados detrás de un tráiler que va exactamente a la velocidad límite de las carreteras en obras, sesenta kilómetros por hora. Lacey es la mejor conductora en estos casos. Yo estaría aporreando el volante, pero ella charla tranquilamente con Ben hasta que se gira y dice: —Q, necesito de verdad ir al baño, y de todas formas estamos perdiendo tiempo detrás de este camión.
vi_translation: We reached the construction site. The highway narrowed to a single lane. We were stuck behind a large cargo truck moving at the exact speed limit of thirty-five miles per hour. Lacey driving at this moment was very sensible; if it were me, I would probably be pounding on the steering wheel, but Lacey just smiled and chatted with Ben until she turned to me and said, "Q, I need to use the restroom, we’re wasting time behind this truck anyway."
tr_translation: We are approaching the part where the roadwork is. The main road narrows to a single lane and we get stuck behind a tractor going at the speed limit of fifty-five kilometers per hour. Lacey is the right driver for this situation; I would be punching the steering wheel, but she sweetly chats with Ben. he says, until he turns around: "Q, I really need to go to the bathroom, we're wasting time behind this tractor anyway."
es_translation: We arrived at the construction site. The highway narrows to one lane and we get stuck behind a trailer that is going exactly at the speed limit for roads under construction, sixty kilometers per hour. Lacey is the best driver in these situations. I would be pounding the steering wheel, but she calmly chats with Ben until she turns and says: —Q, I really need to go to the bathroom, and anyway, we're wasting time behind this truck.

en: I just nod. I can’t blame her. I would have forced us to stop long ago had it been impossible for me to pee in a bottle. It was heroic of her to make it as long as she did.
vi: Tôi chỉ gật. Không thể trách Lacey được. Nếu không thể tiểu vào chai thì tôi đã bắt cả bọn dừng lại từ lâu rồi. Lacey giữ được hết mức có thể như vậy kể cũng gan.
tr: Sadece başımla onaylıyorum. Lacey'yi suçlayamam. Bir şişenin içine işemem imkânsız olsaydı, ben çok önceden bizi durmaya zorlardım. Onun kadar uzun süre kendini tutmak kahramancaydı.
es: Asiento. No puedo culparla. Yo habría obligado a parar hace rato si no pudiera mear en una botella. Era heroico que hubiera aguantado tanto.
vi_translation: I just nodded. Can't blame Lacey. If I couldn't pee into a bottle, I would have made everyone stop a long time ago. It's pretty brave of Lacey to hold it in as much as she did.
tr_translation: I just nod my head. I can't blame Lacey. If it were impossible for me to pee into a bottle, I would have forced us to stop long ago. Holding it in for as long as she did was heroic.
es_translation: Seat. I can't blame her. I would have forced a stop a while ago if I couldn't pee in a bottle. It was heroic that she had held on for so long.

en: She pulls into an all-night gas station, and I get out to stretch my rubbery legs. When Lacey comes racing back to the minivan, I’m sitting in the driver’s seat. I don’t even really know how I came to be sitting in the driver’s seat, why I end up there and not Lacey. She comes around to the front door, and she sees me there, and the window is open, and I say to her, “I can drive.” It’s my car, after all, and my mission. And she says, “Really, you’re sure?” and I say, “Yeah, yeah, I’m good to go,” and she just throws open the sliding door and lies down in the first row.
vi: Lacey tấp xe vào một trạm xăng mở cả đêm, tôi ra ngoài duỗi hai cẳng giờ đã như cao su. Khi Lacey quay lại, tôi đang ngồi ở ghế lái. Tôi thực sự không biết tôi đã lên ghế lái như thế nào, sao tôi lại ngồi đây mà không phải Lacey. Đến cửa xe, Lacey thấy tôi đã yên vị, cửa sổ để mở. Tôi nói với Lacey, “Để tớ lái cho.” Xe của tôi, và rút cục, sứ mệnh của tôi. Lacey hỏi, “Thật không? Cậu chắc chứ?” và tôi đáp, “Ừ, ừ, tớ khỏe re mà,” thế nên Lacey đẩy cánh cửa trượt, vào nằm ở hàng ghế sau lái xe.
tr: Bütün gece açık olan bir benzin istasyonuna çekiyor, lastik gibi olmuş bacaklarımı esnetmek için dışarı çıkıyorum. Lacey koşarak minivana döndüğünde, sürücü koltuğunda ben oturuyorum. Sürücü koltuğuna nasıl oturduğumu, neden Lacey’nin değil de benim oraya düştüğümü bilmiyorum bile. Dönüp ön kapıya geliyor ve orada olduğumu görüyor, pencere açık, ona, “Ben sürebilirim,” diyorum. Ne de olsa benim arabam ve benim görevim. “Gerçekten emin misin?” diyor ve ben de “Evet, evet, gidecek kadar iyiyim,” diyorum, Lacey sadece sürgülü kapıyı çekip açıyor ve ilk sıraya uzanıyor.
es: Se mete en una gasolinera abierta toda la noche y salgo para estirar las piernas. Cuando Lacey vuelve al coche corriendo, estoy sentado en el asiento del conductor. Ni siquiera sé cómo he ido a parar a ese asiento, por qué acabo yo ahí en lugar de Lacey. Da la vuelta hasta la puerta delantera y me ve. La ventanilla está bajada. —Puedo conducir yo —le digo. Al fin y al cabo, es mi coche. Y mi misión. —¿Seguro? —me pregunta. —Sí, sí, puedo seguir. Abre la puerta corredera y se tumba en el primer asiento.
vi_translation: Lacey pulled the car into an all-night gas station, and I got out to stretch my legs, now feeling like rubber. When Lacey returned, I was sitting in the driver's seat. I really didn't know how I ended up in the driver's seat, why I was sitting there instead of Lacey. At the car door, Lacey saw that I was settled in, with the window open. I said to Lacey, "Let me drive." It was my car, and ultimately, my mission. Lacey asked, "Really? Are you sure?" and I replied, "Yeah, yeah, I'm totally fine," so Lacey slid the door open and lay down in the back seat.
tr_translation: I pull into a gas station that's open all night, and step outside to stretch my legs that feel like rubber. When Lacey runs back to the minivan, I'm in the driver's seat. I don't even know how I got into the driver's seat or why it was me instead of Lacey who ended up there. She turns and comes to the front door and sees me there, the window is open, and I say to her, "I can drive." After all, it's my car and my responsibility. "Are you really sure?" she says, and I reply, "Yes, yes, I'm good enough to go," Lacey just slides open the door and stretches out in the first row.
es_translation: He pulls into a gas station that's open all night and I get out to stretch my legs. When Lacey comes running back to the car, I'm sitting in the driver's seat. I don't even know how I ended up in that seat, why I'm there instead of Lacey. She walks around to the front door and sees me. The window is rolled down. —I can drive —I tell him. After all, it is my car. And my mission. —Are you sure? —he asks me. —Yes, yes, I can continue. He opens the sliding door and lies down on the first seat.

en: Hour Twelve
vi: Giờ thứ mười hai
tr: On İkinci Saat
es: HORA DOCE
vi_translation: The twelfth hour
tr_translation: The Second Hour
es_translation: SWEET HOUR

en: It is 2:40 in the morning. Lacey is sleeping. Radar is sleeping. I drive. The road is deserted. Even most of the truck drivers have gone to bed. We go minutes without seeing headlights coming in the opposite direction. Ben keeps me awake, chattering next to me. We are talking about Margo.
vi: Đang là 2:40 sáng. Lacey đang ngủ. Radar đang ngủ. Tôi lái xe. Đường vắng tanh. Thậm chí hầu hết các tài xế xe tải cũng đã đi ngủ rồi. Chúng tôi đi hàng phút liền mà không thấy đèn pha nào từ phía trước. Ben buôn chuyện để tôi không bị buồn ngủ. Chúng tôi nói về Margo.
tr: Saat sabah 02:40. Lacey uyuyor, Radar uyuyor. Ben sürüyorum. Yol ıssız. Kamyon şoförlerinin bile çoğu yatmış. Dakikalar boyunca ters yönde far görmeden gidiyoruz. Ben, yanımda konuşup durarak beni uyanık tutuyor. Margo hakkında konuşuyoruz.
es: Son las 2:40 de la madrugada. Lacey está durmiendo. Radar está durmiendo. Yo conduzco. La carretera está desierta. Incluso la mayoría de los camioneros se han ido a dormir. Durante muchos minutos no veo luces de frente. Ben va a mi lado y me da conversación para mantenerme despierto. Charlamos sobre Margo.
vi_translation: It is 2:40 AM. Lacey is sleeping. Radar is sleeping. I am driving. The road is completely empty. Even most of the truck drivers have gone to sleep. We go for minutes without seeing any headlights from the opposite direction. Ben chats to keep me from getting sleepy. We talk about Margo.
tr_translation: It's 2:40 in the morning. Lacey is sleeping, Radar is sleeping. I'm driving. The road is desolate. Even most of the truck drivers have gone to bed. We go for minutes without seeing headlights in the opposite direction. He keeps talking beside me to keep me awake. We are talking about Margo.
es_translation: It is 2:40 in the morning. Lacey is sleeping. Radar is sleeping. I am driving. The road is deserted. Even most of the truckers have gone to sleep. For many minutes, I do not see any lights ahead. Ben is next to me and keeps me company to keep me awake. We chat about Margo.

en: “Have you given any thought to how we will actually, like, find Agloe?” he asks me.
vi: “Ông đã nghĩ xem bọn mình sẽ thực sự tìm ra Agloe như thế nào chưa?” nó hỏi.
tr: “Agloe’yu aslında, şey, nasıl bulacağımızı hiç düşündün mü?” diye soruyor.
es: —¿Has pensado cómo vamos a encontrar Agloe? —me pregunta.
vi_translation: "Have you thought about how we are actually going to find Agloe?" he asked.
tr_translation: "Have you ever actually thought about, well, how we would find Agloe?" he asks.
es_translation: —Have you thought about how we are going to find Agloe? —he asks me.

en: “Uh, I have an approximate idea of the intersection,” I say.
vi: “Ừ, tôi đoán chừng ở đoạn hai con đường cắt nhau,” tôi nói.
tr: “Ah, kavşakla ilgili bir fikrim var,” diyorum.
es: —Bueno, tengo una ligera idea de dónde está el cruce —le contesto—.
vi_translation: "Yes, I guess it's at the intersection of the two roads," I said.
tr_translation: “Ah, I have an idea about the intersection,” I say.
es_translation: —Well, I have a slight idea of where the crossing is —I reply—.

en: “And it’s nothing but an intersection.”
vi: “Và chẳng có gì ngoài một giao lộ.
tr: “O da bir kavşaktan başka bir şey olmadığı.
es: Y solo es un cruce.
vi_translation: "And there's nothing but a crossroads."
tr_translation: “It is nothing but an intersection.”
es_translation: And it's just a crossing.

en: “And she’s just gonna be sitting at the corner on the trunk of her car, chin in her hands, waiting for you?”
vi: “Và Margo ngồi đó trên thùng xe của cậu ấy, tay chống cằm đợi ông chứ gì?”
tr: “Ve Margo orada, öylece bagajın bir köşesine oturmuş, elleri çenesinde seni mi bekliyor olacak?
es: —¿Y Margo va a estar en una esquina, sentada en el maletero del coche, esperándote con la barbilla apoyada en las manos?
vi_translation: “And Margo was sitting there on his truck, resting her chin on her hand waiting for him, right?”
tr_translation: “And Margo will be there, just sitting in a corner of the luggage, with her hands on her chin, waiting for you?”
es_translation: —And is Margo going to be in a corner, sitting on the car trunk, waiting for you with her chin resting on her hands?

en: “That would certainly be helpful,” I answered.
vi: “Nghe hay đấy,” tôi đáp.
tr: “Bu kesinlikle faydalı olurdu,” diye cevaplıyorum.
es: —Sería un detalle —le contesto.
vi_translation: "Sounds good," I replied. "Buddy, I'm a bit worried.
tr_translation: “That would definitely be helpful,” I reply.
es_translation: —It would be a nice gesture —I reply to him.

en: “Bro, I gotta say I’m a little worried that you might, like—if it doesn’t go as you’re planning it—you might be really disappointed.”
vi: “Bồ tèo ơi, tôi hơi lo đấy, nếu chuyện không diễn ra như ông nghĩ thì ông sẽ thất vọng lắm đó.
tr: “Kardeşim, söylemeliyim ki şeyeğer senin planladığın gibi gitmezse, gerçekten hayal kırıklığına uğrayabilirsin diye biraz endişeleniyorum.
es: —Colega, tengo que decirte que me preocupa un poco que… si las cosas no van como las has planeado, te lleves una gran decepción.
vi_translation: If things don't go as you think, you'll be very disappointed."
tr_translation: “Brother, I must say that if things don't go as you planned, you might be really disappointed, and I'm a bit worried about that.”
es_translation: —Colleague, I have to tell you that I am a little worried that... if things don't go as you have planned, you will be greatly disappointed.

en: “I just want to find her,” I say, because I do. I want her to be safe, alive, found. The string played out. The rest is secondary.
vi: “Tôi chỉ muốn tìm thấy Margo thôi,” tôi đáp, vì đúng như vậy. Tôi muốn cô ấy được an toàn, còn sống, được tìm thấy. Lần theo đến cùng dây nối. Phần còn lại chỉ là thứ yếu.
tr: “Sadece onu bulmak istiyorum,” diyorum, çünkü öyle istiyorum. Onun güvende, hayatta ve bulunmuş olmasını istiyorum. Bütün ipler çekildi. Geri kalanı önemsiz.
es: —Solo quiero encontrarla —le digo, y es verdad. Solo quiero que esté viva y a salvo. Encontrarla. Que el hilo siga su curso. Lo demás es secundario.
vi_translation: “I just want to find Margo,” I replied, because that was true. I want her to be safe, alive, found. Following the thread to the end. The rest is secondary.
tr_translation: “I just want to find him,” I say, because that's what I want. I want him to be safe, alive, and found. All strings have been pulled. The rest is insignificant.
es_translation: —I just want to find her —I tell him, and it's true. I just want her to be alive and safe. To find her. Let the thread follow its course. The rest is secondary.

en: “Yeah, but— I don’t know,” Ben says. I can feel him looking over at me, being Serious Ben. “Just— Just remember that sometimes, the way you think about a person isn’t the way they actually are. Like, I always thought Lacey was so hot and so awesome and so cool, but now when it actually comes to being with her . . . it’s not the exact same. People are different when you can smell them and see them up close, you know?”
vi: “Ừ, nhưng–tôi không biết nữa,” Ben nói. “Chỉ là–ông hãy nhớ đôi khi suy nghĩ của ông về ai đó lại không giống với con người thật của họ. Chẳng hạn, ngày trước lúc nào tôi cũng nghĩ Lacey nóng bỏng hay ho tuyệt vời lắm, nhưng bây giờ thực sự ở cạnh cậu ấy... thì không chính xác là như vậy. Mọi người trở nên rất khác khi ta có thể ngửi thấy họ và nhìn họ thật gần, ông biết chứ?”
tr: “Evet ama... bilmiyorum,” diyor Ben. Ciddi Ben haline gelip bana baktığını hissedebiliyorum. “Sadece... Sadece insanların bazen gerçekte düşündüğün gibi olmadığım hatırla. Benim Lacey’nin çok seksi, çok müthiş ve çok havalı olduğunu düşünmem gibi ama şimdi iş onunla gerçekten birlikte olmaya gelince... tam olarak aynı değil, insanlar onları hissedebildiğinde, onları yakından görebildiğinde daha farklı.
es: —Sí, pero… No sé —dice Ben. Noto que está mirándome muy serio—. Pero… Pero recuerda que algunas veces las personas no son como crees que son. Por ejemplo, siempre había pensado que Lacey estaba buenísima, que era increíble y guay, pero ahora, cuando realmente estoy con ella… no es lo mismo. Las personas son diferentes cuando puedes olerlas y verlas de cerca, ¿sabes?
vi_translation: “Yeah, but—I don't know,” Ben said. “It's just—remember that sometimes your thoughts about someone don't match who they really are. For example, I used to always think Lacey was hot and amazing, but now actually being around her... it's not exactly like that. People become very different when you can smell them and see them up close, you know?”
tr_translation: “Yes, but... I don't know,” says Ben. I can feel that he has turned into Serious Ben and is looking at me. “It's just... Just remember that sometimes people aren't exactly as you think they are. Like how I think Lacey is very sexy, very amazing, and very cool, but now when it comes to actually being with her... it's not exactly the same, people are different when you can feel them, when you can see them up close.”
es_translation: —Yes, but... I don't know —says Ben. I notice that he is looking at me very seriously—. But... But remember that sometimes people are not how you think they are. For example, I always thought that Lacey was really hot, that she was incredible and cool, but now, when I'm actually with her... it's not the same. People are different when you can smell them and see them up close, you know?

en: “I know that,” I say. I know how long, and how badly, I wrongly imagined her.
vi: “Tôi biết,” tôi đáp. Tôi biết tôi đã nhầm tưởng về Margo trong thời gian dài như thế nào, lệch lạc đến mức nào.
tr: “Bunu biliyorum,” diyorum. Margo’yu ne kadar uzun süre boyunca, ne kadar kötü bir şekilde, ne kadar yanlış hayal ettiğimi biliyorum.
es: —Lo sé —le contesto. Sé que durante mucho tiempo me he equivocado, y mucho, imaginándola.
vi_translation: “I know,” I replied. I know how long I've been mistaken about Margo, how distorted my perception was.
tr_translation: “I know this,” I say. I know how long, how badly, and how wrongly I have imagined Margo.
es_translation: —I know —I reply to him. I know that for a long time I have been wrong, and very much so, imagining her.

en: “I’m just saying that it was easy for me to like Lacey before. It’s easy to like someone from a distance. But when she stopped being this amazing unattainable thing or whatever, and started being, like, just a regular girl with a weird relationship with food and frequent crankiness who’s kinda bossy—then I had to basically start liking a whole different person.”
vi: “Tôi muốn nói là đối với tôi trước đây thích Lacey rất dễ. Thích ai đó từ xa luôn rất dễ. Nhưng khi cậu ấy không còn là kì quan xa vời nữa, mà bắt đầu trở thành, xem nào, một cô gái bình thường, có thói quen ăn uống kì cục, thỉnh thoảng giở trò bắt nạt như bà tướng–thì về căn bản tôi phải bắt đầu thích một người hoàn toàn khác.
