tr: “Sadece, önceden Lacey’den hoşlanmamn benim için kolay olduğunu söylüyorum. Birini uzaktan sevmek kolay. Ama şaşırtıcı derecede ulaşılmaz filan olmayı bırakıp yiyeceklerle tuhaf bir ilişkisi olan ve sıkça huysuzluk edip biraz da patronluk taslayan sıradan bir kız olmaya başladığında... o zaman tamamen farklı bir insandan hoşlanmaya başlamak zorunda kaldım.
es: —Solo digo que antes era fácil que me gustara Lacey. Es fácil que te guste alguien desde la distancia. Pero cuando deja de ser algo increíble e inalcanzable y empieza a ser una chica normal, con una extraña relación con la comida, bastante cascarrabias y mandona… entonces básicamente tiene que empezar a gustarme una persona totalmente diferente.
vi_translation: “What I mean is that it used to be very easy for me to like Lacey. Liking someone from afar is always very easy. But when she was no longer a distant wonder, and started to become, well, an ordinary girl with weird eating habits, occasionally acting like a bully–basically, I had to start liking a completely different person.”
tr_translation: “I'm just saying it was easy for me to like Lacey from a distance before. It's easy to love someone from afar. But when she stopped being surprisingly unattainable and started being an ordinary girl with a weird relationship with food, often cranky and a bit bossy... then I had to start liking a completely different person.”
es_translation: —I’m just saying that it used to be easy for me to like Lacey. It’s easy to like someone from a distance. But when it stops being something incredible and unattainable and starts being a normal girl, with a strange relationship with food, quite grumpy and bossy… then basically I have to start liking a totally different person.

en: I can feel my cheeks warming. “You’re saying I don’t really like Margo? After all this—I’m twelve hours inside this car already and you don’t think I care about her because I don’t— ” I cut myself off. “You think that since you have a girlfriend you can stand atop the lofty mountain and lecture me? You can be such a—”
vi: Tôi thấy hai má mình nóng lên. “Ông đang bảo tôi không thực sự thích Margo ư? Sau tất cả những chuyện này–tôi đã ở trong cái xe này mười hai tiếng và ông bảo tôi không quan tâm đến Margo vì tôi không–” tôi khựng lại. “Ông tưởng bây giờ ông có bạn gái rồi thì ông được đứng trên thái sơn lên lớp tôi sao? Ông thật là–”
tr: Yanaklarımın yandığım hissedebiliyorum. “Margo’dan gerçekten hoşlanmadığımı mı söylüyorsun? Bütün bunlardan sonra... On iki saattir bu arabanın içindeyim ve ona önem verdiğimi düşünmüyorsun çünkü ben...” Kendi sözümü kesiyorum. “Bir kız arkadaşın olduğu için yüce dağların tepesinde durup bana nutuk çekebileceğini mi sanıyorsun? O kadar...
es: Siento que me arden las mejillas. —¿Estás diciéndome que en realidad no me gusta Margo? Después de todo esto… Ya llevo doce horas metido en este coche y crees que no me importa Margo porque no… —Me interrumpo—. ¿Crees que porque tienes novia puedes subirte a la montaña y pegarme un sermón? A veces eres tan…
vi_translation: I felt my cheeks heating up. “Are you telling me I don't really like Margo? After all this–I've been in this car for twelve hours and you're saying I don't care about Margo because I don't–” I paused. “You think just because you have a girlfriend now, you can stand on a high horse and lecture me? You really are–”
tr_translation: I can feel my cheeks burning. "Are you saying that I really don't like Margo? After all this... I've been in this car for twelve hours and you don't think I care about her because I...” I cut myself off. “Do you think you can stand on top of the high mountains and lecture me just because you have a girlfriend? So much...”
es_translation: I feel my cheeks burning. —Are you telling me that I don't actually like Margo? After all this... I've been stuck in this car for twelve hours and you think I don't care about Margo because I don't... —I interrupt myself—. You think that just because you have a girlfriend you can climb up the mountain and preach to me? Sometimes you are so...

en: I stop talking because I see in the outer reaches of the headlights the thing that will shortly kill me.
vi: Tôi ngừng lời vì thấy phía trước, ngoài vùng sáng của đèn pha, một thứ sắp cho tôi đi tong.
tr: Konuşmayı kesiyorum çünkü dışarıda, farların ulaşabildiği noktanın en ucunda, az sonra beni öldürecek olan şeyi görüyorum.
es: Me callo porque al final de la luz de los faros veo algo que no tardará en matarme.
vi_translation: I stopped speaking because I saw ahead, outside the beam of the headlights, something that was about to ruin everything for me.
tr_translation: I stop talking because outside, at the very edge of where the headlights can reach, I see the thing that will soon kill me.
es_translation: I stay silent because at the end of the headlights' light, I see something that will soon kill me.

en: Two cows stand oblivious in the highway. They come into view all at once, a spotted cow in the left lane, and in our lane an immense creature, the entire width of our car, standing stock-still, her head turned back as she appraises us with blank eyes. The cow is flawlessly white, a great white wall of cow that cannot be climbed or ducked or dodged. It can only be hit. I know that Ben sees it, too, because I hear his breath stop.
vi: Hai con bò hồn nhiên đứng giữa đường cao tốc. Nhoằng một cái cùng thấy chúng, con đốm ở làn trái, và ở làn chúng tôi đang đi, một sinh vật khổng lồ, bằng cả chiều rộng xe, đang đứng như phỗng. Nó quay đầu lại điềm nhiên nhìn chúng tôi bằng đôi mắt lững lờ. Con bò trắng toát không một vết đốm, một mảng tường bò trắng không thể nhảy, chui hoặc vòng qua. Chỉ có thể đâm sầm vào. Tôi biết Ben cũng đã nhìn thấy, vì nghe nhịp thở của Ben đã tắt lịm.
tr: İki inek, ilgisiz tavırlarla anayolda duruyor. Bir anda ortaya çıkıyorlar; sol şeritte benekli bir inek ve bizim şeridimizde, araba genişliğinde muazzam bir yaratık tamamıyla hareketsiz bir şekilde duruyor, bizi algılamaya çalışırken kafası arkaya dönük duruyor. İnek kusursuz bir şekilde beyaz; tırmanılamayacak, altından geçilemeyecek ya da yanından geçilemeyecek, inekten yapılmış, kocaman, beyaz bir duvar. Yalnızca çarpmak mümkün. Ben’in de onu gördüğünü biliyorum çünkü nefesinin kesildiğim duyuyorum.
es: En medio de la autopista hay dos vacas tan tranquilas. Aparecen en mi campo de visión de golpe, una vaca con manchas negras en el carril de la izquierda, y en nuestro carril una criatura inmensa, del tamaño de nuestro coche, totalmente inmóvil, con la cabeza girada hacia atrás, mirándonos con los ojos en blanco. Es absolutamente blanca, una enorme pared blanca de vaca que no podemos saltar, ni pasar por debajo, ni esquivarla. Solo podemos chocar con ella. Sé que Ben también la ve, porque oigo que deja de respirar.
vi_translation: Two cows stood innocently in the middle of the highway. In a flash, we saw them: the spotted one in the left lane, and in our lane, a gigantic creature, as wide as the car, standing motionless. It turned its head and calmly looked at us with indifferent eyes. The cow was completely white without a single spot, a white wall of a cow that couldn't be jumped over, crawled under, or circled around. The only option was to crash into it. I knew Ben had seen it too, because I heard Ben's breath stop abruptly.
tr_translation: Two cows are standing on the main road with indifferent attitudes. They suddenly appear; a spotted cow in the left lane and in our lane, a massive creature the width of a car stands completely motionless, its head turned backward as it tries to perceive us. The cow is perfectly white; an enormous white wall made of cow, which cannot be climbed over, passed under, or bypassed. The only option is to crash. I know Ben sees it too because I hear his breath catch.
es_translation: In the middle of the highway, there are two cows so calm. They suddenly appear in my field of vision, one cow with black spots in the left lane, and in our lane, an immense creature, the size of our car, completely motionless, with its head turned back, staring at us with blank eyes. It is absolutely white, an enormous white wall of cow that we cannot jump over, pass under, or avoid. We can only crash into it. I know that Ben sees it too, because I hear him stop breathing.

en: They say that your life flashes before your eyes, but for me that is not the case. Nothing flashes before my eyes except this impossibly vast expanse of snowy fur, now only a second from us. I don’t know what to do. No, that’s not the problem. The problem is that there is nothing to do, except to hit this white wall and kill it and us, both. I slam on the brakes, but out of habit not expectation: there is absolutely no avoiding this. I raise my hands off the steering wheel. I do not know why I am doing this, but I raise my hands up, as if I am surrendering. I’m thinking the most banal thing in the world: I am thinking that I don’t want this to happen. I don’t want to die. I don’t want my friends to die. And to be honest, as the time slows down and my hands are in the air, I am afforded the chance to think one more thought, and I think about her. I blame her for this ridiculous, fatal chase—for putting us at risk, for making me into the kind of jackass who would stay up all night and drive too fast. I would not be dying were it not for her. I would have stayed home, as I have always stayed home, and I would have been safe, and I would have done the one thing I have always wanted to do, which is to grow up.
vi: Người ta nói rằng cuộc đời nhá lên trước mắt ta, nhưng với tôi không phải như vậy. Không có gì nhá lên trước mắt tôi trừ vùng trắng như tuyết mênh mang đến bất khả này, giờ chỉ còn cách chúng tôi vài tích tắc. Tôi không biết phải làm gì. Không, đó không phải là vấn đề. Vấn đề là không có gì để làm, trừ việc đâm vào bức tường trắng đó, phá hủy nó và chúng tôi, cả đôi bên. Tôi dậm phanh, theo thói quen chứ không mong thay đổi cục diện: rõ ràng là không thể tránh được. Tôi giơ tay lên khỏi vô-lăng. Không biết tại sao lại làm vậy, nhưng tôi đã giơ tay lên, như đang đầu hàng. Tôi nghĩ đến điều nhạt nhẽo nhất trên đời: rằng tôi không muốn chuyện này xảy ra. Tôi không muốn chết. Tôi không muốn bạn bè tôi chết. Và thật lòng, khi thời gian chậm lại và tay tôi giơ lên trong không trung, tôi được dịp có thêm một suy nghĩ nữa, và tôi nghĩ đến cô ấy. Tôi trách cô ấy vì cuộc rượt đuổi ngớ ngẩn chết chóc này–vì đẩy chúng tôi đến chỗ rủi ro, vì biến tôi thành thằng hề thức trắng đêm phóng xe như điên. Không tại cô ấy thì tôi sẽ không chết. Lẽ ra tôi đã ở nhà, vì tôi luôn ở nhà, lẽ ra tôi đã an toàn, và lẽ ra tôi đã làm điều tôi luôn mong được làm, đó là trưởng thành.
tr: Hayatınızın gözünüzün önünden film şeridi gibi geçtiğini söylerler ama benim için durum böyle değil. Gözümün önünden, artık bizden bir saniye uzakta olan bu inanılmaz derecede geniş, kar gibi kürk dışında hiçbir şey geçmiyor. Ne yapacağımı bilmiyorum. Hayır, sorun bu değil. Sorun yapılacak hiçbir şey olmaması, bu beyaz duvara çarpıp hem onu hem de kendimizi öldürmek dışında. Frenlere asılıyorum ama alışkanlıktan, hiçbir beklentim yok: bundan kaçınmak mümkün değil. Ellerimi direksiyondan çekip yukan kaldırıyorum. Bunu neden yaptığımı bilmiyorum ama ellerimi kaldırıyorum, sanki teslim oluyormuşum gibi. Dünyadaki en sıkıcı şeyi düşünüyorum: Bunun olmasını istemediğimi düşünüyorum. Ölmek istemiyorum. Arkadaşlarımın ölmesini istemiyorum. Ayrıca dürüst olmak gerekirse, zaman yavaşlarken ve ellerim havadayken, gücüm bir düşünceye daha yetiyor ve Margo’yu düşünüyorum. Bu saçma, ölümcül takip için onu suçluyorum... bizi tehlikeye attığı için; beni, bütün gece uyumayıp hızlı araba kullanan türde bir ahmağa dönüştürdüğü için. O olmasaydı ölüyor olmayacaktım. Her zaman olduğu gibi evde kalacaktım, güvende olacaktım ve her zaman yapmak istediğim tek şeyi yapacak, büyüyecektim.
es: Dicen que la vida pasa ante tus ojos, pero en mi caso no es así. Nada pasa ante mis ojos aparte de esa enorme extensión de pelo blanco, ahora a solo un segundo de nosotros. No sé qué hacer. No, no es ese el problema. El problema es que no hay nada que hacer, salvo chocarse contra esa pared blanca, matarla y matarnos nosotros. Piso el freno, pero por costumbre, sin expectativas. No hay manera de evitarlo. No sé por qué, pero levanto las manos, como si me rindiera. Pienso en la cosa más banal del mundo: que no quiero que pase. No quiero morir. No quiero que mis amigos mueran. Y para ser sincero, mientras el tiempo se ralentiza y tengo las manos en el aire, me permito pensar en una cosa más, y pienso en Margo. Le echo la culpa de esta ridícula y fatal persecución… por ponernos en peligro, por convertirme en un gilipollas que se pasa la noche sin dormir y conduce demasiado deprisa. No iría a morirme de no haber sido por ella. Me habría quedado en casa, como siempre, y habría estado seguro, y habría hecho la única cosa que siempre he querido hacer, que es crecer.
vi_translation: They say that life flashes before your eyes, but for me, it wasn't like that. Nothing flashed before my eyes except this vast, impossibly white expanse, now just seconds away from us. I didn't know what to do. No, that wasn't the issue. The issue was that there was nothing to do except crash into that white wall, destroying it and us, both sides. I slammed on the brakes, out of habit rather than hoping to change the outcome: it was clearly unavoidable. I raised my hands off the steering wheel. I didn't know why I did it, but I raised my hands, as if surrendering. I thought about the most mundane thing in the world: that I didn't want this to happen. I didn't want to die. I didn't want my friends to die. And honestly, as time slowed down and my hands were in the air, I had the chance for one more thought, and I thought of her. I blamed her for this deadly, ridiculous chase—for putting us at risk, for turning me into a fool driving like a maniac all night. If it weren't for her, I wouldn't be dying. I would have been at home, because I always stayed home, I would have been safe, and I would have been doing what I always wanted to do, which was to grow up.
tr_translation: They say that your life flashes before your eyes like a film strip, but that's not the case for me. Before my eyes, nothing passes except for this incredibly vast, snow-like fur that is now just a second away from us. I don't know what to do. No, that's not the problem. The problem is that there's nothing to do except crash into this white wall and kill both it and ourselves. I'm slamming on the brakes out of habit, with no expectation: it's impossible to avoid this. I take my hands off the steering wheel and raise them up. I don't know why I'm doing this, but I raise my hands, as if I'm surrendering. I'm thinking about the most boring thing in the world: I'm thinking that I don't want this to happen. I don't want to die. I don't want my friends to die. Also, to be honest, as time slows down and my hands are in the air, I have the strength for one more thought and I think of Margo. I blame her for this absurd, deadly chase... for putting us in danger; for turning me into the kind of fool who drives fast all night without sleeping. If it weren't for her, I wouldn't be dying. I would be at home as always, safe, and doing the only thing I've ever wanted to do, which is to grow up.
es_translation: They say that life flashes before your eyes, but in my case, it isn't like that. Nothing flashes before my eyes except that enormous expanse of white fur, now just a second away from us. I don't know what to do. No, that's not the problem. The problem is that there's nothing to do, except crash into that white wall, kill it and kill ourselves. I hit the brakes, but out of habit, without expectations. There's no way to avoid it. I don't know why, but I raise my hands, as if surrendering. I think about the most banal thing in the world: that I don't want it to happen. I don't want to die. I don't want my friends to die. And to be honest, as time slows down and my hands are in the air, I allow myself to think of one more thing, and I think of Margo. I blame her for this ridiculous and fatal chase... for putting us in danger, for turning me into an idiot who spends the night sleepless and drives too fast. I wouldn't be about to die if it weren't for her. I would have stayed home, as always, and would have been safe, and would have done the only thing I've always wanted to do, which is to grow up.

en: Having surrendered control of the vessel, I am surprised to see a hand on the steering wheel. We are turning before I realize why we are turning, and then I realize that Ben is pulling the wheel toward him, turning us in a hopeless attempt to miss the cow, and then we are on the shoulder and then on the grass. I can hear the tires spinning as Ben turns the wheel hard and fast in the opposite direction. I stop watching. I don’t know if my eyes close or if they just cease to see. My stomach and my lungs meet in the middle and crush each other. Something sharp hits my cheek. We stop.
vi: Đã đầu hàng quyền kiểm soát chiếc xe, tôi ngạc nhiên thấy một bàn tay trên vô-lăng. Chúng tôi rẽ trước khi tôi nhận ra tại sao lại rẽ, và nhận ra Ben đang kéo vô-lăng về phía nó, bẻ tay lái trong nỗ lực tuyệt vọng tránh con bò. Chúng tôi trượt sang vai đường rồi lao trên mặt cỏ. Tôi nghe thấy tiếng bánh xe quay tít khi Ben giật tay lái về hướng ngược lại. Tôi không nhìn nữa. Tôi không biết do mắt mình nhắm lại, hay do hai mắt đã không còn thấy được gì. Dạ dày và lá phổi tôi xô vào nhau trong lồng ngực. Thứ gì sắc lẻm cứa vào má tôi. Chúng tôi dừng lại.
tr: Dümenin kontrolünü teslim etmişken, direksiyonda bir el görünce şaşırıyorum. Ben neden döndüğümüzü anlayamadan dönüyoruz; sonra, bizi, ineği ıskalamanın umutsuz beklentisi içine sokarak Ben’in direksiyonu kendine doğru çevirdiğini fark ediyorum, önce bankette, ardından çimenlerdeyiz. Ben, direksiyonu sert ve hızlı bir şekilde öteki yöne çevirirken, lastiklerin fırıl fırıl döndüğünü duyabiliyorum. İzlemeyi bırakıyorum. Gözlerim kapandı mı yoksa sadece görmeyi mi kesti, bilmiyorum. Midem ile ciğerlerim ortada buluşup birbirini eziyor. Keskin bir şey yanağıma çarpıyor. Duruyoruz.
es: Aunque he abandonado el control de la nave, me sorprende ver una mano en el volante. Giramos antes de que me dé cuenta de por qué estamos girando, y entonces veo que Ben está girando el volante hacia él, girando en un desesperado intento de evitar la vaca, y de repente estamos en el arcén y luego en la hierba. Oigo los neumáticos mientras Ben gira el volante con fuerza en la dirección contraria. Dejo de mirar. No sé si cierro los ojos o si sencillamente dejo de ver. Mi estómago choca con mis pulmones y se aplastan entre sí. Algo afilado me golpea en la mejilla. Nos paramos.
vi_translation: Having surrendered control of the car, I was surprised to see a hand on the steering wheel. We turned before I realized why we were turning, and saw Ben pulling the steering wheel towards him, twisting it in a desperate attempt to avoid the cow. We skidded onto the shoulder and then onto the grass. I heard the tires screeching as Ben jerked the wheel in the opposite direction. I stopped looking. I didn't know if it was because my eyes were closed, or because my eyes could no longer see anything. My stomach and lungs collided in my chest. Something sharp cut across my cheek. We came to a stop.
tr_translation: While having handed over control of the helm, I am surprised to see a hand on the steering wheel. We are turning before I understand why we are turning; then, I realize that Ben is turning the wheel towards himself, putting us in the desperate expectation of missing the cow, first on the shoulder, then on the grass. Ben, the wheel hard and While quickly turning the other way, I can hear the tires spinning furiously. I stop watching. I don't know if my eyes closed or if they just stopped seeing. My stomach and lungs meet in the middle and crush each other. Something sharp hits my cheek. We stop.
es_translation: Although I have abandoned control of the ship, I am surprised to see a hand on the wheel. We turn before I realize why we are turning, and then I see that Ben is turning the wheel towards him, turning in a desperate attempt to avoid the cow, and suddenly we are on the shoulder and then on the grass. I hear the tires as Ben turns the wheel sharply in the opposite direction. I stop looking. I don't know if I close my eyes or if I simply stop seeing. My stomach crashes into my lungs and they crush each other. Something sharp hits me on the cheek. We stop.

en: I don’t know why, but I touch my face. I pull my hand back and there is a streak of blood. I touch my arms with my hands, hugging my arms to myself, but I am only checking to make sure that they are there, and they are. I look at my legs. They are there. There is some glass. I look around. Bottles are broken. Ben is looking at me. Ben is touching his face. He looks okay. He holds himself as I held myself. His body still works. He is just looking at me. In the rearview mirror, I can see the cow. And now, belatedly, Ben screams. He is staring at me and screaming, his mouth all the way open, the scream low and guttural and terrified. He stops screaming. Something is wrong with me. I feel faint. My chest is burning. And then I gulp air. I had forgotten to breathe. I had been holding my breath the whole time. I feel much better when I start up again. In through the nose, out through the mouth.
vi: Không biết tại sao, nhưng tôi đưa tay lên mặt. Lật bàn tay ra tôi thấy có vệt máu. Tôi lần sờ hai cánh tay, tự ôm lấy mình, nhưng tôi chỉ kiểm tra xem có còn đủ hai tay không, hóa ra vẫn đủ. Tôi nhìn xuống chân. Vẫn còn. Có mấy mảnh thủy tinh. Tôi nhìn quanh. Các chai vỡ. Ben đang nhìn tôi. Ben đang sờ mặt nó. Trông nó ổn. Nó cũng tự ôm lấy mình như tôi đã làm. Thân thể nó còn hoạt động. Nó chỉ nhìn tôi. Qua gương chiếu hậu, tôi thấy con bò. Và giờ, một cách muộn mằn, Ben hét lên. Nó nhìn tôi chằm chằm và hét lên, miệng há to hết cỡ, tiếng hét trầm thấp và hãi hùng. Nó không hét nữa. Điều gì đó không ổn với tôi. Tôi như đang xỉu. Lồng ngực nóng rát. Rồi tôi bụm một ngụm không khí. Tôi đã quên cả thở. Tôi đã không thở suốt thời gian đó. Tôi thấy khá hơn khi có thể hô hấp trở lại. Hít vào đằng mũi, thở ra đằng miệng.
tr: Neden olduğunu bilmiyorum ama yüzüme dokunuyorum. Elimi geri çekiyorum, kan izi var. Kollarımı kendime sararak, ellerimle yalnızca orada olduklarından emin olmak için kollanma dokunarak kontrol ediyorum, oradalar. Bacaklanma bakıyorum. Oradalar. Biraz cam var. Etrafa bakıyorum. Şişeler kırılmış. Ben bana bakıyor. Ben yüzüne dokunuyor. İyi görünüyor. Benim kendime sarıldığım gibi kendine sarıkyor. Vücudu hâlâ yerli yerinde. Sadece bana bakıyor. Dikiz aynasında ineği görebihyorum. Ancak şimdi, gecikmeli olarak Ben çığlık atıyor. Bana bakıyor ve çığlık atıyor, ağzı tamamen açık, çığhğı kısık, boğuk ve dehşete kapılmış. Çığlık atmayı bırakıyor. Bende bir sorun var. Bayılacak gibi hissediyorum. Göğsüm yanıyor. Ve sonra hava yutuyorum. Nefes almayı unutmuşum. Bunca zamandır nefesimi tutmuşum. Tekrar nefes almaya başlayınca çok daha iyi hissediyorum. Burundan içeri, ağızdan dışarı.
es: No sé por qué, pero me toco la cara. Retiro la mano y veo una mancha de sangre. Me toco los brazos, como si me abrazara a mí mismo, aunque solo estoy comprobando si están ahí, y lo están. Me miro las piernas. Están ahí. Hay cristales. Miro alrededor. Se han roto las botellas. Ben me mira. Se toca la cara. Parece que está bien. Se pasa las manos por el cuerpo como yo. Su cuerpo todavía funciona. Solo me mira. Veo la vaca por el retrovisor. Y ahora, con retraso, Ben grita. Me mira y grita con la boca muy abierta, un grito grave, gutural y aterrorizado. Deja de gritar. Algo me pasa. Siento que me desmayo. Me arde el pecho. Entonces trago aire. Había olvidado respirar. Había contenido la respiración todo ese tiempo. Me siento mucho mejor cuando la recupero. «Inspirar por la nariz, espirar por la boca».
vi_translation: I don't know why, but I raised my hand to my face. Turning my hand over, I saw a streak of blood. I felt both my arms, hugged myself, but I was just checking if I still had both arms, turns out I did. I looked down at my legs. Still there. There were some pieces of glass. I looked around. The bottles were broken. Ben was looking at me. Ben was touching his face. He looked fine. He also hugged himself like I did. His body was still functioning. He just looked at me. Through the rearview mirror, I saw the cow. And now, belatedly, Ben screamed. He stared at me and screamed, his mouth wide open, the scream deep and terrifying. He stopped screaming. Something was wrong with me. I felt like I was fainting. My chest was burning. Then I gasped for air. I had forgotten to breathe. I hadn't been breathing that whole time. I felt better when I could breathe again. Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth.
tr_translation: I don't know why, but I touch my face. I pull my hand back, there's a trace of blood. Wrapping my arms around myself, I touch my arms just to make sure they're there, they are. I look at my legs. They're there. There's some glass. I look around. Bottles are broken. I am looking at me. I touch my face. It looks fine. Just like I am hugging myself, he is hugging himself. His body is still intact. He just looks at me. I can see him in the rearview mirror. But now, belatedly, he screams. He looks at me and screams, his mouth wide open, his scream hoarse, muffled, and terrified. He stops screaming. There's something wrong with me. I feel like I'm going to faint. My chest is burning. And then I gulp air. I had forgotten to breathe. I've been holding my breath all this time. When I start breathing again, I feel much better. In through the nose, out through the mouth.
es_translation: I don't know why, but I touch my face. I withdraw my hand and see a bloodstain. I touch my arms, as if hugging myself, although I'm just checking if they're there, and they are. I look at my legs. They're there. There is glass. I look around. The bottles have broken. Ben looks at me. He touches his face. He seems to be okay. He runs his hands over his body like I do. His body still works. He just looks at me. I see the cow in the rearview mirror. And now, belatedly, Ben screams. He looks at me and screams with his mouth wide open, a deep, guttural, and terrified scream. He stops screaming. Something is happening to me. I feel like I'm fainting. My chest burns. Then I gasp for air. I had forgotten to breathe. I had been holding my breath all that time. I feel much better when I catch it. “Inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth.”

en: “Who is hurt?!” Lacey shouts. She’s unbuckled herself from her sleeping position and she’s leaning into the wayback. When I turn around, I can see that the back door has popped open, and for a moment I think that Radar has been thrown from the car, but then he sits up. He is running his hands over his face, and he says, “I’m okay. I’m okay. Is everyone okay?”
vi: “Có ai bị sao không?” Lacey la lên. Cậu ấy vùng khỏi chỗ nằm và chúi về phía sau. Tôi quay lại, thấy cửa sau xe bị bật, trong tích tắc tôi đã nghĩ Radar bị văng ra ngoài mất rồi, nhưng nó nhỏm dậy. Nó quờ tay lên mặt rồi nói, “Tôi không sao, không sao. Mọi người ổn cả không?”
tr: “Kim yaralı?!” diye bağırıyor Lacey. Emniyet kemerini açıp uyku pozisyonundan çıkmış, arka tarafa doğru eğiliyor. Arkamı döndüğümde, arka kapının açılmış olduğunu görebiliyorum ve bir anlığına Radar’m arabadan fırladığım düşünüyorum fakat Radar doğruluyor. Ellerini hızla yüzünde gezdiriyor ve “iyiyim. İyiyim. Herkes iyi mi?” diyor.
es: —¿Quién está herido? —grita Lacey. Se ha desabrochado el cinturón, se incorpora y se inclina hacia la parte de atrás. Cuando me giro, veo que la puerta de atrás se ha abierto, y por un momento pienso que Radar ha salido disparado del coche, pero de repente se levanta. Se pasa las manos por la cara. —Estoy bien. Estoy bien. ¿Estáis todos bien? —pregunta.
vi_translation: “Is anyone hurt?” Lacey shouted. He scrambled out of his spot and stumbled backward. I turned around, saw the back door of the car was open, and for a moment I thought Radar had been thrown out, but he sat up. He wiped his face and said, “I’m okay, I’m okay. Is everyone else alright?”
tr_translation: “Who is injured?!” shouts Lacey. She unbuckles her seatbelt, gets out of her sleeping position, and leans towards the back. When I turn around, I can see that the back door is open, and for a moment I think Radar has been thrown out of the car, but Radar straightens up. He quickly runs his hands over his face and says, “I'm fine. I'm fine. Is everyone okay?”
es_translation: —Who is hurt? —shouts Lacey. He has unbuckled his seatbelt, sits up, and leans towards the back. When I turn around, I see that the back door has opened, and for a moment I think Radar has shot out of the car, but suddenly he gets up. He runs his hands over his face. —I'm fine. I'm fine. Are you all okay? —he asks.

en: Lacey doesn’t even respond; she just jumps forward, between Ben and me. She is leaning over the apartment’s kitchen, and she looks at Ben. She says, “Sweetie, where are you hurt?” Her eyes are overfull of water like a swimming pool on a rainy day. And Ben says, “I’mfineI’mfineQisbleeding.”
vi: Lacey không đáp; cậu ấy nhảy về phía trước, giữa tôi và Ben. Lacey cúi xuống trên gian bếp của căn hộ, nhìn Ben hỏi, “Cưng bị đau chỗ nào?” Đôi mắt Lacey ậng ậng nước như mặt bể bơi một ngày mưa. Và Ben đáp, “KhôngsaokhôngsaoQchảymáukìa.”
tr: Lacey cevap bile vermiyor; sadece öne, Ben ile benim arama zıplıyor. Evin mutfağına yaslanıp Ben’e bakıyor. “Tatlım, neren yaralandı?” diyor. Gözleri, yağmurlu bir gündeki yüzme havuzu gibi dolmuş. Ve Ben, “İyiyimIyiyimQ’nunkanamasıvar,” diyor.
es: Lacey ni siquiera contesta. Salta hacia delante, entre Ben y yo. Se apoya en la cocina y mira a Ben. —Cariño, ¿dónde te has hecho daño? Tiene los ojos llenos de agua, como una piscina en un día lluvioso. —EstoybienestoybienQestásangrando.
vi_translation: Lacey didn't respond; she jumped forward, between me and Ben. Lacey bent down in the kitchen of the apartment, looking at Ben and asked, "Where does it hurt, honey?" Lacey's eyes were brimming with tears like a swimming pool on a rainy day. And Ben replied, "It'sokit'sokQyou'rebleeding."
tr_translation: Lacey doesn't even respond; she just jumps forward, between Ben and me. She leans against the kitchen and looks at Ben. “Sweetheart, where are you hurt?” she says. Her eyes are filled, like a swimming pool on a rainy day. And Ben says, “I'm fineI'mfineQ'sbleeding,” he says.
es_translation: Lacey doesn't even answer. She jumps forward, between Ben and me. She leans on the kitchen counter and looks at Ben. —Honey, where did you hurt yourself? Her eyes are filled with water, like a swimming pool on a rainy day. —I'm fine, I'm fine. You're bleeding.

en: She turns to me, and I shouldn’t cry but I do, not because it hurts, but because I am scared, and I raised my hands, and Ben saved us, and now there is this girl looking at me, and she looks at me kind of the way a mom does, and that shouldn’t crack me open, but it does. I know the cut on my cheek isn’t bad, and I’m trying to say so, but I keep crying. Lacey is pressing against the cut with her fingers, thin and soft, and shouting at Ben for something to use as a bandage, and then I’ve got a small swath of the Confederate flag pressed against my cheek just to the right of my nose. She says, “Just hold it there tight; you’re fine does anything else hurt?” and I say no. That’s when I realize that the car is still running, and still in gear, stopped only because I’m still standing on the brakes. I put it into park and turn it off. When I turn it off, I can hear liquid leaking—not dripping so much as pouring.
vi: Lacey quay sang tôi. Lẽ ra không nên khóc nhưng tôi đã khóc. Không phải tại đau, mà vì tôi sợ, tôi đã giơ tay lên, Ben đã cứu chúng tôi, và bây giờ cô gái này đang nhìn tôi, như cách mẹ vẫn dành cho tôi, và điều đó lẽ ra không nên làm tôi nứt rạn, nhưng tôi đã nứt rạn. Tôi biết vết xước trên mặt mình không nhằm nhò gì, và tôi cố gắng nói lên điều đó, nhưng tôi cứ khóc. Lacey ấn lên vết xước bằng mấy ngón tay, thon mảnh và mềm mại, kêu Ben hãy tìm thứ gì để băng. Và rồi tôi được một dải trên lá cờ Liên Minh ấn lên má phải, ngay gần mũi. Lacey nói, “Cứ giữ chặt thế, sẽ ổn thôi, cậu còn đau chỗ nào không?” và tôi đáp không. Khi đó tôi nhận ra rằng xe vẫn đang nổ máy, động cơ vẫn hoạt động, xe dừng lại chỉ bởi vì tôi vẫn còn dậm phanh. Tôi chuyển về trạng thái đỗ và tắt máy xe. Đến lúc ấy, tôi mới nghe được tiếng chất lỏng đang chảy–không phải nhỏ giọt mà nghe rào rào.
tr: Lacey bana dönüyor, ağlamamalıyım ama ağlıyorum, canım yandığı için değil, korktuğum için, ellerimi kaldırdığım için ve Ben bizi kurtardığı için, şimdi bana bakan bir kız var ve bana bir annenin baktığı şekilde bakıyor, bu beni savunmasız bırakmamalı ama bırakıyor. Yanağımdaki kesiğin kötü olmadığım biliyorum ve öyle olduğunu söylemeye çalışıyorum ama ağlayıp duruyorum. Lacey parmaklarıyla hafif ve yumuşak bir şekilde kesiğe bastırıyor ve bandaj olarak kullanılabilecek bir şey bulması için Ben’e bağırıyor; sonra burnumun tam sağ tarafında, yanağıma bastırılmış Konfederasyon bayrağından bir bandajım oluyor. Lacey, “Onu sıkıca orada tut; sorun yok, başka bir yerin acıyor mu?” diyor, ben de hayır diyorum. O an arabanın hâlâ çalıştığını, viteste olduğunu ve yalnızca hâlâ frene bastığım için durduğunu fark ediyorum. Arabanın vitesini park konumuna getirip motoru kapatıyorum. Kapatınca bir sıvının aktığını duyabiliyorum... Damlamıyor, daha ziyade dökülüyor.
es: Se gira hacia mí, y no debería llorar, pero lloro, no porque me duela, sino porque estoy asustado, yo levanté las manos, y Ben nos ha salvado, y ahora esta chica me mira, y me mira como mira una madre, y no debería romperme, pero me rompo. Sé que el corte en la mejilla no es grave, e intento decirlo, pero sigo llorando. Lacey presiona el corte con los dedos, delgados y suaves, y grita a Ben que le dé algo que sirva como venda, y de repente tengo una franja de la bandera de la Confederación pegada a la mejilla, justo a la derecha de la nariz. —Apriétalo un momento —me dice—. No es nada. ¿Te has hecho algo más? Le digo que no. Entonces me doy cuenta de que el coche sigue en marcha, que está parado solo porque todavía estoy pisando el freno. Quito la marcha y lo apago. Al apagarlo, oigo que pierde líquido. Más que gotear, chorrea.
vi_translation: Lacey turned to me. I shouldn't have cried but I did. It wasn't because of the pain, but because I was scared, I raised my hand, Ben saved us, and now this girl was looking at me, like the way my mother used to, and that shouldn't have broken me, but it did. I knew the scratch on my face was nothing, and I tried to say that, but I kept crying. Lacey pressed on the scratch with her slender, soft fingers, telling Ben to find something to bandage it. And then a strip of the Union flag was pressed against my right cheek, near my nose. Lacey said, "Just hold it tight, it'll be okay, are you hurt anywhere else?" and I said no. At that moment I realized the car engine was still running, the engine was still on, the car had stopped only because I was still pressing the brake. I shifted to park and turned off the engine. Only then did I hear the sound of liquid flowing—not dripping but gushing.
tr_translation: Lacey is turning to me, I shouldn't cry but I am crying, not because I am hurt, but because I am scared, because I raised my hands and Because Ben saved me, there is now a girl looking after me, and she looks at me in a way a mother would, which shouldn't make me feel vulnerable, but it does. I know the cut on my cheek isn't bad and I'm trying to say so, but I keep crying. Lacey gently and softly presses on the cut with her fingers and yells at Ben to find something that can be used as a bandage; then I have a bandage made from a Confederate flag pressed against my cheek, just to the right of my nose. Lacey says, "Hold it there tightly; it's okay, does anything else hurt?" and I say no. At that moment, I realize the car is still running, in gear, and only stopped because I am still pressing the brake. I shift the car into park and turn off the engine. When I turn it off, I can hear a liquid flowing... It's not dripping, more like pouring.
es_translation: She turns towards me, and I shouldn't cry, but I cry, not because it hurts, but because I'm scared, I raised my hands, and Ben has saved us, and now this girl looks at me, and she looks at me like a mother, and I shouldn't break, but I break. I know the cut on my cheek is not serious, and I try to say it, but I keep crying. Lacey presses the cut with her fingers, thin and soft, and yells at Ben to give her something that can serve as a bandage, and suddenly I have a strip of the Confederate flag stuck to my cheek, just to the right of my nose. —Squeeze it for a moment —he tells me—. It's nothing. Did you hurt yourself more? I tell him no. Then I realize that the car is still running, that it is only stopped because I am still pressing the brake. I put it in neutral and turn it off. When I turn it off, I hear it leaking fluid. More than dripping, it's gushing.

en: “We should probably get out,” Radar says. I hold the Confederate flag to my face. The sound of liquid pouring out of the car continues.
vi: “Nên ra ngoài ngay,” Radar nói. Tôi giữ dải cờ Liên Minh trên mặt. Tiếng chất lỏng chảy từ xe ra vẫn chưa dứt.
tr: “Muhtemelen dışarı çıkmalıyız,” diyor Radar. Konfederasyon bayrağını yüzüme bastırıyorum. Arabadan dışarı dökülen sıvının sesi devam ediyor.
es: —Creo que deberíamos salir —dice Radar. Mantengo la bandera de la Confederación pegada a la cara. Sigo oyendo el ruido del líquido.
vi_translation: “We should go outside immediately,” Radar said. I held the Confederate flag strip on my face. The sound of liquid flowing from the car had not yet ceased.
tr_translation: “We should probably go outside,” says Radar. I press the Confederate flag against my face. The sound of the liquid spilling out of the car continues.
es_translation: —I think we should leave —says Radar. I keep the Confederate flag stuck to my face. I continue to hear the sound of the liquid.

en: “It’s gas! It’s gonna blow!” Ben shouts. He throws open the passenger door and takes off, running in a panic. He hurdles a split-rail fence and tears across a hay field. I get out as well, but not in quite the same hurry. Radar is outside, too, and as Ben hauls ass, Radar is laughing. “It’s the beer,” he says.
vi: “Xăng đấy! Chắc sắp nổ đấy!” Ben kêu toáng lên. Nó mở ngay cửa trước và lao ra, hoảng hốt chạy đi. Nó nhảy phóc qua một hàng rào gỗ và chạy xé qua đồng cỏ khô. Tôi cũng ra nhưng không khẩn trương đến mức ấy. Radar cũng ra ngoài, và trong khi Ben vẫn đang chạy thục mạng, Radar cười ngất, “Là bia đấy,” nó nói.
tr: “Benzin! Patlayacak!” diye bağırıyor Ben. Ön kapıyı hızla açıyor ve panikle çıkıp koşarak gidiyor. Ahşap bir çitin üstünden sıçrayarak çayırda koşmaya başlıyor. Bu sırada ben de dışarı çıkıyorum ama o kadar acele etmiyorum. Radar da dışarıda ve Ben topuklan kıçına vurarak kaçarken Radar gülüyor. “Bira,” diyor.
es: —¡Es gasolina! ¡Va a explotar! —grita Ben. Abre la puerta del copiloto y sale corriendo, aterrorizado. Salta una valla y corre por un campo de heno. Yo también salgo, aunque no tan deprisa. Radar también está fuera, y mientras Ben sale por patas, se ríe. —Es la cerveza —dice.
vi_translation: “That's gasoline!” “It's probably going to explode!” Ben shouted. He immediately opened the front door and rushed out, running away in panic. He jumped over a wooden fence and dashed through the dry meadow. I also went out but not in such a hurry. Radar also went outside, and while Ben was still running frantically, Radar burst out laughing, “It's beer,” he said.
tr_translation: "Gasoline! It's going to explode!" Ben shouts. He quickly opens the front door and runs out in a panic. He starts running across the meadow, jumping over a wooden fence. Meanwhile, I also go outside, but I'm not in such a hurry. Radar is also outside, and while Ben is running away with his heels hitting his backside, Radar is laughing. "Beer," he says.
es_translation: —It's gasoline! It's going to explode! —shouts Ben. He opens the passenger door and runs out, terrified. He jumps a fence and runs through a hayfield. I also get out, though not as quickly. Radar is also out, and while Ben runs away, he laughs. —It's the beer —he says.

en: “What?”
vi: “Gì cơ?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?

en: We try to call Ben but he can’t hear us because he’s too busy screaming, “IT’S GONNA BLOW!” as he races across the field. His graduation robe flies up in the gray dawn, his bony bare ass exposed.
vi: Chúng tôi cố gắng gọi Ben nhưng nó không nghe thấy vì còn mải la hét, “SẼ NỔ ĐẤY!” và vẫn đang chạy qua đồng. Áo chùng của nó bay phấp phới trong ánh bình minh nhàn nhạt, phô ra cái mông còi nhọn vểnh.
tr: Ben’i çağırmayı deniyoruz ama bizi duyamıyor çünkü çayın koşarak aşarken, “PATLAYACAK!” diye çığlık atmakla meşgul. Mezuniyet cübbesi gri renkli şafakta uçuşuyor, çıplak cılız kıçı açığa çıkmış.
es: Intentamos llamar a Ben, que no nos oye porque se dedica a gritar ¡VA A EXPLOTAR! corriendo por el campo. Su toga vuela a la luz grisácea del amanecer y se le ve el culo huesudo.
vi_translation: We tried to call Ben, but he couldn't hear us because he was busy shouting, "IT'S GOING TO EXPLODE!" and was still running across the field. His robe fluttered in the pale dawn light, exposing his bony, pointed buttocks.

es_translation: We tried to call Ben, who doesn't hear us because he is busy shouting "IT'S GOING TO EXPLODE!" while running across the field. His toga flies in the grayish dawn light, and his bony butt is visible.

en: I turn and look out at the highway as I hear a car coming. The white beast and her spotted friend have successfully ambled to the safety of the opposite shoulder, still impassive. Turning back, I realize the minivan is against the fence.
vi: Tôi quay lại nhìn ra đường cao tốc khi nghe thấy tiếng ô-tô chạy đến. Cô nàng trắng muốt và anh bạn đốm đã thủng thẳng ở vùng an toàn trên vai đường đối diện, vẫn rõ là nhởn nhơ vô tự lự. Quay lại, tôi thấy chiếc minivan đang húc vào hàng rào.
tr: Bir arabanın geldiğini duyunca dönüp anayola bakıyorum. Beyaz canavar ile benekli arkadaşı sahnarak karşı bankete geçip başanlı bir şekilde kendilerini emniyete almışlar, hâlâ umursamazlar. Arkama dönünce minivanın çite dayalı olduğunu fark ediyorum.
es: Oigo un coche, así que me giro y miro hacia la autopista. La bestia blanca y su amiga con manchas han llegado tranquilamente, sanas y salvas, a la otra cuneta, impasibles. Al volver a girarme veo que el monovolumen está contra la valla.
vi_translation: I turned back to look at the highway when I heard the sound of a car approaching. The pure white girl and her spotted friend were leisurely in the safe zone on the opposite shoulder, still clearly carefree and untroubled. Turning back, I saw the minivan crashing into the fence.
tr_translation: When I hear a car coming, I turn and look at the main road. The white monster and its spotted friend trot across to the opposite bank. They have successfully secured themselves, still indifferent. When I turn around, I notice that the minivan is leaning against the fence.
es_translation: I hear a car, so I turn around and look towards the highway. The white beast and its spotted friend have calmly arrived, safe and sound, at the other shoulder, unperturbed. When I turn around again, I see that the minivan is against the fence.

en: I tell her: we were dead, and then Ben managed to spin the car in just the right way, like some kind of brilliant vehicular ballerina.
vi: Tôi kể: cả lũ tiêu đến nơi rồi, nhưng Ben đã kịp thời bẻ tay lái, cái xe rẽ ngoặt đầy nghệ thuật như một vũ công ba-lê vậy.
tr: Anlatıyorum: Ölmüştük, sonra Ben arabayı harika bir araç balerini gibi doğru yöne döndürmeyi başardı.
es: Se lo cuento: estábamos muertos, pero Ben consiguió girar el coche en la dirección correcta, como si fuera una brillante bailarina vehicular.
vi_translation: I said: we were all about to crash, but Ben managed to steer just in time, making the car turn sharply like a ballet dancer.
tr_translation: We had died, then I managed to turn the car in the right direction like a wonderful vehicle ballerina.
es_translation: I'll tell you: we were dead, but Ben managed to turn the car in the right direction, as if it were a brilliant vehicular ballerina.

en: Ben and Radar have crawled underneath the minivan. Neither of them knows shit about cars, but I suppose it makes them feel better. The hem of Ben’s robe and his naked calves peek out.
vi: Ben và Radar đã bò vào gầm xe. Cả hai thằng đều ấm ớ về xe cộ, nhưng chắc chui vào như vậy khiến chúng nó thấy khá hơn. Mép áo chùng của Ben và ống chân nó thò ra.
tr: Ben ile Radar minivamn altına girmişler. İkisi de arabalar haJckmda bir bok bilmez ama sanırım bu, onların daha iyi hissetmesini sağlıyor. Ben’in cübbesinin ucu ve çıplak baldırları dışarı çıkmış durumda.
es: Ben y Radar se han metido debajo del monovolumen. Ninguno de los dos sabe una mierda de coches, pero supongo que así se sienten mejor. Por un lado asoma el dobladillo de la toga de Ben y su culo al aire.
vi_translation: Ben and Radar crawled under the car. Both of them were clueless about cars, but crawling under probably made them feel better. The hem of Ben's robe and his legs stuck out.
tr_translation: Ben and Radar have gotten under the minivan. Neither of them knows a damn thing about cars, but I guess it makes them feel better. The edge of Ben's robe and his bare calves are sticking out.
es_translation: Ben and Radar have crawled under the minivan. Neither of them knows a damn thing about cars, but I guess it makes them feel better. On one side, the hem of Ben's toga and his bare butt are sticking out.

en: “Dude,” Radar shouts. “It looks, like, fine.”
vi: “Trông ổn các bồ ạ,” Radar nói to.
tr: ‘Dostum,” diye bağırıyor Radar. “İyi gibi görünüyor.
es: —Tío —grita Radar—, parece que está perfecto.
vi_translation: "Looks good, guys," Radar said loudly.
tr_translation: “My friend,” shouts Radar. “It looks good.”
es_translation: —Uncle —shouts Radar—, it looks like it's perfect.

en: “Radar,” I say, “the car spun around like eight times. Surely it’s not fine.”
vi: “Xe xoay ngang khoảng tám vòng đó Radar,” tôi nói, “Chắc không ổn được đâu.”
tr: “Radar,” diyorum, “araba sekiz kere falan etrafında döndü. Kesinlikle iyi olmamalı.
es: —Radar —le digo—, el coche ha dado unas ocho vueltas. Seguro que no está perfecto.

tr_translation: “Radar,” I say, “the car spun around about eight times. It definitely can't be good.”
es_translation: —Radar —I tell him—, the car has spun about eight times. It's surely not in perfect condition.

en: “Well it seems fine,” Radar says.

en: “Hey,” I say, grabbing at Ben’s New Balances. “Hey, come out here.” He scoots his way out, and I offer him my hand and help him up. His hands are black with car gunk. I grab him and hug him. If I had not ceded control of the wheel, and if he had not assumed control of the vessel so deftly, I’m sure I’d be dead. “Thank you,” I say, pounding his back probably too hard. “That was the best damned passenger-seat driving I’ve ever seen in my life.”
vi: “Này,” tôi gọi, tóm đôi giày New Balance trên chân Ben. “Này, ra đây.” Nó nhích ra, tôi chìa tay đỡ nó đứng dậy. Hai tay nó đen sì những thứ bẩn bẩn từ xe. Tôi quàng vai ôm lấy nó. Nếu tôi không đầu hàng tay lái, và nếu nó không kịp thời xử lí, chắc chắn tôi đã đi đời rồi. “Cảm ơn ông,” tôi nói, vỗ thùm thụp chắc là hơi quá mạnh tay lên lưng nó. “Cả đời tôi bây giờ mới được chứng kiến màn bẻ tay lái từ ghế bên ngoạn mục đến vậy.”
tr: “Hey,” diyorum, Ben’in New Balance ayakkabılarını tutarak. “Hey, dışan çık.” Sürünerek dışan çıkıyor, ona elimi uzatıp kalkmasına yardım ediyorum. Elleri arabadan gelen yapışkan bir maddeyle kararmış. Onu yakalayıp sarılıyorum. Eğer direksiyonun kontrolünü devretmiş olmasaydım, o direksiyonun kontrolünü böyle hünerli bir şekilde ele geçirmemiş olsaydı ölmüş olurdum. “Teşekkürler,” diyorum, muhtemelen çok sert bir şekilde sırtına vurarak. “Bu hayatımda gördüğüm en iyi yolcu koltuğu sürüşüydü.
es: —Eh —digo agarrando las New Balance de Ben—. Eh, venga, sal de ahí. Sale arrastrándose, le tiendo la mano y tiro de él para que se levante. Se ha manchado las manos de grasa. Lo abrazo. Si yo no hubiera soltado el volante, y si él no hubiera asumido el control tan hábilmente, estoy seguro de que estaría muerto. —Gracias —le digo golpeándole en la espalda, seguramente demasiado fuerte—. Eres el mejor copiloto que he visto en mi vida.
vi_translation: “Hey,” I called, grabbing the New Balance shoes on Ben's feet. “Hey, come here.” He scooted out, and I extended my hand to help him up. His hands were pitch black with grime from the car. I put my arm around his shoulder. If I hadn't surrendered the wheel, and if he hadn't acted in time, I would have been a goner for sure. “Thanks, man,” I said, patting him on the back, probably a bit too hard. “In my entire life, I've never seen such an impressive steering maneuver from the passenger seat.”
tr_translation: “Hey,” I say, holding Ben’s New Balance shoes. “Hey, get out.” He crawls out, and I extend my hand to help him up. His hands are darkened with a sticky substance from the car. I grab him and hug him. If I hadn’t handed over control of the steering wheel, if he hadn’t taken control of it so skillfully, I would have died. “Thanks,” I say, probably patting his back too hard. “That was the best passenger seat driving I’ve ever seen.”
es_translation: —Hey —I say, grabbing Ben's New Balance shoes—. Hey, come on, get out of there. He comes out crawling, I extend my hand and pull him up to help him stand. His hands are stained with grease. I hug him. If I hadn't let go of the steering wheel, and if he hadn't taken control so skillfully, I'm sure I would be dead. —Thanks —I say, patting him on the back, probably too hard—. You are the best co-pilot I have ever seen in my life.

en: He pats my uninjured cheek with a greasy hand. “I did it to save myself, not you,” he says. “Believe me when I say that you did not once cross my mind.”
vi: Ben quệt bàn tay lem nhem dầu xe lên bên má lành của tôi. “Tôi làm thế để tự cứu mình chứ cứu gì ông,” nó nói. “Tin tôi đi, trong đầu tôi lúc đó không nghĩ tí tị tèo teo nào đến ông cả.
tr: Yağlı eliyle yaralı olmayan yanağıma vuruyor. “Kendimi kurtarmak için yaptım, seni değil,” diyor. “İnan ki sen aklıma bir kez bile gelmedin.
es: Me da una palmada en la mejilla con su mano grasienta. —Lo he hecho para salvarme a mí mismo, no a ti —contesta—. No he pensado en ti ni un segundo, créeme.
vi_translation: Ben wiped his greasy, oil-stained hand on my uninjured cheek. "I did it to save myself, not you," he said. "Believe me, at that moment, you didn't cross my mind at all."
tr_translation: He hits my uninjured cheek with his greasy hand. “I did it to save myself, not you,” he says. “Believe me, you never crossed my mind even once.”
es_translation: He gives me a slap on the cheek with his greasy hand. —I did it to save myself, not you —he replies—. I haven't thought about you for even a second, believe me.

en: I laugh. “Nor you mine,” I say.
vi: Tôi bật cười. “Tôi cũng chả nghĩ đến ông,” tôi nói.
tr: Gülüyorum. “Sen de benim,” diyorum.
es: Me río. —Ni yo en ti —le contesto.
vi_translation: I burst out laughing. "I didn't think about you either," I said.
tr_translation: I am laughing. “You too, mine,” I say.
es_translation: I laugh. —Neither do I in you —he replied.

en: Ben looks at me, his mouth on the edge of smiling, and then says, “I mean, that was a big damned cow. It wasn’t even a cow so much as it was a land whale.” I laugh.
vi: Ben nhìn tôi, khóe miệng chực múm mím, rồi nó nói, “Ờ, con bò to vật vã. Chắc không phải bò mà là cá voi biết đi quá.” Tôi cười ngất.
tr: Ben bana bakıyor, gülümsemek üzere, sonra ekliyor: ‘Yani gerçekten lanet olası inek çok büyüktü. Bir inek filan değil de karaya vurmuş bir balina gibiydi.” Gülüyorum.
es: Ben me mira a punto de sonreír. —Bueno, era una puta vaca enorme. Más que una vaca, era una ballena de tierra. Me río.
vi_translation: Ben looked at me, the corners of his mouth twitching, then he said, "Yeah, that cow is huge." "It must not be a cow but a walking whale." I burst out laughing.
tr_translation: He looks at me, about to smile, then adds: ‘I mean, the damn cow was really huge. It was more like a beached whale than a cow.” I laugh.
es_translation: Ben looks at me, about to smile. —Well, it was a huge damn cow. More than a cow, it was a land whale. I laugh.

en: Radar scoots out then. “Dude, I really think it’s fine. I mean, we’ve only lost like five minutes. We don’t even have to push up the cruising speed.”
vi: Radar chui ra. “Các bồ thân mến, tôi thực sự nghĩ là ổn. Bọn mình chỉ mất khoảng năm phút thôi. Cứ đi tiếp cũng không cần tăng tốc.”
tr: O sırada Radar sürünerek dışarı çıkıyor. “Dostum, gerçekten iyi olduğunu düşünüyorum. Yani sadece beş dakika falan kaybettik. Sabit hızımızı artırmak zorunda bile değiliz.
es: Radar sale de debajo del coche. —Tío, de verdad que creo que está perfecto. Solo hemos perdido cinco minutos. Ni siquiera tenemos que aumentar la velocidad de crucero.
vi_translation: Radar poked out. "Dear friends, I really think it's fine. We only lost about five minutes. Just keep going, no need to speed up."
tr_translation: At that moment, Radar is crawling out. "Buddy, I really think you're doing well. I mean, we only lost about five minutes. We don't even have to increase our steady speed."
es_translation: Radar comes out from under the car. —Uncle, I really think it's perfect. We've only lost five minutes. We don't even have to increase the cruising speed.

en: Lacey is looking at the gouge in the minivan, her lips pursed. “What do you think?” I ask her.
vi: Lacey đang bặm môi nhìn lỗ thủng trên xe. “Cậu thấy thế nào?” tôi hỏi Lacey.
tr: Lacey minivandaki göçüğe bakıyor, dudakları büzülmüş. “Ne düşünüyorsun?” diye soruyorum.
es: Lacey observa el monovolumen abollado frunciendo los labios. —¿Qué opinas? —le pregunto.
vi_translation: Lacey was biting her lip, looking at the hole in the car. "What do you think?" I asked Lacey.
tr_translation: Lacey is looking at the dent in the minivan, her lips pursed. “What are you thinking?” I ask.
es_translation: Lacey observes the dented minivan, pursing her lips. —What do you think? —I ask him.

en: “Go,” she says.

tr: “Devam,” diyor.

en: “Go,” Radar votes.

en: Ben puffs out his cheeks and exhales. “Mostly because I’m prone to peer pressure: go.”
vi: Ben thở ra đánh phìu. “Phần nhiều vì tôi quen với áp lực từ đồng đội: đi thôi.”
tr: Ben yanaklarını şişirip nefesini üflüyor. “Daha çok çevre baskısından etkilendiğim için devam.
es: Ben hincha las mejillas y resopla. —Sobre todo porque me gusta presionar al grupo: vamos.
vi_translation: Ben sighed heavily. “Mostly because I'm used to pressure from my teammates: let's go.”
tr_translation: I'm puffing out my cheeks and blowing out my breath. "I continue mainly because I'm influenced by social pressure."
es_translation: Ben puffs out his cheeks and snorts. —Above all because I like to push the group: let's go.

en: “Go,” I say. “But I’m sure as hell not driving anymore.”
vi: “Đi thôi,” tôi nói. “Nhưng chắc như ăn bắp là tôi không cầm lái nữa.”
tr: ‘Devam,” diyorum. “Ama arabayı daha fazla sürmeyeceğimden adım gibi eminim.
es: —Vamos —digo yo—. Pero os aseguro que no vuelvo a conducir.
vi_translation: "Let's go," I said. "But I'm definitely not driving anymore."
tr_translation: “Continue,” I say. “But I am as sure as my name that I will not drive the car any longer.”
es_translation: —Let's go —I say—. But I assure you that I won't drive again.

en: Ben takes the keys from me. We get into the minivan. Radar guides us up a slow-sloping embankment and back onto the interstate. We’re 542 miles from Agloe.
vi: Ben nhận chìa khóa từ tay tôi. Chúng tôi vào xe. Radar chỉ đường đi lên một kè hơi dốc, rồi bọn tôi quay lại cao tốc liên bang. Chúng tôi đang cách Agloe 542 dặm.
tr: Ben, anahtarları benden alıyor. Minivana biniyoruz. Radar banketten yavaşça çıkıp eyaletler arası yola geri dönmemiz için bize yön gösteriyor. Agloe’dan 872 kilometre uzaktayız.
es: Le paso a Ben las llaves y subimos al coche. Radar nos guía por un pequeño terraplén y volvemos a meternos en la autopista. Estamos a 872 kilómetros de Agloe.
vi_translation: Ben received the keys from my hand. We got into the car. Radar directed us up a slightly sloping embankment, then we got back on the interstate highway. We were 542 miles away from Agloe.

en: Hour Thirteen

vi_translation: The Thirteenth Hour
