en: Every couple minutes, Radar says, “Do you guys remember that time when we were all definitely going to die and then Ben grabbed the steering wheel and dodged a ginormous freaking cow and spun the car like the teacups at Disney World and we didn’t die?”
vi: Vài phút một Radar lại nói, “Các cậu nhớ không hồi đấy khi chúng mình đều sắp chết ấy có Ben kì tài biết mấy bắn qua em bò to phát ngấy xoay bạn xe mòng mòng như tách trà ở Disney World bá chấy thế là chúng mình khỏi nát bấy.”
tr: Her birkaç dakikada bir Radar şöyle diyor: “Çocuklar, hepimizin kesinlikle öleceği, sonra Ben’in direksiyonu yakalayıp devasa boyuttaki lanet inekten kaçarak arabayı lunaparktaki fincanlar gibi döndürdüğü ve ölmediğimiz zamanı hatırlıyor musunuz?
es: Cada dos minutos, Radar dice: —Chicos, ¿recordáis aquella vez en que todos íbamos a morir y entonces Ben agarró el volante, esquivó una puñetera vaca gigante, giró el coche como las tazas de Disney World y nos salvamos?
vi_translation: Every few minutes, Radar would say, "Do you guys remember back then when we were all about to die and there was Ben, so talented, shooting through the big cow, making it spin like a teacup ride at Disney World, saving us from being smashed to pieces."
tr_translation: Every few minutes, Radar says, "Kids, do you all remember the time we were definitely going to die, then Ben grabbed the wheel, swerved the car like a teacup ride at the amusement park to avoid the gigantic damn cow, and we didn't die?"
es_translation: Every two minutes, Radar says: —Guys, do you remember that time when we were all going to die and then Ben grabbed the wheel, dodged a freaking giant cow, spun the car like the teacups at Disney World, and we were saved?

en: Lacey leans across the kitchen, her hand on Ben’s knee, and says, “I mean, you are a hero, do you realize that? They give out medals for this stuff.”
vi: Lacey nhoài người qua bếp, đặt tay lên đầu gối Ben và nói, “Tớ muốn nói rằng cậu là một anh hùng, cậu không biết sao? Người ta gắn huân chương cho những chiến công như vậy đấy.”
tr: Lacey mutfağın üstünden eğiliyor, eli Ben’in omzunda. “Yani, sen bir kahramansın, bunu fark etmiş miydin? Böyle şeyler için madalya veriyorlar.
es: Lacey se adelanta hasta la cocina y apoya una mano en la rodilla de Ben. —Eres un héroe, ¿te das cuenta? —le dice—. Por cosas como esta dan medallas.
vi_translation: Lacey leaned over the kitchen, placed her hand on Ben's knee, and said, "I want to tell you that you are a hero, don't you know that? People award medals for such feats."
tr_translation: Lacey is leaning over the counter, her hand on Ben's shoulder. "So, you're a hero, did you realize that? They give medals for things like this."
es_translation: Lacey moves forward to the kitchen and places a hand on Ben's knee. —You are a hero, do you realize that? —he says to him—. They give medals for things like this.

en: “I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: I wasn’t thinking about none of y’all. I. Wanted. To. Save. My. Ass.”
vi: “Tớ đã nói rồi và tớ nói lại đây: Tớ không nghĩ được đến bất cứ ai hết. Tớ. Muốn. Cứu. Cái. Mông. Mình. Thôi.”
tr: “Daha önce de söylemiştim ve yine söyleyeceğim: Hiçbirinizi düşünmüyordum. Kendi. Kıçımı. Kurtarmak. İstedim.
es: —Lo he dicho antes y lo repito ahora: no he pensado en ninguno de vosotros. Lo que quería era salvar mi culo.
vi_translation: "I already said it and I'll say it again: I can't think of anyone else." "I. Want." "To. Save. My." "Own." "Ass."
tr_translation: “I said it before and I will say it again: I wasn't thinking about any of you. My own. Ass. To save. I wanted.”
es_translation: —I have said it before and I repeat it now: I have not thought about any of you. What I wanted was to save my own skin.

en: “You liar. You heroic, adorable liar,” she says, and then plants a kiss on his cheek.
vi: “Chỉ điêu. Cậu là gã nói dối đáng yêu với phẩm chất anh hùng,” Lacey nói rồi hôn choẹt lên má nó.
tr: “Seni yalancı. Seni cesur, tapılası yalancı,” diyor ve yanağına bir öpücük konduruyor.
es: —Mentiroso. Heroico y adorable mentiroso —dice Lacey. Y le da un beso en la mejilla.
vi_translation: "Nonsense." "You are a lovable liar with heroic qualities," Lacey said and gave it a big kiss on the cheek.
tr_translation: "You liar. You brave, adorable liar," she says and plants a kiss on his cheek.
es_translation: —Liar. Heroic and adorable liar —says Lacey. And he gives her a kiss on the cheek.

en: Radar says, “Hey guys, do you remember that time I was double-seat-belted in the wayback and the door flew open and the beer fell out but I survived completely uninjured? How is that even possible?”
vi: Radar tiếp tục, “Các cậu có nhớ không hồi nớ tớ ở ghế sau ngủ mơ nói mớ cửa xe tự dưng mở chớ bia chảy ào ào qua tớ mà sao tớ khỏe re thế này tớ không nhớ sao mà kì diệu quớ!”
tr: Radar, “Hey çocuklar, arka tarafta çift emniyet kemeriyle bağlanmış olduğum, kapımn aniden açıldığı ve biranın döküldüğü ama benim kesinlikle yaralanmadan kurtulduğum zamanı hatırlıyor musunuz? Bu nasıl mümkün olabilir ki?” diyor.
es: —Eh, chicos, ¿recordáis aquella vez en que estaba tumbado en la parte de atrás, con los dos cinturones de seguridad puestos, y la puerta se abrió de golpe, todas las cervezas se rompieron, pero sobreviví totalmente ileso? —dice Radar—. ¿Cómo es posible?
vi_translation: Radar continued, "Do you guys remember that time when I was sleeping in the back seat and talking in my sleep, and the car door suddenly opened and beer poured all over me, but I felt completely fine? I don't remember how it happened, it's so miraculous!"
tr_translation: Radar, "Hey kids, do you remember the time I was strapped in the back with a double seatbelt, my door suddenly opened, and the beer spilled but I definitely escaped without injury?" "How could that be possible?" he says.
es_translation: —Hey, guys, do you remember that time when I was lying in the back, with both seat belts on, and the door suddenly opened, all the beers broke, but I survived completely unscathed? —says Radar—. How is that possible?

en: “Let’s play metaphysical I Spy,” Lacey says. “I Spy with my little eye a hero’s heart, a heart that beats not for itself but for all humanity.”
vi: “Chơi trò Tôi Phát Hiện kiểu siêu hình đi,” Lacey rủ. “Tôi Phát Hiện bằng con mắt bé nhỏ của mình có một trái tim anh hùng, trái tim không đập cho bản thân mà cho toàn nhân loại.
tr: “Haydi Fizıkötesi Görüyorum oynayalım,” diyor Lacey. “Şu anda etrafta bir kahraman kalbi, kendisi için değil, insanlık için atan bir kalp Görüyorum.
es: —Vamos a jugar al veo veo metafísico —dice Lacey—. Veo veo el corazón de un héroe, un corazón que late no para sí mismo, sino para toda la humanidad.
vi_translation: "Let's play the Metaphysical I Spy game," Lacey suggested. "I spy with my little eye a heroic heart, a heart that beats not for itself but for all of humanity."
tr_translation: “Let's play I See Metaphysics,” says Lacey. “Right now, I see a hero's heart around, a heart that beats not for itself, but for humanity.”
es_translation: —Let's play metaphysical I spy —says Lacey—. I spy the heart of a hero, a heart that beats not for itself, but for all humanity.

en: “I’M NOT BEING MODEST. I JUST DIDN’T WANT TO DIE,” Ben exclaims.
vi: “AI KHIÊM TỐN LÀM CHI. TÔI CHỈ KHÔNG MUỐN CHẾT THÔI,” Ben gào lên.
tr: “MÜTEVAZILIK YAPMIYORUM. SADECE ÖLMEK İSTEMEDİM,” diye haykırıyor Ben.
es: —NO ESTOY SIENDO HUMILDE. SENCILLAMENTE NO ME QUERÍA MORIR —exclama Ben.
vi_translation: “WHO CARES ABOUT HUMILITY. I JUST DON'T WANT TO DIE,” Ben shouted.
tr_translation: “I'M NOT BEING MODEST. I JUST DIDN'T WANT TO DIE,” Ben shouts.
es_translation: —I'M NOT BEING HUMBLE. I SIMPLY DIDN'T WANT TO DIE —exclaims Ben.

en: “Do you guys remember that one time, in the minivan, twenty minutes ago, that we somehow didn’t die?”
vi: “Các cậu có nhớ hồi đó trên chiếc xe nhỏ thó cách đây hai mươi phút khỉ gió chúng mình không bị chết chổng vó.
tr: “Çocuklar, bir keresinde minivanda, yirmi dakika önce, bir şekilde ölmediğimizi hatırlıyor musunuz?
es: —Chicos, ¿recordáis aquella vez, en el coche, hace veinte minutos, que por alguna razón no nos matamos?
vi_translation: "Do you remember back then on that tiny car twenty minutes ago when we didn't end up dead?"
tr_translation: "Kids, do you remember that one time in the minivan, twenty minutes ago, when we somehow didn't die?""
es_translation: —Guys, do you remember that time, in the car, twenty minutes ago, when for some reason we didn't die?

en: Hour Fourteen
vi: Giờ thứ mười bốn
tr: On Dördüncü Saat
es: HORA CATORCE
vi_translation: The fourteenth hour
tr_translation: Fourteenth Hour
es_translation: HOUR FOURTEEN

en: Once the initial shock passes, we clean. We try to shepherd as much glass from the broken Bluefin bottles as possible onto pieces of paper and then gather them into a single bag for later disposal. The minivan’s carpet is soaked with sticky Mountain Dew and Bluefin and Diet Coke, and we try to sop it up with the few napkins we’ve collected. But this will require a serious car wash, at the very least, and there’s no time for that before Agloe. Radar has looked up the side panel replacement I’ll need: $300 plus paint. The cost of this trip keeps going up, but I’ll make it back this summer working in my dad’s office, and anyway, it’s a small ransom to pay for Margo.
vi: Hoàn hồn trở lại, chúng tôi bắt đầu dọn dẹp. Cả lũ cố gắng gom hết những mảnh chai Bluefin bị vỡ vào giấy, bỏ cả vào một túi để lát nữa vứt. Thảm sàn xe đẫm nước Mountain Dew, Bluefin và Coke nhớp nháp, bọn tôi tìm cách thấm bớt bằng khăn giấy. Chắc chắn cần phải rửa xe thật kĩ, nhưng chí ít không có thời gian cho việc đó trước khi đến Agloe. Radar đã tra khoản tiền cần để thay cánh cửa kéo: 300 đô-la kèm tiền sơn. Chi phí cho chuyến đi cứ từ từ đội lên, nhưng mùa hè này tôi sẽ làm việc ở văn phòng của bố để bù vào, dù sao, đó là món tiền chuộc nhỏ đổi lấy Margo.
tr: Olayın ilk şoku geçer geçmez etrafı temizliyoruz. Kırık Bluefin şişelerinden mümkün olduğu kadar çok camı, kâğıt parçalarının üzerine süpürüp daha sonra atmak için hepsini tek bir poşette toplamaya çalışıyoruz. Minivamn halısı yapışkan Mountain Dew, Bluefin ve diyet kolayla sırılsıklam olmuş, topladığımız birkaç peçeteyle halıyı kurulamaya çalışıyoruz. Ama oto yıkamaya gitmek gerekecek ve Agloe’dan önce bunun için vaktimiz yok. Radar minivan için gerekli olan yan panelin değişiminin ne kadar tutacağına bakmış: 300 dolar artı boya. Bu gezinin maliyeti yükselmeye devam ediyo ama bu yaz babamın ofisinde çalışarak telafi edeceğim, hem bu Margo için ödenecek küçük bir kefaret.
es: Una vez superado el shock inicial, limpiamos. Intentamos meter todos los trozos de cristal de botellas de Bluefin posibles en hojas de papel y los dejamos en una bolsa de plástico para tirarlos después. Las alfombras del monovolumen están pegajosas y empapadas de Mountain Dew, Bluefin y Coca-Cola Light, e intentamos secarlas con los pocos pañuelos de papel que tenemos. Pero el coche necesitaría una buena limpieza, como mínimo, y no tenemos tiempo antes de llegar a Agloe. Radar ha buscado lo que me costará cambiar el panel lateral: 300 dólares más la pintura. Este viaje sale cada vez más caro, pero conseguiré devolver el dinero este verano, trabajando en el despacho de mi padre, y de todas formas no es un rescate tan elevado tratándose de Margo.
vi_translation: Coming back to our senses, we started cleaning up. The whole group tried to gather all the broken Bluefin bottle pieces into paper, putting them all into a bag to throw away later. The car floor mat was soaked with Mountain Dew, Bluefin, and sticky Coke, and we tried to absorb it with paper towels. We definitely needed to wash the car thoroughly, but there was no time for that before reaching Agloe. Radar had looked up the cost to replace the sliding door: $300 plus painting. The trip expenses were slowly adding up, but I would work at my dad's office this summer to make up for it; after all, it was a small ransom to pay for Margo.
tr_translation: As soon as the initial shock of the incident passes, we start cleaning up the area. We try to sweep as much glass as possible from the broken Bluefin bottles onto pieces of paper and then collect everything into a single bag to dispose of later. The minivan's carpet is soaked with sticky Mountain Dew, Bluefin, and diet cola, and we attempt to dry it with a few napkins we've gathered. But we'll need to go to a car wash, and we don't have time for that before Agloe. Radar checked how much it would cost to replace the necessary side panel for the minivan: $300 plus paint. The cost of this trip keeps rising. but I will make up for it by working at my father's office this summer, and besides, it will be a small atonement for Margo.
es_translation: Once we got over the initial shock, we cleaned up. We tried to gather all the pieces of Bluefin bottle glass onto sheets of paper and put them in a plastic bag to throw away later. The minivan's carpets are sticky and soaked with Mountain Dew, Bluefin, and Diet Coke, and we tried to dry them with the few tissues we had. But the car would need a good cleaning, at the very least, and we don't have time before we get to Agloe. Radar has looked up what it will cost me to replace the side panel: 300 dollars plus the paint. This trip is getting more expensive, but I'll be able to pay back the money this summer, working at my dad's office, and anyway, it's not such a high price considering it's for Margo.

en: The sun is rising to our right. My cheek is still bleeding. The Confederate flag is stuck to the wound now, so I no longer need to hold it there.
vi: Mặt trời nhô lên ở bên phải. Má tôi vẫn chảy máu. Dải cờ Liên Minh đã dính vào vết thương, tôi không phải giữ khư khư nữa.
tr: Güneş sağımızdan yükseliyor. Yanağım hâlâ kamyor. Konfederasyon bayrağı artık yaraya yapışık durumda, bu yüzden artık onu orada tutmam gerekmiyor.
es: El sol empieza a salir por nuestra derecha. Sigue sangrándome la mejilla. Ahora la bandera de la Confederación se ha quedado pegada a la herida, así que ya no tengo que sujetarla.
vi_translation: The sun rose on the right. My cheek was still bleeding. The Confederate flag had stuck to the wound, so I didn't have to hold it tightly anymore.
tr_translation: The sun is rising from our right. My cheek is still burning. The Confederate flag is now stuck to the wound, so I no longer need to hold it there.
es_translation: The sun begins to rise on our right. My cheek is still bleeding. Now the Confederate flag has stuck to the wound, so I no longer have to hold it.

en: A thin stand of oak trees obscures the cornfields that stretch out to the horizon. The landscape changes, but nothing else. Big interstates like this one make the country into a single place: McDonald’s, BP, Wendy’s. I know I should probably hate that about interstates and yearn for the halcyon days of yore, back when you could be drenched in local color at every turn— but whatever. I like this. I like the consistency. I like that I can drive fifteen hours from home without the world changing too much. Lacey double-belts me down in the wayback. “You need the rest,” she says. “You’ve been through a lot.” It’s amazing that no one has yet blamed me for not being more proactive in the battle against the cow.
vi: Một dải sồi thưa đứng bên rìa những cánh đồng ngô trải ngút tới chân trời. Phong cảnh thay đổi, nhưng không có gì khác. Những cao tốc liên bang như con đường này khiến miền quê chỉ còn như một nơi duy nhất: McDonald’s, BP, Wendy’s. Tôi biết có lẽ mình đã ghét những con đường liên bang và thèm những ngày thủng thẳng xa xưa, nơi mỗi khúc rẽ đều như nhúng trong sắc màu thị thành quen thuộc–nhưng thôi kệ. Tôi thích thế này. Tôi thích sự liên tục. Tôi thích rằng mình có thể lái xe khỏi nhà mười lăm tiếng đồng hồ liền mà thế giới không thay đổi quá nhiều. Lacey thắt tôi lại ở ghế cuối bằng cả hai đai an toàn. “Cậu cần nghỉ ngơi,” Lacey nói. “Cậu vất vả nhiều rồi.” Ngạc nhiên là không ai trách tôi đã quá ư ù ì trong trận chiến với con bò.
tr: Seyrek bir meşe ağacı dizisi, ufka kadar uzanan mısır tarlalarım gözlerden az da olsa gizliyor. Manzara değişiyor ama diğer her şey aynı kahyor. Bunun gibi geniş eyaletler arası yollar ülkeyi tek bir mekâna dönüştürüyor: McDonald’s, BP, Wendy’s. Muhtemelen eyaletler arası yolların bu yönünden nefret etmeli ve eski zamanların altın günlerim Özlemeliyim, her köşe başmda yöresel renklerle çevrelenilen eski günleri filan... ama umurumda değil. Bunu seviyorum. Tutarlılığı seviyorum. Dünya çok fazla değişmeden, evden on beş saat mesafeye gidebilmeyi seviyorum. Lacey beni arka tarafta çift emniyet kemeriyle bağlıyor. “Dinlenmen gerek,” diyor. “Çok fazla şey yaşadın.” Kimsenin beni ineğe karşı girişilen savaşta daha tedbirli olmamakla suçlamamış olması hayret verici.
es: Un grupo de robles oculta los campos de maíz que se extienden hasta el horizonte. El paisaje cambia, pero nada más. Las grandes autopistas como esta convierten el país en un único lugar: McDonald’s, BP y Wendy’s. Sé que seguramente debería odiar este aspecto de las autopistas y añorar los felices días del pasado, cuando podías empaparte del color local de cada sitio, pero en fin. Me gusta. Me gusta la regularidad. Me gusta conducir quince horas seguidas desde casa sin que el mundo cambie demasiado. Lacey me abrocha los cinturones de seguridad. —Tienes que descansar —me dice—. Lo has pasado mal. Me sorprende que nadie me haya echado la culpa por no haber sabido reaccionar en la batalla contra la vaca.
vi_translation: A sparse line of oaks stood on the edge of cornfields stretching endlessly to the horizon. The scenery changed, but nothing else did. Interstate highways like this one made the countryside feel like just one place: McDonald’s, BP, Wendy’s. I know I probably hated the interstates and longed for the leisurely days of old, where every turn was steeped in familiar urban hues—but never mind. I like it this way. I like the continuity. I like that I can drive away from home for fifteen hours straight and the world doesn’t change too much. Lacey strapped me in the back seat with both seat belts. “You need to rest,” Lacey said. “You’ve been through a lot.” Surprisingly, no one blamed me for being so sluggish in the battle with the cow.
tr_translation: A sparse line of oak trees slightly conceals my cornfields stretching to the horizon. The scenery changes, but everything else remains the same. Highways like this turn the country into a single place: McDonald’s, BP, Wendy’s. I probably should hate this aspect of highways and long for the golden days of yore, when every corner was surrounded by local colors and such... but I don't care. I love it. I love the consistency. I love being able to travel fifteen hours from home without the world changing too much. Lacey straps me in the back with a double seatbelt. “You need to rest,” she says. “You've been through a lot.” It's amazing that no one has accused me of not being more cautious in the fight against the cow.
es_translation: A group of oak trees hides the cornfields that stretch to the horizon. The landscape changes, but nothing else. Highways like this one turn the country into a single place: McDonald’s, BP, and Wendy’s. I know I probably should hate this aspect of highways and long for the happy days of the past, when you could soak up the local color of each place, but oh well. I like it. I like the regularity. I like driving fifteen hours straight from home without the world changing too much. Lacey fastens my seat belts. —You need to rest —he tells me—. You've had a tough time. I am surprised that no one has blamed me for not knowing how to react in the battle against the cow.

en: As I trail off, I hear them making one another laugh—not the words exactly, but the cadence, the rising and falling pitches of banter. I like just listening, just loafing on the grass. And I decide that if we get there on time but don’t find her, that’s what we’ll do: we’ll drive around the Catskills and find a place to sit around and hang out, loafing on the grass, talking, telling jokes. Maybe the sure knowledge that she is alive makes all of that possible again—even if I never see proof of it. I can almost imagine a happiness without her, the ability to let her go, to feel our roots are connected even if I never see that leaf of grass again.
vi: Nằm lắng lại, tôi nghe thấy tụi bạn chọc nhau cười– không phải từ ngữ chính xác, mà là ngữ điệu, những cung cao khúc trầm trong câu chuyện. Tôi thích chỉ lắng nghe, chỉ an nhiên trên cỏ. Và tôi quyết định rằng nếu chúng tôi đến nơi đúng giờ mà không thấy Margo, thì việc sẽ làm tiếp theo là: cả bọn lái xe mòng mòng quanh Catskill, tìm một chỗ ngồi vãn vu vơ, an nhiên trên cỏ, nói chuyện, đùa cợt với nhau. Có lẽ chỉ cần biết chắc chắn rằng Margo còn sống thì tất cả lại trở thành khả thi ngay–dù tôi thậm chí không bao giờ thấy bằng chứng cho điều đó. Tôi gần như có thể tưởng tượng được niềm hạnh phúc dù không có cô ấy, có thể để cô ấy ra đi, cảm thấy gốc rễ của chúng tôi đan kết vào nhau, dù có thể tôi không bao giờ được thấy lại cánh cỏ ấy nữa.
tr: Ben yavaştan kayıp giderken, birbirlerini güldürdüklerini duyuyorum. Tam olarak kelimeleri değil ama ritmi, şakalaşmanın yükselen ve alçalan tonlarını. Sadece dinlemeyi, sadece çimenlerin üzerinde aylaklık etmeyi seviyorum. Ve olur da oraya zamanında gider ama onu bulamazsak yapacağımız şeye karar veriyorum: Catskills civarında arabayla dolaşıp çimenlerin üzerinde aylaklık ederek, konuşarak, şakalaşarak boş boş oturacak ve takılacak bir yer bulacağız. Belki hayatta olduğuna dair kesin bir bilgi bunları tekrar mümkün kılar... hayatta olduğunun kanıtım görmesem bile. Onsuz bir mutluluğun, onun gitmesine izin verebilme kudretinin, o çimen yaprağını bir daha asla görmesem bile köklerimizin bağlı olduğunu hissetmenin nasıl bir şey olduğunu hayal edebiliyor gibiyim.
es: Mientras me quedo dormido, los oigo haciéndose reír. No oigo las palabras exactas, sino la cadencia, las subidas y bajadas de tono de su charla. Me gusta escuchar tumbado en la hierba. Y decido que si llegamos a tiempo pero no encontramos a Margo, eso es lo que haremos. Buscaremos un sitio en Catskill para pasar un rato, tumbarnos en la hierba, charlar y hacernos bromas. Quizá saber que está viva hace que vuelva a ser posible, aunque no tengo pruebas de que lo esté. Casi puedo imaginarme la felicidad sin ella, mi capacidad de dejarla marchar, de sentir que nuestras raíces están conectadas aunque nunca vuelva a ver esa hoja de hierba.
vi_translation: Lying quietly, I could hear my friends teasing each other and laughing – not the exact words, but the intonation, the highs and lows in their stories. I liked just listening, just peacefully lying on the grass. And I decided that if we arrived on time and didn’t see Margo, the next thing we would do was: drive around Catskill, find a spot to sit aimlessly, peacefully on the grass, talk, and joke with each other. Maybe just knowing for sure that Margo was alive would make everything possible again – even though I never actually saw any evidence of that. I could almost imagine being happy without her, being able to let her go, feeling our roots intertwined, even though I might never see that patch of grass again.
tr_translation: As I slowly drift away, I hear them making each other laugh. .. Not exactly the words, but the rhythm, the rising and falling tones of their banter. I just love listening, just idling on the grass. And if we get there on time but can't find him, I've decided what we'll do: We'll drive around the Catskills, idling on the grass, talking, joking, finding a place to sit idly and hang out. Maybe the certainty of his being alive will make these things possible again... even if I don't see proof of his being alive. The happiness without him, the power to let him go, Even if I never see the blade of grass again, I feel like I can imagine what it is like to feel that our roots are connected.
es_translation: While I fall asleep, I hear them making each other laugh. I don't hear the exact words, just the cadence, the rises and falls of their conversation. I like to listen while lying on the grass. And I decide that if we arrive on time but don't find Margo, that's what we'll do. We'll find a spot in Catskill to spend some time, lie on the grass, chat, and joke around. Maybe knowing that she's alive makes it possible again, even though I have no proof that she is. I can almost imagine happiness without her, my ability to let her go, to feel that our roots are connected even if I never see that blade of grass again.

vi: Giờ thứ mười sáu
tr: On Altıncı Saat
es: HORA DIECISÉIS
vi_translation: The sixteenth hour
tr_translation: The Sixth Hour
es_translation: SIXTEEN HUNDRED HOURS

en: I sleep.
vi: Tôi ngủ.
tr: Uyuyorum.
es: Duermo.
vi_translation: I sleep.
tr_translation: I am sleeping.
es_translation: I sleep.

es_translation: SEVENTEEN O'CLOCK

en: Hour Nineteen
vi: Giờ thứ mười chín
tr: On Dokuzuncu Saat
es: HORA DIECINUEVE
vi_translation: Nineteenth hour
tr_translation: The Ninth Hour
es_translation: HOUR NINETEEN

en: When I wake up, Radar and Ben are loudly debating the name of the car. Ben would like to name it Muhammad Ali, because, just like Muhammad Ali, the minivan takes a punch and keeps going. Radar says you can’t name a car after a historical figure. He thinks the car ought to be called Lurlene, because it sounds right.
vi: Khi tôi thức dậy, Ben và Radar đang tranh luận sôi nổi về tên của cái xe này. Ben muốn đặt tên nó là Muhammad Ali vì giống như Muhammad Ali, chiếc minivan này uýnh một cú rồi tiếp tục bon bon. Radar nói không thể lấy tên một nhân vật lịch sử đặt cho ô-tô. Nó nghĩ nên đặt tên là Lurlene, vì nghe hay hay.
tr: Uyandığımda, Radar ile Ben yüksek sesle arabanın ismini tartışıyorlar. Ben, Muhammet Ali adını vermek istiyor çünkü minivan tıpkı Muhammet Ali gibi yumruk yemesine rağmen yoluna devam ediyor. Radar bir arabanın tarihî bir figürünadıyla anılamayacağım söylüyor. Arabanın Lurlene diye adlandırılması gerektiğini düşünüyor, çünkü bu kulağa doğru geliyor.
es: Cuando me despierto, Radar y Ben discuten en voz alta sobre el nombre del coche. A Ben le gustaría llamarlo Mohamed Alí, porque, como Mohamed Alí, el monovolumen recibe un puñetazo y sigue avanzando. Radar dice que no se puede poner el nombre de un personaje histórico a un coche. Cree que debería llamarse Lurlene, porque suena bien.
vi_translation: When I woke up, Ben and Radar were having a heated debate about the name of the car. Ben wanted to name it Muhammad Ali because, like Muhammad Ali, this minivan could take a hit and keep on going. Radar said you can't name a car after a historical figure. He thought it should be named Lurlene, because it sounded nice.
tr_translation: When I wake up, Radar and Ben are loudly arguing about the name of the car. Ben wants to name it Muhammad Ali because the minivan keeps going despite taking punches, just like Muhammad Ali. Radar says a car can't be named after a historical figure. He thinks the car should be named Lurlene because it sounds right.
es_translation: When I wake up, Radar and Ben are loudly arguing about the name of the car. Ben would like to call it Muhammad Ali, because, like Muhammad Ali, the minivan takes a punch and keeps going. Radar says you can't name a car after a historical figure. He thinks it should be called Lurlene, because it sounds nice.

en: “You want to name it Lurlene?” Ben asks, his voice rising with the horror of it all. “Hasn’t this poor vehicle been through enough?!”
vi: “Ông muốn đặt tên Lurlene thật sao?” Ben hỏi, giọng lên tông nghe chừng sợ hãi. “Em xe khốn khổ này phải chịu đựng chưa đủ sao?”
tr: “Lurlene adını mı vermek istiyorsun?” diye soruyor Ben, sesi dehşetle yükseliyor. “Bu zavallı araç yeterince şey yaşamadı mı?!”
es: —¿Quieres llamarlo Lurlene? —pregunta Ben elevando la voz, horrorizado—. ¿No ha pasado ya por bastante este pobre vehículo?
vi_translation: “Do you really want to name it Lurlene?” Ben asked, his voice rising in apparent fear. “Hasn't this poor car suffered enough?”
tr_translation: “Do you want to name it Lurlene?” Ben asks, his voice rising in horror. “Hasn't this poor vehicle been through enough?!”
es_translation: —Do you want to call it Lurlene? —asks Ben, raising his voice, horrified—. Hasn't this poor vehicle already been through enough?

en: I unbuckle one seat belt and sit up. Lacey turns around to me. “Good morning,” she says. “Welcome to the great state of New York.”

tr: Emniyet kemerlerinden birini çözüp doğruluyorum. Lacey bana dönüyor. “Günaydın,” diyor.

es_translation: I unbuckle a belt and sit down. Lacey turns around. —Good morning —he says to me—. Welcome to the great state of New York.

en: “Nine forty-two.” Her hair is pulled back in a ponytail, but the shorter strands have strayed. “How’s it going?” she asks.

es: —Las nueve cuarenta y dos. —Se ha recogido el pelo en una coleta, pero los mechones más cortos le quedan sueltos—. ¿Cómo estás?

es_translation: —Nine forty-two. —She has tied her hair back in a ponytail, but the shorter strands are loose—. How are you?

en: Lacey smiles at me and nods. “Yeah, me, too. It’s like there’s too many things that could happen to prepare for all of them.”
vi: Lacey nhìn tôi cười và gật đầu. “Ừ, tớ cũng vậy. Cứ như thể quá nhiều chuyện có thể xảy ra để sẵn sàng cho tất cả những điều này.”

es: Lacey me sonríe y asiente. —Sí, yo también. Es como si pudieran suceder demasiadas cosas como para estar preparado para todas.
vi_translation: Lacey looked at me, smiled, and nodded. "Yeah, me too. It's as if too many things can happen to be ready for all of this."
tr_translation: Lacey smiles at me and nods her head. "Yes, me too. There seems to be too much for us to be prepared for everything."
es_translation: Lacey smiles at me and nods. —Yes, me too. It's as if too many things could happen to be prepared for all of them.

en: “Yeah,” I say.
vi: “Ừ,” tôi đáp.

en: “I hope you and me stay friends this summer,” she says. And that helps, for some reason. You can never tell what is going to help.
vi: “Tớ hi vọng mùa hè này chúng ta vẫn là bạn,” Lacey nói. Nghe vậy cũng đỡ, chẳng hiểu sao. Ta không bao giờ có thể nói được điều gì sẽ khiến ta thấy khá hơn.
tr: “Umarım seninle bu yaz arkadaş olarak kalırız,” diyor. Ve nedense bunun yardımı oluyor. Neyin yardımı olacağını asla bilemiyorsunuz.
es: —Espero que sigamos siendo amigos este verano —me dice. Y por alguna razón me siento mejor. Nunca sabes qué va a hacer que te sientas mejor.
vi_translation: "I hope we will still be friends this summer," Lacey said. Somehow, hearing that made me feel better. We can never tell what will make us feel better.
tr_translation: “I hope we stay friends this summer,” he says. And somehow, it helps. You never know what will help.
es_translation: —I hope we continue being friends this summer —he tells me. And for some reason, I feel better. You never know what will make you feel better.

en: I’m sitting in the first bedroom with Lacey. Ben drives. Radar’s navigating. I was asleep when they last stopped, but they picked up a map of New York. Agloe isn’t marked, but there are only five or six intersections north of Roscoe. I always thought of New York as being a sprawling and endless metropolis, but here it is just lush rolling hills that the minivan heroically strains its way up. When there’s a lull in the conversation and Ben reaches for the radio knob, I say, “Metaphysical I Spy!”
vi: Tôi đang ngồi ở phòng ngủ số một với Lacey. Ben cầm lái. Radar chỉ đường. Tôi vẫn ngủ khi chúng tôi dừng lần cuối, nhưng mấy đứa kia đã mua được cái bản đồ New York. Không có Agloe trên bản đồ, nhưng chỉ có khoảng năm, sáu giao lộ ở phía bắc Roscoe. Tôi vẫn nghĩ New York là chốn phồn hoa sầm uất, nhưng hiện tại chỉ có những quả đồi rậm rạp trập trùng nối nhau, chiếc minivan phải anh dũng lắm mới bò lên nổi. Một lúc chẳng đứa nào nói gì, Ben giơ tay tìm chỗ bật radio, tôi bảo, “Chơi Tôi Phát Hiện kiểu siêu hình đi!”
tr: Lacey’yle ilk yatak odasında oturuyorum. Arabayı Ben sürüyor. Radar internette geziniyor. Son durduklarında ben uyuyordum ama bir New York haritası almışlar. Agloe işaretlenmemiş ama Roscoe’nun kuzeyinde sadece beşaltı kavşak var. Her zaman New York’un genişleyen ve sonsuz bir metropol olduğunu düşünürdüm ama burada yalnızca, minivamn kahramanca kendini zorlayarak çıktığı, yemyeşil, inişli çıkışlı tepeler var. Sohbet biraz kesintiye uğrayınca Ben radyo düğmesine uzamyor; “Fizikötesi Görüyorum!” diyorum.
es: Estoy sentado en la primera habitación con Lacey. Ben conduce. Radar navega. La última vez que pararon estaba dormido, pero compraron un mapa de Nueva York. No aparece Agloe, pero al norte de Roscoe solo hay cinco o seis cruces. Siempre había pensado que Nueva York era una metrópolis que se extendía infinitamente, pero aquí solo se ven colinas por las que el monovolumen asciende heroicamente. La conversación se interrumpe un momento y Ben se inclina a encender la radio. —Veo veo metafísico —digo.
vi_translation: I'm sitting in bedroom number one with Lacey. Ben is driving. Radar is navigating. I was still asleep when we made our last stop, but the others had bought a map of New York. Agloe wasn't on the map, but there were only about five or six intersections north of Roscoe. I still thought of New York as a bustling metropolis, but at the moment there were only rolling, densely wooded hills that the minivan had to bravely climb. For a while, no one said anything, then Ben reached out to turn on the radio, and I said, "Let's play Metaphysical I Spy!"

Agloe is not marked, but there are only five or six intersections north of Roscoe. I always thought of New York as an expanding and endless metropolis, but here there are only lush, rolling hills that the minivan heroically struggles to climb. When the conversation gets a bit interrupted, Ben doesn't reach for the radio button; I say, "I See Metaphysics!"

Agloe does not appear, but to the north of Roscoe, there are only five or six crossings. I had always thought that New York was an infinitely sprawling metropolis, but here you only see hills that the minivan heroically ascends. The conversation pauses for a moment, and Ben leans over to turn on the radio. —I spy something metaphysical —I say.

en: “No, although excellent guess.”
vi: “Không, nhưng đoán hay đấy.”
tr: “Hayır, buna rağmen mükemmel tahmin.
es: —No, aunque excelente respuesta.
vi_translation: “No, but good guess.”
tr_translation: “No, nevertheless, an excellent guess.”
es_translation: —No, although an excellent response.

en: Lacey says, “Is it that weird feeling you get from so much caffeine that, like, your heart isn’t beating so much as your whole body is beating?”
vi: Lacey nói, “Có phải là cảm giác kì kì khi có quá nhiều ca-phê-in trong người không? Kiểu như tim đập chẳng thấm vào đâu so với toàn thân đang đập ấy?”
tr: Lacey konuşuyor. “Çok fazla kafeinden aldığın tuhaf hisle ilgili bir şey mi? Hani şu kalbinin bütün vücudunun attığı kadar çok atmaması gibi bir şey?
es: —¿Esa extraña sensación de que el corazón no late tan deprisa como todo tu cuerpo por el exceso de cafeína? —dice Lacey.
vi_translation: Lacey said, "Isn't it a weird feeling to have too much caffeine in your system? Like your heart beating is nothing compared to your whole body pulsing?"
tr_translation: Lacey is speaking. “Is it something about that weird feeling you get from too much caffeine? You know, like when your heart feels like it's beating all over your body?”
es_translation: —That strange feeling that your heart isn't beating as fast as the rest of your body due to excess caffeine? —says Lacey.

en: “No. Ben?”
vi: “Không. Ben đoán sao?”
tr: “Hayır. Ben?
es: —No. ¿Ben?
vi_translation: "No." "What do you guess, Ben?"
tr_translation: “No. Me?”
es_translation: —No. Ben?

en: “Um, are we feeling the need to pee, or is that just me?”
vi: “Ừm, chúng ta đều muốn đi tè, hay là chỉ mình tui thấy vậy hè?”
tr: “Eee, çişimizi yapma ihtiyacı mı hissediyoruz, yoksa sadece bende mi sorun var?
es: —Hum, ¿sentimos ganas de mear, o soy yo solo?
vi_translation: “Um, do we all need to pee, or is it just me?”
tr_translation: “Eee, do we feel the need to pee, or is it just me who has a problem?”
es_translation: —Hmm, do we feel like peeing, or is it just me?

en: “That is, as usual, just you. More guesses?” We are silent. “The correct answer is that we are all feeling like we will be happier after an a cappella rendition of ‘Blister in the Sun.’”
vi: “Như thường tình, chỉ có ông thôi. Có ai đoán nữa không?” Chúng tôi đều yên lặng. “Câu trả lời đúng là tụi mình sẽ thấy vui hơn sau khi cùng hát bài ‘Sưng phồng dưới nắng’ mà không cần nhạc đệm.”
tr: “Her zamanki gibi, sadece sende var. Başka tahmin?” Sessiz kalıyoruz. “Doğru cevap, hepimizin Blister in the Sun’m akapella yorumundan sonra daha mutlu olacağımızı hissediyor olmamız.
es: —Solo tú, como siempre. ¿Alguna más? —Nos quedamos callados—. La respuesta correcta es que todos sentimos que seríamos más felices después de una interpretación a capela del «Blister in the Sun».
vi_translation: "As usual, it's just you." "Is there anyone else guessing?" We were all silent. "The correct answer is that we will feel happier after singing 'Swelling Under the Sun' together without any accompaniment."
tr_translation: “As usual, only you have it. Any other guesses?” We remain silent. “The correct answer is that we all feel happier after our a cappella rendition of Blister in the Sun.”
es_translation: —Just you, as always. Any more? —We stayed silent—. The correct answer is that we all felt we would be happier after an a cappella rendition of "Blister in the Sun."

en: And so it is. Tone deaf as I may be, I sing as loud as anybody. And when we finish, I say, “I Spy with my little eye a great story.”
vi: Và quả đúng vậy. Dù có thể bị chứng điếc thanh điệu, tôi vẫn hát vang như mấy đứa kia. Hát hết bài, tôi nói, “Tôi Phát Hiện bằng con mắt bé nhỏ của mình, có một chuyện hay lắm.”
tr: Ve gerçekten öyle. Ton sağın olabilirim ama herkes kadar yüksek sesle şarkıyı söylüyorum. Bitirdiğimizde, “Şu anda etrafta harika bir hikâye Görüyorum,” diyorum.
es: Y así es. Aunque tengo menos oído para la música que un sordo, canto tan alto como los demás. Y cuando hemos acabado digo: —Veo veo una gran historia.
vi_translation: And it was indeed so. Even though I might have tone-deafness, I still sang out loud like the others. After finishing the song, I said, "I Spy with my little eye, something really interesting."
tr_translation: And it really is so. I may be tone-deaf, but I sing the song as loudly as everyone else. When we finish, I say, "I see a great story around right now."
es_translation: And so it is. Although I have less ear for music than a deaf person, I sing as loudly as the others. And when we have finished, I say: I see, I see a great story.

en: No one says anything for a while. There’s just the sound of the Dreidel devouring the blacktop as she speeds downhill. And then after a while Ben says, “It’s this, isn’t it?”
vi: Một lúc không ai nói gì. Chỉ có tiếng Con Quay liên tục ngốn mặt đường nhựa khi đổ dốc. Lát sau Ben nói,
tr: Bir süre kimse hiçbir şey söylemiyor. Yalnızca yokuş aşağı hızlanırken, Fırdöndü’nün asfalt yolu yiyip bitirmesinin sesi var. Bir süre sonra Ben, “Hikâye bu, değil mi?” diyor.
es: Por un momento nadie dice nada. Solo se oye el ruido del Dreidel devorando el asfalto y acelerando para subir la colina. —Esta, ¿no? —dice al rato Ben.
vi_translation: For a moment, no one said anything. Only the sound of the Spinner continuously devouring the asphalt as it descended the slope. After a while, Ben said,
tr_translation: For a while, no one says anything. There is only the sound of Fırdöndü devouring the asphalt road as it speeds downhill. After a while, Ben says, "This is the story, isn't it?"
es_translation: For a moment, no one says anything. Only the noise of the Dreidel devouring the asphalt and accelerating to climb the hill can be heard. —This one, right? —says Ben after a while.

en: “Yeah,” Radar says. “As long as we don’t die, this is gonna be one hell of a story.”
vi: “Ừ,” Radar nói. “Miễn là bọn mình không chết, đây đúng là một chuyện trời long đất lở.”
tr: “Evet,” diyor Radar. “Ölmediğimiz sürece, bu acayip bir hikâye olacak.
es: —Sí —dice Radar—. Si conseguimos no matarnos, será una historia de puta madre.
vi_translation: "Yeah," Radar said. "As long as we don't die, this is truly a groundbreaking event."
tr_translation: “Yes,” says Radar. “As long as we don't die, this will be a crazy story.”
es_translation: —Yes —says Radar—. If we manage not to kill ourselves, it will be one hell of a story.

en: It will help if we can find her, I think, but I don’t say anything. Ben turns on the radio finally and finds a rock station with ballads we can sing along to.
vi: Nếu tìm thấy cô ấy thì mừng quá, tôi nghĩ, nhưng không nói gì. Cuối cùng Ben bật radio, tìm một kênh nhạc rock với những bản ballad mà chúng tôi có thể hát theo.
tr: Eğer onu bulabilirsek yardımı olur, diye düşünüyorum ama hiçbir şey söylemiyorum. Ben, sonunda radyoyu açıyor ve eşlik edebileceğimiz şarkıları olan bir rock müzik istasyonu buluyor.
es: «No iría mal que la encontráramos», pienso, pero no lo digo. Al final Ben enciende la radio y busca una emisora de baladas de rock para que cantemos todos juntos.
vi_translation: If we find her, that would be great, I thought, but said nothing. Finally, Ben turned on the radio, found a rock music station with ballads that we could sing along to.
tr_translation: I think it would be helpful if we could find it, but I don't say anything. Finally, I turn on the radio and find a rock music station with songs we can sing along to.
es_translation: "It wouldn't be bad if we found her," I think, but I don't say it. In the end, Ben turns on the radio and looks for a rock ballad station so we can all sing together.

en: Hour Twenty-one
vi: Giờ thứ hai mươi mốt
tr: Yirmi Birinci Saat
es: HORA VEINTIUNO
vi_translation: The twenty-first hour
tr_translation: Twenty-First Hour
es_translation: HOUR TWENTY-ONE

en: After more than 1,100 miles on interstates, it’s finally time to exit. It’s entirely impossible to drive seventy-seven miles per hour on the two-lane state highway that takes us farther north, up toward the Catskills. But we’ll be okay. Radar, ever the brilliant tactician, has banked an extra thirty minutes without telling us. It’s beautiful up here, the late-morning sunlight pouring down on old-growth forest. Even the brick buildings in the ramshackle little downtowns we drive past seem crisp in this light.
vi: Sau hơn 1. 100 dặm trên đường cao tốc liên bang, cuối cùng đã đến lúc ra được rồi. Hoàn toàn không thể lái xe với tốc độ bảy mươi bảy dặm một giờ trên quốc lộ hai làn và đi tiếp về hướng bắc, ngược dãy núi Catskill. Nhưng chúng tôi sẽ ổn thôi. Radar, chiến lược gia xuất sắc, đã tính ba mươi phút dự trữ mà không cho bọn tôi biết. Chỗ này tuyệt đẹp, ánh mặt trời gần trưa đổ xuống cánh rừng cổ thụ. Những ngôi nhà gạch trong khu dân cư tiêu điều bên dưới cũng lấp lánh trong thứ nắng này khi chúng tôi đi qua.
tr: Eyaletler arası yollarda bin sekiz yüz kilometreden fazla gittikten sonra, nihayet çıkma zamanı. Bizi daha kuzeye, Catskills’e doğru götüren iki şeritli anayolda saatte yüz yirmi dört kilometre gitmemiz kesinlikle imkânsız. Ama sorun olmayacak. Radar gelmiş geçmiş en iyi taktikçi olduğu için, bize söylemeden fazladan otuz dakika ayırmış. Burası çok güzel, kuşluk vaktindeki gün ışığı, el değmemiş ormanların üzerine dökülüyor. Yanından geçtiğimiz viran kasabalardaki tuğla binalar bile bu ışıkta bakımlı görünüyor.
es: Después de más de 1800 kilómetros por autopista, casi ha llegado la hora de salir. Es totalmente imposible conducir a ciento veinticinco kilómetros por hora por la autovía de dos carriles que nos lleva más al norte, hacia Catskill, pero nos las arreglaremos. Radar, siempre un brillante estratega, se había reservado media hora extra sin decirnos nada. Esto es bonito. La luz de la mañana ilumina los viejos árboles. Incluso los edificios de ladrillo de las ruinosas poblaciones por las que pasamos parecen nuevos con esta luz.
vi_translation: After more than 1,100 miles on the interstate highway, it was finally time to get off. It was completely impossible to drive at seventy-seven miles per hour on a two-lane highway and continue heading north, against the Catskill Mountains. But we would be fine. Radar, an excellent strategist, had calculated a thirty-minute reserve without letting us know. This place was beautiful, with the near-noon sunlight pouring down on the ancient forest. The brick houses in the desolate residential area below also sparkled in this sunlight as we passed by.
tr_translation: After traveling more than one thousand eight hundred kilometers on interstate highways, it's finally time to exit. It's absolutely impossible for us to go one hundred twenty-four kilometers per hour on the two-lane highway that takes us further north to the Catskills. But it won't be a problem. Since Radar is the best tactician ever, he has allocated an extra thirty minutes without telling us. This place is very beautiful, the daylight at dawn is pouring over the untouched forests. Even the brick buildings in the desolate towns we pass by look well-maintained in this light.
es_translation: After more than 1800 kilometers on the highway, it's almost time to exit. It is completely impossible to drive at one hundred twenty-five kilometers per hour on the two-lane road that takes us further north, towards Catskill, but we will manage. Radar, always a brilliant strategist, had reserved an extra half hour without telling us anything. This is nice. The morning light illuminates the old trees. Even the brick buildings of the rundown towns we pass through seem new in this light.

en: Lacey and I are telling Ben and Radar everything we can think of in hopes of helping them find Margo. Reminding them of her. Reminding ourselves of her. Her silver Honda Civic. Her chestnut hair, stick straight. Her fascination with abandoned buildings.
vi: Lacey và tôi nói với Ben và Radar tất cả những gì chúng tôi có thể nhớ ra được để hai đứa ấy dễ tìm Margo hơn. Gợi cho hai thằng nhớ được Margo. Gợi cho chính chúng tôi nhớ được Margo. Chiếc xe Honda Civic màu bạc của cô ấy. Mái tóc nâu nhạt màu hạt dẻ của cô ấy, suôn thẳng. Sở thích những khu nhà bị bỏ hoang của cô ấy.
tr: Margo’yu bulmalarına yardım etme umuduyla Lacey’yle birlikte, Ben ve Radar’a düşünebildiğimiz her şeyi anlatıyoruz. Onlara Margo’yu hatırlatıyoruz. Kendimize Margo’yu hatırlatıyoruz. Gümüş rengi Honda Civic’ini. Kestane rengi, dümdüz saçlarını. Terk edilmiş binalara olan düşkünlüğünü.
es: Lacey y yo contamos a Ben y a Radar todo lo que se nos ocurre para ayudarlos a que encuentren a Margo. Les recordamos detalles. Nos los recordamos a nosotros mismos. Su Honda Civic plateado. Su pelo castaño, muy liso. Su fascinación por los edificios abandonados.
vi_translation: Lacey and I told Ben and Radar everything we could remember to help them find Margo more easily. Reminding the guys about Margo. Reminding ourselves about Margo. Her silver Honda Civic. Her light chestnut brown hair, straight and smooth. Her interest in abandoned houses.
tr_translation: In the hope of helping them find Margo, together with Lacey, we are telling Ben and Radar everything we can think of. We remind them of Margo. We remind ourselves of Margo. Her silver Honda Civic. Her chestnut, straight hair. Her fondness for abandoned buildings.
es_translation: Lacey and I tell Ben and Radar everything we can think of to help them find Margo. We remind them of details. We remind ourselves of them. Her silver Honda Civic. Her very straight brown hair. Her fascination with abandoned buildings.

en: “She has a black notebook with her,” I say.
vi: “Margo có cuốn sổ bìa đen nữa nhé,” tôi nói.
tr: ‘Yanında siyah bir defteri var,” diyorum.
es: —Lleva una libreta negra —digo.
vi_translation: “Margo also has a black notebook,” I said.
tr_translation: "He has a black notebook with him," I say.
es_translation: —He carries a black notebook —I say.

en: Ben wheels around to me. “Okay, Q. If I see a girl who looks exactly like Margo in Agloe, New York, I’m not going to do anything. Unless she has a notebook. That’ll be the giveaway.”
vi: Ben quay sang tôi. “Được rồi, nếu tôi thấy bạn nữ nào trông giống Margo ở Agloe, New York, tôi sẽ không làm gì hết. Trừ phi bạn ấy có một cuốn sổ. Đó là đặc điểm nhận dạng.
tr: Ben birden bana dönüyor. ‘Tamam, Q. Eğer Agloe, New York’ta tamamen Margo gibi görünen bir kız görürsem hiçbir şey yapmayacağım. Bir defteri olmadığı sürece. Onu ele veren şey bu olacak.”
es: Ben se gira hacia mí. —Vale, Q. Si veo a una chica exactamente como Margo en Agloe, Nueva York, no pienso hacer nada si no lleva una libreta. Esa será la señal.
vi_translation: Ben turned to me. “Alright, if I see any girl who looks like Margo in Agloe, New York, I won't do anything. Unless she has a notebook. That's the identifying feature.”
tr_translation: Ben suddenly turns to me. ‘Okay, Q. If I see a girl in Agloe, New York who looks exactly like Margo, I won’t do anything. Unless she has a notebook. That will be the giveaway.”
es_translation: Ben turns towards me. —Okay, Q. If I see a girl exactly like Margo in Agloe, New York, I won't do anything unless she has a notebook. That will be the signal.

en: I shrug him off. I just want to remember her. One last time, I want to remember her while still hoping to see her again.
vi: Đó là đặc điểm nhận dạng. Tôi huých vai Ben. Tôi chỉ muốn nhớ lại về cô ấy. Một lần cuối, tôi muốn nhớ được Margo khi vẫn đang hi vọng gặp lại cô ấy.
tr: Ona aldırış etmiyorum. Sadece Margo’yu hatırlamak istiyorum. Hâlâ onu görmeyi umuyorken, son bir kez onu hatırlamak istiyorum.
es: No le hago caso. Solo quiero recordarla. Por última vez, quiero recordarla mientras aún espero volver a verla.
vi_translation: That's the identifying feature.” I nudged Ben. I just wanted to remember her. One last time, I wanted to remember Margo while still hoping to see her again.
tr_translation: I don’t pay attention to him. I just want to remember Margo. While I still hope to see her, I want to remember her one last time.
es_translation: I don't pay attention to her. I just want to remember her. For the last time, I want to remember her while I still hope to see her again.

en: Agloe
vi: Agloe
tr: Agloe
es: AGLOE
vi_translation: Agloe
tr_translation: Agloe
es_translation: AGLOE

en: The speed limit drops from fifty-five to forty-five and then to thirty-five. We cross some railroad tracks, and we’re in Roscoe. We drive slowly through a sleepy downtown with a café, a clothing store, a dollar store, and a couple boarded-up storefronts.
vi: Tốc độ giảm dần từ năm mươi lăm xuống bốn mươi lăm, rồi ba mươi lăm dặm một giờ. Qua vài đoạn đường tàu, chúng tôi đã đến Roscoe. Chúng tôi từ từ lái xe qua khu trung tâm ngái ngủ với một quán cà phê, một cửa hàng quần áo, một tiệm bán đồ đồng giá, và mấy gian hàng có mặt tiền toàn là cửa ván xếp.
tr: Hız sınırı, doksandan yetmişe, sonra da elliye düşüyor. Demiryolu raylarının üstünden geçiyoruz ve Roscoe’dayız. Bir kafesi, bir giyim mağazası, bir ucuzcu dükkânı ve birkaç tane üstüne tahta çakılmış mağazası olan uykulu bir kasaba merkezinden yavaşça geçiyoruz.
es: El límite de velocidad baja de noventa a setenta, y luego a sesenta. Cruzamos unas vías de tren y llegamos a Roscoe. Avanzamos despacio por una población adormecida con una cafetería, una tienda de ropa, una tienda de todo a un dólar y un par de escaparates cerrados con tablones.
vi_translation: The speed gradually decreased from fifty-five to forty-five, then thirty-five miles per hour. After a few railroad crossings, we arrived at Roscoe. We slowly drove through the sleepy downtown area with a café, a clothing store, a dollar store, and several storefronts with entirely boarded-up windows.
tr_translation: The speed limit drops from ninety to seventy, then to fifty. We cross over the railroad tracks and we are in Roscoe. We slowly pass through the sleepy town center, which has a café, a clothing store, a discount shop, and a few boarded-up stores.
es_translation: The speed limit drops from ninety to seventy, and then to sixty. We cross some train tracks and arrive in Roscoe. We move slowly through a sleepy town with a café, a clothing store, a dollar store, and a couple of storefronts boarded up.

en: I lean forward and say, “I can imagine her in there.”
vi: Tôi nhoài về phía trước, nói, “Tôi có thể tưởng tượng được Margo ở trong đó.”
tr: Öne eğilip, “Margo’yu orada hayal edebiliyorum,” diyorum.
es: —Puedo imaginármela aquí —digo inclinándome hacia delante.
vi_translation: I lean forward and say, "I can imagine Margo being in there."
tr_translation: Leaning forward, I say, "I can imagine Margo there."
es_translation: —I can imagine her here —I say, leaning forward.

en: “Yeah,” Ben allows. “Man, I really don’t want to break into buildings. I don’t think I would do well in New York prisons.”
vi: “Ừ,” Ben đồng tình. “Trời ạ, tôi không muốn đột nhập vào mấy tòa nhà đó tí nào. Chắc tôi không trụ nổi nhà tù New York đâu.”
tr: “Evet,” diyor Ben. ‘Dostum, binalara izinsiz girmek istemiyorum gerçekten. New York hapishanelerinde iyi olacağımı sanmıyorum.
es: —Sí —admite Ben—. Tío, de verdad que no quiero allanar edificios. No creo que me vaya muy bien en las cárceles de Nueva York.
vi_translation: "Yeah," Ben agreed. "Gosh, I don't want to break into those buildings at all. I probably wouldn't survive New York prison."
tr_translation: “Yes,” says Ben. “Buddy, I really don't want to break into buildings without permission. I don't think I'll do well in New York prisons.”
es_translation: —Yes —admits Ben—. Dude, I really don't want to break into buildings. I don't think I'd do very well in New York's prisons.

en: The thought of exploring these buildings doesn’t strike me as particularly scary, though, since the whole town seems deserted. Nothing’s open here. Past downtown, a single road bisects the highway, and on that road sits Roscoe’s lone neighborhood and an elementary school. Modest wood-frame houses are dwarfed by the trees, which grow thick and tall here.
vi: Nhưng ý tưởng thám hiểm những căn nhà đó không khiến tôi đặc biệt sợ hãi, vì toàn bộ nơi này như đã bị bỏ không. Không có tiệm nào mở cửa. Qua khu trung tâm, có một phố duy nhất cắt qua đường cao tốc. Trên con phố đó là khu dân cư đơn côi và trường tiểu học Roscoe. Những ngôi nhà khung gỗ khiêm tốn như những chú lùn núp dưới hàng cây cao, tán rậm rạp.
tr: Bütün kasaba ıssız göründüğü için bu binaları araştırma fikri bana özel olarak korkutucu gelmiyor. Burada hiçbir şey açık değil. Merkezi geçince tek bir yol, anayolu ortadan kesiyor ve bu yolda Roscoe’nun tenha mahallesi ile bir ilkokul var. Mütevazı ahşap evler, geniş ve uzun ağaçların yatımda küçücük kalmış.
es: Aunque la idea de explorar estos edificios no me parece especialmente alarmante, ya que todo el pueblo da la impresión de estar desierto. No hay nada abierto. Pasado el centro, la carretera cruza la autovía, y en esa carretera solo está el vecindario de Roscoe y una escuela primaria. Los gruesos y altos árboles hacen que las modestas casas de madera parezcan enanas.
vi_translation: But the idea of exploring those houses did not particularly scare me, because the whole place seemed abandoned. No shops were open. Through the town center, there was a single street that cut through the highway. On that street was a solitary residential area and Roscoe Elementary School. The modest wooden houses were like dwarfs hiding under the tall trees with dense foliage.
tr_translation: Since the whole town looks deserted, the idea of exploring these buildings doesn't particularly scare me. Nothing is open here. After passing the center, a single road intersects the main road, and on this road, there is Roscoe's secluded neighborhood and an elementary school. Modest wooden houses appear tiny beside the wide and tall trees.
es_translation: Although the idea of exploring these buildings does not seem particularly alarming to me, as the whole town gives the impression of being deserted. There is nothing open. Past the center, the road crosses the highway, and on that road there is only the Roscoe neighborhood and an elementary school. The thick and tall trees make the modest wooden houses look tiny.

en: We turn onto a different highway, and the speed limit goes back up incrementally, but Radar is driving slowly anyway. We haven’t gone a mile when we see a dirt road on our left with no street sign to tell us its name.
vi: Chúng tôi rẽ vào một đường cao tốc khác, tăng tốc chạy nhanh như trước, nhưng thực ra Radar lái cũng chậm. Chưa đi được một dặm, bọn tôi thấy một đường đất ở bên trái, không có biển báo hiệu nào cả.
tr: Başka bir anayola sapıyoruz ve hız sınırı tekrar artıyor ama Radar yine de yavaş sürüyor. Solumuzda bize ismini gösterecek bir sokak tabelası olmayan, toprak bir yol gördüğümüzde, daha bir buçuk kilometre gitmemişiz.
es: Nos metemos en otra autovía y aumentamos la velocidad, aunque Radar sigue conduciendo despacio. Hemos hecho poco más de un kilómetro cuando vemos a la izquierda un camino sin asfaltar y sin un cartel que nos indique su nombre.
vi_translation: We turned onto another highway, accelerating as fast as before, but in reality, Radar was driving slowly. We hadn't gone a mile when we saw a dirt road on the left, with no signs at all.
tr_translation: We turn onto another main road and the speed limit increases again, but Radar still drives slowly. When we see a dirt road on our left without a street sign to show us its name, we haven't even gone one and a half kilometers yet.
es_translation: We enter another highway and increase our speed, although Radar continues to drive slowly. We have gone a little over a kilometer when we see an unpaved road to the left with no sign indicating its name.

en: “This may be it,” I say.
vi: “Có thể là chỗ này,” tôi nói.
tr: “Bu o olabilir,” diyorum.
es: —Puede ser esto —digo.
vi_translation: “This could be the place,” I said.
tr_translation: “This could be it,” I say.
es_translation: —This could be it —I say.

en: “That’s a driveway,” Ben answers, but Radar turns in anyway. But it does seem to be a driveway, actually, cut into the hard-packed dirt. To our left, uncut grass grows as high as the tires; I don’t see anything, although I worry that it’d be easy for a person to hide anywhere in that field. We drive for a while and the road dead-ends into a Victorian farmhouse. We turn around and head back up the two-lane highway, farther north. The highway turns into Cat Hollow Road, and we drive until we see a dirt road identical to the previous one, this time on the right side of the street, leading to a crumbling barnlike structure with grayed wood. Huge cylindrical bales of hay line the fields on either side of us, but the grass has begun to grow up again. Radar drives no faster than five miles an hour. We are looking for something unusual. Some crack in the perfectly idyllic landscape.
vi: “Là đường cho xe đi thôi,” Ben nói, nhưng Radar vẫn rẽ vào. Thực ra trông đúng là giống đường cho xe đi thật, một dải đường chạy trên nền đất rắn. Ở bên trái bọn tôi, cỏ dại mọc cao đến bánh xe; tôi không thấy gì, nhưng hơi lo rằng nếu ai đó muốn trốn trong đồng cỏ này thì cũng chẳng mấy khó khăn. Chúng tôi lái xe thêm một đoạn nữa thì dải đường chạy vào một ngôi nhà nông thôn kiến trúc thời Victoria. Bọn tôi vòng ra sau, quay đầu trở lại đường cao tốc hai làn, đi tiếp về phía bắc. Đường cao tốc rẽ vào đường Cat Hollow, chúng tôi chạy xe cho đến khi thấy một dải đường đất giống đường đất lúc nãy, lần này ở bên phải, dẫn vào nơi trông như một nhà kho ọp ẹp bằng gỗ đã bạc màu. Hàng kiện cỏ khô hình trụ nằm thành hàng trên những cánh đồng ở cả hai bên chúng tôi, cỏ trên đồng đã bắt đầu mọc trở lại. Radar lái chưa đến năm dặm một giờ. Chúng tôi đang tìm những dấu hiệu bất thường. Chút nứt rạn trên phong cảnh nên thơ hoàn hảo này.
tr: “Bu bir garaj yolu,” diye karşılık veriyor Ben ama Radar yine de dönüyor. Fakat toprak bir garaj yolu gibi görünüyor aslında. Solumuzda biçilmemiş çimenler, lastikler kadar uzun; hiçbir şey görmüyorum, öte yandan burada bir insanın herhangi bir yere saklanmasının kolay olacağından endişeleniyorum. Bir süre gidiyo ruz ve yol Victoria tarzı bir çiftlik evinde son buluyor. Geri dönüp tekrar daha kuzeydeki iki şeritli anayola yöneliyoruz. Anayol, Cat Hollow Yolu’na dönüşüyor ve öncekinin aynısı olan toprak bir yol görene kadar gidiyoruz, bu seferki, caddenin sağ tarafında, matlaşmış ahşaptan, ahır benzeri bir yapıya çıkıyor. İki taralımızdaki çayırlarda kocaman, silindir şeklinde ot balyalan dizilmiş ama çimenler tekrar büyümeye başlamış. Radar saatte sekiz kilometreden daha hızlı sürmüyor. Alışılmadık bir şey anyoruz. Huzurlu kır manzarasında bir çatlak.
es: —Es el camino de una casa —contesta Ben. Pero Radar gira de todas formas. Lo cierto es que parece el camino de una casa, abierto en la tierra apisonada. A nuestra izquierda crece la hierba, que alcanza la altura de los neumáticos. No veo nada, aunque me temo que sería fácil esconderse en cualquier parte de este campo. Avanzamos un trecho, y la carretera va a parar a una granja victoriana. Damos media vuelta y regresamos a la autovía de dos carriles, más al norte. La autovía gira hacia Cat Hollow Road y seguimos hasta que vemos una carretera sin asfaltar idéntica a la anterior, esta vez a la derecha, que conduce a una especie de granero derruido de madera gris. En los campos, a ambos lados de nosotros, hay enormes balas cilíndricas de heno, pero la hierba ha empezado a crecer. Radar no supera los diez kilómetros por hora. Buscamos algo raro. Alguna falla en este paisaje perfectamente idílico.
vi_translation: “It's just a road for cars,” Ben said, but Radar still turned in. In fact, it really did look like a road for cars, a strip of road running on solid ground. To our left, weeds grew as high as the car wheels; I couldn't see anything, but I was a bit worried that if someone wanted to hide in this field, it wouldn't be too difficult. We drove a bit further and the strip of road led to a Victorian-style farmhouse. We circled around back, turned back onto the two-lane highway, and continued north. The highway turned onto Cat Hollow Road, and we drove until we saw a strip of dirt road similar to the one earlier, this time on the right, leading to what looked like a dilapidated wooden barn. Rows of cylindrical hay bales lay in the fields on both sides of us, and the grass in the fields had started to grow back. Radar was driving at less than five miles per hour. We were looking for any signs of irregularity. A slight crack in this perfectly picturesque landscape.
tr_translation: "It's a driveway," Ben replies, but Radar turns anyway. However, it actually looks like a dirt driveway. To our left, the uncut grass is as tall as tires; I can't see anything, but on the other hand, I'm worried that it would be easy for someone to hide anywhere here. We go for a while The road and journey end at a Victorian-style farmhouse. We turn back and head towards the two-lane highway further north again. The highway turns into Cat Hollow Road, and we go until we see a dirt road identical to the previous one, this time leading to a barn-like structure made of weathered wood on the right side of the street. In the meadows on both sides of us, large cylindrical hay bales are lined up, but the grass has started to grow again. Radar is not driving faster than eight kilometers per hour. We notice something unusual. A crack in the peaceful countryside scenery.
es_translation: —It's the way to a house —answers Ben. But Radar turns anyway. The truth is that it looks like the path to a house, open in the packed earth. To our left, the grass grows, reaching the height of the tires. I don't see anything, although I fear it would be easy to hide anywhere in this field. We advance a stretch, and the road ends at a Victorian farmhouse. We turn around and return to the two-lane highway, further north. The highway turns towards Cat Hollow Road and we continue until we see an unpaved road identical to the previous one, this time to the right, leading to a sort of dilapidated gray wooden barn. In the fields, on both sides of us, there are huge cylindrical bales of hay, but the grass has started to grow. Radar doesn't exceed ten kilometers per hour. We are looking for something strange. Some flaw in this perfectly idyllic landscape.

en: “Do you think that could have been the Agloe General Store?” I ask.
vi: “Mọi người có nghĩ đó có thể là Hiệu Tạp Hóa Agloe không?”
tr: “Sizce, şu Agloe Market olabilir mi?
es: —¿Creéis que puede haber sido el Supermercado Agloe? —pregunto.
vi_translation: "Do people think it could be the Agloe General Store?"
tr_translation: “Do you think this could be the Agloe Market?”
es_translation: —Do you think it could have been the Agloe Supermarket? —I ask.

en: “That barn?”
vi: “Nhà kho ấy á?”
tr: “Şu ahır mı?
es: —¿Ese granero?
vi_translation: "That warehouse?"
tr_translation: “Is this the barn?”
es_translation: —That barn?

en: “Yeah.”
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: “Yes.”
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “I dunno,” Radar says. “Did general stores look like barns?”
vi: “Không biết nữa,” Radar đáp. “Đã từng có hiệu tạp hóa trông giống nhà kho sao?”
tr: “Bilmem,” diyor Radar. “Marketler ahır gibi mi görünürdü?”
es: —No sé —me contesta Radar—. ¿Los supermercados parecen graneros?
vi_translation: “I don't know,” Radar replied. “Has there ever been a grocery store that looked like a warehouse?”
tr_translation: "I don't know," says Radar. "Would the markets look like barns?"
es_translation: —I don't know —Radar answers me—. Do supermarkets look like barns?

en: I blow a long breath from between pursed lips. “Dunno.”
vi: Tôi nhả một hơi dài qua hai môi méo xẹo. “Biết chết liền.
tr: Büzülmüş dudaklarınım arasından uzun bir nefes veriyorum. “Bilmem.
es: Dejo escapar un largo soplido entre los labios fruncidos. —No sé.
vi_translation: I exhale a long breath through my crooked lips. "Beats me."
tr_translation: I let out a long breath through my pursed lips. "I don't know."
es_translation: I let out a long sigh through my pursed lips. —I don't know.

en: “Is that—shit, that’s her car!” Lacey shouts next to me. “Yes yes yes yes yes her car her car!”
vi: “Kìa–trời ơi, xe của Margo!” Lacey hét lên ngay cạnh tôi. “Đúng đúng đúng đúng đúng đúng xe của Margo xe của Margo!”
tr: “Bu... Kahretsin, bu Margo’nun arabası!” diye bağınyor Lacey yanımda.
es: —Es ese… mierda, ¡es su coche! —grita Lacey a mi lado—. ¡Sí sí sí sí sí su coche su coche!
vi_translation: "Oh my God, Margo's car!" Lacey shouted right next to me. "Yes yes yes yes yes yes Margo's car Margo's car!"
tr_translation: “This... “Damn it, this is Margo’s car!” Lacey is shouting next to me. “Yes yes yes yes yes it’s her car it’s her car!”
es_translation: —It's that... shit, it's his car! —Lacey shouts next to me—. Yes yes yes yes yes his car his car!

en: Radar stops the minivan as I follow Lacey’s finger back across the field, behind the building. A glint of silver. Leaning down so my face is next to hers, I can see the arc of the car’s roof. God knows how it got there, since no road leads in that direction.
vi: Radar dừng xe trong khi tôi nhìn theo hướng Lacey chỉ qua cánh đồng, phía sau nhà kho. Một chớp ánh bạc. Cúi sát lại chỗ Lacey, tôi thấy cạnh cong ở nóc xe. Có Chúa mới biết làm sao chiếc xe lại ở đó, vì không có đường nào dẫn ra hướng đấy.
tr: “Evet evet evet evet evet onun arabası onun arabası!” Ben, Lacey’nin parmağım çayırın öbür tarafına, binanın arkasına doğru takip ederken, Radar arabayı durduruyor. Bir gümüş ışıltısı. Yüzüm Lacey’n i ilkinin yanında durana kadar eğiliyorum, arabamn tavanındaki kavisi görebiliyorum. Oraya nasıl ulaştığım Tanrı bilir, çünkü hiçbir yol o yöne çıkmıyor.
es: Radar detiene el monovolumen mientras sigo el dedo de Lacey, que señala más allá del campo, detrás del edificio. Un destello plateado. Me agacho, coloco la cara al lado de la suya y veo el arco del techo del coche. Sabe Dios cómo ha llegado hasta allí, porque no hay ningún camino.
vi_translation: Radar stopped the car while I looked in the direction Lacey pointed across the field, behind the barn. A flash of silver. Leaning closer to Lacey, I saw the curved edge of the car roof. God only knows how the car got there, as there was no road leading in that direction.
tr_translation: As I follow Lacey’s finger pointing to the other side of the field, behind the building, Radar stops the car. A silver glint. I bend down until my face is next to Lacey’s, and I can see the curve of the roof of the car. God knows how it got there, because no road leads in that direction.
es_translation: Radar stops the minivan while I follow Lacey's finger, which points beyond the field, behind the building. A silver flash. I crouch down, place my face next to hers, and see the arc of the car's roof. God knows how it got there, because there is no path.

en: Radar pulls over, and I jump out and run back toward her car. Empty. Unlocked. I pop the trunk. Empty, too, except for an open and empty suitcase. I look around, and take off toward what I now believe to be the remnants of Agloe’s General Store. Ben and Radar pass me as I run through the mown field. We enter the barn not through a door but through one of several gaping holes where the wooden wall has simply fallen away.
vi: Radar tìm chỗ đỗ, tôi nhảy khỏi minivan và chạy về phía xe của cô ấy. Trống không. Không khóa. Tôi mở thùng xe. Cũng không có gì, trừ một va-li để mở và trống không. Tôi nhìn quanh, và đi về phía mà bây giờ tôi tin là những gì còn lại của Hiệu Tạp Hóa Agloe. Ben và Radar vượt tôi khi tôi chạy qua vạt cỏ đã cắt. Chúng tôi không vào nhà kho qua cửa ra vào mà qua một trong mấy lỗ trống hoác, nơi tường gỗ đơn giản là đã sút ra.
tr: Radar kenara çekiyor, dışarı atlayıp Margo’nun arabasına doğru koşuyorum. Boş. Kilitlenmemiş. Bagajı açıyorum. O da boş, açık ve boş bir valiz dışında. Etrafa bakıyorum ve şimdi Agloe Market’in kalıntıları olduğuna inandığım yapıya doğru harekete geçiyorum. Biçilmiş otların üstünden koşarken Ben ile Radar beni geçiyorlar. Ahıra bir kapıdan değil, ahşap duvardaki aralıktan giriyoruz.
es: Radar para, salgo de un salto y corro hasta el coche. Vacío. Abierto. Abro el maletero. También vacío. Solo hay una maleta abierta y sin nada. Miro a mi alrededor y me dirijo hacia lo que ahora creo que son los restos del Supermercado Agloe. Ben y Radar me adelantan mientras corro por el campo segado. Entramos en el granero no por la puerta, sino por uno de los grandes agujeros que se han formado al caerse la pared de madera.
vi_translation: Radar found a parking spot, I jumped out of the minivan and ran towards her car. Empty. Unlocked. I opened the trunk. Nothing either, except for an open and empty suitcase. I looked around, and walked towards what I now believed to be the remains of the Agloe General Store. Ben and Radar passed me as I ran across the mowed grass. We didn't enter the barn through the door but through one of the gaping holes, where the wooden wall had simply fallen apart.
tr_translation: Radar pulls over, I jump out and run towards Margo's car. Empty. Unlocked. I open the trunk. It is also empty, except for an open and empty suitcase. I look around and now move towards the structure I believe to be the remnants of the Agloe Market. As I run over the mowed grass, Ben and Radar pass me. We enter the barn not through a door, but through a gap in the wooden wall.
es_translation: Radar stops, I jump out and run to the car. Empty. Open. I open the trunk. Also empty. There's only an open suitcase with nothing inside. I look around and head towards what I now believe are the remains of the Agloe Supermarket. Ben and Radar overtake me as I run through the mowed field. We enter the barn not through the door, but through one of the large holes that have formed where the wooden wall has fallen.

en: Inside the building, the sun lights up segments of the rotting wooden floor through the many holes in the roof. As I look for her, I register things: the soggy floorboards. The smell of almonds, like her. An old claw-footed bathtub in a corner. So many holes everywhere that this place is simultaneously inside and outside.
vi: Trong gian kho, mặt trời chiếu xuống những mảng sàn gỗ mục nát qua nhiều lỗ thủng trên mái. Trong khi tìm cô ấy, tôi điểm qua từng thứ: ván sàn ẩm thấp. Mùi hạnh nhân, giống cô ấy. Một bồn tắm có chân ở góc. Đâu đâu cũng cơ man là lỗ nên nơi này đồng thời ở trong và ở ngoài.
tr: Binanın içinde güneş ışığı, çatıdaki bir sürü delikten geçerek, çürümekte olan ahşap döşemenin parçalarım aydınlatıyor. Margo’yu ararken, bazı şeyleri algılamaya başlıyorum: sırılsıklam döşeme tahtaları. Badem kokusu, onun gibi. Bir köşede eski, çengel ayaklı bir küvet. Burayı aynı anda hem iç hem de dış mekân yapan, her taraftaki bir sürü delik.
es: Dentro del edificio el sol entra por los muchos agujeros del techo e ilumina partes del suelo de madera podrido. Mientras la busco, tomo nota mentalmente de todo lo que veo: las tablas del suelo mojadas. El olor a almendras, como ella. Una vieja bañera con patas en forma de garra en una esquina. Está tan lleno de agujeros que el edificio es a la vez interior y exterior.
vi_translation: In the warehouse, the sun shone down on the rotten wooden floorboards through numerous holes in the roof. While searching for her, I noted each thing: the damp floorboards. The smell of almonds, like her. A clawfoot bathtub in the corner. Holes everywhere, making this place both inside and outside at the same time.
tr_translation: Inside the building, sunlight streams through numerous holes in the roof, illuminating the pieces of the decaying wooden floor. As I search for Margo, I start to perceive certain things: the soaking wet floor the boards. The scent of almonds, like her. An old, claw-footed bathtub in a corner. What makes this place both an interior and exterior space at the same time are the numerous holes everywhere.
es_translation: Inside the building, the sun enters through the many holes in the roof and illuminates parts of the rotten wooden floor. While I search for her, I mentally take note of everything I see: the wet floorboards. The smell of almonds, like her. An old clawfoot bathtub in a corner. It is so full of holes that the building is both interior and exterior at the same time.

en: I feel someone pull hard on my shirt. I spin my head and see Ben, his eyes shooting back and forth between me and a corner of the room. I have to look past a wide beam of bright white light shining down from the ceiling, but I can see into that corner. Two long panes of chest-high, dirty, gray-tinted Plexiglas lean against each other at an acute angle, held up on the other side by the wooden wall. It’s a triangular cubicle, if such a thing is possible.
vi: Tôi cảm thấy ai đó kéo mạnh áo mình. Tôi quay lại và thấy Ben, mắt nó bắn qua bắn lại giữa tôi và một góc phòng. Phải nhìn qua một vùng sáng trắng tràn từ trần xuống, nhưng tôi có thể thấy được góc đó. Hai tấm nhựa cứng dài cao ngang ngực, cáu bẩn và mờ xám, dựa vào nhau làm thành một góc nhọn, hai cạnh bên có tường gỗ giữ. Một ô làm việc hình tam giác, nếu có thứ tương tự như vậy.
tr: Birinin, sertçe tişörtümü çekiştirdiğini hissediyorum. Başımı çeviriyorum ve Ben’i görüyorum, gözleri odanın bir köşesi ile benim aramda gidip geliyor. Tavandan aşağı süzülen parlak beyaz, geniş bir ışık hüzmesinin ötesine bakmak zorunda kalıyorum ama o köşeyi görebiliyorum. Göğüs hizasında, kirli, gri renkli, iki uzun pleksiglas levha, dar bir açıyla birbirlerine yaslanmış, diğer yandan ahşap duvara dayanıyorlar. Bu, üçgen şeklinde bir odacık, eğer böyle bir şey mümkünse.
es: Siento que alguien me tira fuerte de la camiseta. Giro la cabeza y veo a Ben, que desplaza los ojos hacia un rincón de la estancia. Tengo que atravesar con la mirada un gran haz de luz que entra por el techo, pero veo ese rincón. Dos paneles de plexiglás de aproximadamente un metro de altura, sucios y tintados de color gris, se apoyan entre sí formando un ángulo pegado a la pared de madera. Es un cubículo triangular, si un cubículo puede ser triangular.
vi_translation: I felt someone tugging hard at my shirt. I turned around and saw Ben, his eyes darting back and forth between me and a corner of the room. I had to look through a bright white area streaming down from the ceiling, but I could see that corner. Two long, chest-high, dirty and grayish plastic sheets leaned against each other forming a sharp angle, with wooden walls holding the sides. A triangular workspace, if such a thing existed.
tr_translation: I feel someone tugging at my shirt roughly. I turn my head and see Ben, his eyes darting between a corner of the room and me. I have to look beyond a broad beam of bright white light streaming down from the ceiling, but I can see that corner. At chest height, two long, dirty, gray plexiglass sheets are leaning against each other at a narrow angle, while on the other side they rest against the wooden wall. It's a triangular-shaped nook, if such a thing is possible.
es_translation: I feel someone pulling hard on my shirt. I turn my head and see Ben, who shifts his eyes towards a corner of the room. I have to look through a large beam of light coming in from the ceiling, but I see that corner. Two plexiglass panels approximately one meter high, dirty and tinted gray, lean against each other forming an angle against the wooden wall. It's a triangular cubicle, if a cubicle can be triangular.

en: And here’s the thing about tinted windows: the light still gets through. So I can see the jarring scene, albeit in gray scale: Margo Roth Spiegelman sits in a black leather office chair, hunched over a school desk, writing. Her hair is much shorter— she has choppy bangs above her eyebrows and everything is mussed-up, as if to emphasize the asymmetry—but it is her. She is alive. She has relocated her offices from an abandoned mini-mall in Florida to an abandoned barn in New York, and I have found her.
vi: Và đây là điều đáng lưu ý về cửa sổ mờ: ánh sáng có thể lọt qua được. Nên tôi thấy được một khung cảnh xót xa, dù đã qua sắc xám: Margo Roth Spiegelman ngồi trên cái ghế văn phòng bọc da đen, khom người xuống mặt bàn, kiểu bàn học trò, cô ấy đang viết. Tóc Margo ngắn đi nhiều–tóc mái lỉa chỉa xòa xuống lông mày và mọi thứ lộn xộn, như thể điểm nhấn là sự lệch tâm–nhưng đó là cô ấy. Margo còn sống. Cô ấy đã chuyển phòng làm việc từ khu mua sắm mini bị bỏ hoang ở Florida đến một nhà kho bị bỏ hoang ở New York, và tôi đã tìm thấy cô ấy.
tr: Ve koyu renkli pencerelerle ilgili olay işte bu: Işık yine de içeri giriyor. Bu yüzden gri tonlarında olmasma karşm, sarsıcı sahneyi görebiliyorum: Margo Roth Spiegelman, siyah deri bir ofis sandalyesinde oturuyor, bir okul sırasmm üstüne eğilmiş, yazıyor. Saçı çok daha kısakaşlarının üzerinde dalgalı perçemleri var ve sanki asimetriyi vurgulamak istermiş gibi karmakarışıkfakat bu Margo. Hayatta. Ofisini, Florida’daki terk edilmiş bir alışveriş merkezinden, New York’taki terk edilmiş bir ahıra taşımış ve onu bulmuş durumdayım.
es: Y lo que sucede con las ventanas tintadas es que dejan pasar la luz, así que veo la inquietante escena, aunque en una escala de grises: Margo Roth Spiegelman está sentada en una silla de oficina de piel negra, inclinada sobre un pupitre de escuela, escribiendo. Lleva el pelo mucho más corto —el flequillo desigual por encima de las cejas y todo alborotado, como para resaltar la asimetría—, pero es ella. Está viva.
