Ha trasladado su despacho de un centro comercial abandonado de Florida a un granero abandonado de Nueva York, y la he encontrado.
vi_translation: And here is the noteworthy thing about the frosted window: light can pass through it. So I saw a poignant scene, though through a gray tint: Margo Roth Spiegelman sitting on a black leather office chair, hunched over a desk, like a student's desk, she was writing. Margo's hair was much shorter—her bangs were messy and falling over her eyebrows, everything in disarray, as if the emphasis was on eccentricity—but it was her. Margo was alive. She had moved her office from the abandoned mini-mall in Florida to an abandoned warehouse in New York, and I had found her.
tr_translation: And here's the thing about dark-colored windows: The light still gets in. So despite being in shades of gray, I can see the shocking scene: Margo Roth Spiegelman, sitting in a black leather office chair, leaning over a school desk, writing. Her hair is much shorter, with wavy bangs over her eyebrows, and as if to emphasize the asymmetry, it's all messy—but this is Margo. Alive. She has moved her office from an abandoned shopping mall in Florida to an abandoned barn in New York, and I have found her.
es_translation: And what happens with tinted windows is that they let light through, so I see the unsettling scene, although in grayscale: Margo Roth Spiegelman is sitting in a black leather office chair, leaning over a school desk, writing. Her hair is much shorter —the uneven bangs above her eyebrows and all messy, as if to highlight the asymmetry—, but it's her. She is alive. She has moved her office from an abandoned mall in Florida to an abandoned barn in New York, and I have found her.

en: We walk toward Margo, all four of us, but she doesn’t seem to see us. She just keeps writing. Finally, someone—Radar, maybe—says, “Margo. Margo?”
vi: Chúng tôi đi về phía Margo, cả bốn, nhưng hình như cô ấy không nhận ra. Margo cứ viết. Cuối cùng, ai đó–Radar, hình như thế–lên tiếng, “Margo. Margo hả?”
tr: Margo’ya doğru yürüyoruz, dördümüz birden, ancak bizi görmüş gibi durmuyor. Sadece yazmaya devam ediyor. Nihayet biribelki Radar, “Margo. Margo?” diyor.
es: Nos acercamos a Margo los cuatro, pero no parece vernos. Sigue escribiendo. Al final, alguien —quizá Radar— dice: —¿Margo, Margo?
vi_translation: We walked towards Margo, all four of us, but it seemed like she didn't notice. Margo kept writing. Finally, someone—Radar, it seemed—spoke up, "Margo." "Margo?"
tr_translation: We are walking towards Margo, all four of us at once, but she doesn't seem to notice us. She just keeps writing. Finally, someone—maybe Radar—says, "Margo. Margo?"
es_translation: The four of us approach Margo, but she doesn't seem to see us. She keeps writing. Finally, someone—maybe Radar—says: —Margo, Margo?

en: She stands up on her tiptoes, her hands resting atop the makeshift cubicle’s walls. If she is surprised to see us, her eyes do not give it away. Here is Margo Roth Spiegelman, five feet away from me, her lips chapped to cracking, makeup-less, dirt in her fingernails, her eyes silent. I’ve never seen her eyes dead like that, but then again, maybe I’ve never seen her eyes before. She stares at me. I feel certain she is staring at me and not at Lacey or Ben or Radar. I haven’t felt so stared at since Robert Joyner’s dead eyes watched me in Jefferson Park.
vi: Margo hả?” Cô ấy đứng dậy và kiễng lên, bàn tay tì vào mép tường cái văn phòng dã chiến này. Nếu có ngạc nhiên khi thấy chúng tôi, đôi mắt cô ấy cũng không biểu hiện ra chút nào. Đây là Margo Roth Spiegelman, cách tôi chừng một mét rưỡi, bờ môi khô nứt, không trang điểm, đất bám ở móng tay, đôi mắt lặng lẽ. Tôi chưa từng thấy mắt Margo chết như vậy, nhưng rồi một lần nữa, có lẽ tôi chưa từng nhìn đôi mắt cô ấy. Margo chằm chằm nhìn tôi. Tôi cảm thấy chắc chắn rằng cô ấy đang nhìn tôi chứ không phải Lacey hay Ben hay Radar. Tôi chưa từng cảm thấy ánh mắt gắt gao như vậy kể từ khi đôi mắt chết của Robert Joyner nhìn tôi trong Công viên Jefferson.
tr: Margo?” diyor. Parmak uçlarında ayağa kalkıyor; elleri, eğreti odacığın duvarlarının tepesinde. Eğer bizi gördüğüne şaşırmışsa bile gözleri onu ele vermiyor. İşte Margo Roth Spiegelman, benden bir buçuk metre ötede, dudakları çatlamaktan pütür pütür olmuş, makyajsız, tırnaklarında kir, gözleri sessiz. Gözlerini hiç böyle ölü görmemiştim ama belki de gözlerini daha önce hiç görmedim. Bana bakıyor. Lacey’ye, Ben’e ya da Radar’a değil, bana baktığından eminim. Kobcrl doyner’ın ölü gözleri Jefferson Park’ta beni izlediğinden beri, lıiç İni kudur uzun uzun izleniyormuşum gibi hissetmemiştim.
es: —¿Margo, Margo? Margo se levanta de puntillas, con las manos en las paredes del improvisado cubículo. Si le sorprende vernos, sus ojos no lo muestran. Aquí está Margo Roth Spiegelman, a metro y medio de mí, con los labios agrietados, sin maquillar, con las uñas sucias y los ojos mudos. Nunca había visto sus ojos muertos hasta ese punto, pero quizá nunca antes había visto sus ojos. Me observa. Estoy seguro de que está observándome a mí, no a Lacey, Ben o Radar. No me había sentido tan observado desde que los ojos sin vida de Robert Joyner me miraron en Jefferson Park.
vi_translation: She stood up and tiptoed, her hand resting on the edge of the wall of this makeshift office. If she was surprised to see us, her eyes did not show it at all. This is Margo Roth Spiegelman, about one and a half meters away from me, with dry, cracked lips, no makeup, dirt under her fingernails, and quiet eyes. I had never seen Margo's eyes so lifeless, but then again, perhaps I had never really looked into her eyes. Margo stared at me. I felt certain that she was looking at me and not at Lacey or Ben or Radar. I had not felt such an intense gaze since the dead eyes of Robert Joyner looked at me in Jefferson Park.
tr_translation: She stands on her tiptoes; her hands are at the top of the makeshift room's walls. Even if she's surprised to see us, her eyes don't give her away. Here is Margo Roth Spiegelman, a meter and a half away from me, her lips chapped and rough, no makeup, dirt under her nails, her eyes silent. I've never seen her eyes so lifeless, but maybe I've never seen her eyes before. She's looking at me. I'm sure she's looking at me, not at Lacey, Ben, or Radar. Since the dead eyes of Kobcrl Doyner watched me in Jefferson Park, I haven't felt like I've been watched for a long time.
es_translation: Margo stands on tiptoe, with her hands on the walls of the makeshift cubicle. If she is surprised to see us, her eyes do not show it. Here is Margo Roth Spiegelman, a meter and a half away from me, with chapped lips, no makeup, dirty nails, and mute eyes. I had never seen her eyes so dead until this point, but perhaps I had never seen her eyes before. She observes me. I am sure she is observing me, not Lacey, Ben, or Radar. I hadn't felt so observed since the lifeless eyes of Robert Joyner looked at me in Jefferson Park.

en: She stands there in silence for a long time, and I am too scared of her eyes to keep walking forward. “I and this mystery here we stand,” Whitman wrote.
vi: Margo đứng yên lặng như thế một lúc lâu, tôi sợ ánh mắt cô ấy đến mức không tiến gần lại nữa. “Ta và bí ẩn này đôi bên cùng ở đây,” Whitman đã viết như vậy.
tr: Uzun süre boyunca, sessizlik içinde orada duruyor ve bakışlarından yürümeye devam edemeyecek kadar korkuyorum. “Ben ve bu gizem, işte burada duruyoruz,” diye yazıyor Whitman.
es: Se queda un buen rato en silencio, y me asustan demasiado sus ojos para acercarme a ella. «Yo y este misterio nos enfrentamos aquí», escribió Whitman.
vi_translation: Margo stood silently like that for a long time, I was so afraid of her gaze that I didn't approach any closer. "We and this mystery here we stand," Whitman had written.
tr_translation: For a long time, I stand there in silence, too scared to continue walking from their gaze. "I and this mystery, here we stand," writes Whitman.
es_translation: She remains silent for a long time, and her eyes scare me too much to approach her. "I and this mystery here we stand," wrote Whitman.

en: Finally, she says, “Give me like five minutes,” and then sits back down and resumes her writing.
vi: Rút cục, Margo nói, “Cho tớ năm phút,” rồi ngồi xuống và lại viết.
tr: Sonunda Margo konuşuyor: “Bana beş dakika falan verin.” Ve ardından tekrar oturup yazmaya kaldığı yerden devam ediyor.
es: —Dadme cinco minutos —dice por fin. Vuelve a sentarse y sigue escribiendo.
vi_translation: In the end, Margo said, "Give me five minutes," then sat down and started writing again.
tr_translation: Finally, Margo speaks: "Give me about five minutes." And then she sits back down and continues writing from where she left off.
es_translation: —Give me five minutes —he says finally. He sits down again and continues writing.

en: I watch her write. Except for being a little grimy, she looks like she has always looked. I don’t know why, but I always thought she would look different. Older. That I would barely recognize her when I finally saw her again. But there she is, and I am watching her through the Plexiglas, and she looks like Margo Roth Spiegelman, this girl I have known since I was two—this girl who was an idea that I loved.
vi: Tôi nhìn cô ấy viết. Trừ một chút lấm lem, trông cô ấy vẫn như trước. Không biết tại sao, nhưng tôi đã luôn nghĩ rằng cô ấy trông khác. Già dặn hơn. Đến mức tôi sẽ hầu như không nhận ra Margo khi rút cục được gặp lại cô ấy. Nhưng cô ấy đây, tôi đang nhìn cô ấy qua tấm nhựa mờ, cô ấy trông giống Margo Roth Spiegelman, cô bạn tôi đã biết từ khi lên hai–cô gái đã là một ý niệm mà tôi đem lòng yêu.
tr: Yazmasını izliyorum. Biraz pasaklı olması dışında, her zaman göründüğü gibi görünüyor. Neden bilmiyorum ama hep farkh görüneceğini düşündüm. Daha yaşlı olacağım. Onu nihayet tekrar gördüğümde zar zor tanıyacağımı. Ama işte orada, pleksiglasın arkasından onu izliyorum ve o, Margo Roth Spiegelman gibi görünüyor, iki yaşımdan beri tanıdığım o kız... sevdiğim bir fikir olan o kız.
es: La observo escribir. Parece la misma de siempre, excepto en que está un poco sucia. No sé por qué, pero siempre pensé que estaría diferente. Más mayor. Que apenas la reconocería cuando por fin volviera a verla. Pero aquí está, la observo a través del plexiglás, y parece Margo Roth Spiegelman, la chica a la que conozco desde que tenía dos años, la chica que era una idea que amaba.
vi_translation: I watched her write. Except for a little smudge, she looked just the same as before. I don't know why, but I had always thought she would look different. More mature. To the point where I would hardly recognize Margo when I finally met her again. But here she is, I'm looking at her through the frosted plastic, she looks like Margo Roth Spiegelman, my friend I've known since I was two—the girl who became an idea I fell in love with.
tr_translation: I'm watching her write. Aside from being a bit messy, she looks just like she always does. I don't know why, but I always thought she would look different. I would be older. That when I finally saw her again, I would barely recognize her. But there she is, I'm watching her through the plexiglass, and she looks like Margo Roth Spiegelman, the girl I've known since I was two... the girl who was an idea I loved.
es_translation: I watch her write. She seems the same as always, except that she is a little dirty. I don't know why, but I always thought she would be different. Older. That I would barely recognize her when I finally saw her again. But here she is, I watch her through the plexiglass, and she looks like Margo Roth Spiegelman, the girl I've known since I was two years old, the girl who was an idea I loved.

en: And it is only now, when she closes her notebook and places it inside a backpack next to her and then stands up and walks toward us, that I realize that the idea is not only wrong but dangerous. What a treacherous thing it is to believe that a person is more than a person.
vi: Và chỉ lúc này, khi cô ấy gập sổ lại, bỏ vào trong cái ba-lô bên cạnh và đứng dậy đi về phía chúng tôi, tôi mới nhận ra rằng ý niệm đó không chỉ sai mà còn nguy hiểm nữa. Tin rằng một con người lớn lao hơn chính họ là một ảo tưởng bất trắc biết bao.
tr: Ve ancak şimdi, deflerini kapatıp onu yanındaki sırt çantasına koyduğunda ve ayağa kalkıp bize doğru yürüdüğünde, o fikrin sadece yanlış değil, aynı zamanda tehlikeli olduğunu fark ediyorum. Bir insanın, bir insandan daha fazlası olduğuna inanmak ne kadar aldatıcı bir şey.
es: Y solo ahora, cuando cierra la libreta, la mete en una mochila que tiene a su lado, se levanta y se acerca a nosotros, me doy cuenta de que esa idea es no solo equivocada, sino también peligrosa. Qué engañoso creer que una persona es algo más que una persona.
vi_translation: And only at this moment, when she closed the notebook, put it into the backpack next to her, and stood up to walk towards us, did I realize that the notion was not only wrong but also dangerous. Believing that a person is greater than themselves is such a precarious illusion.
tr_translation: And only now, when she closes her notebook, puts it in the backpack next to her, stands up, and walks towards us, do I realize that the idea is not only wrong but also dangerous. How deceptive it is to believe that a person is more than just a person.
es_translation: And only now, when she closes the notebook, puts it in a backpack she has next to her, stands up, and approaches us, do I realize that this idea is not only wrong but also dangerous. How deceptive it is to believe that a person is anything more than just a person.

en: “Hey,” she says to Lacey, smiling. She hugs Lacey first, then shakes Ben’s hand, then Radar’s. She raises her eyebrows and says, “Hi, Q,” and then hugs me, quickly and not hard. I want to hold on. I want an event. I want to feel her heaving sobs against my chest, tears running down her dusty cheeks onto my shirt. But she just hugs me quickly and sits down on the floor. I sit down across from her, with Ben and Radar and Lacey following in a line, so that we are all facing Margo.
vi: “Ê,” Margo nói với Lacey, mỉm cười. Cô ấy ôm Lacey đầu tiên, rồi bắt tay Ben và Radar. Cô ấy nhướn lông mày, nói, “Chào Q,” rồi ôm tôi, thoáng qua và không chặt. Tôi muốn ghì chặt. Tôi muốn một dấu ấn. Tôi muốn cảm thấy cô ấy thổn thức trong lòng mình, nước mắt hoen từ gò má lem nhem bụi thấm vào áo tôi. Nhưng Margo chỉ ôm tôi chóng vánh và ngồi xuống sàn. Tôi ngồi xuống trước mặt cô ấy. Ben, Radar và Lacey cũng ngồi xuống cạnh tôi thành một hàng, để tất cả chúng tôi cùng đối diện Margo.
tr: “Hey,” diyor Lacey’ye gülümseyerek. Önce Lacey’ye sarılıyor, sonra Ben’in elini, ardından da Radar’mkini sıkıyor. Kaşlarını kaldırıp, “Selam, Q,” diyor ve sonra bana sarılıyor, çabucak ve yumuşak bir şekilde. Öyle kalmak istiyorum. Bir olay istiyorum. Göğsüme yaslanmış halde hıçkıra hıçkıra ağlasın istiyorum, gözyaşları tozlu yanaklarından tişörtüme aksın. Ama bana çabucak sarılıyor sadece ve yere oturuyor. Beni takip eden Ben, Radar ve Lacey’yle bir sıra halinde karşısına oturuyoruz, böylece hepimiz Margo’yla yüz yüze geliyoruz.
es: —Hola —le dice a Lacey sonriendo. Abraza primero a Lacey, luego le da la mano a Ben y por último a Radar. Alza las cejas y dice: —Hola, Q. Y me abraza rápidamente y sin apretar. Quiero que se quede ahí. Quiero que suceda algo. Quiero sentirla sollozar contra mi pecho, con las lágrimas resbalando por sus sucias mejillas hasta mi camiseta. Pero se limita a abrazarme rápidamente y se sienta en el suelo. Me siento frente a ella. Ben, Radar y Lacey se sientan también en línea conmigo, de modo que estamos los cuatro delante de Margo.
vi_translation: “Hey,” Margo said to Lacey, smiling. She hugged Lacey first, then shook hands with Ben and Radar. She raised an eyebrow, said, “Hi Q,” then hugged me, briefly and not tightly. I wanted to hold on tight. I wanted a mark. I wanted to feel her sobbing in my arms, tears smudging from her dusty cheeks onto my shirt. But Margo just hugged me quickly and sat down on the floor. I sat down in front of her. Ben, Radar, and Lacey also sat down next to me in a row, so that all of us were facing Margo.
tr_translation: “Hey,” he says to Lacey with a smile. First, he hugs Lacey, then shakes Ben's hand, and then Radar's. Raising his eyebrows, he says, “Hi, Q,” and then hugs me quickly and softly. I want to stay like that. I want an event. I want her to sob against my chest, her tears flowing from her dusty cheeks onto my shirt. But she only hugs me quickly and sits down on the ground. Following me, Ben, Radar, and Lacey sit in a row opposite her, so we all face Margo.
es_translation: —Hello —he says to Lacey, smiling. First, she hugs Lacey, then she shakes hands with Ben, and finally with Radar. She raises her eyebrows and says: Hello, Q. And she hugs me quickly and without squeezing. I want her to stay there. I want something to happen. I want to feel her sobbing against my chest, with tears sliding down her dirty cheeks onto my shirt. But she just hugs me quickly and sits on the floor. I sit in front of her. Ben, Radar, and Lacey also sit in a line with me, so the four of us are in front of Margo.

en: “It’s good to see you,” I say after a while, feeling like I’m breaking a silent prayer.
vi: “Thấy cậu là mừng rồi,” lát sau tôi nói, cảm thấy như mình đang phá một lời cầu nguyện yên lặng.
tr: “Seni görmek güzel,” diyorum bir süre sonra, sessiz bir duayı bozduğumu hissederek.
es: —Me alegro de verte —digo al rato con la sensación de estar rompiendo una oración silenciosa.
vi_translation: "Seeing you is a relief," I said after a while, feeling as if I were interrupting a silent prayer.
tr_translation: "It's nice to see you," I say after a while, feeling as if I have broken a silent prayer.
es_translation: —I'm glad to see you —I say after a while, feeling like I'm breaking a silent prayer.

en: She pushes her bangs to the side. She seems to be deciding exactly what to say before she says it. “I, uh. Uh. I’m rarely at a loss for words, huh? Not much talking to people lately. Um. I guess maybe we should start with, what the hell are you doing here?”
vi: Margo gạt tóc mái sang bên. Hình như cô ấy đang quyết định chính xác sẽ nói gì trước khi lên tiếng. “Tớ, ừ. Ừ. Tớ không mấy khi bị cạn kiệt từ ngữ, nhỉ? Gần đây không nói chuyện với ai mấy. Ừm. Có khi các cậu nói trước đi, mấy cậu đang làm cái quái gì ở đây?”
tr: Perçemlerini bir kenara atıyor. Söylemeden önce, tam olarak ne söyleyeceğine karar veriyormuş gibi görünüyor. “Ben, şey. Şey. Nadiren söyleyecek bir şey bulamam, değil mi? Son zamanlarda insanlarla fazla konuşmadım. Eee. Sanırım, burada ne halt ediyorsunuz sorusuyla başlamalıyız.
es: Se aparta el flequillo a un lado. Parece estar decidiendo qué decir exactamente antes de decirlo. —Yo… bueno… bueno… pocas veces me quedo sin palabras, ¿verdad? No he hablado mucho últimamente. Supongo que deberíamos empezar por: ¿qué demonios hacéis aquí?
vi_translation: Margo brushed her bangs to the side. It seemed like she was deciding exactly what to say before speaking. “I, um. Um. I'm not often at a loss for words, right? Haven't talked to anyone much lately. Hmm. Maybe you guys should go first, what the heck are you doing here?”
tr_translation: She tosses her bangs to one side. Before speaking, she seems to be deciding exactly what to say. "I, um. Um. It's rare for me to be at a loss for words, isn't it? Lately I didn't talk much with people. Umm. I guess we should start with the question, what the hell are you doing here.”
es_translation: She moves her bangs to one side. She seems to be deciding exactly what to say before saying it. —I… well… well… I rarely find myself at a loss for words, right? I haven't spoken much lately. I suppose we should start with: what the hell are you doing here?

en: “Margo,” Lacey says. “Christ, we were so worried.”
vi: “Margo ơi,” Lacey nói. “Có Chúa chứng giám, bọn tớ lo lắm.”
tr: “Margo,” diyor Lacey. ‘Tanrım, çok endişelendik.”
es: —Margo —dice Lacey—. Por Dios, estábamos muy preocupados.
vi_translation: “Margo,” Lacey said. “God knows, we were so worried.”
tr_translation: “Margo,” says Lacey. “God, we were so worried.”
es_translation: —Margo —says Lacey—. For God's sake, we were so worried.

en: “No need to worry,” Margo answers cheerfully. “I’m good.” She gives us two thumbs-up. “I am A-OK.”
vi: “Lo lắng làm gì,” Margo vui vẻ đáp. “Tớ ổn mà.” Cô ấy giơ hai ngón cái lên. “Tớ ổn loại A luôn.”
tr: “Endişelenmeye gerek yok,” diye karşılık veriyor Margo neşeyle, “iyiyim.” İki başparmağım yukarı kaldırıyor. “Her şey yolunda.” “Bizi arayıp haber verebilirdin,” diyor Ben, sesinden hayal kırıldığı okunuyor.
es: —No teníais que preocuparos —le contesta Margo alegremente—. Estoy bien. —Levanta los dos pulgares—. Estoy OK.
vi_translation: “Why worry,” Margo replied cheerfully. “I’m fine.” She gave two thumbs up. “I’m grade A fine.”
tr_translation: “No need to worry,” Margo replies cheerfully, “I’m fine.” She raises both of her thumbs up. “Everything is fine.” “You could have called and let us know,” says Ben, his voice revealing disappointment.
es_translation: —You didn't have to worry —Margo replies cheerfully—. I'm fine. —She raises both thumbs—. I'm OK.

en: “You could have called us and let us know that,” Ben says, his voice tinged with frustration. “Saved us a hell of a drive.”
vi: “Lẽ ra cậu nên gọi điện báo cho bọn tớ một tiếng,” Ben nói, giọng thoáng nhấm nhẳng cáu. “Để cả lũ đỡ phải lặn lội.”
tr: “Her şey yolunda.” “Bizi arayıp haber verebilirdin,” diyor Ben, sesinden hayal kırıldığı okunuyor. “Bizi felaket bir araba yolculuğundan kurtarırdın.”
es: —Podrías habernos llamado para decírnoslo —dice Ben con cierto tono de frustración—. Nos habríamos ahorrado un viaje que ha sido un infierno.
vi_translation: "You should have called to let us know," Ben said, his voice slightly tinged with irritation. "So that we wouldn't have to go through all this trouble."
tr_translation: “Everything is fine.” “You could have called and let us know,” says Ben, his voice revealing disappointment. “You would have saved us from a disastrous road trip.”
es_translation: —You could have called us to tell us —says Ben with a certain tone of frustration—. We would have saved ourselves a trip that has been hell.

en: “In my experience, Bloody Ben, when you leave a place, it’s best to leave. Why are you wearing a dress, by the way?”
vi: “Theo kinh nghiệm của tớ, Ben Bỉ Bựa ạ, khi rời khỏi nơi nào đó, tốt nhất cứ thế ra đi thôi. Mà sao cậu mặc váy thế này?”
tr: “Deneyimlerime göre bir yeri terk ettiğinde, terk etmek en iyisidir, Kanlı Ben. Bu arada neden elbise giyiyorsun?
es: —Según mi experiencia, Ben el Sangriento, cuando te marchas de un sitio, lo mejor es marcharte. ¿Por qué te has puesto un vestido, por cierto?
vi_translation: “In my experience, Ben Bỉ Bựa, when leaving a place, it's best to just go. But why are you wearing a dress like this?”
tr_translation: “In my experience, when you leave a place, it’s best to leave it, Bloody Ben. By the way, why are you wearing a dress?”
es_translation: —In my experience, Bloody Ben, when you leave a place, it's best to leave. Why are you wearing a dress, by the way?

en: Ben blushes. “Don’t call him that,” Lacey snaps.
vi: Ben đỏ mặt. “Đừng gọi cậu ấy thế,” Lacey cao giọng.
tr: Ben kızarıyor. “Ona böyle deme,” diye çıkışıyor Lacey.
es: Ben se ruboriza. —No lo llames así —interviene Lacey.
vi_translation: Ben blushed. "Don't call him that," Lacey raised her voice.
tr_translation: Ben is blushing. “Don’t say that to him,” Lacey scolds.
es_translation: Ben blushes. —Don't call him that —Lacey interjects.

en: Margo cuts a look at Lacey. “Oh, my God, are you hooking up with him?” Lacey says nothing. “You’re not actually hooking up with him,” Margo says.
vi: Margo quay sang nhìn Lacey. “Ôi trời ơi, cậu đang cặp cậu ta hả?” Lacey không nói gì. “Cậu không thực sự cặp cậu ta rồi,” Margo nói tiếp.
tr: Margo, Lacey’ye bir bakış atıyor. “Ah, Tannm, onunla mı takılıyorsun?” Lacey hiçbir şey söylemiyor. “Aslında onunla takılmıyorsun,” diyor Margo.
es: Margo lanza una mirada a Lacey. —Vaya, ¿te has enrollado con él? —Lacey no dice nada—. No me digas que te has enrollado con él —dice Margo.
vi_translation: Margo turned to look at Lacey. “Oh my God, are you dating him?” Lacey said nothing. “You’re not actually dating him,” Margo continued.
tr_translation: Margo gives Lacey a look. “Oh, God, are you hanging out with him?” Lacey says nothing. “Actually, you’re not hanging out with him,” Margo says.
es_translation: Margo throws a glance at Lacey. —Wow, did you hook up with him? —Lacey says nothing—. Don't tell me you hooked up with him —says Margo.

en: “Actually, yes,” Lacey says. “And actually he’s great. And actually you’re a bitch. And actually, I’m leaving. It’s nice to see you again, Margo. Thanks for terrifying me and making me feel like shit for the entire last month of my senior year, and then being a bitch when we track you down to make sure you’re okay. It’s been a real pleasure knowing you.”
vi: “Thực sự là có đấy,” Lacey nói. “Thực sự cậu ấy rất tốt. Thực sự cậu mới là đồ bựa. Và thực sự, tớ đi đây. Rất vui đã gặp cậu, Margo ạ. Cảm ơn đã làm tớ tá hỏa, làm tớ cảm thấy mình là đồ tồi trong gần hết tháng cuối cùng của năm cuối cấp, và cảm ơn đã là một ả cún bựa khi bọn tớ đi bao xa đến đây để xem cậu thế nào. Rất hân hạnh được quen biết cậu.”
tr: “Aslında takılıyorum,” diyor Lacey. “Ve aslında harika biri. Ve sen aslında bir fahişesin. Ve aslında ben gidiyorum. Seni tekrar görmek güzel, Margo. Beni dehşete düşürdüğün, okuldaki son yılımın son ayı boyunca bana kendimi bok gibi hissettirdiğin ve sonra iyi olduğundan emin olmak için peşine düştüğümüzde, bir fahişe gibi davrandığın için teşekkürler.
es: —Te lo digo —le contesta Lacey—. Y te digo que es genial. Y te digo que eres una zorra. Y te digo que me largo. Encantada de verte, Margo. Gracias por aterrorizarme y hacerme sentirme como una mierda durante todo el último mes de mi último año de instituto, y por ser una zorra cuando te buscamos por todas partes para asegurarnos de que estás bien. Ha sido un placer conocerte.
vi_translation: “There really is,” Lacey said. “He really is very nice. You're the real jerk. And really, I'm leaving. It was nice to meet you, Margo. Thanks for freaking me out, making me feel like crap for almost the entire last month of senior year, and thanks for being a bitch when we came all this way to see how you were doing. It was a pleasure knowing you.”
tr_translation: “Actually, I'm kidding,” says Lacey. “And actually, he's a great person. And actually, you're a whore. And actually, I'm leaving. It was nice to see you again, Margo. Thanks for terrifying me, making me feel like crap for the last month of my last year at school, and then acting like a whore when we chased after you to make sure you were okay. It was really a pleasure knowing you.”
es_translation: —I'm telling you —Lacey replies to her—. And I'm telling you that it's great. And I'm telling you that you're a bitch. And I'm telling you that I'm leaving. Nice to see you, Margo. Thanks for terrifying me and making me feel like shit during the whole last month of my senior year of high school, and for being a bitch when we searched everywhere to make sure you were okay. It was a pleasure meeting you.

en: “You, too. I mean, without you, how would I have ever known how fat I was?” Lacey gets up and stomps off, her footfalls vibrating through the crumbling floor. Ben follows. I look over, and Radar has stood up, too.
vi: “Cậu thì hơn gì. Không có cậu, sao tớ có thể biết rằng tớ béo đến mức nào?” Lacey đứng dậy hằm hằm đi, mỗi bước chân làm rung cả sàn nhà ọp ẹp. Ben đi theo. Tôi nhìn sang, Radar cũng đứng dậy.
tr: Seni tanımak gerçekten zevkti.” “Seni de. Yani, sen olmadan ne kadar şişman olduğumu nereden bilebilirdim ki?” Lacey kalkıp ayaklarım yere vurarak gidiyor, ayak sesleri ufalanmış döşemeyi titretiyor. Ben onu takip ediyor. O tarafa bakıyorum ve Radar da ayağa kalkmış.
es: —Para mí también. Sin ti, ¿cómo habría sabido lo gorda que estaba? Lacey se levanta y sale pisando fuerte. Sus pasos vibran en el suelo destartalado. Ben sale detrás de ella. Echo una ojeada y veo que Radar se ha levantado también.
vi_translation: “What makes you any better. Without you, how could I know just how fat I am?” Lacey stood up and stormed off, each step causing the creaky floor to shake. Ben followed her. I looked over, and Radar stood up as well.
tr_translation: “You too. I mean, how else would I have known how fat I was without you?” Lacey gets up and leaves with her steps pounding on the floor, making the worn-out flooring tremble. I follow her. I look that way and see that Radar has also stood up.
es_translation: —For me too. Without you, how would I have known how fat I was? Lacey gets up and stomps out. Her steps vibrate on the rickety floor. Ben goes out after her. I glance over and see that Radar has also stood up.

en: “I never knew you until I got to know you through your clues,” he says. “I like the clues more than I like you.”
vi: “Tớ không hề biết cậu cho đến khi tớ dần biết về cậu qua những manh mối cậu để lại,” Radar nói. “Tớ thấy thích những manh mối ấy hơn là thích cậu.”
tr: “Seni ipuçlarından tamyana kadar ashnda hiç tanımıyordum,” diyor. “İpuçlarını, seni sevdiğimden daha çok sevdim.
es: —No te conocía hasta que supe de ti por tus pistas —dice Radar—. Tus pistas me gustan más que tú.
vi_translation: "I didn't know you at all until I gradually got to know you through the clues you left behind," Radar said. "I liked those clues more than I liked you."
tr_translation: “I actually never knew you from the clues to the full extent,” he says. “I loved the clues more than I loved you.”
es_translation: —I didn't know you until I learned about you through your clues —says Radar—. I like your clues more than I like you.

en: “What the hell is he talking about?” Margo asks me. Radar doesn’t answer. He just leaves.
vi: “Cậu ta đang lảm nhảm cái quái gì vậy?” Margo hỏi tôi. Radar không đáp, nó chỉ đi khỏi.
tr: Margo, “Neden bahsediyor bu?” diye bana soruyor. Radar cevap vermiyor. Sadece gidiyor.
es: —¿De qué mierda está hablando? —me pregunta Margo. Radar no contesta. Se limita a marcharse.
vi_translation: “What the heck is he rambling about?” Margo asked me. Radar didn't respond, he just walked away.
tr_translation: Margo asks me, "What is he talking about?" Radar doesn't answer. He just leaves.
es_translation: —What the hell is he talking about? —Margo asks me. Radar doesn't respond. He just leaves.

en: I should, too, of course. They’re my friends—more than Margo, certainly. But I have questions. As Margo stands and starts to walk back toward her cubicle, I start with the obvious one. “Why are you acting like such a brat?”
vi: Tôi cũng nên đi, tất nhiên rồi. Chúng tôi là bạn–thân hơn Margo, chắc chắn vậy. Nhưng tôi có những câu hỏi. Vì Margo đứng dậy và bắt đầu quay lại góc làm việc, tôi hỏi một câu rành rành. “Sao cậu cư xử chẳng ra sao như vậy?”
tr: Ben de gitmeliyim elbette. Onlar benim arkadaşım, Margo’dan daha çok arkadaşım oldukları kesin. Ama sorularım var. Margo ayağa kalkıp odacığına doğru yürürken, en bariz olanla başlıyorum. “Niye böyle şımarık bir çocuk gibi davranıyorsun?
es: También yo debería marcharme, por supuesto. Ellos son más amigos míos que Margo, sin duda. Pero tengo preguntas que hacerle. Mientras se levanta y se dirige de nuevo a su cubículo, empiezo por la más obvia: —¿Por qué te comportas como una niña mimada?
vi_translation: I should go too, of course. We are closer friends than Margo, definitely. But I have questions. As Margo stood up and started to return to the work corner, I asked a straightforward question. “Why are you behaving so badly?”
tr_translation: Of course, I should go too. They are my friends, definitely more friends than Margo. But I have questions. As Margo stands up and walks towards her cubicle, I start with the most obvious one. "Why are you acting like such a spoiled child?"
es_translation: I should also leave, of course. They are more my friends than Margo, without a doubt. But I have questions to ask her. As she gets up and heads back to her cubicle, I start with the most obvious one: —Why are you behaving like a spoiled child?

en: She spins around and grabs a fistful of my shirt and shouts into my face, “Where do you get off showing up here without any kind of warning?!”
vi: Margo quay ngoắt lại, túm lấy ngực áo tôi và quát vào mặt tôi, “Sao không dưng các cậu kéo cả lũ đến đây mà không báo trước gì cả?
tr: Aniden dönüp eliyle tişörtümü yakalıyor ve yüzüme bağırıyor: "İliç haber vermeden böyle ortaya çıkabileceğini nereden çıkarıyorsun?
es: Se gira, me agarra por la camiseta y me grita a la cara: —¿De qué coño vas presentándote aquí sin avisar?
vi_translation: Margo suddenly turned around, grabbed my shirt collar, and shouted in my face, "Why did you all suddenly come here without any prior notice?!”
tr_translation: Suddenly, he turns around, grabs my shirt with his hand, and yells in my face: "Where do you get the idea that you can just show up like this without informing Iliç?!"
es_translation: He turns around, grabs me by the shirt, and yells in my face: —What the hell are you doing showing up here without warning?

en: “How could I have warned you when you completely dropped off the face of the planet?!” I see a long blink and know she has no response for this, so I keep going. I’m so pissed at her. For . . . for, I don’t know. Not being the Margo I had expected her to be. Not being the Margo I thought I had finally imagined correctly. “I thought for sure there was a good reason why you never got in touch with anyone after that night. And . . . this is your good reason? So you can live like a bum?”
vi: “Làm sao tớ báo được cho cậu khi cậu hoàn toàn biến mất khỏi bề mặt hành tinh này?!” Tôi thấy Margo nhắm mắt lại lâu, và tôi biết cô ấy không trả lời được, thế là tôi cứ bùng lên. Tôi cáu Margo. Vì... vì, tôi không biết nữa. Không phải Margo tôi đã mong đợi. Không phải Margo tôi nghĩ cuối cùng tôi đã tưởng tượng được đúng. “Tớ đã nghĩ chắc chắn có một lí do chính đáng tại sao cậu không liên lạc với ai sau đêm hôm đó. Và... đây là lí do chính đáng của cậu sao? Hóa ra cậu có thể lang thang sống vô gia cư thế này à
tr: “Sen âdeta yeryüzünden silinmişken sana nasıl haber verebilirdim?!” Gözlerini kırpıştırdığını görüyorum ve buna verecek cevabı olmadığını biliyorum, bu yüzden devam ediyorum. Ona çok k ızgınım. Şey için... Niçin olduğunu bilmiyorum. Olmasını beklediğim Margo olmadığı için. Nihayet doğru hayal ettiğimi sandığım Margo olmadığı için. “O geceden sonra kimseyle iletişime geçmemiş olmanın iyi bir nedeni olduğundan emindim. Ve... İyi nedenin bu muydu yani? Böylece serseri gibi yaşayabilmek için miydi?
es: —¿Cómo narices iba a avisarte si desapareciste de la faz de la Tierra? Veo que parpadea y sé que no tiene respuesta, así que sigo. Me ha decepcionado. Por… por… No sé. Por no ser la Margo que esperaba. Por no ser la Margo que pensé que por fin había imaginado correctamente. —Daba por sentado que tendrías una buena razón para no haberte puesto en contacto con nadie desde aquella noche. Pero… ¿esta es tu razón? ¿Para poder vivir como una vagabunda?
vi_translation: “How could I inform you when you completely disappeared from the surface of this planet?!” I saw Margo close her eyes for a long time, and I knew she couldn't answer, so I just burst out. I was mad at Margo. Because... because, I don't know. This wasn't the Margo I had expected. This wasn't the Margo I thought I had finally imagined correctly. “I thought there must have been a legitimate reason why you didn't contact anyone after that night. And... is this your legitimate reason? Turns out you could wander around living homeless like this?”
tr_translation: “How could I have informed you when you had practically vanished from the face of the earth?!” I see you blinking your eyes and I know you have no answer to this, so I continue. I am very angry with her. For the thing... I don't know why. Because she wasn't the Margo I expected her to be. Because she wasn't the Margo I finally thought I had imagined correctly. “I was sure there was a good reason for not having contacted anyone after that night. And... Was this your good reason? Was it so you could live like a vagabond?”
es_translation: —How on earth was I supposed to warn you if you disappeared off the face of the Earth? I see that she blinks and I know she has no answer, so I continue. She has disappointed me. For… for… I don't know. For not being the Margo I expected. For not being the Margo I thought I had finally imagined correctly. —I assumed you had a good reason for not getting in touch with anyone since that night. But… is this your reason? To be able to live like a vagabond?

en: She lets go of my shirt and pushes away from me. “Now who’s being a brat? I left the only way you can leave. You pull your life off all at once—like a Band-Aid. And then you get to be you and Lace gets to be Lace and everybody gets to be everybody and I get to be me.”
vi: Margo thả tay và đẩy tôi ra. “Giờ ai vô gia cư chứ? Tớ ra đi theo cách duy nhất người ta có thể ra đi. Bóc tuột cuộc đời mình ra ngay một lúc–như băng cứu thương ấy. Rồi cậu trở thành cậu, Lacey trở thành Lacey, ai đó trở thành ai đó và tớ trở thành tớ.
tr: Tişörtümü bırakıp bir kenara itiyor. “Şimdi şımank olan kim? Terk edilebilecek tek yolla terk ettim. Hayatım bir anda çeker atarsın... yara bandı gibi. Ancak ondan sonra, sen sen olursun, I ,ace Lace olur, herkes kendi olur ve ben de ben olurum.
es: Me suelta la camiseta y se aleja de mí. —¿Y ahora quién está siendo un niño mimado? Me marché de la única manera que puede uno marcharse. Arrancas tu vida de golpe, como una tirita. Y entonces tú eres tú, y Lace es Lace, y cada quien es quien es, y yo soy yo.
vi_translation: Margo let go and pushed me away. “Now who's homeless? I left in the only way one can leave. Ripping my life off all at once–like a band-aid. Then you become you, Lacey becomes Lacey, someone becomes someone, and I become me.”
tr_translation: He leaves my t-shirt and pushes it aside. "Now who is the spoiled one? I left in the only way I could be left. You pull and throw away my life in an instant... like a band-aid. But after that, you become you, I become Lace, everyone becomes themselves, and I become myself."
es_translation: He lets go of my shirt and moves away from me. —And now who is being a spoiled child? I left in the only way one can leave. You rip your life off suddenly, like a band-aid. And then you are you, and Lace is Lace, and everyone is who they are, and I am me.

en: “Except I didn’t get to be me, Margo, because I thought you were dead. For the longest time. So I had to do all kinds of crap that I would never do.”
vi: “Ngoại trừ tớ đã không là tớ, Margo ạ, vì tớ tưởng cậu đã chết. Trong khoảng thời gian lâu nhất. Nên tớ đã phải làm tất cả những chuyện tồi tệ hại mà lẽ ra tớ không bao giờ làm.”
tr: “Yalnız ben ben olamıyorum, Margo, çünkü öldüğünü sandım. Çok uzun süre boyunca. Bu yüzden asla yapmayacağım saçmalıklar yapmak zorunda kaldım.
es: —Pero yo no pude ser yo, Margo, porque pensé que estabas muerta. Casi todo el tiempo. Así que tuve que hacer todo tipo de mierdas que jamás habría hecho.
vi_translation: “Except I wasn't myself, Margo, because I thought you were dead. For the longest time. So I had to do all those terrible things that I would never have done otherwise.”
tr_translation: “I just can't be myself, Margo, because I thought you were dead. For a very long time. That's why I had to do things I would never normally do.”
es_translation: —But I couldn't be myself, Margo, because I thought you were dead. Almost all the time. So I had to do all kinds of shit I would never have done.

en: She screams at me now, pulling herself up by my shirt so she can get in my face. “Oh, bullshit. You didn’t come here to make sure I was okay. You came here because you wanted to save poor little Margo from her troubled little self, so that I would be oh-so-thankful to my knight in shining armor that I would strip my clothes off and beg you to ravage my body.”
vi: Margo hét lên, sát lại gần để có thể nhìn thẳng vào tôi. “Đừng nói nhảm. Cậu không đến đây để đảm bảo rằng tớ bình an vô sự. Cậu đến vì cậu muốn cứu Margo bé bỏng tội nghiệp khỏi cái tôi bé bỏng rắc rối của cô ta, để rồi tớ sẽ ôi-quá-cảm-động trước chàng hiệp sĩ oai phong lẫm liệt mà tự lột sạch xống áo rồi cầu xin cậu hãy hủy hoại tấm thân tớ chứ gì.”
tr: Şimdi bana doğru çığlık atıyor, yüzüme ulaşabilmek için tişörtümden tutarak parmaklarının üstünde yükseliyor. “Ah, saçmalama. Buraya benim iyi olduğumdan emin olmak için gelmedin. Buraya geldin çünkü zavallı küçük Margo’yu, sorunlu küçük benliğinden kurtarmak istedin, böylece parlak zırhlı şövalyeme o kadar minnettar olacaktım ki kıyafetlerimi sıyırıp vücudumu kasıp kavurman için sana yalvaracaktım.
es: Ahora me grita y me coge de la camisa para colocarse cara a cara. —Tonterías. No has venido para asegurarte de que estoy bien. Has venido porque querías salvar a la pobrecita Margo de su naturaleza problemática para que estuviera tan agradecida a mi caballero de brillante armadura que me quitara la ropa y te suplicara que me hicieras tuya.
vi_translation: Margo screamed, moving closer so she could look me straight in the eye. "Don't talk nonsense. You didn't come here to make sure I'm safe and sound. You came because you want to save poor little Margo from her little troubled self, so that I would be oh-so-moved by the gallant knight and strip off my clothes and beg you to ruin my body, right."
tr_translation: Now she is screaming at me, rising on her toes by grabbing my shirt to reach my face. “Oh, don't be ridiculous. You didn't come here to make sure I was okay. You came here because you wanted to save poor little Margo from her troubled little self, so that I would be so grateful to my knight in shining armor that I would strip off my clothes and beg you to ravage my body.”
es_translation: Now he yells at me and grabs me by the shirt to get face to face. —Nonsense. You didn't come to make sure I was okay. You came because you wanted to save poor little Margo from her problematic nature so that she would be so grateful to her knight in shining armor that she would take off her clothes and beg you to make her yours.

en: “Bullshit!” I shout, which it mostly is. “You were just playing with us, weren’t you? You just wanted to make sure that even after you left to go have your fun, you were still the axis we spun around.”
vi: “Nói vớ vẩn gì vậy!” tôi quát, gần như vậy. “Cậu chỉ chơi bọn tớ thôi đúng không? Cậu chỉ muốn đảm bảo rằng dù đã ra đi và có trò vui mới, nhưng cậu sẽ vẫn là cái trục để bọn tớ xoay mòng mòng xung quanh.
tr: “Saçmalama!” diye bağırıyorum çünkü genel olarak saçmalıyor. “Sadece bizimle oynuyordun, değil mi? Eğlenmek için çekip gittikten sonra bile, hâlâ etrafında döndüğümüz eksen olduğundan emin olmak istedin.
es: —¡Gilipolleces! —grito, y en buena medida lo son—. Solo estabas jugando con nosotros, ¿verdad? Solo querías asegurarte de que incluso después de marcharte a divertirte por ahí, todo seguía girando a tu alrededor.
vi_translation: “What nonsense are you talking about!” I shouted, almost like that. “You’re just playing us, right? You just want to make sure that even though you’ve left and have new fun, you will still be the axis around which we revolve.”
tr_translation: “Stop talking nonsense!” I shout because, generally, he is talking nonsense. “You were just playing with us, weren't you? Even after you left to have fun, you wanted to make sure you were still the axis around which we revolved.”
es_translation: —Nonsense! —I shout, and to a large extent, they are—. You were just playing with us, weren't you? You just wanted to make sure that even after you left to have fun elsewhere, everything still revolved around you.

en: She’s screaming back, louder than I thought possible. “You’re not even pissed at me, Q! You’re pissed at this idea of me you keep inside your brain from when we were little!”
vi: Margo hét trả, to hơn tôi nghĩ cô ấy có thể hét được. “Cậu thậm chí còn chẳng thèm nổi cáu với tớ, Q! Cậu chỉ cáu vì những tưởng tượng về tớ mà cậu giữ rịt trong đầu từ hồi bé thôi!”
tr: Karşılık olarak, mümkün olduğunu düşündüğümden daha yüksek sesle çığlık atıyor. “Bana kızgın bile değilsin, Q! Küçüklüğümüzden beri kafanın içinde tuttuğun bana dair fikre kızgınsın!
es: Y ella me grita también, más alto de lo que habría creído posible. —¡Ni siquiera te he decepcionado yo, Q! ¡Te ha decepcionado la idea de mí que te metiste en la cabeza desde que éramos niños!
vi_translation: Margo screamed back, louder than I thought she could scream. “You don't even bother to get mad at me, Q! You're just mad because of the fantasies about me that you've been holding onto since childhood!”
tr_translation: In response, she screams louder than I thought possible. "You're not even mad at me, Q! You're mad at the idea of me that you've kept in your head since we were kids!"
es_translation: And she yells at me too, louder than I would have thought possible. —I haven't even disappointed you, Q! It's the idea of me that you got into your head since we were kids that has disappointed you!

en: She tries to turn away from me, but I grab her shoulders and hold her in front of me and say, “Did you ever even think about what your leaving meant? About Ruthie? About me or Lacey or any of the other people who cared about you? No. Of course you didn’t. Because if it doesn’t happen to you, it doesn’t happen at all. Isn’t that it, Margo? Isn’t it?”
vi: Cô ấy cố gắng chạy khỏi tôi, nhưng tôi giữ lấy hai vai Margo, xoay cô ấy đứng trước mặt mình và nói, “Đã bao giờ cậu nghĩ sự ra đi của cậu có tác động thế nào chưa? Đến Ruthie? Đến Lacey hoặc tớ hoặc bất cứ ai khác quan tâm đến cậu? Cậu không nghĩ gì cả. Tất nhiên là cậu không nghĩ gì rồi. Bởi cậu mà không bị sao tức là chẳng có gì đáng bận tâm cả. Phải thế không, Margo? Phải không?”
tr: Benden başka tarafa dönmeye çalışıyor ama omuzlarını yakalayıp onu önümde tutuyorum. “Gidişinin ne anlama geldiğini hiç düşündün mü? Ruthie için? Benim için, Lacey için ya da seni önemseyen diğer insanlar için? Hayır. Tabii ki düşünmedin. Çünkü eğer bir şey senin başına gelmiyorsa aslında hiç olmuyordu. Böyle, değil mi Margo? Değil mi?
es: Intenta girarse, pero la agarro por los hombros y la sujeto frente a mí. —¿Has pensado alguna vez lo que significaba marcharte? ¿Has pensado en Ruthie? ¿En mí, en Lacey o en cualquiera de las personas a las que les importabas? No. Claro que no. Porque si no te pasa a ti, no le pasa a nadie. ¿Verdad, Margo? ¿Verdad?
vi_translation: She tried to run away from me, but I grabbed Margo by the shoulders, turned her to face me, and said, "Have you ever thought about how your departure might affect others? Ruthie? Lacey or me or anyone else who cares about you? You haven't thought at all. Of course, you haven't thought about it. Because if you're okay, then nothing else matters. Isn't that right, Margo? Isn't it?"
tr_translation: She tries to turn away from me, but I grab her shoulders and hold her in front of me. “Have you ever thought about what your leaving means? For Ruthie? For me, for Lacey, or for the other people who care about you? No. Of course you haven't. Because if something doesn't happen to you, it doesn't really happen at all. Isn't that right, Margo? Isn't it?”
es_translation: She tries to turn around, but I grab her by the shoulders and hold her in front of me. —Have you ever thought about what it meant to leave? Have you thought about Ruthie? About me, Lacey, or any of the people who cared about you? No. Of course not. Because if it doesn't happen to you, it doesn't happen to anyone. Right, Margo? Right?

en: She doesn’t fight me now. She just slumps her shoulders, turns, and walks back to her office. She kicks down both of the Plexiglas walls, and they clamor against the desk and chair before sliding onto the ground. “SHUT UP SHUT UP YOU ASSHOLE.”
vi: Bây giờ cô ấy không kháng cự nữa. Margo chỉ so vai quay đi, trở lại góc làm việc. Cô ấy đá đổ cả hai tấm nhựa cứng dựng làm tường, chúng va mạnh vào bàn và ghế rồi trượt xuống sàn. “IM ĐI IM ĐI ĐỒ TỒI.”
tr: Artık benimle mücadele etmiyor. Sadece omuzlarını düşürüyor, dönüyor ve tekrar ofisine yürüyor. Pleksiglas duvarların ikisini de tekmeleyip düşürüyor, yere kaymadan önce sıraya ve sandalyeye çarpıp gürültü çıkarıyorlar. “KAPA ÇENENİ KAPA ÇENENİ GÖT HERİF.
es: Ya no se enfrenta a mí. Se suelta, se gira y vuelve a su despacho. Pega una patada a las paredes de plexiglás, que resuenan contra el escritorio y la silla antes de caer al suelo. —CÁLLATE CÁLLATE IMBÉCIL.
vi_translation: Now she doesn't resist anymore. Margo just shrugged and turned away, going back to her workspace. She kicked down both hard plastic panels used as walls, which hit the table and chairs hard before sliding to the floor. "SHUT UP SHUT UP YOU JERK."
tr_translation: He no longer fights with me. He just drops his shoulders, turns around, and walks back to his office. They kick and knock down the two Plexiglas walls, making noise as they hit the row and chair before sliding to the ground. "SHUT UP SHUT UP YOU ASSHOLE."
es_translation: He no longer confronts me. He lets go, turns around, and goes back to his office. He kicks the plexiglass walls, which resonate against the desk and chair before falling to the floor. —SHUT UP SHUT UP IDIOT.

en: “Okay,” I say. Something about Margo completely losing her temper allows me to regain mine. I try to talk like my mom. “I’ll shut up. We’re both upset. Lots of, uh, unresolved issues on my side.”
vi: “Được,” tôi nói. Điều gì đó trong cơn bột phát hoàn toàn mất kiểm soát cảm xúc của Margo đã khiến tôi ghìm được bản thân lại. Tôi cố gắng nói như mẹ tôi. “Tớ sẽ im lặng. Cả hai đứa mình đều không vui. Còn rất nhiều, ừ, vướng mắc chưa gỡ được từ phía tớ.
tr: “Tamam,” diyorum. Margo’nun sabrım tamamen kaybetmesiyle ilgili bir şey, kendiminkini geri kazanmamı sağhyor. Annem gibi konuşmayı deniyorum. “Çenemi kapatacağım, ikimiz de altüst olmuş durumdayız. Benim açımdan bir sürü, şey, çözülmemiş sorun var.
es: —Muy bien —le contesto. El hecho de que Margo pierda totalmente los papeles hace que yo recupere los míos. Intento hablar como mi madre. —Me callo. Estamos los dos enfadados. Por mi parte… hay muchas cosas sin resolver.
vi_translation: "Okay," I said. Something in the completely uncontrolled emotional outburst of Margo made me hold myself back. I tried to speak like my mother. "I will be silent. Neither of us is happy. There are still many, um, unresolved issues from my side."
tr_translation: “Okay,” I say. Something about Margo completely losing her patience helps me regain mine. I try to talk like my mom. “I will shut up, we are both in a mess. From my perspective, there are a lot of unresolved issues.”
es_translation: —Very well —I answered him. The fact that Margo completely loses her composure makes me regain mine. I try to speak like my mother. —I remain silent. We are both angry. As for me... there are many unresolved issues.

en: She sits down in the desk chair, her feet on what had been the wall of her office. She’s looking into a corner of the barn. At least ten feet between us. “How the hell did you even find me?”
vi: Margo ngồi xuống chiếc ghế xoay, bàn chân đặt trên cái từng là tường ngăn góc làm việc. Cô ấy nhìn một góc nhà kho. Chúng tôi cách nhau ít nhất ba mét. “Thế quái nào các cậu tìm được tớ vậy?”
tr: Sandalyeye tekrar oturuyor, ayakları önceden ofisinin duvarı olan malzemenin üzerinde. Ahırın bir köşesini inceliyor. Aramızda en az üç metre var. “Beni nasıl buldun ki?
es: Se sienta en la silla, con los pies apoyados en lo que había sido la pared de su despacho. Mira hacia un rincón del granero. Nos separan al menos tres metros. —¿Cómo demonios me habéis encontrado?
vi_translation: Margo sat down on the swivel chair, her feet placed on what used to be the partition wall of the workspace. She looked at a corner of the warehouse. We were at least three meters apart. "How the hell did you guys find me?"
tr_translation: He sits back down on the chair, his feet on the material that used to be the wall of his office. He examines a corner of the barn. There are at least three meters between us. "How did you find me?"
es_translation: He sits in the chair, with his feet resting on what had been the wall of his office. He looks towards a corner of the barn. At least three meters separate us. —How the hell did you find me?

en: “I thought you wanted us to,” I answer. My voice is so small I’m surprised she even hears me, but she spins the chair to glare at me.
vi: “Tớ tưởng cậu muốn bọn tớ đi tìm,” tôi đáp, nói rất nhỏ nhưng ngạc nhiên là Margo vẫn nghe thấy. Cô ấy xoay ghế lại và chăm chú nhìn tôi.
tr: “Öyle yapmamızı istediğini sandım,” diye cevapladım. Sesim o kadar kısık ki, beni duymasına bile şaşırıyorum ama bana dik dik bakmak için sandalyeyi çeviriyor.
es: —Pensé que querías que te encontráramos —le contesto. Hablo en voz tan baja que me sorprende que me oiga, pero gira la silla para mirarme.
vi_translation: “I thought you wanted us to find you,” I replied, speaking very softly but surprisingly Margo still heard. She turned her chair around and looked at me intently.
tr_translation: “I thought you wanted us to do it that way,” I replied. My voice is so low that I'm surprised he even hears me, but he turns his chair to glare at me.
es_translation: —I thought you wanted us to find you —I answered. I speak in such a low voice that I'm surprised she hears me, but she turns the chair to look at me.

en: “I sure as shit did not.”
vi: “Chắc chắn là tớ đâu có muốn như vậy.”
tr: “İstemediğimden adım gibi eminim.
es: —Puedo jurarte que no.
vi_translation: “Surely, I didn't want that.”
tr_translation: “I am as sure as my name that I don't want it.”
es_translation: —I can swear to you that no.

en: “‘Song of Myself,’” I say. “Guthrie took me to Whitman. Whitman took me to the door. The door took me to the mini-mall. We figured out how to read the painted-over graffiti. I didn’t understand ‘paper towns’; it can also mean subdivisions that never got built, and so I thought you had gone to one and were never coming back. I thought you were dead in one of these places, that you had killed yourself and wanted me to find you for whatever reason. So I went to a bunch of them, looking for you. But then I matched the map in the gift shop to the thumbtack holes. I started reading the poem more closely, figured out you weren’t running probably, just holed up, planning. Writing in that notebook. I found Agloe from the map, saw your comment on the talk page of Omnictionary, skipped graduation, and drove here.”
vi: “‘Tự khúc,’” tôi nói. “Guthrie dẫn tớ đến Whitman. Whitman dẫn tớ đến cánh cửa. Cánh cửa dẫn tớ đến khu mua sắm mini. Bọn tớ phát hiện ra cách đọc hàng chữ graffiti đã bị sơn đè lên. Tớ không hiểu ‘những thành phố giấy’ nghĩa là gì; cũng có thể là những tiểu khu không bao giờ được xây xong, thế là tớ nghĩ rằng cậu đã đến một khu như vậy và sẽ không bao giờ quay lại. Tớ tưởng cậu đã chết ở một trong những nơi như thế, rằng cậu đã tự vẫn và vì lí do nào đó muốn tớ tìm thấy cậu. Tớ đã đến cả đống nơi như vậy, tìm cậu. Nhưng rồi tớ khớp được tấm bản đồ trong cửa hàng lưu niệm với những lỗ ghim trên tường. Tớ bắt đầu đọc bài thơ kĩ hơn, hiểu ra rằng có lẽ cậu không chạy trốn mà chỉ đang lánh ở đâu đó, lập nên các kế hoạch. Viết vào cuốn sổ đó. Tớ tìm ra Agloe trên bản đồ, đọc được bình luận của cậu trên phụ trang thảo luận trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ, tớ bỏ dự lễ tốt nghiệp và lái xe thẳng đến đây.”
tr: “Kendi Şarkım,” diyorum. “Guthrie, beni Whitman’a götürdü. Whitman, beni kapıya götürdü. Kapı, beni alışveriş merkezine götürdü. Üstü boyanmış duvar yazısını nasıl okuyacağımızı çözdük. ‘Kâğıttan kentler’ olayını anlamadım; hiç inşa edilememiş semtler anlamına da gelebiliyor, bu yüzden onlardan birine gidip asla geri dönmeyeceğini düşündüm. Bu yerlerden birinde öldüğünü, kendini öldürdüğünü ve her ne sebeple olursa olsun seni bulmamı istediğini sandım. Böylece seni arayarak birkaç tanesine gittim. Ama sonra, hediye dükkânındaki haritayla raptiye deliklerini karşılaştırdım. Şiiri daha dikkatli okumaya başladım, muhtemelen kaçmadığını anladım, sadece plan yaparak köşene çekilmiştin. O deftere bir şeyler yazarak. Haritadan Agloe’yu buldum, Omnictionary’nin konuşma sayfasındaki yorumunu gördüm, mezuniyeti astım ve arabayla buraya geldim.
es: —El «Canto de mí mismo» —le digo—. Guthrie me llevó a Whitman. Whitman me llevó a la puerta. La puerta me llevó al centro comercial abandonado. Descubrimos cómo leer la pintada oculta. No entendía lo de «ciudades de papel», porque también significa urbanizaciones que no se han llegado a construir, así que pensé que habías ido a una de esas urbanizaciones y que nunca volverías. Pensé que estabas muerta en uno de esos sitios, que te habías matado y por alguna razón querías que yo te encontrara. Así que fui a un montón de urbanizaciones a buscarte. Pero luego encajé el mapa de la tienda de souvenirs con los agujeros de chincheta. Empecé a leer el poema con más atención y pensé que probablemente no ibas de un lado a otro, que te habías encerrado a planificar. A escribir en esa libreta. Encontré Agloe en el mapa, vi tu comentario en la página del Omnictionary, me salté la graduación y vine en coche hasta aquí.
vi_translation: “‘Song of Myself,’” I said. “Guthrie led me to Whitman. Whitman led me to the door. The door led me to the mini-mall. We discovered how to read the graffiti that had been painted over. I didn’t understand what ‘paper towns’ meant; it could be unfinished subdivisions, so I thought you had gone to such a place and would never come back. I thought you had died in one of those places, that you had committed suicide and for some reason wanted me to find you. I went to a bunch of places like that, looking for you. But then I matched the map from the souvenir shop with the pinholes on the wall. I started reading the poem more closely, realizing that maybe you weren’t running away but just hiding somewhere, making plans. Writing in that notebook. I found Agloe on the map, read your comment on the discussion page in the Omnictionary, I skipped graduation and drove straight here.”
tr_translation: “My Own Song,” I say. “Guthrie took me to Whitman. Whitman took me to the door. The door took me to the shopping mall. We figured out how to read the overpainted graffiti. I didn’t understand the ‘paper towns’ thing; it can also mean neighborhoods that were never built, so I thought you went to one of them and never came back. I thought you died in one of these places, killed yourself, and for whatever reason, wanted me to find you. So I went to a few of them looking for you. But then, I compared the pinholes on the map from the gift shop. I started reading the poem more carefully, probably you didn’t run away I understand, you had withdrawn to your corner just by making plans. By writing something in that notebook. I found Agloe on the map, saw your comment on the talk page of Omnictionary, skipped graduation, and drove here.”
es_translation: —The "Song of Myself" —I tell her—. Guthrie led me to Whitman. Whitman led me to the door. The door led me to the abandoned mall. We discovered how to read the hidden graffiti. I didn't understand the "paper towns" thing, because it also means subdivisions that were never built, so I thought you had gone to one of those subdivisions and that you would never come back. I thought you were dead in one of those places, that you had killed yourself and for some reason wanted me to find you. So I went to a bunch of subdivisions to look for you. But then I matched the souvenir shop map with the pinholes. I started reading the poem more carefully and thought that you probably weren't going from place to place, that you had locked yourself up to plan. To write in that notebook. I found Agloe on the map, saw your comment on the Omnictionary page, skipped graduation, and drove here.

en: She brushes her hair down, but it isn’t long enough to fall over her face anymore. “I hate this haircut,” she says. “I wanted to look different, but—it looks ridiculous.”
vi: Margo cào cào tóc xuống, nhưng mái tóc không còn đủ dài để che kín gương mặt cô ấy nữa. “Ghét kiểu tóc này quá,” Margo nói. “Tớ chỉ muốn trông khác đi, nhưng– hóa ra ngố quá.”
tr: Saçını aşağı doğru tarıyor fakat artık yüzüne düşecek kadar uzun değil. “Bu saç kesiminden nefret ediyorum,” diyor. “Farklı görünmek istedim ama... gülünç görünüyor.
es: Se pasa una mano por el pelo, pero ya no es lo bastante largo para que le caiga en la cara. —Odio este corte de pelo —me dice—. Quería cambiar de imagen, pero… es ridículo.
vi_translation: Margo brushed her hair down, but it was no longer long enough to cover her face. "I hate this hairstyle," Margo said. "I just wanted to look different, but– it turned out so silly."
tr_translation: She combs her hair down, but it's no longer long enough to fall over her face. "I hate this haircut," she says. "I wanted to look different, but... it looks ridiculous."
es_translation: He runs a hand through his hair, but it's no longer long enough to fall into his face. —I hate this haircut —he tells me—. I wanted to change my look, but… it's ridiculous.

en: “I like it,” I say. “It frames your face nicely.”
vi: “Tớ thích kiểu này,” tôi nói. “Tóc ôm lấy mặt cậu trông rất hợp.”
tr: “Benim hoşuma gitti,” diyorum. “Yüzünü hoş bir biçimde çevreliyor.
es: —A mí me gusta —le digo—. Te enmarca muy bien la cara.
vi_translation: "I like this style," I said. "The way your hair frames your face looks really good."
tr_translation: “I liked it,” I say. “It frames your face nicely.”
es_translation: —I like it —I tell her—. It frames your face very well.

en: “I’m sorry I was being so bitchy,” she says. “You just have to understand—I mean, you guys walk in here out of nowhere and you scare the shit out of me—”
vi: “Tớ xin lỗi vì đã làm nhặng lên chẳng ra sao cả,” cô ấy nói. “Cậu phải hiểu là–không dưng các cậu mò vào đây, làm tớ sợ cứng luôn–”
tr: “Üzgünüm çok şirret davranıyordum,” diyor. “Ama şunu anlaman lazım... Yani, siz böyle aniden içeri giriyorsunuz ve ödümü koparıyorsunuz ve...
es: —Siento haber sido tan zorra —me dice—. Tienes que entenderlo… Bueno, aparecéis por aquí de la nada y me acojonáis…
vi_translation: “I'm sorry for making such a fuss over nothing,” she said. “You have to understand that–suddenly you all came in here, it scared me stiff–”
tr_translation: “I'm sorry, I was being very shrewish,” she says. “But you need to understand this... I mean, you come in so suddenly and scare me to death and...”
es_translation: —I'm sorry for being such a bitch —she tells me—. You have to understand… Well, you guys show up out of nowhere and scare the hell out of me…

en: “You could have just said, like, ‘Guys, you are scaring the shit out of me,’” I said.
vi: “Lẽ ra cậu chỉ cần nói là, ‘Này, các bồ làm tôi sợ cứng lại luôn rồi đấy’ thôi.” tôi nói.
tr: “Sadece şöyle diyebilirdin: '(. 'ocuklar, ödiiınü koparıyorsunuz.
es: —Podrías haberte limitado a decir: «Chicos, me estáis acojonando» —le digo.
vi_translation: “You should have just said, ‘Hey, you guys scared me stiff.’”
tr_translation: “You could have just said: '(. 'Kids, you're scaring me to death.”’
es_translation: —You could have just said: "Guys, you're freaking me out" —I tell him.

en: She scoffs. “Yeah, right, ’cause that’s the Margo Roth Spiegelman everybody knows and loves.” Margo is quiet for a moment, and then says, “I knew I shouldn’t have said that on Omnictionary. I just thought it would be funny for them to find it later. I thought the cops might trace it somehow, but not soon enough. There’s like a billion pages on Omnictionary or whatever. I never thought . . .”
vi: “Lẽ ra cậu chỉ cần nói là, ‘Này, các bồ làm tôi sợ cứng lại luôn rồi đấy’ thôi.” tôi nói. Margo cười nhạt. “Ừ, phải rồi, vì đó là Margo Roth Spiegelman mà ai cũng biết và yêu mến mà.” Cô ấy im lặng một lúc, rồi nói tiếp, “Tớ biết mình không nên nói như vậy trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ. Tớ chỉ nghĩ sau này có ai đọc được thì vui phải biết. Tớ nghĩ có thể cảnh sát sẽ lần theo manh mối đó, nhưng không được sớm sủa cho lắm. Có hàng tỉ trang trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ cơ mà. Tớ chưa bao giờ nghĩ...”
tr: Dudağını büküyor. “Evet, doğru, çi'mkii luı herkesin tanıdığı ve sevdiği Margo Roth Spiegelman.” M argo bir anlığına sessiz kalıyor ve sonra devam ediyor: “(hmıicl. ıonnrv’de otıu söylememem gerektiğini biliyordum. Daha sonra bulduklarında eğlenceli olacağını düşündüm o kadar. Polislerin bir şekilde izini sürebileceğini düşündüm ama yeterince çabuk değil. Omnictionary’de bir milyar sayfa falan var. Aklıma hiç gelmedi...
es: Se burla. —Sí, claro, porque esa es la Margo Roth Spiegelman que todo el mundo conoce y a la que todo el mundo quiere. —Se queda un momento callada y luego dice—: Sabía que no debía haber escrito eso en el Omnictionary. Solo pensé que sería divertido que lo encontraran después. Pensé que la poli llegaría a encontrarme, pero no a tiempo. El Omnictionary tiene mil millones de páginas. Nunca pensé…
vi_translation: I said. Margo gave a faint smile. “Yeah, right, because that's the Margo Roth Spiegelman everyone knows and loves.” She was silent for a moment, then continued, “I know I shouldn't say things like that in the Omnictionary. I just thought if someone reads it later, it would be really funny. I think the police might follow that clue, but not very soon. There are billions of pages in the Omnictionary after all. I never thought...”
tr_translation: She purses her lips. “Yes, right, because everyone knows and loves Margo Roth Spiegelman.” Margo stays silent for a moment and then continues: “(hmıicl. I knew I shouldn't have said it in Omnictionary. I just thought it would be fun when they found it later. I thought the police might somehow track it, but not quickly enough. There are like a billion pages on Omnictionary. It never occurred to me...”
es_translation: He mocks. —Yes, of course, because that is the Margo Roth Spiegelman that everyone knows and everyone loves. —She stays silent for a moment and then says—: I knew I shouldn't have written that in the Omnictionary. I just thought it would be fun for them to find it later. I thought the police would find me, but not in time. The Omnictionary has a billion pages. I never thought…

en: “What?”
vi: “Gì cơ?”
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —What?

en: “I thought about you a lot, to answer your question. And Ruthie. And my parents. Of course, okay? Maybe I am the most horribly self-centered person in the history of the world. But God, do you think I would have done it if I didn’t need to?” She shakes her head. Now, finally, she leans toward me, elbows on knees, and we are talking. At a distance, but still. “I couldn’t figure out any other way that I could leave without getting dragged back.”
vi: “Tớ đã nghĩ nhiều đến cậu, trả lời cho câu hỏi của cậu đây. Và nghĩ đến Ruthie. Và bố mẹ tớ. Tất nhiên, nhỉ? Có lẽ tớ là đứa độc tôn trầm trọng nhất trong lịch sử nhân loại. Nhưng Chúa ơi, cậu có nghĩ tớ sẽ làm thế nếu tớ không cần làm thế không?” Margo lắc đầu. Giờ, cuối cùng, cô ấy quay hẳn về phía tôi, khuỷu tay chống trên đầu gối, và chúng tôi nói chuyện. Còn cách xa, nhưng vẫn là đang nói chuyện với nhau. “Tớ không tìm được cách nào khác để ra đi mà không bị lôi trở lại.”
tr: “Soruna cevap vermek gerekirse, seni çok düşündüm. Ve Ruthie’yi. Ve ebeveynlerimi. Tabii ki düşündüm, tamam mı? Belki de dünya tarihindeki en korkunç derecede bencil insanım. Ama sence ihtiyacım olmasaydı bunu yapar mıydım?” Başını sallıyor. Şimdi, nihayet, bana doğru eğiliyor, dirsekleri dizlerinde ve konuşuyoruz. Belli bir mesafeden konuşuyoruz ama olsun. “Geri sürüklenmeden terk edebileceğim başka bir yol düşünemedim.
es: —He pensado mucho en ti, si eso responde a tu pregunta. Y en Ruthie. Y en mis padres. Por supuesto, ¿vale? Quizá soy la persona más tremendamente egocéntrica de la historia del mundo. Pero ¿crees que lo habría hecho si no lo hubiera necesitado? —Mueve la cabeza. Se inclina por fin hacia mí, con los codos en las rodillas, y hablamos. A cierta distancia, pero da igual—. No se me ocurría otra manera de marcharme sin que me arrastraran de vuelta.
vi_translation: “I’ve thought a lot about you, here’s the answer to your question. And thought about Ruthie. And my parents. Of course, right? Maybe I’m the most severely solitary person in human history. But God, do you think I would do this if I didn’t have to?” Margo shook her head. Now, finally, she turned fully towards me, elbows resting on her knees, and we talked. Still far apart, but still talking to each other. “I couldn’t find any other way to leave without being pulled back.”
tr_translation: “To answer the question, I thought about you a lot. And Ruthie. And my parents. Of course I thought about it, okay? Maybe I'm the most horribly selfish person in world history. But do you think I would have done this if I didn't need to?” He nods his head. Now, finally, he leans towards me, elbows on his knees, and we are talking. We are talking from a certain distance, but that's okay. “I couldn't think of another way to leave without being dragged back.”
es_translation: —I have thought about you a lot, if that answers your question. And about Ruthie. And about my parents. Of course, okay? Maybe I am the most tremendously egocentric person in the history of the world. But do you think I would have done it if I didn't need to? —He shakes his head. He finally leans towards me, with his elbows on his knees, and we talk. At a certain distance, but it doesn't matter—. I couldn't think of any other way to leave without being dragged back.

en: “I’m happy you’re not dead,” I say to her.
vi: “Tớ mừng vì cậu không chết,” tôi nói với Margo.
tr: “Ölmediğine sevindim,” diyorum.
es: —Me alegro de que no estés muerta —le digo.
vi_translation: “I'm glad you didn't die,” I said to Margo.
tr_translation: "I'm glad you're not dead," I say.
es_translation: —I'm glad you're not dead —I tell her.

en: “Yeah. Me, too,” she says. She smirks, and it’s the first time I’ve seen that smile I have spent so much time missing. “That’s why I had to leave. As much as life can suck, it always beats the alternative.”
vi: “Ừ, tớ cũng vậy,” cô ấy đáp, khẽ nhếch mép. Đó là lần đầu tiên tôi thấy nét cười mà tôi đã mất quá nhiều thời gian nhung nhớ. “Đó là lí do tại sao tớ phải đi.
tr: “Evet. Ben de,” diyor. Sırıtıyor ve bu, özleyerek çok uzun zaman geçirdiğim o gülüşü ilk görüşüm. “Terk etmek zorunda kalmamın nedeni bu. Hayat ne kadar berbat olursa olsun, alternatifinden her zaman daha iyi.
es: —Sí, yo también —me contesta. Sonríe, y es la primera vez que veo esa sonrisa que tanto he echado de menos—. Por eso tuve que marcharme. Por jodida que sea la vida, siempre es mejor que la muerte.
vi_translation: “Yeah, me too,” she replied, with a slight smirk. It was the first time I saw the smile that I had longed for so long. “That's why I have to go. No matter how miserable life gets, there are always other choices.”
tr_translation: "Yes." "Me too," he says. He grins, and this is the first time I've seen that smile which I've missed for so long. "Having to leave that's the reason. No matter how miserable life is, it is always better than the alternative.”
es_translation: —Yes, me too —he replies to me. He smiles, and it is the first time I see that smile that I have missed so much—. That's why I had to leave. No matter how fucked up life is, it's always better than death.

en: My phone rings. It’s Ben. I answer it.
vi: Cuộc đời thê thảm đến đâu thì vẫn luôn có lựa chọn khác mà.” Điện thoại của tôi đổ chuông. Là Ben. Tôi nhấc máy.
tr: Telefonum çalıyor. Arayan Ben. Cevap veriyorum.
es: Suena mi móvil. Es Ben. Contesto.
vi_translation: My phone rang. It was Ben. I picked up.
tr_translation: My phone is ringing. It's me calling. I'm answering.
es_translation: My phone rings. It's Ben. I answer.

en: “Lacey wants to talk to Margo,” he tells me.
vi: “Lacey muốn nói chuyện với Margo,” Ben nói với tôi.
tr: “Lacey, Margo’yla konuşmak istiyor,” diyor bana.
es: —Lacey quiere hablar con Margo —me dice.
vi_translation: “Lacey wants to talk to Margo,” Ben told me.
tr_translation: "Lacey, Margo wants to talk to you," he says to me.
es_translation: —Lacey wants to talk to Margo —he tells me.

en: I walk over to Margo, hand her the phone, and linger there as she sits with her shoulders hunched, listening. I can hear the noises coming through the phone, and then I hear Margo cut her off and say, “Listen, I’m really sorry. I was just so scared.” And then silence. Lacey starts talking again finally, and Margo laughs, and says something. I feel like they should have some privacy, so I do some exploring. Against the same wall as the office, but in the opposite corner of the barn, Margo has set up a kind of bed—four forklift pallets beneath an orange air mattress. Her small, neatly folded collection of clothes sits next to the bed on a pallet of its own. There’s a toothbrush and toothpaste, along with a large plastic cup from Subway. Those items sit atop two books: The Bell Jar by Sylvia Plath and Slaughterhouse-Five by Kurt Vonnegut. I can’t believe she’s been living like this, this irreconcilable mix of tidy suburbanality and creepy decay. But then again, I can’t believe how much time I wasted believing she was living any other way.
vi: Tôi đi tới bên Margo, đưa cô ấy cái điện thoại, và còn nấn ná đứng cạnh trong khi cô ấy ngồi nhô vai về phía trước, tôi lắng nghe. Tôi nghe thấy những tiếng động vọng từ điện thoại ra, rồi tôi nghe thấy Margo cắt lời và nói, “Nghe này, tớ thực sự xin lỗi. Tớ sợ quá đấy thôi.” Và rồi im lặng. Cuối cùng Lacey nói trở lại, và Margo cười thành tiếng, nói gì đó đáp lại. Nghĩ là cả hai cần chút gì đó riêng tư, tôi bắt đầu loanh quanh khám phá. Dựa vào cùng bức tường như góc làm việc, nhưng ở góc đối diện của nhà kho, Margo đã sắp đặt cái có thể gọi là giường ngủ–bốn tấm giát dưới một đệm không khí màu da cam. Chồng quần áo nhỏ, gấp gọn gàng của Margo ở cạnh giường, cũng trên một tấm giát. Có bàn chải và thuốc đánh răng, với một cái cốc nhựa to từ cửa hàng Subway. Những đồ dùng đó ở trên hai cuốn sách: Lọ Chuông của Sylvia Plath và Lò sát sinh số năm của Kurt Vonnegut. Tôi không thể tin được rằng Margo đã sống như thế này, sự pha trộn không thể dung hòa được này giữa nét ngoại ô ngăn nắp đáng mến và vẻ suy tàn tiều tụy rờn rợn. Nhưng rồi một lần nữa, tôi không thể tin được rằng mình đã mất bao nhiêu thời gian nghĩ cô ấy đang sống rất khác.
tr: Margo’nun yanma gidip telefonu ona uzatıyorum ve o kamburlaşmış omuzlarıyla otururken, dinleyerek orada oyalanıyorum. Telefondan gelen sesleri duyabiliyorum ve sonra Margo’nun sözünü kesip şöyle dediğini duyuyorum: “Bak, gerçekten üzgünüm. Sadece çok korkmuştum.” Ardından sessizlik oluyor. Sonunda Lacey tekrar konuşmaya başlıyor, Margo gülüyor ve bir şeyler söylüyor. Biraz mahremiyetleri olması gerekiyormuş gibi hissettiğimden biraz etrafa göz gezdiriyorum. Ofisle aym duvarın karşısına, ahırın karşı köşesine Margo bir tür yatak kurmuş... Turuncu şişme yatağın altında dört tane ayaklı palet var. Küçük, muntazam bir şekilde katlanmış kıyafetleri başka bir paletin üzerinde, yatağın yanında duruyor. Bir diş fırçası ve diş macunu var, Subway’den alınmış plastik bardakla beraber. Bu eşyalar, iki kitabın üstünde duruyor: Sylvia Plath’m Sırça Fanus’u ve Kurt Vonnegut’un Mezbaha No. Si. Tertipli kendilik ile tüyler ürpertici çürümüşlüğün bu bağdaşmayan karışımında yaşadığına inanamıyorum. Ama öte yandan başka türlü yaşadığına inanarak ne kadar zaman harcadığıma da inanamıyorum.
es: Me acerco a Margo, le paso el teléfono y me quedo ahí mientras ella escucha con los hombros encorvados. Oigo los ruidos procedentes del teléfono, y entonces oigo a Margo interrumpiendo a Lacey. —Oye —le dice—, lo siento mucho. Solo estaba muy asustada. Y silencio. Lacey empieza a hablar de nuevo, y al final Margo se ríe y dice algo. Siento que deberían tener cierta privacidad, así que voy a echar un vistazo. Contra la pared del despacho, pero en la esquina opuesta del granero, Margo ha montado una especie de cama: cuatro palés con una colchoneta hinchable encima. Su reducida colección de ropa, perfectamente doblada, está en otro palé, al lado de la cama. Hay un cepillo y pasta de dientes, además de una taza grande de plástico. Estas cosas están encima de dos libros: La campana de cristal, de Sylvia Plath, y Matadero cinco, de Kurt Vonnegut. Me cuesta creer que haya estado viviendo así, con esta irreconciliable mezcla de pulcra zona residencial y espeluznante deterioro. Y también me cuesta creer el tiempo que he perdido creyendo que estaba viviendo de cualquier otra manera.
vi_translation: I walked over to Margo, handed her the phone, and lingered by her side while she sat hunched forward, listening. I heard noises coming from the phone, then I heard Margo interrupt and say, "Listen, I'm really sorry. I was just scared." And then silence. Finally, Lacey spoke again, and Margo laughed out loud, saying something in response. Thinking they needed some privacy, I started wandering around exploring. Leaning against the same wall as the workspace, but in the opposite corner of the warehouse, Margo had set up what could be called a bed—four slats beneath an orange air mattress. Margo's small, neatly folded stack of clothes was next to the bed, also on a slat. There was a toothbrush and toothpaste, with a large plastic cup from Subway. These items were on top of two books: Sylvia Plath's The Bell Jar and Kurt Vonnegut's Slaughterhouse-Five. I couldn't believe that Margo had been living like this, this irreconcilable mix of charming suburban neatness and eerie dilapidation. But then again, I couldn't believe how much time I had spent thinking she was living so differently.
tr_translation: I go over to Margo and hand her the phone, and while she sits with her hunched shoulders, I linger there, listening. I can hear the voices coming from the phone and then I hear Margo interrupting and saying, “Look, I’m really sorry. I was just so scared.” Then there is silence. Eventually, Lacey starts talking again, Margo laughs and says something. Feeling like they should have some privacy, I glance around a bit. Against the opposite wall from the office, in the far corner of the barn, Margo has set up some sort of bed... There are four-legged pallets under the orange inflatable mattress. Her small, neatly folded clothes are on another pallet next to the bed. There is a toothbrush and toothpaste, along with a plastic cup from Subway. These items are on top of two books: Sylvia Plath's The Bell Jar and Kurt Vonnegut's Slaughterhouse-Five. Five. I can't believe she lives in this incongruous mix of orderly self and creepy decay. But on the other hand, I can't believe how much time I've spent believing she lived any other way.
es_translation: I approach Margo, hand her the phone, and stay there while she listens with hunched shoulders. I hear the noises coming from the phone, and then I hear Margo interrupting Lacey. —Hey —she says to him—, I'm really sorry. I was just very scared. And silence. Lacey starts talking again, and in the end, Margo laughs and says something. I feel they should have some privacy, so I'm going to take a look. Against the office wall, but in the opposite corner of the barn, Margo has set up some kind of bed: four pallets with an inflatable mattress on top.
