vi_translation: “That graffiti,” I said. “Oh my God, Margo, I went to so many abandoned subdivisions like that to find your body. I really thought–I really thought you were dead.”
tr_translation: "Graffiti," I say. "God, Margo, I wandered through many of those abandoned neighborhoods looking for your body. I really... really thought you were dead."
es_translation: —The spray-painted one —I told her—. For God's sake, Margo, I've searched through many abandoned subdivisions looking for your body. I really thought… I really thought you were dead.

en: She gets up and searches around her backpack for a moment, and then reaches over and grabs The Bell Jar, and reads to me.
vi: Margo đứng dậy, tìm trong ba-lô một lát rồi với ra lấy cuốn Lọ chuông, và đọc to cho tôi nghe.
tr: Ayağa kalkıp kısa bir süre sırt çantasını karıştırıyor, sonra uzanıp Sırça Fanus’u alıyor ve okuyor.
es: Se levanta, rebusca un momento en su mochila, saca La campana de cristal y me lee.
vi_translation: Margo stood up, searched in her backpack for a moment, then reached out to grab the book "The Bell Jar," and read aloud to me.
tr_translation: She stands up and rummages through her backpack for a short while, then lies down, takes The Bell Jar, and starts reading.
es_translation: He gets up, rummages in his backpack for a moment, takes out The Bell Jar, and reads to me.

en: “‘But when it came right down to it, the skin of my wrist looked so white and defenseless that I couldn’t do it. It was as if what I wanted to kill wasn’t in that skin or the thin blue pulse that jumped under my thumb, but somewhere else, deeper, more secret, and a whole lot harder to get at.’” She sits back down next to me, close, facing me, the fabric of our jeans touching without our knees actually touching. Margo says, “I know what she’s talking about. The something deeper and more secret. It’s like cracks inside of you. Like there are these fault lines where things don’t meet up right.”
vi: “‘Nhưng đến giờ phút quyết định ấy, da trên cổ tay tôi sao mà trắng và không chút kháng cự đến thế, tôi chẳng thể nào làm được nữa. Hình như những gì tôi muốn giết chết không phải trong làn da ấy, hay mạch máu xanh mảnh đập dưới ngón tay tôi, mà ở đâu đó khác, sâu hơn, bí mật hơn, và vô cùng khó chạm đến hơn.’” Margo ngồi lại xuống bên tôi, gần, quay mặt nhìn tôi, vải quần jeans của chúng tôi chạm nhau nhưng hai đầu gối không hề chạm. Margo nói, “Tớ hiểu bà ấy muốn nói gì. Cái đâu đó khác sâu hơn và bí mật hơn ấy. Nó giống như những vết nứt bên trong cậu. Giống như có những đường bị lỗi nơi mọi thứ không khớp vào nhau được.”
tr: “‘Ama iş tam o noktaya geldiğinde bileğimin derisi o kadar beyaz ve korunmasız göründü ki yapamadım. Sanki öldürmek istediğim şey o deride ya da başparmağımın altında atan zayıf, mavi nabızda değil de başka bir yerdeydi, daha derin, daha gizli ve ulaşması çok daha zor olan başka bir yerde. ”’ Tekrar yanıma oturuyor, yakınıma, karşıma, dizlerimiz gerçekten birbirine değmeden, kot pantolonlarımızın kumaşı birbirine değiyor. Konuşuyor: “Onun neden bahsettiğini anhyorum. Daha derin ve gizli olan şeyin ne olduğunu, içindeki çatlaklar gibi. Sanki bir şeylerin doğru düzgün birleşmediği şu fay hatlarından varmış gibi.
es: —«Pero cuando llegó el momento de hacerlo, la piel de mi muñeca parecía tan blanca e indefensa que no pude. Era como si lo que yo quería matar no estuviera en esa piel, ni en el ligero pulso azul que saltaba bajo mi pulgar, sino en alguna parte más profunda, más secreta y mucho más difícil de alcanzar». Vuelve a sentarse a mi lado, muy cerca, frente a mí. La tela de nuestros vaqueros se toca sin que nuestras rodillas lleguen a rozarse. —Sé de lo que habla —dice Margo—. Ese algo más profundo y más secreto. Son como grietas dentro de ti. Como líneas defectuosas en las que las cosas no encajan bien.
vi_translation: “‘But at that decisive moment, the skin on my wrist was so white and unresisting, I couldn't do it anymore. It seemed that what I wanted to kill was not in that skin, or in the thin blue vein pulsing under my finger, but somewhere else, deeper, more secretive, and infinitely harder to reach.’” Margo sat back down next to me, close, facing me, our jeans touching but our knees not. Margo said, “I understand what she meant. That somewhere else deeper and more secretive. It's like the cracks inside you. Like there are flawed lines where things don't fit together.”
tr_translation: "'But when it came right down to it, the skin of my wrist looked so white and defenseless that I couldn't do it. It was as if what I wanted to kill wasn't in that skin or the faint, blue pulse beating under my thumb, but somewhere else, deeper, more secret, and much harder to reach. somewhere else.”’ He sits down next to me again, close to me, across from me, without our knees actually touching, the fabric of our jeans touching. He speaks: “I understand what he's talking about. What the deeper and more secret thing is, like the cracks inside. As if there are these fault lines where things don't quite come together properly.”
es_translation: —"But when the moment came to do it, the skin on my wrist seemed so white and defenseless that I couldn't. It was as if what I wanted to kill wasn't in that skin, nor in the faint blue pulse that throbbed under my thumb, but somewhere deeper, more secret, and much harder to reach." Sit back down next to me, very close, facing me. The fabric of our jeans touches without our knees actually brushing against each other. —I know what you're talking about —says Margo—. That deeper and more secret something. They are like cracks inside you. Like faulty lines where things don't fit well.

en: “I like that,” I say. “Or it’s like cracks in the hull of a ship.”
vi: “Tớ thấy hay đấy,” tôi nói. “Hoặc như những vết nứt trên vỏ tàu.”
tr: “Bunu sevdim,” diyorum. “Ya da bir geminin gövdesindeki çatlaklar gibi.
es: —Me gusta —le digo—. O como grietas en el casco de un barco.
vi_translation: "I think it's good," I said. "Or like the cracks on the ship's hull."
tr_translation: “I like this,” I say. “Or like the cracks on the hull of a ship.”
es_translation: —I like it —I tell him—. Or like cracks in the hull of a ship.

en: “Right, right.”
vi: “Phải, phải.”
tr: “Doğru, doğru.
es: —Sí, sí.
vi_translation: "Yes, yes."
tr_translation: “Right, right.”
es_translation: —Yes, yes.

en: “Brings you down eventually.”
vi: “Kiểu gì cũng sẽ kéo cậu chìm xuống.
tr: “Eninde sonunda seni aşağı çekiyor.
es: —Al final te hundes.
vi_translation: “It will drag you down no matter what.”
tr_translation: "In the end, it drags you down."
es_translation: —In the end, you sink.

en: “Exactly,” she says. We’re talking back and forth so fast now.
vi: “Chính xác,” Margo thốt lên. Chúng tôi nói qua nói lại khá nhanh.
tr: “Kesinlikle,” diyor. Şimdi çok hızlı bir şekilde konuşuyoruz.
es: —Exacto —me dice. Ahora estamos dialogando.
vi_translation: "Exactly," Margo exclaimed. We talked back and forth quite quickly.
tr_translation: “Absolutely,” he says. Now we are talking very quickly.
es_translation: —Exactly —he tells me. Now we are having a conversation.

en: “I can’t believe you didn’t want me to find you.”
vi: “Không thể tin được là cậu không muốn tớ đi tìm cậu.”
tr: “Seni bulmamı istemediğine inanamıyorum.
es: —No puedo creerme que no quisieras que te encontrara.
vi_translation: "I can't believe you don't want me to come looking for you."
tr_translation: “I can't believe you don't want me to find you.”
es_translation: —I can't believe you didn't want me to find you.

en: “Sorry. If it makes you feel any better, I’m impressed. Also, it’s nice to have you here. You’re a good traveling companion.”
vi: “Xin lỗi mà. Nếu nói ra mà có chút tác dụng thì tớ hơi bị ấn tượng đấy. Mà có cậu ở đây vui thật. Cậu là một bạn đồng hành tuyệt vời.”
tr: “Üzgünüm. Eğer daha iyi hissetmeni sağlayacaksa, etkilendim. Ayrıca burada olman güzel. İyi bir seyahat arkadaşısın.
es: —Perdona. Si vas a sentirte mejor, estoy impresionada. Además, está bien tenerte aquí. Eres un buen compañero de viaje.
vi_translation: “I'm sorry.” “If saying it had any effect, I would be quite impressed.” “But it's really fun having you here.” “You are a wonderful companion.”
tr_translation: “I'm sorry. If it will make you feel better, I am impressed. Also, it's nice to have you here. You are a good travel companion.”
es_translation: —Sorry. If it will make you feel better, I'm impressed. Besides, it's nice to have you here. You are a good travel companion.

en: “Is that a proposal?” I ask.
vi: “Đó là một lời mời phải không?” tôi hỏi.
tr: “Bu bir teklif mi?” diye soruyorum.
es: —¿Es una propuesta? —le pregunto.
vi_translation: “Is that an invitation?” I asked.
tr_translation: "Is this an offer?" I ask.
es_translation: —Is that a proposal? —I ask him.

en: “Maybe.” She smiles.
vi: “Chắc thế.” Cô ấy cười.
tr: “Belki.” Gülümsüyor.
es: —Puede ser —me contesta sonriendo.
vi_translation: “I guess so.” She smiled.
tr_translation: "Maybe." She smiles.
es_translation: —It could be —he replies to me, smiling.

en: My heart has been fluttering around my chest for so long now that this variety of intoxication almost seems sustainable—but only almost. “Margo, if you just come home for the summer— my parents said you can live with us, or you can get a job and an apartment for the summer, and then school will start, and you’ll never have to live with your parents again.”
vi: Con tim tôi nhảy nhót liên hồi trong lồng ngực vì trạng thái say này như cứ kéo dài mãi–nhưng chỉ gần như thôi. “Margo ơi, nếu mùa hè này cậu đến nhà tớ ở–bố mẹ tớ đã nói rằng cậu có thể ở với cả nhà tớ, hoặc cậu có thể kiếm việc làm và thuê một căn hộ trong mùa hè, rồi học kì đại học sẽ bắt đầu, và cậu sẽ không bao giờ phải sống với bố mẹ cậu nữa.”
tr: Kalbim göğsümün içinde o kadar uzun zamandır pır pır ediyor ki bu sarhoşluk seviyesi neredeyse sürdürülebilecek bir şeymiş gibi geliyor... neredeyse. “Margo, yazın eve gelirsen... Annemle babam bizimle yaşayabileceğini söyledi ya da yaz boyunca bir iş ve bir daire bulabilirsin, sonra okul başlayacak ve bir daha asla ebeveynlerinle yaşamak zorunda kalmayacaksın.
es: El corazón lleva tanto tiempo dándome vueltas en el pecho que esta especie de borrachera me parece casi soportable, pero solo casi. —Margo, si vuelves a casa a pasar el verano… mis padres han dicho que puedes vivir con nosotros, o puedes buscar trabajo y un apartamento para el verano, y luego empezarán las clases y no tendrás que volver a vivir con tus padres.
vi_translation: My heart was dancing incessantly in my chest because this state of intoxication seemed to last forever–but only almost. “Margo, if you come to stay at my house this summer–my parents have said that you can stay with my family, or you can get a job and rent an apartment for the summer, then the college semester will start, and you will never have to live with your parents again.”
tr_translation: My heart has been fluttering inside my chest for so long that this level of intoxication almost feels like something that could be sustained... almost. "Margo, if you come home in the summer... My mom and dad said you could live with us, or you could find a job and an apartment for the summer, then school will start and you'll never have to live with your parents again."
es_translation: My heart has been spinning in my chest for so long that this kind of dizziness seems almost bearable, but only almost. —Margo, if you come back home for the summer… my parents have said that you can live with us, or you can look for a job and an apartment for the summer, and then classes will start and you won't have to live with your parents again.

en: “It’s not just them. I’d get sucked right back in,” she says, “and I’d never get out. It’s not just the gossip and the parties and all that crap, but the whole allure of a life rightly lived—college and job and husband and babies and all that bullshit.”
vi: “Không phải chỉ họ. Tớ thấy oải từ bên trong,” Margo đáp, “và tớ chưa bao giờ thoát ra. Không phải chỉ là những chuyện tầm phào, tiệc tùng và tất cả những thứ nhạt nhẽo nhảm nhí khác, mà là toàn bộ ánh hào quang của một cuộc đời được sống đúng–đại học, việc làm, chồng, con, và tất cả các thể loại hão huyền ấy.”
tr: “Sorun sadece onlar değil. Hemen aynı duruma geri dönerim,” diyor, “ve bundan asla kurtulamam. Sorun sadece dedikodu, partiler ve bütün o saçmalıklar değil, doğru şekilde yaşanacak bir hayatın tüm o cazibesi... yani üniversite, iş, koca, bebekler ve tüm o saçmalıklar.
es: —No es solo por ellos. Volvería a quedarme atrapada y nunca saldría de allí. No son solo los cotilleos, las fiestas y toda esa mierda, sino la perspectiva de vivir la vida como hay que vivirla: universidad, trabajo, marido, hijos y todas esas gilipolleces.
vi_translation: “It's not just them. I feel weary from the inside,” Margo replied, “and I have never escaped it. It's not just the trivial matters, parties, and all the other dull nonsense, but the entire aura of a life lived correctly—college, job, husband, children, and all those kinds of illusions.”
tr_translation: “The problem is not just them. I immediately return to the same situation,” he says, “and I can never escape from it. The problem is not just gossip, parties, and all that nonsense, but all the allure of a life lived the right way... that is, university, job, husband, babies, and all that nonsense.”
es_translation: —It's not just because of them. I would get trapped again and never get out of there. It's not just the gossip, the parties, and all that crap, but the prospect of living life the way it should be lived: university, job, husband, kids, and all that bullshit.

en: The thing is that I do believe in college, and jobs, and maybe even babies one day. I believe in the future. Maybe it’s a character flaw, but for me it is a congenital one. “But college expands your opportunities,” I say finally. “It doesn’t limit them.”
vi: Vấn đề là tôi có tin vào đại học, việc làm, và có thể một ngày nào đó là con cái. Tôi tin ở tương lai. Có lẽ đó là một khiếm khuyết trong tính cách, nhưng với tôi điều đó là bẩm sinh. “Nhưng đi học đại học cậu sẽ có nhiều cơ hội hơn,” cuối cùng tôi nói, “Đại học không làm giảm các khả năng đâu.”
tr: Olay şu ki ben üniversiteye, işlere ve belki bir gün bebeklere bile inanıyorum. Geleceğe inanıyorum. Belki bu bir kişilik bozukluğu ama benim için doğuştan gelen bir şey. “Ama üniversite imkânlarım genişletir,” diyorum sonunda. “Sınırlamaz.
es: El problema es que yo sí creo en la universidad, en el trabajo y quizá en los hijos algún día. Creo en el futuro. Quizá es una tara de mi carácter, pero en mi caso es congénita. —Pero la universidad te amplía las oportunidades —le digo por fin—. No te las limita.
vi_translation: The issue is whether I believe in college, jobs, and perhaps one day, children. I believe in the future. Maybe it's a flaw in my character, but for me, it's innate. "But going to college will give you more opportunities," I finally said, "College doesn't reduce possibilities."
tr_translation: The thing is, I believe in university, jobs, and maybe even babies one day. I believe in the future. Maybe this is a personality disorder, but for me, it's something innate. "But university expands my opportunities," I say finally. "It doesn't limit them."
es_translation: The problem is that I do believe in the university, in work, and maybe in having children someday. I believe in the future. Maybe it's a flaw in my character, but in my case, it's congenital. —But the university broadens your opportunities —I finally tell him—. It doesn't limit them.

en: She smirks. “Thank you, College Counselor Jacobsen,” she says, and then changes the subject. “I kept thinking about you inside the Osprey. Whether you would get used to it. Stop worrying about the rats.”
vi: Margo cười nửa miệng. “Cảm ơn Chuyên Gia Tư Vấn Đại Học Jacobsen,” cô ấy nói, rồi thay đổi chủ đề. “Tớ thường nghĩ đến cậu khi ở trong Osprey. Dù cậu có quen với nó hay không chăng nữa. Đừng lo lắng về bọn chuột.
tr: Sırıtıyor. “Teşekkürler, Rehberlik Hocası Jacobsen,” diyor ve sonra konuyu değiştiriyor. “Osprey’de seni düşünüp durdum. Buraya alışıp alışamayacağını. Fareler yüzünden endişelenmeyi bırakıp bırakamayacağını.
es: Sonríe con suficiencia. —Gracias, orientador universitario Jacobsen —me dice, y cambia de tema—. Pensaba mucho en ti metido en el Osprey. En si te acostumbrarías. En si dejarías de preocuparte por las ratas.
vi_translation: Margo smirked. “Thank you, College Counseling Expert Jacobsen,” she said, then changed the subject. “I often think of you when I'm in Osprey. Whether you're familiar with it or not. Don't worry about the rats.”
tr_translation: Smiling. "Thank you, Guidance Counselor Jacobsen," he says and then changes the subject. "I kept thinking about you in Osprey. Whether you would get used to this place. Whether you would stop worrying about the mice."
es_translation: Smiles with smugness. —Thank you, university advisor Jacobsen —he says to me, and changes the subject—. I thought about you a lot while inside the Osprey. About whether you would get used to it. About whether you would stop worrying about the rats.

en: “I did,” I say. “I started to like it there. I spent prom night there, actually.”
vi: “Tớ quen đấy,” tôi đáp. “Tớ bắt đầu thích chỗ đấy. Thực ra cả đêm dạ tiệc tốt nghiệp tớ đã ở đó.”
tr: “Alıştım,” diyorum. “Orayı sevmeye başladım. Balo gecesini orada geçirdim aslında.
es: —Así fue —le contesto—. Empezó a gustarme. La verdad es que pasé allí la noche del baile.
vi_translation: “I'm familiar with it,” I replied. “I'm starting to like that place. In fact, I spent the entire prom night there.”
tr_translation: “I'm used to it,” I say. “I started to like it there. Actually, I spent the prom night there.”
es_translation: —That's how it was —I answered—. I started to like it. The truth is that I spent the night of the dance there.

en: She smiles. “Awesome. I imagined you would like it eventually.
vi: Cô ấy cười. “Tuyệt. Tớ từng hình dung rồi cậu sẽ thích chỗ đó cho coi.
tr: Gülümsüyor. “Müthiş. Eninde sonunda seveceğini hayal etmiştim.
es: Sonríe. —Increíble. Me imaginaba que al final te gustaría.
vi_translation: She laughed. "Great." "I had a feeling you would like that place."
tr_translation: Smiling. “Amazing. I had imagined that you would eventually love it.
es_translation: Smile. —Incredible. I imagined that in the end you would like it.

en: It never got boring in the Osprey, but that was because I had to go home at some point. When I got here, I did get bored. There’s nothing to do; I’ve read so much since I got here. I got more and more nervous here, too, not knowing anybody. And I kept waiting for that loneliness and nervousness to make me want to go back. But it never did. It’s the one thing I can’t do, Q.”
vi: Chưa bao giờ thấy chán khi ở Osprey, nhưng đó là do sớm muộn gì tớ cũng phải về nhà. Khi ở đây, tớ cũng chán lắm. Chẳng có gì để làm, tớ đã đọc rất nhiều từ khi đến đây. Càng ở tớ cũng càng thấy căng thẳng, chẳng quen biết ai cả. Tớ cứ cố chờ cho sự cô đơn và căng thẳng đó đưa tớ về nhà. Nhưng điều đó không xảy ra. Có một điều tớ không thể làm được, Q ạ.”
tr: Osprey’de benim için hiç sıkıcı olmadı ama bu, bir noktada eve gitmek zorunda olduğum içindi. Buraya geldiğimde sıkıldım. Yapacak hiçbir şey yok; buraya geldiğimden beri çok şey okudum. Ayrıca burada gitgide daha fazla tedirgin bir hale geldim, kimseyi tanımadığım için. Ve o yalnızlık ile tedirginliğin geri dönmek istememe neden olmasını bekleyip durdum. Ama hiç olmadı. Bu yapamayacağım tek şey, Q.
es: Nunca me aburría en el Osprey, pero era porque en algún momento tenía que volver a casa. Cuando llegué aquí sí que me aburría. No hay nada que hacer. He leído mucho desde que llegué. No conocer a nadie me ponía cada vez más nerviosa. Y esperaba que esa soledad y ese nerviosismo me hicieran volver atrás. Pero no ha sido así. Es lo único que no puedo hacer, Q.
vi_translation: "I've never gotten bored at Osprey, but that's because sooner or later I always have to go home." "When I'm here, I get really bored too." "There's nothing to do, I've read a lot since I got here." "The longer I stay, the more tense I feel, I don't know anyone." "I keep waiting for the loneliness and tension to take me home." "But that doesn't happen." "There's one thing I can't do, Q."
tr_translation: It was never boring for me in Osprey, but that was because I had to go home at some point. I got bored when I came here. There is nothing to do; I have read a lot since I came here. Also, I became increasingly anxious here because I didn't know anyone. And I kept waiting for that loneliness and anxiety to make me want to go back. But it never happened. This is the one thing I can't do, Q.”
es_translation: I was never bored on the Osprey, but it was because at some point I had to go back home. When I got here, I was indeed bored. There is nothing to do. I have read a lot since I arrived. Not knowing anyone made me more and more nervous. And I hoped that this loneliness and nervousness would make me go back. But it hasn't been like that. It's the only thing I can't do, Q.

en: I nod. I understand this. I imagine it is hard to go back once you’ve felt the continents in your palm. But I still try one more time. “But what about after the summer? What about college? What about the rest of your life?”
vi: Tôi gật đầu. Tôi hiểu điều đó. Tôi tưởng tượng được khó có thể quay trở lại một khi đã cảm thấy những lục địa trong lòng bàn tay. Nhưng tôi vẫn cố thêm chút nữa. “Thế qua mùa hè thì sao? Còn trường đại học? Còn phần còn lại của cuộc đời cậu nữa?”
tr: Başımla onayhyorum. Bunu anlıyorum. Bir kez kıtalan avucunuzda hissettiğinizde geri dönmenin zor olduğunu hayal edebiliyorum. Ama yine de bir kez daha deniyorum. “Ama yazdan sonra ne olacak? Üniversite ne olacak? Hayatının geri kalanı ne olacak?
es: Asiento. Lo entiendo. Imagino que es duro volver atrás cuando las palmas de tu mano abarcan continentes. Pero lo intento una vez más. —¿Y qué pasará después del verano? ¿Qué pasará con la universidad? ¿Qué pasará con el resto de tu vida?
vi_translation: I nodded. I understood that. I could imagine how hard it would be to return once you have felt the continents in the palm of your hand. But I still tried a little more. "What about the summer then? What about college? What about the rest of your life?"
tr_translation: I nod my head in agreement. I understand this. I can imagine that once you feel the continent in the palm of your hand, it is hard to go back. But still, I try once more. “But what will happen after summer? What will happen to university? What will happen to the rest of your life?”
es_translation: Seat. I understand it. I imagine it's hard to go back when the palms of your hands encompass continents. But I try once more. —And what will happen after the summer? What will happen with the university? What will happen with the rest of your life?

en: She shrugged. “What about it?”
vi: Margo nhún vai. “Những điều đó thì sao?”
tr: Omuzlarım silkiyor. “Ne olmuş?
es: ¿Qué pasará con el resto de tu vida? Se encoge de hombros. —¿Qué pasará?
vi_translation: Margo shrugged. “What about those things?”
tr_translation: My shoulders shrug. “What happened?”
es_translation: He shrugs. —What will happen?

en: “Aren’t you worried about, like, forever?”
vi: “Cậu không lo lắng về, gì nhỉ, mãi mãi sao?”
tr: “Şey, sonsuza dek konusunda endişeli değil misin?
es: —¿No te preocupa el futuro?
vi_translation: “Aren't you worried about, um, forever?”
tr_translation: “Well, aren't you worried about forever?’
es_translation: —Aren't you worried about the future?

en: “Forever is composed of nows,” she says. I have nothing to say to that; I am just chewing through it when Margo says, “Emily Dickinson. Like I said, I’m doing a lot of reading.”
vi: “Mãi mãi là hợp âm của những hiện tại,” Margo đáp. Tôi không biết nói gì, chỉ cố gắng nuốt trôi khi Margo nói, “Emily Dickinson đấy. Tớ bảo rồi mà, tớ đã đọc rất nhiều.
tr: “Sonsuza dek şimdilerden oluşur,” diyor. Buna verebilecek bir karşılığım yok; Margo tekrar konuştuğunda hâlâ önceki söylediğinin üstüne kafa yoruyorum: “Emily Dickinson. Söylediğim gibi çok şey okuyorum.
es: —El futuro está formado por ahoras —me contesta. No tengo nada que decir. Estoy dándole vueltas cuando Margo dice: —Emily Dickinson. Como te he dicho, estoy leyendo mucho.
vi_translation: “Forever is the harmony of the present,” Margo replied. I didn't know what to say, just tried to swallow as Margo said, “That's Emily Dickinson. I told you, I read a lot.”
tr_translation: “Forever is composed of nows,” she says. I have no response to that; when Margo speaks again, I am still pondering her previous statement: “Emily Dickinson. As I said, I read a lot.”
es_translation: "The future is made up of nows," he replies to me. I have nothing to say. I'm mulling it over when Margo says: —Emily Dickinson. As I told you, I am reading a lot.

en: I think the future deserves our faith. But it is hard to argue with Emily Dickinson. Margo stands up, slings her backpack over one shoulder, and reaches her hand down for me. “Let’s take a walk.” As we’re walking outside, Margo asks for my phone. She punches in a number, and I start to walk away to let her talk, but she grabs my forearm and keeps me with her. So I walk beside her out into the field as she talks to her parents.
vi: Tôi nghĩ tương lai xứng đáng có được niềm tin của chúng ta. Nhưng khó có thể tranh luận được với Emily Dickinson. Margo đứng dậy, khoác ba-lô lên vai và chìa tay xuống cho tôi. “Mình đi dạo đi.” Ra đến bên ngoài, Margo hỏi mượn điện thoại của tôi. Cô ấy bấm số, tôi chực đi để cô ấy nói chuyện cho tự nhiên, nhưng Margo đã kéo tay giữ tôi lại. Thế nên tôi đi bộ cùng Margo ra cánh đồng trong khi cô ấy nói chuyện với bố mẹ.
tr: Geleceğin inancımızı hak ettiğini düşünüyorum. Ama Emily Dickinson’la tartışmak zor. Margo ayağa kalkıyor, sırt çantasını omzuna atıyor ve elini bana uzatıyor. “Haydi, yürüyüş yapalım.” Dışarı çıkarken Margo telefonumu istiyor. Sertçe basarak bir numara çeviriyor, konuşmasma izin vermek için uzaklaşmaya başlıyorum ama kolumu yakalayıp beni yamnda tutuyor. Böylece o, ebeveynleriyle konuşurken, dışarıdaki çayıra doğru yarımda yürüyorum.
es: Creo que el futuro merece que creamos en él. Pero es difícil llevarle la contraria a Emily Dickinson. Margo se levanta, se cuelga la mochila de un hombro y me tiende la mano. —Vamos a dar un paseo. Mientras salimos, Margo me pide el teléfono. Teclea un número y cuando voy a apartarme para dejarla hablar me sujeta del brazo para que me quede con ella. Camino a su lado hacia el campo mientras habla con sus padres.
vi_translation: I think the future deserves our trust. But it's hard to argue with Emily Dickinson. Margo stood up, slung her backpack over her shoulder, and extended her hand to me. "Let's go for a walk." Once outside, Margo asked to borrow my phone. She dialed a number, and I was about to leave to give her some privacy, but Margo grabbed my hand to keep me there. So I walked with Margo to the field while she talked to her parents.
tr_translation: I believe the future deserves our faith. But it's hard to argue with Emily Dickinson. Margo stands up, slings her backpack over her shoulder, and extends her hand to me. "Come on, let's take a walk." As we head out, Margo asks for my phone. She dials a number with a firm press, and I start to walk away to give her privacy, but she grabs my arm and keeps me by her side. So, while she talks to her parents, I walk beside her towards the meadow outside.
es_translation: I believe that the future deserves that we believe in it. But it is difficult to contradict Emily Dickinson. Margo stands up, slings the backpack over one shoulder, and extends her hand to me. —Let's go for a walk. As we leave, Margo asks me for the phone. She types in a number and when I start to move away to let her talk, she grabs my arm to keep me with her. I walk beside her towards the field while she talks to her parents.

en: “Hey, it’s Margo. . . . I’m in Agloe, New York, with Quentin. . . . Uh. . . . well, no, Mom, I’m just trying to think of a way to answer your question honestly. . . . Mom, come on. . . . I don’t know, Mom . . . I decided to move to a fictitious place. That’s what happened. . . . Yeah, well, I don’t think I’m headed that way, regardless. . . . Can I talk to Ruthie? . . . Hey, buddy. . . . Yeah, well, I loved you first. . . . Yeah, I’m sorry. It was a mistake. I thought—I don’t know what I thought, Ruthie, but anyway it was a mistake and I’ll call now. I may not call Mom, but I’ll call you. . . . Wednesdays? . . . You’re busy on Wednesdays. Hmm. Okay. What’s a good day for you? . . . Tuesday it is. . . . Yeah, every Tuesday. . . . Yeah, including this Tuesday.” Margo closes her eyes tight, her teeth clenched. “Okay, Ruthers, can you put Mom back on? . . . I love you, Mom. I’ll be okay. I swear. . . . Yeah, okay, you, too. Bye.”
vi: Thế nên tôi đi bộ cùng Margo ra cánh đồng trong khi cô ấy nói chuyện với bố mẹ. “Dạ, con Margo đây ạ... Con đang ở Agloe, New York, với Quentin... Ơ... dạ, không mẹ ạ, con muốn trả lời mẹ thật thành thực... Mẹ, thôi mà... Con không biết mẹ ạ... Con quyết định chuyển đến một chỗ không có thật. Chuyện diễn ra như vậy... Vâng, à, nhưng dù sao con không nghĩ con lại bị coi là đứa như vậy... Con nói chuyện với Ruthie được không ạ?... À, cưng đấy à... Ừ, ừ, chị thương cưng nhất... Ừ, chị xin lỗi mà. Thế là lỗi rồi mà. Chị cứ tưởng– chị không biết mình đã tưởng gì nữa, Ruthie ạ, nhưng chị biết đó là lỗi của chị rồi, từ giờ chị sẽ gọi điện. Chắc chị không gọi cho mẹ đâu, nhưng nhất định sẽ gọi cho cưng... Các ngày thứ Tư nhé?... Cưng bận thứ Tư rồi à? Ừm, được rồi. Thế ngày nào thì được?... Thứ Ba là... ừ... vậy thứ Ba hàng tuần nhé... Ừ, tính cả thứ Ba tuần này luôn.” Margo nhắm chặt mắt, răng hơi nghiến lại. “Được rồi, Ruthie ngoan, bây giờ đưa điện thoại lại cho mẹ nhé?... Con yêu mẹ ạ. Con sẽ ổn cả, con thề ạ... Vâng, được rồi mẹ cũng thế ạ. Con chào mẹ.”
tr: “Selam, ben Margo... Quentin’le Agloe, New York’tayım... Ah... Şey, hayır anne, sadece soruna dürüstçe cevap vermenin bir yolunu düşünmeye çalışıyorum... Anne, yapma ama... Bilmiyorum, anne... Hayalî bir yere taşınmaya karar vermiştim. Olan bu... Evet, şey, o yöne gittiğimi sanmıyorum, ne olursa olsun... Ruthie’yle konuşabilir miyim?.. Selam, dostum... Hayır, önce ben seni sevdim... Evet, ö/Âir dilerim. Bu bir hataydı. Düşündüm ki... ne düşündüğümü bilmiyorum Ruthie ama ne olursa olsun bu bir hataydı ve artık arayacağım. Annemi aramayabilirim ama seni arayacağım... Çarşambaları olur mu?.. Çarşambaları meşgulsün. Hımm. Tamam. Senin için uygun olan gün hangisi?.. Sah o zaman. Evet, her salı... Evet, bu sah da dâhil.” Margo gözlerini sıkıca kapatıyor, dişleri kenetlenmiş. “Tamam, Ruthers, annemi geri verebilir misin?.. Seni seviyorum, anne. Ben iyiyim. Yemin ederim... Evet, tamam, sen de. Hoşça kal.
es: —Hola, soy Margo… Estoy en Agloe, Nueva York, con Quentin… Vaya… Bueno, no, mamá, solo estoy pensando cómo contestarte con sinceridad… Mamá, vamos… No lo sé, mamá… Decidí trasladarme a un lugar ficticio. Eso es lo que pasó… Sí, bueno, de todas formas no creo que vaya por ahí… ¿Puedo hablar con Ruthie?… Hola, guapa… Sí, bueno, yo te quise primero… Sí, lo siento. Fue un error. Pensé… No sé lo que pensé, Ruthie, pero fue un error y a partir de ahora te llamaré. Quizá no llamaré a mamá, pero te llamaré a ti… ¿Los miércoles?… Los miércoles no puedes. Hum. Vale. ¿Qué día te va bien?… Los martes… Sí, cada martes… Sí, incluido este martes. —Margo cierra los ojos y aprieta los dientes—. Muy bien, Ruthers, ¿puedes pasarme a mamá?… Te quiero, mamá. Todo irá bien. Te lo prometo… Sí, vale, tú también. Adiós.
vi_translation: So I walked with Margo to the field while she talked to her parents. "Yes, it's Margo here... I'm in Agloe, New York, with Quentin... Uh... no, mom, I want to answer you honestly... Mom, come on... I don't know, mom... I've decided to move to a place that doesn't exist. That's how it happened... Yes, well, but anyway, I didn't think I would be seen as that kind of person... Can I talk to Ruthie?... Oh, hey there, sweetie... Yeah, yeah, I love you the most... Yeah, I'm really sorry. So, it was a mistake. I thought– I don't even know what I thought, Ruthie, but I know it was my fault, from now on I'll call. I probably won't call mom, but I will definitely call you... Wednesdays, okay?... You're busy on Wednesdays? Hmm, alright. So what day works for you?... Tuesday is... yeah... so every Tuesday then... Yeah, starting this Tuesday." Margo closed her eyes tightly, her teeth slightly clenched. "Alright, good girl, now give the phone back to mom, okay?... I love you, mom. I'll be fine, I swear... Yes, okay, you too, mom. Goodbye, mom."
tr_translation: “Hello, I'm Margo... I'm with Quentin in Agloe, New York... Ah... Well, no mom, I'm just trying to think of a way to answer your question honestly... Mom, don't... I don't know, mom... I had decided to move to an imaginary place. That's what happened... Yes, well, I don't think I'm heading that way, whatever happens... Can I talk to Ruthie?.. Hello, my friend... No, I loved you first... Yes, I wish you well. This was a mistake. I thought that... I don't know what I was thinking, Ruthie, but whatever it was, it was a mistake and I will call you from now on. I might not call my mom, but I will call you... Is Wednesday okay?.. You're busy on Wednesdays. Hmm. Okay. Which day works for you?.. Alright then. Yes, every Tuesday... Yes, including this Tuesday.” Margo closes her eyes tightly, her teeth clenched. “Okay, Ruthers, can you give the phone back to my mom?.. I love you, mom. I'm fine. I swear... Yes, okay, you too. Goodbye.”
es_translation: —Hello, it's Margo… I'm in Agloe, New York, with Quentin… Wow… Well, no, mom, I'm just thinking about how to answer you honestly… Mom, come on… I don't know, mom… I decided to move to a fictional place. That's what happened… Yes, well, anyway, I don't think I'll go there… Can I talk to Ruthie?… Hello, sweetie… Yes, well, I loved you first… Yes, I'm sorry. It was a mistake. I thought… I don't know what I thought, Ruthie, but it was a mistake and from now on I'll call you. Maybe I won't call mom, but I'll call you… Wednesdays?… You can't on Wednesdays. Hmm. Okay. What day works for you?… Tuesdays… Yes, every Tuesday… Yes, including this Tuesday. —Margo closes her eyes and grits her teeth—. Alright, Ruthers, can you put mom on?… I love you, mom. Everything will be fine. I promise you… Yes, okay, you too. Goodbye.

en: She stops walking and closes the phone but holds it a minute. I can see her fingertips pinkening with the tightness of her grip, and then she drops it onto the ground. Her scream is short but deafening, and in its wake I am aware for the first time of Agloe’s abject silence. “It’s like she thinks my job is to please her, and that should be my dearest wish, and when I don’t please her—I get shut out. She changed the locks. That’s the first thing she said. Jesus.”
vi: Margo dừng lại, ngắt cuộc gọi nhưng vẫn giữ điện thoại trong tay khoảng một phút. Tôi thấy mấy đầu ngón tay cô ấy hồng lên vì nắm chặt, rồi cô ấy đánh rơi điện thoại xuống đất. Tiếng thét của Margo ngắn nhưng chói tai, sau đó lần đầu tiên tôi nhận ra sự tĩnh lặng biền biệt của Agloe. “Mẹ nghĩ việc của tớ là phải làm hài lòng mẹ thì phải, và đó phải là nguyện vọng lớn nhất của tớ, và khi không làm mẹ hài lòng nữa thì tớ bị tống đi. Mẹ đã thay hết khóa rồi. Đó là điều đầu tiên mẹ nói với tớ. Lạy Chúa.”
tr: Yürümeyi bırakıp telefonu kapatıyor ama bir dakika kadar elinde tutuyor. O kadar sıkı tutuyor ki parmak uçlarının pembeleştiğini görebiliyorum, sonra telefonu yere düşürüyor. Çığlığı kısa ama kulakları sağır eden cinsten, ardından ilk defa Agloe’nun sefil sessizliğinin farkına varıyorum. “Sanki işimin onu memnun etmek olduğunu ve bunun en değerli dileğim olması gerektiğini düşünüyor, onu memnun etmediğimde de... kapı dışan ediliyorum. Kilitleri değiştirmiş. Söylediği ilk şey bu. Tanrım.
es: Se detiene y cuelga el teléfono, pero se lo queda un minuto. Lo aprieta tan fuerte que las puntas de los dedos empiezan a ponérsele rojas. Luego lo deja caer al suelo. Su grito es breve, pero ensordecedor, y mientras resuena soy consciente por primera vez del miserable silencio de Agloe. —Se cree que lo que tengo que hacer es complacerla, que no debería desear otra cosa, y cuando no la complazco… me echa. Ha cambiado las cerraduras. Es lo primero que me ha dicho. Por Dios.
vi_translation: Margo stopped, ended the call but still held the phone in her hand for about a minute. I saw her fingertips turn pink from gripping tightly, then she dropped the phone to the ground. Margo's scream was short but piercing, and then for the first time, I noticed the profound silence of Agloe. “My mom thinks my job is to please her, and that should be my greatest wish, and when I no longer please her, I get thrown out. She changed all the locks. That was the first thing she told me. Oh my God.”
tr_translation: He stops walking and turns off the phone but holds it in his hand for about a minute. He grips it so tightly that I can see his fingertips turning pink, then he drops the phone to the ground. His scream is short but deafening, and then for the first time, I notice the miserable silence of Agloe. “It's as if he thinks my job is to please him and that this should be my most precious wish, and when I don't please him... I am thrown out. He changed the locks. That's the first thing he said. My God.”
es_translation: He stops and hangs up the phone, but holds onto it for a minute. He squeezes it so hard that the tips of his fingers start to turn red. Then he lets it fall to the ground. His scream is brief but deafening, and as it echoes, I become aware for the first time of the miserable silence of Agloe. —It is believed that what I have to do is please her, that I shouldn't desire anything else, and when I don't please her... she throws me out. She has changed the locks. It's the first thing she told me. For God's sake.

en: “Sorry,” I say, pushing aside some knee-high yellow-green grass to pick up the phone. “Nice to talk to Ruthie, though?”
vi: “Tớ rất tiếc,” tôi nói, vén thứ cỏ nửa vàng nửa xanh cao đến đầu gối ra để nhặt điện thoại lên. “Nhưng nói chuyện với Ruthie thì vui chứ?”
tr: “Üzgünüm,” diyorum, telefonu almak için diz boyundaki sarıyeşil çimenleri bir kenara iterken. “Ruthie’yle konuşmak iyi miydi?” “Evet, Ruthie sevimli bir kız.
es: —Lo siento —le digo apartando la hierba amarillenta, que nos llega a las rodillas, para coger el teléfono—. Pero ¿bien con Ruthie?
vi_translation: “I'm very sorry,” I said, pushing aside the knee-high grass, half yellow and half green, to pick up the phone. “But was it fun talking to Ruthie?”
tr_translation: “I'm sorry,” I say, pushing aside the knee-high yellow-green grass to get the phone. “Was it good to talk to Ruthie?” “Yes, Ruthie is a lovely girl.
es_translation: —I'm sorry —I say, pushing aside the yellowish grass that reaches our knees to pick up the phone—. But everything okay with Ruthie?

en: “Yeah, she’s pretty adorable. I kind of hate myself for—you know—not talking to her.”
vi: “Ừ, con bé ngoan và đáng yêu lắm. Tớ thấy mình rất tệ vì–cậu biết đấy–đã không nói gì với nó.
tr: “Ruthie’yle konuşmak iyi miydi?” “Evet, Ruthie sevimli bir kız. Aslına bakarsan onunla konuşmadığım için kendimden nefret ediyorum.
es: —Sí, es muy maja. Me odio a mí misma por… ya sabes… no haber hablado con ella.
vi_translation: “Yes, the girl is very nice and lovely. I feel really bad because—you know—I didn't say anything to her.”
tr_translation: “Was it good to talk to Ruthie?” “Yes, Ruthie is a lovely girl. Actually, I hate myself for not talking to her.”
es_translation: —Yes, she is very nice. I hate myself for... you know... not having talked to her.

en: “Yeah,” I say. She shoves me playfully.
vi: “Được rồi mà,” tôi nói. Margo đánh đùa tôi.
tr: “Evet,” diyorum. Şaka yaparcasına beni dürtüyor.
es: —Sí —le digo. Me da un empujón en broma.
vi_translation: “It's okay,” I said. Margo playfully hit me.
tr_translation: "Yes," I say. He nudges me as if joking.
es_translation: —Yes —I tell him. He gives me a playful shove.

en: “You’re supposed to make me feel better, not worse!” she says. “That’s your whole gig!”
vi: “Lẽ ra cậu phải làm tớ thấy vui hơn chứ không phải tệ đi!” Margo nói. “Đó là tất cả biệt tài của cậu cơ mà!”
tr: “Beni daha iyi hissettirmen gerekiyor, daha kötü değil!” diyor. “Bütün olayın bu!
es: —¡Se supone que deberías hacer que me sintiera mejor, no peor! —me dice—. ¡Es tu papel!
vi_translation: “You were supposed to make me feel better, not worse!” Margo said. “That’s your whole talent!”
tr_translation: “You need to make me feel better, not worse!” he says. “That's the whole point!”
es_translation: —You are supposed to make me feel better, not worse! —he tells me—. It's your role!

en: “I didn’t realize my job was to please you, Mrs. Spiegelman.”
vi: “Tôi không biết hóa ra việc của tôi là phải làm hài lòng cô đấy, thưa cô Spiegelman.
tr: “işimin seni memnun etmek olduğunu fark etmemiştim, Bayan Spiegelman.
es: —No sabía que lo que tenía que hacer era complacerla, señorita Spiegelman.
vi_translation: "I didn't know it turned out my job was to please you, Ms. Spiegelman."
tr_translation: “I hadn't realized that my job was to please you, Ms. Spiegelman.”
es_translation: —I didn't know that what I had to do was to please you, Miss Spiegelman.

en: She laughs. “Ooh, the Mom comparison. What a burn. But fair enough. So how have you been? If Ben is dating Lacey, surely you are having nightly orgies with dozens of cheerleaders.”
vi: Margo cười thành tiếng. “Ôôi, so sánh với các bà mẹ. Vinh dự toát cả mồ hôi. Nhưng cũng có phần đúng đấy. Thế cậu dạo này thế nào? Nếu Ben đang dập dìu với Lacey, chắc chắn cậu cũng trải qua hàng đêm nóng bỏng với cả chục cô nàng trong đội cổ vũ rồi.”
tr: Gülüyor. “Oo, anne benzetmesi. Çok fena. Ama haklısın. Peki, sen nasılsın? Eğer Ben, Lacey’yle çıkıyorsa, sen düzinelerce amigo kızla her gece seks partileri yapıyor olmalısın.
es: Se ríe. —Ay, me comparas con mi madre. Qué insulto. Pero me lo merezco. Bueno, ¿qué tal te ha ido? Si Ben está saliendo con Lacey, seguro que tú estás pegándote orgías todas las noches con un montón de animadoras.
vi_translation: Margo laughed out loud. “Oh, comparing with the mothers. An honor that makes you break a sweat. But there's some truth to it. So how have you been lately? If Ben is flirting with Lacey, surely you've been having hot nights with a dozen cheerleaders.”
tr_translation: Laughing. “Oh, the mom comparison. Very bad. But you're right. So, how are you? If Ben is dating Lacey, you must be having sex parties with dozens of cheerleaders every night.”
es_translation: He/She laughs. —Oh, you compare me to my mother. What an insult. But I deserve it. Well, how have you been? If Ben is dating Lacey, surely you are having orgies every night with a bunch of cheerleaders.

en: We walk slowly through the uneven dirt of this field. It doesn’t look big, but as we walk, I realize that we do not seem to be getting closer to the stand of trees in the distance. I tell her about leaving graduation, about the miraculous spinning of the Dreidel. I tell her about prom, Lacey’s fight with Becca, and my night in the Osprey. “That was the night I really knew you’d definitely been there,” I tell her. “That blanket still smelled like you.”
vi: Chúng tôi từ từ đi trên mặt đất mấp mô của cánh đồng này. Thoạt nhìn cánh đồng không lớn, nhưng có đi tôi mới nhận ra chẳng có vẻ gì như chúng tôi đang lại gần hàng cây ở phía xa cả. Tôi kể cho Margo nghe về màn đánh tháo khỏi lễ tốt nghiệp, những vòng xoay ngoạn mục của Con Quay. Tôi kể với cô ấy về dạ tiệc, Lacey đã chiến đấu với Becca, và đêm tôi ở Osprey. “Đó là đêm tớ thực sự biết rằng chắc chắn cậu đã ở đó,” tôi nói với Margo. “Tấm chăn vẫn còn mùi giống cậu.”
tr: Engebeli çayırda yavaşça yürüyoruz. Çayırlık alan geniş görünmüyor ama yürürken, uzaktaki ağaçlığa yaklaşıyormuş gibi görünmediğimizi fark ediyorum. Ona mezuniyeti terk etmemi, Fırdöndü’nün mucizevi dönüşünü anlatıyorum. Baloyu, Lacey’nin Becca’yla kavgasını ve Osprey5deki gecemden bahsediyorum. “Kesinlikle orada olduğunu gerçekten anladığım geceydi,” diyorum. “O battaniye hâlâ senin gibi kokuyordu.
es: Caminamos despacio por el campo desigual. No parece grande, pero a medida que avanzamos me doy cuenta de que no hay manera de que nos acerquemos a los árboles del fondo. Le cuento que me salté la graduación y lo del milagroso giro del Dreidel. Le cuento lo del baile, la pelea de Lacey con Becca y mi noche en el Osprey. —Fue la noche en que supe que no había duda de que habías estado allí —le digo—. La manta todavía olía como tú.
vi_translation: We slowly walked on the uneven ground of this field. At first glance, the field didn't seem large, but as we walked, I realized it didn't look like we were getting any closer to the trees in the distance. I told Margo about the escape from the graduation ceremony, the spectacular spins of the Top. I told her about the prom, Lacey fighting with Becca, and the night I spent at Osprey. "That was the night I really knew for sure you had been there," I said to Margo. "The blanket still smelled like you."
tr_translation: We are walking slowly on the rugged meadow. The meadow area does not look wide, but as we walk, I realize that it does not seem like we are getting closer to the distant grove. I am telling her about dropping out of graduation, the miraculous return of Fırdöndü. I talk about the prom, Lacey’s fight with Becca, and my night at Osprey5. “It was definitely the night I truly realized you were there,” I say. “That blanket still smelled like you.”
es_translation: We walked slowly through the uneven field. It doesn't seem big, but as we move forward, I realize that there is no way we can get closer to the trees in the background. I tell him that I skipped graduation and about the miraculous spin of the Dreidel. I tell him about the dance, Lacey's fight with Becca, and my night at the Osprey. —It was the night I knew there was no doubt you had been there —I tell her—. The blanket still smelled like you.

en: And when I say that her hand brushes up against mine, and I just grab hers because it feels like there is less to ruin now. She looks at me. “I had to leave. I didn’t have to scare you and that was stupid and I should have done a better job leaving, but I did have to leave. Do you see that yet?”
vi: Khi tôi nói đến đấy, bàn tay Margo khẽ chạm vào tôi, và tôi nắm ngay lấy bàn tay ấy, vì có cảm giác như lúc này còn ít điều dễ bị phá hỏng hơn. Margo nhìn tôi. “Tớ đã phải ra đi. Tớ không cần phải làm cậu sợ và như thế ngốc thật. Lẽ ra tớ phải ra đi gọn ghẽ hơn, nhưng đúng là tớ phải ra đi. Cậu hiểu chứ?”
tr: Bunu söylediğimde eli hafifçe elime değiyor ve elini hemen yakalıyorum çünkü artık mahvedilecek daha az şey varmış gibi geliyor. Bana bakıyor. “Gitmek zorundaydım. Seni korkutmam gerekmezdi, bu aptalcaydı ve giderken daha iyi iş çıkarmalıydım ama gitmek zorundaydım. Artık anlıyor musun?
es: Y cuando se lo digo, su mano roza la mía, y se la cojo porque me da la impresión de que ahora ya no hay tanto que estropear. Me mira. —Tenía que marcharme. No debería haberte asustado, fue una estupidez, tendría que haberme ido de otra manera, pero tenía que irme. ¿Lo entiendes ahora?
vi_translation: When I said that, Margo's hand gently touched me, and I immediately held that hand, because it felt like there were fewer things that could be ruined at that moment. Margo looked at me. "I had to leave. I didn't need to scare you and that was really stupid. I should have left more neatly, but I really had to go. Do you understand?"
tr_translation: When I say this, his hand lightly touches mine and I immediately grab his hand because it feels like there are fewer things left to ruin. He looks at me. “I had to go. I didn't need to scare you, it was foolish, and I should have done a better job when leaving, but I had to go. Do you understand now?”
es_translation: And when I tell her, her hand brushes against mine, and I take it because it feels like there's not much left to ruin now. She looks at me. —I had to leave. I shouldn't have scared you, it was stupid, I should have left in another way, but I had to go. Do you understand now?

en: “Yeah,” I say, “but I think you can come back now. I really do.”
vi: “Ừ,” tôi đáp, “nhưng tớ nghĩ bây giờ cậu cũng có thể trở về. Đúng là tớ nghĩ như vậy.”
tr: “Evet,” diyorum, “ama artık geri dönebileceğini düşünüyorum. Gerçekten öyle düşünüyorum.
es: —Sí —le digo—, pero creo que ya puedes volver. De verdad lo creo.
vi_translation: “Yes,” I replied, “but I think now you can also return. That's exactly what I think.”
tr_translation: “Yes,” I say, “but I think you can come back now. I really think so.”
es_translation: —Yes —I tell him—, but I think you can come back now. I really believe it.

en: “No, you don’t,” she answers, and she’s right. She can see it in my face—I understand now that I can’t be her and she can’t be me. Maybe Whitman had a gift I don’t have. But as for me: I must ask the wounded man where he is hurt, because I cannot become the wounded man. The only wounded man I can be is me.
vi: “Không đâu, cậu không nghĩ như vậy đâu,” Margo đáp, và cô ấy nói đúng. Cô ấy có thể thấy được điều đó trên mặt tôi–giờ tôi hiểu rằng mình không thể là cô ấy và cô ấy không thể là tôi. Có lẽ Whitman có một cái tài mà tôi không có. Đối với tôi: Tôi phải hỏi người mang vết thương xem anh ta bị đau ở đâu, vì tôi không thể trở thành người mang vết thương. Người mang vết thương duy nhất mà tôi có thể ở trong, chính là tôi.
tr: “Hayır, düşünmüyorsun,” diye cevap veriyor ve haklı. Yüzümden okuyabiliyor... benim o ve onun da ben olamayacağını şimdi anlıyorum. Belki Whitman’da bende olmayan bir yetenek vardı. Ama ben yaralı adama neresinin acıdığını sormalıyım çünkü ben yaralı adam olamam. Olabileceğim tek yaralı adam benim.
es: —No, no lo crees —me contesta. Y tiene razón. Me lo ve en la cara. Por fin entiendo que no puedo ser ella, y que ella no puede ser yo. Quizá Whitman tenía un don que yo no tengo. Por lo que a mí respecta, tengo que preguntarle al herido dónde tiene la herida, porque no puedo convertirme en el herido. El único herido que puedo ser es yo mismo.
vi_translation: “No, you don't think that way,” Margo replied, and she was right. She could see it on my face–now I understand that I can't be her and she can't be me. Maybe Whitman has a talent that I don't have. For me: I have to ask the wounded person where he is hurt, because I can't become the wounded person. The only wounded person I can be is myself.
tr_translation: “No, you are not thinking,” he replies, and he is right. He can read it from my face... I now understand that I cannot be him and he cannot be me. Maybe Whitman had a talent that I did not possess. But I must ask the wounded man where it hurts because I cannot be the wounded man. The only wounded man I can be is myself.
es_translation: —No, you don't believe it —he replies to me. And he is right. He sees it in my face. At last, I understand that I cannot be her, and that she cannot be me. Maybe Whitman had a gift that I do not have. As far as I am concerned, I have to ask the wounded where the wound is, because I cannot become the wounded. The only wounded person I can be is myself.

en: I stomp down some grass and sit. She lies down next to me, her backpack a pillow. I lay back, too. She digs a couple of books out of her backpack and hands them to me so I can have a pillow, too. Selected Poems of Emily Dickinson and Leaves of Grass. “I had two copies,” she says, smiling.
vi: Tôi dẫm rạp một trảng cỏ và ngồi xuống. Margo nằm xuống cạnh tôi, gối đầu lên ba-lô. Tôi cũng nằm xuống. Margo lấy mấy cuốn sách trong ba-lô ra, đưa cho tôi gối đầu. Tuyển tập thơ Emily Dickinson và Những cánh cỏ. “Tớ có hai cuốn,” Margo nói, mỉm cười.
tr: Ayağımla çimenleri ezip oturuyorum. Yanıma uzanıyor, sırt çantası yastığı. Ben de sırtüstü uzamyorum. Sırt çantasında birkaç kitap aramyor ve benim de bir yastığım olsun diye onları bana uzatıyor. Emily Dickinson’dan Seçme Şiirler ve Çimen Yaprakları, “iki tane vardı,” diyor gülümseyerek.
es: Pisoteo la hierba y me siento. Margo se tumba a mi lado, con la mochila como almohada. Me tumbo boca arriba también yo. Saca un par de libros de la mochila y me los pasa para que me hagan de almohada. Una antología de poemas de Emily Dickinson y Hojas de hierba. —Tenía dos ejemplares —me dice sonriendo.
vi_translation: I trampled a patch of grass and sat down. Margo lay down next to me, resting her head on the backpack. I lay down as well. Margo took some books out of the backpack and gave them to me to use as a pillow. A collection of Emily Dickinson's poetry and Leaves of Grass. “I have two books,” Margo said, smiling.
tr_translation: I sit down, crushing the grass under my feet. He lies down next to me, his backpack as a pillow. I also lie down on my back. He searches for a few books in his backpack and hands them to me so that I also have a pillow. Selected Poems by Emily Dickinson and Leaves of Grass, “there were two,” he says with a smile.
es_translation: I trample the grass and sit down. Margo lies down next to me, using the backpack as a pillow. I lie down on my back as well. She takes a couple of books out of the backpack and hands them to me to use as a pillow. An anthology of poems by Emily Dickinson and Leaves of Grass. —I had two copies —he tells me, smiling.

en: “It’s a hell of a good poem,” I tell her. “You couldn’t have picked a better one.”
vi: “Một áng thơ tuyệt đẹp,” tôi nói với Margo. “Cậu không thể chọn chính xác hơn được.”
tr: “Felaket iyi bir şiir,” diyorum. “Daha iyisini seçemezdin.”
es: —Es buenísimo —le digo—. No podrías haber elegido mejor.
vi_translation: “A beautiful poem,” I said to Margo. “You couldn't have chosen better.”
tr_translation: “A terribly good poem,” I say. “You couldn't have chosen a better one.”
es_translation: —It's excellent —I tell him—. You couldn't have chosen better.

en: “Really, it was an impulse decision that morning. I remembered the bit about the doors and thought that was perfect. But then when I got here I reread it. I hadn’t read it since sophomore English, and yeah, I liked it. I tried to read a bunch of poetry. I was trying to figure out—like, what was it that surprised me about you that night? And for a long time I thought it was when you quoted T. S. Eliot.”
vi: “Thực ra chỉ là quyết định bột phát sáng hôm ấy thôi. Tớ nhớ có câu về những cánh cửa và thấy rất hợp. Nhưng rồi khi đến đây tớ đã đọc lại. Tớ đã không đọc lại kể từ hồi học Quốc ngữ lớp mười. Ừ, tớ rất thích bài thơ ấy. Tớ cố đọc rất nhiều thơ. Tớ cố hiểu xem–ừ, đêm đó điều gì đã khiến tớ ngạc nhiên về cậu đến thế? Một thời gian dài tớ đã nghĩ có lẽ là khi cậu đọc T. S. Eliot.”
tr: “Gerçekten mi, o sabah verdiğim ani bir karardı. Kapılarla ilgili ufak parçayı hatırladım ve kusursuz olduğunu düşündüm. Ama sonra buraya geldiğimde tekrar okudum. Lise ikideki edebiyat dersinden beri okumamıştım ve evet, sevdim. Bir sürü şiir okumayı denedim. Şey, o gece seninle ilgili beni şaşırtan şeyin ne olduğunu çözmeye çalışıyordum. Ve uzun süre boyunca T. S. Eliot’tan alıntı yaptığın zaman olduğunu sandım.
es: —Fue una decisión impulsiva aquella mañana, de verdad. Recordé el fragmento sobre las puertas y pensé que era perfecto. Pero luego, al llegar aquí, volví a leerlo. No lo había leído desde el segundo año de instituto y, sí, me gustó. He intentado leer un montón de poesía. Intentaba descubrir… qué fue lo que me sorprendió de ti aquella noche. Y durante mucho tiempo he pensado que fue cuando citaste a T. S. Eliot.
vi_translation: "Actually, it was just a spontaneous decision that morning. I remembered a quote about doors and thought it was very fitting. But then when I got here, I read it again. I hadn't read it again since I was in tenth grade studying the national language. Yes, I really liked that poem. I tried to read a lot of poetry. I tried to understand—yes, what was it that surprised me so much about you that night? For a long time, I thought maybe it was when you read T. S. Eliot."
tr_translation: “Really? It was a sudden decision I made that morning. I remembered the small piece about doors and thought it was perfect. But then when I came here, I read it again. I hadn't read it since literature class in the second year of high school, and yes, I liked it. I tried to read a lot of poetry. Well, that night I was trying to figure out what it was about you that surprised me. And for a long time, I thought it was when you quoted T. S. Eliot.”
es_translation: —It was an impulsive decision that morning, truly. I remembered the passage about the doors and thought it was perfect. But then, upon arriving here, I read it again. I hadn't read it since my sophomore year of high school and, yes, I liked it. I've tried to read a lot of poetry. I was trying to figure out… what it was that surprised me about you that night. And for a long time, I thought it was when you quoted T. S. Eliot.

en: “But it wasn’t,” I say. “You were surprised by the size of my biceps and my graceful window-exiting.”
vi: “Nhưng không phải,” tôi nói. “Cậu sửng sốt vì bắp tay con chuột và màn phi thân qua cửa sổ đầy quyến rũ của tớ chứ gì?”
tr: “Ama değildi,” diyorum. “Pazılarımın boyutuna ve pencereden çıkışımın zarifliğine şaşırmıştın.
es: —Pero no era eso —le digo—. Te sorprendieron mis bíceps y mi elegante salida por la ventana.
vi_translation: “But that's not it,” I said. “You're astonished by the mouse's biceps and my charming leap through the window, aren't you?”
tr_translation: “But it wasn't,” I say. “You were surprised by the size of my biceps and the grace with which I exited through the window.”
es_translation: —But that wasn't it —I tell her—. You were surprised by my biceps and my elegant exit through the window.

en: She smirks. “Shut up and let me compliment you, dillhole. It wasn’t the poetry or your biceps. What surprised me was that, in spite of your anxiety attacks and everything, you were like the Quentin in my story. I mean, I’ve been crosshatching over that story for years now, and whenever I write over it, I also read that page, and I would always laugh, like—don’t get offended, but, like, ‘God I can’t believe I used to think Quentin Jacobsen was like a superhot, superloyal defender of justice.’ But then—you know—you kind of were.”
vi: Margo cười nhếch miệng. “Trật tự và để tớ khen cậu đây, đồ lắm chuyện. Không phải thơ hay cơ con chuột. Điều làm tớ ngạc nhiên là dù phải chịu căng thẳng và đủ thứ khác, cậu đã giống như Quentin trong câu chuyện của tớ. Tớ viết chen vào chỗ trống những trang sổ ấy hàng năm trời, mỗi lần viết tớ lại đọc lại câu chuyện, lần nào cũng phì cười, kiểu như–cậu đừng mếch lòng nhé–‘Trời, không tin nổi rằng mình từng nghĩ Quentin Jacobsen là người bảo vệ công lí siêu nóng bỏng, siêu tận tụy như vậy chứ.’ Nhưng rồi–cậu biết đấy–cậu cũng hơi hơi như vậy.”
tr: Sırıtıyor. “Kapa çeneni de iltifat edebileyim, salak. Şiir ya da pazıların değildi. Beni şaşırtan . şey, endişe krizlerine filan rağmen, hikâyemdeki Quentin gibi idmandı. Yani şimdiye kadar yıllardır o hikâyenin üzerine çaprazlama yazı yazıyorum ve ne zaman üstüne yazsam, o sayfayı da okurum ve hep, şey... darılma ama, ‘Tanrım, Quentin Jacobsen’ı adaletin süper seksi ve süper sadık koruyucusu olarak düşündüğüme' inanamıyorum,’ deyip gülerdim. Ama sonra bir de farkına vardım ki bir bakıma öyleydin.
es: Sonríe. —Cállate y déjame piropearte, gilipuertas. No fue ni la poesía ni tus bíceps. Lo que me sorprendió fue que, a pesar de tus ataques de ansiedad y todo eso, realmente eras como el Quentin de mi relato. Bueno, llevaba años escribiendo encima de esa historia, y cada vez que escribía, leía también esa página, y siempre me reía y me decía… No te ofendas, pero me decía: «Joder, no me creo que pensara que Quentin Jacobsen era un supertío bueno, superleal defensor de la justicia». Pero… bueno… lo eras.
vi_translation: Margo smirked. "Shut up and let me compliment you, you chatterbox. It's not poetry, you little mouse. What surprises me is that despite the stress and everything else, you have been like Quentin in my story. I've been writing in the margins of those pages for years, and every time I write, I reread the story, always laughing to myself, like–don't be offended–'God, I can't believe I once thought Quentin Jacobsen was such a super hot, super dedicated justice warrior.' But then–you know–you kind of are."
tr_translation: Grinning. "Shut up so I can compliment you, idiot. It wasn't the poetry or the muscles. What surprised me was that, despite anxiety attacks and all, you were as disciplined as Quentin in my story. I mean, for years now, I've been writing crosswise over that story, and whenever I write over it, I read that page, and always, well... no offense, but I would laugh and say, 'My God, I can't believe I thought of Quentin Jacobsen as the super sexy and super loyal protector of justice.' But then I realized that, in a way, you were."
es_translation: Smile. —Shut up and let me compliment you, dumbass. It wasn't the poetry or your biceps. What surprised me was that, despite your anxiety attacks and all that, you really were like the Quentin from my story. Well, I had been writing over that story for years, and every time I wrote, I also read that page, and I always laughed and told myself… No offense, but I told myself: "Damn, I can't believe I thought Quentin Jacobsen was a super good-looking, super loyal defender of justice." But… well… you were.

en: I could turn on my side, and she might turn on her side, too. And then we could kiss. But what’s the point of kissing her now, anyway? It won’t go anywhere. We are both staring at the cloudless sky. “Nothing ever happens like you imagine it will,” she says.
vi: Tôi có thể quay nghiêng, cô ấy cũng có thể quay nghiêng, và rồi chúng tôi có thể hôn nhau. Nhưng rút cục hôn cô ấy bây giờ để làm gì? Sẽ không đi đến đâu cả. Chúng tôi đều cùng nhìn lên bầu trời trong vắt. “Chẳng có gì xảy ra giống như ta tưởng tượng cả,” cô ấy nói.
tr: Yan dönebilirim ve o da yan dönebilir. Ve sonra öpüşebiliriz. Ama onu şimdi öpmenin amacı ne ki zaten? Hiçbir yere varmayacak. ikimiz de bulutsuz gökyüzünü seyrediyoruz. “Hiçbir şey asla hayal ettiğin gibi olmuyor,” diyor.
es: Podría girarme, y ella también podría girarse. Y podríamos besarnos. Pero ¿qué sentido tiene besarla ahora? Es algo que no irá a ninguna parte. Los dos contemplamos el cielo sin nubes. —Las cosas nunca suceden como imaginas —me dice.
vi_translation: I can turn sideways, she can also turn sideways, and then we can kiss each other. But in the end, what is the point of kissing her now? It won't lead anywhere. We both looked up at the clear sky. "Nothing happens the way we imagine it," she said.
tr_translation: I can turn sideways and so can he. And then we can kiss. But what's the point of kissing him now anyway? It won't lead anywhere. We are both watching the cloudless sky. "Nothing ever turns out the way you imagine," he says.
es_translation: I could turn around, and she could also turn around. And we could kiss. But what sense does it make to kiss her now? It's something that won't go anywhere. We both gaze at the cloudless sky. —Things never happen the way you imagine —he tells me.

en: The sky is like a monochromatic contemporary painting, drawing me in with its illusion of depth, pulling me up. “Yeah, that’s true,” I say. But then after I think about it for a second, I add, “But then again, if you don’t imagine, nothing ever happens at all.” Imagining isn’t perfect. You can’t get all the way inside someone else. I could never have imagined Margo’s anger at being found, or the story she was writing over. But imagining being someone else, or the world being something else, is the only way in. It is the machine that kills fascists.
vi: Bầu trời lúc này như một tác phẩm hội họa đương đại đơn sắc, hút lấy tôi bằng ảo ảnh về chiều sâu của nó, kéo tôi lên mãi. “Ừ, đúng vậy,” tôi nói. Nhưng rồi nghĩ một giây, tôi thêm vào, “Nhưng nếu không tưởng tượng, chẳng điều gì có thể xảy ra cả.” Tưởng tượng không hoàn hảo. Ta không thể tưởng tượng được mọi mặt bên trong một người khác. Tôi chưa từng tưởng tượng được Margo lại có thể nổi giận như cô ấy vừa bộc lộ ra, cũng như câu chuyện cô ấy đã viết. Nhưng tưởng tượng mình là người khác, hoặc tưởng tượng thế giới này khác đi, là cách duy nhất để vào trong được. Đó là cỗ máy diệt được phát-xít.
tr: Gökyüzü tek renkli bir modem resim gibi, derinlik yanılsamasıyla beni yukarı doğru, kendine çekiyor. “Evet, doğru,” diyorum. Ama bir saniye düşündükten sonra ekliyorum: “Ama hayal etmezsen, hiçbir şey de gerçekleşmez.” Hayal etmek kusursuz değil. Bir insanın tamamen içine giremezsiniz. Margo’nun bulununca sinirleneceğini ya da yazdığı hikâyeyi asla hayal edemezdim. Ama başka bir insan olmayı ya da dünyanın başka bir şey olmasını hayal etmek, tek giriş yolu. Bu, faşistleri öldüren makine.
es: El cielo es como un cuadro monocromático contemporáneo, su ilusión de profundidad me atrae y me eleva. —Sí, es verdad —le digo. Pero lo pienso un segundo y añado—: Pero también es verdad que si no imaginas, nunca pasa nada. Imaginar no es perfecto. No puedes meterte dentro de otra persona. Nunca me habría imaginado la rabia de Margo cuando la encontramos, ni la historia que estaba escribiendo. Pero imaginar que eres otra persona, o que el mundo es otra cosa, es la única manera de entrar. Es la máquina que mata fascistas.
vi_translation: The sky at this moment is like a monochromatic contemporary painting, drawing me in with the illusion of its depth, pulling me ever upwards. "Yes, that's right," I said. But then, after a second of thought, I added, "But if we don't imagine, nothing can happen at all." Imagination is not perfect. We cannot imagine every aspect inside another person. I had never imagined that Margo could get as angry as she just did, nor the story she had written. But imagining oneself as someone else, or imagining the world differently, is the only way to get inside. That is the machine that can destroy fascists.
tr_translation: The sky is like a monochrome modern painting, with the illusion of depth pulling me upward, towards itself. “Yes, that's right,” I say. But after thinking for a second, I add: “But if you don't imagine, nothing will happen.” Imagining is not perfect. You can't fully enter into another person. I could never imagine Margo getting angry when found or the story she wrote. But imagining being another person or the world being something else is the only way in. This is the machine that kills fascists.
es_translation: The sky is like a contemporary monochromatic painting, its illusion of depth attracts and elevates me. —Yes, it's true —I tell him. But I think for a second and add—: But it's also true that if you don't imagine, nothing ever happens. Imagining is not perfect. You can't get inside another person. I could never have imagined Margo's rage when we found her, nor the story she was writing. But imagining that you are someone else, or that the world is something else, is the only way to enter. It is the machine that kills fascists.

en: She turns over toward me and puts her head onto my shoulder, and we lie there, as I long ago imagined lying on the grass at SeaWorld. It has taken us thousands of miles and many days, but here we are: her head on my shoulder, her breath on my neck, the fatigue thick inside both of us. We are now as I wished we could be then.
vi: Margo quay sang và gối đầu lên vai tôi, và chúng tôi nằm đó, như cách đây lâu lâu tôi từng tưởng tượng hai đứa tôi nằm trên thảm cỏ trong SeaWorld. Phải mất hàng ngàn dặm đường và nhiều ngày trời, nhưng giờ chúng tôi đang ở đây: mái đầu cô ấy gối lên vai tôi, hơi thở của cô ấy trên cổ tôi, cơn mệt mỏi giặm sâu trong lòng hai đứa. Chúng tôi bây giờ giống như khi ấy tôi đã từng ao ước.
tr: Bana dönüp elini omzuma koyuyor ve orada öyle uzanıyoruz, SeaWorld’de uzun zaman önce çimenlerde uzandığımızı hayal ettiğim gibi. Bize binlerce kilometreye ve bir sürü güne mal oldu ama işte buradayız: Onun başı benim omzumda, nefesi boynumda, ikimizde de derinlere işlemiş bir yorgunluk var. Şu anda tıpkı o zaman olmayı dilediğim gibiyiz.
es: Se gira hacia mí, apoya la cabeza en mi hombro y nos quedamos tumbados, como nos imaginé en la hierba del SeaWorld. Hemos necesitado miles de kilómetros y muchos días, pero aquí estamos: su cabeza sobre mi hombro, su respiración en mi cuello y el enorme cansancio de los dos. Estamos ahora como habría deseado estar entonces.
vi_translation: Margo turned and rested her head on my shoulder, and we lay there, just as I had imagined long ago, the two of us lying on the grass in SeaWorld. It took thousands of miles and many days, but now we are here: her head resting on my shoulder, her breath on my neck, the fatigue deeply embedded in both of us. We are now just as I had once wished.
tr_translation: He turns to me, puts his hand on my shoulder, and we lie there just like that, as I had imagined us lying on the grass at SeaWorld a long time ago. It cost us thousands of kilometers and many days, but here we are: His head on my shoulder, his breath on my neck, There is a fatigue deeply ingrained in both of us. Right now, we are just as I wished we were back then.
es_translation: She turns towards me, rests her head on my shoulder, and we lie down, just as I imagined us in the grass at SeaWorld. We have traveled thousands of kilometers and many days, but here we are: her head on my shoulder, her breath on my neck, and the immense fatigue of both of us. We are now as I would have wished to be then.

en: When I wake up, the dying light of the day makes everything seem to matter, from the yellowing sky to the stalks of grass above my head, waving in slow motion like a beauty queen. I roll onto my side and see Margo Roth Spiegelman on her hands and knees a few feet from me, the jeans tight against her legs. It takes me a moment to realize that she is digging. I crawl over to her and start to dig beside her, the dirt beneath the grass dry as dust in my fingers. She smiles at me. My heart beats at the speed of sound.
vi: Khi tôi tỉnh dậy, ánh ngày đang tắt dần khiến mọi thứ trông thật đặc biệt, từ bầu trời vàng óng tới những thân cỏ trên đầu tôi, dập dìu đung đưa như nữ hoàng sắc đẹp. Tôi nằm nghiêng, thấy Margo Roth Spiegelman đang quì trên đất cách tôi mấy mét, quần jeans bó lấy chân. Mất một lúc tôi mới nhận ra Margo đang đào. Tôi bò về phía đó và bắt đầu đào cạnh cô ấy, đất dưới lớp cỏ khô như bụi trong những ngón tay tôi. Margo nhìn tôi mỉm cười. Tim tôi đập loạn như vận tốc của âm thanh.
tr: Uyandığımda günün ölmekte olan ışığı her şeyin önemliymiş gibi görünmesini sağlıyor, sararan gökyüzünden, başımın üzerinde bir güzellik kraliçesi gibi yavaş hareketlerle el sallayan çimen saplarına kadar. Yana dönüyorum ve Margo Roth Spiegelman’ı benden birkaç metre uzakta elleriyle dizlerinin üzerinde görüyorum, pantolonu bacaklarına yapışmış. Yeri kazdığım fark etmem kısa bir zamanımı alıyor. Ona doğru emekliyorum ve yanında kazmaya başlıyorum, çimenlerin altındaki toprak, parmaklarımdaki toz kadar kuru. Bana gülümsüyor. Kalbim ses hızında atıyor.
es: Cuando me despierto, la mortecina luz del día hace que parezca que todo es importante, desde el cielo amarillento hasta los tallos de hierba por encima de mi cabeza, que oscilan a cámara lenta como una reina de la belleza. Me coloco de lado y veo a Margo Roth Spiegelman arrodillada y con las manos en el suelo a unos metros de mí, los vaqueros se le ajustan a sus piernas. Tardo un momento en darme cuenta de que está cavando. Me arrastro hasta ella y empiezo a cavar a su lado. La tierra debajo de la hierba está seca como polvo entre mis dedos. Me sonríe. Me late el corazón a la velocidad del sonido.
vi_translation: When I woke up, the daylight was fading, making everything look so special, from the golden sky to the blades of grass above me, swaying like beauty queens. I lay on my side, seeing Margo Roth Spiegelman kneeling on the ground a few meters away from me, her jeans clinging to her legs. It took me a moment to realize Margo was digging. I crawled over and started digging next to her, the soil beneath the dry grass crumbling like dust in my fingers. Margo looked at me and smiled. My heart pounded wildly like the speed of sound.
tr_translation: When I wake up, the dying light of the day makes everything seem important, from the yellowing sky to the blades of grass waving slowly above my head like a beauty queen. I turn to the side and see Margo Roth Spiegelman a few meters away from me, with her hands on her knees, her pants clinging to her legs. It takes me a short time to realize that I am digging the ground. I crawl towards her and start digging beside her, the soil beneath the grass as dry as the dust on my fingers. She smiles at me. My heart is beating at the speed of sound.
es_translation: When I wake up, the dim daylight makes everything seem important, from the yellowish sky to the blades of grass above my head, swaying in slow motion like a beauty queen. I turn to the side and see Margo Roth Spiegelman kneeling with her hands on the ground a few meters from me, her jeans hugging her legs. It takes me a moment to realize that she is digging. I crawl over to her and start digging beside her. The earth beneath the grass is dry as dust between my fingers. She smiles at me. My heart beats at the speed of sound.

en: “What are we digging to?” I ask her.
vi: “Mình đang đào cái gì vậy?” tôi hỏi cô ấy.
tr: “Niçin kazıyoruz?” diye soruyorum.
es: —¿Qué estamos cavando? —le pregunto.
vi_translation: “What are we digging?” I asked her.
tr_translation: "Why are we digging?" I ask.
es_translation: —What are we digging? —I ask him.

en: “That’s not the right question,” she says. “The question is, Who are we digging for?”
vi: “Đó không phải câu hỏi thích hợp,” Margo đáp. “Câu hỏi phải là, ta đang đào đất cho ai?”
tr: “Doğru soru bu değil,” diyor. “Doğru soru, kimin için kazıyoruz.
es: —No es la pregunta correcta —me dice—. La pregunta es: ¿para quién estamos cavando?
vi_translation: “That's not the right question,” Margo replied. “The question should be, who are we digging for?”
tr_translation: “That is not the right question,” he says. “The right question is, for whom are we digging.”
es_translation: —That is not the right question —he tells me—. The question is: For whom are we digging?

en: “Okay, then. Who are we digging for?”
vi: “Ừ, được rồi, ta đang đào đất cho ai thế?”
tr: “Tamam o zaman. Kimin için kazıyoruz?
es: —De acuerdo. ¿Para quién estamos cavando?
vi_translation: “Alright, who am I digging the soil for?”
tr_translation: “Alright then. Who are we digging for?”
es_translation: —Alright. Who are we digging for?

en: “We are digging graves for Little Margo and Little Quentin and puppy Myrna Mountweazel and poor dead Robert Joyner,” she says.
vi: “Ta đang đào mộ cho nhóc Margo, nhóc Quentin, cún Myrna Mountweazel và bác Robert Joyner tội nghiệp đã quá cố,” Margo đáp.
tr: “Küçük Margo, Küçük Quentin, Yavru Köpek Myma Mountweazel ve zavallı ölü Robert Joyner için mezar kazıyoruz,” diyor.
es: —Estamos cavando tumbas para la pequeña Margo, el pequeño Quentin, la cachorrilla Myrna Mountweazel y el pobre Robert Joyner muerto —me contesta.
vi_translation: “I am digging a grave for little Margo, little Quentin, the dog Myrna Mountweazel, and poor deceased Mr. Robert Joyner,” Margo replied.
tr_translation: "We are digging graves for Little Margo, Little Quentin, Puppy Myma Mountweazel, and poor dead Robert Joyner," he says.
es_translation: —We are digging graves for little Margo, little Quentin, the puppy Myrna Mountweazel, and poor dead Robert Joyner —he answers me.

en: “I can get behind those burials, I think,” I say. The dirt is clumpy and dry, drilled through with the paths of insects like an abandoned ant farm. We dig our bare hands into the ground over and over again, each fistful of earth accompanied by a little cloud of dust. We dig the hole wide and deep. This grave must be proper. Soon I’m reaching in as deep as my elbows. The sleeve of my shirt gets dusty when I wipe the sweat from my cheek. Margo’s cheeks are reddening. I can smell her, and she smells like that night right before we jumped into the moat at SeaWorld.
vi: “Chắc tớ đuối với những đám tang này quá,” tôi nói. Đất lổn nhổn và khô, dọc ngang đường đi của côn trùng trong lòng đất, trông như một trang trại kiến bị bỏ hoang. Bọn tôi đào bằng tay trần vào đất, mỗi nắm đất đi kèm một đám mây bụi nho nhỏ. Hai đứa đào một cái hố sâu và rộng. Ngôi mộ này thích hợp phải biết. Chẳng mấy chốc tôi đào sâu đến khuỷu tay. Tay áo tôi lem bụi khi tôi quyệt mồ hôi trên má. Hai má cô ấy hồng lên. Tôi ngửi thấy mùi của Margo, cô ấy thơm giống như đêm hôm ấy, ngay trước khi chúng tôi nhảy xuống hào nước ở SeaWorld.
tr: “Bu cenaze törenlerinden geri kalamam,” diyorum. Toprak topak topak ve kuru, terk edilmiş bir karınca yuvası gibi, böceklerin açtığı yollarla delinmiş. Çıplak ellerimizi tekrar tekrar toprağa sokuyoruz, her avuç dolusu toprağa küçük bir toz bulutu eşlik ediyor. Derin ve geniş bir çukur kazıyoruz. Bu mezar düzgün olmak. Az sonra dirseklerime kadar kazmış buluyorum kendimi. Yanağımdaki teri silince tişörtümün kolu tozlanıyor. Margo’nun yanakları kızarıyor. Kokusunu duyabiliyorum ve o gece SeaWorld’de tam hendeğe atlamamızdan önceki gibi kokuyor.
es: —Creo que apoyo esos entierros —le digo. La tierra es grumosa y seca, perforada por el paso de insectos como un hormiguero abandonado. Hundimos las manos en el suelo una y otra vez, y cada puñado de tierra arrastra una pequeña nube de polvo. Abrimos un agujero grande y profundo. La tumba debe ser apropiada. No tardo en llegar a los codos. Se me ensucia la manga de la camiseta cuando me seco el sudor de la mejilla. Las mejillas de Margo están cada vez más rojas. Me llega su olor, y huele como aquella noche antes de que saltáramos al foso en el SeaWorld.
vi_translation: “I think I'm overwhelmed with all these funerals,” I said. The ground was rough and dry, crisscrossed with the paths of underground insects, looking like an abandoned ant farm. We dug into the earth with our bare hands, each handful of soil accompanied by a small cloud of dust. The two of us dug a deep and wide hole. This grave is just perfect. Soon, I was digging down to my elbows. My sleeves got dusty as I wiped the sweat off my cheek. Her cheeks turned rosy. I could smell Margo, she smelled just like that night, right before we jumped into the moat at SeaWorld.
tr_translation: “I can't miss these funerals,” I say. The soil is clumpy and dry, like an abandoned ant nest, perforated with paths made by insects. We repeatedly dig our bare hands into the soil, and a small cloud of dust accompanies each handful of earth. We are digging a deep and wide hole. This grave must be neat. Soon, I find myself digging up to my elbows. When I wipe the sweat off my cheek, the sleeve of my t-shirt gets dusty. Margo's cheeks are turning red. I can smell her, and it smells just like that night at SeaWorld, right before we jumped into the moat.
es_translation: —I think I support those burials —I tell him. The earth is lumpy and dry, perforated by the passage of insects like an abandoned anthill. We sink our hands into the ground again and again, and each handful of soil drags a small cloud of dust. We open a large and deep hole. The grave must be appropriate. It doesn't take long to reach my elbows. My shirt sleeve gets dirty when I wipe the sweat from my cheek. Margo's cheeks are getting redder and redder.
