Her scent reaches me, and it smells like that night before we jumped into the pit at SeaWorld.

en: “I never really thought of him as a real person,” she says.
vi: “Tớ chưa bao giờ thực sự nghĩ rằng bác ấy là một người có thật,” cô ấy nói.
tr: “Onu gerçek bir insan olarak hiç düşünmemiştim,” diyor.
es: —Nunca he pensado en él como en una persona real —me dice.
vi_translation: “I never really thought that he was a real person,” she said.
tr_translation: "I had never thought of him as a real person," she says.
es_translation: —I have never thought of him as a real person —she tells me.

en: When she speaks, I take the opportunity to take a break, and sit back on my haunches. “Who, Robert Joyner?”
vi: Trong khi Margo nói, tôi tận dụng thời gian nghỉ một lát và ngồi bệt xuống. “Ai cơ, Robert Joyner à?”
tr: Konuştuğunda, elime bir ara verme fırsatı geçiyor ve oturuyorum. “Kimi, Robert Joyner’ı mı?
es: Mientras habla, aprovecho la ocasión para hacer una pausa y me siento en cuclillas. —¿En quién, en Robert Joyner?
vi_translation: While Margo was talking, I took advantage of the break and sat down. "Who, Robert Joyner?"
tr_translation: When she talks, I get a chance to take a break and sit down. "Who, Robert Joyner?""
es_translation: While he speaks, I take the opportunity to pause and squat down. —In whom, in Robert Joyner?

en: She keeps digging. “Yeah. I mean, he was something that happened to me, you know? But before he was this minor figure in the drama of my life, he was—you know, the central figure in the drama of his own life.”
vi: Margo vẫn đào tiếp. “Ừ. Bác ấy như một điều gì đó xảy ra với tớ, cậu hiểu chứ? Nhưng trước khi bác ấy là nhân vật bé nhỏ này trong vở kịch của cuộc đời tớ, bác ấy đã là–cậu biết đấy, nhân vật chính trong vở kịch của cuộc đời bác ấy.”
tr: Kazmaya devam ediyor. “Evet. Yani o benim başıma gelen bir şeydi, anlatabiliyor muyum? Ama benim hayat dramımda küçük bir rol almadan önce o... kendi hayatının dramında başkahramandı.”
es: Sigue cavando. —Sí. Bueno, ya sabes, fue algo que me sucedió a mí. Pero antes de que fuera una figura menor en el drama de mi vida, era… en fin, la figura central del drama de su propia vida.
vi_translation: Margo kept digging. "Yeah. He was like something that happened to me, you know? But before he was this little character in the play of my life, he was—you know, the main character in the play of his own life."
tr_translation: He continues digging. “Yes. I mean, it was something that happened to me, do you understand? But before he took a small role in the drama of my life... he was the main character in the drama of his own life.”
es_translation: Keep digging. —Yes. Well, you know, it was something that happened to me. But before he was a minor figure in the drama of my life, he was... well, the central figure in the drama of his own life.

en: I have never really thought of him as a person, either. A guy who played in the dirt like me. A guy who fell in love like me. A guy whose strings were broken, who didn’t feel the root of his leaf of grass connected to the field, a guy who was cracked. Like me. “Yeah,” I say after a while as I return to digging. “He was always just a body to me.”
vi: Tôi cũng chưa từng nghĩ đến bác ấy như một con người. Một người cũng bày trò nghịch đất như tôi. Một người cũng biết yêu như tôi. Một người có những dây nối đã đứt hết, không cảm thấy gốc rễ nhánh cỏ của mình ăn vào lòng đất, một người đã bị nứt ra. Như tôi. “Ừ,” lúc sau tôi nói và quay lại đào tiếp. “Đối với tớ bác ấy luôn chỉ là một cái xác thôi.”
tr: Ben de onu gerçek bir insan olarak hiç düşünmemiştim. Benim gibi toprakta oynayan bir adam olarak. Benim gibi âşık olan bir adam olarak. İpleri kopmuş bir adam olarak, kendi çimen yaprağı kökünün çayıra bağlı olduğunu hissetmemiş, çatlamış bir adam olarak. Benim gibi. “Evet," diyorum bir süre sonra kazmaya geri dönerken. “Benim için her /. aman bir ceset oldu.
es: Yo tampoco he pensado nunca en él como persona. Un tipo que jugó en la tierra como yo. Un tipo que se enamoró como yo. Un tipo al que se le rompieron los hilos, que no sintió que las raíces de su hoja de hierba estuvieran conectadas con el campo, un tipo que estaba chiflado. Como yo. —Sí —digo al rato, mientras vuelvo a cavar—. Siempre fue solo un cadáver para mí.
vi_translation: I also never thought of him as a human being. A person who also played with dirt like me. A person who also knew how to love like me. A person whose connections were all severed, who couldn't feel the roots of his grass reaching into the earth, a person who had cracked open. Like me. "Yeah," I said after a while and turned back to continue digging. "To me, he was always just a corpse."
tr_translation: I had never thought of him as a real person either. As a man playing in the dirt like me. As a man who falls in love like me. As a man who had broken strings, who had never felt that his own grass blade root was connected to the meadow, a cracked man. Like me. “Yes," I say after a while, returning to digging. “For me, he was always a corpse. always a corpse.”
es_translation: I have never thought of him as a person either. A guy who played on the earth like me. A guy who fell in love like me. A guy whose threads broke, who didn't feel that the roots of his blade of grass were connected to the field, a guy who was crazy. Like me. —Yes —I say after a while, as I resume digging—. It was always just a corpse to me.

en: “I wish we could have done something,” she says. “I wish we could have proven how heroic we were.”
vi: “Tớ ước sao tụi mình đã làm được chuyện gì đó ra hồn,” cô ấy bảo. “Tớ ước sao tụi mình đã tỏ ra được là tụi mình anh hùng cỡ nào.”
tr: “Keşke bir şey yapabilseydik,” diyor. “Keşke ne kadar cesur olduğumuzu kanıtlayabiİsiydik.
es: —Ojalá hubiéramos podido hacer algo —dice Margo—. Ojalá hubiéramos podido demostrar lo heroicos que éramos.
vi_translation: “I wish we had done something worthwhile,” she said. “I wish we had shown how heroic we are.”
tr_translation: “I wish we could have done something,” he says. “I wish we could have proven how brave we are.”
es_translation: —I wish we could have done something —says Margo—. I wish we could have shown how heroic we were.

en: “Yeah,” I say. “It would have been nice to tell him that, whatever it was, that it didn’t have to be the end of the world.”
vi: “Ừa,” tôi đáp lời. “Giá mà ta nói được với bác ấy rằng, dù chuyện gì có xảy ra thì đó cũng không nhất thiết phải là ngày tận thế.”
tr: “Evet,” diyorum. “Ona bunu söylemek güzel olurdu, her ne olduysa, dünyanın sonu olmasına gerek yoktu.
es: —Sí. Habría estado bien decirle que, fuera lo que fuese, no tenía por qué ser el fin del mundo.
vi_translation: "Yeah," I replied. "I wish we could tell him that no matter what happens, it doesn't necessarily have to be the end of the world."
tr_translation: “Yes,” I say. “It would be nice to tell him this, whatever happened, it didn't have to be the end of the world.”
es_translation: —Yes. It would have been good to tell him that, whatever it was, it didn't have to be the end of the world.

en: “Yeah, although in the end something kills you.”
vi: “Ừ, dù cuối cùng có cái gì đó đã giết được cậu.”
tr: “Evet, gerçi sonuçta bir şey seni öldürüyor.
es: —Sí, aunque al final lo que sea te mate.
vi_translation: "Yes, in the end, something did kill you."
tr_translation: "Yes, although in the end something kills you."
es_translation: —Yes, although in the end whatever it is will kill you.

en: I shrug. “Yeah, I know. I’m not saying that everything is survivable. Just that everything except the last thing is.” I dig my hand in again, the dirt here so much blacker than back home. I toss a handful into the pile behind us, and sit back. I feel on the edge of an idea, and I try to talk my way into it. I have never spoken this many words in a row to Margo in our long and storied relationship, but here it is, my last play for her.
vi: Tôi nhún vai. “Ừ, tớ biết. Tớ không nói rằng mọi thứ đều sống mãi được. Chỉ là, mọi thứ trừ thứ cuối cùng ra.” Tôi lại sục tay đào tiếp, đất ở đây đen hơn ở nhà nhiều. Tôi thêm một vốc đầy vào đống đất sau lưng, và ngồi xuống. Tôi cảm thấy như đang mon men gần một suy nghĩ, và tôi cố gắng đi vào sâu trong nó. Tôi chưa từng một mạch nói nhiều như thế này với Margo, xét trong mối quan hệ dài và được viết thành truyện giữa chúng tôi. Nhưng nó đây rồi, trò chơi cuối cùng của tôi dành cho cô ấy.
tr: Omuzlarımı silkiyorum. “Evet, biliyorum. Her şeyin dayanılabilir olduğunu söylemiyorum. Sadece son şey hariç her şey dayanılabilir.” Elimi tekrar toprağa sokuyorum, buradaki toprak evdekinden çok daha koyu renkli. Arkamızdaki yığma bir avuç dolusu toprak atıyorum ve geri oturuyorum. Bir fikrin eşiğinde olduğumu hissediyorum ve konuşarak içine girmeye çalışıyorum. Uzun ve hikâyelerle dolu ilişkimizde, Margo’ya art arda hiç bu kadar çok kelime söylememiştim ama işte, onun için son oyunum.
es: Me encojo de hombros. —Sí, lo sé. No estoy diciendo que pueda sobrevivirse a todo. Solo que puede sobrevivirse a todo, menos a lo último. Vuelvo a hundir la mano. La tierra aquí es mucho más oscura que en Orlando. Lanzo un puñado a la pila que está detrás de nosotros y me siento. Se me está ocurriendo una idea e intento abrirme camino hacia ella. Nunca he dicho tantas palabras seguidas a Margo en nuestra larga y notoria relación, pero ahí va, mi última actuación para ella.
vi_translation: I shrugged. "Yeah, I know. I'm not saying everything can live forever. It's just that, everything except the last thing." I dug my hands in again, the soil here was much darker than at home. I added another handful to the pile of dirt behind me, and sat down. I felt like I was on the verge of a thought, and I tried to delve deeper into it. I've never talked this much at once with Margo, considering our long and storied relationship. But here it was, my final game for her.
tr_translation: I shrug my shoulders. "Yes, I know. I'm not saying everything is bearable. Just that everything except the last thing is bearable." I put my hand back into the soil, the soil here is much darker than at home. I throw a handful of soil behind us and sit back down. I feel like I'm on the verge of an idea and try to get into it by talking. In our long and story-filled relationship, I have never said so many words to Margo in succession, but here it is, my last game for her.
es_translation: I shrug my shoulders. —Yes, I know. I'm not saying that one can survive everything. Just that one can survive everything, except the last thing. I sink my hand again. The soil here is much darker than in Orlando. I throw a handful onto the pile behind us and sit down. An idea is occurring to me, and I try to make my way towards it. I have never said so many words in a row to Margo in our long and notorious relationship, but here it goes, my last performance for her.

en: “When I’ve thought about him dying—which admittedly isn’t that much—I always thought of it like you said, that all the strings inside him broke. But there are a thousand ways to look at it: maybe the strings break, or maybe our ships sink, or maybe we’re grass—our roots so interdependent that no one is dead as long as someone is still alive. We don’t suffer from a shortage of metaphors, is what I mean. But you have to be careful which metaphor you choose, because it matters. If you choose the strings, then you’re imagining a world in which you can become irreparably broken. If you choose the grass, you’re saying that we are all infinitely interconnected, that we can use these root systems not only to understand one another but to become one another. The metaphors have implications. Do you know what I mean?”
vi: “Khi nghĩ đến việc bác ấy đã chết–phải nói thật là không nhiều–tớ luôn nghĩ kiểu như cậu đã nói, rằng các dây nối bên trong bác ta đã đứt hết cả rồi. Nhưng có cả ngàn cách để nhìn nhận: có thể là dây nối bị đứt, có thể là tàu chìm, hoặc có thể chúng ta là cỏ–bộ rễ của chúng ta đan cài vào nhau mật thiết đến mức miễn là người nào đó còn sống thì sẽ không có ai chết cả. Ý tớ là chúng ta không thiếu các ẩn dụ. Nhưng ta phải cẩn thận với những ẩn dụ mình chọn dùng, vì điều đó rất hệ trọng. Nếu chọn những sợi dây nối, cậu đang tưởng tượng ra một thế giới nơi cậu có thể bị đứt lìa không gì cứu vãn được. Nếu chọn cỏ, cậu đang muốn nói rằng tất cả chúng ta đều được gắn kết với nhau không hạn định, rằng ta có thể tận dụng bộ rễ ấy để không chỉ hiểu được người khác mà còn trở thành một người khác. Ẩn dụ mang nhiều tầng nghĩa hàm ngôn mà.
tr: “Onun ölümünü düşündüğümdeki itiraf edeyim, o kadar da çok düşünmedimsenin söylediğin gibi, içindeki bütün iplerin koptuğunu düşündüm. Ama bunu algılamanın binlerce yolu var: Belki ipler kopar, belki gemilerimiz batar ya da belki biz çimeniz... Köklerimiz birbirine o kadar bağımlı ki, biri hâlâ hayatta olduğu sürece kimse ölü değil. Metafor kıtlığı çekmiyoruz, demek istediğim bu. Fakat hangi metaforu seçeceğin konusunda dikkatli olmalısın çünkü bu önemli. Eğer ipleri seçiyorsan, o zaman tamir edilemez derecede kopabileceğin bir dünya hayal ediyorsundur. Eğer çimeni seçiyorsan, hepimizin karşılıklı olarak birbirimize son derece bağlı olduğumuzu söylüyorsundur, o zaman şu kök sistemlerini yalnızca birbirimizi anlamak için değil, aynı zamanda birbirimiz haline gelmek için de kullanabiliriz. Metaforların saklı anlamları var. Ne demek istediğimi anlıyor musun?
es: —Cuando pensaba en él muriendo, que admito que no ha sido muchas veces, siempre pensaba en lo que dijiste, en que se le habían roto los hilos por dentro. Pero hay mil maneras de verlo. Quizá los hilos se rompen, o quizá nuestros barcos se hunden, o quizá somos hierba y nuestras raíces son tan interdependientes que nadie está muerto mientras quede alguien vivo. Lo que quiero decir es que no nos faltan las metáforas. Pero debes tener cuidado con la metáfora que eliges, porque es importante. Si eliges los hilos, estás imaginándote un mundo en el que puedes romperte irreparablemente. Si eliges la hierba, estás diciendo que todos estamos infinitamente interconectados, que podemos utilizar ese sistema de raíces no solo para entendernos unos a otros, sino para convertirnos los unos en los otros. Las metáforas implican cosas. ¿Entiendes lo que te digo?
vi_translation: "When I think about the fact that he has died–to be honest, not very often–I always think like you said, that all the internal connections inside him have snapped." "But there are a thousand ways to look at it: maybe the connections snapped, maybe the ship sank, or maybe we are grass–our roots intertwined so closely that as long as someone is alive, no one is truly dead." "I mean, we are not short of metaphors." "But we have to be careful with the metaphors we choose to use, because it is very important." "If you choose the snapped connections, you are imagining a world where you can be irreparably severed." "If you choose grass, you are implying that we are all indefinitely connected, that we can use those roots not only to understand others but to become another person." "Metaphors carry multiple layers of meaning." "Do you understand what I mean?"
tr_translation: "When I thought about his death, let me confess, I didn't think as much as you said, I thought all the strings inside me broke. But there are thousands of ways to perceive this: Maybe the strings break, maybe our ships sink, or maybe we are grass... Our roots are so dependent on each other that as long as one is still alive, no one is dead. We are not short of metaphors, that's what I mean. But you have to be careful about which metaphor you choose because it's important. If you choose the strings, then you are imagining a world where they can break irreparably. If you choose the grass, we are all extremely mutually dependent on each other You are saying that we are connected, so we can use these root systems not only to understand each other but also to become each other. Metaphors have hidden meanings. Do you understand what I mean?”
es_translation: —When I thought about him dying, which I admit hasn't been many times, I always thought about what you said, that his strings had broken inside him. But there are a thousand ways to see it. Maybe the strings break, or maybe our ships sink, or maybe we are grass and our roots are so interdependent that no one is dead as long as someone is alive. What I mean is that we are not short of metaphors. But you must be careful with the metaphor you choose, because it is important. If you choose the strings, you are imagining a world where you can break irreparably. If you choose the grass, you are saying that we are all infinitely interconnected, that we can use that root system not only to understand each other but to become each other. Metaphors imply things. Do you understand what I'm saying?

en: “I like the strings. I always have. Because that’s how it feels. But the strings make pain seem more fatal than it is, I think. We’re not as frail as the strings would make us believe. And I like the grass, too. The grass got me to you, helped me to imagine you as an actual person. But we’re not different sprouts from the same plant. I can’t be you. You can’t be me. You can imagine another well—but never quite perfectly, you know?
vi: “Tớ thích những sợi dây nối. Tớ luôn thích. Vì đó là cách để cảm nhận. Nhưng những dây nối khiến nỗi đau có vẻ dễ dẫn đến cái chết hơn thực tế, tớ nghĩ vậy. Ta không mỏng manh dễ đứt như những sợi dây khiến ta tin như vậy. Và tớ cũng thích cỏ. Cỏ đưa tớ đến với cậu, giúp tớ hình dung ra cậu là một con người thật. Nhưng bọn mình không phải là những nhánh khác nhau trên cùng một cây. Tớ không thể là cậu. Cậu không thể là tớ. Ta có thể tưởng tượng rất đúng về người khác–nhưng không bao giờ tương đối hoàn hảo cả, cậu hiểu chứ?
tr: “İpleri seviyorum. Hep sevdim. Çünkü öyle hissediyorum. Ama ipler, acının, olduğundan daha ölümcül görünmesine neden oluyor sanırım, iplerin bizi inandırdığı kadar dayanıksız değiliz. Ve çimeni de seviyorum. Çimen beni sana getirdi, seni gerçek bir insan olarak hayal etmeme yardımcı oldu. Ama biz aynı bitkinin farkh filizleri değiliz. Ben sen olamam. Sen de ben olamazsın. Başka birini iyi bir şekilde hayal edebilirsin... ama asla tamamen kusursuz olmaz, anlıyor musun?
es: —Me gustan los hilos —sigo diciendo—. Siempre me han gustado. Porque así lo siento. Pero creo que los hilos hacen que el dolor parezca más fatal de lo que es. No somos tan frágiles como nos harían creer los hilos. Y también me gusta la hierba. La hierba me ha traído hasta ti, me ha ayudado a imaginarte como una persona real. Pero no somos brotes diferentes de la misma planta. Yo no puedo ser tú. Tú no puedes ser yo. Puedes imaginarte a otro… pero nunca perfectamente, ¿sabes?
vi_translation: "I like the connecting threads. I've always liked them. Because they are a way to feel. But the threads make the pain seem more likely to lead to death than it actually does, I think. We are not as fragile as the threads make us believe. And I also like grass. Grass brings me to you, helps me imagine you as a real person. But we are not different branches on the same tree. I cannot be you. You cannot be me. We can imagine others very accurately—but never relatively perfectly, you understand?
tr_translation: “I love ropes. I always have. Because that's how I feel. But I think ropes make pain seem more deadly than it is, we are not as fragile as the ropes make us believe. And I love grass too. Grass brought me to you, helped me imagine you as a real person. But we are not different sprouts of the same plant. I cannot be you. And you cannot be me. You can imagine someone else in a good way... but it will never be completely perfect, do you understand?
es_translation: —I like threads —I continue saying—. I've always liked them. Because that's how I feel. But I think threads make pain seem more fatal than it is. We are not as fragile as threads would have us believe. And I also like grass. The grass has brought me to you, it has helped me imagine you as a real person. But we are not different sprouts from the same plant. I cannot be you. You cannot be me. You can imagine another... but never perfectly, you know?

en: “Maybe it’s more like you said before, all of us being cracked open. Like, each of us starts out as a watertight vessel. And these things happen—these people leave us, or don’t love us, or don’t get us, or we don’t get them, and we lose and fail and hurt one another. And the vessel starts to crack open in places. And I mean, yeah, once the vessel cracks open, the end becomes inevitable. Once it starts to rain inside the Osprey, it will never be remodeled. But there is all this time between when the cracks start to open up and when we finally fall apart. And it’s only in that time that we can see one another, because we see out of ourselves through our cracks and into others through theirs. When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.”
vi: “Có lẽ giống nhiều hơn với điều cậu từng nói, tất cả chúng ta đều bị nứt mở. Như thể ban đầu mỗi chúng ta đều là một vỏ tàu kín, nước không lọt vào được. Và những chuyện như vậy xảy ra–những người như vậy rời bỏ ta, hoặc không yêu ta, hoặc không hiểu ta, hoặc ta không hiểu họ, chúng ta mất mát, thất bại và làm đau lòng lẫn nhau. Rồi vỏ tàu bắt đầu nứt ra ở đâu đó. Và đấy, một khi vỏ đã nứt vỡ, thì kết cục là không thể tránh được. Một khi mưa bắt đầu rơi được vào Osprey, sẽ không bao giờ có sửa chữa tu bổ. Nhưng vẫn còn khoảng thời gian này ở giữa, khi những nứt rạn mới chỉ bắt đầu cho tới khi ta hoàn toàn tan rã. Và chỉ có trong thời gian này ta mới có thể nhìn được vào nhau, vì ta thấy được chính mình qua những nứt rạn của ta và nhìn người khác qua những nứt rạn của họ. Khi nào chúng ta đã nhìn thẳng được vào nhau, mặt đối mặt? Chỉ đến khi cậu nhìn vào qua những nứt rạn của tớ và tớ nhìn vào qua những nứt rạn của cậu. Còn trước đó, chúng ta chỉ thấy những ý niệm về nhau, giống như cậu nhìn qua ô cửa sổ nhưng không bao giờ thấy được bên trong. Nhưng một khi những vết nứt đã rạn mở, ánh sáng có thể lọt vào trong. Ánh sáng có thể hắt ra ngoài.”
tr: “Belki önceden söylediğin gibi, hepimiz çatlayıp açılıyoruz. Sanki her birimiz su geçirmez bir kabuk olarak yola çıkıyoruz. Ve bir şeyler oluyor... birileri bizi terk ediyor, sevmiyor, anlamıyor ya da biz onları anlamıyoruz ve kaybediyoruz, başarısız oluyoruz ve birbirimizi incitiyoruz. Ve kabuk bazı yerlerinden çatlayıp açılmaya başlıyor. Yani evet, kabuk bir kere çatladığında, son kaçınılmaz oluyor. Osprey’in içine bir kere yağmur yağmaya başladığında, asla tadilat yapılmayacak. Ama çatlakların açılmaya başladığı an ile parçalandığımız an arasında çok zaman var. Ve ancak o zaman birbirimizi görebiliriz çünkü kendi çatlaklarımızın arasından dışımızdakileri ve başkalarının çatlaklarının arasından da onların içini görüyoruz. Ne zaman birbirimizi yüz yüze gördük? Sen benim çatlaklarımın içini, ben de seninkilerin içini görene kadar değil. Ondan önce, sadece birbirimizin fikirlerine bakıyorduk, pencerendeki jaluziye bakıp içeriyi hiç görmemek gibi. Ama kabuk bir kere çatladığında ışık içeri girebiliyor. Işık dışarı çıkabiliyor.
es: »Quizá es más como has dicho antes, que todos estamos agrietados. Cada uno de nosotros empieza siendo un recipiente hermético. Y pasan cosas. Personas que nos dejan, o que no nos quieren, o que no nos entienden, o que no las entendemos, y nos perdemos, nos fallamos y nos hacemos daño. Y el recipiente empieza a agrietarse por algunos sitios. Y, sí, en cuanto el recipiente se agrieta, el final es inevitable. En cuanto empieza a entrar la lluvia dentro del Osprey, ya nunca será remodelado. Pero está todo ese tiempo desde que las grietas empiezan a abrirse hasta que por fin nos desmoronamos. Y solo en ese tiempo podemos vernos unos a otros, porque vemos lo que hay fuera a través de nuestras grietas, y lo que hay dentro se nos ve también a través de ellas. ¿Cuándo nos vimos tú y yo cara a cara? No hasta que me viste entre mis grietas, y yo a ti entre las tuyas. Hasta ese momento solo veíamos ideas del otro, como mirar tu persiana, pero sin ver lo que había dentro. Pero cuando el recipiente se rompe, la luz puede entrar. Y puede salir.
vi_translation: "Perhaps more like what you once said, we are all cracked open. As if each of us was initially a sealed ship's hull, impervious to water. And then things like this happen—people like this leave us, or don't love us, or don't understand us, or we don't understand them, we experience loss, failure, and we hurt each other. Then the hull begins to crack somewhere. And there, once the hull has cracked, the outcome is inevitable. Once the rain starts getting into the Osprey, there will never be any repair or restoration. But there is still this time in between, when the cracks are just beginning until we completely fall apart. And only during this time can we see each other, because we see ourselves through our own cracks and see others through their cracks. When have we ever looked directly at each other, face to face? Only when you look through my cracks and I look through yours. Before that, we only saw ideas of each other, like looking through a window but never seeing inside. But once the cracks have opened, light can come in. Light can shine out."
tr_translation: “Maybe, as you said before, we are all cracking open. It’s as if each of us starts out as a waterproof shell. And something happens... someone leaves us, doesn’t love us, doesn’t understand us, or we don’t understand them and we lose, we fail, and we hurt each other. And the shell starts to crack open in some places. So yes, once the shell cracks, the end becomes inevitable. Once rain starts to pour into the Osprey, it will never be repaired. But there is a lot of time between the moment the cracks start to open and the moment we shatter. And only then can we see each other because we see the outside through our own cracks and the inside of others through their cracks. When did we ever see each other face to face? Not until you saw inside my cracks and I saw inside yours. Before that, we were just looking at each other’s ideas, like looking at the blinds on your window without ever seeing inside. But once the shell cracks, light can come in. Light can go out.”
es_translation: »Maybe it's more like you said before, that we are all cracked. Each one of us starts off as a sealed vessel. And things happen. People leave us, or don't love us, or don't understand us, or we don't understand them, and we get lost, we fail, and we hurt each other. And the vessel starts to crack in some places. And, yes, once the vessel cracks, the end is inevitable. Once the rain starts to get inside the Osprey, it will never be refurbished. But there's all that time from when the cracks start to open until we finally crumble. And only in that time can we see each other, because we see what is outside through our cracks, and what is inside can also be seen through them. When did you and I see each other face to face? Not until you saw me through my cracks, and I saw you through yours. Until that moment we only saw ideas of each other, like looking at your blind, but without seeing what was inside. But when the vessel breaks, the light can enter. And it can exit.

en: She raises her fingers to her lips, as if concentrating, or as if hiding her mouth from me, or as if to feel the words she speaks. “You’re pretty something,” she says finally. She stares at me, my eyes and her eyes and nothing between them. I have nothing to gain from kissing her. But I am no longer looking to gain anything. “There’s something I have to do,” I say, and she nods very slightly, as if she knows the something, and I kiss her.
vi: Margo đặt những ngón tay lên môi, trông như đang tập trung, hoặc như đang giấu không cho tôi nhìn thấy môi cô ấy, hoặc như đang cảm nhận những từ ngữ mà cô ấy muốn nói. “Cậu thực sự là một cái gì đó,” cuối cùng Margo nói. Cô ấy chăm chú nhìn tôi, mắt tôi và mắt cô ấy và không gì giữa chúng. Tôi chẳng đạt được gì nếu hôn cô ấy. Nhưng tôi không còn đi tìm những điều để đạt được nữa. “Có việc này tớ cần phải làm,” tôi nói, cô ấy gật đầu rất khẽ, như thể đã biết, và tôi hôn cô ấy.
tr: Parmaklarını dudaklarına götürüyor, sanki yoğunlaşıyormuş ya da ağzını benden saklıyormuş ya da söyleyeceği kelimeleri hissetmek istiyormuş gibi. “Sende gerçekten bir şeyler var,” diyor sonımda. Uzun uzun bana bakıyor, benim gözlerim ve onun gözleri... aralarında hiçbir şey yok. Onu öpmekle elime geçecek hiçbir şey yok. Ama artık elime bir şey geçmesini beklemiyorum. ‘Yapmak zorunda olduğum bir şey var,” diyorum, belli belirsiz başını sallıyor, sanki bunun ne olduğunu biliyormuş gibi ve onu öpüyorum.
es: Se lleva los dedos a los labios, como si estuviera concentrándose, o como si me ocultara la boca, o como si quisiera sentir sus palabras. —Eres especial —me dice por fin. Me mira. Mis ojos, sus ojos y nada entre ellos. No voy a ganar nada besándola, pero ya no pretendo ganar nada. —Hay algo que tengo que hacer —le digo. Asiente ligeramente, como si supiera qué es ese algo. Y la beso.
vi_translation: Margo placed her fingers on her lips, looking as if she was concentrating, or as if she was hiding her lips from me, or as if she was feeling the words she wanted to say. "You really are something," Margo finally said. She looked at me intently, my eyes and her eyes and nothing between them. I would gain nothing by kissing her. But I was no longer looking for things to gain. "There's something I need to do," I said, and she nodded very slightly, as if she already knew, and I kissed her.
tr_translation: She brings her fingers to her lips, as if she is concentrating or hiding her mouth from me or wanting to feel the words she is about to say. "There really is something about you," she says at last. She looks at me for a long time, my eyes and her eyes... there is nothing between them. There is nothing to gain by kissing her. But I no longer expect to gain anything. "There is something I have to do," I say, she nods faintly, as if she knows what it is, and I kiss her.
es_translation: She brings her fingers to her lips, as if she were concentrating, or as if she were hiding her mouth from me, or as if she wanted to feel her words. —You are special —he finally tells me. She looks at me. My eyes, her eyes, and nothing between them. I'm not going to gain anything by kissing her, but I no longer intend to gain anything. —There is something I have to do —I tell him. Nods slightly, as if knowing what that something is. And I kiss her.

en: It ends quite a while later when she says, “You can come to New York. It will be fun. It will be like kissing.”
vi: Chúng tôi rời nhau một lúc lâu rồi Margo mới nói, “Cậu có thể đến New York. Sẽ vui lắm. Giống như hôn nhau vậy.”
tr: Öpüşmemiz uzun bir süre sonra M,argo konuştuğunda bitiyor. “New York’a gelebilirsin. Kğleneeli olur. Öpüşmek gibi.
es: El beso acaba un rato después, cuando me dice: —Puedes venir a Nueva York. Será divertido. Será como besarnos.
vi_translation: We parted ways for a long time before Margo finally said, "You could come to New York. It would be fun. Like kissing."
tr_translation: Our kiss ends when Margo speaks after a long time. "You can come to New York. It would be fun. Like kissing."
es_translation: The kiss ends a while later, when she says to me: —You can come to New York. It will be fun. It will be like kissing each other.

en: And I say, “Kissing is pretty something.”
vi: Và tôi nói, “Hôn thực sự là một cái gì đó.”
tr: Ben de, “Öpüşmekle gerçekten bir şeyler var,” diyorum.
es: —Besarnos es especial —le digo.
vi_translation: And I said, "Kissing is really something."
tr_translation: And I say, "There really is something about kissing."
es_translation: —Kissing each other is special —I tell her.

en: And she says, “You’re saying no.”
vi: Và cô ấy nói, “Cậu đang từ chối.
tr: O da, “Hayır diyorsun,” iliyor.
es: —Estás diciéndome que no —me contesta.
vi_translation: And she said, "You are refusing."
tr_translation: He also says, "You are saying no."
es_translation: —You're telling me no —he replies.

en: And I say, “Margo, I have a whole life there, and I’m not you, and I—” But I can’t say anything because she kisses me again, and it’s in the moment that she kisses me that I know without question that we’re headed in different directions. She stands up and walks over to where we were sleeping, to her backpack. She pulls out the moleskin notebook, walks back to the grave, and places it in the ground.
vi: Tôi bảo, “Margo ơi, tớ có cả cuộc đời mình ở đây, tớ không phải cậu, và tớ–” Nhưng tôi không thể nói thêm gì vì Margo lại hôn tôi, và chính khoảnh khắc cô ấy đặt môi lên tôi, tôi đã biết mà không cần đặt câu hỏi nào, rằng chúng tôi rẽ những ngả khác nhau. Cô ấy đứng dậy đi về chỗ chúng tôi vừa nằm ngủ, lấy ba-lô. Margo lấy cuốn sổ bìa da màu đen, quay trở lại huyệt mộ, đặt cuốn sổ vào lòng đất.
tr: “Margo, bütün hayatım orada ve ben sen değilim, ben...” Ama hiçbir şey söyleyemiyorum çi'mkii beni tekrar öpüyor ve beni öptüğü anda, farklı yönlere doğru gittiğimizi kesinlikle anlıyorum. Ayağa kalkıp uyuduğumuz yere, sırt çantasına yürüyor. Not defterini çıkarıyor, tekrar mezara yürüyor ve defteri oraya yerleştiriyor.
es: —Margo, toda mi vida está allí, y no soy tú, y… Pero no puedo decir nada más, porque vuelve a besarme, y en el momento en que me besa sé sin la menor duda que llevamos caminos distintos. Se levanta y se dirige hacia donde estábamos tumbados para coger su mochila. Saca la libreta, vuelve a la tumba y deja la libreta en el suelo.
vi_translation: I said, "Margo, I have my whole life here, I'm not you, and I–" But I couldn't say anything more because Margo kissed me again, and the moment she placed her lips on mine, I knew without needing to ask any questions, that we were heading in different directions. She stood up and went back to where we had just been sleeping, and grabbed her backpack. Margo took out a black leather-bound notebook, returned to the grave, and placed the notebook into the ground.
tr_translation: “Margo, my whole life is there and I am not you, I...” But I can't say anything because she kisses me again and at the moment she kisses me, I absolutely understand that we are heading in different directions. She stands up and walks to where we slept, to the backpack. She takes out the notebook, walks back to the grave, and places the notebook there.
es_translation: —Margo, my entire life is there, and I am not you, and… But I can't say anything more, because he kisses me again, and at the moment he kisses me, I know without the slightest doubt that we are on different paths. He gets up and heads to where we were lying to grab his backpack. He takes out the notebook, returns to the grave, and leaves the notebook on the ground.

en: “I’ll miss you,” she whispers, and I don’t know if she’s talking to me or to the notebook. Nor do I know to whom I’m talking when I say, “As will I.”
vi: “Tớ sẽ nhớ cậu,” Margo thì thầm. Tôi không biết cô ấy đang nói với tôi hay với cuốn sổ. Tôi cũng không biết mình nói với ai khi thốt lên, “Tớ cũng vậy.”
tr: “Seni özleyeceğim,” diye fısıldıyor, benimle mi yoksa defterle ' mi konuştuğunu bilmiyorum. Konuştuğumda kiminle konuştuğumu da bilmiyorum: “Ben de.
es: —Te echaré de menos —susurra. Y no sé si habla conmigo o con la libreta. Y tampoco yo sé con quién hablo cuando digo: —Yo también.
vi_translation: "I'll miss you," Margo whispered. I didn't know if she was talking to me or to the notebook. I also didn't know who I was talking to when I said, "Me too."
tr_translation: "I will miss you," he whispers, I don't know if he's talking to me or the notebook. When I speak, I don't know who I'm talking to either: "Me too."
es_translation: —I will miss you —she whispers. And I don't know if he is talking to me or to the notebook. And I also don't know who I'm talking to when I say: —Me too.

en: “Godspeed, Robert Joyner,” I say, and drop a handful of dirt onto the notebook.
vi: “Hãy bình an nhé, bác Robert Joyner,” tôi nói, thả một nắm đất lên cuốn sổ.
tr: “Tanrı yanında olsun, Robert Joyner,” diyorum ve bir avuç dolusu toprağı defterin üzerine atıyorum.
es: Ve con Dios, Robert Joyner. Lanzo un puñado de tierra sobre la libreta.
vi_translation: "Rest in peace, Mr. Robert Joyner," I said, dropping a handful of soil onto the notebook.
tr_translation: “May God be with you, Robert Joyner,” I say, and throw a handful of soil onto the notebook.
es_translation: Go with God, Robert Joyner. I throw a handful of dirt onto the notebook.

en: “Godspeed, young and heroic Quentin Jacobsen,” she says, tossing in dirt of her own.
vi: “Hãy bình an nhé, cậu Quentin Jacobsen ngây thơ và quả cảm,” Margo nói, thả nắm đất lúc nãy cô ấy đã đào lên.
tr: “Tanrı yanında olsun, genç ve cesur Quentin Jacobsen,” diyor ve o da kendi elindeki toprağı atıyor.
es: —Ve con Dios, joven y heroico Quentin Jacobsen —dice Margo lanzando también un puñado de tierra.
vi_translation: "Be at peace, naive and brave Quentin Jacobsen," Margo said, releasing the handful of earth she had just dug up.
tr_translation: “May God be with you, young and brave Quentin Jacobsen,” he says, and then he throws the soil in his hand.
es_translation: —Go with God, young and heroic Quentin Jacobsen —says Margo, also throwing a handful of dirt.

Multiple_ents: ['orlandoan margo roth spiegelman', 'dios', 'margo roth spiegelman', 'orlando margo roth spiegelman']
en: Another handful as I say, “Godspeed, fearless Orlandoan Margo Roth Spiegelman.”
vi: Một nắm đầy nữa, tôi nói, “Hãy bình an nhé, cô Margo Roth Spiegelman người Orlando, không bao giờ biết chùn bước.”
tr: “Tanrı yamnda olsun, Orlandolu korkusuz Margo Roth Spiegelman,” derken bir avuç dolusu toprak daha atıyorum.
es: —Ve con Dios, valiente ciudadana de Orlando Margo Roth Spiegelman —digo lanzando otro puñado.
vi_translation: Another handful, I said, "Be at peace, Miss Margo Roth Spiegelman of Orlando, never one to back down."
tr_translation: “May God be with you, fearless Margo Roth Spiegelman of Orlando,” I say as I throw another handful of dirt.
es_translation: —Go with God, brave citizen of Orlando Margo Roth Spiegelman —I say, throwing another handful.

en: And another as she says, “Godspeed, magical puppy Myrna Mountweazel.” We shove the dirt over the book, tamping down the disturbed soil. The grass will grow back soon enough. It will be for us the beautiful uncut hair of graves.
vi: Và một nắm nữa, Margo nói, “Hãy bình an nhé, siêu cún Myrna Mountweazel.” Chúng tôi gạt hết đất lên cuốn sổ, dận bằng mặt đất bị bới lên. Cỏ sẽ sớm mọc lại thôi. Với chúng tôi cỏ sẽ là làn tóc mộ chí buông không buồn cắt.
tr: O, ‘Tanrı yamnda olsun, sihirli yavru köpek Myma Mountvveazel,” derken bir avuç toprak daha dökülüyor. Toprağı defterin üstüne itiyor, bastırıp sıkıştırıyoruz. Yakın zamanda çimenler büyüyecek. Bizim için mezarların kesilmemiş güzel saçlan olacak.
es: —Ve con Dios, mágica cachorrilla Myrna Mountweazel —dice Margo lanzando otro puñado. Empujamos la tierra sobre el libro y apisonamos el suelo. La hierba no tardará en volver a crecer. Para nosotros será la cabellera suelta y hermosa de las tumbas.
vi_translation: And one more handful, Margo said, "Rest in peace, super dog Myrna Mountweazel." We covered the notebook with soil, leveling it with the dug-up ground. The grass will soon grow back. To us, the grass will be the untrimmed hair of the grave.
tr_translation: "Oh, 'May God be with you, magical puppy Myma Mountvveazel,' he says as he pours another handful of soil. He pushes the soil onto the notebook, pressing and compacting it. Soon, the grass will grow. For us, the graves will have beautiful uncut hair.
es_translation: —Go with God, magical little puppy Myrna Mountweazel —says Margo, throwing another handful. We pushed the earth over the book and tamped down the soil. The grass will soon grow back. For us, it will be the loose and beautiful hair of the graves.

en: We hold hands rough with dirt as we walk back to the Agloe General Store. I help Margo carry her belongings—an armful of clothes, her toiletries, and the desk chair—to her car. The preciousness of the moment, which should make it easier to talk, makes it harder.
vi: Chúng tôi nắm tay nhau lem đất đi về Hiệu Tạp Hóa Agloe. Tôi giúp Margo bê hành lí–một ôm quần áo, đồ vệ sinh cá nhân, và cái ghế văn phòng–ra xe của cô ấy. Sự quí giá của khoảnh khắc thường khiến người ta dễ nói với nhau, nhưng bây giờ chỉ khó mở lời hơn.
tr: Agloe Market’e geri yürürken, topraktan sertleşmiş ellerimizi birbirine kenetliyoruz. Margo’nun eşyalarını arabasına taşımasına yardım ediyorum... bir kucak dolusu kıyafet, banyo malzemeleri ve sandalye. 0 anın kıymeti, konuşmayı kolaylaştırması gerekirken daha da zorlaştırıyor.
es: Volvemos al Supermercado Agloe cogidos de la mano, que están ásperas por la tierra. Ayudo a Margo a cargar en el coche sus cosas: la ropa, los artículos de aseo y la silla. El momento es tan valioso que, en lugar de facilitar la conversación, la hace más difícil.
vi_translation: We held hands, our feet dirty, and walked towards Agloe General Store. I helped Margo carry her luggage—a bundle of clothes, personal hygiene items, and an office chair—to her car. The preciousness of the moment often makes people speak easily to each other, but now it was just harder to find the words.
tr_translation: As we walk back to Agloe Market, we clasp our hardened hands together. I'm helping Margo carry her belongings to her car... an armful of clothes, toiletries, and chair. 0 the value of the moment, instead of making the conversation easier, makes it even more difficult.
es_translation: We return to the Agloe Supermarket holding hands, which are rough from the dirt. I help Margo load her things into the car: clothes, toiletries, and the chair. The moment is so precious that, instead of facilitating the conversation, it makes it more difficult.

en: We’re standing outside in the parking lot of a single-story motel when the good-byes become unavoidable. “I’m gonna get a cell, and I’ll call you,” she says. “And email. And post mysterious statements on Omnictionary’s Paper Towns talk page.”
vi: Chúng tôi đứng ngoài trời trong bãi đỗ xe của một nhà trọ một tầng, khi không thể tránh những lời tạm biệt được nữa. “Tớ sẽ mua điện thoại di động, và sẽ gọi cho cậu,” Margo nói. “Cả e-mail nữa. Và đăng những lời bình luận bí ẩn lên phần thảo luận bài viết về Những Thành Phố Giấy trong Toàn Thư Đủ Thứ.”
tr: Hoşça kal demek kaçınılmaz olduğunda, tek katlı bir motelin park alanında duruyoruz. “Bir cep telefonu alacağım ve seni arayacağım,” diyor. “Ve eposta göndereceğim. Ve Omnictionary’nin konuşma sayfasına gizemli açıklamalar yollayacağım.
es: Estamos frente al aparcamiento de un motel de una sola planta cuando la despedida es inevitable. —Conseguiré un móvil y te llamaré —me dice—. Y te escribiré e-mails. Y comentarios misteriosos en la página de las ciudades de papel del Omnictionary.
vi_translation: We stood outside in the parking lot of a one-story motel, when we could no longer avoid the goodbyes. “I'll buy a cell phone, and I'll call you,” Margo said. “And email too. And post mysterious comments on the discussion section of the article about Paper Towns in the Everything Encyclopedia.”
tr_translation: When saying goodbye becomes inevitable, we stop in the parking lot of a single-story motel. “I will get a cell phone and call you,” he says. “And I will send emails. And I will send mysterious messages to the talk page of Omnictionary.”
es_translation: We are in front of the parking lot of a one-story motel when the farewell is inevitable. —I will get a cell phone and call you —he tells me—. And I will write you emails. And mysterious comments on the Omnictionary's page about the paper towns.

en: I smile. “I’ll email you when we get home,” I say, “and I expect a response.”
vi: Tôi mỉm cười. “Tớ sẽ gửi e-mail cho cậu khi bọn tớ về đến nhà,” tôi nói, “và tớ sẽ đợi hồi âm đấy.”
tr: Gülümsüyorum. “Eve vardığımızda sana eposta göndereceğim,” diyorum, “ve bir cevap bekleyeceğim.
es: Sonrío. —Te escribiré un e-mail cuando lleguemos a casa —le digo—, y espero respuesta.
vi_translation: I smiled. "I'll send you an email when we get home," I said, "and I'll be waiting for your reply."
tr_translation: I'm smiling. “I will send you an email when we get home,” I say, “and I will be expecting a reply.”
es_translation: I smile. —I will write you an email when we get home —I tell her—, and I expect a reply.

en: “You have my word. And I’ll see you. We’re not done seeing each other.”
vi: “Tớ bảo đảm. Và tớ sẽ gặp lại cậu. Chúng ta chưa xong màn gặp gỡ nhau ở đây đâu.”
tr: “Göndereceğime söz veriyorum. Ve görüşeceğiz. Birbirimizi görmeyi daha bitirmedik.
es: —Prometido. Y nos veremos. No vamos a dejar de vernos.
vi_translation: "I assure you. And I will see you again. We are not done with our meetings here yet."
tr_translation: “I promise to send it. And we will meet. We are not done seeing each other yet.”
es_translation: —Promised. And we will see each other. We are not going to stop seeing each other.

en: “At the end of the summer, maybe, I can meet you somewhere before school,” I say.
vi: “Cuối mùa hè, có khi thế, tớ có thể gặp cậu ở đâu đó trước khi nhập học,” tôi nói.
tr: “Yaz sonunda, okuldan önce seninle bir yerde buluşabilirim,” diyorum.
es: —A finales de verano quizá pueda ir a verte, antes de que empiecen las clases —le digo.
vi_translation: "At the end of summer, maybe, I could meet you somewhere before school starts," I said.
tr_translation: "At the end of summer, before school starts, I can meet you somewhere," I say.
es_translation: —At the end of summer, I might be able to come see you, before classes start —I tell her.

en: “Yeah,” she says. “Yeah, that’s a good idea.” I smile and nod. She turns away, and I am wondering if she means any of it when I see her shoulders collapse. She is crying.
vi: “Ừ,” Margo đáp. “Ý kiến hay đấy.” Tôi cười và gật đầu. Cô ấy quay đi, tôi đang tự hỏi không biết Margo có thực sự nghĩ vậy không, thì thấy bờ vai cô ấy so lại. Margo đang khóc.
tr: “Evet,” diyor. “Evet, bu iyi fikir.” Gülümseyip başımı safiıyorum. Arkasını dönüyor ve omuzlarının sarsıldığım gördüğümde, söylediklerinden herhangi birinin gerçek olup olmadığını merak ediyorum. Ağlıyor.
es: —Sí —me contesta—. Sí, buena idea. Sonrío y asiento. Se gira y estoy preguntándome si lo decía en serio cuando veo que encorva los hombros. Está llorando.
vi_translation: "Yes," Margo replied. "Good idea." I smiled and nodded. She turned away, and I was wondering if Margo really thought so, when I saw her shoulders shaking. Margo was crying.
tr_translation: “Yes,” he says. “Yes, this is a good idea.” Smiling, I nod my head. He turns his back and when I see his shoulders shaking, I wonder if any of what he said was true. He is crying.
es_translation: —Yes —he answers me—. Yes, good idea. I smile and nod. He turns around and I'm wondering if he was serious when I see him hunch his shoulders. He's crying.

en: “I’ll see you then. And I’ll write in the meantime,” I say.
vi: “Tớ sẽ gặp lại cậu. Trong khi đó tớ sẽ viết cho cậu,” tôi nói.
tr: “Görüşürüz, Ve bu arada sana yazacağım,” diyorum.
es: —Nos vemos entonces. Y entretanto te escribiré —digo.
vi_translation: "I will see you again. In the meantime, I will write to you," I said.
tr_translation: “See you, and by the way, I will write to you,” I say.
es_translation: —See you then. And in the meantime, I'll write to you —I say.

en: “Yes,” she says without turning around, her voice thick. “I’ll write you, too.”
vi: “Ừ, thế nhé,” cô ấy nói mà không quay lại, giọng trầm xuống. “Tớ cũng sẽ viết cho cậu.”
tr: “Evet,” diyor arkasını dönmeden, sesi boğuk. “Ben de sana yazacağım.
es: —Sí —me contesta sin girarse, con voz ronca—. Yo también te escribiré.
vi_translation: "Alright, see you," she said without turning back, her voice lowering. "I'll write to you too."
tr_translation: "Yes," he says without turning around, his voice muffled. "I will write to you too."
es_translation: —Yes —he answers me without turning, with a hoarse voice—. I will write to you too.

en: It is saying these things that keeps us from falling apart. And maybe by imagining these futures we can make them real, and maybe not, but either way we must imagine them. The light rushes out and floods in.
vi: Chính nói ra những điều này đã giữ chúng tôi khỏi bị vỡ tan. Và có lẽ khi tưởng tượng ra những tương lai ấy, chúng tôi có thể khiến chúng thành sự thực. Cũng có thể là không. Nhưng trong cả hai trường hợp chúng tôi vẫn phải tưởng tượng ra chúng. Ánh sáng trào ra và tràn vào.
tr: Dağılmamızı engelleyen şey bunları söylememiz. Belki bu gelecekleri hayal ederek onları gerçekleştirebiliriz, belki de gerçekleştiremeyiz ama her halükârda onlan hayal etmeliyiz. Işık dışarı sızıyor ve içeri doluyor.
es: Decir estas cosas evita que nos desmoronemos. Y quizá imaginando esos futuros podemos hacerlos reales, o quizá no, pero en cualquier caso tenemos que imaginarlos. La luz se desborda y lo inunda todo.
vi_translation: It was precisely speaking these things that kept us from falling apart. And perhaps by imagining those futures, we could make them come true. Or maybe not. But in either case, we still had to imagine them. Light surged out and flowed in.
tr_translation: The thing that prevents us from falling apart is saying these things. Maybe we can make these futures come true by imagining them, maybe we can't, but in any case, we must imagine them. Light seeps out and pours in.
es_translation: Saying these things prevents us from falling apart. And maybe by imagining those futures we can make them real, or maybe not, but in any case, we have to imagine them. The light overflows and floods everything.

en: I stand in this parking lot, realizing that I’ve never been this far from home, and here is this girl I love and cannot follow. I hope this is the hero’s errand, because not following her is the hardest thing I’ve ever done.
vi: Tôi đứng ở bãi đỗ xe này, nhận ra rằng tôi chưa từng ở xa nhà đến thế, và đây là cô gái tôi đem lòng yêu và không thể đi theo được. Tôi hi vọng đây là chuyện vặt của người anh hùng, vì không đi theo cô ấy là điều khó khăn nhất tôi từng làm.
tr: Evden daha önce hiç bu kadar uzak olmadığımın farkına vararak, bu park alanındayım ve sevdiğim ve takip edemediğim kız işte burada. Umarım kahramanın yolculuğu tabir edilen şey buraya kadardır çünkü onu takip etmemek şimdiye kadar yaptığım en zor şey.
es: Estoy en este aparcamiento pensando que nunca he estado tan lejos de casa, y aquí está la chica a la que amo y a la que no puedo seguir. Espero que sea la misión del héroe, porque no seguirla es lo más duro que he hecho en mi vida.
vi_translation: I stand in this parking lot, realizing that I have never been this far from home, and here is the girl I love but cannot follow. I hope this is a trivial matter for a hero, because not following her is the hardest thing I have ever done.
tr_translation: Realizing that I have never been this far from home before, I am in this park area and the girl I love and cannot follow is right here. I hope that what is referred to as the hero's journey ends here because not following her is the most hard thing.
es_translation: I am in this parking lot thinking that I have never been so far from home, and here is the girl I love and cannot follow. I hope this is the hero's mission, because not following her is the hardest thing I have ever done in my life.

en: I keep thinking she will get into the car, but she doesn’t, and she finally turns around to me and I see her soaked eyes. The physical space between us evaporates. We play the broken strings of our instruments one last time.
vi: Tôi cứ nghĩ Margo sẽ vào trong xe, nhưng không, cuối cùng Margo quay lại, và tôi thấy đôi mắt cô ấy, ầng ậng long lanh. Khoảng cách thực tế giữa chúng tôi biến mất. Chúng tôi chơi những sợi dây đã đứt trên cung đàn của mình một lần nữa.
tr: Arabaya bineceğini düşünmeye devam ediyorum ama binmiyor, nihayet bana dönünce sırılsıklam gözlerini görüyorum. Aramızdaki fiziksel alan buharlaşıyor. Son bir kez kopuk iplere elimizi atıyoruz.
es: Pienso que subirá al coche, pero no lo hace. Al final se gira hacia mí y veo sus ojos mojados. El espacio físico que nos separa se desvanece. Tocamos las cuerdas rotas de nuestros instrumentos por última vez.
vi_translation: I kept thinking Margo would get into the car, but no, in the end, Margo turned back, and I saw her eyes, glistening with tears. The physical distance between us disappeared. We played the broken strings on our harp once again.
tr_translation: I keep thinking that she will get into the car, but she doesn't; finally, when she turns to me, I see her tear-filled eyes. The physical space between us evaporates. For one last time, we reach for the broken strings.
es_translation: I think he will get into the car, but he doesn't. In the end, he turns towards me and I see his wet eyes. The physical space that separates us vanishes. We touch the broken strings of our instruments for the last time.

en: I feel her hands on my back. And it is dark as I kiss her, but I have my eyes open and so does Margo. She is close enough to me that I can see her, because even now there is the outward sign of the invisible light, even at night in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. After we kiss, our foreheads touch as we stare at each other. Yes, I can see her almost perfectly in this cracked darkness.
vi: Tôi cảm thấy bàn tay Margo trên lưng mình. Trời đã đổ tối khi tôi hôn cô ấy, nhưng tôi mở mắt và Margo cũng vậy. Cô ấy ở đủ gần để tôi có thể thấy được cô ấy, vì giờ có một thứ ánh sáng vô hình từ bên trong, dù vào buổi tối trên bãi đỗ xe này ở ngoại ô Agloe. Nụ hôn dứt, chúng tôi áp trán lại và nhìn vào nhau. Đúng vậy, tôi có thể thấy được cô ấy gần như hoàn hảo trong bóng tối nứt rạn này.
tr: Sırtımda ellerini hissediyorum. Onu öperken hava karanlık fakat gözlerimi açık tutuyorum, Margo da oyla Onu görebileceğim kadar yakınımda, şu anda, Agloe’nun dışındaki bu park alanındaki gecede bile o görünmez ışığın görünür işaretleri var. Öpüştükten sonra uzun uzun bakışırken alınlarımız birbirine değiyor. Bu çatlakları olan karanlıkta onu neredeyse kusursuz bir şekilde görebiliyorum.
es: Siento sus manos en mi espalda. Y aunque está oscuro, no cierro los ojos mientras la beso, y Margo tampoco. Está tan cerca de mí que puedo verla, porque incluso ahora aparece el signo externo de la luz invisible, incluso por la noche en este aparcamiento a las afueras de Agloe. Después de besarnos nos miramos tan de cerca que nuestras frentes se tocan. Sí, la veo casi a la perfección en esta agrietada oscuridad.
vi_translation: I felt Margo's hand on my back. It had already turned dark when I kissed her, but I opened my eyes and so did Margo. She was close enough for me to see her, as there was now an invisible light from within, even in the evening in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. The kiss ended, we pressed our foreheads together and looked at each other. Yes, I could see her almost perfectly in this fractured darkness.
tr_translation: I feel her hands on my back. While kissing her, the air is dark but I keep my eyes open, Margo too, so close that I can see her, even in this night at the parking lot outside Agloe, there are visible signs of that invisible light. After kissing, as we look at each other for a long time, our foreheads touch. In this darkness with cracks, I can see her almost perfectly.
es_translation: I feel her hands on my back. And even though it's dark, I don't close my eyes while I kiss her, and neither does Margo. She is so close to me that I can see her, because even now the external sign of invisible light appears, even at night in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. After kissing, we look at each other so closely that our foreheads touch. Yes, I see her almost perfectly in this cracked darkness.
